Job_Description: Business Analyst for Application Development Processes:  full time, 6 month duration, based in Calgary This role provides ownership and oversight of all process development, improvement, and implementation of Software Process Improvement (SPI) based on the CMM framework.A key responsibility of this group is to monitor process metrics in order to identify either problem areas or identify opportunities for process improvement.They are responsible for staffing the SEPG team and providing direction in applying the Process Change Method (PCM) for the account and in training the delivery team.They train the delivery team, begins the implementation, acts as process owner for changes and updates, and plans and leads the IBM tasks of the Software Engineering Institute (SEI) CMM-based assessment.They also engage ADE to perform an effectiveness study when funded and appropriate.Capture business requirements, analysis of requirements, mapping of requirements (As is and To be processes)Particular focus on Windows 10 application Please send your resumes to Danielle Pelletier at daniellep@tes.net.
Title: Business Analyst

Job_Description: *PLEASE NOTE: PREFERENCE WILL BE GIVEN TO CANDIDATES WHO APPLY THROUGH CANFOR.COM/CAREERSCanfor TechnologyAt Canfor, our Information Technology professionals play an important role in the daily functioning of our operations. Consistently pushing the boundaries when it comes to innovation within the forestry and pulp and paper industries, our IT professionals support Canfor in achieving exceptional results.With a high caliber Information Technology leadership team, a clear vision, and significant growth and training opportunities, a career in IT at Canfor allows individuals to strengthen their competencies and grow within their respective roles. Working as an equal partner with our operations to achieve organizational objectives, you will be at the forefront of innovation.Who We Are: Canfor is one of the world’s largest and most respected integrated forest products companies. For more than 75 years, we have been delivering top-quality lumber, pulp and paper products to our valued customers worldwide. With operations in Western Canada and the Southern United States, and sales offices around the world, you can find Canfor products in every corner of the globe. We are leaders in sustainable forest management and in converting wood residuals into green energy.As we continue to grow our company and our markets, find out how you can grow your career with us.The OpportunityThe Data Analyst, Business Intelligence supports Canfor’s objectives by turning data into meaningful information that can be used to make sound business decisions. The Data Analyst will provide expertise in business intelligence to prepare and deliver data and information to internal customers and stakeholders through reports, dashboards and scorecards. It is essential that the Data Analyst build an understanding of the business at a level of detail that enables them to work with the business to deliver valuable information.Please Note:  This is a relocation opportunity in Vancouver, British Columbia. The successful applicant may be provided with relocation assistance.Main ResponsibilitiesRequirements Gathering:Engage with various business units to capture information needs, compare those needs with existing tools and identify gapsParticipate in business requirements workshopsWrite business requirements documents as required to elaborate needs, gain acceptanceDesign & Development:Architect tables and dataDesign dashboards, reports, drill-down analytics and data visualizationsDesign, configure and administer the metadata layerCreate system technical requirements for documentation and knowledge managementActively challenge and find solutions to optimize system performanceTesting, Validation, Release Management:Develop and implement testing strategiesValidate data accuracyDeploy and validate changes in production environmentTraining & Change Management:Support the development of training, documentation, and help desk capabilitiesRequired SkillsBachelor's degree in computer science, information systems, business management or specialized training/certificationExperience working with relational databases (Microsoft SQL Server, Oracle Database, MySQL, etc)Applied knowledge of SQL (T-SQL, PL/SQL, ANSI-SQL, etc)Applied understanding of data modelling and warehousing conceptsWorking knowledge of business intelligence tools such as Oracle Business IntelligenceWorking knowledge of ETL tools such as Oracle Data Integrator or InformaticaExperience mediating and clarifying sometimes ambiguous or conflicting end user requirementsEagerness to learn new concepts and technologies and keep-up-to-date with existing onesWillingness to go above and beyond to understand both the business and technical aspects of a problemHiring for this position is ongoing and will be filled as required. To be considered for this position, please apply today.In order to be eligible for this position, you must be legally entitled to work in Canada for our Company.There has never been a better time to join the Canfor Information Technology team and become a part of the modern forest industry. We have a wide range of rewarding and innovative careers in some of the best communities in North America, with plenty of room for advancement. We offer competitive compensation and benefits packages, and are committed to the professional development of our employees.*PLEASE NOTE: PREFERENCE WILL BE GIVEN TO CANDIDATES WHO APPLY THROUGH CANFOR.COM/CAREERSFollow us on LinkedIn , Twitter , and Facebook for Canfor news, career opportunities, and upcoming events!Vancouver, BCThe city of Vancouver is both a natural beauty and a progressive urban centre, a rare place on earth that is idyllic and electric all at once. With one of Canada’s mildest climates, Vancouver is ideally suited for those devoted to outdoor pursuits, health and wellness. Along with its endless supply of fresh air and clean water, Vancouver also boasts countless choices for culturally diverse, world-class cuisine and an inventory of arts and entertainment events. For more information, visit http://canfor.com/our-company/our-communities/vancouverJob Type: Full-timeEducation:High school or equivalent

Job_Description: Inter Pipeline is a major petroleum transportation, storage and natural gas liquids processing business that ranks among the largest energy infrastructure companies in Canada. We are proud to be named one of Alberta’s Top 70 Employers, which recognizes Alberta businesses that lead their industries by being exceptional places to work.  Located out of our Calgary office, the individual in the Senior Business Analyst role will report to the Supervisor, Finance Solutions Centre. The successful candidate will be responsible for the stewardship of finance master data and project support within SAP for Inter Pipeline, as well indirect leadership of the Business Analyst.  Key Activities and Responsibilities: Review and ongoing improvement of master data creation/change approval processes Leadership of the Business Analyst role, utilizing a team accountability approach for facilitating finance master data creation/changes Work with the business and SAP Competency Centre to develop Service Level Agreements (SLAs), key performance indicators (KPIs) and other metrics for SAP finance master data Act as a data steward bringing forward cross-functional data quality and process integration issues and working collaboratively to solve them, championing the collective management of data governance Serve as a central point of contact for finance data governance understanding and providing direction and training to data consumers and producers from the business in line with business rules Ensure the right stakeholders across the enterprise (e.g. operations, finance, supply chain, etc.) are brought into make business process improvements which mitigate data issues Bring best practices in master data management and propose opportunities for improvement Interaction with SAP Competency Center on future system enhancements, builds, testing, and roll-outs Assist with development and usage of SAP reports  Education, Skills and Experience: Undergraduate diploma or degree in business with 5+ years of progressive experience in financial system support, CPA (CA, CMA, CGA) designation is an asset Strong finance expertise on master data usage, configuration, and integrated data requirements/linkage points combined with prior oil and gas experience considered an asset In depth knowledge of SAP FI_CO and Business Warehouse, experience with S/4HANA and Fiori an asset Approaches work with a high level of curiosity and aptitude to identify and solve problems, takes initiative, is accountable, and works independently Change agent who can persuade and influence stakeholders to establish new processes, shift to automation, and provide innovative solutions Ability to manage internal and external relationships with well-developed interpersonal, team, customer service and communication skills (both written and verbal) Strong customer service skills in working with internal departments to achieve results through relationships with people and teams Able to work well in a fast-paced, growth environment, with strong attention to detail and accuracy Maintains strong initiative and possesses superior analytical skills
Title: Senior Business Analyst

Job_Description: If you are committed to public service, enjoy collaborating with others, share our values and have a desire to learn and grow, join The City of Calgary. City employees deliver the services, run the programs and operate the facilities which make a difference in our community. We support work-life balance and offer competitive wages, pensions, and benefits. Together we make Calgary a great place to make a living, a great place to make a life.   As a Business Analyst you will analyze data from a wide range of data sources to generate key insights for Calgary Recreation, work with stakeholders to identify solutions to various issues, and monitor impacts to support customer focused service delivery. Primary duties include: Conduct analyses of primary and secondary data to inform facility planning and design, product and service development, customer service, and business optimization. Prepare reports and presentations that summarize results, identify key insights, and outline recommendations including an assessment of risk and reward. Work with stakeholders to promote data-driven decision making for ongoing improvements in recreation services delivered to citizens. Collaborate with others across the business unit and department in such areas as benchmarking and best practices, performance reporting, customer service improvement, data integration and data management, advanced analytics, and market research. Contribute to corporate and business unit business planning and policy projects.  Qualifications A degree in Business, Social Sciences or a related field with at least 4 years of relevant experience including data analysis and project management. Intermediate proficiency with Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Outlook). Possess working knowledge of statistical software programs (such as Statistical Product and Services Solutions [SPSS] and SAS), business intelligence tools (such as System, Application and Products (SAP) Business Objects, and geospatial analytical tools (such as ArcGIS) will be considered assets. Experience working with advanced analytics and geospatial analysis will also be considered assets. Demonstrate analytical and problem solving skills. Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills with the ability to build and maintain effective professional relationships with various levels of staff throughout the business unit and corporation. Equivalent combinations of experience and education may be considered. Pre-employment Requirements Successful applicants must provide proof of qualifications.  Union: Exempt   Business Unit: Calgary Recreation Position Type: 1 Permanent Location: 2808 Spiller Road S.E. Compensation: Level D $70,196 - 104,501 per annum Days of Work: This position typically works a 5 day work week, earning one day off in a 3 week cycle. Hours of work: Standard 35 hour work week Audience: Internal/External Apply By: May 28, 2018  Job ID #: 300793
Title: Business Analyst

Job_Description: CALGARY PARKING AUTHORITY  BUSINESS ANALYST (ONE YEAR TEMPORARY POSITION)  Information Technology and Technical Services  We are looking for a Business Analyst (BA) that provides clear, concise context and analysis that can be referenced by many stakeholders (some of them business, some of them technical). The BA will be part of a fast paced, agile team that are developing solutions to delight our customers.  Responsibilities  · Working with a variety of stakeholders to deliver a clear mapping of business and non-functional requirements to development, and Quality Assurance (QA).  · Work with developers and QA to produce supporting technical artifacts as needed including Use Cases, Flow charts, Wireframes, Performance parameters, etc.  · Maintain service specific documentation from release to release (capture changes for each release).  · Provide analysis documentation that stands the test of time. Creating documentation that provides context for the analysis, explains the approach and succinctly articulates the results is essential.  Qualifications  · The successful candidate will have a Degree in Information Technology or related discipline and a minimum of 3 years of relevant experience  · 5-7 years of related business analysis experience is preferred  · 3+ years of experience in working with teams in Agile Software Development  · Excellent verbal and written communication; strong analytical abilities  · Possess a familiarity with multiple technologies, business analysis tools, and development methods.  · Possesses deep understanding of agile software development methodologies  · Understands complex business processes and is able to document them in a logical and comprehensible manner  · Must be very comfortable with two week sprints and two week release windows  · Must understand how to deliver on requirements in a fast pace working environment  Competencies: Technical/Professional Knowledge & Skills; Stress Tolerance; Contributing to Team Success; Innovation; Building Strategic Working Relationships.  Hours of Work This position works a 35 hour work week  Compensation Exempt Pay Band D (starting wage $63,700)  Notes  The Calgary Parking Authority is committed to Employment Equity and encourages applications from all who are qualified. Applicants are thanked in advance for their interest and advised that only individuals selected for interviews will be contacted. Applicants are advised that this position requires completion of a Police Information Check to determine eligibility for employment. Successful applicants must provide proof of qualifications.  Please apply online at https://calgaryparking.startdate.ca with cover letter and resume by 2018 May 27.
Title: Business Analyst

Manage the customer relationship between IS and specific business areasSupport, maintain, enhance and/or upgrade a portfolio of custom and package applicationsAnalyze requests for new functionality, groups portfolioPlan, assign and monitor daily work assignments for Systems Analysts, Developers and Developer AnalystsDevelop and maintain technical specifications and documentationTroubleshoot and repair problems that occur in the everyday use of an applicationDevelop cost estimates for the annual IS capital and sustainment budgets QUALIFICATIONS: Typically 8+ years’ experience as a Business Systems Analyst and Systems Analyst, preferably in Production Accounting, PAS/PRISM AND Field Data CollectionPost-secondary degree in Computer Sciences is preferredExcellent written and verbal communication skillsHighly developed analytical skillsDemonstrated proficiency in business modeling, process modeling, data modeling, and effort/cost modeling and estimatingDemonstrated proficiency in Information Technology roles at CNRL, visit: http://www.cnrl-careers.com/jobs/Information-Technology ABOUT CANADIAN NATURAL At Canadian Natural, we strive to live through our mission statement: "To develop people to work together to create value for the Company's shareholders by doing it right with fun and integrity." Job_Description: IS Business Analyst-00134914-20180427 Description One of Husky’s advantages is that we are an integrated oil and gas company. From exploration to development, production, refining and marketing, we’ve got it all! Combine this with a range of learning and development tools and an inclusive work environment, and you are well-positioned for a successful career at Husky.  We have training, mentoring and career development programs and resources to help you develop both personally and professionally – as an employee or a leader. We offer many internal leadership and business skills courses along with tuition reimbursement programs for qualified employees. Every year, a significant number of our employees are able to take on new roles within the company thanks to our strong focus on hands-on learning and development. Husky is currently looking for an IS Business Analyst for their Calgary, AB office. The IS Business Analyst works closely with the IS Program Managers to gather and assess project requirements. They possess a solid understanding of business specific processes and collaborate with relevant IS teams to develop Project Development & Execution Framework artefacts. The role is integral in evaluating the business value and benefits associated within the projects and programs. Specific responsibilities will include: Liaise with business teams to gather technical and non-technical business requirements on behalf of the Business Partners and IS Program Managers to create the Project artefacts for identified opportunities Utilize relevant business analysis techniques to perform solution analysis and design this could include but is not limited to: Requirements Management (requirements traceability, baselining, etc.) Enterprise Analysis (benchmark studies, feasibility analysis, SWOT, etc.) Requirements Analysis (process modeling, organization modeling, use cases, etc.) Solution Assessment and Validation (user acceptance testing, defect and issue reporting, etc.) Inform Business Partners and IS Program Managers of potential continuous improvement opportunities Conduct Requirements Management using relevant tools such as; requirements traceability matrices, base lining, prototyping, focus groups, etc. Perform Enterprise Analysis using relevant tools such as; benchmark studies, feasibility analysis, integration effectiveness, SWOT, etc. Conduct Process Analysis using relevant tools such as; process modeling, reverse engineering, organization modeling, use cases, etc. Participate and enhance the BA Community of Practice including tools, templates, etc. Qualifications Our ideal candidate will have the following qualifications: College diploma or university degree in business or information systems or equivalent experience or combination thereof The following would be an asset: Certified Business Analysis Professional (CBAP) Project Management Professional (PMP) ITIL Foundations Minimum of five years’ direct experience of contributing to the success of a range of small-to-medium initiatives with escalating levels of complexity and business criticality Experience in facilitating change, including collaboration with management stakeholders Minimum of 5 years’ experience working with information technology in an oil and gas domain is desirable Proficient with Microsoft Office Experience using the following is preferred: ARIS Microsoft Visio SAP At Husky, we respect diversity and embrace an inclusive culture. We value uniqueness and different perspectives as they play a critical role in our success. To achieve this, individuals are selected based on qualifications, merit, and abilities and we encourage applications from everyone including visible minorities, Aboriginal people, women, and persons with disabilities. Husky Energy is an integrated Canadian energy company. It is headquartered in Calgary, Alberta, and is publicly traded on the Toronto Stock Exchange under the symbol HSE. The Company operates Upstream and Downstream business segments, with operations in Canada, the United States, China and Indonesia.  Husky's balanced growth strategy focuses on consistent execution, disciplined financial management and safe and reliable operations. Interested candidates must apply online at: www.huskyenergy.com/careers. Only those candidates who apply via Husky's online application process can be considered. We thank all applicants for their interest in our organization; however, only short-listed applicants will be contacted. #LI-Post Job Business Analysis Primary Location CA-AB-Calgary

Job_Description: Business Analyst - (18000411) Description  At Golder, we thrive on challenges.  Golder is not just a place to work, it is a promise of a living, dynamic environment where people collaborate, innovate, build enduring relationships, excel, and grow professionally in a strong culture of ownership.  Do you have the desire to learn? The drive to excel and thrive in an engaged, collaborative environment?  Golder has a new opportunity for a Business Analyst to join our IT team on a full time basis based in Vancouver or Calgary.  An overview of your role will include:  Using current techniques and models, develop business requirements aligned with global industry best practices and Golder’s outcomes Develop relationships with stakeholders, adopting a ‘trusted advisor’ role Collaborate with technical and business teams in developing practical and cost effective technology solutions Participate in the design and testing of any approved application to be used in conjunction with existing global system so that it adheres to our existing practices, procedures, and standards Conduct research on software and hardware products to meet agreed upon requirements and to support purchasing efforts Work with business sponsors to gather pilot test groups, conduct application overviews, conduct “train the trainer” sessions Assist release teams to achieve successful releases Resolve issues raised by the user communities from fault identification, reproduction, root cause analysis, product issues, etc.; identify and resolve common problems; identify work-around solutions while issue is resolved Communicate changes, enhancements, and modifications of business requirements– verbally or through written documentation to project managers, sponsors, and other stakeholders so that issues and solutions are understood Create and maintain documentation including user guides and training materials to aid in user training and support; deliver training where necessary Travel regionally and internationally as required. Estimated travel time 10%  Qualifications  You will have a background in:  University degree in Computing systems, Systems Design, or related Business Degree in information systems 5+ years’ experience in business analysis, requirements gathering, process and data mapping Knowledge of cloud technologies for the financial / project accounting / professional services field(s) / CRM / HR systems in a professional services organization Knowledge in risk management, environmental health and safety, quality assurance audits, and legal processes an asset Project Management experience required, as well as process design and documentation experience Experience in financial reporting systems and tools Exposure to project-based work structures Working knowledge of Microsoft platforms including MS Windows, MS Office, SharePoint O365 Knowledge in relational databases, agile application development, and Oracle Cloud systems an asset Your benefits at Golder will include:  Competitive benefits and remuneration packages Option to purchase shares in Golder Employee owned structure - own the business, own the result Deepen your expertise in a dynamic work environment Innovative and collaborative multidisciplinary projects On the job training, mentoring and coaching Global projects and travel opportunities One of Canada’s Best Managed Companies, Platinum member status 11 consecutive years  Renowned for technical excellence, Golder is a leading, global employee-owned engineering and consulting firm with over a half century of successful service to its clients. With over 165 offices in over 40 countries, Golder’s 6,500 professionals are driven by a passion to deliver results, offering unique specialized skills to address the ever-evolving challenges that earth, environment and energy present to clients across the infrastructure, mining, oil and gas, manufacturing and power sectors.  Golder is committed to providing equitable treatment and equal opportunity to all individuals. As such, Golder will provide accommodations throughout the recruitment and selection process to applicants with disabilities, upon request.  To learn more about our company and culture click here to view The Promise of Golder video. Primary Location: CA-AB-CALGARY Schedule: Full-time Employee Status: Regular Job Posting: Mar 8, 2018, 2:02:42 PM
Title: Business Analyst

Job_Description: About Bethany For over half a century, Bethany has been improving the lives of Alberta seniors and adults with disabilities by providing housing, health and community services that honour their spirit and individuality. At Bethany, our journey of service excellence has just begun. We have recently launched WAVE (We Action our Values Everyday), our service excellence program through which we are committed to providing great service experiences for our residents, tenants, families and each other. Together, we are living our mission of “Creating Caring Communities”. We offer competitive salaries, attractive benefits and pension programs, growth through learning and development, and numerous opportunities to give back to the community – just a few of the things that led to Bethany being named one of Alberta’s Top Employers for 11 consecutive years in 2018. It’s simple — we invest in our people because they are the reason for our success. We are delighted that you are considering joining our team! We are looking for people who are passionate about people, working to enhance everyone’s quality of life at every stage of the journey.  About the Role:  We are currently seeking a Business Analyst to join Bethany's Information Technology team. Reporting to the Business Solutions Manger, you will support existing software applications at Bethany. You will also partner with business and health care resources on initiatives to introduce new business processes and software into the organization.  What You Will Do: Participating in the planning, design, development, configuration, integration, service introduction, and enhancement of existing and new business and clinical applications Gathering functional and technical requirements through interviews, site visits, research and analysis Developing and documenting business cases and plans, including business, functional, and technical requirements Coordinating, executing and supporting application testing, such as creating test cases and scripts Developing training materials and documentation for educators and end users Performing day-to-day troubleshooting and supporting of current systems in collaboration with vendor application support teams Identifying and leading continuous improvement efforts within the organization  What You Bring: Over two (2) years of experience as a Business Analyst working on business and/or clinical application projects. Experience with implementing and supporting enterprise Finance, Logistis, HR/Payroll, and Operations applications. A University Degree or a diploma in business and/or information technology or related discipline is required. Project management experience would be an asset. Experience with writing SQL queries and/or report writing would be an asset. Ability to effectively partner with business and clinical resources at all levels of the organization. Ability to manage multiple priorities; changing course and direction as needed. Proven problem solving, analytical and critical thinking skills. Strong collaboration and communication (written and verbal) skills.  Position Information:  Posting Number: 18-1508 Position Number: PR-CP72-005 Location: Corporate Services FTE: 100% Position Type: Full Time Permanent  Posting end date: May 15, 2018 (Please note this competition may close earlier if a suitable candidate is found) All applicants are thanked for their interest. Bethany Care Society is an equal opportunity employer. Successful candidates will be required to obtain a Criminal Background Check. Bethany Care Society complies with the Personal Information Protection and Electronic Documents Act (PIPEDA). By forwarding your resume to Bethany you are consenting to the collection and use of your personal information for this job competition. Your information will be kept strictly confidential.
Title: IT Business Analyst

Job_Description: If you are committed to public service, enjoy collaborating with others, share our values and have a desire to learn and grow, join The City of Calgary. City employees deliver the services, run the programs and operate the facilities which make a difference in our community. We support work-life balance and offer competitive wages, pensions, and benefits. Together we make Calgary a great place to make a living, a great place to make a life.   Reporting to the Leader of Analytics and Integration group, the Management Systems Analyst will be responsible for working closely with business representatives and other areas of Information Technology (IT) to ensure the success of Analytics and Integration projects and operations. Primary duties include: Create and continuously improve the Business Intelligence frameworks (standards, best practices, guideline and patterns). Extend current capabilities, as required, through the successful assimilation of new technologies and techniques (such as: mobile, advanced analytics, unstructured data, advanced data visualization and big data). Provide guidance and expertise in the delivery of innovative Business Intelligence (BI) solutions. Support and mentor other IT staff in Extract, Transform, Load (ETL) and Data warehousing design and implementation. Help with the development of the BI future state strategic architecture and migration roadmap. Communicate successfully across all levels and disciplines (business stakeholders and technical teams) within the organization in resolving problems, developing solutions, soliciting cooperation and ensure alignment to The City’s Business Intelligence best practices and strategic vision. Provide technical support for business clients and other areas of IT in Business Intelligence related technologies, including, but not limited to, ETL, Data Warehousing and Data Visualization. Act as a subject matter expert within the Business Intelligence and Integration group.  Qualifications A degree in Computer Science, Commerce, Business Administration, Geography, Math or Engineering, plus 4 years of systems development experience; OR A completed 2 year technical diploma in a related field, supplemented by formal systems development training and 8 years of systems development experience. 4 years of experience in Informatica PowerCentre and Kimball Dimensional Modeling. Experience with Structured Query Language (SQL), data modeling, analytics, Oracle, SQL Server, Visio, Excel spreadsheets, Crystal Reports, Active Reports, Procedural Language (PL), Unified Modeling Language (UML), Extensible Markup Language (XML), data profiling, open source and data cleansing, administration of Informatica PowerCenter will be considered assets. You will have proven ability to lead a very diverse team of IT professionals, work strategically as well as operationally, work with all levels of people throughout the corporation and build consensus and be a team player. Equivalent combinations of experience and education may be considered. Pre-employment Requirements A security clearance will be conducted. Successful applicants must provide proof of qualifications.  Union: Exempt   Business Unit: Information Technology Position Type: Temporary ( up to 1 year) Location: 133 6 Avenue S.E Compensation: Level E $77,891 - 117,609 per annum Days of Work: This position works a 5 day work week with one day off in a 3 week cycle. Hours of work: Standard 35 hour work week Audience: Internal/External Apply By: May 23, 2018  Job ID #: 300757
Title: Management Systems Analyst

Job_Description: Why the Stampede?  For over 100 years the Calgary Stampede has been the heart and soul of our city. It is both where and how we come together to celebrate our unique brand of western hospitality and community spirit. As we embark on the next chapter of our story, we will deliver exceptional experiences that entertain, educate and engage visitors. We will build inspired spaces to bring our community together to celebrate, and we will further energize the brand that has come to define our city. Our vision is to create a world-class, year-round gathering place for the community.  Position Summary   The Project Coordinator is an administrative support role within the Business Service team. The successful candidate will implement operational plans, contributing to and supporting both the Business Service team and other teams in the Calgary Stampede as well as internal and external stakeholders.  Responsibilities  Responsibilities of this role include, but are not limited to:  Conduct administration, accounting, reporting and process maintenance. This will also include risk mitigation factors. Develop process maps and training throughout the park. Develop plans for implementation of net new or updated processes Responsible for research and development around the Calgary Stampede policies. Support project teams in organizational project delivery  Qualifications  The ideal candidate will be proactive, optimistic and have worked in a dynamic environment where they have experience delivering on multiple priorities and will hold the following qualifications:   At least, High School Diploma Working Knowledge of Microsoft Project and Visio will be an asset Strong organizational skills Basic understanding of Business Analyst and Project Management methodologies A minimum of two years’ experience in an administrative support role or related experience  Benefits  The Calgary Stampede offers a unique and exciting work environment, an excellent total compensation package and the opportunity for advancement and employee training.  To Apply  To apply, please submit your resume.  All applicants are thanked in advance and only those selected for interviews will be contacted.

Title: Business Analyst

Job_Description: Inter Pipeline is a major petroleum transportation, storage and natural gas liquids processing business that ranks among the largest energy infrastructure companies in Canada. We are proud to be named one of Alberta’s Top 70 Employers, which recognizes Alberta businesses that lead their industries by being exceptional places to work.  Located out of our Calgary office, the individual in the Senior Business Analyst role will report to the Supervisor, Finance Solutions Centre. The successful candidate will be responsible for the stewardship of finance master data and project support within SAP for Inter Pipeline, as well indirect leadership of the Business Analyst.  Key Activities and Responsibilities: Review and ongoing improvement of master data creation/change approval processes Leadership of the Business Analyst role, utilizing a team accountability approach for facilitating finance master data creation/changes Work with the business and SAP Competency Centre to develop Service Level Agreements (SLAs), key performance indicators (KPIs) and other metrics for SAP finance master data Act as a data steward bringing forward cross-functional data quality and process integration issues and working collaboratively to solve them, championing the collective management of data governance Serve as a central point of contact for finance data governance understanding and providing direction and training to data consumers and producers from the business in line with business rules Ensure the right stakeholders across the enterprise (e.g. operations, finance, supply chain, etc.) are brought into make business process improvements which mitigate data issues Bring best practices in master data management and propose opportunities for improvement Interaction with SAP Competency Center on future system enhancements, builds, testing, and roll-outs Assist with development and usage of SAP reports  Education, Skills and Experience: Undergraduate diploma or degree in business with 5+ years of progressive experience in financial system support, CPA (CA, CMA, CGA) designation is an asset Strong finance expertise on master data usage, configuration, and integrated data requirements/linkage points combined with prior oil and gas experience considered an asset In depth knowledge of SAP FI_CO and Business Warehouse, experience with S/4HANA and Fiori an asset Approaches work with a high level of curiosity and aptitude to identify and solve problems, takes initiative, is accountable, and works independently Change agent who can persuade and influence stakeholders to establish new processes, shift to automation, and provide innovative solutions Ability to manage internal and external relationships with well-developed interpersonal, team, customer service and communication skills (both written and verbal) Strong customer service skills in working with internal departments to achieve results through relationships with people and teams Able to work well in a fast-paced, growth environment, with strong attention to detail and accuracy Maintains strong initiative and possesses superior analytical skills
Title: Senior Business Analyst

Job_Description: Working under the direction of the Vice President, Operations Finance, the Senior Business Analyst will perform financial and business analysis in order to provide timely, reliable and useful information to the senior operations management team in support of the achievement of operations’ goals and objectives. Essential Duties and Responsibilities Business Analysis Contribute financial analysis and support as required by the senior operations management team to assist the team in making timely, fully informed business decisions; Proactively identify and analyse opportunities for margin improvement; and Assist in evaluation, planning and implementation of new internal business expansion opportunities.  Purchasing Provide project analysis and ongoing support to assist the director of purchasing in implementation and tracking of cost reduction strategies and process improvements.  Financial Reporting, Budgets and Forecasts Regularly review and analyse ongoing divisional financial results to assist in understanding of the results and identification of opportunities for improvement in margins and profitability; Coordinate annual budget and quarterly forecast process, including maintenance of models and reports, consolidation and scheduling; Review and analyse divisional annual budgets and forecast updates to identify anomalies and potential corrective actions. Review monthly divisional reporting packages to ensure consistency and accuracy; Maintain and prepare operational monthly and quarterly consolidated reporting package; and Continuously explore opportunities for improvement in reporting and budgeting processes that result in efficiencies and improved information.  Mergers and Acquisitions Participate in due diligence on M&A targets; and Play a key role in integration of successful acquisitions.  Other Participate in evaluation and implementation of new information systems as required; Assist in ensuring compliance with and development of new financial policies; and Special projects as required. Specific Knowledge, Skills and Abilities CPA, CFA or MBA with up to five years relevant post designation experience; Expert proficiency in Excel and strong proficiency with other Microsoft Office products; Experience with extracting and manipulating data from business information systems; Experience with Great Plains and Management Reporter Excellent analytical and problem solving skills, attention to detail; Aptitude and desire to learn the business beyond accounting and the numbers; Ability to liaise independently and directly in a collaborative style with the senior executive team and other disciplines and levels within the Company; Strong written and verbal communication skills; Ability to meet tight deadlines while maintaining a high level of detail; Superior organization skills; Must be able to manage a core workload in addition to a high proportion of ad hoc projects and competing priorities; and A strong work ethic and desire to succeed. Special Conditions of Employment Overtime will be required based on activity levels; Some travel is required in Canada, the US and possibly international
Title: Senior Business Analyst

Title: Senior - Retail Systems Analyst

Job_Description: Build a meaningful career  At Morneau Shepell, we offer more than career opportunities, we provide career opportunities to make meaningful contributions to people’s lives. The extraordinary expertise of our 4,000-strong workforce is harnessed to support the employees and families of the organizations we serve. Our innovative programs have a lasting impact on the health, financial security and productivity of 20,000 workplaces.  Consultant Health and Benefits  Health & Benefits Solutions  Calgary, AB  Full Time, Permanent  Benefits programs are an important and highly valued part of any employment offering. But understanding how much or what type of benefit coverage is necessary can be difficult. Our client relationship model is consultative and encourages continual communication. By providing you with the resources to support employers in engaging employees in their health, we provide a path to better workforce health and productivity.  Our Consultant works in a team and is responsible for managing, servicing and providing quality benefits consulting services for small to medium sized clients. In addition, they will be responsible for helping to build business with existing clients as well as attracting and supporting new clients through our association partnerships.  Responsibilities include:  Business Development  Identify and manage cross-sell opportunities Develop strategic relationships with key account contacts and introduce Morneau Shepell team members as appropriate Supervise the complete employee benefits cycle: plan design, provider search, implementation, experience monitoring, renewal rating Develop new business with existing clients and assists in obtaining new business with prospective clients focusing on our key association partnerships Understand client needs and identify company or industry products or services that can meet these needs Service  Deliver presentations to clients; conduct client meetings and the occasional employee presentation. Ensure that quality control and service standards are attained with every transaction Negotiate, problem solve and maintain positive relationships with insurers, external advisors and internal underwriting and benefits administration departments Develop and maintain excellent relationships with clients, through regular telephone contact and office visits Understand the client’s perspective and priorities, and work with the client to resolve administrative issues Establish strategies for services that meet client needs  Administration  Provide and oversee direct day-to-day support for clients by phone, e-mail, letters, formal reports, and face-to-face meetings Lead and manage multiple client assignments and projects Manage special projects as required Peer review the work of analysts Knowledge  Maintain current knowledge of industry trends including insurer news, products, legislation, and cost trends as well as current knowledge of our company's products and services  Qualifications:  Experience  Five years of experience in group benefits. Preference will be given to those from the group insurance industry, a consulting firm or brokerage or in an HR department. Education  Post-secondary education GBA (CEBS) designation, or working towards it. Life Insurance license (this will be a requirement within 3 months of onboarding) Skills  Strong presentation skills and comfort speaking in front of large groups Understanding of consultative selling and the ability to manage the sales cycle effectively and autonomously Expert negotiation, technical and analytical skills Can effectively communicate complex concepts in plain written and spoken language Professional Traits  Exceptional customer focus; some would say you’re the best Extremely organized self-starter, flexible, highly independent Ability to manage multiple deadlines simultaneously Proven collaborative team member with the ability to motivate and inspire team members  Morneau Shepell Morneau Shepell is in the business of helping organizations help their people because we believe that engaged people are the driving force for society. Every day, the expertise of our almost 4,000 employees is recognized as essential to the financial security, health, and productivity of our clients and their people. We're always looking for talented professionals and strategic leaders who will listen and work together with colleagues and clients to form long-term relationships and to deliver integrative solutions that fit. As we continue to grow, we're presently engaging with exceptional candidates interested in a range of exciting career opportunities. Job_Description: Build a meaningful career  At Morneau Shepell, we offer more than career opportunities, we provide career opportunities to make meaningful contributions to people’s lives. The extraordinary expertise of our 4,000-strong workforce is harnessed to support the employees and families of the organizations we serve. Our innovative programs have a lasting impact on the health, financial security and productivity of 20,000 workplaces.  Consultant Health and Benefits  Health & Benefits Solutions  Calgary, AB  Full Time, Permanent  Benefits programs are an important and highly valued part of any employment offering. But understanding how much or what type of benefit coverage is necessary can be difficult. Our client relationship model is consultative and encourages continual communication. By providing you with the resources to support employers in engaging employees in their health, we provide a path to better workforce health and productivity.  Our Consultant works in a team and is responsible for managing, servicing and providing quality benefits consulting services for small to medium sized clients. In addition, they will be responsible for helping to build business with existing clients as well as attracting and supporting new clients through our association partnerships.  Responsibilities include:  Business Development  Identify and manage cross-sell opportunities Develop strategic relationships with key account contacts and introduce Morneau Shepell team members as appropriate Supervise the complete employee benefits cycle: plan design, provider search, implementation, experience monitoring, renewal rating Develop new business with existing clients and assists in obtaining new business with prospective clients focusing on our key association partnerships Understand client needs and identify company or industry products or services that can meet these needs Service  Deliver presentations to clients; conduct client meetings and the occasional employee presentation. Ensure that quality control and service standards are attained with every transaction Negotiate, problem solve and maintain positive relationships with insurers, external advisors and internal underwriting and benefits administration departments Develop and maintain excellent relationships with clients, through regular telephone contact and office visits Understand the client’s perspective and priorities, and work with the client to resolve administrative issues Establish strategies for services that meet client needs  Administration  Provide and oversee direct day-to-day support for clients by phone, e-mail, letters, formal reports, and face-to-face meetings Lead and manage multiple client assignments and projects Manage special projects as required Peer review the work of analysts Knowledge  Maintain current knowledge of industry trends including insurer news, products, legislation, and cost trends as well as current knowledge of our company's products and services  Qualifications:  Experience  Five years of experience in group benefits. Preference will be given to those from the group insurance industry, a consulting firm or brokerage or in an HR department. Education  Post-secondary education GBA (CEBS) designation, or working towards it. Life Insurance license (this will be a requirement within 3 months of onboarding) Skills  Strong presentation skills and comfort speaking in front of large groups Understanding of consultative selling and the ability to manage the sales cycle effectively and autonomously Expert negotiation, technical and analytical skills Can effectively communicate complex concepts in plain written and spoken language Professional Traits  Exceptional customer focus; some would say you’re the best Extremely organized self-starter, flexible, highly independent Ability to manage multiple deadlines simultaneously Proven collaborative team member with the ability to motivate and inspire team members  Morneau Shepell Morneau Shepell is in the business of helping organizations help their people because we believe that engaged people are the driving force for society. Every day, the expertise of our almost 4,000 employees is recognized as essential to the financial security, health, and productivity of our clients and their people. We're always looking for talented professionals and strategic leaders who will listen and work together with colleagues and clients to form long-term relationships and to deliver integrative solutions that fit. Job_Description: The ROT Senior Architect Analyst is responsible for ensuring that ROT funded projects deliver enterprise suitable solutions, optimizing potential savings and reducing risk. The ROT Senior Architect Analyst will assist with the creation of business cases by identifying and documenting the business needs of stakeholders and assisting with the complicated task of estimating the costs and savings early in the project development process. By ensuring that the proposed solutions will meet the enterprise needs and not just the needs of a single group, the ROT Senior Architect Analyst optimizes the return on investment of the ROT funds.  Starting with eliciting, analyzing, validating and documenting business, organizational and/or operational requirements, they develop the data needed to develop the optimum IT solution. The ROT Senior Architect Analyst will also contribute to the solution development, and the data that builds the business case – estimating both costs and savings. Lastly, the ROT Senior Architect Analyst will assist with the measurement of the actual savings achieved to ensure that the ROT program financial savings estimates are being met, and that the program has accurate data to support the reporting function.  Must be comfortable working with very large enterprise technology solutions across a wide variety of technical domains, and taking abstract, fluid solution ideas and turning them into concrete designs.  Must have outstanding interpersonal skills and deep technical fluency to allow them to complete complex tasks, to work independently with minimal coaching, and demonstrate leadership skills.  What you’ll do  The ROT Senior Architect Analyst will use their extensive experience coupled with formal architecture and analysis techniques and their own creativity to support the ROT program delivery. This role is primarily focused on collaborating with the 90+ solution architects in the enterprise, and the senior leaders and other stakeholders to ensure that all decision making is supported with data and facts. The role has a secondary focus on supporting the program and project manager(s) as required, particularly in understanding risk and impact.  Elicit Requirements  : Anticipates, quantifies and resolves problems and issues through requirements. Done by the identification of source requirements, risk management, and development of a priority matrix. Must be capable and confident to lead requirements gathering workshops and JAM sessions  Create Requirements  :  Document: Publishes, distributes, and ensures sign-off of the business requirements. Performs impact analysis on requested changes to requirements. Assists with risk management and can use specific tools such as priority matrices, and / or formal reviews with clients  Structured Analysis  : Analyzes and determines problems, opportunities, and solution resolutions. Can identify and document "as-is" state vs. "to-be" state using a variety of tools and techniques based on the project and its complexity plus facilitation of interviews to help develop a consensus about the requirements  Business Case Development  : Works with ROT stakeholders to develop the business case, including solution design, estimate costs, efforts and savings. Uses a variety of tools and techniques based on the need at hand, and is able to craft solutions that are suitable for enterprise use and account for the various different needs and demands of the various SBUs and functional units across the corporation.  Change Agency  : Understands process and issues inherent in change management and plans and advises the program accordingly; instills confidence and trust in others; coordinates resources across departments/units; evaluates measures, works with delivery teams to develop specific change mgmt plans and deliverables for alignment and smooth implementation; acknowledges individual’s responses to change and helps them adjust  Monitoring  : Monitors changing requirements and architectural responses to problems. Uses tools such as a user acceptance strategy to ensure that all business scenarios have been validated and business requirements and their integrity are maintained throughout the execution of the project.  Results Analysis and Internal Audit  : Upon project conclusion, the Senior Architect Analyst with assist the PMO in performing the internal audit to ensure that the predicted benefits (financial) have been achieved.  Business / IT Fluency  : Understands the societal impact of information and information technology in the business environment. Has a deep understanding of technology and solution architecture.  Business Process Analysis: Recommends improvements to business processes. Done by ensuring business goals are met by considering all tangible and intangible costs.  Build Business Relationships  : Understand the business issues and challenges of the organization and industry. Done by working closely with Business and IT to ensure a strategic partnership between Business needs and Technology solutions.  What you’ve done  10+ years experience in a relevant industry vertical. (Retail, Wholesale Distribution, CPG, etc.)  5+ years experience in Business Analysis practice  Proven proficiency / mastery of junior and intermediate Business Analyst competencies  Experience with package (COTS) customization and deployment  Experience with Product Lifecycle, Sales Order, Retail, Supply Chain, Finance, and/or Human Capital management systems is an asset  Experience in Solution Design and Architecture is an asset  Experience with ITIL Framework and IT Service Management (ITSM) is an asset  Knowledge of both traditional waterfall and Agile project methodologies is an asset.  Experience and knowledge of solution architecture is an asset.  Who you are  Communication: Ability to formulate concepts; communication of technical information to a non-technical audience; communication of business information to a technical audience.  Leadership: as a change agent, ability to develop and communicate change management strategies to technical and non-technical staff alike.  Business: Knowledge of business processes; ability to have a business-oriented vision; case development; business writing; modeling techniques.  Analytical: analytical and conceptual expertise; documentation, analysis and business requirements management techniques; object-oriented analysis; evaluation of profitability/risk; testing, verification and validation techniques.  Thinking (Analytical, Systemic, Creative): Identifies and integrates the critical elements of a situation, making correct inferences from data; breaks complex problems into component parts and organizes the parts in a systematic way; uses innovation to develop novel solutions; explains to others how to understand / approach complicated problems.  Professional Knowledge: Continually enhances knowledge and skills to keep abreast of industry changes, developments and emerging issues; understands what it takes to be successful in this business; has a thorough knowledge of organization’s mission, history, stakeholders and customers.  Builds Trust and Credibility by consistently adhering to the organization’s business principles and values.  Is seen as direct, truthful, and trustworthy by co-workers, vendors, and customers.  Committed to results by taking personal responsibility for achieving mutually agreed upon individual/team objectives.  Demonstrates a desire to help and serve internal/external customers to meet their needs. Is proactive, responsive, and focused on discovering, anticipating, and exceeding the customer’s needs.  Works collaboratively and cooperatively with others to achieve shared goals and objectives. Considers the wider team, function, banner or the organization and takes action or makes decisions which support the success of those groups.  Recovers quickly after change, disruptions, or mistakes and can remain productive and focused. Is adaptable and can apply lessons learned in one situation to another situation.  Academic / Educational requirements  University degree or equivalent experience in Computer Science or related discipline.  Business Analysis Certification from an accredited source is an asset (CBAP  ®  , CCBA  TM  )  Canadian Tire and FGL Sports are equal opportunity employers. All accommodation information provided will be treated as confidential and used only for the purpose of providing an accessible candidate experience. Title: Business Analyst (System Architecture)

Job_Description: As a Business Analyst at Integrated Sustainability Consultants Ltd., you will be responsible for supporting projects that span multiple disciplines within our organization in order to delivery high quality and sustainable solutions to our clients. You will support InSolutions Advisory group throughout sales and project delivery process with respect to market, economic, environmental, operational and financial factors. Reporting directly to the Director of InSolutions Advisory, you will be integral to the team and be part of a growing and leading group of professionals. Your project work will expose you to new industries, technologies and approaches that will require an ability to learn quickly. Your project and people skills will enable you to make a difference in our industry and inspire new and better ways to implement project management solutions.  Company Overview:  Integrated Sustainability Consultants Ltd. is a Calgary based innovative leading provider of professional services that integrates world-class front-end project consulting and delivery teams to execute sustainable Water, Waste and Energy solutions. Our goal is to engage clients from early stage problem solving to successfully engineered project delivery completion by an employee owned team who value long-term social and environmentally sustainable solutions.  We are passionate about the water lifecycle from source protection and resource management, to water and wastewater treatment and disposal. We strive to find full lifecycle solutions through a risk management approach, while implementing efficient fit-for-purpose engineering design and scientific solutions. To meet these challenges, we have attracted a dynamic, energetic team of professionals who are highly recognized specialists in their field of expertise and love coming to work every day!  Position Responsibilities:  Contribute to strategic consulting projects by incorporating the input of many different parties into well-written reports and deliverables. Produce high quality models, research, presentations, client reports and technical proposals. Research and assess emerging sustainability trends and technologies. Assist in developing business cases and completing feasibility studies. Assist with cost estimation. Involved in the development of new systems and processes for the department. Effectively manage workloads from multiple projects. Work logically and systematically, with good time management. Interact with multi-disciplinary teams (water, waste, energy, environmental, regulatory, geology, and engineering) on multidisciplinary projects. Position Requirements:  A minimum of three years recent experience, preferably related to finance, and/or risk management. Strong market research and business case writing skills. Excellent quantitative and analytical skills, with great attention to detail. Life-cycle assessment experience, including triple bottom line options and cost-benefit analysis considered as asset. Involvement with strategic business impact, non-financial risk, and socio-economic impact assessments. Understanding of sustainability issues within the energy industry an asset. Quick learner, ability to manage change and work in a faced-paced environment with tight deadlines. Excellent problem-solving and decision-making skills. Must have strong written and verbal communication skills. Advanced-level MS Office skills, particularly PowerPoint and Excel skills. Demonstrated leadership in and outside of the workplace. Strong, demonstrated interest and commitment to sustainability issues. Must be fluent in English and have strong written and verbal communication skills. Must legally able to work in Canada. Job_Description: One of Husky’s advantages is that we are an integrated oil and gas company. From exploration to development, production, refining and marketing, we’ve got it all! Combine this with a range of learning and development tools and an inclusive work environment, and you are well-positioned for a successful career at Husky.  We have training, mentoring and career development programs and resources to help you develop both personally and professionally – as an employee or a leader. We offer many internal leadership and business skills courses along with tuition reimbursement programs for qualified employees. Every year, a significant number of our employees are able to take on new roles within the company thanks to our strong focus on hands-on learning and development.  Husky is currently looking for an IS Business Analyst for their Calgary, AB office. The IS Business Analyst works closely with the IS Program Managers to gather and assess project requirements. They possess a solid understanding of business specific processes and collaborate with relevant IS teams to develop Project Development & Execution Framework artefacts. The role is integral in evaluating the business value and benefits associated within the projects and programs.  Specific responsibilities will include: Liaise with business teams to gather technical and non-technical business requirements on behalf of the Business Partners and IS Program Managers to create the Project artefacts for identified opportunities Utilize relevant business analysis techniques to perform solution analysis and design this could include but is not limited to: Requirements Management (requirements traceability, baselining, etc.) Enterprise Analysis (benchmark studies, feasibility analysis, SWOT, etc.) Requirements Analysis (process modeling, organization modeling, use cases, etc.) Solution Assessment and Validation (user acceptance testing, defect and issue reporting, etc.) Inform Business Partners and IS Program Managers of potential continuous improvement opportunities Conduct Requirements Management using relevant tools such as; requirements traceability matrices, base lining, prototyping, focus groups, etc. Perform Enterprise Analysis using relevant tools such as; benchmark studies, feasibility analysis, integration effectiveness, SWOT, etc. Conduct Process Analysis using relevant tools such as; process modeling, reverse engineering, organization modeling, use cases, etc. Participate and enhance the BA Community of Practice including tools, templates, etc. Qualifications  Our ideal candidate will have the following qualifications: College diploma or university degree in business or information systems or equivalent experience or combination thereof The following would be an asset: Certified Business Analysis Professional (CBAP) Project Management Professional (PMP) ITIL Foundations Minimum of five years’ direct experience of contributing to the success of a range of small-to-medium initiatives with escalating levels of complexity and business criticality Experience in facilitating change, including collaboration with management stakeholders Minimum of 5 years’ experience working with information technology in an oil and gas domain is desirable Proficient with Microsoft Office Experience using the following is preferred: ARIS Microsoft Visio SAP At Husky, we respect diversity and embrace an inclusive culture. We value uniqueness and different perspectives as they play a critical role in our success. To achieve this, individuals are selected based on qualifications, merit, and abilities and we encourage applications from everyone including visible minorities, Aboriginal people, women, and persons with disabilities.  Husky Energy is an integrated Canadian energy company. It is headquartered in Calgary, Alberta, and is publicly traded on the Toronto Stock Exchange under the symbol HSE. The Company operates Upstream and Downstream business segments, with operations in Canada, the United States, China and Indonesia.  Husky's balanced growth strategy focuses on consistent execution, disciplined financial management and safe and reliable operations.  Interested candidates must apply online at: www.huskyenergy.com/careers. Only those candidates who apply via Husky's online application process can be considered. We thank all applicants for their interest in our organization; however, only short-listed applicants will be contacted.  #LI-Post  Job Business Analysis Primary Location CA-AB-Calgary Job Posting May 9, 2018, 10:25:47 PM Unposting Date May 24, 2018, 5:59:00 AM

Job_Description: Job Description The Business Analyst will be responsible for research and supporting corporate growth initiatives - such as mergers and acquisitions. This position will report directly to the CEO and support the Executive Team members with the planning and execution of mergers and acquisitions as well as the company’s overall strategic planning process. Title: Business Analyst, Corporate Planning

Job_Description: Interested in being a part of a team that is leading the evolution of retail in Canada?  Embracing and driving change is critical to our success. The complexity and rate at which the retail industry is transforming has increased exponentially in recent years and we are committed to being a leader in the industry. As such we are relentlessly focused on innovating at every level of our business, investing in new technologies and products, and doubling down on the best talent to drive the company forward. It is an especially exciting time to join the Canadian Tire Family of Companies.  Our Technology team plays a critical role in our evolution, specifically as we transition to an omni-retailer where digital complements the physical. Our commitment to being a world-class digital organization is evident in how we are using cutting-edge technologies to bring our digital strategy to life in-store, online and on your mobile devices, ultimately improving customer experiences, driving traffic, and boosting loyalty.  The Corporate Application Delivery group supports all corporate portfolios with the planning (road mapping) and new capability project delivery. The team works core business hours, with occasional weekend or after-hours engagements to support the implementation of changes. The list of supported portfolios includes, but is not limited to, Legal, Loss Prevention, Corporate Security, Risk & Regulatory Affairs and Store Operations (Marks & FGL) as it relates to time and attendance tracking.  What you’ll do  As a member of the Corporate Application Delivery team the Senior Business Analyst will help define and deliver solutions that meet business objectives and will serve as the ultimate facilitator between the business and IT in truly understanding the business’ needs. The Sr. BA will contribute to the delivery of projects using the Agile delivery methodology. In partnership with Project Managers, Product owners, Business Stakeholders and IT interfacing groups The Sr. BA will lead the planning, requirements eliciting, analyzing designs, executing configuration changes, creation of test cases, implementation planning and support. This role will focus particularly on project delivery in any of the above mentioned portfolios.  Specific duties include: Influencing teams to define, prioritize requirements and user stories.  Facilitate or participate in JAM sessions to refine scope into a project’s initial requirements (user stories) and high-level design, producing appropriate documentation as needed.  Work with the Product Owner, other Business Analysts and project team members to prioritize the product backlog and help to define acceptance criteria for testing efforts. As a Sr BA, coordinate and oversee the work of other BAs as it relates to a specific project  Solid understanding of a formal project management methodology and Agile delivery methodology on cross-functional projects.  Support the Scrum Master and Project Manager during all phases of the project  Understanding of business case development and ongoing project level financials  Enterprise analysis – plan and scope several inter-related initiatives  Apply process standards to technology solutions  Execute system configuration changes as per project requirements  Provide support and participate in change management  Translate system functionality into business relevant language  Strong knowledge of business process design, mapping and optimization  Strong interpersonal and communication skills to play a key role within the project team  Strong planning and organizational skills, ability to prioritize, meet time commitments  Bridge the gap between both business and IT teams, ensuring common understanding and alignment of both functional and non-functional requirements  Build stakeholder trust by understanding business concepts, issues, opportunities and language  Convey requirements and design concepts with models such as gap analysis, UE cases and prototypes  In waterfall projects: using best practice methods and tools, you will be responsible for creating key deliverables like process flows, requirements packages, high level design packages, test cases and implementation plans for stakeholder approval  In waterfall projects: you will implement complete requirements tracking from business objectives, through all project phases, and into downstream processes to ensure consistent and accurate translation of requirements through all SDLC phases  In Agile projects: you will be responsible for creating, refining and maintaining user stories and associated deliverables such as process flows and test cases to meet development and stakeholder needs  Facilitate problem-solving discussions and general communications between the business and IT and within IT itself  Provide project management support  Contribute to a collaborative team environment by information sharing and team cooperation  Who you are  We are looking for high performing individuals who are: Agile and innovative individuals, who are able to manage in an environment of change and ambiguity to help us take bold and strategic moves in this rapidly evolving retail environment  Creative thinkers who take initiative and are capable of building, launching and managing projects/programs that drive results for our customers  Problem solvers with the ability to analyze and prioritize to meet business objectives  Collaborative team players with superior influencing skills, who build relationships easily across various stakeholder groups to move initiatives forward  If you’re curious, ready to take on new challenges and open to doing things differently to help us evolve rapidly, then Canadian Tire is definitely the place to be.  What you’ve done  University degree or equivalent  Minimum of 3 years of experience as a Business Analyst in a project-based environment  Strong knowledge of Retail systems, with a focus on the applications for the above mentioned portfolios.  Understanding and experience with Retail systems and processes in a shared services model, specifically for the above mentioned portfolios.  Fluent in technology and strong knowledge of project and software administration methodologies/techniques  Excellent verbal and communication skills.  Proficiency in written English and good documentation skills.  Why us  Canadian Tire and FGL Sports are Canada’s most iconic and diversified companies. Our culture and values uphold our pledge to sustainable practices, and commitment to our local communities through Jumpstart cannot be beat.  To learn more about this team and the Canadian Tire Family of Companies follow us on LinkedIn.  AODA/D&I; statement  Canadian Tire is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace for all. We recognize that our future success depends on the perspectives and contributions of all our employees -- their diverse backgrounds, abilities and experiences make our business stronger. If you are contacted for a job opportunity, please advise us of any accommodations needed to ensure fair and equitable access throughout the recruitment and selection process. All accommodation information provided will be treated as confidential and used only for the purpose of providing an accessible candidate experience.  FGL Corporate  Alberta-Calgary  Permanent  Full-time  Job Posting  :  May 17, 2018, 2:52:51 PM

Job_Description: The Senior Analyst is a quality and performance management role reporting to the Business Intelligence Manager. This position supports evaluation and performance-related activities within the greater Seniors, Palliative & Continuing Care (SPCC) portfolio. The position works with a high degree of independence to lead various business intelligence and evaluation initiatives. The position develops and manages various initiatives and/or programs and provides leadership to develop strategies for the coordination and delivery of evaluation and data management projects, tools, and resources. A highlight of the accountabilities and responsibilities of this role include: Leads business intelligence and statistical evaluation activities for the different programs within SPCC. Leads development of data frameworks as well as the collection, analysis and reporting of data from various sources for targeted audiences such as program leadership across SPCC. Analyzes data and prepares reports to identify trends within and across all SPCC programs. Facilitates program-specific and cross-program reviews and participates in development of QI processes as needed. Identifies critical risk factors for attention and recommends needs for change to ensure quality of care for AHS clients. Initiates contact with highly valued stakeholders such as provincial teams, various internal AHS portfolios and many more to inform and report on various evaluation and QI activities. Maintains ongoing relationships and optimal communications with diverse stakeholders including clinical and non-clinical audiences. Makes significant contributions in determining, monitoring, and achieving program outcomes; strategic planning and decision-making; and achieving program outcomes; strategic planning and decision-making; and ultimately improving quality of AHS client care. Proficiency in English with strong verbal written communication skills to produce reports that go to project partners at different levels within the organization. Experience in cleaning, linking, creating, modifying and analyzing data-sets in a statistical or database-management software package. Advanced SQL and relational database knowledge. Excellent interpersonal relations and demonstrated ability to work effectively with cross-functional teams. Working knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Visio and Access) and the ability to become proficient with new software packages. Technology independent; proven competency in multiple technologies and methodologies.  Proven ability to lead projects and deliver successful solutions.  Senior knowledge of application of software design patterns and integration patterns.  Highly competent in engaging with business stakeholders at all levels.
