Job_Description: Data & Business Insights Analysts  What you’ll do  In support of Operational Excellence, the Data & Business Insights Analysts  will be responsible for interpreting cleansed, mined data into a consumable format for the business. They will leverage discovered patterns and insights into actionable intelligence that can be clearly communicated to all levels of the organization’s leadership structure to aid in the overall corporate strategy.  Reporting to the AVP, Business Intelligence & Data Analytics, this position will work with all business units across the FGL banner to provide analytical interpretation; analysis, presented recommendations and consultative services to assist with new initiatives, day to day business, or to solve pressing business problems. The Business Intelligence group will also work to provide ad-hoc data when that data is not accessible by the business.  Responsibilities  Support the business with a full analytical services offering. Including developing operational reporting and executive dashboards, providing analysis, conclusions and recommendations for the business  Support of any departmental analytical team with augmented analysis and consultation for their new initiatives, day to day business and problem solving  Present findings to all levels of the organization’s leadership in an understandable and compelling manner  Take an active role in understanding the each department’s activities and strategies to gain a deeper understanding of the business  Optimize tasks to increase efficiency and accuracy, include driving the design of automation for the business.  Champion the Data Science capabilities and service offerings within the organization  Support the business with ad-hoc data requests to help them answer questions or to satisfy audit requirements.  What you bring…  5+ years of experience in a retail analytics or corporate retail environment.  Proficient with statistical methods and mathematical techniques including predictive modeling, regression, AB testing, cluster analysis, etc.  Ability to formulate or quickly understand business problems, find patterns and insights within structured and unstructured data.  Ability to clearly communicate results to technical and non-technical audiences.  Demonstrated experience in exploratory data analysis and data mining process of large, complex data sets (i.e. “Big Data”)  Comfort manipulating and analyzing complex, high-volume, high-dimensionality data from varying sources  Hands-on experience using business intelligence and statistical analysis tools such as R, Cognos, Micro Strategy, etc.  Familiarity with relational databases and SQL  Have a good eye for and an understanding of visual report design principles  Ability to execute multiple projects and drive key business results under tight deadlines.  Self-starter attitude with willingness to learn and master new technologies  Ability to work independently and in an ambiguous environment  FGL Corporate  Alberta-Calgary  Permanent  Full-time  Job Posting  :  Apr 19, 2018, 8:03:57 PM

Job_Description: Tervita is a leading environmental solutions provider. Our integrated earth, water, waste and resource solutions deliver safe and efficient results through all phases of a project by minimizing impact, maximizing returns.™ Our dedicated employees are trusted sustainability partners to oil and gas, construction, mining, government and communities. Safety is our highest priority: it influences our actions and shapes our culture.  Why Work for Tervita?  Competitive wages and comprehensive benefit plan  Opportunities for career growth  Industry - leading experience  A culture that puts safety first  Position Summary: Reporting to the Manager of Commercial, the Business Analyst role is responsible for tactical and strategic pricing, within a particular portfolio of business. Based in the corporate head office in Calgary, AB, the successful candidate will be responsible for a broad range of activities focused on managing the price program (pricing/market analysis) for their area of responsibility.  Key Responsibilities: Manage annual price program, including Price Book adjustments aligned to corporate strategy, market/competitive dynamics and yield initiatives, within assigned area of responsibility, which will be a specific region.  Manage the Contract Renewal Process in support of Sales, as defined in the Contract Renewal Process, providing contract analytics, and recommendations on price targets, trade space evaluation, competitive dynamics, overall contract strategy, and alignment to corporate strategy and objectives.  Manage the Published Book Rate and Market rates pricing.  Understand market dynamics for a specific sales region and provide analytical support for business case development.  Track, monitor, and evaluate the impact of pricing actions implemented; report results and provide market implications to management.  Support the Revenue planning and Forecast Process.  Provide analytics and pricing recommendations on day-to-day tactical pricing opportunities.  Support implementation of Salesforce Price Engine as needed, as well as maintain prices in Salesforce Price Engine, including book rates, discount structures and reporting.  Drive annual targets on market share, pricing, commitments and margin enhancement targets throughout range of pricing recommendations, by managing their pricing portfolio as a whole and developing a thorough understanding of market dynamics.  Drive implementation and execution of Campaigns with Sales and Operations.  Support the sales team as an expert on commercial processes, as well as providing various analytical reports such as sales self-serve tools.  Assist with QFAIM Pricing Process as needed.  Communicate regularly with various stakeholders, including all members of Sales, Operation and Business development.  Deliver advanced level of pricing analytics by statistically analyzing sales, pricing and market data  Utilize tools such as Excel, Word, Powerpoint, QFAIM, Geoscout, etc, in order to provide recommendations to various stakeholders, such Sales, Operations and Commercial leadership as needed.  Qualifications: University Degree or Diploma is required (preferably in Commerce, Business, Economics, Sociology, Mathematics, or something similar).  Minimum 3-5 years of experience (either within the industry or in other industries but with a focus in any of Marketing, Pricing, Yield, Planning, or Sales experience. Preference may be given to those with specific Pricing related experience).  Very strong analytical and problem solving skills, including excellent MS Excel (especially with data modeling experience).  Demonstrated experience in delivering results, managing internal expectations, using initiative and innovation for solving problems, and challenging the status quo.  Strong analytical and problem-solving skills  Highly self-motivated and directed and keen attention to detail.  Proven analytical and problem-solving capabilities.  Ability to multi-task in a fast-paced environment, manage multiple priorities and make ongoing decisions  Work effectively in situations involving rapid change, shifting priorities and multiple projects. Job_Description: We're looking to groom our next top producer! You'll be working with a high performing team focused on client service and innovation. WHAT'S THE BIG IDEA?  Our team at Calvert continues to produce great results in the rapidly expanding private mortgage lending industry. A successful applicant will be immersed in our underwriting team learning how to value property and make mortgage lending decisions. You will be working in a collaborative and caring culture and provided the tools and support for you to succeed with the goal of producing over $20,000,000 in funded mortgages annually  WHAT YOU'LL BE DOING? Business Development  Be actively engaged in industry leading initiatives including: securities compliance, mortgage rule changes, industry advocacy on provincial and federal initiatives, income tax act changes, real estate act changes and many other issues that impact the real estate, mortgage brokering and private mortgage lending business.  Community involvement that heightens Calvert's brand awareness in our industry and community by attending local events and participating in marketing and outreach activities. Grow your network to create lasting connections that will generate future opportunities Leverage customer relationship management tools to keep client files updated, and the team on the same page  Real Estate Valuations and Appraisals  Offering the best solution is highly dependent on the analysis of each individual loan application and their property security.  Review mortgage applications to determine needs, business plans, current financial situation, credit history, credit worthiness, and mortgage risk profile Inspect and value real estate, identify potential risks and analyze the real estate market and local economic conditions Organize and summarize this information in a way that will serve Calvert's goal of unprecedented speed without ever sacrificing accuracy Client Engagement  As an organization, we aim to be trusted advisors, offering an effortless experience in providing short term lending solutions for the personal and financial success of those who we work with. It is vital to know our clients. We listen and focus on each client experience to make every interaction meaningful.  Partner with brokers, or borrowers, discussing financing options, providing a proposal for their financing requirements. Preparing letters of interest, commitments, and release for funding A demonstrated thoroughness and attention to detail as well as the ability to prioritize tasks and work on multiple assignments in a team environment Exceptional communication skills, both written and oral, in front of a variety of internal and external audiences WHAT CAN WE OFFER YOU  An opportunity to be a part of culture committed to truly making a difference int he personal and financial success of others. We are a grounded and family-oriented workplace and equitable employer. Compensation and Benefits  Competitive salary, plus bonus potential Opportunity for share ownership Health spending accounts and/or benefits We'll financially contribute to "bucket list" experiences or achievements that a person hopes to have or accomplish
Title: Business Development, Analyst

Job_Description: Are you an abstract thinker that is passionate about technology? Looking for a job that’s different than anything you’ve ever done before? Do you have a lot to offer in a highly creative environment where your work has a direct impact on the success of the company? Stream Systems is rapidly gaining market credibility – and we’re having a whole lot of fun while doing it! Interested in learning how? We’d love to share our story with you.  Stream (www.streamsystems.ca) is a Canadian software company that provides a one of a kind software-as-a-service simulation platform that empowers users to create abstract digital twins of industrial assets. By combining business and operating rules with physics, engineering and finance, users are better equipped to make more informed business decisions. Stream’s engine has been tested in multiple industries, including but not limited to Energy (Oil and Gas and Renewables), Power, Mining and Metallurgy. We are looking for a talented, high-performing Business Analyst/Technical Writer to join our head office in Calgary, AB. Advanced knowledge of the following is required: Software Implementation (SaaS) in Information Technology Agile software development methodology Requirements gathering, use case development, acceptance testing, data analytics Development of wikis, user guides, quick reference guides, online help documentation & other training materials CBAP Certification would be considered an asset.  If your consider yourself to be an expert in your field and have over 7 years of demonstrated experience, please introduce yourself to us. We look forward to meeting you!  Please note that applications will be directed through Cadre to Stream Systems directly. We thank all those who apply but only qualified applicants will be contacted. Successful completion of a Criminal Background check will be required.
Title: Business Analyst/Tech Writer

Job_Description: Helping Albertans achieve their dreams by turning the complex world of banking into brilliantly simple solutions. That’s ATB. Is that you? Coach of the Year. Magnificent Mentor. Visionary. Motivator. Team Player. Whether at work or out in your community, you are the person that knows how to bring it all together. You’re a natural leader and your passion and excitement comes from knowing that your efforts make a significant difference in the lives of your team members, customers and the community around you. Continuous Improvement Analyst, Procurement The Procurement department is responsible for sourcing suppliers, hosting competitive bidding, negotiating contracts, establishing supplier governance programs, and making sure every ATB dollar spent returns the most value. We need an advanced analyst that can support our team on a variety of activities. The Continuous Improvement Analyst is responsible for performance reporting, quality assurance, and analytics activities within the Continuous Improvement function within the Procurement department. Part of their role includes developing procurement and contract management reporting dashboards and conducting data analysis in order to drive performance monitoring of the department. This role requires collaboration with all Procurement functions in researching and analyzing high complexity work / data in support of business functions, Procurement process optimization, systems requirements and generating/compiling reports/recommendations based on findings. This role will be responsible for developing and maintaining performance dashboards, establishing and reporting on Procurement’s metrics, and managing standard reporting across Procurement functions.  We crave diversity of thought, we love big ideas and we value those with the ability to obsessively listen to the needs of the business and provide smart, simple and helpful solutions that drive real business value. Job Requirements As the ideal candidate you possess: Advanced computer skills; ability to learn, utilize, and update various databases, programs and systems such as Google Suite, Google App Script, SAP, industry standard procurement and supply chain technologies, and industry standard analytics applications such as Tableau. Bachelor’s degree in Management Information Systems or Finance related degree is preferred. A minimum 3-5 years related experience. Advanced written and oral communication skills. Advanced analytical skills with ability to share business insights beyond the numbers. Advanced presentation creation skills. Ex: creating visually appealing infographics or slides within Google Slides or PowerPoint. Advanced data analysis and problem solving skills are required. Advanced Google Sheet or Excel data manipulation skills (ex: Pivot tables, VLookups, Macros). SAP reporting and eProcurement / Contract management system experience. Skills that are a “nice to have”... Understanding of Procurement, Strategic Sourcing and Category Management objectives, best practices, and processes. Additional relative certifications are preferred (e.g. Contracts, People Management, Facilitation, Project Management). Experience in procurement, supply chain, and contract management is preferred. Working knowledge of the banking industry and managing customer experience is preferred. So what can ATB Financial offer you? Imagine paying less for your everyday banking, mortgages, loans and investments. Throw in an excellent benefits and pension package, opportunities for career advancement, and a financial institution that’s leading the way in change – now you’re talking about a career with a company that allows you to grow. As an award-winning employer-of-choice – we have the best of the best working for Albertans. Sound like a team you want to be a part of? Advancement. Fun. Rewards… We get it.
Title: Continuous Improvement Analyst, Procurement

Job_Description: You are curious, persistent, logical and clever – a true techie at heart. You enjoy living by the code of your craft and developing elegant solutions for complex problems. If this sounds like you, this could be the perfect opportunity to join EPAM as a Senior Business Analyst. Scroll down to learn more about the position’s responsibilities and requirements.  EPAM Canada is seeking a strong and consultative Senior Business Analyst to join our team in Calgary. As a Senior Business Analyst at EPAM, you will be playing a key role on EPAM engagements by working with the client to establish and document business requirements, business processes and identifying the business problem. You will be guiding the creation of User Stories, Conceptual Design, Business Requirements, including Data Flow Diagrams, Report & Screen Diagrams & Entity Relationship Diagrams. You will be a domain expert working directly onsite with the EPAM client to articulate their needs and then solution them. Job_Description: *PLEASE NOTE: PREFERENCE WILL BE GIVEN TO CANDIDATES WHO APPLY THROUGH CANFOR.COM/CAREERSCanfor TechnologyAt Canfor, our Information Technology professionals play an important role in the daily functioning of our operations. Consistently pushing the boundaries when it comes to innovation within the forestry and pulp and paper industries, our IT professionals support Canfor in achieving exceptional results.With a high caliber Information Technology leadership team, a clear vision, and significant growth and training opportunities, a career in IT at Canfor allows individuals to strengthen their competencies and grow within their respective roles. Working as an equal partner with our operations to achieve organizational objectives, you will be at the forefront of innovation.Who We Are: Canfor is one of the world’s largest and most respected integrated forest products companies. For more than 75 years, we have been delivering top-quality lumber, pulp and paper products to our valued customers worldwide. With operations in Western Canada and the Southern United States, and sales offices around the world, you can find Canfor products in every corner of the globe. We are leaders in sustainable forest management and in converting wood residuals into green energy.As we continue to grow our company and our markets, find out how you can grow your career with us.The OpportunityThe Data Analyst, Business Intelligence supports Canfor’s objectives by turning data into meaningful information that can be used to make sound business decisions. The Data Analyst will provide expertise in business intelligence to prepare and deliver data and information to internal customers and stakeholders through reports, dashboards and scorecards. It is essential that the Data Analyst build an understanding of the business at a level of detail that enables them to work with the business to deliver valuable information.Please Note:  This is a relocation opportunity in Vancouver, British Columbia. The successful applicant may be provided with relocation assistance.Main ResponsibilitiesRequirements Gathering:Engage with various business units to capture information needs, compare those needs with existing tools and identify gapsParticipate in business requirements workshopsWrite business requirements documents as required to elaborate needs, gain acceptanceDesign & Development:Architect tables and dataDesign dashboards, reports, drill-down analytics and data visualizationsDesign, configure and administer the metadata layerCreate system technical requirements for documentation and knowledge managementActively challenge and find solutions to optimize system performanceTesting, Validation, Release Management:Develop and implement testing strategiesValidate data accuracyDeploy and validate changes in production environmentTraining & Change Management:Support the development of training, documentation, and help desk capabilitiesRequired SkillsBachelor's degree in computer science, information systems, business management or specialized training/certificationExperience working with relational databases (Microsoft SQL Server, Oracle Database, MySQL, etc)Applied knowledge of SQL (T-SQL, PL/SQL, ANSI-SQL, etc)Applied understanding of data modelling and warehousing conceptsWorking knowledge of business intelligence tools such as Oracle Business IntelligenceWorking knowledge of ETL tools such as Oracle Data Integrator or InformaticaExperience mediating and clarifying sometimes ambiguous or conflicting end user requirementsEagerness to learn new concepts and technologies and keep-up-to-date with existing onesWillingness to go above and beyond to understand both the business and technical aspects of a problemHiring for this position is ongoing and will be filled as required. To be considered for this position, please apply today.In order to be eligible for this position, you must be legally entitled to work in Canada for our Company.There has never been a better time to join the Canfor Information Technology team and become a part of the modern forest industry. We have a wide range of rewarding and innovative careers in some of the best communities in North America, with plenty of room for advancement. We offer competitive compensation and benefits packages, and are committed to the professional development of our employees.*PLEASE NOTE: PREFERENCE WILL BE GIVEN TO CANDIDATES WHO APPLY THROUGH CANFOR.COM/CAREERSFollow us on LinkedIn , Twitter , and Facebook for Canfor news, career opportunities, and upcoming events!Vancouver, BCThe city of Vancouver is both a natural beauty and a progressive urban centre, a rare place on earth that is idyllic and electric all at once. With one of Canada’s mildest climates, Vancouver is ideally suited for those devoted to outdoor pursuits, health and wellness. Along with its endless supply of fresh air and clean water, Vancouver also boasts countless choices for culturally diverse, world-class cuisine and an inventory of arts and entertainment events. For more information, visit http://canfor.com/our-company/our-communities/vancouverJob Type: Full-timeEducation:High school or equivalent

Job_Description: Inter Pipeline is a major petroleum transportation, storage and natural gas liquids processing business that ranks among the largest energy infrastructure companies in Canada. We are proud to be named one of Alberta’s Top 70 Employers, which recognizes Alberta businesses that lead their industries by being exceptional places to work.  Located out of our Calgary office, the individual in the Senior Business Analyst role will report to the Supervisor, Finance Solutions Centre. The successful candidate will be responsible for the stewardship of finance master data and project support within SAP for Inter Pipeline, as well indirect leadership of the Business Analyst.  Key Activities and Responsibilities: Review and ongoing improvement of master data creation/change approval processes Leadership of the Business Analyst role, utilizing a team accountability approach for facilitating finance master data creation/changes Work with the business and SAP Competency Centre to develop Service Level Agreements (SLAs), key performance indicators (KPIs) and other metrics for SAP finance master data Act as a data steward bringing forward cross-functional data quality and process integration issues and working collaboratively to solve them, championing the collective management of data governance Serve as a central point of contact for finance data governance understanding and providing direction and training to data consumers and producers from the business in line with business rules Ensure the right stakeholders across the enterprise (e.g. operations, finance, supply chain, etc.) are brought into make business process improvements which mitigate data issues Bring best practices in master data management and propose opportunities for improvement Interaction with SAP Competency Center on future system enhancements, builds, testing, and roll-outs Assist with development and usage of SAP reports  Education, Skills and Experience: Undergraduate diploma or degree in business with 5+ years of progressive experience in financial system support, CPA (CA, CMA, CGA) designation is an asset Strong finance expertise on master data usage, configuration, and integrated data requirements/linkage points combined with prior oil and gas experience considered an asset In depth knowledge of SAP FI_CO and Business Warehouse, experience with S/4HANA and Fiori an asset Approaches work with a high level of curiosity and aptitude to identify and solve problems, takes initiative, is accountable, and works independently Change agent who can persuade and influence stakeholders to establish new processes, shift to automation, and provide innovative solutions Ability to manage internal and external relationships with well-developed interpersonal, team, customer service and communication skills (both written and verbal) Strong customer service skills in working with internal departments to achieve results through relationships with people and teams Able to work well in a fast-paced, growth environment, with strong attention to detail and accuracy Maintains strong initiative and possesses superior analytical skills
Title: Senior Business Analyst

Job_Description: Business Analyst for Application Development Processes:  full time, 6 month duration, based in Calgary This role provides ownership and oversight of all process development, improvement, and implementation of Software Process Improvement (SPI) based on the CMM framework.A key responsibility of this group is to monitor process metrics in order to identify either problem areas or identify opportunities for process improvement.They are responsible for staffing the SEPG team and providing direction in applying the Process Change Method (PCM) for the account and in training the delivery team.They train the delivery team, begins the implementation, acts as process owner for changes and updates, and plans and leads the IBM tasks of the Software Engineering Institute (SEI) CMM-based assessment.They also engage ADE to perform an effectiveness study when funded and appropriate.Capture business requirements, analysis of requirements, mapping of requirements (As is and To be processes)Particular focus on Windows 10 application Please send your resumes to Danielle Pelletier at daniellep@tes.net.
Title: Business Analyst

Job_Description: Interested in being a part of a team that is leading the evolution of retail in Canada?  Embracing and driving change is critical to our success. The complexity and rate at which the retail industry is transforming has increased exponentially in recent years and we are committed to being a leader in the industry. As such we are relentlessly focused on innovating at every level of our business, investing in new technologies and products, and doubling down on the best talent to drive the company forward. It is an especially exciting time to join the Canadian Tire Family of Companies.  Our Technology team plays a critical role in our evolution, specifically as we transition to an omni-retailer where digital complements the physical. Our commitment to being a world-class digital organization is evident in how we are using cutting-edge technologies to bring our digital strategy to life in-store, online and on your mobile devices, ultimately improving customer experiences, driving traffic, and boosting loyalty.  Reporting directly to the Manager, Data Governance and Business Intelligence, the Data Analyst will work directly with internal and external delivery teams, vendors, partner resources, project managers, business analysts, data architects, developers and stakeholders to help provide quality work for our business with a focus on data governance.  The successful candidate will be quality focused, passionate, a quick-learner, self-motivated, analytical, detail-oriented, and ready to become a key contributor in short time. They will ensure a high caliber of data quality through the duration of the project work. They will support the Data Governance Team and Manager in reporting the status of the deliverables across all stakeholders within the organization.  What you’ll do  As a member of the Data Governance Team, the Data Analyst will work with teams across all portfolios to deliver robust solutions for our business.  Specific responsibilities include: Work with relational databases, and all other integrated interfaced systems for Marks and FGL.  Understand applications and data, to a level where they can build and execute SQL statements.  Work closely with developers, database administrators, and Data Architects to design transformations between data models and implement best practices designs, apply a technical understanding and interpersonal skills to support the successful development and delivery of projects related to Business Intelligence, Data Integration, and Data Warehousing.  Manage and work on projects with both Business and IT Project Managers in regards to any new or changes to data elements.  Ensure detailed data requirements are understood by the delivery services team and adequately documented for the business solution.  Translate identified business requirements and use in-depth knowledge of data content to generate data mappings to enable data integration development.  Understand use of data by the business processes to identify transformations, rules and formats.  Work with Solution/Integration Architecture on the data related aspects of solution specification.  Articulate and promote the corporate data design principals ensuring they are followed in all designed and developed business solutions.  Represent the enterprise data standard and guidelines to support the definition of policies, standards, and procedures for the development and operation of database objects and ETL solutions.  Facilitate workshops, handle complex questions from varied audiences, and respond to difficult questions.  Support development teams with data content knowledge and data transformation design.  Map data flows between systems and recommend design changes to improve performance and reliability.  Participate in review sessions for ETL and data model designs.  Interact and build strong on-going relationships with all business clients.  Champion the governance principles set by the team, with the business.  Manage and coach other DA’s on multiple work assignments in fast paced, ever-changing business and IT environments.  Develop, maintain, and share best practices as well as contributes to improve them at Marks and FGL.  Who you are  We are looking for high performing individuals who are: Agile and innovative individuals, who are able to manage in an environment of change and ambiguity to help us take bold and strategic moves in this rapidly evolving retail environment.  Creative thinkers who take initiative and are capable of building, launching and managing project work that drive results for our customers.  Problem solvers with the ability to analyze and prioritize to meet business objectives.  Collaborative team players with superior influencing skills, who build relationships easily across various stakeholder groups to move initiatives forward and have excellent written, oral and presentation skills.  Positive, pragmatic and results oriented, hands on when required, with a focus on achieving meaningful results.  Able to think both tactically and strategically, and to communicate ideas in a way that will facilitate the development of optimal solutions.  Able to effectively manage timelines and communicate requirements to key stakeholders to achieve timelines.  Apply curiosity and skills to clarify business, data and analytical issues and help develop solutions.  If you’re curious, ready to take on new challenges and open to doing things differently to help us evolve rapidly, then Canadian Tire is definitely the place to be.  What you’ve done  The successful candidate will have the following: 5+ years industry experience in data analysis or data architecture.  Degree in Business Admin, Computer Science, Information Technology or equivalent experience.  Experience working with complex data structures.  Experience working in a highly integrated, multi-project environment.  Knowledge of both traditional waterfall and Agile project methodologies.  Experience working with both in house and vendor developed applications.  Familiar working with Jira, Confluence, GIT, MS Office Suite.  Experience with TOAD/DB Visualizer/Aqua Data Studio/XML Spy.  Familiar with Change Data Capture, IIB, Data Stage and Tibco.  Detailed oriented personality complimented with strong analytical and problem solving skills.  Retail related experience, an asset.  Experience with application migration and upgrade projects.  An in-depth understanding of data within the following retail business domains: Finance, Supply Chain Management, Merchandising and Marketing, Human Resources or Store Operations.  Experience with the following applications and data, an asset. (PMM, Demand/Fulfillment, Size Scaling, SAS, People Soft, Cognos, Microstrategy, Hadoop).  Working knowledge of relational database technology, specifically Oracle, SQL Server, and UDB.  Expert knowledge of Structured Query Language (SQL).  Working knowledge using data modeling tools, preferably ER Studio.  Understanding of ETL tools and ETL principals.  Working knowledge of web, Windows, database, data warehouse, integration, and security technologies.  Knowledgeable in all facets of architecture, including application, data, business and technology.  Knowledgeable in current and emergent technologies in IT.  Knowledge of Canadian Tire Corporation, Mark’s and FGL environments a definite asset.  Why us: Canadian Tire is one of Canada’s most iconic and diversified companies. Our culture and values uphold our pledge to sustainable practices, and commitment to our local communities through Jumpstart cannot be beat.  To learn more about this team and the Canadian Tire Family of Companies follow us on LinkedIn.  AODA/D&I; statement  Canadian Tire is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace for all. We recognize that our future success depends on the perspectives and contributions of all our employees -- their diverse backgrounds, abilities and experiences make our business stronger. If you are contacted for a job opportunity, please advise us of any accommodations needed to ensure fair and equitable access throughout the recruitment and selection process. All accommodation information provided will be treated as confidential and used only for the purpose of providing an accessible candidate experience.  FGL Corporate  Alberta-Calgary  Permanent  Full-time  Job Posting  :  May 11, 2018, 2:34:19 PM
Title: Data Analyst

Job_Description: Job Description  Are you ready to put your data analysis skills to work in a fast-paced and challenging environment? We are looking for candidates that have a breadth of technical expertise including the ability to collect requirements, develop plans of action, analyze and report. A significant portion of this role will include data mining, cleansing and modeling. Experience with BI tools such as Microstrategy or Tableau is desired as well as scripting experience in either Python or R. This is an opportunity to join a well-established and agile technology company. Our video, broadband and WiFi products are used by a number of large IP communication providers around the world and provide insight into customer usage patterns and service quality levels. We process massive amounts of data and this position will give you the chance to work with large databases and to gain experience in a fast-paced environment. You will be empowered to explore the data for insights and to present the findings in creative ways. Data visualization is a significant component of this role and you will have the opportunity to quickly integrate into existing projects. Typical job responsibilities: Ad-hoc analysis to determine quality of performance, service performance trends and similar key operational patterns/insights Report development and build dashboards to provide the insights at scale Support of analytical requests from Customers, Operations and Sales teams Provide statistical and machine learning leadership to the internal teams. As our Ideal Candidate: You have a strong background in gathering data and applying statistical methods You are curious and able to pull out actionable insights from large datasets You have strong attention to detail and are able to understand the “big picture” You are a self-starter with a high degree of organization and discipline to achieve desired results You embrace challenges in an ever-changing environment Qualifications  BA/BSc degree in Statistics or related field (Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics) Scientific Computing, Statistics, Data Analytics, Machine Learning or equivalent experienc Very comfortable with databases (Oracle, PostgreSQL, Hadoop, etc.), Business Intelligence tools (MicroStrategy, Tableau or similar) and scripting languages (Python, R) Strong written and verbal (English) communication skills Above-average problem solving skills with great intuition, curiosity and ability to clearly articulate findings to various stakeholders Additional Information  All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.
Title: Data Analyst

Job_Description: Reporting to the VP of Corporate Development, the Business Development Analyst will support the organization’s growth by helping Tundra acquire companies.  Key Responsibilities The responsibilities of this role include, but are not limited to: Research potential acquisition targets and the related market segments Initiating contact and fostering relationships with potential acquisition targets Preparing business plans, financial models and competitor analysis Executing NDA’s and preparing LOI’s Assist with due diligence and implementation/integration plans Requirements University or college degree in Business, Finance or related field CBV, CPA, MBA or CFA preferred Minimum 2 years of industry experience Ability to multi-task, prioritize, and work positively under pressure Ability to be pro-active and anticipate the needs of the team Exceptional organizational skills and attention to detail High proficiency in Microsoft office products (Excel, Word, PowerPoint) Benefits We offer a base salary with benefits and a generous compensation package. We have a strong philanthropic presence within Alberta and work closely with charities such as The Kids Cancer Care Foundation of Alberta, motionball and others. We are always looking to provide our employees with different opportunities to give back to the community, often during work hours.
Title: Business Development Analyst

Job_Description: Posting Open Date: 05/18/2018 Posting Close Date: 06/03/2018 (Please note the posting will close at 11:59pm)  Job Title: New Graduate Analyst - Technical Operations Start Date: September 2018 Position: Full Time, Permanent Location: Calgary, AB WestJet is looking to university students and graduates who can help us realize our vision of being recognized internationally as the most Canadian airline. We believe the future of WestJet lies with innovative thinking, continuous improvement, and active stewards of our culture––as well as the fresh perspectives of the next generation of leaders. The New Graduate Analyst program welcomes resourceful, data-driven undergraduate and master’s degree students in diverse disciplines who are close to completing their degrees, to become New Graduate analysts in key areas; revenue management, finance management, technical operations, flight operations, airport operations, and information technology. During their first year at WestJet, the new graduate experiences the support of a transformational leadership community made up of Executive Sponsors, Direct Leaders, Team Mentors, Culture Buddies and other new graduates all starting the program at the same time. Further corporate information is available here: https://www.westjet.com/en-ca/about-us/index We are seeking a new Business Analyst reporting to the Vice President Technical Operations; this role is a blend of strategic planning and analysis, business intuition, critical thinking, project leadership, advisory service and administrative support. The role provides support for decisions which require thought leadership, financial analysis and modeling, and collaboration cross-functionally to create and capture value for WestJet. Responsibilities: Provide the VP Technical Operations with analytical and organizational support, acting as the primary medium of information sharing and coordination amongst the Technical Operations Team Facilitate and review the Technical Operations team’s strategic business discussions to ensure objectives continually align and tie into the overall Operations Team business strategy; Manage and lead the internal planning activities for WestJet’s Technical Operations department including monthly scorecard objectives and key results, bi-weekly leadership meetings, President’s reports, budget alignment, flow of Board of Directors decisions and results, and Town Hall events, among others; Develop financial rigor and structure to support VP level decisions on major strategic initiatives and ensure the Technical Operations Team is working within budget Research and develop a deep understanding of the Technical Operations function and communicate industry trends and changes in the competitive landscape to the VP & Technical Operation Team Summarize insights in a way that facilitates decisions and develop high-impact presentations for senior-level executives Qualifications: An MBA Degree with a background in engineering, business, economics, or statistics is required. 3+ years of relevant work experience in strategic planning or management consulting; previous airline experience is an asset Strong analytical, financial modeling and forecasting skills including financial statement analysis Proven organizational and project management skills with the ability to manage multiple simultaneous projects under tight deadlines Naturally curious, highly organized and detail-oriented self-starter that takes great pride in delivering high-quality results Well-rounded interpersonal skills with the ability to effectively build strong relationships Highly self-motivated and willing to proactively take on leadership roles within project teams; ready to go the extra mile to support the team Demonstrated skills and accomplishments: Proven critical thinking skills in developing complex analysis on strategic initiatives where errors in logic, judgment, and math are extremely costly and very difficult to reverse Demonstrated ability to conduct detailed financial and strategic analysis, drawing out implications and recommendations Proven track record of synthesizing qualitative and quantitative analysis into clear, concise and insightful reports and presentation materials Demonstrated project management abilities Our mission is to enrich the lives of everyone in WestJet’s world by providing safe, friendly and affordable air travel. Our passionate, caring attitude is the foundation of WestJet’s corporate culture and the fuel for everything we achieve. If this sounds like the sort of environment where you’d love to learn and make a contribution, we’d very much like to meet you. Only candidates who have graduated within the last two years with a degree from a recognized post-secondary institution will be considered.
Title: New Graduate, Analyst - Technical Operations

Job_Description: Viking is seeking an experienced Business Development Analyst to join Viking's Customer Service & Product Support department in Calgary, Alberta. Viking Air Limited is the global leader providing support and services, and manufacturing of utility, specialty, and fire-fighting aircraft. Viking provides OEM support for the global fleet of de Havilland DHC-1 through DHC-7 and the Bombardier CL-215, 215T and 415 aircraft. SUMMARY OF FUNCTIONS: We are looking for a Business Development Analyst to participate in our overall marketing efforts with concentration on research and data analytics. Your main responsibilities include conducting research and providing insights regarding the market, trends, competitors, potential and existing customers, and current campaigns. Use data to determine the company's position in the marketplace by researching their competitors and analyzing their prices, sales, and marketing methods. The goal is to support the Marketing team in delivering an effective program that will help the growth of the company. MAJOR DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: Conduct research to identify new markets and customer needs. Convert complex data and findings into understandable tables, graphs, and written reports; Prepare reports by collecting and analyzing sales data; Create databases and capture market data; Analyze marketing metrics to identify cause and effect relationships; Analyze data using statistical software; Monitor and forecast marketing and sales trends; Generate reports that analyze competition and customers. Provide competitive analysis on various companies' market offerings; identify market trends; pricing/business models; sales and methods of operation. Remain fully informed on market trends; other parties researches and implement best practices. Familiarity with CRM programs Working knowledge of data warehousing, modelling and mining. Conduct secondary research, including finding information from industry associations, statisticians and marketing experts. Set up tracking systems for online marketing activities. Assist in outbound or inbound marketing activities. Assist in analyzing marketing data (campaign results, conversion rates, traffic etc.) Examine a campaign's return on investment. EXPERIENCE AND/OR EDUCATIONAL REQUIREMENTS: Bachelor's degree in Statistics, Marketing or related field Proven work experience as a Marketing Specialist, Data Analyst or similar role Exceptional analytical abilities, including the interpretation of large data sets and deciphering the findings into clear messages and visuals Demonstrable experience in marketing data analytics and tools Strong MS Excel skills are preferred, and experience using SQL and VBA. Search engines, web analytics and business research tools acumen Familiarity with Customer Relationship Management and Content Management System software Knowledge of HTML, CSS and web development tools preferred Strong analytical and critical thinking We thank all applicants for applying, however; only selected candidates will be contacted.
Title: Business Development Analyst

Job_Description: What you’ll do  As a team member, you will: Provide application technical support by investigating, troubleshooting and resolving operational application functionality related issues.  Manage application updates and ensure proper testing, documenting, and communications.  Document application problems and resolutions for future reference.  Document stakeholder requirements, and collaborate with all necessary stakeholders to determine scope items.  Configure software to meet documented requirements.  Test software based on Horizon North best practices and specifications.  Create and maintain system documentation  Acts as the liaison between various employees, technology and support teams  Develop and maintain an understanding of the business processes that rely on the supported applications.  Responsible for maintaining the integrity and availability of the business data while stored in IS Systems.  Responsible for supporting the achievement of Service Level Expectations (SLE) for supported applications.  Develop and maintain an effective work intake and management process.  Follow the development, and release of processes, procedures and systems required to accomplish goals.  Represent the team at various cross functional meetings and/or projects; promote existing and new programs and/or policies.  Participate on teams or projects which recommend, coordinate, and implement changes and/or improvements to products or systems.  Communicate with customers concerning issue escalation and established procedures.  Manage critical issues to resolution.  Perform other operational duties as required.  Comply with HNL safety policies and procedures  Support the company’s the vision and goals  Who you are  We are looking for high performing individuals who are: Agile and innovative individuals, who can manage in an environment of change and ambiguity to help us take bold and strategic moves in this rapidly evolving environment  Creative thinkers who take initiative and are capable of building, launching and managing projects/programs that drive results for our customers  Problem solvers with the ability to analyze and prioritize to meet business objectives  Collaborative team players with superior influencing skills, who build relationships easily across various stakeholder groups to move initiatives forward  Solid understanding of business process and supporting technologies;  Ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks in a high-pressure environment;  What you’ve done  Bachelor’s degree or technical diploma from an accredited institution in Computer Science, Information Technology (IT) or related field;  5+ years of IT experience implementing, operating, enhancing, both packaged and custom applications  Experience with Financial Applications  Experience with implementing applications from requirements to delivery.  Experience with MS SQL and related reporting applications  Experience with MS PowerBI  Experience writing DAX  Experience supporting a medium to large Finance, HR and QHSE team.  Why us  We are industry leaders, always on the lookout for top talent. Embracing and driving change is critical to Horizon North’s success. The complexity and rate at which our portfolio is transforming has increased exponentially in recent years and we are committed to becoming a leader in the industry. As such we are relentlessly focused on innovating at every level of our business, and doubling down on the best talent to drive the company forward. It is an especially exciting time to join Horizon North.  Our industrial division supplies workforce accommodations, camp management services, access solutions, relocatable structures, and maintenance and utilities services.  Our modular construction division produces high quality building solutions for commercial and residential clients, including; offices, hotels, and retail buildings, as well as distinctive single detached homes and multi-family residential structures.  Because of our well diversified offering, Horizon North is uniquely positioned to meet the needs of our customers in numerous sectors, anywhere in Canada.  We are always looking for motivated and talented individuals who share our and are looking for people who want to build an organization they can be proud of, with growth opportunities befitting a brand that is entrepreneurial, innovative and highly competitive.  To learn more about this team and Horizon North, follow us on LinkedIn. This is not intended to be an exhaustive list of all responsibilities and duties required of personnel so classified.

Job_Description: The SAP FICO Business Analyst is a member of a team providing leadership, support and expertise to the SAP user community for activities related to Treasury, AP, FICO, Month End processes, Project Systems, Planning, JVA, etc. The position includes application support and enhancements with a focus on issue management, timely resolution of problems, and process improvements to ensure business benefits realization. This is a permanent position with the SAP Solution Centre (SSC) reporting to the Manager, IT Business Applications, SAP Finance. Job Duties & Responsibilities Provide consultation and advice to the global SAP user community on effective use of SAP for Treasury and Accounts Payable. Utilize SAP configuration skills in Treasury and AP to assist business in their requirements, Collaborate with other team members on other SAP modules, i.e. FICO, MM, JVA , AM, ECCS, PM, etc, Advise SSC team members in regard to their business process and SAP design enhancements that integrate with Treasury, Proactive resolution of SAP and / or business integration issues with other SSC groups including Logistics, Systems Development, Reporting and Training, Respond to and resolve SAP user requests, issues and problems within defined service levels, Identify and assist in development of reporting solutions to improve information delivery, Test changes and upgrades to existing functionality, including coordination of user testing, Assist in the development, maintenance and delivery of education strategies and training material, Employ critical thinking skills to meet both the short and long term business solutions for customers, Apply excellent interpersonal and communication skills along with a strong customer service focus to work effectively with the user groups and support team members. Education & Experience SAP support experience in Treasury and Accounts Payable is required, Experience in other SAP modules (i.e. FICO, JVA, AM, etc) is considered an asset Combined strong business background relating to finance and accounting, ideally in upstream Oil & Gas, with a minimum 3 years user and / or support experience with SAP, Exposure to foreign currency management and revaluation is an asset, Possession of a finance or accounting designation considered an asset, Strong problem solving skills and attention to detail, Excellent time management skills with the ability to prioritize workload, Ability to deal effectively with all level of professionals within the company, Ability to work both independently and in a team environment.

Assist with the day-to-day management, administration, and continuous improvement of AESO’s IT Vendor Management Office program. Managing multiple vendors’ performance (KPI, SLA), relationship, etc. Assist with the development, maintenance, and administration of competitive processes, and procurement exceptions and reliefs Plan and execute negotiations with vendors Development, monitoring, and reporting of vendor performance as applicable. Assist with Contract Reviews and Approvals. Monitor short-term and long-term (multiple year) procurement needs based on policy, and develop and monitor plans to meet those needs Provide regular reporting to IT leadership on IT procurement and contract matters Support to IT service management monitoring and reporting  Education / Degree / Certification: Degree or Diploma in applicable field (i.e. Business Administration) preferred. 5-10 years similar work experience will be considered. ITIL Foundations would be an asset.  Job Experience: Minimum 5 years’ experience in a similar role; Knowledge of IT Managed Service function is vital; background in IT Service Management and Account management; Competitive sourcing of IT services (i.e. RFx) and the coordination of evaluations; Contract negotiation, administration, and ongoing governance; IT Service Management; Monitoring and tracking of vendor performance (i.e. SLA’s, OLA’s and KPI’s); Managing performance, relationships, and governance in a multi-vendor environment; Developing and maintaining relationships with Business Units; Flexibility to work on multiple job assignments; Excellent written and verbal communication skills; Ability to work within a dynamic team environment; Comfortable with general IT terminology; General IT, MS Office skills, strength in Word and Excel; and Utilities industry experience would be a definite asset  Application deadline: May 31, 2018

Job_Description: The role of a Support Analyst is to provide first line support service via the Service Desk, receiving incidents and service requests from telephone calls, intranet forms and emails. The Support Analyst will provide first call resolution to end user service requests while participating in level 1 and 2 support on applications and infrastructure incidents. They will also provide training and coaching to junior and coop staff.  Key Responsibilities The responsibilities of this role include, but are not limited to:  Provide first line service desk support by responding to support calls, service requests and logging all incidents into the service desk ticketing system. Provide first call resolution for desktop, application, email, virus protection/removal, printing, and end user ‘how to’ support requests. Provide level 1 & 2 support on troubleshooting back end server and network connectivity issues, escalating requests to level 3 support resources as appropriate. Monitor the queue to prioritize and address high priority and critical issues first Provide level 1 support for enterprise applications, escalating requests to level 2 support resources as appropriate. Provide onsite desktop and deployment support for new releases of key enterprise applications Configure and deploy desktops, laptops, phones (mobile & landline) and printers for new employees. Contribute to the knowledge base by creating user guides and documentation for known issues. Gain a basic understanding of key business specific applications in order to provide ‘value-add’ technical support. Perform hands-on fixes at the desktop level, including installing and upgrading software, installing hardware, and configuring systems and applications. Will be required to participate in after-hours support on-call rotation. Qualifications and Education Requirements The successful candidate will have:  1 - 5 years relevant work experience. University or college degree in Computer Science or related field Basic knowledge of IT hardware including PCs, switches, printers, mobile devices. Experience with desktop operating systems and applications (i.e. Windows, office, Citrix, Dynamics). Basic application support experience (i.e. Office, Dynamics AX, CRM, SharePoint, SysAid). Basic network knowledge and network troubleshooting skills. Working knowledge of a range of diagnostic utilities. Exceptional written and oral communication skills. Exceptional interpersonal skills, with a focus on rapport-building, listening, and questioning skills. Ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks in a high-pressure environment. Please note: This is a 12 month term position. Qualifications Skills  Preferred Strong Customer Relationship Building Advanced Interpersonal Skills Advanced Ability to Meet Timelines Advanced Microsoft Office Advanced Computer Skills Advanced Behaviors  Preferred Dedicated: Devoted to a task or purpose with loyalty or integrity Team Player: Works well as a member of a group Education Required Bachelors or better in Computer Science or related field.  Experience Required 1-5 years: IT Support  Licenses & Certifications Required Drivers Licence (Class 5)

Key Responsibilities  The successful candidate will be responsible for: Serving as primary contact for any questions related to how IT related systems work from both a business and technical perspective;  Collaborating with other team members to determine requirements, create technical specifications, designs, and processes;  Performing cost-benefit calculations, interdependency analysis, and prioritization exercises related to systems implementations and changes;  Partnering with business, financial, marketing, and technical teams to understand and define system goals and technical system requirements;  Creating requirements, technical specifications and processes using structured analysis including data modeling techniques (i.e. activity diagrams, entity-relationship diagrams);  Partnering with designers to build system functionality and quality attributes;  Assisting Corporate IT groups in revising logic for performance efficiency;  Participating in system and user acceptance testing efforts;  Building standards, processes and procedures, and guidelines for business and technical teams;  Evaluating system cost-benefit and ROI analyses; and,  Understanding system interdependencies and collaborate with project teams accordingly. Job_Description: Build a meaningful career  At Morneau Shepell, we offer more than career opportunities, we provide career opportunities to make meaningful contributions to people’s lives. The extraordinary expertise of our 4,000-strong workforce is harnessed to support the employees and families of the organizations we serve. Our innovative programs have a lasting impact on the health, financial security and productivity of 20,000 workplaces.  Consultant Health and Benefits  Health & Benefits Solutions  Calgary, AB  Full Time, Permanent  Benefits programs are an important and highly valued part of any employment offering. But understanding how much or what type of benefit coverage is necessary can be difficult. Our client relationship model is consultative and encourages continual communication. By providing you with the resources to support employers in engaging employees in their health, we provide a path to better workforce health and productivity.  Our Consultant works in a team and is responsible for managing, servicing and providing quality benefits consulting services for small to medium sized clients. In addition, they will be responsible for helping to build business with existing clients as well as attracting and supporting new clients through our association partnerships.  Responsibilities include:  Business Development  Identify and manage cross-sell opportunities Develop strategic relationships with key account contacts and introduce Morneau Shepell team members as appropriate Supervise the complete employee benefits cycle: plan design, provider search, implementation, experience monitoring, renewal rating Develop new business with existing clients and assists in obtaining new business with prospective clients focusing on our key association partnerships Understand client needs and identify company or industry products or services that can meet these needs Service  Deliver presentations to clients; conduct client meetings and the occasional employee presentation. Ensure that quality control and service standards are attained with every transaction Negotiate, problem solve and maintain positive relationships with insurers, external advisors and internal underwriting and benefits administration departments Develop and maintain excellent relationships with clients, through regular telephone contact and office visits Understand the client’s perspective and priorities, and work with the client to resolve administrative issues Establish strategies for services that meet client needs  Administration  Provide and oversee direct day-to-day support for clients by phone, e-mail, letters, formal reports, and face-to-face meetings Lead and manage multiple client assignments and projects Manage special projects as required Peer review the work of analysts Knowledge  Maintain current knowledge of industry trends including insurer news, products, legislation, and cost trends as well as current knowledge of our company's products and services  Qualifications:  Experience  Five years of experience in group benefits. Preference will be given to those from the group insurance industry, a consulting firm or brokerage or in an HR department. Education  Post-secondary education GBA (CEBS) designation, or working towards it. Life Insurance license (this will be a requirement within 3 months of onboarding) Skills  Strong presentation skills and comfort speaking in front of large groups Understanding of consultative selling and the ability to manage the sales cycle effectively and autonomously Expert negotiation, technical and analytical skills Can effectively communicate complex concepts in plain written and spoken language Professional Traits  Exceptional customer focus; some would say you’re the best Extremely organized self-starter, flexible, highly independent Ability to manage multiple deadlines simultaneously Proven collaborative team member with the ability to motivate and inspire team members  Morneau Shepell Morneau Shepell is in the business of helping organizations help their people because we believe that engaged people are the driving force for society. Every day, the expertise of our almost 4,000 employees is recognized as essential to the financial security, health, and productivity of our clients and their people. We're always looking for talented professionals and strategic leaders who will listen and work together with colleagues and clients to form long-term relationships and to deliver integrative solutions that fit. As we continue to grow, we're presently engaging with exceptional candidates interested in a range of exciting career opportunities. At www.morneaushepell.com you can explore our careers page to learn more about the solutions we deliver and the great people who help us do it. Follow us on LinkedIn and Twitter (Morneau_Shepell, Shepell). We are thankful for your interest, but unfortunately, we can only personally connect with those selected for an interview.  INDCAD LI-PH1  Job Grade: MS4   Fulfilling work that matters  Morneau Shepell is in the business of helping organizations help their people and in the process, we strive to elevate ours.  We're always looking for talented professionals and strategic leaders looking to make a difference in the lives of the people we serve.  We appreciate the interest of every applicant; however, we contact only those selected for an interview.  Find your fit with us. Follow us on LinkedIn, Youtube and Twitter.
Title: Consultant

Job_Description: *PLEASE NOTE: PREFERENCE WILL BE GIVEN TO CANDIDATES WHO APPLY THROUGH CANFOR.COM/CAREERSCanfor TechnologyAt Canfor, our Information Technology professionals play an important role in the daily functioning of our operations. Consistently pushing the boundaries when it comes to innovation within the forestry and pulp and paper industries, our IT professionals support Canfor in achieving exceptional results.With a high caliber Information Technology leadership team, a clear vision, and significant growth and training opportunities, a career in IT at Canfor allows individuals to strengthen their competencies and grow within their respective roles. Working as an equal partner with our operations to achieve organizational objectives, you will be at the forefront of innovation.Who We Are: Canfor is one of the world’s largest and most respected integrated forest products companies. For more than 75 years, we have been delivering top-quality lumber, pulp and paper products to our valued customers worldwide. With operations in Western Canada and the Southern United States, and sales offices around the world, you can find Canfor products in every corner of the globe. We are leaders in sustainable forest management and in converting wood residuals into green energy.As we continue to grow our company and our markets, find out how you can grow your career with us.The OpportunityThe Data Analyst, Business Intelligence supports Canfor’s objectives by turning data into meaningful information that can be used to make sound business decisions. The Data Analyst will provide expertise in business intelligence to prepare and deliver data and information to internal customers and stakeholders through reports, dashboards and scorecards. It is essential that the Data Analyst build an understanding of the business at a level of detail that enables them to work with the business to deliver valuable information.Please Note:  This is a relocation opportunity in Vancouver, British Columbia. The successful applicant may be provided with relocation assistance.Main ResponsibilitiesRequirements Gathering:Engage with various business units to capture information needs, compare those needs with existing tools and identify gapsParticipate in business requirements workshopsWrite business requirements documents as required to elaborate needs, gain acceptanceDesign & Development:Architect tables and dataDesign dashboards, reports, drill-down analytics and data visualizationsDesign, configure and administer the metadata layerCreate system technical requirements for documentation and knowledge managementActively challenge and find solutions to optimize system performanceTesting, Validation, Release Management:Develop and implement testing strategiesValidate data accuracyDeploy and validate changes in production environmentTraining & Change Management:Support the development of training, documentation, and help desk capabilitiesRequired SkillsBachelor's degree in computer science, information systems, business management or specialized training/certificationExperience working with relational databases (Microsoft SQL Server, Oracle Database, MySQL, etc)Applied knowledge of SQL (T-SQL, PL/SQL, ANSI-SQL, etc)Applied understanding of data modelling and warehousing conceptsWorking knowledge of business intelligence tools such as Oracle Business IntelligenceWorking knowledge of ETL tools such as Oracle Data Integrator or InformaticaExperience mediating and clarifying sometimes ambiguous or conflicting end user requirementsEagerness to learn new concepts and technologies and keep-up-to-date with existing onesWillingness to go above and beyond to understand both the business and technical aspects of a problemHiring for this position is ongoing and will be filled as required. To be considered for this position, please apply today.In order to be eligible for this position, you must be legally entitled to work in Canada for our Company.There has never been a better time to join the Canfor Information Technology team and become a part of the modern forest industry. We have a wide range of rewarding and innovative careers in some of the best communities in North America, with plenty of room for advancement. We offer competitive compensation and benefits packages, and are committed to the professional development of our employees.*PLEASE NOTE: PREFERENCE WILL BE GIVEN TO CANDIDATES WHO APPLY THROUGH CANFOR.COM/CAREERSFollow us on LinkedIn , Twitter , and Facebook for Canfor news, career opportunities, and upcoming events!Vancouver, BCThe city of Vancouver is both a natural beauty and a progressive urban centre, a rare place on earth that is idyllic and electric all at once. With one of Canada’s mildest climates, Vancouver is ideally suited for those devoted to outdoor pursuits, health and wellness. Along with its endless supply of fresh air and clean water, Vancouver also boasts countless choices for culturally diverse, world-class cuisine and an inventory of arts and entertainment events. For more information, visit http://canfor.com/our-company/our-communities/vancouverJob Type: Full-timeEducation:High school or equivalent

Job_Description: Inter Pipeline is a major petroleum transportation, storage and natural gas liquids processing business that ranks among the largest energy infrastructure companies in Canada. We are proud to be named one of Alberta’s Top 70 Employers, which recognizes Alberta businesses that lead their industries by being exceptional places to work.  Located out of our Calgary office, the individual in the Senior Business Analyst role will report to the Supervisor, Finance Solutions Centre. The successful candidate will be responsible for the stewardship of finance master data and project support within SAP for Inter Pipeline, as well indirect leadership of the Business Analyst.  Key Activities and Responsibilities: Review and ongoing improvement of master data creation/change approval processes Leadership of the Business Analyst role, utilizing a team accountability approach for facilitating finance master data creation/changes Work with the business and SAP Competency Centre to develop Service Level Agreements (SLAs), key performance indicators (KPIs) and other metrics for SAP finance master data Act as a data steward bringing forward cross-functional data quality and process integration issues and working collaboratively to solve them, championing the collective management of data governance Serve as a central point of contact for finance data governance understanding and providing direction and training to data consumers and producers from the business in line with business rules Ensure the right stakeholders across the enterprise (e.g. operations, finance, supply chain, etc.) are brought into make business process improvements which mitigate data issues Bring best practices in master data management and propose opportunities for improvement Interaction with SAP Competency Center on future system enhancements, builds, testing, and roll-outs Assist with development and usage of SAP reports  Education, Skills and Experience: Undergraduate diploma or degree in business with 5+ years of progressive experience in financial system support, CPA (CA, CMA, CGA) designation is an asset Strong finance expertise on master data usage, configuration, and integrated data requirements/linkage points combined with prior oil and gas experience considered an asset In depth knowledge of SAP FI_CO and Business Warehouse, experience with S/4HANA and Fiori an asset Approaches work with a high level of curiosity and aptitude to identify and solve problems, takes initiative, is accountable, and works independently Change agent who can persuade and influence stakeholders to establish new processes, shift to automation, and provide innovative solutions Ability to manage internal and external relationships with well-developed interpersonal, team, customer service and communication skills (both written and verbal) Strong customer service skills in working with internal departments to achieve results through relationships with people and teams Able to work well in a fast-paced, growth environment, with strong attention to detail and accuracy Maintains strong initiative and possesses superior analytical skills

The role requires the ability to develop, optimize, and maintain applications. Involvement will span the development life cycle including design, development, testing, implementation and documentation. This position will participate in the training of customers and provide on-going support and guidance.ResponsibilitiesResponsible for the day to day operation of the Microsoft Dynamics-SL ERP and web service applicationsDevelopment and maintenance of web applications and portalsSupport the evaluation and deployment of new Business applicationsDocument and follow Information Technology development/support proceduresWork with the entire Information Technology team to ensure Service Level Agreements are metLiaise with the support vendor on problems and customizationsProvide end user application support and trainingEnsure applications are properly protected from unauthorized access and data corruptionParticipate with team members on backup and disaster recovery plans/testsRequirementsA degree in Accounting, Business Management, Finance, Economics or MIS with 1 to 3 years of related work experienceMinimum of 1 to 3 years’ experience with Financial Applications such as Dynamics SL, Dynamics AX, Dynamics NAV, Dynamics GP, MAS 90/200/500, Sage AccPac or EpicorDevelopment experience with Microsoft SQL Server, C#, ASP.NET Model-View-ControllerExperience with the below would also be an asset:SSAS/Data warehousingReporting Tools like Crystal Reports, FRx Report Writer, Management Reporter, SSRSMicrosoft SharePoint workflowsMicrosoft System Center applications; Service Manager and/or Operations ManagerUsing Team Foundation Server and/or GITSolid understanding of business processes, best practices and transactional data workflowsStrong analytical and troubleshooting skillsExperience providing help desk support to end usersWorking knowledge of project management and change processesComfortable in a time-sensitive, project driven, team based environmentAbility to handle multiple projects/prioritiesExcellent interpersonal and organizational skillsOther information: Only those selected for an interview will be contacted. We will only contact candidates selected for further consideration. If you are invited to continue in the selection process and require any form of accommodation, please notify us.
