Title: Application Analyst

Job_Description: Analytics & Insights Analyst - (0093378)  About the Analytics & Insights Group:  The Analytic & Insights Group at The AIR MILES® Reward Program provides world class analytical solutions through the delivery of insights that enable our clients to build stronger mutually-beneficial relationships with their customers. The group works directly with the sponsors of the program as well as internal business managers to ensure the successful partnering with our clients.  Why work with us?  The AIR MILES Reward Program Analytics & Insights practice is growing significantly and we are looking for a well-rounded Analytics & Insights Analyst to join our team in Calgary. We are looking for a best-in-class analytics practitioner with a blend of proficient technical skills and strong business acumen. The Senior Analyst plays an expert role in the application & execution of consumer data and analytics to support the development of customer-centric business strategies and Loyalty Marketing for our clients.  What will you be doing?  Subject Matter Expert in Loyalty & Marketing Analytics for the retail sponsor portfolio Contribute to all phases of campaign management (ideation, planning, targeting, list generation, measurement, recommendation) with a focus in pre-analysis and post-analysis Work collaboratively with internal business partners to fully understand external client’s business needs Work collaboratively with internal business partners to clearly define analysis / campaign scope, objectives, targeting & measurement strategy for client’s loyalty marketing initiatives Assist in the translation of business requirements into technical specifications Extract, cleanse and modify raw data from data warehouse, conduct customer analysis or campaign measurement to identify opportunities for clients to maximize the use of AIR MILES Reward Program to drive incremental sales Present analysis results and recommendations in business language in different forums/meetings Identify further marketing opportunities for our clients by triangulating industry / competitive analyses with external 3rd party information (research, government reports / trends) Create case studies to demonstrate how analytics drive revenue, profit or efficiencies for our clients and for LoyaltyOne Automate process using Python/SAS/SQL and/or make suggestions to tool / process improvement to drive operational efficiency Ensure timely completion of analysis while maintaining high quality Balance the demands of multiple concurrent projects while maintaining a high level of diplomacy Respond to ad hoc requests (internal & external) for analysis, data and information on a regular basis Contribute in other corporate strategic initiatives as required   What will you bring?  Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in any of the following (or combination of): Statistics, Economics, Computer Science, Engineering, Math or any quant field. Minimum of 2-3 years of customer analysis / insight delivery experience in a complex data-driven organization. Expert knowledge in campaign management, experimental design, customer analytics, CRM, segmentation, modeling Technical Skills - experience with Excel, Access, R, Python, SAS, SQL, R, relational databases, data warehouses, analytics systems (e.g. Tableau Server); strong analytical & data mining skills; intermediate predictive modeling / machine learning experience; experience with both qualitative and quantitative consumer research techniques Business Skills - strong understanding of Retail or Financial Services - direct marketing (market research, experimental design); interpret research, extracting insights, linking to strategies, and communicating a compelling summary of findings and drive results, client communication and presentation.  About LoyaltyOne:  LoyaltyOne is a global leader in the design and implementation of coalition loyalty programs, customer analytics, and loyalty services for Fortune 1000 clients around the world. LoyaltyOne has over 20 years history leveraging data-driven insights to develop and operate some of the world's most effective loyalty programs and customer-centric solutions. These include the AIR MILES Reward Program, North America's premier coalition loyalty program, Precima, the global retail strategy and analytics arm, LoyaltyOne Consulting, European-based BrandLoyalty, and Latin America's leading coalition program, dotz. LoyaltyOne is an Alliance Data company. www.loyalty.com  About ADS:  Alliance Data® (NYSE: ADS) is a leading global provider of data-driven marketing and loyalty solutions serving large, consumer-based industries. The Company creates and deploys customized solutions, enhancing the critical customer marketing experience; the result is measurably changing consumer behavior while driving business growth and profitability for some of today's most recognizable brands. Alliance Data helps its clients create and increase customer loyalty through solutions that engage millions of customers each day across multiple touch points using traditional, digital, mobile and emerging technologies. An S&P 500 and Fortune 500 company headquartered in Plano, Texas, Alliance Data consists of three businesses that together employ more than 16,000 associates at approximately 100 locations worldwide. www.alliancedata.com  Alliance Data is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. Accordingly, we will make reasonable accommodations to respond to the needs of people with disabilities in accordance with legislation.  Alliance Data participates in E-Verify.
Title: Analytics & Insights Analyst

Job_Description: About the Opportunity This is a 100% virtual/work-from-home Help Desk position. You may work from your home office anywhere in Canada providing support for small, medium, and enterprise business environments. GMS supports professional development and offers tons of growth opportunity and room for advancement! If you genuinely love helping others, we would love to hear from you! If you don't enjoy helping others or can't handle the occasional caller in a panic, this might not be a great fit for you!  Application Instructions: Please apply only in English. While some positions are bilingual, all internal communication is in English. Please upload a formatted resume in Microsoft Word of PDF format, instead of using a saved resume in a job board. We recommend saving the URL of the job posting for future reference.  Your regular activities will include: Identifying, diagnosing, and resolving Tier One and Tier Two incidents via phone, chat, remote assistance in a contact centre environment, on a 24/7 rotating shift schedule; Creating a positive customer support experience and building strong relationships through deep problem understanding, ensuring timely resolution on escalation, communicating promptly on progress, and handling customers with a consummately professional attitude; Maintaining and protecting confidentiality with regard to all aspects of patient care and employee information; Performing multiple, technical tasks with a need to routinely upgrade skills to meet changing job conditions; Using helpdesk management tools to log/monitor/close client problems & requests according to GMS’ policy and procedures; and Performing administrative duties such as e-mail management and documentation.  To qualify for this role, you must have the following: High-level oral and written communication skills in English; 2 years of experience in any one, or a blend of the following areas:> Contact Centre> Help Desk> In-home PC repair> Trainer / Instructor / One-on-one tutor or coach At least 1 year of experience in the following areas:> Microsoft Windows Server 2008 or later, including restarting server-side services, AD DS, and Print and Document Services> Resolving remote access issues, including VPN> Troubleshooting and restoring connectivity to the internet, network devices, and servers> E-mail applications and browsers> Antivirus and anti-malware applications> Current versions of Microsoft Windows and Microsoft Office At least one of the following certifications: A+, MCP, MCSA, MCSE, CCNA or equivalent experience with Microsoft Windows environments; and Ability to type a minimum of 35 wpm. Experience in any of the following areas would be an asset: High-level oral communication skills in French and/or Spanish IT ticketing systems and remote management tools Monitoring network and server event alerts in a NOC Exchange Server 2010 or later Office 365 Admin Center macOS and macOS applications in a standalone and Windows domain environment iOS, Android, Blackberry Cloud infrastructure IM clients – Microsoft Lync/Skype for Business Financial and CRM applications PC/Network Security, TCP/IP and wireless communications  You will be successful in this position if... You have a positive personality, enjoy helping others, and are committed to providing unparalleled customer service; You don't take things personally and let distressed end-users get to you, because you understand that people calling about tech problems are sometimes in a panic; You are skilled at multitasking and work well under limited supervision in a fast-paced virtual office environment; You have superior problem solving abilities; You enjoy variety and supporting a wide scope of issues; You are passionate about technology and committed to continuous learning and personal growth.  About the Benefits  In exchange for all your hard work and dedication, you will receive a competitive salary or wage based on your skills and qualifications. Full-time permanent employees are also entitled to an extended health benefits package.  At Global Mentoring Solutions, we help you reach your full potential by providing learning materials, coaching, and subsidies for completing technology certification exams that are relevant to your position.  GMS thanks all applicants for their interest. However, only qualified candidates will be contacted with next steps.
Title: Help Desk Analyst - Work-from-home

Job_Description: Company: Dream Asset Management Corporation Hours per Week: 35.0 Application Deadline: 6/1/18 Dream is looking for a Junior Analyst, Land & Housing  We are always looking for the best and brightest to join our thriving community. Dream’s Development Finance team is currently looking for an Jr. Analyst to support our Land and Housing team in Calgary.  Who are you? There’s a lot happening at Dream, and it’s happening fast. Are you passionate, dedicated, and highly analytical? Do you love working with people? If so, read on. We want to hear from you.  Over the 1+ year(s) you’ve worked in financial planning & analysis you’ve proven that you are not afraid to think outside the box to find the best approach to achieve results. You are proactive, leading by example rather than sitting back. You consider the bigger picture when focusing on new initiatives and you thrive on driving improvement and efficiency.  Your understanding of the financial planning & analysis group and senior management’s needs are apparent through your clear written and verbal communication skills. You are comfortable conducting presentations and facilitating meetings, and it is important to us that you are team-oriented and that people like collaborating with you.  We want to bring on someone who is eager to learn, work hard, and have fun. In other words, we want you to fit in here. This is an opportunity for you to take on responsibilities, build on your already strong skill set and help your team achieve its goals, all in a work environment that is fast-paced, dynamic and fun.  What will you do?  Below are some of the primary responsibilities you will be taking on in this role. There will be more, but we can discuss those in person. Supporting the forecasting process for Western Developments through maintaining and improving all ongoing financial reforecast models for current and future real estate development projects, and ensuring data integrity of financial models and reporting at all times; Drive process improvements and maximize efficiency of the processes utilized; Act as a business partner and key resource for the Director, Development Finance, Land and Housing, and local Land operations in the evaluation of the financial results; Prepare, analyze, provide and communicate relevant operational project performance results in a coherent and effective manner; and Have a pulse on where the business is going and obtain a detailed understanding of our Western Developments in order to be able to forecast, and explain the financial results of our business, and provide operational insights and recommendations on process or other operational improvements identified. What type of experience and skills do you have? These are only some of the things we’d like you to bring to the table. We can cover the rest when we meet. Your strong analytical and problem solving skills complement your excellent attention to detail; You have experience working with large data volumes in an Excel environment and building budgets; pro forma building would be a plus; You should have 1+ years of experience within the real estate industry, specifically in land or residential development; You have an undergraduate degree in Business, Accounting or Finance, or equivalent experience; Working towards a CMA/MBA/CFA designation is an asset; Solid understanding of accounting is a must; Your track record of being entrepreneurial, innovative and resilient constantly sets you apart; A self-starter with the ability to work independently; Your communication and presentation skills are exceptional; and You deliver on commitments and are able manage multiple deliverables. Who are we?  Land & Housing Dream’s Land & Housing division is one of the largest developers in Western Canada. We are proud to build on our track record of developing communities in Canada’s largest cities and are dedicated to building the best homes. Together, we build better communities by providing Canadians with a wide selection of beautiful, high-quality homes in communities that answer their needs and fit their lifestyles. Dream Unlimited Corp. is a leading Canadian real estate company with approximately $14 billion of assets under management in Canada and Europe. We develop, manage, and invest in master-planned communities, income properties, and urban intensification. We proudly build communities from the ground up: from land development to buildings homes and condominiums, and from providing retail centres and driving renewable energy projects to managing assets across the country.  Our attitude and approach sets us apart from our competitors. We are guided by our entrepreneurial spirit: we seize unconventional opportunities and try new things, approaching every project with passion and purpose. We care about our employees. We want everyone to have a rewarding career and to work with people they like, so we provide exciting work opportunities, open work environments, and fun events. We hire constant learners, so we make sure to provide them with engaging work and to encourage them to share their ideas that will help us shape the company.  Once you join us, it won’t take long to figure out why your colleagues like it so much here.  This is your invitation to make a difference. We’re looking forward to helping you grow.  Dream Unlimited is committed to workplace diversity and provides accommodations to applicants with disabilities throughout our hiring process
Title: Jr. Analyst, Land & Housing

Job_Description: Long View is seeking a results-driven and team-oriented Reporting Analyst for our Head Office in Calgary! In this role, you will be responsible for coordinating and managing budget and forecast preparation, assisting with preparation of monthly, quarterly and annual financial statements, notes and other company disclosure requirements and reviewing costs and perform cost benefit analysts related to projects and/or programs. Additionally, you will prepare and distribute ad hoc analysis as required.  What You Can Expect  Great People and Culture – A practical approach to business with no bureaucracy or red tape. An environment of collaboration and support. Career Growth – Permanent staff positions, paid training, career life planning, and relocation and travel opportunities. Interesting Work – Be part of exciting projects while accessing all the latest technologies. Flexible Environment – A workplace that values the importance of flexibility for personal/professional growth, happiness and wellness. What You’ll Bring  3 to 5 years of related experience in financial planning and analysis Experience in budgeting and planning Excellent financial and analytical abilities Outstanding written and oral communication skills High energy, high ownership of work product and dedication and commitment to driving result Strong business partnering and interpersonal skills Ability to work well in high pressure situations in order to meet deadlines and simultaneous priorities CPA designation, or near completion of Strong working knowledge of the MS suite of products (Word, PowerPoint, etc.), with advanced to expert level in Excel
Title: Reporting Analyst

Job_Description: POSITION OVERVIEW Do you have experience conducting research to compile market information and statistics to support pitch materials, publications and reports on the local commercial real estate market? Are you able to adapt and prioritize to meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment?  JLL is currently seeking a dynamic individual for the role of Research Analyst to provide reliable, timely, efficient support to their Calgary team. The position entails working with a diverse group of internal and external Stakeholders at all levels of the organization, and the individual will require the independent judgment to plan, prioritize, and organize a diverse workload. This role provides a wide variety of support services to the brokerage teams and the successful candidate will be detail oriented with strong organizational skills and a team player attitude.  With a long track record representing both tenants and landlords, our tenant representation group understands what motivates each side in a lease negotiation. We get to know our clients and their goals then use our market leading research, leading market expertise and global connections to develop tailored occupancy plans for our clients.  RESPONSIBILITIES Work with research and other team members to compile market information and statistics on the local commercial real estate market; conduct research and collect information materials on market fundamentals, ownership, tenants, and economic analysis Conduct research at a designated level to support pitch materials, publications, reports and deliverables to the Local Practice Leader and/or applicable brokerage team; assist brokerage professionals through the completion of market surveys, data analysis, cash flow analysis, financial modelling and other deliverables Contribute to the collection of and ensure the integrity of comparable data, new development information, and applicable information on city planning changes/issues; apply technical and analytical skills to disseminate market data and ensure data integrity Contribute to designated local market research requests: market snapshots, market overviews, quarterly market decks, topic specific research to support pitches and brokerage opportunities Liaise regularly with other real estate professionals including developers, appraisers, landlords and brokers Coordinate and manage daily, weekly and quarterly research tasks Contribute to special initiatives, such as: annual/semi-annual publications, whitepapers, and quarterly reports (Skyline, Look Forward Skyline, Office Insight) as required Any other reasonable duties and responsibilities assigned  QUALIFICATIONS Post-secondary education in Commerce, Economics, Business Administration, Urban Economics, Urban Planning, or Urban Geography 3+ years of relevant experience or combination of education and experience Experience in the commercial real estate sector is an asset Demonstrated proficiency with all applicable software packages including but not limited to MS Windows; MS Office, including MS Word, Excel, Outlook, and PowerPoint; ESRI and ArcGIS    REQUIRED SKILLS  Good verbal and written communication skills in English Able to adapt and prioritize, meeting deadlines, in a fast-paced environment May require on-call activity after regular office hours Operates with a sense of urgency, quickly responding to Stakeholders Professional yet personable demeanor Excellent time management and organizational skills Positive and professional attitude and demonstrates professionalism at all times Detail oriented with strong analytical skills Able to work well independently with an ability to work collaboratively with others Proactive and takes initiative Able to maintain confidentiality, utilize judgment, and work with minimal supervision  TO APPLY Qualified applicants may apply on JLL’s Careers web site: www.jll.ca/canada/en-ca/careers We thank all applicants for their interest, but advise that only those selected for an interview will be contacted.  JLL IS AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER JLL is an equal opportunity employer and committed to recruiting, developing and maintaining a diverse workforce in compliance with all applicable Human Rights legislation. The Company will endeavor to make reasonable accommodations up to the point of undue hardship, for disabilities made known to it by its employees and applicants.      JLL Is an Equal Opportunity Employer   JLL is committed to developing and maintaining a diverse workforce. JLL strongly believes in equal opportunity extended to all individuals in all aspects of the employment relationship, including recruitment, hiring, training, promotion, transfer, discipline, layoff, recall and termination without regard to race, color, religion, belief, creed, age, sex, pregnancy or maternity (including childbirth and related conditions), family responsibility (e.g. child care, elder care), nationality, ethnic or national origin or ancestry, citizenship, marital status, civil partner status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, transgender status, veteran’s status, genetic information, trade union membership, social position, political view or status as a qualified individual with a disability, protected leave status or any other protected characteristic in accordance with applicable law. The company also endeavors to make reasonable accommodations for known physical or mental limitations of otherwise qualified employees and applicants with disabilities unless the accommodations would impose an undue hardship on the operation of our business and ensures that employment decisions are based only on valid job requirements.   For employees in the United States, please see a fully copy of our Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action policy at https://jll2.sharepoint.com/CorporatePolicies/HR%20Policies/Equal%20Employment%20Opportunity%20and%20Affirmative%20Action.pdf .
Title: Research Analyst

Job_Description: Operations Analyst  Vermilion has an excellent opportunity for an Operations Analyst. Based in Calgary, this position will report to the Supervisor, Canadian Operational Accounting. This position is a key member of the Canadian Planning & Analysis team which supports the Canadian Business Unit by delivering best in class information solutions that result in optimal business decisions. This role focuses on production/revenue reporting and operating expenses with key responsibilities that include monthly accruals, variance analysis, reporting, budgeting and forecasting.  Key Responsibilities Generate accruals related to monthly production, revenue, royalty expense, royalty income, transportation, and operating expense Work in conjunction with operations personnel to understand and analyze Vermilion’s performance Analyze and present operational results at monthly lease-op review meetings Prepare and distribute scheduled and ad hoc reports supporting multiple users at various levels Compiling quarterly operating expense results and forecast for management Contribute to the development of the annual operating expense budget Prepare and maintain operated payouts statements Provide back-up assistance for capital analysis Month-end close process including accruals, journal entries, account reconciliations Active support of internal control processes, including SOX Participate in special projects as required Any other assignments or projects as necessary   Essential Experience & Skills Minimum 5+ years of financial analysis experience in the oil and gas industry. The ideal candidate will have a strong familiarity with production, revenue and operating expense Strategic thinker with exemplary analytical and problem solving skills and capacity to identify information and resources needed to complete tasks Professional, team player with strong interpersonal skills and ability to develop and maintain partnerships Exceptional organizational and time management skills, ability to multi-task and manage priorities in a deadline driven environment Effective verbal and written communication skills with acute attention to detail Advanced Microsoft Excel Knowledge of Qbyte and AFE Navigator is an asset  Education Accounting designation (CPA)   Attributes & Characteristics Open and honest team player Positive and engaging personality Flexible, influential and assertive when required   Vermilion Attractions Alberta based, international company Diverse asset base in Europe, Australia, US and Canada 20-year history of market outperformance Ranked among the Top 10 Best Workplaces in Canada, France and The Netherlands Challenging and inspiring environment that embraces teamwork and collaboration Strong community investment and committed to giving back to the communities where our people live and work   Vermilion is committed to ensuring we conduct our activities in a manner that will protect the health and safety of our employees, contractors and the public. Our HSE vision is to fully integrate Health, Safety and Environment into our business, where our culture is recognized as a model by industry and stakeholders, resulting in a healthy workplace free of incidents. All positions at Vermilion require a commitment to high levels of excellence in respect to HSE, reinforcing our corporate Core Values of Excellence, Trust, Respect, and Responsibility.  Posting Close Date: Open until a suitable candidate has been found

Job_Description: Interested in being a part of a team that is leading the evolution of retail in Canada?  Embracing and driving change is critical to our success. The complexity and rate at which the retail industry is transforming has increased exponentially in recent years and we are committed to being a leader in the industry. As such we are relentlessly focused on innovating at every level of our business, investing in new technologies and products, and doubling down on the best talent to drive the company forward. It is an especially exciting time to join the Canadian Tire Family of Companies.  Our Technology team plays a critical role in our evolution, specifically as we transition to an omni-retailer where digital complements the physical. Our commitment to being a world-class digital organization is evident in how we are using cutting-edge technologies to bring our digital strategy to life in-store, online and on your mobile devices, ultimately improving customer experiences, driving traffic, and boosting loyalty.  The Digital Operations team provides 24x7 production support for e-commerce banners including Sportchek, Marks, and Atmosphere. The team works core business hours and provides off-hours pager support on a rotating basis. The list of supported applications includes, but is not limited to: Web Content Management Systems, e-commerce Systems, Integration Endpoints and Connected Systems.  What you’ll do: As a member of the Digital Operations team, the Systems Support Analyst plays a support role that provides production support and maintenance for e-commerce based applications.  Specific duties include: Preserving/Restoring service and resolving client-reported problems escalated from the 1st level support desk or monitoring alerts. Ensuring that business users are informed as to status and expected resolution times.  Providing 2nd level incident support, including rotating off-hours pager support.  Providing hands-on application support for daily operations for core applications, including service, data and process integrity, configuration, user administration, reporting and optimization.  Identifying root cause and resolution of any incidents reported by the monitoring systems and end users. Analyzing data inaccuracies and identifying risks of changes to the environment.  Developing the monitoring and alerting portfolio to meet service level requirements.  Ensuring software being transitioned to the team for support is stable and sustainable by guiding project teams during warranty periods.  Ensuring Change Management processes are adhered to.  Maintaining documentation, run-books, and providing training.  Providing SME (subject matter expertise) to projects and teams developing software enhancements.  Who you are: We are looking for high performing individuals who are: Agile and innovative individuals, who are able to manage in an environment of change and ambiguity to help us take bold and strategic moves in this rapidly evolving retail environment.  Creative thinkers who take initiative and are capable of building, launching and managing projects/programs that drive results for our customers.  Problem solvers with the ability to analyze and prioritize to meet business objectives.  Collaborative team players with superior influencing skills, who build relationships easily across various stakeholder groups to move initiatives forward .  If you’re curious, ready to take on new challenges and open to doing things differently to help us evolve rapidly, then Canadian Tire is definitely the place to be.  What you’ve done: 3-5 years of experience in a retail environment and 5-7 years in an IT environment.  3-5 years of experience of SAP (Hybris) and Adobe (AEM) applications.  3-5 years of experience in Cloud Marketing tools including Google and Adobe.  Understanding of database environments (Oracle, MongoDB) with experience in reading, writing, and executing queries and scripts.  Solid experience in monitoring and managing production systems including Java-based applications and Linux-based environments.  Good understanding of retail business processes from an e-commerce and omni-channel perspective.  Excellent analytical skills with a keen attention to detail.  Strong technical and troubleshooting skills with the ability to correlate information.  Excellent facilitation and communication skills with the ability to bring multiple teams, knowledge-sets, and experience levels together to solve issues.  Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and able to meet strict timelines.  Ability to learn quickly, maintain documentation and deliver training to others.  Ability to compile ideas into a formal presentation and deliver to a group of individuals at various levels of the organization.  A strong focus on curiosity, drive, teamwork, and communication with a dedication to customer experience, brand, and revenue.  Why us: Canadian Tire is one of Canada’s most iconic and diversified companies. Our culture and values uphold our pledge to sustainable practices, and commitment to our local communities through Jumpstart cannot be beat.  To learn more about this team and the Canadian Tire Family of Companies follow us on LinkedIn.  AODA/D&I; statement  Canadian Tire is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace for all. We recognize that our future success depends on the perspectives and contributions of all our employees -- their diverse backgrounds, abilities and experiences make our business stronger. If you are contacted for a job opportunity, please advise us of any accommodations needed to ensure fair and equitable access throughout the recruitment and selection process. All accommodation information provided will be treated as confidential and used only for the purpose of providing an accessible candidate experience. The decisions we make, every day, are based on these Guiding Principles.What does a Data Visualization / Business Intelligence (BI) Analyst look like at Western?Reporting to the Manager, Application Management, Business Systems & Technology, our Business Intelligence Analyst will support our network of retail branches across western Canada. Together with your team, you will contribute to a positive work environment while demonstrating Westerns Guiding Principles.BSc/M.S. in a statistical, mathematical, or technical field (ie computer science) or equivalent experience1+ years of experience in developing and implementing data science techniques (descriptive, predictive, prescriptive)Proficient in using one or more statistical programming languages (Python/R/SAS) for data scienceWorking experience with one or more multiple data visualization tools like: Spotfire, Tibco, Tableau, QlikView, Cognos AnalyticsExperience in architecting BI & Dashboards solutions using one of the above toolsExperience applying Business Intelligence skills to data mining and verification, and analysis of complex data in a professional environmentProven ability in defining, designing, developing and documenting KPI’s for the presentation of results to leadershipPrior experience recommending solutions to create revenue growth, maximize profits and reduce lossInsurance brokerage industry experience is an assetSpecifics: High River, AlbertaFull Time – 37.5 hours/weekMonday - Friday scheduleJob Type: Full-timeEducation:Master's

Job_Description: David Aplin Group, one of Canada's Best Managed Companies, has partnered with our client to recruit for an IT Business Analyst for my client located in Downtown, Calgary.  Summary  The Business Analyst (Finance/IS/Sales) position is a fantastic opportunity for a candidate that is interested to translate operations and finance ERP data into useful dashboards and reporting tools for internal and external customers. This individual will report into the Finance team; however will spend a great deal of time working hand-in-hand with a very supportive IS team on a working level, and interface with Finance/Sales/Operations management from a customer perspective.  The successful candidate will perform a variety of data analysis and development tasks against our relational databases and create reports that will help drive key business decisions. Analysis will be in the form of reports built using Microsoft Excel, SQL Server, and SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS). Additionally, the successful candidate will demonstrate an interest in applications development, programming and support. They will become an expert on both our accounting and operations processes and systems, thereby effectively communicating appropriate and accurate information.  The Role:  Acquiring and transforming raw data into meaningful and useful system driven reporting tools. Working closely with Sales and Finance management to gather requirements for analysis and reporting. Working closely with the IS team to identify data sources and develop queries to extract accurate data. Responsible for requirement analysis, design, development, and deployment of business intelligence and analytical solutions. Communicating findings of analysis in non-technical language. Work closely with the sales and operational group to understand current and historical business practices. SQL database development, SSRS report development and internal applications support. Other duties as assigned.  The Ideal Candidate:  A diploma or certificate in Computer Science or Business Intelligence and Analytics’ or Information Technologies or equivalent experience. Must be adept at queries and report writing – T-SQL, SQL Server Reporting Services, and Microsoft Excel (macro development / VB scripting). Experience in Business Intelligence projects including Financial Data analysis using Power BI would be an asset. Exposure to programming languages such as C#, VBA, .net framework, database architectures, etc. would be an asset. Must love data analysis and finding out the ‘truth’ through rigorous and in-depth research and analytics, and possess a keen interest to drill down to discover root cause. Strong interpersonal and communication skills to interact with different levels and types of users, understand stakeholder’s business requirements, and translate these requirements into meaningful information and reporting. Strong multi-tasking and prioritization skills, with minimal supervision, for an ever-changing, fast paced environment.  If you are interested in this position and meet the above criteria, please click the Apply button to send your resume in confidence directly to Sushant Shah, Consultant, Aplin Office Professionals. We thank all applicants; however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted. #LI-CAL  WE APPRECIATE YOUR INTEREST IN DAVID APLIN GROUP.  If this is your first introduction to us, we invite you to become one of our satisfied candidates. David Aplin Group has been Canadian owned since 1975. Our professional consultants are passionate about helping you find a fulfilling job or career and ensuring your complete satisfaction with our process. Our proven track record, nearly 4 decades long, is largely due to our team of highly skilled and successful specialists. Through superior service and a commitment to long-term relationships, we provide deep specialization in core areas for complete recruiting and HR solutions across Canada - all from one source. We look forward to exceeding your expectations!  Learn more about David Aplin Group and view all of our current job opportunities, career tips, and tools at www.aplin.com.
Title: IT Business Analyst

Job_Description: Life at Swoop. When you work for Swoop, you’re a part of an entrepreneurial startup where nimble, bold, collaborative and digitally-focused are just a few of the words we use to summarize how we roll. Swoop is a wholly owned subsidiary of the WestJet Group (TSX: WJA) but make no mistake, we march to the beat of our own drum. At Swoop, our day-to-day operations are vastly different and deliberately separate, but carefully aligned to complement the big picture strategy of the group. Posting Open Date: 05/11/2018 Posting Close Date: 05/25/2018 (Please note the posting will close at 11:59pm)  The role of Senior Analyst, Product is an exciting and rewarding opportunity at Swoop. You’ll be part of a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment while managing one of the most critical portfolios in the company. The Product portfolio is expected to generate ~50% of total revenues for Swoop and includes all air-related ancillaries and 3rd party products such as hotels, cars, and insurance. Swoop is in the infancy of developing the product portfolio and we’re looking for a strong candidate with can strategically grow this area of the business quickly. We are looking for someone who is driven, a self-starter, has strong analytical and strategic thinking skills, and the ability to work well across all functions in the organization. Candidates looking for stable, well-defined 9-5 role need not apply – But if you’re looking to break into the travel industry, deal with adversity/uncertainty, make you mark on a truly pioneering Canadian airline and work with a can-do team, then we’d love to speak with you! Key Responsibilities Manage product portfolio (including but not limited to: bags, seats, priority boarding, Inflight Entertainment and Wi-Fi, new air-related products and 3rd party ancillary products); Work closely with IT, Marketing, Digital, Revenue & Pricing, Network Planning, Finance and Operations to successfully develop, manage and optimize ancillary products; Work closely with the leader and key stakeholders, develop the product roadmap and 5-year strategic plan; Develop business and functional requirements documentation related to new ancillary products; Responsible for the development and interpretation of reporting and forecasts related to the performance of all air-related and third-party ancillary products; Develop sophisticated pricing models to optimize product pricing and maximize revenue; Manage the relationships and negotiate with 3rd party product vendors including hotel, car and insurance providers; Analyze all aspects of the traveler journey and recommend additional revenue generating opportunities; Identify and source new business opportunities that meet both short- and long-term objectives; Maintain a good understanding of developments among competitors, the broader airline industry and other related industries to enhance products, customer-centricity, decision making, and strategic development capability, and help disseminate throughout the business; Achieve overall ancillary budget.  Requirements Bachelor degree in Business, Economics, Mathematics or related field. MBA is a strong asset; Demonstrate significant analytical ability; Able to efficiently summarize data and present recommendations to leadership team; Excellent written and verbal communications skills; Must have ability to identify problems and reach creative solutions; Revenue analysis and forecasting experience a strong asset; Experience negotiating independently with third party partners and suppliers.  Compensation A competitive compensation package including base salary, benefits and incentives will be provided.   What about the Benjamin’s? At Swoop, we’re committed to offering a fair and competitive total compensation package that starts with a solid base salary, and complemented by perks like performance based profit sharing, a company-matched share purchase plan, flexible group benefits and of course, flight privileges.  We celebrate differences and diversity. Swoop is an equal-opportunity employer, and our workplace culture is one where diversity and differences are embraced, appreciated and celebrated. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, colour, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expressions, transgender status, marital or family status, disability, age or convictions for which a pardon has been granted.
Title: Senior Analyst, Product

Job_Description: Position Title: Director, Data & Business Intelligence  Employment Terms: Permanent Full-Time  Reporting to: Craig Maccubbin, EVP and Chief Information Officer  Location: Calgary, AB  COMPANY BACKGROUND WestJet (TSX: WJA) is an iconic Canadian brand. Headquartered in Calgary, Canada, WestJet, along with regional carrier WestJet Encore, is Canada’s leading high-value, low-cost carrier. WestJet is continually recognized as one of the top employers in the country and one of Canada’s most admired corporate cultures. In 2017, WestJet celebrated its 50th consecutive quarter of profitability, and was recognized as the only Canadian airline with investment grade credit ratings. Founded as a regional carrier in Calgary in 1996, with 3 aircraft and 220 employees, WestJet has experienced momentous growth. Today, WestJet is a thriving international airline operated by 13,000+ employees, collectively known as WestJetters. Through scheduled flights across a rapidly expanding network, WestJet also operates WestJet Vacations (providing air, hotel, car and excursion packages), and WestJet Encore (a regional airline operating in Canada and the United States). WestJet is embarking upon a transformative era, transitioning from a low-cost carrier (LCC) to a global, full service network carrier with the delivery of Boeing 787-9 Dreamliner aircraft in January 2019. Further, WestJet has recently launched an ultra-low cost carrier (ULCC), Swoop, a wholly owned subsidiary, with first flights scheduled in June 2018. The mission of WestJet is “to enrich the lives of everyone in WestJet's world.” Since inception, WestJet has nurtured its employee-focused culture of care, planning for its culture at the strategic level. WestJet expresses its strong corporate culture and commitment to guest service with the employee slogan “Because Owners Care.” This refers to the fact that approximately 86 percent of eligible employees, referred to as WestJetters, participate in an employee share purchase plan. Tying the personal success of WestJetters to the company’s success helps nurture a corporate culture that is focused on safety, exceptional guest service and cost containment. Further, with an average age of 40, WestJetters are among the youngest across all North American carriers. This has influenced the airline to create an open-minded, communicative and transparent culture. WestJet has recently unveiled a refreshed set of values, built over the last two years by WestJetters. These values and the behaviours that accompany them will set the stage for global expansion in a way that is uniquely WestJet: Act like an Owner: I take responsibility for my decisions and accountability for the outcomes. Care from the Heart: I do the right thing and do things right, because I care. Rise to the Challenge: I have the courage of a champion, relentless in my pursuit of excellence. Work Together to Win: I play my part, connecting as one team. Together we fly. By keeping a commitment to low costs, WestJet continues to offer value to its people, its shareholders and above all, its guests. It is on these fundamental beliefs that WestJet has built its four-pillar strategy: People and Culture: Putting our people first goes beyond fostering an environment of caring and commitment. We are all owners – empowered and accountable for making the right decisions for our guests and our business. Operational Excellence: Delivering great guest value is the most important part of what we do. If there is one thing that will continue to separate us from the rest, it is how we treat our guests, and providing the ultimate guest experience. Diversified, Sustainable Revenue Growth: Growing strategically and profitably means taking advantage of smart growth opportunities, and understanding the wants and needs of travelers. We will continue to add new destinations and gain market share. Financial strength: Keeping our low-cost advantage is simple. We will continue to offer value to our guests and our shareholders by providing the best guest experience in the industry, while achieving a targeted, sustainable profit margin that will be No. 1 among North American airlines. Further corporate information can be found within our most recent MD&A, Financial Statements and Annual Report: https://www.westjet.com/en-ca/about-us/media-investor-relations/financial-reports WestJet’s Investor Day 2017 Presentation is accessible here: https://www.westjet.com/assets/wj-web/documents/en/investorMedia/171206-presentation-investor-day.pdf KEY RESPONSIBILITIES  The Director, Data and Business Intelligence is responsible for the full systems life cycle management of data that supports WestJet’s core business processes and a culture of data-driven decision making. The focus of this role is on collaborating with the senior leadership from other internal departments to develop, implement and optimize business processes to enable data solutions, drive business intelligence and analytics.  The successful candidate will actively participate in long-term analytics strategic planning and ensure data-related policies, procedures and processes are in place to address complex business needs. This involves both strategic work on data science and analytics as well as enterprise services and applications. This role also ensures that long-term solution delivery methodologies are followed and that these methodologies deliver quality, reliability, stability and completeness of all data-related programs while also meeting financial objectives and the needs of the business.  The Director, Data and Business Intelligence leverages their in-depth technical skills on BI and analytics applications as well as their detailed understanding of corporate functions and business processes to effectively fulfill the responsibilities of this job. The successful candidate will create and implement best-practice data/analytics standards and processes and ensure adherence to relevant regulatory requirements. They will promote that knowledge across the team in order to develop and support data solutions that align with executive leadership goals and objectives. Principal Duties: Conducts strategic planning activities for the information data system landscape and communicates the outcomes in terms of future-state architectures, strategies and roadmaps for big data and related applications. Help provide direction for the Technology function and business stakeholders that will lead to simplification of the data architecture. Understands business requirements for data and information to support business strategy and objectives. Performs cost-benefit analyses for proposed systems to aid management in making implementation decision and aligns data management and technology with business needs. Leads design sessions in prototyping new data solutions and BI dashboards. Promotes the value of Data as an asset. Leads technical leaders including hiring, career development and performance reviews with a focus on enhancing leadership effectiveness. Provides leadership, mentoring and coaching for all staff and foster a culture of accountability, innovation and team building. Forms part of the IT Senior Leadership team and works collaboratively across the group and exhibits the servant leadership mentality that is aligned with WestJet’s culture. Manages the IT Data & Business Intelligence operational and capital budgets including forecasting and reporting of fiscal performance for domain of responsibility. Ensures that the proper investments are made with a multi-year view but is adaptable in a rapidly changing environment. Reviews and analyzes the effectiveness and efficiency of existing data source systems and develops strategies for improving or further leveraging these systems. Collaborates in the planning, development, and deployment of new data solutions, enhancements to existing data solutions and dashboards. Develops and adapts business analysis processes and supporting tools as the IT organization scales to meet the needs of a rapidly growing business. Functions as a senior-level advisor and business analyst for enterprise scale initiatives. Serves as function Subject Matter Expert in one or more business subjects such as: Finance, Supply Chain, Operations, Commercial, to name a few. Collaborates with both the analytic organization and business owners to turn data into actionable business insights using self-service analytics and reporting tools. Demonstrates forward thinking and plans ahead for potential roadblocks; comprehends bigger picture of the business strategy. Provides an exceptional customer service experience to internal business partners Additional responsibilities as assigned and consistent with the role.  PROFESSIONAL EXPERIENCE & QUALIFICATIONS  The successful candidate will be a team player with business acumen, strategic insight and sound judgment along with proven, in-depth experience in supporting sensitive and high-touch projects. Professional Experience A bachelor’s degree in computer science, information technology, mathematics or a related major. Enterprise IT senior leadership experience in an organization of similar size, scope and complexity to WestJet. Minimum of 5 years of that time in senior leadership positions directly related to the Data & Business Intelligence domain. Experience with enterprise systems, including ERP, PSS, Customer Relationship Management (CRM) business processes/systems and cloud-based applications, data, security and integration architectures including data warehouse and BI solutions. Demonstrated expertise in establishing methodologies and implementing structured ways of analyzing business problems. Demonstrated ability to understand current state business processes and work with business to design efficient and effective business processes. Excellent conflict resolution technique and capable for building consensus with business partners. Strong presentation / collaboration skills; lead or facilitate discussions with senior business leaders and technically adept colleagues.  Required Skills, Competencies & Attributes  Analytical mind with excellent critical thinking and problem-solving skills as well as the ability to adapt to changing priorities and deadlines. Can balance long-term ("big picture") and short-term implications of individual decisions. Self-motivated, quick learner and with a “roll up your sleeves” mindset, ability to lead initiatives involving complex, integrated systems. Strong mentoring and coaching aptitude; listens effectively, demonstrates empathy towards individual concerns and drives conflict resolution; promotes a culture of collaboration and continuous improvement. Ability to work independently and collaboratively, as required, in a fast-paced team environment consisting of internal and external team members. Excellent planning, organization and time management skills including the ability to support and prioritize multiple projects. Strong analytical, problem solving, organizational, and prioritization skills. Proven record of building high performing teams. Excellent verbal and written communication skills.  COMPENSATION A competitive compensation package will be negotiated based on experience and qualifications with a base salary in excess of $150,000 annually.  This position is eligible for a performance bonus as per WestJet’s compensation policy and the Total Rewards program that includes the following: extended health, emergency travel medical, dental, vision, short-term disability (STD), long-term disability (LTD), life insurance, accidental death and dismemberment (AD&D) & travel benefits. This position is also eligible for relocation assistance. Please note the position is based at WestJet headquarters in Calgary, and the successful candidate is eligible for relocation assistance. Learn more about life in Calgary here: https://www.lifeincalgary.ca/ CONTACT DETAILS  Please submit your application via the WestJet website: https://www.westjet.com/en-ca/about-us/jobs/index Inquiries can be forwarded to Doug Windover at globalleadershiprecriuting@westjet.com. The position will remain posted until the successful candidate is identified. WestJet An Alberta Partnership 22 Aerial Place NE Calgary, AB T2E 3J1 P. 1-888-937-8583
Title: Director, Data & Business Intelligence

Job_Description: At Rogers we’re for supporting you on a journey to a rewarding career. Whether you’re a developer, an analyst, or a customer care consultant, Rogers is the place where ideas become reality. We embrace change, and find ways to do better. And we deliver on that commitment by fostering an environment of passion and innovation for all people.  Job Responsibilities/Job Functions:  Manage all aspects of the project (New Site Acquisition-Real Estate) including project scoping, resource assignment, project plan development, project tracking, monitoring and reporting through the application of proven project management principles and methodologies. Develop and maintain all project documentation (Project Plan, Issue and Action Logs, Risk Management, Communication Plan, Status Reports, Post Implementation Reviews, etc.). Identify benefits expected from initiatives and conduct post implementation reviews to report on and track results. Pull together resources effectively to implement projects. Orchestrate multiple activities at once to accomplish objectives. Use critical thinking skills to anticipate and manage potential risks that will arise. Communicate these to the stakeholders on a regular basis and ensure decisions are made quickly and effectively. Maintain the Project Management Office Lessons Learned database, and apply lessons learned to all initiatives. Where process creation or modification recommendations result from the lesson learned, Project Manager is responsible for determining ownership within the organization and managing the implementation of recommended solutions. Assist in the development and implementation of templates, procedures and processes as part of the continuous development of the Wireless Customer Deployment team.  Job Qualifications:  Minimum (5) years of demonstrated progressive experience in project management, preferably in projects associated with the deployment or implementation of services for customers. Preference that this experience is in telecommunications industry. Experience in managing a group of simultaneous initiatives. Post secondary education, preferably in a business administration or project management related discipline. Completely conversant in Microsoft Project and other MS Office tools. Knowledge and consistent application of proven industry standard Project Management approaches. Project Management designation an asset but not required. High level of energy and strong passion to lead team members to successful completion of projects and to ensure the delivery of a positive customer experience. Great attention to detail. Creativity, flexibility and an ability to manage time and reset priorities in a dynamic environment. Superior skill set including: analytical thinking and problem solving, coaching and leadership, presentation and facilitation, negotiation and relationship building and proficient probing, listening and positioning skills and a good risk manager.  Experience in Telco Real Estate Acquisition and associated industry relationships an asset. Experience in large telecom projects Experience and understanding of Telco lease and municipal development process. Schedule: Full Time Shift: Day Length of Contract: Not Applicable (Regular Position) Work Location: #700, 500 - 4 Ave Sw (056), Calgary, AB Travel Requirements: Up to 25% Posting Category/Function: Project Management & Engineering Requisition ID: 120710 WHY ROGERS? As a proud Canadian company, we're dedicated to making things easier for our customers. We’ve been embracing and leading change for over 50-years, and we’ll continue to seek out new opportunities to bring our customers simple solutions for today and tomorrow. We recognize that success is determined by the strength and diversity of our people. We work together because we want to win together, and these five shared values guide and define our work: Simplify and innovate Take ownership of the what and the how Equip people to succeed Execute with discipline and pride Talk straight, build trust, and over deliver Why Rogers? Because your tomorrow inspires our today. What makes us different makes us stronger. Rogers has a strong commitment to diversity and inclusion. Everyone who applies for a job will be considered. We recognize the business value in creating a workplace where each team member has the tools to reach their full potential. At Rogers, we value the insights and innovation that diverse teams bring to work. We work with our candidates with disabilities throughout the recruitment process to ensure that they have what they need to be at their best. Please reach out to our recruiters and hiring managers to begin a conversation about how we can ensure that you deliver your best work. You can also reach out to our team at RogersRecruiting@rci.rogers.com to begin a conversation about your individual accessibility needs throughout the hiring process. Job_Description: Robert Half Technology is searching for a Business Analyst who is highly capable of and deeply passionate about understanding and translating customer needs into actionable development plans. If you are outgoing and a self-starter with strong technical knowledge and excellent communication skills, this Business Analyst role may be a great fit for you. As the successful candidate you will perform a variety of data analysis and development tasks, translating operations and finance ERP data into useful dashboards and reporting tools. This full-time opening is for a Business Analyst in the Calgary, Alberta area. If you have the qualifications we are looking for, please submit your resume online to stephanie.sherlock@rht.com  RESPONSIBILITIES × Responsible for analysis, design, development and deployment of BI and analytical solutions × SQL database development, SSRS report development and internal applications support × Working within the IS team to identify data sources and develop queries for extracting Data. × Acquiring and transforming raw data into meaningful and useful reporting tools × Collaborate with Sales and Finance Management to gather requirements for Analysis and reporting × Work closely with the sales and operational group to understand current and historical business practices. × Other duties as assigned × 4 + years of relevant work experience in a Business Systems/Business Analyst Role × Verified proficiency in queries and report writing - SQL Development, SQL Server Reporting Services and Microsoft Excel (macro development / VB scripting) × Experience with Business Intelligence projects including Financial Data analysis using Power BI × Knowledge of C#, VBA, .net framework and database architectures × Ability to manage multiple projects and assignments, prioritize projects, set and meet deadlines × Must be highly motivated with great attention to detail and providing quality results. × Excellent analytical skills and problem-solving ability. × Capability to work in a team as well as being individually motivated. × Excellent interpersonal and communication skills with the ability to interact with different levels and types of users and the ability to translate business requirements into meaningful information and reporting. × Post-secondary Degree/Certificate in Computer Science, Business Intelligence or equivalent.  Our Client offers a competitive salary and benefits package and the opportunity to work in a challenging team-oriented environment. This position will remain open until a suitable candidate is selected. If you have the qualifications we are looking for, please submit your resume online to stephanie.sherlock@rht.com

Finally, they will support the QA leaders in reporting the status of testing across all stakeholders within the CTC, FGL & Marks organizations. If this sounds like the role for you, you must have a passion for Quality Assurance & Software Testing, be excited by learning and exploration of applications, and be willing to have fun with an enthusiastic QA Team.  Responsibilities  Define the testing strategy and approach for all integration and BigData projects in a complex & multisystem environments (including Hadoop platform)  Manage & perform the testing activities for data integrations in alignment with the testing strategy and expectations for the quality of the project  Create liaisons between different teams and contribute to the smooth communication between teams  Design, implement and execute tests for ETL and Data Integration scenarios  Perform Functional, Integration, Regression and End to End testing on all Data Technology projects  Identify and assist in the resolution of testing issues, defects and Issues & risks in Jira Agile board  Help coordinate project deliverables and resolve issues, identify dependencies and roadblocks  Provide non-production and production environment support assistance when required  Represent QA in different status meetings which may include project team members, business members, external vendors, leadership teams and stakeholders as required  Provide coaching, mentoring and training to other team members on Data Technology QA framework  Keep up to date of the latest emerging knowledge of integration testing methodologies and practices  Experience testing in a Unix/Linux environment  Experience working with integration tools like Tibco, Data stage, MQ, Change  Experience working on Agile based team collaborative tools like JIRA, Bitbucket and Jenkins  Experience developing tests in functional programming languages such as Python  Experience testing of ETL and message queue workflows and workloads, including such tools as Apache Kafka, Nifi  Experience testing distributed systems, including testing on the Hadoop platform and user-level Hadoop configuration and light administration skills  Strong Hive – SQL knowledge including writing and executing queries to analyze data integrity  Experience working in a highly integrated, multi-project environment  Experience working with XML, jSON and EDI data formats  Experience working with databases, including SQL Server, Oracle, Netezza and MariaDB  Experience in planning, developing and executing Test Plans and Test Procedures and coordinating the collection of test results  Detailed oriented personality complimented with strong analytical and problem solving skills  Ability to communicate clearly in written and verbal communications  Ability to work independently and as part of a team  Excellent organizational and planning skills  Ability to work well under pressure in a fast-paced team environment,working on multiple deliverables at the same time  Knowledge of Retail, POS, Warehousing/Inventory, Supply Chain, or Finance industries an asset  About You  Builds Trust and Credibility by consistently adhering to the organization’s business principles and values. Is seen as direct, truthful, and trustworthy by co-workers, vendors, and customers  Committed to results by taking personal responsibility for achieving mutually agreed upon individual/team objectives  Demonstrates a desire to help and serve internal/external customers to meet their needs. Is proactive, responsive, and focused on discovering, anticipating, and exceeding the customer’s needs  Works collaboratively and cooperatively with others to achieve shared goals and objectives.  Considers the wider team, function, banner or the organization and takes action or makes decisions which support the success of those groups  Recovers quickly after change, disruptions, or mistakes and can remain productive and focused.  Is adaptable and can apply lessons learned in one situation to another situation  Academic / Educational requirements  BS in Computer Science, Engineering, Information Systems, or a Minimum of 5 years’ experience in the IT industry, specifically, as part of a team responsible for delivering software quality assurance and testing to IT projects  Information Technology  Alberta-Calgary  Permanent  Full-time  Job Posting  :  May 15, 2018, 3:09:18 PM

Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Ability to work well under pressure and meet deadlines within a team environment. Excellent organization skills and attention to detail.

Job_Description: Job Summary*PLEASE NOTE: PREFERENCE WILL BE GIVEN TO CANDIDATES WHO APPLY THROUGH CANFOR.COM/CAREERSCanfor TechnologyAt Canfor, our Information Technology professionals play an important role in the daily functioning of our operations. Consistently pushing the boundaries when it comes to innovation within the forestry and pulp and paper industries, our IT professionals support Canfor in achieving exceptional results.With a high caliber Information Technology leadership team, a clear vision, and significant growth and training opportunities, a career in IT at Canfor allows individuals to strengthen their competencies and grow within their respective roles. Working as an equal partner with our operations to achieve organizational objectives, you will be at the forefront of innovation.The OpportunityThe Business Analyst, (Payroll Support), supports the Payroll team by handling technical issues, implementing changes and assisting with maintenance of The Canfor payroll systems. This will include the SAP Payroll / EC Payroll (Cloud) environments and may involve interim support of Canfor’s VIP and Empath payroll systems.The Business Analyst, Payroll Support), IT will also support the time capture systems in use at Canfor. This individual will partner with internal and external resources to ensure proper payroll processing and problem resolution.Relocation packages to move you and your family to Vancouver, BC may be available for successful candidates.Key ResponsibilitiesSystem DevelopmentServe as a key resource on HR/Payroll/Timekeeping projects (SAP SuccessFactors)For feature enhancements and/or acquisition activities, participate in the project management process including; assessing business and application requirements, design specification development, change management, system configuration, identifying security requirements, developing test plans, coordinating test execution and implementationCapture and document non-functional requirements that are important to the user community (i.e. usability, learnability, reliability). Liaise with architecture to ensure other non-functional requirements are considered (i.e. security, compatibility, maintainability)Create necessary documentation and deliver knowledge transfer sessionsProvide SAP Payroll / EC Payroll (Cloud) and Timekeeping technical support and problem resolutionSupport maintenance of tax tables and setup to ensure compliance with federal, state, and local regulationsServe as an HR/Payroll team Business Intelligence (BI) resource/support, including coordination with the BI lead resource for requirements analysis, data modeling, testing, security, integration and query developmentPayroll SupportSupports the Payroll Manager(s) in payroll processing to ensure payroll deadlines are metRun ad hoc reports to extract payroll data as needed as approved by the Payroll Manager and/or Director Total Rewards & NA Payroll.Assist in establishing priorities and meeting project deadlinesMaintain accurate and sufficient testing documentationSafeguard and ensure confidentiality of HR and payroll dataRequired SkillsBachelor’s degree or equivalent experience.Minimum five (5) years’ experience in business operations or HR/Payroll Business Support.Experience in supporting a corporate payroll environmentExperience with time keeping solutions is requiredPayroll knowledge required; tax knowledge preferredExperience in configuring and implementing HCM modules in SAP (ECC, workflow and Business Warehouse), or a similar ERP system preferredExperience with testing and problem solving within the SAP Payroll / EC Payroll system preferredWork experience in an industrial / shift worker environment is considered an assetHiring for this position is ongoing and will be filled as required. To be considered for this position, please apply today.In order to be eligible for this position, you must be legally entitled to work in Canada for our Company.There has never been a better time to join the Canfor Information Technology team and become a part of the modern forest industry. We have a wide range of rewarding and innovative careers in some of the best communities in North America, with plenty of room for advancement. We offer competitive compensation and benefits packages, and are committed to the professional development of our employees.Follow us on LinkedIn , Twitter , and Facebook for Canfor news, career opportunities, and upcoming events!Vancouver, BCThe city of Vancouver is both a natural beauty and a progressive urban centre, a rare place on earth that is idyllic and electric all at once. With one of Canada’s mildest climates, Vancouver is ideally suited for those devoted to outdoor pursuits, health and wellness. Along with its endless supply of fresh air and clean water, Vancouver also boasts countless choices for culturally diverse, world-class cuisine and an inventory of arts and entertainment events. Job_Description: *PLEASE NOTE: PREFERENCE WILL BE GIVEN TO CANDIDATES WHO APPLY THROUGH CANFOR.COM/CAREERSCanfor TechnologyAt Canfor, our Information Technology professionals play an important role in the daily functioning of our operations. Consistently pushing the boundaries when it comes to innovation within the forestry and pulp and paper industries, our IT professionals support Canfor in achieving exceptional results.With a high caliber Information Technology leadership team, a clear vision, and significant growth and training opportunities, a career in IT at Canfor allows individuals to strengthen their competencies and grow within their respective roles. Working as an equal partner with our operations to achieve organizational objectives, you will be at the forefront of innovation.Who We Are: Canfor is one of the world’s largest and most respected integrated forest products companies. For more than 75 years, we have been delivering top-quality lumber, pulp and paper products to our valued customers worldwide. With operations in Western Canada and the Southern United States, and sales offices around the world, you can find Canfor products in every corner of the globe. We are leaders in sustainable forest management and in converting wood residuals into green energy.As we continue to grow our company and our markets, find out how you can grow your career with us.The OpportunityThe Data Analyst, Business Intelligence supports Canfor’s objectives by turning data into meaningful information that can be used to make sound business decisions. The Data Analyst will provide expertise in business intelligence to prepare and deliver data and information to internal customers and stakeholders through reports, dashboards and scorecards. It is essential that the Data Analyst build an understanding of the business at a level of detail that enables them to work with the business to deliver valuable information.Please Note:  This is a relocation opportunity in Vancouver, British Columbia. The successful applicant may be provided with relocation assistance.Main ResponsibilitiesRequirements Gathering:Engage with various business units to capture information needs, compare those needs with existing tools and identify gapsParticipate in business requirements workshopsWrite business requirements documents as required to elaborate needs, gain acceptanceDesign & Development:Architect tables and dataDesign dashboards, reports, drill-down analytics and data visualizationsDesign, configure and administer the metadata layerCreate system technical requirements for documentation and knowledge managementActively challenge and find solutions to optimize system performanceTesting, Validation, Release Management:Develop and implement testing strategiesValidate data accuracyDeploy and validate changes in production environmentTraining & Change Management:Support the development of training, documentation, and help desk capabilitiesRequired SkillsBachelor's degree in computer science, information systems, business management or specialized training/certificationExperience working with relational databases (Microsoft SQL Server, Oracle Database, MySQL, etc)Applied knowledge of SQL (T-SQL, PL/SQL, ANSI-SQL, etc)Applied understanding of data modelling and warehousing conceptsWorking knowledge of business intelligence tools such as Oracle Business IntelligenceWorking knowledge of ETL tools such as Oracle Data Integrator or InformaticaExperience mediating and clarifying sometimes ambiguous or conflicting end user requirementsEagerness to learn new concepts and technologies and keep-up-to-date with existing onesWillingness to go above and beyond to understand both the business and technical aspects of a problemHiring for this position is ongoing and will be filled as required. To be considered for this position, please apply today.In order to be eligible for this position, you must be legally entitled to work in Canada for our Company.There has never been a better time to join the Canfor Information Technology team and become a part of the modern forest industry. We have a wide range of rewarding and innovative careers in some of the best communities in North America, with plenty of room for advancement. We offer competitive compensation and benefits packages, and are committed to the professional development of our employees.*PLEASE NOTE: PREFERENCE WILL BE GIVEN TO CANDIDATES WHO APPLY THROUGH CANFOR.COM/CAREERSFollow us on LinkedIn , Twitter , and Facebook for Canfor news, career opportunities, and upcoming events!Vancouver, BCThe city of Vancouver is both a natural beauty and a progressive urban centre, a rare place on earth that is idyllic and electric all at once. With one of Canada’s mildest climates, Vancouver is ideally suited for those devoted to outdoor pursuits, health and wellness. Along with its endless supply of fresh air and clean water, Vancouver also boasts countless choices for culturally diverse, world-class cuisine and an inventory of arts and entertainment events. For more information, visit http://canfor.com/our-company/our-communities/vancouverJob Type: Full-timeEducation:High school or equivalent
