Job_Description: As an IT Analyst II, you will provide technical support related to information technology applications either directly to users of the systems or to service delivery functions. You will ensure reliable operations of information systems, resolves complex technical problems, finds solutions to customer needs, and leads projects and program initiatives. You will be responsible for more advanced application, telecom or technology support duties. You will investigate diagnoses and resolve complex problems that have typically been escalated several levels before assignment to this position, and will translate business requirements into technical requirements for a solution and recommend a potential approach to the vendor. You will analyse the solution provided to ensure that it fits both technical requirements and business needs. You will also spend time on project or initiative leadership and delivery. Classification: IT Analyst II Union: AUPE GSS Department: Prov CalgyIT SCM Reports Primary Location: QuarryPark Multi-Site: Not Applicable FTE: 1.00 Posting End Date: 28-MAY-2018 Employee Class: Regular Full Time Date Available: 07-JUN-2018 Hours per Shift: 7.75 Length of Shift in weeks: 2 Shifts per cycle: 10 Shift Pattern: Days Days Off: Saturday/Sunday Minimum Salary: $36.94 Maximum Salary: $49.88 Vehicle Requirement: N/A Required Qualifications: Completion of bachelor's degree in Computer Science or Information Technology or equivalent. Additional Required Qualifications: 2 or more years recent IT experience, within a team setting, in the technical development of data warehouses, databases, ETL processes, data modeling, data analysis, data visualization, report development, and system implementation required. SQL Server 2008R2 or above skills with recent relevant experience required. Strong SQL skills with recent relevant experience required. Skills and understanding of data warehousing and business intelligence methodologies with recent relevant experience required. Microsoft BI development stack understanding and recent relevant experience required. ETL skills with recent relevant experience required. Report development experience required. Programming skills and experience required. Strong analytical, problem solving and organizational skills required. Strong written and oral communication skills required. Excellent interpersonal skills with a strong client focus and a proven ability to work collaboratively within multiple team environments required. Problem resolution skills required. Preferred Qualifications: SCM application and data model knowledge. Data visualization experience an asset, Tableau. SharePoint 2013 for BI experience. Team Foundation Server 2013 skills. SSRS 2012 preferred. Familiarly with ITIL Incident and Change Management Procedures. Health care industry knowledge and experience. Clinical data experience. C# preferred. Java an asset. Microsoft preferred. Oracle an asset.
Title: IT Analyst II - Data Analyst

Job_Description: Reporting to the Manager of Annual Giving, the Development Data Analyst will play a crucial role in the growth and long-term sustainability of The Mustard Seed’s fundraising and marketing efforts. With a strong analytical skill set, this person will utilize internal and external data sets to provide insights that will drive action to generate support from the community at large. The Development Data Analyst will be an experienced data practitioner who combines technical skill with creative thinking to solve problems and enhance the work of the entire Development team.  MAJOR DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES CRM Management  Extract data from the CRM system and support team members with creation of custom reports and dashboards.  Perform sensitive global tasks with database such as mass update, mass delete.  Create and manage workflows and automations within the CRM and digital marketing systems.  Provide training on the proper use of the CRM system to end users. Champion of Good Data Practices  Act as the internal champion for data standards and good data hygiene practices.  Assist the Major Gifts team in the management of Prospect Portfolio Lists.  Participate in decisions around data governance and future data systems enhancements. Direct Marketing Segmentation and Testing Strategy  Develop targeting and segmentation strategies for fundraising and marketing.  Monitor analytics for website, AdWords, social media, and other platforms to identify poorly performing webpages, campaigns and postings, that create opportunities for optimization.  Support the design and execution of statistically significant testing to help optimize the performance of the direct marketing program.  Create descriptive and predictive data models to support Direct Marketing and other areas within the Development team, in particular the Major Gifts team. Analytics and Data Visualization  Produce reports and dashboards that provide Daily, Weekly, Monthly, Quarterly and Annual details on financial results and other relevant KPIs.  Create and run a suite of integrated reports that show the results of multi-channel marketing/fundraising campaigns.  Create deep-dive reports showing the performance of different segments of donors within a given appeal, and work with the team to produce insights and recommendations based on that data.  Work with the Finance Department to develop cross-functional reports that demonstrate The Mustard Seed’s organizational effectiveness.  Work with the Development team to execute special projects upon request.  MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS AND SKILLS  A post-secondary degree or diploma in Computer Science, Business Intelligence or Business Management would be an asset.  A strong passion for helping people experiencing homelessness and poverty.  Some experience working in a non-profit environment and a strong working knowledge of non-profit business models and standard practices.  Experience using the Salesforce platform is a great asset.  Familiarity with marketing data models and segmentation strategies.  Experience working with Direct Marketing campaigns would be an asset.  Demonstrated experience producing analytical insights to drive decision making.  Advanced data manipulation skills are a core requirement.  Advanced skills in data visualization using Excel, Tableau, etc.  Some coding skills are required (Excel functions/formulas at minimum; some experience with apex, java, python, or r would be preferred).  A self-starting, independent worker who is able to produce high quality work with minimal oversight.  Excellent communication and team collaboration skills.  OTHER INFORMATION  Full-time permanent position  Employment Security Check is required  As The Mustard Seed is a Christian ministry, we require our employees to be in agreement and to sign our statement of faith  Must have legal authorization to work in Canada on a full-time basis for anyone other than current employer  Start date: once a suitable candidate is found Apply online using our Position Application Form on our Careers page. (https://themustardseedhr.wufoo.eu/forms/position-application-form/)  The Mustard Seed offers a competitive compensation package including 100% employer paid extended health and dental benefits for staff and dependents, matching RRSP after one year of service, and flex days. The Mustard Seed embraces the concept of employment equity, which includes fair representation, anti-discrimination and reasonable accommodation.  Privacy Policy: The Mustard Seed follows the principles of privacy therefore the privacy policy will be adhered to. We thank all candidates for their interest, however, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted. The Mustard Seed reserves the right to amend job advertisements. No phone calls please.
Title: Development Data Analyst

Job_Description: Position Title: Credit Analyst (12 Month Term)  Team and Location: Corporate Adjudication – Calgary, AB  Company Profile: Parkland is unique. We fuel communities by safely delivering high-quality petroleum products to motorists, businesses, consumers and wholesale customers across North America. Through unrivaled dependability and service, we connect communities to the products they need to heat their homes, fuel their industries and drive their economies.  Parkland is strong. We are one of North America’s fastest growing and largest independent distributors and marketers of fuels and lubricants. Our family includes Bluewave Energy, Columbia Fuels, Elbow River Marketing, Island Petroleum, Fas Gas Plus, Farstad Oil, Les Pétroles Parkland, Pioneer Energy, Sparlings, Superpumper Inc. and the Ultramar Brand.  Parkland is growing. Our organization is powered by effective leadership, progressive strategies and industry-leading best practices — but more importantly, it is driven by talented, customer-focused people who value integrity, innovation and quality. We are looking for good-natured, hard-working candidates who want to build a rewarding career in a dynamic and collaborative work environment. We are a family and our family continues to grow.  Position Summary:  Reporting to the Manager, Adjudication and Credit Risk, the Credit Analyst will be responsible for effectively managing the exposure and risk associated with the Accounts Receivable portfolio which is comprised of both residential and commercial clients. This position is for a 12 month term.  Key Responsibilities:  Receive and process residential and commercial credit applications and credit limit reviews from branch locations Canada wide Gather credit information from various external sources such as Credit Reporting Agencies, Bank References, internet sites, and financial statement analysis Interpret the compiled information to complete a credit risk assessment and assign a limit, balancing the client’s requirements with that of their credit worthiness. Develop and maintain a strong supportive relationship with both branch personnel and sales team. When warranted, will be required to deal directly with client Qualifications and Skills:  University Degree in Business or Finance 5 years previous credit/collections experience within a Commercial and/or Retail environment Members of the Credit Institute of Canada will be preferred Strong problem solving and analytical skills Excellent computer skills, specifically with Microsoft Excel Customer Service oriented Ability to multi-task Detail oriented Team player Ability to accept and adapt to change Our main priority at Parkland is our people. As an employee, you can expect a fair workplace, a professional work environment, competitive compensation, outstanding benefits, and a share in our success through the Employee Share Purchase Plan and our Annual Incentive Plan.  Our preferred method of application is online at www.parkland.ca  We thank all candidates in advance for their interest, however only those being considered will be contacted.  Parkland Fuel Corporation is committed to the principles of Employment Equity.  We strive to provide accessibility in employment to ensure equal access to employment opportunities for candidates, including persons with disabilities. Parkland Fuel Corporation will endeavour to provide accommodation to persons with disabilities in the recruitment process upon request. If you are selected for an interview and you require accommodation due to a disability, please notify us upon scheduling your interview.
Title: Credit Analyst - Contract Opportunity

Job_Description: Fixed Asset Analyst Reference Code: 50331   Location: Canada (CA) - Calgary, AB Job Category: Accounting/Finance Employment Type: Employee Full-time Relocation Eligibility: This position is not eligible for our relocation program  General Information This new position reports to the Manager, Accounting Business Support with working level supervision provided by the Coordinator – ABS Fixed Assets / Consolidations and Forecasts. The Accounting Business Support team is part of the Controller’s team and is responsible for ensuring that systems and processes are in place to allow our peers to meet their deadlines. The team needs to have a good understanding of both accounting and systems operations/capabilities in order to work with both the Controller’s Team and IS to design solutions that meet our business needs. Day to day activities include everything from: monitoring nightly jobs, managing master data, supporting reporting requests, training end users, to investigation, identification and resolution of issues, to determining how to implement new business into our system landscape.  Responsibilities Managing master data request queues including; Validation of master data requests to ensure they meet standards; Review of requests to ensure it is the best solution for the issue at hand; Implementing master data changes; Documentation of master data processes and standards; Build and maintain effective relationships with accounting group peers and other TransCanada master data teams; Develop an in depth understanding of TransCanada’s SAP PS and PowerPlan Project implementations; Investigation, identification and resolution of Fixed Asset Issues; Preparation of information to support audit requests; Identify, implement and test system/process changes to enhance business process; Perform month-end processes; Train end users in the use of the PowerPlan; Proactively monitor the PowerPlan system/process to avoid processing delays.  Qualifications Excellent organizational skills with ability to manage multiple and competing priorities; Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to interact effectively with counterparts in the Company; Demonstrates the ability to make decisions and recommendations within established accounting procedures; Excellent analytical and problem solving skills; Strong attention to detail.  Education/Experience University degree in Business or Commerce is required; Minimum 6 years of progressive accounting related experience is required; An equivalent combination of education and experience would be considered; Working knowledge of PowerPlan and SAP PS transactions and Master Data is preferred; Proficient in Excel. Depending on the qualifications of the applicants, the successful candidate may be offered a position at a more appropriate level and/or ladder. Applicants must have legal authorization to work in the country in which the position is based with no restrictions. Applicants who require accommodation at any stage of the application process or if you would like additional information regarding TransCanada's accommodation policies please contact careers@transcanada.com.  All positions require background screening. Some include criminal and/or credit checks in order to comply with regulations. Please apply to this posting by 05/21/2018. To apply, go to jobs.transcanada.com and enter reference code 50331. Only applications submitted through the TransCanada Careers website will be acknowledged. TransCanada is an equal opportunity employer.  Make what you do matter. At TransCanada we dream big, think big and do big things. For over 65 years, we've had the vision and scale to deliver big things that matter to the world. From supplying reliable and efficient energy to millions of North Americans with our pipelines, gas storage and power generation facilities, we believe in making big things possible. TransCanada is looking for people who are willing to think about the future...and think big. We're looking for people who are ready to take on the most significant challenges of their careers and define energy infrastructure in North America. Thank you for choosing TransCanada in your career search.

The role requires advanced technical knowledge and is the Information Management Subject Matter Expert (SME) within the Business Unit. As the Corporate requirements for Information Management transform, this role ensures the Business meets the requirements of the corporation in a manner that will satisfy the Business and enhance performance. Job_Description: Encana is a leading North American energy producer that is focused on growing its strong portfolio of diverse resource plays producing natural gas, oil and natural gas liquids. By partnering with employees, community organizations and other businesses, Encana contributes to the strength and sustainability of the communities where it operates. Attracting and retaining the best and brightest people to Encana is at the heart of our business strategy. Fuel your future, Experience Encana. www.encana.com THE POSITION – Information Technology Analyst- Student The IT Analyst role will be part of the IT Business Analysis and Project Management team. Our IT Business Analysts and Project Managers work on a variety of projects on behalf of IT and our Business stakeholders. Our IT Analyst intern will be assigned specific tasks to help with the successful execution and completion of a project. The project could be sponsored by our IT Infrastructure, Solutions or Shared Services teams. Additionally, our IT Analyst will assist with process improvement and reporting for our project pipeline. Job responsibilities may include all or some of the following: understand and translate the business or IT goals into IT solutions act as a project coordinator/planner on small initiatives reporting creation using MS Power BI participate in analysis, detailed requirements gathering, and researching potential IT solutions prepare project documents aligned with the Project Management Office requirements gathering, product analysis, testing and work coordination current/Future state analysis and process documentation assist with standardizing project and systems documentation This position will be based in our Calgary office and is available for a 16 week term starting in May 2018.  Qualifications: you must be legally eligible to work in the Canada for the duration of your work term 3.0 or higher GPA 3rd, 4th year or graduate student must be enrolled as a full-time student, working towards a degree Business Technology Management, Management Information Systems, or related major analytical thinking IT/Technical knowledge proactive, self-starter ability to communicate effectively with a variety of audiences Application Requirements: Combine the following items into one document to upload with application as the resume: your cover letter your resume your most recent unofficial full transcript screenshot WE VALUE YOUR CONTRIBUTIONS Encana values the contribution of new talent and recruits ambitious, high-performing students who are committed to excellence. At Encana, you will work on challenging and rewarding hands-on projects that apply and expand your business and technical skills. You will have opportunities to demonstrate your initiative and determination in ways that make a positive impact on Encana’s business strategy and further develop your talents. INTERVIEWS If selected for an interview you will be contacted to arrange a suitable interview time and are required to bring a copy of their transcripts to the interview. We thank you for your interest in working at Encana and wish you success in your job search.

Job_Description: Inter Pipeline is a major petroleum transportation, storage and natural gas liquids processing business that ranks among the largest energy infrastructure companies in Canada. We are proud to be named one of Alberta’s Top 70 Employers, which recognizes Alberta businesses that lead their industries by being exceptional places to work.   Located out of our Calgary office, the individual in the Business Analyst role will report to the Supervisor, Finance Solutions Centre. The successful candidate will be responsible for planning administration, assisting with project support and other team accountabilities from an SAP perspective for Inter Pipeline.  Key Activities and Responsibilities: Administer the planning (budgeting and forecasting) function within SAP BPC, including opening and closing planning periods Assist in the review and ongoing improvement of processes Research and identify critical data issues and risks Achieve data quality key performance indicators (KPIs), metrics, and service level agreements (SLAs) Monitor data quality and data governance scorecards and escalate critical issues to leadership Process improvements in the planning function and ongoing sustainment of best practice Provide support to business users (primarily Finance) on use of SAP functionality, reporting and structure of data elements to assist with retrieving and analyzing data Interaction with SAP Competency Center on future system enhancements, builds, testing, and production roll-outs Assist with SAP reports  Education, Skills and Experience: Strong finance expertise in the planning function, combined with prior oil and gas experience considered an asset (4-7 years of experience) In depth knowledge of SAP FI_CO and Business Warehouse, experience with BPC, S/4HANA, and Fiori an asset Undergraduate diploma or degree in business Approaches work with a high level of curiosity and aptitude to identify and solve problems, takes initiative and works independently Change agent who can persuade and influence stakeholders to establish new processes, shift to automation, and provide innovative solutions Strong accountability and ownership mentality Ability to manage internal and external relationships with well-developed interpersonal, team, customer service and communication skills (both written and verbal) Strong customer service skills in working with internal departments to achieve results through relationships with people and teams Able to work well in a fast-paced, growth environment, with strong attention to detail and accuracy Maintains strong initiative and possesses superior analytical skills
Title: Business Analyst (SAP Finance)

Job_Description: We are an experience design agency with a relentless focus on the customer. The way a customer experiences a brand has a profound impact on perception, purchase behavior and loyalty. That’s why our work begins and ends with our clients’ customers. We listen to them. Validate with them. We even include them in our design process. By creating customer experiences that are simple, valuable, entertaining, and convenient, we deliver measurable results for some of the world’s most admired brands. Today we’re 950 people in 11 offices on 4 continents. We are thinkers. Makers. Do’ers. We speak a dozen different languages and are inspired by a million different things. But no matter what our discipline is or where we are in the world, we’re united by a common excitement for digital that’s absolute and contagious. MARKETING SCIENCE ANALYST The primary role of an analyst is to support the day-to-day work with supervision from a manager. This requires solid contribution to at least two (2) of the five (5) sub-disciplines (tracking and measurement, data visualization, testing and evaluation, data integration and statistical modeling.) This position should have an understanding of how at least one of the other sub-disciplines fits into clients’ business and should continue to learn and develop in the other areas. The analyst will work closely with a manager that will have more experience to train him/her on daily work responsibilities, teach project delivery, and explain other sub-disciplines in Marketing Science. Responsibilities: Constant curiosity for what the data means and where it fits into the clients’ business Well organized approach to a variety of project work Detailed-oriented work style Strong time management skills to ensure accurate delivery Good communication skills with Marketing Science team members as well as across other disciplines Logical approach to analysis process that demonstrates how data lead to conclusions Consistent drive for collaboration with others to provide support, share skills, and learn more Requirements: Strong attention to detail, organizational skills, and time management is key Top notch communication and collaboration skills are also key to success in the analyst role Expectations Management: a successful analyst will communicate quickly and accurately about delivery and delay, and follow up Intellectual Curiosity: analyst should ask the next question, and understand where our work fits in the big picture Logical Approach: cut a path that others can follow, and make sure your conclusions follow your evidence Skills Enhancement & Sharing: Keep learning, offer support, grow your comfort zone, and help the team grow and learn
Title: Marketing Science Analyst

Job_Description: Encana is a leading North American energy producer that is focused on growing its strong portfolio of diverse resource plays producing natural gas, oil and natural gas liquids. By partnering with employees, community organizations and other businesses, Encana contributes to the strength and sustainability of the communities where it operates. Attracting and retaining the best and brightest people to Encana is at the heart of our business strategy. Fuel your future, Experience Encana. www.encana.com THE POSITION –Information Analyst - Student The Analyst student role will be part of the Records and Information Management team. Our Analysts work on a variety of projects on behalf of our team and our Business stakeholders. Our Analyst student will be assigned specific tasks to help with the successful execution of our “Future Of Archives” project. The project is sponsored by our Executive Vice President of Corporate Services. Job responsibilities may include all or some of the following: conduct inventory review support with data analysis, preparation and entry (in readiness for system migration) participate in lifecycle management activities prepare project documentation perform quality assurance checks contribute to ongoing process improvements participate in team and business meetings assist with other related duties as needed This position will be based in our Calgary office and is available for 4 months starting in May 2018. Qualifications: you must be legally eligible to work in Canada for the duration of your work term 3.0 or higher GPA 4th year or graduate student must be enrolled as a full-time student, working towards a degree Archival, Records and Information, Library or related major analytical thinking proactive, self-starter ability to communicate effectively with a variety of audiences Application Requirements: Combine the following items into one document to upload with application as the resume: your cover letter your resume your most recent unofficial full transcript screenshot Posting closes on April 16 WE VALUE YOUR CONTRIBUTIONS Encana values the contribution of new talent and recruits ambitious, high-performing students who are committed to excellence. At Encana, you will work on challenging and rewarding hands-on projects that apply and expand your business and technical skills. You will have opportunities to demonstrate your initiative and determination in ways that make a positive impact on Encana’s business strategy and further develop your talents. INTERVIEWS If selected for an interview you will be contacted to arrange a suitable interview time and are required to bring a copy of their transcripts to the interview. We thank you for your interest in working at Encana and wish you success in your job search.
Title: Information Analyst - Student

Job_Description: DIFFERENT BY DESIGN At MNP we pride ourselves on being different – it’s our entrepreneurial drive that sets us apart. It’s the same drive that’s helped us become Canada’s fastest growing national firm. We foster collaboration, value your ideas, promote based on talent, live balanced lifestyles and make time for FUN. We are one firm, one team, collaborating to support you wherever you want to take your career.  Join the momentum. We are seeking an Analyst for our growing Technology Consulting team. Driving business excellence, MNP is a leading national accounting, tax and business consulting firm in Canada. Our Consulting team works with organizations in the public, private and not-for-profit sectors to provide innovative strategies tailored to maximize efficiencies, enhance performance and increase profitability. Specifically, our recognized Technology Consulting team works with clients to translate technology issues and opportunities into meaningful results that meet organizational needs.   RESPONSIBILITIES AND QUALIFICATIONS Performance Expectations Facilitate and run effective meetings Requirement elicitation from stakeholders via workshops Business process modeling of the current and to-be state Requirement analysis, defining all types of requirements to define the business need Requirements management and prioritization Organize and coordinate stakeholder engagement System integration analysis, including creating system interface specifications Data analysis and design, creating logical data models and specifying lookups Solution design and prototyping; creating user interface specifications Be familiar with standard BA techniques as defined in the BABOK Engage business stakeholders and write formal documentation such as business cases, proposals, requirements definition specifications, project glossaries, non-functional requirements specifications and communication plans Engage developers and solution implementer and write formal technical documentation such as request for proposals (RFP), test cases, technical specifications and technical models Credentials Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Commerce or equivalent A minimum of 3 years’ experience in business analysis in an enterprise environment Expert-level knowledge in the Business Analysis or Systems Analysis subject area Working understanding of enterprise system infrastructure Working understanding of enterprise analysis processes and documentation requirements for improving an organization’s processes and/or procedures Microsoft Office tools including: Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Visio, MS Project considered an asset Image editing software (i.e. GIMP, Snag It, etc.) Using business process modelling and diagramming techniques such as BPMN Using the Unified Modeling Language (UML) to generate specifications Familiar with standard BA techniques as defined in the BABOK ERP implementation experience considered an asset Experience with IT Frameworks, i.e. ITIL, COBIT, etc. considered an asset Core Competencies and Personal Characteristics Integrity – professional whose honesty, integrity, confidentiality and high ethical standards contributes to effective leadership and optimal business relationships Energy – displays enthusiasm, optimism, drive and passion while maintaining a high level of productivity and a balanced lifestyle Diversity – understands the importance of different backgrounds, perspectives and experiences and is respectful of individual differences Communication – effectively expresses ideas and conveys information in business writing, conversations and interactions with others Client Service Excellence – understands the importance of quality client service by being courteous, responding to client requests in a timely manner and monitoring satisfaction Teamwork & Relationship Development – works collaboratively with team members in order to achieve a common goal and develops, maintains and strengthens relationships with others, both inside and outside the Firm Accountability – takes responsibility for one’s own performance by setting clear goals and tracking progress against those goals; is highly organized and uses personal judgement and decision making Flexibility – effectively manages multiple assignments, adapts to changing priorities and is able to work independently or as part of a team Work Ethic – consistently performs to high quality standards, is dependable and has a constant drive to improve TOTAL REWARDS MNP encourages a balanced lifestyle and offers benefits that suit the way our team members work and play! In addition to a competitive salary, our total rewards package includes paid personal days, wellness program initiatives, health and dental benefits, a group pension plan with matching contribution, firm sponsored social events and professional development assistance.  MNP proudly serves and responds to the needs of our clients in the public, private and not-for-profit sectors. Through partner-led engagements, we provide a collaborative, cost-effective approach to doing business, with innovative strategies to help organizations succeed across the country and around the world.
Title: Analyst, Technology Consulting

Job_Description: Analyst, Corporate Planning (Temporary), Calgary, AB  Why work at Nutrien? Great question!  Safety is a core value at Nutrien. Keeping every employee safe, healthy and secure is our top priority. Nothing is more important than seeing our people go home safe at the end of every single day.  While working here you will have the opportunity to grow your career while helping us feed the future. We pride ourselves in hiring from a variety of backgrounds and truly believe that it is our differences that make us stronger so we hope you will join us.  In addition to exciting and challenging opportunities, Nutrien offers competitive salaries, great benefits and performance based incentives.  Outside of the skills and necessary qualifications, you will be committed to sustaining our safe and positive work environment while welcoming working side by side others in a diverse culture. Culture at Nutrien is the core of everything we do and all employees are respectful of diverse opinions and views.  Reporting to the Sr Manager, Planning & Forecasting, the successful candidate will be part of a high performing team responsible for the consolidation and reporting of Nutrien’s monthly forecasts, annual budget, and ad hoc analysis.   This is a temporary, 12 month position*  Corporate Planning is looking for a creative and analytical finance professional, in this temporary role, that thrives on working in a dynamic and fast paced environment. The successful candidate will have a solid understanding of accounting principles and financial statements along with strong technical skills in Excel and reporting systems (experience with SAP and BPC is preferred).  This role will take part in, and have assigned accountability for components of the following Corporate Planning team initiatives:  Key Tasks: Implementation of monthly forecasts Preparation of Senior Leadership and Board review materials Compilation of the Board Business Plan Administration and reporting of the annual G&A budgeting process Financial analytics on all aspects of business unit and consolidated forecasts Maintenance, enhancement, and report writing within the BPC Planning system The role will be specifically responsible for forecasting and analyzing the financial statements for Nutrien’s Corporate business unit including:  Inter-company gross profit elimination G&A and other expenses Short and long-term finance costs Working capital and capital expenditures  Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree in accounting or related field and a professional accounting designation (preferred) Three plus years’ experience in a planning or related accounting/ finance role Strong technical, analytical, and problem-solving skills Proficiency in the use of Microsoft Office products, SAP, and BPC Strong conceptual knowledge of financial statements and accounting principles Effective verbal and written communication skills The ability to multi-task in a deadline driven, team environment Nutrien is committed to creating an inclusive workplace. We encourage applications from all well qualified candidates who reflect the diversity of the regions where we operate. This includes recognizing the voluntary identification of status such as gender, sexual orientation, visible minority, Indigenous status, persons with disabilities, and veterans, where applicable.  If this sounds like a good match, apply now. This job will remain posted until filled. You may be required to undergo a background check and substance test in accordance with Nutrien policies.  While we appreciate all applications we receive, we advise that only candidates under consideration will be contacted.
Title: Analyst, Corporate Planning (Temporary)

Job_Description: Looking for a great place to work? A place where an award-winning culture means empowerment, teamwork and a passion for what you do? Then think WestJet. It's a great place to land. WestJet is an organization recognized by its delivery of a remarkable guest experience resulting in us achieving over $3B in sales. In order for our best-in-class airline to be this successful, we require the skills and talents of professionals like you to ensure our ongoing growth. In an industry that is dominated by legacy competitors, you have the opportunity to build your career with an organization driven by progressive strategies, leadership and practices. If you are looking to break out of the status quo by joining a company with a strong growth plan, which consistently ranks as one of the most profitable airlines in the world, and which has a vision to be a top five international airline, WestJet is the place for you!  Senior Cloud Analyst As WestJet becomes more complex and dynamic, we are seeking a Senior Cloud Analyst reporting into our Information Technology office. This individual can exhibit a high standard of excellence, enjoys challenges, and is results-driven. The incumbent must be highly motivated and demonstrate the ability to work in an agile environment. The Senior Cloud Analyst will play an integral part in the design, development, and operation of the WestJet cloud presence. This role will be responsible for the migration, planning, and operational process development to assist in WestJet’s journey to the cloud. Working with the rest of the Cloud Operations Team and the Cloud Solution Architect, the Senior Cloud Operations Analyst will meet with other Application support groups and develop roadmaps to migrate the various application workloads into the WestJet cloud environment. Responsibilities: Contribute to the development of AWS, Azure (and other) public cloud provider standards and best practices. Develop and maintain a strong set of guard rails in the Cloud environments to ensure WestJet’s Information is kept safe and secure. Build out and expand on our Infrastructure as Code as it pertains to our Cloud environments. Create runbooks / operational procedures for the upkeep of the cloud infrastructure. Collaborate with Application Teams to replace / rebuild / revise / refactor and if required, re-host applications from out datacenter to the cloud. Act as an evangelist when meeting with other groups in describing the WestJet journey to the cloud. Represent the Cloud Operations team to other technical and non-technical teams including Directors, Senior Leadership, and Executive. Provide mentorship to other members of the Cloud Operations team as well as members of the Information Technology teams in the best practices within the Cloud.  Professional Qualifications: 3-5 years Cloud experience and 5-7 years IT Operations experience Strong working knowledge of cloud best practices Deep technical background (operating systems, networking, application performance management, load balancing, security systems, etc.) Experience in building large distributed systems Experience in supporting highly available applications Developing and maintaining business continuity and disaster recovery processes Experience with enterprise monitoring tools Experience with databases (relational and NoSQL) Experience with networks (routing, firewalls, load balancers, DNS, etc.) Experience supporting/building applications in AWS or Azure Experience support cloud to on-premise workloads and understanding the mitigating factors involved Knowledge of DevOps, agile development and cloud operations support processes Experience with Infrastructure as Code using any of the following Python/Cloud Formation Templates/Terraform/VSTS/Ansible/PowerShell, etc. Strong presentation skills Must be detail-oriented and possess the ability to multi-task and meet unexpected deadlines in a demanding environment. Demonstrate sound judgment regarding confidential and sensitive matters. Must provide high level of customer service to internal and external guests.   We would like to thank all applicants in advance for their interest in WestJet. We believe in enriching the lives of everyone in WestJet's world and encourage applications from all qualified individuals. Our ongoing efforts toward evolving total diversity will continue to be the way we do business every day. As owners, we believe in celebrating everyone’s unique skills, perspectives and experiences. WestJet is committed to inclusiveness, equity and accessibility. We encourage all qualified candidates to apply. If you inspire greater creativity and innovation towards reaching new altitudes and meet the qualifications for the position in which you are interested, we welcome you to complete an online application. WestJet is a great place to land - powered by Talent and Growth. At WestJet, the safety and security of our people and our guests is a core value and at the heart of what we do. As safety and security is a shared responsibility, it is expected that you will utilize safe work practices to ensure your well-being and the safety of others.
Title: Senior Cloud Analyst

Job_Description: SUMMARYBHE Canada is a Canadian subsidiary of Berkshire Hathaway Energy and is focused on identifying and investing in business opportunities within all aspects of the energy infrastructure market across Canada, as well as electricity transmission internationally. BHE Canada has a particular focus on renewable energy such as wind. BHE Canada is headquartered in Calgary, Alberta.BHE Canada is currently seeking a Senior Corporate Development Analyst to be part of the BHE Canada team. Reporting to the Managing Director, the successful candidate will be responsible for evaluating business development opportunities for the company and supporting strategy development and competitor analysis efforts.As a key player, involved in strategic investment decisions, the successful candidate will independently perform discounted cash flow analysis; determine financial measurements that are appropriate for investment decisions; document results and effectively communicate results to BHE Canada team and BHE Canada management. Working with technical resources one successful candidate will apply their expertise in financial evaluation and risk analysis to help develop optimal project investment decisions and to frame project returns versus risks.RESPONSIBILITIESConduct financial economic evaluation activities essential to the proper assessment of investment and acquisition opportunities.Monitor target-market fundamentals, procurement processes, investment environments, and energy policy developments for integration into business development activities.Conduct energy and electricity market and macroeconomic analysis and report findings on Canadian, U.S. and International markets.Develop and construct financial models for greenfield projects, acquisitions or other business development activities.Perform due diligence activities on transmission and generation investment opportunities.Undertake a wide range of special projects and economic modeling activities related to the thorough evaluation of new business growth opportunities and green field construction opportunities.Assist in the development and communication of strategic initiatives in supporting the company’s growth.Evaluate competitive environments and market participants, including preparation of detailed company profiles and competitor assessments.QUALIFICATIONS· University degree (ideally a commerce, economic, engineering, or science discipline) or equivalent in experience.· An MBA, CFA or professional accounting designation (or equivalent in experience).· 5 - 10 years of experience as a financial and economic analyst.· Energy industry experience, preferably electric, with a well-rounded knowledge of what drives the energy industry as well as the indicators of change within the industry.· Strong lateral thinker with highly developed conceptual and analytical skills.· Excellent computer skills and a comfort level with most business and risk analysis-related software packages.· Good business sense with a proven track record of participating in and bringing forward sound business decisions related to asset growth.· Adaptable and flexible with the ability to work on more than one project at a time and with a variety of individuals and disciplines.· A highly motivated team player with a positive attitude and the ability to function effectively as part of a team.· Excellent communication and organizational skills.Interested applicants can submit their resume and cover letter by May 18, 2018.Job Types: Full-time, Permanent
Title: Sr Corporate Development Analyst

Job_Description: Build a meaningful career  At Morneau Shepell, we offer more than career opportunities, we provide career opportunities to make meaningful contributions to people’s lives. The extraordinary expertise of our 4,000-strong workforce is harnessed to support the employees and families of the organizations we serve. Our innovative programs have a lasting impact on the health, financial security and productivity of 20,000 workplaces.  Consultant Health and Benefits  Health & Benefits Solutions  Calgary, AB  Full Time, Permanent  Benefits programs are an important and highly valued part of any employment offering. But understanding how much or what type of benefit coverage is necessary can be difficult. Our client relationship model is consultative and encourages continual communication. By providing you with the resources to support employers in engaging employees in their health, we provide a path to better workforce health and productivity.  Our Consultant works in a team and is responsible for managing, servicing and providing quality benefits consulting services for small to medium sized clients. In addition, they will be responsible for helping to build business with existing clients as well as attracting and supporting new clients through our association partnerships.  Responsibilities include:  Business Development  Identify and manage cross-sell opportunities Develop strategic relationships with key account contacts and introduce Morneau Shepell team members as appropriate Supervise the complete employee benefits cycle: plan design, provider search, implementation, experience monitoring, renewal rating Develop new business with existing clients and assists in obtaining new business with prospective clients focusing on our key association partnerships Understand client needs and identify company or industry products or services that can meet these needs Service  Deliver presentations to clients; conduct client meetings and the occasional employee presentation. Ensure that quality control and service standards are attained with every transaction Negotiate, problem solve and maintain positive relationships with insurers, external advisors and internal underwriting and benefits administration departments Develop and maintain excellent relationships with clients, through regular telephone contact and office visits Understand the client’s perspective and priorities, and work with the client to resolve administrative issues Establish strategies for services that meet client needs  Administration  Provide and oversee direct day-to-day support for clients by phone, e-mail, letters, formal reports, and face-to-face meetings Lead and manage multiple client assignments and projects Manage special projects as required Peer review the work of analysts Knowledge  Maintain current knowledge of industry trends including insurer news, products, legislation, and cost trends as well as current knowledge of our company's products and services  Qualifications:  Experience  Five years of experience in group benefits. Preference will be given to those from the group insurance industry, a consulting firm or brokerage or in an HR department. Education  Post-secondary education GBA (CEBS) designation, or working towards it. Life Insurance license (this will be a requirement within 3 months of onboarding) Skills  Strong presentation skills and comfort speaking in front of large groups Understanding of consultative selling and the ability to manage the sales cycle effectively and autonomously Expert negotiation, technical and analytical skills Can effectively communicate complex concepts in plain written and spoken language Professional Traits  Exceptional customer focus; some would say you’re the best Extremely organized self-starter, flexible, highly independent Ability to manage multiple deadlines simultaneously Proven collaborative team member with the ability to motivate and inspire team members  Morneau Shepell Morneau Shepell is in the business of helping organizations help their people because we believe that engaged people are the driving force for society. Every day, the expertise of our almost 4,000 employees is recognized as essential to the financial security, health, and productivity of our clients and their people. We're always looking for talented professionals and strategic leaders who will listen and work together with colleagues and clients to form long-term relationships and to deliver integrative solutions that fit. As we continue to grow, we're presently engaging with exceptional candidates interested in a range of exciting career opportunities. At www.morneaushepell.com you can explore our careers page to learn more about the solutions we deliver and the great people who help us do it. Follow us on LinkedIn and Twitter (Morneau_Shepell, Shepell). We are thankful for your interest, but unfortunately, we can only personally connect with those selected for an interview.  INDCAD LI-PH1  Job Grade: MS4   Fulfilling work that matters  Morneau Shepell is in the business of helping organizations help their people and in the process, we strive to elevate ours.  We're always looking for talented professionals and strategic leaders looking to make a difference in the lives of the people we serve.  We appreciate the interest of every applicant; however, we contact only those selected for an interview.  Find your fit with us. Follow us on LinkedIn, Youtube and Twitter.

Job_Description: Inter Pipeline is a major petroleum transportation, storage and natural gas liquids processing business that ranks among the largest energy infrastructure companies in Canada. We are proud to be named one of Alberta’s Top 70 Employers, which recognizes Alberta businesses that lead their industries by being exceptional places to work.  Located out of our Calgary office, the individual in the Senior Business Analyst role will report to the Supervisor, Finance Solutions Centre. The successful candidate will be responsible for the stewardship of finance master data and project support within SAP for Inter Pipeline, as well indirect leadership of the Business Analyst.  Key Activities and Responsibilities: Review and ongoing improvement of master data creation/change approval processes Leadership of the Business Analyst role, utilizing a team accountability approach for facilitating finance master data creation/changes Work with the business and SAP Competency Centre to develop Service Level Agreements (SLAs), key performance indicators (KPIs) and other metrics for SAP finance master data Act as a data steward bringing forward cross-functional data quality and process integration issues and working collaboratively to solve them, championing the collective management of data governance Serve as a central point of contact for finance data governance understanding and providing direction and training to data consumers and producers from the business in line with business rules Ensure the right stakeholders across the enterprise (e.g. operations, finance, supply chain, etc.) are brought into make business process improvements which mitigate data issues Bring best practices in master data management and propose opportunities for improvement Interaction with SAP Competency Center on future system enhancements, builds, testing, and roll-outs Assist with development and usage of SAP reports  Education, Skills and Experience: Undergraduate diploma or degree in business with 5+ years of progressive experience in financial system support, CPA (CA, CMA, CGA) designation is an asset Strong finance expertise on master data usage, configuration, and integrated data requirements/linkage points combined with prior oil and gas experience considered an asset In depth knowledge of SAP FI_CO and Business Warehouse, experience with S/4HANA and Fiori an asset Approaches work with a high level of curiosity and aptitude to identify and solve problems, takes initiative, is accountable, and works independently Change agent who can persuade and influence stakeholders to establish new processes, shift to automation, and provide innovative solutions Ability to manage internal and external relationships with well-developed interpersonal, team, customer service and communication skills (both written and verbal) Strong customer service skills in working with internal departments to achieve results through relationships with people and teams Able to work well in a fast-paced, growth environment, with strong attention to detail and accuracy Maintains strong initiative and possesses superior analytical skills
Title: Senior Business Analyst

Job_Description: *PLEASE NOTE: PREFERENCE WILL BE GIVEN TO CANDIDATES WHO APPLY THROUGH CANFOR.COM/CAREERSCanfor TechnologyAt Canfor, our Information Technology professionals play an important role in the daily functioning of our operations. Consistently pushing the boundaries when it comes to innovation within the forestry and pulp and paper industries, our IT professionals support Canfor in achieving exceptional results.With a high caliber Information Technology leadership team, a clear vision, and significant growth and training opportunities, a career in IT at Canfor allows individuals to strengthen their competencies and grow within their respective roles. Working as an equal partner with our operations to achieve organizational objectives, you will be at the forefront of innovation.Who We Are: Canfor is one of the world’s largest and most respected integrated forest products companies. For more than 75 years, we have been delivering top-quality lumber, pulp and paper products to our valued customers worldwide. With operations in Western Canada and the Southern United States, and sales offices around the world, you can find Canfor products in every corner of the globe. We are leaders in sustainable forest management and in converting wood residuals into green energy.As we continue to grow our company and our markets, find out how you can grow your career with us.The OpportunityThe Data Analyst, Business Intelligence supports Canfor’s objectives by turning data into meaningful information that can be used to make sound business decisions. The Data Analyst will provide expertise in business intelligence to prepare and deliver data and information to internal customers and stakeholders through reports, dashboards and scorecards. It is essential that the Data Analyst build an understanding of the business at a level of detail that enables them to work with the business to deliver valuable information.Please Note:  This is a relocation opportunity in Vancouver, British Columbia. The successful applicant may be provided with relocation assistance.Main ResponsibilitiesRequirements Gathering:Engage with various business units to capture information needs, compare those needs with existing tools and identify gapsParticipate in business requirements workshopsWrite business requirements documents as required to elaborate needs, gain acceptanceDesign & Development:Architect tables and dataDesign dashboards, reports, drill-down analytics and data visualizationsDesign, configure and administer the metadata layerCreate system technical requirements for documentation and knowledge managementActively challenge and find solutions to optimize system performanceTesting, Validation, Release Management:Develop and implement testing strategiesValidate data accuracyDeploy and validate changes in production environmentTraining & Change Management:Support the development of training, documentation, and help desk capabilitiesRequired SkillsBachelor's degree in computer science, information systems, business management or specialized training/certificationExperience working with relational databases (Microsoft SQL Server, Oracle Database, MySQL, etc)Applied knowledge of SQL (T-SQL, PL/SQL, ANSI-SQL, etc)Applied understanding of data modelling and warehousing conceptsWorking knowledge of business intelligence tools such as Oracle Business IntelligenceWorking knowledge of ETL tools such as Oracle Data Integrator or InformaticaExperience mediating and clarifying sometimes ambiguous or conflicting end user requirementsEagerness to learn new concepts and technologies and keep-up-to-date with existing onesWillingness to go above and beyond to understand both the business and technical aspects of a problemHiring for this position is ongoing and will be filled as required. To be considered for this position, please apply today.In order to be eligible for this position, you must be legally entitled to work in Canada for our Company.There has never been a better time to join the Canfor Information Technology team and become a part of the modern forest industry. We have a wide range of rewarding and innovative careers in some of the best communities in North America, with plenty of room for advancement. We offer competitive compensation and benefits packages, and are committed to the professional development of our employees.*PLEASE NOTE: PREFERENCE WILL BE GIVEN TO CANDIDATES WHO APPLY THROUGH CANFOR.COM/CAREERSFollow us on LinkedIn , Twitter , and Facebook for Canfor news, career opportunities, and upcoming events!Vancouver, BCThe city of Vancouver is both a natural beauty and a progressive urban centre, a rare place on earth that is idyllic and electric all at once. With one of Canada’s mildest climates, Vancouver is ideally suited for those devoted to outdoor pursuits, health and wellness. Along with its endless supply of fresh air and clean water, Vancouver also boasts countless choices for culturally diverse, world-class cuisine and an inventory of arts and entertainment events. For more information, visit http://canfor.com/our-company/our-communities/vancouverJob Type: Full-timeEducation:High school or equivalent
Title: Business Intelligence Analyst (Relocation Opportunity)

Job_Description: At LifeLabs, we are focused on our vision of building a healthier Canada! We are the largest community diagnostics laboratory in Canada with over 350 collection centres, 21 laboratories and service over 19 million patients each year. Caring, Agile, Customer Driven, One Team - We live our values every day in what we do to help our patients and healthcare providers. With over 5,000 employees, we all make a difference and that’s why our people are so important to us. This is an exciting time to join our LifeLabs team, grow your career with us and support numerous business initiatives, innovations, best practice and business development opportunities. Rocky Mountain Analytical provides specialized tests to naturopathic doctors, physicians and other healthcare providers who practice integrative medicine. Rocky Mountain Analytical, a division of LifeLabs is seeking a Senior Analyst who will be integral in ensuring LifeLabs successfully achieves its growth strategies. Reporting to the Director or Manager, Business Development RMA, the Senior Analyst will support the RMA Business Development team in areas of growth strategy development and execution, project management and business development. We are looking for individuals with a strong drive for change, a natural curiosity, and a passion for transforming healthcare in Canada. The role may require some travel within Canada. This is a full time permanent role and will be located in our Calgary office. Accountabilities: Conducting and facilitating internal stakeholder meetings Researching and synthesizing industry trends and the competitive landscape Conducting market research in the area of functional medicine including formal market evaluation and sizing studies Synthesizing all information and data into executive level reports to facilitate strategic decision making Supporting the development of tools and templates to help facilitate the data/information gathering and analysis process Becoming a subject matter expert in functional medicine testing and the functional medicine landscape overall Assessing/evaluating the competitive landscape relative to a particular opportunity Providing financial analysis, costing, and projections to internal clients to enable effective decision making and risk assessment Supporting the development of executive level briefing notes, updates, presentation decks and stakeholder communications Liaising with internal leaders to build an intimate understanding of the business and ongoing activities occurring across different functional units  Experience and Skills: Bachelor’s degree in Business, Management, Health Sciences or equivalent Preferred 2-3 years of experience, including 1 year recent experience in a related role; willing to look at the right new grad Master’s Degree in Business / Health Administration or equivalent considered an asset Prior knowledge and experience within the health care/life sciences industries Background in sciences (e.g. biology, physiology, biochemistry) an asset Management consulting experience considered an asset Proven ability to gain support for and drive organizational strategies Exceptional leadership and interpersonal skills with a collaborative mindset. Proven capacity to engage with diverse multidisciplinary teams (e.g., Med/Sci, Business Development, Strategy, Marketing and Sales, Client Services, Laboratory Operations, Government Relations, etc.) An excellent written and verbal communicator, including with senior executives Ability to work across multiple jurisdictions, with multiple team members in different time zones. High-level of adaptability, emotional intelligence, and comfort with ambiguity Close attention to detail, with a quality-focused mindset A detail and results oriented self-starter with demonstrated analytical expertise Proven proficiency in the Microsoft Office Suite and well developed skills in quantitative and qualitative analyses Demonstrated passion and enthusiasm for the healthcare and life sciences industries in Canada Dynamic, possessing the ability to prioritize multiple work assignments and manage time effectively
Title: Senior Analyst, Business Development - Calgary

Job_Description: SUMMARYBHE Canada is a Canadian subsidiary of Berkshire Hathaway Energy and is focused on identifying and investing in business opportunities within all aspects of the energy infrastructure market across Canada, as well as electricity transmission internationally. BHE Canada has a particular focus on renewable energy such as wind. BHE Canada is headquartered in Calgary, Alberta.BHE Canada is currently seeking a Senior Corporate Development Analyst to be part of the BHE Canada team. Reporting to the Managing Director, the successful candidate will be responsible for evaluating business development opportunities for the company and supporting strategy development and competitor analysis efforts.As a key player, involved in strategic investment decisions, the successful candidate will independently perform discounted cash flow analysis; determine financial measurements that are appropriate for investment decisions; document results and effectively communicate results to BHE Canada team and BHE Canada management. Working with technical resources one successful candidate will apply their expertise in financial evaluation and risk analysis to help develop optimal project investment decisions and to frame project returns versus risks.RESPONSIBILITIESConduct financial economic evaluation activities essential to the proper assessment of investment and acquisition opportunities.Monitor target-market fundamentals, procurement processes, investment environments, and energy policy developments for integration into business development activities.Conduct energy and electricity market and macroeconomic analysis and report findings on Canadian, U.S. and International markets.Develop and construct financial models for greenfield projects, acquisitions or other business development activities.Perform due diligence activities on transmission and generation investment opportunities.Undertake a wide range of special projects and economic modeling activities related to the thorough evaluation of new business growth opportunities and green field construction opportunities.Assist in the development and communication of strategic initiatives in supporting the company’s growth.Evaluate competitive environments and market participants, including preparation of detailed company profiles and competitor assessments.QUALIFICATIONS· University degree (ideally a commerce, economic, engineering, or science discipline) or equivalent in experience.· An MBA, CFA or professional accounting designation (or equivalent in experience).· 5 - 10 years of experience as a financial and economic analyst.· Energy industry experience, preferably electric, with a well-rounded knowledge of what drives the energy industry as well as the indicators of change within the industry.· Strong lateral thinker with highly developed conceptual and analytical skills.· Excellent computer skills and a comfort level with most business and risk analysis-related software packages.· Good business sense with a proven track record of participating in and bringing forward sound business decisions related to asset growth.· Adaptable and flexible with the ability to work on more than one project at a time and with a variety of individuals and disciplines.· A highly motivated team player with a positive attitude and the ability to function effectively as part of a team.· Excellent communication and organizational skills.Interested applicants can submit their resume and cover letter by May 18, 2018.Job Types: Full-time, Permanent
Title: Sr Corporate Development Analyst

Job_Description: Solutions Analyst, IT Transportation Distribution & Logistics (TD&L), Calgary, AB and Saskatoon, SK  Why work at Nutrien? Great question! Safety is a core value at Nutrien. Keeping every employee safe, healthy and secure is our top priority. Nothing is more important than seeing our people go home safe at the end of every single day. While working here you will have the opportunity to grow your career while helping us feed the future. We pride ourselves in hiring from a variety of backgrounds and truly believe that it is our differences that make us stronger so we hope you will join us. In addition to exciting and challenging opportunities, Nutrien offers competitive salaries, great benefits and performance based incentives. Outside of the skills and necessary qualifications, you will be committed to sustaining our safe and positive work environment while welcoming working side by side others in a diverse culture. Culture at Nutrien is the core of everything we do and all employees are respectful of diverse opinions and views. Reporting to the Sr Manager IT TD&L, the Solution Analyst will work with business users to drive out business requirements and translate them into effective and efficient system solutions. The Solution Analyst will gain an in-depth functional understanding of TD&L and Sales applications and how they facilitate business process. The Solution Analyst will collaborate with other members from the IT TD&L, Sales and IBP teams, the broader IT team, and business stakeholders to deliver solutions that add value for Nutrien.  Key Tasks: Serve as business facing system solution resource to collaborate on solution components required to meet business objectives Act as a liaison between IT and our business partners to uphold a clear understanding of business requirements and to ensure functional deliverables align with the stakeholder needs Own the solution design and work with IT partners to meet business needs Define functional requirements for application development efforts and facilitate definition of project scope, goals and deliverables for application development vendors. Oversee and review testing plans and outcomes to validate proposed solution meets intent and is appropriate in response to business demand for change  Skills:  Effective with creative solutioning and communication to influence and facilitate resolution of a problem/business issue. Uses influencing and negotiation skills when appropriate. Exceptional communication, both written and verbal, and facilitation skills Ability to work independently or as a team with both technical and non-technical staff Willingness to learn, teach and share information with teammates, peers, management and users Able to engage in multiple initiatives simultaneously Results driven  Qualifications: 1 - 5 years practical experience in application solution design and analysis and a degree in Computer Science, MIS or Computer Engineering or related equivalent Experience in functional solution design and delivery across the ERP software development lifecycle Proven capability and experience managing requirements gathering initiatives across multiple teams and business areas Experience working with SAP SD, Mainframe systems, Java or .NET applications considered an asset  Nutrien is committed to creating an inclusive workplace. We encourage applications from all well qualified candidates who reflect the diversity of the regions where we operate. This includes recognizing the voluntary identification of status such as gender, sexual orientation, visible minority, Indigenous status, persons with disabilities, and veterans, where applicable. If this sounds like a good match, apply now. This job will remain posted until filled. You may be required to undergo a background check and substance test in accordance with Nutrien policies. While we appreciate all applications we receive, we advise that only candidates under consideration will be contacted.
