Job_Description: Administrative Coordinator - (149346) Description  About Us At HDR, we specialize in engineering, architecture, environmental and construction services. While we are most well-known for adding beauty and structure to communities through high-performance buildings and smart infrastructure, we provide much more than that. We create an unshakable foundation for progress because our multidisciplinary teams also include scientists, economists, builders, analysts and artists. That’s why we believe diversity is our greatest strength. HDR is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and an affirmative action employer.  Watch our 'About Us' video  We believe that the way we work can add meaning and value to the world. That ideas inspire positive change. That coloring outside the lines can illuminate fresh perspectives. And that small details yield important realizations. Above all, we believe that collaboration is the best way forward.  Primary Responsibilities In the role of Adminstrative Coordinator, we'll count on you to: Provide a variety of administrative functions, which may include administrative support for one or more executives, phone coverage, reading and routing incoming mail, scheduling appointments and processing expense reports Compose and organize materials and reports, and maintain records for work performed Coordinate and manage meeting facilities and arrangements Handle highly sensitive and confidential information with professionalism and discretion Maintain budget or handle specific accounting responsibilities as needed Answer questions relating to company policies and procedures as needed Perform other duties as needed  Qualifications  Required Qualifications High School diploma or equivalent 3+ years experience in administrative support Knowledge of MS Office Suite, including Word and Outlook Excellent verbal and written communication skills Professional, self-motivated, well-organized and detail-oriented with the flexibility and ability to prioritize and handle multiple tasks in a fast-paced environment Ability to meet deadlines Knowledge of A/E industry desired Experience working in an office environment An attitude and commitment to being an active participant of our employee-owned culture is a must  Preferred Qualifications Associate or Bachelor's degree in Business Administration or related field preferred Why HDR At HDR, we know work isn’t only about who you work for; it’s also about what you do and how you do it. Led by the strength of our values and a culture shaped by employee ownership, we network with each other, build on each other’s contributions, and collaborate together to make great things possible. When you join HDR, we give you license to do the same. We help you take charge of your career, giving you multiple growth opportunities along the way.  Primary Location: Canada-Alberta-Calgary Industry: Administrative Schedule: Full-time Employee Status: Regular BusinessClass: Marketing and Admin Job Posting: Apr 23, 2018
Title: Administrative Coordinator

Job_Description: TRS Staffing is looking for a cutting-edge BUSINESS ANALYST for a Canada wide communication company. You are cutting edge which means you are very creative and love to be viewed as someone who is an outside of the box thinker and you are someone that cannot wait to get out of bed in the morning and start making things happen. Your dynamic “can do” personality will be valued equally with your technical BA skills. This is a permanent full-time position based in Calgary.  Key Details:  Our client is looking for individuals to help them go boldly where few others have gone before. Our client is undergoing a systemic evaluation of their processes and looking for new technologies to provide concrete benefits to their clients - including fully automated services. You will be at the forefront of forging these new processes and technologies - Exciting! Superlative communication skills are required as you will be networking vertically and horizontally, enterprise wide. You will have skills at building networks and managing them. You will also have strong persuasive and instructional capabilities and your written communication matches the level of your oral skills Excited about working in a very fast paced transformative environment and you take pride in seeing your end results come to fruition. Once again, this is fast paced!!! You realize that all bottlenecks are temporary hazards and you develop creative means to overcome them You have strong knowledge of Business Process and Change Management and have experience taking organizations through major transformations Experience with Service Management (ITSM) and ITIL Experience with and involvement in the implementation of IT Service Management application software - ideally ServiceNow but not necessarily Experience in the evaluation of technology and its effectiveness to both business and end users You are very strong in data analysis and workflow analysis and modelling You determine business requirements through research, facilitation and analysis  Requirements:  University Degree in Computer Science, Business Administration, Commerce or other Minimum of 5 years of experience in business analysis and stakeholder management Strong abilities with MS Office including Visio; MS Project Knowledge of Software Development Lifecycle  PLEASE NOTE: Only those eligible to work in Canada will be considered for this position and only those selected for interviews will be contracted. TRS is an equal opportunity company.  To apply for this position, please send your Word formatted resume to patrick.mclean@trsstaffing.com  TRS Staffing Solutions (Canada) Inc. specializes in supplying engineers, designers, project managers, and other technical and professional services personnel to a broad spectrum of industries worldwide.
Title: Business Analyst - IT

Job_Description: Interested in being a part of a team that is leading the evolution of retail in Canada?  Embracing and driving change is critical to our success. The complexity and rate at which the retail industry is transforming has increased exponentially in recent years and we are committed to being a leader in the industry. As such we are relentlessly focused on innovating at every level of our business, investing in new technologies and products, and doubling down on the best talent to drive the company forward. It is an especially exciting time to join the Canadian Tire Family of Companies.  Our Technology team plays a critical role in our evolution, specifically as we transition to an omni-retailer where digital complements the physical. Our commitment to being a world-class digital organization is evident in how we are using cutting-edge technologies to bring our digital strategy to life in-store, online and on your mobile devices, ultimately improving customer experiences, driving traffic, and boosting loyalty.  The Enterprise Data team is responsible to serve Canadian Tire’s data management and analytics services to meet business service levels. We work in a fast paced Agile environment, that provides opportunities to learn every day. This includes:  Day to day identification and triaging of issues that are identified from customers, enterprise support desk or business partners  24/7 support for the reporting environment  Monitoring of the applications and their infrastructure  Updating and implementation of tools and techniques to improve monitoring and system health  Develop, document and update procedures to improve support processes  Work with IT and Business Partners to ensure the reporting systems are performing as optimally as possible  What you’ll do: As a member of the Enterprise Data team the DevOps Support Analyst plays a BI DevOps role that provides production support, enhancements and maintenance of CTC reporting and analytical applications.  As the DevOps Support Analyst, you will be responsible for the following:  Initial triage and documentation of production issues as they are identified  Creating and managing tickets for each issue to resolution  Working with developers and other IT partners to find root cause of issues  Communicating with team management regarding issue status and progress  Documenting issue resolutions and ensure relevant teams are informed  Suggesting and documenting improvements to support processes and procedures  Working with development teams focus on the best practices and scalability  Who you are: We are looking for high performing individuals who are: Agile and innovative individuals, who are able to manage in an environment of change and ambiguity to help us take bold and strategic moves in this rapidly evolving retail environment  Creative thinkers who take initiative and are capable of building, launching and managing projects/programs that drive results for our customers  Problem solvers with the ability to analyze and prioritize to meet business objectives  Collaborative team players with superior influencing skills, who build relationships easily across various stakeholder groups to move initiatives forward  If you’re curious, ready to take on new challenges and open to doing things differently to help us evolve rapidly, then Canadian Tire is definitely the place to be.  What you’ve done: Post-secondary education in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or related discipline (or equivalent experience)  Experience with BI tools like MicroStrategy, Cognos and Crystal Reports etc  Knowledge on Hadoop and related programs and it's key architecture technologies: Nifi, Kafka, Hive, Sqoop, Pig, Flume, MapReduce and NoSQL  Expert knowledge and experience with Data Warehousing, ETL or Hadoop  Provide application support for Production systems  SQL programing skills (Intermediate or higher)  Data Analysis and Modeling  Excellent verbal and communication skills  Proficiency in written English and good documentation skills  Willingness to provide off-hours support on a rotation basis  Why us: Canadian Tire is one of Canada’s most iconic and diversified companies. Our culture and values uphold our pledge to sustainable practices, and commitment to our local communities through Jumpstart cannot be beat.  To learn more about this team and the Canadian Tire Family of Companies follow us on LinkedIn.  AODA/D&I; statement  Canadian Tire is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace for all. We recognize that our future success depends on the perspectives and contributions of all our employees -- their diverse backgrounds, abilities and experiences make our business stronger. If you are contacted for a job opportunity, please advise us of any accommodations needed to ensure fair and equitable access throughout the recruitment and selection process. All accommodation information provided will be treated as confidential and used only for the purpose of providing an accessible candidate experience.  FGL Corporate  Alberta-Calgary  Permanent  Full-time  Job Posting  :  May 17, 2018, 10:41:43 AM

Job_Description: Why work for Lafarge? Lafarge in Canada is proud to provide construction solutions in the buildings, infrastructure and industrial segments. These solutions are built with high performance products from our cement, aggregates, ready-mix concrete, asphalt and road construction, and concrete products divisions. From the use of alternative materials and recycling to renewable energy, Lafarge's focus is to develop innovative products that can contribute toward sustainably constructed building solutions. Lafarge takes personal growth and development to heart, and provides resources for our employees to take control of their own careers. Through our commitment to communities, to the health and safety of our employees and their families, or through the many volunteer hours of our employees, Lafarge demonstrates our care for people. If you want to work in an environment that values hard work, entrepreneurship, and collaborative teamwork, Lafarge is for you. Building Better Cities is what we do. Come Build a Better Career with us! More information can be found at www.lafarge-na.com/careers .   Overview Exciting opportunity to learn from and contribute to a world class IT Service Centre (ITSC). The ITSM Ops Analyst (Internship) works with the ITSC teams to provide operational execution on projects and steady-state ongoing activities.  This will be an 8 month contract. Looking to have somebody start in January and will work to August, possible December depending on needs and availability.  Responsibilities This role will provide Tier 2-3 support services and act as an escalation point for the Service Desk and other IT Teams while ensuring that service levels are achieved. This role will be responsible for contributing to IT and Business projects as related to services such as Collaboration, Network, Endpoints, and software. The ITSM Ops Analyst (Internship) is will have the opportunity to learn LafargeHolcim business processes as well as industry standard IT processes and how they work together to ensure success superior execution excellence. The role will require interactions with business end users, relationship managers and project managers. This role works on assignments that are complex in nature and require judgment, initiative, and communication to resolve problems and/or develop recommended solutions. Work is completed with minimal supervision and assignments may be completed without established procedures. The ITSM Ops Analyst (Internship) role will be responsible for formal documentation around processes and procedures. Qualifications Level of education/qualifications normally required: Degree or diploma in Computer Science, Engineering or related discipline with an IT focus - can be in school still Valid Driver’s License and functioning car Ability to lift up to 30 lbs  Specific work experience: Technical knowledge of IT Understanding of IT services, technology and solutions Experience Microsoft and Google products an asset Experience in a related industry setting (manufacturing) an asset Experience in a customer service environment as asset Experience with ITSM/ITIL applications (ServiceNow)  Technical / functional skills: Keen interest in existing and emerging hardware and software technologies and IT architectures Competency in delivering efficient and effective solutions to diverse and complex business problems Ability to translate technical knowledge into a more easily consumable format (laymen terms) Strong communication skills Technical documentation skills Analytical and troubleshooting skills  Behavioral competencies: Ability to work decisively in a fast paced environment Ability to meet deadlines and service level agreements Ability to quickly adapt to and from single person to team working environments Highly self-motivated and directed Keen attention to detail Diverse capability for problem solving, decision making and sound judgment Strong organizational and communications skills Highly professional demeanor with the ability to speak confidently, courteously and credibly to all levels of management. Work effectively in the face of ambiguity, shifting priorities and rapid change while actively developing one’s skills and capabilities Foster a business focused environment delivering exceptional customer service and anticipating future customer needs  Linguistic skills: Excellent English (written & spoken) - other languages specific to region are a plus  Mobility requirements (time spent travelling internationally, nationally etc.): Regional travel required: 20% LafargeHolcim Why work for us?  Working for Lafarge offers a wide variety of career opportunities that utilize your abilities and skills to contribute to a better world. In addition to local and global developmental opportunities, we provide employees with competitive compensation, a comprehensive benefits plan, a health & wellness program with financial incentives, an extensive global e-learning platform and much more! More information can be found at www.lafarge-na.com/careers  www.lafarge-na.com www.lafargeholcim.com We thank you for your interest. Only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted. LafargeHolcim is committed to the principles of employment equity and encourages the applications from women, visible minorities, and persons with disabilities.
Title: Internship - ITSM Operations Analyst

Job_Description: ROLE STATEMENT:  The Analyst, Quality Management will be a member of the Quality Management Department responsible for maintaining and improving corporate KPI reporting on operational and quality indicators and monitoring the overall integrity of the Quality Management System in regards capturing, managing and analyzing data for KPI reporting as well as document control. Reporting to the Senior Specialist, Quality Management, the Analyst, Quality Management will focus on working with both corporate and divisional groups in Canada, the USA and Latin America to capture operational and quality data, generate and distribute reports and models, maintain document and record integrity and assist with improving existing tools and systems.  SPECIFIC ACCOUNTABILITIES: Capture and publish business procedures and supporting forms for field and corporate operations and functions Manage capture, analysis and presentation of operational and quality data and generate and publish KPI reports Assist with management of change processes to ensure operational changes are effectively captured, analyzed, processed and recorded Maintain and improve the integrity of the corporate document and record control system Assist with maintaining and improving the functionality and integrity of the corporate Quality Management reporting system Work with IT and other departments to develop or improve solutions for data capture, analysis and recording Assist operational staff in service quality modeling and reporting HSE ACCOUNTABILITY:  Individual roles, responsibilities and accountabilities specific to Health, Safety and Environment at Calfrac Well Services can be located in the HSE Responsibilities and Performance Procedure (C-PR 14.0-0005). Employees are accountable to review and adhere to this procedure. The procedure is located on the Corporate HSE SharePoint library. KEY ATTRIBUTES AND COMPETENCIES:  Well-developed analytical and problem solving skills Background in data analysis and presentation Strong attention to detail Strong organization and multi-tasking skills Ability to work within set deadlines and produce deliverables Ability to set goals and pursue and achieve those goals independently EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE:  Familiarity with data capture, analysis and presentation Experience with creating and implementing statistical regressions Understanding of KPI’s, benchmarking and balanced scorecard reporting techniques Excellent computer skills including database applications Post-secondary degree in business management, science or engineering This position description represents an overview of the position and is not designed to cover all duties or requirements of the role.
Title: Analyst, Quality Management

Job_Description: The Information Systems(IS) Energy Conponents Developer Analyst is responsible for the analysis, design and building of systems through the development of application logic, user interfaces, data interfaces, data conversion scripts and reports. An IS Developer Analyst works under the guidance and direction of IS Business Systems Analyst to support the portfolio of applications for Field Data Reporting, Property Accounting and Marketing.  COMPETITIVE SALARY - STOCK OPTIONS - STOCK SAVINGS PLAN - ANNUAL BONUSES – BENEFITS!  HOW WILL YOU MAKE YOUR MARK? Participate in supporting and enhancing the portfolio of applications for Field Data ReportingAnalyzing, designing and developing applicationsDeveloping and maintaining functional/technical specifications and documentationTroubleshooting problems that occur in the everyday use of applicationsFixing program bugs and/or data errors identified during troubleshootingManage multiple tasks at the same time with high levels of effectivenessDemonstrate the ability to handle complex work  QUALIFICATIONS: 5 – 10 years of experience as a Developer Analyst working with Field Data Capture applications preferably using Energy Components and PM Suite.Technical experience supporting EC Architecture including Configurations, Integration Services and Jasper Reporting. Experience with PI and Honeywell historians.Highly developed analytical skillsExcellent interpersonal, team and communication skillsStrong multi-tasking and prioritizing abilitiesA post-secondary degree in Computer Science or a related field of studyDemonstrated proficiency in N-tier application analysis, design and development using Java Enterprise, JBoss/Wildfly, Eclipse, TFS, Microsoft VB.NET/ASP.Net, Web Services/APIsExperience supporting 3rd party applications on Windows, Linux and UnixExperience with Oracle SQL and Oracle PL/SQL, MSRS, MS Orchestrator To see related Information Technology roles at CNRL, visit: www.cnrl-careers.com/jobs/Information-Technology
Title: Energy Components Developer Analyst

Job_Description: InSync Systems is a recruitment agency that works with small to large corporate clients to connect them with the best people in the Industry.  Our client is looking for a Quality Assurance Analyst for a 5-month contract for a systems upgrade project. The new system has been designed on Microsoft technologies and they are currently refactoring numerous integration points for previously built in-house applications. The successful candidate will have a minimum of 5 years of experience as a Quality Assurance Analyst and be comfortable being the sole QA Analyst on the team.  Responsibilities: Participate in all phases of software development life cycle, including analysis, design, implementation, testing and planning.  Architect, design, write and execute test cases and test plans to support the quality assurance activities throughout the software development life cycle.  Coordinate setup of test environments and test data management.  Manage defect tracking and defect maintenance  Lead QA reviews with business and IT stakeholders to assess priority and severity of defects  Assist the business with planning, coordination, execution and defect resolution during the User Acceptance phases of the software development life cycle  Skills Required: Minimum 5 years of experience as an IT Software Quality Assurance Analyst.  Proven experience with end-to-end functional testing of web applications and integration.  Demonstrated experience with all forms of Software Quality Assurance testing including System, Integration, Regression, Performance and User Acceptance Testing.  Experience with Defect Management tools such as TFS, Jira or Bugzilla.  Experience with automation such as SOAPUI and Watir  Experience with cross-browser compatibility testing of web applications.  Experience with UI/UX/Usability testing.  Understanding of unit testing and test-driven development practices within an Agile development team.  Nice to Have: Experience with cross-device compatibility testing of web applications within mobile/tablet devices (nice to have).  Location: Calgary, Alberta  Contract Period: Start as soon as possible – end November 30, 2018
Title: Quality Assurance Analyst

Job_Description: Becoming an H&R Block associate means more than just a paycheque; it’s an opportunity to grow with the strongest brand in the Tax Preparation industry. We are looking for people who want to help us look at peoples’ lives through tax and find ways to help. We know that the ability to deliver outstanding client service starts with having the best talent on our team, and if you want to be part of our success story then we want to hear from you!  We have proudly served clients in Canada for over 50 years, constantly evolving to meet our clients’ ever-changing needs. From our digital solutions to our offices, we constantly seek new ways to create frictionless and memorable client experiences.  The Opportunity:  Reporting to the Manager, Quality Assurance, the QA Analyst will be responsible in participating in the following quality assurance activities.  Key Areas of Responsibility:  Create Quality Assurance processes to improve overall excellence  Perform testing strategies and risk analysis  Provide estimates on level of effort required for testing  Create test plans and test cases to validate the quality, accuracy, and usability  Perform functional, integration, system and regression testing  Define areas where automation could add value and implement automation test frameworks  Create documentation to ensure maintainability and portability of test code  Identify, verify and analyze defects and recommend solutions  Drive test architecture, best practices, framework, tools, and reporting  Generate defect reports and testing summaries  Work with H&R Block project management to resolve issues  Escalate process, performance issues as needed  Work and communicate effectively with developers and business users to improve application usability and promote application simplification through QA methodologies  Assist in product deployments and upgrades  Provide second tier support for urgent production issues  Contribute organizational and technical excellence to the QA organization  Liaise with development, project management, analysis, operations, and customer support teams  Key Qualifications:  Proven working experience in software quality assurance  5+ years of experience in a quality assurance role  Demonstrated success in transitioning an organization from manual to automated testing  Experience with functional, system integration, regression, user acceptance and production deployment testing  Strong technical skills in the areas of software testing and test automation  Strong understanding of QA principles and testing methodologies  SCRUM/Agile experience  Strong technical skills in the areas of software testing and test automation  Knowledge of business workflow modeling techniques, use cases, and software development lifecycle best practices for the product development lifecycle  Strong understanding of QA principles and testing methodologies  SCRUM/Agile experience  Quality Assurance certification, an asset  Ability to communicate effectively in French would be an asset  If you meet the skills and qualifications required for this great opportunity, and are truly passionate about leading and crafting QA initiatives, we invite you to send a cover letter and resume to employment.opportunities@hrblock.ca.  Successful candidates must have legal authorization to work in Canada on a full-time basis for any employer. Only those candidates selected for interview will be contacted. H&R Block Canada welcomes and encourages applications from people from all backgrounds, including people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the recruitment and selection process. Back to careers page
Title: Quality Assurance Analyst

Job_Description: As the leading integrated energy services company, Shawcor is responsible for protecting the integrity of operational assets across the world. Succeeding in our current markets and pursuing our growth vision is made possible by our people. In addition to intelligence, dedication and professionalism, we look for individuals who embody our values. These include integrity, execution and technology, with a foundation of accountability, respect and doing the right thing. Integrity is the foundation on which we were built. And it’s not just in how we operate—it’s behind every product we engineer. Its part of every new project we take on. And it’s the promise that we give our customers. At Shawcor, we have built a true team environment where all employees are empowered to contribute to the success of the company. We want you to join our team! The Desktop Support Analyst is often the first point of contact for the resolution of IT issues at Shawcor; they are tasked with ensuring a high level of communication and customer support is provided in support of IT’s goal to deliver a value adding end-user experience.  The Desktop Support Analyst should be experienced in installation, configuration, troubleshooting, diagnosing and resolving end-user computing problems. They must have strong customer service skills, communications skills, experience working with a IT ticket management system, and have a basic understanding of network topology and Active Directory Users and Computers to deliver expected levels of service. This is a full-time permanent position in our manufacturing plant located at 1820 100th Avenue NE. In this role, you will be expected to: Work closely with business units to provide technical support to all user endpoint devices, provide technical advice to end-users and maintain a high level of customer service satisfaction. Support Regional IT operations by, take technical supports phone calls, creating and dispatching IT tickets, escalating IT tickets, and monitoring regional IT ticket queues. Provide support with installing basic hardware/software and computer peripherals for users. Diagnose and troubleshoot basic hardware/software problems. Perform PC Software malware remediation and cleanup. Conduct desktop imaging as need. Participate in and contribute to regular weekly, monthly and quarterly IT operational reviews to monitor IT’s ability to maintain committed service level agreement, review ticket queues and resolutions. Uphold standards, follow training procedures and manuals, and ensure end-user’s support needs are addressed proactively. Demonstrate flexibility regarding occasional on-call technical support after hours and on weekends.  The qualifications that may make you a fit for this role are: Degree or diploma in Information Systems, Information Technology or Computer Science 3-5 years working experience with the following: Active Directory – Account password reset, creation and disabling MS Windows 7, 8, 10 & O365 office suite Printer & copier installation Mobile device management IT Ticketing system VoIP phones Anti-Virus software Sound knowledge and interest in IT management fundamentals, principals and concepts. Must have excellent customer service skills and strong verbal/written communication skills with the ability to interact effectively with novice and experienced computer users. Must effectively manage time while working on customer incidents and/or service requests. Experience providing hands-on and remote customer service and support for client. Basic understanding of TCP/IP networking concepts and PC computing training for the end-users.   We thank all applicants for their interest; however we cannot accept telephone calls regarding this position. All recruiting activities are managed via our applicant tracking system. Please apply online to be considered for this opportunity.  Shawcor welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the recruitment and selection process. To begin a conversation about your individual accessibility needs throughout our recruitment process, please contact our HR team at accessibility@shawcor.com.
Title: Desktop Support Analyst

Job_Description: Dynasty Power is looking for a highly motivated, self-sufficient and enthusiastic individual who has strong desire to grow within the company to fill a new Transmission Analyst role. This analyst will provide electrical transmission system congestion analysis for short and longer term power and FTR trading activity. The role requires aggregating data across a number of databases to produce easy to use reports. The successful candidate will possess an extensive knowledge of power flow simulation software and forecasting tools such as UPLAN, PROMOD, PowerWorld, or similar. Hide Details Responsibilities Run Daily/Term PowerFlow Simulations Models using Powerworld/Matpower Design & develop custom analysis and modeling software for power trading Develop a comprehensive database of various fundamental & statistical risk factors of Power/Gas Markets Develop a stack and dispatch model for generation Identify economic and non-economic factors driving generation behavior Understand cross-commodity fuel linkages, coal/gas switching, gas pipeline flows Develop custom reports and indices summarizing the Energy markets and other market participant FTR portfolios Qualifications Undergraduate degree in Electrical Engineering or related quantitative field, Master’s or PhD degrees preferred High Level of Proficiency in Matlab/Eviews/ programming and Excel analysis. SQL and VBA skills are also required Advanced experience running Powerflow Software: Promod/Dayzer/Powerworld/Matpower Analytical skills required for trade analysis and pricing work Team Player: actively share information, constructively build new strategies, work to make the team better and smarter Required Skills Prior power trade floor experience is required Confident, articulate individual Independently prioritize task and respond quickly to changes in priorities Explain complex concepts in a cohesive and clear manner Good understanding of business processes and data management
Title: Transmission Analyst

Job_Description: The Contracts Analyst is responsible for providing executing assigned contracting activities for the Contracts Post Award – Projects team. The primary accountability is to ensure that Nexen’s commercial activities are being properly monitored, measured and enforced.  This role will be part of the Global Supply Chain Management organization supporting the Company’s small capital project initiatives. The majority of these projects have a strong focus on E&C and D&C. Job Duties & Responsibilities Actively participate in assigned project(s) by providing commercial support, coordinating preparation activities, and executing assigned contracting requirements. Assist in the development of contracting & procurement strategies. Manage contract post-award activities including but not limited to preparing and executing contract documents (work releases, change orders, etc), maintaining supplier relations, coordinating proponent collaboration, maintaining price lists, instituting Supply Relationship Management (SRM) implementation where applicable, resolving contract reconciliations based on commercial terms / audit findings, and completing contract close-outs. Manage assigned contracts to capture value creation for the Company (cost reduction, cost avoidance and efficiency improvement initiatives). Report value creation results as requested. Manage and maintain assigned contracts in the Contract Management System (Ivalua). Ensure that assigned service requests, contracts, and associated SAP documents are completed prior to project start-up, and are appropriately managed throughout the life of the project and then properly closed out. Assist in reporting & analysis for the team and/or project(s). Interface with other Supply Chain groups, negotiate and assign against category agreements, and leverage expenditures across the Company where possible. Liaise with Legal and other assisting departments (Tax, HSE, Finance, CCAR, etc) involved in the supply chain process for the project(s). Participate in internal and external training and development opportunities. Remain compliant with the Company’s policies and procedures at all times. Education & Experience University degree in Commerce, Business Administration, and/or advanced Certificate in Purchasing or Supply Chain Working towards or in possession of a professional designation is preferred (SCMP, IACCM, or equivalent). 10+ years’ experience in Contracts Management Significant Oil & Gas experience required; knowledge of a variety of contracted services, and compensation models, with solid technical knowledge of services contracted, including a working knowledge of the legal aspects of contracts (contract and tort). A background in sourcing Drilling & Completions and/or Engineering & Construction services in a SAGD / Oil Sands environment is required; and a variety of experience is considered a benefit. Both project and operations experience is strongly preferred with full development project lifecycle knowledge Knowledge and familiarity with local, regional, national and international suppliers, and contractors, Working knowledge of the legal aspects of procurement / contracting, Canadian commercial law as it applies to contract and procurement management; Experience in the formation of significant commercial negotiations, purchase agreements. Ability to lead / facilitate team work in developing, implementing and managing contracts Demonstrated ability to generate solutions to complex contract issues Poise and credibility, position interfaces frequently with internal business partners and contractors Good working knowledge of local, provincial, national and global contractor community. Strong oral and written communication and presentation; Formal or informal leadership skills such as coaching / mentoring and leading projects/teams Competency in Microsoft Office; Live Link Document Storage, SAP, Ivalua contract management system an asset
Title: CW - Contracts Analyst

Job_Description: Requisition Id: 15293 Department: Business Development & Customer Service Summary of Responsibilities Working within a team environment and reporting to the Manager, Customer Service, the Analyst, Logistics will be responsible for managing product movements on Pembina’s Oil Sands and Heavy Oil pipeline systems. The successful candidate will be responsible for managing product movements on a variety of Pembina’s pipeline systems that may include, Heavy Oil, Synthetic Crude, Conventional Crude, Condensate and Ethane.  Responsibilities will include, but are not limited to: Overseeing the pipeline nomination process while reviewing for accuracy, reasonability, and pipeline capacity; Monitoring shipper receipts and deliveries versus nominations; Communicating, developing and sustaining strong relationships with refiners, shippers, and other pipelines to ensure proper allocation of deliveries; Balancing and reviewing shipper positions and product transfers based on actual receipts; Preparing and reviewing monthly tariff and equalization invoices; Monitoring petroleum qualities at receipt and delivery points as well as pipeline integrity points; Volumetric forecasting & producer feedback; Providing volumetric analysis reports to management including variance analysis and its impact on revenue; Observing and reporting trends and pipeline developments on Pembina’s systems; Monthly reporting on an internal and external basis; Analytical project support as required; and Ability to be on call on a regular basis. Qualifications 5+ years of Pipelines Logistics experience is required; Experience with Heavy Oil, Synthetic Crude, Conventional Crude, Condensate and Ethane; Bachelor’s Degree is an asset, but related experience will be considered; High degree of proficiency and confidence with software applications specifically MS Excel, Word, Outlook, PowerPoint, Power BI, as well as Polaris and Petrotranz; Highly efficient analytical skills with a strong attention to detail; Strong problem solving skills, proactive in identifying potential issues and providing solutions Strong time management and prioritization skills; An energetic team player with the ability to work productively within a team environment while independently driving personal results; and proven ability to multitask while balancing deadline driven workloads; Communication: strong verbal communication skills with the ability to conduct clear concise conversations that result in shared understanding; Ability to be on call on a regular basis is required. No agency calls please. Pembina is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We are pleased to consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, protected veterans status or any other legally-protected factors. Accommodation for applicants with disabilities is available on request during the recruitment process. Pembina Pipeline Corporation has been serving the transportation and midstream service needs of North America's energy industry for over 60 years. We process, terminal and transport our customers' products safely - all while protecting the environment and delivering on our commitments to our shareholders and community stakeholders. When we build something, we do it right. Powering Pembina's growth are our smart, creative and energetic people who allow us to remain a disciplined and responsible energy transportation and service provider and a trusted member in our communities. Our expectations are high, and so are our rewards. We treat our people well – whether it’s through our total compensation package, our community engagement and volunteer opportunities, or our numerous fun social activities. Pembina is a proud recipient of the 2018 Canada’s Top 100 Employers and Alberta's Top 70 Employers (2014-2017). We are also a strong supporter of Skills Canada. >
Title: Logistics Analyst

Job_Description: Description: The position of Leasing Analyst is a newly created role and is tasked with conducting a variety of market analysis to assist the Residential Operations team in making strategic decisions that will enhance Northview’s core rental business.  Responsibilities:  Collect, analyze and interpret data and statistics using quantitative and qualitative methodology to write comprehensive reports Conduct rental analysis of market rents and recommend adjustments as needed Prepare monthly leasing status reports, following up with Resident Relations and Leasing Manager Collect and analyze resident survey data Review survey results and present data to Residential Operations Team Review Leasing calls and showing conversions Assist in budget and sales forecasting Develop and deliver effective presentations to inform of emerging or existing statistics and trends Reports to Resident Relations and Leasing Manager Other duties as assigned  Qualifications:  An understanding of Property Management functions Analytical skills Bachelor degree in finance, accounting or business Strong computer skills with proficiency in excel, word and PowerPoint Strong written and verbal communication skills Highly professional and team player Ability to multi-task and work under pressure Attention to detail
Title: Leasing Analyst

Job_Description: We are an experience design agency with a relentless focus on the customer. The way a customer experiences a brand has a profound impact on perception, purchase behavior and loyalty. That’s why our work begins and ends with our clients’ customers. We listen to them. Validate with them. We even include them in our experience design process. We do this to create experiences that are simpler, more useful, entertaining, and convenient. Our mission is to in some way change their lives for the better. Today we’re 950 people in 11 offices on 4 continents. We are thinkers. Makers. Do’ers. We speak a dozen different languages and are inspired by a million different things. But no matter what our discipline is or where we are in the world, we’re united by a common excitement for digital that’s absolute and contagious. SEO Analyst The SEO Analyst will be responsible for implementing SEO initiatives for client partners. They ensure that content can be found and viewed by potential and current customers. SEO Analysts play an important role in planning for marketing campaigns and provide insight into search engine optimization and user experience with digital content. Responsibilities: Provide SEO analysis and recommendations in regards to digital presence and visibility Perform on-page optimization of keyword research, title and description tags, density and frequency Focus on data to improve site layout, functionality and conversions tied to business objectives Define key metrics and translate SEO results to business objects Research and administer social media tools in support of strategy Monitor and evaluate search results and performance across major search channels Communicate with SEO team and Management on project developments, timelines and results Requirements: 2-3+ Years of SEO experience with a strong technical focus Site audit experience Basic understanding of the dependencies and interconnectivity of media channels, and their effects on traffic demand and rankings Experience using Omniture, Google Analytics, and Coremetrics Strong analytical skills Systematic approach to identifying opportunities/issues, defining solutions and executing action plans Great attention to detail combined with the ability to prioritize and meet aggressive targets and deadlines Ability to work on multiple projects and clients
Title: SEO Analyst

Job_Description: Inter Pipeline is a major petroleum transportation, storage and natural gas liquids processing business that ranks among the largest energy infrastructure companies in Canada. We are proud to be named one of Alberta’s Top 70 Employers, which recognizes Alberta businesses that lead their industries by being exceptional places to work.  Located out of our Calgary office, the Oil Movements Analyst role reports to the Supervisor of Volumetric Accounting and is a key member of Inter Pipeline’s Oil Movements department.  The Oil Movements Analyst is responsible for the volumetric accounting, analysis and reporting requirements for Inter Pipeline’s conventional and oil sands pipeline systems. In addition, this position provides ongoing management of Shipper Balances, producer statements and equalization statements.  Key Activities and Responsibilities: Validate data to ensure accuracy and completeness of crude oil account information, while interacting frequently with pipeline schedulers Calculate volumetric information from gauge reports, truck tickets, pipeline tickets, and other measurement reports that are gathered from the operators, business units and delivery systems Enter ticket information for the Oil Sands pipelines, ensuring accuracy and completeness for month end reporting Enter production splits, prepare equalization statements for customers on a monthly basis Collaborate with administrators in field offices to ensure tickets, volume adjustments and other deadlines are completed Compile and send Operator Production Summary reports, along with Petrinex reporting on a monthly basis Monitor pipeline quality information as it comes in to ensure it meets the pipeline specifications and ensure testing methods meet the industry standards Liaise with the Measurement department to ensure the accuracy of quality information used for Equalization Liaise with the accounting department to ensure automatic, manual and miscellaneous invoicing is accurate Liaise with the Business Development department ensuring required tariff changes and new implementations are completed accurately Liaise with the Midstream Marketing department to ensure all reporting requirements are accurate on a monthly basis Ensure customer queries are handled professionally and timely  Education, Skills and Experience: Two to four years of related industry experience with University degree or diploma, Business related preferred Attention to detail is critical, demonstrates strong analytical and problem-solving skills Advanced level for MS Office, in particular strong excel skills will be an asset Demonstrates ability to interpret and communicate business analytics Proven experience working in a fast paced, deadline driven environment Well-developed interpersonal, team, customer service and communication skills, both written and verbal Have an understanding of the Industry practices such as COLC calendar and the Equalization procedure guidelines Experience working with Petrinex for government reporting.
Title: Oil Movements Analyst

Job_Description: The Logistics Analyst supports the organization by developing and maintaining the active, daily supply and demand book and forecast models. This position will play a key role in ensuring the operations team makes informed decisions by constantly monitoring activity and preparing reports with recommendations for action.  Essential Duties and Responsibilities  Generate daily reports on key operational metrics such as terminal, wellsite activity and inventory analysis; Identify opportunities to enhance profitability through asset optimization Maintain appropriate communications within area of responsibility; Identify operational inefficiencies and recommends solutions; Identify new business opportunities by performing detailed desktop analysis; Create and presenting Key Performance Indicator (KPI) reports for the operations team to deliver to clients on a regular basis; Support the operations team with periodic generation of purchase orders and sales orders; Understand rail and trucking logistics from our mines in Wisconsin and remote well sites in Western Canada Other applicable duties as assigned or required. Attractions:  Ideal role for career development as the successful candidate will be at the centre of business operations in a fast-paced industry Participation in a growth-oriented company on both a domestic and international level; Opportunity to work in a collaborative team environment where ongoing professional development is valued and expected. Qualifications and Requirements:  The successful candidate will have the following experience and education:  5+ years of proven experience in a research and/or quantitative analysis role (oil and gas or industrial mineral industry experience preferred but not necessary); Post-secondary degree in engineering, math, economics, or commerce / business administration; Enrolment in the CFA program, or similar program, considered an asset. In addition, the successful candidate will also have the following competencies and attributes:  A high performer who is strongly motivated to meet deadlines; Preference will be given to candidates with previous work experience in oil and gas, bulk commodities logistics and / or related services; Excellent interpersonal skills including strong communication both orally and written with the ability to build relationships; Excellent analytical skills with a focus on ability to generate information from spreadsheets; a strong affinity for attention to detail is a must; Must excel in a team oriented environment; Ability to take raw data and refine that into useful and accurate information by which business decisions can be made Strong proficiency with Microsoft Office suite with a focus on Excel; Ability to manage time effectively, set priorities and meet deadlines with strong organization skills; Ability to learn, adapt to change and be flexible in a dynamic, rapidly changing environment. Disclaimer
Title: Logistics Analyst

Job_Description: Superior Gas Liquids is a leading mid-stream marketing company providing innovative and dependable energy solutions to gas & oil producers and whole sale propane end-users. Superior Gas Liquids’ growing operations have been built with its dynamic team of energy experts that strive to exceed both up and down stream customers' expectations. Reporting to the Logistics Team Lead, the Transportation Analyst is responsible for the analysis and monitoring of Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) related to the transportation of propane. The Transportation Analyst also monitors budget and expenses as it relates to transportation, infrastructure, and compliance metrics related to the safe, efficient, and effective delivery of propane. Utilizing technical knowledge of Excel and Access the Transportation Analyst will be responsible for continuous improvement of various systems, processes, and documents. Key Objectives: Prepare and distribute weekly, monthly, quarterly and annual summary reports to key stakeholders at Superior Gas Liquids, Superior Propane, and third party carriers detailing the achievement of key performance indicators. The Transportation Analyst will be responsible for managing various scorecards to track the KPIs, identifying trends, variances and gaps in the data. Create weekly volume reports, compare to forecast, and identify trends. Report on supply and demand on a recurring basis to carriers, Superior Gas Liquids, and Superior Propane. Manage and update yearly tool for Superior Propane’s Master Supply Agreement. Update and maintain on a daily basis. Maintain and update various spreadsheets and tools for analysis including truck and rail freight, inventory, landed cost, demurrage and detention reports. Monthly reconciliation of accessorial costs for SPI with a weekly update on performance Support SGL’s accounting team to streamline payables. Coordinate with vendors and internally to reduce data entry process. System administrator for various systems including SecureSheet, Geometrics, and Winfuel. Update and analyze information for Superior Gas Liquids’ rail operations; backup to Rail Analyst Manage Superior Gas Liquids’ Landed Cost program Liase with service providers and consultants to obtain or collect requested information and coordinate the delivery and execution of transportation programs or services. Create adhoc profitability reports on different truck and rail rates. This includes looking for opportunities to maximize profitability based on landed cost. Work on solutions to decrease truck and rail accessorial fees. Negotiate freight rates with truck and rail carriers Back up to rail specialist and supply analyst. Create weekly market updates for the six regions at Superior Propane. Qualifications Relevant post-secondary education (Business, Logistics, Supply Chain, Finance, Information Technology, or equivalent degree) 1-3 years’ experience in a similar operations or analyst role. Expert computer and technical skills, specifically with Microsoft Office are required (proven skills in Access or Excel using pivot tables, macros, lookups, etc.). Previous exposure to VBA to automate and simplify business processes would be an asset Ability to work well under pressure in a self-directed environment and deliver to deadlines. Strong organizational and priority management skills, with the ability to adapt and respond to changing customer and business demands. Good interpersonal skills, able to communicate effectively at all levels. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with an emphasis on accuracy and attention to detail.
Title: Transportation Analyst

Job_Description: Business Analyst for Application Development Processes:  full time, 6 month duration, based in Calgary This role provides ownership and oversight of all process development, improvement, and implementation of Software Process Improvement (SPI) based on the CMM framework.A key responsibility of this group is to monitor process metrics in order to identify either problem areas or identify opportunities for process improvement.They are responsible for staffing the SEPG team and providing direction in applying the Process Change Method (PCM) for the account and in training the delivery team.They train the delivery team, begins the implementation, acts as process owner for changes and updates, and plans and leads the IBM tasks of the Software Engineering Institute (SEI) CMM-based assessment.They also engage ADE to perform an effectiveness study when funded and appropriate.Capture business requirements, analysis of requirements, mapping of requirements (As is and To be processes)Particular focus on Windows 10 application Please send your resumes to Danielle Pelletier at daniellep@tes.net.
Title: Business Analyst

Job_Description: Job Summary*PLEASE NOTE: PREFERENCE WILL BE GIVEN TO CANDIDATES WHO APPLY THROUGH CANFOR.COM/CAREERSCanfor TechnologyAt Canfor, our Information Technology professionals play an important role in the daily functioning of our operations. Consistently pushing the boundaries when it comes to innovation within the forestry and pulp and paper industries, our IT professionals support Canfor in achieving exceptional results.With a high caliber Information Technology leadership team, a clear vision, and significant growth and training opportunities, a career in IT at Canfor allows individuals to strengthen their competencies and grow within their respective roles. Working as an equal partner with our operations to achieve organizational objectives, you will be at the forefront of innovation.The OpportunityThe Business Analyst, (Payroll Support), supports the Payroll team by handling technical issues, implementing changes and assisting with maintenance of The Canfor payroll systems. Job_Description: Inter Pipeline is a major petroleum transportation, storage and natural gas liquids processing business that ranks among the largest energy infrastructure companies in Canada. We are proud to be named one of Alberta’s Top 70 Employers, which recognizes Alberta businesses that lead their industries by being exceptional places to work.  Located out of our Calgary office, the individual in the Senior Business Analyst role will report to the Supervisor, Finance Solutions Centre. The successful candidate will be responsible for the stewardship of finance master data and project support within SAP for Inter Pipeline, as well indirect leadership of the Business Analyst.  Key Activities and Responsibilities: Review and ongoing improvement of master data creation/change approval processes Leadership of the Business Analyst role, utilizing a team accountability approach for facilitating finance master data creation/changes Work with the business and SAP Competency Centre to develop Service Level Agreements (SLAs), key performance indicators (KPIs) and other metrics for SAP finance master data Act as a data steward bringing forward cross-functional data quality and process integration issues and working collaboratively to solve them, championing the collective management of data governance Serve as a central point of contact for finance data governance understanding and providing direction and training to data consumers and producers from the business in line with business rules Ensure the right stakeholders across the enterprise (e.g. operations, finance, supply chain, etc.) are brought into make business process improvements which mitigate data issues Bring best practices in master data management and propose opportunities for improvement Interaction with SAP Competency Center on future system enhancements, builds, testing, and roll-outs Assist with development and usage of SAP reports  Education, Skills and Experience: Undergraduate diploma or degree in business with 5+ years of progressive experience in financial system support, CPA (CA, CMA, CGA) designation is an asset Strong finance expertise on master data usage, configuration, and integrated data requirements/linkage points combined with prior oil and gas experience considered an asset In depth knowledge of SAP FI_CO and Business Warehouse, experience with S/4HANA and Fiori an asset Approaches work with a high level of curiosity and aptitude to identify and solve problems, takes initiative, is accountable, and works independently Change agent who can persuade and influence stakeholders to establish new processes, shift to automation, and provide innovative solutions Ability to manage internal and external relationships with well-developed interpersonal, team, customer service and communication skills (both written and verbal) Strong customer service skills in working with internal departments to achieve results through relationships with people and teams Able to work well in a fast-paced, growth environment, with strong attention to detail and accuracy Maintains strong initiative and possesses superior analytical skills
Title: Senior Business Analyst

Job_Description: Business Analyst for Application Development Processes: full time, 6 month duration, based in Calgary  This role provides ownership and oversight of all process development, improvement, and implementation of Software Process Improvement (SPI) based on the CMM framework. A key responsibility of this group is to monitor process metrics in order to identify either problem areas or identify opportunities for process improvement. They are responsible for staffing the SEPG team and providing direction in applying the Process Change Method (PCM) for the account and in training the delivery team. They train the delivery team, begins the implementation, acts as process owner for changes and updates, and plans and leads the IBM tasks of the Software Engineering Institute (SEI) CMM-based assessment. They also engage ADE to perform an effectiveness study when funded and appropriate. Capture business requirements, analysis of requirements, mapping of requirements (As is and To be processes) Particular focus on Windows 10 application  Please send your resumes to Danielle Pelletier at daniellep@tes.net.
Title: Business Analyst

Job_Description: CGG (www.cgg.com) is a fully integrated Geoscience company providing leading geological, geophysical, and reservoir capabilities to its broad base of customers. Through its three complementary business divisions of Equipment, Acquisition and Geology, Geophysics & Reservoir (GGR), CGG brings value across all aspects of natural resource exploration by providing detailed information about the subsurface. CGG employs over 5,500 people around the world, all with a Passion for Geoscience and working together to deliver the best solutions to its customers. Job Description Start your career with a recognized leader in the geophysical industry. At CGG you will learn to create accurate 3D images of the subsurface using seismic data. You will be trained to utilize knowledge of seismic data acquisition, wavelet processing, noise attenuation, and velocity model building. You will learn to use state-of-the-art imaging software and select parameters to ensure a high quality, timely, and cost effective product. Qualifications This role requires that you work as part of a team of Seismic Imagers, dedicated to producing high resolution images of the earths subsurface for our internal and external clients. Emphasis will be on managing day-to-day operations of large projects, providing optimal quality control, problem identification and defining ideal solutions. You may work closely with our technical support staff to develop new techniques and tools and possibly collaborate with them to roll-out developing technologies. You will work to ensure that our clients receive a timely product that exceeds their expectations for image quality.  JOB REQUIREMENTS Graduate (MSc. or PhD) degree in Physics, Engineering, Mathamatics Geophysics or other related technical degree Must be a new graduate within the last 12 months Must have strong math and excellent problem-solving skills Team player that is a quick learner, with strong communication, organizational and presentation skills Experience with a UNIX environment preferred Must have the legal right to live and work in Canada  Please note, the successful candidate will be required to relocate to Houston, Texas, USA for the first 6 months to participate in the New Hire Training program in our regional head office. Additional Information Why choose CGG? Joining a company with a culture of learning and a world-class structured career development pathway, our graduates can develop their technical, commercial and personal skills for the future via a suite of internal courses led by our own CGG University. We encourage you to take ownership of your development by identifying opportunities to further progress your own skills and experience. CGG focuses on the strengths and talents of our people and develop learning opportunities that encourage development at every step of your career. I'm interested
Title: Seismic Imaging Analyst

We have, and continue to build, a solid portfolio of assets to serve producers and to provide clean and affordable energy to our customers. We continuously strive to build dynamic teams to support our future growth. We provide opportunity, challenge and competitive compensation within a positive work environment that motivates people to build careers within our company. AltaGas’ success is driven by a skilled team of more than 1700 employees. Rapid expansion of our business has created a wide range of career opportunities for qualified individuals. If you want to work for a company that offers work/life balance, financial assistance to support continuous learning and growth, and that has a solid track record of success with an achievement-oriented organizational culture, AltaGas may be the right company for you. Reporting to the Team Lead, Corporate Applications Management Services, this position is responsible for providing application support and maintenance to ensure applications are compliant and meet business requirements. Responsibilities of the position include, but are not limited to the following: Provides application support and maintenance including daily checks, minor fixes or changes and minor application upgrades/patches (as well as documentation management) Manages applications, including installation, maintenance and decommissioning Manages and maintains the cybersecurity services and applications for Cybersecurity Operations Manages the organization’s compliance to internal/external cybersecurity and cybersecurity accreditation regulations and policies Ensures all services comply with quality assurance and control specifications Supports the service transition team (including document reviews) during release management and new service introductions Supports the Service/Help Desk in day-to-day end-user assistance and event management, including incident troubleshooting and resolution Supports the acceptance, approval and fulfilment of provisioning request Supports testing for upgrades, new release/service introduction Uses best practices and tools to measure relevant data points providing high levels of management and team visibility to enable a rich, service level driven environment Provides on-call support as required Qualifications: Minimum five (5) years’ experience working in an application support role supporting JD Edwards or other ERP systems Experience with a variety of enterprise level business applications and functions and supporting cybersecurity infrastructures Strong data analysis capabilities and advanced Excel and Microsoft Office Suite proficiency required Completion of a college diploma or university degree in business or information systems Finance designations/certifications is heavily weighted Experience with a variety of enterprise level business applications and functions Knowledge of industry standard reporting and business intelligence tools Experienced with applying fixes, patches, and upgrades from the product vendor Strong We thank all applicants for their interest in our organization, but only those candidates selected for interviews will be contacted. No agency referrals or telephone inquiries at this time, please.

Job_Description: The Customs & Trade Services group at Encana provides Canadian and US customs and trade support to the entire organization. The Customs Analyst will provide day-to-day support to the Customs & Trade Team and Encana business areas in Canada and U.S. Responsibilities: provide advice on Customs tariff classifications, customs duties, country of origins, customs valuations, import/export facilitation and trade controls including forms, permits and licenses provide administrative support on customs brokerage invoices including signature authorities and transaction tracking work with customs brokers on a variety of customs and trade matters ensure goods and commodities move in compliance with customs and other government department/agencies regulations, and internal Encana process and procedures identify process and systems enhancements perform trade compliance reviews file customs entry adjustments where required deliver on critical deadlines and have flexibility to support unanticipated work (on call service) remain current with Canadian, U.S. and other relevant trade legislation and regulations Qualifications: must be legally eligible to work in Canada Canadian Certified Customs Specialist (CCS) designation and U.S. Certified Customs Specialist designation, or other customs/trade designations with customs brokerage experience a minimum 5 years of demonstrated work experience related to customs and trade matters experience in assessing complex trade data/information with strict attention to detail, and present findings in a clear and concise manner excellent verbal and written communication skills ability to multi-task within a fast-paced environment enthusiastic and positive attitude towards work and team
