Job_Description: KPMG's Deal Advisory Group helps companies manage and profit from change. As part of our Deal Advisory Group, our Transaction Services (TS) practice helps companies grow and enhance shareholder value by providing strategic advice on merger and acquisition transactions. Our service is designed to help identify risks inherent in these types of transactions, and to find practical solutions to manage these risks. We offer start-to-finish support in the acquisition process, including input on strategy, early identification of risk areas, coordination and execution of due diligence investigations (financial and commercial) and input and advice on contract terms geared to reduce risks. We also get involved in assisting our clients and their other advisors with a host of services surrounding closing the transaction and post-deal integration.  Our clients are typically pension funds, private equity funds, large public companies, as well as private businesses. We serve both domestic clients and clients from outside Canada – often working as part of cross-border KPMG teams providing seamless service to clients. Our people are motivated self-starters with expertise in finance, valuation, tax, accounting and financial reporting. Our network is global.  Position Summary  KPMG's Transaction Services is currently looking for professionals in our Calgary, Canada office at the Associate level. Working in multi-disciplinary teams, you will apply your professional and technical skills on a wide variety of transactions and at different stages of the transaction cycle.  Role and Responsibilities  The successful candidate will be responsible for:  Identifying key issues on the deals, carrying out the relevant quantitative and qualitative data analysis, interpreting results, and reporting key findings Evaluating a business’ historical performance and sustainability of earnings/cash flows, working capital cycles, financial projections, key contractual commitments, accounting policies and management control environment Preparing extensive written documents including deal findings reports, management reports, management presentations, and industry research reports Creating deal and financial models and maintaining certain industry models Participating in business development by developing an awareness, monitor, track, analyze and report on, an ongoing basis, M&A market activities, industry developments and market trends Play a key role in the preparation of prospect proposals, business development presentations and pitch books Maintaining and enhancing research and transaction databases on a current basis Building relationships with peers across all KPMG service lines within Audit, Tax and Advisory Developing relationships with current and prospective clients by participating in KPMG engagement teams with access to senior client executives, attorneys, and private equity investors Be in contact with peers at other financial advisory firms, financial institutions, private equity groups, and industry associations on a regular basis to promote KPMG’s interest and maintain knowledge of their area of specialization Collaborating with other deal advisory functions (Valuations, Corporate Finance and Restructuring) on cross-function projects At times, business needs arise and employees are required and agree to work beyond their normal work day or work week to fulfill the accountabilities required for their job. Likewise, people need extra time to devote to personal matters, and our approach to flexibility provides for this.  Skills & Qualifications  A successful candidate will possess the following experience, skills, and behaviors:  1 to 4 years of relevant experience in financial services, investment banking, private equity, accounting and/or finance in a consulting and/or corporate environment Proven academic track record. Undergraduate University degree in Finance, Economics, Accounting, or relevant business field. Post-graduate designations such as a CA, CPA, CFA, CBV, or MBA is considered an asset M&A advisory, deal structuring, and financial due diligence experience is an asset Strong business acumen with ability to synthesize company and market related information and understand key business drivers Superior analytical, quantitative, and financial modeling skills are required Experience with research tools such as Capital IQ, Bloomberg, Mergerstat, Thompson Reuters, etc. is preferred Excellent written and verbal communication skills incorporating the ability to explain detailed financial analyses Energetic and decisive, with a high level of integrity Demonstrated ability to learn and succeed in a fast-paced environment Highly motivated, committed, and flexible to cope with changing priorities and strict deadlines Willingness and ability to travel on short-term assignments within Canada and internationally as required #LI-HH1
Title: Transaction Services - Analyst/Associate

Job_Description: Analyst, Corporate Development, Calgary, Alberta Why work at Nutrien? Great question! Safety is a core value at Nutrien. Keeping every employee safe, healthy and secure is our top priority. Nothing is more important than seeing our people go home safe at the end of every single day. While working here you will have the opportunity to grow your career while helping us feed the future. We pride ourselves in hiring from a variety of backgrounds and truly believe that it is our differences that make us stronger so we hope you will join us. In addition to exciting and challenging opportunities, Nutrien offers competitive salaries, great benefits and performance based incentives. Outside of the skills and necessary qualifications, you will be committed to sustaining our safe and positive work environment while welcoming working side by side others in a diverse culture. Culture at Nutrien is the core of everything we do and all employees are respectful of diverse opinions and views. Reporting to a Director, Corporate Development, the primary objective of the Analyst is to provide analytical support to the Corporate Development team. This will include analysis of market and company data in support of acquisition activities, and management of data in due diligence processes. The analyst will regularly be working with confidential data, and the analysis will generally be time sensitive. Key Tasks: Collect and manage market and industry data; Update and maintain financial models of companies under a watching brief; Analyze financial statements and information to perform complex and detailed financial modeling and valuation analysis of potential acquisitions/divestitures; Support all areas of transactional business development including research, opportunity evaluation, due diligence, and closing; Prepare presentations providing an overview of opportunities for executive leadership Take a proactive approach to the tasks at hand and respond quickly to the needs of the business Communicate with tact and diplomacy, presents clear and concise analytically-driven insights with the understanding of the need for confidentiality; Work effectively within a small highly accountable team; display a flexible “can do” attitude and willingness to help out where required; Manage to deadlines on multiple projects of varying complexities; and Be enthusiastic, inquisitive and have a strong desire to learn Skills: Effective oral and written communication skills; Strong organizational and time management skills; High degree of proficiency in Microsoft Office – particularly Excel and financial modelling; and Ability to interpret financial statements and financial information. Qualifications: University degree in Accounting, Finance or Economics / Agricultural Economics Enrollment in or completion of CFA designation desirable but not mandatory; Minimum two years’ experience in investment banking, corporate development, private equity or an analytical/data focused role; Experience with financial databases (Capital IQ, Bloomberg, etc) is considered an asset; Nutrien is committed to creating an inclusive workplace. We encourage applications from all well qualified candidates who reflect the diversity of the regions where we operate. This includes recognizing the voluntary identification of status such as gender, sexual orientation, visible minority, Indigenous status, persons with disabilities, and veterans, where applicable. If this sounds like a good match, apply now. This job will remain posted until filled. You may be required to undergo a background check and substance test in accordance with Nutrien policies. While we appreciate all applications we receive, we advise that only candidates under consideration will be contacted.
Title: Analyst, Corporate Development

Job_Description: Contract Analyst  Vermilion has an excellent opportunity for a Contract Analyst. Based in Calgary, this position will report to the Team Lead Contracts. This position is an integral member of the team and will have solid proficiency in analyzing land contracts to respond to queries from various departments, including Land and Accounting. The successful incumbent will prepare specific land agreements and will be well versed on the inter-relationship of land contracts and mineral leases, and updating of the land system. Key Responsibilities Verifying working interests for negotiators and partners Extensive Freehold lease management experience Processing notice of assignments and assignment and novation agreements Process change of operator notices Preparing and reviewing joint operating agreements and pooling agreements Reviewing problem files and preparing working interest clarification agreements Resolving accounting and rental disputes Verify land information in AFE Navigator Learn and apply proper file maintenance practices Update CSE Land as a result of work completed Other responsibilities as assigned   Essential Experience & Skills 10 years Land experience with 5+ years’ experience as a Land Administrator and 3-4 years Contract Analyst experience Strong working knowledge of Alberta and Saskatchewan PNG Regulations Proficient with CS Explorer, Word, Excel Effective verbal and written communication skills with acute attention to detail Results focused team player with a positive attitude and initiative to drive change. Strategic thinker with exemplary analytical and problem solving skills and capacity to identify information and resources needed to complete tasks Professional, team player with strong interpersonal skills and ability to develop and maintain partnerships Exceptional organizational and time management skills, ability to multi-task and manage priorities in a deadline driven environment   Education University Degree, preference given to Petroleum Land Management program   Attributes & Characteristics Open and honest team player Positive and engaging personality Flexible, influential and assertive when required   Vermilion Attractions Alberta based, international company Diverse asset base in Europe, Australia, US and Canada 20-year history of market outperformance Ranked among the Top 10 Best Workplaces in Canada, France and The Netherlands Challenging and inspiring environment that embraces teamwork and collaboration Strong community investment and committed to giving back to the communities where our people live and work  Vermilion is committed to ensuring we conduct our activities in a manner that will protect the health and safety of our employees, contractors and the public. Our HSE vision is to fully integrate Health, Safety and Environment into our business, where our culture is recognized as a model by industry and stakeholders, resulting in a healthy workplace free of incidents. All positions at Vermilion require a commitment to high levels of excellence in respect to HSE, reinforcing our corporate Core Values of Excellence, Trust, Respect, and Responsibility.  Posting Close Date: Open until a suitable candidate has been found
Title: Contract Analyst

Job_Description: Eagle is currently seeking an Intermediate Business Systems Analyst for a six (6) month contract opportunity, scheduled to begin in June.  Key Responsibilities  The successful candidate will be responsible for: Documenting and analyzing business system requirements in such a way that the business team members understand and approve them and other project team members can successfully use them to develop the solution;  Ensuring the solution meets the business requirements;  Developing detailed functional, system, and program specifications;  Conducting analysis to help the business system function more effectively through analytics, developing and writing business systems specifications or can plan and analyze business systems practices providing expertise to senior management;  Being involved in matters that could have strategic importance;  Supporting facilitation of user requirements/user story/backlog development sessions;  Documenting assumptions and constraints;  Producing and maintaining business process models and system data flow maps;  Collaborating and defining requirements with project teams and business users, translating business needs into documented requirements and use cases that can be used by developers to create software, by application specialists to configure software, or by infrastructure specialists to develop technical solutions;  Reviewing and validating requirements with project teams and business users, translating business needs into documented requirements and use cases to create and configure software by application specialist, or by infrastructure specialists to develop technical solutions;  Facilitating and assisting the business in prioritizing and re-prioritizing requirements;  Building and maintaining relationships with the project business stakeholders and team members;  Tracking requirements and deliverables to ensure that business requirements are being met; and,  Identifying business requirements that may change due to development or technical decisions or as a result of scope changes or technical changes from vendor.  Skills and Qualifications  The qualified candidate must have: A minimum of five (5) years’ demonstrable experience as a Business Analyst/Quality Analyst on large technology projects;  Experience with Agile development projects;  Experience with facilitation, requirements gathering, and story writing;  Experience working with remote teams;  Experience with tools for backlog-management, testing and iteration planning: Microsoft Team Foundation Server (TFS), Visual Studio, SharePoint, Excel, Kanban Boards, SQL Server;  The ability to understand and describe business problems, business processes, constraints, and advantages and disadvantages of solution options;  Experience with defining the QM Standards and Test Process standards;  Experience developing and executing User Acceptance test cases with the QA team;  Experience establishing test repository for test plans, test cases and test results;  Experience performing defect tracking and analysis;  Experience generates test status reports for the Project Manager;  Experience develops test cases for Functional, Integration, System testing and any other test types;  Experience working with the business client to identify test data to support the different test cycles;  Experience executing System/Integration test cases; performs Ad Hoc testing;  The ability to function effectively in an environment where change occurs continuously;  The ability to build effective relationships with team members, business partners, external vendors, and key stakeholders;  The ability to effectively communicate to all levels of personnel from field/operations through to Corporate management;  Excellent verbal and written communication skills;  The ability to ramp quickly, gaining an understanding of the business problems/opportunities, project objectives, and high level design completed to date; and,  Strong understanding of business processes, analyzes complex business problems to be solved with IT technologies.  Don’t miss out on this opportunity, apply online today!  We would like to thank all applicants for their interest; however, only candidates under consideration will be contacted. Please note that your application does not signify the beginning of employment with Eagle and that employment with Eagle will only commence when placed on an assignment as a temporary employee of Eagle.
Title: Intermediate Business System Analyst

Job_Description: Reporting to the Manager Information Technology, the Systems Analyst position requires a creative person who is a team player, with a strong technical and problem-solving background, the ability to relate to several different IT and client groups, and excellent verbal and written communication skills. Provide second level support for Field Service applications inquiries within Ensign Analyze and resolve both technical and process issues for business users Liaise with other personnel within IT to diagnose and resolve support issues Identifying, managing and escalating issues and risks in a timely manner Work with other functional teams within IT to investigate and resolve cross application process and integration issues Identify possible project opportunities to Management Report on current state of support Keep abreast of Ensign’s global systems strategies Qualifications  Post-secondary education in Computer Science, Management Information Systems discipline or equivalent experience 2 - 5 years of experience in business application implementation and support Core technical skills should include SQL abilities and a good working knowledge of web application architecture Exposure to a wide range of technologies including a solid knowledge of databases, web applications, operating platforms, networking and systems integration Ability to work independently and as a part of a team and manage multiple tasks in an ever-changing environment Able to work with different client types to understand their needs, identify root causes of problems, and work to resolution Ability to develop rapport with various client groups and personalities and maintain strong working relationships Experience with ERP-level systems and processes Experience with SSRS reporting Some travel may be required, including to the United States Work is expected to be completed at the client’s office in downtown Calgary Job Business systems analysis Primary LocationCanada-Alberta-Calgary Organization Corporate Admininistration Schedule Full-time Posting Date Mar 27, 2018, 1:00:00 AM Recruiter Marci Connors
Title: Systems Analyst - 1 Year Limited Term Contract

Job_Description: If you are committed to public service, enjoy collaborating with others, share our values and have a desire to learn and grow, join The City of Calgary. City employees deliver the services, run the programs and operate the facilities which make a difference in our community. We support work-life balance and offer competitive wages, pensions, and benefits. Together we make Calgary a great place to make a living, a great place to make a life.   Reporting to the Manager of The Corporate Budget Office, you are responsible for providing direction and professional leadership to a team of economists and senior regulatory analysts. You will be delivering timely and relevant economic outlooks, policy analysis and advice on matters related to economic evaluation, statistical analysis and forecasting, and municipal finance. You will advise Council and Administration on the prudent allocation of public resources and the development and implementation of citywide economic policies. In addition you will manage and lead the team in developing utility interventions, regulatory and energy policy on behalf of The City of Calgary. Primary duties include: Policy development on projects that deal with matters concerning the relationship between The City and its economic environment such as the cost of growth. T hese can range from the formulation of and recommendations on, City pricing, taxation and funding strategies, response to, and participation in, the formulation of senior government-municipal relationships. Provide corporate forecasting by preparing the core corporate-wide forecasts, with concentration on population, employment and general performance of the local economy. Supply forecasting consulting services to City departments. Extend general consulting on demand which can range from operating policy reviews through the development of sophisticated evaluation methodologies or application of specialized economic/econometric techniques to major project initiatives. Provide within and outside The City economic information and special economic data such as the Monthly Economic Report. Manage and lead utility interventions, regulatory policy (natural gas, electricity and telecommunications) and energy policy. Manage and lead utility interventions, regulatory policy (natural gas, electricity and telecommunications) and energy policy. Act as the focal point for The City's interpretation and compliance with federal and provincial legislation involving taxes and fees either collectible by, or assessed upon, The City. Manage the City's participation in provincial and federal policy consultations relating to natural gas, electricity and telecommunications.  Qualifications A master's degree, preferably in Economics and at least 10 years of related experience. Comprehensive knowledge of economic theory, quantitative economic techniques, econometric forecasting techniques, financial analysis, computer simulation packages and their economic applications. A solid knowledge of regulatory decisions and rulings in Alberta and other jurisdictions. Demonstrated ability to apply critical and strategic thinking, manage projects and resources, strong interpersonal and communication skills and a high attention to detail. Equivalent combinations of experience and education may be considered. Pre-employment Requirements A security clearance will be conducted. Successful applicants must provide proof of qualifications.    Union: Exempt   Business Unit: Finance Position Type: Permanent Location: 800 Macleod Trail S.E. Compensation: Level G $98,270 - 154,609 per annum Days of Work: This position typically works a 5 day work week, earning 1 day off in each 3 week cycle. Hours of work: Standard 35 hour work week Audience: Internal/External Apply By: June 6, 2018 Note: Relocation assistance may be available Amendment: Responsibilities Job ID #: 300835

Job_Description: The Inventory Analyst is responsible for analyzing and managing master data, attributes, systems and processes for multiple operating areas within the company. Working alongside business units, buyers, warehouse personnel and systems support teams, the Analyst is responsible for creation, validation, analyzing and improving process, data and tools.  Calgary Based – Horizon/Albian Projects with potential travel or Temporary Assignment To support the growth of Canadian Natural's Oil Sands operations, this position may be assigned to or require business travel to various contractor workplaces or to the Oil Sands site’s during project phases for extended periods.  **Please Note: This is a 12 month temporary position **  HOW WILL YOU MAKE YOUR MARK?  Understand, create, manage and analyze supply chain data, including item master, vendor master, inventory ledger and transactions, purchasing records, warehouse operations records, spend and assets information  Identify business process gaps and requirements to develop and manage reporting  Develop business intelligence for process accuracy, improvement and standardization opportunities  Identify and implement opportunities for optimized supply/demand (increasing service, mitigating risk, reducing holding cost)  Identify and implement opportunities to improve the procure to pay cycle, procurement functions and to leverage technology and tools for process efficiency  Manage and deliver process improvement initiatives, including communication and change management of stakeholders  Collaborate with leadership to incorporate policy and procedural changes into work practices  QUALIFICATIONS:  Typically 5+ years of direct experience in master data management, business analysis, planning, consulting, supply management or inventory control  Solid experience with: o ERP systems (JD Edwards, Maximo, SAP) o Data management and analysis using queries in SQL, Java etc o Supply chain operations processes o Reporting and data visualization tools (Tableau, Spotfire, OBIEE, etc.) o Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint at an advanced level  To see related Supply Management and Contracts roles at CNRL, visit: www.cnrl-careers.com/jobs/Supply-Management-and-Contracts
Title: Inventory Analyst - Temporary

Job_Description: Application Services: Solvera Architects, Developers and Business Analysts provide top-quality Java, .NET, C++, Visual Basic and/or SharePoint consulting services to clients across western Canada. Solvera’s development team composition ranges from relatively recent graduates to the best and most experienced in the industry. We provide a dynamic working and learning environment that leverages the contributions of the entire team and provides enhanced mentoring for emerging resources. Solvera has an immediate need for experienced SharePoint professionals (Solution Architects, Developers and Business Analysts) based in Calgary. Responsibilities: Developing and implementing architecture and development models and frameworks Conducting systems analysis, collecting business requirements, defining functional specifications and developing use cases Developing, testing, implementing and supporting SharePoint applications Working on assigned development projects which will include a number of applications requiring new development, or upgrades/enhancements  Desired Skills and Experience Completion of a recognized post-secondary education program in Information Technology Four or more years of architecture, development or business analysis experience specifically related to SharePoint Capacity to understand the broader implications of business strategy across all business units Previous experience designing business services and core business processes Previous experience eliciting, formulating, functional and non-functional requirements Excellent interpersonal communication skills and ability to work well in a team environment Microsoft SharePoint Certification (MCTS) an asset Ability to communicate technical ideas using non-technical language Fluency in written and oral English Ability to work legally in Canada Relocation assistance is not available for this position  Reporting Relationship In addition to reporting to a specified person on client assignments, Solvera consultants report directly to a Solvera Delivery Manager, with dotted line reporting to their Practice Leader on professional development matters. Assignments Solvera consultants are based in one of four western Canadian cities and can expect the vast majority of their work assignments will be supporting Solvera’s base of clients within that city. Although each client assignment is different, the hours are typically Monday – Friday workdays and the work is performed in a comfortable, safe office environment befitting many of Canada’s most progressive companies. Total Compensation Solvera’s total compensation program includes market-competitive base compensation, bonus opportunities to recognize individual and corporate success and an outstanding benefits package.
Title: Sharepoint Consultant - 0218 (Calgary)

Job_Description: LOCATION: Calgary, Alberta (CA-AB) JOB NUMBER: 22842  Job Overview Co-op positions at Suncor are more than just a work term. They provide you with meaningful and challenging work experiences to help enable you to determine where you want your career to go – better yet, many of our co-op students go on to become permanent Suncor employees after they graduate! You will work side-by-side with some of the most talented people in the energy industry, and your work assignments and mentoring will offer you extraordinary academic and career growth. This position will be of interest to students planning to pursue a career in Renewable Energy. You will gain exposure to wind and solar power project planning, development and execution activities and will work in a multidisciplinary team of engineers, analysts and land agents allowing you to develop your professional skills and establish relationships with internal partners. Key Accountabilities Preparing and maintaining maps of project lands Working with a team to prepare bid packages for wind and solar power projects Obtaining permits and approvals for project development Assisting with the installation and maintenance of meteorological towers Investigating new technologies Performing technical studies and data analysis Supporting project management activities Exposure to field work Required Qualifications Experience and Education: Currently enrolled in a 4th year Engineering co-op program at an accredited post-secondary institution, and returning to full-time studies after the work term Attach your transcripts with your application and clearly indicate the length of work term for which you are available Intermediate to advanced computer skills in the Microsoft Office suite, particularly Excel, and a strong willingness to improve Proficiency using ArcGIS is an asset Exposure to land information system would be an asset Skills and Knowledge: Ability to work both independently and in a team environment Strong analytical skills and problem solving skills Strong attention to detail while working in a dynamic environment Strong collaboration skills, you collaborate with others in order to achieve the best results and deliver the best outcome Possess a questioning attitude to surface problems, you constantly ask what could go wrong and check for out-of-the-ordinary conditions and learn to anticipate potential problems Working Conditions This position will be based in Calgary, AB for a 12 month work term, from September 2018 – August 2019 Some travel may be required  Why Suncor Start your career at one of Canada's leading companies. Suncor looks for people who have the best to offer, and provides the same in return. We are committed to sustainable, ethical growth - Suncor is a company where you can contribute in a meaningful way, grow your skills and career, and achieve success. Business Overview Suncor Energy is Canada's energy company - meaning rewarding opportunities for you to apply your knowledge, contribute and grow in a variety of career-building positions. Our business portfolio spans the entire energy sector, from a leadership position in oil sands development, to refining and marketing operations, natural gas, and conventional oil production, internationally and offshore East Coast Canada. And while we are working to responsibly develop petroleum resources and contribute to the communities where we live and work, we are also developing our renewable energy portfolio, which includes wind power and biofuels. As part of Suncor's team, you'll contribute to the ongoing success of Canada's largest energy company - one with a solid track record of growth, a focus on safety and sustainability and tremendous potential for the future. And you'll have the opportunity to learn from experts in the industry and build on your skills every day. Suncor promotes diversity and inclusion in the workplace. Suncor is an equal opportunity employer and encourages applications from all qualified individuals. Suncor is committed to accessibility and accommodations will be provided to applicants upon request. At Suncor, we are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of the communities in which we live, and where every team member has the opportunity to reach their full potential. Not sure if this particular listing is the right opportunity for you? Please join our Talent Community at www.suncor.com and click on Careers, or follow us on LinkedIn, Facebook and Twitter for the latest job listings and employment news. Please note that our job postings are typically open for two weeks, so if you are interested and qualified, apply now. JOB CATEGORY: Students & New Grads
Title: Co-op Student, Renewable Energy

Job_Description: If you are committed to public service, enjoy collaborating with others, share our values and have a desire to learn and grow, join The City of Calgary. City employees deliver the services, run the programs and operate the facilities which make a difference in our community. We support work-life balance and offer competitive wages, pensions, and benefits. Together we make Calgary a great place to make a living, a great place to make a life.   As a Social Research Policy Analyst, you will support Research & Strategy staff in research and policy analysis activities. This position requires that you are a motivated individual with excellent social research, data analysis, communication and interpersonal skills. Primary duties include: Conduct quantitative and qualitative data analysis and interpretation, and summarize findings in recurrent and on-time reports and presentations. Design and complete literature reviews and environmental scans, and summarize findings in reports and presentations. Prepare, maintain, and steward electronic datasets including socioeconomic, demographic, and Geographic Information System (GIS) data, as well as social service indicators and outcomes. Provide training and expertise on data collection to internal and external clients.  Qualifications A degree in Social Sciences or a related field and a minimum of 3 years of research experience, including (social policy research, program evaluation, and research design). Intermediate proficiency in Microsoft Office (Excel, Word, PowerPoint and Outlook) is required. Advanced proficiency in Statistical Package for the Social Sciences (SPSS) or related software and intermediate proficiency in database, business intelligence or geospatial software would be considered assets. Demonstrate applied knowledge of research methodology, instrument design, analysis, cleaning/analyzing/interpreting census data or other large data sets. Ability to prioritize competing tasks and complete work on time with high quality with strong attention to detail. Able to learn quickly and understand complex systems. Ability to adapt to changing scenarios with efficiency and thoroughness while thinking critically about solutions to complex problems. Ability to provide evidence-based interpretation and produce a variety of research communications (for example: briefing notes, fact sheets, reports, data visualizations, presentations). Pre-employment Requirements Applicants will be tested for appropriate skills. Successful applicants must provide proof of qualifications.  Union: CUPE Local 38   Business Unit: Calgary Neighbourhoods Position Type: 1 Permanent Location: 315 10 Avenue S.E. Compensation: Pay Grade 10 $37.58 - 50.23 per hour (2017 rates) Days of Work: This position works a 5 day work week with one day off in a 3 week cycle. Hours of work: Standard 35 hour work week Audience: Internal/External Apply By: May 25, 2018  Job ID #: 300833
Title: Social Research Policy Analyst

Job_Description: POSITION SPECIFICATIONPosition Title: Director, Data & Business IntelligenceEmployment Terms: Permanent Full-TimeReporting to: Craig Maccubbin, EVP and Chief Information OfficerLocation: Calgary, ABCOMPANY BACKGROUNDWestJet (TSX: WJA) is an iconic Canadian brand. Headquartered in Calgary, Canada, WestJet, along with regional carrier WestJet Encore, is Canada’s leading high-value, low-cost carrier. WestJet is continually recognized as one of the top employers in the country and one of Canada’s most admired corporate cultures. In 2017, WestJet celebrated its 50th consecutive quarter of profitability, and was recognized as the only Canadian airline with investment grade credit ratings.Founded as a regional carrier in Calgary in 1996, with 3 aircraft and 220 employees, WestJet has experienced momentous growth. Today, WestJet is a thriving international airline operated by 13,000+ employees, collectively known as WestJetters. Through scheduled flights across a rapidly expanding network, WestJet also operates WestJet Vacations (providing air, hotel, car and excursion packages), and WestJet Encore (a regional airline operating in Canada and the United States).WestJet is embarking upon a transformative era, transitioning from a low-cost carrier (LCC) to a global, full service network carrier with the delivery of Boeing 787-9 Dreamliner aircraft in January 2019. Further, WestJet has recently launched an ultra-low cost carrier (ULCC), Swoop, a wholly owned subsidiary, with first flights scheduled in June 2018.The mission of WestJet is “to enrich the lives of everyone in WestJet's world.” Since inception, WestJet has nurtured its employee-focused culture of care, planning for its culture at the strategic level. WestJet expresses its strong corporate culture and commitment to guest service with the employee slogan “Because Owners Care.” This refers to the fact that approximately 86 percent of eligible employees, referred to as WestJetters, participate in an employee share purchase plan. Tying the personal success of WestJetters to the company’s success helps nurture a corporate culture that is focused on safety, exceptional guest service and cost containment. Further, with an average age of 40, WestJetters are among the youngest across all North American carriers. This has influenced the airline to create an open-minded, communicative and transparent culture.WestJet has recently unveiled a refreshed set of values, built over the last two years by WestJetters. These values and the behaviours that accompany them will set the stage for global expansion in a way that is uniquely WestJet:Act like an Owner: I take responsibility for my decisions and accountability for the outcomes.Care from the Heart: I do the right thing and do things right, because I care.Rise to the Challenge: I have the courage of a champion, relentless in my pursuit of excellence.Work Together to Win: I play my part, connecting as one team. Together we fly.By keeping a commitment to low costs, WestJet continues to offer value to its people, its shareholders and above all, its guests. It is on these fundamental beliefs that WestJet has built its four-pillar strategy:People and Culture: Putting our people first goes beyond fostering an environment of caring and commitment. We are all owners – empowered and accountable for making the right decisions for our guests and our business.Operational Excellence: Delivering great guest value is the most important part of what we do. If there is one thing that will continue to separate us from the rest, it is how we treat our guests, and providing the ultimate guest experience.Diversified, Sustainable Revenue Growth: Growing strategically and profitably means taking advantage of smart growth opportunities, and understanding the wants and needs of travelers. We will continue to add new destinations and gain market share.Financial strength: Keeping our low-cost advantage is simple. We will continue to offer value to our guests and our shareholders by providing the best guest experience in the industry, while achieving a targeted, sustainable profit margin that will be No. 1 among North American airlines.Further corporate information can be found within our most recent MD&A;, Financial Statements and Annual Report: https://www.westjet.com/en-ca/about-us/media-investor-relations/financial-reportsWestJet’s Investor Day 2017 Presentation is accessible here:https://www.westjet.com/assets/wj-web/documents/en/investorMedia/171206-presentation-investor-day.pdfKEY RESPONSIBILITIESThe Director, Data and Business Intelligence is responsible for the full systems life cycle management of data that supports WestJet’s core business processes and a culture of data-driven decision making. The focus of this role is on collaborating with the senior leadership from other internal departments to develop, implement and optimize business processes to enable data solutions, drive business intelligence and analytics.The successful candidate will actively participate in long-term analytics strategic planning and ensure data-related policies, procedures and processes are in place to address complex business needs. This involves both strategic work on data science and analytics as well as enterprise services and applications. This role also ensures that long-term solution delivery methodologies are followed and that these methodologies deliver quality, reliability, stability and completeness of all data-related programs while also meeting financial objectives and the needs of the business.The Director, Data and Business Intelligence leverages their in-depth technical skills on BI and analytics applications as well as their detailed understanding of corporate functions and business processes to effectively fulfill the responsibilities of this job. The successful candidate will create and implement best-practice data/analytics standards and processes and ensure adherence to relevant regulatory requirements. They will promote that knowledge across the team in order to develop and support data solutions that align with executive leadership goals and objectives.PrincipalDuties: Conducts strategic planning activities for the information data system landscape and communicates the outcomes in terms of future-state architectures, strategies and roadmaps for big data and related applications. Help provide direction for the Technology function and business stakeholders that will lead to simplification of the data architecture.Understands business requirements for data and information to support business strategy and objectives. Performs cost-benefit analyses for proposed systems to aid management in making implementation decision and aligns data management and technology with business needs.Leads design sessions in prototyping new data solutions and BI dashboards. Promotes the value of Data as an asset.Leads technical leaders including hiring, career development and performance reviews with a focus on enhancing leadership effectiveness. Provides leadership, mentoring and coaching for all staff and foster a culture of accountability, innovation and team building.Forms part of the IT Senior Leadership team and works collaboratively across the group and exhibits the servant leadership mentality that is aligned with WestJet’s culture.Manages the IT Data & Business Intelligence operational and capital budgets including forecasting and reporting of fiscal performance for domain of responsibility. Ensures that the proper investments are made with a multi-year view but is adaptable in a rapidly changing environment.Reviews and analyzes the effectiveness and efficiency of existing data source systems and develops strategies for improving or further leveraging these systems.Collaborates in the planning, development, and deployment of new data solutions, enhancements to existing data solutions and dashboards.Develops and adapts business analysis processes and supporting tools as the IT organization scales to meet the needs of a rapidly growing business.Functions as a senior-level advisor and business analyst for enterprise scale initiatives.Serves as function Subject Matter Expert in one or more business subjects such as: Finance, Supply Chain, Operations, Commercial, to name a few.Collaborates with both the analytic organization and business owners to turn data into actionable business insights using self-service analytics and reporting tools.Demonstrates forward thinking and plans ahead for potential roadblocks; comprehends bigger picture of the business strategy.Provides an exceptional customer service experience to internal business partnersAdditional responsibilities as assigned and consistent with the role.PROFESSIONAL EXPERIENCE & QUALIFICATIONSThe successful candidate will be a team player with business acumen, strategic insight and sound judgment along with proven, in-depth experience in supporting sensitive and high-touch projects.Professional ExperienceA bachelor’s degree in computer science, information technology, mathematics or a related major.Progressively more responsible enterprise IT senior leadership experience in an organization of similar size, scope and complexity to WestJet.Minimum of 5 years of that time in senior leadership positions directly related to the Data & Business Intelligence domain.Experience with enterprise systems, including ERP, PSS, Customer Relationship Management (CRM) business processes/systems and cloud-based applications, data, security and integration architectures including data warehouse and BI solutions.Demonstrated expertise in establishing methodologies and implementing structured ways of analyzing business problems.Demonstrated ability to understand current state business processes and work with business to design efficient and effective business processes. Excellent conflict resolution technique and capable for building consensus with business partners.Strong presentation / collaboration skills; lead or facilitate discussions with senior business leaders and technically adept colleagues.required skills, COMPETENCIES & ATTRIBUTESAnalytical mind with excellent critical thinking and problem-solving skills as well as the ability to adapt to changing priorities and deadlines. Can balance long-term ("big picture") and short-term implications of individual decisions.Self-motivated, quick learner and with a “roll up your sleeves” mindset, ability to lead initiatives involving complex, integrated systems.Strong mentoring and coaching aptitude; listens effectively, demonstrates empathy towards individual concerns and drives conflict resolution; promotes a culture of collaboration and continuous improvement.Ability to work independently and collaboratively, as required, in a fast-paced team environment consisting of internal and external team members.Excellent planning, organization and time management skills including the ability to support and prioritize multiple projects.Strong analytical, problem solving, organizational, and prioritization skills.Proven record of building high performing teams.Excellent verbal and written communication skills.COMPENSATIONA competitive compensation package will be negotiated based on experience and qualifications with a base salary in excess of $150,000 annually.This position is eligible for a performance bonus as per WestJet’s compensation policy and the Total Rewards program that includes the following: extended health, emergency travel medical, dental, vision, short-term disability (STD), long-term disability (LTD), life insurance, accidental death and dismemberment (AD&D;) & travel benefits. This position is also eligible for relocation assistance.Please note the position is based at WestJet headquarters in Calgary, and the successful candidate is eligible for relocation assistance. Learn more about life in Calgary here: https://www.lifeincalgary.ca/CONTACT DETAILSPlease submit your application via the WestJet website:https://www.westjet.com/en-ca/about-us/jobs/indexInquiries can be forwarded to Doug Windover at globalleadershiprecriuting @ westjet.com.The position will remain posted until the successful candidate is identified.WestJet An Alberta Partnership22 Aerial Place NECalgary, AB T2E 3J11-888-937-8583Job Type: Full-timeEducation:Bachelor's
Title: Director, Data & Business Intelligence

Job_Description: Build a meaningful career  At Morneau Shepell, we offer more than career opportunities, we provide career opportunities to make meaningful contributions to people’s lives. The extraordinary expertise of our 4,000-strong workforce is harnessed to support the employees and families of the organizations we serve. Our innovative programs have a lasting impact on the health, financial security and productivity of 20,000 workplaces.  Consultant Health and Benefits  Health & Benefits Solutions  Calgary, AB  Full Time, Permanent  Benefits programs are an important and highly valued part of any employment offering. But understanding how much or what type of benefit coverage is necessary can be difficult. Our client relationship model is consultative and encourages continual communication. By providing you with the resources to support employers in engaging employees in their health, we provide a path to better workforce health and productivity.  Our Consultant works in a team and is responsible for managing, servicing and providing quality benefits consulting services for small to medium sized clients. In addition, they will be responsible for helping to build business with existing clients as well as attracting and supporting new clients through our association partnerships.  Responsibilities include:  Business Development  Identify and manage cross-sell opportunities Develop strategic relationships with key account contacts and introduce Morneau Shepell team members as appropriate Supervise the complete employee benefits cycle: plan design, provider search, implementation, experience monitoring, renewal rating Develop new business with existing clients and assists in obtaining new business with prospective clients focusing on our key association partnerships Understand client needs and identify company or industry products or services that can meet these needs Service  Deliver presentations to clients; conduct client meetings and the occasional employee presentation. Ensure that quality control and service standards are attained with every transaction Negotiate, problem solve and maintain positive relationships with insurers, external advisors and internal underwriting and benefits administration departments Develop and maintain excellent relationships with clients, through regular telephone contact and office visits Understand the client’s perspective and priorities, and work with the client to resolve administrative issues Establish strategies for services that meet client needs  Administration  Provide and oversee direct day-to-day support for clients by phone, e-mail, letters, formal reports, and face-to-face meetings Lead and manage multiple client assignments and projects Manage special projects as required Peer review the work of analysts Knowledge  Maintain current knowledge of industry trends including insurer news, products, legislation, and cost trends as well as current knowledge of our company's products and services  Qualifications:  Experience  Five years of experience in group benefits. Preference will be given to those from the group insurance industry, a consulting firm or brokerage or in an HR department. Education  Post-secondary education GBA (CEBS) designation, or working towards it. Life Insurance license (this will be a requirement within 3 months of onboarding) Skills  Strong presentation skills and comfort speaking in front of large groups Understanding of consultative selling and the ability to manage the sales cycle effectively and autonomously Expert negotiation, technical and analytical skills Can effectively communicate complex concepts in plain written and spoken language Professional Traits  Exceptional customer focus; some would say you’re the best Extremely organized self-starter, flexible, highly independent Ability to manage multiple deadlines simultaneously Proven collaborative team member with the ability to motivate and inspire team members  Morneau Shepell Morneau Shepell is in the business of helping organizations help their people because we believe that engaged people are the driving force for society. Every day, the expertise of our almost 4,000 employees is recognized as essential to the financial security, health, and productivity of our clients and their people. We're always looking for talented professionals and strategic leaders who will listen and work together with colleagues and clients to form long-term relationships and to deliver integrative solutions that fit. As we continue to grow, we're presently engaging with exceptional candidates interested in a range of exciting career opportunities. At www.morneaushepell.com you can explore our careers page to learn more about the solutions we deliver and the great people who help us do it. Working closely with the users of the system, you will analyze the business requirements and assist with improving business processes while developing and implementing effective and efficient solutions.  Minimum Qualifications:  College Diploma or undergraduate degree with  Computer Science, Information Systems, Business Administration or related field experience within a retail environment  Four(4) years relevant work experience with a POS  System and/or Price Management Systems preferably ISS, Store Point and Retalix HQPM2  Two(2) years experience in Business Analysis One(1) years experience managing project-based work  structures or Project Management Certification and 300 hours of project work  Desirable Qualifications:  Relational database management systems and SQL  Querying Skills  ITIL Foundations Experience with Kronos Workforce Time Keeper and  Forecast Manager  Experience with FLUX Java Scheduling Tool Technical knowledge of procedural and/or  object-oriented programming languages i.e. Perl, Java, scripting Benefits and Perks Calgary Co-op offers excellent opportunities for increasing levels of responsibility, personal growth and challenge supported by sound leadership and direction. Job_Description: *PLEASE NOTE: PREFERENCE WILL BE GIVEN TO CANDIDATES WHO APPLY THROUGH CANFOR.COM/CAREERSCanfor TechnologyAt Canfor, our Information Technology professionals play an important role in the daily functioning of our operations. Consistently pushing the boundaries when it comes to innovation within the forestry and pulp and paper industries, our IT professionals support Canfor in achieving exceptional results.With a high caliber Information Technology leadership team, a clear vision, and significant growth and training opportunities, a career in IT at Canfor allows individuals to strengthen their competencies and grow within their respective roles. Working as an equal partner with our operations to achieve organizational objectives, you will be at the forefront of innovation.Who We Are: Canfor is one of the world’s largest and most respected integrated forest products companies. For more than 75 years, we have been delivering top-quality lumber, pulp and paper products to our valued customers worldwide. With operations in Western Canada and the Southern United States, and sales offices around the world, you can find Canfor products in every corner of the globe. We are leaders in sustainable forest management and in converting wood residuals into green energy.As we continue to grow our company and our markets, find out how you can grow your career with us.The OpportunityThe Data Analyst, Business Intelligence supports Canfor’s objectives by turning data into meaningful information that can be used to make sound business decisions. The Data Analyst will provide expertise in business intelligence to prepare and deliver data and information to internal customers and stakeholders through reports, dashboards and scorecards. It is essential that the Data Analyst build an understanding of the business at a level of detail that enables them to work with the business to deliver valuable information.Please Note:  This is a relocation opportunity in Vancouver, British Columbia. The successful applicant may be provided with relocation assistance.Main ResponsibilitiesRequirements Gathering:Engage with various business units to capture information needs, compare those needs with existing tools and identify gapsParticipate in business requirements workshopsWrite business requirements documents as required to elaborate needs, gain acceptanceDesign & Development:Architect tables and dataDesign dashboards, reports, drill-down analytics and data visualizationsDesign, configure and administer the metadata layerCreate system technical requirements for documentation and knowledge managementActively challenge and find solutions to optimize system performanceTesting, Validation, Release Management:Develop and implement testing strategiesValidate data accuracyDeploy and validate changes in production environmentTraining & Change Management:Support the development of training, documentation, and help desk capabilitiesRequired SkillsBachelor's degree in computer science, information systems, business management or specialized training/certificationExperience working with relational databases (Microsoft SQL Server, Oracle Database, MySQL, etc)Applied knowledge of SQL (T-SQL, PL/SQL, ANSI-SQL, etc)Applied understanding of data modelling and warehousing conceptsWorking knowledge of business intelligence tools such as Oracle Business IntelligenceWorking knowledge of ETL tools such as Oracle Data Integrator or InformaticaExperience mediating and clarifying sometimes ambiguous or conflicting end user requirementsEagerness to learn new concepts and technologies and keep-up-to-date with existing onesWillingness to go above and beyond to understand both the business and technical aspects of a problemHiring for this position is ongoing and will be filled as required. To be considered for this position, please apply today.In order to be eligible for this position, you must be legally entitled to work in Canada for our Company.There has never been a better time to join the Canfor Information Technology team and become a part of the modern forest industry. We have a wide range of rewarding and innovative careers in some of the best communities in North America, with plenty of room for advancement. We offer competitive compensation and benefits packages, and are committed to the professional development of our employees.*PLEASE NOTE: PREFERENCE WILL BE GIVEN TO CANDIDATES WHO APPLY THROUGH CANFOR.COM/CAREERSFollow us on LinkedIn , Twitter , and Facebook for Canfor news, career opportunities, and upcoming events!Vancouver, BCThe city of Vancouver is both a natural beauty and a progressive urban centre, a rare place on earth that is idyllic and electric all at once. With one of Canada’s mildest climates, Vancouver is ideally suited for those devoted to outdoor pursuits, health and wellness. Along with its endless supply of fresh air and clean water, Vancouver also boasts countless choices for culturally diverse, world-class cuisine and an inventory of arts and entertainment events. Job_Description: Inter Pipeline is a major petroleum transportation, storage and natural gas liquids processing business that ranks among the largest energy infrastructure companies in Canada. We are proud to be named one of Alberta’s Top 70 Employers, which recognizes Alberta businesses that lead their industries by being exceptional places to work.  Located out of our Calgary office, the individual in the Senior Business Analyst role will report to the Supervisor, Finance Solutions Centre. The successful candidate will be responsible for the stewardship of finance master data and project support within SAP for Inter Pipeline, as well indirect leadership of the Business Analyst.  Key Activities and Responsibilities: Review and ongoing improvement of master data creation/change approval processes Leadership of the Business Analyst role, utilizing a team accountability approach for facilitating finance master data creation/changes Work with the business and SAP Competency Centre to develop Service Level Agreements (SLAs), key performance indicators (KPIs) and other metrics for SAP finance master data Act as a data steward bringing forward cross-functional data quality and process integration issues and working collaboratively to solve them, championing the collective management of data governance Serve as a central point of contact for finance data governance understanding and providing direction and training to data consumers and producers from the business in line with business rules Ensure the right stakeholders across the enterprise (e.g. operations, finance, supply chain, etc.) are brought into make business process improvements which mitigate data issues Bring best practices in master data management and propose opportunities for improvement Interaction with SAP Competency Center on future system enhancements, builds, testing, and roll-outs Assist with development and usage of SAP reports  Education, Skills and Experience: Undergraduate diploma or degree in business with 5+ years of progressive experience in financial system support, CPA (CA, CMA, CGA) designation is an asset Strong finance expertise on master data usage, configuration, and integrated data requirements/linkage points combined with prior oil and gas experience considered an asset In depth knowledge of SAP FI_CO and Business Warehouse, experience with S/4HANA and Fiori an asset Approaches work with a high level of curiosity and aptitude to identify and solve problems, takes initiative, is accountable, and works independently Change agent who can persuade and influence stakeholders to establish new processes, shift to automation, and provide innovative solutions Ability to manage internal and external relationships with well-developed interpersonal, team, customer service and communication skills (both written and verbal) Strong customer service skills in working with internal departments to achieve results through relationships with people and teams Able to work well in a fast-paced, growth environment, with strong attention to detail and accuracy Maintains strong initiative and possesses superior analytical skills
Title: Senior Business Analyst

Job_Description: At LifeLabs, we are focused on our vision of building a healthier Canada! We are the largest community diagnostics laboratory in Canada with over 350 collection centres, 21 laboratories and service over 19 million patients each year. Caring, Agile, Customer Driven, One Team - We live our values every day in what we do to help our patients and healthcare providers. With over 5,000 employees, we all make a difference and that’s why our people are so important to us. This is an exciting time to join our LifeLabs team, grow your career with us and support numerous business initiatives, innovations, best practice and business development opportunities. Rocky Mountain Analytical provides specialized tests to naturopathic doctors, physicians and other healthcare providers who practice integrative medicine. Rocky Mountain Analytical, a division of LifeLabs is seeking a Senior Analyst who will be integral in ensuring LifeLabs successfully achieves its growth strategies. Reporting to the Director or Manager, Business Development RMA, the Senior Analyst will support the RMA Business Development team in areas of growth strategy development and execution, project management and business development. We are looking for individuals with a strong drive for change, a natural curiosity, and a passion for transforming healthcare in Canada. The role may require some travel within Canada. This is a full time permanent role and will be located in our Calgary office. Accountabilities: Conducting and facilitating internal stakeholder meetings Researching and synthesizing industry trends and the competitive landscape Conducting market research in the area of functional medicine including formal market evaluation and sizing studies Synthesizing all information and data into executive level reports to facilitate strategic decision making Supporting the development of tools and templates to help facilitate the data/information gathering and analysis process Becoming a subject matter expert in functional medicine testing and the functional medicine landscape overall Assessing/evaluating the competitive landscape relative to a particular opportunity Providing financial analysis, costing, and projections to internal clients to enable effective decision making and risk assessment Supporting the development of executive level briefing notes, updates, presentation decks and stakeholder communications Liaising with internal leaders to build an intimate understanding of the business and ongoing activities occurring across different functional units  Experience and Skills: Bachelor’s degree in Business, Management, Health Sciences or equivalent Preferred 2-3 years of experience, including 1 year recent experience in a related role; willing to look at the right new grad Master’s Degree in Business / Health Administration or equivalent considered an asset Prior knowledge and experience within the health care/life sciences industries Background in sciences (e.g. biology, physiology, biochemistry) an asset Management consulting experience considered an asset Proven ability to gain support for and drive organizational strategies Exceptional leadership and interpersonal skills with a collaborative mindset. Proven capacity to engage with diverse multidisciplinary teams (e.g., Med/Sci, Business Development, Strategy, Marketing and Sales, Client Services, Laboratory Operations, Government Relations, etc.) An excellent written and verbal communicator, including with senior executives Ability to work across multiple jurisdictions, with multiple team members in different time zones. High-level of adaptability, emotional intelligence, and comfort with ambiguity Close attention to detail, with a quality-focused mindset A detail and results oriented self-starter with demonstrated analytical expertise Proven proficiency in the Microsoft Office Suite and well developed skills in quantitative and qualitative analyses Demonstrated passion and enthusiasm for the healthcare and life sciences industries in Canada Dynamic, possessing the ability to prioritize multiple work assignments and manage time effectively
Title: Senior Analyst, Business Development - Calgary

Job_Description: Business Development/Client Sales Executive REF#00483X Calgary, Alberta Schneider Electric™ creates connected technologies that reshape industries, transform cities and enrich lives. Our 160,000 employees thrive in more than 100 countries. From the simplest of switches to complex operational systems, our technology, software and services improve the way our customers manage and automate their operations. Help us deliver solutions that ensure Life Is On everywhere, for everyone and at every moment: https://youtu.be/NlLJMv1Y7Hk .  Great people make Schneider Electric a great company.  Schneider Electric Process Automation (PA) brings together the best-known brands in industrial automation (Foxboro DCS, Triconex SIS, and Modicon PLC ’s ) to deliver integrated solutions that automate and optimize plant operations. We are part of Schneider-Electric, a $35 billion & 160,000 employee global group headquartered in France. Schneider-Electric is a major global supplier of systems, software, instruments, and solutions for electrical distribution, process automation and asset performance management. Primary customer industries include Refining and Petrochemicals, Upstream Oil and Gas, Metals and Mining, Pulp & Paper, and Power and Utilities.  We are presently looking for a Client Sales Executive (CSE) to strengthen our team in the West. Ideally, the candidate should be based in Calgary, Alberta. Responsibilities   The Client Sales Executive is responsible for the establishment and maintenance of the sales relationship with each client/prospect in their portfolio at every level from the executive suite (CxO) to departmental line managers. The CSE drives new business through the identification, development, negotiation, and closure of new automation projects and services agreements with prospects and clients, and participates in the subsequent maintenance of the client relationship. They target potential leads, qualify them, and lead the pursuit team in crafting and positioning the offer and pursuit. To this end, they leverage their industry and financial business knowledge to create demand and persuade through the development and presentation of compelling purchasing rationales and offers. Product, Services and Solution agreements will encompass all PA offerings and range in scale from short-term consulting engagements to complex, multi-year, multi-service, and global projects and partnerships. Specific new sales/revenue and profit margin targets are established annually by management for each CSE.   Additional CSE responsibilities include the smooth transition of new business from sales to delivery, coaching and mentoring account delivery leaders on client relationship management issues, providing feedback on customer needs to the S-E strategic portfolio manager, ensuring compliance with the sales processes and approval requirements, coordinating the relationship between key client personnel and management, and leading or coordinating global relationship management initiatives with other geographic units focused on the same client.   The CSE also shares industry, deal, and sales best-practice knowledge with the S-E sales community and may mentor and coach other Client Sales Executives, as required.   Job Essential Functions  PA Client Sales Executives are responsible for managing the entire sales process from identifying prospects to negotiating contracts.   Other job essential functions include, but are not limited to, the following:  Identify prospects and create entry strategies for each Create and manage demand and qualify opportunities • Utilize business and financial knowledge to create value propositions  Execute competitive sales tactics to win business Coordinate the pursuit as well as the deal crafting and positioning Lead or participate in contract negotiations • Create and maintain territory sales plan and Account plans • Report client activities in bFO/ SalesForce CRM • Maintain all opportunities current and accurate in bFO/ SalesForce   This position will : - Have a strong Business Development component for large projects in the East. - Will have minimum travel requirement of 50% Qualifications Education:  Undergraduate degree, preferably in Business, Engineering, or Computer Science, or College degree with strong pertinent experience. An MBA, or graduate degree in Business, Engineering, Computer Science, or professional qualifications in Law or Finance are considered a major plus.   Experience:  10+ years of complex, solution selling sales experience to industrial clients, ideally to the refining, oil and gas, Metals & Mining industries. Strong technical knowledge of DCS, Safety Systems, PLC controls, Instruments, and Advanced Applications for process optimization, management or control. Past experience in closing deals of $2-3 + Million in contract value Knowledgeable of Business Solutions and Manufacturing Applications Ability to establish CXO level relationships Track record of meeting/exceeding yearly quota Experience in business transformation solutions Capability to understand S-E offerings and articulate those offerings to the industry and prospects As part of our team, you'll build a strong career with a collaborative, knowledgeable team of people. We'll challenge you to think differently to achieve your goals. You'll have easy access to senior management, leading thinkers, and colleagues around the world.  In addition to competitive salaries and inclusive benefits, we offer global career opportunities and travel to new places to inspire fresh, new thinking. We believe in rewarding and recognizing risk-taking and creativity. We also promote a healthy work-life balance as essential for your personal growth.  Visit…. Web site  We seek out and reward people for being straightforward, open, passionate, effective and challenging the status quo. We want our employees to reflect the diversity of the communities in which we operate. We welcome people as they are, creating an inclusive culture where all forms of diversity are seen as a real value for the company. We’re looking for people with a passion for success — on the job and beyond. See what our people have to say about working for Schneider Electric: https://youtu.be/6D2Av1uUrzY .  Let us learn about you! Apply today.  You must submit an online application to be considered for any position with us. This position will be posted until filled.  It is the policy of Schneider Electric to provide equal employment and advancement opportunities in the areas of recruiting, hiring, training, transferring, and promoting all qualified individuals regardless of race, religion, color, gender, disability, national origin, ancestry, age, military status, sexual orientation, marital status, or any other legally protected characteristic or conduct.
