Job_Description: Peraton Canada is the leading provider of complete life cycle management of avionics and propulsion systems for Canada’s CF-18 fleet. Our experienced team provides a broad range of services to the Department of National Defence including Automated Test Equipment, Engineering Services, Logistics Support Analysis, Electronic Systems Maintenance and Repair, and long range planning for full fleet support.We are currently recruiting for an Aerospace Life Cycle Support Analyst to join our team in Calgary. Reporting to the Program Management Representative, you will perform in-service / life cycle support for the Avionics, Electronics, Automated Test Equipment (ATE) and / or Support Equipment (SE) for the CF-18 aircraft. Using your analytical skills you will perform sparing, reliability and maintainability analyses; analyze procurement requirements and initiate procurement activities; analyze failure trends, perform obsolescence reviews, and maintain technical publications. Using your strong communicative abilities, you will prepare and present written and /or verbal briefings and presentations, and liaise with external customers, subcontractors and services / material providers.Minimum Qualifications: Certified Electronics Technologist (CET) or equivalent with a minimum five years’ experience in the field of avionics maintenanceExtensive avionics systems and or test equipment knowledgeDemonstrated ability to analyze data and forecast future procurement requirementsProficient in MS Office and business enterprise systemsFamiliarity with electronic parts procurement and obsolescence management principalsCustomer service orientedSuperior written and verbal communication skillsHigh level of detail orientationAbility to work well on a team but also independentlyPreferred Qualifications: CF-18 avionics experienceReliability and Maintainability experienceLife Cycle Management CertificationFinally, you are highly organized, proscribe to a positive ‘can-do’ attitude and enjoy being a member of a strong team.Come and join this highly motivated team of professionals and help us continue to set the standards of excellence in a field that offers both challenge and reward.All successful applicants must be capable of obtaining and maintaining a Canadian Government Industrial Security Clearance.http://www.tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca/esc-src/personnel/enquete-screening-eng.htmlWe thank all candidates for their interest, however, only qualified candidates will be contacted.Peraton is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Subject to applicable laws applicants will receive consideration for positions on the basis of qualifications and without regard to race, colour, religion, age, sex, ethnic origin, disability or any other prohibited ground under applicable legislation.Job Types: Full-time, Permanent
Title: Aerospace Life Cycle Support Analyst

Job_Description: Interested in being a part of a team that is leading the evolution of retail in Canada?  Embracing and driving change is critical to our success. The complexity and rate at which the retail industry is transforming has increased exponentially in recent years and we are committed to being a leader in the industry. As such we are relentlessly focused on innovating at every level of our business, investing in new technologies and products, and doubling down on the best talent to drive the company forward. It is an especially exciting time to join the Canadian Tire Family of Companies.  Our Technology team plays a critical role in our evolution, specifically as we transition to an Omni-retailer where digital complements the physical. Our commitment to being a world-class digital organization is evident in how we are using cutting-edge technologies to bring our digital strategy to life in-store, online and on your mobile devices, ultimately improving customer experiences, driving traffic and boosting loyalty.  Reporting into the Data Technology Team, the Data Architect will be responsible for maintenance and evolution of the data vision and implementation of changes to the data environment and the overall data management roadmap.  The Data Architect moves deftly between the business and the technical, with skills in Big Data, dimensional and relational modelling, data warehousing, XSD/XML, SQL development and analysis supported by a superior client-facing presence. The successful incumbent will interact with internal stakeholders on multiple projects to facilitate the collection of information requirements as well as the development and management of conceptual, logical and physical data models to support the needs of the business including creation of tactical solutions towards a longer term roadmap. In addition, this role will participate in the definition of sound data architecture and modeling standards and processes for the Data Architecture practice and champion data governance frameworks across the organization.  What you'll do  Provide a leadership role in the development and communication of Data Management strategies, principles, standards and best practices.  Develop and maintain conceptual, logical and physical data models for Operational and Analytical.  Support tasks to ensure optimum data performance. Support teams to provide the solutions to meet business needs that are aligned to a strategic direction.  Manage and maintain the data model library and data inventory. Review and approve the data designs.  Partner with Analysts to gather business, data and reporting requirements and translate the needs into information structures.  Create & maintain DDLs, XSD/XMLs to implement tactical and enterprise data model designs.  Maintain expertise for the modeling tools viz. ER/Studio, Erwin and XML Spy and query languages.  Understands end-to-end data processes, flows and using that knowledge to design and implement data management solutions. \  Build and maintain enterprise relationships and partnerships.  Negotiate resolution of conflicts between Functional Area Teams and Projects/Initiatives with respect to data related issues to ensure a "win-win" data solution to enable business requirements.  Help manage and maintain a motivated, highly productive, business minded, technically fluent team.  Develops, maintains, and shares best practices and contributes to improve them at Marks/FGL and CT.  Participate in the development of the Data Architecture practise, toward attaining the target architecture.  What you've done  University Degree or College Equivalent preferred.  7-10+ years IT experience in large scale technology architecture, operations and design related disciplines.  5+ years in a Data Modeller or Data Architect specific role.  3rd Normal Form, Dimensional, XSD and Big Data modeling expertise.  Hands on experience in developing and implementing enterprise data architecture and complex data models for operational, data warehouse, and XSD/XML solutions.  Experience with metadata management, data stewardship, data quality, IT governance, TOGAF Certification, Enterprise Data Models, and Enterprise Frameworks.  Hands-on knowledge of enterprise repository tools, data modelling tools, data mapping tools, and data profiling tools.  Hands-on experience with data architecting, data analysis data mining and large-scale data modelling.  Direct experience in implementing enterprise data management processes, procedures and decision support.  Strong understanding of Big Data, relational and analytical theories, principles and practices.  Demonstrated expertise with repository creation, and data and information system life cycle methodologies  Experience with business requirements gathering/analysis, entity relationship planning, database design and reporting structures  Strong SQL skills required. Experience with DB2, Hive, Oracle and SQL Server experience would be an asset.  Expertise in a (or multiple) data modeling tools (ER/Studio, Erwin, XMLSpy, etc.)  Exposure to integration tools (Cognos/Nifi/Kafka/DataStage/XML//IIB)  Exposure to OLAP and Reporting tools (Cognos/MicroStrategy/AtScale/Tableau)  Experience with ETL tools (DataStage, DataManager, PL/SQL, etc.) would be an asset.  Strong communication skills. Ability to communicate effectively technical and complex security concepts across all levels including IT and the business.  Understanding of Project Management and SDLC methodologies in both a Waterfall and Agile development environment.  Ability to balance work priorities, work in a team as well as independently is valuable.  Working knowledge of the Retail Industry would be an asset.  Why us?  Canadian Tire is one of Canada’s most iconic and diversified companies. Our culture and values uphold our pledge to sustainable practices, and commitment to our local communities through Jumpstart cannot be beat.  To learn more about this team and the Canadian Tire Family of Companies follow us on LinkedIn.  Canadian Tire is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace for all. We recognize that our future success depends on the perspectives and contributions of all our employees -- their diverse backgrounds, abilities and experiences make our business stronger. If you are contacted for a job opportunity, please advise us of any accommodations needed to ensure fair and equitable access throughout the recruitment and selection process. All accommodation information provided will be treated as confidential and used only for the purpose of providing an accessible candidate experience.  FGL Corporate  Alberta-Calgary  Permanent  Full-time  Job Posting  :  Mar 5, 2018, 9:33:32 AM
Title: Data Architect

Job_Description: We are an experience design agency with a relentless focus on the customer. The way a customer experiences a brand has a profound impact on perception, purchase behavior and loyalty. That’s why our work begins and ends with our clients’ customers. We listen to them. Validate with them. We even include them in our design process. By creating customer experiences that are simple, valuable, entertaining, and convenient, we deliver measurable results for some of the world’s most admired brands. Today we’re 950 people in 11 offices on 4 continents. We love diverse points of view, open minds, and people who are passionate, driven, and real. And we love all things digital, too. Marketing Science Lead The Marketing Science Lead is the day-to-day owner of empirical practice for one or more clients, the Marketing Science Lead works closely with agency colleagues to identify, prioritize and address clients’ business needs. This requires understanding of all five sub-disciplines (tracking and measurement, data visualization, testing and evaluation, data integration and statistical modeling), as well as deep expertise in at least one of these with solid contribution others. The lead also supervises and develops a team of analysts. This includes management of their work priorities, timelines, deliverables and training. Leads are responsible for exposing analysts to all Marketing Science sub-disciplines and developing expertise as appropriate for team development and client needs. Responsibilities: Data specialist with clear understanding of data, data management, data infrastructure and marketing applications of same Strong written and oral communication and presentation skills including the ability to communicate complex technical concepts to non-technical audiences Proven team and project management skills including training and staff development Clear understanding of the role of empirical practice in digital experience design and optimization Consistent track record of timely delivery including complex projects involving multiple stages, components and contributors Aptitude for creative problem solving, process improvement and methodological design Requirements: Career Development & Team Management: the Lead will grow a team, monitor day-to-day work of team members, and ensure they are both growing in their role and within the discipline; delegate work and provide opportunities for team members to work together and individually Client Consulting: be a confidant to clients, suggest new things, and drive organic growth Crisis Management: be able to manage both clients and employees, troubleshoot for solutions in a calm and effective manner, and ensure that employees are always protected and supported. Discipline Ambassadorship: facilitate understanding of the discipline across the agency Interdisciplinary Collaboration: ability to work across disciplines, follow up to make sure you’re understood and what was needed has been handled Problem Solving: be creative when finding a new answer, and seek counsel or corroboration when needed Process Development: work to build new solutions and processes, then document and share with the team Work Flow Prioritization: strong prioritization skills are key to ensure important and urgent items are handled as they arise
Title: Marketing Science Lead

Job_Description: Are you an advocate for quality? Are you someone who strives for excellence in everything you do? Do you want everything associated with your namesake to have the sex appeal of a Rick Springfield ballad while also having the amazing dual-purpose functionality of a Spork? If any of this is true, then we have a spot for you.  QA at Solium is focused beyond the bug. At Solium, the QA team puts on our hard hat, we do the heavy lifting; we aren’t gatekeepers looking to catch bugs as a means for job preservation. Instead, we are builders involved in the creation of truly fantastic products. We are the voice of reason in the war room; we are technologists looking to the forefront of our industry and impassioning our teams to make the best. We are individuals who know that with building something great comes rebuilding and revisiting and living and breathing an agile mentality.  Solium is a Calgary success story. Our trajectory is one that only moves forward towards our goal of being the best Global Equity Compensation Management Platform on the planet. We fuel this rocket not with high-powered fuel from a very volatile energy sector and economy, but with the brightest technological minds we can find.  We have full-time, permanent opportunities for:  Quality Assurance Analysts  Who are we?  The QA team at Solium are beyond the bug. We are creators and builders who are shaping the best online platform for our industry. We are vocal contributors when our stories are created, and we are automators who know that there is always a better way to do the tough tasks and we make sure our individuals adding code feel safe when they do so. We are a team of including new grads, twenty-year vets, domain experts, automation specialists, and anything else you can think of. The one thing we aren’t is boring. We are karate practitioners, part time app developers, salsa dancers, speed runners and Mom and Dads to amazing families. Beyond that we are a QA family that knows the trade and respects and relies on one another to make sure that each one of us achieves beyond what we think is possible each and every day.  Things we believe:  Free tools are great unless they aren’t the best. We use high-end workstations with big monitors and use things like Selenium WebDriver TestNg, Jenkins and the Atlassian suite of tools to keep us automated and making sure we can explore the results of what we build rather than confirm nothing else is broken.  Things we like:  Prior experience with production large-scale distributed systems Prior experience with technologies we use (Spring,GWT,Struts,JPA,EJB,REST) A hunger for tracking down root causes – no matter how deep the rabbit hole A B.Sc. in CS is appreciated but not necessary with the right background A sense of humour and good aim with a Nerf gun What you’ll do:  Be customer focused – learn about the business to help bring value to our customers Act technology driven – design, implement, and test new functionality, explore Work closely with Dev they are executors of our amazing plans Work with Product Management to keep our battle station fully operational Push us through your experience to help the whole team get better What you’ll get:  Market rate salary based on experience Participation in annual bonus plan and stock incentives Casual Environment – we aren’t a bank, they just happen to be clients. 20 Paid Days off + 9 stat holidays (and 5 week sabbatical after five years) Work how you want – Linux, OS X, or Windows The occasional spontaneous Nerf War While we thank all applicants for their interest in a career with Solium, please note that only those individuals selected for an interview will be contacted.
Title: Quality Assurance Analyst

Job_Description: The Financial Operations team is committed to connecting the DIALOG business with the numbers. A significant opportunity to link the past numbers with the current and future business exists within a newly-created position of Budget Analyst. Reporting to the Director, Financial Operations, as a senior financial accountant, you will have an opportunity to contribute valuable insight and understanding to the business leaders as to how well we are performing overall, and help influence future decisions by providing a robust set of analysis and recommendations based upon that analysis.  Responsibilities include but are not limited to:  Gather and validate financial and non-financial information for the annual budget, and monthly business dashboards Partner with the project accountants, financial accounting and business leaders to gather and validate assumptions underlying the financial and non-financial KPIs to enhance the quality of the planning and budgeting deliverables Prepare analysis and reports to enhance the presentation of budgets and business plans with a focus on performance measures, capital spending, and expenses Prepare detailed analysis of the business segments to validate and present the expected operational, commercial, and financial results Transform data into information to facilitate informed decision making throughout the firm Deliver concise and informative information that clearly explains the business drivers and the impact of these on the financial results of the organization Lead the investigation of critical business issues through analysis of results versus budgeted items Propose enhancements to the budget/planning model Manage the process for submission of budget information on a quarterly basis Professional Essentials   Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Economics, or a related field Professional accountant relevant accreditation (i.e. CPA) will be considered a significant asset Very strong analytical abilities Excellent interpersonal skills and an intrinsic curiosity regarding underlying business drivers Ability to understand complex business issues and present issues in a logical and concise manner Excellent communication skills – both written and oral Very proficient in MS Office, especially Excel including exceptional electronic spreadsheet construction skills 7 to 10 years of experience in: Financial modelling and consolidated reporting Forecasting and budgeting of a mid-size to large scale organization Creating executive level presentation material Why work for DIALOG?  In past years we’ve won Top 100 Employer in Canada for 2013, 2014, 2015 and 2017. Employing over 600 people in 5 studios across Canada & the US, DIALOG is committed to delivering sustainability and excellence in design along with exceptional client service, in a fun working environment.  Our team is fun, creative and committed to success; DIALOG offers first-class internal training and development; We offer competitive compensation and benefits; and, DIALOG is an award-winning design firm committed to sustainable, integrated design. How to Apply  Please go to www.dialogdesign.ca and visit our Careers Page and submit your cover letter and resume in confidence.  We are delighted that you are considering furthering your career with DIALOG. Your submission will be reviewed carefully; however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.  DIALOG is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to the principle of diversity and looks forward to receiving applications from a wide range of people.
Title: Budget Analyst

Job_Description: Reporting to the Manager, Facilities Engineering & Joint Venture Operations, you will create and maintain existing and new joint venture agreements. You will complete thorough area reviews of facilities and pipelines, agreements, production and third-party/carried partners to ensure all joint venture agreement revenue has been captured. You will help accounting resolve incorrect billings, equalization issues and JIB disputes. You will also be responsible for reviewing AFEs to ensure working interest is correct for facilities and pipeline projects. Developing and implementing electronic processes and systems for improved efficiency is another key aspect of this position. To qualify for this position, you have a minimum of 10 years of upstream energy business experience. You have a strong understanding of upstream oil and gas including facilities, production, operations, drilling and completions. Exposure to other areas of the oil and gas business such as accounting, land (unit agreements) and marketing will be considered assets. You have a solid understanding of industry standard agreements including PJVA templates and CAPL operating procedures. You are proficient using Microsoft Office; CS Explorer; SharePoint; geoSCOUT or AbaData; PETRINEX; PRISM/FeeMax; Qbyte FM; FileBound; and the Alberta Energy Electronic Transfer System (ETS).  You are effective at time management and following up on issues. Your strong problem solving, communication and organization skills enable you to prioritize tasks and produce results from yourself and the team. NAL provides a fast-paced, team-orientated environment and excellent compensation. To apply for this position, please submit your resume to jobs@nal.ca, referencing the position title in the subject line. We appreciate the interest of all applicants; however, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.
Title: Joint Venture Analyst

The analyst collaborates with other team members to determine requirements, create technical specifications, designs and processes. The analyst also performs cost-benefit calculations, interdependency analysis, and prioritization exercises related to systems implementations and changes.  RESPONSIBILITIES Partner with business, financial, marketing and technical teams to understand and define system goals and technical system requirements Create requirements, technical specifications and processes using structured analysis including data modeling techniques (e.g. activity diagrams, entity-relationship diagrams) Partner with designers to build system functionality and quality attributes Assist Corporate IT groups in revising logic for performance efficiency Participate in system and user acceptance testing efforts Build standards, processes and procedures, and guidelines for business and technical teams Evaluate system cost-benefit and ROI analyses Understand system interdependencies and collaborate with project teams accordingly QUALIFICATIONS Soft Skills Ability to adapt quickly to new technologies and changing business requirements Ability to quickly troubleshoot problems that may arise in work products Ability to partner with QA to identify course of resolutions Excellent analytical and problem solving skills Excellent project management and prioritization skills Strong communication skills Must possess excellent communication skills and an ability to communicate across all levels of users, including upper management, and interface with numerous departments Technical Skills In-depth understanding of waterfall and agile software methodologies Modeling Techniques: Object Orientation analysis, UML (e.g. Use Cases, Activity Diagrams) Demonstrated experience writing requirements, designs and technical specifications Must be proficient in Microsoft Project, Excel, PowerPoint, Visio and Word 7-10 years experience EDUCATION  Bachelor of Computer Science, Management Information Systems or related field MBA preferred ABOUT AXIA  At Axia, we believe the Internet is something that should never be restricted, by speed, or reliability, or usage. It was created to be open to all. And, now that it’s more a part of the fabric of life than ever before, we believe everyone, everywhere, should have the right to choose the fastest, most reliable access, with no limits.  We are doing what others can’t, or won’t, to give people these fundamental freedoms.  We are Axia. Improving lives at the speed of light

Take a chance and apply to our Client Services Team today!

Core business verticals are: Professional IT Services, Enterprise Content Management, Mobile software development, Utility Sector Services and Managed Services.ARC Business Solutions Inc. is currently seeking a Senior Oil and Gas IT Practice Lead for Calgary.ROLE: Senior Oil and Gas IT Practice Lead – CalgaryThe ideal candidate is someone that has been deeply involved in the oil and gas sector delivering IT solutions to numerous local Calgary organizations for a minimum of sixteen years. The successful candidate is a well-known respected IT professional that has a strong reputation throughout the Calgary O&G; sector for delivering quality solutions. They are continually sought after for their skills and leadership abilities. They are constantly engaged but want something more. The position will be at least eighty percent delivery focused to Calgary O&G; sector clients, typically on client sites.MANDATORY REQUIREMENTS: 15+ years delivering information technology solutions to the O&G; sector in CalgaryHeld positions such as: management consultant, senior business analyst or program/project managementInvolved in the delivery of multi-million dollar solutionsDeep understanding of the O&G; business sector (upstream, mid-stream and downstream) including the underlying business and technical architectureFamiliar with Commercial Off The Shelf (COTS) products specific to the O&G; sectorSkilled and knowledgeable in both IT systems and OT systems.Strong communication skills with a record of workshop facilitation, and public speaking engagementsExperience and comfortable working with/reporting to C-level and executive managementExperience with Business Process Improvement (BPI) or Business Process Reengineering (BPR)Ability to recruit and lead your team of consultants (at all levels and roles) to support and grow this practiceAbility to develop strategic and tactical plans for the sectorAbility to develop, execute and report against sector marketing plansComfortable setting up sales calls and delivering presentationsWorks with the President, Calgary managing partner and owners in practice planning and providing regular updatesActive with industry associations an stays ahead of O&G; industry trendsAbility to travel within AlbertaUniversity Degree in a related discipline from recognized institutionDegree destinations (e.g., Bachelor of Science, Computing Science, Business administration) and/or vendor technical certifications are desirable criteria for our selection.We offer a competitive salary, profit sharing, share options and a comprehensive benefits package. These positions can be filled by fulltime ARC employees or contractors.We thank all applicants for their interest; however only candidates considered for interviews will be contacted. We will be conducting interviews immediately. TO BE CONSIDERED - Please forward your resume clearly displaying reference number MdO: OGC in the subject line to hr at arcbus.com . For more information on ARC, please visit our website at www.arcbus.com.Job Type: Full-time
Title: Senior Oil and Gas IT Practice Lead

Job_Description: Exergy Solutions is a different engineering design firm located in Calgary, Alberta. Exergy provides a unique blend of advice and skilled professionals to help customers improve their technical drawings and asset information. Exergy’s services include drafting as-builts, document management, field redlining, design and additive manufacturing. Our team is growing! We are a team of talented individuals focused on delivering consistent quality to our customers. We are looking for a document management professional that will be responsible for registering, tracking, classifying and distributing electronic and hard copy documents for our projects. Candidates that are flexible and willing to expand their knowledge and skills in other areas of the business operations, drafting and implementation of information management systems will be preferred. Requirements Roles and Responsibilities Document management and control of multi-discipline drawings, with the creation of new lists and folder structures. Tracking all correspondences and transmissions. Learning client standards and familiarize with different transmittal and drawing tracking documents. Spearhead and develop electronic filing, archive system and project documentation turnover. Establish document control files and standards, work processes and training documentation. Respond to requests for retrieval of information and other general requests. Timely review document packages and requirements to ensure they are complete and compliant, integrated with specifications required on individual projects. Receive, track, file and monitor all documentation generated by drafting team, contractors and clients. Identify inconsistency and gaps in governing document workflow processes, requirements, or formats, and communicate findings to the team for improvement. Assist with project update and specific reporting. Create drawing transmittal packages for sending clients. Overall understanding of project delivery and management of change systems. Skills and Experience 6+ years document control experience. Accurate data entry and/or processing experience is beneficial. Advanced proficiency Microsoft Outlook, Word and Excel. Experience with Livelink, Bluecielo Meridian and other popular platforms. Efficiencies in responding to internal inquiries via email, phone or in person. Exceptional time management and prioritization skills. Ability to work within a team environment but also strongly self-motivated. Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail. Strong sense of responsibility and initiative is expected to drive results. Working knowledge of Business Intelligence reporting system would be an asset. Benefits Employer paid benefits program **Online applications accepted only. Please do not contact us by phone.
Title: Intermediate Document Control Analyst

Job_Description: Position Title: People and Culture Analyst  Team and Location: People and Culture – Calgary, AB  Company Profile: Parkland is unique. We fuel communities by safely delivering high-quality petroleum products to motorists, businesses, consumers and wholesale customers across North America. Through unrivaled dependability and service, we connect communities to the products they need to heat their homes, fuel their industries and drive their economies.  Parkland is strong. We are one of North America’s fastest growing and largest independent distributors and marketers of fuels and lubricants. Our family includes Bluewave Energy, Columbia Fuels, Elbow River Marketing, Island Petroleum, Fas Gas Plus, Farstad Oil, Les Pétroles Parkland, Pioneer Energy, Sparlings, Superpumper Inc., Ultramar, and most recently Parkland Refining (B.C.) Ltd.  Parkland is growing. Our organization is powered by effective leadership, progressive strategies and industry-leading best practices — but more importantly, it is driven by talented, customer-focused people who value integrity, innovation and quality. We are looking for good-natured, hard-working candidates who want to build a rewarding career in a dynamic and collaborative work environment. We are a family and our family continues to grow.  Overview of Position:  The People and Culture Analyst will perform professional-level analytical and reporting work in a variety of assignments. This position will analyze data, report HR trends, provide predictive analytics and recommend solutions for people-related strategies.  Key Responsibilities:  Responsibilities for this position may include but are not limited to:  Research and Analytics  Use statistical analysis and data mining to develop, track, and analyze HR metrics and reports to empower operational decisions based on quantitative, qualitative, transactional, efficiency and human capital data; Conduct analysis on data examining workforce demographics and diversity, recruitment, turnover, employee engagement, compensation and benefits, and learning and development Determine baseline trends in order to provide predictive analysis for future direction setting, and; Proactively contribute to the creation of presentation materials relating to data modeling for stakeholder discussions; Reporting and Workflow Design  Use Cognos Analytics (BI Reporting) to design, update and maintain reports as required from the business; Design and implement workflows; HCM System Functionality   Ensure continuous learning and improvement for current HCM to ensure system capabilities are maximized; Research and continued education on the software features, updates; Budget  Plan, review and provide direction for HR; Business Unit annual budget and monthly reviews; Continuous Improvement  Coach other members of HR to increase the analytical skills of the team; Monitor changes in metrics and advise Senior Management of potential root causes, and; Create information briefs for the Board of Directors and Senior Management. Qualifications and Skills:  3-5 years’ experience of in depth data analysis and predictive forecasting with a proven track record of implemented solutions; 2-3 years’ exposure to the Human Resources field would be an asset; Degree or equivalent relevant experience; Formal statistics or actuarial training; Familiar with Human Capital Management Systems (HCM) and Payroll platforms (preferably Ultimate Software, JDE); Advanced expertise in Excel, Word and PowerPoint; Proficient knowledge of general human resource practices, Employment Standards Acts, Human Rights Acts, privacy legislation, Employment Equity, and labour relations; Understands the impacts that Human Resources data and trends have on the larger organization; Attention to detail; Ability to work in a fast pace environment with changing priorities; Working Knowledge of enterprise Reporting and Visualization tools (Tableau, MS Power BI), and; Experience with Programming languages such as R & Python would be an asset.  Our main priority at Parkland is our people. As an employee, you can expect a fair workplace, a professional work environment, competitive compensation, outstanding benefits, and a share in our success through the Employee Share Purchase Plan and our Annual Incentive Plan.  Our preferred method of application is online at www.parkland.ca  We thank all candidates in advance for their interest, however only those being considered will be contacted.  Parkland Fuel Corporation is committed to the principles of Employment Equity.  We strive to provide accessibility in employment to ensure equal access to employment opportunities for candidates, including persons with disabilities. Parkland Fuel Corporation will endeavour to provide accommodation to persons with disabilities in the recruitment process upon request. If you are selected for an interview and you require accommodation due to a disability, please notify us upon scheduling your interview.
Title: People and Culture Analyst

Job_Description: Job Department : Corporate Job Location : Calgary, Alberta About Vista  Recognized as one of Canada’s top employers and Best Managed Companies, Vista Projects is a full service engineering, procurement and project management company serving Western Canada’s oil sands and conventional oil and gas producers for over 30 years. Our continued growth comes from an experienced team of professionals who have an absolute commitment to providing our clients with exceptional service. We specialize in facility engineering design for thermal heavy oil (SAGD, CSS), enhanced oil recovery, and sustaining capital projects. Over the years, we have earned our reputation as a trusted leader in thermal energy projects, working on some of the most successful in-situ heavy oil projects in the oil sands.  Main Duties and Competencies  The Business Intelligence Analyst is responsible for the development and maintenance of the company business intelligence portal, and related business applications. This is a fantastic opportunity for either a tech savvy business graduate, or a business savvy developer to elevate their career.  This role combines business analysis, front-end and back-end development to deliver a challenging and engaging position where the successful candidate will be able to see their contributions come to life within a fast-paced and dynamic workplace.  If a role where you are empowered and supported to move from opportunity identification, through conceptualization, development and testing in weeks and not year’s sounds up your alley read on.  Duties will include: Creative problem solving  Design and develop business intelligence reporting tools, visualizations and applications across all parts of Vista’s business  Maintain and work within Vista’s data warehouse. Participate in the design, development and analysis of the data warehouse  Assist in the selection, deployment and maintenance of third party business applications  Maintain and develop new and legacy code for proprietary business applications  Complete ad-hoc BI reporting for a variety of stakeholders  Document business processes, relationships and software  Design, code and test SQL queries to provide information to internal teams  Identify process improvement opportunities within the organization  Complete data integrity audits  Complete security audits  Other duties as required.  Requirements: Undergraduate degree in one of: Business, Commerce, Accounting, Management Information Systems or Engineering OR post-secondary diploma in Software Development, Web Development  Strong understanding of best-in-class business processes (HR, Accounting, Finance etc…)  Advanced knowledge of relational databases (RDB) and SQL (one of tSQL, MySQL, Postres etc…)  Must be trustworthy, discreet, detail focused and action orientated.  Must be comfortable working autonomously, as well as in a team-development environment. Must be comfortable working with a remote team  Preferred: Demonstrated experience in programming in either PHP or Python  Previous development experience in either Logi Analytics, Tableau, SiSense  Three plus years of post-graduate professional work experience  What We Offer  An opportunity with Vista is not just a job; it is a chance to work with colleagues who are among the most recognized and accomplished in the industry.  Vista offers all employees  A stimulating, fast-paced and challenging work environment where you will contribute to the most successful oil and gas projects in Western Canada;  An opportunity to be a part of an entrepreneurial, technically skilled team which has established leadership in innovative engineering;  A strong value-based philosophy that provides an informal, close-knit team environment, where you and your family feel like a part of our organization, and not just an employee number;  Competitive compensation and benefits, including a performance-linked variable pay program;  Company-sponsored social events and team sports;  Flexible work schedules, half-day Fridays and free parking (excludes downtown office);  An organization that values and encourages diversity;  Shareholder opportunities are a long-term potential for exceptional employees.  How To Apply  Please submit a cover letter concisely demonstrating how your skills and experience align with our job posting.  Note: As part of the interview process there will be a technical testing component which will take up to two hours and can be completed at home on your own timelines. Candidates may be required to complete a security clearance procedure prior to offer.  Last modification : 05/21/2018
Title: Business Intelligence Analyst / Developer

This includes the planning, coordinating and managing of small to medium Business IT projects. Working closely with the users of the system, you will analyze the business requirements and assist with improving business processes while developing and implementing effective and efficient solutions. Title: Senior - Retail Systems Analyst

Job_Description: Business Analyst for Application Development Processes:  full time, 6 month duration, based in Calgary This role provides ownership and oversight of all process development, improvement, and implementation of Software Process Improvement (SPI) based on the CMM framework.A key responsibility of this group is to monitor process metrics in order to identify either problem areas or identify opportunities for process improvement.They are responsible for staffing the SEPG team and providing direction in applying the Process Change Method (PCM) for the account and in training the delivery team.They train the delivery team, begins the implementation, acts as process owner for changes and updates, and plans and leads the IBM tasks of the Software Engineering Institute (SEI) CMM-based assessment.They also engage ADE to perform an effectiveness study when funded and appropriate.Capture business requirements, analysis of requirements, mapping of requirements (As is and To be processes)Particular focus on Windows 10 application Please send your resumes to Danielle Pelletier at daniellep@tes.net.
Title: Business Analyst

Job_Description: *PLEASE NOTE: PREFERENCE WILL BE GIVEN TO CANDIDATES WHO APPLY THROUGH CANFOR.COM/CAREERSCanfor TechnologyAt Canfor, our Information Technology professionals play an important role in the daily functioning of our operations. Consistently pushing the boundaries when it comes to innovation within the forestry and pulp and paper industries, our IT professionals support Canfor in achieving exceptional results.With a high caliber Information Technology leadership team, a clear vision, and significant growth and training opportunities, a career in IT at Canfor allows individuals to strengthen their competencies and grow within their respective roles. Working as an equal partner with our operations to achieve organizational objectives, you will be at the forefront of innovation.Who We Are: Canfor is one of the world’s largest and most respected integrated forest products companies. For more than 75 years, we have been delivering top-quality lumber, pulp and paper products to our valued customers worldwide. With operations in Western Canada and the Southern United States, and sales offices around the world, you can find Canfor products in every corner of the globe. We are leaders in sustainable forest management and in converting wood residuals into green energy.As we continue to grow our company and our markets, find out how you can grow your career with us.The OpportunityThe Data Analyst, Business Intelligence supports Canfor’s objectives by turning data into meaningful information that can be used to make sound business decisions. The Data Analyst will provide expertise in business intelligence to prepare and deliver data and information to internal customers and stakeholders through reports, dashboards and scorecards. It is essential that the Data Analyst build an understanding of the business at a level of detail that enables them to work with the business to deliver valuable information.Please Note:  This is a relocation opportunity in Vancouver, British Columbia. The successful applicant may be provided with relocation assistance.Main ResponsibilitiesRequirements Gathering:Engage with various business units to capture information needs, compare those needs with existing tools and identify gapsParticipate in business requirements workshopsWrite business requirements documents as required to elaborate needs, gain acceptanceDesign & Development:Architect tables and dataDesign dashboards, reports, drill-down analytics and data visualizationsDesign, configure and administer the metadata layerCreate system technical requirements for documentation and knowledge managementActively challenge and find solutions to optimize system performanceTesting, Validation, Release Management:Develop and implement testing strategiesValidate data accuracyDeploy and validate changes in production environmentTraining & Change Management:Support the development of training, documentation, and help desk capabilitiesRequired SkillsBachelor's degree in computer science, information systems, business management or specialized training/certificationExperience working with relational databases (Microsoft SQL Server, Oracle Database, MySQL, etc)Applied knowledge of SQL (T-SQL, PL/SQL, ANSI-SQL, etc)Applied understanding of data modelling and warehousing conceptsWorking knowledge of business intelligence tools such as Oracle Business IntelligenceWorking knowledge of ETL tools such as Oracle Data Integrator or InformaticaExperience mediating and clarifying sometimes ambiguous or conflicting end user requirementsEagerness to learn new concepts and technologies and keep-up-to-date with existing onesWillingness to go above and beyond to understand both the business and technical aspects of a problemHiring for this position is ongoing and will be filled as required. To be considered for this position, please apply today.In order to be eligible for this position, you must be legally entitled to work in Canada for our Company.There has never been a better time to join the Canfor Information Technology team and become a part of the modern forest industry. We have a wide range of rewarding and innovative careers in some of the best communities in North America, with plenty of room for advancement. We offer competitive compensation and benefits packages, and are committed to the professional development of our employees.*PLEASE NOTE: PREFERENCE WILL BE GIVEN TO CANDIDATES WHO APPLY THROUGH CANFOR.COM/CAREERSFollow us on LinkedIn , Twitter , and Facebook for Canfor news, career opportunities, and upcoming events!Vancouver, BCThe city of Vancouver is both a natural beauty and a progressive urban centre, a rare place on earth that is idyllic and electric all at once. With one of Canada’s mildest climates, Vancouver is ideally suited for those devoted to outdoor pursuits, health and wellness. Along with its endless supply of fresh air and clean water, Vancouver also boasts countless choices for culturally diverse, world-class cuisine and an inventory of arts and entertainment events. For more information, visit http://canfor.com/our-company/our-communities/vancouverJob Type: Full-timeEducation:High school or equivalent

Job_Description: Build a meaningful career  At Morneau Shepell, we offer more than career opportunities, we provide career opportunities to make meaningful contributions to people’s lives. The extraordinary expertise of our 4,000-strong workforce is harnessed to support the employees and families of the organizations we serve. Our innovative programs have a lasting impact on the health, financial security and productivity of 20,000 workplaces.  Consultant Health and Benefits  Health & Benefits Solutions  Calgary, AB  Full Time, Permanent  Benefits programs are an important and highly valued part of any employment offering. But understanding how much or what type of benefit coverage is necessary can be difficult. Our client relationship model is consultative and encourages continual communication. By providing you with the resources to support employers in engaging employees in their health, we provide a path to better workforce health and productivity.  Our Consultant works in a team and is responsible for managing, servicing and providing quality benefits consulting services for small to medium sized clients. In addition, they will be responsible for helping to build business with existing clients as well as attracting and supporting new clients through our association partnerships.  Responsibilities include:  Business Development  Identify and manage cross-sell opportunities Develop strategic relationships with key account contacts and introduce Morneau Shepell team members as appropriate Supervise the complete employee benefits cycle: plan design, provider search, implementation, experience monitoring, renewal rating Develop new business with existing clients and assists in obtaining new business with prospective clients focusing on our key association partnerships Understand client needs and identify company or industry products or services that can meet these needs Service  Deliver presentations to clients; conduct client meetings and the occasional employee presentation. Ensure that quality control and service standards are attained with every transaction Negotiate, problem solve and maintain positive relationships with insurers, external advisors and internal underwriting and benefits administration departments Develop and maintain excellent relationships with clients, through regular telephone contact and office visits Understand the client’s perspective and priorities, and work with the client to resolve administrative issues Establish strategies for services that meet client needs  Administration  Provide and oversee direct day-to-day support for clients by phone, e-mail, letters, formal reports, and face-to-face meetings Lead and manage multiple client assignments and projects Manage special projects as required Peer review the work of analysts Knowledge  Maintain current knowledge of industry trends including insurer news, products, legislation, and cost trends as well as current knowledge of our company's products and services  Qualifications:  Experience  Five years of experience in group benefits. Preference will be given to those from the group insurance industry, a consulting firm or brokerage or in an HR department. Education  Post-secondary education GBA (CEBS) designation, or working towards it. Life Insurance license (this will be a requirement within 3 months of onboarding) Skills  Strong presentation skills and comfort speaking in front of large groups Understanding of consultative selling and the ability to manage the sales cycle effectively and autonomously Expert negotiation, technical and analytical skills Can effectively communicate complex concepts in plain written and spoken language Professional Traits  Exceptional customer focus; some would say you’re the best Extremely organized self-starter, flexible, highly independent Ability to manage multiple deadlines simultaneously Proven collaborative team member with the ability to motivate and inspire team members  Morneau Shepell Morneau Shepell is in the business of helping organizations help their people because we believe that engaged people are the driving force for society. Every day, the expertise of our almost 4,000 employees is recognized as essential to the financial security, health, and productivity of our clients and their people. We're always looking for talented professionals and strategic leaders who will listen and work together with colleagues and clients to form long-term relationships and to deliver integrative solutions that fit. As we continue to grow, we're presently engaging with exceptional candidates interested in a range of exciting career opportunities. At www.morneaushepell.com you can explore our careers page to learn more about the solutions we deliver and the great people who help us do it. Follow us on LinkedIn and Twitter (Morneau_Shepell, Shepell). We are thankful for your interest, but unfortunately, we can only personally connect with those selected for an interview.  INDCAD LI-PH1  Job Grade: MS4   Fulfilling work that matters  Morneau Shepell is in the business of helping organizations help their people and in the process, we strive to elevate ours.  We're always looking for talented professionals and strategic leaders looking to make a difference in the lives of the people we serve.  We appreciate the interest of every applicant; however, we contact only those selected for an interview.  Find your fit with us. Follow us on LinkedIn, Youtube and Twitter.

Job_Description: Our Client requires a development and analyst dedicated to determination and implementation of services and information solutions. The primary focus of this position is to perform guidance, consultation and operational support to information consumers on Data Management needs in an Enterprise Data Warehouse environment. Additionally, to determine and implement Enterprise Data Warehouse solutions that service business and analytic objectives. Understanding of information management concepts and terminology.  Understanding of OLAP (On-Line Analytical Processing) concepts and technology.  Knowledge and experience with a business intelligence project life cycle.  Customer service, leadership, problem solving and decision making skills. Title: Data Analyst

Job_Description: In this role, you will provide technology support to Macquarie’s internal staff. You can expect your customer support efforts to be 70% on the phone, 20% via email and 10% via walk-up.  Functional Responsibilities  Customer facing, technical support, focused on Workplace technologies listed below. Log incidents and requests for continued problem resolution and tracking. Maintain direct contact with users through the lifecycle of an incident or request. Call out to users and otherwise follow-up with them directly for more complex issues. Collaborate with domestic and international technology teams in order to drive issue resolution on behalf of customers. Contribute to Technology projects as required. Examples include office moves and phone testing. Occasional domestic travel required. Desired Technology Support Capabilities  Windows 7 PC support via phone, email and remote assistance tools. Microsoft Office 2013, Office 365. Experience with Microsoft Active Directory. Mobility device support: iPhones and iPads. Remote Support Tools such as RDP and Remote Assistance. Support of Citrix based applications. Support of video conferencing technologies. Experience with a ticketing tool such as Remedy or ServiceNow. Familiarity with MacOS. Desired Business Capabilities  Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Ability to tailor communication style to fit the audience and situation. Polished, mature, confident phone support skills. Commitment to delivering to the client within the boundaries of policies and procedures as they exist in a highly regulated industry such as Financial Services. Willingness to ‘own’ and be accountable for problems through resolution. Ability to perform effectively in a high pressure situations when faced with urgent issues or distressed customers. Ability to multi-task and prioritize with minimal supervision. Ability to balance high volume productivity and high quality demands in the form of first call resolutions. Possess a Continuous Improvement mindset by viewing current processes and procedures as opportunities for enhancement, tuning and improvement. Empathetic appreciation for different cultures and diverse points of view in the work place. Desired Experience  University degree in computer science or engineering, or equivalent work experience. Experience providing technology support to a global customer. Experience working as part of a global Technology support team. Experience providing formal phone support in a Help Desk, Service Desk or Call Center environment. The Corporate Operations Group (COG) brings together specialist support services including workplace, human resources, market operations and technology. COG's purpose is to drive operational excellence through business-aligned services with a focus on quality, cost and risk. COG comprises the following divisions: Business Improvement and Strategy, Business Services, Human Resources, Market Operations, and Technology.  Find out more about Macquarie careers at www.macquarie.com/careers  Accommodation is available to all applicants to Macquarie, including during recruitment, selection and assessment processes. Please notify the recruiter listed on this posting if you require accommodation at any stage of the recruitment process. Access to Macquarie’s Accessibility policies is available at www.macquarie.ca  We facilitate a range of flexible working arrangements within our teams. Talk to us about what flexibility may be available.
Title: Tech Assist Analyst

Job_Description: Summary Precision Drilling recently completed a large project to re-implement our 20+year old SAP system on the latest S/4 HANA platform. To support and continue to build on this investment we are looking for a candidate with strong experience in one or more of the following areas to join the team – Enterprise Asset Management, Sales & Distribution, Supply Chain Management, Health-Safety & Environment, Management of Change Reporting to the Director of Business Systems Integration, the IT ERP Functional Analyst will design, implement, deploy, and sustain SAP functional solutions to achieve defined business goals Responsibilities Act as subject matter expert for one or more of the SAP Logistics areas and business processes (SD, PM, MM, EH&S, MOC), and providing system and data support for the business process execution Maintain skills in SAP applications process design and configuration Maintain skills in SAP applications process design and configuration; SAP application design, development, integration, testing and deployment; and application technical architecture. Collect, analyze and document business process and functional requirements in both current and future-state Perform gap analysis between current and future state scenarios, implementation planning including development of implementation roadmaps Identify opportunities for and provide recommendations on business process improvements Lead test strategy development and facilitate sessions with technical staff and business team members to execute test cases Communicate effectively with business users and internal teams to deliver functional requirements, assist with documentation, create process maps, etc. Assist in the development of communications, training, and job aids to support change management activities for any projects or initiatives Develop and maintain strong relationships with business users and internal team members Motivate, communicate, and leverage skills and competencies of individuals within the business unit(s) supported Assist Project Manager(s) with project schedule development and maintenance Utilize expertise in project management, process improvement, metrics, requirements management, information technology, and understanding of the organization’s systems and capabilities to ensure the most efficient use of resources  Knowledge & Skills Eagerness to contribute in a team-oriented environment Self-starter who is able to work in a fast paced, results driven environment Ability to work creatively and analytically in a problem-solving environment Strong interpersonal skills, especially interviewing skills. Excellent communication (written and verbal) Superior organization skills and attention to detail Self-confident to make suggestions for process improvement and issue resolution Strong focus on delivery and quality; ability to ensure quality and accuracy of deliverables, with a focus on attention to detail Large / complex implementation experience is a plus Solid understanding of SAP is a must for the success of this role. Strong expertise in one or more of the following areas: SD, MM, PM, EHS, MOC  Education University / college degree or equivalent experience plus 3 years SAP analyst experience Experience Experience working within the oil and gas industry an asset Experience in process analysis, training material development and testing
Title: SAP Functional Analyst - Operations

Job_Description: DIFFERENT BY DESIGN At MNP we pride ourselves on being different – it’s our entrepreneurial drive that sets us apart. It’s the same drive that’s helped us become Canada’s fastest growing national firm. We foster collaboration, value your ideas, promote based on talent, live balanced lifestyles and make time for FUN. We are one firm, one team, collaborating to support you wherever you want to take your career.  Join the momentum. We are seeking an Analyst for our growing Enterprise Risk Services team. Protecting businesses’ best interests, MNP is a leading national accounting, tax and business consulting firm in Canada. Our recognized Enterprise Risk team helps identify, evaluate and manage risk exposure to protect a company’s reputation and assets. Specifically, our Enterprise Risk Management team helps organizations reduce uncertainty and seize new opportunities to increase stakeholder value.   RESPONSIBILITIES AND QUALIFICATIONS  Performance Expectations Work with project team to determine client needs, develop plans to meet the requirements, develop methodology to execute the project, and develop timelines for project execution. Engage in continuous knowledge development regarding rules, regulations, best practices, tools, techniques and performance standards of various sectors. Execute transactions through the provision of client services including planning, budgeting, scheduling and coordinating engagements. Facilitate collaboration with client engagement team prior to commencement of client work to discuss roles and responsibilities, risk areas, materiality and deadlines. Identify ways to maximize the relationship with clients and deliver added value Communicate (written and verbal) findings and recommendations to clients through the preparation of reports, presentations, and other deliverables. Coordinate with Project Manager regarding the status of the work-in-progress and provide feedback where necessary. Assist in the planning for and development of proposals, engagement letters, and other sales activities. Monitor project timelines against targets, adjust where necessary; advise clients of project status. Assist in the execution of Business Resilience Services projects, including but not limited to: Assist in the preparation of documentation for Risk Assessments, Emergency Plans/Procedures, Business Impact Analysis, Business Continuity Plans, Crisis Communication Plans, Crisis Management Plans, Exercises and Audits. Participate in client meetings to capture findings. Assist in the execution of Enterprise Risk Management (ERM) projects, including but not limited to: Implementation of ERM programs for clients, including ERM Framework and tool design. Risk Assessments, including facilitation of risk identification and assessment workshops, developing risk registers. Developing risk appetite and risk tolerance statements and metrics. ERM Maturity Assessments, including assessing clients’ ERM programs, benchmarking against leading practice, and developing implementation plans, reports and other deliverables. Network and take a leadership role in the local professional, business, and community while raising awareness of MNP and looking for new business development opportunities. Contribute to the development of new ideas and approaches to improve work processes. Promote regular attendance, balanced lifestyle and high standard of team wellness. Attend internal MNP courses to further develop knowledge around performance improvement. Credentials Some experience, including completion in course related to Enterprise Risk Management and / or Business Resilience program components including Emergency Response, Emergency Management, Business Continuity, Crisis Communication, and IT Disaster Recovery is an asset. Must have excellent analytical, organizational, interpersonal, verbal, and written communication skills to effectively engage client and support the planning and execution of projects. Highly motivated, committed, self-starter who can prioritize work, multi-task, and cope with changing priorities. Strong customer service orientation and the ability to build positive business relationships. Enthusiasm, capacity, and willingness to expand general business knowledge (finance, legal, HR, IT, etc.) and general industry knowledge (across various industries, including oil and gas, education, manufacturing, public sector, not-for-profit) through formal and informal means to ensure long term success in this role. Must be able to work in a team and coordinate with colleagues to meet project objectives. Flexibility and strong problem-solving skills, as required to meet client needs. Strong analytical, organizational, and decision-making skills. Strong verbal / written communications. Possess a Certified Business Continuity Planner (CBCP) certification or equivalent certifications and/or experience is an asset. Enterprise Risk Management Certification is an asset. Experience in general management consulting is an asset. Administrative skills, with effectiveness in managing time, developing tasks, and managing resources. Proficiency in MS Office Suite (e.g. Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Visio). Strong formatting skills are an asset. Some travel is required. Core Competencies and Personal Characteristics Integrity – professional whose honesty, integrity, confidentiality and high ethical standards contributes to effective leadership and optimal business relationships Energy – displays enthusiasm, optimism, drive and passion while maintaining a high level of productivity and a balanced lifestyle Diversity – understands the importance of different backgrounds, perspectives and experiences and is respectful of individual differences Communication – effectively expresses ideas and conveys information in business writing, conversations and interactions with others Client Service Excellence – understands the importance of quality client service by being courteous, responding to client requests in a timely manner and monitoring satisfaction Teamwork & Relationship Development – works collaboratively with team members in order to achieve a common goal and develops, maintains and strengthens relationships with others, both inside and outside the Firm Accountability – takes responsibility for one’s own performance by setting clear goals and tracking progress against those goals; is highly organized and uses personal judgement and decision making Flexibility – effectively manages multiple assignments, adapts to changing priorities and is able to work independently or as part of a team TOTAL REWARDS MNP encourages a balanced lifestyle and offers benefits that suit the way our team members work and play! In addition to a competitive salary, our total rewards package includes paid personal days, wellness program initiatives, health and dental benefits, a group pension plan with matching contribution, firm sponsored social events, and professional development assistance.  MNP proudly serves and responds to the needs of our clients in the public, private and not-for-profit sectors. Through partner-led engagements, we provide a collaborative, cost-effective approach to doing business, with innovative strategies to help organizations succeed across the country and around the world.
Title: Analyst, Enterprise Risk Services

Job_Description: The Credit Analyst is responsible for reviewing and assessing counterparty credit, proposing credit limits for customers, monitoring credit exposures, providing accurate and timely credit reporting for internal business units and insurance providers and ensuring the Credit Policy is being followed. ACCOUNTABILITIES: Maintain a portfolio of counterparties and monitor credit quality on an on-going basis Complete credit reviews for counterparties and recommend credit limits in line with the credit policy in a timely manner Monitor counterparty credit and take action on high risk customers in a timely manner Collect, research and analyze financial and market data from external credit agencies reports and articles from the financial press, internet and other relevant sources to identify high risk credit issues Coordinate the preparation of legal documentation including confidentiality agreements, parental guarantees and netting agreements with internal and external stakeholders (e.g. internal counsel, the business unit and the counterparty) Liaise with traders/business units and managers on credit matters Support the preparation of credit reporting deliverables for management on an ongoing basis, including Credit Committee presentations and audit committee materials Work with external lenders to prepare letters of credit requests and coordinate with external lenders and customers Make recommendations and coordinate credit inbound requests to Gibson from our customers (e.g. review request, provide information and coordinate providing financial assurance as required) Provide cash management support for the Treasury team as needed, including providing vacation back up coverage for primary analyst Proactively identify trends or patterns in information, draw conclusions and make recommendations based on implications of data Demonstrate a commitment to continual improvement including identifying opportunities to enhance processes and create efficiencies Provides advice and guidance to colleagues when required Support other activities across the treasury and capital markets finance functions on an ad hoc basis, as required (e.g. Treasury, Corporate Finance) Demonstrate a personal commitment and proactive approach to Health, Safety, Security & Environment (HSS&E) through participation in all applicable HSS&E programs and ensure safe operation of the branch, team or unit and compliance with all Company HSS&E policies and procedures KEY SKILLS: Complete all required reporting accurately and timely Strong quantitative skills focused on financial analysis, accounting and financial theory Strong written and verbal communication skills Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously while maintaining a high standard of work Ability to excel under pressure amid demanding deadlines Ability to perform effectively in a team environment Demonstrated ability to quickly adapt to new situations QUALIFICATIONS: Two to five years of relevant, full time work experience Undergraduate degree in Business Administration or Commerce with a finance focus Treasury, credit or corporate finance experience is considered an asset Strong financial/analytical skills, excellent communication abilities Possess exceptional proficiency with MS Office, particularly Excel and PowerPoint Please note: all employment offers are contingent upon completion of satisfactory background check, which, depending upon the position and function you are applying for, may include the following: criminal background check, employment references, employment verification, credit inquiry check and education/credential verification.
Title: Credit Analyst
