Job_Description: SQL Report Writer / Dev Support Analyst Reports to  Manager of Information Technology  About International Fitness Holdings  International Fitness Holdings (IFH) is the parent company of World Health, Spa Lady and Bankers Hall Club. With 17 locations in Calgary and Edmonton, we have been inspiring Albertans to live a healthy and active lifestyle for the last 30 years.  Location  This position is based out the IFH head office located in North West Calgary (Edgemont).  Summary  The SQL Report Writer and Support (IT) position is a fantastic opportunity for a candidate that is beginning or in the early stages of their career. The successful candidate will perform a variety of data analysis and development tasks against our relational databases and produce detailed findings that will drive key business decisions. Analysis will be in the form of reports built using Microsoft Excel, SQL Server, and SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS). Additionally, the successful candidate will demonstrate an interest in applications development, programming and support. They will become an expert on our club management software as they will be required to configure and support the application on a regular basis, thereby ensuring that it is addressing the organization’s needs.  Key Accountabilities  Acquiring and transforming raw data into meaningful and useful information for ad hoc and ongoing business needs. Working closely with the senior staff in gathering requirements for analysis and reporting. Responsible for requirement analysis, design, development, and deployment of business intelligence and analytical solutions. Communicating findings of analysis in non-technical language. Working with the operational group to understand current and historical business practices.Member Experience SQL database development and internal applications support. Maintaining and updating club management software. Serving as a Subject Matter Expert (SME) for club management software related inquiries. Other duties as assigned. Required Experience  A diploma or certificate in Computer Science or Business Intelligence and Analytics’ or Information Technologies or equivalent experience. Must be adept at queries and/or report writing – T-SQL, and SQL Server Reporting Services. Have exposure to modern programming languages such as Java, C#, etc Must love data analysis and finding out the ‘truth’ through rigorous and in-depth research and analytics. Experience writing reports using SQL Server Reporting Services and Microsoft Excel (macro development / VB scripting). Experience in Business Intelligence projects including Financial Data analysis would be an asset. Proficiency in summarizing analytics and conclusion according to the audience. Strong interpersonal and communication skills to interact with different levels and types of users. Understanding stakeholder’s business requirements and transforming these requirements into meaningful information and reporting. Strong multi-tasking and prioritization skills, with minimal supervision, for an ever-changing, fast paced environment. Benefits  Health, Dental, Paramedical (Massage, Chiropractor, etc.) for full-time employees. Complimentary gym membership for yourself and a friend or family member. Career advancement opportunities. Community involvement and philanthropy. Due the volume of candidates, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.
Title: SQL Report Writer / Dev Support Analyst

Job_Description: H&R Block, the leader in the tax preparation industry, is looking for a Systems Analyst to join its fast-paced and dynamic Information Technology team. The location for this great opportunity is Calgary, AB.  Becoming an H&R Block associate means more than just a paycheque; it’s an opportunity to grow with the strongest brand in the Tax Preparation industry. We are looking for people who want to help us look at peoples’ lives through tax and find ways to help. We know that the ability to deliver outstanding client service starts with having the best talent on our team, and if you want to be part of our success story then we want to hear from you!  We have proudly served clients in Canada for over 50 years, constantly evolving to meet our clients’ ever-changing needs. From our digital solutions to our offices, we constantly seek new ways to create frictionless and memorable client experiences.  The Opportunity:  We are looking for a Systems Analyst to implement and improve our IT systems in our branch offices. You will analyze system requirements and address any relevant problems. You will also perform standard testing and provide solutions to ensure high levels of performance and security.  To do well in this role you should have a thorough knowledge of modern computer systems, networking, and applications, and be able to quickly collect data to back up decisions.  Duties and Responsibilities:  Analyzing systems hardware and software problems and developing technical solutions Analyzing complex business problems and assessing how automated systems can be implemented to solve them Gathering data and analyzing business and user needs in consultation with both business managers and end users Translating user and/or systems requirements into functional technical specifications Formulating and defining the objectives and scope of business systems Making recommendations on hardware and software procurement to support business goals Providing IT support for regulatory and compliance activities Conduct testing to ensure that the systems work as expected Writing and maintaining detailed systems documentation and train system’s end users Investigating, diagnosing and solving computer software and hardware faults Help the support team with installing and configuring computer hardware, software, systems, networks, printers and scanners. Acting as a liaison between developers and end users to ensure technical compatibility and satisfaction Key Qualifications:  Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or equivalent combination of education and work experience Five (5) years experience in a technical capacity Strong conceptual and analytical skills – demonstrating outside-the-box problem solving skills Strong critical thinker with problem solving aptitude Ability to effectively communicate, both orally and in writing, complex technical information so that the intended audience understands the context and content of the information Demonstrated knowledge and experience with Microsoft operating systems, active directory, system security and scripting (primarily PowerShell, but also VB Script) Working knowledge of infrastructure including servers, storage, firewalls, routers, VPN, etc Experience with an incident management software, preferably ServiceNow Hands’ on experience using applications such as Microsoft Word, Excel, and Outlook If you meet the skills and qualifications required for this great opportunity, and are truly passionate about leading business initiatives, we invite you to send your cover letter stating compensation expectations along with your resume to employment.opportunities@hrblock.ca.  Successful candidates must have legal authorization to work in Canada on a full-time basis for any employer. Only those candidates selected for interview will be contacted.  H&R Block Canada welcomes and encourages applications from people from all backgrounds, including people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the recruitment and selection process. Back to careers page
Title: Systems Analyst

Job_Description: IT Systems Support Ananlyst | Calgary, AB  KEY RESPONSIBILITIES AND ACCOUNTABILITIES : The Intermediate IT Systems Analyst must experience working in Enterprise IT environments and have a proven track record of implementing new technology. In addition, can demonstrate superior problem solving and technical analytical skills. Proven ability to operate in high pressure situations, successfully handle multiple priorities and possess a high level of discipline while remaining flexible. They must possess exceptional people skills dealing with all levels of the company.  Responsibilities include network administration and troubleshooting, mentorship of Technical Support Analysts, systems administration in a variety of environments, telecom administration and efficient IT project delivery.  DUTIES: Network Administration  Second level end user support for all Corporate IT  End user training (Office 365, WebEx, etc.)  Laptop/Desktop builds and Software deployment  Providing after hours support as needed to users and to support IT initiatives  Provide administrative support for the Shoretel phone system (setup, configuration and maintenance)  Travel may be required  REQUIRED KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES: Good communication skills, written and oral  Strong knowledge of Network and IT Security Fundamentals, Palo Alto Networks and Cisco technology experience required.  Strong knowledge of Operating Systems (Windows XP/7/8/2003/2008/2012)  Experience with Office 365 Administration  Experience with end-user and back-end Citrix support (Netscaller/XenApp)  Experience with Exchange 2010/2013  Remote desktop support (VNC, RDP, TeamViewer and Bomgar)  Strong command line skills (scripting experience an asset)  Hardware (Dell DRAC, NGFW, Networking, etc)  SharePoint experience an asset  Experience with VOIP specifically with Shoretel phone systems  MDM experience is an asset (iOS, Android, BES, Windows Phone, AirWatch, InTune)  EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE: 4 year degree in MIS or Computer Science or equivalent experience  5 yrs supporting users in small and medium business  Merger/acquisition experience a plus  TRAVEL REQUIREMENT: Ability to travel within Canada and USA. >1
Title: IT Systems Support Analyst

Backed by our entrepreneurial spirit, passion and commitment to great customer service and satisfaction, we have acquired a portfolio in excess of 6000 apartments since our inception in 2006 and are continuing with this aggressive growth plan. To support this growth we are seeking to welcome the right candidate into our family. Our people are our unique business advantage. Avenue Living Communities, a fast-paced, fast-growing owner and operator of apartment buildings in Western Canada, is seeking an IS & Technical Support Analyst to join our team. Backed by our entrepreneurial spirit, passion and commitment to great customer service and satisfaction, we have acquired a portfolio in excess of 6000 apartments since our inception in 2006 and are continuing with this aggressive growth plan. To support this growth we are seeking to welcome the right candidate into our family. Our people are our unique business advantage. Set-up and configure devices to be used by employees; ensures all new hires are provided with the necessary IT equipment. Ability to multi-task, prioritize and adjust quickly in a rapidly changing environment; High attention to detail and organization; Our commitment is to our people…because it is our people that decide our direction through hard work, a passion for customer service and always keeping in mind that we are part of a team. There is no end date for this posting, we will keep looking for the very best candidate to join the avenue living family.  ***Only those candidates determined to be fully qualified for the position noted above will be contacted for interviews. avenue living is an equal opportunity employer and encourages applications from all qualified individuals. avenue livings hiring policy is to recruit and select the best applicant for employment solely on the basis of their qualifications for the position. avenue living does not discriminate against applicants based on race, national or ethnic origin, colour, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, marital status, family status, disability or a conviction for which a pardon has been granted
Title: IS & Technical Support Analyst

Job_Description: Calgary, AB  Job Summary  Business analysts are responsible for identifying the business needs of their clients and stakeholders, and to determine solutions to business problems. As a translator between the users and the IT group, he or she elicits, analyzes, validates and documents business, organizational and/or operational requirements. The Business Analyst can perform tasks with help. The Business Analyst is part of the business solution team and reports to the Application Delivery Manager.  Finance Background preferably in Real Estate (Retail Lease and REM applications) including property holdings is preferred.  Looking for a BA that has strong business acumen as well as understanding of technical. This person must be a self-starter and can be flexible when necessary (ie: switching gears to other deliverables due to prioritization changes).  Requirements gathering acumen is very important  Process Mapping – technical  Functional design and testing  Responsibilities  Elicit Requirements: Assists in requirements gathering using a variety of basic techniques. Done through interviews, surveys, and historical data.  Create Business Requirements Document: Analyzes, classifies and documents requirements using the Business Requirements Document outline to manage the requirements according to their source.  Structured Analysis: Identifies and clarifies requirements using basic conceptual and logical process/data modeling techniques. Done through business process, workflow, and data flow modeling; functional decomposition diagrams; development of entity relationship diagrams (static); and simple use case diagrams.  Testing: Demonstrates knowledge of test strategies, plans, and execution through setting up a requirements coverage matrix.  End User Support: Provides day-to-day support of end users through service desk support processes.  Business / IT Fluency: Displays to peers, technology team, and clients a basic understanding of business and IT concepts. Done by working with clients and developers/administrators to develop as-is and to-be states of products from a systems perspective.  Business Process Analysis: Identifies which business modeling tools are appropriate for the task at hand. Done through use case modeling techniques, workflow modeling, and business process modeling.  Change Agency: Understands process and issues inherent in change management and plans  accordingly; instills confidence and trust in others; coordinates resources across departments/units; evaluates measures, plans and deliverables for alignment; acknowledges individual’s responses to change and helps them adjust.  Create Functional Specification Document: Assists in the design specifications. Done through analyzing the current system design and proposed changes to the design.  Build Business Relationships: Engages with business owners from affected business areas to understand current processes and document business requirements. Done by assisting with the creation of business process decomposition diagrams and documenting business requirements.  Required Skills and Experience  Experience: Must have 5+ years’ experience of IT experience.  Must have 2+ years’ experience in Business Analysis practice  Must have proven proficiency / mastery of basic Business Analyst competencies  Must have experience with package (COTS) customization and deployment  Experience with Finance, Real Estate, or Leasing is desired.  Experience in (Retail, Wholesale Distribution, CPG, etc.) is an asset  Experience in Data Retrieval & Analysis from application databases is an asset.  Knowledge of ITIL Framework and IT Service Management (ITSM) is an asset  Knowledge of both traditional waterfall and Agile project methodologies is an asset.  Practical knowledge and experience working with Agile roles and artifacts, and Scrum processes is an asset.  Peoplesoft experience is an asset  Skills Required: Communication: Ability to formulate concepts; communication of technical information to a non-technical audience; communication of business information to a technical audience.  Business: Knowledge of business processes; ability to have a business-oriented vision; case development; business writing; modeling techniques.  Analytical: analytical and conceptual expertise; documentation, analysis and business requirements management techniques; object-oriented analysis; evaluation of profitability/risk; testing, verification and validation techniques.  Desired Behaviors  Thinking (Analytical, Systemic, Creative): Identifies and integrates the critical elements of a situation, making correct inferences from data; breaks complex problems into component parts and organizes the parts in a systematic way; uses innovation to develop novel solutions; explains to others how to understand / approach complicated problems.  Professional Knowledge: Continually enhances knowledge and skills to keep abreast of industry changes, developments and emerging issues; understands what it takes to be successful in this business; has a thorough knowledge of organization’s mission, history, stakeholders and customers.  Builds Trust and Credibility by consistently adhering to the organization’s business principles and values. Is seen as direct, truthful, and trustworthy by co-workers, vendors, and customers.  Committed to results by taking personal responsibility for achieving mutually agreed upon individual/team objectives.  Demonstrates a desire to help and serve internal/external customers to meet their needs. Is proactive, responsive, and focused on discovering, anticipating, and exceeding the customer’s needs.  Works collaboratively and cooperatively with others to achieve shared goals and objectives. Considers the wider team, function, banner or the organization and takes action or makes decisions which support the success of those groups.  Recovers quickly after change, disruptions, or mistakes and can remain productive and focused. Is adaptable and can apply lessons learned in one situation to another situation. Job_Description: Analyst, Risk Analytics AltaGas is an energy infrastructure business with a focus on natural gas, power, and regulated utilities. We have, and continue to build, a solid portfolio of assets to serve producers and to provide clean and affordable energy to our customers. We continuously strive to build dynamic teams to support our future growth. We provide opportunity, challenge and competitive compensation within a positive work environment that motivates people to build careers within our company. AltaGas’ success is driven by a skilled team of more than 1700 employees. Rapid expansion of our business has created a wide range of career opportunities for qualified individuals. If you want to work for a company that offers work/life balance, financial assistance to support continuous learning and growth, and that has a solid track record of success with an achievement-oriented organizational culture, AltaGas may be the right company for you. Reporting to the Manager Risk Analytics this position is responsible for developing enhanced measurement of market exposures, prices, and overall risk for AltaGas’ portfolio of commodity transactions, and enhancing the existing reporting to encompass our growing business. Responsibilities of the position include, but are not limited to the following: Working collaboratively with Front, Middle, and Back office to ensure accurate valuation and reporting of transactions Hands-on approach to Commodity Risk, taking a lead role in developing price models and price validation tools for commodity markets across North America Analyzing internal and external market data and creating concise explanatory visuals and presentations Collecting and analyzing data to support valuation models for prospective transactions Developing tools to reconcile AltaGas’ commodity transaction exposure, position, and P&L Ad hoc projects relating to AltaGas’ commodity transactions and prospective transactions Utilizing analytical tools to assess future commodity risks Creating and documenting commodity transaction valuation models Explaining commodity market movements and drivers Working within ETRM systems or other transactional data systems  Required Skills and Competencies: Undergraduate degree in a quantitative discipline like Mathematics, Statistics, Finance, Economics, or Engineering. Three to five years of experience in a Front or Middle Office role dealing in Natural Gas, Power, or NGL markets Solid understanding of advanced market risk modelling techniques including option models, volatility measures, VaR, back-testing, stress scenarios, etc. Ability to work independently and to collaborate as part of a team, while managing a volatile work load Advanced skills in Excel and other business applications Ability to effectively query SQL databases to extract required information Experience with high-level programming languages (Java, C#, Python, etc.) is an asset Experience with Allegro software is an asset Qualified applicants are invited to submit their resumes and accompanying cover letters in confidence to the Human Resources Department by visiting the link below. We thank all applicants for their interest in our organization, but only those candidates selected for interviews will be contacted. No agency referrals or telephone inquiries at this time, please.
Title: Analyst, Risk Analytics

Job_Description: Are you passionate about making a difference in the world? Do you want to act as a catalyst helping to infuse a culture of goodness? Have you been a technical product manager, senior developer, software architect, engineering manager or just have some great experience working with business and technology? We may have just the right role for you! As Benevity’s Technical Product Analyst, you’ll be responsible for providing technical expertise to internal stakeholders and clients, while liaising with an outsourced team of passionate engineers and business analysts.  In this role, you’ll be expected to use your product and technical knowledge to provide input and guidance on the product roadmap, advocating for “back end” investment areas. You’ll be Benevity’s resident in-house expert and troubleshooter for the technical aspects of the product. You’ll support our implementation, services, and sales teams with your deep understanding of the system and the data it collects.  Who we are  Better Work and a Better World: at Benevity that’s what we’re all about. We’re a software company in the business of doing good, building better ways for companies to connect with their customers and employees around causes - we make “doing well by doing good” more than just a tagline. We’re growing fast and looking for more great people to join us.  We’re not Bono, just a passionate crew of workhorses out to change the world. We have that fun, flexible tech culture that people love (ok, some people – you know who you are!) – and we have a heart. We’re a registered B Corporation, which means we’re part of a new breed of companies committed to higher social and environmental standards.  You’ll join a dedicated, passionate team that creates innovative solutions for our raving fans (er, clients). And you’ll get to rub shoulders with some of the most iconic and notable companies and charities in the world to help them make a difference (in even better ways). Our entrepreneurial environment appeals to self-driven, flexible team players who learn quickly, aren’t afraid to tackle hard problems and don’t mind wearing jeans to work. Sound cool? Join us!  What You Will Do   Leverage your knowledge of the product and expertise to derive an optimal solution. Assess and analyze business strategy, market requirements, current state, and technology choices to evaluate and recommend solution alternatives. Lead elicitation activities and author documentation of the system, architecture, and processes. Bring outsourced knowledge in-house. Understand (and document) the system from a data security, compliance, and infrastructure operations perspective. Oversee the relationship with our development outsource partner. Liaise between outsource partner and Operations, ensuring smooth deployments and stable performance. Conduct decision, business rules, and risk analysis. Work closely with Product Management to ensure a balanced backlog of work that addresses technical debt, reduces operational friction, and designs for the future. Identify opportunities to expand the application of the technology. Assist in analysis / troubleshooting of issues. Support Sales and Marketing during the RFP process.  What You Bring   An analytical mindset; people have said you have a gift for seeing how seemingly disparate and unrelated events or processes are related Strong written and verbal communication skills, able to communicate with both technical and business audiences Demonstrable .NET experience including development, code analysis with debug / troubleshooting, and interpretation (to determine the underlying business logic and function of an existing piece of code). Data and process modelling. Use case diagrams and entity relationship diagrams should be old hat. Experience with end-to-end software development projects, preferably using a variety of different software development methodologies Experience working with relational databases, BI/Reporting, ETL and integration projects Experience managing (or at least working closely with) outsourced development teams Background in computer science, engineering or related field A passion for the Benevity mission  What You Can Expect   Enjoy a fast-paced environment, with a history of proven success in a dynamic, rapidly growing company. Demonstrate extraordinary time-management skills and organizational capabilities. Be an innovative thinker, keen to be part of a growing company that is all about helping businesses do things differently to get better returns on their social good programs. B uild trust, value others, communicate effectively, drive execution, foster innovation. Focus on the client, collaborate with others, solve problems creatively and demonstrate high integrity. Professional internal and external relationships that meet company core values.  It is our hope and belief that you apply because you believe the same things we do – that global Goodness is an achievable goal! While we sincerely appreciate the time and effort you put into your application, unfortunately only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.
Title: Technical Product Analyst (.Net)

Job_Description: Reporting to the Manager Information Technology, the IT Project Manager oversees one large project or performs a blended Project Manager / Business Analyst role on smaller projects. They will perform the role through to final implementation, ensuring the successful delivery of assigned projects in a timely, cost efficient, structured and consistent manner. This role requires strong project management, analytical, business process improvement, and inter-personnel skills. Coordinating the definition and formalized acceptance of the project scope Using formal methods to control changes to project scope Creating project schedule to enable the project team to realistically build project deliverables per the customer’s requirements and within the imposed constraints of time and budget Identifying and requesting project resources Managing the day to day aspects of the project Mentoring project team members as required Work with functional Managers / Team Leads to arrive at optimum solutions Managing and reporting status of deliverables, schedule, budget, risks and issues Creating and distributing project status reports to relevant stakeholders Identifying, managing and escalating issues and risks in a timely manner Identifying the need and possibly managing the training of end users Working with the business to clearly and accurately define their business needs and detailed requirements Identifying opportunities for business process improvements as well as proposing options for those improvements and facilitating their implementation where possible Working with IT technical resources to ensure that the business needs and requirements are understood and facilitating clarifications when needed Ensuring quality control activities are executed Delivering the end product to production in accordance with established process Qualifications  Degree or Diploma in Computer Science or equivalent combination of education and experience 5+ years IT Project Management experience 10+ years’ experience in a combination of business systems analysis, project management, and software development Experience in process definition, improvement and re-engineering. Exposure to a wide range of technologies including systems designed for field users as well as solid knowledge of ERP Systems, databases and systems integration. Ability to work independently and as a part of a team and manage multiple tasks in an ever-changing environment. Able to work with different client types to understand their needs, identify root causes of problems, and implement creative and pragmatic solutions. Ability to develop rapport with various client groups and personalities and maintain strong working relationships. Experience with various project delivery methodologies (waterfall, agile etc) Strong project management/business analyst and inter-personal skills Excellent oral and written communication skills and the ability to clearly articulate to all project members and stakeholders Ability to work independently and as a part of a team and manage multiple projects in a fast-paced, dynamic environment Comfortable working with and mentoring business analysts, technical team members and business users Experience with package implementation and vendor relationships Oilfield experience, specifically in the Energy Services sector, would be a definite asset Professional Project Management Certification (PMP, PRINCE2, MCPM) Some travel may be required, including to the United States Work is expected to be completed at the client’s office in downtown Calgary  Job Business systems analysis Primary LocationCanada-Alberta-Calgary Organization Corporate Admininistration Schedule Full-time Posting Date Mar 27, 2018, 1:00:00 AM Recruiter Marci Connors
Title: Project Manager - 1 Year Limited Term Contract

Job_Description: Position Description:  Who we are Altus Group Limited is a leading provider of independent advisory services, software and data solutions to the global commercial real estate industry. Through our two business lines, Altus Analytics and Altus Expert Services, we are creating innovative technology-enabled solutions that better enable the commercial real estate industry to analyze, gain market insight and recognize value on their investments. Our clients include some of the world’s largest real estate industry participants, spread across a broad variety of sectors. Headquartered in Canada, we have approximately 2,300 employees around the world, with a network of more than 75 offices with operations in North America, Europe and Asia Pacific. The opportunity Reporting to the Service Desk Manager the IT Support Technician will be the first point-of-contact for internal staff. This is a 9am to 6pm role based out of our Calgary office supporting the west coast region, with training taking place in Aurora, Ontario as well as remotely. You will be responsible for timely, effective, user-friendly resolutions to end-user issues, fielding up to 150 tickets per week, as well as in-person support requests and the production of IT end user documentation. Who you are You are a Tier 1 Helpdesk Analyst or IT Technician who thrives in a supportive role. You enjoy asking questions and solving puzzles of a technical nature. You want to join a successful company that is growing rapidly; a company that is at the forefront of software solutions for their industry. What’s in it for you This is an opportunity to learn more about the Commercial Real Estate industry and gain exposure to multiple business lines and departments. A chance to grow into the next level of support, into a team lead role or move into another area such as Development. Our new IT Technician will: Resolve end-user IT issues: Provide one-on-one end-user support and problem resolution via telephone, instant messaging, email and remote desktop access. Offer support for video conferencing. Recognize, troubleshoot and escalate deeper and more complex issues to Tier 2 Technicians. Accurately log work orders/IT tickets and resolutions into IT software management system, prioritizing according to severity. Vigilantly maintain of the ticketing process. Perform in-person, on-site assistance: Repair hardware, printers and other peripherals when possible. Coordinate timely repair of IT equipment covered by third-party vendor agreements. Attend training sessions and create materials for end users. Maintain and support the network: Diagnose and resolve minor network issues (e.g., LAN access). Assist hardware and network technicians by troubleshooting software, hardware and network issues. Install network interface cards, hubs, switches, network cabling, etc. Participate in adds, moves and changes to network and systems access. Maintain documentation: Accurately log work orders/ tickets and resolutions into IT software management system. Use IT log entries to report trends to conduct proactive maintenance or repairs.   Position Requirements:  Our new IT Technician has: The education. High school or college diploma, with a preference for a university degree, or an acceptable combination of education and relevant experience The certification. CompTIA A+, CompTIA Network+, MCP (Microsoft Certified Professional), MCSE or CCNA preferred. ITIL Certified (or knowledge of) preferred but not required The hands-on experience. 3 to 5 years of direct work experience in an IT support capacity, preferably within a software solutions company, including: Ability to diagnose problems, perform repairs on IT assets and provide support for a range of applications. Technical knowledge of different network levels: WAN and LAN connectivity, routers, firewalls and security. Understanding of operating systems, business. Experience with: Antivirus and anti-spam solutions. Active Directory. Windows Deployment Services. Service Now ticketing system preferred but not required. The problem-solving skills. Ability to quickly analyze issues and determine the best course of action using available resources The communication skills. Excellent written, oral and telephone communication skills with the ability to “translate” technical solutions to non-technical users at any level A collaborative approach. A team player with the ability to work under pressure. Willingness and interest in sharing ideas and resolutions The mindset. Driven by a desire to help, with a strong customer service focus The flexibility. Availability to travel infrequently. Flexibility to work outside of core business hours, potentially as part of a 24-7 global team Need any more reasons to join Altus Group? In 2005, we started with 400 employees and have grown exponentially to over 2,300 around the globe today. Altus Group employees don’t see boundaries; they see opportunity. They deliver results for our clients and our company and are recognized and rewarded for the value they create. This is an opportunity to work on multiple projects that encompass many industries, geographic reach and high profile design. At Altus Group, we want you to realize your potential. We value collaboration and knowledge sharing of best practices. We support professional growth and we actively seek out ideas. This is the place to present the newest research, to introduce the coolest tech and see it come to fruition and be applied. Your work will make a difference. At Altus Group, we are proud to say that many of our teams are comprised of members who have been here five years or longer. We think that speaks volumes about our atmosphere and our people. Opportunity awaits - come realize your potential at Altus Group.    Altus Group is committed to fostering an inclusive and accessible environment where employees feel valued and respected, and where every employee has the opportunity to realize their potential. We are committed to providing reasonable accommodations, if required, and will work with you to meet your needs. If you are a person with a disability and require assistance during the application process, please contact us at accessibility@altusgroup.com or 416-641-9500.
Title: IT Support Technician

Job_Description: Leases Project Analyst (Temporary), Calgary, AB Why work at Nutrien? Great question! Safety is a core value at Nutrien. Keeping every employee safe, healthy and secure is our top priority. Nothing is more important than seeing our people go home safe at the end of every single day. While working here you will have the opportunity to grow your career while helping us feed the future. We pride ourselves in hiring from a variety of backgrounds and truly believe that it is our differences that make us stronger so we hope you will join us. In addition to exciting and challenging opportunities, Nutrien offers competitive salaries, great benefits and performance based incentives. Outside of the skills and necessary qualifications, you will be committed to sustaining our safe and positive work environment while welcoming working side by side others in a diverse culture. Culture at Nutrien is the core of everything we do and all employees are respectful of diverse opinions and views. The purpose of the Business Analyst role is to document and assist in implementation of the future state business processes that will be impacted by the new standard International Financial Reporting Standards (IFRS) 16 – Leases. This is to gain a complete understanding of the impact and aid our business partners in identifying the future processes and documenting those processes to support the transition to the new standard. *Please note that this is a temporary, full-time position (40 hours per week), expected to end February 2019* Key Tasks: Facilitation of information gathering and process design through interviews, existing documentation analysis, requirements workshops, surveys, site visits, and business process modeling this will primarily be for the future state process redesign to support the new accounting standards Acting as a Liaison between Finance and our Business Partners to uphold a clear understanding of future state process requirements and to ensure functional deliverables align with the stakeholders needs Proactive communication and collaboration with external and internal stakeholders to develop: Process Flows, Report design, Test Plans, Defect / Enhancement tracking, Business Process Procedures (BPPs) Working independently with stakeholders, as well as under the direction of project managers. Collaboration with subject matter experts and functional business leads to establish the future state process and impacts Producing deliverables according to standard templates appropriate for project scale Assist in user acceptance testing, test planning, development of test cases and test execution management to ensure alignment with original requirements, process definition and future compliance. Skills: Knowledge of Agriculture, Manufacturing and Supply Chain an asset Competent and proficient understanding of a variety of technology platforms, including ERP’s such as SAP and PeopleSoft, as well as current Microsoft and Internet technologies Excellent analytical and organizational skills with expert fluency in Excel, Visio and PowerPoint. Previous project experience Business aptitude for strategy and benefits realization alignment Knowledge and experience with Business Process modeling tools and techniques Understanding of the IT Life Cycle Proven capability and experience managing requirements gathering initiatives across multiple teams and business areas Exceptional communication, both written and verbal, and facilitation skills Qualifications: A Finance background with knowledge of accounting practice. A background of 3 years minimum of practical experience in business analysis and processes A professional degree or a combination of education and experience may also be considered Nutrien is committed to creating an inclusive workplace. We encourage applications from all well qualified candidates who reflect the diversity of the regions where we operate. This includes recognizing the voluntary identification of status such as gender, sexual orientation, visible minority, Indigenous status, persons with disabilities, and veterans, where applicable. If this sounds like a good match, apply now. This job will remain posted until filled. You may be required to undergo a background check and substance test in accordance with Nutrien policies. While we appreciate all applications we receive, we advise that only candidates under consideration will be contacted.
Title: Leases Project Analyst (Temporary)

Job_Description: Our enterprise oil and gas client is seeking a Sr. Business Systems Analyst that is knowledgeable in Upstream Well Data Management for a contract until end of the year.  Project: Upstream Well Data Management A company wide standard (with location specific exceptions) needs to be established around Data Management, Data Retention and Sensitivity (i.e. well name, tags, etc.) The introduction of a sustainable, enterprise wide, integrated system to replace inconsistent, disparate systems of data would result in the ability for senior leaders to make lower risked-infused decisions with regards to wells and drilling. Mining would need to be considered as they currently have their own system and standards Access to the database could also be considered in the standard. Responsibilities: Process Scoping Interview SME’s (typically in conjunction with the BA) to decipher process impactCompile consolidated scopeProvide BPM process design estimateTake part in relevant project discussions (i.e. Standard development) Process Design Prepare drafts of current state processesPrepare for and facilitating future state/to-be process design workshopsComplete future state/to-be process designCorrespond with SME’s as required to enhance the future state/to-be process designFacilitate validation workshops for the future state/to-be processesFine tune process design post technology implementationComplete technical writing, QA, facilitating BPC approval and publishing of final state processes Support Implementation Work with selected software vendor to support the implementation of a technical solution for wells data managementMap selected solution against document requirements to determine gaps and develop workarounds as neededWork with the QM team to support creation of a test strategyFacilitate data analysis and cleanup between the vendor and software vendorSupport warranty of selected software solution, and assist in transition to operations  Expertise and Skills Business Analysis, Business/Systems Analyst 5 - 7 years Business Analysis, Process Analysis 5 - 7 years Priority Requirements Must-have: What is your experience as a Sr. Business Systems Analyst for process scoping and process design to establish company-wide Upstream Well Data Management standards? Work Environment Downtown Calgary. 40hr/week

Responsibilities: In line inspection data assessment Integration and confirmation of supplementary data Data Preparation and processing Data Analysis Feature categorization and evaluation Feature sizing Application of anomaly interaction rules Standard & non-standard analysis Organize and report ILI tool results as per client requirements Maintain own personal skills/certifications, and complete additional training as required Additional related duties as assigned   Qualifications: Previous ILI data experience is preferred, specifically UT crack experience Post-secondary education General computer skills familiarity working with network directory structures and ability to learn new software applications easily Intermediate Microsoft Office skills, particularly Microsoft Word and Excel Excellent verbal communications; the ability to communicate highly technical information in such a way that it is easily understand Excellent writing skills Adapt to frequently changing schedules and tight timelines Able to follow established quality and health, safety and environment policies and procedures Excellent customer relations skills Ability to think outside the box and challenge processes for efficiency Work individually, as well as in a team environment with minimum supervision Organization and time management skills Ability to be consistent and thorough when checking and preparing data, as well as in daily tasks Able to perform routine tasks for extended period of time Troubleshooting skills Strong analytical and interpretive skills Detail oriented  We thank you for your interest in this role however only those applicants who are legally eligible to work in Canada can be considered at this time    Please visit our website at www.klopprichards.com to apply for this or other vacancies through Klopp Richards & Associates. We value our relationship with you as strongly as with our Clients.

Job_Description: DIFFERENT BY DESIGN At MNP we pride ourselves on being different – it’s our entrepreneurial drive that sets us apart. It’s the same drive that’s helped us become Canada’s fastest growing national firm. We foster collaboration, value your ideas, promote based on talent, live balanced lifestyles and make time for FUN. We are one firm, one team, collaborating to support you wherever you want to take your career.  Join the momentum. We are currently seeking a Project Manager for our growing Technology team. MNP is a leading national accounting, tax and business consulting firm in Canada. Driving innovation throughout the firm, our Technology team provides industry-leading solutions that enable MNP to better serve our clients and people. We deliver on the strategic needs of service lines, industry and specialty groups, and operations at all levels throughout the firm. Our specialists develop, enable and support initiatives that allow MNP to deliver client service, collaborate, communicate and operate reliably and efficiently.   RESPONSIBILITIES AND QUALIFICATIONS Performance Expectations Develop a project management framework, appropriate for the technology needs of the Firm Coordinate with cross-functional project teams across the organization to plan, coordinate and manage technology projects ranging from software development, implementation and process improvement Collaborate with a variety of stakeholders and other subject matter experts, including the Development team to apply project structure and to drive multiple initiatives forward Create and maintain project documentation, plans, schedules and timelines, facilitate meetings and workshops and communicate project milestone progress on a regular basis Create and maintain formal and informal plans, schedules and timelines including project charter, user manuals and other documentation, as required Manage change in a complex and dynamic environment Balance technology and business issues and communicate appropriately with both technology and business experts Contribute to the development of new ideas and approaches in order to improve work processes Manage, mentor, motivate and coach a team of Business Analysts and Quality Assurance Specialists towards professional and personal development by setting clear expectations, providing feedback and addressing performance issues promptly Coordinate resources by managing project performance and ensuring timely execution of deliverables Promote regular attendance, balanced lifestyle and high standard of team wellness Conduct formal, written annual performance reviews Develop a thorough understanding of MNP’s services, businesses and industry Credentials Completion of a Bachelor’s Degree in Technology or related discipline preferred Minimum of five (5) years of experience in project management in a technology focussed role Proven track record of successful program/project execution Demonstrated ability to lead and motivate teams and influence across organizational boundaries Demonstrated knowledge of modern software development methodologies - Agile/Scrum and Iterative Experience with technology and software development projects in a professional services organization would be considered an asset Core Competencies and Personal Characteristics Integrity – professional whose honesty, integrity, confidentiality and high ethical standards contributes to effective leadership and optimal business relationships Energy – displays enthusiasm, optimism, drive and passion while maintaining a high level of productivity and a balanced lifestyle Diversity – understands the importance of different backgrounds, perspectives and experiences and is respectful of individual differences Communication – effectively expresses ideas and conveys information in business writing, conversations and interactions with others Client Service Excellence – understands the importance of quality client service by being courteous, responding to client requests in a timely manner and monitoring satisfaction Teamwork & Relationship Development – works collaboratively with team members in order to achieve a common goal and develops, maintains and strengthens relationships with others, both inside and outside the Firm Accountability – takes responsibility for one’s own performance by setting clear goals and tracking progress against those goals; is highly organized and uses personal judgement and decision making Flexibility – effectively manages multiple assignments, adapts to changing priorities and is able to work independently or as part of a team TOTAL REWARDS MNP encourages a balanced lifestyle and offers benefits that suit the way our team members work and play! In addition to a competitive salary, our total rewards package includes paid personal days, wellness program initiatives, health and dental benefits, a group pension plan with matching contribution, firm sponsored social events and professional development assistance.  MNP proudly serves and responds to the needs of our clients in the public, private and not-for-profit sectors. Through partner-led engagements, we provide a collaborative, cost-effective approach to doing business, with innovative strategies to help organizations succeed across the country and around the world.  #LI-LL1

issues Bring best practices in master data management and propose opportunities for improvement Interaction with SAP Competency Center on future system enhancements, builds, testing, and roll-outs Job_Description: *PLEASE NOTE: PREFERENCE WILL BE GIVEN TO CANDIDATES WHO APPLY THROUGH CANFOR.COM/CAREERSCanfor TechnologyAt Canfor, our Information Technology professionals play an important role in the daily functioning of our operations. Consistently pushing the boundaries when it comes to innovation within the forestry and pulp and paper industries, our IT professionals support Canfor in achieving exceptional results.With a high caliber Information Technology leadership team, a clear vision, and significant growth and training opportunities, a career in IT at Canfor allows individuals to strengthen their competencies and grow within their respective roles. Working as an equal partner with our operations to achieve organizational objectives, you will be at the forefront of innovation.Who We Are: Canfor is one of the world’s largest and most respected integrated forest products companies. For more than 75 years, we have been delivering top-quality lumber, pulp and paper products to our valued customers worldwide. With operations in Western Canada and the Southern United States, and sales offices around the world, you can find Canfor products in every corner of the globe. We are leaders in sustainable forest management and in converting wood residuals into green energy.As we continue to grow our company and our markets, find out how you can grow your career with us.The OpportunityThe Data Analyst, Business Intelligence supports Canfor’s objectives by turning data into meaningful information that can be used to make sound business decisions. The Data Analyst will provide expertise in business intelligence to prepare and deliver data and information to internal customers and stakeholders through reports, dashboards and scorecards. It is essential that the Data Analyst build an understanding of the business at a level of detail that enables them to work with the business to deliver valuable information.Please Note:  This is a relocation opportunity in Vancouver, British Columbia. The successful applicant may be provided with relocation assistance.Main ResponsibilitiesRequirements Gathering:Engage with various business units to capture information needs, compare those needs with existing tools and identify gapsParticipate in business requirements workshopsWrite business requirements documents as required to elaborate needs, gain acceptanceDesign & Development:Architect tables and dataDesign dashboards, reports, drill-down analytics and data visualizationsDesign, configure and administer the metadata layerCreate system technical requirements for documentation and knowledge managementActively challenge and find solutions to optimize system performanceTesting, Validation, Release Management:Develop and implement testing strategiesValidate data accuracyDeploy and validate changes in production environmentTraining & Change Management:Support the development of training, documentation, and help desk capabilitiesRequired SkillsBachelor's degree in computer science, information systems, business management or specialized training/certificationExperience working with relational databases (Microsoft SQL Server, Oracle Database, MySQL, etc)Applied knowledge of SQL (T-SQL, PL/SQL, ANSI-SQL, etc)Applied understanding of data modelling and warehousing conceptsWorking knowledge of business intelligence tools such as Oracle Business IntelligenceWorking knowledge of ETL tools such as Oracle Data Integrator or InformaticaExperience mediating and clarifying sometimes ambiguous or conflicting end user requirementsEagerness to learn new concepts and technologies and keep-up-to-date with existing onesWillingness to go above and beyond to understand both the business and technical aspects of a problemHiring for this position is ongoing and will be filled as required. To be considered for this position, please apply today.In order to be eligible for this position, you must be legally entitled to work in Canada for our Company.There has never been a better time to join the Canfor Information Technology team and become a part of the modern forest industry. We have a wide range of rewarding and innovative careers in some of the best communities in North America, with plenty of room for advancement. We offer competitive compensation and benefits packages, and are committed to the professional development of our employees.*PLEASE NOTE: PREFERENCE WILL BE GIVEN TO CANDIDATES WHO APPLY THROUGH CANFOR.COM/CAREERSFollow us on LinkedIn , Twitter , and Facebook for Canfor news, career opportunities, and upcoming events!Vancouver, BCThe city of Vancouver is both a natural beauty and a progressive urban centre, a rare place on earth that is idyllic and electric all at once. With one of Canada’s mildest climates, Vancouver is ideally suited for those devoted to outdoor pursuits, health and wellness. Along with its endless supply of fresh air and clean water, Vancouver also boasts countless choices for culturally diverse, world-class cuisine and an inventory of arts and entertainment events. For more information, visit http://canfor.com/our-company/our-communities/vancouverJob Type: Full-timeEducation:High school or equivalent

Job_Description: Build a meaningful career  At Morneau Shepell, we offer more than career opportunities, we provide career opportunities to make meaningful contributions to people’s lives. The extraordinary expertise of our 4,000-strong workforce is harnessed to support the employees and families of the organizations we serve. Our innovative programs have a lasting impact on the health, financial security and productivity of 20,000 workplaces.  Consultant Health and Benefits  Health & Benefits Solutions  Calgary, AB  Full Time, Permanent  Benefits programs are an important and highly valued part of any employment offering. But understanding how much or what type of benefit coverage is necessary can be difficult. Our client relationship model is consultative and encourages continual communication. By providing you with the resources to support employers in engaging employees in their health, we provide a path to better workforce health and productivity.  Our Consultant works in a team and is responsible for managing, servicing and providing quality benefits consulting services for small to medium sized clients. In addition, they will be responsible for helping to build business with existing clients as well as attracting and supporting new clients through our association partnerships.  Responsibilities include:  Business Development  Identify and manage cross-sell opportunities Develop strategic relationships with key account contacts and introduce Morneau Shepell team members as appropriate Supervise the complete employee benefits cycle: plan design, provider search, implementation, experience monitoring, renewal rating Develop new business with existing clients and assists in obtaining new business with prospective clients focusing on our key association partnerships Understand client needs and identify company or industry products or services that can meet these needs Service  Deliver presentations to clients; conduct client meetings and the occasional employee presentation. Ensure that quality control and service standards are attained with every transaction Negotiate, problem solve and maintain positive relationships with insurers, external advisors and internal underwriting and benefits administration departments Develop and maintain excellent relationships with clients, through regular telephone contact and office visits Understand the client’s perspective and priorities, and work with the client to resolve administrative issues Establish strategies for services that meet client needs  Administration  Provide and oversee direct day-to-day support for clients by phone, e-mail, letters, formal reports, and face-to-face meetings Lead and manage multiple client assignments and projects Manage special projects as required Peer review the work of analysts Knowledge  Maintain current knowledge of industry trends including insurer news, products, legislation, and cost trends as well as current knowledge of our company's products and services  Qualifications:  Experience  Five years of experience in group benefits. Preference will be given to those from the group insurance industry, a consulting firm or brokerage or in an HR department. Education  Post-secondary education GBA (CEBS) designation, or working towards it. Life Insurance license (this will be a requirement within 3 months of onboarding) Skills  Strong presentation skills and comfort speaking in front of large groups Understanding of consultative selling and the ability to manage the sales cycle effectively and autonomously Expert negotiation, technical and analytical skills Can effectively communicate complex concepts in plain written and spoken language Professional Traits  Exceptional customer focus; some would say you’re the best Extremely organized self-starter, flexible, highly independent Ability to manage multiple deadlines simultaneously Proven collaborative team member with the ability to motivate and inspire team members  Morneau Shepell Morneau Shepell is in the business of helping organizations help their people because we believe that engaged people are the driving force for society. Every day, the expertise of our almost 4,000 employees is recognized as essential to the financial security, health, and productivity of our clients and their people. We're always looking for talented professionals and strategic leaders who will listen and work together with colleagues and clients to form long-term relationships and to deliver integrative solutions that fit. As we continue to grow, we're presently engaging with exceptional candidates interested in a range of exciting career opportunities. At www.morneaushepell.com you can explore our careers page to learn more about the solutions we deliver and the great people who help us do it. Follow us on LinkedIn and Twitter (Morneau_Shepell, Shepell). We are thankful for your interest, but unfortunately, we can only personally connect with those selected for an interview.  INDCAD LI-PH1  Job Grade: MS4   Fulfilling work that matters  Morneau Shepell is in the business of helping organizations help their people and in the process, we strive to elevate ours.  We're always looking for talented professionals and strategic leaders looking to make a difference in the lives of the people we serve.  We appreciate the interest of every applicant; however, we contact only those selected for an interview.  Find your fit with us. Follow us on LinkedIn, Youtube and Twitter.
Title: Consultant

Job_Description: PTW Energy Services is a privately held group of companies comprised of three primary businesses: Pyramid Corporation, Tarpon Energy Services, and Warwick Structures Group. Headquartered in Calgary, Alberta with over 3,000 employees in its worldwide network of offices, PTW is a leader in electrical, instrumentation and rigid structures. We are constantly striving to find safer and more innovative ways to deliver a range of specialized services to customers in the Oil & Gas, Energy, Industrial and Mining sectors across North America and Internationally.Position DescriptionPTW is in the process of centralizing its shared services functions, including Accounts Receivable, out of its new corporate office in downtown Calgary. This is an exciting opportunity for a self-motivated individual who thrives in a fast paced environment to join our dynamic shared services team. The Credit & Collections Analyst will contribute to the achievement of Accounts Receivable KPIs by minimizing bad debts and ensuring collections are achieved within term. Reporting to the Accounts Receivable Manager, the Credit & Collections Analysts will serve as a team lead of two (2) to four (4) Collections Administrators.Specific Duties & ResponsibilitiesResponsible for application of established credit procedures on both new and existing accountsManages and monitors accounts with a view to minimizing the company’s credit riskAssesses new customer credit applications and approves or recommends appropriate credit limitsPerforms regular account reviews and research reviewing/approving credit limit changes where appropriateHandles delicate and complex collection issues by working directly with appropriate Operations personnel and/or customerCreates and maintains credit history files on all accountsMotivates, mentors, and coaches Collections staffReviews aging reports in conjunction with established credit policies, limits, and DSO targetsMaintains customer payables contacts and relationships, contacting customers regarding invoice processing and payments within established termsWorks proactively to identify and communicate potential payment issuesCoordinates collection activities interfacing with customers and Accounts Receivable teamWorks efficiently meets KPIs for collection activity, customer follow up, and resolution of account issuesOrganizes and maintains assigned accounts in acceptable delinquency categoriesMakes recommendations regarding uncollectible accountsAssists with external and internal audit information requestsAssists Accounts Receivable Manager with A/R cash collections forecasting, management reporting, and special projects/ad hoc tasks as assignedQualifications and Experience RequirementsMinimum five (5) years commercial credit and collection experienceCertified Credit Professional (CPP) designation or working towards CPP preferredStrong working knowledge of invoicing processes and e-portal systemsExceptional communication and relationship building abilitiesAbility to interact with customer pleasantly, efficiently, and professionally through telephone and e-mailOrganized and results driven self-starter with strong time management skills and attention to detailsPreference given to those with Oil & Gas experienceProficient in Microsoft Excel, Word and OutlookJob Types: Full-time, Permanent
Title: Credit & Collections Analyst

Job_Description: Senior Systems Analyst, Calgary  Stratiform was founded in 2012 and has quickly grown to prominence with a hand-picked team and our commitment to Do What’s Right. Our expertise in Microsoft and Cloud has led to our rapid growth and market-leading reputation with customers. At Stratiform, we have become one of Microsoft’s go-to cloud partners in Canada.  In 2017, Stratiform was purchased by PCM Canada. Our Managed Services business continues to grow, and as it does, we need to bolster the team with more senior resources to oversee our customers, both within Stratiform and the greater PCM Canada.  Key Responsibilities (Senior Systems Analyst, Calgary):  Stratiform’s Managed Services are delivered out of Calgary, consisting of tier 1, tier 2, and tier 3 technicians. As a Senior Systems Analyst (Tier 3), you will be responsible for providing technical leadership along with the other tier 3 resources, handling escalations from tier 2 and providing strategic value to Managed Services customers working with your team lead, and solution delivery manager. You will assist with customer onboarding, process development, and other high value technical tasks.  The organization is in the process of migrating from legacy ConnectWise and ZenDesk platforms to PCM’s global, very mature, ServiceNow platform. There are Team Leads in Calgary and Edmonton that manage the day-to-day workloads, and two Solution Architects dedicated to Managed Services that assist the sales teams. Key Responsibilities include:  Manage tickets Own incidents from inception to resolution, you are the point of contact for our customers Sometimes scheduling tickets will be required Be responsive and ensure SLA’s are met with any tickets you handle End-user support End user support will be limited, but in cases where problems are escalated you will be engaged Be responsive and respectful to end-user’s concerns, questions, and problems Deal with issues related to  Workstations Mobile Devices General software troubleshooting Server support Correspond with and deal with contacts at customer organizations, whether they are IT Staff, or Managers Deal with issues related to corporate infrastructure  Server Hardware Switches Routers Firewalls Access Points Storage Arrays Software  General software troubleshooting Patching Training Responsible aiding in for mentorship and training of tier 1 and 2 resources Tier 1 and 2 resources will engage you for guidance and leadership You will be part of the tier 2 and 3 on-call rotation. This will potentially mean additional after-hours work, and additional compensation. Own high value, highly technical tasks assigned by the SDM or team lead As a highly skilled technical resource you may be engaged for process development, or technical guidance as required by the SDM or team lead Assist team lead and SDM in technical discovery and assessment as our tools mature Providing strategic technical advisory to managed services clients You will be part of the team that deals with alerts from our monitoring systems, helping investigate and triage problems detected by our monitoring systems Working flexibility is required, not everyone on the team starts and ends their day at the same time, we grant flexibility in the hours you work but expect there may be times you are required to work outside business hours too (this is a staple of IT) Cross training and training as a team is a part of this role, if you possess skills other team members do not you may be expected to provide training, and if you require training other team members will provide you with training and mentorship as well Respect and professionalism Working hour flexibility is a benefit, but you will be expected to be communicative if you are unable to come in during your normal schedule You are expected to work with your team, be respectful of your team mates, and conduct yourself with the utmost in professionalism You will be respectful, and use appropriate language when dealing with customers and colleagues, we’re all adults and we expect you will understand what language is appropriate given your audience Stratiform is a professional working environment, and we expect your attire, grooming, and hygiene reflect this, dress appropriately, and expect you may be expected to adhere to the dress standards of customers if you are required to go on site Required Skills & Experience:   Post-secondary training or education in an applicable technology related program, or equivalent work experience  8-10 years work experience in IT  Experience working with, and understanding of Microsoft Operating Systems  Experience working with, and understanding of Microsoft Office Products  Experience with and understanding of virtualization technologies  Knowledge of ITIL disciplines  Excellent people skills  Excellent written and verbal communication skills  Willingness to support and mentor junior staff  Excellent customer facing/customer service skills  Able to demonstrate a high degree of flexibility including out of hours working  Able to manage sensitive and sometimes confidential information  Self-motivation and able to take responsibility  Able to manage and prioritize and tasks and time efficiently  Extensive Experience with troubleshooting and using computers and software  Passion for technology and learning  Easygoing, hardworking, team focused attitude Foundational knowledge of Microsoft technologies, networking, backup and other infrastructure platforms Experience with Microsoft Azure services This description reflects the core activities of the role but is not intended to be all-inclusive and other duties within the group/department may be required in addition to changes in the emphasis of duties as required from time to time. There is a requirement for the post holder to recognize this and adopt a flexible approach to work. Job descriptions will be reviewed regularly and where necessary revised in accordance with organizational needs. Any major changes will be discussed with the post holder.  Desired Skills & Experience:  Experience with Microsoft Azure services is a highly differentiating asset Programming and or scripting knowledge an asset (PowerShell and C# in particular) Customer service experience Prior work in an IT environment Experience with other Microsoft Software Experience with the Microsoft Cloud Solution Provider (CSP) program Experience with ServiceNow and Kaseya is an asset Consulting experience Candidates must be able to work independently. Characteristics of importance include but are not limited to customer service, problem solving, communication skills, and the ability to read/interpret the needs/wants of customers.  Physical Requirements:   Handling maximum of 21-50 lbs.  Lifting 20- 50 lbs. (occasional) – low level lifting 20- 50 lbs. (frequent) - waist level lifting 20-50 lbs. (rare) – above shoulder lifting 20- 50 lbs. (occasional) – front carry 5-20 lbs. (rare) – side carry Pushing/Pulling (hand carts and dollies) 60-100 lbs. (occasional)  Sitting/driving (constant)  Trunk rotation (rare)  Crouching/squatting/kneeling/crawling (occasional)  Walking and standing (frequent)  Climbing stairs (occasional)  Hand use (frequent).
Title: Senior Systems Analyst (Stratiform)

Job_Description: Our client is a leading provider of integrated risk solutions to energy companies operating in today's energy commodity markets. Founded over ten years ago by accomplished energy risk professionals, the company has provided risk software solutions, management consulting and educational services to over 220 clients in the global energy sector. They are now a division of a much larger organization which has been included on Fortune's list of the "100 Best Companies to Work For" for seven straight years. They have engaged ROSS (www.getROSS.com) to search for a Senior Energy Trading Risk Business Analyst. ROSS is an innovative leader in Recruitment Process Outsourcing (RPO) and Recruitment Augmentation. Our unique model truly creates strategic alignment between the goals of hiring managers, HR professionals, recruiters and career/contract seekers.  As a Senior Risk Business Analyst  You Will…  Provide senior level onsite consulting expertise to clients to assist them in optimally utilizing our client’s solutions and establishing best practices  Your responsibilities will include  Act as a Subject Matter Expert (SME) with respect to energy trading and risk  Take leadership role in working with clients and managers to determine product direction for major functionality enhancements  Act as Lead Project Manager in providing analytical services and projects to clients.  Formulate consulting services proposals in support of our client’s solutions.  Work with internal and external clients, and act as the Analytical Project Lead dedicated to the conception, design, testing and implementation of the product from a data modeling perspective,  Create business specifications for developers and oversee junior and intermediate level Analysts in developing specifications.  Work with developers on an ongoing basis to develop and enhance the product.  Provide senior level assistance to clients on a day-to-day basis on how to use our client’s solutions.  Perform senior level training sessions with internal and external clients as it relates to our client’s products.  Edit and enhance user documentation of product methodologies, concepts and usability.  May work as part of a development team in senior analyst capacity on long-term projects to deliver production applications.  Drive revenue generation and growth by providing support to pre-sales to design, develop and periodically perform demos of our solutions to potential and existing clients.  You Have…  Superior knowledge of energy risk management and the trading environment; Trading of energy commodities such as power, gas and oil, and foreign exchange. Superior knowledge of risk analytics; Advanced modeling experience with various risk metrics including Mark-to-Market (MtM), Value-at-Risk (VaR), Earnings-at-Risk (EaR), Credit Risk and various statistical and simulation models. Superior understanding of energy derivatives pricing models. Ability to lead within a very team-oriented environment. Superior ability to conceptualize client needs, perform gap analysis reviews and translate into specific implementation strategies. Superior quantitative and analytical skills. Superior written, verbal and interpersonal communication skills. Bachelor’s or graduate level degree in Mathematics, Finance or other related degree. Accreditation to professional designation such as CFA, PRM, or FRM. 5 to 10 years of work experience associated with the energy risk management or energy trading fields Nice to Have: Advanced understanding of software development and the software development cycle. Senior level ability to work with SQL to access an Oracle database through a data query tool. Working knowledge or exposure to analytics, reporting tools and statistics products such as SAS, SPSS, Angoss, etc, Superior systems analysis skills. Travel and Location:  Ability to travel internationally approximately 50% of the time as this is mainly an external client-facing role. Other work will be done onsite at the Calgary office Our client will consider relocating the incumbent to Calgary for this role Salary: 100K to $140K + bonus  If you're not interested, but know someone who is; please help a current or former colleague in their career development by referring them. In addition, we're happy to give you a $750 referral fee. Click http://www.getROSS.com/referral_fee.php for more details.
Title: Senior Risk Business Analyst
