Job_Description: Founded in 1957, Pacific Western Transportation (PWT) is the largest privately-owned passenger transportation company in Canada. Today PWT offers comprehensive transportation services and solutions across the country, with over 4,800 employees and numerous business locations. Reporting to the Director, IT Operations, the IT Infrastructure Support Technician is responsible for implementing, supporting and delivering IT infrastructure and services to the Pacific Western Transportation Group of Companies. You will also assist with various infrastructure projects, maintenance and respond to escalated service desk tickets. Your responsibilities will include sharing 24x7 support duties for the production environment and maintenance windows to ensure that infrastructure is operating at optimal levels. Responsibilities of the position include, but are not limited to the following: Assist Service Desk and support team Follow standards and processes Second level support escalation for IT infrastructure incidents Administer backups of systems and servers Plan and implement server upgrades, maintenance fixes, and vendor supplied patches Actively participate in monthly server maintenance windows Implement and support IT infrastructure solutions, including process and efficiency improvements Update status of current projects including issues, deliverables and timelines Transition support documentation to IT Service Desk Continuous improvement in technology and processes Occasional site visits to facilities Qualifications: Completion of a post-secondary IT degree or diploma program 3+ years of progressive experience as a Server or Network Administrator/Analyst in a medium to large enterprise Strong technical skills in the following areas: Microsoft Windows Server environment Microsoft Office365 Administration Skype for Business BlackBerry Enterprise Server (iOS device management) Microsoft Active Directory, Azure Active Directory Microsoft SCCM Administration IT security Microsoft SharePoint (OnPrem and Online) Citrix XenApp Virtualization (VMWare) Networking in LAN, Wi-Fi, WAN and data center environments Printer, scanners VOIP, phone services and teleconferencing Pacific Western Transportation offers a competitive salary and benefits package in addition to opportunities for personal and professional achievement.
Title: IT Infrastructure Support Technician

Job_Description: Regular-Full time  W E= unlimited potential  We didn’t get to be a leader in energy delivery or ranked on the Global 100 Most Sustainable Corporations index on our own. We did it in partnership with outstanding individuals who work together as a team to fuel people’s quality of life. Individuals like you. And now we’re looking for just such an individual to join our team.  To learn more about us, visit www.enbridge.com .  This requisition will remain open until filled; however, consideration will be given to applicants in order of applicat ion date.   Primary Focus  The Analyst, Natural Gas Marketing position will be accountable for the day to day and forward analysis of the market fundamentals for our natural gas business. Primary responsibilities include providing commercial support to the traders and originators, building and maintaining models and other analytical trading tools that will be used to develop an internal proprietary marketing view in our core markets, which will support the execution of Tidal’s key strategic initiatives and value creation.  Responsibilities Providing analytical support for the short and long term commercial management and execution of existing and new lines of business Monitoring and reporting on factors that may impact market and price dynamics including pipeline infrastructure, transport, weather, storage and other factors influencing supply/demand balances Developing, implementing and maintaining fundamental supply/demand models of the North American natural gas marketing Designing and developing short term asset optimization and trading tools that produce actionable outputs Supporting to the Trading and Origination teams including customer research and analysis, deal structuring and modeling. Ad-hoc and regular support for commercial and operations teams as required Prioritizing the administrative requirements between the front and back office in the area of contracts, confirmations, credit and accounting. Establishing robust working relationships with internal groups (Operations, Contracts, Legal, Credit and Accounting) to ensure a smooth flow of information to assist with the efficient and effective operation of the business. Confirming accuracy of the physical and financial exposure within the natural gas portfolio and Market reports by ensuring all deals are modelled and reported properly. Analyzing and reporting profit and loss across the different portfolios of business and multiple entities. Monitoring and gauging industry developments (broadly and a part of industry working groups) to assist with deployment of the current business plan, to help identify strategies for capturing cross commodity opportunities, and to support Tidal and Enbridge business development initiatives  Qualifications Bachelor’s Degree – Business (Commerce), Economics or Engineering. Minimum 4 years progressive experience in the energy marketing industry including prior experience having executed commercial transactions Drive for Results: Demonstrates a strong drive to achieve meaningful actionable results. Significant specialized industry experience preferably gained from working in the commodity marketing field with exposure to gas marketing, derivatives, cash management, risk management and related systems Experience with the development and deployment of commercial strategies including contracts, scheduling, asset evaluation, risk management, asset optimization, and deal structuring Effective interpersonal and communication skills with the ability to build consensus and promote ideas for both internal and external stakeholders Highly motivated and energetic self-starter possessing strong customer focus, while delivering on key strategic plans   We accept applications submitted via our online recruiting system only ( https://careers.enbridge.com ).  Enbridge is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer and is committed to provide employment opportunities to all individuals, without regard to race, religion, age, sex, color, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, or disability. Accommodation for applicants with disabilities is available on request during the recruitment process. Applicants with disabilities can request accessible formats or communication supports by contacting careers@enbridge.com .  We appreciate your interest in working with us; however, only those applicants selected for interviews will be contacted.  Final candidates for this position may be required to undergo a security screening, including a criminal records check.
Title: Natural Gas Marketing Advisor

Job_Description: The Information Technology Services (ITS) department is looking for a Systems Analyst - Network and Telecommunications to join their dynamic team. Reporting to the Lead, Infrastructure Architect, the incumbent is responsible for the installation, support, optimization and maintenance of College’s Unified Communication Systems, along with the network and virtualization infrastructure to achieve high performance of the various business and educational applications supported. This includes all infrastructure hardware devices (core and edge switches, firewalls, wireless controllers, etc.) along with developing processes and procedures for ongoing management of the environment. Responsibilities: Network and Infrastructure Implementation - 60% Acts as primary role for Cisco Unified Communication System. Maintain and configure the College’s Voice Gateways. Performs network configurations, including hardware, software, and integration requirements. Researches and evaluate new technologies to recommend the most effective communication and transmission systems. Coordinates network development activities with systems hardware as appropriate. Analyzes and advises system elements such as system hardware as appropriate. Acts as the technical liaison for network product or system vendors. Monitors the network security utilities/ reports to prevent access to systems by unauthorized users. Maintains up-to-date documentation on all network configurations. Network and Infrastructure Support - 40% Resolves helpdesk work orders, prioritize and respond to help desk tickets as appropriate. Contact for escalating voice, network, and infrastructure issues; provide timely response to customer escalations. Adheres to policies, procedures, and technologies to ensure network security. Provides support of network infrastructure systems, configuration and management. Plans and implements upgrades and maintenance fixes. Ensures Infrastructure is fully operational and appropriately integrated for access with other systems. Recommends and executes modifications to network, or Virtualization environment in order to improve efficiency, reliability, and performance. Develops and maintains appropriate documentation. Keep current with technical changes. Other related support duties as assigned. Job Requirements Minimum Qualifications Diploma Computer Science or Management Information Systems or a related discipline preferred. Certificate in CCNA Voice, CCNP Voice. 4 years of equivalent work experience. Experience with Voice Gateways (analog, digital and SIP) and dial plan design. Management and configuration of Cisco Unified communications. An equivalent combination of directly related education and experience may be considered. Preferred Hands-On experience with: Unified Communications Manager 11.5 and/or higher, Unity Connection 11.5 and/or higher and UCCX 11.5 and/or higher, IM&P 11.5 and/or higher, CER 11.5 and/or higher. Cisco Contact Center Express. Experience with Voice Gateways (analog, digital and SIP) and dial plan design. Understanding of and ability to configure Quality of Service (Campus and WAN). Microsoft Exchange integration plus Cisco Jabber, and Finesse solutions. Networking technologies, multi-VLAN, Layer 2/3 switched networks, 802.1x. VMware vCenter 6.0 and above. Packet capture analysis. Strong understanding of: Palo Alto series Next-Gen firewalls (PanOS 8.0 and up). Cisco IOS and Dell Force 10 Networking. Dell Blade server infrastructure (M1000e, M620/630, etc…). Wireless Technologies, WPA2, 802.11abgn. Security technologies (IPSec/SSL VPN’s, IDS/IPS, Multi-Factor Authentication). DR knowledge and processes to meet business requirements. Experience in a technical analytical position responsible for managing network environments. Experience with ServiceNow preferred. Proven knowledge of systems development life cycle methodologies. Excellent planning and organizational skills. Interpersonal and communication skills. Teamwork skills. Ability to solve complex work problems/inquiries. This is a full-time, continuous position. Please note that all successful candidates will be required to provide government issued identification and proof of educational qualifications upon hire and may be required to provide an enhanced police information check. Minimum Education Requirements Diploma Location BVC CALGARY - CA (Primary) Job Family Information Technology FTE Per Individual (%) 100% Closing Date 5/25/2018 Employment Status Continuous Salary Commensurate with experience
Title: Systems Analyst - Network and Telecommunications

Job_Description: Are you a self-starter who is eager to learn? Do you enjoy building relationships with colleagues and customers? Are you enthusiastic and confident? If you answered yes to these questions, then PBS wants you!  The PBS Products and Solutions Team is looking for an eager individual to join our team in the position of Junior Software Product Analyst. You will be responsible for working with a team of developers to bring our software to life, as well as be a liaison between our development department, call center and customers. You will be influential in the direction of our software. This is an entry-level position with the opportunity to grow and expand. Direct experience is not required.  Responsibilities Include;  Investigate, document and efficiently resolve problem and change tickets Gather and prioritize product and customer requirements, helping to define the product vision Maintain product backlog, write necessary requirements and user stories for new product features and enhancements Serve as a resource for internal teams on product questions, feature requests & other product related needs Manage multiple projects ensuring proper execution in a timely manner with exceptional quality Create, execute and validate manual test plans Work with our Product Marketing team to develop a seamless deployment process Confidently speak with customers to solve problems and uncover opportunities  Job Requirements: Excellent written and verbal communication skills Exceptional attention to detail and outstanding organizational skills, including strong project management skills and the ability to balance multiple priorities & manage time effectively Ability to guide others and develop key relationships Willingness to dive into technical issues and find resolutions Possess strong decision making and prioritization skills; anticipating and resolving problems Motivated, dynamic, creative and results-oriented Flexible, fast learner who thrives in a constantly changing work environment Ability to work collaboratively in both a team atmosphere and independently  Additional Assets;  Experience in Business Analysis and/or QA Testing TFS (Team Foundation Server) Knowledge & Experience Dealership Experience: Accounting, F&I;, Parts or Service  Who we are;  Headquartered in Calgary, AB and in business for over 25 years; PBS has become the third largest DMS provider to the North American retail automotive industry. We are unique in the industry because we view our customers as business partners, technology innovators, and friends. Discover the face behind the name and the culture that defines us as an organization.  What we do;  PBS Software is a true windows based platform boasting ease of use and training while fully featured to support our customer experience. Our software can run all aspects of an automotive dealership with sales, service, inventory management and accounting modules to keep things moving at a steady pace.  We can provide the opportunity for you to utilize your skills and abilities. Take a chance and apply to our Team today!
Title: Junior Software Product Analyst - Calgary, Alberta, CA

Job_Description: If you are committed to public service, enjoy collaborating with others, share our values and have a desire to learn and grow, join The City of Calgary. City employees deliver the services, run the programs and operate the facilities which make a difference in our community. We support work-life balance and offer competitive wages, pensions, and benefits. Together we make Calgary a great place to make a living, a great place to make a life.   As the CSC Planner you will lead, develop, implement and continuously improve communications/marketing activities for City initiatives, programs and services. Primary duties include: Develop, oversee and manage the delivery of strategic, project and work plans for marketing and/or communications that meet corporate, business unit, client and other stakeholders' objectives and goals and that may require persuading or influencing clients to accept recommended approaches. Lead communications on multiple projects that includes conducting clients' needs assessments, selecting and recommending the mix of communications and marketing approaches to achieve campaign objectives, negotiating deliverables (e.g. time, budget, resources), and assigning and directing the work of ad-hoc and standing project teams. Lead the development of a variety of complex original communications, marketing, web or engagement materials, project briefs, key messages and proof points for use on a mix of medium and channels. Develop and define the performance metrics and targets to evaluate the effectiveness of implemented communications/marketing activities and channels. Provide oversight and guidance to CSC analysts and CSC associates in the development of work that supports marketing and/or communications strategic plans.  Qualifications A completed 2 year diploma in Marketing, Communications, Public Relations, Journalism, Business Administration or a related field and 8 years experience in areas such as marketing, communications and strategic planning; OR a degree in any of the disciplines listed above (or closely related) fields and 6 years of experience in marketing, communications and strategic planning. Experience in one or more of these will be considered an asset: writing, and executing strategic marketing and/or communication plans, best practices in research and performance metrics, collaborating with multiple stakeholders and highly developed communications skills. A designation from and/or membership in a recognized professional communications or marketing association such Certified Marketing Management Professional, Accredited Business Communicator, Accreditation in Public Relations, Communications and Advertising Accredited Professional or Certified Campaign Planning Program would be an asset. Membership in organizations such as International Association of Business Communicators (IABC), Canadian Public Relations Society (CPRS), Calgary Marketing Association (CMA) or Interactive Advertising Bureau (IAB); professional development certifications from advanced digital marketing courses will be considered assets. Competencies includes critical thinking and customer service, interpersonal, organizational skills; the ability to apply business knowledge and logic, be politically sensitive, and respond to multiple and conflicting priorities is a must. Pre-employment Requirements Successful applicants must provide proof of qualifications. A security clearance may be conducted.  Union: CUPE Local 38 Business Unit: Customer Service & Communications  Position Type: 4 Permanent Location: 201 - 8 Avenue S.E.  Compensation: Pay Grade 12 $41.44 - 55.40 per hour (2017 rates) Days of Work: This position works a 5 day work week with one day off in a 3 week cycle.  Hours of work: Standard 35 hour work week  Audience: Internal/External Apply By: May 25, 2018  Amdnement: Qualsifications and Apply By Job ID #: 300828
Title: Customer Service and Communications (CSC) Planner AMENDMENT

Job_Description: Build a meaningful career  At Morneau Shepell, we offer more than career opportunities, we provide career opportunities to make meaningful contributions to people’s lives. The extraordinary expertise of our 4,000-strong workforce is harnessed to support the employees and families of the organizations we serve. Our innovative programs have a lasting impact on the health, financial security and productivity of 20,000 workplaces.  Consultant Health and Benefits  Health & Benefits Solutions  Calgary, AB  Full Time, Permanent  Benefits programs are an important and highly valued part of any employment offering. But understanding how much or what type of benefit coverage is necessary can be difficult. Our client relationship model is consultative and encourages continual communication. By providing you with the resources to support employers in engaging employees in their health, we provide a path to better workforce health and productivity.  Our Consultant works in a team and is responsible for managing, servicing and providing quality benefits consulting services for small to medium sized clients. In addition, they will be responsible for helping to build business with existing clients as well as attracting and supporting new clients through our association partnerships.  Responsibilities include:  Business Development  Identify and manage cross-sell opportunities Develop strategic relationships with key account contacts and introduce Morneau Shepell team members as appropriate Supervise the complete employee benefits cycle: plan design, provider search, implementation, experience monitoring, renewal rating Develop new business with existing clients and assists in obtaining new business with prospective clients focusing on our key association partnerships Understand client needs and identify company or industry products or services that can meet these needs Service  Deliver presentations to clients; conduct client meetings and the occasional employee presentation. Ensure that quality control and service standards are attained with every transaction Negotiate, problem solve and maintain positive relationships with insurers, external advisors and internal underwriting and benefits administration departments Develop and maintain excellent relationships with clients, through regular telephone contact and office visits Understand the client’s perspective and priorities, and work with the client to resolve administrative issues Establish strategies for services that meet client needs  Administration  Provide and oversee direct day-to-day support for clients by phone, e-mail, letters, formal reports, and face-to-face meetings Lead and manage multiple client assignments and projects Manage special projects as required Peer review the work of analysts Knowledge  Maintain current knowledge of industry trends including insurer news, products, legislation, and cost trends as well as current knowledge of our company's products and services  Qualifications:  Experience  Five years of experience in group benefits. Preference will be given to those from the group insurance industry, a consulting firm or brokerage or in an HR department. Education  Post-secondary education GBA (CEBS) designation, or working towards it. Life Insurance license (this will be a requirement within 3 months of onboarding) Skills  Strong presentation skills and comfort speaking in front of large groups Understanding of consultative selling and the ability to manage the sales cycle effectively and autonomously Expert negotiation, technical and analytical skills Can effectively communicate complex concepts in plain written and spoken language Professional Traits  Exceptional customer focus; some would say you’re the best Extremely organized self-starter, flexible, highly independent Ability to manage multiple deadlines simultaneously Proven collaborative team member with the ability to motivate and inspire team members  Morneau Shepell Morneau Shepell is in the business of helping organizations help their people because we believe that engaged people are the driving force for society. Every day, the expertise of our almost 4,000 employees is recognized as essential to the financial security, health, and productivity of our clients and their people. We're always looking for talented professionals and strategic leaders who will listen and work together with colleagues and clients to form long-term relationships and to deliver integrative solutions that fit. As we continue to grow, we're presently engaging with exceptional candidates interested in a range of exciting career opportunities. At www.morneaushepell.com you can explore our careers page to learn more about the solutions we deliver and the great people who help us do it. Follow us on LinkedIn and Twitter (Morneau_Shepell, Shepell). We are thankful for your interest, but unfortunately, we can only personally connect with those selected for an interview.  INDCAD LI-PH1  Job Grade: MS4   Fulfilling work that matters  Morneau Shepell is in the business of helping organizations help their people and in the process, we strive to elevate ours.  We're always looking for talented professionals and strategic leaders looking to make a difference in the lives of the people we serve.  We appreciate the interest of every applicant; however, we contact only those selected for an interview.  Find your fit with us. Follow us on LinkedIn, Youtube and Twitter.
Title: Consultant

Job_Description: About Solium  Solium aims to solve the problem of equity management and financial record keeping with our platform: Shareworks. Shareworks provides the ability for public and private companies to manage stock option plans, employee share purchase programs, and perform complex financial reporting. Shareworks also empowers employees of companies using the platform to access their equity through the transaction of their shares and holding. We actively trade on exchanges around the world including the NYSE, NSADAQ, LSE, and ASX.  Our Culture  Solium takes cultural characteristics from the industries we draw upon. We develop and maintain a sophisticated set of enterprise software products, so we embody the casual style but relentless focus that is often associated with the tech industry. But we are also a client service organization, offering support to both corporate clients and their employees. We also employ a wealth of “numbers” people, those with backgrounds in math, finance and economics. And because we are a global organization, you’ll routinely hear Spanish and French spoken in our offices. Solium offices are all about diversity. What unites us is a commitment to quality. We are all passionate people who bring our best in support of a singular focus, to be the global leader in our industry.  We think in terms of what-ifs. And we answer with:  Innovation: We create solutions and services that make the complex manageableFlexibility: We offer the choices that provide compliance and convenienceService: We demonstrate problem-solving, reliability and accuracy in everything we do for our customers We reward our people with a competitive compensation and benefits package and a fun, flexible working environment.  Recent Awards:  Deloitte’s Technology Fast 50™ - 2006 to 2010, 2012, 2014 Canada's 10 Most Admired Corporate Cultures - 2012 Branham’s Top 5 Canadian Software-as-a-Service Companies Top 20 Movers & Shakers – 2011 Top 25 Canadian Software Companies - 2011 We currently have several permanent full-time opportunities for a Web Operations Analysts  Highlights:  When a bystander walks past your computer do they ask you if you're looking at the Matrix? Have you ever made a Developer or QA team member cry tears of happiness and gratitude? Do people throughout the organization come to you because you get the job done? Have you ever tamed a wild RDBMS? Are you a high functioning individual in stressful situations? Are you obsessed with keeping the data on time and system up and running?  If you've answered yes to any of these questions, we want to talk to you!  Overall Responsibility:  Solium’s production application support team is responsible for supporting our internal and customer-facing web application in order to fulfill our required service standards. The team interacts with multiple business teams within Solium including software developers, customer support, operations, and quality assurance and provides hands-on technical assistance as needed. The team is dedicated to ensuring a quick response to urgent customer needs and special requests as they arise.  At this time the Production Application Support Team (aka the LIVE team) is undergoing a transformation into a service driven arm of the organization with the following aims:  Keeping the data on time: SQL and Scripting are our main tools to make sure the data is correct and the equity is managed the way our customers need. We use Oracle and in addition to SQL skills the ability to administer Oracle is preferred.  Keeping the system and all its components operational: Shareworks makes Equity Management easy for our clients. That means it's on us to keep it running and bring the creations of our developers to life. It's a complex system and working on it is both interesting and exciting. Software systems knowledge combined with strong debugging skills are required.  Monitoring and measurement: Knowing how the system is doing over time and how things are trending. We simply have to know what is going on in the system. We use a series of metrics to drive a dedicated process of ongoing improvement. We are not complacent and are always looking for ways to make our system better. Step one is measuring everything. Step two is understanding the story our data is telling us.  Automation and Tooling: We're not keen on repetitive tasks and seek to apply automation where it makes sense.  Skills that we require:  Linux Administration (ubuntu, centos and RHEL) Programming Skills: Java, JSP, Ruby, SQL Scripting (bash, perl, ruby)· Experience with composed systems (many individual systems combined to provide the end service to the user) Technical Debugging capability Soft Skills:  Communication: you'll be working with every arm of the business you must be fluent in technical and business and be able to switch between the two Discipline: you follow a prudent course of action regardless of the situation (during an outage or just writing a script) Trustworthiness: each member of the team is responsible for how they execute their work and how they work with others Commitment to Excellence: we all aim to achieve excellence in our skills and knowledge and actively combat complacency through the pursuit of continuous improvement Teamwork: the team is above any individual, we all rely on each other and our ability to solve problems  Qualifications:  BS degree preferred in Computer Science, Engineering or related fields (or the equivalent tenacity and wherewithal to have obtained a degree or technical diploma) Ability to interface with diverse technical and non-technical groups spanning the all organizations levels Experience running/maintaining large scale complex technology stacks Solid experience with time series data collection and analysis Outstanding verbal and written communication skills Understanding of WebOps principles and familiarity with WebOps tools
Title: Web Operations Analyst

Job_Description: Summary: Reporting to the Associate Director of North American Land and GIS Content Operations, the Principal Analyst II is responsible for the overall quality and integrity of Canadian Land content in the internal IHS database(s) and software. As the Subject Matter Expert (SME) in Land data, you will be responsible for the land data, quality standards and database management. The Analyst will represent their expertise with Developers, DBA’s, Operational staff, Product managers, and Client-Support teams.  The Principal Analyst II will work with their peers in developing and maintaining quality standards and processes optimization strategies while advising on the complexities of land data. This new colleague will have a keen interest and proven track record for resolving land data issues, processing complex data queries, driving data improvement opportunities, and problem resolution.  General Job Duties: Use of subject matter expertise to implement, follow and enforce measures and processes defined by the data Governance group and to support commercial teams and/or customers. Use independent judgment to proactively problem solve information transformation issues. Contribute to the development of and improving the information processing and management systems. Responsible for the ultimate success and release of daily and weekly land data updates. Perform quality control analysis on Relational and Spatial databases and processes, and provide data capture quality direction on data correctness, currency, consistency and completeness. Ensure outputs are aligned with customer expectations and report/resolve any problems with stakeholders. Responsible for compiling ideas or improvements for process optimization and ensure resolutions of any technical problems or roadblocks Respond to internal customer concerns and requests, including data analysis and extraction requests from internal colleagues. Perform data mining, complex querying, analysis, and compilation for internal and external customers. Explains complex, difficult and/or sensitive information; works to build consensus Works independently, receives minimal guidance Acts as a resource for colleagues with less experience Specific Job Duties: Work directly with developers and cross-functional colleagues to maintain and support current systems, primarily from a data perspective. Test and approve changes to current and newly created systems. Define, implement and enforce defined quality control measures. Perform or oversee land data processing of Crown and Freehold data Perform or oversee maintenance of all Canadian land tables required to effectively provide current data delivery to all internal & customer data delivery products. Assist IHS & partner software development teams with testing and subject matter expertise as required. Assist Land Operations in resolving process failures and recovery – especially those which may compromise data deliveries and require immediate attention. Assist Land Customer Advisors in researching and responding to client enquiries requiring research and in-depth data knowledge Required Education: University degree (or equivalent working experience) in Business, Petroleum Land Management or other oil & gas related designation, or Oil & Gas related certification, preferably in Petroleum Land or Land Administration.  Required Experience: 8+ years of Oil & Gas industry information experience with a strong focus in Relational database specifications and analysis Experience with relational databases and querying required (comparing databases, analyzing and resolving differences). Experience with the following are strongly preferred: Database querying and interaction with content Interacting with data-entry GUI’s Working in an Agile development methodology understanding or experience as the product owner Experience with the following an asset: Spatial experience is an asset Business Analysts experience Other skills: Solid knowledge of commonly-used concepts, practices, and procedures within Canadian land operations Must be observant, organized, investigative, results-oriented with strong attention to detail Must be able to work with team members and stakeholders at all levels in a positive, service-oriented and team-affirming manner Understands daily operational requirements Excellent Communication and Writing skills – able to write consistent, accurate documentation and contribute effectively in Team / stakeholder meetings, and when troubleshooting Physical Requirements: May be required to monitor processes during evenings or weekends (from home). May need to be available for phone or email consultation during non-business hours. It is the policy of IHS Markit to provide equal employment opportunity (EEO) to all persons regardless of age, color, national origin, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, race, religion, creed, gender, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, genetic information, marital status, status with regard to public assistance, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law. In addition, IHS Markit will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities. We maintain a drug-free workplace. For candidates in the US, we are a participant in E-Verify (see link below).  EEO is the Law EEO is the Law Supplement Right to Work Pay Transparency Policy E-Verify   Current Colleagues If you are currently a colleague with IHS Markit please apply internally via Workday.
Title: Principal Analyst, Canadian Land

Job_Description: Interested in being a part of a team that is leading the evolution of retail in Canada?  Embracing and driving change is critical to our success. The complexity and rate at which the retail industry is transforming has increased exponentially in recent years and we are committed to being a leader in the industry. As such we are relentlessly focused on innovating at every level of our business, investing in new technologies and products, and doubling down on the best talent to drive the company forward. It is an especially exciting time to join the Canadian Tire Family of Companies.  Sr. QA Analyst – Data Integration & Hadoop will report to the QA Manager  The successful candidate will be accountable for working with the Data Technology & Integration project teams to help provide quality products for our business. They will also work with Project Managers, QA Analysts, Business Analysts, Developers, Architects, Vendors, and Business Stakeholders. The successful candidate in this role will ensure a high caliber of testing through execution of the testing plans and strategies. Finally, they will support the QA leaders in reporting the status of testing across all stakeholders within the CTC, FGL & Marks organizations. If this sounds like the role for you, you must have a passion for Quality Assurance & Software Testing, be excited by learning and exploration of applications, and be willing to have fun with an enthusiastic QA Team.  Responsibilities: Define the testing strategy and approach for all integration and BigData projects in a complex & multisystem environments (including Hadoop platform)  Manage & perform the testing activities for data integrations in alignment with the testing strategy and expectations for the quality of the project  Create liaisons between different teams and contribute to the smooth communication between teams  Design, implement and execute tests for ETL and Data Integration scenarios  Perform Functional, Integration, Regression and End to End testing on all Data Technology projects  Identify and assist in the resolution of testing issues, defects and Issues & risks in Jira Agile board  Help coordinate project deliverables and resolve issues, identify dependencies and roadblocks  Provide non-production and production environment support assistance when required  Represent QA in different status meetings which may include project team members, business members, external vendors, leadership teams and stakeholders as required  Provide coaching, mentoring and training to other team members on Data Technology QA framework  Keep up to date of the latest emerging trends in the testing industry through personal research and by being an active member within the industry  In collaboration with the QA Manager, help define ongoing quality improvement practices for CTC/FGL  Required Skills and Experience: Minimum 5 years of experience in a software development environment including 3+ years in integration/ ETL testing (in Big Data platform)  Demonstrated knowledge of integration testing methodologies and practices  Experience testing in a Unix/Linux environment  Experience working with integration tools like Tibco, Data stage, MQ, Change  Experience working on Agile based team collaborative tools like JIRA, Bitbucket and Jenkins  Experience developing tests in functional programming languages such as Python  Experience testing of ETL and message queue workflows and workloads, including such tools as Apache Kafka, Nifi  Experience testing distributed systems, including testing on the Hadoop platform and user-level Hadoop configuration and light administration skills  Strong Hive – SQL knowledge including writing and executing queries to analyze data integrity  Experience working in a highly integrated, multi-project environment  Experience working with XML, jSON and EDI data formats  Experience working with databases, including SQL Server, Oracle, Netezza and MariaDB  Experience in planning, developing and executing Test Plans and Test Procedures and coordinating the collection of test results  Detailed oriented personality complimented with strong analytical and problem solving skills  Ability to communicate clearly in written and verbal communications  Ability to work independently and as part of a team  Excellent organizational and planning skills  Ability to work well under pressure in a fast-paced team environment, working on multiple deliverables at the same time  Knowledge of Retail, POS, Warehousing/Inventory, Supply Chain, or Finance industries an asset  About You: Builds Trust and Credibility by consistently adhering to the organization’s business principles and values. Is seen as direct, truthful, and trustworthy by co-workers, vendors, and customers  Committed to results by taking personal responsibility for achieving mutually agreed upon individual/team objectives  Demonstrates a desire to help and serve internal/external customers to meet their needs. Is proactive, responsive, and focused on discovering, anticipating, and exceeding the customer’s needs  Works collaboratively and cooperatively with others to achieve shared goals and objectives. Considers the wider team, function, banner or the organization and takes action or makes decisions which support the success of those groups  Recovers quickly after change, disruptions, or mistakes and can remain productive and focused. Is adaptable and can apply lessons learned in one situation to another situation  Academic / Educational requirements: BS in Computer Science, Engineering, Information Systems, or a Minimum of 5 years’ experience in the IT industry, specifically, as part of a team responsible for delivering software quality assurance and testing to IT projects  Canadian Tire is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace for all. We recognize that our future success depends on the perspectives and contributions of all our employees -- their diverse backgrounds, abilities and experiences make our business stronger. If you are contacted for a job opportunity, please advise us of any accommodations needed to ensure fair and equitable access throughout the recruitment and selection process. Job_Description: Powering Possibilities …for Today & Tomorrow!  A leader in sustainable energy, TransAlta has over 100 years of experience generating power and is one of Canada’s top 50 Socially Responsible Companies since 2009, recognized as a global leader for sustainability and corporate responsibility standards. TransAlta operates 75 facilities in three countries; Australia, Canada, and United States.  TransAlta is committed to fostering a dynamic, productive and safe work environment. Our employees contribute to a diverse, open, and transparent culture with clear accountability, strong leadership and challenging opportunities for personal career growth.  Summary: The Sr. Analyst, Credit role provides a review of credit limit requests, calculates credit exposures and performs deal and strategy analysis, and drives weekly, monthly and quarterly reporting. This position coordinates insurance coverage, guarantees and collateral posting (i.e. cash and letters of credit) for Commercial & Industrial, Energy Trading and Marketing and Business Development Project teams with a focus on optimizing collateral utilized. The Sr. Analyst, Credit reports to the Manager Credit & Customer Enablement.  Accountabilities: Calculate and recommend counterparty credit limits; review Energy Trading counterparty credit limit requests (deals, auctions, etc.) and approve credit and tenor for deals within approved exposure limits and terms. Track, report and recommend optimization strategies for collateral posting (cash and letters of credit), and track utilization relative to governance limits. In addition to Collateral posted, coordinate insurance coverage and guarantees for Commercial & Industrial, Energy Trading & Marketing and Business Development Project teams. Deliver weekly, monthly and quarterly reporting including contributing to the weekly Trading & Risk meetings, monthly Commodity Risk and Compliance Committee meetings, management reporting, collateral budgeting, quarterly financial reporting and other reporting as required. Perform, as required, counterparty credit reviews and manage credit/tenor limits and collateral in the Allegro Trading Risk Management system. Act as the Credit representative on the weekly Deal Management Team which operationalizes new commercial initiatives. Review non-trading contracts and master agreements and negotiate credit terms. Manage exposure limits on ICE platform. Act as an Allegro super user (troubleshooting relating to deal entries, bug identification, etc.). Back-up as required on daily management of Futures Commission Merchant / NGX margin calls; wire and LC approvals; coordinating approvals and daily posting of wire payments with Cash Management.  Requirements: 5 - 10+ years of experience in Credit, Treasury, or Banking areas. Bachelor degree in Finance, Accounting, Economics, Statistics or equivalent. Advanced Excel, analytical and modelling skills. Comprehensive understanding of counterparty credit analysis, terminology, and standards including the ability to interpret and apply counterparty financial metrics and ratings. A detailed understanding of credit policies, processes, and procedures. Strong attention to detail. Strong interpersonal and communication skills. Ability to work independently and multi-task in a fast pace and demanding environment. Ability to research using a variety of services including: S&P;, Moody’s, Bloomberg, Reuters, Credit Risk Monitor. Ability to review and negotiate contract credit terms. Experience with credit risk management systems such as Allegro. Ability to use external systems /platforms (ICE, FCM portals, etc.).  Our comprehensive and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, incentive and rewards programs form the foundation of TransAlta’s excellent employment proposition. Come on board!  Our commitment is to attract and retain the best talent. Some positions may require the successful completion of one or more background checks such as criminal, medical, or compliance. If these verifications are needed, they will be indicated on the job posting.
Title: Sr. Analyst 2, Credit

Job_Description: Job Summary*PLEASE NOTE: PREFERENCE WILL BE GIVEN TO CANDIDATES WHO APPLY THROUGH CANFOR.COM/CAREERSCanfor TechnologyAt Canfor, our Information Technology professionals play an important role in the daily functioning of our operations. Consistently pushing the boundaries when it comes to innovation within the forestry and pulp and paper industries, our IT professionals support Canfor in achieving exceptional results.With a high caliber Information Technology leadership team, a clear vision, and significant growth and training opportunities, a career in IT at Canfor allows individuals to strengthen their competencies and grow within their respective roles. Working as an equal partner with our operations to achieve organizational objectives, you will be at the forefront of innovation.The OpportunityThe Business Analyst, (Payroll Support), supports the Payroll team by handling technical issues, implementing changes and assisting with maintenance of The Canfor payroll systems. This will include the SAP Payroll / EC Payroll (Cloud) environments and may involve interim support of Canfor’s VIP and Empath payroll systems.The Business Analyst, Payroll Support), IT will also support the time capture systems in use at Canfor. This individual will partner with internal and external resources to ensure proper payroll processing and problem resolution.Relocation packages to move you and your family to Vancouver, BC may be available for successful candidates.Key ResponsibilitiesSystem DevelopmentServe as a key resource on HR/Payroll/Timekeeping projects (SAP SuccessFactors)For feature enhancements and/or acquisition activities, participate in the project management process including; assessing business and application requirements, design specification development, change management, system configuration, identifying security requirements, developing test plans, coordinating test execution and implementationCapture and document non-functional requirements that are important to the user community (i.e. usability, learnability, reliability). Liaise with architecture to ensure other non-functional requirements are considered (i.e. security, compatibility, maintainability)Create necessary documentation and deliver knowledge transfer sessionsProvide SAP Payroll / EC Payroll (Cloud) and Timekeeping technical support and problem resolutionSupport maintenance of tax tables and setup to ensure compliance with federal, state, and local regulationsServe as an HR/Payroll team Business Intelligence (BI) resource/support, including coordination with the BI lead resource for requirements analysis, data modeling, testing, security, integration and query developmentPayroll SupportSupports the Payroll Manager(s) in payroll processing to ensure payroll deadlines are metRun ad hoc reports to extract payroll data as needed as approved by the Payroll Manager and/or Director Total Rewards & NA Payroll.Assist in establishing priorities and meeting project deadlinesMaintain accurate and sufficient testing documentationSafeguard and ensure confidentiality of HR and payroll dataRequired SkillsBachelor’s degree or equivalent experience.Minimum five (5) years’ experience in business operations or HR/Payroll Business Support.Experience in supporting a corporate payroll environmentExperience with time keeping solutions is requiredPayroll knowledge required; tax knowledge preferredExperience in configuring and implementing HCM modules in SAP (ECC, workflow and Business Warehouse), or a similar ERP system preferredExperience with testing and problem solving within the SAP Payroll / EC Payroll system preferredWork experience in an industrial / shift worker environment is considered an assetHiring for this position is ongoing and will be filled as required. To be considered for this position, please apply today.In order to be eligible for this position, you must be legally entitled to work in Canada for our Company.There has never been a better time to join the Canfor Information Technology team and become a part of the modern forest industry. We have a wide range of rewarding and innovative careers in some of the best communities in North America, with plenty of room for advancement. We offer competitive compensation and benefits packages, and are committed to the professional development of our employees.Follow us on LinkedIn , Twitter , and Facebook for Canfor news, career opportunities, and upcoming events!Vancouver, BCThe city of Vancouver is both a natural beauty and a progressive urban centre, a rare place on earth that is idyllic and electric all at once. With one of Canada’s mildest climates, Vancouver is ideally suited for those devoted to outdoor pursuits, health and wellness. Along with its endless supply of fresh air and clean water, Vancouver also boasts countless choices for culturally diverse, world-class cuisine and an inventory of arts and entertainment events. For more information, visit http://canfor.com/our-company/our-communities/vancouverJob Type: Full-timeEducation:High school or equivalent
Title: Business Analyst (Payroll/IT) (Relocation Opportunity)

Job_Description: Inter Pipeline is a major petroleum transportation, storage and natural gas liquids processing business that ranks among the largest energy infrastructure companies in Canada. We are proud to be named one of Alberta’s Top 70 Employers, which recognizes Alberta businesses that lead their industries by being exceptional places to work.  Located out of our Calgary office, the individual in the Senior Business Analyst role will report to the Supervisor, Finance Solutions Centre. The successful candidate will be responsible for the stewardship of finance master data and project support within SAP for Inter Pipeline, as well indirect leadership of the Business Analyst.  Key Activities and Responsibilities: Review and ongoing improvement of master data creation/change approval processes Leadership of the Business Analyst role, utilizing a team accountability approach for facilitating finance master data creation/changes Work with the business and SAP Competency Centre to develop Service Level Agreements (SLAs), key performance indicators (KPIs) and other metrics for SAP finance master data Act as a data steward bringing forward cross-functional data quality and process integration issues and working collaboratively to solve them, championing the collective management of data governance Serve as a central point of contact for finance data governance understanding and providing direction and training to data consumers and producers from the business in line with business rules Ensure the right stakeholders across the enterprise (e.g. operations, finance, supply chain, etc.) are brought into make business process improvements which mitigate data issues Bring best practices in master data management and propose opportunities for improvement Interaction with SAP Competency Center on future system enhancements, builds, testing, and roll-outs Assist with development and usage of SAP reports  Education, Skills and Experience: Undergraduate diploma or degree in business with 5+ years of progressive experience in financial system support, CPA (CA, CMA, CGA) designation is an asset Strong finance expertise on master data usage, configuration, and integrated data requirements/linkage points combined with prior oil and gas experience considered an asset In depth knowledge of SAP FI_CO and Business Warehouse, experience with S/4HANA and Fiori an asset Approaches work with a high level of curiosity and aptitude to identify and solve problems, takes initiative, is accountable, and works independently Change agent who can persuade and influence stakeholders to establish new processes, shift to automation, and provide innovative solutions Ability to manage internal and external relationships with well-developed interpersonal, team, customer service and communication skills (both written and verbal) Strong customer service skills in working with internal departments to achieve results through relationships with people and teams Able to work well in a fast-paced, growth environment, with strong attention to detail and accuracy Maintains strong initiative and possesses superior analytical skills
Title: Senior Business Analyst
