Job_Description: Build a meaningful career  At Morneau Shepell, we offer more than career opportunities, we provide career opportunities to make meaningful contributions to people’s lives. The extraordinary expertise of our 4,000-strong workforce is harnessed to support the employees and families of the organizations we serve. Our innovative programs have a lasting impact on the health, financial security and productivity of 20,000 workplaces.  Consultant Health and Benefits  Health & Benefits Solutions  Calgary, AB  Full Time, Permanent  Benefits programs are an important and highly valued part of any employment offering. But understanding how much or what type of benefit coverage is necessary can be difficult. Our client relationship model is consultative and encourages continual communication. By providing you with the resources to support employers in engaging employees in their health, we provide a path to better workforce health and productivity.  Our Consultant works in a team and is responsible for managing, servicing and providing quality benefits consulting services for small to medium sized clients. In addition, they will be responsible for helping to build business with existing clients as well as attracting and supporting new clients through our association partnerships.  Responsibilities include:  Business Development  Identify and manage cross-sell opportunities Develop strategic relationships with key account contacts and introduce Morneau Shepell team members as appropriate Supervise the complete employee benefits cycle: plan design, provider search, implementation, experience monitoring, renewal rating Develop new business with existing clients and assists in obtaining new business with prospective clients focusing on our key association partnerships Understand client needs and identify company or industry products or services that can meet these needs Service  Deliver presentations to clients; conduct client meetings and the occasional employee presentation. Ensure that quality control and service standards are attained with every transaction Negotiate, problem solve and maintain positive relationships with insurers, external advisors and internal underwriting and benefits administration departments Develop and maintain excellent relationships with clients, through regular telephone contact and office visits Understand the client’s perspective and priorities, and work with the client to resolve administrative issues Establish strategies for services that meet client needs  Administration  Provide and oversee direct day-to-day support for clients by phone, e-mail, letters, formal reports, and face-to-face meetings Lead and manage multiple client assignments and projects Manage special projects as required Peer review the work of analysts Knowledge  Maintain current knowledge of industry trends including insurer news, products, legislation, and cost trends as well as current knowledge of our company's products and services  Qualifications:  Experience  Five years of experience in group benefits. Preference will be given to those from the group insurance industry, a consulting firm or brokerage or in an HR department. Education  Post-secondary education GBA (CEBS) designation, or working towards it. Life Insurance license (this will be a requirement within 3 months of onboarding) Skills  Strong presentation skills and comfort speaking in front of large groups Understanding of consultative selling and the ability to manage the sales cycle effectively and autonomously Expert negotiation, technical and analytical skills Can effectively communicate complex concepts in plain written and spoken language Professional Traits  Exceptional customer focus; some would say you’re the best Extremely organized self-starter, flexible, highly independent Ability to manage multiple deadlines simultaneously Proven collaborative team member with the ability to motivate and inspire team members  Morneau Shepell Morneau Shepell is in the business of helping organizations help their people because we believe that engaged people are the driving force for society. Every day, the expertise of our almost 4,000 employees is recognized as essential to the financial security, health, and productivity of our clients and their people. We're always looking for talented professionals and strategic leaders who will listen and work together with colleagues and clients to form long-term relationships and to deliver integrative solutions that fit. As we continue to grow, we're presently engaging with exceptional candidates interested in a range of exciting career opportunities. At www.morneaushepell.com you can explore our careers page to learn more about the solutions we deliver and the great people who help us do it. Follow us on LinkedIn and Twitter (Morneau_Shepell, Shepell). We are thankful for your interest, but unfortunately, we can only personally connect with those selected for an interview.  INDCAD LI-PH1  Job Grade: MS4   Fulfilling work that matters  Morneau Shepell is in the business of helping organizations help their people and in the process, we strive to elevate ours.  We're always looking for talented professionals and strategic leaders looking to make a difference in the lives of the people we serve.  We appreciate the interest of every applicant; however, we contact only those selected for an interview.  Find your fit with us. Follow us on LinkedIn, Youtube and Twitter.
Title: Consultant

Job_Description: Do you have a weakness for analyzing the SERPs? Actually, first, can you tell our copywriter what “SERP” stands for? He wants to know. Does data driven content creation to improve organic traffic inspire you? It inspires us. Do you wish we’d cut all this pre-amble, so you can go back to looking through your latest Screaming Frog crawl? You win, potential Evans Hunt Search & Analytics manager/analyst.  Requirements Three years or more experience in SEO Ability to work with diverse project teams Solid verbal and written communication skills Excellent presentation skills A relevant degree certainly helps PPC / SEM / Social Advertising experience is a definite asset CRO experience is a definite asset Title will be based on experience and expertise  Responsibilities: Define business and strategic requirements for SEO Maximize organic traffic using white-hat SEO tactics Complete technical SEO audits and site optimization Conduct keyword research Complete Web analytics reporting, and goal/event tracking and set-up Define content strategy for outreach and link building Execute on link building and outreach strategy Use your knowledge of SEM and social to create integrated holistic digital solutions for clients Do stuff we don’t know we need (but you do) Remote employment or relocation may be an option for exceptional candidates.
Title: SEO & Analytics Manager / Analyst

Job_Description: Our downtown Calgary client is looking for a Senior Business/Systems Analyst to gather requirements for an AWS cloud migration/infrastructure project.  Specific to this role: Significant experience as an Infrastructure Business Analyst with a strong background in IT projects and operations. Experience with Cloud technologies like AWS and Azure Experience in gathering requirements for infrastructure-centric projects covering a broad range of infrastructure technologies: Networks Virtualization (ie. VMWare) Servers Databases Desktop Virtualization Storage Technologies Data center consolidation or migration project experience. Ability to facilitate and lead technical requirements sessions with multiple stakeholders Solid understanding of infrastructure and/or application support and operations Experience with at least one CMDB tool (e.g. Remedy, Service Now, etc) Base Experience with Windows and Unix Operating systems Basic knowledge about infrastructure security Experience with large infrastructure projects in enterprise environments (e.g. Windows server or desktop upgrade projects, data center migrations, etc)   Additional Responsibilities: The Business Systems Analyst is accountable for documenting and analyzing business system requirements in such a way that the business team members understand and approve them and other project team members can successfully use them to develop the solution. The Business Systems Analyst ensures the solution meets the business requirements. Should have strong understanding of business processes, analyzes complex business problems to be solved with IT technologies. Develops detailed functional, system and program specifications. Expertise and Skills Networks and Infrastructure, Amazon Web Services 5 - 7 years Business Analysis, Business/Systems Analyst 8 - 10 years Priority Requirements Must-have: Please outline your experience as a Senior Business/Systems Analyst gathering requirements for an AWS cloud migration project. Work Environment Successful candidate must undergo a criminal background check.
Title: Senior Business/Systems Analyst to gather requirements for a...

Job_Description: The Day & Ross Transportation Group is currently seeking a full-time Logistics Coordinator for our Freight division in Calgary, AB  As a Logistics Coordinator you will be responsible for ensuring a positive customer experience in the movement of orders throughout North America. You will do this through carrier partners (including own assets) with a focus on claims-free, on-time service, protection and growth of revenue and margin. We are looking for someone who will meet and strive to exceed service expectations.  With a focus on quality customer service that extends to our valued employees, Day & Ross has been continuously recognized as an honored recipient of Canada’s Best Managed Companies since 2005. We offer our full-time employees a generous Benefits package and a company matched Pension plan. Day & Ross Freight is committed to an exceptional customer experience. We achieve this by being: authentic, committed, caring, trusted, and enthusiastic.  Please note: This position is tentatively scheduled for 40 hours per week, flexible hours will be required to accommodate various time zones and customer requirements. Periodic overtime and after hours coverage may be required.  To be successful in this role, you will exceptionally complete the following (not an exhaustive list of responsibilities):  Receive, analyze, and process booking information from customers in order to identify and confirm appropriate routes, and verify service requirements. Understand the wide array of capabilities and scheduled of designated carriers and make appropriate matches to customer requirements. Understand transportation market conditions throughout North America; seasonal vs. non-seasonal. Negotiate rates with carriers on daily basis for short term work and as well as longer term contractual work. Strong understanding of the trucking industry and knowledge of customs bond, customs documentation for transborder movements. Maintain strong relationships with all internal and external stakeholders. Provide spot quotes on daily basis for short term and long term contractual work. Coordinate carrier bookings, following throughout the duration of the order, and communicating with the customer, both positive and negative occurrences as required. Mitigate additional charges and assist with maintaining the accuracy of carrier information. Timely, accurate and appropriate escalation of issues. Work with analysts, managers, and customers in order to quickly resolve issues in the most efficient manner. Understand industry market conditions and communicate with the entire team issues that could impact operations as a whole. Other related duties as may be required.  To be qualified for this role, please ensure your resume clearly displays some or all of the following:  Previous experience in transportation, freight brokerage and 3PL (third party logistics) is required. Post-secondary education, preferably in business, transportation, supply chain and logistics management is considered an asset. A suitable combination of post-secondary education and transportation experience may be considered. Professional Industry Certifications such as SCMP, CITT and CTB will be considered an asset. Experience with all types of equipment, especially Flatdecks, Stepdecks, Goose Neck, and all applicable projects associated with this types of specialty equipment. Exceptional customer service and relationship management skills. Strong aptitude and skills with computers, including accuracy and efficiency in data entry and the use of MS Outlook, Excel & Word; experience with Cargowise an asset. Troubleshooting and problem solving skills, with the ability to evaluate current situation, respond quickly to changing requirements, and execute accordingly. Strong organizational and time management skills, including the ability to work under pressure in a fast paced setting, multitask and prioritize in a deadline driven environment; appropriate sense of urgency. Strong English (written and spoken) is required. Bilingual in French and/or Spanish will be considered an asset.  The working environment can include a fast paced, deadline driven office environment with computer work and handling of documentation.  Please apply directly on our website at www.dayandrosscareers.com or send your resume to yourcareer@dayandrossinc.ca and note the job title and location in the subject line.  Please note that the successful candidate will be subject to reference and criminal background checks prior to employment.  We thank you for your application, but only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted. As a federally regulated employer, The Day & Ross Transportation Group fully supports the principles of employment equity and encourages all qualified members of the designated groups to apply.
Title: Logistics Coordinator

Job_Description: Proposal Coordinator - (18000474) Description  At Golder, we thrive on challenges.  Golder is not just a place to work, it is a promise of a living, dynamic environment where people collaborate, innovate, build enduring relationships, excel, and grow professionally in a strong culture of ownership.  Do you have the desire to learn? The drive to excel and thrive in an engaged, collaborative environment?  Golder has a new opportunity for a Proposal Coordinator to join the Calgary office on a full time basis to support the growth of our North American business. As the Proposal Coordinator, you will be reporting to our Prairies and North Central Team Lead, and work closely with the regional and North American staff and colleagues to develop and deliver a strategic approach to winning business through proposal response channels.  As a member of the North American Proposal Team, you will directly contribute to the proposals pursuits, request for information, presentations, and other client-centric responses. You will also be responsible for win strategy planning, capture planning, development and post-submission efforts for service or industry-based bids in response to local, regional, national or global requests, as needed. You will be a gatekeeper of proposal content online, and an advocate for promoting the proposals team’s best practices, tools and policies. This may include being the main contributor to location-specific content.  An overview of your role will include:   Review/analyst in-bound proposal requests such as (RFP, RFQ, EOI, SOA, etc.), and develop proposal structure and contents to address these Plan and coordinate proposal tasks, from initial Go/No go and kick-off meeting to proposal delivery and post-submission follow-up Assess and execute proposal win strategy and compile internal intelligence such as history with the client for proposal decisions Compile, edit, and write standard proposal components in adherence to requirements Perform and delegate proposal tasks, and ensure proposal schedules are maintained and met Assist with proposal budgets and other technical sections, as required Adapt existing resumes, project descriptions and boilerplate information Review final/deliverable documents for quality assurance and quality control Facilitate short-list interview strategy and develop presentations Assist with internal and external proposal debriefs and other proposal close-out activities Assist staff in developing capture plans for business opportunities and leads Act as a subject matter expert for Golder's proposal process and tools and participate in the development of such Contribute to the generation, collection, dissemination, and storage of related proposal information Effectively communicate with proposal teams and colleagues, as well as other stakeholders Report on proposal metrics as required Support and contribute to North American Proposal Team initiatives and activities, and ad-hoc requests Think and act for the company's best interest and sustainability; actively promote Golder and support Golder Core Values    Qualifications  You will have a background in:  Bachelor's Degree in Journalism, Marketing, Corporate Communications, Business or related discipline A minimum of 4 years' relevant experience Strong verbal and written communication skills in English are an asset Attention to detail and proofreading/grammar skills Excellent interpersonal skills Superb team player able to excel in a multi-task, deadline-driven environment Client-focused, and have strong relationship building skills Positive attitude and strong work ethic A motivated individual working remotely as a part of a larger proposal team or individually Ability to work overtime and under pressure to meet deadlines Project Management skills (prioritizing, scheduling, follow up, etc.) Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) Proficient in Adobe Creative Cloud suite (InDesign, Photoshop, and Acrobat) to create client collateral and proposals is highly desirable Experience with Customer Relationship Management tools (CRM) Experience in the professional services consulting industry (engineering and sciences an asset), with an emphasis on proposal management and/or writing Experience working on Federal Government and Public Works proposals would be considered a strong asset Experience working with both internal and external client groups, and distributed (virtual) proposal teams Comfortable working and interacting at all levels in a multidisciplinary environment  Your benefits at Golder will include: Competitive benefits and remuneration packages Option to purchase shares in Golder Employee owned structure - own the business, own the result Deepen your expertise in a dynamic work environment Innovative and collaborative multidisciplinary projects On the job training, mentoring and coaching Global projects and travel opportunities  One of Canada’s Best Managed Companies, Platinum member status 11 consecutive years  Renowned for technical excellence, Golder is a leading, global employee-owned engineering and consulting firm with over a half century of successful service to its clients. With over 165 offices in over 40 countries, Golder’s 6,500 professionals are driven by a passion to deliver results, offering unique specialized skills to address the ever-evolving challenges that earth, environment and energy present to clients across the infrastructure, mining, oil and gas, manufacturing and power sectors.   Golder is committed to providing equitable treatment and equal opportunity to all individuals. As such, Golder will provide accommodations throughout the recruitment and selection process to applicants with disabilities, upon request.  To learn more about our company and culture click here to view The Promise of Golder video.         Primary Location: CA-AB-CALGARY Schedule: Full-time Employee Status: Regular Job Posting: Mar 15, 2018, 12:10:23 PM
Title: Proposal Coordinator

Job_Description: Job Type: Permanent Primary Location: Calgary, Alberta, Canada All Available Locations: Calgary; Toronto  Position Overview: If you are a strategic minded, highly analytical, change agent motivated by the challenge to elevate the role of finance to strategic business advisor for our senior executives than we want to hear from you. Reporting to the Senior Finance Manager, this role will lead all aspects of Financial Planning and Analysis for our largest region. You will work alongside the Firm’s Executive leaders to drive operational excellence and outstanding financial performance by providing insightful, actionable recommendations related to but not limited to client profitability, resource optimization, and investments with the highest rate of return. Fostering strong working relationships with multiple members of the senior leadership team in addition to coaching and developing a Senior Financial Analyst to a future leader on our team will be critical to the success of this role.  Your role as a manager at Deloitte: Embrace and live the firm’s purpose – to make an impact that matters – by pushing yourself and your team to identify solutions to challenges that are most important for our clients, people, and society Develop high-performing people and teams through challenging and meaningful opportunities Deliver exceptional client service by maximizing results and driving high performance from people, while also fostering collaboration across businesses and borders Influence clients, teams and individuals positively, leading by example and establishing confident relationships Understand key objectives for clients and Deloitte, and align people to them to set appropriate priorities and direction  Key Responsibilities include but not limited to: Prepare and present insights based on analyses, key metrics trending and quantified risks and opportunities; Leverage a strong knowledge of the Firm’s financial model, systems and processes to act as a point of reference for leaders, practitioners and finance colleagues Financial modelling, analysis, interpretation and recommendations that support management decision making Monthly detailed review, analysis and progress reporting on the core business units of the practice Identify financial risk areas and recommend financial risk mitigation opportunities or actions Create and Manage executive friendly financial reporting for period end, forecasts and plans that form the basis of decision making Manage a rolling forecast that gathers inputs from the regions and is benchmarked against relevant comparables but is not bound by system limitations; Proactively assess and address needs of the business leaders; Participate as a Subject Matter Expert (SME) in firm wide Finance & Operations initiatives, fostering integration and collaboration across regions and services  Qualifications: Degree in business/commerce including relevant professional designation (CPA,CA, CPA,CMA) 3-5 years of progressive experience in a finance role in a fast paced environment Strong knowledge of business fundamentals and financial acumen Strategic thinker who is able to drive business initiatives end to end and deliver insights Management and leadership skills with the ability to coach, mentor and develop members of our team into the next generation of leaders Excellent communication and strong inter-personal skills Ability to thrive in a fast paced, high growth, evolving environment Strong organizational skills and a demonstrated ability to prioritize work in a demanding environment Ability to exercise sound judgment in interpreting firm policies and objectives Extremely detail oriented and able to work with time-sensitive and confidential information Customer focused, proactive and results-oriented Expert level proficiency in MS Excel Previous experience with Cognos (eg report studio), Hyperion and SAP an asset  Why Deloitte? Launch your career with The One Firm where you can make a greater impact than you ever thought possible. With endless opportunities at every turn, and a culture built to support and drive our people to be the very best they can be, Deloitte is The One Firm for you to learn, grow, create, and lead. At Deloitte, we understand that everyone, and their career goals, are different. As a firm, we help create the conditions and opportunities that will enable our people to thrive – both professionally and personally. We do this by making three commitments to our people: You will lead at every level: We grow the world’s best leaders so you can achieve the impact you seek, faster. You can work your way: We give you the means to work how you want, and we have innovative spaces and the mindset to help you be wildly successful. You will feel included and inspired: We create a deep sense of belonging where you can bring your whole self to work. Apply now and let us show you how to push your career to the next level at Deloitte. The One Firm. For You. Deloitte is an inclusive employer dedicated to building a diverse workforce. We encourage applications from all qualified candidates and will accommodate applicants’ needs under the respective provincial human rights codes throughout all stages of the recruitment and selection process. Please advise the Recruiter to ensure your accessibility needs are accommodated throughout this process. Information received relating to accommodation will be addressed confidentially. We thank all applicants in advance for their interest; however, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted 35141
Title: Finance Manager, Financial Analysis & Business Support

Job_Description: Why work for Lafarge? Lafarge in Canada is proud to provide construction solutions in the buildings, infrastructure and industrial segments. These solutions are built with high performance products from our cement, aggregates, ready-mix concrete, asphalt and road construction, and concrete products divisions. From the use of alternative materials and recycling to renewable energy, Lafarge's focus is to develop innovative products that can contribute toward sustainably constructed building solutions. Lafarge takes personal growth and development to heart, and provides resources for our employees to take control of their own careers. Through our commitment to communities, to the health and safety of our employees and their families, or through the many volunteer hours of our employees, Lafarge demonstrates our care for people. If you want to work in an environment that values hard work, entrepreneurship, and collaborative teamwork, Lafarge is for you. Building Better Cities is what we do. Come Build a Better Career with us! More information can be found at www.lafarge.ca/en/careers . Overview The Logistics Specialist is responsible for the short-term execution of the WCAN sourcing plan and the tactical management of WCAN’s railcar fleets. This entails close coordination and communication with all plants and terminals in WCAN, rail carrier customer service and operations personnel, and logistics functions in the US and ECAN. The position will also be responsible for working with carriers, terminal managers and customs brokers on various EDI and data issues. The Logistics Specialist will also be critical in ensuring that rail fleet utilization is maximized without compromising supply chain performance. The Logistics Specialist assists the Distribution and Sales organization in the development and execution of strategies to drive cost reductions and performance improvement. Responsibilities Key Missions: Assist the Rail Modal Manager in providing cost-effective, timely transportation of cementitious products in order to maximize profitability. Develop tools and processes to ensure that plants and terminals are supplied with the correct number of cars. Develop and maintain plant rail shipment plans. Drive plant adherence to these plans. Ensure plants and terminals are completing various rail-related tracking reports. Assist in data exchange with carriers, freight analysis and performance metrics. Develop methods for tracking and tracing to ensure proper delivery of Lafarge cementitious products. Minimize terminal outages (product availability/quality customer service) Manage all rail carrier vendor payables and work with rail carriers to resolve data and invoicing issues. Develop a knowledge base of all three modes of transportation (Barge, Rail and Motor Carrier) used by the business unit. Provide relief in supply chain jobs as necessary. Work with the Rail Modal Manager and Logistics Manager to ensure that weekly shipping plans are in line with the sourcing plan. Assist Performance Analyst with rail related analyses. Achieve total shipments objective to meet demand requirements Develop and implement action plans for deviations from supply plan Ensure effective communication across functions and inter-regionally Assist Rail Modal Manager in various ad-hoc projects. Results/Accountabilities: Fulfilled rail service demand for both inbound and outbound products. Cost performance of rail relative to plan. Optimal asset utilization (load size, cycle times and gate-to-gate at origin-destinations) Regular performance management reporting. Accurate and timely data management related to rail tracing application information. Support of business and financial analysis Develop an understanding of inter-regional transportation issues and communicate with other regions when required Develop an understanding of tariff and customs regulations that is required for all modes of transportation. Relationships with Other Jobs: Modal Managers, Logistics Managers, Sales ManagersRelationships with Others’ Jobs: Operations and Terminal Managers, Plant Shipping Personnel Finance US and ECAN Rail Modal and Logistics Managers Purchasing Qualifications Education and Work Experience: Three to five years of logistics / supply chain related work experience Minimum three years of experience as an employee or customer of a Class I railroad Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Information Systems or Engineering Logistics certification preferred Knowledge and Skills: Ability to analyze supply chain activity, identifying trends and potential performance gaps Familiarity with rail transportation and North American Class I rail network, preferably Western Canada and NW US. Demonstrated ability to compile, process, and analyze large volumes of data and convert that information to drive business decisions. Effective interpersonal, communication and presentation skills. Demonstrated ability to influence others Demonstrated ability to successfully work with a diversified group of people Demonstrated ability to work with minimal direction and to take initiative where warranted Demonstrated ability to use research and analytical tools and methodologies Familiarity with ERP systems desired (preferably SAP based systems) Proficiency in Excel LafargeHolcim Why work for us?  Working for Lafarge offers a wide variety of career opportunities that utilize your abilities and skills to contribute to a better world. In addition to local and global developmental opportunities, we provide employees with competitive compensation, a comprehensive benefits plan, a health & wellness program with financial incentives, an extensive global e-learning platform and much more! More information can be found at: www.lafarge.ca We thank you for your interest. Only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted. Lafarge is committed to the principles of employment equity and encourages the applications from women, visible minorities, and persons with disabilities.
Title: Logistics Specialist

Job_Description: Graham is a growing, dynamic and innovative construction solutions provider with history of success dating back to 1926. As an employee-owned company, you’ll be able to capitalize on our collective success by becoming an owner yourself. You’ll also be able to take advantage of professional development, learning and growth opportunities, while working on exciting, leading-edge projects. We rank among Canada’s largest construction companies, are a Platinum Member of Canada’s 50 Best Managed Companies and are seeking top tier talent to further strengthen our capabilities. We provide a collaborative and caring culture and the necessary tools and support for you to succeed, both personally and professionally. If you’re eager to work on innovative projects, be part of a great team and become an employee-owner, Graham is the place for you.   Our career opportunities extend well beyond construction and engineering. We also offer exciting career growth and development in areas such as: accounting; administration; asset management; business development; communications; estimating; finance; health, safety, environment and quality; human resources; information systems/technology; investments; legal and risk management; purchasing; and SAP. As a member of one of these groups, you will play an essential role in supporting the successful execution of our projects and overall business operations by advising and applying your expertise to various improvement initiatives within your functional area. About the Role Reporting to the Treasury Manager, the Treasury Analyst is responsible primarily for Treasury Banking activities.   As a Treasury Analyst at Graham you will: Forecast both short and long-term receipts and payments to maximize liquidity Approve payment files Maintain bank accounts and signatories while complying with bank policies and regulation Prepare and coordinate documents for Letters of Credit issuances Reconcile cash and cash related GL’s; complete Bank Recs Develop and document end-to-end policies and processes Prepare confirmations and settlements of various Treasury transactions Work closely and build relationships throughout the organization Assist with year-end audits, collaborate and cross-train with other team members Assist with ad hoc projects and requests as required Assist with identifying and developing continuous business improvement opportunities To be Successful at Graham, you will have the following qualifications and experience: University degree; two years minimum Treasury operations experience Recently designated or close to designation CPA, CFA or CTP Knowledge of institutional financial services industry, practices and regulations Advanced Excel skills Experience with SAP would be considered a significant asset Motivated self-starter with excellent written and verbal communication skills Compensation and Benefits: Competitive salary with annual bonus potential Comprehensive benefits package including dental, optical and medical and company matched pension plan. Ownership and long term equity opportunities What we can offer you: Strong commitment to safety in the workplace Grounded and family-oriented workplace in a progressive environment that is at the forefront of a fast-evolving business sector Commitment to the training and wealth of opportunities for career development across job categories, project types and locations around North America Graham is an Equal Opportunity Employer, and employment selection decisions are based on merit, qualifications, and abilities. Graham does not discriminate in employment opportunities or practices on the basis of race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, veteran status or any other characteristic protected by country, regional or local law.   We're Building careers, not filling jobs.   View available job opportunities and submit your application online at http://careers.grahambuilds.com/.  Applications will only be accepted as online submissions through the Graham website.  Please, no unsolicited resumes or phone inquiries from agencies, thank you.   Graham Management Services LP  10840 27th Street SE  Calgary, AB T2Z 3R6  Fax: 403.236.6575 Job Code: BH-18-025
Title: Treasury Analyst - Corporate

Job_Description: The Company  Willis Towers Watson is a leading global advisory, broking and solutions company that helps clients around the world turn risk into a path for growth. With roots dating to 1828, Willis Towers Watson has 40,000 employees serving more than 140 countries. We design and deliver solutions that manage risk, optimize benefits, cultivate talent, and expand the power of capital to protect and strengthen institutions and individuals. Our unique perspective allows us to see the critical intersections between talent, assets and ideas – the dynamic formula that drives business performance. Together, we unlock potential. Learn more at willistowerswatson.com. The Business Create your future. Our Health and Benefits business helps large and mid-size clients control soaring health and welfare plan costs, improve health outcomes and promote employee engagement through broad-based, state-of-the-art interventions. We provide solutions encompassing creative plan design, vendor evaluation and management, pricing and funding strategies, data analytics, valuation support, and legal compliance and governance strategies. We also provide specialty consulting services including clinical/health management program design, pharmacy solutions, disability/absence management strategies and claims audit services. Product based solutions such as our pharmacy purchasing coalition round out our broad-based suite of offerings.  The Role Explore an opportunity. As a Health and Benefits Intern, you will work beside some of the industry’s top consultants while you progress toward becoming a thought leader of the future.  You will have immediate exposure to real client assignments which will draw on your imagination and creativity as well as your ability to analyze data, draw conclusions and present results. These experiences will help build your technical knowledge and overall industry expertise.  Your main responsibilities will be as follows:  People  Build relationships internally and collaborate effectively on cross-functional teams Client  Partner with Analysts and Consultants to provide support on client projects. Depending on your area of specialty this might include some of the following client projects: Design, funding, pricing, implementation and management of a full array of health and group benefits or retirement programs Competitive benchmarking analysis of benefit plan designs Insurance pricing analyses to ensure that clients are competitive Financial modeling Increase efficiency within client teams by identifying ways to improve processes Demonstrate natural ease and effectiveness when dealing with clients/colleagues at all levels Financial  Meet chargeable hours targets Contribute to sales and marketing efforts by supplying information for proposals Excellence  Develop technical knowledge and skills in the area you have chosen to focus on Deliver on projects to meet or exceed client expectations The Requirements About you. Progress towards a Commerce degree in risk management or finance or a Bachelors in mathematics, statistics, finance, public health, health management, actuarial science or any other major with significant quantitative course work with a minimum overall GPA of 3.0 For Actuarial students:Successful completion of one or more actuarial exams highly preferred Work experience that demonstrates strong technical and/or client service skills (analyst type of internship preferred) Passion for solving problems and sharing solutions to exceed the standards of the client Ability to be a self-starter and work independently, but also cooperatively in a close team environment Excellent oral and written communication skills Excellent Microsoft Office skills, particularly in Excel
Title: Health and Benefits Intern, Fall 2018

Job_Description: HR Operations Lead  The future looks bright & the Badger is wearing shades for a reason. With a high growth runway, Badger Daylighting is the right company in the right industry at the right time. After 25 years of success, we are poised for significant growth. Our service solution transcends industry sector and we are the dominant player.  Key Deliverables This Year The first quick win will come in HR administration. As a project thinker who can inspire the team to bring their best game every day. Ensure employees are set up to succeed by: Research, recommend and implement policy and tools that will create a more efficient, professional and robust HR process (online enrollment, web-based new hire paperwork, onboarding, benefits administration) With a focus on service, productivity and quality, develop KPIs that will measure service quality and performance. Support and collaborate with payroll and HR Managers to ensure HR transactions are developed and executed in support of the overall HR strategy  Big Picture We are moving to the cloud. Work closely with our Leaders in Operations across the organization to ensure that HR activities are running smoothly and efficiently Lead and develop a high-quality, service-driven HR function Improve processes and establish best practices in benefits administration, HR administration, new hire onboarding, terminations. Education Bachelor’s degree in HR or combination of education and experience CPHR designation would be an asset  Experience  5-7 years of related work experience in a mid-sized (1-3K employees) organization with high growth, start-up or in times of rapid change Industries such as transportation, manufacturing, construction and industrial services are ideal Must have previous experience leading remote teams Knowledge of US and Canadian Benefits Experience managing & analyzing data and producing reports – must have solid skills in Excel Knowledge of data privacy issues, HR laws and regulations associated with HR operations  Personal Characteristics “Wouldn’t it be great if….” You are the kind of person who loves to peer over the horizon. The future fascinates you and you can see, in detail, the possibilities; in fact this pulls you forward. When faced with a complex situation involving many factors, you enjoy managing all of the variables, aligning and realigning them until you are sure you have them all arranged in the most productive configuration possible. Change is attractive, it means we are moving forward and action is key. Yet you appreciate and value that not everyone on your team will feel the same way, so patience and understanding are your best tools. Business acumen comes as 2nd nature, if we understand how our business makes money, we know how to best support our success. Leadership is defined by the relationships you build, how your team demonstrates excellence and embrace change   Our Recruitment Process This position is based in Calgary. Relocation is not offered for this role. We encourage all qualified candidates to apply. It is our aim to ensure our workforce reflects the diversity of the communities we operate within. Professional references are conducted by a 3rd party provider Final candidates will participate in The Predictive Index® Behavioral Assessment. Results are analyzed by a professionally trained PI Analyst. Pre-employment drug & alcohol screen is required
Title: HR Operations Lead

Job_Description: Position Description Critical Control Energy Services provides systems, technology and business solutions to a wide range of Oil & Gas clients across North America. Combining vision, innovation and expertise, Critical Control Energy Services has become a leader in business solution delivery. We are currently looking for a OneCall Technical Analyst. This position is focused on the delivery of OneCall Manager Services to our customers.  The Technical Analyst has daily responsibilities to generate OneCall Ticket Packages within the service level agreements. The Technical Analyst assists the OneCall Client Service Manager in ensuring outstanding customer service, accurate data and a proactive approach to problem solving by being the main liaison between the client, their designated locators and the One-Call organizations. Who We Are Critical Control Energy Services provides cloud-based solutions and services to a wide range of upstream oil & gas clients across North America for the access to and management of their production and measurement data. We run on a passion for quality and a dedication to service and expertise to deliver competitive solutions that enhance our client’s productivity, profitability and efficiency.  Our team is essential to who we are and what we do, and as a part of Critical Control, and you will be at the forefront of the service we to provide to our clients each and every day. Day-to-Day Responsibilities The Technical Analyst will deliver responsibilities to the following key customers: OneCall Manager Subscribers – energy producers who have outsourced administration of their pipeline one call location to Critical Control Energy Services. Alberta One-Call, BC One-Call and Saskatchewan One-Call – provincial organizations that distribute ground disturbance tickets. Designated locators The job responsibilities are outlined below, but other areas of responsibility may be added as required.  Specifically, the Technical Analyst will be responsible for: Ticket Management Receive one call tickets (requests to dig) from One-Call organizations on a daily basis on behalf of clients From each ticket, identify the client and their District/Field Screen each ticket by researching the clients’ pipeline data Identify the clients’ pipelines on a map Prepare a ticket package – cover sheet, ticket text and map(s) for each ticket received Distribute ticket packages to all stakeholders involved (Client – Head Office and District; and designated locate company) by fax and/or email Receive and print delivery and read notifications for watch tickets Check daily and monthly audits from one call organizations to ensure that all tickets issued were received and processed in a timely manner Ensure that all necessary client contact information is kept current Monthly Data Updates Receive monthly pipeline activity and change reports for clients from pipeline group Ensure that changes in the client data is transmitted to One-Call organizations so that clients assets chosen method of registration (LLD spreadsheet or shape file) Review updated files from One-Call organizations Sign off on verification of data Maintain all records of data updates and verification Provide copies Qualifications As a Technical Analyst, attention to deal is critical to your success. The Technical Analyst will be conscientious and thorough and will persist in resolving issues satisfactory for customers. The following skills will be needed to deliver the variety of work: Detail orientated and enjoys trouble shooting Operationally focused Enjoys repetitive work – daily tickets, monthly updates and set up of new clients Works well in a structured environment with defined expectations and outcomes Tech savvy Intermediate skills with Microsoft Office suite of products Minimum 5 years customer service experience Minimum 2 year post secondary education (oil and gas focused an asset) Preference will be given to those with GIS, locating and/or call center experience What We Offer Critical Control Energy Services offers competitive compensation, numerous company benefits and excellent opportunities for advancement to staff with the commitment to succeed in our dynamic business environment. We are interested in candidates who have the desire to become experts in the field and who are willing to learn and advance their careers.  Think you’d like to meet us and learn more about the opportunity? Send your resume today and let’s see if we can make a connection! We wish to thank all applicants for their interest and effort in applying for this position; however, only candidates selected for interviews will be contacted. Position Details Position Title: OneCall Manager™ Technical Analyst Hours: Full Time Reference Number: ES1106701 Posting Date: June 13, 2017 Location: Calgary, AB Closing Date: August 11, 2017 Department: OneCall Manager
Title: OneCall Manager™ Technical Analyst

Job_Description: The Day & Ross Transportation Group is currently seeking a full-time Flatdeck Logistics Specialist for our Freight division in Calgary, AB.As a Flatdeck Logistics Specialist you will be responsible for ensuring a positive customer experience in the movement of orders throughout North America. You will do this through carrier partners (including own assets) with a focus on claims-free, on-time service, protection and growth of revenue and margin. We are looking for someone who will meet and strive to exceed service expectations.With a focus on quality customer service that extends to our valued employees, Day & Ross has been continuously recognized as an honored recipient of Canada’s Best Managed Companies since 2005. We offer our full-time employees a generous Benefits package and a company matched Pension plan. Day & Ross Freight is committed to an exceptional customer experience. We achieve this by being: authentic, committed, caring, trusted, and enthusiastic.Please note: This position is tentatively scheduled for 40 hours per week, flexible hours will be required to accommodate various time zones and customer requirements. Periodic overtime and after hours coverage may be required.To be successful in this role, you will exceptionally complete the following (not an exhaustive list of responsibilities): Receive, analyze, and process booking information from customers in order to identify and confirm appropriate routes, and verify service requirements.Understand the wide array of capabilities and scheduled of designated carriers and make appropriate matches to customer requirements.Understand Flatdeck transportation market conditions throughout North America; Seasonal vs. Non-Seasonal.Negotiate rates with carriers on daily basis for short term work and as well as longer term contractual work.Strong understanding of Flatdeck equipment types such as regular Flatdecks, Stepdecks, Goosenecks, Lowboys and RGN trailersMaintain good relationships with carriers and Flatdeck service providers.Provide Spot Quotes to customers on daily basis for short term and long term contractual work.Coordinate carrier bookings, following throughout the duration of the order, and communicating with the customer, both positive and negative occurrences as required.Mitigate additional charges and assist with maintaining the accuracy of carrier information.Timely, accurate and appropriate escalation of issues.Work with analysts, managers, and customers in order to quickly resolve issues in the most efficient manner.Understand industry market conditions and communicate with the entire team issues that could impact operations as a whole.Other related duties as may be required.To be qualified for this role, please ensure your resume clearly displays some or all of the following:Previous experience in transportation, freight brokerage and 3PL (third party logistics) is required, especially in a Flatdeck dispatch environment.Post-secondary education, preferably in business, transportation, and supply chain and logistics management is considered an asset. A suitable combination of post-secondary education and transportation experience may be considered.Experience with all types of equipment, especially Flatdecks, Stepdecks, Goose Neck, and all applicable projects associated with this types of specialty equipment.Experience with pricing Flatdeck shipments as Full Truckloads and as well as Less than a Truckload modes.Strong understanding of all Flatdeck accessorial charges.Exceptional customer service and relationship management skills.Strong aptitude and skills with computers, including accuracy and efficiency in data entry and the use of MS Outlook, Excel & Word.Troubleshooting and problem solving skills, with the ability to evaluate current situation, respond quickly to changing requirements, and execute accordingly.Strong organizational and time management skills, including the ability to work under pressure in a fast paced setting, multitask and prioritize in a deadline driven environment; appropriate sense of urgency.Strong English (written and spoken) is required.Energetic, Hard Working and with a “can-do attitude”Ability to recognize sense of urgency. Exceptional follow up skills are a must!The working environment can include a fast paced, deadline driven office environment with computer work and handling of documentation.Please note that the successful candidate will be subject to reference and criminal background checks prior to employment.We thank you for your application, but only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.As a federally regulated employer, The Day & Ross Transportation Group fully supports the principles of employment equity and encourages all qualified members of the designated groups to apply.Job Type: Full-time
Title: Flatdeck Logistics Specialist

A background in engineering, economics, or regulatory accounting is preferred. Combinations of successfully completed graduate level education, professional designations and specialized experience may be used to meet total experience requirements.Competencies: Ability to use a variety of analytical approaches to solve routine to complex problems and make decisions and recommendations.Knowledge of performance-based regulation or price cap regulation. Experience working with performance-based regulation or price cap regulation is a definite asset.Skills in planning project, or proceeding work activities and identifying and managing the resources required to ensure quality deliverables.Skills in written communications that convey intended messages to target audiences with clarity and precision.Excellent communication skills and demonstrated ability to work effectively across all levels of the organization and with external stakeholders (both verbal and written).Knowledge of the structure, components, and issues related to the Alberta electric and natural gas distribution sectors.Knowledge of the regulatory process for setting rates and terms and conditions of service for the electric and natural gas distribution sectors.Knowledge of cost-of-service regulation and associated principles considered in establishing revenue requirements and rate design.Awareness of electric and gas distribution facilities and operations is an asset.Ability to perform well in challenging conditions and derive learning from a range of different situations, opportunities and sources.Ability to exercise sound judgment and deal with confidential matters.How to apply: Please send your resume with position number 18-011 and your name in the subject line. Applications will be accepted until a suitable candidate is found.Job Types: Full-time, PermanentExperience:relevant regulatory or utility industry: 6 yearsEducation:Bachelor's

Job_Description: *PLEASE NOTE: PREFERENCE WILL BE GIVEN TO CANDIDATES WHO APPLY THROUGH CANFOR.COM/CAREERSCanfor TechnologyAt Canfor, our Information Technology professionals play an important role in the daily functioning of our operations. Consistently pushing the boundaries when it comes to innovation within the forestry and pulp and paper industries, our IT professionals support Canfor in achieving exceptional results.With a high caliber Information Technology leadership team, a clear vision, and significant growth and training opportunities, a career in IT at Canfor allows individuals to strengthen their competencies and grow within their respective roles. Working as an equal partner with our operations to achieve organizational objectives, you will be at the forefront of innovation.Who We Are: Canfor is one of the world’s largest and most respected integrated forest products companies. For more than 75 years, we have been delivering top-quality lumber, pulp and paper products to our valued customers worldwide. With operations in Western Canada and the Southern United States, and sales offices around the world, you can find Canfor products in every corner of the globe. We are leaders in sustainable forest management and in converting wood residuals into green energy.As we continue to grow our company and our markets, find out how you can grow your career with us.The OpportunityThe Data Analyst, Business Intelligence supports Canfor’s objectives by turning data into meaningful information that can be used to make sound business decisions. The Data Analyst will provide expertise in business intelligence to prepare and deliver data and information to internal customers and stakeholders through reports, dashboards and scorecards. It is essential that the Data Analyst build an understanding of the business at a level of detail that enables them to work with the business to deliver valuable information.Please Note:  This is a relocation opportunity in Vancouver, British Columbia. To be considered for this position, please apply today.In order to be eligible for this position, you must be legally entitled to work in Canada for our Company.There has never been a better time to join the Canfor Information Technology team and become a part of the modern forest industry. We have a wide range of rewarding and innovative careers in some of the best communities in North America, with plenty of room for advancement. We offer competitive compensation and benefits packages, and are committed to the professional development of our employees.*PLEASE NOTE: PREFERENCE WILL BE GIVEN TO CANDIDATES WHO APPLY THROUGH CANFOR.COM/CAREERSFollow us on LinkedIn , Twitter , and Facebook for Canfor news, career opportunities, and upcoming events!Vancouver, BCThe city of Vancouver is both a natural beauty and a progressive urban centre, a rare place on earth that is idyllic and electric all at once. Job_Description: Inter Pipeline is a major petroleum transportation, storage and natural gas liquids processing business that ranks among the largest energy infrastructure companies in Canada. We are proud to be named one of Alberta’s Top 70 Employers, which recognizes Alberta businesses that lead their industries by being exceptional places to work.  Located out of our Calgary office, the individual in the Senior Business Analyst role will report to the Supervisor, Finance Solutions Centre. The successful candidate will be responsible for the stewardship of finance master data and project support within SAP for Inter Pipeline, as well indirect leadership of the Business Analyst.  Key Activities and Responsibilities: Review and ongoing improvement of master data creation/change approval processes Leadership of the Business Analyst role, utilizing a team accountability approach for facilitating finance master data creation/changes Work with the business and SAP Competency Centre to develop Service Level Agreements (SLAs), key performance indicators (KPIs) and other metrics for SAP finance master data Act as a data steward bringing forward cross-functional data quality and process integration issues and working collaboratively to solve them, championing the collective management of data governance Serve as a central point of contact for finance data governance understanding and providing direction and training to data consumers and producers from the business in line with business rules Ensure the right stakeholders across the enterprise (e.g. operations, finance, supply chain, etc.) are brought into make business process improvements which mitigate data issues Bring best practices in master data management and propose opportunities for improvement Interaction with SAP Competency Center on future system enhancements, builds, testing, and roll-outs Job_Description: Build a meaningful career  At Morneau Shepell, we offer more than career opportunities, we provide career opportunities to make meaningful contributions to people’s lives. The extraordinary expertise of our 4,000-strong workforce is harnessed to support the employees and families of the organizations we serve. Our innovative programs have a lasting impact on the health, financial security and productivity of 20,000 workplaces.  Consultant Health and Benefits  Health & Benefits Solutions  Calgary, AB  Full Time, Permanent  Benefits programs are an important and highly valued part of any employment offering. But understanding how much or what type of benefit coverage is necessary can be difficult. Our client relationship model is consultative and encourages continual communication. By providing you with the resources to support employers in engaging employees in their health, we provide a path to better workforce health and productivity.  Our Consultant works in a team and is responsible for managing, servicing and providing quality benefits consulting services for small to medium sized clients. In addition, they will be responsible for helping to build business with existing clients as well as attracting and supporting new clients through our association partnerships.  Responsibilities include:  Business Development  Identify and manage cross-sell opportunities Develop strategic relationships with key account contacts and introduce Morneau Shepell team members as appropriate Supervise the complete employee benefits cycle: plan design, provider search, implementation, experience monitoring, renewal rating Develop new business with existing clients and assists in obtaining new business with prospective clients focusing on our key association partnerships Understand client needs and identify company or industry products or services that can meet these needs Service  Deliver presentations to clients; conduct client meetings and the occasional employee presentation. Ensure that quality control and service standards are attained with every transaction Negotiate, problem solve and maintain positive relationships with insurers, external advisors and internal underwriting and benefits administration departments Develop and maintain excellent relationships with clients, through regular telephone contact and office visits Understand the client’s perspective and priorities, and work with the client to resolve administrative issues Establish strategies for services that meet client needs  Administration  Provide and oversee direct day-to-day support for clients by phone, e-mail, letters, formal reports, and face-to-face meetings Lead and manage multiple client assignments and projects Manage special projects as required Peer review the work of analysts Knowledge  Maintain current knowledge of industry trends including insurer news, products, legislation, and cost trends as well as current knowledge of our company's products and services  Qualifications:  Experience  Five years of experience in group benefits. Preference will be given to those from the group insurance industry, a consulting firm or brokerage or in an HR department. Education  Post-secondary education GBA (CEBS) designation, or working towards it. Life Insurance license (this will be a requirement within 3 months of onboarding) Skills  Strong presentation skills and comfort speaking in front of large groups Understanding of consultative selling and the ability to manage the sales cycle effectively and autonomously Expert negotiation, technical and analytical skills Can effectively communicate complex concepts in plain written and spoken language Professional Traits  Exceptional customer focus; some would say you’re the best Extremely organized self-starter, flexible, highly independent Ability to manage multiple deadlines simultaneously Proven collaborative team member with the ability to motivate and inspire team members  Morneau Shepell Morneau Shepell is in the business of helping organizations help their people because we believe that engaged people are the driving force for society. Every day, the expertise of our almost 4,000 employees is recognized as essential to the financial security, health, and productivity of our clients and their people. We're always looking for talented professionals and strategic leaders who will listen and work together with colleagues and clients to form long-term relationships and to deliver integrative solutions that fit. As we continue to grow, we're presently engaging with exceptional candidates interested in a range of exciting career opportunities. At www.morneaushepell.com you can explore our careers page to learn more about the solutions we deliver and the great people who help us do it. Follow us on LinkedIn and Twitter (Morneau_Shepell, Shepell). We are thankful for your interest, but unfortunately, we can only personally connect with those selected for an interview.  INDCAD LI-PH1  Job Grade: MS4   Fulfilling work that matters  Morneau Shepell is in the business of helping organizations help their people and in the process, we strive to elevate ours.  We're always looking for talented professionals and strategic leaders looking to make a difference in the lives of the people we serve.  We appreciate the interest of every applicant; however, we contact only those selected for an interview.  Find your fit with us. Follow us on LinkedIn, Youtube and Twitter.
Title: Consultant

Job_Description: Summary  Landmark Advisory Services is looking for a Transaction Assistant - Commercial Real Estate - to work out of our Calgary, Alberta Office supporting our Director Corporate Accounts and our Market Research Analyst. We are a dynamic and growing company that offers competitive remuneration not only commensurate with experience but with the value you bring to the team, great benefits, a fantastic working environment with opportunities to advance nationwide and learn alongside industry leaders.  The profile  Reporting to our Director of Corporate of Accounts for Western Canada, you have at least five years of pertinent experience, an accredited education pertinent to our industry, (paralegal, and/or administrative, and/or commercial real estate/advisory) which speaks as to your organization, communication and challenge resolution skills. You have in-depth understanding of the commercial real estate industry and the cornerstones on which it is built, processes, documents and culture, and you thrive on results-driven interaction with internal and external clients. You can shift easily from team player to working independently based on your excellent situation diagnostic and anticipation skills and you are equally comfortable and efficient with people as well as with tasks.  Main tasks and responsibilities  1. Prepare, submit for review and distribute legal documentation in concert with legal team and guidance of transaction manager; this includes drafting letters of intent, generating and revising offers to lease, leases, renewal / amending agreements and other leasing / real estate documentation (condition removals, extensions of renewal option notices, short-term tenancy agreements);  2. Prepare Lease Summary/Extract, set-up location files, secure contact information.  3. Prepare and coordinate client communication documents including, update to weekly activity reports, follow-up with Legal lists, client quarterly reports and assist with client annual reports  4. Prepare with Research authorisations to proceed – process, track/record approvals, Draft ATP-2 for review and approval  5. Support Market Research Analyst, follow up with weekly search parameters for relocation and new to market locations  6. Prepare and assist the Transaction Team with the execution and distribution of contracts and agreements such as, Brokerage Mandates, Commission Agreements, etc.  7. Research and compile relevant industry and real estate market data and distribute the data, including current broker fee data base for Western Canada  8. Prepare travel bookings and submit expenses claims for Western Canada team.  9. Compile and maintain accurate and organized reporting data of each transaction including closing procedures, documenting KPI and benefits to clients for client portfolio reporting requirements  10. Assist and support LAS marketing efforts, create presentations in PowerPoint and other software programs that utilize photos, videos, audio material and other visual assets, I.E. locations wanted, updates to web site, annual reports,  11. Participate and contribute to other initiatives such as custom reporting, special projects, etc.  The skills  Apart from experience, you must also bring the following skills with which you support the team and our mission, and demonstrate your value.  Outgoing, personable and friendly;  Confident and tenacious;  Customer service-driven;  Proven high performer, results oriented;  Enjoys working in a highly accountable team environment;  High level of professionalism and excellent interpersonal skills;  Resourceful;  Outstanding communicator both verbal and written;  Methodical and detail oriented in maintaining and tracking information;  Strong organizational and time management skills;  Proficiency in Microsoft Office applications  The Company  Landmark Advisory Services Inc. has successfully delivered corporate real estate solutions to multi-national organizations since 1986. Our approach is to go far beyond the execution of day-to-day transactions; we add value to every real estate project we handle. Through our dedicated team of real estate experts, we deliver a streamlined execution process, a results-oriented business model, and a broad platform of services (including market intelligence, transaction management, lease administration, lease auditing, construction management, legal services and consulting).  The Location  Calgary is Alberta’s most populous city and one of Canada’s wealthiest cities. It has also earned the distinction of being one of the world’s most livable and cleanest cities and boasts North America’s first wind-powered public transit system – the C Train.
Title: Transaction Assistant - Commercial Real Estate

Job_Description: We are an experience design agency with a relentless focus on the customer. The way a customer experiences a brand has a profound impact on perception, purchase behavior and loyalty. That’s why our work begins and ends with our clients’ customers. We listen to them. Validate with them. We even include them in our design process. By creating customer experiences that are simple, valuable, entertaining, and convenient, we deliver measurable results for some of the world’s most admired brands. Today we’re 950 people in 11 offices on 4 continents. We love diverse points of view, open minds, and people who are passionate, driven, and real. And we love all things digital, too. Marketing Science Senior Analyst The primary role of a senior analyst is to support the day-to-day work more independently. This requires solid contribution to at least two (2) of the five (5) sub-disciplines (tracking and measurement, data visualization, testing and evaluation, data integration and statistical modeling.) This position should have an understanding of how at least two of the other sub-disciplines fit into clients’ business and should continue to learn and develop in the other areas. The senior analyst will have more experience and provide guidance to less experienced analysts on daily work responsibilities and project delivery. This role will continue to learn the other sub-disciplines within Marketing Science. Responsibilities: Solid understanding of what the data means and where it fits into the clients’ business Well organized approach to a variety of project work Detail-oriented work style Strong time management skills to ensure accurate delivery Good communication skills with Marketing Science team members as well as across other disciplines Logical approach to analysis process that demonstrates how data lead to conclusions Consistent drive for collaboration with others to provide support, share skills, and learn more Confidently manage expectations with quick communications about project delivery and follow-up Requirements: Strong attention to detail, organizational skills, and time management is key Top notch communication and collaboration skills are also key to success in the analyst role Expectations Management: a successful analyst will communicate quickly and accurately about delivery and delay, and follow up Intellectual Curiosity: analyst should ask the next question, and understand where our work fits in the big picture Logical Approach: cut a path that others can follow, and make sure your conclusions follow your evidence Skills Enhancement & Sharing: Keep learning, offer support, grow your comfort zone, and help the team grow and learn
Title: Marketing Science Senior Analyst

Your team will be responsible for manual and automated testing, including building new automation and analyzing the results. You will work with teams across the company to coordinate and schedule testing resources, and raise issues to senior management when necessary. Though not heavily involved in the day to day testing you may need to occasionally roll up your sleeves and get your hands dirty by reviewing test plans, test cases and test results and sometimes even testing things yourself.This position is also responsible for overseeing the company’s ISO certification process and quality management system. Developers in Test who are focused on manual and automated testing (as well as regulatory personnel as the team grows)Lead resource management across projects, recruiting, mentorship, and performance bothProductWork with project leads to plan, estimate and coordinate QA resources, activities and dependencies in order to meet project needs and deliverablesWork with project leads to define and
