Job_Description: VICE PRESIDENT, INVESTMENT BANKING - ENERGY & ENERGY SERVICESCALGARY, ABJob Posting # 18-102May 16, 2018ENERGY & ENERGY SERVICESRaymond James Ltd., the Canadian subsidiary of Raymond James Financial Inc (NYSE-RJF), a US$12 billion market capital company, is seeking a Vice President to join our Energy & Energy Services Investment Banking team in our Calgary office.Raymond James Ltd. is Canada’s leading independent investment dealers offering high quality investment products and services to individual Canadians seeking customized solutions to their wealth management needs.Our Investment Banking team of over 350 investment bankers across North America and Europe is focused on servicing the corporate finance and financial advisory needs of our clients. We offer a complete range of capital markets services with strong expertise in mergers & acquisitions, public offerings, private placements and syndication. Our advisory services include mergers, acquisitions and divestitures advice / execution, fairness opinions and valuations.The Vice President position will offer the opportunity to gain significant business development and transaction experience. Drawing on previous experience, the ideal candidate will have a proven ability to take initiative, will possess exceptional communication and presentation skills and demonstrate academic excellence.Specifically you will:Work closely with other Analysts, Associates and VPs in the investment banking team;Work closely with other senior bankers and experts from various groups in Canada and the United States;Conduct financial modelling, various financial and strategic analyses, discounted cash flow analysis, comparable company analysis, precedent transaction analysis and evaluate other industry metrics as required;Perform quantitative and qualitative data analysis and industry research;Build and maintain detailed financial models and industry databases;Maintain the groups’ databases and valuation tools on an ongoing basis;Assist in preparing extensive written documents including transaction documentation / proposals, pitch-books and company information documents for business development and marketing purposes;Assist in transaction execution tasks as required; andOther duties as assigned.To qualify for this opportunity you:Have an undergraduate and/or graduate degree in a business-related discipline and / or a CA/CPA designation;Have a minimum of 2-4 years’ work experience in investment banking or corporate finance;Prior experience in Energy & Energy Services industry is considered an asset;Prior investment banking experience, accounting experience (CA/CPA/CBV) and / or enrollment or completion of the CFA program is considered an asset.Demonstrate an interest in finance and the capital markets;Have a proven academic track record of strong performance in analytical and financial courses;Possess excellent written & verbal communication skills;Possess quantitative and analytical skills with an interest in financial analysis and modeling;Have a highly motivated, committed and responsible attitude, with a demonstrated ability to manage competing priorities and requests in a demanding work environment;Possess the ability to work independently while functioning as part of a team;Are a quick learner with very strong attention to detail; andPossess exceptional proficiency with MS Office (particularly Excel and PowerPoint), Capital IQ, and Bloomberg;This is a permanent full-time position with a competitive compensation and benefits package.If you would like to submit an application to join our team, please send a resume and cover letter in a single PDF document, quoting the position and Job Posting # 18-102 as soon as possible but no later than June 15, 2018.To be considered for employment candidates will be required to provide proof of citizenship, permanent residency or eligibility to work in Canada with no restrictions. We require applicants to complete a background verification process prior to commencing employment with the company, including but not limited to a credit and criminal record check. Employment is contingent on the satisfactory completion of a pre-employment background check.We sincerely thank all applicants who express an interest in this role: only those being directly considered will be contacted.Raymond James Ltd. recognizes the value of a diverse workforce and appreciates the unique skills and special contribution of each employee. We are committed to accessibility for candidates through all stages of the recruitment process. Should you require accommodation, please contact Human Resources.Job Types: Full-time, Permanent
Title: Vice President Investment Banking

Job_Description: Based in Calgary and reporting to the Manager, Commercial, you will play a key role in strategic commercial decision making related to TransAlta’s thermal and gas converted assets. By leveraging your expertise in market modeling, economic forecasting, and scenarios analysis, you will help with the evaluation of business opportunities and risks in a competitive power market with the intent of maximizing value of these assets within TransAlta’s portfolio.  Accountabilities: Develop and refine market model, economic dispatch and asset performance models to evaluate thermal and coal converted assets performance and profitability. Model the impacts of policy and capacity market changes to support sound commercial business decision-making and inform external partner and stakeholder negotiations Maintain comprehensive knowledge of commercially managed contracts, agreements and market and competitors’ changes governing the thermal and gas converted assets Leverage your knowledge of agreements and commercial acumen to support other projects, areas of the business including: Act as liaison to Plant Engineering and Operations to ensure the most competitive operating decisions Coordinate fuel cost management strategies based upon commodities pricing, plant operations and carbon exposure Communicate and support analysis on coal to gas project. Present with impact to management team around commercial business recommendations. Review changes in regulations affecting generation assets Work with the regulatory group and provide analytical review of the effects of the regulations on asset contracts and make recommendations Execute commercial and external communications and negotiations within approved mandate Support dispute resolution including strategy development, cost-benefits and business case development Accountable to seek and deliver value-add growth opportunities for TransAlta  Qualifications: Post-secondary in Economics, Econometrics, Business (ideally a Master’s degree) 10 to 15 years of energy market forecasting and modeling experience (ideally in electricity markets) Experience with business case development, and contractual and financial management Functional knowledge of electricity markets, gas markets and energy market fundamentals Understand and adhere to regulatory compliance requirements within the Alberta power market  Technical Skills: Demonstrated strong economic market modeling and financial business decision acumen is a must Capacity to understand complex commercial arrangements and market rules in order to develop sound business cases and contractual solutions Ability to represent the company, its position and values with internal stakeholders, and external partners Team player with the ability to communicate effectively to stakeholders in the organization Capacity to understand, manage and balance risk/reward tradeoffs in evaluating commercial business decisions and new market opportunities Ability to apply market knowledge in enhancing the commercial value of the business  Social Process Skills: Leadership and Multi-Tasking skills Ability to manage cross-functional requests and projects without formal reports Communication Demonstrated capability to communicate to broad audiences including management and cross functional stakeholders Relationship management skills Establishing and maintaining cross functional collaborative relationships Demonstrated ability to influence, negotiate and facilitate buy-in with a variety of stakeholders Presents with impact--includes skillfully participating in discussions and confidently expressing ideas and insights when appropriate with senior management Ability to exchange ideas and information effectively using tact and diplomacy when dealing with others  Other: Travel may be required After hours support may be required Our comprehensive and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, incentive and rewards programs form the foundation of TransAlta’s excellent employment proposition.  Come on board!
Title: Senior Market Analyst, Commercial

Job_Description: The purpose of this document is to outline the basic role and responsibilities of a Senior Market Analyst for Rockpoint Gas Storage and the associated reporting structure. It is not the intent of this document to specify all actual duties associated with the position, but to give a general understanding of the expectations and capabilities the position carries.  This position is located in Calgary, and will report directly to the Vice President, Marketing and Optimization.   The role is designed to research and analyze the key drivers which impact near and medium term natural gas storage spreads and natural gas pricing in Rockpoint’s key market regions (Alberta, California and the Midcontinent). Additionally, the incumbent will work in a support role with the scheduling and trade team to both assist and enhance execution of transactions. The ability to provide some on call, weekend and holiday coverage as part of a rotation is a requirement for the role. TYPICAL DUTIES:  Fundamental analysis of North American natural gas supply and demand dynamics to support marketing, proprietary trade activities and corporate initiatives Develop and maintain reports and presentations on North American natural gas supply and demand dynamics and other factors that impact storage values and gas prices in Rockpoint’s key market regions Develop and maintain models to track and forecast gas supply and demand dynamics in Alberta, California and the Midcontinent Maintain and prepare Board of Directors material and ad hoc presentations and reports to Senior Management and the Commercial Group Support the Marketing and Optimization teams by making transactional recommendations based on market analysis Provide some on call, weekend and holiday coverage as part of a rotation is a requirement for the role.    REQUIRED EXPERIENCE:  Degree in Business (finance concentration), Economics, Mathematics or Engineering, CFA or equivalent experience 5+years of related experience working within a busy trading environment as a Fundamentals or Market Analyst Strong analytical and research skills Experience in analyzing hedging strategies Ability to work on multiple projects and meet deadlines Advanced Excel (VBA), Word and PowerPoint skills that will allow you to create and present materials to leadership  ADDITIONAL NICE TO HAVE EXPERIENCE:  Previous experience working with 3rd party storage valuation models, i.e., CRG, Lukens, FEA Programming experience with Python and SQLExperience in Gas Scheduling   PERSONAL ATTRIBUTES:  A keen attention to detail along with the ability to focus on the overall concepts The ability to handle multiple priorities in a time sensitive environment Great oral and written communication skills along with strong interpersonal skills Demonstrated organizational, analytical and problem-solving skills Able to interact with co-workers, management and clients in a professional manner Self directed and ability to work in a dynamic environment Flexible and willing to work different shifts occasionally  To apply for this role please send your cover letter and resume to careers@rockpointgs.com For more information about our company, please visit our website at www.rockpointgs.com. Rockpoint Gas Storage is an equal opportunity employer and strongly supports diversity in the workplace; all candidates who are authorized to work in the country in which the job opportunity is located are welcome to apply. We thank all applicants for their interest in Rockpoint Gas Storage; however only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.
Title: Senior Market Analyst

Job_Description: Commodities and Global Markets provides clients with an integrated, end-to-end offering across global markets including equities, fixed income, foreign exchange and commodities.  The platform covers more than 25 markets and over 160 products, and has evolved over more than three decades to provide clients with access to markets, financing, financial hedging and physical execution.  Commodity Markets and Finance provides a full spectrum offering to clients with exposure to commodity markets. The division provides risk management, lending and financing, and physical execution and logistics services across the energy, metals and agricultural sectors globally. The division also offers commodity-based index products to institutional investors.  We are looking to hire a Senior Fundamentals Analyst to join our US Gas Trading team in Calgary.  Responsibilities  Provide analytical support and expertise by conducting supply and demand analysis to generate trade strategies and identify market and pricing trends. Primary regional focus will be Canada but an understanding of downstream influences in the Pacific Northwest, US Midwest and the US Northeast will be required. Coordination with fundamentals analysts in other Macquarie locations will be a key requirement of the job. Understanding of and experience with producer influences/drivers across the Western Canadian Sedimentary basin is required. Design, develop and support short-term data and trading tools. Provide ad hoc analyses for the trading desk: Identify traders’ needs and provide timely and tradable analyses. Provide daily reports and participate in weekly meetings by providing a fundamental regional outlook. Utilize advance modelling techniques to determine the relationship between energy market variables. Provide updates on regulatory developments and analyses regarding the impact of changes. Investigate historical trends and analyze pricing volatility. Take initiative to continuously improve existing processes, tools and models with the aim of improving overall performance and reliability. Requirements  Bachelor’s degree in economics, business, finance, or other relevant degree with five or more years of natural gas market experience. Experience in fundamentals analysis in the natural gas sector. Expertise in Canadian markets as well as US Pacific Northwest, Northeast and Midwest markets. Knowledge of related commodity markets (such as electricity, oil, NGLs) would be helpful. Prior experience in optimization and trading activities in an energy trading environment (trading, asset optimization, risk management or portfolio analysis), preferred but not required. Strong Excel & VBA skills required; experience with SQL or Python a plus. Accommodation is available to all applicants to Macquarie, including during recruitment, selection and assessment processes. Please notify the recruiter listed on this posting if you require accommodation at any stage of the recruitment process. Access to Macquarie’s Accessibility policies is available at www.macquarie.ca
Title: Senior Fundamentals Analyst - Commodities and Global Markets...

Job_Description: SLR is an environmental consultancy that specializes in the energy, mining & minerals, waste management, planning & development, infrastructure and industrial sectors. SLR is one of a very small number of truly international specialist environmental consultancies.  As an employee controlled company, in which many of our staff have a share, SLR offers rewarding careers to all of its staff and values and rewards customer care and commitment as well as technical expertise. SLR provides a healthy and dynamic work environment, challenging career opportunities and competitive compensation and benefit packages.  For more information, please visit http://www.slrconsulting.com.  Role: As part of a growing team of GIS professionals the successful candidate will provide GIS support and services to the various offices and business sectors across Canada for a wide variety of projects and clients. Responsibilities: Reporting to the GIS/CAD Manager the successful candidate will be supporting the development of the Geographic Information Services group in Western Canada. Daily duties would include mapping, database design and management, custom tool development and the development of web-based services in support of project deliverables for a wide variety of clients and projects throughout Canada.  Technical Skills / Abilities / Experience:  Direct experience with ESRI ArcGIS and extensions (Spatial Analyst, 3D Analyst, Geostatistical Analyst) 7-10 years of related work experience in the GIS field. Job_Description: Pi Engineering is rapidly growing and we require piping engineers and stress analysts with experience in Alberta.  Pi offers engineers an opportunity to work for a variety of clients in an virtual environment with opportunity for growth. We mostly work from well equipped home offices, our head office, and some part-time work in clients offices.  Sound good? Well, we want to hear from you if you have experience with any of the following:  Piping engineering – pipe specifications, specialty items, pipe support design Stress analysis – plant piping, pipelines (Caesar II, AutoPIPE) FEA – pipe supports, nozzles (FE/Pipe) Requirements:  Bachelors degree in engineering Alberta P. Eng designation with 5-10 years experience Experience as a senior piping engineer or lead on a major project Relevant piping national codes and standards knowledge such as ASME/ANSI, ASTM, and CSA Z662 etc Caesar II, AutoPIPE experience Able to communicate effectively with clients and meet deadlines Organized and able to work without direction Demonstrated history of delivering high-quality error-free work to clients Why Pi Engineering?  Virtual office environment Flexible hours Independence Competitive compensation Consistent, steady work Training opportunities Get in on the ground floor of a rapidly growing company Note: work at client sites may be required  Pi Engineering boasts a client portfolio of over 70 businesses, ranging from small service companies, to large EPCs and Oil & Gas Companies. Our service offering includes: piping stress analysis, piping engineering, plant and facility piping, equipment piping design and stress analysis, dynamic analysis, finite element analysis (FEA), trouble-shooting, and training.  Pi Engineering will place a preference on candidates currently living in Calgary, AB. Relocation for this position is not available.  To apply, submit your resume and cover letter with compensation expectations.  No Phone Calls Please
Title: Senior Piping Engineers & Stress Analysts

Job_Description: Accurate Network Services Inc. is on the hunt for a master-class Centralized ServicesSr.Technical Analyst to join our team of lovable computer geeks. The person who holds this role shall be the gate keeper at the centre of the NOC universe, providing unseen—but awesome (not to mention critical) network monitoring. You are not only responsible for monitoring, but for taking the reins and building this department and its processes from the ground up.Are you our next Centralized Services Sr. Technical Analyst? If so, your glass if half full. You can’t stand the thought of leaving at the end of the day unless alerts are dealt with and you know your clients are well taken care of. You get jazzed about forging new paths where none exist, building up a department with scalable processes and tools into the operations powerhouse it’s destined to be. While fluent in technical jargon, you are also well-versed in “plain English.” When everything is running smoothly in your perfectly built department, you help mop up technical support tickets like you’re cleaning up the streets of Gotham (if Batman kept excellent ticket notes, that is). You possess obsessive attention to detail and prioritize like it’s a superpower. And hey—you probably have at least 5 years’ training with another Managed Service Provider, in computer and network troubleshooting/administration, and have at least a few Microsoft, or A+ certifications under your belt.Experience with remote monitoring tools (RMM) and Windows patching deployment is a highly valuable asset.Recognize yourself in there? Read on.Accurate Network Services Inc. is an Edmonton-based company providing common sense, practical IT solutions for small and medium-sized businesses. At Accurate, we strive daily to foster a community of creativity, learning, acceptance, and humility. Our values are a way of life for us, not empty words plastered on the wall behind the coffee machine. To be a part of the team, you’ll need to get behind the values.We think Accurate is a pretty sweet place to call your work home. When we’re not Jedi mind-bending computers to our will, we may be go-karting, mini-golfing, or throwing axes at things (in a controlled setting—we’re not animals), and most definitely shooting NERF guns at each other. Or, perhaps, we’re taking advantage of the company’s personal fitness and professional development allowances.Sound like something you want to be a part of? We’d love to hear from you. Send resume with cover letter in response to this ad and quote the position SeniorTechnical Analyst – Centralized Services in the subject line.Job Type: Full-timeExperience:Network Administration: 5 yearsRemote Monitoring Tool Administration and Implementation: 1 yearLocation:Calgary, ABLicence:MCSE or MCSALanguage:English
Title: Senior Technical Analyst - Centralized Services

Job_Description: Eagle is currently seeking a Data Management Analyst for a permanent job opportunity, scheduled to begin immediately.  Key Responsibilities  The successful candidate will be responsible for: Working with computer application/user interfaces to apply data entry updates;  Working with customers/clients and industry groups to understand, clarify, confirm, and correctly apply data updates from many sources of media (email/phone) both in a direct face-to-face and phone call environment, including convening conference calls and being able to lead customers through phone and email discussions;  Working both independently and in a team-oriented collaborative environment;  Self-managing and controlling work plans and scheduling;  Working under pressure to meet deadlines and due process in order to meet customer needs;  Discerning customer requests, problem solving/resolution;  Conducting proactive data analysis for finding anomalies, possible errors or preventing conflicts/restrictions before they occur;  Interpreting a variety of instructions furnished in written, oral, diagram, or schedule form;  Working with technical support groups for user application troubleshooting, testing, and investigation;  Providing innovative ideas to resolve problems and/or address new opportunities;  Communicating requirements for changes to business processes, policies, and information systems to technical teams when designing and implementing a solution;  Assisting with creating user guides and training;  Generating statistical reports from work completed;  Being involved with technical project activity to create/run test cases for proof of application functionality; and,  Creating requirement documents for change or improvement to systems or process.  Skills and Qualifications  The qualified candidate must have: A University Degree or Diploma in Commerce/Business, Computer Science, Information Systems, Engineering, Science, Administration, or equivalent practical experience;  Five plus (5+) years of practical experience with Customer Service and Computer Data Entry;  The ability to type at 100 words per minute;  Experience with customer and master data management;  Application development experience;  Experience with testing methodologies, test plans, and test cases;  Experience with Oracle 11g, 12c, SQL, PL/SQL, Unix, and Linux operating systems;  Experience with the Microsoft Windows Suite (Word, Excel, Win10);  Experience creating and running PL/SQL queries on Oracle tables;  Customer service experience with demonstrated people and interaction skills (such as listening, directing, eliciting, paraphrasing);  The ability to learn quickly, understand and apply data management rules for amending corporate master data;  Keen eye and critical attention to detail for data quality;  Excellent communicative skills;  The ability to write with clarity for reports, business correspondence, process, and procedure documentation;  The ability to effectively present information and respond to questions from groups, managers, clients, or customers; and,  The ability to work non-standard hours and/or extended work hours due to user/project requirements and/or deadlines, system or user issues as well as workload backlog.  Don’t miss out on this opportunity, apply online today!  We would like to thank all applicants for their interest; however, only candidates under consideration will be contacted. Please note that your application does not signify the beginning of employment with Eagle and that employment with Eagle will only commence when placed on an assignment as a temporary employee of Eagle.
Title: Data Management Analyst

Job_Description: Business Analyst for Application Development Processes:  full time, 6 month duration, based in Calgary This role provides ownership and oversight of all process development, improvement, and implementation of Software Process Improvement (SPI) based on the CMM framework.A key responsibility of this group is to monitor process metrics in order to identify either problem areas or identify opportunities for process improvement.They are responsible for staffing the SEPG team and providing direction in applying the Process Change Method (PCM) for the account and in training the delivery team.They train the delivery team, begins the implementation, acts as process owner for changes and updates, and plans and leads the IBM tasks of the Software Engineering Institute (SEI) CMM-based assessment.They also engage ADE to perform an effectiveness study when funded and appropriate.Capture business requirements, analysis of requirements, mapping of requirements (As is and To be processes)Particular focus on Windows 10 application Please send your resumes to Danielle Pelletier at daniellep@tes.net.
Title: Business Analyst

Job_Description: *PLEASE NOTE: PREFERENCE WILL BE GIVEN TO CANDIDATES WHO APPLY THROUGH CANFOR.COM/CAREERSCanfor TechnologyAt Canfor, our Information Technology professionals play an important role in the daily functioning of our operations. Consistently pushing the boundaries when it comes to innovation within the forestry and pulp and paper industries, our IT professionals support Canfor in achieving exceptional results.With a high caliber Information Technology leadership team, a clear vision, and significant growth and training opportunities, a career in IT at Canfor allows individuals to strengthen their competencies and grow within their respective roles. Working as an equal partner with our operations to achieve organizational objectives, you will be at the forefront of innovation.Who We Are: Canfor is one of the world’s largest and most respected integrated forest products companies. For more than 75 years, we have been delivering top-quality lumber, pulp and paper products to our valued customers worldwide. With operations in Western Canada and the Southern United States, and sales offices around the world, you can find Canfor products in every corner of the globe. We are leaders in sustainable forest management and in converting wood residuals into green energy.As we continue to grow our company and our markets, find out how you can grow your career with us.The OpportunityThe Data Analyst, Business Intelligence supports Canfor’s objectives by turning data into meaningful information that can be used to make sound business decisions. The Data Analyst will provide expertise in business intelligence to prepare and deliver data and information to internal customers and stakeholders through reports, dashboards and scorecards. It is essential that the Data Analyst build an understanding of the business at a level of detail that enables them to work with the business to deliver valuable information.Please Note:  This is a relocation opportunity in Vancouver, British Columbia. The successful applicant may be provided with relocation assistance.Main ResponsibilitiesRequirements Gathering:Engage with various business units to capture information needs, compare those needs with existing tools and identify gapsParticipate in business requirements workshopsWrite business requirements documents as required to elaborate needs, gain acceptanceDesign & Development:Architect tables and dataDesign dashboards, reports, drill-down analytics and data visualizationsDesign, configure and administer the metadata layerCreate system technical requirements for documentation and knowledge managementActively challenge and find solutions to optimize system performanceTesting, Validation, Release Management:Develop and implement testing strategiesValidate data accuracyDeploy and validate changes in production environmentTraining & Change Management:Support the development of training, documentation, and help desk capabilitiesRequired SkillsBachelor's degree in computer science, information systems, business management or specialized training/certificationExperience working with relational databases (Microsoft SQL Server, Oracle Database, MySQL, etc)Applied knowledge of SQL (T-SQL, PL/SQL, ANSI-SQL, etc)Applied understanding of data modelling and warehousing conceptsWorking knowledge of business intelligence tools such as Oracle Business IntelligenceWorking knowledge of ETL tools such as Oracle Data Integrator or InformaticaExperience mediating and clarifying sometimes ambiguous or conflicting end user requirementsEagerness to learn new concepts and technologies and keep-up-to-date with existing onesWillingness to go above and beyond to understand both the business and technical aspects of a problemHiring for this position is ongoing and will be filled as required. To be considered for this position, please apply today.In order to be eligible for this position, you must be legally entitled to work in Canada for our Company.There has never been a better time to join the Canfor Information Technology team and become a part of the modern forest industry. We have a wide range of rewarding and innovative careers in some of the best communities in North America, with plenty of room for advancement. We offer competitive compensation and benefits packages, and are committed to the professional development of our employees.*PLEASE NOTE: PREFERENCE WILL BE GIVEN TO CANDIDATES WHO APPLY THROUGH CANFOR.COM/CAREERSFollow us on LinkedIn , Twitter , and Facebook for Canfor news, career opportunities, and upcoming events!Vancouver, BCThe city of Vancouver is both a natural beauty and a progressive urban centre, a rare place on earth that is idyllic and electric all at once. With one of Canada’s mildest climates, Vancouver is ideally suited for those devoted to outdoor pursuits, health and wellness. Along with its endless supply of fresh air and clean water, Vancouver also boasts countless choices for culturally diverse, world-class cuisine and an inventory of arts and entertainment events. For more information, visit http://canfor.com/our-company/our-communities/vancouverJob Type: Full-timeEducation:High school or equivalent

For more than 75 years, we have been delivering top-quality lumber, pulp and paper products to our valued customers worldwide. With operations in Western Canada and the Southern United States, and sales offices around the world, you can find Canfor products in every corner of the globe. We are leaders in sustainable forest management and in converting wood residuals into green energy.As we continue to grow our company and our markets, find out how you can grow your career with us.The OpportunityThe Data Analyst, Business Intelligence supports Canfor’s objectives by turning data into meaningful information that can be used to make sound business decisions. The Data Analyst will provide expertise in business intelligence to prepare and deliver data and information to internal customers and stakeholders through reports, dashboards and scorecards. It is essential that the Data Analyst build an understanding of the business at a level of detail that enables them to work with the business to deliver valuable information.Please Note:  This is a relocation opportunity in Vancouver, British Columbia. The successful applicant may be provided with relocation assistance.Main ResponsibilitiesRequirements Gathering:Engage with various business units to capture information needs, compare those needs with existing tools and identify gapsParticipate in business requirements workshopsWrite business requirements documents as required to elaborate needs, gain acceptanceDesign & Development:Architect tables and dataDesign dashboards, reports, drill-down analytics and data visualizationsDesign, configure and administer the metadata layerCreate system technical requirements for documentation and knowledge managementActively challenge and find solutions to optimize system performanceTesting, Validation, Release Management:Develop and implement testing strategiesValidate data accuracyDeploy and validate changes in production environmentTraining & Change Management:Support the development of training, documentation, and help desk capabilitiesRequired SkillsBachelor's degree in computer science, information systems, business management or specialized training/certificationExperience working with relational databases (Microsoft SQL Server, Oracle Database, MySQL, etc)Applied knowledge of SQL (T-SQL, PL/SQL, ANSI-SQL, etc)Applied understanding of data modelling and warehousing conceptsWorking knowledge of business intelligence tools such as Oracle Business IntelligenceWorking knowledge of ETL tools such as Oracle Data Integrator or InformaticaExperience mediating and clarifying sometimes ambiguous or conflicting end user requirementsEagerness to learn new concepts and technologies and keep-up-to-date with existing onesWillingness to go above and beyond to understand both the business and technical aspects of a problemHiring for this position is ongoing and will be filled as required. To be considered for this position, please apply today.In order to be eligible for this position, you must be legally entitled to work in Canada for our Company.There has never been a better time to join the Canfor Information Technology team and become a part of the modern forest industry. We have a wide range of rewarding and innovative careers in some of the best communities in North America, with plenty of room for advancement. We offer competitive compensation and benefits packages, and are committed to the professional development of our employees.*PLEASE NOTE: PREFERENCE WILL BE GIVEN TO CANDIDATES WHO APPLY THROUGH CANFOR.COM/CAREERSFollow us on LinkedIn , Twitter , and Facebook for Canfor news, career opportunities, and upcoming events!Vancouver, BCThe city of Vancouver is both a natural beauty and a progressive urban centre, a rare place on earth that is idyllic and electric all at once. With one of Canada’s mildest climates, Vancouver is ideally suited for those devoted to outdoor pursuits, health and wellness. Along with its endless supply of fresh air and clean water, Vancouver also boasts countless choices for culturally diverse, world-class cuisine and an inventory of arts and entertainment events. For more information, visit http://canfor.com/our-company/our-communities/vancouverJob Type: Full-timeEducation:High school or equivalent
Title: Business Intelligence Analyst (Relocation Opportunity)

Job_Description: Build a meaningful career  At Morneau Shepell, we offer more than career opportunities, we provide career opportunities to make meaningful contributions to people’s lives. The extraordinary expertise of our 4,000-strong workforce is harnessed to support the employees and families of the organizations we serve. Our innovative programs have a lasting impact on the health, financial security and productivity of 20,000 workplaces.  Consultant Health and Benefits  Health & Benefits Solutions  Calgary, AB  Full Time, Permanent  Benefits programs are an important and highly valued part of any employment offering. But understanding how much or what type of benefit coverage is necessary can be difficult. Our client relationship model is consultative and encourages continual communication. By providing you with the resources to support employers in engaging employees in their health, we provide a path to better workforce health and productivity.  Our Consultant works in a team and is responsible for managing, servicing and providing quality benefits consulting services for small to medium sized clients. In addition, they will be responsible for helping to build business with existing clients as well as attracting and supporting new clients through our association partnerships.  Responsibilities include:  Business Development  Identify and manage cross-sell opportunities Develop strategic relationships with key account contacts and introduce Morneau Shepell team members as appropriate Supervise the complete employee benefits cycle: plan design, provider search, implementation, experience monitoring, renewal rating Develop new business with existing clients and assists in obtaining new business with prospective clients focusing on our key association partnerships Understand client needs and identify company or industry products or services that can meet these needs Service  Deliver presentations to clients; conduct client meetings and the occasional employee presentation. Ensure that quality control and service standards are attained with every transaction Negotiate, problem solve and maintain positive relationships with insurers, external advisors and internal underwriting and benefits administration departments Develop and maintain excellent relationships with clients, through regular telephone contact and office visits Understand the client’s perspective and priorities, and work with the client to resolve administrative issues Establish strategies for services that meet client needs  Administration  Provide and oversee direct day-to-day support for clients by phone, e-mail, letters, formal reports, and face-to-face meetings Lead and manage multiple client assignments and projects Manage special projects as required Peer review the work of analysts Knowledge  Maintain current knowledge of industry trends including insurer news, products, legislation, and cost trends as well as current knowledge of our company's products and services  Qualifications:  Experience  Five years of experience in group benefits. Preference will be given to those from the group insurance industry, a consulting firm or brokerage or in an HR department. Education  Post-secondary education GBA (CEBS) designation, or working towards it. Life Insurance license (this will be a requirement within 3 months of onboarding) Skills  Strong presentation skills and comfort speaking in front of large groups Understanding of consultative selling and the ability to manage the sales cycle effectively and autonomously Expert negotiation, technical and analytical skills Can effectively communicate complex concepts in plain written and spoken language Professional Traits  Exceptional customer focus; some would say you’re the best Extremely organized self-starter, flexible, highly independent Ability to manage multiple deadlines simultaneously Proven collaborative team member with the ability to motivate and inspire team members  Morneau Shepell Morneau Shepell is in the business of helping organizations help their people because we believe that engaged people are the driving force for society. Every day, the expertise of our almost 4,000 employees is recognized as essential to the financial security, health, and productivity of our clients and their people. We're always looking for talented professionals and strategic leaders who will listen and work together with colleagues and clients to form long-term relationships and to deliver integrative solutions that fit. As we continue to grow, we're presently engaging with exceptional candidates interested in a range of exciting career opportunities. At www.morneaushepell.com you can explore our careers page to learn more about the solutions we deliver and the great people who help us do it. Follow us on LinkedIn and Twitter (Morneau_Shepell, Shepell). We are thankful for your interest, but unfortunately, we can only personally connect with those selected for an interview.  INDCAD LI-PH1  Job Grade: MS4   Fulfilling work that matters  Morneau Shepell is in the business of helping organizations help their people and in the process, we strive to elevate ours.  We're always looking for talented professionals and strategic leaders looking to make a difference in the lives of the people we serve.  We appreciate the interest of every applicant; however, we contact only those selected for an interview.  Find your fit with us. Follow us on LinkedIn, Youtube and Twitter.
Title: Consultant

Job_Description: At Rogers we’re for supporting you on a journey to a rewarding career. Whether you’re a developer, an analyst, or a customer care consultant, Rogers is the place where ideas become reality. We embrace change, and find ways to do better. And we deliver on that commitment by fostering an environment of passion and innovation for all people.  Part-Time Operations Generalist We are launching expansion of our Citytv news programming across the country, to deliver compelling locally relevant content to Canadians. As seasoned Operations Generalist you have the technical aptitude and are accountable for setting a high standard for the day to day maintenance activities required to ensure City Edmonton functions at peak technical performance. Consistently leading by example in this "hands on" role is vital to your success and the success of your team.  What you’ll be doing: Basic editing of footage for news segments on Quantel and Premier Pro editing systems. Digitizing footage; paying close attention to naming conventions. Operating ENG camera as well as remote truck for live segments. Provide production support to various initiatives and special programs. Remain conversant with all departmental production equipment. Ensure that programs and segments meet company and industry standards for content and quality. Work with Production Engineering on equipment faults and failures. Editing and posting of media to Social Media and other online content. Occasional Production Assistant duties in the Production Control Room. Occasional writing and producing duties if required. Other duties as assigned.  What you have: Minimum two years’ experience in television production. In-depth knowledge of editing, shooting and technical facilities. Experience with ENG/EFP and Studio production including editing both linear and non-linear, camera work. Experience with Quantel editing systems, Premier Pro, and the Adobe line of products is preferred. Must be highly motivated, show initiative and creativity. Self-starter; well organized and detail oriented; Ability to prioritize effectively. Strong communication and interpersonal skills. Take direction and handle stressful situations well. Able to meet tight deadlines. Valid Drivers License (non-GDL) Ability to work shifts, including evenings and weekends. Schedule: Part Time Shift: Weekend Length of Contract: Not Applicable (Regular Position) Work Location: 535 7th Avenue Sout West (811), Calgary, AB Travel Requirements: Up to 25% Posting Category/Function: Broadcasting & TV Operations Requisition ID: 121382 WHY ROGERS? As a proud Canadian company, we're dedicated to making things easier for our customers. We’ve been embracing and leading change for over 50-years, and we’ll continue to seek out new opportunities to bring our customers simple solutions for today and tomorrow. We recognize that success is determined by the strength and diversity of our people. We work together because we want to win together, and these five shared values guide and define our work: Simplify and innovate Take ownership of the what and the how Equip people to succeed Execute with discipline and pride Talk straight, build trust, and over deliver Why Rogers? Because your tomorrow inspires our today. What makes us different makes us stronger. Rogers has a strong commitment to diversity and inclusion. Everyone who applies for a job will be considered. We recognize the business value in creating a workplace where each team member has the tools to reach their full potential. At Rogers, we value the insights and innovation that diverse teams bring to work. We work with our candidates with disabilities throughout the recruitment process to ensure that they have what they need to be at their best. Please reach out to our recruiters and hiring managers to begin a conversation about how we can ensure that you deliver your best work. You can also reach out to our team at RogersRecruiting@rci.rogers.com to begin a conversation about your individual accessibility needs throughout the hiring process. Posting Notes: Media || Canada (CA) || AB || Calgary || SF: LI ||
Title: Operations Generalist (Part-Time)

Job_Description: Accurate Network Services Inc. is on the hunt for a master-class Centralized ServicesSr.Technical Analyst to join our team of lovable computer geeks. The person who holds this role shall be the gate keeper at the centre of the NOC universe, providing unseen—but awesome (not to mention critical) network monitoring. You are not only responsible for monitoring, but for taking the reins and building this department and its processes from the ground up.Are you our next Centralized Services Sr. Technical Analyst? If so, your glass if half full. You can’t stand the thought of leaving at the end of the day unless alerts are dealt with and you know your clients are well taken care of. You get jazzed about forging new paths where none exist, building up a department with scalable processes and tools into the operations powerhouse it’s destined to be. While fluent in technical jargon, you are also well-versed in “plain English.” When everything is running smoothly in your perfectly built department, you help mop up technical support tickets like you’re cleaning up the streets of Gotham (if Batman kept excellent ticket notes, that is). You possess obsessive attention to detail and prioritize like it’s a superpower. And hey—you probably have at least 5 years’ training with another Managed Service Provider, in computer and network troubleshooting/administration, and have at least a few Microsoft, or A+ certifications under your belt.Experience with remote monitoring tools (RMM) and Windows patching deployment is a highly valuable asset.Recognize yourself in there? Read on.Accurate Network Services Inc. is an Edmonton-based company providing common sense, practical IT solutions for small and medium-sized businesses. At Accurate, we strive daily to foster a community of creativity, learning, acceptance, and humility. Our values are a way of life for us, not empty words plastered on the wall behind the coffee machine. To be a part of the team, you’ll need to get behind the values.We think Accurate is a pretty sweet place to call your work home. When we’re not Jedi mind-bending computers to our will, we may be go-karting, mini-golfing, or throwing axes at things (in a controlled setting—we’re not animals), and most definitely shooting NERF guns at each other. Or, perhaps, we’re taking advantage of the company’s personal fitness and professional development allowances.Sound like something you want to be a part of? We’d love to hear from you. Send resume with cover letter in response to this ad and quote the position SeniorTechnical Analyst – Centralized Services in the subject line.Job Type: Full-timeExperience:Network Administration: 5 yearsRemote Monitoring Tool Administration and Implementation: 1 yearLocation:Calgary, ABLicence:MCSE or MCSALanguage:English
Title: Senior Technical Analyst - Centralized Services

Job_Description: Data Analyst On behalf of our client, Procom is currently seeking a Data Analyst who will design and implement the data related-elements of technology solutions, including data models, physical database designs, and meta-data management. The role analyzes abstract, complex problems and effectively communicates with the business and IT regarding data design, usage, and management to provide project and operations support. The role focuses on business intelligence solutions, and also provides input into the strategic elements of an overall Enterprise Data Management (EDM) strategy. The Data Analyst received guidance form the Senior Data Analyst on more complex data requirements Data Analyst Job Details: Collaborate with business partners to gather and document requirements, subsequently translating business requirements into data requirements.Build logical and physical data models to meet data requirements.Assist with ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) source to target data mapping.Validate data flow through implemented data models from source to target.Perform root cause analysis to determine cause of data defects and recommends solutions for resolution.Ensure all data requirements are delivered.Collaborate with Senior Data Analyst to create, maintain and manage meta-data for an entity.Capture and document business definitions and terms using the appropriate tools and methods.Provide input to enterprise architects specializing in information and data on data management decisions, including development and maintenance of the enterprise data model.Contribute to the development and maintenance of the enterprise architecture for information and data, and EDM strategy.Assist with EDM initiatives such as data quality, meta-data and reporting.Participate in the development, implementation, and maintenance of data administration processes.Advise business partners to assist in better understanding the enterprise data asset. Data Analyst Mandatory Skills: Diploma or degree in Information Technology or Computer Science with at least 5 years of experience working in database systems, or equivalent combination of education and experience.Significant experience in complex relational data modelling and database design; dimensional data modelling experience preferred.Knowledge of ETL processes, as well as data warehouse and data mart principles and best practices.Experience with database platforms such as SQL Server and Oracle, and modelling tools such as Erwin.Self-motivated and self-directed, with excellent problem solving skillsExpertise in gathering, documenting and analyzing requirementsExcellent written and verbal communications skillsAbility to work collaboratively in a team environmentThe successful candidate shall be subject to a Criminal Record and Consumer History background check as a condition of employment Data Analyst Assignment Length Permanent Data Analyst Assignment Location Calgary, AB

Job_Description: Additional Comments: Compensation will be commensurate with education and experience, Internal and External candidates are being considered simultaneously Overview NOVA Chemicals’ strategic priorities include growing significantly. Our strategy leverages our ability to deliver game changing technology and create an exceptional customer experience to help meet the growing consumer demand for polyethylene in the Americas. We are looking for innovative, passionate people who are focused on success. If you are interested in being challenged, inspired and supported by a team to deliver your best work while making everyday life healthier, easier and safer, come join us on this exciting journey. As a member of the Technology Leadership Team (TLT), the successful candidate will work collaboratively with other groups (Manufacturing East Leadership Team, Financial Planning, Engineering Leadership) and have accountability for delivering results through the safe operation and continual improvement of our facilities, consistency of business case analysis across the Technology portfolio, safe and flawless execution of Capital Projects and preparation of the overall Technology portfolio.  Reporting to the Vice-President, Technology this role will provide leadership for the Technology Operations Department including:  Technology Services Team (Capital Projects, Maintenance, Technology IT Support and Material Handling); Analytical Team (Scientists and Technologists); Technical Scale Facilities (3 operating units providing catalyst manufacturing and Polyethylene synthesis via gas phase and solution processes at technical scale); AST Pilot Plant Team (pilot scale solution polymerization process unit and the operators, and engineers who support it); Leadership of Technology Process Safety and focal point for Responsible Care; Business Analysts – Responsible for the overall Technology Portfolio provided to the NOVA Management Board and support to the Technology Decision Boards in the form of both business cases and portfolio support.  Responsibilities: Leads consolidation of the Technology Research Portfolio utilizing consistent 1NOVA portfolio management practices. This includes coordination of the Capital Portfolio; Liaises with the Polyethylene (PE) R&D team to enable effective planning and utilization of the PE scale up facilities; Provides oversight to the Leadership of the Pilot Plant facilities and maintains relationships with the Manufacturing East Region Technical leadership; Leads Technology’s Responsible Care initiatives including Process Safety; Supports the implementation and maintenance of our 1NOVA operations practices (e.g. Continuous Improvement) in Technology; Builds and maintains relationships with external benchmarking organizations to ensure research best practices and portfolio management techniques are being effectively leveraged into NOVA Chemicals’ Technology.  Qualifications: The successful candidate will have a Bachelor’s degree in Engineering or Science with a minimum of ten to fifteen years’ proven experience in leading teams the areas of Operations, Managing research, Capital and Tactical Portfolios. The successful candidate will have demonstrated capability to bring Innovative thinking to R&D and the capacity to grow into other TLT roles. In addition, the desired candidate will have: Demonstrated excellence in leading teams and across functional boundaries; Advanced knowledge of research best practices and portfolio management techniques; Strong communication and facilitation skills; A demonstrated commitment to Responsible Care.  About Us: NOVA Chemicals develops and manufactures chemicals and plastic resins that make everyday life safer, healthier and easier. Our employees work to ensure health, safety, security and environmental stewardship through our commitment to sustainability and Responsible Care®. NOVA Chemicals, headquartered in Calgary, Alberta, Canada, is wholly-owned ultimately by Mubadala Investment Company of the Emirate of Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates.  The NOVA Chemicals technology center is located in Calgary, Alberta. The state-of-the-art facilities, comprised of the Centre for Applied Research and Centre for Performance Applications, focus to support technological advancements in the polyolefins and olefins fields. The technology center is recognized as the largest in Canada.  Benefits: NOVA Chemicals’ flexible benefit programs are designed to meet the diverse needs of our employees, because when it comes to benefits, everyone has different priorities. Our benefits offerings will vary based on your work location, and are an element of the “Total Rewards” package used to reward employees.
Title: Technology Operations Leader

Job_Description: Benevity is seeking a Project Manager ( a key member of our Professional Services team) with a demonstrated track record in SaaS implementations.  You enjoy variety and the challenge of leading, managing and performing tasks on both major software implementations and ad hoc projects . You would operate as a dedicated client advocate who leads, develops and executes implementation plans for Benevity products & solutions to ensure our clients are successful. You are a quick study, able to learn new products and processes easily, and you enjoy leveraging that knowledge to help clients take advantage of new solutions provided by a game-changing software company.  You are someone who is technically-oriented with expert organizational skills, strong presentation skills and exemplary project management skills. You have the ability to train users effectively in a variety of environments, with a strong passion in solutioning and its ability to drive change to business outcomes. You must be client-obsessed with strong communication and analytical skills. You must be able to articulate value, inspire and be comfortable consulting and collaborating with our clients remotely or in-person.  An adept communicator, you can translate difficult concepts into layman’s terms and act as the interpreter between technical and non-technical project stakeholders. If you like being at the centre of projects and guiding them to success with a company helping its clients to change the world, read on!  Who we are  Benevity is a software company working to build better and more engaging ways for companies to unite their people around doing the right thing. For us, doing well by doing good is way more than just a tagline, but on the subject of tag, we hope you’re “it!” We’re a growing company and we’re looking for just the people to help us take our business (and Goodness) to the next level.  If you joined us you’d be joining a diverse, dedicated, and passionate team that works hard day in and day out to deliver and develop innovative solutions and peerless customer service to our growing ranks of raving fans (aka our amazing clients). You’d be working with, and for, some of the most iconic companies and charitable organizations in the world to make a real difference in their communities (and on a global scale). If you’d describe yourself as self-driven, flexible, inclusive, cooperative, quick-learning, and unafraid to tackle hard problems head-on, we want you as part of our team. And we want you to know what we think wearing jeans to work is absolutely acceptable—and feel to bring your pup along for the ride.  Though we may have outgrown our “startup” label, our fun, flexible tech culture has grown with us and still fits perfectly. More than all of that, we have a heart and hold Goodness at the forefront of everything we do. We’re getting all As as a registered B Corporation, meaning we’re happy to be counted among a growing number of companies who’re committed to higher social and sustainability standards.  What you will do  Own project implementation and delivery for Benevity clients. Manage the successful implementation of Benevity products and other ad hoc projects for prospective and existing clients, contributing to long-term client satisfaction and healthy adoption rates.  Work with key client contacts and stakeholders to understand, define and document business requirements for system configuration, development and implementation.  Collaborate with internal stakeholders (i.e., project developers, report developers, QC analysts, Business manager, and Client Service) to ensure efficient and effective system configuration, development, testing, billing, training and implementation.  Provide support to the Sales team during the pre-sales cycle to give prospective and existing clients insight into implementation processes. You’ll provide guidance on how various challenges may be resolved, enabling the team to hit their targets.  Partner with clients to identify key business goals and objectives to align products and services with the clients desired outcomes.  Conduct requirements gathering sessions and customized training sessions via online webinars, phone or in-person.  Set clear project expectations and achievable timeline goals required to execute the technical and business objectives based on the scope of the launch and supporting adoption and rollout with a solutions-oriented approach.  Manage multiple projects at once while paying strict attention to detail.  Provide regular status reporting and meet with clients regularly to discuss project progress, outstanding project tasks and risks.  Maintain an in-depth understanding of Benevity’s suite of products, and services.  What you bring  2-4 years' experience managing software implementation projects relevant work experience in account management, business analysis, consulting, Professional Services or other implementation and delivery type roles.  A Bachelors’ degree  Excellent organizational skills and great leadership aptitude.  Experience conducting client needs analysis and configuring a software platform to meet those needs.  Strong client management experience, especially related to SaaS.  Expert-level project management skills and an ability to work with multiple Enterprise clients at a time to deliver on milestones, and tasks within the scope and on time.  Strong analytical skills, detail oriented, ability to prioritize and meet deadlines.  Technical understanding – not afraid to question and investigate so that challenges can be resolved quickly.  Professional, motivated and flexible – enthusiastic about using process to deliver but understand that there’s a time and a place to go with the flow.  Can-do attitude – happily takes on any relevant task; comfortable in a fast-paced, dynamic, growing company culture.  Motivated self-starter that works well both alone and with a team.  Manages multiple projects at once while paying strict attention to detail.  Excellent verbal and written communications skills.  What you can expect  A once-in-a-career opportunity to join a mission-driven growth company on a growth trajectory and with a unique, ultra-engaged culture.  Join a team of innovative thinkers, keen to be part of a growing company that is all about helping businesses create innovative corporate and workplace giving and other Goodness programs.  Work in a fast-paced environment for a dynamic, rapidly growing company with a history of proven success and stunning colleagues.  Connect with a rapidly growing and passionate group in an open, collaborative and fun environment.  While we are grateful and appreciative of every application, we are only able to respond to those candidates selected for an interview.
Title: SaaS Implementation Manager

Job_Description: We're currently seeking a Cloud Portfolio Architect for a contract engagement. Initial duration May - December 2018. Experience managing and migrating infrastructure and application to the cloud; Experience in benefit creation of moving infrastructure and applications to the cloud; Experience in orchestration, automation, DevOps, DaaS, Private Cloud, Azure AD, multi-cloud and multi-region networks, subscription, and resource group configuration (Azure experience strongly preferred); Experience with Business Problem Identification, Risk Management, Requirements Gathering and Analysis; Project Management experience; Design, implementation planning, and deployment management experience; Excellent problem solving and negotiation skills; The ability to be hands-on and lead technical teams; The ability to facilitate and create and overall design and implementation plan through coordination of multiple technical experts; Flexibility and adaptable to change; Excellent time management and setting priorities; Excellent written and verbal communication skills with the ability to articulate technical problems and issues to non-technical people as well as communicating business requirements to technical people; The ability to collaborate in a team environment; Demonstrated situational leadership. Working with the Enterprise Architecture team to interpret the Cloud Roadmap and defining work packages for the Cloud Delivery Program; Overseeing the execution of the work packages and providing advice and guidance on the technical solution; The creation of the Cloud solution design document using industry best practices and vendor recommended approach to establish the best solution; Guidance on the evaluation criteria for assessing workload candidates for the cloud; Advice and guidance on the migration of selected workloads to the cloud; Collaborating with all stakeholders (program, operation support teams, enterprise architecture, etc.) to facilitate an understanding of the solution architecture and how it addresses functional and non-functional requirements; Facilitating technical discussions to gather the information and decisions needed to develop the solution architecture; Collaborating with the Business Analyst on gathering and analyzing non-functional requirements; Ensuring that Cyber security and running organizations have signed off on the solution design; Ensuring the solution design is updated to reflect as-built information; Defining a solution architecture that meets functional and non-functional requirements; Ensuring that the solution design adheres to client standards; Identifying areas of architectural concern (i.e. applications, data, infrastructure, etc.) and executing investigations that lead to recommendations of practical solutions for both business and architectural stakeholder; Partnering with the Cloud Delivery team and subject matter experts to ensure custom solutions are meeting the program outcomes and the identified needs of the business; Assisting with coordination of effort required to implement the technical solution; Ensuring technical program deliverables are in accordance with technical specifications and supporting the Program Manager to ensure planned scope, resource commitments, and schedule; Managing the technical staff by collaborating on the detailed design of the system or program; Performing the general technical staff management duties such as allocating coding/testing tasks, monitoring progress and identifying and managing the technical issues/defects/problems/etc.; Working with Program Manager to ensure the technical scope, issues, and risks are managed as part of the overall program scope, issues, and risk management activities; Working with program BAs, Cloud Engineer, DBAs, Cloud Operations team to ensure all functional and nonfunctional requirements are addressed in the detailed design on the solution; Helping with the Implementation Plan and other deliverables as deemed appropriate by the Program Manager, such as deliverables related to transition to operations; Acting as liaison between the Program and Enterprise Architecture teams and the Technical Support teams; Partnering with the Program Manager and the Business for creating and executing the program plan; Identifying program and solution risks with their mitigation strategy in earliest portion of program lifecycle; Contributing to and reviewing program documentation; Collaborating with program team members to progress the program forward as per program plan and scope outline; Outlining both client and operations acceptance criteria; Participating on program close out activities; Partnering to ensure a successful transition to operations; and, Managing/participating in transition to operations work and deliverables.

These may include Enterprise Risk Management (ERM), Operational Risk Management, Environment, Health and Safety Management (EHS) Internal Controls Management and Sarbanes Oxley Compliance (SOX), Regulatory Compliance, Audits and Self-Assessments, Business Continuity Management (BCM), Disaster Recovery, Cybersecurity and Physical Security, Supply Chain Management or other comparable areas.Proven experience as consultant or equivalent, in a client facing roleKnowledge of diverse business matters such as IT, Marketing, HR etc.Strong analytical, problem solving skills and communication skillsWillingness to acquire additional GRC domain experience, skills, and formal certifications to enable the GRC Consultant in their daily consulting job.Outstanding communication and interpersonal skillsAbility to work independently and work within a multi stakeholder team environmentApply initiative to evaluate situations and recommend solutions to customersExperience working with customers in an enterprise software solutions project, either as a consultant, analyst, developer or application administratorBSc/BA in business administration or relevant field; MSc/MA in a specialized business field will be an advantageNice to Have: Second language proficiency (Spanish or French preferred)Prior experience with a software or IT consulting companyExperience configuring or supporting a vendor software tool/platformRelational database knowledgeExperience of Web Design Technologies to include Java Scripting, XML, HTML, CSSExperience with SQL / (REST) APICertified Management Consultant is a plusFamiliarity of any Governance, Risk & Compliance practice or processExperience in Financial Services, High Tech & Telecoms, Energy & Utilities, and/or Mining & Resources preferredExperience working with any GRC related applications, such as: Enablon (preferred), MetricStream, EMC/RSA Archer, Nasdaq BWise, Cura, Thomson Reuters Accelus, IBM OpenPages, Walters Kluwer TeamMate, ServiceNow IT GRC, Crowe Horwath Model Risk Manager, SAP GRC SolutionsIf you’re interested in joining a collaborative team in an exciting fast paced environment, please apply here and someone from our talent acquisition team will be in touch with you shortly.Job Type: Full-timeEducation:Bachelor'sLocation:Calgary, AB

Job_Description: CGI is currently seeking an experienced Product Manager within our Oil & Gas business unit in Calgary for PAS (Production Accounting Solution).  The O&G / Energy BU works with 5 primary products: PAS (Production Accounting Solution), RMS (Royalty Management System), PVR (Production Volume Reporting), LandMan (Land & Asset Management) and enVision (O&G Financial Management). CGI is well known in the industry as a leader in the Energy field for providing high quality and high impact systems. Your future duties and responsibilities: As the PAS Product Manager you will be responsible for defining the strategy, roadmap, and feature definition for the product. The position offers a challenging and rewarding position within a cross functional team of developers, business analysts and application support staff. The Product Manager is also considered to be a client liaison and key point of contact for over 45 Oil & Gas clients.  Responsibilities  Work with Sustainment Board to set a product vision and strategy  Manage a multi-million dollar development and support budget for the PAS product  Monitor and measure the profitability of the product including monthly financial reporting to senior management and Sustainment Board  Work with clients to determine which features need to move forward into the product  Work with clients and PAS team to balance product scope with strategic goals and budget  Support CGIs sales team through execution of PAS product demonstrations  Business Advisor to PAS Implementation Consultants and Business Analysts  Work closely with Service Delivery and Support Managers to plan timeline and team deliverables Required qualifications to be successful in this role:  15+ years of experience with applications supporting the Oil & Gas industry and a strong knowledge of the O&G domain  Previous leadership experience  Experience in positions requiring analysis, documentation and client interaction  Excellent interpersonal, oral and written communication skills  Post-secondary education in a relevant discipline or equivalent work experience  Attributes  Production Accounting System knowledge  Experience with chairing and presenting at client meetings  Ability to build strong relationships with team members and clients  Ability to work independently and as part of a team  Ability to multi-task effectively  Have excellent time management, task planning and prioritization skills  Able to adapt quickly to changing requirements  Excellent written and verbal communications in English  Nice to Have  Formal training and/or designation related to Product Management and/or Project Management  Experience working in an Agile Development environment #LI-AG1 What you can expect from us: Build your career with us.  It is an extraordinary time to be in business. As digital transformation continues to accelerate, CGI is at the center of this changesupporting our clients digital journeys and offering our professionals exciting career opportunities.  At CGI, our success comes from the talent and commitment of our professionals. As one team, we share the challenges and rewards that come from growing our company, which reinforces our culture of ownership. All of our professionals benefit from the value we collectively create.  Be part of building one of the largest independent technology and business services firms in the world.  Learn more about CGI at www.cgi.com.  No unsolicited agency referrals please.  CGI is an equal opportunity employer. In addition, CGI is committed to providing accommodations for people with disabilities in accordance with provincial legislation. Please let us know if you require a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during any aspect of the recruitment process and we will work with you to address your needs. Skills: Business Analysis Certified BusinessAnalysis Pro

Job_Description: At Franklin Templeton Investments, we are dedicated to delivering strong results and exceptional service to clients, team members and business partners. Over 9,000 employees working in 60 offices around the world are dedicated to servicing investment solutions for our clients in more than 150 countries. For over 65 years, our success has been a direct result of the talent, skills and persistence of our people, and we are looking for qualified candidates to join our team.  What are the goals of the team and how can you contribute to its success?  Provide specialized administrative support for accounts managed on behalf of high net worth clients of the trust company. Support the middle office, as an intermediary between front office client service specialists and various back office operations groups.  What are the ongoing responsibilities of the Private Client Administrator?  Prepare new client account opening kits by reviewing account documentation for accuracy and completeness.  Review and maintain accuracy of coding on all systems, as well client billing and referral fee data on various systems.  Conduct client reporting of statements, confirmations, notifications via online portal and regular mail.  Design and implement improved administrative processes to improve efficiency and respond to new client service needs.  Work with front and back office to resolve operational issues, per timelines.  Work with internal and external auditors, and compliance analysts to assist with required examinations of client records. Maintain proper records of user access, AML, FATCA and all client documentations.  Prepare compliance reporting and peer review reports to ensure that portfolios are compliant with investment policy.  What ideal qualifications would help someone to be successful?  University degree or equivalent financial services industry experience.  Canadian Securities Course or similar investment education.  Strong interpersonal, verbal and written communication skills.  Strong organizational, priority setting, and decision-making skills.  Strong computer proficiency, including with Microsoft Office applications.  Able to achieve results with minimal supervision as part of a self-guiding team.  What makes Franklin Templeton Investments unique?  In addition to the dynamic and professional environment at Franklin Templeton, we strive to ensure that our employees have access to a competitive and valuable set of Total Rewards—the mix of both monetary and non-monetary rewards provided to you in recognition for your time, talents, efforts, and results.  Highlights of our benefits include: Flexible medical, dental and vision insurance Corporate Pension Plan Employee Stock Investment Program Purchase company funds with no sales charge Competitive vacation package that includes three annual personal days Company paid short-term and long-term Disability Insurance Education assistance We believe that being a good corporate citizen is good business. To us, corporate citizenship means being accountable, serving our clients, being an employer of choice, managing our environmental impact, and supporting our communities. An emphasis on corporate citizenship is embedded in our culture and values, and is an important element of how we achieve success.  We are also committed to your learning and development with resources focused around Experience, Exposure, and Education, to help you achieve your professional development goals. Take some time to, meet some of our people, and see what it means to say, “I AM Franklin Templeton”.  Franklin Templeton Investments is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We invite you to visit us at http://www.franklintempletoncareers.com/ to learn more about our company and our career opportunities.  #LI-US
Title: Private Client Administrator
