Job_Description: Reporting to the Manager, Measurement and Crude Oil Quality – C&T Operations, this position is responsible for ensuring the continuation of the PRD Quality Compliance Program (QCP), while working in a fast paced environment to safely handle and optimize our facilities inbound and outbound crude streams while mitigating commercial risk.  Essential Duties & Responsibilities The responsibilities of this role include, but are not limited to:  Act as the primary point of contact for Secure Energy’s PRD Quality programs (QCP). Act as an intercompany representative for multiple stakeholder groups. Develop and implement key KPI tracking reports on a monthly and quarterly basis. Monitor industry relations and report on any changes that may have commercial impact to the Commercial teams (Participate In the CCQTA meetings and progress any upcoming changes). Own the development and maintenance of all SOP’s are developed in accordance with the Secure QCP and applicable ASTM methods. Manage/oversee internal Secure hydrocarbon labs. Liaison with delivery/receipt point customers to mitigate all quality infractions/Shut-in’s/classifications. Budget, Maintain and designate testing requirements to the quality analyst for all 3rd party analytical regarding hydrocarbon quality testing. Coordinate Operations QCP training programs by working with field operations. Champion the determination of the Sliding scale risk matrix for all PRD facilities receipt point quality monitoring process. Support field operations around the understanding and validation of all analytics coming in from third party labs. Manage and rollout the PRD quality monitoring software. Work with Commercial Marketing to understand, validate and maximize value chain to customers and Secure Support vendor agreements and hold them accountable to Secure quality specifications. Work with the Secure Measurement teams to optimize and address sampling issues for Sampling Systems / Analyzers / Blend skids. Validate and resolve any third-party infraction and Force Majeure incidents while tracking resolution. Direct all investigations into quality related incidents to determine root cause and make recommendations to mitigate. Act as a primary champion for monthly Secure Quality Group (SQG) meetings. Further development of Secure Standard Operating Procedures – owning all Quality related QCP standard’s and work with the operations document control group to achieve continuation of the Secure standards. Act as a technical Advisor and Key Stakeholder on MOC generated work regarding quality related systems. Act as a technical Advisor and Key Stakeholder on BD generated work regarding quality related systems. Develop Standardized audit templates to create clear and effective continuation for Secure PRD quality operations. Develop and standardize all necessary quality identification protocol with the regulatory and operations GM’s for PRD operating facilities. Support continuous improvement based on a direct working relationship with the Measurement team for all Pipeline Sampling Systems and quality control systems. Any other responsibilities as directed by the Manager of Measurement and Crude Oil Quality.  Qualifications/Competencies The individual in this role will have:  High energy, results focused, financial focused and can work well in fast paced environments 5+ years related experience in Crude quality determination. Chemistry and Chemical engineering diploma or equivalent training required. Knowledge of sampling systems, API 8.2 knowledge required. Knowledge of Lab set up and work flow requirements required. Strong understanding of crude oil chemistry and ASTM hydrocarbon test methods required. Demonstrated leadership skills. Excellent verbal and written communication skills, and customer service skills. Proficient in Microsoft Office (Excel, Word, Outlook, Power Point). Strong ability to build working relationships and contacts within the organization as well as with external regulators, vendors and contractors. Interface with field operations, perform audit functions and develop corrective actions. Team player who enjoys learning and contributing to team goals. Must be willing to travel.  Qualifications Skills  Preferred Interpersonal Skills Expert Microsoft Office Advanced Strong Customer Services Expert Attention to Detail Expert Analytical Capabilities Expert Team Oriented Expert Behaviors  Preferred Functional Expert: Considered a thought leader on a subject Motivations  Preferred Ability to Make an Impact: Inspired to perform well by the ability to contribute to the success of a project or the organization Entrepreneurial Spirit: Inspired to perform well by an ability to drive new ventures within the business Education  Preferred Associates or better in Chemistry or related field. Experience Required Knowledge of Lab set up and work flow requirements Strong understanding of crude oil chemistry and ASTM hydrocarbon test methods 5 years: Crude quality determination Knowledge of sampling systems, API 8.2 knowledge  Licenses & Certifications  Preferred Driver's Licences
Title: Senior Crude Oil Quality Specialist

Job_Description: Every day, our passionate employees connect our customers to the world and everything in it  its why we exist at Shaw, and its why we strive to be the place where the best people choose to work. Our people reflect the richness of our communities, and our culture is inclusive of each individuals diverse background and perspective, which makes us a stronger team.  At Shaw we believe a diverse workforce fosters diversity of thought and perspective, and more diversity means more solutions. We invite all qualified individuals to apply.  Career Opportunity: Manager, Digital Performance  Shaw Communications Inc. has an exciting opportunity leading Digital Analytics in our Calgary, Alberta Corporate Headquarters.  The Manager, Digital Performance will lead a team of digital and technical analysts, who are responsible for tracking, analyzing and reporting on Shaws digital properties and campaigns, and helping define a data-driven marketing strategy. They will provide strategic insights to help improve digital marketing effectiveness, online sales order conversion and overall digital customer journey and user experience. In addition, they will also play a key role in the operational execution of our marketing cloud tools to drive adoption of a new approach to marketing at Shaw.  As a passionate digital analytics practitioner, you should have an understanding of performance-based marketing, data mining, data modeling and predictive analytics. The successful candidate will also be a strong leader able to motivate team members to push beyond their boundaries, and a passionate individual with the ability to drive change and evangelize a data-driven culture. This position reports into the Director, Digital Sales.  Accountabilities/ Responsibilities:  Lead team of analysts, providing guidance and training to ensure they have the skillset and tools to deliver on their business responsibilities.  Provide actionable insights to drive continuous improvements in user experience, digital marketing campaign performance and online conversion.  Utilize multiple marketing cloud solutions to design data-driven targeting strategies to deliver relevant content at the right point in the customer journey.  Drive testing strategy for marketing campaigns leveraging DMP audiences, attribution data, and A/B testing, and communicate program results and progress.  Define analytics requirements and solution design across all digital initiatives, and maintain data integrity across tag management, web analytics, DMP, attribution and business reporting tools.  Establish success criteria and measurement framework tied to the strategic intent of initiatives and the underlying business objectives, and track team progress against targets.  Prioritize initiatives based on business value and implementation effort.  Work closely with the Digital Marketing and Marketing Operations teams to inform media investments, and recommend optimizations to drive down cost per acquisition and improve marketing efficiency.  Socialize, train and support business stakeholders to empower them with real-time reporting capabilities and ensure data is being leveraged across the organization.  Analytics thought leadership.  Required Skills, Experience and Qualifications:  Post-secondary degree in Business, Economics, Data Science, Mathematics, or similar. MBA preferred  Minimum 5+ years of experience in a data analytics role  Minimum 5+ years of experience in ecommerce or marketing  Strong leadership skills with the ability to influence and drive change  Advanced quantitative analytical and problem-solving skills  Experience with Adobe Analytics suite, Google Analytics or similar, as well as tag management solutions like Tealium  Experience with at least one of the following platforms: A/B and multivariate testing, algorithmic attribution, marketing automation, DMP, ad serving, and/or bid-management tools  Experience with data visualization tools like Domo or Tableau  Advanced Excel and PowerPoint skills  Proven ability to draw insights out of complex data and communicate findings in a clear and concise manner  Excellent interpersonal skills with the ability to communicate with cross-functional teams, business partners and leadership  Ability to handle a heavy workload, balancing multiple demands in a fast-paced environment  Passionate about data-driven strategy and its ability to deliver beyond the status quo  If you want to be part of something biggerpart of a dynamic team of people who are aligned, focused, and passionate about working together to care for our customers, then we look forward to meeting you! Join us.  We thank all interested applicants, however, only qualified candidates will be contacted. This position requires the successful completion of a criminal background check.  Shaw Communications, through its third party vendor, collects and stores information applicable to the candidate profile you create when you submit the information asked for below. The use and disclosure of the collected information is for the sole purpose of job search and placement activities for Shaw Communications. The information is subject to Personal Information Protection and Electronic Documents Act. The information will be retained and when disposed of, it is done so in a secure manner. Your profile will become inactive and moved to the archive if you do not access your profile for a period of 1 year.
Title: Manager, Digital Performance

Consistently pushing the boundaries when it comes to innovation within the forestry and pulp and paper industries, our IT professionals support Canfor in achieving exceptional results.With a high caliber Information Technology leadership team, a clear vision, and significant growth and training opportunities, a career in IT at Canfor allows individuals to strengthen their competencies and grow within their respective roles. Job_Description: Business Analyst for Application Development Processes:  full time, 6 month duration, based in Calgary This role provides ownership and oversight of all process development, improvement, and implementation of Software Process Improvement (SPI) based on the CMM framework.A key responsibility of this group is to monitor process metrics in order to identify either problem areas or identify opportunities for process improvement.They are responsible for staffing the SEPG team and providing direction in applying the Process Change Method (PCM) for the account and in training the delivery team.They train the delivery team, begins the implementation, acts as process owner for changes and updates, and plans and leads the IBM tasks of the Software Engineering Institute (SEI) CMM-based assessment.They also engage ADE to perform an effectiveness study when funded and appropriate.Capture business requirements, analysis of requirements, mapping of requirements (As is and To be processes)Particular focus on Windows 10 application Please send your resumes to Danielle Pelletier at daniellep@tes.net.

Job_Description: *PLEASE NOTE: PREFERENCE WILL BE GIVEN TO CANDIDATES WHO APPLY THROUGH CANFOR.COM/CAREERSCanfor TechnologyAt Canfor, our Information Technology professionals play an important role in the daily functioning of our operations. Consistently pushing the boundaries when it comes to innovation within the forestry and pulp and paper industries, our IT professionals support Canfor in achieving exceptional results.With a high caliber Information Technology leadership team, a clear vision, and significant growth and training opportunities, a career in IT at Canfor allows individuals to strengthen their competencies and grow within their respective roles. Working as an equal partner with our operations to achieve organizational objectives, you will be at the forefront of innovation.Who We Are: Canfor is one of the world’s largest and most respected integrated forest products companies. For more than 75 years, we have been delivering top-quality lumber, pulp and paper products to our valued customers worldwide. With operations in Western Canada and the Southern United States, and sales offices around the world, you can find Canfor products in every corner of the globe. We are leaders in sustainable forest management and in converting wood residuals into green energy.As we continue to grow our company and our markets, find out how you can grow your career with us.The OpportunityThe Data Analyst, Business Intelligence supports Canfor’s objectives by turning data into meaningful information that can be used to make sound business decisions. The Data Analyst will provide expertise in business intelligence to prepare and deliver data and information to internal customers and stakeholders through reports, dashboards and scorecards. It is essential that the Data Analyst build an understanding of the business at a level of detail that enables them to work with the business to deliver valuable information.Please Note:  This is a relocation opportunity in Vancouver, British Columbia. The successful applicant may be provided with relocation assistance.Main ResponsibilitiesRequirements Gathering:Engage with various business units to capture information needs, compare those needs with existing tools and identify gapsParticipate in business requirements workshopsWrite business requirements documents as required to elaborate needs, gain acceptanceDesign & Development:Architect tables and dataDesign dashboards, reports, drill-down analytics and data visualizationsDesign, configure and administer the metadata layerCreate system technical requirements for documentation and knowledge managementActively challenge and find solutions to optimize system performanceTesting, Validation, Release Management:Develop and implement testing strategiesValidate data accuracyDeploy and validate changes in production environmentTraining & Change Management:Support the development of training, documentation, and help desk capabilitiesRequired SkillsBachelor's degree in computer science, information systems, business management or specialized training/certificationExperience working with relational databases (Microsoft SQL Server, Oracle Database, MySQL, etc)Applied knowledge of SQL (T-SQL, PL/SQL, ANSI-SQL, etc)Applied understanding of data modelling and warehousing conceptsWorking knowledge of business intelligence tools such as Oracle Business IntelligenceWorking knowledge of ETL tools such as Oracle Data Integrator or InformaticaExperience mediating and clarifying sometimes ambiguous or conflicting end user requirementsEagerness to learn new concepts and technologies and keep-up-to-date with existing onesWillingness to go above and beyond to understand both the business and technical aspects of a problemHiring for this position is ongoing and will be filled as required. To be considered for this position, please apply today.In order to be eligible for this position, you must be legally entitled to work in Canada for our Company.There has never been a better time to join the Canfor Information Technology team and become a part of the modern forest industry. We have a wide range of rewarding and innovative careers in some of the best communities in North America, with plenty of room for advancement. We offer competitive compensation and benefits packages, and are committed to the professional development of our employees.*PLEASE NOTE: PREFERENCE WILL BE GIVEN TO CANDIDATES WHO APPLY THROUGH CANFOR.COM/CAREERSFollow us on LinkedIn , Twitter , and Facebook for Canfor news, career opportunities, and upcoming events!Vancouver, BCThe city of Vancouver is both a natural beauty and a progressive urban centre, a rare place on earth that is idyllic and electric all at once. Title: Test Analyst

Job_Description: "The Power of Together” Join a growing and dynamic company that has a long and rich Canadian history in providing innovative insurance solutions to customers nationwide. Northbridge Financial Corporation is a leading commercial property and casualty insurance company that’s been helping protect Canadian businesses for more than 90 years. As a group, we offer a wide range of creative solutions to our customers through our Northbridge Insurance, TruShield Insurance and Federated Insurance brands. At Northbridge, we strive to create a fair and friendly culture, upheld by the foundation of our five corporate values: respect, passion, connectedness, creativity, and excellence. We’re committed to living these values into everything we do, and our dedicated team of over 1,400 employees brings them to life every day. Job Purpose: The Client Service Representative position provides exceptional front line commercial client service in a Commercial Insurance Specialist (CIS) support role, providing timely service and information to the client, CIS and Underwriting. Key Accountabilities: Client Service Provides front line communication liaison with our commercial clients. Handles all incoming client phone calls with the objective of resolving all questions related to coverage additions, deletions and modifications. Timely handling of client service requests. Completes policy adjustment requests, identifying and informing CIS where potential cross sell/upsell opportunities exist as required. Maintenance of client database. Processes certificates of insurance, pink cards, coverage confirmations etc. within 24 hours. Commercial Insurance Specialist Support Assists CIS with their responsibilities so as to effectively maximize their use of time, as required by the CIS. Provides timely information from the client to the risk analysts as requested. Assists in the preparation and production of all documents as required. Supports renewal, underwriting and ACR function. Calls client on over-due accounts as required. Process and forward all data, Right Reports, and PARs within 48 hours to Data Entry Personnel. Produces Annual Client Reviews and proposals as required. Processes certificates of insurance, pink cards, coverage confirmations etc. Completes policy adjustment requests and informs CISs where potential coverage deficiencies are evident. Keeps CISs informed in advance of all renewal and ACR due dates, and assists in maintaining ACR completion system. Forwards critical phone messages and correspondence to CIS, keeping them informed of account status. Assists in obtaining territory results and forwarding to District Sales Manager on a weekly basis. Administrative Provides support and remains cross functional in data inputting of renewals and new business. Completion of adjustments and changes in our database as required and authorized. General maintenance of computer database and Salesplace system. Production of documents and reports as required. Maintains client files in an orderly, organized manner. Office support to the Risk Analysts. Knowledgeable of Federated’s products in our target market. Teamwork and Professionalism Supports other business unit functions, promoting professionalism and cooperation between Sales, Underwriting, Loss Prevention and Accounting. Prioritizes and organizes workload to maintain service standards. Makes every attempt to minimize time delays in processing by following up on outstanding items. Maintains exceptional working relationships with Clients, Sales, Underwriting, Loss Prevention and other office personnel. Strives for ongoing self-development through industry and related courses. Remains calm and professional when dealing with difficult circumstances. Willingly helps others maintain standards and trains new and existing staff as needs arise. Qualifications: High school graduate plus a two-year diploma course or an equivalent combination of education and related experience. Licensed in Commercial Lines Insurance. Strong Microsoft office skills Application Process: Federated welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available upon request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. Interested, qualified candidates are encouraged to apply below.
Title: Client Service Representative

Job_Description: Organization OverviewCPA Alberta is the professional regulatory organization representing Alberta’s approximately 28,500 Chartered Professional Accountants (CPAs). Alberta’s members are among the more than 210,000 Canadian CPAs who provide financial and management expertise across the country and around the world, at every level and in every sector. CPA Alberta’s legislated mandate is to protect the interest of the public, protect the integrity of the profession, promote and increase the competence of Alberta CPAs, and regulate the conduct of Alberta CPAs. CPA Alberta has offices in Edmonton and Calgary.Further information can be found at our website: www.cpaalberta.ca.The RoleReporting to the Director, Corporate Strategy & Risk, the Business Partner, Operations Analyst is a key position within CPA Alberta responsible for process improvement, ensuring compliance with internal policies and governing documents, strengthening internal controls, and performing business analytics and reporting. The role will partner with various departments to document workflow and identify solutions that streamline processes and ensure they are effective and will support the Chief Financial Officer and the Senior Executive Team in providing value to the membership by demonstrating strong fiscal accountability, transparency, and compliance.The Business Partner Operations Analyst is expected to demonstrate excellence by enhancing and protecting organizational value through risk-based and objective assurance, advice, and insight.Key ResponsibilitiesDevelop a strong understanding of CPA Alberta and its environment, including products, services, and business units.Ensure organizational compliance with governing documents and internal policies.Review operations and prepare detailed process maps to identify opportunities for improvement, detect potential risk exposure, develop risk mitigation strategies, and find cost savings.Recommend improvement based new rules, regulations, best practices and standards to the organization.Confirm the accuracy of financial documents and systems.Recommend improvements to strengthen internal controls.Safeguard corporate assets by providing recommendations on protection measures.Champion corporate responsiveness in the areas of continuous improvement, risk mitigation, and fiscal and operational accountability.Develop business analytics to assist departments in improving operations and to report on business plan progress.Update organizational balanced scorecard and validate metrics.Develop and monitor Payment Card Industry (PCI) compliance system.RequirementsA Bachelor’s Degree in accounting, business administration or a related field along with 3 - 5 years of related experience in similar role.Significant experience working with process maps and workflow improvement and strong background using analytics is required.A Certified Internal Auditor designation is considered an asset.Exceptional written and verbal communication skills; and a persuasive and passionate communicator.The ability to develop and maintain strong professional relationships with internal and external stakeholders.Attention to detail in all areas of work.Strong problem identification and problem resolution skills.Proven organizational and time management skills.Ability to handle multiple tasks and work well under pressure.Demonstrates integrity, competence and due professional care.Maintains objectivity, is insightful, proactive, and future-focused.Experience with the COSO Internal Control Integrated Framework is considered an asset.CompetenciesValue and EthicsTeamwork and CooperationOrganizational AwarenessFlexibility/AdaptabilityResults ManagementAnalytical ThinkingJudgmentPlanning/OrganizingWorking ConditionsFast paced work environment.Some travel may be required between the Calgary and Edmonton offices.Some overtime may be required from time to time to meet business objectives.Location:  Edmonton or Calgary OfficeQualified interested candidates may submit their resume and cover letter indicating the position title with #2018-87 in the subject line.Due to the anticipated volume of responses, we will contact only those candidates who most closely match our requirements.Job Types: Full-time, PermanentExperience:related work: 3 yearsEducation:Bachelor'sLocation:Calgary, AB
Title: Operations Analyst #2018 – 87

Job_Description: a. Should have 10+ years of development experience and deep understanding of Microsoft BI suits including T-SQL, SSIS, SSAS (Tabular), SSRS and Power BI. b. Should have 8+ years of experience and strong knowledge in web-application development using VB.NET, C#.Net, JavaScript, ASP.NET, WCF/Web services and HTML c. Should have excellent track record in architecture, design and implementation for complex global applications involving Microsoft .Net and BI stack. d. Should be very strong in ETL designing and implementation, with 7+ years of work experience, for large enterprise reporting systems. e. Should have 4+ years of experience in Business and System Analysis and requirements gathering. f. Demonstrable ability to own and deliver very large applications and results of increasing technical complexity g. Comfort working in an agile environment, embracing change, and thriving amid ambiguity. h. Self-starter who can effectively manage time and work load. i. Must have exceptional written/verbal communication and presentation skills across all levels of customers, partners, and stakeholders. j. Experience in developing interfaces to connect with SAP would be an advantage. k. Exposure to payroll and/or enterprise time and attendance solutions would be big plus.

Job_Description: "The Power of Together” Join a growing and dynamic company that has a long and rich Canadian history in providing innovative insurance solutions to customers nationwide. Northbridge Financial Corporation is a leading commercial property and casualty insurance company that’s been helping protect Canadian businesses for more than 90 years. As a group, we offer a wide range of creative solutions to our customers through our Northbridge Insurance, TruShield Insurance and Federated Insurance brands. At Northbridge, we strive to create a fair and friendly culture, upheld by the foundation of our five corporate values: respect, passion, connectedness, creativity, and excellence. We’re committed to living these values into everything we do, and our dedicated team of over 1,400 employees brings them to life every day. Job Purpose: The Client Service Representative position provides exceptional front line commercial client service in a Commercial Insurance Specialist (CIS) support role, providing timely service and information to the client, CIS and Underwriting. Key Accountabilities: Client Service Provides front line communication liaison with our commercial clients. Handles all incoming client phone calls with the objective of resolving all questions related to coverage additions, deletions and modifications. Timely handling of client service requests. Completes policy adjustment requests, identifying and informing CIS where potential cross sell/upsell opportunities exist as required. Maintenance of client database. Processes certificates of insurance, pink cards, coverage confirmations etc. within 24 hours. Commercial Insurance Specialist Support Assists CIS with their responsibilities so as to effectively maximize their use of time, as required by the CIS. Provides timely information from the client to the risk analysts as requested. Assists in the preparation and production of all documents as required. Supports renewal, underwriting and ACR function. Calls client on over-due accounts as required. Process and forward all data, Right Reports, and PARs within 48 hours to Data Entry Personnel. Produces Annual Client Reviews and proposals as required. Processes certificates of insurance, pink cards, coverage confirmations etc. Completes policy adjustment requests and informs CISs where potential coverage deficiencies are evident. Keeps CISs informed in advance of all renewal and ACR due dates, and assists in maintaining ACR completion system. Forwards critical phone messages and correspondence to CIS, keeping them informed of account status. Assists in obtaining territory results and forwarding to District Sales Manager on a weekly basis. Administrative Provides support and remains cross functional in data inputting of renewals and new business. Completion of adjustments and changes in our database as required and authorized. General maintenance of computer database and Salesplace system. Production of documents and reports as required. Maintains client files in an orderly, organized manner. Office support to the Risk Analysts. Knowledgeable of Federated’s products in our target market. Teamwork and Professionalism Supports other business unit functions, promoting professionalism and cooperation between Sales, Underwriting, Loss Prevention and Accounting. Prioritizes and organizes workload to maintain service standards. Makes every attempt to minimize time delays in processing by following up on outstanding items. Remains calm and professional when dealing with difficult circumstances. Willingly helps others maintain standards and trains new and existing staff as needs arise. Strong Microsoft office skills Application Process: Federated welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Job_Description: Analyze and interpret data from incidents and leading & lagging indicators to assist in implementation of corrective and preventive measures; Prepare performance reports to various functional groups and committees to communicate EH&S results to internal partners; Support ongoing actions to maintain a COR and prepare for COR audits; Review, update and develop documents for the Environmental Health & Safety Management System in order to keep the system current and in compliance; Responsible for the Harvest incident management and contractor management systems; Corporate support of health and safety activities in order to ensure compliance with the applicable laws, regulations, standards and company requirements; Foster and promote a proactive health and safety mindset towards employees through communication, involvement and participation in health and safety activities Responsible for distribution and communication of safety and regulatory alerts; Participate in incident investigation, reporting and follow-up in accordance with incident reporting protocols; Responsible for new hire safety orientations for Harvest employees and contractors; Support of the Harvest Joint Worksite Health & Safety Committee Qualifications: A degree or certification in Occupational Health & Safety, Business Analyst or other areas of relevance A minimum of three years of health & safety experience in the energy industry Technical and interpersonal skills to identify EH&S issues and communicate corrective and preventative actions through the involvement of management Excellent knowledge of applicable health and safety legislation requirements Safety Professional accreditations (CRSP, CHSC, CIH, etc.) is an asset Business Analyst or Business Management experience Available for occasional business/field trips Proficient use of Microsoft Office Suite applications such as Outlook, Word, Excel and PowerPoint
Title: Corporate Safety Advisor

Job_Description: This role supports Superior Propane's sister company, Superior Gas Liquids. Superior Gas Liquids is a leading mid-stream marketer providing innovative and dependable energy solutions to gas & oil producers and whole sale propane and NGL end-users. Reporting directly to the Logistics Team Lead, the NGL Scheduler is responsible for forecasting supply requirements, ensuring timely and cost effective ordering and delivery of propane to consistently meet inventory and supply needs for Superior storage locations and direct delivered customers. The NGL Scheduler works closely with the marketing group to ensure supply plans are executed and manages the day to day relationships with the gas plants and third party trucking companies. This role is also responsible for ensuring orders are executed in a cost effective manner, with maximum productivity, and for providing appropriate direction and control of related transport providers to ensure all relevant Health and Safety standards and practices are maintained. KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES: 1. Forecast Propane and Butane supply requirements on a daily, weekly and monthly basis to: Identify variances from expected volumes; from primary/ pipeline locations Manage the stability of forecasts with regional expectations to achieve supply consistency. Solicit regional input for planning Work with marketers to ensure supply is available and point out any areas of concerns 2. Develop plans and analyze performance for MSA (Master Supply Agreement), MTA (Master Transportation Agreement) and MMR (Monthly Material Requirements) to ensure supply flow is effective to meet market requirements and is balanced with contractual requirements with propane suppliers. 3. Monitor and manage KPI’s (Key Performance Indicators) for transportation providers to ensure they are consistently meeting our service, cost and safety requirements. 4. Coordinate and monitor deliveries to primary supply storage locations ensuring they are delivered in a cost effective and timely manner. Validate performance against contracts expectation and review discrepancies for follow-up. 5. Manage relationships with various contacts at the different terminals, plants and refineries of our supplies as well as the trucking companies 6. Responsible for providing monthly nominations and updates to our various inventory holders. 7. Track contractual liftings of our Canadian and US wholesale customers and act as main point of contact for any supply/pricing questions. 8. Work closely with the Rail Logistic analyst to ensure everyone on the Logistics team is cross-trained for back up and support reasons. 9. Responsible for understanding, managing and maintaining SGL’s Landed Cost specific information in order to ensure all product is shipped in the most cost effective way. 10. Work closely with SGL marketers to ensure the supply plan is executed and to optimize profits through efficient origin/destination pairings and maximizing rebates. 11. Ensure timely delivery information is available on Secure Sheet so that the admin team can receipt product purchases. 12. Resolve problems by determining the root cause and taking pro-active steps to prevent future occurrences. Communicate issues that impact supply chain including weather, carrier malfunctions, etc and provide updated routing or supply delay information to the internal operations. 13. Identify, develop, activate and manage contingency plans and be on call for product unavailability or shortages. 14. Identify and assist in the resolution of any issues between Superior Propane and Superior Gas Liquids 15. Develop, manage and maintain relationships with direct and 3 rd party suppliers to reduce demurrage costs, improve and enhance modal efficiencies and build a strong network to achieve overall Supply and Transportation objectives. 16. Monitor relevant expenses related to primary transportation and product costing to ensure cost effective delivery of services to respective regions. 17. Work with AP and SGL to ensure all payables for product costs and transportation are current and accurate. 18. Advise the regional business and customers as the subject matter expert on supply and transportation initiatives, projects and new account set ups. 19. Conduct site visits to customer account sites, refinery lift points, 3 rd party carrier locations and Superior sites to ensure compliance, assess concerns and review performance. 20. Ensure the successful planning and execution of strategic projects as assigned QUALIFICATIONS: Minimum of University Degree or professional certification or equivalent training. Minimum of three (3) years’ logistics experience. Experience at a marketing organization or in LPG industry would be an asset. Knowledge of the rail industry would be an asset Intermediate computer knowledge including Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, Outlook) are required; Microsoft Access and JDE experience is preferred Knowledge of regional geography. Proven ability to build positive working relationships with strong written and verbal communication skills. Solid planning and organizational skills with ability to prioritize and multi-task. Fluency in French/English, both written and verbal would be an asset
Title: NGL Scheduler

Job_Description: Lead the implementation and management of portfolio, program and project governance frameworks and development of appropriate reporting tools. Manage the administration for project submissions and approvals through the agreed approval process, maintaining a pipeline of approved projects. Manage the governance approved project prioritization by monitoring project execution to minimize project scope change, time, cost and resource risks. Engage the PMO stakeholders and organizational leadership to define the PMO mission, goals and operating model, and vision of the PMO organization to foster a project-management-oriented culture and mindset, and releases this after senior management approval, in the form of the PMO charter. Lead the identification and development of PMO roles, team configuration and recruitment appropriate to deliver the agreed-upon PMO goals and objectives. Define and maintain standards (practices, processes and templates) for managing projects consistently and efficiently to reduce project related risk and costs. Provide leadership to ensure proper investments in tools, processes, and people exist to govern the project portfolios, risk reviews, document controls, and project management training. Monitor and report on compliance with established standards to ensure the organization adheres to agreed policies and standards. Responsible for PMO and RMO organization structure; hiring management and development of team members; and managing team member requirements in line with PMO and RMO activities and expectations. Provide project and portfolio budget monitoring to ensure the accurate and timely reporting, notification and escalation of project expenditures, burn rates and risks. Ensure timely post project reviews to explore lessons learned and action change to improve project delivery. Classification: Director Union: Exempt Department: IT Business Services Primary Location: QuarryPark Negotiable Location: Provincial Employee Class: Regular Full Time FTE: 1.00 Posting End Date: 22-MAY-2018 Date Available: 25-JUN-2018 Hours per Shift: 7.75 Length of Shift in weeks: 2 Shifts per cycle: 10 Shift Pattern: Days Days Off: Saturday/Sunday Minimum Salary: $50.87 Maximum Salary: $89.48 Vehicle Requirement: N/A Required Qualifications: Excellent leadership experience with a focus on team development, coaching and mentoring. Expertise in project and program management, and the associated methodologies, technologies, processes and approaches. Budget analysis, cost management and project financial reporting. Excellent communication skills, including verbal, written, presentation and training. Strong problem solving, multi-tasking and organizational skills. Ability to work independently to gather, analyze, and organize data, define problems and requirements, and recommend solutions. Ability to build and maintain productive working relationships with all stakeholders, at all levels of the organization. Excellent conflict resolution and negotiation skills. Ability and willingness to be flexible and adaptable to changing priorities. Proven ability to work effectively both independently and in a team based environment. Dedication and commitment to customer service focused delivery of solutions. Superior analytical problem solving ability for dealing with escalated issues.  Additional Required Qualifications: Ability to build a strong network and relationships at executive levels with technology and solutions. Demonstrated flexibility, resilience, and resourcefulness. Ability to identify current or future problems or opportunities, analyze, synthesize, and compare information to understand issues and cause/effect relationships, and explores alternative solutions to support sound decision making. A Bachelor’s degree from an accredited college or university in Computer Science, Business, Finance, Statistics, Technology, or other related fields, with a minimum of 6 - 10 years of experience as a Senior Project or Program Manager. Project Management Professional (PMP) and/or Program Management Professional (PgMP) and/or Certified Business Analysis Professional (CBAP) and/or Business Systems Analyst Certificate (BSAC).  Preferred Qualifications: Experience in public sector is an asset. An equivalent combination of education and/or experience may be acceptable.
Title: Director - IT Project Delivery and Governance

Job_Description: This position is to support the Project Controls Lead in the area of cost control. This will include assisting in setting up the budget, monitoring actual costs, calculate incurred costs, forecasting the final cost, and assess contractors performance.  ***This is a consultant contract position and not an employee contract***  Job Duties & Responsibilities Project Cost Control and Forecasting:  Re-cast control budget into Vendor Cost Tracking for Drilling and Completions (D&C) daily cost tracking and forecasting activities; Coordinate reviews of planned activities to evaluate both daily and estimate at complete forecast; Interface with Supply Chain Management (SCM) team & contract proponent to ensure budget control; Interface with Drilling and Completions (D&C) teams to review historical data and forecast to complete; Support Project Analyst with trending and change management alerts / controls and monthly reporting; Interface with Business Focal Points (BFPs) to ensure accurate processing of requests for purchase requisition (p-req), change requests and vendor daily tickets; Understands and uses Cost Control Systems &/or SAP. Reconcile D&C cost tracker with SAP actuals; Monitors man-hours and progress to establish trends and to assist in forecasting; Checking documentation to ensure correct cost coding; Input of commitments and invoices into cost system; Makes sure that cost data is being gathered in a proper format to allow for a concise closeout report; Exercises judgment and initiative in the analysis of data obtained from a variety of sources. Education & Experience Post-secondary education with 5 years minimum relevant experience in oil and gas; Experience working with Drilling and Completions (D&C) considered an asset Good understanding of basic Project Management principles and their application Experience using cost systems; such as SAP, Prism G2, and Others Results oriented individual with the ability to effectively manage multiple priorities and time lines; People oriented with an ability to establish a high degree of credibility with project stakeholders; Strong communication skills verbal and written; Ability to produce timely and high quality documentation; Proven teamwork environment skills; Ability to lead meetings.
Title: CW - Cost Control

Job_Description: At Rogers we’re for supporting you on a journey to a rewarding career. Whether you’re a developer, an analyst, or a customer care consultant, Rogers is the place where ideas become reality. We embrace change, and find ways to do better. And we deliver on that commitment by fostering an environment of passion and innovation for all people.  JACK 96.9 has a rare programming opportunity. We’re seeking a Program Director to lead JACK back to the top of the ratings in Calgary.  We are looking for someone who will be excited to roll up his or her sleeves and create the product; every minute of every day of every week of every… ok, you get the idea! We want someone who is going to truly obsess about the listener experience.  Our next PD will need to act as the Executive Producer of the station working with talent, producers, promotions and marketing to develop a memorable brand experience. That's a fancy way of saying you'll be expected to "make the station sound and look great!"  We like to keep things simple so, as PD you'll have just one objective; to make JACK 96-9 the #1 station in Calgary. Now, if that objective scares you then this isn't the gig for you. That's cool; it's not for everyone. If however it excites and motivates you, then you're our kind of crazy and we'd like to hear from you.  Send whatever you think is going to impress us (we suspect that will include your resume) to Paul Kaye, VP Product & Talent, at Paul.Kaye@rci.rogers.com.  Deadline for applications is Friday May 18, 2018. All applications will be treated in the strictest of confidence. Schedule: Full Time Shift: Day Length of Contract: Not Applicable (Regular Position) Work Location: 535 7th Avenue Sout West (811), Calgary, AB Travel Requirements: Up to 10% Posting Category/Function: Broadcasting & Programming Requisition ID: 121370 WHY ROGERS? As a proud Canadian company, we're dedicated to making things easier for our customers. We’ve been embracing and leading change for over 50-years, and we’ll continue to seek out new opportunities to bring our customers simple solutions for today and tomorrow. We recognize that success is determined by the strength and diversity of our people. We work together because we want to win together, and these five shared values guide and define our work: Simplify and innovate Take ownership of the what and the how Equip people to succeed Execute with discipline and pride Talk straight, build trust, and over deliver Why Rogers? Because your tomorrow inspires our today. What makes us different makes us stronger. Rogers has a strong commitment to diversity and inclusion. Everyone who applies for a job will be considered. We recognize the business value in creating a workplace where each team member has the tools to reach their full potential. At Rogers, we value the insights and innovation that diverse teams bring to work. We work with our candidates with disabilities throughout the recruitment process to ensure that they have what they need to be at their best. Please reach out to our recruiters and hiring managers to begin a conversation about how we can ensure that you deliver your best work. You can also reach out to our team at RogersRecruiting@rci.rogers.com to begin a conversation about your individual accessibility needs throughout the hiring process. Job_Description: Senior Commodity Tax Analyst Reference Code: 50672   Location: Canada (CA) - Calgary, AB Job Category: Accounting/Finance Employment Type: Employee Full-time Relocation Eligibility: This position is not eligible for our relocation program  General Information A Senior Commodity Tax Analyst position is currently available within the Taxation department, reporting to the Director of Indirect Tax. The team is responsible for preparing commodity tax returns for many Canadian pipeline and non-pipeline entities. The Senior Commodity Tax Analyst will work as part of a larger group to ensure compliance with Canadian commodity tax legislation. The successful candidate will have a strong knowledge of Canadian commodity tax legislation and possess the ability to analyze costs incurred and determine the appropriate tax treatment of these costs.  ResponsibilitiesPreparing and reviewing tax returns for a large number of Canadian entities;Providing leadership and further develop best practices in compliance with commodity tax processes as they relate to TransCanada's Canadian entities;Interacting with internal Supply Chain, Accounts Payable, Corporate Accounting, Legal, Treasury and Finance departments to provide commodity tax guidance for all of TransCanada's Canadian business units;Researching tax issues;Corresponding with Federal and Provincial tax authorities as required;Providing support for Canadian external and internal audits;Participating in special projects, including implementation of a new tax provision software program;Other tasks as required.  QualificationsDemonstrated project management skills, with an ability to manage multiple and competing priorities;Team player having the ability to work effectively under tight deadlines;Excellent communication and interpersonal skills combined with the ability to interact effectively with senior management;Attention to detail and excellent organizational skills;Self-starter with a positive attitude and willingness to learn.  Education/Experience Completion of a professional accounting designation (CA, CGA, CMA, CPA) with a minimum of four years of post-qualification experience; Completion of the CICA in-depth GST course is preferred; Strong knowledge of accounting and reporting standards; Working knowledge of SAP background; An equivalent combination of education and related work experience may be considered. Depending on the qualifications of the applicants, the successful candidate may be offered a position at a more appropriate level and/or ladder. Applicants must have legal authorization to work in the country in which the position is based with no restrictions. Applicants who require accommodation at any stage of the application process or if you would like additional information regarding TransCanada's accommodation policies please contact careers@transcanada.com.  All positions require background screening. Some include criminal and/or credit checks in order to comply with regulations. Please apply to this posting by 05/21/2018. To apply, go to jobs.transcanada.com and enter reference code 50672. Only applications submitted through the TransCanada Careers website will be acknowledged. TransCanada is an equal opportunity employer.  Make what you do matter. At TransCanada we dream big, think big and do big things. For over 65 years, we've had the vision and scale to deliver big things that matter to the world. From supplying reliable and efficient energy to millions of North Americans with our pipelines, gas storage and power generation facilities, we believe in making big things possible. TransCanada is looking for people who are willing to think about the future...and think big. We're looking for people who are ready to take on the most significant challenges of their careers and define energy infrastructure in North America. Thank you for choosing TransCanada in your career search.
Title: Senior Commodity Tax Analyst

Responsibilities: Must be comfortable and able to work as the sole QA Analyst on the project team Architect, design, write and execute test cases and test plans to support the quality assurance activities throughout the software development life cycle Coordinate setup of test environments and test data management Manage defect tracking and defect maintenance; lead QA reviews with business and IT stakeholders to assess priority and severity of defects   Requirements: Minimum 5 years of experience as an IT Software Quality Assurance Analyst. Job_Description: Who we areWe have built Curve Dental into an industry-leading provider of beautiful cloud software for the dental industry. With development operations based in Calgary for over 12 years, we recently received private equity investment (Battery Ventures) so that we can accelerate our growth and further dominate the dental software industry.Who we are looking forWe employ developers who are passionate about software development and technically excellent. Our developers work across the full stack of an application and understand that a project is not done until it has been deployed to production for our users. We want developers who can contribute positively to our culture and teach us things we didn't know before. Those same developers are always hungry to learn and improve in any way they can.Our development managers combine all of the above alongside superior leadership and people skills, a talent for project management and taking on a scrum-master role, expert-level technical ability and the desire to promote quality and standards in all areas of building product, and a true desire to build high-performing teams. Let's not forget the love of getting hands well and truly dirty in code too!If you want to be coding all day every day then this is NOT the opportunity for you; please check out our Full Stack Software Developer posting. Otherwise read on, my friend...Things we’re looking for in terms of more specific skill-sets and experience:3+ years of experience leading or managing software developers for a software company building large-scale web applications using open source technologies8+ years of experience building large scale enterprise softwareExperience mentoring and leading software engineers and small teams through strong interpersonal and organisational skillsExperience writing user stories and breaking down high-level requirements into smaller well-defined work tasksExtensive programming experience in a language that demands strong OO skills (C# / Java / C++ / etc.). Note that we don't use all these technologies; these are examples of the types of skills we look for. Experience with PHP is a definite plus, as is experience with REST. Ideally, you’ve been coding since you were old enough to read.Extensive experience working with JavaScript frameworks in a rich web application. Experience with AngularJS and Angular is a definite plus.Code reviews are a part of everyday life in your work (both as a reviewer and reviewee)Advanced knowledge of how applications interact with databases, mainly through ORM technologies and also through stored procedures, triggers, etc.Proficiency in Unix / Linux environmentsEvangelism of automated testing in all its forms in your previous work; you've written way more unit tests than application code.Project management experience (specifically with Agile Scrum teams) with a solid track record of delivering high-quality software within estimated times while handling multiple sizable projects concurrently.Ability to lead constructive and objective estimation sessions with a view to longer term project planningAbility to effectively manage dependencies and remove obstacles to ensure team productivityKeeps stakeholders proactively informed about project status and plansExperience working and collaborating with many different areas of a business such as product management, software architects, business analysts, user experience designers and customer support teams.Experience of recruiting software developers is a bonusHow to ApplySend your resume with the subject line YOUR NAME: Software Development Manager! Remember to make the name substitution, select the level of experience you have and to include the exclamation mark : -)Don't just send us your standard cover letter; simply answer the following 3 questions:What do you know about our business and industry?Why is what we do important to our clients?What is your favourite aspect of our business, and why?This particular role is at Curve Dental's office in Calgary, Alberta, Canada. To find out more about Curve Dental and what it's like to work with us go to www.curvedental.com/jobs.Job Type: Full-timeExperience:leading or managing software developers: 3 yearsbuilding large scale enterprise software: 8 yearsEducation:High school or equivalentLocation:Calgary, ABLanguage:English
Title: Software Development Manager!

Job_Description: Reporting to the Canadian Programs and Systems Manager, the WCB Claims Administrator will primarily be responsible for WCB claim submission and early intervention case management from the time of injury to the successful resumption of regular duties including return to work and modified duty planning across the Canada region.  This position would be ideal for an individual who has recently graduated from a disability management program and is seeking employment experience or an experienced disability manager who is familiar with WCB claims management practices in a multi-province corporate environment.  Duties and Responsibilities: WCB claim submission.WCB Claims case management based upon early intervention strategies with the goal of timely return to work.Liaison with stakeholders (injured worker, treating healthcare practitioner, WCB, QHSSE coordinators and managers) for early injury resolution.Participate or lead return to work planning.Other duties as required within the Programs and Systems team. Qualifications: Skills and Knowledge:  Superior verbal communication and presentation skills.Working knowledge of Microsoft computer software including Word, PowerPoint, ExcelAble to research and gather information independently.Able to manage projects from beginning to end.Able to sustain working relationships and to effectively participate in a collaborative team environment.Thrives in complex organizational structures. Preferred Qualifications and Experience: Secondary education related to Disability Management or Health and Safety.Oil and Gas industry experience. We welcome the wide range of experiences and viewpoints that potential workers bring to our business and our clients, including those based on nationality, gender, culture, educational and professional backgrounds, race, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, disability, and age differences, job classification and religion. Job_Description: Build a meaningful career  At Morneau Shepell, we offer more than career opportunities, we provide career opportunities to make meaningful contributions to people’s lives. The extraordinary expertise of our 4,000-strong workforce is harnessed to support the employees and families of the organizations we serve. Our innovative programs have a lasting impact on the health, financial security and productivity of 20,000 workplaces.  Consultant Health and Benefits  Health & Benefits Solutions  Calgary, AB  Full Time, Permanent  Benefits programs are an important and highly valued part of any employment offering. But understanding how much or what type of benefit coverage is necessary can be difficult. Our client relationship model is consultative and encourages continual communication. By providing you with the resources to support employers in engaging employees in their health, we provide a path to better workforce health and productivity.  Our Consultant works in a team and is responsible for managing, servicing and providing quality benefits consulting services for small to medium sized clients. In addition, they will be responsible for helping to build business with existing clients as well as attracting and supporting new clients through our association partnerships.  Responsibilities include:  Business Development  Identify and manage cross-sell opportunities Develop strategic relationships with key account contacts and introduce Morneau Shepell team members as appropriate Supervise the complete employee benefits cycle: plan design, provider search, implementation, experience monitoring, renewal rating Develop new business with existing clients and assists in obtaining new business with prospective clients focusing on our key association partnerships Understand client needs and identify company or industry products or services that can meet these needs Service  Deliver presentations to clients; conduct client meetings and the occasional employee presentation. Ensure that quality control and service standards are attained with every transaction Negotiate, problem solve and maintain positive relationships with insurers, external advisors and internal underwriting and benefits administration departments Develop and maintain excellent relationships with clients, through regular telephone contact and office visits Understand the client’s perspective and priorities, and work with the client to resolve administrative issues Establish strategies for services that meet client needs  Administration  Provide and oversee direct day-to-day support for clients by phone, e-mail, letters, formal reports, and face-to-face meetings Lead and manage multiple client assignments and projects Manage special projects as required Peer review the work of analysts Knowledge  Maintain current knowledge of industry trends including insurer news, products, legislation, and cost trends as well as current knowledge of our company's products and services  Qualifications:  Experience  Five years of experience in group benefits. Preference will be given to those from the group insurance industry, a consulting firm or brokerage or in an HR department. Education  Post-secondary education GBA (CEBS) designation, or working towards it. Life Insurance license (this will be a requirement within 3 months of onboarding) Skills  Strong presentation skills and comfort speaking in front of large groups Understanding of consultative selling and the ability to manage the sales cycle effectively and autonomously Expert negotiation, technical and analytical skills Can effectively communicate complex concepts in plain written and spoken language Professional Traits  Exceptional customer focus; some would say you’re the best Extremely organized self-starter, flexible, highly independent Ability to manage multiple deadlines simultaneously Proven collaborative team member with the ability to motivate and inspire team members  Morneau Shepell Morneau Shepell is in the business of helping organizations help their people because we believe that engaged people are the driving force for society. Every day, the expertise of our almost 4,000 employees is recognized as essential to the financial security, health, and productivity of our clients and their people. We're always looking for talented professionals and strategic leaders who will listen and work together with colleagues and clients to form long-term relationships and to deliver integrative solutions that fit. As we continue to grow, we're presently engaging with exceptional candidates interested in a range of exciting career opportunities. At www.morneaushepell.com you can explore our careers page to learn more about the solutions we deliver and the great people who help us do it. Follow us on LinkedIn and Twitter (Morneau_Shepell, Shepell). We are thankful for your interest, but unfortunately, we can only personally connect with those selected for an interview.  INDCAD LI-PH1  Job Grade: MS4   Fulfilling work that matters  Morneau Shepell is in the business of helping organizations help their people and in the process, we strive to elevate ours.  We're always looking for talented professionals and strategic leaders looking to make a difference in the lives of the people we serve.  We appreciate the interest of every applicant; however, we contact only those selected for an interview.  Find your fit with us. Follow us on LinkedIn, Youtube and Twitter.
Title: Consultant

Job_Description: *PLEASE NOTE: PREFERENCE WILL BE GIVEN TO CANDIDATES WHO APPLY THROUGH CANFOR.COM/CAREERSCanfor TechnologyAt Canfor, our Information Technology professionals play an important role in the daily functioning of our operations. Consistently pushing the boundaries when it comes to innovation within the forestry and pulp and paper industries, our IT professionals support Canfor in achieving exceptional results.With a high caliber Information Technology leadership team, a clear vision, and significant growth and training opportunities, a career in IT at Canfor allows individuals to strengthen their competencies and grow within their respective roles. Working as an equal partner with our operations to achieve organizational objectives, you will be at the forefront of innovation.Who We Are: Canfor is one of the world’s largest and most respected integrated forest products companies. For more than 75 years, we have been delivering top-quality lumber, pulp and paper products to our valued customers worldwide. With operations in Western Canada and the Southern United States, and sales offices around the world, you can find Canfor products in every corner of the globe. We are leaders in sustainable forest management and in converting wood residuals into green energy.As we continue to grow our company and our markets, find out how you can grow your career with us.The OpportunityThe Data Analyst, Business Intelligence supports Canfor’s objectives by turning data into meaningful information that can be used to make sound business decisions. The Data Analyst will provide expertise in business intelligence to prepare and deliver data and information to internal customers and stakeholders through reports, dashboards and scorecards. It is essential that the Data Analyst build an understanding of the business at a level of detail that enables them to work with the business to deliver valuable information.Please Note:  This is a relocation opportunity in Vancouver, British Columbia. The successful applicant may be provided with relocation assistance.Main ResponsibilitiesRequirements Gathering:Engage with various business units to capture information needs, compare those needs with existing tools and identify gapsParticipate in business requirements workshopsWrite business requirements documents as required to elaborate needs, gain acceptanceDesign & Development:Architect tables and dataDesign dashboards, reports, drill-down analytics and data visualizationsDesign, configure and administer the metadata layerCreate system technical requirements for documentation and knowledge managementActively challenge and find solutions to optimize system performanceTesting, Validation, Release Management:Develop and implement testing strategiesValidate data accuracyDeploy and validate changes in production environmentTraining & Change Management:Support the development of training, documentation, and help desk capabilitiesRequired SkillsBachelor's degree in computer science, information systems, business management or specialized training/certificationExperience working with relational databases (Microsoft SQL Server, Oracle Database, MySQL, etc)Applied knowledge of SQL (T-SQL, PL/SQL, ANSI-SQL, etc)Applied understanding of data modelling and warehousing conceptsWorking knowledge of business intelligence tools such as Oracle Business IntelligenceWorking knowledge of ETL tools such as Oracle Data Integrator or InformaticaExperience mediating and clarifying sometimes ambiguous or conflicting end user requirementsEagerness to learn new concepts and technologies and keep-up-to-date with existing onesWillingness to go above and beyond to understand both the business and technical aspects of a problemHiring for this position is ongoing and will be filled as required. To be considered for this position, please apply today.In order to be eligible for this position, you must be legally entitled to work in Canada for our Company.There has never been a better time to join the Canfor Information Technology team and become a part of the modern forest industry. We have a wide range of rewarding and innovative careers in some of the best communities in North America, with plenty of room for advancement. We offer competitive compensation and benefits packages, and are committed to the professional development of our employees.*PLEASE NOTE: PREFERENCE WILL BE GIVEN TO CANDIDATES WHO APPLY THROUGH CANFOR.COM/CAREERSFollow us on LinkedIn , Twitter , and Facebook for Canfor news, career opportunities, and upcoming events!Vancouver, BCThe city of Vancouver is both a natural beauty and a progressive urban centre, a rare place on earth that is idyllic and electric all at once. With one of Canada’s mildest climates, Vancouver is ideally suited for those devoted to outdoor pursuits, health and wellness. Along with its endless supply of fresh air and clean water, Vancouver also boasts countless choices for culturally diverse, world-class cuisine and an inventory of arts and entertainment events. For more information, visit http://canfor.com/our-company/our-communities/vancouverJob Type: Full-timeEducation:High school or equivalent

Job_Description: Job Description: Calgary Co-op is looking for an individual who can work in a fast pace environment and contribute to the development, maintenance, and modification of our Marketing and Operations application programs as they relate to the corporation. This includes the planning, coordinating and managing of small to medium Business IT projects. Working closely with the users of the system, you will analyze the business requirements and assist with improving business processes while developing and implementing effective and efficient solutions.  Minimum Qualifications:  College Diploma or undergraduate degree with  Computer Science, Information Systems, Business Administration or related field experience within a retail environment  Four(4) years relevant work experience with a POS  System and/or Price Management Systems preferably ISS, Store Point and Retalix HQPM2  Two(2) years experience in Business Analysis One(1) years experience managing project-based work  structures or Project Management Certification and 300 hours of project work  Desirable Qualifications:  Relational database management systems and SQL  Querying Skills  ITIL Foundations Experience with Kronos Workforce Time Keeper and  Forecast Manager  Experience with FLUX Java Scheduling Tool Technical knowledge of procedural and/or  object-oriented programming languages i.e. Perl, Java, scripting Benefits and Perks Calgary Co-op offers excellent opportunities for increasing levels of responsibility, personal growth and challenge supported by sound leadership and direction. We offer competitive wages and benefits packages which includes an excellent pension plan, as well as a full range of training programs and other development resources. If you possess the necessary skills and abilities, and you are interested in a career with Calgary Co-op, please apply in confidence stating qualifications.
