Job_Description: Service Marketing Coordinator [#1737] - In this position, you will support the Western Region Sales or Service Marketing Manager on the implementation of Western Canada marketing plan development and execution.As a Service Marketing Coordinator, you will provide insight on innovative marketing opportunities, act as point person for Dealer events and sponsorships supported by the Region and liaison between advertising agency and Dealer Marketing Boards/Regional Marketing Advisory Boards.Compensation and Work Schedule- Term: Contract position- Start date: Immediate- Duration: 12 months, renewable- Work Schedule: 40 Hrs/wk, 8:00am–4:30pm- OT Hours/Week: N/A- Compensation: $31-36/hr- Travel: none- Work location/environment: Calgary, AB; office environmentRequired Skills and Experience- Post secondary major in Marketing is preferred, however all candidates holding a Bachelor's degree will be considered- 2-4 years of related experience- Expert in Excel- will need to create and run reports- Business Analyst ability- be able to analyze reports- Has SAP experienceResponsibilities- Assist with the set up and hosting of meetings with Marketing Boards as well as internal staff- Develop communiques for Dealers informing them of marketing initiatives and Go to Market strategy for the upcoming month in addition to the results of the past month- Utilizing intranet to communicate marketing material– Global Connect authoring- Processing monthly bills and updating forecasts- Schedule month end conference calls with Dealers in the Region- Complete a monthly Contact Analysis for Regional Director and Regional Managers- Update Dealer Dashboard and Action Plans monthly- Assist in the administration of the Dealer Co-Op Program- Complete Website Audits- Sales and Service as required- Complete Customer Satisfaction Ranking Report and Sales Ranking Report monthly- Administer the GM Canada Courtesy Car and Pool Vehicle Program within the Region- Prepare adhoc Distribution reports as required- Attend, plan and organize Regional Professional Development Days- Point person for Regional and National Sales and Service contest development and reporting- Completes adhoc Certified Service or Marketing projects as required- Maintains technical expertise and procedural knowledge- Keeps supervision advised of work in progress- Frequent contact with others outside the work group- Attends meetings/disseminates information and makes suggestions for future development as requiredRequired Conditions - Candidates must complete a background check and be eligible to work in CanadaClient Summary - Our client is a global provider of transportation products and services, from their assembly lines to customers' driveways. This position is an exciting opportunity to join one of the company's Regional Training Centers.Job Type: Contract
Title: Service Marketing Coordinator

Job_Description: We are currently looking for a Senior Technical Support Analyst to ensure proper computer operation in order for end users to accomplish business tasks in multiple domain environments. This includes receiving, prioritizing, documenting and actively resolving end user help requests within established service level agreements (SLAs). Problem resolution may involve the use of diagnostic and help request tracking tools, as well as require that the individual give in-person, hands-on help at the client device level.  Responsibilities  Strategy & Planning  Evaluate documented resolutions and analyze trends for ways to prevent future problems.  Alert management to emerging trends in incidents.  Roll-outs and operation system on-boarding projects.  Acquisition & Deployment  Implement software releases and roll-outs according to Change Management best practices.  Manage hardware life cycle of computers, printers and devices on the network.  Execute project plans to on-board approved operation systems and devices.  Operational Management  Fulfill incoming service requests from end users via telephone, client self-service portal, and email in an efficient and courteous manner.  Document all pertinent end user identification information, including name, department, contact information, and nature of problem or issue.  Build rapport and elicit problem details from internal and external clients.  Escalate problems (when required) to the Service Desk Team Lead.  Prioritize client service request and incidents. Escalate when required to the appropriate resources.  Coordinate internal/external resources to deliver solution.  Record, track, and document the service desk request and problem-solving process, including all successful and unsuccessful decisions made, and actions taken, through to final resolution.  Apply diagnostic utilities to aid in troubleshooting.  Access software updates, drivers, knowledge bases, and frequently asked question resources to aid in problem resolution.  Identify and learn appropriate software and hardware used and supported by the organization.  Perform hands-on fixes at the workstation level, including installing and upgrading software, installing hardware, implementing file backups, and configuring systems and applications.  Ensure virus definitions and security patches are up-to-date on all computers.  Performing preventative maintenance as required, including checking and cleaning of workstations, printers, and peripherals.  Test fixes to ensure problem has been adequately resolved.  Perform post-resolution follow-ups to service requests.  Develop knowledge base articles to assist with problem resolutions.  Reinforce service level agreements (SLAs) to manage end-user expectations.  Qualifications  Post-secondary education in Computer Science or related field. Continued Information Technology training through formal courses and personally initiated improvement is required.  Minimum 5 years of extensive working experience in Microsoft Active Directory and IP network administration.  Proven experience in customer service, supporting multi-platform systems and related applications.  ITIL V3 certified  Experience with an enterprise Incident Management System.  Experience with Microsoft System Centre Configuration Manager (SCCM) or similar enterprise software deployment tools.  Experience with Microsoft System Centre Operations Manager (SCOM) or similar enterprise performance monitoring and reporting tools.  Experience with eVault Cloud backup Services, or a similar server backup software.  Knowledge of advanced computer hardware, including desktops, laptops, printers, switches and wireless devices.  Extensive experience with desktop and server operating systems, including Windows and Macs.  Extensive application support experience with MS Office Suite, Google Apps.  Experience working in an ITIL-driven environment, and working knowledge of ITIL principles and processes.  Exceptional written and oral communication skills.  Exceptional interpersonal skills, with a focus on rapport-building, listening and questioning skills.  Strong documentation skills.  Fluent English language skills – French language skills are an asset.  Skills  Achieves Results  Ability to Multi-task  Detail Oriented  Meets Deadlines and Commitments  Organizational Skills  Collaborates with Others, Works Effectively with Others  Communicates Effectively, Clear and Concise (oral and written communication)  Demonstrates Functional Expertise  Microsoft Office Applications  Web/Software Applications  Additional Qualifications  Education  Community College, Computer Science  This is a permanent position in Calgary, AB with an annual salary of $66,000.00 – $68,000.00 plus bonus and benefits
Title: Senior Technical Support Analyst

Job_Description: Summary: Reporting to the Associate Director of North American Land and GIS Content Operations, the Principal Analyst II is responsible for the overall quality and integrity of Canadian Land content in the internal IHS database(s) and software. As the Subject Matter Expert (SME) in Land data, you will be responsible for the land data, quality standards and database management. The Analyst will represent their expertise with Developers, DBA’s, Operational staff, Product managers, and Client-Support teams.  The Principal Analyst II will work with their peers in developing and maintaining quality standards and processes optimization strategies while advising on the complexities of land data. This new colleague will have a keen interest and proven track record for resolving land data issues, processing complex data queries, driving data improvement opportunities, and problem resolution.  General Job Duties: Use of subject matter expertise to implement, follow and enforce measures and processes defined by the data Governance group and to support commercial teams and/or customers. Use independent judgment to proactively problem solve information transformation issues. Contribute to the development of and improving the information processing and management systems. Responsible for the ultimate success and release of daily and weekly land data updates. Perform quality control analysis on Relational and Spatial databases and processes, and provide data capture quality direction on data correctness, currency, consistency and completeness. Ensure outputs are aligned with customer expectations and report/resolve any problems with stakeholders. Responsible for compiling ideas or improvements for process optimization and ensure resolutions of any technical problems or roadblocks Respond to internal customer concerns and requests, including data analysis and extraction requests from internal colleagues. Perform data mining, complex querying, analysis, and compilation for internal and external customers. Explains complex, difficult and/or sensitive information; works to build consensus Works independently, receives minimal guidance Acts as a resource for colleagues with less experience  Specific Job Duties: Work directly with developers and cross-functional colleagues to maintain and support current systems, primarily from a data perspective. Test and approve changes to current and newly created systems. Define, implement and enforce defined quality control measures. Perform or oversee land data processing of Crown and Freehold data Perform or oversee maintenance of all Canadian land tables required to effectively provide current data delivery to all internal & customer data delivery products. Assist IHS & partner software development teams with testing and subject matter expertise as required. Assist Land Operations in resolving process failures and recovery – especially those which may compromise data deliveries and require immediate attention. Assist Land Customer Advisors in researching and responding to client enquiries requiring research and in-depth data knowledge  Required Education: University degree (or equivalent working experience) in Business, Petroleum Land Management or other oil & gas related designation, or Oil & Gas related certification, preferably in Petroleum Land or Land Administration.  Required Experience: 8+ years of Oil & Gas industry information experience with a strong focus in Relational database specifications and analysis Experience with relational databases and querying required (comparing databases, analyzing and resolving differences).  Experience with the following are strongly preferred: Database querying and interaction with content Interacting with data-entry GUI’s Working in an Agile development methodology understanding or experience as the product owner  Experience with the following an asset: Spatial experience is an asset Business Analysts experience  Other skills: Solid knowledge of commonly-used concepts, practices, and procedures within Canadian land operations Must be observant, organized, investigative, results-oriented with strong attention to detail Must be able to work with team members and stakeholders at all levels in a positive, service-oriented and team-affirming manner Understands daily operational requirements Excellent Communication and Writing skills – able to write consistent, accurate documentation and contribute effectively in Team / stakeholder meetings, and when troubleshooting  Physical Requirements: May be required to monitor processes during evenings or weekends (from home). May need to be available for phone or email consultation during non-business hours. It is the policy of IHS Markit to provide equal employment opportunity (EEO) to all persons regardless of age, color, national origin, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, race, religion, creed, gender, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, genetic information, marital status, status with regard to public assistance, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law. In addition, IHS Markit will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities. We maintain a drug-free workplace. For candidates in the US, we are a participant in E-Verify (see link below).  EEO is the Law EEO is the Law Supplement Right to Work Pay Transparency Policy E-Verify  Current Colleagues If you are currently a colleague with IHS Markit please apply internally via Workday.
Title: Explore the possibilities

This will include completing status reports, briefing notes, and presentations in support of findings.  The new system will consist of key information management, business intelligence and advanced analytics capabilities. Job_Description: Rail EIT - (148764) Description  About Us At HDR, we specialize in engineering, architecture, environmental and construction services. While we are most well-known for adding beauty and structure to communities through high-performance buildings and smart infrastructure, we provide much more than that. We create an unshakable foundation for progress because our multidisciplinary teams also include scientists, economists, builders, analysts and artists. That’s why we believe diversity is our greatest strength. HDR is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and an affirmative action employer.  Watch our 'About Us' video  We believe that the way we work can add meaning and value to the world. That ideas inspire positive change. That coloring outside the lines can illuminate fresh perspectives. And that small details yield important realizations. Above all, we believe that collaboration is the best way forward. #LI-MP2  Overview / Responsibilities: HDR is actively seeking a creative, highly talented and motivated Engineer-In-Training for the Calgary, Alberta Office. Key Responsibilities: Reporting to the Canada Rail Lead, provide engineering, technical, and management support to projects Assist with the preparation of proposals, design packages, and tender documentation Embrace project management principles and successfully manage multiple projects and clients Oversee preparation of detailed design drawings for rail and civil projects that meets client and HDR quality standards Prepare and review computer 3D and 2D models, and resultant plans, cross sections, quantities and other deliverables Provide quality control on design and construction projects Be able to supervise a project team, ensuring the quality of work and compliance with the regulations, laws and standards; Provide technical support during the construction of structures and coordinate the work supervision; Participate in the planning stages, design and construction of the project; Prepare reports on the execution of the work and follow the schedule; Participate in the activities of cost estimates and recommend payments; Participate in the preparation of technical specifications and bidding documents and assist in the analysis of bids; Ensuring compliance with laws and regulations in health and safety on construction sites; Perform detailed technical analysis, interpret data, make summaries and draft reports; Visit construction sites to ensure the quality of the work and to carry out inspections.  Qualifications  Required Qualifications An attitude and commitment to being an active participant of our employee-owned culture is a must A diploma in Civil Engineering Technology or Degree in Civil Engineering Eligibility to obtain P.Eng. license an asset Minimum 3 years of transportation/rail & civil experience Experience coordinating projects Knowledge of project scheduling and cost control Demonstrates excellent communication skills and willingness to get involved in planning, design, and construction as projects dictate Team player who is willing and eager to lead multi-disciplinary projects and proposals to grow the business Demonstrates analytical, technical and problem-solving skills and abilities Works independently with limited guidance Experience with project financial reporting systems, accounting principles, spreadsheets, report writing and basic knowledge of Occupational, Health and Safety legislation Some skill in utilizing Civil 3D and CADD Willingness for periodic travel and site visits Experience with construction management and field inspections Firm understanding of Canadian class 1 railway, and AREMA standards Preferred Qualifications Railroad design/engineering Why HDR At HDR, we know work isn’t only about who you work for; it’s also about what you do and how you do it. Led by the strength of our values and a culture shaped by employee ownership, we network with each other, build on each other’s contributions, and collaborate together to make great things possible. When you join HDR, we give you license to do the same. We help you take charge of your career, giving you multiple growth opportunities along the way. Primary Location : Canada-Alberta-Calgary Industry : Freight Rail Schedule : Full-time Employee Status : Temporary BusinessClass: Freight Railroads Job Posting : Mar 21, 2018
Title: Rail EIT

Job_Description: The successful candidate must have a high level of technical, project management and leadership expertise. Knowledge of ecological land classification, wetland classification, soil classification and statistics, data management and GIS applications to ecological studies. Must have excellent communication skills, organization skills, strong analytical and problem solving skills.  Reports to: Director, Technical Services  Based at: Calgary, AB  This position is primarily office based in a consultancy environment. The senior ecologist is expected to lead or direct vegetation and wetland surveys and apply current scientific and regulatory knowledge to efficiently execute analysis and reporting. In consultation with others, the senior ecologist will provide recommendations for mitigation and monitoring, restoration, or reclamation for resource based industries including mining, oil and gas, midstream or oil sands in support of regulatory approval applications. The duties include the following responsibilities:  providing senior technical support and guidance to team members; full sign-off authority on vegetation and wetland project deliverables; identifying in-house and third-party resources needed and assigning individual responsibilities; executing all aspects of the project in accordance with the contract and ensuring quality of processes and deliverables; provide input and advice on identifying and acting on opportunities to optimize the delivery of services to clients; proposal preparation including assessing project requirements and client needs, scope definition and risk assessment of the project, and development of an appropriate execution plan; developing and maintaining direct contact with clients and stakeholders; working with senior business development staff to support growth and new business; and making presentations to industry associations and professional associations that promotes MEMS project work and capabilities, and other duties as required. MEMS is a dynamic environmental consulting company offering outstanding opportunities and long-term career advancement. Currently MEMS’ employs over 100 employees in various disciplines including, hydrogeologists, engineers, soil scientists, foresters, vegetation ecologists, auditors, biologists, air quality experts, regulatory analysts and reclamation specialists.  MEMS’ offers an excellent benefits program, extra time banking and a performance bonus program. Please send your resume with a covering letter/email referencing the position number and title to the attention of Human Resources at recruitment@mems.ca. We thank all applicants for their interest however only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.
Title: Senior Vegetation and Wetlands Ecologist #11-VE-1803-C– Full...

We are looking for qualified, motivated individuals to join our teams in the Calgary and Vancouver locations. In this role you will have the opportunity to work with a very talented group of Tax professionals on a variety of interesting and challenging international and Canadian tax issues.  As a Senior Analyst you will: Participate in cross-border engagements including structuring corporate investment, developing tax strategies and compliance Understand, analyze and research Canadian and international tax transactions Develop your technical skills and knowledge of our clients' business Work as part of a team to develop recommendations and provide solutions to clients Lead specific projects of moderate size and complexity Work closely with other service lines and Deloitte foreign offices to deliver cross-border solutions to our clients  External Posting Qualifications  Completed undergraduate degree with outstanding academic credentials A completed masters degree in Tax, an accounting designation (Chartered Professional Accountants (CPA) designation) or LLB 2-4 years of relevant work experience, including some experience in international tax Enrolled or willingness to enroll in the CICA In-depth Tax program Strong commitment to professional client service excellence Excellent interpersonal relations and demonstrated ability to work with others effectively in teams Superior verbal and written communication skills Ability to develop and present new ideas and conceptualize new approaches and solutions Proven analytical skills and systematic problem solving Canadian travel required, occasional international travel. Job_Description: Regular-Full time  W E= unlimited potential  We didn’t get to be a leader in energy delivery or ranked on the Global 100 Most Sustainable Corporations index on our own. We did it in partnership with outstanding individuals who work together as a team to fuel people’s quality of life. Individuals like you. And now we’re looking for just such an individual to join our team.  To learn more about us, visit www.enbridge.com .  This requisition will remain open until filled; however, consideration will be given to applicants in order of applicat ion date.   Primary Focus  The primary responsibility of the Supervisor Cybersecurity Governance is to supervise a team of cybersecurity analysts/advisors with responsibility for the oversight, administration and maintenance of Enbridge’s Cybersecurity Control Framework. Ensuring the company can meet or exceed its regulatory, best practice and internal control objectives. Through the analysis of the data, the Supervisor Cybersecurity Governance is also responsible for reporting on the effectiveness of Enbridge’s cybersecurity controls and defining the criteria supporting risk based cybersecurity investments.  Responsibilities Assumes full leadership responsibility for a team of Analysts/Advisors. Includes responsibility for recruitment and hiring of qualified personnel, team productivity, performance assessment management, employee career development and maintaining employee engagement in a fast paced, high stress work environment. Ensure staffing, training, process, procedures and tools are in place to ensure success of departmental objectives. Provide oversight and actively participate in developing cybersecurity governance framework materials (policies, controls, standards) to drive consistent cybersecurity risk treatment across the enterprise Facilitate cybersecurity governance conversations with cybersecurity and business stakeholders to help ensure positive and deliberate outcomes. Deliver and report cybersecurity metrics that provide stakeholders with situational awareness and provide quality information for risk-based decision making. Collaborate with internal and external stakeholders to identify all related cybersecurity effectiveness targets and metrics. Evaluate cybersecurity control gaps and work with applicable stakeholders to recommend solutions Promote the desired outcome of controls described in the Enbridge Cybersecurity Compliance Framework Provide assistance to stakeholders in identifying and resolving cybersecurity control gaps and deficiencies Monitor the remediation status of cybersecurity control gaps and deficiencies Work closely with Security teams and business units to review and respond to cybersecurity questionnaires and due diligence requests. Provide oversight for the maintenance of Enbridge’s cybersecurity policies, standards, controls and procedures Provide oversight for the maintenance of the cybersecurity process for cybersecurity policy development and risk acceptance requests  Qualifications  Required: University degree or technical diploma in an IT related field 10+ years of experience in cybersecurity risk and compliance Demonstrated strength in effective leadership, team building, conflict resolution, communication and interpersonal skills. Proven ability to effectively manage resources in a faced paced and dynamic environment. Knowledge of ISO 27001 and 27002 is strongly desired Knowledge of NIST 800-53 and other frameworks Strong knowledge of cybersecurity control frameworks and governance procedures Strong business and technical background Excellent organizational skills Excellent written and verbal communication skills, including the ability to communicate complex technical matters in easy to understand non-technical ways Ability to identify priorities and ensure work is completed within stipulated timeframes Ability to work independently or as part of a team In-depth understanding of cybersecurity governance trends and risks  Preferred: Cybersecurity-related certifications are an asset: CISSP, CRISC, CISM, etc Experience in creating risk reporting, analysis and dashboards  We accept applications submitted via our online recruiting system only ( https://careers.enbridge.com ).  Enbridge is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer and is committed to provide employment opportunities to all individuals, without regard to race, religion, age, sex, color, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, or disability. Accommodation for applicants with disabilities is available on request during the recruitment process. Applicants with disabilities can request accessible formats or communication supports by contacting careers@enbridge.com .  We appreciate your interest in working with us; however, only those applicants selected for interviews will be contacted.  Final candidates for this position may be required to undergo a security screening, including a criminal records check.
Title: Supervisor, Cyber Security Governance

Job_Description: The Network Analyst is a key technical resource responsible for installing, configuring, maintaining and monitoring all network hardware, software and communication links, while ensuring minimal network downtime.  The Network Analyst will also work with the Architecture team to assist with implementation of network solutions and development of the associated processes and documentation. This person is a member of a nation-wide team of technical support staff focused on ongoing support and new deployments of KPMG’s IT infrastructure.  In this role, you will troubleshoot and resolve network-related issues, analyze and identify performance bottlenecks, recommend optimization opportunities, and support internal users and applications used in our environment while working closely with other IT staff.  This is a 1 year contract role.  What you will do Support and manage KPMG’s local and wide area network infrastructure, with a focus on proactive improvement of network health – solving issues before they become problems Support, administration and configuration of corporate firewalls, including Palo Alto and Cisco platforms Support, administration and configuration of corporate load balancers Support, administration and configuration, of network monitoring and analysis tools including Cisco NAM/AVC, Cisco Prime Infrastructure, NetQOS Reporter Analyzer, NetVoyant, Bluecoat Reporter and others Apply the suite of network management tools to new or evolving services, such as voice and video, Skype for Business and video conferencing to create reports for analysis, identifying trends and make recommendations Work closely with Operations, Support and Architecture team members to implement proactive approaches to monitoring and reporting on network services that maximize uptime, reliability and visibility Document operational processes and troubleshooting guides for Network Support and Operations staff Monitor and measure performance with regards to Service Level Agreements and KPI’s Monitor and resolve incident and problem tickets as they relate to network issues Manage multiple concurrent projects and ensure implementation of network services and monitoring solutions to meet ITS and business requirements Perform application updates, security patches and configuration changes on network hardware, services and management tools Work with Cisco and other vendors to resolve network issues in the environment Support and train Network Support and Operations resources Provide rotational on-call support outside of regular business hours At times, business needs arise and employees are required and agree to work beyond their normal work day or work week to fulfill the accountabilities required for their job. Likewise, people need extra time to devote to personal matters, and our approach to flexibility provides for this.  What you bring to the role College Diploma or University Degree in the field of computer science and/or 5 years equivalent work experience Minimum 3 years of experience supporting routing and switching in a complex Cisco based network environment that includes voice, video and data. Experience with Skype for Business is preferred Minimum of 1 year of experience of Palo Alto Firewall administration Minimum of 1 year of experience of Load Balancer administration, Netscaler SDX/MPX preferred Cisco CCNA or CCNP would be an asset Working knowledge of QoS concepts and configuration Extensive experience in using network monitoring & management tools, including Cisco Prime Infrastructure, NAM and AVC, for troubleshooting and proactive analysis Ability to review network flows and metrics proactively to determine potential trouble spots in the network before they lead to business impact Working knowledge of TCP/IP and network routing protocols Understanding of Netflow and SNMP protocols Strong interpersonal and oral communication skills Highly self-motivated and directed and keen attention to detail Proven analytical and problem-solving abilities Ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks in a high-pressure environment. Strong customer service orientation Why Choose KPMG? Making the right career choice is important, finding the right company is essential. Watch this video to see the type of people that thrive at KPMG. #LI-CD1
Title: Network Analyst (Contract)

Job_Description: About Solium  Solium Capital Inc. is fulfilling a vision of becoming the global leader in equity-based (stock) incentive and share purchase savings plan management. We specialize in the delivery of complete web-based services for the full lifecycle of equity-based incentive and savings plans. Through our technically advanced Solium Shareworks™ platform, Solium is setting the Industry's service standard for the administration and execution of all types of equity-based incentives and savings plans.  Why work at Solium  Solium is a fast-growing company where every team member is vital to success. If you have an unfailing commitment to excellence, alignment with customer interests and strong problem-solving skills, Solium welcomes your contribution to our enthusiastic team.  With offices in Canada, the United States, the United Kingdom, France, Germany, Spain, Australia and Hong Kong we strive every day to work locally while thinking globally, in order to achieve service excellence.  Our culture  Solium takes cultural characteristics from the industries we draw upon. We develop and maintain a sophisticated set of enterprise software products, so we embody the casual style but relentless focus that is often associated with the tech industry. But we are also a client service organization, offering support to both corporate clients and their employees. We also employ a wealth of “numbers” people, those with backgrounds in math, finance and economics. And because we are a global organization, you’ll routinely hear English, French, Spanish, Dutch, German, Cantonese and other languages spoken in our offices. Solium offices are all about diversity. What unites us is a commitment to quality. We are all passionate people who bring our best in support of a singular focus, to be the global leader in our industry.  We think in terms of what-ifs. And we answer with:  Innovation – We create solutions and services that make the complex manageable Flexibility – We offer the choices that provide compliance and convenience Service – We demonstrate problem-solving, reliability and accuracy in everything we do for our customers We reward our people with a competitive compensation and benefits package and a fun, flexible work environment.  Recent Awards:  Top 25 Canadian Software Companies – 2011, 2015, 2016, 2017 Forbes Best Software Companies To Work For - 2015 20 Most Promising Corporate Finance Tech Solution Providers – 2016 Software 500: Largest Software & Services Providers - 2015 Canada’s 500 Fastest Growing Companies – 2014, 2015 Alberta Venture – Venture 250 – 2015 Deloitte’s Technology Fast 50™ - 2006 to 2010, 2012, 2014 Canada's 10 Most Admired Corporate Cultures – 2012 Branham’s Top 5 Canadian Software-as-a-Service Companies Top 20 Movers & Shakers – 2011 We currently have a full-time, permanent opportunity for an:  Information Security Analyst  Located in the Eau Claire neighbourhood of downtown Calgary, AB and reporting to the Enterprise Security Manager you will work collaboratively with a variety of internal and external stakeholders, with the goal of providing expertise and guidance specific to information security across the organization.  Responsibilities  Plan, implement and upgrade security measures and controls Protect digital files and information systems against unauthorized access, modification or destruction Maintain data and monitor security access Conduct internal and external security audits Manage network, intrusion detection and prevention systems Analyze security breaches to determine their root cause Recommend and install appropriate tools and countermeasures Define, implement and maintain corporate security policies Security awareness training Coordinate security plans with outside vendors Qualifications  Post-secondary education in Computer Science, Information Systems or Information Technology would be preferred, but is not mandatory Proven success with, or exposure to any/all of the following a definite asset:  o Penetration testing of applications and infrastructure – a good way to find vulnerabilities before attackers do o Social engineering – given that humans are the weakest link in the security chain, an analyst’s expertise can help with awareness training o Vulnerability and risk assessment – important components of risk management o Security assessments of network infrastructure, hosts and applications – another element of risk management o Forensics – investigation and analysis of how and why a breach or other compromise occurred o Troubleshooting – the skill to recognize the cause of a problem o DLP, AV and anti-malware – an understanding of the tools used to protect the organization o TCP/IP, computer networking, routing and switching – an understanding of the fundamentals: the language, protocol and functioning of the internet o ISO27001 assessment – specificationsfor a framework of policies and procedures that include all legal, physical and technical controls involved in an organization’s risk management o Java, Javascript or other programming languages – you can’t analyze what you don’t understand o Cloud computing – the risks and benefits of using a vendor’s remote servers to store, manage and process an organization’s data o Apple, Windows, and Linux operating systems, on which most of the business world runs Exceptional communication skills in English, including report writing and other types of written and oral communication The ability to work well independently or with a team Available to travel without restriction, both within and outside North America Proven success with meeting deadlines and budgets for both every-day and project-based initiatives Demonstrated proficiency with technology and technical concepts, including but not limited to the Microsoft office suite, including Intermediate level Excel Effectively manages themselves during times of stress and acts as a leader by setting an example for others Strong analytical, attention-to-detail, and problem solving skills Comfortable in a fast-paced and evolving environment which includes ongoing learning and training opportunities While we thank all applicants for their interest in a career with Solium, please note that only those individuals selected for an interview will be contacted.
Title: Information Security Analyst

Job_Description: Parkland is unique. We fuel communities by safely delivering high-quality petroleum products to motorists, businesses, consumers and wholesale customers across North America. Through unrivaled dependability and service, we connect communities to the products they need to heat their homes, fuel their industries and drive their economies.  Parkland is strong. We are one of North America’s fastest growing and largest independent distributors and marketers of fuels and lubricants. Our family includes Bluewave Energy, Columbia Fuels, Elbow River Marketing, Island Petroleum, Fas Gas Plus, Farstad Oil, Les Pétroles Parkland, Pioneer Energy, Sparlings, Superpumper Inc., Ultramar, and most recently Parkland Refining (B.C.) Ltd.  Parkland is growing. Our organization is powered by effective leadership, progressive strategies and industry-leading best practices — but more importantly, it is driven by talented, customer-focused people who value integrity, innovation and quality. We are looking for good-natured, hard-working candidates who want to build a rewarding career in a dynamic and collaborative work environment. We are a family and our family continues to grow.  Position summary:  The incumbent is responsible for managing the company’s entire SCCM environment (corporate level and service stations). The scope of his responsibilities includes imaging Windows and a range of tasks such as software deployment, security updates and producing SCCM reports. He must also ensure that all SCCM services are functional, plan and manage architecture expansion and work around the complex constraints of PCI and/or SOX compliance as required.  As a technical point of contact in his team, he is also responsible for providing assistance and support to other analysts in his group when issues go beyond their skillset, and for providing training from time to time. He must also occasionally act as a 3rd-level support contact as he is the most experienced technical resource in his team.  He must be able to take on the role of project manager as required and provide a turnkey service. He must respect and apply company standards and industry best practices. He must also have extensive knowledge of networking principles and networking topology.  Key Responsibilities: Take full responsibility for the company’s SCCM environment and manage the associated servers;Provide 3rd-level assistance to other analysts and users on all technical aspects (software, materials, deployment strategy, etc.);Analyze, draft and plan large-scale projects assigned to the team;Participate in analyses, plan, coordinate and execute migrations of systems and/or platforms when upgrading to a new operating system (64-bit Windows, for example) or installing Microsoft Office;Understand, change, draft and develop complex Powershell or VBScript scripts, recognize which situations call for scripting (appropriate solution or requirement), analyze and validate scripts submitted for approval;Show creativity in coming up with ingenious and unconventional solutions to complex or unsolvable problems;Share knowledge with members of his team and colleagues and ensure that information is made available to them;Communicate with various IT and business unit teams on support actions and coordinate the support process;Maintain the company IT infrastructure’s standardization and integrity by analyzing upgrades and corrective measures required by manufacturers of software and materials;Solve issues, configure and upgrade company workstations, laptops, printers and peripherals;Analyze and solve technical issues rapidly and effectively;Provide support required by the specificity of certain applications and the deployment of new systems configurations;Manage the certification of new software and materials;  o Evaluate the technical makeup of replacement models  o Evaluate the functionalities and compatibility of new software and provide recommendations  o Contribute to drafting corporate standards and provide recommendations to management Meet or exceed company performance standards.  Qualifications & Skills: College diploma (CEGEP/DEC) or equivalent experience;At least 5 years of experience as an SCCM system administrator and experience in managing a rapidly growing global SCCM infrastructure with multiple servers;Minimum of 10 years in Level 3 user technical support;Extensive knowledge of the automation process (scripting, deployment strategies, packaging, GPO, virtualization, Office 365, etc.);Extensive knowledge of networking topology;Maintain a good working relationship with clients and be capable of handling criticism and occasional frustration;Stressful working environment: heavy workload and deadlines are often tight.  Candidates must be legally able to work in Canada at this time. Parkland regrets that it is unable to sponsor employment Visas or consider individuals on time-limited Visa status for this position.  Our main priority at Parkland is our people. As an employee, you can expect a fair workplace, a professional work environment, competitive compensation, outstanding benefits, and a share in our success through the Employee Share Purchase Plan and our Annual Incentive Plan.  Our preferred method of application is online at www.parkland.ca  We thank all candidates in advance for their interest, however only those being considered will be contacted.  Parkland Fuel Corporation is committed to the principles of Employment Equity.  We strive to provide accessibility in employment to ensure equal access to employment opportunities for candidates, including persons with disabilities. Parkland Fuel Corporation will endeavour to provide accommodation to persons with disabilities in the recruitment process upon request. If you are selected for an interview and you require accommodation due to a disability, please notify us upon scheduling your interview.
Title: SCCM Administrator

Job_Description: About the Company  PCM Canada (formerly Acrodex), is a full spectrum, enterprise-wide technology solutions provider that has been in the IT business since 1984. Our mission is to “deliver enterprise IT solutions that enable customers to achieve their business outcomes.” Translating our technical strength into business value for our clients requires more than just expertise and strategic alliances; it requires a team that thrives on understanding and solving problems. With office locations across Canada, we provide our clients with flexible IT solutions that drive results.  Role:  PCM Canada is currently seeking an experienced IT Technical Recruiter (Contract) to join a growing team starting on or around April 18th, 2018. The ideal candidate will have 4 years of professional experience in a IT recruitment function (corporate, agency, or similar industry) and 2 years of experience with inside/outside sales and client interaction. All candidates must be available to interview in either Calgary, Edmonton, or Toronto. Must be legally entitled to work in Canada.  Applications will be accepted until: Wednesday, April 11, 2018.  General Responsibilities:  Targeted recruiting on requested IT skillset/technologies. Ability to respond and recruit quickly and efficiently within tight timelines. Ability to negotiate “win/win” scenario between candidates and PCM Canada requirements. Proactive sourcing/building candidate pipelines in designated region through networking / social media / referrals/industry events etc. Develop sourcing strategies for critical and hard to fill roles and identify relevant sourcing channels Proactively reach out to clients to identify upcoming IT resource requirements Sourcing candidate resumes from various recruitment sites such as Indeed, Monster, LinkedIn. Assist with revising recruitment listings provided by clients to target top candidates. Prepare resumes, matrixes, profiles, in standard PCM Canada format. Co-ordinate the interview process and notify applicants of results. Provide weekly updates/progress on recruitment activities I.e. number of opportunities, candidates etc. Attend meetings as required with other Business Units. Qualifications:  4 years of professional experience in an IT recruitment function (corporate, agency, or similar industry). 2 years of experience with inside/outside sales and client interaction to determine IT resource requirements Experience with full life cycle recruiting including: receiving opportunities from clients, writing job descriptions, posting jobs, sourcing, pre-screening, salary/contract negotiation, profile/matrix editing and submission, scheduling interviews, prep interview, collecting feedback from the candidates and client, and closing recruiting cycle. Experience managing and handling quick turnaround recruitment requests Experience working on resume profiles and skills matrix with candidates. Experience with using an ATS system (Applicant tracking system) – ie Bullhorn, HRMDirect, MaxHire. Experience working with clients and building business relationships Knowledge/understanding of different IT technical positions, skillsets. Demonstrated track record of placements in variety of IT roles (I.e. Server Analyst, Deskside Technician, Project Manager, Technical Analysts etc.) Must be able to multi-task, prioritize workload, and maintain strong attention to detail. Demonstrated ability to analyze issues, exercise judgment and initiative when responding to requests. Demonstrated ability to work independently or within a team environment Must be available to interview in Calgary, Edmonton, or Toronto Must be eligible to work in Canada Education (Must Have one of the following combinations):  College Diploma OR certificate OR a combination of education/ work experience. Note:  Please submit your resume describing your relevant experience. We thank you for your interest, however, only those selected for interviews will be contacted. All Qualified Applicants must be legally entitled to work in Canada
Title: IT Technical Recruiter (Contract)

Job_Description: Regular-Full time  W E= unlimited potential  We didn’t get to be a leader in energy delivery or ranked on the Global 100 Most Sustainable Corporations index on our own. We did it in partnership with outstanding individuals who work together as a team to fuel people’s quality of life. Individuals like you. And now we’re looking for just such an individual to join our team.  To learn more about us, visit www.enbridge.com .  This requisition will remain open until filled; however, consideration will be given to applicants in order of applicat ion date.   Primary Focus  T he Sr Analyst Cyber Risk supports and maintains governance and cybersecurity-related processes. This individual serves as liaison between internal/external cyber risk teams and the processes that manage cyber risk, including cyber risk activity tracking, and assists with cybersecurity-related processes maintenance, reporting and documentation.  Responsibilities Maintains the CISO policy exception and risk acceptance processes in the Enterprise Risk Management (ERM) tool Maintain documentation in support of ERM process and toolset Administers the CISO policy exception process Facilitate an understanding of enterprise cybersecurity risk landscape tolerance and accepted risk Develop and deliver education, awareness and communication of the exception process for end users Tracks cybersecurity risk remediation activities Contributes to the development of Standard Operating Procedure documentation for cybersecurity risk coordination activities Provides detailed status reporting cybersecurity risks and associated remediation activities Assist in maintenance of Cybersecurity Framework and related risk/security metrics Assist in design and creation of new cybersecurity policies and related risk/security metrics Other tasks as assigned, cybersecurity or governance related  Qualifications University degree or technical diploma in an IT related field 2+ years of experience in cybersecurity risk and compliance Knowledge of ISO 27001 and 27002 is strongly desired Strong knowledge of cybersecurity risk management procedures Strong business and technical background Excellent organizational skills Excellent written and verbal communication skills, including the ability to communicate complex technical matters in easy to understand non-technical ways Ability to identify priorities and ensure work is completed within stipulated timeframes Ability to work independently or as part of a team  Preferred: Cybersecurity-related certifications are an asset: CISSP, CRISC, CISM, etc Experience in creating risk reporting, analysis and dashboards  We accept applications submitted via our online recruiting system only ( https://careers.enbridge.com ).  Enbridge is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer and is committed to provide employment opportunities to all individuals, without regard to race, religion, age, sex, color, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, or disability. Accommodation for applicants with disabilities is available on request during the recruitment process. Applicants with disabilities can request accessible formats or communication supports by contacting careers@enbridge.com .  We appreciate your interest in working with us; however, only those applicants selected for interviews will be contacted.  Final candidates for this position may be required to undergo a security screening, including a criminal records check.
Title: Sr Analyst Cyber Risk

Job_Description: We are looking for energetic and innovative Software Developers to help us re-invent the category we invented! We know that the ability to deliver outstanding client service starts with having the best talent on our team, and if you want to be part of our success story then we want to hear from you!  We have proudly served clients in Canada for over 50 years, constantly evolving to meet our clients’ ever-changing needs. From our digital solutions to our offices, we constantly seek new ways to create frictionless and memorable client experiences.  The Opportunity:  This is a rare opportunity to join an international brand during a transformative period. Reporting to the Manager of Development, the Software Developer will be part of a collaborative, Agile team responsible for the end-to-end design, development, implementation and maintenance of a wide range of new and existing applications.  Requirements:  Enjoy working in a collaborative, agile team environment  Experience building software from the ground-up  Passionate about software development  Take pride in your work; ensuring it is testable, reusable, scalable, and maintainable  Enjoy learning new technologies and pick them up quickly  Ability to work in a fast-paced environment  Proven ability to demonstrate innovative solutions to complex business problems  A great sense of humour and mad Nerf skills  Key Areas of Responsibility:  Build enterprise-scale applications while being mindful of performance, reliability, and scalability  Apply your understanding of software development methodologies, processes, and practices (OO, TDD, SOLID, etc.)  Collaborate with the team to analyze and solve technical challenges  Promote the use of best practices and design patterns within the team  Ability to understand business stakeholders vision and, in turn, delight stakeholders and customers with the delivery of feature rich, high quality software  Work with project managers, business analysts, database administrators, and quality assurance to build new products and features which will help take our business to the next level  Key Qualifications:  Post-Secondary education in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Programming, and/ or a related discipline, or the equivalent combination of education, technical training and professional experience  5-15 years of Development experience  A strong understanding of Object Oriented development principles and methodologies  Wicked REST API development skills (and knowledge of best practices)  Strongly skilled in C# (or Java), MVC, Angular, React/Redux  Strongly skilled with JavaScript  Knowledge of AWS, Azure, or IBM Cloud  Experience in React Native or similar Mobile development frameworks is an asset  Experience with TSQL and database development  Working knowledge of SSMS, SSRS and SSIS  An appreciation of ITIL/COBIT along with a working knowledge of Agile with a SCRUM focus  If you meet the skills and qualifications required for this great opportunity, and are truly passionate about software development, we invite you to send your cover letter and resume to employment.opportunities@hrblock.ca.  Successful candidates must have legal authorization to work in Canada on a full-time basis for any employer. Only those candidates selected for interview will be contacted. H&R Block Canada welcomes and encourages applications from people from all backgrounds, including people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the recruitment and selection process. Back to careers page
Title: Software Developer, IT

Job_Description: ARC Business Solutions Inc. is a customer oriented information technology solution provider with proven abilities to incorporate strategy, creativity and technical aspects into business solutions. Core business verticals are: Professional IT Services, Enterprise Content Management, Utility Sector Services, Mobile Solutions and Managed Services.ARC has an immediate opportunity for a Security Analyst on a part time, long term basis to join our Managed Services Division/ROLE: SECURITY ANALYSTThe successful candidates must possess demonstrated experience in the following areas:SANS Certified Penetration Testing or Offensive Security Certified Professional (OSCP)Demonstrated proficiency in written communication.Demonstrated planning and organizational skills.Demonstrated ability to quickly learn business applications.Demonstrated analytical and problem-solving skills.Good customer service and communication skills. Must be comfortable interacting with clients.Desirable attributes are:Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP)CompTIA Advanced Security Practitioner (CASP)We offer a competitive salary, profit sharing, share options and a comprehensive benefits package. These positions can be filled by full time ARC employees or contractors.We thank all applicants for their interest; however only candidates considered for interviews will be contacted. We will be conducting interviews immediately. TO BE CONSIDERED - Please forward your resume clearly displaying reference number DP: SA in the subject line to hr at arcbus.com . For more information on ARC, please visit our website at www.arcbus.com.Job Type: Full-time
Title: Security Analyst

Job_Description: Job Type: Permanent Primary Location: Calgary, Alberta, Canada All Available Locations: Calgary  Role Description  Remarkable people. Remarkable work. Remarkable career. At Deloitte, we recognize that the days of one set path to career success are long over. We offer you the flexibility and choice to customize a work experience that fuels your passions, strengths and ambitions. We also try to ensure there are plenty of occasions to have fun, relax, play, exercise, and build relationships. At Deloitte, we are redefining what it means to be a professional services firm. We are all about ‘remarkable’: Remarkable people. Remarkable work. Remarkable career. ( Even our workplace is remarkable! ) The team Our HR Transformation (HRT) practice is leading the way when it comes to helping clients make sense of and draw insights from the rapid changes happening in the market. From being digital, to employee experience, to robotic process automation and the future of work: it is no longer enough to be strategic, HR needs to be the agent of change and innovation, win the war for talent and embrace the workforce disruption. Our ability to provide end-to-end services to our clients – from helping them envision where they want to go, to technology selection and solution design, straight through to implementation – makes us a standout in the market place (analysts consistently rate us as the leading firm in Canada and globally!). The roadmap to becoming a high-impact HR organization has never been more complex, and yet, it has never been more exciting to play in this space. Possibilities are limitless. The role As a Senior Consultant, you will be engaged and play a role in delivering high quality outputs to our clients across a breadth of industries. You will have the opportunity to leverage leading research, analytics, technology and industry insights to impact the future of work and provide business-focused solutions to our clients. You will be part of a team that loves collaborating, taking on challenges and exceeding expectations. No two days are ever the same, but here is a sample of some of the work you might do in this role: participate in engagements that advance strategic HR transformation for clients; work collaboratively across multiple service lines and alongside service line leaders to deliver best in class solutions to our clients; design and participate in client workshops; develop project deliverables; and participate in practice development activities to continually develop your skills and grow your knowledge  Who you are Growing your career and future at Deloitte is within your hands and here is how you’ll succeed: You are genuinely passionate about HR, keeping up with trends, having an active interest and desire to change what HR will look like in 10 to 15 years, and staying connected with what is happening in the market today, from an employee and an employer perspective. You demonstrate social perceptiveness, by listening well and being able to incorporate feedback into personal development and professional growth. You have a design mindset, delivering a unique and customized customer service solution by using logic, imagination, intuition, and systemic reasoning to explore possibilities of what could be and by as a means of creating the desired outcomes that benefit the end user. You are passionate about personal development. You understand what drives you and you actively seek feedback from your peers as well as leaders. You take action on the feedback received and seek challenging and meaningful opportunities for personal and professional growth and development. You’re able to collaborate and work as part of a team . You are attentive to the needs of others and understand what needs to be done in order to achieve collective success. You provide meaningful contributions when on a team and never hesitate to help others when needed. The essentials You have a bachelor’s degree in a related field. Master’s degree, CHRP and PMP designations are all attributes we are looking for, but if you have not acquired one yet, we are happy to help you to! You're digitally savvy. You seek out innovative solutions and embrace evolving technologies. You can easily adapt to new tools and trends You’re able to demonstrate previous experience in managing multiple priorities and delivering quality commitments on time (consulting or HR industry experience is an asset). You have strong business acumen, with ability to quickly translate theoretical concepts into practical outcomes that deliver business value Travel requirements vary; we make efforts to match our people to local, national or global opportunities that align with their needs and preferences. Join our team, share your strengths and dare to explore what a remarkable future could mean for you at Deloitte! Why Deloitte? Launch your career with The One Firm where you can make a greater impact than you ever thought possible. With endless opportunities at every turn, and a culture built to support and drive our people to be the very best they can be, Deloitte is The One Firm for you to learn, grow, create, and lead. At Deloitte, we understand that everyone, and their career goals, are different. As a firm, we help create the conditions and opportunities that will enable our people to thrive – both professionally and personally. We do this by making three commitments to our people: You will lead at every level: We grow the world’s best leaders so you can achieve the impact you seek, faster. You can work your way: We give you the means to work how you want, and we have innovative spaces and the mindset to help you be wildly successful. You will feel included and inspired: We create a deep sense of belonging where you can bring your whole self to work. Apply now and let us show you how to push your career to the next level at Deloitte. The One Firm. For You. Deloitte is an inclusive employer dedicated to building a diverse workforce. We encourage applications from all qualified candidates and will accommodate applicants’ needs under the respective provincial human rights codes throughout all stages of the recruitment and selection process. Please advise the Recruiter to ensure your accessibility needs are accommodated throughout this process. Information received relating to accommodation will be addressed confidentially. We thank all applicants in advance for their interest; however, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted 34702
Title: Senior Consultant, Human Capital Consulting: HR Transformati...

Job_Description: At Connverge, we are driven by technology, innovation and the opportunity to work with amazing clients. We build business-level, web-based applications on Cloud platforms like Microsoft Azure, SharePoint, Power BI, Dynamics and Flow that support a rich set of interactions among customers, employees and users like us. As software developers, designers and analysts, our work requires us to consider usability, design, business workflow, performance, as well as strong technical platform integrations. We are regional leaders in an emerging cloud technology space.About Our TeamWe passionately solve problems and commit to quality as the leading design principle.We are agile practitioners who think critically and systemically.We are striving to maintain a culture of automation.We scale ourselves through small, self-empowered and self-organizing teams.We focus on learning, at an organizational and personal level.We value a diverse team with a variety of educational backgrounds.About YouYou are a software developer with 2+ years of experience developing solutions who truly loves working with technology and solving problems. You have worked as a part of a development team and take great pride in creating resilient, high quality software. You are excited to work with a team that strives to solve complex business problems, no matter what it takes.Key ResponsibilitiesContribute collaboratively within a creative and fast paced environment, designing innovative solutions that are architecturally solid and scalable.Thrive working independently within an open environment.Work within an Agile development environment, adhering to process standards and best practices.Demonstrate an ability to break down complex problems into smaller tasks that can be systematically prioritized and addressed.Develop strong coding solutions using JavaScript frameworks such as React, Angular or Vue on Microsoft business platforms that perform and fit well within the context of a larger product.Proactively identify and communicate risks or delays that may affect the overall health of a project.RequirementsMust have at least 2 years experience with JavaScript, using frameworks such as React (preferred), Angular or VueExperience with TypeScriptExperience with REST APIsExperience with GITFamiliar with Office 365Nice to Have SkillsWe will give strong preference to developers who have the following additional experience:Experience with Microsoft SharePoint, especially Office 365 / SharePoint Online, SharePoint FrameworkExperience with C#Experience with command line (PowerShell, Bash)Experience with Node.jsJob Types: Full-time, ContractExperience:software development: 2 yearsLocation:Calgary, AB
Title: Software Developer

Job_Description: Want to be on the leading edge?  Desktop/Network Analyst   Are you passionate about IT and helping humans get the most from their technology? Do you want to work in a highly collaborative company where you're learning like crazy with a team to back you up? Do you want to have fun working in a fast-paced setting, and know that you're making a difference?  CORE RESPONSIBILITIES:  Priority #1: Help humans get their jobs done with technology; Configure, deploy, and support business-class equipment onsite and remotely using a variety of cutting-edge tools and technologies; Respond to customer-reported issues - identify problems, troubleshoot, and resolve with the support of your team; Recommend solutions and provide advice as required; Assist in design and delivery of IT projects; Document all activity in a clear and concise manner.  REQUIREMENTS  Bulletproof IT is growing steadily, and looking for reinforcements - people with experience supporting:   Microsoft Windows-based desktops and servers Microsoft Exchange Remote Desktop Services Advanced firewalls Cloud services Mobile devices  Excellent communication and people skills are as important to us as technical skills, and education and certifications are an advantage though the right experience and attitude may substitute.  This position may be exactly what you're looking for, if:  you want to be with a company that cares more about client satisfaction than "billable hours"; you want to make a real difference instead of fighting bureaucracy and apathy all day; you are fed up with chaotic environments where everyone is expected to work in a vacuum, and REAL standards and best practices are few and far between; you want to be with a company that continually innovates and works to become something better every day.  With offices in Calgary and Red Deer, Bulletproof InfoTech is celebrating its 31st year as a high-end provider of Information Technology services to small and mid-sized businesses throughout Alberta.
Title: Desktop/Network Analyst - Calgary

Job_Description: Inter Pipeline is a major petroleum transportation, storage and natural gas liquids processing business that ranks among the largest energy infrastructure companies in Canada. We are proud to be named one of Alberta’s Top 70 Employers, which recognizes Alberta businesses that lead their industries by being exceptional places to work.  Located out of our Calgary office, the individual in the Senior Business Analyst role will report to the Supervisor, Finance Solutions Centre. The successful candidate will be responsible for the stewardship of finance master data and project support within SAP for Inter Pipeline, as well indirect leadership of the Business Analyst.  Key Activities and Responsibilities: Review and ongoing improvement of master data creation/change approval processes Leadership of the Business Analyst role, utilizing a team accountability approach for facilitating finance master data creation/changes Work with the business and SAP Competency Centre to develop Service Level Agreements (SLAs), key performance indicators (KPIs) and other metrics for SAP finance master data Act as a data steward bringing forward cross-functional data quality and process integration issues and working collaboratively to solve them, championing the collective management of data governance Serve as a central point of contact for finance data governance understanding and providing direction and training to data consumers and producers from the business in line with business rules Ensure the right stakeholders across the enterprise (e.g. operations, finance, supply chain, etc.) are brought into make business process improvements which mitigate data issues Bring best practices in master data management and propose opportunities for improvement Interaction with SAP Competency Center on future system enhancements, builds, testing, and roll-outs Assist with development and usage of SAP reports  Education, Skills and Experience: Undergraduate diploma or degree in business with 5+ years of progressive experience in financial system support, CPA (CA, CMA, CGA) designation is an asset Strong finance expertise on master data usage, configuration, and integrated data requirements/linkage points combined with prior oil and gas experience considered an asset In depth knowledge of SAP FI_CO and Business Warehouse, experience with S/4HANA and Fiori an asset Approaches work with a high level of curiosity and aptitude to identify and solve problems, takes initiative, is accountable, and works independently Change agent who can persuade and influence stakeholders to establish new processes, shift to automation, and provide innovative solutions Ability to manage internal and external relationships with well-developed interpersonal, team, customer service and communication skills (both written and verbal) Strong customer service skills in working with internal departments to achieve results through relationships with people and teams Able to work well in a fast-paced, growth environment, with strong attention to detail and accuracy Maintains strong initiative and possesses superior analytical skills
Title: Senior Business Analyst

Job_Description: Build a meaningful career  At Morneau Shepell, we offer more than career opportunities, we provide career opportunities to make meaningful contributions to people’s lives. The extraordinary expertise of our 4,000-strong workforce is harnessed to support the employees and families of the organizations we serve. Our innovative programs have a lasting impact on the health, financial security and productivity of 20,000 workplaces.  Consultant Health and Benefits  Health & Benefits Solutions  Calgary, AB  Full Time, Permanent  Benefits programs are an important and highly valued part of any employment offering. But understanding how much or what type of benefit coverage is necessary can be difficult. Our client relationship model is consultative and encourages continual communication. By providing you with the resources to support employers in engaging employees in their health, we provide a path to better workforce health and productivity.  Our Consultant works in a team and is responsible for managing, servicing and providing quality benefits consulting services for small to medium sized clients. In addition, they will be responsible for helping to build business with existing clients as well as attracting and supporting new clients through our association partnerships.  Responsibilities include:  Business Development  Identify and manage cross-sell opportunities Develop strategic relationships with key account contacts and introduce Morneau Shepell team members as appropriate Supervise the complete employee benefits cycle: plan design, provider search, implementation, experience monitoring, renewal rating Develop new business with existing clients and assists in obtaining new business with prospective clients focusing on our key association partnerships Understand client needs and identify company or industry products or services that can meet these needs Service  Deliver presentations to clients; conduct client meetings and the occasional employee presentation. Ensure that quality control and service standards are attained with every transaction Negotiate, problem solve and maintain positive relationships with insurers, external advisors and internal underwriting and benefits administration departments Develop and maintain excellent relationships with clients, through regular telephone contact and office visits Understand the client’s perspective and priorities, and work with the client to resolve administrative issues Establish strategies for services that meet client needs  Administration  Provide and oversee direct day-to-day support for clients by phone, e-mail, letters, formal reports, and face-to-face meetings Lead and manage multiple client assignments and projects Manage special projects as required Peer review the work of analysts Knowledge  Maintain current knowledge of industry trends including insurer news, products, legislation, and cost trends as well as current knowledge of our company's products and services  Qualifications:  Experience  Five years of experience in group benefits. Preference will be given to those from the group insurance industry, a consulting firm or brokerage or in an HR department. Education  Post-secondary education GBA (CEBS) designation, or working towards it. Life Insurance license (this will be a requirement within 3 months of onboarding) Skills  Strong presentation skills and comfort speaking in front of large groups Understanding of consultative selling and the ability to manage the sales cycle effectively and autonomously Expert negotiation, technical and analytical skills Can effectively communicate complex concepts in plain written and spoken language Professional Traits  Exceptional customer focus; some would say you’re the best Extremely organized self-starter, flexible, highly independent Ability to manage multiple deadlines simultaneously Proven collaborative team member with the ability to motivate and inspire team members  Morneau Shepell Morneau Shepell is in the business of helping organizations help their people because we believe that engaged people are the driving force for society. Every day, the expertise of our almost 4,000 employees is recognized as essential to the financial security, health, and productivity of our clients and their people. We're always looking for talented professionals and strategic leaders who will listen and work together with colleagues and clients to form long-term relationships and to deliver integrative solutions that fit. As we continue to grow, we're presently engaging with exceptional candidates interested in a range of exciting career opportunities. At www.morneaushepell.com you can explore our careers page to learn more about the solutions we deliver and the great people who help us do it. Follow us on LinkedIn and Twitter (Morneau_Shepell, Shepell). We are thankful for your interest, but unfortunately, we can only personally connect with those selected for an interview.  INDCAD LI-PH1  Job Grade: MS4   Fulfilling work that matters  Morneau Shepell is in the business of helping organizations help their people and in the process, we strive to elevate ours.  We're always looking for talented professionals and strategic leaders looking to make a difference in the lives of the people we serve.  We appreciate the interest of every applicant; however, we contact only those selected for an interview.  Find your fit with us. Follow us on LinkedIn, Youtube and Twitter.
Title: Consultant

Job_Description: Business Analyst for Application Development Processes:  full time, 6 month duration, based in Calgary This role provides ownership and oversight of all process development, improvement, and implementation of Software Process Improvement (SPI) based on the CMM framework.A key responsibility of this group is to monitor process metrics in order to identify either problem areas or identify opportunities for process improvement.They are responsible for staffing the SEPG team and providing direction in applying the Process Change Method (PCM) for the account and in training the delivery team.They train the delivery team, begins the implementation, acts as process owner for changes and updates, and plans and leads the IBM tasks of the Software Engineering Institute (SEI) CMM-based assessment.They also engage ADE to perform an effectiveness study when funded and appropriate.Capture business requirements, analysis of requirements, mapping of requirements (As is and To be processes)Particular focus on Windows 10 application Please send your resumes to Danielle Pelletier at daniellep@tes.net.
Title: Business Analyst
