Title: Business Analyst

Job_Description: *PLEASE NOTE: PREFERENCE WILL BE GIVEN TO CANDIDATES WHO APPLY THROUGH CANFOR.COM/CAREERSCanfor TechnologyAt Canfor, our Information Technology professionals play an important role in the daily functioning of our operations. Consistently pushing the boundaries when it comes to innovation within the forestry and pulp and paper industries, our IT professionals support Canfor in achieving exceptional results.With a high caliber Information Technology leadership team, a clear vision, and significant growth and training opportunities, a career in IT at Canfor allows individuals to strengthen their competencies and grow within their respective roles. Working as an equal partner with our operations to achieve organizational objectives, you will be at the forefront of innovation.Who We Are: Canfor is one of the world’s largest and most respected integrated forest products companies. For more than 75 years, we have been delivering top-quality lumber, pulp and paper products to our valued customers worldwide. With operations in Western Canada and the Southern United States, and sales offices around the world, you can find Canfor products in every corner of the globe. We are leaders in sustainable forest management and in converting wood residuals into green energy.As we continue to grow our company and our markets, find out how you can grow your career with us.The OpportunityThe Data Analyst, Business Intelligence supports Canfor’s objectives by turning data into meaningful information that can be used to make sound business decisions. The Data Analyst will provide expertise in business intelligence to prepare and deliver data and information to internal customers and stakeholders through reports, dashboards and scorecards. It is essential that the Data Analyst build an understanding of the business at a level of detail that enables them to work with the business to deliver valuable information.Please Note:  This is a relocation opportunity in Vancouver, British Columbia. The successful applicant may be provided with relocation assistance.Main ResponsibilitiesRequirements Gathering:Engage with various business units to capture information needs, compare those needs with existing tools and identify gapsParticipate in business requirements workshopsWrite business requirements documents as required to elaborate needs, gain acceptanceDesign & Development:Architect tables and dataDesign dashboards, reports, drill-down analytics and data visualizationsDesign, configure and administer the metadata layerCreate system technical requirements for documentation and knowledge managementActively challenge and find solutions to optimize system performanceTesting, Validation, Release Management:Develop and implement testing strategiesValidate data accuracyDeploy and validate changes in production environmentTraining & Change Management:Support the development of training, documentation, and help desk capabilitiesRequired SkillsBachelor's degree in computer science, information systems, business management or specialized training/certificationExperience working with relational databases (Microsoft SQL Server, Oracle Database, MySQL, etc)Applied knowledge of SQL (T-SQL, PL/SQL, ANSI-SQL, etc)Applied understanding of data modelling and warehousing conceptsWorking knowledge of business intelligence tools such as Oracle Business IntelligenceWorking knowledge of ETL tools such as Oracle Data Integrator or InformaticaExperience mediating and clarifying sometimes ambiguous or conflicting end user requirementsEagerness to learn new concepts and technologies and keep-up-to-date with existing onesWillingness to go above and beyond to understand both the business and technical aspects of a problemHiring for this position is ongoing and will be filled as required. To be considered for this position, please apply today.In order to be eligible for this position, you must be legally entitled to work in Canada for our Company.There has never been a better time to join the Canfor Information Technology team and become a part of the modern forest industry. We have a wide range of rewarding and innovative careers in some of the best communities in North America, with plenty of room for advancement. We offer competitive compensation and benefits packages, and are committed to the professional development of our employees.*PLEASE NOTE: PREFERENCE WILL BE GIVEN TO CANDIDATES WHO APPLY THROUGH CANFOR.COM/CAREERSFollow us on LinkedIn , Twitter , and Facebook for Canfor news, career opportunities, and upcoming events!Vancouver, BCThe city of Vancouver is both a natural beauty and a progressive urban centre, a rare place on earth that is idyllic and electric all at once. With one of Canada’s mildest climates, Vancouver is ideally suited for those devoted to outdoor pursuits, health and wellness. Along with its endless supply of fresh air and clean water, Vancouver also boasts countless choices for culturally diverse, world-class cuisine and an inventory of arts and entertainment events. For more information, visit http://canfor.com/our-company/our-communities/vancouverJob Type: Full-timeEducation:High school or equivalent
Title: Business Intelligence Analyst (Relocation Opportunity)

Job_Description: Tell us your story. Don't go unnoticed. Explain why you're a winning candidate. Think "TD" if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward. Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us. Here's our story: jobs.td.com  Department Overview TD Insurance is part of TD Bank Group, one of Canada’s largest financial institutions. TD Insurance helps protect clients from the ‘accidents of life’ with a wide range of products including credit protection, life, health, travel, home and auto insurance. With more than three million clients, TD Insurance authorized products and services are available online, over the phone, and through a network of more than 1,000 TD Canada Trust branches. In Canada, we have two lines of business, General Insurance and Life and Health. Our General Insurance business is one of the top home and auto insurance groups in Canada and the national leader in group insurance and affinity marketing. Our Life and Health business is the number one provider of critical illness insurance and direct life and health insurance in Canada. At TD Insurance, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment. With a Canada-wide workforce of over 4,000 employees and offices in Atlantic Canada, Quebec, Ontario and Alberta, our company is always growing and can help you to grow. TD Insurance offers a stable and dynamic work environment where talent is appreciated and professional development is taken seriously. More than just a job, we offer rewarding careers.  Job Type Regular  Job Status Full Time  Hours 35  Business line TD Insurance  Job Category - Primary Management | Consulting | Advisory  Job Category(s) Insurance Management | Consulting | Advisory  Job Description Reporting to the Group Manager, Repair Advice Claims Services; the Team Manager is responsible for the day-to-day performance of the Residential team of Repair Advisors. The Team Manager is responsible for coaching Analysts on productivity , Lead time and quality aspects of their position; for supporting the achievement of business objectives; for participating in the evaluation of individual and group performance; and for inspiring team members to achieve results. Communicates expectations to team members; manages performance and provides ongoing coaching, feedback and recognition on all productivity and quality aspects, this may include site inspections. Administers employment conditions fairly and objectively. Creates and fosters a motivating work environment. Develops team members. Manages the implementation of change within the team. Establishes and maintains effective relationships with key partners.  Job Requirements You have solid property claims adjusting experience in scoping property damages. You have solid experience in the review and vetting of contractor’s scopes and estimates. You have knowledge and understanding of residential insurance as it applies to a claims environment. You are able to create and sustain positive team spirit and a constructive working environment within the team. You are a role model influencing individuals towards achievement of objectives and you have a thorough understanding of the coaching process and techniques required to coach Analysts. You share technical and professional expertise with team members to become more competent and effective. You know and understand the PP & D process. You have knowledge and understand Claims Services objectives and standards (quality & productivity) and you demonstrate full support of company objectives and direction, by understanding and adhering to the mission and strategic orientation of the Company. You have a strong client orientation. You demonstrate superior interpersonal and communication skills. You have sound knowledge of problem solving techniques. You have effective analytical skills and demonstrate leadership skills. You demonstrate support for change and understand basic change principles and you demonstrate the ability to adapt to changing situations. Post secondary education. Previous management experience is an asset. Completion of CIP courses is an asset. Knowledge of Xactimate and XactAnalysis is an asset.  Additional Information If this position is located in Quebec: Fluently bilingual (French / English) You possess a valid driving license You possess a valid Claims Adjuster certificate from the Autorité des Marchés Financiers (AMF).  Inclusiveness At TD, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve. They combine a deep understanding of technology, applications, industry best practices, business processes and architectural patterns to drive IT transformation initiatives that meet the business objectives of our customers. Job_Description: Regular-Full time  W E= unlimited potential  We didn’t get to be a leader in energy delivery or ranked on the Global 100 Most Sustainable Corporations index on our own. We did it in partnership with outstanding individuals who work together as a team to fuel people’s quality of life. Individuals like you. And now we’re looking for just such an individual to join our team.  To learn more about us, visit www.enbridge.com .  This requisition will remain open until filled; however, consideration will be given to applicants in order of applicat ion date.  Primary Focus  This role will support: Indirect tax and Customs compliance for Tidal Energy Marketing Inc. (Tidal CA) and Tidal Energy Marketing (US) LLC (Tidal US) to ensure Canadian and US customs and indirect tax filing requirements are met. Assist with other Canadian and US customs and indirect tax issues, as necessary.  Responsibilities Works independently to ensure all US and Canadian customs filings for Tidal CA and Tidal US are prepared and filed on time to meet all compliance deadlines. Works independently to ensure all Canadian indirect tax filings for Tidal CA and Tidal US, including but not limited to GST, HST, QST, PST, carbon tax/levy, fuel tax are prepared and filed on time to meet all compliance deadlines. Works independently to ensure all US indirect taxes filings for Tidal CA and Tidal US, including but not limited to Sales and Use taxes in various jurisdictions, Oil Spills Tax, and other US and meets all compliance deadlines. Manages tax remittances to meet all compliance deadlines. Prepares relevant monthly journal entries including reconciliation of tax general ledger accounts. Works collaboratively with relevant Tidal CA and Tidal US marketing and accounting staff to monitor marketing activities to ensure new or modified transactions are identified and potential compliance issues identified and addressed with appropriate Tidal and Tax staff. Assists other Tax staff with gathering and maintaining relevant documentation such as NAFTA certificates, licenses and registrations, customs bonds. Assists with customs and indirect tax audits including gathering data for timely and accurate preparation of responses. Assists in the development and maintenance of a Customs and Indirect Tax manual for Tidal personnel. Assists in the preparation and delivery of in-house training, as required. Assists other Tax staff as required by providing support for a variety of planning, compliance, regulatory, audit and financial reporting matters. Tasks include generating Oracle reports, preparing Excel spreadsheets and drafting letters and memos. Assists with department administration including establishing and maintaining well-documented project files, etc.  Qualifications  Required: Related university degree (Business Administration or a related discipline) and/or professional designation. Two or more years of experience in an accounting and/or tax environment. Knowledge of oil and gas marketing industry in Canada and the US. Ability to work independently and prioritize a demanding workload. Ability to work to meet numerous compliance deadlines. Proficiency with Microsoft Office application and strong working ability with computers.  Preferred: Professional designation. Basic knowledge of Canadian Indirect Tax concepts and filing requirements. Knowledge of Canadian and US Customs entry processes, reporting concepts and filing requirements. Knowledge of US Sales and Use Tax concepts and filing requirements.  We accept applications submitted via our online recruiting system only ( https://careers.enbridge.com ).  Enbridge is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer and is committed to provide employment opportunities to all individuals, without regard to race, religion, age, sex, color, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, or disability. Accommodation for applicants with disabilities is available on request during the recruitment process. Applicants with disabilities can request accessible formats or communication supports by contacting careers@enbridge.com .  We appreciate your interest in working with us; however, only those applicants selected for interviews will be contacted.  Final candidates for this position may be required to undergo a security screening, including a criminal records check.

Providing 7x24x365 support, the DCT is expected to deliver the highest level of customer service by adhering to internal policies and procedures. The DCT is the local primary point of contact for the local data centre, monitoring of the data centre facility, and is the coordinator of client escalations. During client escalations within their local data centre, the DCTs will be the primary point of contact to identify and feed information to the local operational teams, as well as the Operations Centre (NOC).  Essential Duties, Responsibilities and Accountabilities: The position includes, but is not limited to, the following (other duties may be assigned): Receive and prioritize requests related to ticketing system Assist the Data Center Coordinator, Facilities Manager and Data Centre Management Services (DCMS) teams in MACD’s (Moves, Adds, Changes, and Deletions) Monitor local security feeds and access control logs Issue security badges in compliance with local access control procedures Follow policies and procedures related to escalations, ticketing, and change management Identify and report to the Data Centre Manager any situations or client concerns that would improve quality or mitigate risk Create, update, and document existing Standard Operating Procedures (SOP), as required Provide notifications and updates to internal operational teams and/or clients Participate in special projects as required Ensure the ongoing flawless operation of the data centres to provide clients with world class service and support Execute the transformational vision of Rogers Perform other duties as requested by the Data Centre Manager  Role Breakdown Security Ensure the property, both internally and externally, is safe and secure Execute and adhere to Rogers Security Policy Ensure data centre security access cards are properly maintained, distributed and accounted Provide effective local surveillance monitoring of both base building and data centre areas Follow reporting and escalation processes for incidents Daily Operations Ensure all receiving is performed, recorded and announced in an accurate and expedient manner and that the shipping and receiving policy and processes are followed Provide accurate and thorough site inspections and shift walk-throughs Assist in performing core functionality support for DCC/DCFM team at the local site Coordinate detailed handoff on operational status during shift changes Perform timely and concise escalation and exception reporting describing incidents outside of normal operating policy Act as primary point of contact for NOC and local operational teams during an incident Administration Demonstrate strong shift turnover and peer communication practices; Contribute to process documentation for all functions Assist with ‘Smart Hand Services’; these services may include tape swaps, suite inspection, and other services as required Assist with client on-boarding functions, as required Maintain a tidy, professional, and unobstructed work environment including client accessible areas such as lobby, loading dock, etc.  Primary Interactions: Rogers Clients Team Members Rogers Employees Data Centre Operations teams Operations Centre (NOC) Data Centre Management Services team Suppliers, vendors, and trades  Competencies: Fluent English and excellent verbal and written communication skills Well-developed Customer service skills, focused on overall client satisfaction Excellent organizational and problem-solving abilities Work calmly in high pressure situations Willingness to work shift rotations in a 24/7/365 facility Utilize effective listening and communication skills Strong ability to build rapport with co-workers and clients – team player Strong focus on finite details Aptitude and willingness to learn/work on new technologies  Education and/or Experience: Help Desk/NOC experience in a Telecommunications/IT capacity is considered a plus Customer service experience Ability to work shifts and weekends High School graduation with some Post-Secondary Education preferred Security Guard Certification will be required once hired Strong working knowledge of Microsoft Office  Physical Demands The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this position. Office environment is continually using the phone and computer. May require physical effort associated with using the computer to access information, or occasional standing, walking, lifting (50 lbs.) needed to carry out everyday activities. Job_Description: Department overview: Financial Risk Analytics is part of the IHS Markit group and provides industry leading risk analytics solutions to sell side institutions within the financial markets. Risk management and risk regulation is continuously driving demand for more accurate calculations and risk system vendors are continuously striving for improvements in performance and scalability. The product has been designed, built and continuously improved over a ten year period. It is carefully architected to scale from running on a single laptop for demonstration purposes right through to running on 1,000+ core distributed grids.  Financial Risk Analytics provides solutions for Credit Risk PFE, Market Risk VaR and sensitivities, Credit Value Adjustment (CVA), Initial Margin (IM) and regulatory calculations such as EC, RC, IRC and CRM,  Position summary IHS Markit is seeking a Quality Assurance Analyst to join the Financial Risk Analytics group. The successful candidate will be involved in all aspects of testing with emphasis on test automation. We are looking for a pragmatic advocate of quality and someone that is willing to take a lead role. As part of the Quality Assurance team, you will help develop automated tests for our suite of windows and linux software including grid-based simulation software. A programming (mandatory) and an investment banking background (ideal) as you work closely with financial engineering, product development groups, and work directly to support our customers. We are looking for a methodical problem solver that is comfortable mentoring and working with a team.  Duties & accountabilities Develop detailed test plans, test cases, and test scripts to support regression, functional, load and stress testing for rest, client/server, and computational grid-based applications. Automation of testing including updates to and creation of automated test scripts for system, load and performance testing.Design and maintain automated test frameworks, including support of agile and test-driven development Conduct full product testing (component, system, integration, performance, etc.) including automation of the testing wherever possible. Help define and develop Quality Assurance strategies Identify, document and track software defects to resolution Establish and maintain multi-platform test environments Support customers on all Financial Risk Analytics products Business competencies Education and experience Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or a related discipline Strong knowledge of Quality Assurance concepts and methodologies Minimum 8 years of testing experience in a software development organization Understanding of the operating and data models of risk solutions, particularly in investment banking Commercial awareness Excellent knowledge of REST and network application testing. Strong analytical ability and programming skills (preferably in PowerShell, Python) Experience with performance and load testing tools.Jmeter expertise. Experience with agile software development methodologies and test-driven development Working knowledge Hadoop would be valuable.HBase, HDFS, Yarn, Hive, etc. Exposure to Apache NiFi, Apache Kafka. Strong knowledge of Windows, Windows Server platforms and Linux.  Personal competencies Personal impact Strong organizational, planning, and analytical skills Communication Excellent written and verbal communication skills Must be able to communicate at a senior level with all areas of the company within the financial services risk management domain Teamwork Strong collaboration skills in a team environment   We are proud to be an EEO/AA employer M/F/Disability/Veterans. Please refer to the EEO is the Law Poster & Supplement, Right to Work and Pay Transparency Policy. IHS Markit is a participant in E-Verify (see links below). We maintain a drug-free workplace and perform pre-employment drug testing. EEO is the Law EEO is the Law Supplement Right to Work Pay Transparency Policy E-Verify   Current Colleagues If you are currently a colleague with IHS Markit please apply internally via Workday.
Title: Principal Quality Assurance Engineer

To be considered for this position, please apply today.In order to be eligible for this position, you must be legally entitled to work in Canada for our Company.There has never been a better time to join the Canfor Information Technology team and become a part of the modern forest industry. Job_Description: Build a meaningful career  At Morneau Shepell, we offer more than career opportunities, we provide career opportunities to make meaningful contributions to people’s lives. The extraordinary expertise of our 4,000-strong workforce is harnessed to support the employees and families of the organizations we serve. Our innovative programs have a lasting impact on the health, financial security and productivity of 20,000 workplaces.  Consultant Health and Benefits  Health & Benefits Solutions  Calgary, AB  Full Time, Permanent  Benefits programs are an important and highly valued part of any employment offering. But understanding how much or what type of benefit coverage is necessary can be difficult. Our client relationship model is consultative and encourages continual communication. By providing you with the resources to support employers in engaging employees in their health, we provide a path to better workforce health and productivity.  Our Consultant works in a team and is responsible for managing, servicing and providing quality benefits consulting services for small to medium sized clients. In addition, they will be responsible for helping to build business with existing clients as well as attracting and supporting new clients through our association partnerships.  Responsibilities include:  Business Development  Identify and manage cross-sell opportunities Develop strategic relationships with key account contacts and introduce Morneau Shepell team members as appropriate Supervise the complete employee benefits cycle: plan design, provider search, implementation, experience monitoring, renewal rating Develop new business with existing clients and assists in obtaining new business with prospective clients focusing on our key association partnerships Understand client needs and identify company or industry products or services that can meet these needs Service  Deliver presentations to clients; conduct client meetings and the occasional employee presentation. Ensure that quality control and service standards are attained with every transaction Negotiate, problem solve and maintain positive relationships with insurers, external advisors and internal underwriting and benefits administration departments Develop and maintain excellent relationships with clients, through regular telephone contact and office visits Understand the client’s perspective and priorities, and work with the client to resolve administrative issues Establish strategies for services that meet client needs  Administration  Provide and oversee direct day-to-day support for clients by phone, e-mail, letters, formal reports, and face-to-face meetings Lead and manage multiple client assignments and projects Manage special projects as required Peer review the work of analysts Knowledge  Maintain current knowledge of industry trends including insurer news, products, legislation, and cost trends as well as current knowledge of our company's products and services  Qualifications:  Experience  Five years of experience in group benefits. Preference will be given to those from the group insurance industry, a consulting firm or brokerage or in an HR department. Education  Post-secondary education GBA (CEBS) designation, or working towards it. Life Insurance license (this will be a requirement within 3 months of onboarding) Skills  Strong presentation skills and comfort speaking in front of large groups Understanding of consultative selling and the ability to manage the sales cycle effectively and autonomously Expert negotiation, technical and analytical skills Can effectively communicate complex concepts in plain written and spoken language Professional Traits  Exceptional customer focus; some would say you’re the best Extremely organized self-starter, flexible, highly independent Ability to manage multiple deadlines simultaneously Proven collaborative team member with the ability to motivate and inspire team members  Morneau Shepell Morneau Shepell is in the business of helping organizations help their people because we believe that engaged people are the driving force for society. Every day, the expertise of our almost 4,000 employees is recognized as essential to the financial security, health, and productivity of our clients and their people. We're always looking for talented professionals and strategic leaders who will listen and work together with colleagues and clients to form long-term relationships and to deliver integrative solutions that fit. As we continue to grow, we're presently engaging with exceptional candidates interested in a range of exciting career opportunities. At www.morneaushepell.com you can explore our careers page to learn more about the solutions we deliver and the great people who help us do it. Follow us on LinkedIn and Twitter (Morneau_Shepell, Shepell). We are thankful for your interest, but unfortunately, we can only personally connect with those selected for an interview.  INDCAD LI-PH1  Job Grade: MS4   Fulfilling work that matters  Morneau Shepell is in the business of helping organizations help their people and in the process, we strive to elevate ours.  We're always looking for talented professionals and strategic leaders looking to make a difference in the lives of the people we serve.  We appreciate the interest of every applicant; however, we contact only those selected for an interview.  Find your fit with us. Follow us on LinkedIn, Youtube and Twitter.

Job_Description: Procurement Policy Analyst On behalf of our client, Procom is currently seeking a Procurement Policy Analyst.The Procurement Analyst is responsible to deliver results as a key member of the Centre of Excellence, representing the strategic procurement departments best interests, and assuring policies and procedures are created, planned and developed for the Strategic procurement department and business team they support. The Procurement Analyst ensures process effectiveness and efficiency in policy through process definition, measurement, analysis and continuous improvement. The scope of this assignment is from a policy centric focus developing policies from two major legacy organizations and facilitating the development of them into one going forward to publish in the organization. The ‘hands-on” analyst will ensure delivered products meet new governance requirements and objectives through excellence in planning, facilitation, communication, execution and follow-up. This involves multiple interfaces both within the company (including cross functional teamwork) and in some cases supplier partners to ensure policies developed ensure the effective procurement of products, materials, supplies and services for wholesale business needs through comprehensive measurement. Procurement Policy Analyst Job Details Works as part of a procurement team to understand the company’s material and service requirements for supporting procurement.Develops procurement policies with key business stakeholders including category managers, analysts, site leads.Analyzes and interprets historical policies and procedures with a focus on developing KPI to track governance.Engages and collaborates with cross-functional teams to develop and improve operational performance with effective policy and procedural development.Supports and maintains procurement standards and on-going objectives to achieve department objectives and KPI targets.Works with other team members, such as Buyers/Planners and cross-functional team members to support policy development and continuous improvements.Reviews practices, procedures and processes, seeking ways to improve efficiency and effectiveness, reduce risk to operational performanceIdentifies and documents risks and countermeasures with mitigation plans. Procurement Policy Analyst Mandatory Skills Degree or professional Supply Chain designations and ten or more years of experience in Procurement, Supply Chain, Manufacturing.Experience in governance of policies and procedures, document management, information management.Knowledge and experience with ERP systems and E-Procurement systems (Oracle and SAP).Knowledge of Category Management.Excellent communication and writing skills; attention to detail.Ability to work well in a cross-functional team environment.Great Communication skillsProficiency in MS Office and Outlook. Procurement Policy Analyst Job Location Calgary, AB Procurement Policy Analyst Assignment Length 6 Months

Document and communicate to senior management all recommendations for contract award including commercial rationale. Qualifications: A relevant University degree and five to ten (5-10) years of related experience in sourcing and contracting or within the contract management An MBA Degree is an asset Superior written and oral communication skills, analytical and problem solving skills, people management skills and financial acumen are a requirement Experience in the oil and gas industry. Midstream, energy generation, or construction experience Experience in Supply Chain Management process and systems Thorough understanding of contract structure, terms and conditions and supplier performance Experience managing high value relationships with internal and external stakeholders and understanding of their objectives and needs Project management or project controls skills and experience Proven strong negotiation skills and contract management expertise Expertise and Skills Supply Chain and Procurement, Procurement Analyst > 10 years Priority Requirements Must-have: Describe your experience as a Senior Contract Analyst specializing in Strategic Development and Management of Custom Contract Formation/Solutions for Midstream Construction Contracts

The Human Resources Advisor – Employee Relations Specialist role will support the Branded Retail operations client group in Alberta, Saskatchewan and Manitoba, based in Calgary or Edmonton, providing internal consulting support to our regional area / store managers in dealing with a broad spectrum of human resources initiatives. Lead all investigation cases nationally for branded retail in partnership with in region HR support. Build strong relationships and credibility with all levels of management Be results-oriented and have a demonstrated ability to handle multiple priorities Through knowledge transfer, coaching, and training, increase the ability of business unit managers and employees to independently action and resolve minor employee relations issues and facilitate change management Partner with leadership to improve HR practices, process decisions and programs Assist leadership with building effective practices to meet business and employee needs Keep current on business knowledge, internal to the function and across the Company Seek out development opportunities to expand knowledge and experience Participating in industry/HR committees to seek out and implement 'best practices’ Provide data and analysis to support multiple HR projects & ensure timely completion  Qualifications: 3-7 years of front line (retail) investigation experience dealing with complex human factors and conflict resolution is a must have; 3-7 years of HR generalist experience supporting retail or another high volume front line organization Post-secondary degree with concentration in business/Human Resources or CHRP designation a strong asset Specialized investigation training considered a strong asset Bilingual considered a strong asset Demonstrated interpersonal and communication skills to effectively influence and build strong relationships with multiple stakeholders and confidential/sensitive information Ability to diagnose complex employee relations issues; Comfortable with change and managing to tight timelines; Proven ability to influence and build strong client relationships with mangers and peers; Results orientation. Highly organized with the ability to multi-task. Excellent facilitation/presentation skills. Job_Description: EAM Developer/ Analyst - Consultant Reference: 2596  Sierra Systems is currently seeking a strong EAM Developer/Analyst to join our Nation-Wide practice. This position will work closely with the Application Development Team, as well as other 3rd party development consultants. The EAM Developer / Analyst position is responsible for providing technical support and management for our client’s implementation. The consultant will work with management, business users and other consultants to support and enhance functionality in the Infor EAM system. Configurations will be based on business/functional requirements, design specifications and software updates as needed.  Key Areas of Responsibility  Work with management, business users and other consultants to add or enhance functionality in the Infor EAM system. Configurations will be based on business/functional requirements, design specifications and software updates as needed. Identify opportunities that can improve the efficiency of business processes. The position will support & develop technical elements of the client’s EAM solution, including database code. Design and development of integration solutions, allowing EAM to work efficiently with other enterprise systems such as ERP; integrating Infor EAM to other external systems such as PeopleSoft. Assist in Investigating and resolving application functionality related issues. Assist in troubleshooting software application issues. Assist network administrator with application installation and testing. Troubleshoot technical issues and identify modifications needed in existing applications to meet changing user requirements. Technical support of client during User Acceptance testing, End-user Training and assist the customers in cutover. Analyze the database and identify data integrity issues with existing and proposed systems and implement solutions. Assist in documenting technical procedures and how-to procedures for the applications including operations, user guide, etc. Professional Qualifications & Experience  Minimum of 3-5 years of technology experience with at least 3 years hands-on technical roles in the field and relies on experience and judgment to plan and accomplish goals. Knowledge of data processing, and enterprise software applications. 5 + years of experience with Infor EAM and knowledge of the Infor EAM system architecture: event tables, drivers, import/export triggers, code, XML (Extensible Markup Language) documents, and Integration Server. 5 + years of technology-related support experience in Asset Management solutions other than Infor EAM such as Maximo, Oracle EAM, Ventyx, SAP will be considered. Technical experience with systems networking, databases, web development, and user support. Good background in database design and data analysis in Microsoft SQL and Access. Microsoft SQL Server database scripts, views, and queries. Proficiency in extending Infor EAM through Extensibility Framework. Working knowledge of XML data and schemas. Experience creating reports using Cognos. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills. Self-motivated with the ability to prioritize, meet deadlines, and manage changing priorities. Proven ability to be flexible and work hard, both independently and in a team environment. Post-secondary degree in computer science or related field or a combination of related experience and education. _______________________ Who we are  Headquartered in Vancouver, British Columbia and founded in 1966, Sierra Systems is a top tier IT services and management consulting firm offering a full range of advisory services, systems integration, and managed application services. With approximately 800 professionals across Canada, Sierra Systems has developed deep expertise in its targeted industries and has earned a reputation for delivering superior solutions that strengthen organizations’ operational performance.  Our unwavering commitment to our clients’ needs has allowed us to build long-term, trusting, and loyal relationships. It has given us the ability to set ambitious objectives for client projects and meet them time and time again with unparalleled speed and precision.  We offer a full range of management consulting, systems integration and managed services tailored to the unique needs of each industry in which we have deep expertise – including: Canadian government, justice, health, energy, and the commercial sector. We focus on delivering a boutique experience backed by the resources, deep knowledge, and expertise our 50-year heritage provides to tackle large scale projects.  What to expect  Sierra Systems is committed to a working environment that fosters professional and personal progression, communication, and collaboration. We offer opportunities for personal growth and professional development at every career level.  We are regularly recognized as a Top Employer , in part due to the compensation and benefits packages we offer which are just one of the many great reasons to join Sierra Systems. www.SierraSystems.com | Facebook | LinkedIn | Twitter | Glassdoor |
Title: EAM Developer Analyst

Title: Senior Analyst, Corporate Advisory Tax

Job_Description: Devon Canada Corporation is the Canadian operating division of Oklahoma-based Devon Energy Corporation, a leading independent energy company. Devon’s Canadian head office is located in Calgary, Alberta with approximately 1,500 employees who support the development and operations of world-class heavy oil properties in northeastern Alberta. Our strong entrepreneurial spirit, together with a culture of empowerment, integrity and innovation create opportunities to grow and succeed and have put us on Fortune 100 Best Places to Work list for seven straight years. Information Technology Co-op Student Calgary Office Devon Canada Corporation is an experienced player in heavy oil, with more than 20 years of cold flow heavy oil production in Lloydminster and Bonnyville, Alberta, and steam assisted gravity drainage (SAGD) heavy oil operations in the Athabasca region of northeastern Alberta. Exponential growth in our Jackfish 1, 2 and 3 operations has led to in excess of 100,000 BOED of best-in-class production. Devon Canada knows heavy oil – and it’s what we do best. We pioneered using saline water in the SAGD process, completely eliminating the use of fresh water in our operations and we have the most vigorous wildlife monitoring program in the industry. We are committed to maximizing our assets and finding solutions to help us work faster, safer and better. We’ve made the list of Fortune 100’s Best Companies to Work For for seven straight years. Just watch where we go from here. www.devonenergy.com This 8-month co-op student position will provide a well-rounded IT experience with opportunities to learn about multiple roles. The position will commence on September 4, 2018 and is based in Calgary, Alberta. Duties & Responsibilities Analyst Participate in requirement gathering sessions with stakeholders Become familiar with Devon’s SDLC (System Development Lifecycle) through the documentation of Opportunity Evaluations, Business Cases, Business Requirements, Process Flows and Diagrams. Facilitate the training, documentation and support of technology users as required Participate in testing and quality assurance procedures Query generation, maintenance, and design of reports and analyses using business intelligence technologies and platforms like Spotfire and Power BI Work with stakeholders to identify opportunities for enhancements, and facilitate the creation of changes to existing or new workflows and establish related best practices Developer Provide applications development and enhancement functions in the support of the Devon systems environment. Includes analysis, design, coding, testing, and deployments of web, SharePoint and Windows applications Work with business analysts and technical architects to formalize specifications for custom development Attend Knowledge Transfer sessions for all custom work developed prior to release of their duties from the projects Develop and enhance custom solutions using approved technologies and platforms Document and perform unit, string, integration, and regression testing in support of new implementations and releases Qualifications Currently enrolled in an Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, Software Engineering, or Computer Engineering program returning to school in 2018 Personal commitment to safety Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills Ability to present thoughts and ideas clearly and effectively Strong analytical skills Oil & Gas industry experience is beneficial but not required Enjoys working in a team environment Be a self-starter and recognize when issues need to be raised Time management and task prioritization skills. Willingness to travel to field site locations. Why work for Devon? Devon Energy’s core values emphasize openness, teamwork and results. Students who work at Devon Energy experience: work-life balance, a fun working environment, consideration for long-term employment, an “open-door” office environment, the opportunity to learn and enhance skills, and working for a successful company that maintains a “small company” work environment. For more information on Devon Energy visit devonenergy.com. Application Process: Individuals interested in pursuing this opportunity are encouraged to submit their resume, cover letter and transcripts at devonenergy.com. Applicants must be legally eligible to work in Canada. We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only those selected for interviews will be contacted.
Title: Information Technology Coop Student

Job_Description: Broaden your horizons with bright ideas  The Opportunity: Senior Security Analyst / Architect Secures enterprise information by determining security requirements; planning, implementing, and testing security systems; preparing security standards, policies, and procedures; mentoring team members. Responsibilities: Perform cybersecurity maturity assessment using well-known frameworks such as NIST, ISO 27001, ISF Enhances security team accomplishments and competence by planning delivery of solutions; answering technical and procedural questions for less experienced team members; teaching improved processes; mentoring team members. Determines security requirements by evaluating business strategies and requirements; researching information security standards; conducting system security and vulnerability analyses and risk assessments; studying architecture/platform; identifying integration issues; preparing cost estimates. Plans security systems by evaluating network and security technologies; developing requirements for local area networks (LANs), wide area networks (WANs), virtual private networks (VPNs), routers, firewalls, and related security and network devices; designs public key infrastructures (PKIs), including use of certification authorities (CAs) and digital signatures as well as hardware and software; adhering to industry standards. Implements security systems by specifying intrusion detection methodologies and equipment; directing equipment and software installation and calibration; preparing preventive and reactive measures; creating, transmitting, and maintaining keys; providing technical support; completing documentation. Verifies security systems by developing and implementing test scripts. Maintains security by monitoring and ensuring compliance to standards, policies, and procedures; conducting incident response analyses; developing and conducting training programs. Upgrades security systems by monitoring security environment; identifying security gaps; evaluating and implementing enhancements. Prepares system security reports by collecting, analyzing, and summarizing data and trends. Updates job knowledge by tracking and understanding emerging security practices and standards; participating in educational opportunities; reading professional publications; maintaining personal networks; participating in professional organizations. Enhances department and organization reputation by accepting ownership for accomplishing new and different requests; exploring opportunities to add value to job accomplishments. Requirements:  Network Security, Network Hardware Configuration, Network Protocols, Networking Standards, Supervision, Conceptual Skills, Functional and Technical Skills, Dependability, Information Security Policies, SANS, IAM, CISSP. PwC is committed to building a diverse workforce representative of the communities we serve. We encourage and are pleased to consider all qualified candidates, without regard to race, colour, citizenship, religion, sex, marital / family status, sexual orientation, gender identity, aboriginal status, age, disability or persons who may require an accommodation, to apply.  PwC: the Opportunity of a Lifetime
Title: Senior Security Analyst / Architect

Job_Description: At Paysafe, we are building the future in payments – an ever-evolving platform that meets the needs and expectations of tomorrow's businesses and consumers. We’re a global provider of online and mobile payment processing services to thousands of companies and millions of consumers. From cash to digital currency; from all-in-one processing to multi-currency consumer wallets and remittance; from order-ahead mobile apps to consumer credit solutions, our unique portfolio for merchants, partners, developers and consumers comprises industry-leading capabilities in payment processing, digital wallets and online cash solutions. But we’re much more than that. We offer people confidence and convenience when they buy and pay online. And we help companies win and keep more customers by improving the services they provide. Having been at the centre of innovation in payments since 1996, we understand how to stay ahead of the curve. How to anticipate new customer needs. How to react to changes in regulation. How to leverage new technologies. How to adapt and be agile. This is what defines us. That’s why at Paysafe, you will see a portfolio and set of capabilities that is always growing. Never standing still, never complacent. Our staff of over 2000 includes more than 40 nationalities, based at our offices throughout Europe and North America. We are all working towards the Paysafe vision of becoming the world’s favourite payments provider. The Candidate: We’re seeking an intermediate to senior range front-end developer to join our team. Your responsibilities include: Creating a beautiful front-end experience. Provide expertise with HTML 5, (S)CSS, JavaScript, Angular, RxJS, as well as other client-side technologies. Writing maintainable, tested, and well documented client-side code that adhere to best practices. Translate visual and written designs into efficient reusable Angular components. Liaise with UX Team, Development, Test Analysts, Product Management, and Project Management. Ability to quickly ramp up on and apply new technologies and processes. Advocating delivery and maintenance in terms of technical feasibility, value, and complexity.  Do you have? Strong knowledge of HTML 5, (S)CSS and JavaScript. Experience with modern SPA frameworks such as Angular, React, VueJs, Ember, etc. Minimum of 3 years’ experience focusing on front-end development and implementation. Experience with front-end build tools, such as NPM, Yarn, Gulp, etc. Experience with responsive design/development. Working with code repositories such as GIT or SVN. Excellent analytical and problem-solving abilities. Great attention to detail. Excellent verbal and written communication skills. (Bonus) Experience in Java Development (Bonus) Experience in SQL  Technologies we use: Angular 2+ Typescript/Javascript CSS/SCSS RxJS Protractor/Karma/Jasmine Webpack/SystemJS npm/gulp  What’s in it for you? Enjoy working in a highly collaborative environment Competitive salary and bonus package Full benefits (health, dental and vision) RRSP matching and share purchase program Lively, open workspace Casual dress code
Title: Front End Developer

Job_Description: Senior Software Engineer, Product Development and Delivery  Summary We are seeking an outstanding Senior Software Engineer to develop commercial software solutions within the Identity and Access Management (IAM) domain. Incumbents in this role have thorough knowledge in multiple development technologies across the entire technology stack (end to end). This Senior Software Engineer will be expected to learn and apply a broad spectrum of programming languages, design principles, tools and technologies in developing solutions. This individual will be working directly with emerging Cloud technologies on a highly visible business-critical platform; providing substantial opportunity for technical skills development and career growth.  General Job Duties Participate as part of a project team to design, code, test, and implement moderately complex software solutions. Foster inter-team cooperation as part of a project/program. Follow industry good coding practices to ensure high quality deliverables with minimal defects. Follow established testing procedures to ensure application is thoroughly tested throughout the development phase. Report to management on project status, identify issues that may impede attainment of goals, and accept direction on corrective measures. Provide technical direction to more junior Software Development Personnel. Continuously expand knowledge in areas of specialization. Perform other duties as required. Specific Job Duties Operate as a Senior Software Engineer in a .NET development team for a software platform that provides Identity and Access Management (IAM) services across other business platforms. Assist in analyzing customer requirements and providing robust technical designs to drive software implementation. Support leadership in implementing best practices for software development around coding standards, patterns, and software development lifecycle and change management. Support and champion the Agile Scrum development methodology. Collaborate with Development Leads, Developers, Product Managers, Business Analysts, and IT Leadership. Education/Experience Requirements Bachelors in Computer Science, related field or equivalent experience. 7+ years of experience in software development. Thorough knowledge of technologies primarily in the Microsoft development stack, such as C# ASP .Net MVC, WCF, and SQL Server. Thorough knowledge of web development technologies, such Javascript, CSS, HTML. Specifically, JQuery, AngularJS, and Bootstrap. Thorough understanding on web development concepts, such as RESTful services and Cross-browser compatibility. Thorough understanding on design principles such as Object Oriented Design, SOLID Principles, and various Design Patterns. Thorough understanding on Test Driven Development Demonstrated ability to engage self-guided analysis and problem solving. Working knowledge of Agile development methodologies. Ability to effectively communicate technical information to both technical and non-technical personnel. Passion and curiosity for challenging technical problems Working knowledge of Java is a plus. Professional certification is a plus. AWS knowledge is a major plus. Occasional travel may be required. Organizational Relationships Reports to Development Lead. Acts as a major contributor on programs of all sizes. Interacts with other colleagues at all levels in the conduct of day-to-day activities. External Relationships Actively participates in industry forums and user groups. FLSA Status – US Only Exempt It is the policy of IHS Markit to provide equal employment opportunity (EEO) to all persons regardless of age, color, national origin, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, race, religion, creed, gender, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, genetic information, marital status, status with regard to public assistance, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law. In addition, IHS Markit will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities. We maintain a drug-free workplace. For candidates in the US, we are a participant in E-Verify (see link below).  EEO is the Law EEO is the Law Supplement Right to Work Pay Transparency Policy E-Verify   Current Colleagues If you are currently a colleague with IHS Markit please apply internally via Workday.
Title: Sr. Software Developer

Job_Description: Interested in being a part of a team that is leading the digital evolution of retail in Canada?  Embracing and driving change is critical to our success. The complexity and rate at which the retail industry is transforming has increased exponentially in recent years and we are committed to being a leader in the industry.  As such we are relentlessly focused on innovating at every level of our business, investing in new technologies and products, and doubling down on the best talent to drive the company forward. It is an especially exciting time to join the Canadian Tire Family of Companies as a Senior Software Developer at Canada’s premier sporting goods retailer, FGL. FGL owns the most recognizable sporting goods brands in the country including Sport Chek, Sports Experts, National Sports, Pro Hockey Life and Atmosphere.  What you’ll do  In this role, you will be expected to: Collaborate actively with the business analyst (BA) in the design of:  Fully integrated systems, which may include applications, databases, and related systems  Alternative solutions to existing applications  Effective and efficient interfaces to systems, applications, and databases  Conduct feasibility studies, proof-of-concept prototypes  Provide high-level development during the initial stages of a project  Provide & meet estimated time of accomplishment for assigned tasks  Evaluate and enhance the efficiency of existing programs, anticipating future user needs  Ensure system integrity, efficiency, and security  Provide and supervise unit, integrated, and volume testing  Maintain and support assigned systems to ensure minimal downtime and loss of productivity, service  Maintain and support associated databases, models, and technical documentation  Lead a small team of developers to achieve the above goals  Who you are  We are looking for a high performing individual who: Possesses an entrepreneurial spirit, a bias for action, and a desire to work with key stakeholders to drive innovation in the retail environment and in-store e-commerce;  Is direct and truthful, and builds trust and credibility with co-workers, vendors, and customers by consistently adhering to the organization’s business principles and values  Demonstrates a desire to help and is proactive, responsive, and focused on discovering, anticipating, and exceeding the customer’s needs  Is committed to results by taking personal responsibility for achieving mutually agreed upon individual/team objectives, and working collaboratively and cooperatively with others to achieve shared goals and objective  Considers the wider team, function, banner or the organization and takes action or makes decisions which support the success of those groups  Recovers quickly after change, disruptions, or mistakes and can remain productive and focused  Is adaptable and can apply lessons learned in one situation to another situation  If you’re curious, ready to take on new challenges and open to doing things differently to help us evolve rapidly, then FGL Sports is definitely the place to be  What you’ve done  Minimum 10 years of experience as a developer  5+ years working experience designing and building applications using Java  Fundamental understanding of Java design concepts and design patterns  Strong understanding of the J2EE ecosystem including proven experience with Application Servers (Apache Tomcat) and standard Java technologies such as JNDI, JMS, JMX, and the Spring Framework  Experience with the MEAN stack (MongoDB/MariaDB, Express, Angular, Node.js)  Experience building and debugging client/server Internet systems and architecture  Strong understanding of Git  Solid knowledge of at least one SQL programming environment  SQL Server 2005-2012  Oracle 9i-12c  MariaDB or MySQL 10  Experience in native Android application development  Android Studio, Gradle, Maven  User Interfaces Layouts  SQLite  Local Services, External Services, Content Providers, Account Manager Integration Spring Mobile, Corodva (nice to have)  Proficient understanding of Linux operating systems (RHEL 6.x, 7.x) and development environments  Understanding of security, encryption, and compression best practice  Experience developing and deploying to at least one cloud platform  AWS  Azure  Google Cloud  Kubernetes/Docker  Experience with DevOps environments  Bamboo, Jenkins, Ansible  Why us  Canadian Tire is one of Canada’s most iconic and diversified companies. Our culture and values uphold our pledge to sustainable practices, and the commitment to our local communities through Jumpstart cannot be beat.  To learn more about this team and the Canadian Tire Family of Companies follow us on LinkedIn.  FGL Sports is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace for all. We recognize that our future success depends on the perspectives and contributions of all our employees - their diverse backgrounds, abilities and experiences make our business stronger. If you are contacted for a job opportunity, please advise us of any accommodations needed to ensure fair and equitable access throughout the recruitment and selection process. All accommodation information provided will be treated as confidential and used only for the purpose of providing an accessible candidate experience. Liaise with architecture to ensure other non-functional requirements are considered (i.e. security, compatibility, maintainability)Create necessary documentation and deliver knowledge transfer sessionsProvide SAP Payroll / EC Payroll (Cloud) and Timekeeping technical support and problem resolutionSupport maintenance of tax tables and setup to ensure compliance with federal, state, and local regulationsServe as an HR/Payroll team Business Intelligence (BI) resource/support, including coordination with the BI lead resource for requirements analysis, data modeling, testing, security, integration and query developmentPayroll SupportSupports the Payroll Manager(s) in payroll processing to ensure payroll deadlines are metRun ad hoc reports to extract payroll data as needed as approved by the Payroll Manager and/or Director Total Rewards & NA Payroll.Assist in establishing priorities and meeting project deadlinesMaintain accurate and sufficient testing documentationSafeguard and ensure confidentiality of HR and payroll dataRequired SkillsBachelor’s degree or equivalent experience.Minimum five (5) years’ experience in business operations or HR/Payroll Business Support.Experience in supporting a corporate payroll environmentExperience with time keeping solutions is requiredPayroll knowledge required; tax knowledge preferredExperience in configuring and implementing HCM modules in SAP (ECC, workflow and Business Warehouse), or a similar ERP system preferredExperience with testing and problem solving within the SAP Payroll / EC Payroll system preferredWork experience in an industrial / shift worker environment is considered an assetHiring for this position is ongoing and will be filled as required. To be considered for this position, please apply today.In order to be eligible for this position, you must be legally entitled to work in Canada for our Company.There has never been a better time to join the Canfor Information Technology team and become a part of the modern forest industry. We have a wide range of rewarding and innovative careers in some of the best communities in North America, with plenty of room for advancement. We offer competitive compensation and benefits packages, and are committed to the professional development of our employees.Follow us on LinkedIn , Twitter , and Facebook for Canfor news, career opportunities, and upcoming events!Vancouver, BCThe city of Vancouver is both a natural beauty and a progressive urban centre, a rare place on earth that is idyllic and electric all at once. With one of Canada’s mildest climates, Vancouver is ideally suited for those devoted to outdoor pursuits, health and wellness. Along with its endless supply of fresh air and clean water, Vancouver also boasts countless choices for culturally diverse, world-class cuisine and an inventory of arts and entertainment events. Job_Description: Inter Pipeline is a major petroleum transportation, storage and natural gas liquids processing business that ranks among the largest energy infrastructure companies in Canada. We are proud to be named one of Alberta’s Top 70 Employers, which recognizes Alberta businesses that lead their industries by being exceptional places to work.  Located out of our Calgary office, the individual in the Senior Business Analyst role will report to the Supervisor, Finance Solutions Centre. The successful candidate will be responsible for the stewardship of finance master data and project support within SAP for Inter Pipeline, as well indirect leadership of the Business Analyst.  Key Activities and Responsibilities: Review and ongoing improvement of master data creation/change approval processes Leadership of the Business Analyst role, utilizing a team accountability approach for facilitating finance master data creation/changes Work with the business and SAP Competency Centre to develop Service Level Agreements (SLAs), key performance indicators (KPIs) and other metrics for SAP finance master data Act as a data steward bringing forward cross-functional data quality and process integration issues and working collaboratively to solve them, championing the collective management of data governance Serve as a central point of contact for finance data governance understanding and providing direction and training to data consumers and producers from the business in line with business rules Ensure the right stakeholders across the enterprise (e.g. operations, finance, supply chain, etc.) are brought into make business process improvements which mitigate data issues Bring best practices in master data management and propose opportunities for improvement Interaction with SAP Competency Center on future system enhancements, builds, testing, and roll-outs Assist with development and usage of SAP reports  Education, Skills and Experience: Undergraduate diploma or degree in business with 5+ years of progressive experience in financial system support, CPA (CA, CMA, CGA) designation is an asset Strong finance expertise on master data usage, configuration, and integrated data requirements/linkage points combined with prior oil and gas experience considered an asset In depth knowledge of SAP FI_CO and Business Warehouse, experience with S/4HANA and Fiori an asset Approaches work with a high level of curiosity and aptitude to identify and solve problems, takes initiative, is accountable, and works independently Change agent who can persuade and influence stakeholders to establish new processes, shift to automation, and provide innovative solutions Ability to manage internal and external relationships with well-developed interpersonal, team, customer service and communication skills (both written and verbal) Strong customer service skills in working with internal departments to achieve results through relationships with people and teams Able to work well in a fast-paced, growth environment, with strong attention to detail and accuracy Maintains strong initiative and possesses superior analytical skills

Job_Description: Interested in being a part of a team that is leading the digital evolution of retail in Canada?  Embracing and driving change is critical to our success. The complexity and rate at which the retail industry is transforming has increased exponentially in recent years and we are committed to being a leader in the industry.  As such we are relentlessly focused on innovating at every level of our business, investing in new technologies and products, and doubling down on the best talent to drive the company forward. It is an especially exciting time to join the Canadian Tire Family of Companies as a Senior Software Developer at Canada’s premier sporting goods retailer, FGL. FGL owns the most recognizable sporting goods brands in the country including Sport Chek, Sports Experts, National Sports, Pro Hockey Life and Atmosphere.  What you’ll do  In this role, you will be expected to: Collaborate actively with the business analyst (BA) in the design of:  Fully integrated systems, which may include applications, databases, and related systems  Alternative solutions to existing applications  Effective and efficient interfaces to systems, applications, and databases  Conduct feasibility studies, proof-of-concept prototypes  Provide high-level development during the initial stages of a project  Provide & meet estimated time of accomplishment for assigned tasks  Evaluate and enhance the efficiency of existing programs, anticipating future user needs  Ensure system integrity, efficiency, and security  Provide and supervise unit, integrated, and volume testing  Maintain and support assigned systems to ensure minimal downtime and loss of productivity, service  Maintain and support associated databases, models, and technical documentation  Lead a small team of developers to achieve the above goals  Who you are  We are looking for a high performing individual who: Possesses an entrepreneurial spirit, a bias for action, and a desire to work with key stakeholders to drive innovation in the retail environment and in-store e-commerce;  Is direct and truthful, and builds trust and credibility with co-workers, vendors, and customers by consistently adhering to the organization’s business principles and values  Demonstrates a desire to help and is proactive, responsive, and focused on discovering, anticipating, and exceeding the customer’s needs  Is committed to results by taking personal responsibility for achieving mutually agreed upon individual/team objectives, and working collaboratively and cooperatively with others to achieve shared goals and objective  Considers the wider team, function, banner or the organization and takes action or makes decisions which support the success of those groups  Recovers quickly after change, disruptions, or mistakes and can remain productive and focused  Is adaptable and can apply lessons learned in one situation to another situation  If you’re curious, ready to take on new challenges and open to doing things differently to help us evolve rapidly, then FGL Sports is definitely the place to be  What you’ve done  Minimum 10 years of experience as a developer  5+ years working experience designing and building applications using Java  Fundamental understanding of Java design concepts and design patterns  Strong understanding of the J2EE ecosystem including proven experience with Application Servers (Apache Tomcat) and standard Java technologies such as JNDI, JMS, JMX, and the Spring Framework  Experience with the MEAN stack (MongoDB/MariaDB, Express, Angular, Node.js)  Experience building and debugging client/server Internet systems and architecture  Strong understanding of Git  Solid knowledge of at least one SQL programming environment  SQL Server 2005-2012  Oracle 9i-12c  MariaDB or MySQL 10  Experience in native Android application development  Android Studio, Gradle, Maven  User Interfaces Layouts  SQLite  Local Services, External Services, Content Providers, Account Manager Integration Spring Mobile, Corodva (nice to have)  Proficient understanding of Linux operating systems (RHEL 6.x, 7.x) and development environments  Understanding of security, encryption, and compression best practice  Experience developing and deploying to at least one cloud platform  AWS  Azure  Google Cloud  Kubernetes/Docker  Experience with DevOps environments  Bamboo, Jenkins, Ansible  Why us  Canadian Tire is one of Canada’s most iconic and diversified companies. Our culture and values uphold our pledge to sustainable practices, and the commitment to our local communities through Jumpstart cannot be beat.  To learn more about this team and the Canadian Tire Family of Companies follow us on LinkedIn.  FGL Sports is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace for all. We recognize that our future success depends on the perspectives and contributions of all our employees - their diverse backgrounds, abilities and experiences make our business stronger. If you are contacted for a job opportunity, please advise us of any accommodations needed to ensure fair and equitable access throughout the recruitment and selection process. All accommodation information provided will be treated as confidential and used only for the purpose of providing an accessible candidate experience. Must Have Primary Skills : Excellent time management, organizational and prioritization skills. Excellent interpersonal skill. Ability to work with minimal supervision. Ability to collaborate and communicate effectively and tactfully with both business-oriented executives and technology-oriented personnel. Ability to work independently and as part of a collaborative team.   Proven Experience In : Scope, but not limited to: Security Analyst/Project resource for Digital Team for all project efforts. This position is responsible for providing general support for the office of Information Security, as well as performing security activities pertaining to Information Security under the direction of the Sr. Manager – Security Operations. The incumbent is expected to have an in-depth expertise and knowledge in the areas of information and network security. Work with IT Operations on the alignment and implementation of Information Security recommendations. Work on Assigned Information Technology projects as the Information Security Subject Matter Expert (SME). IND1 Skills Soft Skills Experience In at least 5 years of experience with/in Security Information & Event Management (SIEM) Software Experience In at least 5 years of experience with/in IDS/IPS Technologies Industry experience required: Banking
