Job_Description: Job Type: Permanent Primary Location: Calgary, Alberta, Canada All Available Locations: Calgary  Role Description  Remarkable people. Remarkable work. Remarkable career. At Deloitte, we recognize that the days of one set path to career success are long over. We offer you the flexibility and choice to customize a work experience that fuels your passions, strengths and ambitions. We also try to ensure there are plenty of occasions to have fun, relax, play, exercise, and build relationships. At Deloitte, we are redefining what it means to be a professional services firm. We are all about ‘remarkable’: Remarkable people. Remarkable work. Remarkable career. ( Even our workplace is remarkable! ) The team Our HR Transformation (HRT) practice is leading the way when it comes to helping clients make sense of and draw insights from the rapid changes happening in the market. From being digital, to employee experience, to robotic process automation and the future of work: it is no longer enough to be strategic, HR needs to be the agent of change and innovation, win the war for talent and embrace the workforce disruption. Our ability to provide end-to-end services to our clients – from helping them envision where they want to go, to technology selection and solution design, straight through to implementation – makes us a standout in the market place (analysts consistently rate us as the leading firm in Canada and globally!). The roadmap to becoming a high-impact HR organization has never been more complex, and yet, it has never been more exciting to play in this space. Possibilities are limitless. The role As a Manager, you will play a key role in how we deliver our services to clients across a breadth of industries. You will have the opportunity to leverage leading research, analytics, technology and industry insights to impact the future of work and provide strategic and business-focused solutions to our clients. You will be part of a team that loves collaborating, taking on challenges and exceeding expectations. No two days are ever the same, but here is a sample of some of the work you might do in this role: build the infrastructure for new HR capabilities like predictive analytics, robotic process automation and employee experience; deliver engagements that advance strategic HR transformation for clients; develop and maintain client relationships and lead projects from planning through execution; consult with clients to increase effectiveness and reduce costs of HR service delivery through improved processes and technologies; participate in the selection, design and implementation of technology-enabled business and HR solutions for clients.  Who you are Growing your career and future at Deloitte is within your hands and here is how you’ll succeed: You are genuinely passionate about HR, keeping up with trends, having your own point of view on what HR will look like in 10 to 15 years, and staying connected with what is happening in the market today, from an employee and an employer perspective. You demonstrate social perceptiveness, by being aware of others’ reactions and understanding why they react as they do by listening well and encouraging an open exchange of information and ideas using the appropriate communication tools. You have a design mindset, delivering a unique and customized customer service solution by using logic, imagination, intuition, and systemic reasoning to explore possibilities of what could be and by as a means of creating the desired outcomes that benefit the end user. You lead from the heart and with a purpose. You understand what drives those around you, you push them to do their best and you provide your teams with challenging and meaningful opportunities. You’re able to influence clients, teams and individuals positively , leading by example and truly understanding their needs . You project confidence, optimism, energy and credibility internally and externally. The essentials You have a bachelor’s degree in a related field. Master’s degree, CHRP and PMP designations are all attributes we are looking for, but if you have not acquired one yet, we are happy to help you to! You have a successful career including progressively responsible roles in management and/or consulting. You are experienced in leading teams of varying sizes that work with tight deadlines and with a high standard quality of work. You have experience in playing a project manager role and being able to deliver the full cycle of project management accountabilities. You are able to travel within Canada, US and, on occasion, internationally. Join our team, share your strengths and dare to explore what a remarkable future could mean for you at Deloitte ! Why Deloitte? Launch your career with The One Firm where you can make a greater impact than you ever thought possible. With endless opportunities at every turn, and a culture built to support and drive our people to be the very best they can be, Deloitte is The One Firm for you to learn, grow, create, and lead. At Deloitte, we understand that everyone, and their career goals, are different. As a firm, we help create the conditions and opportunities that will enable our people to thrive – both professionally and personally. We do this by making three commitments to our people: You will lead at every level: We grow the world’s best leaders so you can achieve the impact you seek, faster. You can work your way: We give you the means to work how you want, and we have innovative spaces and the mindset to help you be wildly successful. You will feel included and inspired: We create a deep sense of belonging where you can bring your whole self to work. Apply now and let us show you how to push your career to the next level at Deloitte. The One Firm. For You. Deloitte is an inclusive employer dedicated to building a diverse workforce. We encourage applications from all qualified candidates and will accommodate applicants’ needs under the respective provincial human rights codes throughout all stages of the recruitment and selection process. Please advise the Recruiter to ensure your accessibility needs are accommodated throughout this process. Information received relating to accommodation will be addressed confidentially. We thank all applicants in advance for their interest; however, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted 34642

asset Experience and knowledge of the deployment, maintenance, and use of the EnCase Enterprise, eDiscovery, and Cybersecurity forensic applications is an asset Professional designation in information security, control and governance, and digital forensics (CISA, CISSP, CISM, CPA, ENCE, GIAC Certifications) Strong understanding of Windows and Unix operating systems and command line tools Expertise in cyber security solutions including ArcSight, QRadar, NetWitness, FireEye, Damballa, etc. is an asset Expertise in security protection solutions including Firewall, Intrusion Detection/Protection Systems, Web Application Firewalls, Anti-Virus, and Application Whitelisting products Expertise in SIEM configuration/customization/support Knowledge of Operating System and Application Hardening with the ability to thrive in a fast-paced and dynamic environment Strong analytical and problem-solving skills Ability to present ideas and results to technical and non-technical audiences Why Job_Description: Our downtown client is looking for an Intermediate Information Security Analyst to prevent, detect and respond to potential security incidents. This is a 6 month initial contract, with the possibility of extension or permanent employment.  Position Overview Working as an integral part of a diverse Information Services Team, the successful candidate will be responsible for preventing, detecting and responding to potential security incidents involving Information (IS) and Operational Technology (OT) assets. The second purpose of this role is to assess IS security risks within the organizations environment and recommend mitigation controls to reduce risks to an acceptable level to satisfy business needs, regulatory requirements and industry best practices.  Summary of Responsibilities Provide and implement IS security recommendations for the company's systems, networks, applications and facilities based on business needs, regulatory requirements and industry best practices. Support the existing security infrastructure to ensure uninterrupted 24/7 operations. Conduct threat and risk assessments based on industry recognized methodologies. Help position the IS security department as a trusted advisory service for all electronic information, IS, and OT security matters. Collaborate with other business units to ensure we have assessed and mitigated security and compliance risks in line with committed governance programs and security policies. Ensure continuous improvement in security logging, monitoring and reporting. Qualifications Degree or diploma in Computer Science, or related discipline, or equivalent IS work experience. At least three to five years of hands on experience in an Information Security role. Experience establishing and maintaining security logging, monitoring and reporting solutions. Experience working with IDS/IPS, ATP, and SIEM solutions (Q Radar). Forescout network access control Entrust for 2 factor authentication Netskope Cloud Access Security Broker Check Point for Firewalls, VPN encription, and endpoint security SCADA and OT security experience considered a strong asset. GIAC and CISSP designations are a strong asset. Ability to solve complex technical problems quickly and completely. Strong desire to learn new technologies. Ability to communicate effectively, both verbally and in writing, to users and management. Strong organizational, multitasking and creative thinking skills. Ability to work periodic extended hours/after-hours work as projects/work load dictates. Ability to function within a fast paced team environment. Expertise and Skills Security, Security Analyst 5 - 7 years Priority Requirements Must-have: Briefly state your experience preventing, detecting and responding to potential security incidents involving Information (IS) and Operational Technology (OT) assets. Work Environment This is a 6 month contract position with the possibility of extension or permanent employment. The client is located in the downtown core.
Title: Intermediate Information Security Analyst to prevent, detect...

Job_Description: Calgary, AB  Job Summary  Reporting directly to the Integration Practice Lead, the Integration Architect will lead and work cooperatively with internal and 3rd party Integration developers to design, development, and support high quality integration solutions following industry and company standards that meet the objectives of the projects and our company. The successful candidate will be responsible and accountable for delivering high quality Integration solutions utilizing a number of tools and technologies and will exercise leadership through superior technical and domain knowledge along with consensus forming amongst the diverse Integration team.  Responsibilities   Gain a detailed understanding of two disparate and merging systems and interactions from a standpoint of architecture, design, technology, processes, and constraints Understand business problems in order to develop creative, innovative and practical solutions that deliver high quality services to business Design, develop, implement, document, and maintain high quality EAI solutions using appropriate Integration architectures and tools (ESB, Web Services, Message Brokers, Queues, Schedulers, ETL tools, PL/SQL, Stored Procedures, etc.). Collaborate with a team of architects, developers, analysts, and infrastructure and security engineers on defining overall EAI solutions and integration approaches Act as Integration team lead on various projects defining and overseeing Integration solutions while managing small teams successfully through the project lifecycle. Support the estimating/scoping of customer requirements and planning of deliverables for Integration work within multiple projects Manage the ‘day to day’ of the technical team throughout the lifecycle of a project. Report issues, risks and statuses effectively to supervisor(s) both written and verbally Be an integral part of and contribute regularly to the Integration Center of Excellence: Help establish and refine Integration standards and best practices. Provide input into EAI technology and architecture topology and roadmaps for continual evaluation of current state and plan future evolution and improvements Mentor and train Integration team members on integration technologies and designs patterns and conducting regular ongoing code and design reviews with the team Have a clear understanding of Company policy and standards, become an advocate of such standards and evolve in the spirit of continual improvement  Required Skills and Experience  Minimum of 10 years’ overall IT or software engineering experience preferably with the last 5 of those immersed in integration specific technology development  Experience leading implementation teams through full project lifecycle, architecture, design, development, delivery, etc.  Proven experience and success in major system integration projects using messaging middleware and database technologies  Strong general EAI knowledge, process design, and implementation concepts including both industry and technology trends  Modeling (Visio/Provision) and Documentation knowledge and experience   Able to work in a fast-paced dynamic team-oriented environment with minimal supervision Great communication (both written and verbal), organizational, and trouble-shooting skills  Desired Technical Skills:  Database: SQL, PL/SQL, Oracle and SQL server, JDBC General programming skills: XML and XSD, java, JMS, WSDL/SOAP, Web services, SOA Experience in TIBCO suite of middleware products such as TIBCO Business Works, TIBCO Integration Manager, TIBCO adapters, TIBCO HAWK, etc. an asset  ·   EXPERIENCE WITH DATASTAGE is an asset  Desired behaviors   Builds Trust and Credibility by consistently adhering to the organization’s business principles and values. Is seen as direct, truthful, and trustworthy by co-workers, vendors, and customers. Committed to results by taking personal responsibility for achieving mutually agreed upon individual/team objectives wearing multiple hats as required. Demonstrates a desire to help and serve internal/external customers to meet their needs. Is proactive, responsive, and focused on discovering, anticipating, and exceeding the customer’s needs. Works collaboratively and cooperatively with others to achieve shared goals and objectives. Considers the wider team, function, banner or the organization and takes action or makes decisions which support the success of those groups. Recovers quickly after change, disruptions, or mistakes and can remain productive and focused. Is adaptable and can apply lessons learned in one situation to another situation. Retail experience/knowledge would be an asset  Academic / Educational requirements  Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology or related area of expertise  Hiring contact: smears@tundratechnical.ca  Tundra Technical Solutions would like to thank you for the interest you have demonstrated in this opportunity. However, only candidates with the required skills will be contacted.  Tundra Technical Solutions is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. We welcome and encourage diversity in our workplace .  Not interested in this position, but know somebody who might be? Check out our Referral Reward Program, referrals are a big secret behind our success. As always, we’re on the lookout for great people. And we know that you know great people. Simply click on ‘Tell a Friend’ option to refer a friend.  Tundra Technical Solutions is among North America’s leading providers of Information Technology and Engineering staffing and consulting services. Our success and our clients’ success are built on a foundation of service excellence. Rather than continually trying to sell to new clients and companies and simply filling databases with candidates, we focus on developing stronger relationships and deeper knowledge of our existing clients’ challenges and opportunities.  Open ears. Open minds. Open futures  The Tundra team has over 600 years of experience, from a wide variety of disciplines – recruiting executives, business owners and technical consultants. Our combined experience ensures that your needs are covered from every possible direction.
Title: Integration Architect – Tibco / IIB / CDC / ESB / DataStage

Job_Description: Calgary, AB  Job Summary  Located in our Calgary, AB head office the Solution Architect is responsible for providing the integration and architectural framework that Project teams deliver within. Working on multiple projects, the Solution Architect provides appropriate solutions by participating in project definition and prioritization, validating requirements, determining solution alternatives, creating conceptual designs, and facilitating requirements traceability throughout the Systems Development Life Cycle (SDLC). They work with various Information Systems (IS) and business partners to design solutions that deliver recognizable business value.  Responsibilities  Partner with Engagement Managers and Business Analysts to conduct project investigation (examine feasibility; validate requirements; contribute to budget estimates and CBA's and recommend next steps)  Assist Vendor Management by leading the package/technology section of the RFx process  Research, develop and document solution alternatives, approaches and recommendations that address approved project or enhancement scope and business requirements  Ensure alignment with IS's Target State Architecture and Technology Roadmap, and leverage IS investments across the enterprise  When necessary, raise architecture exceptions and communicate to the Portfolio and Project teams  Work with Project Managers (PM's) to balance scope and quality with budget and schedule  Ensure teams understand the broader IT context and ramifications of decisions and approaches  Engage other IS stakeholders as required in order to ensure completeness of solution designs  Act as a representative (one of many) for their portfolio's interests in cross portfolio projects/programs  Contribute to the security risk assessments (risk identification, risk analysis, mitigation strategy) to assist the business in selecting the most appropriate solutions  Create project specific deliverables such as solution alternatives and recommendations, Solution Blueprint Documents, and the infrastructure requirements document  Present the solution alternatives and recommendation document and the solution blueprint document to business and IS stakeholders for approval  Participate in and review and approve project designs (e.g. High Level Designs, and Detailed Designs), Test Definitions and Implementation Strategies  Stay involved throughout project life cycle to resolve design issues and ensure projects deliver according to the approved designs  Contribute to the development and maintenance of Enterprise Architecture strategies, standards, principles, and patterns that can provide the framework for delivery of practical business solutions including all research and development activities.  Required Skills and Experience  University degree or College diploma or equivalent work experience  5-10 years IT experience in progressive analysis and design related positions  3+ years in an IT Architectural role  Broad technology expertise, and proven experience in conceptual, logical and physical design in one or more architectural discipline (e.g. Application, Integration, Data, Infrastructure, Security)  Experience working closely with both the Business and IS stakeholders, and proven experience in building and managing professional relationships and consensus-building throughout all levels of an organization  A strong understanding of Project Management and SDLC methodologies  Knowledge of Agile framework required; hands on practice with Agile is preferred  Adept at balancing the immediate needs of a project (business requirements and business strategy) with Enterprise Architecture standards and the declared IS target state to achieve a win-win situation  Team player with excellent communication and interpersonal skills  Exceptional skills in facilitating meetings, interviewing, probing and influencing others  Ability to create and deliver effective presentations and briefings up to Senior Management/Executive levels.  Academic / Educational requirements  University degree or College diploma or equivalent work experience. Job_Description: At Rogers we’re for supporting you on a journey to a rewarding career. Whether you’re a developer, an analyst, or a customer care consultant, Rogers is the place where ideas become reality. We embrace change, and find ways to do better. And we deliver on that commitment by fostering an environment of passion and innovation for all people.  Manager, Sales Performance, Western Canada  Role Summary: Reporting into the Sr. Manager, Commercial Sales Performance, the primary responsibilities of this position are to analyze, report on and drive improvements in Sales performance in Western Canada. The Sales Performance manager will work closely with the Regional Vice Presidents, Regional Sales Leadership, Account executives, Product, Marketing and Finance, to track and measure all performance indicators allowing the team to invest in areas of strength, improve areas of opportunities and deliver additional tools and associated measures of success.  Accountabilities: Develop and deliver reporting on regional sales performance and revenues Measure and deliver actionable sales performance insights and recommendations on a weekly, monthly and quarterly cadence with Regional Sales Leadership and sales teams Management of regional sales funnel and opportunities, including accurate transition through sales stages Ownership of weekly regional sales forecast cycle, and weekly review with regional sales leadership Manage tracking of sales activities measures in comparison to sales activity standards Champion sales activity standards and Salesforce.com hygiene to support optimal reporting and opportunity health management Facilitate annual sales quota development and delivery within region, followed by ongoing (through the year) management of compensation inquiries within the regional sales teams Establish linkage between regional sales activity and sales results; identifying sales activity and performance related risks and opportunities with actionable recommendations Track and maintain offers/ pricing performance, including delivery and execution of pricing initiatives within sales region Develop and manage campaign and ad-hoc reporting where required, to be leveraged within region and nationally Identify gaps and areas of improvement in Salesforce and other enablement tools to facilitate ongoing system optimization efforts Input into quarterly and annual targets, including sales volumes, churn, revenues and growth objectives  Critical Skills and Qualifications: Post-secondary degree. Preferred Bachelor of Commerce or Business Administration 3+ years of experience in program/ project management 5+ years of sales experience, performing at a high level of proficiency Strong planning, analytical, organizational, problem solving, decision making and time management skills Excellent interpersonal and communication skills (written and oral) Proven ability to deliver through cross- functional teams Extensive knowledge of communication industry i.e. products, services, systems, and tools Can comfortably handle risk and uncertainty and effectively cope with change Ability to develop business plans and provide clear direction on execution Ability to produce and interpret historical data and identify trends Demonstrated leadership and team-building skills Ability to manage multiple priorities and proven time management skills Ability to clearly communicate with all levels in the organization from VPs to frontline management Strong business and financial acumen Schedule: Full Time Shift: Day Length of Contract: Not Applicable (Regular Position) Work Location: 700-500 4 Ave S.W. (208), Calgary, AB Travel Requirements: Up to 10% Posting Category/Function: Sales & Account Management Requisition ID: 120854 WHY ROGERS? As a proud Canadian company, we're dedicated to making things easier for our customers. We’ve been embracing and leading change for over 50-years, and we’ll continue to seek out new opportunities to bring our customers simple solutions for today and tomorrow. We recognize that success is determined by the strength and diversity of our people. We work together because we want to win together, and these five shared values guide and define our work: Simplify and innovate Take ownership of the what and the how Equip people to succeed Execute with discipline and pride Talk straight, build trust, and over deliver Why Rogers? Because your tomorrow inspires our today. What makes us different makes us stronger. Rogers has a strong commitment to diversity and inclusion. Everyone who applies for a job will be considered. We recognize the business value in creating a workplace where each team member has the tools to reach their full potential. At Rogers, we value the insights and innovation that diverse teams bring to work. We work with our candidates with disabilities throughout the recruitment process to ensure that they have what they need to be at their best. Please reach out to our recruiters and hiring managers to begin a conversation about how we can ensure that you deliver your best work. You can also reach out to our team at RogersRecruiting@rci.rogers.com to begin a conversation about your individual accessibility needs throughout the hiring process. Job_Description: Eagle is currently seeking a Security Analyst . This is a seven (7) month, contract position scheduled to start in May.  Key Responsibilities  The successful candidate will be responsible for: Providing general support for the office of Information Security, as well as performing security activities pertaining to Information Security under the direction of the Sr. Manager – Security Operations;  Operational functions pertaining to Information Security;  System implementation, operational support and incident management response as required for the following Information Security systems:  Security Event Management (SIEM) System;  IDS/IPS;  Firewall Policy;  Anti-Virus/Anti-Malware;  Remote Access;  Vulnerability Scans;  Email Filtering;  Information Operating System & Application Patching;  Data Loss Protection;  Internet Content Filtering;  Participation in the Change Management Process;  Work with IT Operations on the alignment and implementation of Information Security recommendations; and,  Work on Assigned Information Technology projects as the Information Security Subject Matter Expert (SME).  Skills and Qualifications  The qualified candidate must have: Recognized Information Technology training – University/College degree/diploma or at least five (5) years working experience, or a combination of training and working experiences in Information Security;  Excellent time management, organizational and prioritization skills;  Excellent interpersonal skill;  Ability to work with minimal supervision;  Ability to conduct presentations and convey ideas from research;  Minimum five (5) years of combined IT related experience in different roles – including IT Administration and Support, Project Administration, Documentation maintenance, IT Security Administration and Security Support in the following areas: Computer Operations, Application Development, Network, Operating System Support, Architecture and Database Management within a distributed environment running Windows, AIX, Linux, and OSX;  Good working knowledge and experience in at least one or many of the following areas pertaining to Information Security: Security Event Management, IDS/IPS, ICF, email filtering, Firewalls, Virus, Application scanning software, Forensic software, Risk Management and Assessment software etc.;  Exceptional communication and advocacy skills, both verbal and written, with the ability to express complex and technical issues in clear and concise language;  Ability to collaborate and communicate effectively and tactfully with both business-oriented executives and technology-oriented personnel;  Ability to work independently and as part of a collaborative team;  Experience in mobile technologies including Enterprise Mobility Management (MDM), Blackberry, Android, iOS, and Windows Mobile (an asset); and,  CISSP (Certified Information Systems Security Professional) (an asset).  Don’t miss out on this opportunity, apply online today!  Eagle is an equal opportunity employer and will provide accommodations during the recruitment process upon request. We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only candidates under consideration will be contacted. Please note that your application does not signify the beginning of employment with Eagle and that employment with Eagle will only commence when placed on an assignment as a temporary employee of Eagle.
Title: Security Analyst

Job_Description: The Director, Credit Structuring is accountable for the formal approval process for the large and complex Commercial Banking credit transactions including (but not limited to) senior debt and cross-border-lending transactions, as well as specific industry verticals like Agriculture, Real Estate Finance, and Healthcare within their assigned community/ market.  The role is also accountable for the structuring and the integrity of credit granting, on a transactional basis thereby maintaining the quality of their assigned Commercial Banking loan portfolio and increasing efficiency and customer loyalty by decreasing required rework. As well, this role has been established to assist Upper Mid-Market Deal teams with structuring and underwriting all new business deals greater than $10MM non-CRE/Ag (<$10MM on exception) or with lending value deficit greater than $2MM. The DCS will be involved early in the deal process to assist and guide the deal team from discussion paper through funding. Responsible as part of that Community team for revenue targets and loyalty scores.  Other accountabilities include providing, enhancing and developing credit and structuring skills and capability within their LOB/Region/Community and assisting their Regional Vice-Presidents (Commercial) and their teams in complex deal structuring, coaching and delivery of select training for individuals and account management teams within their assigned responsibilities. Responsible for the identification of revenue opportunities and cross sell potential within their assigned portfolio. Must be able to apply current market practices when structuring. The DCS will have direct people management responsibilities in their Community for a team of Commercial Account Advisors, Community Analysts (those senior level CAs who are dedicated to the Upper-Mid-Market strategy) and the Senior Managers Training & Development.  The dual solid-line reporting structure to both the RVP-C and National Lead, Credit Structuring is required to recognize the dual-nature of this role – to support the Communities in the duties as noted in this job description, while conducting all operational work, risk management reviews, credit training and coaching, and credit policy and process support in alignment with and as directed from a programmatic perspective, from the National Lead, Credit Structuring, Commercial Banking. All performance evaluations, career discussions, and associated communications for the DCS will be conducted dually by both Senior Leaders.  Key Accountabilities  Risk Management Exercise discretionary lending limits as delegated by the Head of Credit Structuring, Commercial Banking to approve quality transactions which are in excess of the approval limits of the Commercial Account Managers. Ensuring credit decisions and recommendations are in accordance with sound credit-granting principles. Manage risk and minimize losses through monitoring and control reports, ensuring compliance requirements, and verifications are completed in accordance with Bank Policies & Procedures and regulatory, legal and ethical requirements. Monitor external environment for changing prospects and trends of key industries to ensure that emerging risks in the portfolio are identified and marketing efforts are directed to industries with acceptable risk profiles. Protect the Bank’s assets and maintain portfolio quality by adhering to Commercial lending processes, policies & procedures, legal and ethical requirements and regulations, audit requirements, and established risk guidelines. Ensure all business is in conformity with Bank Policies and prescribed guidelines. DCS signs off recommendation on all new business when >$10MM (non CRE/Ag) or LV Deficit >$2MM. Document and follow-up on any discrepancies to procedures, with significant operational risk and escalate as required. Maintain up-to-date knowledge and understanding of products, processes, and relevant legal, regulatory and technology requirements through audits and quality checks, to ensure decisions are adequately documented, and clearly communicated. Initiate engagement of appropriate Commercial Banking partners and Credit early in the process when significant deteriorating trends are evident, working with them to engage other BMO specialty roles &/or SAMU, as appropriate to ensure Bank assets are adequately protected. Ensure the growth of assigned core commercial portfolio / book of business in a manner that aligned to ERPM risk appetite. Attend customer meetings and site visitations as required jointly with Regional Vice President or Vice-President Commercial. Credit Training and Coaching Appraise credit capabilities of account management within assigned region(s) to identify gaps in general credit skills and training needs and recommend formal and informal training, as required. Support Commercial account management team in the attainment of targeted customer service levels. i.e. Net promoter scores. Support development of personnel by providing input to the Head of Credit Structuring and Institute for Learning on what is appropriate curriculum for the needs of the business. Initiate and/or lead internal training activities as required. Providing, enhancing and developing credit and structuring skills and capabilities within their community by providing coaching on advanced credit structuring. Responsible for the orientation, training and mentoring of new employees requiring credit qualification. Contribute to the effectiveness of the account management team by providing input to the performance evaluations and the identification of strengths, training gaps and development areas. Attend joint customer visitations as required with Regional Vice-President and/or Senior Management and provide coaching/feedback on customer negotiation and deal structuring skills. Provide input and guidance on recommendations regarding level of credit limits for account management. Credit Policies and Processes Support Ensure Bank Corporate Policies, Corporate Standards, Lending Directives, and Operating Procedures are interpreted correctly, and that lending transactions meet Bank requirements to ensure the Commercial Lending process functions effectively. This accountability includes providing guidance and assistance to leaders and lenders within Corporate Finance with respect to credit matters. Support the profitable utilization of Bank funds and development of specific financing proposals to meet customer and Bank requirements, while balancing the requirement for loan loss experience to be maintained within prescribed quality standards. Review and provide input to Head of Credit Structuring regarding commercial lending parameters and operating procedures based on changes in the market place. Participate and/or Lead projects assigned by Head, Credit Structuring relative to monitoring portfolio trends and analysis of risk. E.g. CaR, Geographical or Industry Concentrations, Portfolio Reviews for discussion with Senior Bank Executive. Qualifications Knowledge & Skills Business Acumen Business Valuation Risk Management Financial Understanding Analytical Thinking Change Leadership Conflict Management & Resolution Environmental Understanding Coaching/Mentoring Managerial Leadership Negotiation Problem Solving Relationship Management Sales & Service Processes Strategic Business Planning Credit adjudication experience Portfolio/Account Management experience Coaching/Mentoring/management experience People management experience an asset Credit Qualified with: Approval Limits of up $40MM (Risk Based Limits); Relief Limit for Vice President Commercial Banking Technical Product Knowledge: In-depth understanding of Commercial Products, Commercial Lending Process, Commercial Lending Directive, supporting processes and technology Expert knowledge of financial engineering, project financing, loan sales, securitization commensurate with carrying a $40 Million Discretionary limit. In-depth knowledge of all other Commercial Banking Lines of Business Expertise in key market segments to provide P&C with a current and longer-term perspective on each assigned industry Expert knowledge of BMO’s credit philosophy, policies and procedures Market Knowledge Understanding of financial, political, legislative and current events 3-5 year perspective on the evolution and prospects of key industries Education- CA/MBA/CFA or suitable work experience We’re here to help  At BMO we have a shared purpose; we put the customer at the centre of everything we do – helping people is in our DNA. For 200 years we have thought about the future—the future of our customers, our communities and our people. We help our customers and our communities by working together, innovating and pushing boundaries to bring them our very best every day. Together we’re changing the way people think about a bank.  As a member of the BMO team you are valued, respected and heard, and you have more ways to grow and make an impact. We strive to help you make an impact from day one – for yourself and our customers. We’ll support you with the tools and resources you need to reach new milestones, as you help our customers reach theirs. From in-depth training and coaching, to manager support and network-building opportunities, we’ll help you gain valuable experience, and broaden your skillset.  To find out more visit us at https://bmocareers.com .  BMO is committed to an inclusive, equitable and accessible workplace. By learning from each other’s differences, we gain strength through our people and our perspectives. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. Job  Commercial Banking Primary Location  Canada-Alberta-Calgary Organisation  P&C Distribution-X000020 Schedule  full-time Job Posting  05/15/18 Unposting Date  05/29/18
Title: Director, Credit Structuring

Job_Description: Regular-Full time W E= unlimited potential  We didn’t get to be a leader in energy delivery or ranked on the Global 100 Most Sustainable Corporations index on our own. We did it in partnership with outstanding individuals who work together as a team to fuel people’s quality of life. Individuals like you. And now we’re looking for just such an individual to join our team.  To learn more about us, visit www.enbridge.com .  This requisition will remain open until filled; however, consideration will be given to applicants in order of applicat ion date. Primary Focus  The primary responsibility of the Sr Analyst Threat Risk Assessment is to develop, maintain and execute processes and procedures to support the enterprise wide delivery of cybersecurity Threat and Risk Assessments (TRA) across all Enbridge business units and affiliates  This position requires a solid understanding of cybersecurity risk, various cyber security technologies, compliance models (e.g. SOC1, SOC2) and how they inter-relate.  Responsibilities  Conduct cybersecurity TRAs of information technology & industrial control systems, networks and applications across the organization and produce high quality reports clearly articulating risks. Conduct cybersecurity TRAs of external (cloud-based) vendors and their offerings; Design and facilitate third party assurance programs (e.g. SOC1, SOC2 etc.). Serve as a senior cybersecurity consultant to the various lines of businesses by providing subject matter expertise as it relates to new services, products and projects. Examine and interpret cybersecurity requirements documents, architecture diagrams and solution designs to determine if a project, application, infrastructure or external supplier presents security risk to Enbridge. Analyze and classify results of cybersecurity TRAs to ensure alignment with Enbridge’s enterprise risk management guidelines; Provide appropriate technical and procedural recommendations and risk treatment options to stakeholders to address identified risks Prepare, summarize and report the results of information security threat and risk assessments to technical and non-technical audiences across all Enbridge business units and affiliates; Maintain cybersecurity risks in the risk register and provide timely reports; Develop and deliver formal and informal security awareness training materials and presentations; Maintain relationships with key TIS stakeholders and provide information security subject matter expertise and advisory services in remediating information security risks Assist in design and creation of new cybersecurity policies and related risk/security metrics Other tasks as assigned Qualifications  University degree or technical diploma in an IT related field 7+ years of experience in cybersecurity years of experience in cybersecurity risk and compliance Demonstrated strength in effective leadership, team building, conflict resolution, communication and interpersonal skills. Proven ability to effectively manage resources in a faced paced and dynamic environment. Knowledge of NIST CSF, ISO 27001 and 27002 is strongly desired Strong knowledge of cybersecurity risk management procedures Strong business and technical background Excellent organizational skills Excellent written and verbal communication skills, including the ability to communicate complex technical matters in easy to understand non-technical ways Ability to identify priorities and ensure work is completed within stipulated timeframes Ability to work independently or as part of a team  Preferred: Cybersecurity-related certifications are an asset: CISSP, CCSP, GSEC-GIAC, CEH, etc. We accept applications submitted via our online recruiting system only ( https://careers.enbridge.com ).  Enbridge is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer and is committed to provide employment opportunities to all individuals, without regard to race, religion, age, sex, color, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, or disability. Accommodation for applicants with disabilities is available on request during the recruitment process. Applicants with disabilities can request accessible formats or communication supports by contacting careers@enbridge.com .  We appreciate your interest in working with us; however, only those applicants selected for interviews will be contacted.  Final candidates for this position may be required to undergo a security screening, including a criminal records check.
Title: IT Security Sr Advisor

Job_Description: Calgary, AB  Job Summary  The purpose of the Senior Project Manager is to successfully lead a cross-functional project team to successful project completion following the SDLC (Solution Development Life-Cycle). The Project Manager is accountable for delivering a solution within project constraints, namely scope, budget and schedule.  The Senior Project Manager will use formal project management techniques and interact with clients and other stakeholders to ensure projects are completed within scope, cost and execution commitments.  Responsibilities  Plan and successfully deliver large, highly visible IT projects with high risk, complexity and change management;  Follow the appropriate SDLC for each project;  Set project team expectations, and clearly document project success factors;  Provide extensive communications to senior management as required;  Implement efficient communication practices to ensure the that the project team operates efficiently and effectively;  Identify, secure and lead large multi-stream project teams;  Provide leadership to the project team while respecting the project mandate and the company’s values;  Manage project schedules and budgets to ensure project completion on time, on budget, and within scope and agreed performance metrics;  Analyze project risk and execute risk management strategies;  Develop project charters ensuring alignment with business goals and properly defined project scope, deliverables, risk analysis and resource requirements;  Work with the business and the Project Office Administrator to ensure that all elements of the AFE are complete and accurate;  Prepare and possibly present regular project status reports;  Manage both departmental and cross-functional projects as required;  Work with the Project Office Administrator to ensure project financial tracking is current and accurate;  Manage the implementation of assigned projects to meet stakeholder expectations measured by a project post-mortem.  Mentor more junior project staff.  Required Skills and Experience  10+ years of progressive experience, including 5+ years experience in a relevant industry vertical. (Retail / Wholesale Distribution, CPG, WMS, EDI, JDA, Sterling DOM, etc.)  Must have experience with package (COTS) customization and deployment  Must have experience in one or more areas of Supply Chain, Warehouse/Distribution management, Warehouse Automated Material Handling Equipment & EDI transactions.  Experience with IBM’s Sterling Distributed Order Management (DOM) is highly valued.  Experience in Demand Management and Replenishment an asset, especially exposure to JDA PMM or Warehouse Management Systems (WMS) like Manhattan.  Experience managing all phases of large and complex projects;  Experience leading project teams of 10+ members;  Solid SDLC application development experience;  Possess a good sense of how business needs can be met through innovative technology solutions;  Demonstrated excellence in communication and leadership aptitudes;  Experience managing Systems Integration, Software Development, Package Implementation, and e-Business projects;  Experience in creating project plans using formal PM methodologies.  Knowledge of business process analysis and design;  Solid understanding of project management processes, practices and tools;  Understanding of large system implementation, Systems Integration, Software Development, Package Implementation, and e-Business technology;  Knowledge of Project Management Principles and methodology.  Academic / Educational requirements  Must have formal Project Management training  A university degree or equivalent combination of education and experience  Keys  Strong PM with a demonstrated ability to deliver.  Ability to deal with a variety of stakeholders, including senior management.  Ability to deal with difficult stakeholders and effectively manage expectations.  Ability to build relationships.  Ability to manage a cross functional team which would include the ability to communicate effectively with the technical team members and the business people on the project.  Needs to have integration experience with big systems/applications: JDE, JDA, SAP, I2 Solutions, ERP  Needs to have COTS implementation experience as company doesn’t customize their own systems they buy it off the rack and then integrate it.  Has to have managed a large team – 25 people +  Worked with big budgets around the half a million dollar area  Doesn’t need configuration experience  Ability to understand and follow project delivery methodologies. An understanding around when to apply the right one, and an understanding around how to adjust those methodologies.  Bias against people who always play multiple roles (i.e. Project Manager, Business Analyst, and Architect) on their projects.  Additional: Previous experience in one or more of the following areas: relevant industry vertical. (Retail / Wholesale Distribution, CPG, WMS, EDI, JDA, Sterling DOM, etc.)  Must be able to manage multiple projects at once  Excellent communication skills with technical teams as well as business teams  Interest in mentoring junior / intermediate PMs  Focus on forward planning  Understanding of strategic vs tactical delivery  Understanding of SDLC  Hiring contact: smears@tundratechnical.ca  Tundra Technical Solutions would like to thank you for the interest you have demonstrated in this opportunity. Job_Description: At LifeLabs, we are focused on our vision of building a healthier Canada! We are the largest community diagnostics laboratory in Canada with over 350 collection centres, 21 laboratories and service over 19 million patients each year. Caring, Agile, Customer Driven, One Team - We live our values every day in what we do to help our patients and healthcare providers. With over 5,000 employees, we all make a difference and that’s why our people are so important to us. This is an exciting time to join our LifeLabs team, grow your career with us and support numerous business initiatives, innovations, best practice and business development opportunities. Rocky Mountain Analytical provides specialized tests to naturopathic doctors, physicians and other healthcare providers who practice integrative medicine. Rocky Mountain Analytical, a division of LifeLabs is seeking a Senior Analyst who will be integral in ensuring LifeLabs successfully achieves its growth strategies. Reporting to the Director or Manager, Business Development RMA, the Senior Analyst will support the RMA Business Development team in areas of growth strategy development and execution, project management and business development. We are looking for individuals with a strong drive for change, a natural curiosity, and a passion for transforming healthcare in Canada. The role may require some travel within Canada. This is a full time permanent role and will be located in our Calgary office. Accountabilities: Conducting and facilitating internal stakeholder meetings Researching and synthesizing industry trends and the competitive landscape Conducting market research in the area of functional medicine including formal market evaluation and sizing studies Synthesizing all information and data into executive level reports to facilitate strategic decision making Supporting the development of tools and templates to help facilitate the data/information gathering and analysis process Becoming a subject matter expert in functional medicine testing and the functional medicine landscape overall Assessing/evaluating the competitive landscape relative to a particular opportunity Providing financial analysis, costing, and projections to internal clients to enable effective decision making and risk assessment Supporting the development of executive level briefing notes, updates, presentation decks and stakeholder communications Liaising with internal leaders to build an intimate understanding of the business and ongoing activities occurring across different functional units  Experience and Skills: Bachelor’s degree in Business, Management, Health Sciences or equivalent Preferred 2-3 years of experience, including 1 year recent experience in a related role; willing to look at the right new grad Master’s Degree in Business / Health Administration or equivalent considered an asset Prior knowledge and experience within the health care/life sciences industries Background in sciences (e.g. biology, physiology, biochemistry) an asset Management consulting experience considered an asset Proven ability to gain support for and drive organizational strategies Exceptional leadership and interpersonal skills with a collaborative mindset. Proven capacity to engage with diverse multidisciplinary teams (e.g., Med/Sci, Business Development, Strategy, Marketing and Sales, Client Services, Laboratory Operations, Government Relations, etc.) An excellent written and verbal communicator, including with senior executives Ability to work across multiple jurisdictions, with multiple team members in different time zones. High-level of adaptability, emotional intelligence, and comfort with ambiguity Close attention to detail, with a quality-focused mindset A detail and results oriented self-starter with demonstrated analytical expertise Proven proficiency in the Microsoft Office Suite and well developed skills in quantitative and qualitative analyses Demonstrated passion and enthusiasm for the healthcare and life sciences industries in Canada Dynamic, possessing the ability to prioritize multiple work assignments and manage time effectively
Title: Senior Analyst, Business Development - Calgary

Job_Description: Calgary, AB  Job Summary  Located in our Calgary, AB head office the Solution Architect is responsible for providing the integration and architectural framework that Project teams deliver within. Working on multiple projects, the Solution Architect provides appropriate solutions by participating in project definition and prioritization, validating requirements, determining solution alternatives, creating conceptual designs, and facilitating requirements traceability throughout the Systems Development Life Cycle (SDLC). They work with various Information Systems (IS) and business partners to design solutions that deliver recognizable business value.  Responsibilities  Partner with Engagement Managers and Business Analysts to conduct project investigation (examine feasibility; validate requirements; contribute to budget estimates and CBA's and recommend next steps)  Assist Vendor Management by leading the package/technology section of the RFx process  Research, develop and document solution alternatives, approaches and recommendations that address approved project or enhancement scope and business requirements  Ensure alignment with IS's Target State Architecture and Technology Roadmap, and leverage IS investments across the enterprise  When necessary, raise architecture exceptions and communicate to the Portfolio and Project teams  Work with Project Managers (PM's) to balance scope and quality with budget and schedule  Ensure teams understand the broader IT context and ramifications of decisions and approaches  Engage other IS stakeholders as required in order to ensure completeness of solution designs  Act as a representative (one of many) for their portfolio's interests in cross portfolio projects/programs  Contribute to the security risk assessments (risk identification, risk analysis, mitigation strategy) to assist the business in selecting the most appropriate solutions  Create project specific deliverables such as solution alternatives and recommendations, Solution Blueprint Documents, and the infrastructure requirements document  Present the solution alternatives and recommendation document and the solution blueprint document to business and IS stakeholders for approval  Participate in and review and approve project designs (e.g. High Level Designs, and Detailed Designs), Test Definitions and Implementation Strategies  Stay involved throughout project life cycle to resolve design issues and ensure projects deliver according to the approved designs  Contribute to the development and maintenance of Enterprise Architecture strategies, standards, principles, and patterns that can provide the framework for delivery of practical business solutions including all research and development activities.  Required Skills and Experience  University degree or College diploma or equivalent work experience  5-10 years IT experience in progressive analysis and design related positions  3+ years in an IT Architectural role  Broad technology expertise, and proven experience in conceptual, logical and physical design in one or more architectural discipline (e.g. Application, Integration, Data, Infrastructure, Security)  Experience working closely with both the Business and IS stakeholders, and proven experience in building and managing professional relationships and consensus-building throughout all levels of an organization  A strong understanding of Project Management and SDLC methodologies  Knowledge of Agile framework required; hands on practice with Agile is preferred  Adept at balancing the immediate needs of a project (business requirements and business strategy) with Enterprise Architecture standards and the declared IS target state to achieve a win-win situation  Team player with excellent communication and interpersonal skills  Exceptional skills in facilitating meetings, interviewing, probing and influencing others  Ability to create and deliver effective presentations and briefings up to Senior Management/Executive levels.  Academic / Educational requirements  University degree or College diploma or equivalent work experience. Job_Description: Job Type: Permanent Primary Location: Calgary, Alberta, Canada All Available Locations: Calgary  Role Description  Remarkable people. Remarkable work. Remarkable career. At Deloitte, we recognize that the days of one set path to career success are long over. We offer you the flexibility and choice to customize a work experience that fuels your passions, strengths and ambitions. We also try to ensure there are plenty of occasions to have fun, relax, play, exercise, and build relationships. At Deloitte, we are redefining what it means to be a professional services firm. We are all about ‘remarkable’: Remarkable people. Remarkable work. Remarkable career. ( Even our workplace is remarkable! ) The team Our HR Transformation (HRT) practice is leading the way when it comes to helping clients make sense of and draw insights from the rapid changes happening in the market. From being digital, to employee experience, to robotic process automation and the future of work: it is no longer enough to be strategic, HR needs to be the agent of change and innovation, win the war for talent and embrace the workforce disruption. Our ability to provide end-to-end services to our clients – from helping them envision where they want to go, to technology selection and solution design, straight through to implementation – makes us a standout in the market place (analysts consistently rate us as the leading firm in Canada and globally!). The roadmap to becoming a high-impact HR organization has never been more complex, and yet, it has never been more exciting to play in this space. Possibilities are limitless. The role As a Manager, you will play a key role in how we deliver our services to clients across a breadth of industries. You will have the opportunity to leverage leading research, analytics, technology and industry insights to impact the future of work and provide strategic and business-focused solutions to our clients. You will be part of a team that loves collaborating, taking on challenges and exceeding expectations. No two days are ever the same, but here is a sample of some of the work you might do in this role: build the infrastructure for new HR capabilities like predictive analytics, robotic process automation and employee experience; deliver engagements that advance strategic HR transformation for clients; develop and maintain client relationships and lead projects from planning through execution; consult with clients to increase effectiveness and reduce costs of HR service delivery through improved processes and technologies; participate in the selection, design and implementation of technology-enabled business and HR solutions for clients.  Who you are Growing your career and future at Deloitte is within your hands and here is how you’ll succeed: You are genuinely passionate about HR, keeping up with trends, having your own point of view on what HR will look like in 10 to 15 years, and staying connected with what is happening in the market today, from an employee and an employer perspective. You demonstrate social perceptiveness, by being aware of others’ reactions and understanding why they react as they do by listening well and encouraging an open exchange of information and ideas using the appropriate communication tools. You have a design mindset, delivering a unique and customized customer service solution by using logic, imagination, intuition, and systemic reasoning to explore possibilities of what could be and by as a means of creating the desired outcomes that benefit the end user. You lead from the heart and with a purpose. You understand what drives those around you, you push them to do their best and you provide your teams with challenging and meaningful opportunities. You’re able to influence clients, teams and individuals positively , leading by example and truly understanding their needs . Job_Description: Our downtown client is looking for an Intermediate Information Security Analyst to prevent, detect and respond to potential security incidents. This is a 6 month initial contract, with the possibility of extension or permanent employment.  Position Overview Working as an integral part of a diverse Information Services Team, the successful candidate will be responsible for preventing, detecting and responding to potential security incidents involving Information (IS) and Operational Technology (OT) assets. The second purpose of this role is to assess IS security risks within the organizations environment and recommend mitigation controls to reduce risks to an acceptable level to satisfy business needs, regulatory requirements and industry best practices.  Summary of Responsibilities Provide and implement IS security recommendations for the company's systems, networks, applications and facilities based on business needs, regulatory requirements and industry best practices. Support the existing security infrastructure to ensure uninterrupted 24/7 operations. Conduct threat and risk assessments based on industry recognized methodologies. Help position the IS security department as a trusted advisory service for all electronic information, IS, and OT security matters. Collaborate with other business units to ensure we have assessed and mitigated security and compliance risks in line with committed governance programs and security policies. Ensure continuous improvement in security logging, monitoring and reporting. Qualifications Degree or diploma in Computer Science, or related discipline, or equivalent IS work experience. At least three to five years of hands on experience in an Information Security role. Experience establishing and maintaining security logging, monitoring and reporting solutions. Experience working with IDS/IPS, ATP, and SIEM solutions (Q Radar). Forescout network access control Entrust for 2 factor authentication Netskope Cloud Access Security Broker Check Point for Firewalls, VPN encription, and endpoint security SCADA and OT security experience considered a strong asset. GIAC and CISSP designations are a strong asset. Ability to solve complex technical problems quickly and completely. Strong desire to learn new technologies. Ability to communicate effectively, both verbally and in writing, to users and management. Strong organizational, multitasking and creative thinking skills. Ability to work periodic extended hours/after-hours work as projects/work load dictates. Ability to function within a fast paced team environment. Expertise and Skills Security, Security Analyst 5 - 7 years Priority Requirements Must-have: Briefly state your experience preventing, detecting and responding to potential security incidents involving Information (IS) and Operational Technology (OT) assets. Work Environment This is a 6 month contract position with the possibility of extension or permanent employment. The client is located in the downtown core.

Job_Description: Regular-Full time  W E= unlimited potential  We didn’t get to be a leader in energy delivery or ranked on the Global 100 Most Sustainable Corporations index on our own. We did it in partnership with outstanding individuals who work together as a team to fuel people’s quality of life. Individuals like you. And now we’re looking for just such an individual to join our team.  To learn more about us, visit www.enbridge.com .  This requisition will remain open until filled; however, consideration will be given to applicants in order of applicat ion date.   Primary Focus  The primary responsibility of the Supervisor Cybersecurity Governance is to supervise a team of cybersecurity analysts/advisors with responsibility for the oversight, administration and maintenance of Enbridge’s Cybersecurity Control Framework. Ensuring the company can meet or exceed its regulatory, best practice and internal control objectives. Through the analysis of the data, the Supervisor Cybersecurity Governance is also responsible for reporting on the effectiveness of Enbridge’s cybersecurity controls and defining the criteria supporting risk based cybersecurity investments.  Responsibilities Assumes full leadership responsibility for a team of Analysts/Advisors. Includes responsibility for recruitment and hiring of qualified personnel, team productivity, performance assessment management, employee career development and maintaining employee engagement in a fast paced, high stress work environment. Ensure staffing, training, process, procedures and tools are in place to ensure success of departmental objectives. Provide oversight and actively participate in developing cybersecurity governance framework materials (policies, controls, standards) to drive consistent cybersecurity risk treatment across the enterprise Facilitate cybersecurity governance conversations with cybersecurity and business stakeholders to help ensure positive and deliberate outcomes. Deliver and report cybersecurity metrics that provide stakeholders with situational awareness and provide quality information for risk-based decision making. Collaborate with internal and external stakeholders to identify all related cybersecurity effectiveness targets and metrics. Evaluate cybersecurity control gaps and work with applicable stakeholders to recommend solutions Promote the desired outcome of controls described in the Enbridge Cybersecurity Compliance Framework Provide assistance to stakeholders in identifying and resolving cybersecurity control gaps and deficiencies Monitor the remediation status of cybersecurity control gaps and deficiencies Work closely with Security teams and business units to review and respond to cybersecurity questionnaires and due diligence requests. Provide oversight for the maintenance of Enbridge’s cybersecurity policies, standards, controls and procedures Provide oversight for the maintenance of the cybersecurity process for cybersecurity policy development and risk acceptance requests  Qualifications  Required: University degree or technical diploma in an IT related field 10+ years of experience in cybersecurity risk and compliance Demonstrated strength in effective leadership, team building, conflict resolution, communication and interpersonal skills. Proven ability to effectively manage resources in a faced paced and dynamic environment. Knowledge of ISO 27001 and 27002 is strongly desired Knowledge of NIST 800-53 and other frameworks Strong knowledge of cybersecurity control frameworks and governance procedures Strong business and technical background Excellent organizational skills Excellent written and verbal communication skills, including the ability to communicate complex technical matters in easy to understand non-technical ways Ability to identify priorities and ensure work is completed within stipulated timeframes Ability to work independently or as part of a team In-depth understanding of cybersecurity governance trends and risks  Preferred: Cybersecurity-related certifications are an asset: CISSP, CRISC, CISM, etc Experience in creating risk reporting, analysis and dashboards  We accept applications submitted via our online recruiting system only ( https://careers.enbridge.com ).  Enbridge is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer and is committed to provide employment opportunities to all individuals, without regard to race, religion, age, sex, color, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, or disability. Accommodation for applicants with disabilities is available on request during the recruitment process. Applicants with disabilities can request accessible formats or communication supports by contacting careers@enbridge.com .  We appreciate your interest in working with us; however, only those applicants selected for interviews will be contacted.  Final candidates for this position may be required to undergo a security screening, including a criminal records check.
Title: Supervisor, Cyber Security Governance

Job_Description: Enterprise Cloud Architect / Principal Sales Consultant-180006GQ Preferred Qualifications  The Enterprise Cloud Architect will be working closely – depending on each case - with Oracle Sales to develop new business as well as to position Oracle’s Solutions at the heart of the largest transformations, including focus on solutions based on Oracle Public Cloud Services. Oracle Enterprise Cloud Strategists bridge the gap between business and technology –speaking the value language of business and technology with C‐level individuals. They combine a deep understanding of technology, applications, industry best practices, business processes and architectural patterns to drive IT transformation initiatives that meet the business objectives of our customers. Ideal Candidates will be seasoned senior level professionals who not only possess deep experience with technology transformation but also significant experience in cloud. Responsibilities: Lead and execute with a cloud first mind set helping customers realize benefits of an Oracle cloud based architecture Actively show the value of Oracle cloud solutions as part of engaging with customers – strong focus on AppDev and DevOps expected. Contribute to and drive large Oracle X-LOB deals including Oracle IaaS, PaaS, and SaaS cloud services – focus on Digital Transformation, App Modernization, Mobile, AI, Chatbots, Dev, SaaS extension and Integration. Work in collaboration with local account team (X-stack –infrastructure, technology and applications), Industry Advisors, and Key Account Directors Lead all consultative selling enabling services including domain architects, sales consulting, Business Analyst, etc. Exercise creativity, independent judgment and business acumen in selecting methods and techniques to design non-routine and very complex business solutions utilizing Oracle products and technology to meet customer needs Interact with all roles at customer – including CIO, CTO, IT Architects, technical staff and Business representatives Articulate case for change Lead detailed discovery analysis Conduct repeatable strategy, architecture, roadmap and planning workshops Provide assessment of current state architecture and recommendation of future state architecture Provide detailed sizing and associated justification Identify and evangelize key business and technology benefits of adoption Provide roadmap and migration methodology and identify quick wins Advise on organizational impact of solutions Remain fully aware of relevant architectural programs and assets from Oracle worldwide ﻿Skills required: Wide background including architecture, implementation and delivery of large‐scale hardware and software systems in real-world situations Cloud Architecture Development Agile Development and DevOps in a Cloud Architecture Cloud certification (AWS, Azure, Salesforce, Cloud Credential Council, OpenStack etc.) Ability to walk up the cloud stack (IaaS, PaaS, SaaS) model with modern terminology and relevance Architecture or other appropriate certifications like TOGAF, Zachman, CISSP, OpenCA, ITIL, Cobit, Prince Wide knowledge of IT market and trends Knowledge of full Oracle stack including Oracle Public Cloud Services Knowledge of cloud competitors including AWS and/or Azure Some specific knowledge of Oracle and competitor hardware solutions Some specific knowledge of Oracle database and middleware technology Some specific knowledge of Oracle applications Some specific knowledge of Oracle industry solutions Detailed knowledge of architectural approaches including consolidation, cloud computing, virtualization, disaster recovery, information management, big data, Java applications, Oracle and non-Oracle applications C-level presentation expertise Open to travel as required Detailed Description and Job Requirements Provides direction and specialist knowledge in applying the technology/application to client business. Facilitation of customer product/application understanding through presentations demonstrations and benchmarks; provision of support throughout the sell.  As a Principal Sales Consultant you will be responsible as the expert for formulating and leading presales technical / functional support activity to prospective clients and customers while ensuring customer satisfaction. Acts as a technical resource and mentor for less experienced Sales Consultants. Focuses on large or complex sales opportunities that need creative and complex solutions. Develops productivity tools and training for other Sales Consultants. Develops and delivers outstanding Oracle presentations and demonstrations. Leads any and all aspects of the technical sales process. Advises internal and external clients on overall architect solutions.  Leading contributor individually and as a team member, providing direction and mentoring to others. Work is non-routine and very complex, involving the application of advanced technical/business skills in area of specialization. 3 years vendor (sales and marketing) experience. 7 years business experience with relevant computer applications or database/tools. Ability to implement the most advanced product features. Thorough knowledge of system and application design. In depth knowledge of competitors. Demonstrated project management skills. Demonstrated excellent verbal and written communication skills: needs analysis, positioning, business justification, closing techniques. Ability to persuade others through presentations, demonstrations, and written communication. Ability to travel as needed. A/BS degree or equivalent, advanced degree highly desirable. Job_Description: Reference: 2483  Based in either Calgary, Edmonton, Vancouver or Victoria locations  Sierra Systems is seeking a motivated and experienced Oracle Forms - Developer. If you are passionate about the technology, the clients, and all the challenges that go with being a consultant, you will want to be a part of our team. Our people have the skills and business savvy to provide exceptional consulting services to clients, helping them gain the optimum benefit from our solutions. We recruit professional results-oriented team players who have true vision and creativity. Our talented consultants are passionate about what they do and excited to delight our customers with their knowledge and capabilities.  As a Developer with Sierra Systems, you will be assigned to work on a wide range of projects and want to work on projects where you are implementing creative solutions to real problems and you will enjoy learning new technology.  Key Areas of Responsibilities   Write high quality and well-documented code according to accepted standards based on user requirements using PL/SQL, Java, Oracle Forms/Reports, ADF Framework. Test and debug program units in conjunction with other units and/or systems and integrate with other program modules and systems. Participate in project and team meetings interacting and collaborating with team members and other departments as appropriate. Evaluate alternative design approaches to meet business and user requirements. Provide analysis of problems reported by customers. Find and communicate technical problems, procedures and applicable solutions. Work as a team with the analyst to ensure functional analysis to meet customer requirements.  Requirements:  Minimum 3 years professional programming experience using Oracle PL/SQL. Some experience with Oracle Experience of Oracle Forms/Reports Experience in Java, ADF, WebLogic Server Consistently produces clear, concise status report A self-starter who takes initiatives but seeks the assistance of others when necessary. Excellent problem solving and customer service abilities. Excellent verbal and written communication skills Ability to effectively articulate technical challenges and solutions Communicates clearly and effectively with clients, account executives, and management Team player, who can work effectively in a constantly changing environment Builds confidence and trust with customers
Title: Oracle Developer – Forms/Reports

Job_Description: Application Specialist On behalf of our client, a well-established Canadian organization, Procom Consultants Group is seeking an Application Specialist. Application Specialist - Job Details responsible for the detailed implementation of solution design into application programming and configuration that meets clients' requirements. Will work closely with Solution consultants, Project Managers, Business Analysts and Quality Assurance to ensure a successful and well managed implementation. The ideal candidate must have a positive, client focused mindset, fully understanding their role as their "front line" team Application Specialist - Mandatory Skills Strong domain knowledge of EH&S and EH&S applications Strong self learning skills for technical and functional support Strong customer service focus Analytical Skills: Application Specialist must be able to recognize the requirements of customers, and implement application configuration and development solutions that meet client business requirements Communication and Collaboration : AS must be able to clearly communicate their ideas to teammates and leadership and ensure alignment of solutions to overall design Creativity: to help invent new ways of approaching problems and developing innovative applications. Customer-Service: AS would need good customer service skills to answer questions and fix issues. Attention to Detail and Unit Testing Skills: Applications have many parts and all must work together for the application to function. Problem-Solving: As issues come up, AS need to be able to make decisions that move the project forward with change management parameters Technical Skills: strong EHS application configuration and development skills Entrepreneurial Mindset - the capacity to understand the business model of the client and proactively translate problems, inefficiencies, requirements into client value “opportunities”. These opportunities will be shared with team members and brought forward to client in the form of value improvements proposals in quarterly meetings. Application Specialist - Assignment Location Calgary, AB Application Specialist - Length Contract
