Job_Description: JSG Professional Services ULC, a Johnson Service Group Company is experiencing tremendous growth! We have been named by Staffing Industry Analysts (SIA) to three of its prominent 2016 lists: Largest U.S. Staffing Firms, Fastest Growing U.S. Staffing Firms and Largest U.S. Engineering Staffing Firms. JSG is a staffing industry leader, with over 30 years of experience investing in people and companies. We have grown rapidly to more than 30 offices throughout North America. For the last five years, our annual compounded organic growth rate is over 20%, providing growth opportunities for those looking at the big picture.  Join our team! JSG is actively looking for people who bring a high-energy level, and a unique style and personal touch to the way they conduct business.  Job Requirements  As a Recruiter, you will be responsible for providing technical recruitment services to our clients. This position is based in our Calgary, AB office. The Recruiter will locate and hire candidates via our internal database, job boards, personal contact networks and creative recruiting efforts.  Recruit candidates utilizing assorted approaches and techniques (direct, Internet, referrals, research, relationships, agencies, etc.).  Develop and execute strategies to develop targeted candidate pipelines  Develop strong relationships with new and existing candidates and clients  Provide customer service and relevant industry knowledge to prospective candidates  Generate leads, develop and execute candidate pipeline funnel  Research & gain knowledge of client project initiatives as well as their specific technical and cultural environments to provide proactive workforce planning  Preparation and delivery of effective candidate proposals to clients  Partner with assigned leadership & recruiting in order to effectively manage client & candidate pipeline  Source, qualify, vet and submit candidates to the client hiring manager.  Clearly communicate a summary of your candidates via verbal and written communication, including the strengths and gaps of your candidates to the client hiring manager.  Schedule interviews between candidate and client hiring manager (phone and in-person).  Conduct reference checks on candidates prior to hire.  Consistently update Applicant Tracking System (ATS) to reflect current candidate information, activity records and interview summaries.  >2 years of technical recruiting in the Oil & Gas industry preferred.  What is the Calgary, AB office culture like?  Our Calgary office culture is team based, quality focused, results driven, and works hard with work/life balance at its core.  What are the professional growth opportunities?  Your growth at JSG is wide open. Your earning potential is unlimited, with leadership opportunities down the road, as JSG has been in major growth mode for the last five years, and shows no signs of slowing down.  All applications and inquiries will be treated with complete confidentiality.  Job Type: Full-time
Title: Recruiter, Oil & Gas Industry

Job_Description: Build a meaningful career  At Morneau Shepell, we offer more than career opportunities, we provide career opportunities to make meaningful contributions to people’s lives. The extraordinary expertise of our 4,000-strong workforce is harnessed to support the employees and families of the organizations we serve. Our innovative programs have a lasting impact on the health, financial security and productivity of 20,000 workplaces.  Consultant Health and Benefits  Health & Benefits Solutions  Calgary, AB  Full Time, Permanent  Benefits programs are an important and highly valued part of any employment offering. But understanding how much or what type of benefit coverage is necessary can be difficult. Our client relationship model is consultative and encourages continual communication. By providing you with the resources to support employers in engaging employees in their health, we provide a path to better workforce health and productivity.  Our Consultant works in a team and is responsible for managing, servicing and providing quality benefits consulting services for small to medium sized clients. In addition, they will be responsible for helping to build business with existing clients as well as attracting and supporting new clients through our association partnerships.  Responsibilities include:  Business Development  Identify and manage cross-sell opportunities Develop strategic relationships with key account contacts and introduce Morneau Shepell team members as appropriate Supervise the complete employee benefits cycle: plan design, provider search, implementation, experience monitoring, renewal rating Develop new business with existing clients and assists in obtaining new business with prospective clients focusing on our key association partnerships Understand client needs and identify company or industry products or services that can meet these needs Service  Deliver presentations to clients; conduct client meetings and the occasional employee presentation. Ensure that quality control and service standards are attained with every transaction Negotiate, problem solve and maintain positive relationships with insurers, external advisors and internal underwriting and benefits administration departments Develop and maintain excellent relationships with clients, through regular telephone contact and office visits Understand the client’s perspective and priorities, and work with the client to resolve administrative issues Establish strategies for services that meet client needs  Administration  Provide and oversee direct day-to-day support for clients by phone, e-mail, letters, formal reports, and face-to-face meetings Lead and manage multiple client assignments and projects Manage special projects as required Peer review the work of analysts Knowledge  Maintain current knowledge of industry trends including insurer news, products, legislation, and cost trends as well as current knowledge of our company's products and services  Qualifications:  Experience  Five years of experience in group benefits. Preference will be given to those from the group insurance industry, a consulting firm or brokerage or in an HR department. Education  Post-secondary education GBA (CEBS) designation, or working towards it. Life Insurance license (this will be a requirement within 3 months of onboarding) Skills  Strong presentation skills and comfort speaking in front of large groups Understanding of consultative selling and the ability to manage the sales cycle effectively and autonomously Expert negotiation, technical and analytical skills Can effectively communicate complex concepts in plain written and spoken language Professional Traits  Exceptional customer focus; some would say you’re the best Extremely organized self-starter, flexible, highly independent Ability to manage multiple deadlines simultaneously Proven collaborative team member with the ability to motivate and inspire team members  Morneau Shepell Morneau Shepell is in the business of helping organizations help their people because we believe that engaged people are the driving force for society. Every day, the expertise of our almost 4,000 employees is recognized as essential to the financial security, health, and productivity of our clients and their people. We're always looking for talented professionals and strategic leaders who will listen and work together with colleagues and clients to form long-term relationships and to deliver integrative solutions that fit. As we continue to grow, we're presently engaging with exceptional candidates interested in a range of exciting career opportunities. At www.morneaushepell.com you can explore our careers page to learn more about the solutions we deliver and the great people who help us do it. Follow us on LinkedIn and Twitter (Morneau_Shepell, Shepell). We are thankful for your interest, but unfortunately, we can only personally connect with those selected for an interview.  INDCAD LI-PH1  Job Grade: MS4   Fulfilling work that matters  Morneau Shepell is in the business of helping organizations help their people and in the process, we strive to elevate ours.  We're always looking for talented professionals and strategic leaders looking to make a difference in the lives of the people we serve.  We appreciate the interest of every applicant; however, we contact only those selected for an interview.  Find your fit with us. Follow us on LinkedIn, Youtube and Twitter.
Title: Consultant

Job_Description: Business Analyst for Application Development Processes:  full time, 6 month duration, based in Calgary This role provides ownership and oversight of all process development, improvement, and implementation of Software Process Improvement (SPI) based on the CMM framework.A key responsibility of this group is to monitor process metrics in order to identify either problem areas or identify opportunities for process improvement.They are responsible for staffing the SEPG team and providing direction in applying the Process Change Method (PCM) for the account and in training the delivery team.They train the delivery team, begins the implementation, acts as process owner for changes and updates, and plans and leads the IBM tasks of the Software Engineering Institute (SEI) CMM-based assessment.They also engage ADE to perform an effectiveness study when funded and appropriate.Capture business requirements, analysis of requirements, mapping of requirements (As is and To be processes)Particular focus on Windows 10 application Please send your resumes to Danielle Pelletier at daniellep@tes.net.
Title: Business Analyst

Job_Description: *PLEASE NOTE: PREFERENCE WILL BE GIVEN TO CANDIDATES WHO APPLY THROUGH CANFOR.COM/CAREERSCanfor TechnologyAt Canfor, our Information Technology professionals play an important role in the daily functioning of our operations. Consistently pushing the boundaries when it comes to innovation within the forestry and pulp and paper industries, our IT professionals support Canfor in achieving exceptional results.With a high caliber Information Technology leadership team, a clear vision, and significant growth and training opportunities, a career in IT at Canfor allows individuals to strengthen their competencies and grow within their respective roles. Working as an equal partner with our operations to achieve organizational objectives, you will be at the forefront of innovation.Who We Are: Canfor is one of the world’s largest and most respected integrated forest products companies. For more than 75 years, we have been delivering top-quality lumber, pulp and paper products to our valued customers worldwide. With operations in Western Canada and the Southern United States, and sales offices around the world, you can find Canfor products in every corner of the globe. We are leaders in sustainable forest management and in converting wood residuals into green energy.As we continue to grow our company and our markets, find out how you can grow your career with us.The OpportunityThe Data Analyst, Business Intelligence supports Canfor’s objectives by turning data into meaningful information that can be used to make sound business decisions. The Data Analyst will provide expertise in business intelligence to prepare and deliver data and information to internal customers and stakeholders through reports, dashboards and scorecards. It is essential that the Data Analyst build an understanding of the business at a level of detail that enables them to work with the business to deliver valuable information.Please Note:  This is a relocation opportunity in Vancouver, British Columbia. The successful applicant may be provided with relocation assistance.Main ResponsibilitiesRequirements Gathering:Engage with various business units to capture information needs, compare those needs with existing tools and identify gapsParticipate in business requirements workshopsWrite business requirements documents as required to elaborate needs, gain acceptanceDesign & Development:Architect tables and dataDesign dashboards, reports, drill-down analytics and data visualizationsDesign, configure and administer the metadata layerCreate system technical requirements for documentation and knowledge managementActively challenge and find solutions to optimize system performanceTesting, Validation, Release Management:Develop and implement testing strategiesValidate data accuracyDeploy and validate changes in production environmentTraining & Change Management:Support the development of training, documentation, and help desk capabilitiesRequired SkillsBachelor's degree in computer science, information systems, business management or specialized training/certificationExperience working with relational databases (Microsoft SQL Server, Oracle Database, MySQL, etc)Applied knowledge of SQL (T-SQL, PL/SQL, ANSI-SQL, etc)Applied understanding of data modelling and warehousing conceptsWorking knowledge of business intelligence tools such as Oracle Business IntelligenceWorking knowledge of ETL tools such as Oracle Data Integrator or InformaticaExperience mediating and clarifying sometimes ambiguous or conflicting end user requirementsEagerness to learn new concepts and technologies and keep-up-to-date with existing onesWillingness to go above and beyond to understand both the business and technical aspects of a problemHiring for this position is ongoing and will be filled as required. To be considered for this position, please apply today.In order to be eligible for this position, you must be legally entitled to work in Canada for our Company.There has never been a better time to join the Canfor Information Technology team and become a part of the modern forest industry. We have a wide range of rewarding and innovative careers in some of the best communities in North America, with plenty of room for advancement. We offer competitive compensation and benefits packages, and are committed to the professional development of our employees.*PLEASE NOTE: PREFERENCE WILL BE GIVEN TO CANDIDATES WHO APPLY THROUGH CANFOR.COM/CAREERSFollow us on LinkedIn , Twitter , and Facebook for Canfor news, career opportunities, and upcoming events!Vancouver, BCThe city of Vancouver is both a natural beauty and a progressive urban centre, a rare place on earth that is idyllic and electric all at once. With one of Canada’s mildest climates, Vancouver is ideally suited for those devoted to outdoor pursuits, health and wellness. Along with its endless supply of fresh air and clean water, Vancouver also boasts countless choices for culturally diverse, world-class cuisine and an inventory of arts and entertainment events. For more information, visit http://canfor.com/our-company/our-communities/vancouverJob Type: Full-timeEducation:High school or equivalent
Title: Business Intelligence Analyst (Relocation Opportunity)

Job_Description: Inter Pipeline is a major petroleum transportation, storage and natural gas liquids processing business that ranks among the largest energy infrastructure companies in Canada. We are proud to be named one of Alberta’s Top 70 Employers, which recognizes Alberta businesses that lead their industries by being exceptional places to work.  Located out of our Calgary office, the individual in the Senior Business Analyst role will report to the Supervisor, Finance Solutions Centre. The successful candidate will be responsible for the stewardship of finance master data and project support within SAP for Inter Pipeline, as well indirect leadership of the Business Analyst.  Key Activities and Responsibilities: Review and ongoing improvement of master data creation/change approval processes Leadership of the Business Analyst role, utilizing a team accountability approach for facilitating finance master data creation/changes Work with the business and SAP Competency Centre to develop Service Level Agreements (SLAs), key performance indicators (KPIs) and other metrics for SAP finance master data Act as a data steward bringing forward cross-functional data quality and process integration issues and working collaboratively to solve them, championing the collective management of data governance Serve as a central point of contact for finance data governance understanding and providing direction and training to data consumers and producers from the business in line with business rules Ensure the right stakeholders across the enterprise (e.g. operations, finance, supply chain, etc.) are brought into make business process improvements which mitigate data issues Bring best practices in master data management and propose opportunities for improvement Interaction with SAP Competency Center on future system enhancements, builds, testing, and roll-outs Assist with development and usage of SAP reports  Education, Skills and Experience: Undergraduate diploma or degree in business with 5+ years of progressive experience in financial system support, CPA (CA, CMA, CGA) designation is an asset Strong finance expertise on master data usage, configuration, and integrated data requirements/linkage points combined with prior oil and gas experience considered an asset In depth knowledge of SAP FI_CO and Business Warehouse, experience with S/4HANA and Fiori an asset Approaches work with a high level of curiosity and aptitude to identify and solve problems, takes initiative, is accountable, and works independently Change agent who can persuade and influence stakeholders to establish new processes, shift to automation, and provide innovative solutions Ability to manage internal and external relationships with well-developed interpersonal, team, customer service and communication skills (both written and verbal) Strong customer service skills in working with internal departments to achieve results through relationships with people and teams Able to work well in a fast-paced, growth environment, with strong attention to detail and accuracy Maintains strong initiative and possesses superior analytical skills
Title: Senior Business Analyst

Job_Description: Job Title: Marketing Manager  Location: Calgary, AB  Duration: 12 Months  Extension: Yes  Description: Position Overview: You are a passionate, high-energy team member who is excited about taking on things you've never done before and driving them to completion. You enjoy supporting all aspects of our customer experience, from marketing through to operations. As a Marketing Specialist, you will be managing the regional show home strategy, ensuring our partners have the marketing and communication support required. You'll be part of a fast-paced team that looks to deliver results in a condensed time frame.  Responsibilities: Manage regional show home strategy: Develop strong rapport with customer care staff and act as key marketing contact.  Ensure Presentation Sales Centre is fully equipped with updated collateral & marketing communications.  Provide ongoing support and initial education for customer care staff regarding the benefits for new residents moving into a building powered by Client’s PureFibre.  Complete regular visits to show homes to ensure staff are trained and able to communicate/explain exclusive Client offers.  Provide ongoing support to staff for Client interactive displays and act as key contact for any support or training required.  Collaborate with show home launch to ensure sales centre has Client’s PureFibre marketing materials  Identify opportunities to partner on any exciting or new activities to increase brand exposure.  Drive awareness and help promote traffic to new app and New Home website to drive new loading opportunities.  Help design new marketing sales promotions/incentives to reward and engage show suite Staff.  Marketing and communications for Developers/Home Builders  Provide support to Channel Managers and ensure all developers have necessary marketing materials.  Develop new strategies/mini campaigns to drive new sales.  Monitor and track sales penetration by community.  Support segmented marketing strategies (targeting Large, Medium, Small Developers).  Act as a brand ambassador on behalf of the Clientr’s New Growth Markets team and maintain strong interlock with Channel Managers & marketing primes.  Marketing Event Prime  Act as event lead and project manager, overseeing logistical & planning details (ie: Future Home Breakfast, Innovation Centre Events, Executive Developer Events).  Manage catering, venue booking, invites, RSVP tracking, onsite branding, etc.  Manage Client promo times and monitor stock levels.  Order Client swag/promo material/banners, etc.  Manage storage for promo material, etc  Provide onsite support at sponsored industry/association events (ie: CHBA, UDI, Buildex, etc).  Additional Support  Organize lobby events with interlock across the Broadband Network team  Review marketing analytics by region to gauge consumer success and patterns by region  Manage regional budget  Provide marketing team with intel on upcoming projects and opportunities in the community  Required Knowledge: Solid understanding of Client PureFibre and the services and features that Client provides to consumer customers  Required Skills & Abilities: Self-starter with proven organizational and time-management skills  Strong relationship building abilities  Ability to prioritize and handle multiple tasks and deadlines  Excellent research skills and a passion for event planning  Good skills in Excel  Excellent verbal and written communication skills  Focused on the client experience  Ability to work independently and within a team  Ability to cope with ambiguity  Ability to drive to clarity, consensus and closure  Required Professional Designation/Certification: Undergraduate degree in marketing considered an asset  Business analysis or project management certification considered an asset  Required Experience: At least one years in a high-performing, fast-paced team.  Must Have Skills: Marketing experience  Able to work independently and in a team  Outgoing and able to speak to different levels of stakeholders  Nice to Have Skills: Self-starter  Business analyst experience  Familiarity with the real estate/development ecosystem  If you are interested in applying for this role please send an updated copy of your resume to Irena at ilojen@tundratechnical.ca  Tundra Technical Solutions would like to thank you for the interest you have demonstrated in this opportunity. However, only candidates with the required skills will be contacted.  Tundra Technical Solutions is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. Simply click on ‘Tell a Friend’ option to refer a friend. Our success and our clients’ success are built on a foundation of service excellence. Rather than continually trying to sell to new clients and companies and simply filling databases with candidates, we focus on developing stronger relationships and deeper knowledge of our existing clients’ challenges and opportunities.  Open ears. Open minds. Open futures  The Tundra team has over 60 years of experience, from a wide variety of disciplines – recruiting executives, business owners and technical consultants. Job_Description: About MRU Founded in 1910 and located in Calgary, Alberta, Canada, Mount Royal University has built a reputation on a strong, liberal education foundation. Our vision is to provide an exceptional undergraduate educational experience for our students. We are a community of engaged citizens, providing personalized, experiential and outcome-based learning in an environment of inclusion, diversity and respect. Through our focus on teaching and learning informed by scholarship, we are preparing our graduates for success in their careers and lives. Mount Royal University presently offers 12 four-year baccalaureate degrees with 32 majors, with a view to grow this mix to 15 degrees and 50 majors by 2025. Current degree offerings are unique, and include four-year bachelor degrees in interior design, midwifery, child studies and health and physical education, as well as arts, criminal justice, business administration, communication, computer information systems, education, nursing and science. Mount Royal also offers robust continuing education programming as well as an internationally-renowned music conservatory. More than 13,000 credit students attend Mount Royal University annually, with more than 90,000 Mount Royal alumni contributing to their communities worldwide. Our faculty provide a teaching and learning environment that welcomes challenging ideas. Our staff are dedicated to supporting our campus so that students are provided with an exceptional educational experience. Our management team provides leadership throughout the University, and inspires others at all levels to be leaders in their own important sectors. In support of our students, and in response to our broader community, we know that investing in our employees benefits the University as a whole. Talented and committed employees are the driving force behind student success. Our faculty, staff and management are united in creating a thriving learning environment for our students. Mount Royal University is an exceptional community focused on our people. About the Role Reporting to the Database Administrator, the Database Analyst is responsible for aspects of database management including planning, implementation, configuration, support, usage monitoring and tuning. The position is responsible for internal support of data integrity, security and reliability issues within the Oracle administrative system database. The position is responsible for implementing backup and recovery procedures, maintaining system documentation and logs and assisting in troubleshooting and diagnosing production problems.  The Database Analyst will work with the Application Services and Infrastructure teams to ensure that proper security and networking requirements are met to support the University's ERP (BANNER) and all other administrative systems. The Database Analyst is also responsible for managing data access permissions to ensure security of the University's data. Mount Royal University is currently reviewing a shared-resource initiative with other Alberta institutions that use Banner. At this time the amount of travel and tasks at other institutions is unknown. Most of the work will be remote, but some travel may be required. This position is limited term ending April 10, 2020. Responsibilities Perform the administration and maintenance of databases in a Linux environment Establish and maintain sound backup and recovery policies and procedures Monitor databases and review performance logs for issues before they become problems Assist with the development of Banner upgrade project plans Optimize database performance where required Install, configure and upgrade Oracle server software and related products Evaluate Oracle features and Oracle-related products Work as part of a team and provide 24x7 support when required Interface with vendors for technical support Capacity planning Implement and maintain Banner and Oracle database security Assist with application software upgrades, operating system upgrades and network or other hardware upgrades Qualifications BS or BA degree in Information Technology or equivalent degree with work experience Experience with an ERP system or equivalent Enterprise Application (Ellucian's Banner ERP preferred) Experience patching, upgrading, tuning and supporting Oracle in a multi-instance database environment Expert knowledge of Oracle 11g/12c, Oracle WebLogic Fusion Middleware, Tomcat and RMAN Real Application Cluster experience is desired Oracle Grid Control experience is desired Advanced SQL skills Disaster Recovery Strategies Knowledge of Data Warehousing/ETL Processes Experience managing overall security and integrity of the University's database infrastructure Demonstrated ability to work within a matrix management organization while effectively supporting multiple projects and deadlines Strong analysis and critical thinking skills to troubleshoot and perform root cause analysis on technical problems and solution design Ability to work effectively with a team or independently and lead small teams as needed Good communication to manage technical resources and stakeholder expectations Effective organizational skills to plan, prioritize and complete multiple concurrent tasks in a production support environment Understanding of Master Data Management (MDM) concepts and standards is an asset Understanding of Big Data concepts and standards is an asset Experience with DBaaS is an asset Salary: $ 3,931.25 Semi-monthly Closing Date: Open until suitable candidate found A cover letter and resume should be submitted in one .pdf formatted document. Please title your .pdf document as follows: [Job Title], [Requisition Number].pdf (ex. Coordinator, 999999.pdf). Salary Grade:  We thank all applicants for their interest. Only applicants selected for an interview will be contacted. After the close date, you can check on the status of your application through your Career Centre. New career opportunities arise frequently and are posted as they become available. Please check back often to view our latest postings on our Career Opportunities page. All qualified candidates are encouraged to apply; however, Canadians and permanent residents will be given priority. Mount Royal University hires on the basis of merit and is strongly committed to fostering diversity as a source of excellence, intellectual and cultural enrichment, and social strength. We welcome applications from those who would contribute to the further diversification of our staff, faculty and their scholarship including but not limited to Indigenous Peoples, women, persons with disabilities and persons of any sexual or gender identity, ethnic, national or socio-economic background, religion or age.
Title: Database Administrator

Job_Description: About the Job NGX provides electronic trading, central counterparty clearing and data services to the North American natural gas and electricity markets. Our trading systems clear and settle exchange trades and OTC contracts with a notional value of approximately $50 billion. NGX applies agile practices with the goal to provide sustainable quality solutions for our internal users and external customers.  Role Summary The successful candidate will be responsible for leading all software development activities for our trading and clearing systems. This role requires a hands-on, articulate and focused leader, who can own projects, features, functionality and application architecture. In this role the candidate will have the opportunity to work as an integral part of a highly motivated and productive agile team in an excellent work environment. The successful candidate will work in close collaboration with other developers, quality assurance analysts, project managers, internal business users and our operational support team.  In addition to a solid foundation in software development, the ideal candidate already has an understanding or has a strong desire to learn the business of financial trading and risk analysis.  Key Accountabilities Provide technical leadership to teammates through coaching and mentorship Collaborate with other software developers, business analysts and software architects on solution architecture, analysis of requirements, design, application construction, unit and integration testing of business applications Participate in all software development activities at NGX. Job_Description: Title DevOps Engineer, Product Development and Delivery  Summary We are seeking an outstanding DevOps Engineer to drive cloud automation and provide operational support of commercial software products within the Identity and Access Management domain. The DevOps Engineer fills a critical role within our product delivery team, and will partner with Software Engineers to design, implement, and execute cloud automation and operational support processes. This DevOps Engineer will be working directly with emerging public cloud technologies on a highly visible business-critical platform; providing substantial opportunity for technical skills development and career growth.  General Job Duties Participate as part of a product development organization to design and implement cloud operations processes for moderately complex software platforms. Follow industry good DevOps practices to ensure high quality of service. Report to management on project status, identify issues that may impede attainment of goals, and accept direction on corrective measures. Foster inter-team cooperation as part of a project/program. Continuously expand knowledge in area of specialization. Perform other duties as required. Specific Job Duties Operate as a DevOps Engineer in a product development and delivery team for a cloud-based Identity and Access Management (IAM) services platform. Assist in analyzing requirements and providing comprehensive cloud automation solutions to ensure high QoS. Provide operational support for production and pre-production software systems hosted in the public cloud. Drive process improvement through cloud automation. Support and champion the Agile Scrum development methodology. Collaborate with Software Development Leads and Engineers, Product Managers, Business Analysts, and IT Leadership. Education/Experience Requirements Experience in production software system administration. Background in both Linux/Unix and Windows environments. Experience with automation/configuration management using Ansible or an equivalent. Working knowledge of coding/scripting (eg. Java or C#, Python, Unix shell scripting) Understanding of IT Operations best practices in mission-critical high-availability systems. Ability to engage self-guided analysis and problem solving. Passion and curiosity for solving technical problems. Experience with public cloud infrastructure is a major plus (eg. AWS or Azure) Professional certification is a plus. Organizational Relationships Reports to DevOps manager. Interacts with other colleagues at all levels in the conduct of day-to-day activities. External Relationships Actively participates in industry forums and user groups. FLSA Status – US Only Exempt  We are proud to be an EEO/AA employer M/F/Disability/Veterans. Job_Description: If talent acquisition is your forte as a results-oriented professional committed to continuous improvement in systems and processes, and you thrive in a fast-paced environment, this mandate with CBI Health Group would represent a great career move.  You will be responsible for regional full-cycle recruitment within CBI Home Health, with a focus on the timely sourcing and hiring of quality candidates through innovative recruitment strategies, while maintaining reasonable costs in the hiring process. You can do it all: from building relationships with local educational institutions to build a healthy talent pipeline to tracking and reporting on industry trends and other recruitment analytics. This will enable you, as Regional Talent Acquisition Specialist, to attract and retain the best and most effective talent that will uphold CBI’s corporate values and mission while ensuring we meet our business goals and, ultimately, deliver the best client experience.  This is an exceptional opportunity for an innovative thinker and savvy implementer like you to continue learning and to grow within our organization, while building a regional recruitment strategy and assuming full-scope responsibility for the recruitment process for all positions within the Region.  PRIMARY DUTIES  As Talent Acquisition Specialist, you will:  Ensure that management is trained on the recruitment toolbox process and understands its role within itPartner with hiring managers to ensure role clarity and expectations when recruiting, as agreed upon with all stakeholdersWork collaboratively with all stakeholders (Care Managers, Director of Operations, local and national recruitments teams) to understand the recruitment needsSource talent by building networks and cultivating relationships within talent networks to find qualified and “great fit” candidatesBuild and maintain networks of potential candidates for assigned business areasDevelop a talent pipeline of internal and external talentsIdentify hard-to-fill roles and source innovative channels for recruitmentManage posting of job vacancies using the best-performing recruitment channelsSchedule, conduct and score phone and face-to-face candidate interviews, and interpret assessment resultsComplete balanced hiring scorecardProvide recommendations to the Hiring ManagerBuild and maintain relationships with key stakeholders at local schools, colleges and universities, and participate in career fairs, job fairs, etc., to promote CBI as an employer of choice, increase talent brand awareness, and provide information about opportunities availableDevelop recruitment reports and trends in recruitment that will determine best places to recruitProvide talent analytics, tracking candidate pipelines, quality of hire, time to fill, etc.  QUALIFICATIONS  To take on the role of Talent Acquisition Specialist, you must:  Hold a university degree or college diploma in a related fieldBring a strong understanding of the recruiting process, backed by 3-5 years related experienceSales/marketing experience is appreciatedDemonstrate strong project management skills, including the ability to manage multiple projects and resourcesPossess strong interpersonal and communication skills, as reflected in the ability to network in person and onlineBe detail-oriented, proactive and tech savvy.  About CBI Health Group:  CBI Health Group is Canada’s largest provider of integrated community healthcare. For over 40 years, we have remained totally committed to improving the health and enriching the lives of Canadians.  What sets us apart is our ability to work as a unified network dedicated to the ongoing learning that allows us to foster best practices, improve access to care, and create better results for our patients. We organize our teams and services to ensure the right professionals and caregivers provide the right service, at the right time, in the right place.  In over 250 facilities, our services are provided by a dedicated team of more than 11,000 administrators, support staff, and care providers that include physiotherapists, occupational therapists, registered massage therapists, kinesiologists, chiropractors, speech-language pathologists, psychologists, physicians, nurses, dietitians and behaviour analysts.  The CBI group of companies includes CBI Health Centres, CBI Home Health, We Care Home Health Services, Monarch House, CBI Workplace Solutions, and CBI Assessment Services. Our expanding transitional and residential community care network now numbers more than 60 homes nationwide. At CBI, our people really care and believe that by working together, we can aim higher and make great things happen every day.  Facebook: facebook.com/cbihealthgroup | Twitter: twitter.com/cbihealthgroup | www.cbi.ca  CBI Health Group is committed to accommodating people with disabilities as part of our hiring process. If you have special requirements, please advise Human Resources during the recruitment and selection process.
Title: Talent Acquisition Specialist

Job_Description: Treasury and Investment within Finance is currently seeking a Full-time Regular Director, Treasury and Investments . The University of Calgary, is one of Canada’s top comprehensive research universities with four campuses across the Calgary, Alberta region and a fifth location in Doha, Qatar. Granted autonomy as a university in 1966 (with origins in the early 1900’s), the University of Calgary enrolls approximately 32,000 students in undergraduate, graduate, and professional degree programs. The University’s Eyes High strategy – launched in 2011 – set ambitious goals for excellence in teaching and learning, research and scholarship, the student experience, and community engagement. With a clear strategic direction to become one of Canada's top five research universities, they are making tremendous progress towards becoming a global intellectual hub located in Canada’s most enterprising city. The University is a large and complex institution that drives tremendous value: with an annual consolidated budget of more than $1.2B, they are among Calgary’s largest employers, generating nearly $8B in economic impact to the province. Two-thirds of the University's 168,000 alumni live and work in the Calgary area, effectively building the city we know and love. In 2016, the University of Calgary was ranked as the top university under the age of 50 in both Canada and North America by the Times Higher Education World University Rankings, and as one of the top 200 universities in the world by QS World University Rankings and Times Higher Education World University Rankings. In 2016, RE$EARCH Infosource Inc. positioned the University of Calgary as #6 nationwide amongst Canadian research universities. The University houses 75 Canada Research Chairs and more than 50 research institutes and centers. The University of Calgary has incredible talent – motivated and accomplished students, faculty, and staff – who drive new knowledge creation, improve lives, and better our world. Those who work at the University of Calgary come for the opportunity to make a positive contribution to student experience, to participate in groundbreaking research initiatives, to be immersed in a lifelong learning environment, to engage with and give back to the community, and to enjoy all that Calgary has to offer as a city.   Position Description Summary of Key Responsibilities (job functions include but are not limited to): This is a critical role in University of Calgary continued success and growth. The role is accountable for total investments under management of $2.0 billion (endowment of $950 million and non-endowed funds of $1.05 billion) and the following: Administration of University's financial assets and liabilities, including borrowing, cash management, banking operations and investment reporting Ensuring the operational objective of effective stewardship of the University’s assets and providing an efficient central infrastructure to facilitate the University’s cash management and investments Responsible for overseeing the management of the University Endowments and the relationships with the external investment managers Implementing and maintaining comprehensive investment and risk management policies and procedures that will maximize returns within an acceptable level of risk and minimize the adverse effects of losses to the University so it may achieve its operational objectives Liaising with departments, faculties and senior administration to ensure understanding of and compliance with treasury and endowment policies and procedures Evaluating reporting and control functions within the department and making recommendations for changes Contributing to and taking responsibility for decisions made as part of the management team within Finance Planning, scheduling and directing the work of the Treasury and Investment department Selecting, managing, evaluating and compensating staff to ensure unit functions as a team and service levels meet or exceed client expectations Acting as a change agent for the department: initiating and implementing the appropriate financial policies, systems and procedures Responsible for management reporting to the University's Investment Committee (a subcommittee of the Board of Governors), stakeholders, governmental and regulatory bodies and other outside agencies Contributing information and expertise and keeps up to date on relevant current trends and developments with colleagues at other Canadian universities, Canadian Association of University Business Officers "CAUBO," professional organizations and government departments and agencies Undertaking special assignments and projects as requested by senior administration, the University's Investment Committee, CAUBO and government departments and agencies Qualifications / Requirements: Graduate University Degree preferably in Finance, Economics or a Master of Business Administration Professional financial designation (CPA, CA, CFA, CIM or FCSI) 10+ years’ work and management experience in various accounting, budget, and analyst functions Proven evidence of team leadership skills with the ability to lead the team through change Experience working in highly complex and technical investment and finance concepts Previous experience working with complex treasury and investment systems and processes Demonstrated ability to work well with others and to handle difficult situations while maintaining effective relationships Previous experience with PeopleSoft banking software and PC based software applications Intermediate to expert user of complex computer software applications, including enterprise reporting systems, mainframe systems, financial systems, data warehouse and business intelligence tools Think logically, solve problems and be critically objective with an ability to develop innovative solutions to problems Must be able to work independently or in a team environment Excellent interpersonal, verbal and written communication skills are essential in exercising tact and diplomacy regarding sensitive and confidential issues, as well as use of negotiation, presentation, engagement and facilitation skills Application Deadline: This position will remain open until filled; however, applicants will be reviewed as they are received.  For more information and to apply, please contact: Colin Richardson DHR International Suite 250- 435 -4 Avenue Calgary, AB T2P 3A8 T: 403-817-0977 E: crichardson@dhrinternational.com We would like to thank all applicants in advance for submitting their resumes. Please note, only those candidates chosen to continue on through the selection process will be contacted.
Title: Director, Treasury and Investments

Job_Description: Our client, a large Oil & Gas company located in downtown Calgary, is looking to bring on a Transfer Pricing Tax Analyst to be part of the team that is responsible for the planning and implementation of transfer pricing structures and overseeing compliance and audit defense. This is a 1 year contract to start, located downtown Calgary, but supporting multiple jurisdictions. As the Transfer Pricing Tax Analyst, responsibilities would include, but not be limited to: Assist in the development, implementation, monitoring and documentation of Transfer Pricing models for cross-border intra-group transactions in multiple jurisdictions Evaluate and assess legal entity financial information including detailed analysis, reconciliation and reporting of global financial and inter company data for global transfer pricing compliance Assist with the preparation and maintenance of the global business blueprint and value chain analysis for Transfer Pricing purposes Monitor transfer pricing methodologies, compute and document transfer pricing adjustments and year-end entries Assist in the preparation, review and maintenance of benchmark searches, economic, risk, and functional analysis for various types of transactions using Transfer Pricing software Assist in implementation and maintenance of international transfer pricing standards and new regulatory requirements Assist in transfer pricing planning and research initiatives as required Assist in the quarterly and annual transfer pricing review and audit queries as required Candidates to meet consideration will possess the following skills: Business or Economics related degree 3+ years of experience and proficiency in Transfer Pricing • 8+ years of general accounting experience • Considerable knowledge of performing market studies and industry research Strong analytical and research skills Ability to work in a deadline-driven environment and handle multiple projects simultaneously Accounting designation would be preferred Knowledge of the Oil & Gas industry Knowledge of SAP Financial Reporting would be a strong asset  Please send resumes in MS Word format to MelissaN@ifgpr.com today!
Title: Tax Analyst

Job_Description: Build a meaningful career  At Morneau Shepell, we offer more than career opportunities, we provide career opportunities to make meaningful contributions to people’s lives. The extraordinary expertise of our 4,000-strong workforce is harnessed to support the employees and families of the organizations we serve. Our innovative programs have a lasting impact on the health, financial security and productivity of 20,000 workplaces.  Consultant Health and Benefits  Health & Benefits Solutions  Calgary, AB  Full Time, Permanent  Benefits programs are an important and highly valued part of any employment offering. But understanding how much or what type of benefit coverage is necessary can be difficult. Our client relationship model is consultative and encourages continual communication. By providing you with the resources to support employers in engaging employees in their health, we provide a path to better workforce health and productivity.  Our Consultant works in a team and is responsible for managing, servicing and providing quality benefits consulting services for small to medium sized clients. In addition, they will be responsible for helping to build business with existing clients as well as attracting and supporting new clients through our association partnerships.  Responsibilities include:  Business Development  Identify and manage cross-sell opportunities Develop strategic relationships with key account contacts and introduce Morneau Shepell team members as appropriate Supervise the complete employee benefits cycle: plan design, provider search, implementation, experience monitoring, renewal rating Develop new business with existing clients and assists in obtaining new business with prospective clients focusing on our key association partnerships Understand client needs and identify company or industry products or services that can meet these needs Service  Deliver presentations to clients; conduct client meetings and the occasional employee presentation. Ensure that quality control and service standards are attained with every transaction Negotiate, problem solve and maintain positive relationships with insurers, external advisors and internal underwriting and benefits administration departments Develop and maintain excellent relationships with clients, through regular telephone contact and office visits Understand the client’s perspective and priorities, and work with the client to resolve administrative issues Establish strategies for services that meet client needs  Administration  Provide and oversee direct day-to-day support for clients by phone, e-mail, letters, formal reports, and face-to-face meetings Lead and manage multiple client assignments and projects Manage special projects as required Peer review the work of analysts Knowledge  Maintain current knowledge of industry trends including insurer news, products, legislation, and cost trends as well as current knowledge of our company's products and services  Qualifications:  Experience  Five years of experience in group benefits. Preference will be given to those from the group insurance industry, a consulting firm or brokerage or in an HR department. Education  Post-secondary education GBA (CEBS) designation, or working towards it. Life Insurance license (this will be a requirement within 3 months of onboarding) Skills  Strong presentation skills and comfort speaking in front of large groups Understanding of consultative selling and the ability to manage the sales cycle effectively and autonomously Expert negotiation, technical and analytical skills Can effectively communicate complex concepts in plain written and spoken language Professional Traits  Exceptional customer focus; some would say you’re the best Extremely organized self-starter, flexible, highly independent Ability to manage multiple deadlines simultaneously Proven collaborative team member with the ability to motivate and inspire team members  Morneau Shepell Morneau Shepell is in the business of helping organizations help their people because we believe that engaged people are the driving force for society. Every day, the expertise of our almost 4,000 employees is recognized as essential to the financial security, health, and productivity of our clients and their people. We're always looking for talented professionals and strategic leaders who will listen and work together with colleagues and clients to form long-term relationships and to deliver integrative solutions that fit. As we continue to grow, we're presently engaging with exceptional candidates interested in a range of exciting career opportunities. At www.morneaushepell.com you can explore our careers page to learn more about the solutions we deliver and the great people who help us do it. Follow us on LinkedIn and Twitter (Morneau_Shepell, Shepell). We are thankful for your interest, but unfortunately, we can only personally connect with those selected for an interview.  INDCAD LI-PH1  Job Grade: MS4   Fulfilling work that matters  Morneau Shepell is in the business of helping organizations help their people and in the process, we strive to elevate ours.  We're always looking for talented professionals and strategic leaders looking to make a difference in the lives of the people we serve.  We appreciate the interest of every applicant; however, we contact only those selected for an interview.  Find your fit with us. Follow us on LinkedIn, Youtube and Twitter.

Job_Description: Eagle is currently seeking a Senior Organizational Change Manager for a one (1) year contract opportunity, scheduled to begin immediately.  Key Responsibilities  The successful candidate will be responsible for: Supporting internal clients in delivering complex programs and initiatives that are strategic in nature and have substantial implications for the organization's performance;  Preparing the organization to support and adopt new, more effective ways of working including changes to programs, processes, systems, organizational design/structure, roles, capabilities, and culture;  Serving as a change agent, business partner, coach, and facilitator;  Managing resources associated with OCM deliverables including change advisors, communication specialists, training/learning advisors, program coordinators, and business analysts;  Supporting project management, governance and sponsorship activities associated with large scale programs and initiatives, ensuring integration and alignment across multiple concurrent programs and initiatives;  Partnering with Human Resources consultants, talent management, and learning specialists and project teams to develop and deliver integrated OCM solutions;  Supporting the objectives of the corporate organizational change management function through sharing of expertise and best practices, adoption of corporate OCM standards, and active participation in the OCM community;  Applying expert OCM knowledge to prepare and deliver change management assessments and plans for large scale and complex programs and initiatives across multiple stakeholder groups and levels of the organization including senior leadership;  Following change management standards and principles;  Utilizing or modifying available tools and services to implement a structured best fit change approach within a program or initiative;  Completing and assessing detailed change impact and stakeholder analyses;  Developing the OCM strategy and supporting plans including communication, sponsor roadmap, training, coaching, management of risk and issues and acceptance/resistance;  Overseeing and/or performing the required communication, training, and other change management activities;  Preparing key stakeholders to present OCM deliverables such as communications and presentations or training;  Partnering to develop and deliver holistic/integrated OCM solutions, including: accurate change impact and stakeholder analysis, appropriate communications and learning approaches, effective transition management, effective risk management/mitigation, support for leaders in leading through change, an aligned approach to organizational design and talent management elements to support change objectives;  Managing OCM budgets, project costs, and schedule and providing progress reports to leadership;  Facilitating and consulting with senior leaders at all levels to gain sponsorship, approval, and engagement of the business and the affected key audiences in executing the change management strategy;  Providing coaching in change management, resistance management and change sponsorship to the project manager, business lead, change sponsor, project team, the extended change team, and others identified through stakeholder assessment;  Continuously assessing potential issues/risks, conflicting priorities, and opportunities for integration across multiple concurrent programs/initiatives, and raise these to leadership;  Evaluating the success of change management activities and provides progress reports to the broad set of stakeholders;  Monitoring change adoption in the organization and plans additional OCM activities to support gaps in adoption or continued realization of change benefits;  Facilitating and guiding senior leaders and business process owners on long term sustainment to operationalize and embed changes;  Continually building knowledge and acumen in all aspects of the organization, the business, our processes and systems; and,  Supporting the objectives of corporate organizational change management function through: sharing of expertise and best practices; adoption of corporate OCM, communications and learning and development standards; contribution to the continual improvement of the corporate OCM methodology and tools; active participation in the broader OCM community of practice; championing the role of the OCM function.  Skills and Qualifications  The qualified candidate must have: A University Degree in relevant discipline;  Fifteen (15) years’ experience; and,  OCM experience as it relates to IT projects and the deployment of new applications.  Don’t miss out on this opportunity, apply online today!  We would like to thank all applicants for their interest; however, only candidates under consideration will be contacted. Please note that your application does not signify the beginning of employment with Eagle and that employment with Eagle will only commence when placed on an assignment as a temporary employee of Eagle.
Title: Senior Organizational Change Manager

Job_Description: Our client with a campus in SE Calgary is looking for a Senior SAP ICM Techno Functional analyst to help gather requirements, document business process and functional specifications needed to recommend and implement SAP ICM in their environment.  Incentive and Commission Management (SAP ICM) is a solution that enables all types of variable remuneration for employees and partners. It provides up-to-date and clear information on earned and expected commission and incentives, while helping to motivate employees to increase sales and revenue in a short period of time.   POSITION REQUIREMENTS: University Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Engineering, Science, Commerce/Business Administration or equivalent practical experience; Minimum 3-5 years SAP ICM implementation experience - ideally 2 full project lifecycles with SAP ICM. Strong configuration skills performing requirements analysis Development experience Extensive experience designing and configuring integration points between SAP modules as well as interfaces with non-SAP systems; Strong familiarity with project implementation methodologies, including Agile and ASAP; Experience in commission and incentive management of a sales force and sales reporting. Solid experience designing and executing test cases preferably including HP Application Lifecycle Management (HP ALM)/QC experience;   POSITION ACCOUNTABILITIES: Develop functional specifications and perform functional configuration, development SAP ICM. Perform requirements analysis and develop prototype solutions to demonstrate SAP ICM capabilities to the business and enable adoption; Lead troubleshooting of defects that arise in SAP ICM application and ensure a timely resolution. Lead or participate in cross functional teams involved in issue resolution, ensure that partners/stakeholders are kept advised of status; Understand business issues and opportunities. Analyze and define both the “As Is” and “To Be” business processes and perform gap analysis; Ensure adherence to best practices, identify assumptions, constraints, and anticipate and manage risks; Develop diagrams and models (use case, activity diagram, business process models, etc.) and clearly document functional requirements and business rules in order to fulfill the business and user requirements; Communicate requirements for changes to business processes, policies and information systems to technical teams designing and implementing the solution. Write documentation for the applications including operations, training material and user guides. Ensure traceability of requirements back to business need as well as through to solution and testing. Validate the solution meets the business need and verify it conforms to specifications. Participate in project implementations, post-implementation reviews, test plans, test strategy, regression testing and deployment process to maximize and share learning; Responsible for clearly and concisely articulating technical issues and resolutions with varied business stakeholders; Perform tasks within a complex decision-making and problem solving environment, serve as a subject matter expert for the determination and recommendation of problem resolution and system enhancements, root-cause analysis, documentation and integration testing;  Expertise and Skills ERP, ERP functional consultant 5 - 7 years Priority Requirements 5 - 7 years: Please explain your experience as a Senior SAP Incentive and Commission Management (ICM) Techno Functional Analyst to implement and integrate module in a SAP environment Work Environment Free parking and gym on-site. SE Calgary.

Job_Description: Build a meaningful career  At Morneau Shepell, we offer more than career opportunities, we provide career opportunities to make meaningful contributions to people’s lives. The extraordinary expertise of our 4,000-strong workforce is harnessed to support the employees and families of the organizations we serve. Our innovative programs have a lasting impact on the health, financial security and productivity of 20,000 workplaces.  Consultant Health and Benefits  Health & Benefits Solutions  Calgary, AB  Full Time, Permanent  Benefits programs are an important and highly valued part of any employment offering. But understanding how much or what type of benefit coverage is necessary can be difficult. Our client relationship model is consultative and encourages continual communication. By providing you with the resources to support employers in engaging employees in their health, we provide a path to better workforce health and productivity.  Our Consultant works in a team and is responsible for managing, servicing and providing quality benefits consulting services for small to medium sized clients. In addition, they will be responsible for helping to build business with existing clients as well as attracting and supporting new clients through our association partnerships.  Responsibilities include:  Business Development  Identify and manage cross-sell opportunities Develop strategic relationships with key account contacts and introduce Morneau Shepell team members as appropriate Supervise the complete employee benefits cycle: plan design, provider search, implementation, experience monitoring, renewal rating Develop new business with existing clients and assists in obtaining new business with prospective clients focusing on our key association partnerships Understand client needs and identify company or industry products or services that can meet these needs Service  Deliver presentations to clients; conduct client meetings and the occasional employee presentation. Ensure that quality control and service standards are attained with every transaction Negotiate, problem solve and maintain positive relationships with insurers, external advisors and internal underwriting and benefits administration departments Develop and maintain excellent relationships with clients, through regular telephone contact and office visits Understand the client’s perspective and priorities, and work with the client to resolve administrative issues Establish strategies for services that meet client needs  Administration  Provide and oversee direct day-to-day support for clients by phone, e-mail, letters, formal reports, and face-to-face meetings Lead and manage multiple client assignments and projects Manage special projects as required Peer review the work of analysts Knowledge  Maintain current knowledge of industry trends including insurer news, products, legislation, and cost trends as well as current knowledge of our company's products and services  Qualifications:  Experience  Five years of experience in group benefits. Preference will be given to those from the group insurance industry, a consulting firm or brokerage or in an HR department. Education  Post-secondary education GBA (CEBS) designation, or working towards it. Life Insurance license (this will be a requirement within 3 months of onboarding) Skills  Strong presentation skills and comfort speaking in front of large groups Understanding of consultative selling and the ability to manage the sales cycle effectively and autonomously Expert negotiation, technical and analytical skills Can effectively communicate complex concepts in plain written and spoken language Professional Traits  Exceptional customer focus; some would say you’re the best Extremely organized self-starter, flexible, highly independent Ability to manage multiple deadlines simultaneously Proven collaborative team member with the ability to motivate and inspire team members  Morneau Shepell Morneau Shepell is in the business of helping organizations help their people because we believe that engaged people are the driving force for society. Every day, the expertise of our almost 4,000 employees is recognized as essential to the financial security, health, and productivity of our clients and their people. We're always looking for talented professionals and strategic leaders who will listen and work together with colleagues and clients to form long-term relationships and to deliver integrative solutions that fit. As we continue to grow, we're presently engaging with exceptional candidates interested in a range of exciting career opportunities. At www.morneaushepell.com you can explore our careers page to learn more about the solutions we deliver and the great people who help us do it. Follow us on LinkedIn and Twitter (Morneau_Shepell, Shepell). We are thankful for your interest, but unfortunately, we can only personally connect with those selected for an interview.  INDCAD LI-PH1  Job Grade: MS4   Fulfilling work that matters  Morneau Shepell is in the business of helping organizations help their people and in the process, we strive to elevate ours.  We're always looking for talented professionals and strategic leaders looking to make a difference in the lives of the people we serve.  We appreciate the interest of every applicant; however, we contact only those selected for an interview.  Find your fit with us. Follow us on LinkedIn, Youtube and Twitter.
Title: Consultant

With 17 locations in Calgary and Edmonton, we have been inspiring Albertans to live a healthy and active lifestyle for the last 30 years.LocationThis position is based out the IFH head office located in North West Calgary (Edgemont).SummaryThe SQL Report Writer and Support (IT) position is a fantastic opportunity for a candidate that is beginning or in the early stages of their career. T-SQL, and SQL Server Reporting Services.Have exposure to modern programming languages such as Java, C#, etcMust love data analysis and finding out the ‘truth’ through rigorous and in-depth research and analytics.Experience writing reports using SQL Server Reporting Services and Microsoft Excel (macro development / VB scripting).Experience in Business Intelligence projects including Financial Data analysis would be an asset.Proficiency in summarizing analytics and conclusion according to the audience.Strong interpersonal and communication skills to interact with different levels and types of users.Understanding stakeholder’s business requirements and transforming these requirements into meaningful information and reporting.Strong multi-tasking and prioritization skills, with minimal supervision, for an ever-changing, fast paced environment.BenefitsHealth, Dental, Paramedical (Massage, Chiropractor, etc.) for full-time employees.Complimentary gym membership for yourself and a friend or family member.Career advancement opportunities.Community involvement and philanthropy.Due the volume of candidates, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.Job Types: Full-time, PermanentExperience:Business Intelligence Projects including Financial Data: 2 yearsModern programming languages: 2 yearsusing SQL Server Reporting Services: 2 yearsLocation:Calgary, ABLicence:Diploma or certificate in computer science or similar
