Job_Description: The Day & Ross Transportation Group is currently seeking a full-time Flatdeck Logistics Specialist for our Freight division in Calgary, AB.As a Flatdeck Logistics Specialist you will be responsible for ensuring a positive customer experience in the movement of orders throughout North America. You will do this through carrier partners (including own assets) with a focus on claims-free, on-time service, protection and growth of revenue and margin. We are looking for someone who will meet and strive to exceed service expectations.With a focus on quality customer service that extends to our valued employees, Day & Ross has been continuously recognized as an honored recipient of Canada’s Best Managed Companies since 2005. We offer our full-time employees a generous Benefits package and a company matched Pension plan. Day & Ross Freight is committed to an exceptional customer experience. We achieve this by being: authentic, committed, caring, trusted, and enthusiastic.Please note: This position is tentatively scheduled for 40 hours per week, flexible hours will be required to accommodate various time zones and customer requirements. Periodic overtime and after hours coverage may be required.To be successful in this role, you will exceptionally complete the following (not an exhaustive list of responsibilities): Receive, analyze, and process booking information from customers in order to identify and confirm appropriate routes, and verify service requirements.Understand the wide array of capabilities and scheduled of designated carriers and make appropriate matches to customer requirements.Understand Flatdeck transportation market conditions throughout North America; Seasonal vs. Non-Seasonal.Negotiate rates with carriers on daily basis for short term work and as well as longer term contractual work.Strong understanding of Flatdeck equipment types such as regular Flatdecks, Stepdecks, Goosenecks, Lowboys and RGN trailersMaintain good relationships with carriers and Flatdeck service providers.Provide Spot Quotes to customers on daily basis for short term and long term contractual work.Coordinate carrier bookings, following throughout the duration of the order, and communicating with the customer, both positive and negative occurrences as required.Mitigate additional charges and assist with maintaining the accuracy of carrier information.Timely, accurate and appropriate escalation of issues.Work with analysts, managers, and customers in order to quickly resolve issues in the most efficient manner.Understand industry market conditions and communicate with the entire team issues that could impact operations as a whole.Other related duties as may be required.To be qualified for this role, please ensure your resume clearly displays some or all of the following:Previous experience in transportation, freight brokerage and 3PL (third party logistics) is required, especially in a Flatdeck dispatch environment.Post-secondary education, preferably in business, transportation, and supply chain and logistics management is considered an asset. A suitable combination of post-secondary education and transportation experience may be considered.Experience with all types of equipment, especially Flatdecks, Stepdecks, Goose Neck, and all applicable projects associated with this types of specialty equipment.Experience with pricing Flatdeck shipments as Full Truckloads and as well as Less than a Truckload modes.Strong understanding of all Flatdeck accessorial charges.Exceptional customer service and relationship management skills.Strong aptitude and skills with computers, including accuracy and efficiency in data entry and the use of MS Outlook, Excel & Word.Troubleshooting and problem solving skills, with the ability to evaluate current situation, respond quickly to changing requirements, and execute accordingly.Strong organizational and time management skills, including the ability to work under pressure in a fast paced setting, multitask and prioritize in a deadline driven environment; appropriate sense of urgency.Strong English (written and spoken) is required.Energetic, Hard Working and with a “can-do attitude”Ability to recognize sense of urgency. Exceptional follow up skills are a must!The working environment can include a fast paced, deadline driven office environment with computer work and handling of documentation.Please note that the successful candidate will be subject to reference and criminal background checks prior to employment.We thank you for your application, but only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.As a federally regulated employer, The Day & Ross Transportation Group fully supports the principles of employment equity and encourages all qualified members of the designated groups to apply.Job Type: Full-time
Title: Flatdeck Logistics Specialist

Job_Description: Are you an advocate for quality? Are you someone who strives for excellence in everything you do? Do you want everything associated with your namesake to have the sex appeal of a Rick Springfield ballad while also having the amazing dual-purpose functionality of a Spork? If any of this is true, then we have a spot for you.  QA at Solium is focused beyond the bug. At Solium, the QA team puts on our hard hat, we do the heavy lifting; we aren’t gatekeepers looking to catch bugs as a means for job preservation. Instead, we are builders involved in the creation of truly fantastic products. We are the voice of reason in the war room; we are technologists looking to the forefront of our industry and impassioning our teams to make the best. We are individuals who know that with building something great comes rebuilding and revisiting and living and breathing an agile mentality.  Solium is a Calgary success story. Our trajectory is one that only moves forward towards our goal of being the best Global Equity Compensation Management Platform on the planet. We fuel this rocket not with high-powered fuel from a very volatile energy sector and economy, but with the brightest technological minds we can find.  We have full-time, permanent opportunities for:  Quality Assurance Analysts  Who are we?  The QA team at Solium are beyond the bug. We are creators and builders who are shaping the best online platform for our industry. We are vocal contributors when our stories are created, and we are automators who know that there is always a better way to do the tough tasks and we make sure our individuals adding code feel safe when they do so. We are a team of including new grads, twenty-year vets, domain experts, automation specialists, and anything else you can think of. The one thing we aren’t is boring. We are karate practitioners, part time app developers, salsa dancers, speed runners and Mom and Dads to amazing families. Beyond that we are a QA family that knows the trade and respects and relies on one another to make sure that each one of us achieves beyond what we think is possible each and every day.  Things we believe:  Free tools are great unless they aren’t the best. We use high-end workstations with big monitors and use things like Selenium WebDriver TestNg, Jenkins and the Atlassian suite of tools to keep us automated and making sure we can explore the results of what we build rather than confirm nothing else is broken.  Things we like:  Prior experience with production large-scale distributed systems Prior experience with technologies we use (Spring,GWT,Struts,JPA,EJB,REST) A hunger for tracking down root causes – no matter how deep the rabbit hole A B.Sc. in CS is appreciated but not necessary with the right background A sense of humour and good aim with a Nerf gun What you’ll do:  Be customer focused – learn about the business to help bring value to our customers Act technology driven – design, implement, and test new functionality, explore Work closely with Dev they are executors of our amazing plans Work with Product Management to keep our battle station fully operational Push us through your experience to help the whole team get better What you’ll get:  Market rate salary based on experience Participation in annual bonus plan and stock incentives Casual Environment – we aren’t a bank, they just happen to be clients. 20 Paid Days off + 9 stat holidays (and 5 week sabbatical after five years) Work how you want – Linux, OS X, or Windows The occasional spontaneous Nerf War While we thank all applicants for their interest in a career with Solium, please note that only those individuals selected for an interview will be contacted.
Title: Quality Assurance Analyst

Job_Description: At LifeLabs, we are focused on our vision of building a healthier Canada! We are the largest community diagnostics laboratory in Canada with over 350 collection centres, 21 laboratories and service over 19 million patients each year. Caring, Agile, Customer Driven, One Team - We live our values every day in what we do to help our patients and healthcare providers. With over 5,000 employees, we all make a difference and that’s why our people are so important to us. This is an exciting time to join our LifeLabs team, grow your career with us and support numerous business initiatives, innovations, best practice and business development opportunities. Rocky Mountain Analytical provides specialized tests to naturopathic doctors, physicians and other healthcare providers who practice integrative medicine. Rocky Mountain Analytical, a division of LifeLabs is seeking a Senior Analyst who will be integral in ensuring LifeLabs successfully achieves its growth strategies. Reporting to the Director or Manager, Business Development RMA, the Senior Analyst will support the RMA Business Development team in areas of growth strategy development and execution, project management and business development. We are looking for individuals with a strong drive for change, a natural curiosity, and a passion for transforming healthcare in Canada. The role may require some travel within Canada. This is a full time permanent role and will be located in our Calgary office. Accountabilities: Conducting and facilitating internal stakeholder meetings Researching and synthesizing industry trends and the competitive landscape Conducting market research in the area of functional medicine including formal market evaluation and sizing studies Synthesizing all information and data into executive level reports to facilitate strategic decision making Supporting the development of tools and templates to help facilitate the data/information gathering and analysis process Becoming a subject matter expert in functional medicine testing and the functional medicine landscape overall Assessing/evaluating the competitive landscape relative to a particular opportunity Providing financial analysis, costing, and projections to internal clients to enable effective decision making and risk assessment Supporting the development of executive level briefing notes, updates, presentation decks and stakeholder communications Liaising with internal leaders to build an intimate understanding of the business and ongoing activities occurring across different functional units  Experience and Skills: Bachelor’s degree in Business, Management, Health Sciences or equivalent Preferred 2-3 years of experience, including 1 year recent experience in a related role; willing to look at the right new grad Master’s Degree in Business / Health Administration or equivalent considered an asset Prior knowledge and experience within the health care/life sciences industries Background in sciences (e.g. biology, physiology, biochemistry) an asset Management consulting experience considered an asset Proven ability to gain support for and drive organizational strategies Exceptional leadership and interpersonal skills with a collaborative mindset. Proven capacity to engage with diverse multidisciplinary teams (e.g., Med/Sci, Business Development, Strategy, Marketing and Sales, Client Services, Laboratory Operations, Government Relations, etc.) An excellent written and verbal communicator, including with senior executives Ability to work across multiple jurisdictions, with multiple team members in different time zones. High-level of adaptability, emotional intelligence, and comfort with ambiguity Close attention to detail, with a quality-focused mindset A detail and results oriented self-starter with demonstrated analytical expertise Proven proficiency in the Microsoft Office Suite and well developed skills in quantitative and qualitative analyses Demonstrated passion and enthusiasm for the healthcare and life sciences industries in Canada Dynamic, possessing the ability to prioritize multiple work assignments and manage time effectively
Title: Senior Analyst, Business Development - Calgary

Job_Description: Business Analyst for Application Development Processes:  full time, 6 month duration, based in Calgary This role provides ownership and oversight of all process development, improvement, and implementation of Software Process Improvement (SPI) based on the CMM framework.A key responsibility of this group is to monitor process metrics in order to identify either problem areas or identify opportunities for process improvement.They are responsible for staffing the SEPG team and providing direction in applying the Process Change Method (PCM) for the account and in training the delivery team.They train the delivery team, begins the implementation, acts as process owner for changes and updates, and plans and leads the IBM tasks of the Software Engineering Institute (SEI) CMM-based assessment.They also engage ADE to perform an effectiveness study when funded and appropriate.Capture business requirements, analysis of requirements, mapping of requirements (As is and To be processes)Particular focus on Windows 10 application Please send your resumes to Danielle Pelletier at daniellep@tes.net.
Title: Business Analyst

Job_Description: *PLEASE NOTE: PREFERENCE WILL BE GIVEN TO CANDIDATES WHO APPLY THROUGH CANFOR.COM/CAREERSCanfor TechnologyAt Canfor, our Information Technology professionals play an important role in the daily functioning of our operations. Consistently pushing the boundaries when it comes to innovation within the forestry and pulp and paper industries, our IT professionals support Canfor in achieving exceptional results.With a high caliber Information Technology leadership team, a clear vision, and significant growth and training opportunities, a career in IT at Canfor allows individuals to strengthen their competencies and grow within their respective roles. Working as an equal partner with our operations to achieve organizational objectives, you will be at the forefront of innovation.Who We Are: Canfor is one of the world’s largest and most respected integrated forest products companies. For more than 75 years, we have been delivering top-quality lumber, pulp and paper products to our valued customers worldwide. With operations in Western Canada and the Southern United States, and sales offices around the world, you can find Canfor products in every corner of the globe. We are leaders in sustainable forest management and in converting wood residuals into green energy.As we continue to grow our company and our markets, find out how you can grow your career with us.The OpportunityThe Data Analyst, Business Intelligence supports Canfor’s objectives by turning data into meaningful information that can be used to make sound business decisions. Job_Description: Inter Pipeline is a major petroleum transportation, storage and natural gas liquids processing business that ranks among the largest energy infrastructure companies in Canada. We are proud to be named one of Alberta’s Top 70 Employers, which recognizes Alberta businesses that lead their industries by being exceptional places to work.  Located out of our Calgary office, the individual in the Senior Business Analyst role will report to the Supervisor, Finance Solutions Centre. The successful candidate will be responsible for the stewardship of finance master data and project support within SAP for Inter Pipeline, as well indirect leadership of the Business Analyst.  Key Activities and Responsibilities: Review and ongoing improvement of master data creation/change approval processes Leadership of the Business Analyst role, utilizing a team accountability approach for facilitating finance master data creation/changes Work with the business and SAP Competency Centre to develop Service Level Agreements (SLAs), key performance indicators (KPIs) and other metrics for SAP finance master data Act as a data steward bringing forward cross-functional data quality and process integration issues and working collaboratively to solve them, championing the collective management of data governance Serve as a central point of contact for finance data governance understanding and providing direction and training to data consumers and producers from the business in line with business rules Ensure the right stakeholders across the enterprise (e.g. operations, finance, supply chain, etc.) are brought into make business process improvements which mitigate data issues Bring best practices in master data management and propose opportunities for improvement Interaction with SAP Competency Center on future system enhancements, builds, testing, and roll-outs Assist with development and usage of SAP reports  Education, Skills and Experience: Undergraduate diploma or degree in business with 5+ years of progressive experience in financial system support, CPA (CA, CMA, CGA) designation is an asset Strong finance expertise on master data usage, configuration, and integrated data requirements/linkage points combined with prior oil and gas experience considered an asset In depth knowledge of SAP FI_CO and Business Warehouse, experience with S/4HANA and Fiori an asset Approaches work with a high level of curiosity and aptitude to identify and solve problems, takes initiative, is accountable, and works independently Change agent who can persuade and influence stakeholders to establish new processes, shift to automation, and provide innovative solutions Ability to manage internal and external relationships with well-developed interpersonal, team, customer service and communication skills (both written and verbal) Strong customer service skills in working with internal departments to achieve results through relationships with people and teams Able to work well in a fast-paced, growth environment, with strong attention to detail and accuracy Maintains strong initiative and possesses superior analytical skills
Title: Senior Business Analyst

Job_Description: Job Type: Permanent  Primary Location: Vancouver, British Columbia, Canada  All Available Locations: Calgary; Vancouver  External Posting Description  Our International Tax group is growing! We are looking for qualified, motivated individuals to join our teams in the Calgary and Vancouver locations. In this role you will have the opportunity to work with a very talented group of Tax professionals on a variety of interesting and challenging international and Canadian tax issues. As a Senior Analyst you will: Participate in cross-border engagements including structuring corporate investment, developing tax strategies and compliance Understand, analyze and research Canadian and international tax transactions Develop your technical skills and knowledge of our clients' business Work as part of a team to develop recommendations and provide solutions to clients Lead specific projects of moderate size and complexity Work closely with other service lines and Deloitte foreign offices to deliver cross-border solutions to our clients    External Posting Qualifications  Completed undergraduate degree with outstanding academic credentials A completed masters degree in Tax, an accounting designation (Chartered Professional Accountants (CPA) designation) or LLB 2-4 years of relevant work experience, including some experience in international tax Enrolled or willingness to enroll in the CICA In-depth Tax program Strong commitment to professional client service excellence Excellent interpersonal relations and demonstrated ability to work with others effectively in teams Superior verbal and written communication skills Ability to develop and present new ideas and conceptualize new approaches and solutions Proven analytical skills and systematic problem solving Canadian travel required, occasional international travel. Candidates must be able to enter the USA to work on client assignment   Why Deloitte? Launch your career with The One Firm where you can make a greater impact than you ever thought possible. With endless opportunities at every turn, and a culture built to support and drive our people to be the very best they can be, Deloitte is The One Firm for you to learn, grow, create, and lead. At Deloitte, we understand that everyone, and their career goals, are different. As a firm, we help create the conditions and opportunities that will enable our people to thrive – both professionally and personally. We do this by making three commitments to our people: You will lead at every level: We grow the world’s best leaders so you can achieve the impact you seek, faster. You can work your way: We give you the means to work how you want, and we have innovative spaces and the mindset to help you be wildly successful. You will feel included and inspired: We create a deep sense of belonging where you can bring your whole self to work. Apply now and let us show you how to push your career to the next level at Deloitte. The One Firm. For You. Deloitte is an inclusive employer dedicated to building a diverse workforce. We encourage applications from all qualified candidates and will accommodate applicants’ needs under the respective provincial human rights codes throughout all stages of the recruitment and selection process. Please advise the Recruiter to ensure your accessibility needs are accommodated throughout this process. Information received relating to accommodation will be addressed confidentially. We thank all applicants in advance for their interest; however, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted 32641   Requisition code: 32641-en_US

Job_Description: Our client is seeking a Senior Contract Analyst specializing in Strategy and Custom Contract Formation/Solutions for Midstream Construction Contracts. The ideal candidate will possess 3-7 years of Project Management experience.  The Specialist will manage the commercial relationships to control risks as agreed, and to resolve issues that arise, in an equitable manner that preserves the working relationship, while protecting the company’s interests and delivering the outcomes and innovation sought through the commercial relationship.  Key Responsibilities: Strategy Development Develop and articulate project and contract acquisition strategies within area of responsibility and communicate strategies to project clients and Senior Management; Conduct market and competitive intelligence research and analysis within area of responsibility; Support demand planning and supply planning Develop and recommend commercial contracting strategies. Develop and recommend tactics and actions to be pursued in each strategy (e.g. contracting framework, supplier engagement, business participation, negotiation strategies). Validate commercial accuracy and feasibility of strategies. Develop commercial contract strategies (e.g. pricing types, optional pricing, incentives, milestones, etc.) Collaborate with SC Category Management on sourcing strategy development as applicable. Sourcing & Contract Execution: Develop, issue and manage tender documents (RFPs, RFQ, RFIs, etc.); Lead cross-functional teams during contract tendering, formation, administration and negotiation; Lead proposal analyses and proposal commercial evaluations; Lead the contract formation and/or contract administration process for various direct and indirect material purchases; Develop contract and service agreements that drive value within acceptable risks and in accordance with SC Policy & Procedures, approved Contracting strategies, and BU Project drivers. Negotiate contract commercial terms, ensuring they meet requirements of internal stakeholders (i.e., risk, legal, project management, etc.) and standards; Ensure contracting activities are properly aligned with the expectations of the Category, BU, Major Project and stakeholder groups, as applicable, while educating and supporting the deployment of best practices. Document and communicate to senior management all recommendations for contract award including commercial rationale. Qualifications: A relevant University degree and five to ten (5-10) years of related experience in sourcing and contracting or within the contract management An MBA Degree is an asset Superior written and oral communication skills, analytical and problem solving skills, people management skills and financial acumen are a requirement Experience in the oil and gas industry. Midstream, energy generation, or construction experience Experience in Supply Chain Management process and systems Thorough understanding of contract structure, terms and conditions and supplier performance Experience managing high value relationships with internal and external stakeholders and understanding of their objectives and needs Project management or project controls skills and experience Proven strong negotiation skills and contract management expertise Expertise and Skills Supply Chain and Procurement, Procurement Analyst > 10 years Priority Requirements Must-have: Describe your experience as a Senior Contract Analyst specializing in Strategic Development and Management of Custom Contract Formation/Solutions for Midstream Construction Contracts

Job_Description: Eagle is currently seeking a Senior Organizational Change Manager for a one (1) year contract opportunity, scheduled to begin immediately.  Key Responsibilities  The successful candidate will be responsible for: Supporting internal clients in delivering complex programs and initiatives that are strategic in nature and have substantial implications for the organization's performance;  Preparing the organization to support and adopt new, more effective ways of working including changes to programs, processes, systems, organizational design/structure, roles, capabilities, and culture;  Serving as a change agent, business partner, coach, and facilitator;  Managing resources associated with OCM deliverables including change advisors, communication specialists, training/learning advisors, program coordinators, and business analysts;  Supporting project management, governance and sponsorship activities associated with large scale programs and initiatives, ensuring integration and alignment across multiple concurrent programs and initiatives;  Partnering with Human Resources consultants, talent management, and learning specialists and project teams to develop and deliver integrated OCM solutions;  Supporting the objectives of the corporate organizational change management function through sharing of expertise and best practices, adoption of corporate OCM standards, and active participation in the OCM community;  Applying expert OCM knowledge to prepare and deliver change management assessments and plans for large scale and complex programs and initiatives across multiple stakeholder groups and levels of the organization including senior leadership;  Following change management standards and principles;  Utilizing or modifying available tools and services to implement a structured best fit change approach within a program or initiative;  Completing and assessing detailed change impact and stakeholder analyses;  Developing the OCM strategy and supporting plans including communication, sponsor roadmap, training, coaching, management of risk and issues and acceptance/resistance;  Overseeing and/or performing the required communication, training, and other change management activities;  Preparing key stakeholders to present OCM deliverables such as communications and presentations or training;  Partnering to develop and deliver holistic/integrated OCM solutions, including: accurate change impact and stakeholder analysis, appropriate communications and learning approaches, effective transition management, effective risk management/mitigation, support for leaders in leading through change, an aligned approach to organizational design and talent management elements to support change objectives;  Managing OCM budgets, project costs, and schedule and providing progress reports to leadership;  Facilitating and consulting with senior leaders at all levels to gain sponsorship, approval, and engagement of the business and the affected key audiences in executing the change management strategy;  Providing coaching in change management, resistance management and change sponsorship to the project manager, business lead, change sponsor, project team, the extended change team, and others identified through stakeholder assessment;  Continuously assessing potential issues/risks, conflicting priorities, and opportunities for integration across multiple concurrent programs/initiatives, and raise these to leadership;  Evaluating the success of change management activities and provides progress reports to the broad set of stakeholders;  Monitoring change adoption in the organization and plans additional OCM activities to support gaps in adoption or continued realization of change benefits;  Facilitating and guiding senior leaders and business process owners on long term sustainment to operationalize and embed changes;  Continually building knowledge and acumen in all aspects of the organization, the business, our processes and systems; and,  Supporting the objectives of corporate organizational change management function through: sharing of expertise and best practices; adoption of corporate OCM, communications and learning and development standards; contribution to the continual improvement of the corporate OCM methodology and tools; active participation in the broader OCM community of practice; championing the role of the OCM function.  Skills and Qualifications  The qualified candidate must have: A University Degree in relevant discipline;  Fifteen (15) years’ experience; and,  OCM experience as it relates to IT projects and the deployment of new applications.  Don’t miss out on this opportunity, apply online today!  We would like to thank all applicants for their interest; however, only candidates under consideration will be contacted. Please note that your application does not signify the beginning of employment with Eagle and that employment with Eagle will only commence when placed on an assignment as a temporary employee of Eagle.
Title: Senior Organizational Change Manager

Assignment Location Calgary, AB System & Network Administrator - Assignment Length 3-6 months Contract to Hire

Job_Description: Calgary, AB  Job Summary  Located in our Calgary, AB head office the Solution Architect is responsible for providing the integration and architectural framework that Project teams deliver within. Working on multiple projects, the Solution Architect provides appropriate solutions by participating in project definition and prioritization, validating requirements, determining solution alternatives, creating conceptual designs, and facilitating requirements traceability throughout the Systems Development Life Cycle (SDLC). They work with various Information Systems (IS) and business partners to design solutions that deliver recognizable business value.  Responsibilities  Partner with Engagement Managers and Business Analysts to conduct project investigation (examine feasibility; validate requirements; contribute to budget estimates and CBA's and recommend next steps)  Assist Vendor Management by leading the package/technology section of the RFx process  Research, develop and document solution alternatives, approaches and recommendations that address approved project or enhancement scope and business requirements.  Prepare and present technical impact assessments would be a great benefit  Ensure alignment with IS's Target State Architecture and Technology Roadmap, and leverage IS investments across the enterprise  When necessary, raise architecture exceptions and communicate to the Portfolio and Project teams  Work with Project Managers (PM's) to balance scope and quality with budget and schedule  Ensure teams understand the broader IT context and ramifications of decisions and approaches  Engage other IS stakeholders as required in order to ensure completeness of solution designs  Act as a representative (one of many) for their portfolio's interests in cross portfolio projects/programs  Contribute to the security risk assessments (risk identification, risk analysis, mitigation strategy) to assist the business in selecting the most appropriate solutions  Create project specific deliverables such as solution alternatives and recommendations, Solution Blueprint Documents, and the infrastructure requirements document  Present the solution alternatives and recommendation document and the solution blueprint document to business and IS stakeholders for approval  Participate in and review and approve project designs (e.g. High Level Designs, and Detailed Designs), Test Definitions and Implementation Strategies  Stay involved throughout project life cycle to resolve design issues and ensure projects deliver according to the approved designs  Contribute to the development and maintenance of Enterprise Architecture strategies, standards, principles, and patterns that can provide the framework for delivery of practical business solutions including all research and development activities.  Required Skills and Experience  University degree or College diploma or equivalent work experience  5-10 years IT experience in progressive analysis and design related positions  3+ years in an IT Architectural role  Broad technology expertise, and proven experience in conceptual, logical and physical design in one or more architectural discipline (e.g. Application, Integration, Data, Infrastructure, Security)  Experience working closely with both the Business and IS stakeholders, and proven experience in building and managing professional relationships and consensus-building throughout all levels of an organization  A strong understanding of Project Management and SDLC methodologies  Knowledge of Agile framework required; hands on practice with Agile is preferred  Adept at balancing the immediate needs of a project (business requirements and business strategy) with Enterprise Architecture standards and the declared IS target state to achieve a win-win situation  Team player with excellent communication and interpersonal skills  Exceptional skills in facilitating meetings, interviewing, probing and influencing others  Ability to create and deliver effective presentations and briefings up to Senior Management/Executive levels.  Academic / Educational requirements  University degree or College diploma or equivalent work experience.  Business Context  ERP  Great example is Warehouse Management System being worked on now.  Or perhaps interfaces that go between our systems and 3PL Partners.  Data Warehouse solutions is very beneficial  Will work with Enterprise Planning, Interface Team, Data Architecture and create, document solutions.  JDA Suite – PMM, Demand & Fulfill, Size Scaling experience Allocations WMS - Warehouse Management System experience EDI Planning Systems experience (Manhattan or Red Prairie)  Oracle database  Data Warehousing experience – nice to have  Integration  Solid and diverse Interface experience (this is big for me) ETL / Tibco experience - perhaps ESB experience  Retail exposure  Nice to have  A coding background, but not a coder anymore….  Hiring contact: smears@tundratechnical.ca  Tundra Technical Solutions would like to thank you for the interest you have demonstrated in this opportunity. Simply click on ‘Tell a Friend’ option to refer a friend.  Tundra Technical Solutions is among North America’s leading providers of Information Technology and Engineering staffing and consulting services. Our success and our clients’ success are built on a foundation of service excellence. Rather than continually trying to sell to new clients and companies and simply filling databases with candidates, we focus on developing stronger relationships and deeper knowledge of our existing clients’ challenges and opportunities.  Open ears. Open minds. Open futures  The Tundra team has over 600 years of experience, from a wide variety of disciplines – recruiting executives, business owners and technical consultants. Sales Associate Our Sales Associates make every customer feel welcome and leave delighted, more knowledgeable, and feeling better about Rogers and Fido every time. They know how to engage, show they care and invest the time with our customers to get things done. They want every customer sharing their experience and always coming back. At Rogers, retail has impact, and so can you.  In this role you will: Deliver a superior and consistent customer experience Be the first to learn about new products and services Handle all issues and concerns – you're the one-stop resolution for our customers Meet and exceed monthly sales targets Work in a fast-paced environment that requires a high degree of multi-tasking Work with and through others to achieve team goals in a highly collaborative environment Be able to work a varied and flexible schedules (Monday – Sunday)  You are someone who: Knows how to greet and thank our customers – you want everyone to feel welcome and appreciated Has a knack for building rapport – you genuinely care about our customers’ needs. It’s not just about the sale! Ensures our customers understand our products and services Enjoys solving customer problems – you take accountability for their issues Is comfortable taking action, showing initiative and feels empowered to lead Takes pride in their work environment and wants to see the team succeed Acts as a brand ambassador, an educator, a leader, a problem solver, and so much more!  Benefits for you: We invest in you, just as much as you invest in us Base hourly rate and competitive commission structure Opportunities to grow and develop your career Strong internal development programs Comprehensive health and dental plan for full time and part time employees Outstanding share options and wealth accumulation programs Employee discounts across Rogers & Fido services Overtime pay eligible As part of the recruitment process, candidates will be required to provide consent for and successfully pass a criminal background check. Schedule: Part Time Shift: Variable Length of Contract: Not Applicable (Regular Position) Work Location: 200 Southridge Dr., Unit 437 (5689), Okotoks, AB Travel Requirements: None Posting Category/Function: Retail (In Store / Hourly) & Sales and Service Requisition ID: 118933 WHY ROGERS? As a proud Canadian company, we're dedicated to making things easier for our customers. We’ve been embracing and leading change for over 50-years, and we’ll continue to seek out new opportunities to bring our customers simple solutions for today and tomorrow. We recognize that success is determined by the strength and diversity of our people. We work together because we want to win together, and these five shared values guide and define our work: Simplify and innovate Take ownership of the what and the how Equip people to succeed Execute with discipline and pride Talk straight, build trust, and over deliver Why Rogers? Because your tomorrow inspires our today. What makes us different makes us stronger. Rogers has a strong commitment to diversity and inclusion. Everyone who applies for a job will be considered. We recognize the business value in creating a workplace where each team member has the tools to reach their full potential. At Rogers, we value the insights and innovation that diverse teams bring to work. Job_Description: Calgary, AB  Job Summary  The purpose of the Senior Project Manager is to successfully lead a cross-functional project team to successful project completion following the SDLC (Solution Development Life-Cycle). The Project Manager is accountable for delivering a solution within project constraints, namely scope, budget and schedule.  The Senior Project Manager will use formal project management techniques and interact with clients and other stakeholders to ensure projects are completed within scope, cost and execution commitments.  Responsibilities  Plan and successfully deliver large, highly visible IT projects with high risk, complexity and change management;  Follow the appropriate SDLC for each project;  Set project team expectations, and clearly document project success factors;  Provide extensive communications to senior management as required;  Implement efficient communication practices to ensure the that the project team operates efficiently and effectively;  Identify, secure and lead large multi-stream project teams;  Provide leadership to the project team while respecting the project mandate and the company’s values;  Manage project schedules and budgets to ensure project completion on time, on budget, and within scope and agreed performance metrics;  Analyze project risk and execute risk management strategies;  Develop project charters ensuring alignment with business goals and properly defined project scope, deliverables, risk analysis and resource requirements;  Work with the business and the Project Office Administrator to ensure that all elements of the AFE are complete and accurate;  Prepare and possibly present regular project status reports;  Manage both departmental and cross-functional projects as required;  Work with the Project Office Administrator to ensure project financial tracking is current and accurate;  Manage the implementation of assigned projects to meet stakeholder expectations measured by a project post-mortem.  Mentor more junior project staff.  Required Skills and Experience  10+ years of progressive experience, including 5+ years experience in a relevant industry vertical. (Retail / Wholesale Distribution, CPG, WMS, EDI, JDA, Sterling DOM, etc.)  Must have experience with package (COTS) customization and deployment  Must have experience in one or more areas of Supply Chain, Warehouse/Distribution management, Warehouse Automated Material Handling Equipment & EDI transactions.  Experience with IBM’s Sterling Distributed Order Management (DOM) is highly valued.  Experience in Demand Management and Replenishment an asset, especially exposure to JDA PMM or Warehouse Management Systems (WMS) like Manhattan.  Experience managing all phases of large and complex projects;  Experience leading project teams of 10+ members;  Solid SDLC application development experience;  Possess a good sense of how business needs can be met through innovative technology solutions;  Demonstrated excellence in communication and leadership aptitudes;  Experience managing Systems Integration, Software Development, Package Implementation, and e-Business projects;  Experience in creating project plans using formal PM methodologies.  Knowledge of business process analysis and design;  Solid understanding of project management processes, practices and tools;  Understanding of large system implementation, Systems Integration, Software Development, Package Implementation, and e-Business technology;  Knowledge of Project Management Principles and methodology.  Academic / Educational requirements  Must have formal Project Management training  A university degree or equivalent combination of education and experience  Keys  Strong PM with a demonstrated ability to deliver.  Ability to deal with a variety of stakeholders, including senior management.  Ability to deal with difficult stakeholders and effectively manage expectations.  Ability to build relationships.  Ability to manage a cross functional team which would include the ability to communicate effectively with the technical team members and the business people on the project.  Needs to have integration experience with big systems/applications: JDE, JDA, SAP, I2 Solutions, ERP  Needs to have COTS implementation experience as company doesn’t customize their own systems they buy it off the rack and then integrate it.  Has to have managed a large team – 25 people +  Worked with big budgets around the half a million dollar area  Doesn’t need configuration experience  Ability to understand and follow project delivery methodologies. An understanding around when to apply the right one, and an understanding around how to adjust those methodologies.  Bias against people who always play multiple roles (i.e. Project Manager, Business Analyst, and Architect) on their projects.  Additional: Previous experience in one or more of the following areas: relevant industry vertical. (Retail / Wholesale Distribution, CPG, WMS, EDI, JDA, Sterling DOM, etc.)  Must be able to manage multiple projects at once  Excellent communication skills with technical teams as well as business teams  Interest in mentoring junior / intermediate PMs  Focus on forward planning  Understanding of strategic vs tactical delivery  Understanding of SDLC  Hiring contact: smears@tundratechnical.ca  Tundra Technical Solutions would like to thank you for the interest you have demonstrated in this opportunity. Check out our Referral Reward Program, referrals are a big secret behind our success. As always, we’re on the lookout for great people. And we know that you know great people. Simply click on ‘Tell a Friend’ option to refer a friend. Open ears. Open minds. Open futures  The Tundra team has over 600 years of experience, from a wide variety of disciplines – recruiting executives, business owners and technical consultants. Job_Description: Build a meaningful career  At Morneau Shepell, we offer more than career opportunities, we provide career opportunities to make meaningful contributions to people’s lives. The extraordinary expertise of our 4,000-strong workforce is harnessed to support the employees and families of the organizations we serve. Our innovative programs have a lasting impact on the health, financial security and productivity of 20,000 workplaces.  Consultant Health and Benefits  Health & Benefits Solutions  Calgary, AB  Full Time, Permanent  Benefits programs are an important and highly valued part of any employment offering. But understanding how much or what type of benefit coverage is necessary can be difficult. Our client relationship model is consultative and encourages continual communication. By providing you with the resources to support employers in engaging employees in their health, we provide a path to better workforce health and productivity.  Our Consultant works in a team and is responsible for managing, servicing and providing quality benefits consulting services for small to medium sized clients. In addition, they will be responsible for helping to build business with existing clients as well as attracting and supporting new clients through our association partnerships.  Responsibilities include:  Business Development  Identify and manage cross-sell opportunities Develop strategic relationships with key account contacts and introduce Morneau Shepell team members as appropriate Supervise the complete employee benefits cycle: plan design, provider search, implementation, experience monitoring, renewal rating Develop new business with existing clients and assists in obtaining new business with prospective clients focusing on our key association partnerships Understand client needs and identify company or industry products or services that can meet these needs Service  Deliver presentations to clients; conduct client meetings and the occasional employee presentation. Ensure that quality control and service standards are attained with every transaction Negotiate, problem solve and maintain positive relationships with insurers, external advisors and internal underwriting and benefits administration departments Develop and maintain excellent relationships with clients, through regular telephone contact and office visits Understand the client’s perspective and priorities, and work with the client to resolve administrative issues Establish strategies for services that meet client needs  Administration  Provide and oversee direct day-to-day support for clients by phone, e-mail, letters, formal reports, and face-to-face meetings Lead and manage multiple client assignments and projects Manage special projects as required Peer review the work of analysts Knowledge  Maintain current knowledge of industry trends including insurer news, products, legislation, and cost trends as well as current knowledge of our company's products and services  Qualifications:  Experience  Five years of experience in group benefits. Preference will be given to those from the group insurance industry, a consulting firm or brokerage or in an HR department. Education  Post-secondary education GBA (CEBS) designation, or working towards it. Life Insurance license (this will be a requirement within 3 months of onboarding) Skills  Strong presentation skills and comfort speaking in front of large groups Understanding of consultative selling and the ability to manage the sales cycle effectively and autonomously Expert negotiation, technical and analytical skills Can effectively communicate complex concepts in plain written and spoken language Professional Traits  Exceptional customer focus; some would say you’re the best Extremely organized self-starter, flexible, highly independent Ability to manage multiple deadlines simultaneously Proven collaborative team member with the ability to motivate and inspire team members  Morneau Shepell Morneau Shepell is in the business of helping organizations help their people because we believe that engaged people are the driving force for society. Every day, the expertise of our almost 4,000 employees is recognized as essential to the financial security, health, and productivity of our clients and their people. We're always looking for talented professionals and strategic leaders who will listen and work together with colleagues and clients to form long-term relationships and to deliver integrative solutions that fit. As we continue to grow, we're presently engaging with exceptional candidates interested in a range of exciting career opportunities. At www.morneaushepell.com you can explore our careers page to learn more about the solutions we deliver and the great people who help us do it. Follow us on LinkedIn and Twitter (Morneau_Shepell, Shepell). We are thankful for your interest, but unfortunately, we can only personally connect with those selected for an interview.  INDCAD LI-PH1  Job Grade: MS4   Fulfilling work that matters  Morneau Shepell is in the business of helping organizations help their people and in the process, we strive to elevate ours.  We're always looking for talented professionals and strategic leaders looking to make a difference in the lives of the people we serve.  We appreciate the interest of every applicant; however, we contact only those selected for an interview.  Find your fit with us. Follow us on LinkedIn, Youtube and Twitter.

Consistently pushing the boundaries when it comes to innovation within the forestry and pulp and paper industries, our IT professionals support Canfor in achieving exceptional results.With a high caliber Information Technology leadership team, a clear vision, and significant growth and training opportunities, a career in IT at Canfor allows individuals to strengthen their competencies and grow within their respective roles. Working as an equal partner with our operations to achieve organizational objectives, you will be at the forefront of innovation.Who We Are: Canfor is one of the world’s largest and most respected integrated forest products companies. For more than 75 years, we have been delivering top-quality lumber, pulp and paper products to our valued customers worldwide. With operations in Western Canada and the Southern United States, and sales offices around the world, you can find Canfor products in every corner of the globe. We are leaders in sustainable forest management and in converting wood residuals into green energy.As we continue to grow our company and our markets, find out how you can grow your career with us.The OpportunityThe Data Analyst, Business Intelligence supports Canfor’s objectives by turning data into meaningful information that can be used to make sound business decisions. The Data Analyst will provide expertise in business intelligence to prepare and deliver data and information to internal customers and stakeholders through reports, dashboards and scorecards. It is essential that the Data Analyst build an understanding of the business at a level of detail that enables them to work with the business to deliver valuable information.Please Note:  This is a relocation opportunity in Vancouver, British Columbia. The successful applicant may be provided with relocation assistance.Main ResponsibilitiesRequirements Gathering:Engage with various business units to capture information needs, compare those needs with existing tools and identify gapsParticipate in business requirements workshopsWrite business requirements documents as required to elaborate needs, gain acceptanceDesign & Development:Architect tables and dataDesign dashboards, reports, drill-down analytics and data visualizationsDesign, configure and administer the metadata layerCreate system technical requirements for documentation and knowledge managementActively challenge and find solutions to optimize system performanceTesting, Validation, Release Management:Develop and implement testing strategiesValidate data accuracyDeploy and validate changes in production environmentTraining & Change Management:Support the development of training, documentation, and help desk capabilitiesRequired SkillsBachelor's degree in computer science, information systems, business management or specialized training/certificationExperience working with relational databases (Microsoft SQL Server, Oracle Database, MySQL, etc)Applied knowledge of SQL (T-SQL, PL/SQL, ANSI-SQL, etc)Applied understanding of data modelling and warehousing conceptsWorking knowledge of business intelligence tools such as Oracle Business IntelligenceWorking knowledge of ETL tools such as Oracle Data Integrator or InformaticaExperience mediating and clarifying sometimes ambiguous or conflicting end user requirementsEagerness to learn new concepts and technologies and keep-up-to-date with existing onesWillingness to go above and beyond to understand both the business and technical aspects of a problemHiring for this position is ongoing and will be filled as required. To be considered for this position, please apply today.In order to be eligible for this position, you must be legally entitled to work in Canada for our Company.There has never been a better time to join the Canfor Information Technology team and become a part of the modern forest industry. We have a wide range of rewarding and innovative careers in some of the best communities in North America, with plenty of room for advancement. We offer competitive compensation and benefits packages, and are committed to the professional development of our employees.*PLEASE NOTE: PREFERENCE WILL BE GIVEN TO CANDIDATES WHO APPLY THROUGH CANFOR.COM/CAREERSFollow us on LinkedIn , Twitter , and Facebook for Canfor news, career opportunities, and upcoming events!Vancouver, BCThe city of Vancouver is both a natural beauty and a progressive urban centre, a rare place on earth that is idyllic and electric all at once. With one of Canada’s mildest climates, Vancouver is ideally suited for those devoted to outdoor pursuits, health and wellness. Along with its endless supply of fresh air and clean water, Vancouver also boasts countless choices for culturally diverse, world-class cuisine and an inventory of arts and entertainment events. Job_Description: Inter Pipeline is a major petroleum transportation, storage and natural gas liquids processing business that ranks among the largest energy infrastructure companies in Canada. We are proud to be named one of Alberta’s Top 70 Employers, which recognizes Alberta businesses that lead their industries by being exceptional places to work.  Located out of our Calgary office, the individual in the Senior Business Analyst role will report to the Supervisor, Finance Solutions Centre. The successful candidate will be responsible for the stewardship of finance master data and project support within SAP for Inter Pipeline, as well indirect leadership of the Business Analyst.  Key Activities and Responsibilities: Review and ongoing improvement of master data creation/change approval processes Leadership of the Business Analyst role, utilizing a team accountability approach for facilitating finance master data creation/changes Work with the business and SAP Competency Centre to develop Service Level Agreements (SLAs), key performance indicators (KPIs) and other metrics for SAP finance master data Act as a data steward bringing forward cross-functional data quality and process integration issues and working collaboratively to solve them, championing the collective management of data governance Serve as a central point of contact for finance data governance understanding and providing direction and training to data consumers and producers from the business in line with business rules Ensure the right stakeholders across the enterprise (e.g. operations, finance, supply chain, etc.) are brought into make business process improvements which mitigate data issues Bring best practices in master data management and propose opportunities for improvement Interaction with SAP Competency Center on future system enhancements, builds, testing, and roll-outs Assist with development and usage of SAP reports  Education, Skills and Experience: Undergraduate diploma or degree in business with 5+ years of progressive experience in financial system support, CPA (CA, CMA, CGA) designation is an asset Strong finance expertise on master data usage, configuration, and integrated data requirements/linkage points combined with prior oil and gas experience considered an asset In depth knowledge of SAP FI_CO and Business Warehouse, experience with S/4HANA and Fiori an asset Approaches work with a high level of curiosity and aptitude to identify and solve problems, takes initiative, is accountable, and works independently Change agent who can persuade and influence stakeholders to establish new processes, shift to automation, and provide innovative solutions Ability to manage internal and external relationships with well-developed interpersonal, team, customer service and communication skills (both written and verbal) Strong customer service skills in working with internal departments to achieve results through relationships with people and teams Able to work well in a fast-paced, growth environment, with strong attention to detail and accuracy Maintains strong initiative and possesses superior analytical skills

Job_Description: At Rogers we’re for supporting you on a journey to a rewarding career. Whether you’re a developer, an analyst, or a customer care consultant, Rogers is the place where ideas become reality. We embrace change, and find ways to do better. And we deliver on that commitment by fostering an environment of passion and innovation for all people.  Sales Associate Our Sales Associates make every customer feel welcome and leave delighted, more knowledgeable, and feeling better about Rogers and Fido every time. They know how to engage, show they care and invest the time with our customers to get things done. They want every customer sharing their experience and always coming back. At Rogers, retail has impact, and so can you.  In this role you will: Deliver a superior and consistent customer experience Be the first to learn about new products and services Handle all issues and concerns – you're the one-stop resolution for our customers Meet and exceed monthly sales targets Work in a fast-paced environment that requires a high degree of multi-tasking Work with and through others to achieve team goals in a highly collaborative environment Be able to work a varied and flexible schedules (Monday – Sunday)  You are someone who: Knows how to greet and thank our customers – you want everyone to feel welcome and appreciated Has a knack for building rapport – you genuinely care about our customers’ needs. It’s not just about the sale! Ensures our customers understand our products and services Enjoys solving customer problems – you take accountability for their issues Is comfortable taking action, showing initiative and feels empowered to lead Takes pride in their work environment and wants to see the team succeed Acts as a brand ambassador, an educator, a leader, a problem solver, and so much more!  Benefits for you: We invest in you, just as much as you invest in us Base hourly rate and competitive commission structure Opportunities to grow and develop your career Strong internal development programs Comprehensive health and dental plan for full time and part time employees Outstanding share options and wealth accumulation programs Employee discounts across Rogers & Fido services Overtime pay eligible As part of the recruitment process, candidates will be required to provide consent for and successfully pass a criminal background check. Schedule: Part Time Shift: Variable Length of Contract: Not Applicable (Regular Position) Work Location: 200 Southridge Dr., Unit 437 (5689), Okotoks, AB Travel Requirements: None Posting Category/Function: Retail (In Store / Hourly) & Sales and Service Requisition ID: 118933 WHY ROGERS? As a proud Canadian company, we're dedicated to making things easier for our customers. We’ve been embracing and leading change for over 50-years, and we’ll continue to seek out new opportunities to bring our customers simple solutions for today and tomorrow. We recognize that success is determined by the strength and diversity of our people. We work together because we want to win together, and these five shared values guide and define our work: Simplify and innovate Take ownership of the what and the how Equip people to succeed Execute with discipline and pride Talk straight, build trust, and over deliver Why Rogers? Because your tomorrow inspires our today. What makes us different makes us stronger. Rogers has a strong commitment to diversity and inclusion. Everyone who applies for a job will be considered. We recognize the business value in creating a workplace where each team member has the tools to reach their full potential. At Rogers, we value the insights and innovation that diverse teams bring to work. We work with our candidates with disabilities throughout the recruitment process to ensure that they have what they need to be at their best. Please reach out to our recruiters and hiring managers to begin a conversation about how we can ensure that you deliver your best work. You can also reach out to our team at RogersRecruiting@rci.rogers.com to begin a conversation about your individual accessibility needs throughout the hiring process. Posting Notes: Retail || Canada (CA) || AB || Okotoks || Retail ||

Job_Description: About MRU Founded in 1910 and located in Calgary, Alberta, Canada, Mount Royal University has built a reputation on a strong, liberal education foundation. Our vision is to provide an exceptional undergraduate educational experience for our students. We are a community of engaged citizens, providing personalized, experiential and outcome-based learning in an environment of inclusion, diversity and respect. Through our focus on teaching and learning informed by scholarship, we are preparing our graduates for success in their careers and lives. Mount Royal University presently offers 12 four-year baccalaureate degrees with 32 majors, with a view to grow this mix to 15 degrees and 50 majors by 2025. Current degree offerings are unique, and include four-year bachelor degrees in interior design, midwifery, child studies and health and physical education, as well as arts, criminal justice, business administration, communication, computer information systems, education, nursing and science. Mount Royal also offers robust continuing education programming as well as an internationally-renowned music conservatory. More than 13,000 credit students attend Mount Royal University annually, with more than 90,000 Mount Royal alumni contributing to their communities worldwide. Our faculty provide a teaching and learning environment that welcomes challenging ideas. Our staff are dedicated to supporting our campus so that students are provided with an exceptional educational experience. Our management team provides leadership throughout the University, and inspires others at all levels to be leaders in their own important sectors. In support of our students, and in response to our broader community, we know that investing in our employees benefits the University as a whole. Talented and committed employees are the driving force behind student success. Our faculty, staff and management are united in creating a thriving learning environment for our students. Mount Royal University is an exceptional community focused on our people. About the Role Reporting to the Database Administrator, the Database Analyst is responsible for aspects of database management including planning, implementation, configuration, support, usage monitoring and tuning. The position is responsible for internal support of data integrity, security and reliability issues within the Oracle administrative system database. The position is responsible for implementing backup and recovery procedures, maintaining system documentation and logs and assisting in troubleshooting and diagnosing production problems.  The Database Analyst will work with the Application Services and Infrastructure teams to ensure that proper security and networking requirements are met to support the University's ERP (BANNER) and all other administrative systems. The Database Analyst is also responsible for managing data access permissions to ensure security of the University's data. Mount Royal University is currently reviewing a shared-resource initiative with other Alberta institutions that use Banner. At this time the amount of travel and tasks at other institutions is unknown. Most of the work will be remote, but some travel may be required. This position is limited term ending April 10, 2020. Responsibilities Perform the administration and maintenance of databases in a Linux environment Establish and maintain sound backup and recovery policies and procedures Monitor databases and review performance logs for issues before they become problems Assist with the development of Banner upgrade project plans Optimize database performance where required Install, configure and upgrade Oracle server software and related products Evaluate Oracle features and Oracle-related products Work as part of a team and provide 24x7 support when required Interface with vendors for technical support Capacity planning Implement and maintain Banner and Oracle database security Assist with application software upgrades, operating system upgrades and network or other hardware upgrades Qualifications BS or BA degree in Information Technology or equivalent degree with work experience Experience with an ERP system or equivalent Enterprise Application (Ellucian's Banner ERP preferred) Experience patching, upgrading, tuning and supporting Oracle in a multi-instance database environment Expert knowledge of Oracle 11g/12c, Oracle WebLogic Fusion Middleware, Tomcat and RMAN Real Application Cluster experience is desired Oracle Grid Control experience is desired Advanced SQL skills Disaster Recovery Strategies Knowledge of Data Warehousing/ETL Processes Experience managing overall security and integrity of the University's database infrastructure Demonstrated ability to work within a matrix management organization while effectively supporting multiple projects and deadlines Strong analysis and critical thinking skills to troubleshoot and perform root cause analysis on technical problems and solution design Ability to work effectively with a team or independently and lead small teams as needed Good communication to manage technical resources and stakeholder expectations Effective organizational skills to plan, prioritize and complete multiple concurrent tasks in a production support environment Understanding of Master Data Management (MDM) concepts and standards is an asset Understanding of Big Data concepts and standards is an asset Experience with DBaaS is an asset Salary: $ 3,931.25 Semi-monthly Closing Date: Open until suitable candidate found A cover letter and resume should be submitted in one .pdf formatted document. Please title your .pdf document as follows: [Job Title], [Requisition Number].pdf (ex. Coordinator, 999999.pdf). Salary Grade:  We thank all applicants for their interest. Only applicants selected for an interview will be contacted. After the close date, you can check on the status of your application through your Career Centre. New career opportunities arise frequently and are posted as they become available. Please check back often to view our latest postings on our Career Opportunities page. All qualified candidates are encouraged to apply; however, Canadians and permanent residents will be given priority. Mount Royal University hires on the basis of merit and is strongly committed to fostering diversity as a source of excellence, intellectual and cultural enrichment, and social strength. We welcome applications from those who would contribute to the further diversification of our staff, faculty and their scholarship including but not limited to Indigenous Peoples, women, persons with disabilities and persons of any sexual or gender identity, ethnic, national or socio-economic background, religion or age.
Title: Database Administrator

Job_Description: About the Job NGX provides electronic trading, central counterparty clearing and data services to the North American natural gas and electricity markets. Our trading systems clear and settle exchange trades and OTC contracts with a notional value of approximately $50 billion. NGX applies agile practices with the goal to provide sustainable quality solutions for our internal users and external customers.  Role Summary The successful candidate will be responsible for leading all software development activities for our trading and clearing systems. This role requires a hands-on, articulate and focused leader, who can own projects, features, functionality and application architecture. In this role the candidate will have the opportunity to work as an integral part of a highly motivated and productive agile team in an excellent work environment. The successful candidate will work in close collaboration with other developers, quality assurance analysts, project managers, internal business users and our operational support team.  In addition to a solid foundation in software development, the ideal candidate already has an understanding or has a strong desire to learn the business of financial trading and risk analysis.  Key Accountabilities Provide technical leadership to teammates through coaching and mentorship Collaborate with other software developers, business analysts and software architects on solution architecture, analysis of requirements, design, application construction, unit and integration testing of business applications Participate in all software development activities at NGX. Job_Description: Title DevOps Engineer, Product Development and Delivery  Summary We are seeking an outstanding DevOps Engineer to drive cloud automation and provide operational support of commercial software products within the Identity and Access Management domain. The DevOps Engineer fills a critical role within our product delivery team, and will partner with Software Engineers to design, implement, and execute cloud automation and operational support processes. This DevOps Engineer will be working directly with emerging public cloud technologies on a highly visible business-critical platform; providing substantial opportunity for technical skills development and career growth.  General Job Duties Participate as part of a product development organization to design and implement cloud operations processes for moderately complex software platforms. Follow industry good DevOps practices to ensure high quality of service. Report to management on project status, identify issues that may impede attainment of goals, and accept direction on corrective measures. Foster inter-team cooperation as part of a project/program. Continuously expand knowledge in area of specialization. Perform other duties as required. Specific Job Duties Operate as a DevOps Engineer in a product development and delivery team for a cloud-based Identity and Access Management (IAM) services platform. Assist in analyzing requirements and providing comprehensive cloud automation solutions to ensure high QoS. Provide operational support for production and pre-production software systems hosted in the public cloud. Drive process improvement through cloud automation. Support and champion the Agile Scrum development methodology. Collaborate with Software Development Leads and Engineers, Product Managers, Business Analysts, and IT Leadership. Education/Experience Requirements Experience in production software system administration. Background in both Linux/Unix and Windows environments. Experience with automation/configuration management using Ansible or an equivalent. Working knowledge of coding/scripting (eg. Java or C#, Python, Unix shell scripting) Understanding of IT Operations best practices in mission-critical high-availability systems. Ability to engage self-guided analysis and problem solving. Passion and curiosity for solving technical problems. Experience with public cloud infrastructure is a major plus (eg. AWS or Azure) Professional certification is a plus. Organizational Relationships Reports to DevOps manager. Interacts with other colleagues at all levels in the conduct of day-to-day activities. External Relationships Actively participates in industry forums and user groups. FLSA Status – US Only Exempt  We are proud to be an EEO/AA employer M/F/Disability/Veterans.
