Job_Description: If talent acquisition is your forte as a results-oriented professional committed to continuous improvement in systems and processes, and you thrive in a fast-paced environment, this mandate with CBI Health Group would represent a great career move.  You will be responsible for regional full-cycle recruitment within CBI Home Health, with a focus on the timely sourcing and hiring of quality candidates through innovative recruitment strategies, while maintaining reasonable costs in the hiring process. You can do it all: from building relationships with local educational institutions to build a healthy talent pipeline to tracking and reporting on industry trends and other recruitment analytics. This will enable you, as Regional Talent Acquisition Specialist, to attract and retain the best and most effective talent that will uphold CBI’s corporate values and mission while ensuring we meet our business goals and, ultimately, deliver the best client experience.  This is an exceptional opportunity for an innovative thinker and savvy implementer like you to continue learning and to grow within our organization, while building a regional recruitment strategy and assuming full-scope responsibility for the recruitment process for all positions within the Region.  PRIMARY DUTIES  As Talent Acquisition Specialist, you will:  Ensure that management is trained on the recruitment toolbox process and understands its role within itPartner with hiring managers to ensure role clarity and expectations when recruiting, as agreed upon with all stakeholdersWork collaboratively with all stakeholders (Care Managers, Director of Operations, local and national recruitments teams) to understand the recruitment needsSource talent by building networks and cultivating relationships within talent networks to find qualified and “great fit” candidatesBuild and maintain networks of potential candidates for assigned business areasDevelop a talent pipeline of internal and external talentsIdentify hard-to-fill roles and source innovative channels for recruitmentManage posting of job vacancies using the best-performing recruitment channelsSchedule, conduct and score phone and face-to-face candidate interviews, and interpret assessment resultsComplete balanced hiring scorecardProvide recommendations to the Hiring ManagerBuild and maintain relationships with key stakeholders at local schools, colleges and universities, and participate in career fairs, job fairs, etc., to promote CBI as an employer of choice, increase talent brand awareness, and provide information about opportunities availableDevelop recruitment reports and trends in recruitment that will determine best places to recruitProvide talent analytics, tracking candidate pipelines, quality of hire, time to fill, etc.  QUALIFICATIONS  To take on the role of Talent Acquisition Specialist, you must:  Hold a university degree or college diploma in a related fieldBring a strong understanding of the recruiting process, backed by 3-5 years related experienceSales/marketing experience is appreciatedDemonstrate strong project management skills, including the ability to manage multiple projects and resourcesPossess strong interpersonal and communication skills, as reflected in the ability to network in person and onlineBe detail-oriented, proactive and tech savvy.  About CBI Health Group:  CBI Health Group is Canada’s largest provider of integrated community healthcare. For over 40 years, we have remained totally committed to improving the health and enriching the lives of Canadians.  What sets us apart is our ability to work as a unified network dedicated to the ongoing learning that allows us to foster best practices, improve access to care, and create better results for our patients. We organize our teams and services to ensure the right professionals and caregivers provide the right service, at the right time, in the right place.  In over 250 facilities, our services are provided by a dedicated team of more than 11,000 administrators, support staff, and care providers that include physiotherapists, occupational therapists, registered massage therapists, kinesiologists, chiropractors, speech-language pathologists, psychologists, physicians, nurses, dietitians and behaviour analysts.  The CBI group of companies includes CBI Health Centres, CBI Home Health, We Care Home Health Services, Monarch House, CBI Workplace Solutions, and CBI Assessment Services. Our expanding transitional and residential community care network now numbers more than 60 homes nationwide. At CBI, our people really care and believe that by working together, we can aim higher and make great things happen every day.  Facebook: facebook.com/cbihealthgroup | Twitter: twitter.com/cbihealthgroup | www.cbi.ca  CBI Health Group is committed to accommodating people with disabilities as part of our hiring process. If you have special requirements, please advise Human Resources during the recruitment and selection process.
Title: Talent Acquisition Specialist

Job_Description: Treasury and Investment within Finance is currently seeking a Full-time Regular Director, Treasury and Investments . The University of Calgary, is one of Canada’s top comprehensive research universities with four campuses across the Calgary, Alberta region and a fifth location in Doha, Qatar. Granted autonomy as a university in 1966 (with origins in the early 1900’s), the University of Calgary enrolls approximately 32,000 students in undergraduate, graduate, and professional degree programs. The University’s Eyes High strategy – launched in 2011 – set ambitious goals for excellence in teaching and learning, research and scholarship, the student experience, and community engagement. With a clear strategic direction to become one of Canada's top five research universities, they are making tremendous progress towards becoming a global intellectual hub located in Canada’s most enterprising city. The University is a large and complex institution that drives tremendous value: with an annual consolidated budget of more than $1.2B, they are among Calgary’s largest employers, generating nearly $8B in economic impact to the province. Two-thirds of the University's 168,000 alumni live and work in the Calgary area, effectively building the city we know and love. In 2016, the University of Calgary was ranked as the top university under the age of 50 in both Canada and North America by the Times Higher Education World University Rankings, and as one of the top 200 universities in the world by QS World University Rankings and Times Higher Education World University Rankings. In 2016, RE$EARCH Infosource Inc. positioned the University of Calgary as #6 nationwide amongst Canadian research universities. The University houses 75 Canada Research Chairs and more than 50 research institutes and centers. The University of Calgary has incredible talent – motivated and accomplished students, faculty, and staff – who drive new knowledge creation, improve lives, and better our world. Those who work at the University of Calgary come for the opportunity to make a positive contribution to student experience, to participate in groundbreaking research initiatives, to be immersed in a lifelong learning environment, to engage with and give back to the community, and to enjoy all that Calgary has to offer as a city.   Position Description Summary of Key Responsibilities (job functions include but are not limited to): This is a critical role in University of Calgary continued success and growth. The role is accountable for total investments under management of $2.0 billion (endowment of $950 million and non-endowed funds of $1.05 billion) and the following: Administration of University's financial assets and liabilities, including borrowing, cash management, banking operations and investment reporting Ensuring the operational objective of effective stewardship of the University’s assets and providing an efficient central infrastructure to facilitate the University’s cash management and investments Responsible for overseeing the management of the University Endowments and the relationships with the external investment managers Implementing and maintaining comprehensive investment and risk management policies and procedures that will maximize returns within an acceptable level of risk and minimize the adverse effects of losses to the University so it may achieve its operational objectives Liaising with departments, faculties and senior administration to ensure understanding of and compliance with treasury and endowment policies and procedures Evaluating reporting and control functions within the department and making recommendations for changes Contributing to and taking responsibility for decisions made as part of the management team within Finance Planning, scheduling and directing the work of the Treasury and Investment department Selecting, managing, evaluating and compensating staff to ensure unit functions as a team and service levels meet or exceed client expectations Acting as a change agent for the department: initiating and implementing the appropriate financial policies, systems and procedures Responsible for management reporting to the University's Investment Committee (a subcommittee of the Board of Governors), stakeholders, governmental and regulatory bodies and other outside agencies Contributing information and expertise and keeps up to date on relevant current trends and developments with colleagues at other Canadian universities, Canadian Association of University Business Officers "CAUBO," professional organizations and government departments and agencies Undertaking special assignments and projects as requested by senior administration, the University's Investment Committee, CAUBO and government departments and agencies Qualifications / Requirements: Graduate University Degree preferably in Finance, Economics or a Master of Business Administration Professional financial designation (CPA, CA, CFA, CIM or FCSI) 10+ years’ work and management experience in various accounting, budget, and analyst functions Proven evidence of team leadership skills with the ability to lead the team through change Experience working in highly complex and technical investment and finance concepts Previous experience working with complex treasury and investment systems and processes Demonstrated ability to work well with others and to handle difficult situations while maintaining effective relationships Previous experience with PeopleSoft banking software and PC based software applications Intermediate to expert user of complex computer software applications, including enterprise reporting systems, mainframe systems, financial systems, data warehouse and business intelligence tools Think logically, solve problems and be critically objective with an ability to develop innovative solutions to problems Must be able to work independently or in a team environment Excellent interpersonal, verbal and written communication skills are essential in exercising tact and diplomacy regarding sensitive and confidential issues, as well as use of negotiation, presentation, engagement and facilitation skills Application Deadline: This position will remain open until filled; however, applicants will be reviewed as they are received.  For more information and to apply, please contact: Colin Richardson DHR International Suite 250- 435 -4 Avenue Calgary, AB T2P 3A8 T: 403-817-0977 E: crichardson@dhrinternational.com We would like to thank all applicants in advance for submitting their resumes. Please note, only those candidates chosen to continue on through the selection process will be contacted.
Title: Director, Treasury and Investments

Job_Description: Eagle is currently seeking a Senior Organizational Change Manager for a one (1) year contract opportunity, scheduled to begin immediately.  Key Responsibilities  The successful candidate will be responsible for: Supporting internal clients in delivering complex programs and initiatives that are strategic in nature and have substantial implications for the organization's performance;  Preparing the organization to support and adopt new, more effective ways of working including changes to programs, processes, systems, organizational design/structure, roles, capabilities, and culture;  Serving as a change agent, business partner, coach, and facilitator;  Managing resources associated with OCM deliverables including change advisors, communication specialists, training/learning advisors, program coordinators, and business analysts;  Supporting project management, governance and sponsorship activities associated with large scale programs and initiatives, ensuring integration and alignment across multiple concurrent programs and initiatives;  Partnering with Human Resources consultants, talent management, and learning specialists and project teams to develop and deliver integrated OCM solutions;  Supporting the objectives of the corporate organizational change management function through sharing of expertise and best practices, adoption of corporate OCM standards, and active participation in the OCM community;  Applying expert OCM knowledge to prepare and deliver change management assessments and plans for large scale and complex programs and initiatives across multiple stakeholder groups and levels of the organization including senior leadership;  Following change management standards and principles;  Utilizing or modifying available tools and services to implement a structured best fit change approach within a program or initiative;  Completing and assessing detailed change impact and stakeholder analyses;  Developing the OCM strategy and supporting plans including communication, sponsor roadmap, training, coaching, management of risk and issues and acceptance/resistance;  Overseeing and/or performing the required communication, training, and other change management activities;  Preparing key stakeholders to present OCM deliverables such as communications and presentations or training;  Partnering to develop and deliver holistic/integrated OCM solutions, including: accurate change impact and stakeholder analysis, appropriate communications and learning approaches, effective transition management, effective risk management/mitigation, support for leaders in leading through change, an aligned approach to organizational design and talent management elements to support change objectives;  Managing OCM budgets, project costs, and schedule and providing progress reports to leadership;  Facilitating and consulting with senior leaders at all levels to gain sponsorship, approval, and engagement of the business and the affected key audiences in executing the change management strategy;  Providing coaching in change management, resistance management and change sponsorship to the project manager, business lead, change sponsor, project team, the extended change team, and others identified through stakeholder assessment;  Continuously assessing potential issues/risks, conflicting priorities, and opportunities for integration across multiple concurrent programs/initiatives, and raise these to leadership;  Evaluating the success of change management activities and provides progress reports to the broad set of stakeholders;  Monitoring change adoption in the organization and plans additional OCM activities to support gaps in adoption or continued realization of change benefits;  Facilitating and guiding senior leaders and business process owners on long term sustainment to operationalize and embed changes;  Continually building knowledge and acumen in all aspects of the organization, the business, our processes and systems; and,  Supporting the objectives of corporate organizational change management function through: sharing of expertise and best practices; adoption of corporate OCM, communications and learning and development standards; contribution to the continual improvement of the corporate OCM methodology and tools; active participation in the broader OCM community of practice; championing the role of the OCM function.  Skills and Qualifications  The qualified candidate must have: A University Degree in relevant discipline;  Fifteen (15) years’ experience; and,  OCM experience as it relates to IT projects and the deployment of new applications.  Don’t miss out on this opportunity, apply online today!  We would like to thank all applicants for their interest; however, only candidates under consideration will be contacted. Job_Description: Our client with a campus in SE Calgary is looking for a Senior SAP ICM Techno Functional analyst to help gather requirements, document business process and functional specifications needed to recommend and implement SAP ICM in their environment.  Incentive and Commission Management (SAP ICM) is a solution that enables all types of variable remuneration for employees and partners. It provides up-to-date and clear information on earned and expected commission and incentives, while helping to motivate employees to increase sales and revenue in a short period of time.   POSITION REQUIREMENTS: University Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Engineering, Science, Commerce/Business Administration or equivalent practical experience; Minimum 3-5 years SAP ICM implementation experience - ideally 2 full project lifecycles with SAP ICM. Strong configuration skills performing requirements analysis Development experience Extensive experience designing and configuring integration points between SAP modules as well as interfaces with non-SAP systems; Strong familiarity with project implementation methodologies, including Agile and ASAP; Experience in commission and incentive management of a sales force and sales reporting. Solid experience designing and executing test cases preferably including HP Application Lifecycle Management (HP ALM)/QC experience;   POSITION ACCOUNTABILITIES: Develop functional specifications and perform functional configuration, development SAP ICM. Perform requirements analysis and develop prototype solutions to demonstrate SAP ICM capabilities to the business and enable adoption; Lead troubleshooting of defects that arise in SAP ICM application and ensure a timely resolution. Lead or participate in cross functional teams involved in issue resolution, ensure that partners/stakeholders are kept advised of status; Understand business issues and opportunities. Analyze and define both the “As Is” and “To Be” business processes and perform gap analysis; Ensure adherence to best practices, identify assumptions, constraints, and anticipate and manage risks; Develop diagrams and models (use case, activity diagram, business process models, etc.) and clearly document functional requirements and business rules in order to fulfill the business and user requirements; Communicate requirements for changes to business processes, policies and information systems to technical teams designing and implementing the solution. Write documentation for the applications including operations, training material and user guides. Ensure traceability of requirements back to business need as well as through to solution and testing. Validate the solution meets the business need and verify it conforms to specifications. Participate in project implementations, post-implementation reviews, test plans, test strategy, regression testing and deployment process to maximize and share learning; Responsible for clearly and concisely articulating technical issues and resolutions with varied business stakeholders; Perform tasks within a complex decision-making and problem solving environment, serve as a subject matter expert for the determination and recommendation of problem resolution and system enhancements, root-cause analysis, documentation and integration testing;  Expertise and Skills ERP, ERP functional consultant 5 - 7 years Priority Requirements 5 - 7 years: Please explain your experience as a Senior SAP Incentive and Commission Management (ICM) Techno Functional Analyst to implement and integrate module in a SAP environment Work Environment Free parking and gym on-site. SE Calgary.

Job_Description: Build a meaningful career  At Morneau Shepell, we offer more than career opportunities, we provide career opportunities to make meaningful contributions to people’s lives. The extraordinary expertise of our 4,000-strong workforce is harnessed to support the employees and families of the organizations we serve. Our innovative programs have a lasting impact on the health, financial security and productivity of 20,000 workplaces.  Consultant Health and Benefits  Health & Benefits Solutions  Calgary, AB  Full Time, Permanent  Benefits programs are an important and highly valued part of any employment offering. But understanding how much or what type of benefit coverage is necessary can be difficult. Our client relationship model is consultative and encourages continual communication. By providing you with the resources to support employers in engaging employees in their health, we provide a path to better workforce health and productivity.  Our Consultant works in a team and is responsible for managing, servicing and providing quality benefits consulting services for small to medium sized clients. In addition, they will be responsible for helping to build business with existing clients as well as attracting and supporting new clients through our association partnerships.  Responsibilities include:  Business Development  Identify and manage cross-sell opportunities Develop strategic relationships with key account contacts and introduce Morneau Shepell team members as appropriate Supervise the complete employee benefits cycle: plan design, provider search, implementation, experience monitoring, renewal rating Develop new business with existing clients and assists in obtaining new business with prospective clients focusing on our key association partnerships Understand client needs and identify company or industry products or services that can meet these needs Service  Deliver presentations to clients; conduct client meetings and the occasional employee presentation. Ensure that quality control and service standards are attained with every transaction Negotiate, problem solve and maintain positive relationships with insurers, external advisors and internal underwriting and benefits administration departments Develop and maintain excellent relationships with clients, through regular telephone contact and office visits Understand the client’s perspective and priorities, and work with the client to resolve administrative issues Establish strategies for services that meet client needs  Administration  Provide and oversee direct day-to-day support for clients by phone, e-mail, letters, formal reports, and face-to-face meetings Lead and manage multiple client assignments and projects Manage special projects as required Peer review the work of analysts Knowledge  Maintain current knowledge of industry trends including insurer news, products, legislation, and cost trends as well as current knowledge of our company's products and services  Qualifications:  Experience  Five years of experience in group benefits. Preference will be given to those from the group insurance industry, a consulting firm or brokerage or in an HR department. Education  Post-secondary education GBA (CEBS) designation, or working towards it. Life Insurance license (this will be a requirement within 3 months of onboarding) Skills  Strong presentation skills and comfort speaking in front of large groups Understanding of consultative selling and the ability to manage the sales cycle effectively and autonomously Expert negotiation, technical and analytical skills Can effectively communicate complex concepts in plain written and spoken language Professional Traits  Exceptional customer focus; some would say you’re the best Extremely organized self-starter, flexible, highly independent Ability to manage multiple deadlines simultaneously Proven collaborative team member with the ability to motivate and inspire team members  Morneau Shepell Morneau Shepell is in the business of helping organizations help their people because we believe that engaged people are the driving force for society. Every day, the expertise of our almost 4,000 employees is recognized as essential to the financial security, health, and productivity of our clients and their people. We're always looking for talented professionals and strategic leaders who will listen and work together with colleagues and clients to form long-term relationships and to deliver integrative solutions that fit. As we continue to grow, we're presently engaging with exceptional candidates interested in a range of exciting career opportunities. At www.morneaushepell.com you can explore our careers page to learn more about the solutions we deliver and the great people who help us do it. Follow us on LinkedIn and Twitter (Morneau_Shepell, Shepell). We are thankful for your interest, but unfortunately, we can only personally connect with those selected for an interview.  INDCAD LI-PH1  Job Grade: MS4   Fulfilling work that matters  Morneau Shepell is in the business of helping organizations help their people and in the process, we strive to elevate ours.  We're always looking for talented professionals and strategic leaders looking to make a difference in the lives of the people we serve.  We appreciate the interest of every applicant; however, we contact only those selected for an interview.  Find your fit with us. Follow us on LinkedIn, Youtube and Twitter.

Job_Description: About this job Compensation: C$48k - 69k | EquityJob type: Full-timeExperience level: Junior, Mid-Level, LeadIndustry: Enterprise Software, Security Software, Software Development / EngineeringCompany size: 51-200 peopleCompany type: PrivateTechnologies .net, c#, database, enterprise, objective-c Job description Not your everyday software developer position. Challenging and fast moving, yet friendly and supportive: a career you will look forward to every day. Work with intelligent people in an exciting environment where every month is different.   Positions Available:  Multiple positions ranging from intermediate up to team lead level (based on skill, regardless of the amount of experience or education), opening up immediately and throughout the year. Additional positions for specialists (for example, Android programming, user interface programming, etc). Tell us your strengths and we’ll go from there. Other Positions: We are also hiring for other positions (software tester, business analyst, project manager, graphic designer, and front-end GUI designer). You may apply for multiple positions separately. If you know someone in any of these areas, please do them a quick and friendly favour by letting them know about this posting.  Position Overview:  Full time and permanent. Fast moving in terms of variety of work and expectations. Flexible hours (for example: choose to start your day between 6am and 10am, work late some days and shorter on others). Gain valuable career experience in the newest highlevel technologies (C#, .NET 5, Java, MVC7, WCF, web services, SOA, Swift/Objective-C, Xamarin, F#). Gain experience with many advanced software engineering tools and techniques (code generation, object relational mappers, advanced .NET reflection, etc). Gain experience with both small and large projects, with involvement throughout the product life-cycle. Opportunities to be involved with higher level architecture and design. Mentoring from experienced software architects and some of the smartest peers in the country, on exciting projects that you can really sink your teeth into. A blend of programming methodologies (deliberately part way between agile, Kanban, and waterfall plus occasional extreme and pair programming methodologies). Does not involve a lot of boring technical support or fixing broken legacy applications. Most of the learning is through hands-on trying and doing and collaborating. Meetings and formal training are minimized. Rarely requires meeting with a client for those who prefer not to. Environment allows for some privacy at your workstation as well as time to concentrate without distractions when you need it.  Requirements:  Highly intelligent. Fast learner and enjoys learning. Passionate about making software and very good at it. Gets deeply involved with challenges and will persevere at length to achieve victory. Takes pride in work. A deep appreciation for reusable code and the benefits of object oriented design. No specific requirements for formal education or industry experience. We evaluate each applicant based on merit rather than formalities.  Nice To Have:  Ability to see opportunities for improvement everywhere. Experience with .NET or mobile development. Pragmatic approach to balancing perfectionism with getting the job done.  About The Work Environment:  Friendly, non-threatening, and non-political environment. Mid-sized company but retaining the speed and flexibility of a smaller company. We are a great environment for both outgoing people and those who are very shy and introverted (applicable to non-client facing positions). We strive to have every employee sitting near a window for natural light and to have plenty of plants throughout the office; we care about employee health. Free onsite massage therapy. Private nap rooms for isolated thinking time or for taking a nap if you didn’t sleep well last night. Atrium to enjoy the sun during lunch. Social events worth remembering (fencing competitions, curling, video game or board game parties, coding competitions, commando combat training, robotics club coming soon, etc). An example of our culture: Lunch together is in a very comfy sofa room, and even the quiet types are comfortable there. Unlimited access to pillage our kitchens for caffeine, sugar, healthy snacks, soups, and more :) Additional perks that are cost-shared like motorized sit-stand desks. Task focused: everyone in the company heavily uses centralized to-do lists to stay organized, prioritize, and coordinate. Fast paced  Applying:  What do you have to lose by exploring the possibility? Applying does not take long and we keep your application confidential (never disclosed to existing employer). Apply online today at https://careers.pleasantsolutions.com Even if you don't have your resume updated or ready to go, apply anyways, we want to hear from you! Please do not apply via email, use only the https://careers.pleasantsolutions.com link to apply.
Title: Software Developer / Programmer (Exciting and great variety)

Our software connects all E&P data and workflows from strategy to execution through innovative technology, expert consulting and first-rate customer service. 3esi-Enersight is a dynamic and innovative place to work. With both staff and customers located all over the world, every day is filled with new and exciting challenges. 3esi-Enersight promotes and encourages its staff to think outside of the box and places a high value on innovation and creative problem solving. Position Summary: The QA Manager is accountable for maintaining a high standard of quality across our products by working with the Development Team Leads to ensure that efficient and effective quality assurance practices are applied. The QA Manager is also responsible for supporting, mentoring and the professional development of the Quality Assurance Analysts and is required to manage the allocation of QA resources across seven development teams. The successful candidate also contributes to testing efforts on an as-needed basis.  Key Responsibilities:  Support, mentor and ensure quality professional development of the Quality Assurance Analysts Provide technical expertise and best practices to the QA team Continually seek to improve the effectiveness and efficiency of the quality assurance processes Ensure consistency of quality assurance practices across the development teams Identify test automation opportunities Incorporate on-premise and outsourcing/crowdsourcing resourcing to increase efficiency and reduce cost without sacrificing quality and creating development impediments Contribute to testing efforts when needed   Key Competencies:  Excellent written and verbal communication and interpersonal skills. Ability to build and lead a team of quality assurance experts Deep understanding of testing methodologies, technology, tools and practices Good understanding of CI/CD pipelines Experience delivering high quality software products using different delivery models: desktop, on-premise, hosted, and SaaS  Qualifications:  Bachelor’s degree in a related field and/or equivalent combination of education and experience. Minimum of 5 years of experience in a QA role Minimum of 3 years of experience managing a team Upstream Oil and Gas experience is an asset. Experience managing a QA process that incorporated outsourced/crowdsourced QA is an asset   Position Details:  Full time opportunity Location: Calgary Start: Immediately
Title: QA Manager

Job_Description: <p>  </p><p><strong>About Bethany</strong></p><p>For over half a century, Bethany has been improving the lives of Alberta seniors and adults with disabilities by providing housing, health and community services that honour their spirit and individuality.</p><p>At Bethany, our journey of service excellence has just begun. We have recently launched WAVE (We Action our Values Everyday), our service excellence program through which we are committed to providing great service experiences for our residents, tenants, families and each other. Together, we are living our mission of “Creating Caring Communities”.</p><p>We offer competitive salaries, attractive benefits and pension programs, growth through learning and development, and numerous opportunities to give back to the community – just a few of the things that led to Bethany being named one of Alberta’s Top Employers for 11 consecutive years in 2018. It’s simple — we invest in our people because they are the reason for our success.</p><p>We are delighted that you are considering joining our team! We are looking for people who are passionate about people, working to enhance everyone’s quality of life at every stage of the journey.</p><strong><br>About the Role:</strong><br><br>We are currently seeking a Business Analyst to join Bethany's Information Technology team. Reporting to the Business Solutions Manger, you will support existing software applications at Bethany. You will also partner with business and health care resources on initiatives to introduce new business processes and software into the organization. <br><br><strong>What You Will Do:</strong><br><ul><li>Participating in the planning, design, development, configuration, integration, service introduction, and enhancement of existing and new business and clinical applications</li><li>Gathering functional and technical requirements through interviews, site visits, research and analysis</li><li>Developing and documenting business cases and plans, including business, functional, and technical requirements</li><li>Coordinating, executing and supporting application testing, such as creating test cases and scripts</li><li>Developing training materials and documentation for educators and end users</li><li>Performing day-to-day troubleshooting and supporting of current systems in collaboration with vendor application support teams</li><li>Identifying and leading continuous improvement efforts within the organization</li></ul><br><strong>What You Bring:</strong><br><ul><li>Over two (2) years of experience as a Business Analyst working on business and/or clinical application projects.</li><li>Experience with implementing and supporting enterprise Finance, Logistis, HR/Payroll, and Operations applications.</li><li>A University Degree or a diploma in business and/or information technology or related discipline is required.</li><li>Project management experience would be an asset.</li><li>Experience with writing SQL queries and/or report writing would be an asset.</li><li>Ability to effectively partner with business and clinical resources at all levels of the organization.</li><li>Ability to manage multiple priorities; changing course and direction as needed.</li><li>Proven problem solving, analytical and critical thinking skills.</li><li>Strong collaboration and communication (written and verbal) skills.</li></ul><br><strong>Position Information:</strong><br><br>Posting Number: 18-1508<br>Position Number: PR-CP72-005<br>Location: Corporate Services<br>FTE: 100%<br>Position Type: Full Time Permanent<br><br><strong>Posting end date: May 15, 2018</strong> <em><em>(Please note this competition may close earlier if a suitable candidate is found)</em></em><p><strong>All applicants are thanked for their interest.</strong></p><p>Bethany Care Society is an equal opportunity employer.</p><p>Successful candidates will be required to obtain a Criminal Background Check.</p><p>Bethany Care Society complies with the Personal Information Protection and Electronic Documents Act (PIPEDA). By forwarding your resume to Bethany you are consenting to the collection and use of your personal information for this job competition. Your information will be kept strictly confidential.</p>  <p></p>  <p></p>
Title: IT Business Analyst

Job_Description: <em><strong>Who are we?</strong></em> A global team of passionate, purposeful people from a multitude of different backgrounds and careers. What unites this group of amazing people is our incredible sense of purpose – we are united in our mission to inspire a love of learning through our educational products, and this is something we couldn’t be prouder of. Our flagship product Mathletics is trusted globally by millions of students and teachers - it’s all about making Maths fun for kids and drastically improving educational outcomes. <br/><br/> Our culture is fun, informal and a little bit quirky! Most importantly, 3P is somewhere you can be yourself – we value creativity, individuality and a great sense of humour. If you love learning, can see the unseen, are able to move mountains and are happy to be part of 1 big pod (team) then you will love being part of 3P Learning. <br/><br/> We are currently searching for a Go To Customer Business Model Transformation <strong>Business Analyst</strong> to join our team, based in Calgary. <br/><br/> <strong>Requirements</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>The job</strong> <br/><br/> 3P is establishing a small team to design and build a digital, automated and more self-serve go to customer model. <br/><br/> The team will take a “think big, start small, scale fast” approach to the work which will be initially designed to serve the USA market but over time be implemented globally. <br/><br/> Specifically, this role will help the business teams understand what is possible and then work collaboratively with them to design, build and roll out new customer journeys and business processes. <br/><br/> The Business Analyst will develop the necessary documentation required to capture any new or changed business processes, features or functions as well as mapping out the customer experience. The Business Analyst will need to pay particular attention to any data associated with the system so that accurate metrics can be trusted to make automated decisions. Reporting on customer journey performance will also be critical. Designing and documenting all new features and functionality required and ensuring all implementation teams fully understand all requirements and acceptance criteria. Working closely with the Data Analysts and Business Leads and will confidently report on key business SaaS metrics and performance <br/><br/> <strong>Ideally you will have:</strong> <ul>  <li>Minimum of a Bachelor’s degree is required.</li>  <li>5+ years in BA role</li> <li>Previous experience in a Business Analyst role involved in automating a business model using Salesforce and Marketing Automation technology</li> <li>Global SaaS experience</li> <li>Thorough knowledge of web technologies</li> <li> Experience delivering high-quality documentation for business processes and online products</li> <li>Strong project management and coordination skills with the ability to excel in a fluid, cross-functional, multi-region team environment</li> </ul> <strong>Ideally you will be:</strong> <ul>  <li>An effective influencer with top-notch communication skills</li> <li>Able to work independently or collaboratively, and execute on strategic objectives</li> <li>Highly analytical and an excellent problem-solver</li> <li>Self-driven with a desire to see results from all outputs and places importance on measuring success factors</li> <li>Highly organized with the ability to “make it happen”</li> </ul> Joining our 3P team at this exciting time of growth and expansion will give you diverse experience working together with industry experts focused on improving education outcomes for students and teachers across the globe. We look forward to sharing more about 3P and our amazing people and products with you through this journey.
Title: Business Analyst

City employees deliver the services, run the programs and operate the facilities which make a difference in our community. We support work-life balance and offer competitive wages, pensions, and benefits. Together we make Calgary a great place to make a living, a great place to make a life.</div></div> </div> </div></div><div><div><div><div> <div><strong>As a Business Analyst you will analyze data from a wide range of data sources to generate key insights for Calgary Recreation, work with stakeholders to identify solutions to various issues, and monitor impacts to support customer focused service delivery. Job_Description: <strong>SUMMARY</strong> <br/><br/> The Business Analyst is responsible for conducting needs assessments, configuring applications, building and maintaining relationships, training and ongoing client support and follow-up. <br/><br/> <strong>JOB RESPONSIBILITIES</strong>  <ul> <li>Meets with clients to analyze their individual needs, determines priorities, provide estimates and determines project scope</li>  <li>Assists with the management of project scope, schedule and quality</li>  <li>Participates in requirements gathering sessions, investigates, documents and analyzes key client organizational processes</li>  <li>Identifies needs and develops customized solutions</li>  <li>In conjunction with the Project Manager, maintains an effective client follow-up system to ensure that clients are contacted regarding project progress and overall satisfaction</li>  <li>Coordinates and executes client training</li>  <li>Performs and organizes ongoing support for customers such as report building and data quality</li>  <li>Contributes to the development of a strategic customer roadmap</li> </ul> <strong>POSITION REQUIREMENTS</strong>  <ul> <li>Related university degree or college diploma required and/or an acceptable equivalent of education and experience</li>  <li>Minimum 3 years of project-based experience providing client consulting services</li>  <li>Experience with Salesforce</li>  <li>High energy, creativity, resourcefulness and entrepreneurial spirit</li>  <li>Ability to absorb technical information and convey that information to non-technical customers</li>  <li>Must be legally permitted to work in Canada</li> </ul> <strong>Desired Qualifications</strong>  <ul> <li>Oil and gas industry experience</li>  <li>CRM experience</li>  <li>ERP experience</li> </ul>
Title: Business Analyst

Job_Description: <strong>Company Description:</strong> <br/><br/> Gevity is an international informatics and management consulting company offering a full range of interdisciplinary professional services to clients seeking to build sustainable and effective health care and social services systems. Through our focus on the unique needs of the health care, social services and life sciences sectors, we work to support healthier lives through connected systems. <br/><br/> <strong>Position Description:</strong> <br/><br/> The business analyst position requires an individual who is able to collect business requirements from multiple sources, and then critically evaluate information gathered, reconcile conflicts, decompose high-level information into details, abstract up from low-level information to a general understanding, and distinguish user requests from the underlying business needs. This individual interprets business needs and translates them into application and operational requirements; collaborates with developers and subject matter experts to establish the vision and analyze trade-offs between usability and performance needs. They are the liaison between the business community, the technical solution providers and the support team. <br/><br/> <strong>Job Requirements:</strong> <br/><br/> Collection, documentation and analysis of the current state and the future state of clinical processes by means of documenting business process flows and models in collaboration with multi-disciplinary stakeholders. <br/><br/> Analysis of process gaps, information flow obstacles and identification of opportunities for increased efficiency. <br/><br/> Ability to document requirements and create process models using UML modeling techniques <br/><br/> Proven expertise in gathering and documenting requirements to support development of data warehousing and business intelligence solutions <br/><br/> Experience in software development lifecycle activities in an integrated technical environment <br/><br/> Strong leadership and ability to facilitate focus groups to determine requirements and priorities <br/><br/> Experience in assigning project activities to meet the timelines, budget and stakeholder requirements set out in work breakdown structures, project schedules and other related plans (e.g. test, quality, training) <br/><br/> Experience in assessing project status and reporting activity to project team and management <br/><br/> <strong>Required Skills and Qualifications:</strong> <br/><br/> Post-secondary education in Health Informatics, Information Management or Information Technology (or equivalent) <br/><br/> Five or more years of business analysis experience and exposure in the health or social services industry <br/><br/> CBAP or CCBA Certification desired <br/><br/> CPHIMS-CA Certification desired <br/><br/> PROSCI Certification desired <br/><br/> The ability to engage effectively across teams and with various levels of management. <br/><br/> Excellent verbal and written communication skills <br/><br/> The ability to effectively deal with remote teams and users <br/><br/> Ability to travel <br/><br/> <em>Gevity is an equal opportunity employer. Proof of credentials, as well as a criminal check, may be required for successful applicants. Resumes will be kept on file and candidates may be contacted for future opportunities.</em>
Title: Business Analyst

Job_Description: Inter Pipeline is a major petroleum transportation, storage and natural gas liquids processing business that ranks among the largest energy infrastructure companies in Canada. We are proud to be named one of Alberta’s Top 70 Employers, which recognizes Alberta businesses that lead their industries by being exceptional places to work. <br/><br/> Located out of our Calgary office, the individual in the<strong> Business Analyst</strong> role will report to the Supervisor, Finance Solutions Centre with an indirect reporting relationship to the Senior Business Analyst. The successful candidate will be responsible for the administration of finance master data and assisting with project support from an SAP perspective for Inter Pipeline. <br/><br/> <strong>Key Activities and Responsibilities:</strong> <ul> <li>Perform changes, additions or deletions to finance master data elements following process protocol</li><li>Track master data setup for purposes of providing a consistent, transparent audit trail</li><li>Assist in the review and ongoing improvement of master data processes</li><li>Research and identify critical data issues and risks</li><li>Achieve data quality key performance indicators (KPIs), metrics, and service level agreements (SLAs)</li><li>Monitor data quality and data governance scorecards and escalate critical issues to leadership</li><li>Maintain best practices in master data management</li><li>Provide support to business users (primarily Finance) on use of SAP functionality, reporting and structure of data elements to assist with retrieving and analyzing data</li><li>Interaction with SAP Competency Center on future system enhancements, builds, testing, and production roll-outs</li><li>Assist with SAP reports</li> </ul> <strong>Education, Skills and Experience:</strong> <ul> <li>Strong finance expertise on master data usage, configuration, and integrated data requirements/linkage points combined with prior oil and gas experience considered an asset (4-7 years of experience)</li></ul>  <ul> <li>In depth knowledge of SAP FI_CO and Business Warehouse, experience with S/4HANA and Fiori an asset</li><li>Undergraduate diploma or degree in business</li><li>Approaches work with a high level of curiosity and aptitude to identify and solve problems, takes initiative and works independently</li><li>Change agent who can persuade and influence stakeholders to establish new processes, shift to automation, and provide innovative solutions</li><li>Strong accountability and ownership mentality</li><li>Ability to manage internal and external relationships with well-developed interpersonal, team, customer service and communication skills (both written and verbal)</li><li>Strong customer service skills in working with internal departments to achieve results through relationships with people and teams</li><li>Able to work well in a fast-paced, growth environment, with strong attention to detail and accuracy</li><li>Maintains strong initiative and possesses superior analytical skills</li> </ul>
Title: Business Analyst

Job_Description: Robert Half Technology is searching for a Business Analyst who is highly capable of and deeply passionate about understanding and translating customer needs into actionable development plans. If you are outgoing and a self-starter with strong technical knowledge and excellent communication skills, this Business Analyst role may be a great fit for you. As the successful candidate you will perform a variety of data analysis and development tasks, translating operations and finance ERP data into useful dashboards and reporting tools. This full-time opening is for a Business Analyst in the Calgary, Alberta area. <br/> If you have the qualifications we are looking for, please submit your resume online to stephanie.sherlock@rht.com <br/><br/> <strong>RESPONSIBILITIES</strong> <br/> ×	Responsible for analysis, design, development and deployment of BI and analytical solutions <br/> ×	SQL database development, SSRS report development and internal applications support <br/> ×	Working within the IS team to identify data sources and develop queries for extracting Data. <br/> ×	Acquiring and transforming raw data into meaningful and useful reporting tools <br/> ×	Collaborate with Sales and Finance Management to gather requirements for Analysis and reporting <br/> ×	Work closely with the sales and operational group to understand current and historical business practices. <br/> ×	Other duties as assigned
Title: Business Analyst

Job_Description: <div><div> <p><strong>YOUR OPPORTUNITY:</strong><br> The Business Systems Analyst performs a combination of three functions: business analysis, systems analysis, and project management. As a Business Systems Analyst you will be responsible for managing the customer relationship between IS, and one or more business areas, implementing new applications, as well as supporting and maintaining a portfolio of existing applications. A Business Systems Analyst may also provide guidance and direction to Systems Analysts and Developers.</p>  <p><strong>COMPETITIVE SALARY - STOCK OPTIONS - STOCK SAVINGS PLAN - ANNUAL BONUSES – BENEFITS!</strong></p>  <p><strong>HOW WILL YOU MAKE YOUR MARK?</strong><br>  • Manage the customer relationship between IS and specific business areas<br>  • Support, maintain, enhance and/or upgrade a portfolio of custom and package applications<br>  • Analyze requests for new functionality, and document business cases to justify new application investments<br>  • Develop estimates of effort for design of new, and/or modification to existing, application components<br>  • Design application components to automate and streamline business processes and functions<br>  • Business area planning that includes scheduling and management of application projects<br>  • Understand the architecture of the applications within the groups portfolio<br>  • Plan, assign and monitor daily work assignments for Systems Analysts, Developers and Developer Analysts<br>  • Develop and maintain technical specifications and documentation<br>  • Troubleshoot and repair problems that occur in the everyday use of an application<br>  • Develop cost estimates for the annual IS capital and sustainment budgets</p>  <p><strong>QUALIFICATIONS:</strong><br>  • Typically 8+ years’ experience as a Business Systems Analyst and Systems Analyst, preferably in Production Accounting, PAS/PRISM AND Field Data Collection<br>  • Post-secondary degree in Computer Sciences is preferred<br>  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills<br>  • Highly developed analytical skills<br>  • Demonstrated proficiency in business modeling, process modeling, data modeling, and effort/cost modeling and estimating<br>  • Demonstrated proficiency in N-tier application analysis, design and development using the appropriate development environments and tools (Java Enterprise, Tomcat, MS VB.NET/ASP.Net, MS SSRS, and/or Oracle 11C&12C and PL/SQL<br>  • General proficiency with SQL and database query tools such as Microsoft Access and/or SQL+<br>  • Strong multi-tasking and prioritizing abilities<br>  • Exceptional Project Management skills</p>  <p>To see related Information Technology roles at CNRL, visit: http://www.cnrl-careers.com/jobs/Information-Technology</p>  <p><strong>ABOUT CANADIAN NATURAL</strong><br> At Canadian Natural, we strive to live through our mission statement: "To develop people to work together to create value for the Company's shareholders by doing it right with fun and integrity." As a leading oil and gas producer, our diverse combination of assets include light oil, heavy oil, in situ oil sands production, oil sands mining and upgrading facilities, and natural gas. At Canadian Natural, safety is a core value. We conduct all of our operations in a way that identifies, minimizes and mitigates harm to the health and safety of employees, contractors, the public and the environment.</p>  <p>Canadian Natural Resources Limited - CNRL - is a publicly traded company on the TSX and NYSE as CNQ.</p> </div></div><div><div> <br></div></div>
Title: Business Systems Analyst

Job_Description: <div><div> <strong>Technical Analyst - Core Banking Platform</strong><br/><br/>We can transform banking, reimagine it, make banking work for people. We’re on a journey to make meaningful impacts on an industry that has the power to transform a person’s life. When we talk about transformation at ATB Financial, we’re not just talking about pie in the sky ideas, we’re listening and collaborating to bring those ideas to life. To put it simply, we’re on a mission to reinvent how banking can support people's lives. We’re going to provide meaningful solutions to problems, deepen our connection with customers and while we’re at it, transform ourselves from the inside out.  <br/><br/> We need collaborative visionaries and executors who are eager to listen to our customers in order to do things other banks wouldn’t do. We’re building a team of relentless, passionate and inquisitive ATB transformers to build our bench strength in disrupting ourselves before we get disrupted.  <br/><br/> Want to be a part of our story? If you’re looking for an organization where you can use your talents to do remarkable things, you may be the alpha to our beta and we encourage you to read on. <br/><br/> <strong>TEAM TRANSFORMATION:</strong> <br/><br/> We’re invested in transparency being a key part of our recruitment process, so we encourage you to check out and join our Team Transformation Talent Community on LinkedIn to gain real insight on our culture and what it's really like to be an ATB Transformer. You can check it out and join us at https://www.linkedin.com/groups/13551363. <br/><br/> Also, to learn more our work and the transformative projects we have on the go connect with us at https://atbalphabeta.com/. <br/><br/> <strong>THE OPPORTUNITY:</strong> <br/><br/> As part of the Digital Transformation pillar at ATB, you will be working directly with a new service-oriented core banking platform. Your combined banking industry knowledge and technical skills will allow you to design and configure the core as required. Ultimately, you will be designing and building services that will allow your squad to leverage the platform and continuously deliver new banking features. <br/><br/> <strong>You will find success based on your ability to:</strong> <ul> <li>Working closely with the product owner and other stakeholders to identify, define, and document business requirements </li> <li>Learning & understanding the platform’s technical components, including system architecture, functionality, data structure, and integrations with external systems</li> <li>Analyzing business requirements against available capabilities, performing gap analysis, and translating into technical specifications for solution design</li> <li>Identifying potential conflicts and limitations of the solution design and suggesting alternative solutions</li> <li>Creating business process diagrams and technical solution designs</li> <li>Performing system and service configuration when needed</li> <li>Creating & executing unit test scenarios for all new developments</li> <li>Providing operational support by troubleshooting defects and promptly resolving issues</li> </ul>  </div> </div><br/>   <div> <div> Job Requirements</div><br/>  <div><strong>KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & ABILITIES:</strong> <ul> <li>Understanding of the banking industry and its operational processes</li> <li>Functional and technical experience with transactional banking systems is an asset</li> <li>Background in business process design and modelling</li> <li>Experience with relational database design and modelling (SQL/Oracle)</li> <li>Exposure to Java and JSON is an asset</li> <li>Experience in the use of Agile methodologies</li> <li>Experience with collaboration tools such as Slack, G-Suite, JIRA, Confluence and others</li> <li>Proven experience in a technology related position or field is an asset, but above everything else curiosity, hunger, inquisitiveness and passion are required!</li> </ul> <strong>ATTRIBUTES FOR SUCCESS:</strong> <ul> <li><strong>You focus on impact over hard work:</strong> what isn't of a concern is the hours you work, but your results and impact on team members and customers</li> <li><strong>You like to solve difficult problems, together:</strong> no one said transforming banking was going to be easy, but we’re collectively reimagining it and there are no solo heroes welcome</li> <li><strong>You operate with a mentality of Build-Measure-Learn:</strong> our agile mindset is not just for our technical teams, it's a mindset that every one of us is asked to operate from. We move fast, we make mistakes but we measure the impact, learn, grow and change as a result </li> <li><strong>You focus on 10X and leave the incremental thinking at home:</strong> if something doesn't have significant impact, you are the person to challenge whether or not it's worth doing</li> <li><strong>You do it with passion or not at all:</strong> you’re inspired by our purpose and you see the link between yourself and the work you are doing to transform banking </li> <li><strong>You’re comfortable with being uncomfortable:</strong> we won’t always have the answers and change is a constant in our world. As a Transformer you trust in our vision and own an attitude of willingness and patience </li> </ul> As a team member with the Transformation team at ATB, you can expect:  <ul> <li>No day will ever be the same - we’re learning, iterating and making big steps towards our vision of transforming an entire industry, everyday</li> <li>The ability to grow a career within an inspiring, impact focused culture where you are surrounded by changemakers and leaders that empower you to use your voice to make banking work for people</li> <li>To be a part of the energy of an organization that is unlike any other, where you may pinch yourself on the daily and wonder how you got so lucky</li> <li>Bragging rights! You get to call yourself a Transformer and an ATBer and know you play a direct role in helping us become a cutting edge financial institution (it’s going to feel more like a technology company, but either way it’s hella cool.) </li> </ul>   <br/> And being part of ATB Financial you get: <ul> <li>An excellent benefits and pension package, opportunities for career advancement, and a financial institution that’s leading the way in change – now you’re talking about a career with a company that allows you to grow. </li> <li>Amazing benefits for your everyday banking, mortgages, loans and investments needs.</li> <li>Be a part of an award-winning employer-of-choice – we have the best of the best working for Albertans.</li> </ul> If you want to know more, read our employer reviews visit our Glassdoor page. <br/><br/> Online applications are preferred. ATB Financial is an equal opportunity employer. We thank all applicants for their interest; however, due to the high number of resumes we receive, only short-listed candidates will be contacted. <br/><br/> If your application is shortlisted, we might ask you to participate in a digital interview. <br/><br/> Please click the following link for information on communities where ATB thrives. <br/><br/> #LI-PRIO</div>  </div>  <br/>Apply
Title: Technical Analyst

Job_Description: <div><div><strong>Job Title</strong><strong>: Technical Software Applications Business Analyst for Corporate IT and Cloud Technologies</strong> </div><br/>  <div><strong>What We Need:</strong></div><div>A Technical Business Analyst who will be the primary contact for any questions related to how IT related systems work from both a business and technical perspective. The analyst collaborates with other team members to determine requirements, create technical specifications, designs and processes. The analyst will also perform cost-benefit calculations, interdependency analysis, and prioritization exercises related to systems implementations and changes.</div><br/>  <div><strong>Things you need to have:</strong></div><ul><li>In-depth understanding of waterfall and agile software methodologies</li><li>Modeling Techniques: Object Orientation analysis, UML (e.g. Use Cases, Activity Diagrams)</li><li>Demonstrated experience writing requirements, designs and technical specifications</li> <li>Must be proficient in Microsoft Project, Excel, PowerPoint, Visio and Word</li><li>BS in Computer Science, Management Information Systems or related field.</li> <li>7-10 Years relevant experience being a Business Analyst working on corporate applications.</li> <li>Computer Science; Math; Software Engineering background</li> </ul>  <div><strong>Soft Skills that you need to have:</strong></div><ul><li>Must possess excellent communication skills and an ability to communicate across all levels of users, including upper management, and interface with numerous departments</li><li> Ability to adapt quickly to new technologies and changing business requirements</li><li>Ability to quickly troubleshoot problems that may arise in work products</li><li>Ability to partner with QA to identify course of resolutions</li><li>Excellent analytical and problem solving skills</li><li>Excellent project management and prioritization skills</li><li>Strong communication skills</li> </ul><br/>  <div><strong>What you’ll be doing:</strong></div><ul><li>Partner with business, financial, marketing and technical teams to understand and define system goals and technical system requirements</li><li>Create requirements, technical specifications and processes using structured analysis including data modeling techniques (e.g. activity diagrams, entity-relationship diagrams)</li><li>Partner with designers to build system functionality and quality attributes</li><li>Assist Corporate IT groups in revising logic for performance efficiency</li><li>Participate in system and user acceptance testing efforts</li><li>Build standards, processes and procedures, and guidelines for business and technical teams</li><li>Evaluate system cost-benefit and ROI analyses</li><li>Understand system interdependencies and collaborate with project teams accordingly</li> </ul><br/>  <div>This is a permanent position with a great company that is looking for someone to join their growing team!</div><br/>  <div>For information about TEEMA and to consider other career opportunities, please visit us at www.teemagroup.com</div><div>By applying to TEEMA on any job portal implies you are entering into a business relationship with us and therefore grants TEEMA consent to send you further job updates or industry and company related information.</div> </div>
Title: Technical Business Analyst

Job_Description: <div><div> <strong>SAP Banking Functional Analyst</strong><br/><br/>We can transform banking, reimagine it, make banking work for people. We’re on a journey to make meaningful impacts on an industry that has the power to transform a person’s life. When we talk about transformation at ATB Financial, we’re not just talking about pie in the sky ideas, we’re listening and collaborating to bring those ideas to life. To put it simply, we’re on a mission to reinvent how banking can support people's lives. We’re going to provide meaningful solutions to problems, deepen our connection with customers and while we’re at it, transform ourselves from the inside out.  <br/><br/> We need collaborative visionaries and executors who are eager to listen to our customers in order to do things other banks wouldn’t do. We’re building a team of relentless, passionate and inquisitive ATB transformers to build our bench strength in disrupting ourselves before we get disrupted.  <br/><br/> Want to be a part of our story? If you’re looking for an organization where you can use your talents to do remarkable things, you may be the alpha to our beta and we encourage you to read on. <br/><br/> <strong>TEAM TRANSFORMATION:</strong> <br/><br/> We’re invested in transparency being a key part of our recruitment process, so we encourage you to check out and join our Team Transformation Talent Community on LinkedIn to gain real insight on our culture and what it's really like to be an ATB Transformer. You can check it out and join us at https://www.linkedin.com/groups/13551363. <br/><br/> Also, to learn more our work and the transformative projects we have on the go connect with us at https://atbalphabeta.com/. <br/><br/> <strong>THE OPPORTUNITY:</strong> <br/><br/> This position is responsible for providing a wide range of functional services including new <br/> application design and construction, systems integration, and maintenance support of existing business solutions. The Functional Analyst will be working with Solution Architects, Programmers, Business Analysts, and Quality Assurance Analysts to understand the system requirements and the construction of systems that meet those requirements. Where appropriate, Functional Analyst will mentor and guide Junior Functional Analysts. <br/><br/> You will find success based on your ability to: <ul> <li>Interact with other IT Development and Operations departments to clarify and build applications that meet a business unit’s objectives. These departments include, but are not limited to, the Project Management Office, Corporate Solutions Delivery, and IT Development and Operations (see below)</li> <li>Work directly with Solution Architects, other Programmer Analysts, Quality Assurance Analysts, Project Managers, Project Analysts, Business Analysts and programmers to design, develop, and document new and maintain existing business applications</li> <li>Act as a functional subject matter expert with regards to system design, and development related activities. This includes leading configuration change and design reviews within a project team</li> <li>Prepare plans for application construction, implementation and ongoing system support</li> <li>Create and vet use case/requirements specifications</li> <li>Provide work estimates to managers and project managers as requested. This may include working with other developers and Business Analysts to develop such estimates</li> <li>Assist in the development, implementation, and adherence of systems development methodologies within projects</li> <li>Construct new applications, interfaces and maintenance changes</li> <li>Ensure data integrity and accuracy</li> <li>Prepare system documentation and training material</li> </ul>  </div> </div><br/>   <div> <div> Job Requirements</div><br/>  <div><strong>KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & ABILITIES:</strong>  <ul> <li>College diploma or bachelor’s degree in computer science, computer systems engineering, software engineering, computer programming or a related discipline </li> <li>At least 3+ years’ IT experience.</li> <li>Experience in analyzing requirements, writing Functional specifications, conducting tests, troubleshooting issues and interfacing with business users.</li> <li>Experienced in SAP Core Banking Implementations with specific focus on the end to end product life cycle for the following products:  <ul> <li>Savings Products (with and without Notice), Term Deposit Products, Transactional Products (with and without overdraft) & Master Contract Products</li> </ul>  </li> <li>The End to end product life cycle must include all areas of the product, namely:  <ul> <li>Payments</li> <li>Account Maintenance and Servicing (all business operations, and maintenance activities)</li> <li>End of Day processing and exception handling</li> <li>Experience must include, hands on functional configuration, good understanding of technical components, all round unit testing and support thereof.</li> </ul>  </li> <li>Translating business requirements into functional specifications</li> <li>Working with the development, configuration and testing teams</li> <li>Excellent teamwork and communication skills</li> <li>Extensive knowledge of financial process and functional processes</li> </ul> <strong>ATTRIBUTES FOR SUCCESS:</strong> <ul> <li><strong>You focus on impact over hard work:</strong> what isn't of a concern is the hours you work, but your results and impact on team members and customers</li> <li><strong>You like to solve difficult problems, together:</strong> no one said transforming banking was going to be easy, but we’re collectively reimagining it and there are no solo heroes welcome</li> <li><strong>You operate with a mentality of Build-Measure-Learn:</strong> our agile mindset is not just for our technical teams, it's a mindset that every one of us is asked to operate from. We move fast, we make mistakes but we measure the impact, learn, grow and change as a result </li> <li><strong>You focus on 10X and leave the incremental thinking at home:</strong> if something doesn't have significant impact, you are the person to challenge whether or not it's worth doing</li> <li><strong>You do it with passion or not at all:</strong> you’re inspired by our purpose and you see the link between yourself and the work you are doing to transform banking </li> <li><strong>You’re comfortable with being uncomfortable:</strong> we won’t always have the answers and change is a constant in our world. As a Transformer you trust in our vision and own an attitude of willingness and patience </li> <li><strong>You keep the customer at the heart of everything you do:</strong> Empathy is a core driver in which you navigate the world. You don’t build products, processes and solutions for the sake of checking something off your checklist, you build with the end user in mind, openly engaging new ideas, listening with intent and making decisions with the desire to balance both compassion with logical reasoning.</li> </ul>   <br/> As a team member with the Transformation team at ATB, you can expect: <ul> <li>No day will ever be the same - we’re learning, iterating and making big steps towards our vision of transforming an entire industry, everyday</li> <li>The ability to grow a career within an inspiring, impact focused culture where you are surrounded by changemakers and leaders that empower you to use your voice to make banking work for people</li> <li>To be a part of the energy of an organization that is unlike any other, where you may pinch yourself on the daily and wonder how you got so lucky</li> <li>Bragging rights! You get to call yourself a Transformer and an ATBer and know you play a direct role in helping us become a cutting edge financial institution (it’s going to feel more like a technology company, but either way it’s hella cool.) </li> </ul>   <br/> And being part of ATB Financial you get: <ul> <li>An excellent benefits and pension package, opportunities for career advancement, and a financial institution that’s leading the way in change – now you’re talking about a career with a company that allows you to grow. </li> <li>Amazing benefits for your everyday banking, mortgages, loans and investments needs.</li> <li>Be a part of an award-winning employer-of-choice – we have the best of the best working for Albertans.</li> </ul> If you want to know more, read our employer reviews visit our Glassdoor page. <br/><br/> Online applications are preferred.
