The Analysts will be responsible for supporting and assisting a current project team to implement the second phase of a COTS records management product.</div> <div>Skills Workshops, Problem-solving skills, Change Management, Visio, SharePoint</div> <div>Type Contract</div> <div>Project Description</div> <div>Experience Required/ Mandatory Skills   <ul> <li>Minimum 5+ years engaging and presenting to all levels of the organization from Executive to Administrative Staff.</li> <li>Minimum 5+ years facilitating workshops with 10 or more stakeholders from different business units to reach consensus on cross functional business processes.</li> <li>Minimum 5+ years of curiosity and willingness to ask questions in a work environment.</li> <li>Minimum 5+ years of strong problem solving skills and issue resolution.</li> <li>Minimum 5+ years with change management experience.</li> <li>Minimum 5+ years demonstrated competency using Visio and SharePoint.</li> </ul>  </div>  <br/><div>Nice To Have Skills   <ul> <li>Previous work in implementing a COTS product</li> <li>Prior Niche RMS product experience is a plus</li> </ul>  </div>  <br/><div>Location Calgary</div> <div>Work Environment 15 months with possibility of extension</div> <div>Hourly Rate Negotiable</div>    <ul>   <li>
Title: Business-Analyst

Job_Description: <strong>Job Posting:</strong> May 09, 2018 11:25:47 AM <br/><br/>  <strong>Unposting Date:</strong> May 24, 2018 01:59:00 AM<br/>   <div>IS Business Analyst-00134914-20180427</div><div><div><strong>Description</strong></div><div>One of Husky’s advantages is that we are an integrated oil and gas company. From exploration to development, production, refining and marketing, we’ve got it all! Combine this with a range of learning and development tools and an inclusive work environment, and you are well-positioned for a successful career at Husky.</div> <div>We have training, mentoring and career development programs and resources to help you develop both personally and professionally – as an employee or a leader. We offer many internal leadership and business skills courses along with tuition reimbursement programs for qualified employees. Every year, a significant number of our employees are able to take on new roles within the company thanks to our strong focus on hands-on learning and development.</div><div>Husky is currently looking for an <strong>IS Business Analyst</strong> for their Calgary, AB office. The IS Business Analyst works closely with the IS Program Managers to gather and assess project requirements. They possess a solid understanding of business specific processes and collaborate with relevant IS teams to develop Project Development & Execution Framework artefacts. The role is integral in evaluating the business value and benefits associated within the projects and programs.</div><div><strong>Specific responsibilities will include</strong>:</div>  <ul> <li>Liaise with business teams to gather technical and non-technical business requirements on behalf of the Business Partners and IS Program Managers to create the Project artefacts for identified opportunities</li><li>Utilize relevant business analysis techniques to perform solution analysis and design this could include but is not limited to:</li>  <ul> <li>Requirements Management (requirements traceability, baselining, etc.)</li><li>Enterprise Analysis (benchmark studies, feasibility analysis, SWOT, etc.)</li><li>Requirements Analysis (process modeling, organization modeling, use cases, etc.)</li><li>Solution Assessment and Validation (user acceptance testing, defect and issue reporting, etc.)</li> </ul>  <li>Inform Business Partners and IS Program Managers of potential continuous improvement opportunities</li><li>Conduct Requirements Management using relevant tools such as; requirements traceability matrices, base lining, prototyping, focus groups, etc.</li><li>Perform Enterprise Analysis using relevant tools such as; benchmark studies, feasibility analysis, integration effectiveness, SWOT, etc.</li><li>Conduct Process Analysis using relevant tools such as; process modeling, reverse engineering, organization modeling, use cases, etc.</li><li>Participate and enhance the BA Community of Practice including tools, templates, etc.</li></ul></div> <br/> <div><div><strong>Qualifications</strong></div><div><strong>Our ideal candidate will have the following qualifications:</strong></div>  <ul> <li>College diploma or university degree in business or information systems or equivalent experience or combination thereof</li> <li>The following would be an asset:</li>  <ul> <li>Certified Business Analysis Professional (CBAP)</li><li>Project Management Professional (PMP)</li><li>ITIL Foundations</li> </ul>  <li>Minimum of five years’ direct experience of contributing to the success of a range of small-to-medium initiatives with escalating levels of complexity and business criticality</li><li>Experience in facilitating change, including collaboration with management stakeholders</li><li>Minimum of 5 years’ experience working with information technology in an oil and gas domain is desirable</li><li>Proficient with Microsoft Office</li><li>Experience using the following is preferred:</li>  <ul> <li>ARIS</li><li>Microsoft Visio</li><li>SAP</li></ul> </ul>  <div><strong>At Husky, we respect diversity and embrace an inclusive culture. We value uniqueness and different perspectives as they play a critical role in our success. To achieve this, individuals are selected based on qualifications, merit, and abilities and we encourage applications from everyone including visible minorities, Aboriginal people, women, and persons with disabilities.</strong></div><div>Husky Energy is an integrated Canadian energy company. It is headquartered in Calgary, Alberta, and is publicly traded on the Toronto Stock Exchange under the symbol HSE. The Company operates Upstream and Downstream business segments, with operations in Canada, the United States, China and Indonesia.</div> <div>Husky's balanced growth strategy focuses on consistent execution, disciplined financial management and safe and reliable operations.</div><div>Interested candidates must apply online at: www.huskyenergy.com/careers. Only those candidates who apply via Husky's online application process can be considered. We thank all applicants for their interest in our organization; however, only short-listed applicants will be contacted.</div><div>#LI-Post</div></div><div>JobBusiness Analysis</div><div>Primary LocationCA-AB-Calgary</div>
Title: IS Business Analyst

Job_Description: <strong>Company</strong> <br/><br/> Solvera Solutions is a leader in the delivery of innovative IT and business solutions to the western Canadian market, helping our clients leverage the power of technology to achieve transformational growth. Solvera’s two-pronged business strategy of providing exceptional client care and people care has fuelled the company’s impressive growth and firmly established Solvera’s reputation for providing highly capable local resources and high quality results in SAP Solutions, Strategic Consulting, and Business Solutions service areas. <br/><br/> Solvera is one of Canada’s Best Managed Companies and enjoys a very positive reputation as one of Canada’s Best Small and Medium Employers. <br/><br/> <strong>Application Services:</strong> <br/><br/> Solvera Architects, Developers and Business Analysts provide top-quality Java, .NET, C++, Visual Basic and/or SharePoint consulting services to clients across western Canada. Solvera’s development team composition ranges from relatively recent graduates to the best and most experienced in the industry. We provide a dynamic working and learning environment that leverages the contributions of the entire team and provides enhanced mentoring for emerging resources. <br/><br/> Solvera has an immediate need for experienced SharePoint professionals (Solution Architects, Developers and Business Analysts) based in Calgary. <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities:</strong>  <ul>  	<li>Developing and implementing architecture and development models and frameworks</li> <li>Conducting systems analysis, collecting business requirements, defining functional specifications and developing use cases</li> <li>Developing, testing, implementing and supporting SharePoint applications</li> <li>Working on assigned development projects which will include a number of applications requiring new development, or upgrades/enhancements</li> </ul> <strong>Desired Skills and Experience</strong>  <ul>  	<li>Completion of a recognized post-secondary education program in Information Technology</li> <li>Four or more years of architecture, development or business analysis experience specifically related to SharePoint</li> <li>Capacity to understand the broader implications of business strategy across all business units</li> <li>Previous experience designing business services and core business processes</li> <li>Previous experience eliciting, formulating, functional and non-functional requirements</li> <li>Excellent interpersonal communication skills and ability to work well in a team environment</li> <li>Microsoft SharePoint Certification (MCTS) an asset</li> <li>Ability to communicate technical ideas using non-technical language</li> <li>Fluency in written and oral English</li> <li>Ability to work legally in Canada</li> <li>Relocation assistance is not available for this position</li> </ul> <strong>Reporting Relationship</strong> <br/><br/> In addition to reporting to a specified person on client assignments, Solvera consultants report directly to a Solvera Delivery Manager, with dotted line reporting to their Practice Leader on professional development matters. <br/><br/> <strong>Assignments</strong> <br/><br/> Solvera consultants are based in one of four western Canadian cities and can expect the vast majority of their work assignments will be supporting Solvera’s base of clients within that city. Although each client assignment is different, the hours are typically Monday – Friday workdays and the work is performed in a comfortable, safe office environment befitting many of Canada’s most progressive companies. <br/><br/> <strong>Total Compensation</strong> <br/><br/> Solvera’s total compensation program includes market-competitive base compensation, bonus opportunities to recognize individual and corporate success and an outstanding benefits package.
Title: Sharepoint Consultant

Job_Description: <strong><em>Build your future with Cadillac Fairview!</em></strong> <br/> At Cadillac Fairview, we are so much more than our properties. We are building leaders at all levels. We offer the challenge of interesting work, a great organizational culture, the opportunity to collaborate with the best in the business, and support for your growth and development. We reward values-based behavior and superior results with a competitive rewards package that includes best-in-class benefits and pension. Cadillac Fairview is where you can make a difference, and where it all comes together. <br/><br/> <strong><em>Role Summary:</em></strong> <br/><br/> The Leasing Analyst will conduct a variety of financial and market analysis utilizing a variety of assessment and risk management tools and software that will have a significant impact on strategic decisions that support and enhance our core business. As an integral member of the team, this role will be responsible for the delivery of portfolio occupancy reporting and analysis as well as the coordination and compilation of information from internal and external sources in the industry. The incumbent will coordinate leasing-related functions from start to finish of a lease and have exposure to different aspects of the leasing process through interactions with various disciplines throughout the business. <br/><br/> <strong><em>You will:</em></strong>  <ul>  	<li>Collect, analyze and interpret data and statistics using quantitative and qualitative methodology to write comprehensive reports that identify information gaps and future collection requirements</li> <li>Assist in the development of property specific merchandising strategies, utilizing skills to foster ongoing discussions regarding property needs and forecasting future revenue without compromising the merchandise mix</li> <li>Provide financial analysis and prepare business cases in order to have deals approved that require senior management review based on requested extraordinary lease concessions or financial terms that do not meet budget</li> <li>Participate in the lease negotiation process by providing data information to the Leasing Executives and Directors</li> <li>Co-ordinate and progress leasing deals through to TPF delivery. Engage with clients to follow-up on deals to ensure they are executed on time. Track lease execution and involve the Client Design & Delivery team, monitoring the process through to store opening</li> <li>Assist in the preparation of new deals and renewals through Tenant Proposal Form (TPF) and Letter of Intent (LOI) creation</li> <li>Monitor monthly tenant sales information and investigate for any unanticipated fluctuations</li> <li>Track and maintain critical dates including all upcoming expiries and evaluate for multi-asset synergies and leasing opportunities</li> <li>Prepare monthly leasing status reports, following up with Leasing Executives/Directors regarding the status of client deals, contributing comments and providing updates as necessary</li> <li>Maintain and manage leasing deal summaries, tenant files, obtain credit information, track written notice timelines</li> <li>Conduct lease research as required including reviewing and understanding clauses including extraordinary lease concessions, radius restrictions and verification of business terms</li> <li>Act as a department liaison with internal and external clients; maintain professional service to internal and external clients by responding to requests for information and redirecting inquiries beyond own scope of expertise in order to maintain client first focus. Manage information flow from properties and prospective tenants and provide general information to clients</li> <li>Develop and deliver effective presentations to inform of emerging or existing statistics and trends</li> <li>Liaise with Strategic Insight group to track client information, property demographics, psychographics, BIC scores and market share data and disseminate to leasing and portfolio team</li> <li>Report and publish all relevant information to the Client Relationship Management system (Salesforce), including all client-related updates</li> <li>Prepare ad-hoc requests for data and reports as required from all levels of the department , including analyses related to sales, Gross Rent Occupancy Cost reports (GROC), risk reviews, development analysis and tenant specific analysis as well as other miscellaneous leasing analysis</li> <li>Responsible for project administration and coordination including schedule planning, budgeting and financial requirements to complete and/or modify existing leases</li> <li>Support, monitor and assist in the preparation of leasing packages, marketing materials and CF promotional pieces for potential clients, including PowerPoint presentations. Create other presentation materials for Leasing as required</li> </ul> <strong><em>You have:</em></strong> <br/><br/> <strong>EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS:</strong>  <ul>  	<li>University degree in Commerce or Business Administration with experience in statistics an asset</li> <li>Minimum 3 years of experience in a similar role. Preference will be given to those with commercial, development or property management exposure</li> </ul> <strong>CORE COMPETENCIES AND SKILLS:</strong> <br/><br/> <strong><u>Technical skill requirements</u></strong>  <ul>  	<li>Understand and interpret financial and market research data. Working knowledge and experience in financial and statistical methodologies & practices preferred</li> <li>Strong computer skills with proficiency in Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint and Word, with the ability to quickly adapt to other programs such as Salesforce or Argus. Ability to use Gmail</li> <li>Analyze, interpret and understand the significance of commercial lease concepts</li> <li>Understand all aspects of property management including the administrative, accounting and related procedures</li> <li>Prepare reports to deadlines</li> <li>Prepare Business Cases as needed to assist with the approval of leasing deals</li> <li>Research new and existing retail in order to create analysis on the potential client</li> <li>Fast, accurate keyboarding skills</li> <li>Strong knowledge of financial accounting, cash flow modelling, corporate finance and NOI property calculations</li> <li>Experience with real estate property valuation an asset</li> </ul> <strong><u>Interpersonal skill requirements</u></strong>  <ul>  	<li>Strong analytical and interpreting skills are critical to assist with recommendations that will help drive business decisions. Must possess a high commitment to providing quality customer service</li> <li>Strong verbal and written communication skills to deliver clear, concise and professional communications in both spoken and written form</li> <li>Demonstrated ability to exercise judgment, tact and discretion in preparing, disclosing and handling information of a confidential and/or sensitive nature</li> <li>Demonstrated organizational skills, ability to prioritize workload and adjust to changing work plans, schedules and deadlines</li> <li>Self-motivated to work independently and proactively with a focus on timely delivery and quality</li> <li>Demonstrated ability to work collaboratively across all levels of the organization. The incumbent will interact with many different individuals in a variety of contexts</li> <li>Ability to build and manage relationships</li> <li>Effectively assess problems and determine workable solutions</li> <li>Ability to multi-task and work under pressure</li> <li>Ability to deliver effective presentations</li> <li>High level of professionalism</li> </ul> Are you up for the challenge? At CF, we believe our people are core to our success. Join our award-winning team, where your talent and commitment to excellence are welcomed, valued and respected! <br/><br/> <em>Accommodation for applicants with disabilities during the recruitment, assessment, and/or selection process is available.</em>
Title: Leasing Analyst

Job_Description: <div><div> <strong>Functional Analyst – SAP CRM</strong><br/><br/>We can transform banking, reimagine it, make banking work for people. We’re on a journey to make meaningful impacts on an industry that has the power to transform a person’s life. When we talk about transformation at ATB Financial, we’re not just talking about pie in the sky ideas, we’re listening and collaborating to bring those ideas to life. To put it simply, we’re on a mission to reinvent how banking can support people's lives. We’re going to provide meaningful solutions to problems, deepen our connection with customers and while we’re at it, transform ourselves from the inside out. <br/><br/> We need collaborative visionaries and executors who are eager to listen to our customers in order to do things other banks wouldn’t do. We’re building a team of relentless, passionate and inquisitive ATB transformers to build our bench strength in disrupting ourselves before we get disrupted. <br/><br/> Want to be a part of our story? If you’re looking for an organization where you can use your talents to do remarkable things, you may be the alpha to our beta and we encourage you to read on. <br/><br/> <strong>TEAM TRANSFORMATION:</strong> <br/><br/> To learn more about us and what each of our areas focus on, including who our fearless leaders are, connect with us at https://atbalphabeta.com/ or here. <br/><br/> <strong>THE OPPORTUNITY:</strong> <br/> <strong> </strong> <br/> Primary focus of this position is providing functional design based on business requirements and design UI wireframes to simplify the business process. By providing a wide range of business and technical support activities, this role will facilitate the successful development and implementation of assigned projects. This position also requires to work on call support (rotation basis) and work in middle of the nights for production deployments as needed.</div>  </div><br/>   <div> <div> Job Requirements</div><br/>  <div><strong>You will find success based on your ability to: </strong> <ul> <li>Leading Experience at ATB along with IT background is the biggest asset. </li> <li>At least 3-5 years of work experience in SAP CRM. </li> <li>Expertise in CRM Service, Sales, Marketing modules, Business Partners and Products.</li> <li>Sound understanding of One Order Framework and CRM Transactions and SPRO configuration.</li>   <li>Experience in CRM 7.0 and above is essential.</li> <li>Understanding of Integration scenarios - SAP to SAP communications with SAP PI.</li> <li>Understanding of ECC to CRM HR Organization Replication. </li> <li>Exposure to AET, EEWB, CRM WebUI Components, BOL and GENIL concepts. </li> <li>Experience in configuring Transaction types, Status profiles, Action Profiles and Number Ranges.</li> <li>Exposure to SAP OSS messages and SAP Notes search.</li> <li>Ability to perform well in high-paced, high stress environments.</li> <li>Familiar with multi-platform, multi vendor, multiple technology based environments. </li> <li>Strong customer service focus, with demonstrable experience in building trusted relationships with stakeholders.</li> <li>Strong ability to prioritize activities and excellent time management skills.</li> <li>Strong verbal and written communication skills.</li> <li>Ability to adapt to new responsibilities as assigned.</li> <li>Ability to quickly learn and understand the SAP UI framework/design principles and able to handle the front end tools.</li> <li>Recognized Computer Science or Technology related degree preferred. Equivalent education/experience would be considered. </li> </ul> Nice to Have: <ul> <li>Work experience in Banking / Financial Institutions.</li> <li>Exposure to HANA, Hybris Marketing and Hybris E-Comerce. </li> <li>Working knowledge in UI design – Fiori.</li> <li>Exposure to Google Cloud Platform, AWS, Java Applications.</li> </ul> <strong>ATTRIBUTES FOR SUCCESS:</strong> <ul> <li><strong>You focus on impact over hard work:</strong> what isn't of a concern is the hours you work, but your results and impact on team members and customers</li> <li><strong>You like to solve difficult problems, together:</strong> no one said transforming banking was going to be easy, but we’re collectively reimagining it and there are no solo heroes welcome</li> <li><strong>You operate with a mentality of Build-Measure-Learn:</strong> our agile mindset is not just for our technical teams, it's a mindset that every one of us is asked to operate from. We move fast, we make mistakes but we measure the impact, learn, grow and change as a result </li> <li><strong>You focus on 10X and leave the incremental thinking at home:</strong> if something doesn't have significant impact, you are the person to challenge whether or not it's worth doing</li> <li><strong>You do it with passion or not at all:</strong> you’re inspired by our purpose and you see the link between yourself and the work you are doing to transform banking </li> </ul>   <br/> As a team member with the Transformation team at ATB, you can expect:  <ul> <li>No day will ever be the same - we’re learning, iterating and making big steps towards our vision of transforming an entire industry, everyday</li> <li>The ability to grow a career within an inspiring, impact focused culture where you are surrounded by changemakers and leaders that empower you to use your voice to make banking work for people</li> <li>To be a part of the energy of an organization that is unlike any other, where you may pinch yourself on the daily and wonder how you got so lucky</li> <li>Bragging rights! You get to call yourself a Transformer and an ATBer and know you play a direct role in helping us become a cutting edge financial institution (it’s going to feel more like a technology company, but either way it’s hella cool.) </li> </ul>   <br/> And being part of ATB Financial you get: <ul> <li>An excellent benefits and pension package, opportunities for career advancement, and a financial institution that’s leading the way in change – now you’re talking about a career with a company that allows you to grow. </li> <li>Amazing benefits for your everyday banking, mortgages, loans and investments needs.</li> <li>Be a part of an award-winning employer-of-choice – we have the best of the best working for Albertans.</li> </ul> If you want to know more, read our employer reviews visit our Glassdoor page. <br/><br/> Online applications are preferred. ATB Financial is an equal opportunity employer. We thank all applicants for their interest; however, due to the high number of resumes we receive, only short-listed candidates will be contacted. <br/><br/> If your application is shortlisted, we might ask you to participate in a digital interview. <br/><br/> Please click the following link for information on communities where ATB thrives. <br/><br/> #LI-POST <br/><br/>   <br/><br/>  </div>  </div>  <br/>Apply
Title: Functional Analyst, SAP CRM

Job_Description: <div><b>Business Development/Client Sales Executive REF#00483X</b></div><div><b>Calgary, Alberta</b></div><div><br></div><div>Schneider Electric™ creates connected technologies that reshape industries, transform cities and enrich lives. Our 160,000 employees thrive in more than 100 countries. From the simplest of switches to complex operational systems, our technology, software and services improve the way our customers manage and automate their operations. Help us deliver solutions that ensure Life Is On everywhere, for everyone and at every moment: https://youtu.be/NlLJMv1Y7Hk.</div> <div> </div> <div><b>Great people make Schneider Electric a great company.</b></div> <div> </div> <div><b>Schneider Electric Process Automation (PA) brings together the best-known brands in industrial automation (Foxboro DCS, Triconex SIS, and Modicon PLC</b><b>’s</b><b>) to deliver integrated solutions that automate and optimize plant operations. We are part of Schneider-Electric, a $35 billion & 160,000 employee global group headquartered in France. Schneider-Electric is a major global supplier of systems, software, instruments, and solutions for electrical distribution, process automation and asset performance management. Primary customer industries include Refining and Petrochemicals, Upstream Oil and Gas, Metals and Mining, Pulp & Paper, and Power and Utilities.</b></div> <div> </div><div> <div>We are presently looking for a Client Sales Executive (CSE) to strengthen our team in the West.</div> <div>Ideally, the candidate should be based in Calgary, Alberta. </div><u><div><u><br></u></div>Responsibilities</u><br><br>The Client Sales Executive is responsible for the establishment and maintenance of the sales relationship with each client/prospect in their portfolio at every level from the executive suite (CxO) to departmental line managers. The CSE drives new business through the identification, development, negotiation, and closure of new automation projects and services agreements with prospects and clients, and participates in the subsequent maintenance of the client relationship. They target potential leads, qualify them, and lead the pursuit team in crafting and positioning the offer and pursuit. To this end, they leverage their industry and financial business knowledge to create demand and persuade through the development and presentation of compelling purchasing rationales and offers. Product, Services and Solution agreements will encompass all PA offerings and range in scale from short-term consulting engagements to complex, multi-year, multi-service, and global projects and partnerships. Specific new sales/revenue and profit margin targets are established annually by management for each CSE.<br><br>Additional CSE responsibilities include the smooth transition of new business from sales to delivery, coaching and mentoring account delivery leaders on client relationship management issues, providing feedback on customer needs to the S-E strategic portfolio manager, ensuring compliance with the sales processes and approval requirements, coordinating the relationship between key client personnel and management, and leading or coordinating global relationship management initiatives with other geographic units focused on the same client.<br><br>The CSE also shares industry, deal, and sales best-practice knowledge with the S-E sales community and may mentor and coach other Client Sales Executives, as required.<br><u><br></u></div><div><u>Job Essential Functions</u></div> <div><br>PA Client Sales Executives are responsible for managing the entire sales process from identifying prospects to negotiating contracts.<br><br>Other job essential functions include, but are not limited to, the following:<br>• Identify prospects and create entry strategies for each<br>• Create and manage demand and qualify opportunities </div> <div>• Utilize business and financial knowledge to create value propositions<br>• Execute competitive sales tactics to win business<br>• Coordinate the pursuit as well as the deal crafting and positioning<br>• Lead or participate in contract negotiations </div> <div>• Create and maintain territory sales plan and Account plans</div> <div>• Report client activities in bFO/ SalesForce CRM</div> <div>• Maintain all opportunities current and accurate in bFO/ SalesForce<br><br>This position will :</div> <div>- Have a strong Business Development component for large projects in the East.</div> <div>- Will have minimum travel requirement of 50&</div> <div><u>Education: </u></div> <div><br>Undergraduate degree, preferably in Business, Engineering, or Computer Science, or College degree with strong pertinent experience. An MBA, or graduate degree in Business, Engineering, Computer Science, or professional qualifications in Law or Finance are considered a major plus.<br><br><u>Experience:</u> </div> <div><br>• 10 years of complex, solution selling sales experience to industrial clients, ideally to the refining, oil and gas, Metals & Mining industries.<br>• Strong technical knowledge of DCS, Safety Systems, PLC controls, Instruments, and Advanced Applications for process optimization, management or control.<br>• Past experience in closing deals of $2-3 Million in contract value<br>• Knowledgeable of Business Solutions and Manufacturing Applications<br>• Ability to establish CXO level relationships<br>• Track record of meeting/exceeding yearly quota<br>• Experience in business transformation solutions<br>• Capability to understand S-E offerings and articulate those offerings to the industry and prospects</div> <div>As part of our team, you'll build a strong career with a collaborative, knowledgeable team of people. We'll challenge you to think differently to achieve your goals. You'll have easy access to senior management, leading thinkers, and colleagues around the world.</div> <div><br>In addition to competitive salaries and inclusive benefits, we offer global career opportunities and travel to new places to inspire fresh, new thinking. We believe in rewarding and recognizing risk-taking and creativity. We also promote a healthy work-life balance as essential for your personal growth.</div> <div> </div> <div> <div>Visit…. Web site</div> <div> </div> <div>We seek out and reward people for being straightforward, open, passionate, effective and challenging the status quo. We want our employees to reflect the diversity of the communities in which we operate. We welcome people as they are, creating an inclusive culture where all forms of diversity are seen as a real value for the company. We’re looking for people with a passion for success — on the job and beyond. See what our people have to say about working for Schneider Electric: https://youtu.be/6D2Av1uUrzY. </div> <div> </div> <div><b>Let us learn about you! Apply today.</b></div> <div><b> </b></div> <div>You must submit an online application to be considered for any position with us. This position will be posted until filled. </div> <div> </div> <div>It is the policy of Schneider Electric to provide equal employment and advancement opportunities in the areas of recruiting, hiring, training, transferring, and promoting all qualified individuals regardless of race, religion, color, gender, disability, national origin, ancestry, age, military status, sexual orientation, marital status, or any other legally protected characteristic or conduct.</div> <div> </div> <div>Concerning agencies: Schneider Electric does not accept unsolicited resumes and will not be responsible for fees related to such.</div><br><br><br></div>

This position will report directly to the CEO and support the Executive Team members with the planning and execution of mergers and acquisitions as well as the companys overall strategic planning process. <br/><br/> <strong> Key Accountabilities</strong> <li> Support investment/M&A opportunities through execution, negotiation, and due diligence</li> <li> Comprehensive research on competitors, opportunities, and industry</li> <li> Track potential acquisition opportunities and metrics</li> <li> Preparation of financial models and valuation analysis</li> <li> Supports working sessions with the executive team to drive alignment on corporate/operating segment goals, strategic priorities, and strategic plans</li> <li> Prepares strategy presentations for the Board of Directors, senior executives, and segment leadership teams</li> <li> Prepare materials for the Board, CEO and other senior executives</li> <strong> Competencies & Attributes</strong> <li> Strong financial modeling skills and knowledge of accounting and finance</li> <li> Analytical thinking, intellectual curiosity, strong work ethics</li> <li> Strong communication and project management skills</li> <li> Highly organized with attention to detail and the ability to work on multiple projects with varying deadlines</li> <li> Strong leadership and collaboration skills</li> <li> Excel, PowerPoint, and Word expertise</li> <li> Outstanding written and oral communications skills</li> <li> Ability to handle multiple assignments on a timely basis with a high degree of accuracy</li> <strong> Education</strong> <li> MBA or Bachelors Degree in Business, Accounting or Finance</li> <strong> Experience</strong> <li> 3 -5 years of relevant experience in a large corporation such as corporate strategy, private equity investment, or strategic consulting</li></div>

Job_Description: Reporting to the VP of Corporate Development, the Business Development Analyst will support the organization’s growth by helping Tundra acquire companies. <br/><br/> <strong>Key Responsibilities</strong> <br/> The responsibilities of this role include, but are not limited to:  <ul>  <li>Research potential acquisition targets and the related market segments</li> <li>Initiating contact and fostering relationships with potential acquisition targets</li>  <li>Preparing business plans, financial models and competitor analysis</li> <li>Executing NDA’s and preparing LOI’s</li> <li>Assist with due diligence and implementation/integration plans</li> </ul>  <strong>Requirements</strong>  <ul> <li>University or college degree in Business, Finance or related field CBV, CPA, MBA or CFA preferred</li></ul>  <ul>  <li>Minimum 2 years of industry experience</li> <li>Ability to multi-task, prioritize, and work positively under pressure</li> <li>Ability to be pro-active and anticipate the needs of the team</li> <li>Exceptional organizational skills and attention to detail</li> <li>High proficiency in Microsoft office products (Excel, Word, PowerPoint)</li> </ul>  <strong>Benefits</strong> <br/><br/> We offer a base salary with benefits and a generous compensation package. We have a strong philanthropic presence within Alberta and work closely with charities such as The Kids Cancer Care Foundation of Alberta, motionball and others. We are always looking to provide our employees with different opportunities to give back to the community, often during work hours.
Title: Business Development Analyst

Job_Description: <div><div>Helping Albertans achieve their dreams by turning the complex world of banking into brilliantly simple solutions. That’s ATB. Is that you?  <br/><br/> Coach of the Year. Magnificent Mentor. Visionary. Motivator. Team Player.  <br/><br/> Whether at work or out in your community, you are the person that knows how to bring it all together. You’re a natural leader and your passion and excitement comes from knowing that your efforts make a significant difference in the lives of your team members, customers and the community around you.<br/><br/><strong>Continuous Improvement Analyst, Procurement</strong><br/><br/>The Procurement department is responsible for sourcing suppliers, hosting competitive bidding, negotiating contracts, establishing supplier governance programs, and making sure every ATB dollar spent returns the most value. We need an advanced analyst that can support our team on a variety of activities.  <br/><br/> The Continuous Improvement Analyst is responsible for performance reporting, quality assurance, and analytics activities within the Continuous Improvement function within the Procurement department. Part of their role includes developing procurement and contract management reporting dashboards and conducting data analysis in order to drive performance monitoring of the department. This role requires collaboration with all Procurement functions in researching and analyzing high complexity work / data in support of business functions, Procurement process optimization, systems requirements and generating/compiling reports/recommendations based on findings. This role will be responsible for developing and maintaining performance dashboards, establishing and reporting on Procurement’s metrics, and managing standard reporting across Procurement functions. <br/><br/> We crave diversity of thought, we love big ideas and we value those with the ability to obsessively listen to the needs of the business and provide smart, simple and helpful solutions that drive real business value.</div>  </div><br/>   <div> <div> Job Requirements</div><br/>  <div><strong>As the ideal candidate you possess: </strong> <ul> <li>Advanced computer skills; ability to learn, utilize, and update various databases, programs and systems such as Google Suite, Google App Script, SAP, industry standard procurement and supply chain technologies, and industry standard analytics applications such as Tableau.</li> <li>Bachelor’s degree in Management Information Systems or Finance related degree is preferred.</li> <li>A minimum 3-5 years related experience. </li> <li>Advanced written and oral communication skills.</li> <li>Advanced analytical skills with ability to share business insights beyond the numbers.</li> <li>Advanced presentation creation skills. Ex: creating visually appealing infographics or slides within Google Slides or PowerPoint. Advanced data analysis and problem solving skills are required.</li> <li>Advanced Google Sheet or Excel data manipulation skills (ex: Pivot tables, VLookups, Macros).</li> <li>SAP reporting and eProcurement / Contract management system experience.</li> </ul> <strong>Skills that are a “nice to have”...</strong> <ul> <li>Understanding of Procurement, Strategic Sourcing and Category Management objectives, best practices, and processes.</li> <li>Additional relative certifications are preferred (e.g. Contracts, People Management, Facilitation, Project Management).</li> <li>Experience in procurement, supply chain, and contract management is preferred.</li> <li>Working knowledge of the banking industry and managing customer experience is preferred.</li> </ul> So what can ATB Financial offer you? Imagine paying less for your everyday banking, mortgages, loans and investments. Throw in an excellent benefits and pension package, opportunities for career advancement, and a financial institution that’s leading the way in change – now you’re talking about a career with a company that allows you to grow. As an award-winning employer-of-choice – we have the best of the best working for Albertans. Sound like a team you want to be a part of? <br/><br/> <strong>Advancement. Fun. Rewards… We get it. <br/> To learn more visit atb.com.</strong> <br/><br/> To read our employer reviews visit our Glassdoor page. <br/><br/> Online applications are preferred. ATB Financial is an equal opportunity employer. We thank all applicants for their interest; however, due to the high number of resumes we receive, only short-listed candidates will be contacted. <br/><br/> For additional information on this posting, please contact Kyle Brown. <br/><br/> If your application is shortlisted, we might ask you to participate in a digital interview. <br/><br/> Please click the following link for information on communities where ATB thrives. <br/><br/> #LI-PRIO</div>  </div>  <br/>Apply

and how underlying technologies support and enable these processes. <br/> Ability to perform detailed analysis on large set of complex data and provides logical representation of the data in the form detailed business/functional requirements. <br/> Facilitate discussions with all levels and functional areas of the organization. <br/> Prepare gap and impact analysis documentation. <br/> Provide guidance to development teams regarding functional requirements. <br/> Ensure and validate that delivered functionality meets the business objectives. <br/> Co-ordinate with User for User Acceptance testing. <br/> Create and maintain project documentation. <br/> Ability to work with global teams, act as a liaison between the customer and off-shore team <br/>  <br/> <strong>skills:</strong> <br/> Experience as IAM Business Analyst in area of Identity Access Management, Ex: Sailpoint IIQ etc. <br/> Strong experience in understanding IAM solution requirements and develop/modify business processes, prepare communication & training material for IAM/IIQ systems. <br/> Must be able to collect requirements related to user life cycle management (Onboarding, off-boarding etc) <br/> Must be familiar with access governance features of IAM Tool – Access recertification, Approval Workflows, Role Management, SOD policies <br/> Must be able to understand the requirements related to audit and compliance reporting <br/> Demonstrates critical thought and probes beyond the surface of the requested data to get at the valuable (actionable) information. <br/> Able to understand complex concepts quickly. <br/> Excellent written and verbal communication skills. <br/> Relevant experience in performing IAM Requirement Analysis, Preparing Process Map ("As Is” & "To Be”), Providing Training <br/> Job_Description: Robert Half Technology is currently seeking a Business Systems Analyst for our Calgary Client. <br/> Robert Half Technology has partnered with a growing firm in the Energy/Natural Resources industry to find an experienced Business Systems Analyst to join their dynamic, innovative team. <br/> If you have the qualifications we are looking for, please submit your resume online to stephanie.sherlock@rht.com <br/> <strong>RESPONSIBILITIES</strong> <br/> ×	Lead the customer relationship between IS and specific business areas <br/> ×	Analyze requests for new functionality, and document business cases to justify new application investments <br/> ×	Develop estimates of effort for design of new, and/or modification to existing, application components, design application components to automate and streamline business processes and functions <br/> ×	Support, maintain, enhance and/or upgrade a portfolio of custom and package applications <br/> ×	Facilitate business area planning that includes scheduling and management of application projects <br/> ×	Understand the architecture of the applications within the groups portfolio <br/> ×	Manage and supervise Systems Analysts, Developers and Developer Analysts <br/> ×	Develop and maintain technical specifications and documentation <br/> ×	Troubleshoot and repair problems that occur in the everyday use of an application <br/> ×	Provide cost estimates for the annual IS capital and sustainment budgets <br/> ×	Other duties as assigned
Title: Business Systems Analyst

Job_Description: About Cenovus<br/><br/>We’re a Canadian integrated oil and natural gas company headquartered in Calgary. We’re committed to maximizing value by responsibly developing our assets in a safe, innovative and efficient way. <br/><br/> Our operations include oil sands projects in northern Alberta, which use specialized methods to drill and pump the oil to the surface, and established natural gas and oil production in Alberta and British Columbia. We also have 50 percent ownership in two U.S. refineries. <br/><br/> Our shares trade under the symbol CVE, and are listed on the Toronto and New York stock exchanges.<br/><br/>About this Opportunity<br/><br/>Reporting to the Superintendent, Site Services, the Cost Analysts primary responsibility is to support Christina Lake Maintenance, Support Services, Operations and Waste & Fluid Hauling in cost control, monitoring and reporting. Acting as main Christina Lake site point of contact for OPEX cost queries and coding information, this team provides direct assistance and support to contractors, Cenovus employees and CL Leadership. The Cost Control Team works directly with Calgary FP&A to support all Finance initiatives, and to ensure better coding practices, better cost center structures, and more visibility of business drivers. <br/><br/> The Cost Analyst works directly with Cost Control Team and Christina Lake operational and support services teams to develop monthly estimates, monthly outlooks and annual budgets, working to continuously improve the quality and clarity of end product. Results are regularly communicated to applicable Christina Lake superintendent/coordinator group to evaluate monthly performance against prior months and budget, identifying areas of opportunity for cost reduction, determining action items for improvement, and communicating variance causals to Calgary FP&A. <br/><br/> The Cost Analyst also works directly with Christina Lake Superintendents, Coordinators and Leads to determine requirements for incurred cost reporting and KPI development, using feedback to develop, enhance and distribute cost reporting. This cost reporting and direct communication with site leadership enables better understanding of current spend profile, setting business units up for success in preparing reliable, transparent and detailed budgets and outlooks.<br/><br/>Work Environment<br/><br/>This is a contract position at Christina Lake working a shift of 7 days on 7 days off. Christina Lake has full service camp facilities. Depending on your place of residence and your shift rotation, bus and/or air transportation to/from site is offered from designated departure points in select locations. Christina Lake is serviced by flight hubs in Calgary and Edmonton as well as bus transportation to the sites from La Corey, Bonnyville and Cold Lake, AB.<br/><br/>Responsibilities   <ul>   <li>Liaise with FP&A representative for all production operations monthly accruals and investigation; work to continuously improve quality and clarity of estimates provided</li> <li>Support FP&A with the objective of continuous improvement on an ongoing basis</li> <li>Provide FP&A representative with details of month over month and actual to budget variance causals; follow up with CL site representatives on any questions from accounting representative</li> <li>Provide the capability to develop and monitor cost tracking and control protocols, systems and work flow processes based on direct guidance from operational and support services teams</li> <li>Regularly review JDE Cost Pick data to ensure accuracy, requesting JDE corrections where errors are noted</li> <li>Liaise with Maximo implementation team and business analysts on behalf of Christina Lake facility, providing input and requests for cost/contracts related enhancements</li> <li>Work directly with CL operational and support services teams to develop budgets and monthly outlook, and to monitor monthly performance against</li> <li>Work directly with CL Superintendents and Coordinators to break-down monthly results, identify areas of over spend, and determine any action items for improvement</li> <li>Work directly with CL Superintendents, Coordinators and Leads to determine requirements for incurred cost reporting and KPI development; develop, enhance and distribute cost reporting requirements</li> <li>Primary Christina Lake point of contact for coding education and query resolution</li> <li>Support operations and support services teams in the identification and tracking of Cost Savings Opportunities</li> <li>Provide ad hoc reporting as required</li> <li>Support in investigation and resolution of identified discrepancies upon audit of daily time tickets and invoices</li> <li>Support in the development of relationships with CL service providers and Foster Creek Coordinators/Superintendents to enable quality service and support</li> </ul>  <strong>Qualifications</strong>   <ul>   <li>Must be legally entitled to work in Canada</li> <li>Post graduate diploma / degree or equivalent training – preference given to professional Accounting designation or Degree in Commerce</li> <li>Minimum 5 years’ experience</li> <li>Previous experience in Invoice reconciliation and Cost Analysis</li> <li>Must be proficient in Microsoft Office Suite - prepare and present information</li> <li>Well-developed organizational, communication and interpersonal skills</li> <li>Experience with JDE, Open Invoice, Maximo and accounting programs</li> </ul>
Title: Cost Analyst - Contract

Job_Description: About Vista<br/><br/>Recognized as one of Canadas top employers and Best Managed Companies, Vista Projects is a full service engineering, procurement and project management company serving Western Canadas oil sands and conventional oil and gas producers for over 30 years. Our continued growth comes from an experienced team of professionals who have an absolute commitment to providing our clients with exceptional service. We specialize in facility engineering design for thermal heavy oil (SAGD, CSS), enhanced oil recovery, and sustaining capital projects. Over the years, we have earned our reputation as a trusted leader in thermal energy projects, working on some of the most successful in-situ heavy oil projects in the oil sands.<br/><br/>Main Duties and Competencies<br/><br/>The Business Intelligence Analyst is responsible for the development and maintenance of the company business intelligence portal, and related business applications. This is a fantastic opportunity for either a tech savvy business graduate, or a business savvy developer to elevate their career. <br/><br/> This role combines business analysis, front-end and back-end development to deliver a challenging and engaging position where the successful candidate will be able to see their contributions come to life within a fast-paced and dynamic workplace. <br/><br/> If a role where you are empowered and supported to move from opportunity identification, through conceptualization, development and testing in weeks and not years sounds up your alley read on. <br/><br/> Duties will include:  <ul> <li>Creative problem solving</li> <li>Design and develop business intelligence reporting tools, visualizations and applications across all parts of Vistas business</li> <li>Maintain and work within Vistas data warehouse. Participate in the design, development and analysis of the data warehouse</li> <li>Assist in the selection, deployment and maintenance of third party business applications</li> <li>Maintain and develop new and legacy code for proprietary business applications</li> <li>Complete ad-hoc BI reporting for a variety of stakeholders</li> <li>Document business processes, relationships and software</li> <li>Design, code and test SQL queries to provide information to internal teams</li> <li>Identify process improvement opportunities within the organization</li> <li>Complete data integrity audits</li> <li>Complete security audits</li> <li>Other duties as required.</li> </ul>  <strong>Requirements:</strong>   <ul> <li>Undergraduate degree in one of: Business, Commerce, Accounting, Management Information Systems or Engineering OR post-secondary diploma in Software Development, Web Development</li> <li>Strong understanding of best-in-class business processes (HR, Accounting, Finance etc)</li> <li>Advanced knowledge of relational databases (RDB) and SQL (one of tSQL, MySQL, Postres etc)</li> <li>Must be trustworthy, discreet, detail focused and action orientated.</li> <li>Must be comfortable working autonomously, as well as in a team-development environment. Must be comfortable working with a remote team</li> </ul>  <strong>Preferred:</strong>   <ul> <li>Demonstrated experience in programming in either PHP or Python</li> <li>Previous development experience in either Logi Analytics, Tableau, SiSense</li> <li>Three plus years of post-graduate professional work experience</li> </ul>  What We Offer<br/><br/>An opportunity with Vista is not just a job; it is a chance to work with colleagues who are among the most recognized and accomplished in the industry.<br/><br/>Vista offers all employees   <ul> <li>A stimulating, fast-paced and challenging work environment where you will contribute to the most successful oil and gas projects in Western Canada;</li> <li>An opportunity to be a part of an entrepreneurial, technically skilled team which has established leadership in innovative engineering;</li> <li>A strong value-based philosophy that provides an informal, close-knit team environment, where you and your family feel like a part of our organization, and not just an employee number;</li> <li>Competitive compensation and benefits, including a performance-linked variable pay program;</li> <li>Company-sponsored social events and team sports;</li> <li>Flexible work schedules, half-day Fridays and free parking (excludes downtown office);</li> <li>An organization that values and encourages diversity;</li> <li>Shareholder opportunities are a long-term potential for exceptional employees.</li> </ul>  How To Apply<br/><br/>Please submit a cover letter concisely demonstrating how your skills and experience align with our job posting. <br/><br/> <strong>Note:</strong> <em>As part of the interview process there will be a technical testing component which will take up to two hours and can be completed at home on your own timelines. Candidates may be required to complete a security clearance procedure prior to offer.</em>
Title: Business Intelligence Analyst / Developer

Job_Description: <STRONG>Description</STRONG><br/><br/><STRONG>About the Analytics & Insights Group:</STRONG> <br/><br/> The Analytic & Insights Group at The AIR MILES® Reward Program provides world class analytical solutions through the delivery of insights that enable our clients to build stronger mutually-beneficial relationships with their customers. The group works directly with the sponsors of the program as well as internal business managers to ensure the successful partnering with our clients. <br/><br/> <STRONG>Why work with us?</STRONG> <br/><br/> The AIR MILES Reward Program Analytics & Insights practice is growing significantly and we are looking for a well-rounded Analytics & Insights Analyst to join our team in Calgary. We are looking for a best-in-class analytics practitioner with a blend of proficient technical skills and strong business acumen. The Senior Analyst plays an expert role in the application & execution of consumer data and analytics to support the development of customer-centric business strategies and Loyalty Marketing for our clients. <br/><br/> <STRONG>What will you be doing?</STRONG> <ul>  <LI>Subject Matter Expert in Loyalty & Marketing Analytics for the retail sponsor portfolio</LI> <LI>Contribute to all phases of campaign management (ideation, planning, targeting, list generation, measurement, recommendation) with a focus in pre-analysis and post-analysis</LI> <LI>Work collaboratively with internal business partners to fully understand external clients business needs</LI> <LI>Work collaboratively with internal business partners to clearly define analysis / campaign scope, objectives, targeting & measurement strategy for clients loyalty marketing initiatives</LI> <LI>Assist in the translation of business requirements into technical specifications</LI> <LI>Extract, cleanse and modify raw data from data warehouse, conduct customer analysis or campaign measurement to identify opportunities for clients to maximize the use of AIR MILES Reward Program to drive incremental sales</LI> <LI>Present analysis results and recommendations in business language in different forums/meetings</LI> <LI>Identify further marketing opportunities for our clients by triangulating industry / competitive analyses with external 3rd party information (research, government reports / trends)</LI> <LI>Create case studies to demonstrate how analytics drive revenue, profit or efficiencies for our clients and for LoyaltyOne</LI> <LI>Automate process using Python/SAS/SQL and/or make suggestions to tool / process improvement to drive operational efficiency</LI> <LI>Ensure timely completion of analysis while maintaining high quality</LI> <LI>Balance the demands of multiple concurrent projects while maintaining a high level of diplomacy</LI> <LI>Respond to ad hoc requests (internal & external) for analysis, data and information on a regular basis</LI> <LI>Contribute in other corporate strategic initiatives as required</LI> </ul>  <STRONG>Qualifications</STRONG><br/><br/><STRONG>What will you bring?</STRONG> <ul>  <LI> <DIV>Bachelors or Masters degree in any of the following (or combination of): Statistics, Economics, Computer Science, Engineering, Math or any quant field.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Minimum of 2-3 years of customer analysis / insight delivery experience in a complex data-driven organization.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Expert knowledge in campaign management, experimental design, customer analytics, CRM, segmentation, modeling</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Technical Skills - experience with Excel, Access, R, Python, SAS, SQL, R, relational databases, data warehouses, analytics systems (e.g. Tableau Server); strong analytical & data mining skills; intermediate predictive modeling / machine learning experience; experience with both qualitative and quantitative consumer research techniques</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Business Skills - strong understanding of Retail or Financial Services - direct marketing (market research, experimental design); interpret research, extracting insights, linking to strategies, and communicating a compelling summary of findings and drive results, client communication and presentation.</DIV></LI> </ul> <STRONG>About LoyaltyOne:</STRONG> <br/><br/> LoyaltyOne is a global leader in the design and implementation of coalition loyalty programs, customer analytics, and loyalty services for Fortune 1000 clients around the world. LoyaltyOne has over 20 years history leveraging data-driven insights to develop and operate some of the world's most effective loyalty programs and customer-centric solutions. These include the AIR MILES Reward Program, North America's premier coalition loyalty program, Precima, the global retail strategy and analytics arm, LoyaltyOne Consulting, European-based BrandLoyalty, and Latin America's leading coalition program, dotz. LoyaltyOne is an Alliance Data company. www.loyalty.com <br/><br/> <STRONG>About ADS:</STRONG> <br/><br/> Alliance Data® (NYSE: ADS) is a leading global provider of data-driven marketing and loyalty solutions serving large, consumer-based industries. The Company creates and deploys customized solutions, enhancing the critical customer marketing experience; the result is measurably changing consumer behavior while driving business growth and profitability for some of today's most recognizable brands. Alliance Data helps its clients create and increase customer loyalty through solutions that engage millions of customers each day across multiple touch points using traditional, digital, mobile and emerging technologies. An S&P 500 and Fortune 500 company headquartered in Plano, Texas, Alliance Data consists of three businesses that together employ more than 16,000 associates at approximately 100 locations worldwide. www.alliancedata.com <br/><br/> Alliance Data is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. Accordingly, we will make reasonable accommodations to respond to the needs of people with disabilities in accordance with legislation. <br/><br/> Alliance Data participates in E-Verify.
Title: Analytics & Insights Analyst

Job_Description: <strong>LOCATION:</strong> Calgary, Alberta (CA-AB) <br/> <strong>JOB NUMBER:</strong> 22550 <br/>   <br/><br/> <strong>Job Overview</strong> <br/><br/> Reporting to the manager, solutions design, you will conduct business analysis functions to successfully identify and document business requirements that are aligned with organizational enterprise architecture, delivery and process goals. You will work with business leaders and domain experts to identify and bring strategic initiatives from concept to implementation by validating the return on investment across all tiers of the projects. <br/><br/> <strong>Key Accountabilities</strong> <ul> <li>Facilitate sessions with multiple stakeholders in order to gain a common view of the business requirements needed to ultimately develop the proposed information technology (IT) solution while following our asset development and execution model (ADEM) methodology</li><li>Work within the bounds of a gated project methodology alongside solution architects, delivery, business engagement and support teams</li><li>Assess organizational readiness to accept the new solution and define requirements to support the transition of the business</li><li>Work closely with the portfolio architect, project manager and solution design lead to identify high level resource and timeline estimates</li><li>Conduct quantitative analysis to validate “solution build” decisions versus “buy” decisions</li><li>Write business requirements and business case documentation and describe processes as per the standards</li><li>Build comprehensive work products documenting business requirements</li><li>Report on business analysis measurements using established metrics and dashboards</li><li>Uphold organizational standards for business analysis work</li> </ul> <strong>Required Qualifications</strong> <br/><br/> Experience and Education: <ul> <li>Five or more years of experience applying business analyst techniques to create business cases and gather requirements used in creating process and technical solutions</li><li>Oil and gas industry experience is preferred</li><li>Experience writing business cases and gathering requirements for an ERP system (e.g. SAP) is preferred</li><li>Degree or diploma in computer science, management or equivalent</li><li>Completion of, or working towards a Certification of Competency in Business Analysis (CCBA) or Certified Business Analysis Professional (CBAP) is an asset</li> </ul> Skills and Knowledge: <ul> <li>Proficient in Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, Visio, PowerPoint, MS Project), MS SharePoint, HPQC or related tools</li><li>Understanding of oil and gas business processes and their linkage to technology</li><li>Ability to work among stakeholders to build a consensus to ensure that analysis and implementation is focused on the most critical requirements, and consider business value, cost to deliver, and schedule</li><li>You have a proven adaptive work style with the ability to solicit and accept feedback</li><li>You are passionate about continuous improvement and bring this mindset to your work</li> </ul> <strong>Working Conditions</strong> <ul> <li>You are able to handle multiple priorities, challenging demands, and function in a fast paced, dynamic work environment</li> </ul> <strong>Why Suncor</strong> <br/> Go ahead. Expect growth. We want you to have a job you're genuinely excited about - as well as opportunities to learn and challenge yourself or mentor others. Plus, Suncor Energy offers a flexible employee package that can be adjusted to suit the changing needs of your life, including: <ul> <li>Competitive base salary and compensation programs</li><li>Attractive annual incentive program</li><li>Flexible benefits package</li><li>Rewarding pension and savings plans</li> </ul> Our mission to create energy for a better world begins with caring about the communities we live and work in, while responding to your interests and concerns. Read our Suncor Connections newsletter to see how we're living up to our commitment to keeping you informed. <br/><br/> <strong>Business Overview</strong> <br/> Suncor Energy is Canada's energy company - meaning rewarding opportunities for you to apply your knowledge, contribute and grow in a variety of career-building positions. Our business portfolio spans the entire energy sector, from a leadership position in oil sands development, to refining and marketing operations, natural gas, and conventional oil production, internationally and offshore East Coast Canada. <br/><br/> And while we are working to responsibly develop petroleum resources and contribute to the communities where we live and work, we are also developing our renewable energy portfolio, which includes wind power and biofuels. <br/><br/> As part of Suncor's team, you'll contribute to the ongoing success of Canada's largest energy company - one with a solid track record of growth, a focus on safety and sustainability and tremendous potential for the future. And you'll have the opportunity to learn from experts in the industry and build on your skills every day. <br/><br/> Suncor promotes diversity and inclusion in the workplace. Suncor is an equal opportunity employer and encourages applications from all qualified individuals. Suncor is committed to accessibility and accommodations will be provided to applicants upon request. At Suncor, we are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of the communities in which we live, and where every team member has the opportunity to reach their full potential. <br/><br/> Not sure if this particular listing is the right opportunity for you? Please join our Talent Community at www.suncor.com and click on Careers, or follow us on LinkedIn, Facebook and Twitter for the latest job listings and employment news. <br/><br/> <strong>Please note that our job postings are typically open for two weeks, so if you are interested and qualified, apply now.</strong> <br/><br/> JOB CATEGORY: Business Professionals
