Job_Description: Requisition Id: 15293 <br/><br/> Department: Business Development & Customer Service <br/><br/> <strong>Summary of Responsibilities</strong> <br/><br/> Working within a team environment and reporting to the Manager, Customer Service, the Analyst, Logistics will be responsible for managing product movements on Pembinas Oil Sands and Heavy Oil pipeline systems. The successful candidate will be responsible for managing product movements on a variety of Pembinas pipeline systems that may include, Heavy Oil, Synthetic Crude, Conventional Crude, Condensate and Ethane. <br/><br/> Responsibilities will include, but are not limited to: <ul> <li>Overseeing the pipeline nomination process while reviewing for accuracy, reasonability, and pipeline capacity;</li><li>Monitoring shipper receipts and deliveries versus nominations;</li><li>Communicating, developing and sustaining strong relationships with refiners, shippers, and other pipelines to ensure proper allocation of deliveries;</li><li>Balancing and reviewing shipper positions and product transfers based on actual receipts;</li><li>Preparing and reviewing monthly tariff and equalization invoices;</li><li>Monitoring petroleum qualities at receipt and delivery points as well as pipeline integrity points;</li><li>Volumetric forecasting & producer feedback;</li><li>Providing volumetric analysis reports to management including variance analysis and its impact on revenue;</li><li>Observing and reporting trends and pipeline developments on Pembinas systems;</li><li>Monthly reporting on an internal and external basis;</li><li>Analytical project support as required; and</li><li>Ability to be on call on a regular basis.</li> </ul> <strong>Qualifications</strong> <ul> <li>5+ years of Pipelines Logistics experience is required;</li><li>Experience with Heavy Oil, Synthetic Crude, Conventional Crude, Condensate and Ethane;</li><li>Bachelors Degree is an asset, but related experience will be considered;</li><li>High degree of proficiency and confidence with software applications specifically MS Excel, Word, Outlook, PowerPoint, Power BI, as well as Polaris and Petrotranz;</li><li>Highly efficient analytical skills with a strong attention to detail;</li><li>Strong problem solving skills, proactive in identifying potential issues and providing solutions</li><li>Strong time management and prioritization skills;</li><li>An energetic team player with the ability to work productively within a team environment while independently driving personal results; and proven ability to multitask while balancing deadline driven workloads;</li><li>Communication: strong verbal communication skills with the ability to conduct clear concise conversations that result in shared understanding;</li><li>Ability to be on call on a regular basis is required.</li> </ul> <strong>No agency calls please.</strong> <br/><br/> Pembina is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We are pleased to consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, protected veterans status or any other legally-protected factors.Accommodation for applicants with disabilities is available on request during the recruitment process. <br/><br/> Pembina Pipeline Corporation has been serving the transportation and midstream service needs of North America's energy industry for over 60 years. We process, terminal and transport our customers' products safely - all while protecting the environment and delivering on our commitments to our shareholders and community stakeholders. When we build something, we do it right. <br/><br/> Powering Pembina's growth are our smart, creative and energetic people who allow us to remain a disciplined and responsible energy transportation and service provider and a trusted member in our communities. <br/><br/> Our expectations are high, and so are our rewards. We treat our people well whether its through our total compensation package, our community engagement and volunteer opportunities, or our numerous fun social activities. <br/><br/> Pembina is a proud recipient of the 2018 Canadas Top 100Employers and Alberta's Top 70 Employers(2014-2017). We are also a strong supporter of Skills Canada. <br/><br/> <a href="
Title: Logistics Analyst

Job_Description: <div><div><div><div><strong>Senior Business Analyst - Business Planning</strong> <br/><br/> Reference Code: 50802</div> </div></div><div><strong>Location:</strong> Canada (CA) - Calgary, AB</div> <div><strong>Job Category:</strong> Operations</div><div><strong>Employment Type:</strong> Employee Full-time</div><div><strong>Relocation Eligibility:</strong> This position is not eligible for our relocation program</div> <br/><strong>General Information</strong> <br/><br/> Reporting to the Business Planning (BP) Manager in the Canada Gas (CG) Organization, this role will support the development, coordination and reporting of business metrics and performance across Canada Gas, including generation key messages and insights, development of reports/dashboards and timely delivery of relevant information that enhances CG leadership decision making and management of the CG business. <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities</strong> <ul> <li>Partners with Leaders (includes departmental sr. leadership, directors and managers; 149+ leaders) and the BP Team to develop and/or refine business performance metrics & reporting; includes scorecards, goals and targets, risks and performance measures to aid leaders in business planning, management and performance decisions;</li><li>Establishes and enhances data infrastructure to improve reporting efficiencies and effectiveness, including centralization of data collection, automation of various reports, clear message visualization and coordination of monthly input;</li><li>Performs complex analysis and reporting of goals, status and key performance indicators (KPIs) which may include gap and trend analysis, regression analysis and financial analysis that delivers value to leadership as required;</li><li>Monitors and understands performance gaps, from planned to actual business performance, including insightful analytics and variance analysis of planned to actuals; translates into clear and succinct performance reporting for regular review meetings;</li><li>Conducts complex constraints and risk analysis and compiles information on mitigations and controls to report risk preparedness. Translates risk data into visualization and identifies performance relationships and recommendations;</li><li>Applies understanding of the data and business in reporting to create insights and key messages (the story) for leaders;</li><li>Works with the BP Manager to develop meeting materials and co-facilitate monthly/quarterly performance reviews;</li><li>Prepares and/or supports preparation of presentations for organizational alignment and awareness;</li><li>Ensures that the data feed into the performance reports are timely and accurate. Ensures data integrity;</li><li>Supports development of governance models, develops compliance reporting tools including leading development of input cadence and coordination of data collection, consolidation and reporting framework;</li><li>Develops solutions to meet varying management needs including ad-hoc analysis and reporting as required;</li><li>Supports Accounting/Finance where required with the coordinating of budget and performance data;</li><li>Works with the multi-disciplined groups including operations, projects, commercial, regulatory, “commercial services & optimization & design” (CSOD), finance and other internal business partners to frame/build analysis and reporting;</li><li>Tracks the performance of the Business Planning team within Canada Gas;</li><li>Provides facilitation and/or facilitation support for various Business Improvement programs/projects as requested;</li><li>Works with the BP Team to develop visualization dashboards for Program Management, Business Improvement and Business Learning & Capabilities portfolios;</li><li>Helps coach and train other analysts as needed for cross-functionality;</li><li>Provides systems and user interface support to leadership and business users.</li> </ul> <strong>Qualifications</strong> <ul> <li>Strong financial and quantitative analysis skills, efficient at collecting, collating, analyzing and displaying data;</li><li>High attention to detail, accuracy, and presentation while delivering work in timely manner;</li><li>Ability to research topics, research reporting solutions/alternatives and communicate findings effectively;</li><li>Ability to perform successfully in a multi-disciplined, cross functional work team environment;</li><li>Ability to coordinate multi-disciplined stakeholders and present information in a clear and succinct manner;</li><li>Self-starter/self-proficient showing strong initiative and independent judgement where required to meet tight timelines;</li><li>Strong communication and interpersonal skills with the ability to work both independently and within a dynamic TEAM.</li> </ul> <strong>Education/Experience</strong> <ul> <li>Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in relevant discipline;</li><li>Minimum of 6 or more years of industry and analyst experience, Midstream and/or Natural Gas experience is preferred;</li><li>High level of proficiency with MS Word, and MS PowerPoint, Expert proficiency in MS Excel with complex functionalities;</li><li>Power Bi experience is required;</li><li>Visualization software experience is an asset;</li><li>Previous experience of business performance management processes and reporting is an asset.</li> </ul> *Depending on the qualifications of the applicants, the successful candidate may be offered a position at a more appropriate level and/or ladder. <br/><br/> Applicants must have legal authorization to work in the country in which the position is based with no restrictions. <br/><br/> Applicants who require accommodation at any stage of the application process or if you would like additional information regarding TransCanada&apos;s accommodation policies please contact careers@transcanada.com. <br/><br/> All positions require background screening. Some include criminal and/or credit checks in order to comply with regulations. <br/><br/> <strong>Please apply to this posting by 05/17/2018.</strong> To apply, go to jobs.transcanada.com and enter reference code 50802. Only applications submitted through the TransCanada Careers website will be acknowledged. <br/><br/> TransCanada is an equal opportunity employer. <br/><br/> <strong>Make what you do matter.</strong> <br/><br/> At TransCanada we dream big, think big and do big things. For over 65 years, we&apos;ve had the vision and scale to deliver big things that matter to the world. From supplying reliable and efficient energy to millions of North Americans with our pipelines, gas storage and power generation facilities, we believe in making big things possible. <br/><br/> TransCanada is looking for people who are willing to think about the future...and think big. We&apos;re looking for people who are ready to take on the most significant challenges of their careers and define energy infrastructure in North America. <br/><br/> Thank you for choosing TransCanada in your career search.</div>
Title: Senior Business Analyst - Business Planning

Job_Description: Inter Pipeline is a major petroleum transportation, storage and natural gas liquids processing business that ranks among the largest energy infrastructure companies in Canada. We are proud to be named one of Alberta’s Top 70 Employers, which recognizes Alberta businesses that lead their industries by being exceptional places to work. <br/><br/> Located out of our Calgary office, the individual in the Business Analyst, Corporate Development role will report to the Supervisor M&A and Projects. The primary focus of the role is to assist Corporate Development team members with financial modeling that supports important business activities, providing senior management of Inter Pipeline with professional, accurate and well communicated financial and business analysis on merger and acquisition support and organic growth projects. <br/><br/> <strong>Key Activities and Responsibilities:</strong> <ul> <li>Complete detailed, robust economic valuation models including various sensitivity analysis on potential acquisitions and commercial projects.</li><li>Prepare and present detailed financial analysis and communication materials to senior management.</li><li>Be aware of macroeconomic events and provide an analysis of the impact on IPL’s business as required.</li><li>Participate in identifying acquisition opportunities on a proactive basis and prepare detailed overview of financial and strategic rationale of each opportunity.</li><li>Assist with analytical support in various areas of the Company including Treasury, Corporate Planning and Accounting functions as required.</li> </ul> <strong>Education, Skills and Experience:</strong> <ul> <li>The individual will have at minimum 4 years’ experience with a minimum of 2-3 years related industry experience with a proven record of developing and maintaining robust financial models.</li><li>University degree in commerce (finance or accounting preferred).</li><li>Enrolment in or recent achievement of a professional designation in considered an asset (CFA, CBV, and CPA).</li><li>Strong understanding of valuation methodology along with financial statement accounts and their impact on cash flows.</li><li>Advanced Excel skills, particularly in financial and business modeling, with experience interpreting and communicating financial and business information.</li><li>Well-developed presentation, communication and interpersonal skills.</li><li>Must be able to work well in a fast-paced, growth environment.</li> </ul>
Title: Business Analyst, Corporate Development

Job_Description: About Cenovus<br/><br/>We’re a Canadian integrated oil and natural gas company headquartered in Calgary. We’re committed to maximizing value by responsibly developing our assets in a safe, innovative and efficient way. <br/><br/> Our operations include oil sands projects in northern Alberta, which use specialized methods to drill and pump the oil to the surface, and established natural gas and oil production in Alberta and British Columbia. We also have 50 percent ownership in two U.S. refineries. <br/><br/> Our shares trade under the symbol CVE, and are listed on the Toronto and New York stock exchanges.<br/><br/>About this Opportunity<br/><br/>Reporting to the Superintendent, Site Services, the Cost Analysts primary responsibility is to support Christina Lake Maintenance, Support Services, Operations and Waste & Fluid Hauling in cost control, monitoring and reporting. Acting as main Christina Lake site point of contact for OPEX cost queries and coding information, this team provides direct assistance and support to contractors, Cenovus employees and CL Leadership. The Cost Control Team works directly with Calgary FP&A to support all Finance initiatives, and to ensure better coding practices, better cost center structures, and more visibility of business drivers. <br/><br/> The Cost Analyst works directly with Cost Control Team and Christina Lake operational and support services teams to develop monthly estimates, monthly outlooks and annual budgets, working to continuously improve the quality and clarity of end product. Results are regularly communicated to applicable Christina Lake superintendent/coordinator group to evaluate monthly performance against prior months and budget, identifying areas of opportunity for cost reduction, determining action items for improvement, and communicating variance causals to Calgary FP&A. <br/><br/> The Cost Analyst also works directly with Christina Lake Superintendents, Coordinators and Leads to determine requirements for incurred cost reporting and KPI development, using feedback to develop, enhance and distribute cost reporting. This cost reporting and direct communication with site leadership enables better understanding of current spend profile, setting business units up for success in preparing reliable, transparent and detailed budgets and outlooks.<br/><br/>Work Environment<br/><br/>This is a contract position at Christina Lake working a shift of 7 days on 7 days off. Christina Lake has full service camp facilities. Depending on your place of residence and your shift rotation, bus and/or air transportation to/from site is offered from designated departure points in select locations. Christina Lake is serviced by flight hubs in Calgary and Edmonton as well as bus transportation to the sites from La Corey, Bonnyville and Cold Lake, AB.<br/><br/>Responsibilities   <ul>   <li>Liaise with FP&A representative for all production operations monthly accruals and investigation; work to continuously improve quality and clarity of estimates provided</li> <li>Support FP&A with the objective of continuous improvement on an ongoing basis</li> <li>Provide FP&A representative with details of month over month and actual to budget variance causals; follow up with CL site representatives on any questions from accounting representative</li> <li>Provide the capability to develop and monitor cost tracking and control protocols, systems and work flow processes based on direct guidance from operational and support services teams</li> <li>Regularly review JDE Cost Pick data to ensure accuracy, requesting JDE corrections where errors are noted</li> <li>Liaise with Maximo implementation team and business analysts on behalf of Christina Lake facility, providing input and requests for cost/contracts related enhancements</li> <li>Work directly with CL operational and support services teams to develop budgets and monthly outlook, and to monitor monthly performance against</li> <li>Work directly with CL Superintendents and Coordinators to break-down monthly results, identify areas of over spend, and determine any action items for improvement</li> <li>Work directly with CL Superintendents, Coordinators and Leads to determine requirements for incurred cost reporting and KPI development; develop, enhance and distribute cost reporting requirements</li> <li>Primary Christina Lake point of contact for coding education and query resolution</li> <li>Support operations and support services teams in the identification and tracking of Cost Savings Opportunities</li> <li>Provide ad hoc reporting as required</li> <li>Support in investigation and resolution of identified discrepancies upon audit of daily time tickets and invoices</li> <li>Support in the development of relationships with CL service providers and Foster Creek Coordinators/Superintendents to enable quality service and support</li> </ul>  <strong>Qualifications</strong>   <ul>   <li>Must be legally entitled to work in Canada</li> <li>Post graduate diploma / degree or equivalent training – preference given to professional Accounting designation or Degree in Commerce</li> <li>Minimum 5 years’ experience</li> <li>Previous experience in Invoice reconciliation and Cost Analysis</li> <li>Must be proficient in Microsoft Office Suite - prepare and present information</li> <li>Well-developed organizational, communication and interpersonal skills</li> <li>Experience with JDE, Open Invoice, Maximo and accounting programs</li> </ul>
Title: Cost Analyst - Contract

Job_Description: Inter Pipeline is a major petroleum transportation, storage and natural gas liquids processing business that ranks among the largest energy infrastructure companies in Canada. We are proud to be named one of Alberta’s Top 70 Employers, which recognizes Alberta businesses that lead their industries by being exceptional places to work. <br/><br/> Located out of our Calgary office, the individual in the Business Analyst, Corporate Development role will report to the Supervisor M&A and Projects. The primary focus of the role is to assist Corporate Development team members with financial modeling that supports important business activities, providing senior management of Inter Pipeline with professional, accurate and well communicated financial and business analysis on merger and acquisition support and organic growth projects. <br/><br/> <strong>Key Activities and Responsibilities:</strong> <ul> <li>Complete detailed, robust economic valuation models including various sensitivity analysis on potential acquisitions and commercial projects.</li><li>Prepare and present detailed financial analysis and communication materials to senior management.</li><li>Be aware of macroeconomic events and provide an analysis of the impact on IPL’s business as required.</li><li>Participate in identifying acquisition opportunities on a proactive basis and prepare detailed overview of financial and strategic rationale of each opportunity.</li><li>Assist with analytical support in various areas of the Company including Treasury, Corporate Planning and Accounting functions as required.</li> </ul> <strong>Education, Skills and Experience:</strong> <ul> <li>The individual will have at minimum 4 years’ experience with a minimum of 2-3 years related industry experience with a proven record of developing and maintaining robust financial models.</li><li>University degree in commerce (finance or accounting preferred).</li><li>Enrolment in or recent achievement of a professional designation in considered an asset (CFA, CBV, and CPA).</li><li>Strong understanding of valuation methodology along with financial statement accounts and their impact on cash flows.</li><li>Advanced Excel skills, particularly in financial and business modeling, with experience interpreting and communicating financial and business information.</li><li>Well-developed presentation, communication and interpersonal skills.</li><li>Must be able to work well in a fast-paced, growth environment.</li> </ul>
Title: Business Analyst, Corporate Development

Job_Description: Requisition Id: 15293 <br/><br/> Department: Business Development & Customer Service <br/><br/> <strong>Summary of Responsibilities</strong> <br/><br/> Working within a team environment and reporting to the Manager, Customer Service, the Analyst, Logistics will be responsible for managing product movements on Pembinas Oil Sands and Heavy Oil pipeline systems. The successful candidate will be responsible for managing product movements on a variety of Pembinas pipeline systems that may include, Heavy Oil, Synthetic Crude, Conventional Crude, Condensate and Ethane. <br/><br/> Responsibilities will include, but are not limited to: <ul> <li>Overseeing the pipeline nomination process while reviewing for accuracy, reasonability, and pipeline capacity;</li><li>Monitoring shipper receipts and deliveries versus nominations;</li><li>Communicating, developing and sustaining strong relationships with refiners, shippers, and other pipelines to ensure proper allocation of deliveries;</li><li>Balancing and reviewing shipper positions and product transfers based on actual receipts;</li><li>Preparing and reviewing monthly tariff and equalization invoices;</li><li>Monitoring petroleum qualities at receipt and delivery points as well as pipeline integrity points;</li><li>Volumetric forecasting & producer feedback;</li><li>Providing volumetric analysis reports to management including variance analysis and its impact on revenue;</li><li>Observing and reporting trends and pipeline developments on Pembinas systems;</li><li>Monthly reporting on an internal and external basis;</li><li>Analytical project support as required; and</li><li>Ability to be on call on a regular basis.</li> </ul> <strong>Qualifications</strong> <ul> <li>5+ years of Pipelines Logistics experience is required;</li><li>Experience with Heavy Oil, Synthetic Crude, Conventional Crude, Condensate and Ethane;</li><li>Bachelors Degree is an asset, but related experience will be considered;</li><li>High degree of proficiency and confidence with software applications specifically MS Excel, Word, Outlook, PowerPoint, Power BI, as well as Polaris and Petrotranz;</li><li>Highly efficient analytical skills with a strong attention to detail;</li><li>Strong problem solving skills, proactive in identifying potential issues and providing solutions</li><li>Strong time management and prioritization skills;</li><li>An energetic team player with the ability to work productively within a team environment while independently driving personal results; and proven ability to multitask while balancing deadline driven workloads;</li><li>Communication: strong verbal communication skills with the ability to conduct clear concise conversations that result in shared understanding;</li><li>Ability to be on call on a regular basis is required.</li> </ul> <strong>No agency calls please.</strong> <br/><br/> Pembina is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We are pleased to consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, protected veterans status or any other legally-protected factors.Accommodation for applicants with disabilities is available on request during the recruitment process. <br/><br/> Pembina Pipeline Corporation has been serving the transportation and midstream service needs of North America's energy industry for over 60 years. We process, terminal and transport our customers' products safely - all while protecting the environment and delivering on our commitments to our shareholders and community stakeholders. When we build something, we do it right. <br/><br/> Powering Pembina's growth are our smart, creative and energetic people who allow us to remain a disciplined and responsible energy transportation and service provider and a trusted member in our communities. <br/><br/> Our expectations are high, and so are our rewards. We treat our people well whether its through our total compensation package, our community engagement and volunteer opportunities, or our numerous fun social activities. <br/><br/> Pembina is a proud recipient of the 2018 Canadas Top 100Employers and Alberta's Top 70 Employers(2014-2017). Title: Logistics Analyst

Job_Description: <strong>Company Description</strong> <br/><br/> Gevity is an international informatics and management consulting company offering a full range of interdisciplinary professional services to clients seeking to build sustainable and effective health care and social services systems. Through our focus on the unique needs of the health care, social services and life sciences sectors, we work to support healthier lives through connected systems. <br/><br/> <strong>Position Description:</strong> <br/><br/> The senior business analyst position requires an individual who is able to collect business requirements from multiple sources, and then critically evaluate information gathered, reconcile conflicts, decompose high-level information into details, abstract up from low-level information to a general understanding, and distinguish user requests from the underlying business needs. This individual interprets business needs and translates them into application and operational requirements; collaborates with developers and subject matter experts to establish the vision and analyze trade-offs between usability and performance needs. They are the liaison between the business community, the technical solution providers and the support team. <br/><br/> <strong>Job Requirements:</strong> <br/><br/> Collection, documentation and analysis of the current state and the future state of clinical processes by means of documenting business process flows and models in collaboration with multi-disciplinary stakeholders <br/><br/> Analysis of process gaps, information flow obstacles and identification of opportunities for increased efficiency <br/><br/> Ability to document requirements in use case format and create process models using UML modeling techniques <br/><br/> Manage assigned project activities to meet the timelines, budget and stakeholder requirements set out in work breakdown structures, project schedules and other related plans (e.g. test, quality, training). <br/><br/> Reporting activity status to a management level <br/><br/> <strong>Required Skills & Experience:</strong> <br/><br/> Post-secondary education in Health Informatics, Information Management or Information Technology (or equivalent) <br/><br/> Senior Business Analysts require 7+ years of business analysis experience in the healthcare industry <br/><br/> Certification in CPHIMS preferred <br/><br/> Experience in software development lifecycle activities in an integrated technical environment <br/><br/> Strong leadership and ability to facilitate focus groups to determine requirements and priorities <br/><br/> Excellent verbal and written communication skills <br/><br/> The ability to effectively deal with remote teams and users <br/><br/> Ability to travel <br/><br/> <em>Gevity is an equal opportunity employer. Proof of credentials, as well as a criminal check, may be required for successful applicants. Resumes will be kept on file and candidates may be contacted for future opportunities.</em>
Title: Senior Business Analyst

Job_Description: <div><div><div><div><strong>Senior Business Analyst - Business Planning</strong> <br/><br/> Reference Code: 50802</div> </div></div><div><strong>Location:</strong> Canada (CA) - Calgary, AB</div> <div><strong>Job Category:</strong> Operations</div><div><strong>Employment Type:</strong> Employee Full-time</div><div><strong>Relocation Eligibility:</strong> This position is not eligible for our relocation program</div> <br/><strong>General Information</strong> <br/><br/> Reporting to the Business Planning (BP) Manager in the Canada Gas (CG) Organization, this role will support the development, coordination and reporting of business metrics and performance across Canada Gas, including generation key messages and insights, development of reports/dashboards and timely delivery of relevant information that enhances CG leadership decision making and management of the CG business. <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities</strong> <ul> <li>Partners with Leaders (includes departmental sr. leadership, directors and managers; 149+ leaders) and the BP Team to develop and/or refine business performance metrics & reporting; includes scorecards, goals and targets, risks and performance measures to aid leaders in business planning, management and performance decisions;</li><li>Establishes and enhances data infrastructure to improve reporting efficiencies and effectiveness, including centralization of data collection, automation of various reports, clear message visualization and coordination of monthly input;</li><li>Performs complex analysis and reporting of goals, status and key performance indicators (KPIs) which may include gap and trend analysis, regression analysis and financial analysis that delivers value to leadership as required;</li><li>Monitors and understands performance gaps, from planned to actual business performance, including insightful analytics and variance analysis of planned to actuals; translates into clear and succinct performance reporting for regular review meetings;</li><li>Conducts complex constraints and risk analysis and compiles information on mitigations and controls to report risk preparedness. Translates risk data into visualization and identifies performance relationships and recommendations;</li><li>Applies understanding of the data and business in reporting to create insights and key messages (the story) for leaders;</li><li>Works with the BP Manager to develop meeting materials and co-facilitate monthly/quarterly performance reviews;</li><li>Prepares and/or supports preparation of presentations for organizational alignment and awareness;</li><li>Ensures that the data feed into the performance reports are timely and accurate. Ensures data integrity;</li><li>Supports development of governance models, develops compliance reporting tools including leading development of input cadence and coordination of data collection, consolidation and reporting framework;</li><li>Develops solutions to meet varying management needs including ad-hoc analysis and reporting as required;</li><li>Supports Accounting/Finance where required with the coordinating of budget and performance data;</li><li>Works with the multi-disciplined groups including operations, projects, commercial, regulatory, “commercial services & optimization & design” (CSOD), finance and other internal business partners to frame/build analysis and reporting;</li><li>Tracks the performance of the Business Planning team within Canada Gas;</li><li>Provides facilitation and/or facilitation support for various Business Improvement programs/projects as requested;</li><li>Works with the BP Team to develop visualization dashboards for Program Management, Business Improvement and Business Learning & Capabilities portfolios;</li><li>Helps coach and train other analysts as needed for cross-functionality;</li><li>Provides systems and user interface support to leadership and business users.</li> </ul> <strong>Qualifications</strong> <ul> <li>Strong financial and quantitative analysis skills, efficient at collecting, collating, analyzing and displaying data;</li><li>High attention to detail, accuracy, and presentation while delivering work in timely manner;</li><li>Ability to research topics, research reporting solutions/alternatives and communicate findings effectively;</li><li>Ability to perform successfully in a multi-disciplined, cross functional work team environment;</li><li>Ability to coordinate multi-disciplined stakeholders and present information in a clear and succinct manner;</li><li>Self-starter/self-proficient showing strong initiative and independent judgement where required to meet tight timelines;</li><li>Strong communication and interpersonal skills with the ability to work both independently and within a dynamic TEAM.</li> </ul> <strong>Education/Experience</strong> <ul> <li>Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in relevant discipline;</li><li>Minimum of 6 or more years of industry and analyst experience, Midstream and/or Natural Gas experience is preferred;</li><li>High level of proficiency with MS Word, and MS PowerPoint, Expert proficiency in MS Excel with complex functionalities;</li><li>Power Bi experience is required;</li><li>Visualization software experience is an asset;</li><li>Previous experience of business performance management processes and reporting is an asset.</li> </ul> *Depending on the qualifications of the applicants, the successful candidate may be offered a position at a more appropriate level and/or ladder. <br/><br/> Applicants must have legal authorization to work in the country in which the position is based with no restrictions. <br/><br/> Applicants who require accommodation at any stage of the application process or if you would like additional information regarding TransCanada&apos;s accommodation policies please contact careers@transcanada.com. <br/><br/> All positions require background screening. Some include criminal and/or credit checks in order to comply with regulations. <br/><br/> <strong>Please apply to this posting by 05/17/2018.</strong> To apply, go to jobs.transcanada.com and enter reference code 50802. Only applications submitted through the TransCanada Careers website will be acknowledged. <br/><br/> TransCanada is an equal opportunity employer. <br/><br/> <strong>Make what you do matter.</strong> <br/><br/> At TransCanada we dream big, think big and do big things. For over 65 years, we&apos;ve had the vision and scale to deliver big things that matter to the world. From supplying reliable and efficient energy to millions of North Americans with our pipelines, gas storage and power generation facilities, we believe in making big things possible. <br/><br/> TransCanada is looking for people who are willing to think about the future...and think big. We&apos;re looking for people who are ready to take on the most significant challenges of their careers and define energy infrastructure in North America. <br/><br/> Thank you for choosing TransCanada in your career search.</div>
Title: Senior Business Analyst - Business Planning

Job_Description: Inter Pipeline is a major petroleum transportation, storage and natural gas liquids processing business that ranks among the largest energy infrastructure companies in Canada. We are proud to be named one of Alberta’s Top 70 Employers, which recognizes Alberta businesses that lead their industries by being exceptional places to work.<br/><br/>Located out of our Calgary office, the individual in the Senior Business Analyst role will report to the Supervisor, Finance Solutions Centre. The successful candidate will be responsible for the stewardship of finance master data and project support within SAP for Inter Pipeline, as well indirect leadership of the Business Analyst.<br/><br/><strong>Key Activities and Responsibilities:</strong> <ul> <li>Review and ongoing improvement of master data creation/change approval processes</li><li>Leadership of the Business Analyst role, utilizing a team accountability approach for facilitating finance master data creation/changes</li><li>Work with the business and SAP Competency Centre to develop Service Level Agreements (SLAs), key performance indicators (KPIs) and other metrics for SAP finance master data</li><li>Act as a data steward bringing forward cross-functional data quality and process integration issues and working collaboratively to solve them, championing the collective management of data governance</li><li>Serve as a central point of contact for finance data governance understanding and providing direction and training to data consumers and producers from the business in line with business rules</li><li>Ensure the right stakeholders across the enterprise (e.g. operations, finance, supply chain, etc.) are brought into make business process improvements which mitigate data issues</li><li>Bring best practices in master data management and propose opportunities for improvement</li><li>Interaction with SAP Competency Center on future system enhancements, builds, testing, and roll-outs</li><li>Assist with development and usage of SAP reports</li> </ul> <strong>Education, Skills and Experience:</strong> <ul> <li>Undergraduate diploma or degree in business with 5+ years of progressive experience in financial system support, CPA (CA, CMA, CGA) designation is an asset</li></ul>  <ul> <li>Strong finance expertise on master data usage, configuration, and integrated data requirements/linkage points combined with prior oil and gas experience considered an asset</li></ul>  <ul> <li>In depth knowledge of SAP FI_CO and Business Warehouse, experience with S/4HANA and Fiori an asset</li><li>Approaches work with a high level of curiosity and aptitude to identify and solve problems, takes initiative, is accountable, and works independently</li><li>Change agent who can persuade and influence stakeholders to establish new processes, shift to automation, and provide innovative solutions</li><li>Ability to manage internal and external relationships with well-developed interpersonal, team, customer service and communication skills (both written and verbal)</li><li>Strong customer service skills in working with internal departments to achieve results through relationships with people and teams</li><li>Able to work well in a fast-paced, growth environment, with strong attention to detail and accuracy</li><li>Maintains strong initiative and possesses superior analytical skills</li> </ul>
Title: Senior Business Analyst

Job_Description: <div><strong>Ceridian. Makes Work Life Better™</strong> <br/><br/> This is our promise. Not only for our customers, but our employees as well. <br/><br/> Ceridian is a cloud company powered by people. Join us as we transform the world of work for millions of employees around the world. Our products help employees be paid on time, apply for promotions, grow their careers, and support their work/life fit. Our solutions and our people work together to help organizations control costs, save time, optimize their workforce, minimize risk and grow their businesses. <br/><br/> As a software company specializing in human capital management (HCM), Ceridian has not only invested heavily in cloud software development but in its people as well. We have a variety of career growth (Top Talent, Career Pathing, Tuition Reimbursement, & Job Rotation) and Diversity/Inclusion (YOUnity and Ceridian’s Women Network) programs to support your career journey at Ceridian. <br/><br/> We are looking for fun, intelligent, team oriented people who believe in our values: Customer Focus, Transparency, Diligence, Optimism, and Agility. <br/><br/> Find out why Ceridian employees declare Ceridian a Great Place to Work® in 2017, a Glassdoor Best Places to Work in 2017, and one of Canada’s Top 100 Employers for 2017!</div> <br/>  <div><div><div><div>The <strong>Solutions Consultant</strong> drives new client acquisition and growth in our existing client base by providing pre-sales technical support to the sales team throughout the sales cycle, including identifying client needs and the facilitation of customer product/application understanding through interactive presentations, demonstrations and benchmarks. This position will support the Mid Market Sales teams.</div> <div> <strong>Essential Functions</strong></div><div>  <ul> <li>Provides technical sales support</li><li>Analyzes an organization’s existing HCM environment; proposes, and demonstrates how Ceridian’s solutions can better address their requirements and solve business concerns</li><li>Offers insight and creative solutions to best meet client’s needs</li><li>Leads and facilitates demonstrations to provide customer engagement and understanding</li><li>Participates in all aspects of the sales cycle including strategizing, developing, and presenting compelling and relevant solutions</li> <li>Contributes to the RFP and demonstration knowledge base</li><li>Shares feedback and best practices to improve the sales team’s effectiveness</li><li>Exhibits Technical Proficiency</li><li>Maintains technical and professional skills to ensure proficiency in product offerings, in depth knowledge of competition and awareness of industry developments and trends in the marketplace</li><li>Leverages technical and professional skills to increase productivity and customer satisfaction</li><li>Maintains Accurate and Timely Customer, Pipeline, and Forecast Data</li><li>Captures all relevant information in SFDC/CRM system</li><li>Follows all defined processes and timelines (SOW requirements, deal review process, price setting, service level</li><li>requirements, demo scripts, expenses, etc.)</li><li>Keeps current on Ceridian processes and any relevant changes</li></ul></div> <br/> <div> <strong>Educational/Skills/Experience Requirements</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Minimum Qualifications</strong></div><div>  <ul> <li>University/College Degree/Diploma or equivalent related work experience</li><li>At least 1-2 years experience in a technology-related role in a business environment</li><li>Excellent communication (oral & written), problem solving and organization skills</li><li>Excellent interpersonal skills, builds trust and rapport with all levels of personnel</li><li>Excellent problem solving and organization skills</li><li>Demonstrated ability to function in a fast paced, deadline driven environment</li><li>Demonstrated business acumen, high energy and integrity, sense of urgency, work ethic and drive for results</li><li>Must have a valid drivers license</li></ul></div> <br/> <div> <strong>Preferred Qualifications</strong></div><div>  <ul> <li>University Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or relevant software/computer related fields</li><li>Moderate knowledge of Human Capital solutions (Payroll, HR, Workforce Management, Talent Management) and related systems</li><li>At least 1-2 years knowledge of the concepts and principles in at least one of Ceridian’s key HCM verticals</li><li>Previous client support experience</li><li>French or Spanish Bilingual</li><li>Familiarity with Microsoft Server Technology (Windows, SQL server, etc.)</li><li>Strong time management and organizational skills with ability to prioritize work from multiple sources</li> </ul></div> </div></div></div><br/>   <div>Ceridian combines the excitement of a startup environment, with the growth opportunities of a large organization. We believe our employees should be happy and healthy, with peace of mind and a sense of fulfillment. We provide our employees with comprehensive benefits for various life circumstances and needs, great opportunities for career development, and a balanced lifestyle to achieve personal and professional success. <br/><br/> Ceridian is fueled by the diversity of our talented employees. We are an equal opportunity employer and embrace all individuals and what makes them unique. We consider all applicants, regardless of age, religion, race, color, ancestry, gender, gender identity, disability, national origin, race, sexual orientation, military or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, provincial or local laws. We enthusiastically encourage all individuals to apply for positions that fit their passions. Come join our inclusive team and start collaborating with us on award winning projects! <br/><br/> Connect with us on Twitter @CeridianCareers or Facebook CeridianCareers <br/><br/> We thank all applicants in advance for their interest in this position, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted. </div>  <br/>
Title: Solutions Consultant

Job_Description: <div>At LifeLabs, we are focused on our vision of building a healthier Canada! We are the largest community diagnostics laboratory in Canada with over 350 collection centres, 21 laboratories and service over 19 million patients each year. <br/><br/> Caring, Agile, Customer Driven, One Team - We live our values every day in what we do to help our patients and healthcare providers. With over 5,000 employees, we all make a difference and that’s why our people are so important to us. <br/><br/> This is an exciting time to join our LifeLabs team, grow your career with us and support numerous business initiatives, innovations, best practice and business development opportunities. <br/><br/> Rocky Mountain Analytical provides specialized tests to naturopathic doctors, physicians and other healthcare providers who practice integrative medicine. Rocky Mountain Analytical, a division of LifeLabs is seeking a Senior Analyst who will be integral in ensuring LifeLabs successfully achieves its growth strategies. Reporting to the Director or Manager, Business Development RMA, the Senior Analyst will support the RMA Business Development team in areas of growth strategy development and execution, project management and business development. <br/><br/> We are looking for individuals with a strong drive for change, a natural curiosity, and a passion for transforming healthcare in Canada. The role may require some travel within Canada. <br/><br/> This is a full time permanent role and will be located in our Calgary office. <br/><br/> <strong>Accountabilities:</strong>  <ul>  	<li>Conducting and facilitating internal stakeholder meetings</li> <li>Researching and synthesizing industry trends and the competitive landscape</li> <li>Conducting market research in the area of functional medicine including formal market evaluation and sizing studies</li> <li>Synthesizing all information and data into executive level reports to facilitate strategic decision making</li> <li>Supporting the development of tools and templates to help facilitate the data/information gathering and analysis process</li> <li>Becoming a subject matter expert in functional medicine testing and the functional medicine landscape overall</li> <li>Assessing/evaluating the competitive landscape relative to a particular opportunity</li> <li>Providing financial analysis, costing, and projections to internal clients to enable effective decision making and risk assessment</li> <li>Supporting the development of executive level briefing notes, updates, presentation decks and stakeholder communications</li> <li>Liaising with internal leaders to build an intimate understanding of the business and ongoing activities occurring across different functional units</li> </ul> <strong> Experience and Skills:</strong>  <ul>  	<li>Bachelor’s degree in Business, Management, Health Sciences or equivalent</li> <li>Preferred 2-3 years of experience, including 1 year recent experience in a related role; willing to look at the right new grad</li> <li>Master’s Degree in Business / Health Administration or equivalent considered an asset</li> <li>Prior knowledge and experience within the health care/life sciences industries</li> <li>Background in sciences (e.g. biology, physiology, biochemistry) an asset</li> <li>Management consulting experience considered an asset</li> <li>Proven ability to gain support for and drive organizational strategies</li> <li>Exceptional leadership and interpersonal skills with a collaborative mindset. Proven capacity to engage with diverse multidisciplinary teams (e.g., Med/Sci, Business Development, Strategy, Marketing and Sales, Client Services, Laboratory Operations, Government Relations, etc.)</li> <li>An excellent written and verbal communicator, including with senior executives</li> <li>Ability to work across multiple jurisdictions, with multiple team members in different time zones.</li> <li>High-level of adaptability, emotional intelligence, and comfort with ambiguity</li> <li>Close attention to detail, with a quality-focused mindset</li> <li>A detail and results oriented self-starter with demonstrated analytical expertise</li> <li>Proven proficiency in the Microsoft Office Suite and well developed skills in quantitative and qualitative analyses</li> <li>Demonstrated passion and enthusiasm for the healthcare and life sciences industries in Canada</li> <li>Dynamic, possessing the ability to prioritize multiple work assignments and manage time effectively</li> </ul>  </div> <br/>
