We are also a strong supporter of Skills Canada. <br/><br/> ></div>  <br/>
Title: Logistics Analyst

Job_Description: <div><div> <div>Working under the direction of the Vice President, Operations Finance, the Senior Business Analyst will perform financial and business analysis in order to provide timely, reliable and useful information to the senior operations management team in support of the achievement of operations’ goals and objectives. <br/><br/> <strong>Essential Duties and Responsibilities</strong>  <ul> <li><strong>Business Analysis</strong>   <ul>   <li>Contribute financial analysis and support as required by the senior operations management team to assist the team in making timely, fully informed business decisions;</li>  <li>Proactively identify and analyse opportunities for margin improvement; and</li>   <li>Assist in evaluation, planning and implementation of new internal business expansion opportunities.</li> </ul>  </li> </ul>    <ul> <li><strong>Purchasing</strong>   <ul>   <li>Provide project analysis and ongoing support to assist the director of purchasing in implementation and tracking of cost reduction strategies and process improvements.</li> </ul>  </li> </ul>    <ul> <li><strong>Financial Reporting, Budgets and Forecasts</strong>    <ul>   <li>Regularly review and analyse ongoing divisional financial results to assist in understanding of the results and identification of opportunities for improvement in margins and profitability;</li>  <li>Coordinate annual budget and quarterly forecast process, including maintenance of models and reports, consolidation and scheduling;</li>  <li>Review and analyse divisional annual budgets and forecast updates to identify anomalies and potential corrective actions.</li>   <li>Review monthly divisional reporting packages to ensure consistency and accuracy;</li>  <li>Maintain and prepare operational monthly and quarterly consolidated reporting package; and</li>   <li>Continuously explore opportunities for improvement in reporting and budgeting processes that result in efficiencies and improved information.</li> </ul>  </li> </ul>    <ul> <li><strong>Mergers and Acquisitions</strong>   <ul>   <li>Participate in due diligence on M&A targets; and</li>   <li>Play a key role in integration of successful acquisitions.</li>  </ul>  </li> </ul>    <ul> <li><strong>Other</strong>   <ul>   <li>Participate in evaluation and implementation of new information systems as required;</li>   <li>Assist in ensuring compliance with and development of new financial policies; and</li>  <li>Special projects as required.</li> </ul>  </li> </ul> <strong>Specific Knowledge, Skills and Abilities</strong>  <ul> <li>CPA, CFA or MBA with up to five years relevant post designation experience;</li>  <li>Expert proficiency in Excel and strong proficiency with other Microsoft Office products;</li>  <li>Experience with extracting and manipulating data from business information systems;</li>  <li>Experience with Great Plains and Management Reporter</li>  <li>Excellent analytical and problem solving skills, attention to detail;</li>  <li>Aptitude and desire to learn the business beyond accounting and the numbers;</li>   <li>Ability to liaise independently and directly in a collaborative style with the senior executive team and other disciplines and levels within the Company;</li>   <li>Strong written and verbal communication skills;</li>  <li>Ability to meet tight deadlines while maintaining a high level of detail;</li>  <li>Superior organization skills; Must be able to manage a core workload in addition to a high proportion of ad hoc projects and competing priorities; and</li>  <li>A strong work ethic and desire to succeed.</li> </ul> <strong>Special Conditions of Employment</strong>  <ul> <li>Overtime will be required based on activity levels;</li>  <li>Some travel is required in Canada, the US and possibly international</li> </ul>  </div> </div> </div><div></div>
Title: Senior Business Analyst

Job_Description: Job Description <p>Reporting to the Assistant Regional Manager for Disability Intervention Services, and associated with the Calgary Disability Management Services Office. The Rehabilitation Consultant will assess the vocational, educational, and rehabilitative needs of claimants who are disabled. You will develop and implement approved rehabilitation service delivery plans based on claimant needs and contractual provisions. This position requires an appropriate home office and travel is required. Local service handling by car or telephonically including a territory surrounding Calgary and Southern Alberta area area as well as occasional overnight travel. <strong>This is a one year term position.</strong></p> <p> </p> <p>By joining our Disability Insurance Management team, you will evolve in an environment where these values are present and you will also benefit from many advantages, such as:</p> <p> </p> <ul>  <li>37.5 hours per week with a flexible schedule</li>  <li>Comprehensive training program is provided for successful candidates</li>  <li>Excellent benefits and wellness plan</li>  <li>Pension plan</li>  <li>Competitive salary based on experience</li>  <li>Bonus structure</li>  <li>Our Disability Management office is located in Calgary’s downtown core with easy access to restaurants, a fitness centre and other amenities and is a few blocks from the C-train via the plus 15.</li> </ul> <p><strong>Accountabilities:</strong></p> <ul>  <li>Assessment of vocational rehabilitation potential and needs through file review and direct interview of individuals receiving disability benefits</li>  <li>Identifying barriers to employability, interventions to address barriers and making referral to services as necessary (disability adjustment factors; treatment; vocational assessment and training; career planning and development; job development and job search techniques; community resources)</li>  <li>Developing realistic, cost-effective rehabilitation/return-to-work plans (return to work strategies; re-training needs; coordination of rehabilitation efforts with all involved stakeholders)</li>  <li>Preparing written reports detailing finding and recommendations</li>  <li>Actively manage functional recovery and return-to-work expectations with employees, employers and care providers</li>  <li>Recording accurate billing information</li>  <li>Tracking and reporting on service-related activities and document case files electronically</li>  <li>Living our values of Customer View; Integrity; Partnership; and Communities </li> </ul> <p> <strong>Qualifications and Competencies:</strong></p> <ul>  <li>A degree in a discipline related to vocational rehabilitation or disability management, with experience in health or social sciences preferred</li>  <li>5 years of experience in insurance rehabilitation or the field of vocational rehabilitation preferred</li>  <li>Excellent communication and interpersonal skills and competency in using a laptop during claimant interview and meeting for documentation purposes.</li>  <li>Ability to accommodate a home-based office with equipment supplied by Great-West Life and the ability to problem solve technology issues with the assistance of the corporate help desk services.</li>  <li>Excel within a Purpose/Vision driven work environment</li>  <li>Valid driver’s license and vehicle are necessary due to the travel requirements </li>  <li>You will consent to a criminal background check as well as the Government of Canada enhanced security screening, the cost will be covered by Great-West Life.</li>  <li>Bilingual an asset (English/French)</li>  <li>Mental Health and Disability experience an asset</li>  <li>You will consent to a criminal background check as well as the Government of Canada enhanced security screening, the cost will be covered by Great-West Life</li> </ul> <p><strong>Discover your opportunity….</strong><strong>Apply today!</strong></p> <p> </p> <p>Great-West Life offers competitive compensation, great benefits such as medical, dental, life insurance, wellness account and personal days. If you’d like to join our team submit your information online and introduce yourself.</p> <p> </p> <p><em>Together Great-West Life, London Life and Canada Life serve the financial security needs of more than 13 million people across Canada, with additional operations in Europe and the United States. As members of the Power Financial Corporation group of companies, we’re one of Canada’s leading insurers with interests in life insurance, health insurance, investment and retirement savings. We offer a broad portfolio of financial and benefit plan solutions for individuals, families, businesses and organizations.</em></p> <p> </p> <p><em>We are committed to providing an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of the communities in which we live, and to creating an environment where every employee has the opportunity to reach their potential.</em></p> <p> </p> <p> </p> <p><strong><em>Great-West Lifeco would like to thank all applicants, however only those who qualify for an interview will be contacted.</em></strong></p> <p>*LI-KS1</p>
Title: Rehabilitation Consultant

Job_Description: <strong>Business Development, Analyst</strong><br/><br/>We're looking to groom our next top producer! You'll be working with a high performing team focused on client service and innovation.<br/><br/><strong>WHAT'S THE BIG IDEA?</strong><br/><br/>Our team at Calvert continues to produce great results in the rapidly expanding private mortgage lending industry. A successful applicant will be immersed in our underwriting team learning how to value property and make mortgage lending decisions. You will be working in a collaborative and caring culture and provided the tools and support for you to succeed with the goal of producing over $20,000,000 in funded mortgages annually<br/><br/><strong>WHAT YOU'LL BE DOING?</strong> <br/>  <strong>Business Development</strong><br/><br/>Be actively engaged in industry leading initiatives including: securities compliance, mortgage rule changes, industry advocacy on provincial and federal initiatives, income tax act changes, real estate act changes and many other issues that impact the real estate, mortgage brokering and private mortgage lending business. <ul> <li>Community involvement that heightens Calvert's brand awareness in our industry and community by attending local events and participating in marketing and outreach activities. Grow your network to create lasting connections that will generate future opportunities</li><li>Leverage customer relationship management tools to keep client files updated, and the team on the same page</li> </ul>  <strong>Real Estate Valuations and Appraisals</strong><br/><br/>Offering the best solution is highly dependent on the analysis of each individual loan application and their property security. <ul> <li>Review mortgage applications to determine needs, business plans, current financial situation, credit history, credit worthiness, and mortgage risk profile</li><li>Inspect and value real estate, identify potential risks and analyze the real estate market and local economic conditions</li><li>Organize and summarize this information in a way that will serve Calvert's goal of unprecedented speed without ever sacrificing accuracy</li> </ul>  <strong>Client Engagement</strong><br/><br/>As an organization, we aim to be trusted advisors, offering an effortless experience in providing short term lending solutions for the personal and financial success of those who we work with. It is vital to know our clients. We listen and focus on each client experience to make every interaction meaningful. <ul> <li>Partner with brokers, or borrowers, discussing financing options, providing a proposal for their financing requirements. Preparing letters of interest, commitments, and release for funding</li><li>A demonstrated thoroughness and attention to detail as well as the ability to prioritize tasks and work on multiple assignments in a team environment</li><li>Exceptional communication skills, both written and oral, in front of a variety of internal and external audiences</li> </ul>  <strong>WHAT CAN WE OFFER YOU</strong><br/><br/>An opportunity to be a part of culture committed to truly making a difference int he personal and financial success of others. We are a grounded and family-oriented workplace and equitable employer.<br/><br/>Compensation and Benefits  <ul> <li>Competitive salary, plus bonus potential</li><li>Opportunity for share ownership</li> <li>Health spending accounts and/or benefits</li> <li>We'll financially contribute to "bucket list" experiences or achievements that a person hopes to have or accomplish</li> </ul>
Title: Business Development, Analyst

Job_Description: At MNP we pride ourselves on being different – it’s our entrepreneurial drive that sets us apart. It’s the same drive that’s helped us become Canada’s fastest growing national firm. We foster collaboration, value your ideas, promote based on talent, live balanced lifestyles and make time for FUN. We are one firm, one team, collaborating to support you wherever you want to take your career. <br/><br/> Join the momentum. We are seeking an Analyst for our growing Technology Consulting team. Driving business excellence, MNP is a leading national accounting, tax and business consulting firm in Canada. Our Consulting team works with organizations in the public, private and not-for-profit sectors to provide innovative strategies tailored to maximize efficiencies, enhance performance and increase profitability. Specifically, our recognized Technology Consulting team works with clients to translate technology issues and opportunities into meaningful results that meet organizational needs. <br/><br/> <strong>Performance Expectations</strong> <ul> <li><div>Facilitate and run effective meetings</div></li><li><div>Requirement elicitation from stakeholders via workshops</div></li><li><div>Business process modeling of the current and to-be state</div></li><li><div>Requirement analysis, defining all types of requirements to define the business need</div></li><li><div>Requirements management and prioritization</div></li><li><div>Organize and coordinate stakeholder engagement</div></li><li><div>System integration analysis, including creating system interface specifications</div></li><li><div>Data analysis and design, creating logical data models and specifying lookups</div></li><li><div>Solution design and prototyping; creating user interface specifications</div></li><li><div>Be familiar with standard BA techniques as defined in the BABOK</div></li><li><div>Engage business stakeholders and write formal documentation such as business cases, proposals, requirements definition specifications, project glossaries, non-functional requirements specifications and communication plans</div></li><li><div>Engage developers and solution implementer and write formal technical documentation such as request for proposals (RFP), test cases, technical specifications and technical models</div></li> </ul> <strong>Credentials</strong> <ul> <li><div>Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Commerce or equivalent</div></li><li><div>A minimum of 3 years’ experience in business analysis in an enterprise environment</div></li><li><div>Expert-level knowledge in the Business Analysis or Systems Analysis subject area</div></li><li><div>Working understanding of enterprise system infrastructure</div></li><li><div>Working understanding of enterprise analysis processes and documentation requirements for improving an organization’s processes and/or procedures</div></li><li><div>Microsoft Office tools including: Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Visio, MS Project considered an asset</div></li><li><div>Image editing software (i.e. GIMP, Snag It, etc.)</div></li><li><div>Using business process modelling and diagramming techniques such as BPMN</div></li><li><div>Using the Unified Modeling Language (UML) to generate specifications</div></li><li><div>Familiar with standard BA techniques as defined in the BABOK</div></li><li><div>ERP implementation experience considered an asset</div></li><li><div>Experience with IT Frameworks, i.e. ITIL, COBIT, etc. considered an asset</div></li> </ul> <strong>Core Competencies and Personal Characteristics</strong> <ul> <li><div><strong>Integrity</strong> – professional whose honesty, integrity, confidentiality and high ethical standards contributes to effective leadership and optimal business relationships</div></li><li><div><strong>Energy</strong> – displays enthusiasm, optimism, drive and passion while maintaining a high level of productivity and a balanced lifestyle</div></li><li><div><strong>Diversity</strong> – understands the importance of different backgrounds, perspectives and experiences and is respectful of individual differences</div></li><li><div><strong>Communication</strong> – effectively expresses ideas and conveys information in business writing, conversations and interactions with others</div></li><li><div><strong>Client Service Excellence</strong> – understands the importance of quality client service by being courteous, responding to client requests in a timely manner and monitoring satisfaction</div></li><li><div><strong>Teamwork & Relationship Development</strong> – works collaboratively with team members in order to achieve a common goal and develops, maintains and strengthens relationships with others, both inside and outside the Firm</div></li><li><div><strong>Accountability</strong> – takes responsibility for one’s own performance by setting clear goals and tracking progress against those goals; is highly organized and uses personal judgement and decision making</div></li><li><div><strong>Flexibility</strong> – effectively manages multiple assignments, adapts to changing priorities and is able to work independently or as part of a team</div></li><li><div><strong>Work Ethic</strong> – consistently performs to high quality standards, is dependable and has a constant drive to improve</div></li> </ul> MNP encourages a balanced lifestyle and offers benefits that suit the way our team members work and play! In addition to a competitive salary, our total rewards package includes paid personal days, wellness program initiatives, health and dental benefits, a group pension plan with matching contribution, firm sponsored social events and professional development assistance. <br/><br/> MNP proudly serves and responds to the needs of our clients in the public, private and not-for-profit sectors. Through partner-led engagements, we provide a collaborative, cost-effective approach to doing business, with innovative strategies to help organizations succeed across the country and around the world.
Title: Analyst, Technology Consulting

Job_Description: <div><div> <p><strong>YOUR OPPORTUNITY:</strong><br> The Information Systems(IS) Energy Conponents Developer Analyst is responsible for the analysis, design and building of systems through the development of application logic, user interfaces, data interfaces, data conversion scripts and reports. An IS Developer Analyst works under the guidance and direction of IS Business Systems Analyst to support the portfolio of applications for Field Data Reporting, Property Accounting and Marketing.<br>  <br> <strong>COMPETITIVE SALARY - STOCK OPTIONS - STOCK SAVINGS PLAN - ANNUAL BONUSES – BENEFITS!</strong><br>  <br> <strong>HOW WILL YOU MAKE YOUR MARK?</strong><br> • Participate in supporting and enhancing the portfolio of applications for Field Data Reporting<br> • Analyzing, designing and developing applications<br> • Developing and maintaining functional/technical specifications and documentation<br> • Troubleshooting problems that occur in the everyday use of applications<br> • Fixing program bugs and/or data errors identified during troubleshooting<br> • Manage multiple tasks at the same time with high levels of effectiveness<br> • Demonstrate the ability to handle complex work<br>  <br> <strong>QUALIFICATIONS: </strong><br> • 5 – 10 years of experience as a Developer Analyst working with Field Data Capture applications preferably using Energy Components and PM Suite.<br> • Technical experience supporting EC Architecture including Configurations, Integration Services and Jasper Reporting. Experience with PI and Honeywell historians.<br> • Highly developed analytical skills<br> • Excellent interpersonal, team and communication skills<br> • Strong multi-tasking and prioritizing abilities<br> • A post-secondary degree in Computer Science or a related field of study<br> • Demonstrated proficiency in N-tier application analysis, design and development using Java Enterprise, JBoss/Wildfly, Eclipse, TFS, Microsoft VB.NET/ASP.Net, Web Services/APIs<br> • Experience supporting 3rd party applications on Windows, Linux and Unix<br> • Experience with Oracle SQL and Oracle PL/SQL, MSRS, MS Orchestrator</p>  <p>To see related Information Technology roles at CNRL, visit: <u>www.cnrl-careers.com/jobs/Information-Technology</u></p>  <p><strong>About Canadian Natural</strong><br> At Canadian Natural, we strive to live through our mission statement: "To develop people to work together to create value for the Company's shareholders by doing it right with fun and integrity." As a leading oil and gas producer, our diverse combination of assets include light oil, heavy oil, in situ oil sands production, oil sands mining and upgrading facilities, and natural gas. At Canadian Natural, safety is a core value. We conduct all of our operations in a way that identifies, minimizes and mitigates harm to the health and safety of employees, contractors, the public and the environment.</p>  <p>Canadian Natural Resources Limited - CNRL - is a publicly traded company on the TSX and NYSE as CNQ.</p> </div></div><div><div> <br></div></div>
Title: Energy Components Developer Analyst

Job_Description: <div>Tervita is a leading environmental solutions provider. Our integrated earth, water, waste and resource solutions deliver safe and efficient results through all phases of a project by minimizing impact, maximizing returns.™ Our dedicated employees are trusted sustainability partners to oil and gas, construction, mining, government and communities. Safety is our highest priority: it influences our actions and shapes our culture. <br/><br/> <strong>Why Work for Tervita?</strong>  <ul>  	<li>Competitive wages and comprehensive benefit plan</li> <li>Opportunities for career growth</li> <li>Industry - leading experience</li> <li>A culture that puts safety first</li> </ul> <strong><u>Position Summary:</u> </strong> <br/><br/> Reporting to the Manager of Commercial, the Business Analyst role is responsible for tactical and strategic pricing, within a particular portfolio of business. Based in the corporate head office in Calgary, AB, the successful candidate will be responsible for a broad range of activities focused on managing the price program (pricing/market analysis) for their area of responsibility. <br/><br/> <strong><u>Key Responsibilities:</u></strong>  <ul>  	<li>Manage annual price program, including Price Book adjustments aligned to corporate strategy, market/competitive dynamics and yield initiatives, within assigned area of responsibility, which will be a specific region.</li> <li>Manage the Contract Renewal Process in support of Sales, as defined in the Contract Renewal Process, providing contract analytics, and recommendations on price targets, trade space evaluation, competitive dynamics, overall contract strategy, and alignment to corporate strategy and objectives.</li>   <li>Manage the Published Book Rate and Market rates pricing.</li> <li>Understand market dynamics for a specific sales region and provide analytical support for business case development.</li> <li>Track, monitor, and evaluate the impact of pricing actions implemented; report results and provide market implications to management.</li> <li>Support the Revenue planning and Forecast Process.</li> <li>Provide analytics and pricing recommendations on day-to-day tactical pricing opportunities.</li> <li>Support implementation of Salesforce Price Engine as needed, as well as maintain prices in Salesforce Price Engine, including book rates, discount structures and reporting.</li> <li>Drive annual targets on market share, pricing, commitments and margin enhancement targets throughout range of pricing recommendations, by managing their pricing portfolio as a whole and developing a thorough understanding of market dynamics.</li> <li>Drive implementation and execution of Campaigns with Sales and Operations.</li> <li>Support the sales team as an expert on commercial processes, as well as providing various analytical reports such as sales self-serve tools.</li> <li>Assist with QFAIM Pricing Process as needed.</li> <li>Communicate regularly with various stakeholders, including all members of Sales, Operation and Business development.</li> <li>Deliver advanced level of pricing analytics by statistically analyzing sales, pricing and market data</li> <li>Utilize tools such as Excel, Word, Powerpoint, QFAIM, Geoscout, etc, in order to provide recommendations to various stakeholders, such Sales, Operations and Commercial leadership as needed.</li> </ul> <strong><u>Qualifications:</u></strong>  <ul>  	<li>University Degree or Diploma is required (preferably in Commerce, Business, Economics, Sociology, Mathematics, or something similar).</li> <li>Minimum 3-5 years of experience (either within the industry or in other industries but with a focus in any of Marketing, Pricing, Yield, Planning, or Sales experience. Preference may be given to those with specific Pricing related experience).</li> <li>Very strong analytical and problem solving skills, including excellent MS Excel (especially with data modeling experience).</li> <li>Demonstrated experience in delivering results, managing internal expectations, using initiative and innovation for solving problems, and challenging the status quo.</li> <li>Strong analytical and problem-solving skills</li> <li>Highly self-motivated and directed and keen attention to detail.</li> <li>Proven analytical and problem-solving capabilities.</li> <li>Ability to multi-task in a fast-paced environment, manage multiple priorities and make ongoing decisions</li> <li>Work effectively in situations involving rapid change, shifting priorities and multiple projects.</li> </ul> Tervita Corporation is an Equal Opportunity Employer and considers applicants for all positions without regard to race, color, creed, religion, ancestry, national origin, age, gender/sex, marital status, sexual orientation, physical or mental disability, military/veteran status, citizenship status, the basis of genetic information or any other group protected by Federal or Provincial law or local ordinance. <br/><br/> Applicants who are extended an employment offer will be required to complete a pre-employment check. All employment offers are contingent upon the successful completion of this pre-employment process.</div> <br/>
Title: Business Analyst - Commercial (Maternity Leave)

Job_Description: Use Your Experience To Help Businesses Grow! <br/><br/> This position will analyze the data gathered through ESS Business Survey and consult with individual clients and recommend ESS services that would benefit their business. <br/><br/> This position requires 10 years of executive, sales or business ownership experience, analytical skills and the ability to communicate effectively with business owners, senior management and boards of directors. Ideal candidates for this position are individuals who have previously owned their own businesses and/or have held upper management positions for a minimum of five years. This is a full time employee position. A four-year degree is strongly preferred but we will consider candidates with strong business experience. 75%-90% travel-home on weekends. <br/><br/> ESS offers a comprehensive training program and corporate support. This is not a salaried position- this is a fully commissioned employee position with the average first year in the low six figures and higher thereafter. <br/><br/> ESS is the largest full-service business development firm serving small to mid-sized businesses throughout Canada. Through the coordinated efforts of ESS corporate headquarters and field service personnel; ESS installs proven methods, systems, controls and incentives to enable business owners and their managers to maintain positive cash flow, control costs, and accelerate the growth of their companies. <br/><br/> As an ESS Senior Business Analyst, you will analyze small to medium-sized businesses; determine the financial impact of ownership decision-making, corporate structure, business planning and industry benchmarking. At the conclusion of the analysis, the Business Analyst and the client will decide if it makes sense to move into the implementation phase, utilizing the resources of ESS Consulting Services Division. Analysts are given the tools and trained in the skills necessary to accomplish this task. However, successful analysts have attributes that cannot be taught. They are strong, dynamic, confident teachers, communicators and leaders with exceptional understanding and empathy. <br/><br/> Qualified Candidates Please Forward Resume <br/><br/> Equal Opportunity Employer <br/><br/> Candidate must be a Canadian citizen
Title: Management Consulting-Business Analyst

Job_Description: Healthcare Business Intelligence Analyst <br/><br/> Gevity Consulting Inc. is looking for a Business Intelligence Analyst with experience in data capture, information management, reporting, and analytics in a healthcare setting. Through this exciting position, you will have the opportunity to lead and work collaboratively on innovative business intelligence projects for healthcare organizations across Canada and internationally. If you are driven, enjoy working at the forefront of industry trends and are passionate about improving healthcare, please apply. <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities</strong> <br/><br/> Lead and/or partner with clients in planning, designing, implementing, optimizing, administering, and evaluating BI solutions, including databases, data lakes, data warehouses, big data solutions, open data, queries, reports, dashboards, and other visualizations based on stakeholders’ needs; <br/> Develop BI strategy and roadmaps to enable organizations to leverage data, information and knowledge assets; <br/> Leverage healthcare business and statistical knowledge to transform data into information; <br/> Elicit, document, and confirm business requirements and technical specifications; <br/> Define standards for the integration and governance of enterprise data; <br/> Design ETL and metadata management programs and scripts; <br/> Define and evaluate conceptual, logical, and physical BI solution architectures; <br/> Design healthcare business information structures (cubes, dimensions, facts, tables, etc.); <br/> Perform data quality assessments, data transformation, and data cleansing; <br/> Develop test scripts and perform testing of BI solutions; <br/> Provide BI guidance and training to a variety of stakeholders, including clinicians, technical analysts, administrators, and executives; <br/> Create articles, news items and thought leadership through webinars, blog postings and the like; <br/> Network with clients and associates to identify new business opportunities; and <br/> Mentor and coach clients and Gevity team members on BI knowledge and skills. <br/><br/> Required Skills/Qualifications <br/><br/> 3+ years’ experience in the health sector; <br/> Knowledge of Health IT architecture as well as national and international standards; <br/> Experience confirming clinical and business requirements from a broad community of stakeholders; <br/> 3+ years’ experience in the design, development and management of databases, data warehouses, data lakes, reports, dashboards and other forms of visualizations; <br/> Demonstrable experience with a wide variety of BI tooling, including: Tableau, Microsoft Power BI, Information Builders; Quilk, IBM Cognos, SAP, MicroStrategy, Sisense, Salesforce, etc.; <br/> Knowledge and experience with statistical applications, such as SAS, R, GNU Octave andPSPP; <br/> Knowledge and experience with Big Data solutions, such as Hadoop, Spark and NiFi; <br/> Knowledge and experience with Oracle & MS SQL server database design and implementation; <br/> Ability to write advanced SQL queries; <br/> Proficient with the Microsoft Office suite of tools (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Project); <br/> Effective verbal and written communication skills; <br/> Demonstrated leadership and people management skills; <br/> Ability to work both independently and collaboratively with consultants, clients and third parties; <br/> Demonstrable organizational, analytical and innovative thinking skills; <br/> Excellent interpersonal and facilitation skills; and <br/> Strong time management skills (ability to simultaneously manage multiple tasks and projects). <br/><br/> Desired Skills/Qualifications <br/><br/> Experience in facilitating workshops with diverse groups of stakeholders (e.g. technical, clinical, executive); <br/> Proficient public speaker; <br/> Experience leading project teams; <br/> Experience evaluating design options to support the implementation of a system; <br/> Familiarity with multiple provincial or international healthcare systems; <br/> Familiar with traditional and agile project delivery methods; <br/><br/> Travel Requirements <br/><br/> This role will require the ability and willingness to travel across Canada and internationally. Travel duration will depend on the type of client engagement. On-site assignments and projects vary from days to months with the potential for extension.
Title: Health Care Business Intelligence Analyst

Job_Description: The incumbent is accountable to ensure that sales and margin are accurately planned, forecasted and analyzed as well as providing analytical support for strategic initiatives or operational efficiencies. <br/><br/> The suitable candidate will have strong background in performing business analytics with exposure to working and reconciling financial and business information systems. The incumbent will play a key role in understanding system integration, corporate strategy and sales drivers and will provide key insights into the financial performance of the company. During the monthly, quarterly and annual reporting cycle, the incumbent will be responsible to ensure that relevant analysis and reports are prepared to support various levels of reviews and presentations for senior stakeholders both internally and externally. This role will regularly collaborate with stakeholders across the organization to drive financial results. <br/><br/> Responsibilities <br/><br/> Accountable for retail banner financial planning, analysis, forecasting and reporting; brick & mortar and eCommerce aspects <br/><br/> Build and complete financial models with the purpose of analyzing bricks & mortar and eCommerce business unit performance <br/><br/> Thorough analysis and investigation into the variances to plan and forecast <br/><br/> Support business colleagues with financial analysis focused on forward looking financial results <br/><br/> Participate in planning meetings with business colleagues to support ongoing business initiatives <br/><br/> Partner and influence the Senior Management team to ensure that the plan is realistic and executable <br/><br/> Lead and participate in analytics projects with a focus on strategic imperatives; assess strategic alternatives and lead change and process design in the business. <br/><br/> Assess and identify areas of opportunities within the business for operational efficiencies with a requirement to analyse and implement change. <br/><br/> Who you are <br/><br/> We are looking for high performing individuals who are: <br/><br/> Agile and innovative individuals, who are able to manage in an environment of change and ambiguity to help us take bold and strategic moves in this rapidly evolving retail environment <br/><br/> Creative thinkers who take initiative and are capable of building, launching and managing projects/programs that drive results for our customers <br/><br/> Problem solvers with the ability to analyze and prioritize to meet business objectives <br/><br/> Collaborative team players with superior influencing skills, who build relationships easily across various stakeholder groups to move initiatives forward <br/><br/> If you’re curious, ready to take on new challenges and open to doing things differently to help us evolve rapidly, then Canadian Tire is definitely the place to be. <br/><br/> What you’ve done <br/><br/> Professional accounting designation (CPA, CMA, CGA, CA). <br/><br/> Minimum of six (6) years progressive experience in business or financial analytical role with at least two (2) years post designation <br/><br/> Demonstrated experience with sales and revenue planning or accounting in a large organization <br/><br/> Strong technical and accounting knowledge as well as superior analytical skills <br/><br/> Advanced MS Excel and PowerPoint skills <br/><br/> Experience with large financial systems (ERP or other) and Hyperion (Planning and HFM) preferred <br/><br/> Demonstrated ability to independently plan, prioritize and coordinate activities to consistently meet deadlines <br/><br/> Ability to clearly and confidently communicate written and verbal recommendations, as well as, articulate trade-offs <br/><br/> Ability to influence and persuade different points of view <br/><br/> Strong time management and self-management skills
Title: Senior Financial Analyst

Job_Description: Data & Business Insights Analysts <br/><br/> <STRONG>What you’ll do</STRONG> <br/><br/> In support of Operational Excellence, the Data & Business Insights Analysts <br/><br/> will be responsible for interpreting cleansed, mined data into a consumable format for the business. They will leverage discovered patterns and insights into actionable intelligence that can be clearly communicated to all levels of the organization’s leadership structure to aid in the overall corporate strategy. <br/><br/> Reporting to the AVP, Business Intelligence & Data Analytics, this position will work with all business units across the FGL banner to provide analytical interpretation; analysis, presented recommendations and consultative services to assist with new initiatives, day to day business, or to solve pressing business problems. The Business Intelligence group will also work to provide ad-hoc data when that data is not accessible by the business. <br/><br/> Responsibilities  <ul> <li>Support the business with a full analytical services offering. Including developing operational reporting and executive dashboards, providing analysis, conclusions and recommendations for the business   <li>Support of any departmental analytical team with augmented analysis and consultation for their new initiatives, day to day business and problem solving   <li>Present findings to all levels of the organization’s leadership in an understandable and compelling manner   <li>Take an active role in understanding the each department’s activities and strategies to gain a deeper understanding of the business   <li>Optimize tasks to increase efficiency and accuracy, include driving the design of automation for the business.   <li>Champion the Data Science capabilities and service offerings within the organization   <li>Support the business with ad-hoc data requests to help them answer questions or to satisfy audit requirements.</LI> </ul> <STRONG>What you bring…</STRONG>  <ul> <li>5 years of experience in a retail analytics or corporate retail environment.   <li>Proficient with statistical methods and mathematical techniques including predictive modeling, regression, AB testing, cluster analysis, etc.   <li>Ability to formulate or quickly understand business problems, find patterns and insights within structured and unstructured data.   <li>Ability to clearly communicate results to technical and non-technical audiences.   <li>Demonstrated experience in exploratory data analysis and data mining process of large, complex data sets (i.e. “Big Data”)   <li>Comfort manipulating and analyzing complex, high-volume, high-dimensionality data from varying sources   <li>Hands-on experience using business intelligence and statistical analysis tools such as R, Cognos, Micro Strategy, etc.   <li>Familiarity with relational databases and SQL   <li>Have a good eye for and an understanding of visual report design principles   <li>Ability to execute multiple projects and drive key business results under tight deadlines.   <li>Self-starter attitude with willingness to learn and master new technologies   <li>Ability to work independently and in an ambiguous environment</LI> </ul>
Title: Data & Business Insights Analyst - FGL Sports

Job_Description: <strong>Position Title: Credit Analyst (12 Month Term)</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Team and Location: Corporate Adjudication– Calgary, AB</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Company Profile:</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Parkland is unique</strong>. We fuel communities by safely delivering high-quality petroleum products to motorists, businesses, consumers and wholesale customers across North America. Through unrivaled dependability and service, we connect communities to the products they need to heat their homes, fuel their industries and drive their economies. <br/><br/> <strong>Parkland is strong</strong>. We are one of North America’s fastest growing and largest independent distributors and marketers of fuels and lubricants. Our family includes Bluewave Energy, Columbia Fuels, Elbow River Marketing, Island Petroleum, Fas Gas Plus, Farstad Oil, Les Pétroles Parkland, Pioneer Energy, Sparlings, Superpumper Inc. and the Ultramar Brand. <br/><br/> <strong>Parkland is growing</strong>. Our organization is powered by effective leadership, progressive strategies and industry-leading best practices— but more importantly, it is driven by talented, customer-focused people who value integrity, innovation and quality. We are looking for good-natured, hard-working candidates who want to build a rewarding career in a dynamic and collaborative work environment. We are a family and our family continues to grow. <br/><br/> <strong>Position Summary:</strong> <br/><br/> Reporting to the Manager, Adjudication and Credit Risk, the Credit Analyst will be responsible for effectively managing the exposure and risk associated with the Accounts Receivable portfolio which is comprised of both residential and commercial clients. This position is for a 12 month term. <br/><br/> <strong>Key Responsibilities:</strong> <ul> <li>Receive and process residential and commercial credit applications and credit limit reviews from branch locations Canada wide</li><li>Gather credit information from various external sources such as Credit Reporting Agencies, Bank References, internet sites, and financial statement analysis</li><li>Interpret the compiled information to complete a credit risk assessment and assign a limit, balancing the client’s requirements with that of their credit worthiness.</li><li>Develop and maintain a strong supportive relationship with both branch personnel and sales team.</li><li>When warranted, will be required to deal directly with client</li> </ul> <strong>Qualifications and Skills</strong>: <ul> <li>University Degree in Business or Finance</li><li>5 years previous credit/collections experience within a Commercial and/or Retail environment</li><li>Members of the Credit Institute of Canada will be preferred</li><li>Strong problem solving and analytical skills</li><li>Excellent computer skills, specifically with Microsoft Excel</li><li>Customer Service oriented</li><li>Ability to multi-task</li><li>Detail oriented</li><li>Team player</li><li>Ability to accept and adapt to change</li> </ul> Our main priority at Parkland is our people. As an employee, you can expect a fair workplace, a professional work environment, competitive compensation, outstanding benefits, and a share in our success through the Employee Share Purchase Plan and our Annual Incentive Plan. <br/><br/> Our preferred method of application is online at www.parkland.ca <br/><br/> We thank all candidates in advance for their interest, however only those being considered will be contacted. <br/><br/> <strong>Parkland Fuel Corporation is committed to the principles of Employment Equity.</strong> <br/><br/> We strive to provide accessibility in employment to ensure equal access to employment opportunities for candidates, including persons with disabilities. Parkland Fuel Corporation will endeavour to provide accommodation to persons with disabilities in the recruitment process upon request. If you are selected for an interview and you require accommodation due to a disability, please notify us upon scheduling your interview.
Title: Credit Analyst

Job_Description: <div><p><strong>LOCATION:</strong> Calgary, Alberta (CA-AB)<br><strong>JOB NUMBER: </strong>22482<br> </p><p><strong>Job Overview</strong></p><p>Reporting to the manager, treasury operations, you will be required to carry out daily treasury activities in a timely and accurate manner. You will also provide coverage for other treasury analysts by cross-training on all aspects of the team operations.</p><p><strong>Key Accountabilities</strong></p><ul><li>Prepare confirmations and settlements of various treasury transactions</li><li>Create the payment template and ad-hoc payment requests</li><li>Manage the setup of approved users' roles, functions and account access in the financial institution’s online systems</li><li>Maintain all treasury system master data</li><li>Prepare monthly treasury reporting for internal stakeholders</li><li>Facilitate business unit inquiries on treasury related transactions</li><li>Develop, document and maintain end-to-end procedural documents</li><li>Collaborate and cross-train with other team members</li><li>Assist with ad hoc projects and with identifying and developing continuous business improvement opportunities</li><li>Research and identify alternative solutions with a focus on technology-based solutions</li></ul><p><strong>Required Qualifications</strong></p><p>Experience and Education</p><ul><li>Minimum of three years of experience in accounting, finance or equivalent education and experience</li><li>University degree, preferably in accounting or finance</li><li>Registered in a professional designation program such (CFA, CPA or CTP), preferred</li></ul><p>Skills and Knowledge</p><ul><li>Strong Microsoft Office skills</li><li>Proficiency with SAP is preferred</li><li>The ability to work toward multiple deadlines and capable of working in a dynamic, fast-paced environment with the ability to manage change</li></ul><ul><li>A willingness to learn new skills and flexibility to work both independently and in a team environment</li><li>You are a self starter and problem solver, utilizing practiced analytical skills and detail orientation </li><li>Ability to approach situations with an attitude of continuous improvement</li><li>You constantly ask what could go wrong and check for out-of-the-ordinary conditions and learn to anticipate potential problems</li></ul><p><strong>Working Conditions</strong></p><ul><li>This position is located in Calgary, Alberta at the Suncor Energy Centre</li></ul><p><strong>Why Suncor</strong><br>Go ahead. Expect growth. We want you to have a job you&apos;re genuinely excited about - as well as opportunities to learn and challenge yourself or mentor others. Plus, Suncor Energy offers a flexible employee package that can be adjusted to suit the changing needs of your life, including:</p><ul><li>Competitive base salary and compensation programs</li><li>Attractive annual incentive program</li><li>Flexible benefits package</li><li>Rewarding pension and savings plans</li></ul><p>Our mission to create energy for a better world begins with caring about the communities we live and work in, while responding to your interests and concerns. Read our Suncor Connections newsletter to see how we&apos;re living up to our commitment to keeping you informed.</p><p><strong>Business Overview</strong><br>Suncor Energy is Canada&apos;s energy company - meaning rewarding opportunities for you to apply your knowledge, contribute and grow in a variety of career-building positions. Our business portfolio spans the entire energy sector, from a leadership position in oil sands development, to refining and marketing operations, natural gas, and conventional oil production, internationally and offshore East Coast Canada.</p><p>And while we are working to responsibly develop petroleum resources and contribute to the communities where we live and work, we are also developing our renewable energy portfolio, which includes wind power and biofuels.</p><p>As part of Suncor&apos;s team, you&apos;ll contribute to the ongoing success of Canada&apos;s largest energy company - one with a solid track record of growth, a focus on safety and sustainability and tremendous potential for the future. And you&apos;ll have the opportunity to learn from experts in the industry and build on your skills every day.</p><p>Suncor promotes diversity and inclusion in the workplace. Suncor is an equal opportunity employer and encourages applications from all qualified individuals. Suncor is committed to accessibility and accommodations will be provided to applicants upon request. At Suncor, we are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of the communities in which we live, and where every team member has the opportunity to reach their full potential.</p><p>Not sure if this particular listing is the right opportunity for you? Please join our Talent Community at www.suncor.com and click on Careers, or follow us on LinkedIn, Facebook and Twitter for the latest job listings and employment news.</p><p><strong>Please note that our job postings are typically open for two weeks, so if you are interested and qualified, apply now.</strong></p><p>JOB CATEGORY: Business Professionals</p></div>
Title: Analyst, Treasury

Job_Description: <strong>We are an experience design agency with a relentless focus on the customer.</strong> <br/><br/> The way a customer experiences a brand has a profound impact on perception, purchase behavior and loyalty. Thats why our work begins and ends with our clients customers. We listen to them. Validate with them. We even include them in our design process. By creating customer experiences that are simple, valuable, entertaining, and convenient, we deliver measurable results for some of the worlds most admired brands. <br/><br/> <strong>Today were 950 people in 11 offices on 4 continents.</strong> <br/><br/> We are thinkers. Makers. Doers. We speak a dozen different languages and are inspired by a million different things. But no matter what our discipline is or where we are in the world, were united by a common excitement for digital thats absolute and contagious. <br/><br/> <strong>MARKETING SCIENCE ANALYST</strong> <br/><br/> The primary role of an analyst is to support the day-to-day work with supervision from a manager. This requires solid contribution to at least two (2) of the five (5) sub-disciplines (tracking and measurement, data visualization, testing and evaluation, data integration and statistical modeling.) This position should have an understanding of how at least one of the other sub-disciplines fits into clients business and should continue to learn and develop in the other areas. The analyst will work closely with a manager that will have more experience to train him/her on daily work responsibilities, teach project delivery, and explain other sub-disciplines in Marketing Science. <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities:</strong>  <ul> <li>Constant curiosity for what the data means and where it fits into the clients' business</li> <li>Well organized approach to a variety of project work</li> <li>Detailed-oriented work style</li> <li>Strong time management skills to ensure accurate delivery</li> <li>Good communication skills with Marketing Science team members as well as across other disciplines</li> <li>Logical approach to analysis process that demonstrates how data lead to conclusions</li> <li>Consistent drive for collaboration with others to provide support, share skills, and learn more</li> </ul> <strong>Requirements:</strong>  <ul> <li>Strong attention to detail, organizational skills, and time management is key</li> <li>Top notch communication and collaboration skills are also key to success in the analyst role</li> <li>Expectations Management: a successful analyst will communicate quickly and accurately about delivery and delay, and follow up</li> <li>Intellectual Curiosity: analyst should ask the next question, and understand where our work fits in the big picture</li> <li>Logical Approach: cut a path that others can follow, and make sure your conclusions follow your evidence</li> <li>Skills Enhancement & Sharing: Keep learning, offer support, grow your comfort zone, and help the team grow and learn</li> </ul>
Title: Marketing Science Analyst

Job_Description: Job Description<br/> <div>You are energetic, well organized and passionate about economics. You have exceptional computer skills, can prioritize projects and are a quick learner. You appreciate the importance of providing accurate analytical financial results for a variety of real estate property. You want to embrace our vision and values around our people (learning, growing, having fun), our business (longevity, sustainability, growth), and our community (pride, impact, legacy). <br/><br/> Join our energetic and positive team at Strategic Group, Calgary, as the <strong>Junior Analyst.</strong> You will assist with the analysis of operational and financial reporting, acquisitions and dispositions, asset evaluations. Together with the VP Asset Managements and Portfolio Performance Managers, you will focus on creating strong portfolio performance reports, and market research.</div> <br/>Job Requirements <br/><br/> <strong>Key Responsibilities:</strong>  <ul> <li>Prepare and analyze operational data for strategic review by the Portfolio Performance Managers and Executives, while reviewing and coordinating financial analysis across different real estate property types in support of the Portfolio Performance team</li> <li>Liaise with Accounting, Investment, Leasing, and other departments</li> <li>Fully analyze financial results and organize them as required for presentation in quarterly reports and other reporting</li> <li>Analyze property operating budgets and financial statements, cash flow and projected investment returns, while staying up to date on market and economic trends impacting our industry</li> <li>Assist with ADHOC reporting as required, acquisitions, dispositions, financing, and other transactions</li> </ul> <strong>Job Requirements:</strong>  <ul> <li>University degree in Finance, Accounting, Real Estate or relevant Degree</li> <li>Exposure to real estate in a relevant work-term, financial/investment institution, real estate firm, development, or construction firm</li> <li>Ability to handle multiple demands and adapt to new ideas and constant changes</li> <li>Ability to use initiative and self-managing skills to work independently with minimal direction and respond effectively to issues that arise</li> <li>High attention to detail with the ability to comprehend, analyze, and interpret relevant transactions and financial statements and information</li> <li>Excellent interpersonal and communication skills; both verbal and written</li> <li>Strong proficiency in Microsoft Office, with expertise in Excel, PowerPoint, and Word</li> </ul>
Title: Junior Analyst

Job_Description: <strong>Intermediate IT Programmer Analyst</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Location: Calgary, AB</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Scope and Overview</strong> <br/><br/> As an Intermediate IT Programmer Analyst, you will support and make enhancements to an existing web-based system and be responsible for evolving its technologies and projects, building value-added new features. This is an ideal opportunity to gain exposure to the vast technologies required for a leading transportation provider in Southern Alberta. The Intermediate IT Programmer Analyst is required to respond to users during regular office hours with the exception of off-hour emergency situations. This position reports directly to the IT Team Lead. <br/><br/> <strong>Knowledge & Skills Required</strong> <ul> <li>Education with a recognized IT institution, ideally in Computer Science</li><li>Three to five years of application development experience with C#/VB and ASP.Net technologies</li><li>Experience in database design and data analysis with Microsoft SQL Server 2005/2008/2012. Good aptitude in writing queries and preparing analytical reports. Comfortable with database administration, monitoring/tuning database performance and establishing/interpreting database performance metrics</li><li>Good understanding of transportation business and technologies applied in the domain is preferred; experience with GPS system development is an asset</li><li>Former experience of phone app development is a plus</li><li>Experience assisting and supporting users</li><li>Education and/or experience with Networks/Internet</li><li>Some experience in large networks is an asset</li> </ul> <strong>Principal Duties and Responsibilities</strong> <ul> <li>Primarily maintain/support the company business systems, ASP.Net websites and apps in service for business users or customers</li><li>Follow the development standards and conventions with regards to all aspects of the application including documentation, coding, etc.</li><li>Delivering assigned tasks on time and on budget with expected quality based on established priorities</li><li>Design and collaborate with onsite management and IT based business requirements</li><li>Adhere to IT policies, backup policies, internet policies and remote-home access policies</li> </ul>
Title: Intermediate IT Programmer Analyst

Job_Description: <strong>POSITION OVERVIEW</strong> <br/><br/> Do you have experience conducting research to compile market information and statistics to support pitch materials, publications and reports on the local commercial real estate market? Are you able to adapt and prioritize to meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment? <br/><br/> JLL is currently seeking a dynamic individual for the role of Research Analyst to provide reliable, timely, efficient support to their Calgary team. The position entails working with a diverse group of internal and external Stakeholders at all levels of the organization, and the individual will require the independent judgment to plan, prioritize, and organize a diverse workload. This role provides a wide variety of support services to the brokerage teams and the successful candidate will be detail oriented with strong organizational skills and a team player attitude. <br/><br/> With a long track record representing both tenants and landlords, our tenant representation group understands what motivates each side in a lease negotiation. We get to know our clients and their goals then use our market leading research, leading market expertise and global connections to develop tailored occupancy plans for our clients. <br/><br/> <strong>RESPONSIBILITIES</strong> <ul> <li>Work with research and other team members to compile market information and statistics on the local commercial real estate market; conduct research and collect information materials on market fundamentals, ownership, tenants, and economic analysis</li><li>Conduct research at a designated level to support pitch materials, publications, reports and deliverables to the Local Practice Leader and/or applicable brokerage team; assist brokerage professionals through the completion of market surveys, data analysis, cash flow analysis, financial modelling and other deliverables</li><li>Contribute to the collection of and ensure the integrity of comparable data, new development information, and applicable information on city planning changes/issues; apply technical and analytical skills to disseminate market data and ensure data integrity</li><li>Contribute to designated local market research requests: market snapshots, market overviews, quarterly market decks, topic specific research to support pitches and brokerage opportunities</li><li>Liaise regularly with other real estate professionals including developers, appraisers, landlords and brokers</li><li>Coordinate and manage daily, weekly and quarterly research tasks</li><li>Contribute to special initiatives, such as: annual/semi-annual publications, whitepapers, and quarterly reports (Skyline, Look Forward Skyline, Office Insight) as required</li><li>Any other reasonable duties and responsibilities assigned</li> </ul> <strong>QUALIFICATIONS</strong> <ul> <li>Post-secondary education in Commerce, Economics, Business Administration, Urban Economics, Urban Planning, or Urban Geography</li><li>3+ years of relevant experience or combination of education and experience  <ul> <li>Experience in the commercial real estate sector is an asset</li></ul></li> <li>Demonstrated proficiency with all applicable software packages including but not limited to MS Windows; MS Office, including MS Word, Excel, Outlook, and PowerPoint; ESRI and ArcGIS</li> </ul> <strong>REQUIRED SKILLS</strong> <ul> <li>Good verbal and written communication skills in English</li><li>Able to adapt and prioritize, meeting deadlines, in a fast-paced environment  <ul> <li>May require on-call activity after regular office hours</li></ul></li> <li>Operates with a sense of urgency, quickly responding to Stakeholders</li><li>Professional yet personable demeanor</li><li>Excellent time management and organizational skills</li><li>Positive and professional attitude and demonstrates professionalism at all times</li><li>Detail oriented with strong analytical skills</li><li>Able to work well independently with an ability to work collaboratively with others</li><li>Proactive and takes initiative</li><li>Able to maintain confidentiality, utilize judgment, and work with minimal supervision</li> </ul> TO APPLY <br/><br/> Qualified applicants may apply on JLL’s Careers web site: www.jll.ca/canada/en-ca/careers <br/><br/> We thank all applicants for their interest, but advise that only those selected for an interview will be contacted. <br/><br/> JLL IS AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER <br/><br/> JLL is an equal opportunity employer and committed to recruiting, developing and maintaining a diverse workforce in compliance with all applicable Human Rights legislation. The Company will endeavor to make reasonable accommodations up to the point of undue hardship, for disabilities made known to it by its employees and applicants. <br/><br/> <strong>JLL Is an Equal Opportunity Employer</strong> <br/><br/> JLL is committed to developing and maintaining a diverse workforce. JLL strongly believes in equal opportunity extended to all individuals in all aspects of the employment relationship, including recruitment, hiring, training, promotion, transfer, discipline, layoff, recall and termination without regard to race, color, religion, belief, creed, age, sex, pregnancy or maternity (including childbirth and related conditions), family responsibility (e.g. child care, elder care), nationality, ethnic or national origin or ancestry, citizenship, marital status, civil partner status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, transgender status, veteran’s status, genetic information, trade union membership, social position, political view or status as a qualified individual with a disability, protected leave status or any other protected characteristic in accordance with applicable law. The company also endeavors to make reasonable accommodations for known physical or mental limitations of otherwise qualified employees and applicants with disabilities unless the accommodations would impose an undue hardship on the operation of our business and ensures that employment decisions are based only on valid job requirements. <br/><br/> For employees in the United States, please see a fully copy of our Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action policy at https://jll2.sharepoint.com/CorporatePolicies/HR%20Policies/Equal%20Employment%20Opportunity%20and%20Affirmative%20Action.pdf. <br/><br/> If you have questions about careers at JLL or are disabled and require further assistance in applying for a position, please contact us at careers@am.jll.com

This includes interfacing with other IT groups globally to support the effective delivery of technical solutions, process improvements and seamless support to the business. <br/><br/> Examples of specific job responsibilties: <br/><br/> Job Shadowing / Consultation  <ul>  	<li>Meeting (virtually and in-person) with Downstream business partners to understand and document functional requirements that address business productivity opportunities and/or pain points.</li> <li>Collaborating with the business and global IT service delivery organizations to understand and replicate existing productivity solutions to new locations.</li> </ul> Workflow Digitization  <ul>  	<li>Assisting the business in eliminating paper and streamlining approvals by translating functional requirements into written technical designs.</li> <li>Leveraging internal best practices to build responsive web user interfaces for SharePoint sites using HTML, CSS and JavaScript that can be easily supported by existing IT organizations.</li> <li>Configuring Productivity tools (e.g InfoPath, DocuSign, etc.) to meet business requirements.</li> </ul> Technology Awareness  <ul>  	<li>Learning about existing tools/technologies that are offered by ExxonMobil IT and delivering IT Learning training sessions (virtually and face-to-face) to business customers.</li> <li>Providing productivity advice to customers via active participation in IT Booths.</li> <li>Participating in local techSpring initiatives to deliver innovative prototypes.</li> </ul> Bring us your problem  <ul>  	<li>Analyzing complex business problems and identifying/executing productivity improvements.</li> <li>Reviewing, fixing and developing a better way to work for issues with Office applications for business customers.</li>   <li>Working with local and global IT service partners to resolve issues in a timely manner.</li> <li>Providing guidance and support on IT tools and solutions to meet business needs.</li> </ul> Coordination  <ul>  	<li>Coordinating and supporting the implementation of local and global IT initiatives for the local Downstream business.</li> </ul> <strong>Qualifications</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Academic:</strong>  <ul>  	<li>3rd or 4th year Computer/Electrical/Software Engineering, Computer Science or Information Systems students interested in a career in information technology.</li> <li>To be considered for employment, your most recent unofficial transcript(s) must be submitted with your application</li> </ul> <strong>Other:</strong>  <ul>  	<li>Strong interpersonal, listening, verbal and written communication skills</li> <li>Ability to work effectively in a team environment to accomplish organizational goals</li> <li>Demonstrate sound analytical and problem-solving skills</li> <li>Highly motivated individual able to work with minimum supervision</li> <li>Ability to build responsive web interfaces for SharePoint sites using HTML, CSS and JavaScript</li> <li>Maintain effectiveness in a changing environment</li> <li>Well versed in Microsoft tools (Word, PowerPoint, Excel)</li> <li>Capability to rapidly learn and apply new IT technologies and then to teach and train others</li> <li>Familiarity with MS Suite including SharePoint/portal development would be an asset</li> <li>Flexibility in dealing with changing priorities and short deadlines</li> <li>Travel to remote field sites may be required</li> </ul> <strong>Start date:</strong>August 2018 (start date negotiable) <br/><br/> <strong>Work term:</strong> 12 preferred, 8 months considered <br/><br/> <strong>Location:</strong> Calgary, Alberta <br/><br/> <strong>Your benefits</strong> <br/><br/> This position will provide you with an opportunity to leverage your skills in support of a large integrated oil company. You will be provided an opportunity to:  <ul>  	<li>Work in a high caliber, collaborative learning environment</li> <li>Receive on-the-job experience, coaching and training</li> <li>Gain technical and business background in the operations of the oil & gas resource industry through participation in various networking programs</li> <li>Work with a geographically distributed team across Canada and the US</li> <li>Work directly with the client business unit to deliver IT solutions to meet critical business needs</li> <li>Utilize desktop, client/server, network and web technologies</li> </ul> <strong>Who we are</strong> <br/><br/> At ExxonMobil Business Support Centre Canada ULC (EMBSCC) we are an integral part of a worldwide network of business support centres that provide financial, technical, information service, transactional, and customer service support for ExxonMobil’s global operations. <br/><br/> <strong>Other considerations</strong>  <ul>  	<li>For applicants selected to be interviewed, pre-employment background screening will be required.</li> <li>We thank all those who apply; however, only those candidates selected for interviews will be contacted.</li> </ul> <strong>Eligibility to work in Canada</strong> <br/><br/> Applicants must be eligible to work in Canada.
