Failure to provide the appropriate documentation within a reasonable timeframe (generally 6 weeks prior to your start date) may result in the offer being rescinded or a delay in your start date. <br/><br/> <strong>Application deadline:</strong> May 13, 2018</div> <br/>The ExxonMobil Business Support Centre Canada is committed to providing equitable treatment and equal opportunity to all individuals. <br/><br/> In certain situations, ExxonMobil may use your application to consider your suitability for other positions within the Company and may also provide the information to its affiliates, including Imperial Oil and affiliates of Exxon Mobil Corporation, in connection with possible opportunities at those affiliates.</div>  </div>  </div>  </div> <br/><strong>Job Segment:</strong>  <br/>  Developer, Electrical, Engineer, Information Systems, Computer Science, Technology, Engineering</div>  <br/>Apply now »<br/>   <div> Apply now    <ul>    <li> <br/> <br/>  Start apply with LinkedIn</li> <br/><br/> <li> <br/> <br/>  Start apply with Facebook</li> <br/><br/> <li> <br/> <br/>  Start apply with Xing</li> <br/><br/> <li> <br/> <br/>  Start apply with Seek</li> <br/><br/> <li> <br/>  Apply Now</li><br/>  <div> <div> <div> Start</div>  </div>  </div>  <br/><li>  <div> <strong>Please wait...</strong></div> </li>  </ul>   </div> </div>  <br/>
Title: Productivity Solutions Analyst Student

Job_Description: KPMG's Deal Advisory Group helps companies manage and profit from change. As part of our Deal Advisory Group, our Transaction Services (TS) practice helps companies grow and enhance shareholder value by providing strategic advice on merger and acquisition transactions. Our service is designed to help identify risks inherent in these types of transactions, and to find practical solutions to manage these risks. We offer start-to-finish support in the acquisition process, including input on strategy, early identification of risk areas, coordination and execution of due diligence investigations (financial and commercial) and input and advice on contract terms geared to reduce risks. We also get involved in assisting our clients and their other advisors with a host of services surrounding closing the transaction and post-deal integration. <br/><br/> Our clients are typically pension funds, private equity funds, large public companies, as well as private businesses. We serve both domestic clients and clients from outside Canada – often working as part of cross-border KPMG teams providing seamless service to clients. Our people are motivated self-starters with expertise in finance, valuation, tax, accounting and financial reporting. Our network is global. <br/><br/> <STRONG>Position Summary</STRONG> <br/><br/> KPMG's Transaction Services is currently looking for professionals in our Calgary, Canada office at the Associate level. Working in multi-disciplinary teams, you will apply your professional and technical skills on a wide variety of transactions and at different stages of the transaction cycle. <br/><br/> <STRONG>Role and Responsibilities</STRONG> <br/><br/> The successful candidate will be responsible for: <ul> <LI>Identifying key issues on the deals, carrying out the relevant quantitative and qualitative data analysis, interpreting results, and reporting key findings</LI><LI>Evaluating a business’ historical performance and sustainability of earnings/cash flows, working capital cycles, financial projections, key contractual commitments, accounting policies and management control environment</LI><LI>Preparing extensive written documents including deal findings reports, management reports, management presentations, and industry research reports</LI><LI>Creating deal and financial models and maintaining certain industry models</LI><LI>Participating in business development by developing an awareness, monitor, track, analyze and report on, an ongoing basis, M&A market activities, industry developments and market trends</LI><LI>Play a key role in the preparation of prospect proposals, business development presentations and pitch books</LI><LI>Maintaining and enhancing research and transaction databases on a current basis</LI><LI>Building relationships with peers across all KPMG service lines within Audit, Tax and Advisory</LI> <LI>Developing relationships with current and prospective clients by participating in KPMG engagement teams with access to senior client executives, attorneys, and private equity investors</LI> <LI>Be in contact with peers at other financial advisory firms, financial institutions, private equity groups, and industry associations on a regular basis to promote KPMG’s interest and maintain knowledge of their area of specialization</LI><LI>Collaborating with other deal advisory functions (Valuations, Corporate Finance and Restructuring) on cross-function projects</LI> </ul>  At times, business needs arise and employees are required and agree to work beyond their normal work day or work week to fulfill the accountabilities required for their job. Likewise, people need extra time to devote to personal matters, and our approach to flexibility provides for this. <br/><br/> <STRONG>Skills & Qualifications</STRONG> <br/><br/> A successful candidate will possess the following experience, skills, and behaviors:  <ul> <LI>1 to 4 years of relevant experience in financial services, investment banking, private equity, accounting and/or finance in a consulting and/or corporate environment</LI><LI>Proven academic track record. Undergraduate University degree in Finance, Economics, Accounting, or relevant business field. Post-graduate designations such as a CA, CPA, CFA, CBV, or MBA is considered an asset</LI><LI>M&A advisory, deal structuring, and financial due diligence experience is an asset</LI><LI>Strong business acumen with ability to synthesize company and market related information and understand key business drivers</LI><LI>Superior analytical, quantitative, and financial modeling skills are required</LI> <LI>Experience with research tools such as Capital IQ, Bloomberg, Mergerstat, Thompson Reuters, etc. is preferred</LI><LI>Excellent written and verbal communication skills incorporating the ability to explain detailed financial analyses</LI><LI>Energetic and decisive, with a high level of integrity</LI><LI>Demonstrated ability to learn and succeed in a fast-paced environment</LI><LI>Highly motivated, committed, and flexible to cope with changing priorities and strict deadlines</LI> <LI>Willingness and ability to travel on short-term assignments within Canada and internationally as required</LI> </ul>  <strong><DIV>#LI-HH1</DIV></strong>
Title: Transaction Services - Analyst/Associate

Job_Description: The E1 Finance Support Analyst role will be accountable for providing functional and technical assistance for E1 Financial software as well as interfaces to/from E1. This position requires proven communication, problem-solving and customer service skills. <br/><br/> You will leverage your technical and business experience to develop positive relationships with many teams including Finance, Operations, and Supply Management. This position is the first point of contact for incoming E1 Finance application support requests. <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities:</strong>  <ul>  	<li>assess and investigate reported issues, determine the root cause and provide resolution</li> <li>provide recommendations and support of best practices in business process improvements</li> <li>ensure integrity, understanding and documentation of E1 finance modules with respect to the development and execution of new finance system related initiatives</li> <li>ensure month end processes are executed with accuracy and timeliness</li> <li>work as the liaison between the user community and change management team, leading requirements gathering discussions</li> <li>actively participate in continuous improvement of support and business processes, identifying options to reduce cost, improve efficiency and increase productivity</li> <li>execution of system changes (SQL) to E1 finance tables while ensuring integrity of data<br/><br/><strong>Qualifications:</strong></li>  </ul>    <ul>  	<li>must be legally eligible to work in Canada</li> <li>strong knowledge and hands-on experience with the following E1 modules; Foundation, Address Book, Accounts Receivable, Accounts Payable, General Accounting, Multi-Currency</li> <li>understanding of database concepts, E1 structures, and the integration to other modules</li> <li>strong financial understanding of oil and gas accounting procedures</li> <li>exceptional analytical, communication, documentation, planning, prioritization, organization skills</li> <li>must have flexibility with work hours</li> <li>well-developed team skills and a collaborative work style</li> <li>proven ability to set and shift priorities to meet a variety of timelines</li> <li>ability to work independently, within a fast-paced team environment</li> <li>experience writing and executing SQL scripts</li> <li>experience in training business users, Reports Now (DAS) and CostPick</li> </ul>
Title: E1 Finance Support Analyst

Job_Description: The Claims Reinsurance Analyst 1 will be an expert in data analysis in producing insurance reports for different lines of business to offer support to the organization's risk management. He/she will also participate in different projects related to reinsurance and claims. With this purpose in mind, you will: <br/> Extract, process, validate and produce data analysis and compile reports to evaluate insurance portfolios in order to maintain or improve the organization financial security <br/><br/> Complete audits and reconciliations, conducted at various times during the claims lifecycle <br/><br/> Verify and review the claims that have been registered as reinsurance claims <br/><br/> Produce the various presentations that are used to communicate main details related to reinsurance claims <br/><br/> Assisting during Claims CAT (catastrophe) season by setting up new claims, or other claims duties as assigned <br/><br/> Prepare specific reports to answer to questions from internal departments (underwriting, finance, claims, actuarial) using various programs such as Excel <br/><br/> Your Skills <br/><br/> Post secondary education <br/><br/> Related experience in Insurance <br/><br/> 1 year of relevant claims experience preferred <br/><br/> Enrollment in or completion of CIP preferred <br/><br/> Relevant accounting experience preferred <br/><br/> Great attention to detail is required <br/><br/> Strong knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite <br/><br/> Ability to learn new systems such as Halcion, Contact Claims, MDE, and possibly CLPSS <br/><br/> Closing Statement <br/><br/> As part of Intacts selection process, candidates may be requested to consent to background checks relevant to the role under consideration for, prior to receiving a job offer. These could include: work references, education and credential confirmation, employment verification, identity check, credit report, criminal offence and drivers license record. <br/><br/> Eligibility to work in Canada <br/><br/> Proof of eligibility for permanent roles may come in the form of a Canadian birth certificate, Canadian passport, Canadian citizenship certificate, permanent residence card or confirmation. Applicants must be permanently eligible to work in Canada upon hire. <br/><br/> This posting will close on June 16, 2018 at 11:59 PM EST
Title: Claims Reinsurance Analyst 1

Job_Description: <strong>Position Overview</strong> <br/><br/> <strong> Information Technologies</strong> is currently seeking a Full-time Regular <strong> Operational IT Business Analyst</strong> . <br/><br/> Reporting to the Associate Director, Customer Engagement, the incumbent will work as an IT Business Analyst within one or more faculty/ business unit(s). This role is to support and enhance all IT-related capabilities that are critical to core organizational functions within a particular faculty/ business unit. This includes; <ul>  <li> Researching and analyzing current state systems, processes, and data</li> <li> Gathering requirements for change from a people, process or technology perspective</li> <li> Designing and building new processes and procedures</li> <li> Identifying changes required to systems and data</li> <li> Assist in Incident resolution</li> <li> Facilitating the implementation of small initiatives</li> <li> Assisting in the education of process and systems to various business and IT groups</li> </ul> This position involves the ability to manage multiple and often conflicting priorities, simultaneous deadlines, complex and confidential issues, and a rapidly evolving environment. The incumbent must work well under pressure and be able to communicate effectively with all levels of the institution and with external stakeholders. The individual works independently, with guidance in only the most complex situations. <br/><br/> While the role does not require shift work, it is expected that the incumbent will engage in evening, early morning or weekend activities as required from time to time in order to address project and service demands. <br/><br/> <strong>Position Description</strong> <br/><br/> <strong> Summary of Key Responsibilities</strong> (job functions include but are not limited to): <br/><br/> <strong> Strategic and Planning</strong> <ul>  <li> Model the current state as a base set of capabilities, processes, key policies, systems, data and enabling org structure so that requirements and future state development activities can be performed. Champion the evolution and maintenance of this structure</li> <li> Meet with decision makers, systems owners, and end users to define business, financial, and operations requirements and systems goals</li> <li> Research, review, and analyze the effectiveness and efficiency of existing processes and develop strategies for enhancing or further leveraging these processes</li> <li> Prototype new processes/procedures for the purpose of enhancing business processes, operations, and information process flow</li> <li> Prepare and deliver reports, recommendations, or alternatives for improving processes in operating systems across the organization</li> <li> Perform cost-benefit and return on investment (ROI) analyses for proposed changes to aid management in making implementation decisions</li> <li> Identify and establish scope and parameters of process analysis in order to define impact, outcome criteria, and measure-taking actions</li> <li> Collaborate in the planning, design, development, and deployment of new applications, and enhancements to existing applications</li> <li> Assist in conducting research on software and hardware products to justify recommendations and to support purchasing efforts</li> </ul> <strong> Operational Management</strong> <ul>  <li> Develop, standardize, and maintain new or improved processes based on findings and analysis</li> <li> Communicate process changes, enhancements, and modifications - verbally or through written documentation to management, peers, staff, and other employees so that issues and solutions are understood</li> <li> Create process models, specifications, diagrams, and charts to provide direction to IT service owners</li> <li> Develop budgets and timeframes for process changes in order to support faculty/unit objectives</li> <li> Liaise with various business groups in the organization to facilitate implementation of new or improved business processes</li> <li> Coordinate and perform in-depth tests, including end-user reviews, for modified and new processes, and other post-implementation support</li> <li> Lead small initiatives by coordinating all activities and resources, performing analysis and process design, liaison with the technical team, lead the rollout and perform all necessary communication and training activities Assist in incident resolution as required by coordinating all activities and resources, performing analysis and liaison with the technical team</li> <li> Provide guidance and/or instruction to junior staff members</li> <li> Communicate and provide feedback to the product development and sustainment teams to ensure efficient and effective delivery and overall satisfaction of IT products and services</li> <li> Develop communication and ensure that it occurs regularly between the faculty/business unit(s) to resolve issues, priorities, and expectations</li> <li> Actively listen, reframe, influence and persuade</li> </ul> <strong> Qualifications / Requirements:</strong> <ul>  <li> A Bachelor's degree required, preferably in business administration, computer science, or management information systems is recommended</li> <li> An equivalent combination of education and experience from which comparable knowledge and abilities can be acquired will be considered</li> <li> IIBA Certification, BRMI Certification and change management certification such as Prosci are considered an asset</li> <li> Must possess both an academic and technology focus with awareness of current and emerging developments in education information technologies and applications</li> <li> Demonstrate the ability to work with the IT Business Partner in developing a 6 to 36-month vision regarding the use of technology (within either a particular Faculty/Business Unit or Institution wide)</li> <li> Must have excellent organizational, interpersonal, oral and written communication skills and the ability to communicate effectively with Faculty and Business Units</li> <li> Have excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, self-motivation, and able to exercise independent judgment and take action on it</li> <li> Business acumen and an understanding of university's operations is also essential</li> <li> Demonstrated experience in successfully negotiating people both directly and indirectly across an organization will be expected</li> </ul> <strong> Application Deadline:</strong>  May 15, 2018 <br/><br/> <em> We would like to thank all applicants in advance for submitting their resumes. Please note, only those candidates chosen to continue on through the selection process will be contacted.</em> <br/><br/> <strong>Additional Information</strong> <br/><br/> This position is classified in the<strong> Professional Career Band, Level 3</strong>  of the Management and Professional Staff Career Framework. <br/><br/> To find out more about management and staff opportunities at the University of Calgary and all we have to offer, view our <strong> Management and Staff Careers website</strong>  . <br/><br/> <strong> About the University of Calgary</strong> <br/><br/> The University of Calgary is Canada’s leading next-generation university – a living, growing and youthful institution that embraces change and opportunity with a can-do attitude. Located in the nation’s most enterprising city, the university is making tremendous progress on its Eyes High journey to be recognized as one of Canada’s top five research universities, grounded in innovative learning and teaching and fully integrated with the community it both serves and leads. The University of Calgary inspires and supports discovery, creativity and innovation across all disciplines. For more information, visit <strong> ucalgary.ca</strong>  . <br/><br/> <em> The University of Calgary recognizes that a diverse staff/faculty benefits and enriches the work, learning and research experiences of the entire campus and greater community. We are committed to removing barriers that have been historically encountered by some people in our society. We strive to recruit individuals who will further enhance our diversity and will support their professional success while they are here. We encourage all qualified applicants to apply, however preference will be given to Canadian citizens and permanent residents of Canada.</em>
Title: Operational IT Business Analyst, Customer Engagement, Information Technologies

Job_Description: <div><p><strong>Job Type: </strong>Permanent <br><strong>Primary Location: </strong>Calgary, Alberta, Canada <br><strong>All Available Locations: </strong>Calgary </p><p><p><p>External Posting Description</p><p><p>Our Calgary practice is growing and we are seeking a new Senior Security Analyst to join our talented team! As a Senior Security Analyst, you will:</p><ul><li>Work with a diverse team of talented cyber security professionals</li><li>Assist in cultivating relationships with clients</li><li>Demonstrate a solid understanding of business processes, risk management, IT controls and related standards</li><li>Assist with performing capability and cybersecurity assessments, developing best practice recommendations</li><li>Identify and evaluate complex business and technology risks, internal controls which mitigate risks</li><li>Employ a structured approach to project management</li><li>Conduct research to maintain and expand knowledge on the latest cybersecurity technologies and standards,</li><li>Work with security vendors to understand their solution offerings and advise clients on appropriate technologies</li><li>Develop your expertise in a specialization and your reputation as a business advisor</li></ul><p> </p><p>Responsibilities</p><ul><li>Security Operations Center Infrastructure Management:<ul><li>SIEM administration, operation and support (HP ArcSight)<ul><li>Manage SIEM deployment for SOC clients</li><li>Multi-platform design and logging integration to SIEM</li></ul></li><li>Good understanding of enterprise security technologies related to SIEM:<ul><li>Firewalls</li><li>IPS/IDS</li><li>VA Scanners</li><li>Proxies</li><li>Network devices</li></ul></li><li>System performance health checks and uptime monitoring</li><li>Ensuring high availability operations and business continuity for SOC systems</li><li>Capacity planning and management</li><li>System backup and restoration activities</li><li>Recommend configuration enhancements</li><li>Perform operational processes:<ul><li>Change management – assist transition management of current technologies to future state</li><li>Configuration management</li><li>Incident management investigation and reporting</li></ul></li><li>Developing technical and soft documentation – operating procedures, guidelines and standards</li><li>Performing vulnerability management</li><li>Provide detailed technical expertise in area of security technologies and best practice recommendations to clients</li><li>Proactively drives tasks and identifies areas of improvement</li></ul></li></ul></p></p><p><p>External Posting Qualifications</p><p><ul><li>A Bachelor's Degree or Diploma in a relevant area of study with a preference for Computer Science or Computer Engineering</li><li>3-5 years in Information Security</li><li>Proven system troubleshooting experience in enterprise production IT environments</li><li>Experience with enterprise server hardware</li><li>Experience with IT/Network operations including server and network/firewall configuration</li><li>Good working knowledge of:<ul><li>Enterprise platforms:<ul><li>Server platforms (GNU/Linux, Windows etc.)</li><li>Virtualized infrastructure (VMWare, Hyper-V etc.)</li><li>Performance monitoring (SolarWinds, Nagios etc.)</li></ul></li><li>Development and scripting experience in GNU/Linux Operating systems</li><li>Networking and security (TCP, SSL, authentication, Linux PAM, OpenSSL, Apache, RPM)</li></ul></li><li>Direct prior experience with enterprise security technologies</li><li>Prior experience as a SOC Engineer or Analyst</li><li>Customer service and excellence experience</li></ul><p> </p><p><u>Desirable Qualifications:</u></p><ul><li>Industry certifications (CISSP/PMP/SANS/GCIA) are strong assets</li><li>Strong understanding of PCI compliance considered an asset</li><li>Additional certifications (PMP, RHCSA/RHCE)</li><li>Experience building and maintaining Linux or BSD software package repositories such as deb/apt or RPM/yum preferred</li><li>Direct prior experience with either enterprise SIEM solutions is an asset</li><li>Prior experience as a system/security administrator</li><li>Experience working in enterprise operational environments</li><li>Enterprise data centre network architecture</li><li>Network configuration</li><li>Security configuration management systems (Ansible, Puppet, Chef, etc.)</li><li>Version control systems (GIT, mercurial, subversion)</li><li>Splunk or other big data deployment</li><li>Regular Expression</li><li>Scripting (Powershell, Bash, Python)</li><li>Experience and/or knowledge of security and privacy enhancing technologies such as identity management, application security and network security technologies</li></ul><p> </p></p></p></p><p><strong>Why Deloitte?</strong></p><p>Launch your career with The One Firm where you can make a greater impact than you ever thought possible. With endless opportunities at every turn, and a culture built to support and drive our people to be the very best they can be, Deloitte is The One Firm for you to learn, grow, create, and lead.</p><p>At Deloitte, we understand that everyone, and their career goals, are different. As a firm, we help create the conditions and opportunities that will enable our people to thrive – both professionally and personally. We do this by making three commitments to our people:</p><ul><li><em><strong>You will lead at every level:</strong></em> We grow the world’s best leaders so you can achieve the impact you seek, faster.</li><li><em><strong>You can work your way:</strong></em> We give you the means to work how you want, and we have innovative spaces and the mindset to help you be wildly successful.</li><li><em><strong>You will feel included and inspired:</strong></em> We create a deep sense of belonging where you can bring your whole self to work.</li></ul><p>Apply now and let us show you how to push your career to the next level at <em><strong>Deloitte. The One Firm. For You.</strong></em></p><p>Deloitte is an inclusive employer dedicated to building a diverse workforce. We encourage applications from all qualified candidates and will accommodate applicants’ needs under the respective provincial human rights codes throughout all stages of the recruitment and selection process. Please advise the Recruiter to ensure your accessibility needs are accommodated throughout this process. Information received relating to accommodation will be addressed confidentially.</p><p>We thank all applicants in advance for their interest; however, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted</p><p>33185</p><p> </p></div>
Title: Senior Analyst, Cyber Security

Job_Description: <div>Interested in being a part of a team that is leading the evolution of retail in Canada?</div><br/> <div>Embracing and driving change is critical to our success. The complexity and rate at which the retail industry is transforming has increased exponentially in recent years and we are committed to being a leader in the industry. As such we are relentlessly focused on innovating at every level of our business, investing in new technologies and products, and doubling down on the best talent to drive the company forward. It is an especially exciting time to join the Canadian Tire Family of Companies.</div><br/> <div>Our Technology team plays a critical role in our evolution, specifically as we transition to an omni-retailer where digital complements the physical. Our commitment to being a world-class digital organization is evident in how we are using cutting-edge technologies to bring our digital strategy to life in-store, online and on your mobile devices, ultimately improving customer experiences, driving traffic, and boosting loyalty.</div> <br/> <div>The Digital Operations team provides 24x7 production support for e-commerce banners including Sportchek, Marks, and Atmosphere. The team works core business hours and provides off-hours pager support on a rotating basis. The list of supported applications includes, but is not limited to: Web Content Management Systems, e-commerce Systems, Integration Endpoints and Connected Systems.</div><br/> <div><strong>What you’ll do:</strong></div><div>As a member of the Digital Operations team, the Systems Support Analyst plays a support role that provides production support and maintenance for e-commerce based applications.</div><br/>  <div><strong>Specific duties include:</strong></div><div>  <ul> <li>Preserving/Restoring service and resolving client-reported problems escalated from the 1st level support desk or monitoring alerts. Ensuring that business users are informed as to status and expected resolution times.</li><li>Providing 2nd level incident support, including rotating off-hours pager support.</li><li>Providing hands-on application support for daily operations for core applications, including service, data and process integrity, configuration, user administration, reporting and optimization.</li><li>Identifying root cause and resolution of any incidents reported by the monitoring systems and end users. Analyzing data inaccuracies and identifying risks of changes to the environment.</li><li>Developing the monitoring and alerting portfolio to meet service level requirements.</li><li>Ensuring software being transitioned to the team for support is stable and sustainable by guiding project teams during warranty periods.</li><li>Ensuring Change Management processes are adhered to.</li><li>Maintaining documentation, run-books, and providing training.</li><li>Providing SME (subject matter expertise) to projects and teams developing software enhancements.</li></ul></div> <br/> <div><strong>Who you are:</strong></div><br/>  <div><strong>We are looking for high performing individuals who are:</strong></div><div>  <ul> <li>Agile and innovative individuals, who are able to manage in an environment of change and ambiguity to help us take bold and strategic moves in this rapidly evolving retail environment.</li><li>Creative thinkers who take initiative and are capable of building, launching and managing projects/programs that drive results for our customers.</li><li>Problem solvers with the ability to analyze and prioritize to meet business objectives.</li><li>Collaborative team players with superior influencing skills, who build relationships easily across various stakeholder groups to move initiatives forward .</li></ul></div> <br/> <div>If you’re curious, ready to take on new challenges and open to doing things differently to help us evolve rapidly, then Canadian Tire is definitely the place to be.</div><br/> <div><strong>What you’ve done:</strong></div><div>  <ul> <li>3-5 years of experience in a retail environment and 5-7 years in an IT environment.</li><li>3-5 years of experience of SAP (Hybris) and Adobe (AEM) applications.</li><li>3-5 years of experience in Cloud Marketing tools including Google and Adobe.</li><li>Understanding of database environments (Oracle, MongoDB) with experience in reading, writing, and executing queries and scripts.</li><li>Solid experience in monitoring and managing production systems including Java-based applications and Linux-based environments.</li><li>Good understanding of retail business processes from an e-commerce and omni-channel perspective.</li><li>Excellent analytical skills with a keen attention to detail.</li><li>Strong technical and troubleshooting skills with the ability to correlate information.</li><li>Excellent facilitation and communication skills with the ability to bring multiple teams, knowledge-sets, and experience levels together to solve issues.</li><li>Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and able to meet strict timelines.</li><li>Ability to learn quickly, maintain documentation and deliver training to others.</li><li>Ability to compile ideas into a formal presentation and deliver to a group of individuals at various levels of the organization.</li><li>A strong focus on curiosity, drive, teamwork, and communication with a dedication to customer experience, brand, and revenue.</li></ul></div> <br/> <div><strong>Why us:</strong></div><div>Canadian Tire is one of Canada’s most iconic and diversified companies. Our culture and values uphold our pledge to sustainable practices, and commitment to our local communities through Jumpstart cannot be beat.</div> <br/> <div>To learn more about this team and the Canadian Tire Family of Companies follow us on LinkedIn.</div><br/> <div>AODA/D&I statement</div><br/>
Title: Systems Support Analyst - FGL Sports

Job_Description: <strong>Position Summary</strong><br/> <div> <div> <div> <div>As a member of the Calgary Homes team, the Interior Design Consultant is responsible to provide homeowners with an exceptional customer experience by assisting them with their Interior Selections from our Selections Centers. The Interior Design Consultant provides support for our Style Collection Palettes and continuous improvement of the overall homeowner experience. <br/><br/> The role will report to the Studio Manager and will ensure our homeowners expectations are met and reflected in clear concise documentation in a timely manner with an attention to detail and ultimately the customers satisfaction. <br/><br/> <strong>Areas of Responsibility</strong></div> </div> </div> </div>   <ul> <li>Develop strong knowledge base in current interior design trends and customer needs</li> <li>Provide collaborative suggestions to enhance and update product offering</li> <li>Maintain schedules and appointments for homeowner selections</li> <li>Support in planning and maintenance of product samples with Style Collections</li> <li>Represent the Brookfield Residential brand and culture in a positive manner at all times</li> <li>Liason with Estimating for accuracy and timing of pricing requests</li> <li>Attend product knowledge sessions with our Trade Partners</li> <li>Book all homeowner selection meetings in coordination with sales in a timely manner to maintain construction timelines</li> <li>Ensure all homeowner Interior Selections are documented clearly</li> <li>Ensure all upgraded product is documented on a change order with applicable cost</li> </ul> <strong>Qualifications</strong>  <ul> <li>Minimum 2 years experience in residential construction</li> <li>Post-secondary education; specifically an Interior Design Degree/Diploma will be considered an asset</li> <li>Product knowledge in latest design trends is an asset</li> <li>Strong Computer/Microsoft Office Skills</li> <li>Highly organized and detail oriented with great communication skills</li> <li>Ability to create and maintain strong relationship with team, trade partners, and customers</li> </ul> <strong>Career Package</strong> <br/><br/> We are proud to offer our employees what they value most: <br/><br/> • Competitive compensation   <ul> <li>Excellent extended health benefits</li> <li>Work-life balance</li> <li>Leadership development and mentorship programs</li> <li>Charitable donation matching</li> <li>A culture based on our values of Passion, Integrity and Community <br/><br/> <strong>The Company</strong> <br/><br/> Brookfield Residential is a leading North American land developer and homebuilder with one goal in mind - to create the best places to call home. From the development of award winning master-planned communities, to the design and construction of premier homes and commercial properties, we are committed to cultivating exceptional life experience for our customers and for our employees. <br/><br/> Building great communities and homes takes vision and dedication, but most importantly, it takes a strong team. Having been in business for more than 60 years, we know it is our people who make Brookfield Residential what it is today. We were humbled to be named by Aon as one of the Best Employers in Canada and U.S. in 2017.</li>  </ul>
Title: Interior Design Consultant - 14 month contract

Job_Description: <div><div><strong> <br/> Jr. Analyst, Land & Housing</strong><br/>  <div> <div> City <br/><br/> <strong> <br/> Calgary</strong> </div><br/>  <div> Province/Territory <br/><br/> <strong> <br/> Alberta</strong> </div><br/>  <div> Job Type <br/><br/> <strong> <br/> Permanent Full-time</strong> </div> </div> </div>  <br/>Apply Now</div><br/>  <div> <div> </div><br/>  <div> <div> <div><strong>Company:</strong></div><div><strong>Dream Asset Management Corporation</strong></div></div><br/>  <div> <div><strong>Hours per Week:</strong></div><div><strong>35.0</strong></div></div><br/>  <div> <div><strong>Application Deadline:</strong></div><div><strong>6/1/18</strong></div></div> </div><br/>  <div><strong>Dream is looking for a Junior Analyst, Land & Housing</strong></div> <br/> <div>We are always looking for the best and brightest to join our thriving community. Dream’s Development Finance team is currently looking for an Jr. Analyst to support our Land and Housing team in Calgary.</div> <br/> <div><strong>Who are you?</strong></div> <br/> <div>There’s a lot happening at Dream, and it’s happening fast. Are you passionate, dedicated, and highly analytical? Do you love working with people? If so, read on. We want to hear from you.</div> <br/> <div>Over the 1+ year(s) you’ve worked in financial planning & analysis you’ve proven that you are not afraid to think outside the box to find the best approach to achieve results. You are proactive, leading by example rather than sitting back. You consider the bigger picture when focusing on new initiatives and you thrive on driving improvement and efficiency.</div> <br/> <div>Your understanding of the financial planning & analysis group and senior management’s needs are apparent through your clear written and verbal communication skills. You are comfortable conducting presentations and facilitating meetings, and it is important to us that you are team-oriented and that people like collaborating with you.</div> <br/> <div>We want to bring on someone who is eager to learn, work hard, and have fun. In other words, we want you to fit in here. This is an opportunity for you to take on responsibilities, build on your already strong skill set and help your team achieve its goals, all in a work environment that is fast-paced, dynamic and fun.</div> <br/> <div><strong>What will you do?</strong></div> <br/> <div>Below are some of the primary responsibilities you will be taking on in this role. There will be more, but we can discuss those in person.</div>   <ul> <li>Supporting the forecasting process for Western Developments through maintaining and improving all ongoing financial reforecast models for current and future real estate development projects, and ensuring data integrity of financial models and reporting at all times;</li>  <li>Drive process improvements and maximize efficiency of the processes utilized;</li>  <li>Act as a business partner and key resource for the Director, Development Finance, Land and Housing, and local Land operations in the evaluation of the financial results;</li>  <li>Prepare, analyze, provide and communicate relevant operational project performance results in a coherent and effective manner; and</li>  <li>Have a pulse on where the business is going and obtain a detailed understanding of our Western Developments in order to be able to forecast, and explain the financial results of our business, and provide operational insights and recommendations on process or other operational improvements identified.</li> </ul>  <div><strong>What type of experience and skills do you have?</strong></div> <br/> <div>These are only some of the things we’d like you to bring to the table. We can cover the rest when we meet.</div>   <ul> <li>Your strong analytical and problem solving skills complement your excellent attention to detail;</li>  <li>You have experience working with large data volumes in an Excel environment and building budgets; pro forma building would be a plus;</li>  <li>You should have 1+ years of experience within the real estate industry, specifically in land or residential development;</li>  <li>You have an undergraduate degree in Business, Accounting or Finance, or equivalent experience;</li>  <li>Working towards a CMA/MBA/CFA designation is an asset;</li>  <li>Solid understanding of accounting is a must;</li>  <li>Your track record of being entrepreneurial, innovative and resilient constantly sets you apart;</li>  <li>A self-starter with the ability to work independently;</li>  <li>Your communication and presentation skills are exceptional; and</li>  <li>You deliver on commitments and are able manage multiple deliverables.</li> </ul>  <div><strong>Who are we?</strong></div> <br/> <div>Land & Housing</div> <br/> <div>Dream’s Land & Housing division is one of the largest developers in Western Canada. We are proud to build on our track record of developing communities in Canada’s largest cities and are dedicated to building the best homes. Together, we build better communities by providing Canadians with a wide selection of beautiful, high-quality homes in communities that answer their needs and fit their lifestyles.</div> <br/> <div>Dream Unlimited Corp. is a leading Canadian real estate company with approximately $14 billion of assets under management in Canada and Europe. We develop, manage, and invest in master-planned communities, income properties, and urban intensification. We proudly build communities from the ground up: from land development to buildings homes and condominiums, and from providing retail centres and driving renewable energy projects to managing assets across the country.</div> <br/> <div>Our attitude and approach sets us apart from our competitors. We are guided by our entrepreneurial spirit: we seize unconventional opportunities and try new things, approaching every project with passion and purpose.</div>  <br/> <div>We care about our employees. We want everyone to have a rewarding career and to work with people they like, so we provide exciting work opportunities, open work environments, and fun events. We hire constant learners, so we make sure to provide them with engaging work and to encourage them to share their ideas that will help us shape the company.</div>  <br/> <div>Once you join us, it won’t take long to figure out why your colleagues like it so much here.</div> <br/> <div>This is your invitation to make a difference. We’re looking forward to helping you grow.</div> <br/> <div>Dream Unlimited is committed to workplace diversity and provides accommodations to applicants with disabilities throughout our hiring process</div></div>
Title: Jr. Analyst, Land & Housing

Job_Description: Job Description<div><strong>Maverick FX</strong> is a proprietary trading firm focused on Forex currency trading. We are searching for motivated and teachable candidates to trade the Forex market on behalf of the firm. Forex trading is a great career as it offers flexible hours, a challenging profession, unlimited potential and the ability to trade from anywhere in the world via high-speed Internet. <br/><br/> <strong>------- ABOUT MAVERICK FX -------</strong> <br/><br/> Trade for a firm that backs you with technology, training, risk management and capital. As a proprietary trading firm, we provide our traders with capital, giving them tremendous leverage and earning potential in the markets. Our traders keep the lion's share (70%-80%) of profits. Each of our traders starts with a minimum of a $10K account. As our traders grow and illustrate track record of consistency and profitability, they are trading with enough of our capital to potentially earn well over $100K per year. <br/><br/> <strong>------- REQUIREMENTS -------</strong> <br/><br/> Ideally, applicants should have strong math/finance/business backgrounds (or comparable skills) and some trading experience. However, being a hard worker who is enthusiastic and willing to learn is more important than your background. Passion for trading is always key to success in this industry. <br/><br/> <strong>------- HOW TO APPLY -------</strong> <br/><br/> Our application process has multiple steps, designed to communicate all the necessary information about the firm, our methodology, the way we pay our traders, and to separate those applicants who are truly determined from those who are just curious. To get started, click on the application link below, which will take you to a short video that will discuss Maverick FX, the recruitment process and the Capital Sharing Program. <br/><br/> When you complete the application process, you will be contacted by one of our capable recruiters for a suitability interview and to answer any questions you may have. <br/><br/> <strong>CLICK</strong> on the application button or use the link below in your browser to begin the application process! <br/><br/> <em><strong>http://www.maverickfx.com/apply</strong></em> <br/><br/> Will you be our next great trader? We hope so. We look forward to speaking with you. <br/><br/> – The Maverick FX Team <br/><br/> • Compensation is commission-based <br/><br/> • Full-time or part-time <br/><br/> • Telecommuting okay <br/><br/> • Open for persons with disabilities <br/><br/> • Finance, math or business skills are a plus <br/><br/> • Any trading experience is preferred, but not required <br/><br/> <em>There may be fees involved for training and startup determined by previous experience in the trading industry.</em></div>Company Description<div>Maverick FX is one of the leading Proprietary Trading firms in North America. We focus on creating successful professional traders to trade the Forex currencies market on behalf of the firm. Maverick provides Training, Support and Capital to its community of traders. The firm aligns its goals with the traders, creating an ideal trading environment and maximizing the likelihood of long-term success. On top of keeping the lion's share of the profits they generate, traders who are consistent and profitable will receive performance bonuses! For anyone interested in being a professional trader, Maverick FX is a great place to hang your hat! Come join us!</div>
Title: Associate FX Trader - Banking, Financial Analyst, Account Manager

The 19 member team is focused on implementing new Windows computing and Xerox imaging technology solutions. This role will allow you to develop skills in aspects of information technology systems life cycle including: opportunity analysis, solution assessment, design, construction, testing, implementation and support. <br/><br/> Examples of specific job responsibilties:  <ul>  	<li>Develop project plans to roll out Windows, MS Office and printer technology solutions to users across Canada</li> <li>Consult with business users to understand business processes and requirements to deliver optimized technology solutions</li> <li>Develop SharePoint based solutions to streamline business workflows and create business value</li> <li>Use continuous improvement techniques to improve support team performance and streamline operational processes</li> <li>Test, accept, and implement desktop/Imaging software/hardware technology changes</li> <li>Utilize industry business standard problem management systems (eg. BMC Remedy/ITSM)</li> <li>Manage MS SharePoint team site by applying information management and user centered design techniques</li> <li>Work with IT specialists and developers around the globe to deploy new products and refine existing systems</li> <li>Interface with technical experts and external vendors</li> </ul> <strong>Qualifications</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Academic:</strong>  <ul>  	<li>3rd or 4th year Computer/Electrical/Software Engineering, Computer Science or Information Systems/Technology Management students interested in a career in Information Technology</li> <li>To be considered for employment, your most recent unofficial transcript(s) must be submitted with your application</li> </ul> <strong>Other:</strong>  <ul>  	<li>Work effectively in a team environment to accomplish organizational goals</li> <li>Demonstrate sound analytical and problem-solving skills</li> <li>Highly motivated individual</li> <li>Strong inter-personal, listening, verbal, and written communication skills</li> <li>Familiarity with MS Suite including SharePoint/portal development would be an asset</li> <li>Knowledge of SQL, Python, VBA, JavaScript, Angular JS, HTML, CSS, ASP.NET and/or web programming desired</li> </ul> <strong>Start date:</strong>September 2018 (start date negotiable) <br/><br/> <strong>Work term:</strong> 12 months preferred, 8 months considered <br/><br/> <strong>Location:</strong> Calgary, Alberta <br/><br/> <strong>Your benefits</strong> <br/><br/> This position will provide you with an opportunity to leverage your skills in support of a large integrated resource company. You will be provided an opportunity to:  <ul>  	<li>Work in a high caliber, collaborative learning environment</li> <li>Receive on-the-job experience, coaching and training</li> <li>Opportunity to develop leadership and communication skills</li> <li>Develop deeper understanding of desktop, client/server, print and network technologies</li> <li>Work with various kinds of business units to deliver desktop solutions and achieve business goals</li> <li>Work with a geographically distributed team across Canada</li> <li>Gain business knowledge of the oil & gas resource industry through various networking programs</li> </ul> <strong>Who we are</strong> <br/><br/> At ExxonMobil Business Support Centre Canada ULC (EMBSCC) we are an integral part of a worldwide network of business support centres that provide financial, technical, information service, transactional, and customer service support for ExxonMobil’s global operations. <br/><br/> <strong>Other considerations</strong>  <ul>  	<li>For applicants selected to be interviewed, pre-employment background screening will be required.</li> <li>We thank all those who apply; however, only those candidates selected for interviews will be contacted.</li> </ul> <strong>Eligibility to work in Canada</strong> <br/><br/> Applicants must be eligible to work in Canada. Proof of eligibility must be in the form of a Canadian birth certificate, Canadian passport, Canadian citizenship certificate, Canadian certificate of permanent residence or work permit. Document must be current and valid (not expired, cancelled or voided). Work permit must be valid for the duration of the term. Proof of eligibility is required if an offer is made. Failure to provide the appropriate documentation within a reasonable timeframe (generally 6 weeks prior to your start date) may result in the offer being rescinded or a delay in your start date. <br/><br/> <strong>Application deadline:</strong> May 13, 2018</div> <br/>The ExxonMobil Business Support Centre Canada is committed to providing equitable treatment and equal opportunity to all individuals. <br/><br/> In certain situations, ExxonMobil may use your application to consider your suitability for other positions within the Company and may also provide the information to its affiliates, including Imperial Oil and affiliates of Exxon Mobil Corporation, in connection with possible opportunities at those affiliates.</div>  </div>  </div>  </div> <br/><strong>Job Segment:</strong>  <br/>  Systems Analyst, Developer, Electrical, Engineer, Consulting, Technology, Engineering</div>  <br/>Apply now »<br/>   <div> Apply now    <ul>    <li> <br/> <br/>  Start apply with LinkedIn</li> <br/><br/> <li> <br/> <br/>  Start apply with Facebook</li> <br/><br/> <li> <br/> <br/>  Start apply with Xing</li> <br/><br/> <li> <br/> <br/>  Start apply with Seek</li> <br/><br/> <li> <br/>  Apply Now</li><br/>  <div> <div> <div> Start</div>  </div>  </div>  <br/><li>  <div> <strong>Please wait...</strong></div> </li>  </ul>   </div> </div>  <br/>

Job_Description: <div> <div> Document Control Analyst <br/>  <div> Apply now »</div>  </div> <br/><strong>Date:</strong>  <br/>  May 14, 2018 <br/><br/> <strong>Location:</strong> <br/>  Calgary, AB, CA <br/><br/> <strong>Company:</strong>  <br/>  TransCanada<br/> <div> <div> <div> <div><strong>Document Control Analyst</strong> <br/><br/> Reference Code: 51258</div> </div> </div><br/>  <div><strong>Location:</strong> Canada (CA) - Calgary, AB</div><br/>  <div><strong>Job Category:</strong> Administration</div><br/>  <div><strong>Employment Type:</strong> Employee Full-time</div><br/>  <div><strong>Relocation Eligibility:</strong> This position is not eligible for our relocation program</div> <br/><strong>General Information</strong> <br/><br/> This position reports to the Manager of Planning and Optimization on the Energy Engineering and Operations Team. The role requires advanced technical knowledge and is the Information Management Subject Matter Expert (SME) within the Business Unit. As the Corporate requirements for Information Management transform, this role ensures the Business meets the requirements of the corporation in a manner that will satisfy the Business and enhance performance. <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities</strong>  <ul>  	<li>Identify opportunities and make recommendations for improvements in the content server and implement efficiencies to satisfy business requirements;</li> <li>Analyze, correct and adjust information on existing TransCanada repositories to ensure information is retrievable and up to date;</li> <li>Develop and implement consistent taxonomy and metadata for department information;</li> <li>Develop and implement the document management process for Projects inclusive of guidelines;</li> <li>Work with Field users to retrieve records and documents and assist with technical issues or questions with system functionalities or inconsistencies;</li> <li>Develop strategic plans and work with information owners to ensure that records are properly stored in a consistent format for the department;</li> <li>Lead and represent Energy Operations on Corporate information management initiatives inclusive of:   <ul>   <li>Accountability for the updating and transfer of information into the Controlled Document Library which includes TransCanada Operating Procedures, Site specific instructions, Business practices and Engineering Standards</li> <li>Leading the implementation of transitioning existing documents in various forms into the Open Text content server;   <ul>   <li>Developing governance practices for content managed in OpenText</li> <li>Working with the Asset Information Team (AIM) in the Technical Centre to ensure corporate deliverables are met</li> <li>Providing the technical expertise to the plant managers and Project Managers to align a consistent folder structure and methodology</li> </ul>   </li> </ul>  	</li> <li>Manage physical records: index information in TransCanada’s system, organize and package boxes of records and submit requests to send records off-site as required;</li> <li>Other tasks as required.</li>  </ul> <strong>Qualifications</strong>  <ul>  	<li>Analytical and strategic thinking to problem solve and drive continuous improvement;</li> <li>Effective in collaborating and leading the standardization of a new tool;</li> <li>Extensive knowledge of information management best practices;</li> <li>Independent, self-motivated and accountable;</li> <li>Accomplished problem-solving skills;</li> <li>Good listening skills and Judgement to determine which concerns may be ‘show stoppers’;</li> <li>High level of attention to detail;</li> <li>Effective organizational, planning and time management skills;</li> <li>Excellent communication skills, both written and verbally;</li> <li>Ability to make sound business decisions and good judgment.</li> </ul> <strong>Education/Experience</strong>  <ul>  	<li>Post Secondary education and minimum 5 years of related work experience;</li> <li>Proven success in document control analysis;</li> <li>Expertise in information management;</li> <li>Advanced level Microsoft Office skills;</li> <li>Experience within the Energy industry is preferred;</li> <li>Experience with FileNet, P8 and/or OpenText content server is considered an asset.</li> </ul> *Depending on the qualifications of the applicants, the successful candidate may be offered a position at a more appropriate level and/or ladder. <br/><br/> Applicants must have legal authorization to work in the country in which the position is based with no This role will allow you to develop your business knowledge of the oil and gas industry, experience working in a global IT organization and communication skills through extensive collaboration within Imperial Oil and ExxonMobil teams across Canada and around the world. <br/><br/> As a member of the UIT team, you will:  <ul>  	<li>Help promote IT capabilities by understanding Upstream business needs and consult on technology or work with other IT teams to develop effective IT solutions (e.g. process improvements through use of IT technology)</li> <li>Interface with other IT teams locally and globally to support the effective delivery of technical solutions, process improvements and support to resolve issues in a timely manner</li> <li>Learn how to use productivity software (e.g. SharePoint, OneNote, InfoPath) and deliver training as needed</li> <li>Learn and support the team SharePoint website to improve team collaboration</li> <li>Coordinate other IT activities as needed to support a broad range of Upstream customers across Canada</li> </ul> <strong>Qualifications</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Academic:</strong>  <ul>  	<li>3rd or 4th year Computer/Electrical/Software Engineering, Computer Science or Information Systems students interested in a career in information technology.</li> <li>To be considered for employment, your most recent unofficial transcript(s) must be submitted with your application</li> </ul> <strong>Other:</strong>  <ul>  	<li>Strong interpersonal, listening, verbal and written communication skills</li> <li>Ability to work effectively in a team environment to accomplish organizational goals</li> <li>Highly motivated individual able to work with minimal supervision and build network of contacts</li> <li>Continuous improvement mindset with ability to identify problems and drive resolution</li> <li>Flexibility in dealing with changing priorities and short deadlines</li> <li>Rapidly learn and apply new IT technologies, along with the ability to teach/train others</li> <li>Travel to sites may be required</li> </ul> <strong>Start date:</strong>September 2018 (start date negotiable) <br/><br/> <strong>Work term:</strong> 8 months preferred, 12 months considered <br/><br/> <strong>Location:</strong> Calgary, Alberta <br/><br/> <strong>Your benefits</strong> <br/><br/> This position will provide you with an opportunity to leverage your skills in support of a large integrated oil company. You will be provided an opportunity to:  <ul>  	<li>Work in a high caliber, collaborative learning environment</li> <li>Receive on-the-job experience, coaching and training</li> <li>Gain technical and business background in the operations of the oil & gas resource industry through participation in various networking programs</li> <li>Work with a geographically distributed team across Canada</li> <li>Learn about various technologies and how to use them to enhance productivity</li> <li>Work directly with business units to deliver IT solutions to meet their needs</li> </ul> <strong>Who we are</strong> <br/><br/> At ExxonMobil Business Support Centre Canada ULC (EMBSCC) we are an integral part of a worldwide network of business support centres that provide financial, technical, information service, transactional, and customer service support for ExxonMobil’s global operations. <br/><br/> <strong>Other considerations</strong>  <ul>  	<li>For applicants selected to be interviewed, pre-employment background screening will be required.</li> <li>We thank all those who apply; however, only those candidates selected for interviews will be contacted.</li> </ul> <strong>Eligibility to work in Canada</strong> <br/><br/> Applicants must be eligible to work in Canada. Proof of eligibility must be in the form of a Canadian birth certificate, Canadian passport, Canadian citizenship certificate, Canadian certificate of permanent residence or work permit. Document must be current and valid (not expired, cancelled or voided). Work permit must be valid for the duration of the term. Proof of eligibility is required if an offer is made. Failure to provide the appropriate documentation within a reasonable timeframe (generally 6 weeks prior to your start date) may result in the offer being rescinded or a delay in your start date. <br/><br/> <strong>Application deadline:</strong> May 13, 2018</div> <br/>The ExxonMobil Business Support Centre Canada is committed to providing equitable treatment and equal opportunity to all individuals. <br/><br/> In certain situations, ExxonMobil may use your application to consider your suitability for other positions within the Company and may also provide the information to its affiliates, including Imperial Oil and affiliates of Exxon Mobil Corporation, in connection with possible opportunities at those affiliates.</div>  </div>  </div>  </div> <br/><strong>Job Segment:</strong>  <br/>  Gas, Gas Technician, Information Technology, Developer, Engineer, Energy, Technology, Engineering</div>  <br/>Apply now »<br/>   <div> Apply now    <ul>    <li> <br/> <br/>  Start apply with LinkedIn</li> <br/><br/> <li> <br/> <br/>  Start apply with Facebook</li> <br/><br/> <li> <br/> <br/>  Start apply with Xing</li> <br/><br/> <li> <br/> <br/>  Start apply with Seek</li> <br/><br/> <li> <br/>  Apply Now</li><br/>  <div> <div> <div> Start</div>  </div>  </div>  <br/><li>  <div> <strong>Please wait...</strong></div> </li>  </ul>   </div> </div>  <br/>

Job_Description: Why work for Lafarge? <br/>  <br/> <em>Lafarge</em> in Canada is proud to provide construction solutions in the buildings, infrastructure and industrial segments. These solutions are built with high performance products from our cement, aggregates, ready-mix concrete, asphalt and road construction, and concrete products divisions. From the use of alternative materials and recycling to renewable energy, Lafarge's focus is to develop innovative products that can contribute toward <em>sustainably</em>constructed building solutions. Lafarge takes <em>personal growth and development</em> to heart, and provides resources for our employees to take control of their own careers. Through our commitment to communities, to the health and safety of our employees and their families, or through the many volunteer hours of our employees, Lafarge demonstrates our care for people. If you want to work in an environment that values hard work, entrepreneurship, and collaborative teamwork, Lafarge is for you. <em>Building Better Cities</em> is what we do. Come <em>Build a Better Career</em>with us! More information can be found at www.lafarge-na.com/careers . <br/>  <br/> Overview <br/>  <br/> Exciting opportunity to learn from and contribute to a world class IT Service Centre (ITSC). The ITSM Ops Analyst (Internship) works with the ITSC teams to provide operational execution on projects and steady-state ongoing activities. <br/><br/> This will be an 8 month contract. Looking to have somebody start in January and will work to August, possible December depending on needs and availability. <br/>  <br/> <strong>Responsibilities</strong> <br/>  <br/> This role will provide Tier 2-3 support services and act as an escalation point for the Service Desk and other IT Teams while ensuring that service levels are achieved. This role will be responsible for contributing to IT and Business projects as related to services such as Collaboration, Network, Endpoints, and software. The ITSM Ops Analyst (Internship) is will have the opportunity to learn LafargeHolcim business processes as well as industry standard IT processes and how they work together to ensure success superior execution excellence. The role will require interactions with business end users, relationship managers and project managers. This role works on assignments that are complex in nature and require judgment, initiative, and communication to resolve problems and/or develop recommended solutions. Work is completed with minimal supervision and assignments may be completed without established procedures. The ITSM Ops Analyst (Internship) role will be responsible for formal documentation around processes and procedures. <br/>  <br/> <strong>Qualifications</strong> <br/>  <br/> <strong>Level of education/qualifications normally required:</strong>   <ul>   <li>Degree or diploma in Computer Science, Engineering or related discipline with an IT focus - can be in school still</li> <li>Valid Driver’s License and functioning car</li> <li>Ability to lift up to 30 lbs</li> </ul>  <strong>Specific work experience:</strong>    <ul>   <li>Technical knowledge of IT</li> <li>Understanding of IT services, technology and solutions</li> <li>Experience Microsoft and Google products an asset</li> <li>Experience in a related industry setting (manufacturing) an asset</li> <li>Experience in a customer service environment as asset</li> <li>Experience with ITSM/ITIL applications (ServiceNow)</li> </ul>  <strong>Technical / functional skills:</strong>    <ul>   <li>Keen interest in existing and emerging hardware and software technologies and IT architectures</li> <li>Competency in delivering efficient and effective solutions to diverse and complex business problems</li> <li>Ability to translate technical knowledge into a more easily consumable format (laymen terms)</li> <li>Strong communication skills</li> <li>Technical documentation skills</li>   <li>Analytical and troubleshooting skills</li> </ul>  <strong>Behavioral competencies:</strong>    <ul>   <li>Ability to work decisively in a fast paced environment</li> <li>Ability to meet deadlines and service level agreements</li> <li>Ability to quickly adapt to and from single person to team working environments</li> <li>Highly self-motivated and directed</li> <li>Keen attention to detail</li> <li>Diverse capability for problem solving, decision making and sound judgment</li> <li>Strong organizational and communications skills</li> <li>Highly professional demeanor with the ability to speak confidently, courteously and credibly to all levels of management.</li> <li>Work effectively in the face of ambiguity, shifting priorities and rapid change while actively developing one’s skills and capabilities</li> <li>Foster a business focused environment delivering exceptional customer service and anticipating future customer needs</li> </ul>  <strong>Linguistic skills:</strong>    <ul>   <li>Excellent English (written & spoken) - other languages specific to region are a plus</li> </ul>  <strong>Mobility requirements</strong> <em>(time spent travelling internationally, nationally etc.)</em><strong>:</strong>    <ul>   <li>Regional travel required: 20%</li> </ul>  LafargeHolcim <br/>  <br/> <strong>Why work for us?</strong> <br/><br/> Working for Lafarge offers a wide variety of career opportunities that utilize your abilities and skills to contribute to a better world. In addition to local and global developmental opportunities, we provide employees with competitive compensation, a comprehensive benefits plan, a health & wellness program with financial incentives, an extensive global e-learning platform and much more! More information can be found at www.lafarge-na.com/careers <br/><br/> www.lafarge-na.com <br/><br/> www.lafargeholcim.com <br/><br/> We thank you for your interest. Only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted. LafargeHolcim is committed to the principles of employment equity and encourages the applications from women, visible minorities, and persons with disabilities.
