Job_Description: <strong><u>Key Responsibilities:</u></strong>   <ul> <li>Identifying, writing and managing business requirements</li>  <li>Creating test cases, conducting functional tests and providing QA of end user testing</li>  <li>Contributing to the functional and technical design, prototyping, and process design stages of implementations (including scenario design, flow mapping)</li>  <li>Supporting configurations, customization, reports and interfaces, testing and user training</li>  <li>Creates business process flow charts for customer and technical review</li> </ul>  <strong><u>Qualifications</u></strong> <br/> <strong>Must have:</strong> <br/><br/> <strong> <ul> <li>Functional understanding of Oracle (R13 Preferable):</li> </ul>  </strong> <br/> <strong>SCM Role (Supply Chain Management)</strong>   <ul> <li>Fusion Cloud Manufacturing and Inventory</li>  <li>Fusion Cloud Order Management, including Distributed Order Orchestration</li>  <li>WMS Cloud</li>  <li>Fusion Planning Central</li>  <li>Fusion Cloud Product Management</li></ul>   <ul> <li>Deep understanding of Supply Chain warehouse management processes</li> </ul>  <strong>Finance Role</strong>   <ul> <li>Fusion Cloud Accounts Payable</li>  <li>Fusion Cloud Accounts Receivable</li>  <li>Fusion Cloud Cash Management</li>  <li>Fusion Cloud Fixed Assets</li>  <li>Fusions Cloud General Ledge</li>  <li>Cloud Project Costing / Project Accounting</li>  <li>Cloud Tax</li></ul>   <ul> <li>Deep understanding of Finance & Accounting processes</li> </ul>  Technical   <ul> <li>Fusion Cloud Security</li>  <li>Demonstrated ability to <strong>configure</strong> Oracle Fusion Cloud modules based on business requirements and to validate/modify existing configuration to adapt to new business requirements (author BR100)</li>  <li>Demonstrated understanding of integration technologies and development methodologies (Oracle ICS Cloud, Oracle MFT Cloud, Oracle JCS/SOA Cloud)</li> </ul>
Title: Oracle Cloud (Finance & SCM) Functional Analyst

Job_Description: Company Description<br/><br/><strong>Mariner xVu is the worlds most deployed IP video monitoring solution</strong> <br/><br/> Mariner xVu is the world leader in Software Defined Monitoring for managed and unmanaged IP video, streaming and broadband/Wi-Fi networks. Our software helps operators centrally manage the complexity required to deliver new video services with real-time visibility into subscriber experience anywhere. <br/><br/> <strong>Mariner xVu is part of the Mariner Partners group of companies</strong>, known for investing in and building technology companies with themes of big data, software innovation, commitment to customer success and developing international growth markets. In addition to Mariner xVu, Mariner Partners consists of Mariner Innovations, Shift Energy and East Valley Ventures: <ul> <li><strong><em>East Valley</em></strong>, the start-up acceleration division of Mariner Partners, has made over 30 investments, with multiple exits, including Q1 Labs, Internet Security for Banking, sold to IBM; and Radian6, Marketing Cloud Analytics sold to SalesForce.com. The organization specializes in mentoring and providing support to entrepreneurs.</li><li><strong><em>Mariner Innovations</em></strong> is a leading provider of professional IT services, offering unique expertise in application development, information security, data management and support/maintenance services across communications, industrial, utility and the public sector</li><li><strong><em>Shift Energys</em></strong> Energy Optimization System [EOS] automates the real time tuning of independent energy systems for large building complexes. The worlds leading building managers are using Internet-based Big Data and low cost IoT sensors to drive down energy operational costs.</li> </ul> Founded in 2003, Mariner Partners head office is located in Saint John, New Brunswick. We believe in making a positive impact in the communities where we live and work our team and our customers are located in major cities across Canada and in North and South America and Europe. <br/><br/> <strong>Why Mariner Partners?</strong> <br/><br/> We believe in making a positive impact in the communities where we live and work our team is located in major cities all across Canada, throughout the US and internationally. We offer competitive compensation; benefits packages and training and development. <br/><br/> We recognize that empowered employees are more innovative, more efficient, deliver better customer service and can flat out-perform conventional organizations. Our people have built products for national deployments at the worlds largest TV and Internet companies and leading real estate, financial and government organizations. <br/><br/> We are looking for passionate IT professionals who are curious about data, who love solving problems for customers and who want to grow their careers.<br/><br/>Job Description<br/><br/>Are you ready to put your data analysis skills to work in a fast-paced and challenging environment? We are looking for candidates that have a breadth of technical expertise including the ability to collect requirements, develop plans of action, analyze and report. A significant portion of this role will include data mining, cleansing and modeling. Experience with BI tools such as Microstrategy or Tableau is desired as well as scripting experience in either Python or R. <br/><br/> This is an opportunity to join a well-established and agile technology company. Our video, broadband and WiFi products are used by a number of large IP communication providers around the world and provide insight into customer usage patterns and service quality levels. We process massive amounts of data and this position will give you the chance to work with large databases and to gain experience in a fast-paced environment. You will be empowered to explore the data for insights and to present the findings in creative ways. Data visualization is a significant component of this role and you will have the opportunity to quickly integrate into existing projects. <br/><br/> <strong>Typical job responsibilities:</strong> <ul> <li>Ad-hoc analysis to determine quality of performance, service performance trends and similar key operational patterns/insights</li><li>Report development and build dashboards to provide the insights at scale</li><li>Support of analytical requests from Customers, Operations and Sales teams</li><li>Provide statistical and machine learning leadership to the internal teams.</li> </ul> <strong>As our Ideal Candidate:</strong> <ul> <li>You have a strong background in gathering data and applying statistical methods</li><li>You are curious and able to pull out actionable insights from large datasets</li><li>You have strong attention to detail and are able to understand the big picture</li><li>You are a self-starter with a high degree of organization and discipline to achieve desired results</li><li>You embrace challenges in an ever-changing environment</li> </ul>  <strong>Qualifications</strong>  <ul> <li>BA/BSc degree in Statistics or related field (Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics)</li><li>Scientific Computing, Statistics, Data Analytics, Machine Learning or equivalent experienc</li><li>Very comfortable with databases (Oracle, PostgreSQL, Hadoop, etc.), Business Intelligence tools (MicroStrategy, Tableau or similar) and scripting languages (Python, R)</li><li>Strong written and verbal (English) communication skills</li><li>Above-average problem solving skills with great intuition, curiosity and ability to clearly articulate findings to various stakeholders</li> </ul>  Additional Information<br/><br/>All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.
Title: Data Analyst

Job_Description: <div><div><div>     </div>  <strong> PeopleSoft HRMS Functional Analyst </strong> <div> <div>  Job Category  <strong> Systems Analyst </strong> </div> <div>  Job Location  <strong> Calgary, AB, Edmonton, AB, Ottawa, ON, Regina, SK, Toronto, ON, Vancouver, BC, Victoria, BC, Winnipeg, MB </strong> </div> <div>  Last Updated  <strong> 09/02/17 5:19 PM </strong> </div> </div> </div>  Apply Now </div> <div><p><strong>PeopleSoft HRMS/HCM Functional Analysts – All regions in Canada<br> Reference No.880</strong></p> <p>We are currently seeking PeopleSoft professionals throughout all regions in Canada. In this position, you will provide business analysis and functional expertise on PeopleSoft HRMS/HCM implementation and upgrade projects. Performs project activities related to requirements gathering and fit/gap analysis, system design, core table setup, testing and training in support of PeopleSoft HCM modules. Strong functional knowledge of HR operations and business processes is desired.</p> <p><strong>Key Areas of Responsibility</strong></p> <ul> <li>Hands on experience implementing PeopleSoft HRMS/HCM modules in the following functional areas: Core HR, Benefits - Base and/or Benefits Admin, Payroll – North American/Global and Payroll Interface, Time & Labor, Recruiting/Staffing, Talent Acquisition Management, Candidate Gateway, Learning Management/ELM, Training, Position Management, Performance Management, Absence Management, ESS and MSS, Succession Planning, Health & Safety.</li> <li>Experience with foundation table setup.</li> <li>Knowledge of integrations between the functional areas.</li> <li>Practiced at requirements gathering techniques, facilitating meetings, technical documentation, testing methodologies and able to articulate complex ideas clearly.</li> <li>Strong working relationships with end-user community and team members</li> <li>In-depth knowledge of human resource and payroll processes,</li> <li>Excellent analytical, interpersonal and communication skills,</li> <li>Self-starter and able to work independently.</li> </ul> <p><strong>Professional Qualifications & Experience</strong></p> <ul> <li>3 -5 years’ experience implementing large PeopleSoft projects</li> <li>Ability to travel</li> <li>Experience with PeopleSoft HCM v9.x.</li> <li>Exposure to PeopleSoft v. 9.2 a plus</li> <li>Project Management or team leadership experience a plus.</li> <li>Legally able to work in Canada. Must already possess US or Canadian citizenship, Canadian Permanent Resident status or an open Canadian work permit</li> </ul> <p>______________________<br> <strong>Who we are</strong></p> <p>Headquartered in Vancouver, British Columbia and founded in 1966, Sierra Systems is a top tier IT services and management consulting firm offering a full range of advisory services, systems integration, and managed application services.</p> <p>With approximately 800 professionals across Canada, Sierra Systems has developed deep expertise in its targeted industries and has earned a reputation for delivering superior solutions that strengthen organizations’ operational performance.</p> <p>Our unwavering commitment to our clients’ needs has allowed us to build long-term, trusting, and loyal relationships. It has given us the ability to set ambitious objectives for client projects and meet them time and time again with unparalleled speed and precision.</p> <p>We offer a full range of management consulting, systems integration and managed services tailored to the unique needs of each industry in which we have deep expertise – including: Canadian government, justice, health, energy, and the commercial sector. We focus on delivering a boutique experience backed by the resources, deep knowledge, and expertise our 50-year heritage provides to tackle large scale projects.</p> <p><strong>What to expect</strong></p> <p>Sierra Systems is committed to a working environment that fosters professional and personal progression, communication, and collaboration. We offer opportunities for personal growth and professional development at every career level.</p> <p>We are regularly recognized as a Top Employer , in part due to the compensation and benefits packages we offer which are just one of the many great reasons to join Sierra Systems.</p> <p>www.sierrasystems.com | Facebook | Google+ | LinkedIn | Twitter</p> <p> </p> <p> </p></div>
Title: PeopleSoft HRMS Functional Analyst

Job_Description: <strong>LOCATION:</strong> Calgary, Alberta (CA-AB) <br/> <strong>JOB NUMBER:</strong> 22487 <br/>   <br/><br/> <strong>Job Overview</strong> <br/><br/> In this temporary position, you will report to the manager, vendor audit. You will be responsible for analyzing data and performance of predominantly statutory burden reconciliation for various vendors and for providing data analysis to support the manager and other auditors in the team for specific vendor contracts. <br/><br/> <strong>Key Accountabilities</strong> <ul> <li>Report control weaknesses and occurrences of contract non-compliance as well as providing independent recommendations for improvement in controls and processes</li><li>Summarize findings clearly and effectively as well as review commercial templates and contracts for control and cost weaknesses</li><li>Perform statutory burden and ad-hoc reconciliations, volume rebate calculations</li><li>Document findings, present and report results as well as support negotiations to close reconciliation in a timely manner</li><li>Present audit results to management and vendors in a professionally written report</li><li>Develop and maintain relationships and communication channels with supply chain and able to resolve problems with contracts and invoices with affected parties</li><li>Execute data extraction and analysis and prepare working paper files; document testing and findings</li> </ul> <strong>Required Qualifications</strong> <br/><br/> Experience and Education <ul> <li>Post-secondary education in accounting/finance</li><li>Certified Internal Auditor designation is an asset</li> <li>High School Diploma or General Education Diploma (GED)</li> </ul> Skills and Knowledge <ul> <li>Strong understanding of audit practices and procedures and experience in their practical application</li><li>Advanced computer skills in the Microsoft office suite including the ability to construct pivot tables in excel</li><li>Superior SAP knowledge, understanding of ACL and SQL would be an asset</li><li>Oil and gas experience and knowledge of sampling and testing procedures is preferred</li><li>Excellent flexibility in handling multiple tasks and priorities with strong attention to detail</li><li>Exceptional analytical skills, critical thinking and problem-solving skills</li><li>We value a self starter with the ability to work effectively with minimal supervision to independently prioritize and handle workload; in particular, exercising independent discernment in planning, organizing, implementing and completing projects and initiatives</li><li>You constantly ask what could go wrong and check for out-of-the-ordinary conditions and learn to anticipate potential problems</li> </ul> <strong>Working Conditions</strong> <ul> <li>This is an 6-month temporary role at the Calgary office</li> </ul> <strong>Why Suncor</strong> <br/> Go ahead. Expect growth. We want you to have a job you're genuinely excited about - as well as opportunities to learn and challenge yourself or mentor others. Plus, Suncor Energy offers a flexible employee package that can be adjusted to suit the changing needs of your life, including: <ul> <li>Competitive base salary and compensation programs</li><li>Attractive annual incentive program</li><li>Flexible benefits package</li><li>Rewarding pension and savings plans</li> </ul> Our mission to create energy for a better world begins with caring about the communities we live and work in, while responding to your interests and concerns. Read our Suncor Connections newsletter to see how we're living up to our commitment to keeping you informed. <br/><br/> <strong>Business Overview</strong> <br/> Suncor Energy is Canada's energy company - meaning rewarding opportunities for you to apply your knowledge, contribute and grow in a variety of career-building positions. Our business portfolio spans the entire energy sector, from a leadership position in oil sands development, to refining and marketing operations, natural gas, and conventional oil production, internationally and offshore East Coast Canada. <br/><br/> And while we are working to responsibly develop petroleum resources and contribute to the communities where we live and work, we are also developing our renewable energy portfolio, which includes wind power and biofuels. <br/><br/> As part of Suncor's team, you'll contribute to the ongoing success of Canada's largest energy company - one with a solid track record of growth, a focus on safety and sustainability and tremendous potential for the future. And you'll have the opportunity to learn from experts in the industry and build on your skills every day. <br/><br/> Suncor promotes diversity and inclusion in the workplace. Suncor is an equal opportunity employer and encourages applications from all qualified individuals. Suncor is committed to accessibility and accommodations will be provided to applicants upon request. At Suncor, we are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of the communities in which we live, and where every team member has the opportunity to reach their full potential. <br/><br/> Not sure if this particular listing is the right opportunity for you? Please join our Talent Community at www.suncor.com and click on Careers, or follow us on LinkedIn, Facebook and Twitter for the latest job listings and employment news. <br/><br/> <strong>Please note that our job postings are typically open for two weeks, so if you are interested and qualified, apply now.</strong> <br/><br/> JOB CATEGORY: Business Professionals
Title: Analyst, Vendor Audit

Job_Description: <strong>Company Profile</strong>:Parkland is unique<strong>. We fuel communities by safely delivering high-quality petroleum products to motorists, businesses, consumers and wholesale customers across North America. Through unrivaled dependability and service, we connect communities to the products they need to heat their homes, fuel their industries and drive their economies. <br/> Parkland is strong</strong>. We are one of North Americas fastest growing and largest independent distributors and marketers of fuels and lubricants. Our family includes Bluewave Energy, Columbia Fuels, Elbow River Marketing, Island Petroleum, Fas Gas Plus, Farstad Oil, Les Pétroles Parkland, Pioneer Energy, Sparlings, and Superpumper Inc. <br/> <strong>Parkland is growing</strong>. Our organization is powered by effective leadership, progressive strategies and industry-leading best practices but more importantly, it is driven by talented, customer-focused people who value integrity, innovation and quality. We are looking for good-natured, hard-working candidates who want to build a rewarding career in a dynamic and collaborative work environment. We are a family and our family continues to grow. <br/><br/> Our main priority at Parkland is our people. As an employee, you can expect a fair workplace, a professional work environment, competitive compensation, outstanding benefits, and a share in our success through the Employee Share Purchase Plan Join us. <br/><br/> <strong>POSITION DESCRIPTION</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>WSP</strong> is currently seeking a Senior Quality Analyst to join our Geomatics Group, located at our Calgary, AB office. statistics, acting as Client liaison for project quality issues)</li> <li>Leading internal project, process, program and system Quality Audits</li> <li>Acting as a WSP Quality Network Individual, performing Project Health Checks</li> <li>Managing Quality issues investigation, tracking and reporting</li> <li>Escalating High-Risk Quality Action Requests to Director, Quality & PMO, Geomatics</li> 9001 standard</li> <li>High level of proficiency in Microsoft Office</li> <li>Geomatics knowledge is an asset</li> <li>Bentley ProjectWise software experience is an asset</li> <li>Quality certification is an asset</li> <li>French language skill is an asset</li> <li>High level of proficiency in deductive reasoning</li> <li>Can work unsupervised, but works well with others</li> Job_Description: <strong>Position Title: People and Culture Systems Analyst</strong> <br/> <strong>Team and Location: Calgary</strong> <br/> <strong>Company Profile</strong>:Parkland is unique. We fuel communities by safely delivering high-quality petroleum products to motorists, businesses, consumers and wholesale customers across North America. Through unrivaled dependability and service, we connect communities to the products they need to heat their homes, fuel their industries and drive their economies. <br/><br/> <strong>Parkland is strong</strong>. We are one of North Americas fastest growing and largest independent distributors and marketers of fuels and lubricants. Our family includes Bluewave Energy, Columbia Fuels, Elbow River Marketing, Island Petroleum, Fas Gas Plus, Farstad Oil, Les Pétroles Parkland, Pioneer Energy, Sparlings, Superpumper Inc. and the Ultramar Brand. <br/><br/> <strong>Parkland is growing</strong>. Our organization is powered by effective leadership, progressive strategies and industry-leading best practices but more importantly, it is driven by talented, customer-focused people who value integrity, innovation and quality. We are looking for good-natured, hard-working candidates who want to build a rewarding career in a dynamic and collaborative work environment. We are a family and our family continues to grow. <br/> <strong>Position Description</strong> <br/><br/> Reporting to the Manager, HCM this 12-month term role is responsible for effectively processing and delivering customer service excellence solutions for both HRIS business needs and projects. <br/> <strong>Key Responsibilities</strong>: <ul> <li>Analyze, input, and verify HR transactions in Ultimate</li><li>Execute day-to-day Human Resources Information System (HRIS) administration, maintaining the highest level of data integrity, timeliness and confidentiality</li><li>Update information systems as required (e.g. hires/position changes/ terminations etc.) and maintaining other employee related tracking databases</li><li>Act as a point of contact for HR and Payroll inquiries</li><li>Answer general calls and electronic requests pertaining to Human Resource programs and procedures as well as other inquiries in more specialized areas, such as benefits, payroll, etc.</li><li>Support the operational project teams during implementation of projects.</li><li>Identify and escalate complex inquiries or cases as needed</li><li>Assist with preparation and submitting of payroll for hourly employees on a bi-weekly basis <br/> <strong>Qualifications and Experience required</strong>:</li><li>Excellent analytical, problem solving and critical thinking skills. Highly process oriented with developed quantitative and qualitative analytical skills.</li><li>Advanced Proficiency with MS Excel, Outlook and PowerPoint - superior skills with techniques and tools relevant to data analytics including macros, pivots, Excel formulas.</li><li>keen attention to detail and deadlines</li><li>Ability to work independently.</li><li>Hands on working experience with Ultimate software is preferred</li><li>Payroll Professional Certification would be considered an asset</li><li>Strong understanding of Payroll and HR business rules is required</li><li>Flexible and adaptable to change</li><li>Proactive and collaborative team player with a strong customer service focus <br/> Our main priority at Parkland is our people. As an employee, you can expect a fair workplace, a professional work environment, competitive compensation, outstanding benefits, and a share in our success through the Employee Share Purchase Plan and our Annual Incentive Plan.</li> </ul> Our preferred method of application is online at www.parkland.ca <br/><br/> We thank all candidates in advance for their interest, however only those being considered will be contacted. <br/> <strong>Parkland Fuel Corporation is committed to the principles of Employment Equity.</strong> <br/><br/> We strive to provide accessibility in employment to ensure equal access to employment opportunities for candidates, including persons with disabilities. Parkland Fuel Corporation will endeavour to provide accommodation to persons with disabilities in the recruitment process upon request. If you are selected for an interview and you require accommodation due to a disability, please notify us upon scheduling your interview.

Job_Description: <em>Lafarge</em> in Canada is proud to provide construction solutions in the buildings, infrastructure and industrial segments. These solutions are built with high performance products from our cement, aggregates, ready-mix concrete, asphalt and road construction, and concrete products divisions. From the use of alternative materials and recycling to renewable energy, Lafarge's focus is to develop innovative products that can contribute toward <em>sustainably</em>constructed building solutions. Lafarge takes <em>personal growth and development</em> to heart, and provides resources for our employees to take control of their own careers. Through our commitment to communities, to the health and safety of our employees and their families, or through the many volunteer hours of our employees, Lafarge demonstrates our care for people. If you want to work in an environment that values hard work, entrepreneurship, and collaborative teamwork, Lafarge is for you. <em>Building Better Cities</em> is what we do. Come <em>Build a Better Career</em>with us! More information can be found at www.lafarge-na.com/careers . <br/><br/> Exciting opportunity to learn from and contribute to a world class IT Service Centre (ITSC). The ITSM Ops Analyst (Internship) works with the ITSC teams to provide operational execution on projects and steady-state ongoing activities. <br/><br/> This will be an 8 month contract. Looking to have somebody start in January and will work to August, possible December depending on needs and availability. <br/><br/> This role will provide Tier 2-3 support services and act as an escalation point for the Service Desk and other IT Teams while ensuring that service levels are achieved. This role will be responsible for contributing to IT and Business projects as related to services such as Collaboration, Network, Endpoints, and software. The ITSM Ops Analyst (Internship) is will have the opportunity to learn LafargeHolcim business processes as well as industry standard IT processes and how they work together to ensure success superior execution excellence. The role will require interactions with business end users, relationship managers and project managers. This role works on assignments that are complex in nature and require judgment, initiative, and communication to resolve problems and/or develop recommended solutions. Work is completed with minimal supervision and assignments may be completed without established procedures. The ITSM Ops Analyst (Internship) role will be responsible for formal documentation around processes and procedures. <br/><br/> <strong>Level of education/qualifications normally required:</strong> <ul> <li>Degree or diploma in Computer Science, Engineering or related discipline with an IT focus - can be in school still</li><li>Valid Driver’s License and functioning car</li><li>Ability to lift up to 30 lbs</li> </ul> <strong>Specific work experience:</strong> <ul> <li>Technical knowledge of IT</li><li>Understanding of IT services, technology and solutions</li><li>Experience Microsoft and Google products an asset</li><li>Experience in a related industry setting (manufacturing) an asset</li><li>Experience in a customer service environment as asset</li><li>Experience with ITSM/ITIL applications (ServiceNow)</li> </ul> <strong>Technical / functional skills:</strong> <ul> <li>Keen interest in existing and emerging hardware and software technologies and IT architectures</li><li>Competency in delivering efficient and effective solutions to diverse and complex business problems</li><li>Ability to translate technical knowledge into a more easily consumable format (laymen terms)</li><li>Strong communication skills</li><li>Technical documentation skills</li> <li>Analytical and troubleshooting skills</li> </ul> <strong>Behavioral competencies:</strong> <ul> <li>Ability to work decisively in a fast paced environment</li><li>Ability to meet deadlines and service level agreements</li><li>Ability to quickly adapt to and from single person to team working environments</li><li>Highly self-motivated and directed</li><li>Keen attention to detail</li><li>Diverse capability for problem solving, decision making and sound judgment</li><li>Strong organizational and communications skills</li><li>Highly professional demeanor with the ability to speak confidently, courteously and credibly to all levels of management.</li><li>Work effectively in the face of ambiguity, shifting priorities and rapid change while actively developing one’s skills and capabilities</li><li>Foster a business focused environment delivering exceptional customer service and anticipating future customer needs</li> </ul> <strong>Linguistic skills:</strong> <ul> <li>Excellent English (written & spoken) - other languages specific to region are a plus</li> </ul> <strong>Mobility requirements</strong> <em>(time spent travelling internationally, nationally etc.)</em><strong>:</strong> <ul> <li>Regional travel required: 20%</li> </ul> <strong>Why work for us?</strong> <br/><br/> Working for Lafarge offers a wide variety of career opportunities that utilize your abilities and skills to contribute to a better world. In addition to local and global developmental opportunities, we provide employees with competitive compensation, a comprehensive benefits plan, a health & wellness program with financial incentives, an extensive global e-learning platform and much more! More information can be found at www.lafarge-na.com/careers <br/><br/> www.lafarge-na.com <br/><br/> www.lafargeholcim.com <br/><br/> We thank you for your interest. Only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted. LafargeHolcim is committed to the principles of employment equity and encourages the applications from women, visible minorities, and persons with disabilities.

Job_Description: <div> Company Overview<br/><br/><strong>A global energy leader with an exciting future</strong>  <br/><br/> Nexen is an upstream oil and gas company responsibly developing energy resources in some of the world’s most significant basins, including the UK North Sea, offshore West Africa, the Gulf of Mexico and Western Canada. A wholly-owned subsidiary of CNOOC Limited, Nexen has three principal businesses: conventional oil and gas, oil sands, and shale gas. <br/><br/> As a wholly-owned subsidiary of CNOOC Limited, Nexen is better positioned than ever to realize our central purpose – creating value by responsibly supplying the energy that fuels people’s lives. While ownership has changed, our purpose, values and principle-based approach to doing business, remain unaltered. Our high standards of integrity and governance have earned us a global reputation for valuing the big picture: people, safety and the environment. Your contributions are rewarded with a highly competitive compensation package and a healthy work-life balance, and training that will open doors to your future.</div><br/>  <div> Location<br/><br/>Nexen’s head office in Calgary, Alberta, is home to almost all of our corporate support staff including human resources, finance, legal, supply chain management, information technology, as well as a number of asset teams. You’ll work alongside some of the best and most diverse talent in the energy industry.</div><br/>  <div> Position Overview <br/> <div> <div>The SAP FICO Business Analyst is a member of a team providing leadership, support and expertise to the SAP user community for activities related to Treasury, AP, FICO, Month End processes, Project Systems, Planning, JVA, etc. The position includes application support and enhancements with a focus on issue management, timely resolution of problems, and process improvements to ensure business benefits realization. This is a permanent position with the SAP Solution Centre (SSC) reporting to the Manager, IT Business Applications, SAP Finance.</div></div> </div><br/>  <div> Job Duties & Responsibilities   <ul> <li>Provide consultation and advice to the global SAP user community on effective use of SAP for Treasury and Accounts Payable.</li> <li>Utilize SAP configuration skills in Treasury and AP to assist business in their requirements,</li> <li>Collaborate with other team members on other SAP modules, i.e. FICO, MM, JVA , AM, ECCS, PM, etc,</li> <li>Advise SSC team members in regard to their business process and SAP design enhancements that integrate with Treasury,</li> <li>Proactive resolution of SAP and / or business integration issues with other SSC groups including Logistics, Systems Development, Reporting and Training,</li> <li>Respond to and resolve SAP user requests, issues and problems within defined service levels,</li> <li>Identify and assist in development of reporting solutions to improve information delivery,</li> <li>Test changes and upgrades to existing functionality, including coordination of user testing,</li> <li>Assist in the development, maintenance and delivery of education strategies and training material,</li> <li>Employ critical thinking skills to meet both the short and long term business solutions for customers,</li> <li>Apply excellent interpersonal and communication skills along with a strong customer service focus to work effectively with the user groups and support team members.</li> </ul>  </div><br/>  <div> Education & Experience   <ul> <li>SAP support experience in Treasury and Accounts Payable is required,</li> <li>Experience in other SAP modules (i.e. FICO, JVA, AM, etc) is considered an asset</li> <li>Combined strong business background relating to finance and accounting, ideally in upstream Oil & Gas, with a minimum 3 years user and / or support experience with SAP,</li> <li>Exposure to foreign currency management and revaluation is an asset,</li> <li>Possession of a finance or accounting designation considered an asset,</li> <li>Strong problem solving skills and attention to detail,</li> <li>Excellent time management skills with the ability to prioritize workload,</li> <li>Ability to deal effectively with all level of professionals within the company,</li> <li>Ability to work both independently and in a team environment.</li> </ul>  </div><br/>  <div> Closing Statement<br/><br/>All positions require background checks which could include:  <ul> <li>Criminal police record check</li> <li>Education verification</li> <li>Credential verification</li> </ul> Click the “Apply for Job” button to start the application process. <br/><br/> No agency or telephone inquiries please.</div> <br/>

Job_Description: Company Overview <br/> <div>Tell us your story. Don’t go unnoticed. Explain why you’re a winning candidate. Think “TD” if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward. <br/><br/> Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us. Here’s our story: jobs.td.com</div>  <br/>Department Overview <br/> <div><strong>TD Securities Overview</strong>  <br/><br/> With more than 3,500 people in 13 offices around the world, TD Securities provides a wide range of capital market products and services to corporate, government and institutional clients who choose us for our knowledge, innovation and experience in the following key areas of finance:  <ul> <li>Investment and Corporate Banking</li><li>Capital Markets</li><li>Interest Rate, Currency and Derivative Products</li><li>Commodities</li><li>International Trade</li> </ul>  Our services include the underwriting and distribution of new debt and equity issues, providing advice on strategic acquisitions and divestitures, and executing daily trading and investment needs. <br/><br/> <strong>Global Operations Overview</strong>  <br/> With offices located around the world and with more than 650 professionals, the strength of TD Securities Global Operations lies in the diverse and dynamic group of individuals who are dedicated to providing ongoing support functions for TD Securities’ businesses and their partners. As part of TD Securities, Global Operations professionals have the opportunity to learn end to end processes as well as create relationships with different lines of business. Challenged to learn and grow within their role, members of Global Operations are supported in their goals of innovation, excellence and commitment to customer service. <br/><br/> <strong>Department Overview:</strong>  <br/> Global Trade Finance Operations International processing hub is located in Montreal with spoke locations in Vancouver, Calgary, Toronto, Houston and Singapore. We are a team of over 95 experienced professionals who offer a full range of trade products and are dedicated to providing world class service to our customers located all over the globe.</div>  <br/> <strong>Job Description</strong> <br/> <div>  <ul> <li>Be an expert in the International Chamber of Commerce (ICC) rules and standards (ISP98, URDG758, UCP600) with ability to provide consultation to large multi-national clients</li><li>Expert knowledge and understanding of the Standby Letter of Credit (SBLC) & Letter of Guarantee (LG) transactional life cycle in a global environment</li><li>Excellent relationship management and customer service skills required to facilitate positive interaction with our stakeholders and clients.</li><li>Review and provide recommendation of instrument drafting to protect Bank & Customer Risk prior to Issuance</li><li>Provide recommendations / escalate issues (Non-standard, high risk or other activities as per AML Enhanced Due Diligence and Anti-Boycott Procedures)</li><li>Provide training / guidance to the team on best practices, processes, etc. as well as guide junior staff for the completion of business as usual functions or ad-hoc non-routine requests</li> <li>Strong time-management, decision making and organizational skills to manage multiple deadlines and priorities within a fast paced environment</li><li>Maintain full knowledge and understanding of internal and external developments, market conditions, regulatory and other changes impacting Global Trade Finance</li></ul>  <ul> <li>Identify and investigate non-standard operational / reporting / process issues</li></ul>  <ul> <li>Identify procedures for improvement; recommend and monitor the achievement of process enhancements</li><li>Execute on ad-hoc requests</li><li>Release day to day transactions and assess and provide approval on AML escalations.</li></ul></div>  <br/><strong>Requirements</strong> <br/> <div>  <ul> <li>7+ years’ experience in an International Trade Finance Operations environment</li><li>Bachelor Degree in Finance, International Business or other related Discipline</li><li>CDCS, CSDG accreditation an asset</li><li>Strong communications skills</li> <li>Ability to work in a fast paced environment</li></ul></div>  <br/><strong>Additional Information</strong> <br/> <div><strong>Inclusiveness</strong> <br/> At TD, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve. If you require an accommodation for the recruitment/interview process (including alternate formats of materials, or accessible meeting rooms or other accommodation), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs. <br/> <strong>Additional Information</strong>  <ul> <li>French/English is an asset</li></ul></div>  <br/>Hours <br/> <div>8:30am to 5pm</div> <br/> Inclusiveness <br/> <div>At TD, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve. If you require an accommodation for the recruitment/interview process (including alternate formats of materials, or accessible meeting rooms or other accommodation), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.</div> <br/>
Title: Senior Analyst

Job_Description: Data & Business Insights Analysts <br/><br/> <STRONG>What you’ll do</STRONG> <br/><br/> In support of Operational Excellence, the Data & Business Insights Analysts <br/><br/> will be responsible for interpreting cleansed, mined data into a consumable format for the business. They will leverage discovered patterns and insights into actionable intelligence that can be clearly communicated to all levels of the organization’s leadership structure to aid in the overall corporate strategy. <br/><br/> Reporting to the AVP, Business Intelligence & Data Analytics, this position will work with all business units across the FGL banner to provide analytical interpretation; analysis, presented recommendations and consultative services to assist with new initiatives, day to day business, or to solve pressing business problems. The Business Intelligence group will also work to provide ad-hoc data when that data is not accessible by the business. <br/><br/> Responsibilities  <ul> <li>Support the business with a full analytical services offering. Including developing operational reporting and executive dashboards, providing analysis, conclusions and recommendations for the business   <li>Support of any departmental analytical team with augmented analysis and consultation for their new initiatives, day to day business and problem solving   <li>Present findings to all levels of the organization’s leadership in an understandable and compelling manner   <li>Take an active role in understanding the each department’s activities and strategies to gain a deeper understanding of the business   <li>Optimize tasks to increase efficiency and accuracy, include driving the design of automation for the business.   <li>Champion the Data Science capabilities and service offerings within the organization   <li>Support the business with ad-hoc data requests to help them answer questions or to satisfy audit requirements.</LI> </ul> <STRONG>What you bring…</STRONG>  <ul> <li>5 years of experience in a retail analytics or corporate retail environment.   <li>Proficient with statistical methods and mathematical techniques including predictive modeling, regression, AB testing, cluster analysis, etc.   <li>Ability to formulate or quickly understand business problems, find patterns and insights within structured and unstructured data.   <li>Ability to clearly communicate results to technical and non-technical audiences.   <li>Demonstrated experience in exploratory data analysis and data mining process of large, complex data sets (i.e. “Big Data”)   <li>Comfort manipulating and analyzing complex, high-volume, high-dimensionality data from varying sources   <li>Hands-on experience using business intelligence and statistical analysis tools such as R, Cognos, Micro Strategy, etc.   <li>Familiarity with relational databases and SQL   <li>Have a good eye for and an understanding of visual report design principles   <li>Ability to execute multiple projects and drive key business results under tight deadlines.   <li>Self-starter attitude with willingness to learn and master new technologies   <li>Ability to work independently and in an ambiguous environment</LI> </ul>
Title: Data & Business Insights Analyst - FGL Sports

Job_Description: <strong>Leases Project Analyst (Temporary), Calgary, AB</strong> <br/><br/> Why work at Nutrien? Great question! <br/><br/> Safety is a core value at Nutrien. Keeping every employee safe, healthy and secure is our top priority. Nothing is more important than seeing our people go home safe at the end of every single day. <br/><br/> While working here you will have the opportunity to grow your career while helping us feed the future. We pride ourselves in hiring from a variety of backgrounds and truly believe that it is our differences that make us stronger so we hope you will join us. <br/><br/> In addition to exciting and challenging opportunities, Nutrien offers competitive salaries, great benefits and performance based incentives. <br/><br/> Outside of the skills and necessary qualifications, you will be committed to sustaining our safe and positive work environment while welcoming working side by side others in a diverse culture. Culture at Nutrien is the core of everything we do and all employees are respectful of diverse opinions and views. <br/><br/> The purpose of the Business Analyst role is to document and assist in implementation of the future state business processes that will be impacted by the new standard International Financial Reporting Standards (IFRS) 16 – Leases. This is to gain a complete understanding of the impact and aid our business partners in identifying the future processes and documenting those processes to support the transition to the new standard. <br/><br/> *Please note that this is a temporary, full-time position (40 hours per week), expected to end February 2019* <br/><br/> <strong>Key Tasks:</strong> <ul>  <li>Facilitation of information gathering and process design through interviews, existing documentation analysis, requirements workshops, surveys, site visits, and business process modeling this will primarily be for the future state process redesign to support the new accounting standards</li> <li>Acting as a Liaison between Finance and our Business Partners to uphold a clear understanding of future state process requirements and to ensure functional deliverables align with the stakeholders needs</li> <li>Proactive communication and collaboration with external and internal stakeholders to develop: Process Flows, Report design, Test Plans, Defect / Enhancement tracking, Business Process Procedures (BPPs)</li> <li>Working independently with stakeholders, as well as under the direction of project managers. Collaboration with subject matter experts and functional business leads to establish the future state process and impacts</li> <li>Producing deliverables according to standard templates appropriate for project scale</li> <li>Assist in user acceptance testing, test planning, development of test cases and test execution management to ensure alignment with original requirements, process definition and future compliance.</li>  </ul> <strong>Skills:</strong> <ul>  <li>Knowledge of Agriculture, Manufacturing and Supply Chain an asset</li> <li>Competent and proficient understanding of a variety of technology platforms, including ERP’s such as SAP and PeopleSoft, as well as current Microsoft and Internet technologies</li> <li>Excellent analytical and organizational skills with expert fluency in Excel, Visio and PowerPoint.</li> <li>Previous project experience</li> <li>Business aptitude for strategy and benefits realization alignment</li> <li>Knowledge and experience with Business Process modeling tools and techniques</li> <li>Understanding of the IT Life Cycle</li> <li>Proven capability and experience managing requirements gathering initiatives across multiple teams and business areas</li> <li>Exceptional communication, both written and verbal, and facilitation skills</li>  </ul> <strong>Qualifications:</strong> <ul>  <li>A Finance background with knowledge of accounting practice.</li> <li>A background of 3 years minimum of practical experience in business analysis and processes</li> <li>A professional degree or a combination of education and experience may also be considered</li>  </ul> Nutrien is committed to creating an inclusive workplace. We encourage applications from all well qualified candidates who reflect the diversity of the regions where we operate. This includes recognizing the voluntary identification of status such as gender, sexual orientation, visible minority, Indigenous status, persons with disabilities, and veterans, where applicable. <br/><br/> If this sounds like a good match, apply now. This job will remain posted until filled. You may be required to undergo a background check and substance test in accordance with Nutrien policies. <br/><br/> While we appreciate all applications we receive, we advise that only candidates under consideration will be contacted.
Title: Leases Project Analyst (Temporary)

Job_Description: <div><strong>Job ID:</strong> 150446 <br/> <strong>Store Name/Number:</strong> AB-South Calgary (0562) <br/> <strong>Address:</strong> 100 Anderson Road SE Unit #222, Calgary, AB T2J 3V1, Canada (CA) <br/> <strong>Full Time/Part Time:</strong> Full Time <br/> <strong>Position Type:</strong> Regular <br/><br/> Consultant Lead are responsible for supporting the Store Manager and Assistant Manager(s) with client service, sales, productivity and operational functions within the store and their assigned department. Leading Consultants, they perform sales floor supervision duties regularly. <br/><br/> <strong>ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES</strong> <br/> Client Service  <ul>  <li>Demonstrate and model excellent client service and sales floor leadership standards.</li> <li>Utilize client service reporting and onstage observation with Store Manager and Assistant Manager(s) to monitor service levels and remedy areas of opportunity.</li> </ul>  Store&apos;s Budget and Business Results  <ul>  <li>Monitor daily, weekly, monthly sales results with Store Manager and Assistant Manager(s) and communicate to staff members.</li> <li>Assist the Store Manager and Assistant Manager(s) in developing strategies to grow the business in assigned world, leveraging client loyalty program, events, product knowledge and services.</li> </ul>  Human Resources  <ul>  <li>Support product and client service training.</li> <li>Maintain an objective and professional relationship with brand partners, key stakeholders, employees and other leadership.</li> <li>Train, develop, delegate to, supervise and motivate team members.</li> <li>Ensure a coaching culture is present that includes timely acknowledgement of successes, and feedback on opportunities.</li> <li>Resolve employee concerns in a timely manner and communicate to the Store Manager and Assistant Manager(s) as needed.</li> </ul>  Merchandising and Operations  <ul>  <li>Perform opening and closing procedures.</li> <li>Ensure standards of cleanliness and organization, as well as merchandising presentations are maintained.</li> <li>Conduct inventories and maintain updated inventory records.</li> <li>Ensure compliance with SEPHORA’s cash handling and shortage prevention procedures.</li> </ul>  <strong>EXPECTED SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS</strong>  <ul>  <li>1-2 years of management/supervisory experience in the retail/client service industry.</li> <li>Education and product experience in skincare, make-up or fragrance is desirable.</li> <li>Comfortable in engaging clients, and applying products to the client while providing consultations.</li> <li>Effective time management, problem solving and communication skills are essential.</li> <li>Proficiency in Windows, Word and Excel.</li> <li>A High School graduate or equivalent.</li> <li>Open availability including evenings, weekends and holidays is required.</li> </ul>  <strong>ADDITIONAL INFORMATION</strong> <br/> <strong>Physical Requirements:</strong>  <ul>  <li>Work in a fragrance filled environment.</li> <li>Lift and carry up to 50 pounds.</li> <li>Bend and stretch to stock shelves.</li> </ul>  <strong>COMPANY OVERVIEW</strong> <br/> Owned by LVMH Moet Hennessy Louis Vuitton, the world&apos;s leading luxury goods group, Sephora is highly regarded as a beauty trailblazer, thanks to its unparalleled assortment of prestige products, unbiased service from experts, interactive shopping environment, and innovation. <br/><br/> <strong>Sephora stores</strong> - Sephora operates approximately 1,900 stores in 29 countries worldwide, with an expanding base of over 360 stores across North America. Sephora opened its first U.S. store in New York in 1998, its first Canadian store in Toronto in 2004. Sephora&apos;s North American headquarters is located in San Francisco, with corporate offices in New York, Montreal and Toronto. <br/> <strong>Sephora.com</strong>- Launched in the U.S. in 1999 and Canada in 2003, the foremost beauty site on the Internet is also Sephora&apos;s largest North American store in terms of sales and selection of products and brands.</div>
Title: Consultant Lead

Job_Description: Dell is a collective of customer-obsessed, industry-leading visionaries. At our core is a commitment to diversity, sustainability and our communities. We believe in working together to build a brighter future, celebrating the entrepreneurial spirit that lives inside us all, and marrying innovation with action. Dell is proud to offer unparalleled growth and development opportunities for our team members. We believe that technology is essential for driving human progress, and were committed to providing that technology to people and organizations everywhere, so they can transform the way they work and live. We currently have an opening on our Presales Commercial team. This role can be located anywhere within the Montreal region with the ability to work from home and travel within that region. Role Responsibilities Responsible for driving the technical sales strategy for DELL products and services in assigned customer accounts. As a member of a field account team, the candidate must demonstrate leadership abilities across a diverse set of matrix sales teams to accelerate the adoption of DELL EMC products and services. Works with Sales Team to develop & implement specific account penetration strategies, produce account specific product & service & sales plans Maintains knowledge of competitive solutions to effectively address & dispel customer objections to DELL solutions, & train the account team Anticipates technology and/or market trends & provides guidance on their application to external customers & feedback of business requirements back into DELL's engineering & marketing organizations Successfully builds relationships with the account team, partners & customers in support of sales team objectives & engages & leverages corporate resources, abilities, budgets & personnel as appropriate. Leads technical sales calls Configures & documents DELL software, hardware & service solutions to meet customer & sales objectives. Completes required presales documentation quickly & accurately Works with Sales Team to develop & implement specific account penetration strategies, produce account specific product & service & sales plans for Enterprise Products. Detailed product knowledge. Previous hands-on experience in the data center environment, with expertise spanning storage, BRS, virtualization, convergence, Cloud and/or Big Data Maintains knowledge of competitive solutions to effectively address & dispel customer objections to DELL solutions, & train the account team. Competitive Knowhow of HDS, IBM, NetApp Storage Solutions is essential Anticipates technology and/or market trends & provides guidance on their application to external customers & feedback of business requirements back into DELL's engineering & marketing organizations Requirements Candidates responsibilities should include involvement with the following: Competitive understanding of the different storage vendors offerings from HDS, IBM, Oracle, NetApp, etc. Excellent presentation skills in front of all levels of the IT Organization Working knowledge of Storage Analysis and Monitoring Tools Detailed product knowledge. Previous hands-on experience in the data center environment, with expertise spanning storage, BRS, virtualization, convergence, Cloud and/or Big Data Customer focused. Communication skills. Ability to work effectively with senior management. Ability to manage in a matrix environment. Ability to influence others to achieve results. Company: With more than 100,000 team members globally, we promote an environment that is rooted in the entrepreneurial spirit in which the company was founded. Dells team members are committed to serving our communities, regularly volunteering for over 1,500 non-profit organizations. The company has also received many accolades from employer of choice to energy conservation. Our team members follow an open approach to technology innovation and believe that technology is essential for human success. Why work with us? Life at Dell means collaborating with dedicated professionals with a passion for technology. When we see something that could be improved, we get to work inventing the solution. Our people demonstrate our winning culture through positive and meaningful relationships. We invest in our people and offer a series of programs that enables them to pursue a career that fulfills their potential. Our team members health and wellness is our priority as well as rewarding them for their hard work. Dell is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at Dell are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion or belief, national, social or ethnic origin, sex (including pregnancy), age, physical, mental or sensory disability, HIV status, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, marital, civil union or domestic partnership status, past or present military service, family medical history or genetic information, family or parental status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. Dell will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics. Learn more about Diversity and Inclusion at Dell here .
