Job_Description: <div><strong>Service:</strong> Audit & Assurance <br/> <strong>Job Type:</strong> Permanent <br/> <strong>Primary Location:</strong> Calgary, Alberta, Canada <br/> <strong>All Available Locations:</strong> Calgary<br/> <div> External Posting Description <br/><br/> As a Senior Consultant, Accounting Transaction Advisory you will: <ul> <li>Work directly with clients on complex technical accounting matters including transaction related accounting questions, IFRS transition projects (IFRS 9, 15 and 16), GAAP conversions and other related accounting research, projects, audit support and memos</li><li>Review and contribute to the planning and execution of projects</li><li>Opportunities may arise to serve clients and / or support local office teams around the country or internationally</li><li>Contribute to market and eminence initiatives, including development of new service offerings and marketing campaigns within the practice</li><li>Develop and lead timely communications - both internal and external - relevant to our professionals and clients</li><li>Develop materials for and participate in the delivery of presentations to clients and firm personnel</li> </ul> External Posting Qualifications <ul> <li>Have the CPA designation or equivalency OR be in progress of completion of the CPA</li><li>Possess a minimum 3 years of relevant work experience</li><li>Audit & Advisory technical skills (GAAP, securities and regulatory)</li><li>Finance experience including accounting research, memo writing and related process and data</li><li>Capacity to think about requirements from a strategic perspective (options available, pros / cons of different options)</li><li>Operational (ability to translate the “what is required” into the “how it’s done)</li><li>Strong facilitation and presentation skills</li> <li>Problem solving (ability to “find it” and “fix it”)</li><li>Project management discipline and structure</li><li>Strong communication skills (both written and verbal)</li><li>Broad advisory skillsets (capacity to help client explore issues / opportunities)</li><li>Proven ability to deliver the full cycle of project management accountabilities</li><li>Experienced with project problem diagnosis, solution development, client communications, facilitation of decision making, documentation, managing client expectations and team leadership</li><li>Ability to communicate effectively in Spanish & / or French is an asset</li> </ul> </div> <br/><strong>Why Deloitte?</strong> <br/><br/> Launch your career with The One Firm where you can make a greater impact than you ever thought possible. With endless opportunities at every turn, and a culture built to support and drive our people to be the very best they can be, Deloitte is The One Firm for you to learn, grow, create, and lead. <br/><br/> At Deloitte, we understand that everyone, and their career goals, are different. As a firm, we help create the conditions and opportunities that will enable our people to thrive – both professionally and personally. We do this by making three commitments to our people: <ul> <li><em><strong>You will lead at every level:</strong></em> We grow the world’s best leaders so you can achieve the impact you seek, faster.</li><li><em><strong>You can work your way:</strong></em> We give you the means to work how you want, and we have innovative spaces and the mindset to help you be wildly successful.</li><li><em><strong>You will feel included and inspired:</strong></em> We create a deep sense of belonging where you can bring your whole self to work.</li> </ul> Apply now and let us show you how to push your career to the next level at <em><strong>Deloitte. The One Firm. For You.</strong></em> <br/><br/> Deloitte is an inclusive employer dedicated to building a diverse workforce. We encourage applications from all qualified candidates and will accommodate applicants’ needs under the respective provincial human rights codes throughout all stages of the recruitment and selection process. Please advise the Recruiter to ensure your accessibility needs are accommodated throughout this process. Information received relating to accommodation will be addressed confidentially. <br/><br/> We thank all applicants in advance for their interest; however, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted <br/><br/> 35521</div>
Title: Senior Consultant, Accounting Transaction Advisory

Job_Description: <strong>About NCS Multistage</strong> <br/><br/> NCS Multistage is a technology and services company specializing in multistage completions. In 2006, NCS (Canada) developed a line of coiled-tubing fracturing tools for the coalbed methane gas market. In 2007, the company shifted its focus to the oil and gas market, offering downhole completion tools and services for both unconventional and conventional completions and an expanded line of coiled-tubing-deployed frac tools. With corporate offices in Calgary and Houston we service all of North America. NCS is dedicated to reducing our environmental footprint leading the industry in Responsible Resource Recovery. Integrity is the corner stone of the NCS Mantra: <strong>“Leave Nothing Behind”</strong> <br/><br/> At NCS we believe that our employees are the key to unlocking asset potential. NCS assures its success by bringing on people at the very top of their field. NCS is a rapidly growing, young company and as we continue to grow we create value through innovation by ‘doing it right’ with fun and integrity. We employ and invest in people from across the world to help NCS develop and deliver new technology where ever it’s needed. By joining NCS you will have the support and encouragement and room to grow that will undoubtedly make an immediate impact on your career. <br/><br/> <strong>NCS Promise to Employees:</strong> <br/><br/> We will invest in our employees, our most important resource, by providing coaching and training that enables them to learn and grow to their full potential. Together, we will maintain a culture that promotes teamwork and an environment that is challenging, rewarding and fun. We will listen to our employees, treat them with respect and support them when they make decisions that are aligned with the NCS Promise. <br/><br/> <strong>What NCS Offers:</strong>  <ul>  <li>Competitive Salary</li>    <li>Annual Vacation</li>    <li>Full Benefits</li>    <li>Group RSP Program</li>    <li>Annual Bonus Program</li>    <li>Education & Training</li>    </ul> <br/><br/> <strong>Payroll & Finance Analyst</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Reports to</strong> <br/><br/> Canadian Finance Manager <br/><br/> <strong>Overall responsibility</strong> <br/><br/> This dynamic Payroll-centric position will allow the successful candidate to expand their knowledge in Finance and Accounting. The Payroll & Finance Analyst is responsible for managing day to day payroll activities, ensuring accurate and timely processing of payroll. The position brings up-to-date knowledge of legislative compliance guideline, and provides operational direction on payroll functions. This role will assist with the selection and implementation of a SOX compliant payroll system. In addition to Payroll, and key to success in the position, this role includes financial analysis and accounting duties. <br/><br/> <strong>Key areas of responsibility:</strong> <br/><br/> Payroll  <ul> <li>Ensure timely and accurate payroll production is handled in accordance with the Employment Standards Act, payroll related legislation, and CRA rules</li></ul>   <ul> <li>Research and resolve payroll inquiries from management and staff in a timely, courteous manner</li></ul>   <ul> <li>Calculate employee automobile benefits and prepare entries for Accounting</li></ul>   <ul> <li>Prepare uploads for vacation accruals and payroll entries for Accounting</li></ul>   <ul> <li>Provide audit support to internal and external auditors</li></ul>   <ul> <li>Conduct quarterly WCB premium remittances and reconciliations</li></ul>   <ul> <li>Remain current with government legislation, ensuring compliance and legislative changes are implemented in payroll system</li></ul>   <ul> <li>Conduct on-going review of business processes, procedures, and controls</li></ul>   <ul> <li>Participate in system upgrades, testing of payroll and time-keeping related system changes</li></ul>   <ul> <li>Assist in the selection and implementation of a SOX compliant payroll system</li></ul>   <ul> <li>Research and maintain cheat sheets for employees relating to tax implications on RRSP matching, and the exercise of Stock Options and Restricted Stock Units</li> </ul> Finance  <ul> <li>Prepare monthly reporting packages for key management personnel in Canada – knowledge of Hyperion would be useful</li></ul>   <ul> <li>Investigate account fluctuations and account coding</li> </ul>  <ul> <li>Prepare accounting entries, as needed</li></ul>   <ul> <li>Serve as back up for Field Service Order Administrator and enter field sales orders into ERP system when required</li> </ul> <strong>Qualifications</strong>  <ul> <li>Member of the Canadian Payroll Association and possess or working toward a PCP designation</li></ul>   <ul> <li>Demonstrates initiative, attention to detail, integrity, time management and organizational skills</li></ul>   <ul> <li>Professional and able to collaborate with multiple departments</li></ul>   <ul> <li>Self-starter with solid follow-through and multi-tasking capabilities</li></ul>   <ul> <li>Adaptable and flexible, with a positive, pro-active attitude</li></ul>   <ul> <li>Possess strong Excel skills and data query experience will be beneficial</li> </ul> <strong>Location and Hours</strong>  <ul>  <li>Position out of the Calgary Corporate office, located at 840 7th Ave SW</li>    <li>Position is full time, Monday – Friday 8am-5pm</li>    </ul> All offers of employment are contingent on a successful background screen, which includes verification of employment history, education and criminal background check. Safety sensitive positions will also require drug & alcohol testing.
Title: Payroll & Finance Analyst

Job_Description: <div> <strong>KPMG Professionals Are...</strong> <br/>  <br/> Individuals who take deep personal accountability for their work, have a passion for excellence, driven to achieve their full potential and understand the value of building relationships with clients, future clients, their communities, the global firm and each other. A KPMG professional should have all the following characteristics:  <ul> <li>Strong work ethic</li> <li>Thrive on challenges</li> <li>Dedicated to providing outstanding client service.</li>  </ul>  <strong>Position Summary</strong> <br/>  <br/> KPMG's Management Consulting group is experiencing exceptional growth, especially within IT Advisory. The rapidly expanding IT Advisory team is seeking a Senior Consultant for its Technology Enablement practice in Montreal. Specifically, the practice is looking to fill a technical architect position. <br/><br/> <strong>Role and Responsibilities</strong> <br/>  <br/> As an Integration Developer you will work with team leads and use identified business requirements to design successive integrations of Workday with external HR vendors and software applications during testing and production periods. <br/><br/> <strong>Performance Objectives:</strong>  <br/>  <br/> <strong> Excellence</strong>  <ul> <li>Support Workday integrations according to client requirements during testing and production periods</li> <li>Collaborate with team leaders to report assignment status</li><li>Manage, mitigate and remediate risks by identifying integration issues with suggested resolutions</li> <li>Build strong relationships internally and collaborate effectively on cross-functional teams</li><li>Increase efficiency within client teams by identifying ways to improve processes</li><li>Seek and participate in key learning and development opportunities</li> </ul>  <strong>People/</strong><strong>Clients</strong>  <ul> <li>Collaborate with colleagues to broaden and deepen relationships with clients</li> <li>Demonstrate natural ease and effectiveness when dealing with clients/colleagues at all levels</li><li>Represent KPMG on client projects and collaborate with teams of consultants at all levels in order to deliver high-quality services and products</li><li>Manage client expectations on a daily basis, and work to resolve issues</li> </ul>  <strong>Financial</strong>  <ul> <li>Increase efficiency within client teams by identifying ways to improve processes</li> </ul>  <strong>Skills & Qualifications</strong>  <ul> <li>Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics or any other major with significant quantitative/technical course work</li><li>Prior class or work experience that demonstrates analytical capabilities in programming languages such as Java, XML/XSLT or SQL</li><li>Fundamental knowledge of HR systems, such as PeopleSoft, SAP, Oracle, Workday as well as other leading best-of-breed systems</li><li>Propensity to quickly comprehend new and emerging technologies and understand business and testing scenarios</li><li>Self-starter; interest in continually challenging oneself and willingness to step outside of one’s comfort zone</li><li>Well organized and detail oriented</li><li>Ability to work both independently and on client teams and enjoy a fast-paced environment</li> </ul>  </div>   <br/><strong>Why Choose KPMG?</strong>  Making the right career choice is important, finding the right company is essential. Watch this video to see the type of people that thrive at KPMG. <br/><br/> <strong>Location</strong> Calgary, AB <br/>  <br/> <strong>Job Title</strong> Manager or Senior Consultant, Workday Integration Developer <br/>  <br/> <strong>Our Values, The KPMG Way</strong> <br/>  <br/> We lead by example | We work together | We respect the individual <br/> We seek the facts and provide insight | We are open and honest in our communication <br/> We are committed to our communities | Above all, we act with integrity <br/><br/> KPMG is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity in its workforce. KPMG encourages applications from all qualified individuals and will accommodate applicants’ disability-related needs, up to the point of undue hardship, throughout all stages of the recruitment and selection process. Any assessment and selection materials or processes used during the recruitment process will be available in an accessible format to applicants with disabilities, upon request. <strong>If you require a disability-related accommodation in order to participate in the recruitment process</strong>, please contact the HR Shared Service Centre by email at cafmcdnhrsthotline@kpmg.ca or by phone at 416-777-8002 or toll free 1-888-466-4778 (Option 1). KPMG will consult with all applicants with disabilities who request accommodation during the recruitment process to ensure that the accommodation provided takes into account the applicant’s individual accessibility needs. <br/><br/> <strong>Category</strong> Consulting <br/>  <br/> <strong>Job Function</strong> Advisory <br/>  <br/> <strong>Service Line</strong> IT Advisory (Management Consulting) <br/>  <br/> <strong>Industry</strong> Not Applicable
Title: Manager or Senior Consultant, Workday Integration Developer

Job_Description: Graham is a growing, dynamic and innovative construction solutions provider with history of success dating back to 1926. As an employee-owned company, youll be able to capitalize on our collective success by becoming an owner yourself. Youll also be able to take advantage of professional development, learning and growth opportunities, while working on exciting, leading-edge projects. <br/><br/> We rank among Canadas largest construction companies, are a Platinum Member of Canadas 50 Best Managed Companies and are seeking top tier talent to further strengthen our capabilities. We provide a collaborative and caring culture and the necessary tools and support for you to succeed, both personally and professionally. If youre eager to work on innovative projects, be part of a great team and become an employee-owner, Graham is the place for you. <br/><br/> Our career opportunities extend well beyond construction and engineering. We also offer exciting career growth and development in areas such as: accounting; administration; asset management; business development; communications; estimating; finance; health, safety, environment and quality; human resources; information systems/technology; investments; legal and risk management; purchasing; and SAP. As a member of one of these groups, you will play an essential role in supporting the successful execution of our projects and overall business operations by advising and applying your expertise to various improvement initiatives within your functional area. <br/><br/> <u><strong>About the Role</strong></u> <br/><br/> Reporting to the <strong>Treasury Manager</strong>, the <strong>Treasury Analyst</strong> is responsible primarily for Treasury Banking activities. <br/><br/> <em><strong>As a Treasury Analyst at Graham you will:</strong></em>  <ul> <li>Forecast both short and long-term receipts and payments to maximize liquidity</li> <li>Approve payment files</li> <li>Maintain bank accounts and signatories while complying with bank policies and regulation</li> <li>Prepare and coordinate documents for Letters of Credit issuances</li> <li>Reconcile cash and cash related GLs; complete Bank Recs</li> <li>Develop and document end-to-end policies and processes</li> <li>Prepare confirmations and settlements of various Treasury transactions</li> <li>Work closely and build relationships throughout the organization</li> <li>Assist with year-end audits, collaborate and cross-train with other team members</li> <li>Assist with ad hoc projects and requests as required</li> <li>Assist with identifying and developing continuous business improvement opportunities</li> </ul> <em><strong>To be Successful at Graham, you will have the following qualifications and experience:</strong></em>  <ul> <li>University degree; two years minimum Treasury operations experience</li> <li>Recently designated or close to designation CPA, CFA or CTP</li> <li>Knowledge of institutional financial services industry, practices and regulations</li> <li>Advanced Excel skills</li> <li>Experience with SAP would be considered a significant asset</li> <li>Motivated self-starter with excellent written and verbal communication skills</li> </ul> <em><strong>Compensation and Benefits:</strong> </em>  <ul> <li>Competitive salary with annual bonus potential</li> <li>Comprehensive benefits package including dental, optical and medical and company matched pension plan.</li> <li>Ownership and long term equity opportunities</li> </ul> <em><strong>What we can offer you:</strong></em>  <ul> <li>Strong commitment to safety in the workplace</li> <li>Grounded and family-oriented workplace in a progressive environment that is at the forefront of a fast-evolving business sector</li> <li>Commitment to the training and wealth of opportunities for career development across job categories, project types and locations around North America</li> </ul> Graham is an Equal Opportunity Employer, and employment selection decisions are based on merit, qualifications, and abilities. Graham does not discriminate in employment opportunities or practices on the basis of race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, veteran status or any other characteristic protected by country, regional or local law. <br/> <strong> <br/> We're Building careers, not filling jobs.</strong> <br/><br/> View available job opportunities and submit your application online at http://careers.grahambuilds.com/. <br/> Applications will only be accepted as online submissions through the Graham website. <br/> <em><strong>Please, no unsolicited resumes or phone inquiries from agencies, thank you.</strong></em> <br/><br/> <strong>Graham Management Services LP</strong> <br/> 10840 27th Street SE <br/> Calgary, AB T2Z 3R6 <br/> Fax: 403.236.6575 <br/><br/> <strong>Job Code:</strong> BH-18-025
Title: Treasury Analyst - Corporate

Job_Description: <STRONG><EM>Interested in being a part of a team that is leading the evolution of retail in Canada?</EM> <br/> </strong> <br/> Embracing and driving change is critical to our success. The complexity and rate at which the retail industry is transforming has increased exponentially in recent years and we are committed to being a leader in the industry. As such we are relentlessly focused on innovating at every level of our business, investing in new technologies and products, and doubling down on the best talent to drive the company forward. It is an especially exciting time to join the Canadian Tire Family of Companies. <br/><br/> <STRONG>What you'll do:</STRONG> <br/><br/> Reporting to the Manager, Financial Planning & Analysis, the Senior Analyst will be responsible to provide financial and analytical expertise within Mark's. The incumbent will play a key role in understanding system integration, corporate strategy and sales drivers and will provide insights into the financial performance of the company. <br/><br/> During the monthly, quarterly and annual reporting cycle, the incumbent will be responsible to ensure that relevant analysis and reports are prepared to support various levels of reviews and presentations for senior stakeholders both internally and externally. This role will regularly collaborate with stakeholders across the organization to drive financial results. <br/><br/> Key Objectives and Accountabilities:  <ul> <li>Prepare and review monthly reporting packages which contain various reports and analysis</LI>   <li>Work with the Manager, Financial Planning & Analysis, to provide quantitative and qualitative decision support including proactive financial analysis</li> <li>Review key performance metrics (financial and business metrics) to improve existing reports and develop new reports</LI>   <li>Continuously seek to improve the quality and efficiency of these reports, including enhancing financial analysis models and streamlining analysis and processes</li> <li>Foster strong working relationships across the divisional businesses, and work proactively to identify opportunities for finance to act as a strategic business partner</li> <li>Provide support and/or lead ad hoc projects as necessary <br/> Support business partners with financial analysis focused on forward looking results</li> <li>Thorough analysis and investigation into the variances to plan and forecast</li> <li>Develop analysis that delivers qualitative and quantitative information, including internal performance</li> <li>Participate in planning meetings with business colleagues to support ongoing initiatives</li> <li>Partner and influence Management to ensure that the plan is realistic and executable</li> <li>Lead and participate in analytics projects with a focus on strategic imperatives; assess strategic alternatives and lead change and process design in the business.</LI> </ul> <STRONG>Qualifications:</STRONG>  <ul> <li>Professional accounting designation (CPA, CFA).</li> <li>Minimum of four (4) years progressive experience in business or financial analytical role with at least two (2) years post designation</li> <li>Demonstrated experience with revenue planning or accounting in a large organization</li> <li>Strong technical and accounting knowledge as well as superior analytical skills</li> <li>Advanced MS Excel and PowerPoint skills</li> <li>Experience with financial systems (ERP) and Hyperion (Planning and HFM) preferred</li> <li>Demonstrated ability to independently plan, prioritize and coordinate activities to consistently meet deadlines</li> <li>Ability to clearly and confidently communicate recommendations, and trade-offs</li> <li>Ability to influence and persuade different points of view <br/> Strong time management and self-management skills</LI> </ul>  Canadian Tire is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace for all. We recognize that our future success depends on the perspectives and contributions of all our employees -- their diverse backgrounds, abilities and experiences make our business stronger. If you are contacted for a job opportunity, please advise us of any accommodations needed to ensure fair and equitable access throughout the recruitment and selection process. All accommodation information provided will be treated as confidential and used only for the purpose of providing an accessible candidate experience.
Title: Senior Financial Analyst - Mark's

Job_Description: <strong>Job ID:</strong> 00076022<br/><br/><em>Working for the World’s biggest brand is no small thing.</em> <br/><br/> It’s all about creating a brighter future for our employees, our company, and our communities. If you’re looking for a company where you can do your best work and make millions of people smile each day, you’ve come to the right place. <br/><br/> <strong> <em>Ready to turn your enthusiasm into experience?</em></strong> <br/><br/> You are a friendly face, a brand ambassador and a sight for thirsty eyes. If you have the drive, energy and determination that it takes, refreshing opportunities await. <br/><br/> <em> H<em>appiness comes in many packages.</em></em> <br/><br/> Every day is a chance to learn something new. We provide the resources to be successful, enabling you to take pride in your work and the company you do it for. We operate safely and responsibly, and reward individual accomplishments in a positive team environment. Exciting, isn’t it? <br/><br/> <strong>Position Highlights:</strong> <ul> <li>Responsible for analyzing sales data and preparing sales reports under general supervision;</li><li>Agency briefing - coordinating with external vendors and clients;</li>  <li>Prepare sales activity reports;</li> <li>Prepare daily, weekly, monthly and quarterly KBI reports;</li> <li>Customer service support - managing small store accounts and building relationships with clients;</li>  <li>Analyze business trends to identify sales opportunities; and</li> <li>Analyze variances between actual performance versus budgeted and prior year.</li>  </ul>  <div>Requirements</div> <br/><strong>Position Requirements:</strong> <ul>  <li>Bachelor's Degree required;</li> <li>Communications or Marketing background preferred;</li> <li>1-3 years of position related work experience required;</li> <li>Prior sales analyst experience in consumer products field; and</li> <li>Possess critical thinking skills and analytical/problem solving skill and abilities.</li>  </ul> Coca-Cola Refreshments is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workforce. We have a number of programs and policies in place to support this goal. <br/><br/> For individuals with disabilities, accommodations are available upon request. Should you require an accommodation, please contact our Talent Acquisition Services team by calling 1-888-844-4223. <br/><br/> Coca-Cola Refreshments Canada requires applicants to undergo a background verification process prior to commencing employment with the company. Employment with Coca-Cola Refreshments Canada is contingent on the satisfactory completion of a pre-employment background check.<br/><br/>Coca-Cola is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any other federal, state or local protected class.

Job_Description: Our Risk Consulting services in our Advisory Services Practice help our clients to optimize their response and resilience to risks and to expected and unexpected changes and events, whether internally generated or externally imposed. Our Risk Consulting professionals provide a range of services to support our clients undergoing change so that growth, governance, and performance objectives are achieved. <br/><br/> Our Risk Consulting professionals collectively provide the following range of services: <br/> · Internal Audit Risk and Compliance <br/> · IT Advisory <br/> · Forensic <br/> · Financial Risk and Regulatory Management <br/><br/> <STRONG>KPMG Professionals Are...</STRONG> <br/><br/> Individuals who take deep personal accountability for their work, have a passion for excellence, driven to achieve their full potential, and understand the value of building relationships with clients, future clients, their communities, the global firm and each other. A KPMG professional should have all of the following characteristics: <br/><br/> · Strong work ethic <br/> · Thrive on challenges <br/> · Dedicated to providing outstanding client service. <br/><br/> <STRONG>Position Summary</STRONG> <br/><br/> KPMG’s Risk Consulting practice in Calgary is growing and we require an IT Advisory Senior <br/> Consultant to help manage and develop our IT Advisory Services. We are in search of an experienced professional whose knowledge and skill not only spans the technical realm, but who is effective in managing teams, relationship management and business development. The successful candidate will be responsible for managing and developing a team that is closely aligned with both our Advisory and Audit practices and contribute to the overall management and execution of our IT Advisory Services. <br/><br/> <STRONG>Role and Responsibilities</STRONG> <br/><br/> · Manage / Perform operational audit activities in relation to SAP, specifically; process workflow, automated controls testing, access management and data extraction and analysis <br/> · Understand leading practices as it relates to SAP Security and provide recommendations to the business on security role design and implementation <br/> · Manage / Perform pre and post implementation reviews in relation to SAP <br/> · Delivering high quality and risk based internal audit reviews of business processes, business change, and the management of financial, operational and compliance risks within the IT space <br/> · Required to work as part of the end to end audit team in performing operational audits supported by SAP <br/> · Identify and report on all significant control weaknesses <br/> · Assist the Audit Partner and the Audit Team in supporting their work and working on self-contained tasks to ensure a fluent and well-structured Audit Process <br/> · Identify and communicate failures in control framework within SAP based processes and ability to identify opportunities for improvement in the areas of SAP GRC, SAP security and SAP controls. <br/> · Business development and relationship management within the Calgary marketplace. <br/> · Accountable and responsible for reviewing engagement files and ensuring compliance with quality standards. <br/><br/> At times, business needs arise and employees are required and agree to work beyond their normal work day or work week to fulfill the accountabilities required for their job. Likewise, people need extra time to devote to personal matters, and our approach to flexibility provides for this. <br/><br/> <STRONG>Skills & Qualifications</STRONG> <br/><br/> The successful candidate will possess the following: <br/><br/> · 4 or more years experience executing and managing IT Audit / Controls advisory services in a professional services or related organization. <br/> · Knowledge of internal controls in ERP systems and supporting network, operating system and database layers. <br/> · Detailed knowledge of best practice business controls expected within core processes supported by ERP systems and modules, with an emphasis on SAP <br/> · Knowledge of SAP security, including ECC authorization concept and role design for core processes <br/> · Experience with SAP GRC and / or other GRC tools. <br/> · Strong understanding of Segregation of Duties frameworks <br/> · Preference will be given to candidates with CISA, CISSP, CISM or similar certification. <br/> · Highly motivated, committed, self-starter with good organization skills who can prioritize and cope with changing priorities. <br/> · Must be able to clearly communicate issues and solutions to all levels of client and internal staff, on both a formal and informal basis. <br/><br/> #LI-HH1
Title: Senior Consultant - IT Audit

Job_Description: <strong>Job ID:</strong> 00076194<br/><br/><em><strong>Manufacturing Analyst</strong> </em> <br/><br/> <em>Working for the World’s biggest brand is no small thing.</em> <br/><br/> It’s all about creating a brighter future for our employees, our company, and our communities. If you’re looking for a company where you can do your best work and make millions of people smile each day, you’ve come to the right place. <br/><br/> <em>Ready to turn your enthusiasm into experience?</em> <br/><br/> You are a friendly face, a brand ambassador and a sight for thirsty eyes. If you have the drive, energy and determination that it takes, refreshing opportunities await. <br/><br/> <em>Happiness comes in many packages.</em> <br/><br/> Every day is a chance to learn something new. We provide the resources to be successful, enabling you to take pride in your work and the company you do it for. We operate safely and responsibly, and reward individual accomplishments in a positive team environment. Exciting, isn’t it? <br/><br/> <strong>Position Highlights:</strong> <ul>  <li>Assist departmental champions in updating Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) relating to their respective job function;</li> <li>Maintain training records in the IMS training database;</li> <li>Work with department managers to maintain compliance to training schedule through the use of the IMS training database reporting functions;</li> <li>Record monthly meter readings to track environmental metrics and update in reporting tools (SDW and Sharepoint). Analyze data for accuracy;</li> <li>Work with waste suppliers to gather plant waste stream data and update in reporting tools (SDW and Sharepoint). Analyze data for accuracy;</li> <li>Update production reporting in SAP, web tools and Excel;</li> <li>Manage daily tracking and data entry for production volume, line performance and Yield through Excel and SAP, create reporting to highlight and communicate trends;</li> <li>Analyze production results for discrepancies and improvement opportunities;</li> <li>Manage daily production counts in SAP, Complete inventory reconciliation, identifying variances and resolve discrepancies;</li> <li>Complete monthly posting of Raw Material Inventories and work with material planner to analyze variances;</li> <li>Complete daily receiving of Raw Materials for the production process;</li> <li>Complete weekly payroll entries in Kronos, investigate payroll variances with hourly associates and supervisors;</li> <li>Schedule manpower in accordance with the production schedule and CBA requirements;</li> <li>Work with supervisors to balance resources as required to meet changes in the production schedule;</li> <li>Organize production paperwork including managing archived files; and</li> <li>Create memos, posters to communicate manufacturing updates.</li>  </ul>  <div>Requirements</div> <br/><strong>Position Requirements:</strong> <ul>  <li>Experience with SAP, Excel and PowerPoint, Outlook,Word;</li> <li>Must be able to work with a high level of accuracy;</li> <li>High school diploma or GED required;</li> <li>Preferred Degree or diploma in business or Operations Management or equivalent;</li> <li>2-3 years relevant experience required;</li> <li>Strong computer and database skills; and</li> <li>Ability to work with minimal supervision.</li>  </ul> Coca-Cola Refreshments is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workforce. We have a number of programs and policies in place to support this goal. <br/><br/> For individuals with disabilities, accommodations are available upon request. Should you require an accommodation, please contact our Talent Acquisition Services team by calling 1-888-844-4223. <br/><br/> Coca-Cola Refreshments Canada requires applicants to undergo a background verification process prior to commencing employment with the company. Employment with Coca-Cola Refreshments Canada is contingent on the satisfactory completion of a pre-employment background check.<br/><br/>Coca-Cola is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any other federal, state or local protected class.

Job_Description: <div><strong>Job Type:</strong> Permanent <br/> <strong>Primary Location:</strong> Calgary, Alberta, Canada <br/> <strong>All Available Locations:</strong> Calgary; Toronto <br/><br/> <strong><u>Position Overview:</u></strong> <br/><br/> If you are a strategic minded, highly analytical, change agent motivated by the challenge to elevate the role of finance to strategic business advisor for our senior executives than we want to hear from you. Reporting to the Senior Finance Manager, this role will lead all aspects of Financial Planning and Analysis for our largest region. You will work alongside the Firm’s Executive leaders to drive operational excellence and outstanding financial performance by providing insightful, actionable recommendations related to but not limited to client profitability, resource optimization, and investments with the highest rate of return. Fostering strong working relationships with multiple members of the senior leadership team in addition to coaching and developing a Senior Financial Analyst to a future leader on our team will be critical to the success of this role. <br/><br/> <strong><u>Your role as a manager at Deloitte:</u></strong> <ul> <li>Embrace and live the firm’s purpose – to make an impact that matters – by pushing yourself and your team to identify solutions to challenges that are most important for our clients, people, and society</li><li>Develop high-performing people and teams through challenging and meaningful opportunities</li><li>Deliver exceptional client service by maximizing results and driving high performance from people, while also fostering collaboration across businesses and borders</li><li>Influence clients, teams and individuals positively, leading by example and establishing confident relationships</li><li>Understand key objectives for clients and Deloitte, and align people to them to set appropriate priorities and direction</li> </ul> <u><strong>Key Responsibilities include but not limited to:</strong></u> <ul> <li>Prepare and present insights based on analyses, key metrics trending and quantified risks and opportunities;</li><li>Leverage a strong knowledge of the Firm’s financial model, systems and processes to act as a point of reference for leaders, practitioners and finance colleagues</li><li>Financial modelling, analysis, interpretation and recommendations that support management decision making</li><li>Monthly detailed review, analysis and progress reporting on the core business units of the practice</li><li>Identify financial risk areas and recommend financial risk mitigation opportunities or actions</li><li>Create and Manage executive friendly financial reporting for period end, forecasts and plans that form the basis of decision making</li><li>Manage a rolling forecast that gathers inputs from the regions and is benchmarked against relevant comparables but is not bound by system limitations;</li><li>Proactively assess and address needs of the business leaders;</li><li>Participate as a Subject Matter Expert (SME) in firm wide Finance & Operations initiatives, fostering integration and collaboration across regions and services</li> </ul> <u><strong>Qualifications:</strong></u> <ul> <li>Degree in business/commerce including relevant professional designation (CPA,CA, CPA,CMA)</li><li>3-5 years of progressive experience in a finance role in a fast paced environment</li><li>Strong knowledge of business fundamentals and financial acumen</li><li>Strategic thinker who is able to drive business initiatives end to end and deliver insights</li><li>Management and leadership skills with the ability to coach, mentor and develop members of our team into the next generation of leaders</li><li>Excellent communication and strong inter-personal skills</li><li>Ability to thrive in a fast paced, high growth, evolving environment</li><li>Strong organizational skills and a demonstrated ability to prioritize work in a demanding environment</li><li>Ability to exercise sound judgment in interpreting firm policies and objectives</li><li>Extremely detail oriented and able to work with time-sensitive and confidential information</li><li>Customer focused, proactive and results-oriented</li><li>Expert level proficiency in MS Excel</li><li>Previous experience with Cognos (eg report studio), Hyperion and SAP an asset</li> </ul> <strong>Why Deloitte?</strong> <br/><br/> Launch your career with The One Firm where you can make a greater impact than you ever thought possible. With endless opportunities at every turn, and a culture built to support and drive our people to be the very best they can be, Deloitte is The One Firm for you to learn, grow, create, and lead. <br/><br/> At Deloitte, we understand that everyone, and their career goals, are different. As a firm, we help create the conditions and opportunities that will enable our people to thrive – both professionally and personally. We do this by making three commitments to our people: <ul> <li><em><strong>You will lead at every level:</strong></em> We grow the world’s best leaders so you can achieve the impact you seek, faster.</li><li><em><strong>You can work your way:</strong></em> We give you the means to work how you want, and we have innovative spaces and the mindset to help you be wildly successful.</li><li><em><strong>You will feel included and inspired:</strong></em> We create a deep sense of belonging where you can bring your whole self to work.</li> </ul> Apply now and let us show you how to push your career to the next level at <em><strong>Deloitte. The One Firm. For You.</strong></em> <br/><br/> Deloitte is an inclusive employer dedicated to building a diverse workforce. We encourage applications from all qualified candidates and will accommodate applicants’ needs under the respective provincial human rights codes throughout all stages of the recruitment and selection process. Please advise the Recruiter to ensure your accessibility needs are accommodated throughout this process. Information received relating to accommodation will be addressed confidentially. <br/><br/> We thank all applicants in advance for their interest; however, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted <br/><br/> 35141</div>
Title: Finance Manager, Financial Analysis & Business Support

Job_Description: <strong>Closing Date:</strong> <strong>April 25th, 2018</strong>  <br/><br/> Our prestigious enterprise client is seeking a Business Systems Analyst with Production Accounting expertise. <br/> The Business Systems Analyst performs a combination of three functions: business analysis, systems analysis, and project management. As a Business Systems Analyst you will be responsible for managing the customer relationship between IS, and one or more business areas, implementing new applications, as well as supporting and maintaining a portfolio of existing applications. A Business Systems Analyst may also provide guidance and direction to Systems Analysts and Developers. <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities and Deliverables</strong>   <ul> <li>Manage the customer relationship between IS and specific business areas</li>  <li>Support, maintain, enhance and/or upgrade a portfolio of custom and package applications</li>  <li>Analyze requests for new functionality, and document business cases to justify new application investments</li>  <li>Develop estimates of effort for design of new, and/or modification to existing, application components</li>  <li>Design application components to automate and streamline business processes and functions</li>  <li>Business area planning that includes scheduling and management of application projects</li>  <li>Understand the architecture of the applications within the groups portfolio</li>  <li>Plan, assign and monitor daily work assignments for Systems Analysts, Developers and Developer Analysts</li>  <li>Develop and maintain technical specifications and documentation</li>  <li>Troubleshoot and repair problems that occur in the everyday use of an application</li>  <li>Develop cost estimates for the annual IS capital and sustainment budgets</li> </ul>  <strong>Qualifications</strong>   <ul> <li>Typically 8+ years experience as a Business Systems Analyst and Systems Analyst, preferably in Production Accounting, PAS/PRISM AND Field Data Collection</li>  <li>Post-secondary degree in Computer Sciences is preferred</li>  <li>Excellent written and verbal communication skills</li>  <li>Highly developed analytical skills</li>  <li>Demonstrated proficiency in business modeling, process modeling, data modeling, and effort/cost modeling and estimating</li>  <li>Demonstrated proficiency in N-tier application analysis, design and development using the appropriate development environments and tools (Java Enterprise, Tomcat, MS VB.NET/ASP.Net, MS SSRS, and/or Oracle 11C&12C and PL/SQL</li>  <li>General proficiency with SQL and database query tools such as Microsoft Access and/or SQL+</li>  <li>Strong multi-tasking and prioritizing abilities</li>  <li>Exceptional Project Management skills</li> </ul>
Title: Business Systems Analyst ~ Production Accounting

Job_Description: <div>Reporting to the Store Manager of the Experience Centre, the responsibilities include: <br/><br/> Providing a consistent superior premium customer experience to achieve store sales targets and demonstrate expert Miele product knowledge. The successful candidate will embrace the Miele Experience strategy and operational guidelines at all times and ensure customers enjoy a hassle-free, premium retail experience. <br/><br/> Ability to wear different hats, ensuring the Miele Experience Centre is always pristine, preparing of customer quotes and orders, sale of Cash-and-Carry products, cross and up-selling of products, providing owner education. The ability to create leads from end consumer events which take place at the Miele Experience Centre is a must. <br/><br/> <strong>Requirements</strong>  <ul>  	<li>Must be available for flexible schedule including <strong>evenings and Saturdays</strong> – (the Experience Centre is currently closed on Sundays)</li> <li>Minimum of 2 years of experience <strong>in premium retail sales</strong></li> <li>Extremely organized</li> <li>Experience in premium customer service</li> <li>Excellent computer skills</li> <li>Excellent communication and teamwork skills</li> <li>Optimistic and easily adaptable to change</li> </ul> We offer an excellent working environment. <br/><br/> If you have the skills and experience outlined above and like working in a fast-paced environment then please send your resume in confidence to the Human Resources Department at hr@miele.ca <br/><br/> <em>Miele Ltd. is committed to providing accommodation to people with disabilities throughout the job application and interview process to the point of undue hardship. If you require an accommodation during the application or interview process, please do not hesitate to ask the recruiter.</em> <br/><br/> <strong>We appreciate your response; however, only candidates under consideration will be contacted</strong></div>

Job_Description: <div><p><strong>Requisition ID:</strong> 41314 </p><p><strong>Career Group:</strong> Corporate Careers </p><p><strong>Job Category:</strong> Finance </p><p><strong>Travel Requirements:</strong> 0 - 10%</p><p> </p><p><strong>Country:</strong> Canada (CA) </p><p><strong>Province:</strong> Alberta (CA-AB) </p><p><strong>City:</strong> Calgary </p><p><strong>Location:</strong> Sobeys West Calgary Office </p><p><strong>Postal Code:</strong> </p><p> </p><p>A proudly Canadian retail company, Sobeys began in 1907 as a small meat delivery business in Stellarton, Nova Scotia. Today, Sobeys Inc. serves the food shopping needs of Canadians with approximately 1,500 stores in all 10 provinces under retail banners that include Sobeys, Safeway, IGA, Foodland, FreshCo, Thrifty Foods, and Lawton’s Drug Stores as well as in-store pharmacies, liquor and more than 350 retail fuel locations. </p><p> </p><p>Together with our 125,000 employees and franchise affiliates and a collective passion for delivering exceptional food and shopping experiences, Sobeys’ purpose is to improve the lives of Canadians by helping them Eat Better, Feel Better and Do Better. .</p><p> </p><p> </p><p><b>All career opportunities will be open a minimum of 5 business days from the date of posting.</b></p><p> </p><div><p><p>Overview</p><p><p>Provide financial support to the Real Estate Finance departments, focusing primarily on reviewing, uploading and monitoring minor and major CAR’s (capital appropriation request) into Sobeys ECAR system.</p><p> </p></p></p><p><p>Job Description</p><p><ul><li>Perform review of all major and minor CAR’s to ensure completeness prior to uploading into ECAR (Electronic Capital Acquisition Request) system.</li><li>Continuous monitoring of ECAR inboxes for all regions to ensure timely review of CAR’s and uploading into ECAR.</li><li>Ensure CAR’s are reviewed and approved in accordance with Capital Plan Framework but also for special or unusual circumstances outlined by Manager Real Estate Finance.</li><li>Monitor ECAR and Sharepoint sites to determine status of CAR’s, generate reporting that identifies age and stage of minor and major CAR’s.</li><li>Assist in the maintenance of share point sites.</li><li>Swift and diligent response times to urgent requests for E-CAR approval</li><li>Perform Ad-hoc requests and administration including: investigation of CAR approval in REAC minutes or other, vacation coverage for team members, etc.</li><li>Other duties as requested.</li></ul></p></p><p><p>Job Requirements</p><p><ul><li>Attention to detail, accuracy and timeliness</li><li>Proven ability to work independently and to adjust to a variety of tasks on a daily basis</li><li>Good written and verbal communication skills</li><li>Advanced level competence in MS Office tool suite</li><li>Exceptional people skills</li><li>Problem Solving Ability</li><li>Aptitude for learning additional tools and new concepts in a speedy manner</li><li>Understanding of real estate in a retail environment</li><li>Advanced Excel skills</li><li>3 years or more of progressively increasing levels of responsibility within a finance department in a medium to large organization.</li><li>Accounting Designation ( CMA or CGA) preferred or final stages of obtaining the designation</li></ul></p></p></div><p>Sobeys is committed to accommodating applicants with disabilities throughout the hiring process and will work with applicants requesting accommodation at any stage of this process.</p><p> </p><p> </p><p>While all responses are appreciated only those being considered for interviews will be acknowledged.</p><p> </p><p><strong>We appreciate the interest from Job_Description: Position Title: <strong>Peleton Consultant</strong> <br/><br/> Location: <strong>Calgary, Alberta</strong>, <strong>Canada</strong>  <br/> Position Type: <strong>Contract</strong>  <br/> Languages Required: <strong>English</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Job Description:</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Our Client is looking for a Peloton Consultant to help them on a 6 month contract</strong>  <ul>  	<li>Perform Health check on existing Peloton environment and develop recommendations on changes required</li> <li>Upgrade the existing Peloton environment to the current version</li> <li>Conduct and coordinate testing of the upgrade which includes items such as business functionality and interfaces</li> <li>Assist with deployment to production</li> <li>Develop documentation as required during project execution</li> <li>Interact with client to review the solution and gather required approval</li> </ul> <strong>Skillset:</strong>  <ul>  	<li>Possesses knowledge of the Peloton suite</li> <li>Experience performing upgrades and/or customizations to a packaged software product</li> <li>Experience conducting and coordinating testing</li> <li>Ability to communicate, both in spoken and written language</li> <li>Preference will be given to candidates that possess business knowledge of the drilling, wells and upstream business</li> </ul>

Job_Description: <div> Apply <br/> <br/>  Data Analyst</div> <br/>ROSEN is a leading privately owned company that was established as a one-man business in 1981. Over <br/> the last 35 years, ROSEN has grown rapidly and is today a worldwide technology group that operates in <br/> more than 120 countries with over 3,000 employees. <br/><br/> ROSEN is an extended team of people with a passion for technology and innovation. <br/> Our claim “empowered by technology” is the key to our sophisticated and highly innovative products and <br/> services to the oil and gas and other engineering industries. The focus of all our research efforts and high <br/> tech solutions is on a safe operation of assets and therefore provide protection for both people and the <br/> environment.<br/><br/>Description<br/><br/>At ROSEN Canada we work collaboratively to get the job done. We recognize that each person and every department are integral to meet the needs of our clients and to continue to be a leader in what we do. We also recognize that our employees have different needs and we want to make sure they are being taken care of. <br/><br/> Due to our rapid growth, we are currently looking for the following Data Analyst positions to join our Evaluation team:   <ul> <li>Data Analyst – permanent full-time (1)</li> <li>Data Analyst – temporary full-time one year term (1)</li> <li>Data Analyst, Ultrasonic Crack Detection – permanent full-time (2)</li> </ul>  The Data Analyst receives pipeline in-line inspection data, checks for quality and quantity using proprietary software in accordance with company procedure, with emphasis on optimizing parameters for accuracy and efficiency.<br/><br/>Requirements<br/><br/>Responsibilities:   <ul> <li>In line inspection data assessment;</li> <li>Integration and confirmation of supplementary data;</li> <li>Data Preparation and processing;</li> <li>Data Analysis;</li> <li>Feature categorization and evaluation;</li> <li>Feature sizing;</li> <li>Application of anomaly interaction rules;</li> <li>Standard & non-standard analysis;</li> <li>Organize and report ILI tool results as per client requirements;</li> <li>Maintain personal skills/certifications, and complete additional training as required;</li> <li>Additional related duties as assigned.</li> </ul>  <strong>Qualifications and Skills Required:</strong>   <ul> <li>Previous Pipeline In-line Inspection Data Analysis experience is an asset;</li> <li>Previous related Data Analysis experience is required;</li> <li>Post-secondary education or technical certification is an asset;</li> <li>For the Ultrasonic Crack Detection role, a minimum of 2 years UCD Data Analysis experience is mandatory;</li> <li>Superior troubleshooting skills - determine causes of operating errors and make sound decisions about next actions - ability to solve problems & look for improvements;</li> <li>Advanced English communication skills (written and verbal) are required – ability to receive and communicate technical information accurately and timely;</li> <li>Strong computer and software skills;</li> <li>Strong attention to detail, ability to work on a computer for extended periods of time;</li> <li>Ability to pass a color blindness test;</li> <li>Hold a clean drivers abstract and valid passport, with the ability and flexibility to travel on an infrequent basis for work and/or training;</li> <li>Highly motivated to contribute to the evaluation department team goals and able to work independently;</li> <li>Ability to work flexible hours with the potential of overtime (evening/weekend) based on business needs.<br/><br/>We offer<br/><br/>ROSEN offers a competitive compensation package, including a comprehensive benefit plan, Health & Wellness program, RRSP matching, flexible work hours, a great learning environment, interesting & challenging work and the opportunity for career advancement. Only those candidates selected for interview will be contacted – no phone calls please.</li>  </ul>
Title: Data Analyst

Job_Description: Inter Pipeline is a major petroleum transportation, storage and natural gas liquids processing business that ranks among the largest energy infrastructure companies in Canada. We are proud to be named one of Alberta’s Top 70 Employers, which recognizes Alberta businesses that lead their industries by being exceptional places to work.<br/><br/>Located out of our Calgary office, the individual in the NGL Joint Venture Analyst role will report to Manager, NGL Joint Venture. The NGL Joint Venture Analyst performs key analytical work in support of the NGL Joint Venture team. This role focuses on analytics and reporting relating to our Joint Venture activities at the Pioneer 1 and Pioneer 2 facilities, Redwater Olefinic Fractionator (ROF) and Empress II and V assets, making sure that the NGL Joint Venture team has accurate and meaningful data in order to execute work related to those assets successfully.<br/><br/><strong>Key Activities and Responsibilities:</strong> <ul> <li>Evaluating and communicating operational results and scorecards</li><li>Analyzing and evaluating financial metrics, budgets and costs for operating and non- operated assets</li><li>Report on capital spending and update forecasts and accruals for projects on a monthly basis; prepare AFE’s for new capital and expense projects in SAP</li><li>Prepare monthly spending, variance, accrual and forecast summary reports for operating costs</li><li>Review complex invoices (“JIB Billings”) and ensure compliance with contract terms</li><li>Assist in annual budget process for the NGL Processing Group including entering projects and spending profiles into the Budgeting systems</li><li>Monitor daily gas deliveries at the Empress plants to ensure compliance with contract terms</li><li>Review monthly invoices to ensure compliance with contract terms and maintain associated models</li><li>Assist the accounting department with the preparation and analysis of documents for JV assets</li><li>Special projects as requested</li> </ul> <strong>Education, Skills and Experience:</strong> <ul> <li>University degree, preferably business related (economics, accounting, engineering, business)</li><li>A minimum of 2 years of commercial or analyst experience in the energy industry</li><li>Prior experience with analytics for non-operated and/or joint-venture assets</li><li>Demonstrated knowledge of Canadian oil sands, natural gas, midstream and pipeline operations, assets and infrastructure</li><li>Excellent communication skills and ability to effectively interact with various internal and external stakeholders</li><li>Highly effective organization skills and attention to detail</li><li>Motivated individual able to work independently and as a team player</li> </ul>
Title: NGL Joint Venture Analyst

Job_Description: ◃Careers<br/><br/>Budget Analyst <br/> <br/>  Calgary Studio<br/><br/><strong>National Budget Analyst – Calgary</strong><strong> Studio</strong> <br/><br/> DIALOG is a fully integrated multi-disciplinary design firm incorporating architectural, engineering, interior design, landscape architecture, sustainability, urban design and planning services. Our special culture and spirit is founded on a unique collaborative approach to clients and communities. <br/><br/> We work at the intersection of art and science to create places people love to live, work and play. We design projects of every size and level of complexity, from houses to hospitals, office buildings to police headquarters. We are motivated by taking on difference-making projects that influence the long-term health of people and our environments. What you will find here is passion without pretense; a group that loves coming to the studio every day, rolling up its sleeves, interpreting the visions of our clients, and bringing beautiful, functional places into being. <br/><br/> <strong>About the Role</strong> <br/><br/> The Financial Operations team is committed to connecting the DIALOG business with the numbers. A significant opportunity to link the past numbers with the current and future business exists within a newly-created position of Budget Analyst. Reporting to the Director, Financial Operations, as a senior financial accountant, you will have an opportunity to contribute valuable insight and understanding to the business leaders as to how well we are performing overall, and help influence future decisions by providing a robust set of analysis and recommendations based upon that analysis. <br/><br/> Responsibilities include but are not limited to:  <ul> <li>Gather and validate financial and non-financial information for the annual budget, and monthly business dashboards</li> <li>Partner with the project accountants, financial accounting and business leaders to gather and validate assumptions underlying the financial and non-financial KPIs to enhance the quality of the planning and budgeting deliverables</li> <li>Prepare analysis and reports to enhance the presentation of budgets and business plans with a focus on performance measures, capital spending, and expenses</li> <li>Prepare detailed analysis of the business segments to validate and present the expected operational, commercial, and financial results</li> <li>Transform data into information to facilitate informed decision making throughout the firm</li> <li>Deliver concise and informative information that clearly explains the business drivers and the impact of these on the financial results of the organization</li> <li>Lead the investigation of critical business issues through analysis of results versus budgeted items</li> <li>Propose enhancements to the budget/planning model</li> <li>Manage the process for submission of budget information on a quarterly basis</li> </ul> <strong>Professional Essentials</strong>  <ul> <li> Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Economics, or a related field</li> <li>Professional accountant relevant accreditation (i.e. CPA) will be considered a significant asset</li> <li>Very strong analytical abilities</li> <li>Excellent interpersonal skills and an intrinsic curiosity regarding underlying business drivers</li> <li>Ability to understand complex business issues and present issues in a logical and concise manner</li> <li>Excellent communication skills – both written and oral</li> <li>Very proficient in MS Office, especially Excel including exceptional electronic spreadsheet construction skills</li> <li>7 to 10 years of experience in:   <ul> <li>Financial modelling and consolidated reporting</li> <li>Forecasting and budgeting of a mid-size to large scale organization</li> <li>Creating executive level presentation material</li> </ul>  </li> </ul> <strong>Why work for DIALOG?</strong> <br/><br/> In past years we’ve won Top 100 Employer in Canada for 2013, 2014, 2015 and 2017. Employing over 600 people in 5 studios across Canada & the US, DIALOG is committed to delivering sustainability and excellence in design along with exceptional client service, in a fun working environment.  <ul> <li>Our team is fun, creative and committed to success;</li> <li>DIALOG offers first-class internal training and development;</li> <li>We offer competitive compensation and benefits; and,</li> <li>DIALOG is an award-winning design firm committed to sustainable, integrated design.</li> </ul> <strong>How to Apply</strong> <br/><br/> Please go to www.dialogdesign.ca and visit our Careers Page and submit your <strong>cover letter and resume</strong> in confidence. <br/><br/> We are delighted that you are considering furthering your career with DIALOG. Your submission will be reviewed carefully; however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted. <br/><br/> <em>DIALOG is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to the principle of diversity and looks forward to receiving applications from a wide range of people.</em>
Title: Budget Analyst

Job_Description: <div><div>  <br/><br/> Bow Valley College is the largest and fastest growing Comprehensive Community College in Alberta. We have locations across southern Alberta helping 14,000 learners each year. Our mission is to contribute to the vitality of communities and strength of the economy through innovative adult education programs and services which equip students for successful living, lifelong learning, and employment in a global knowledge-based environment. <br/><br/> Why work at Bow Valley College? We have recently been named one of Alberta's Top 70 Employers for 2018. Bow Valley College is made up of employees who are committed to our learners´ success, as well as each other´s. Our staff and faculty consistently say it is the people who keep them at the College, the opportunity to make a difference in the lives of our students, and the incredible support they receive from their co-workers and supervisors.  <br/><br/> The Information Technology Services (ITS) department is looking for a Systems Analyst - Network and Telecommunications to join their dynamic team. <br/><br/> Reporting to the Lead, Infrastructure Architect, the incumbent is responsible for the installation, support, optimization and maintenance of College’s Unified Communication Systems, along with the network and virtualization infrastructure to achieve high performance of the various business and educational applications supported. This includes all infrastructure hardware devices (core and edge switches, firewalls, wireless controllers, etc.) along with developing processes and procedures for ongoing management of the environment. <br/><br/> Responsibilities: <br/><br/> <strong>Network and Infrastructure Implementation - 60%</strong> <ul> <li>Acts as primary role for Cisco Unified Communication System.</li> <li>Maintain and configure the College’s Voice Gateways.</li> <li>Performs network configurations, including hardware, software, and integration requirements.</li> <li>Researches and evaluate new technologies to recommend the most effective communication and transmission systems.</li> <li>Coordinates network development activities with systems hardware as appropriate.</li> <li>Analyzes and advises system elements such as system hardware as appropriate.</li> <li>Acts as the technical liaison for network product or system vendors.</li> <li>Monitors the network security utilities/ reports to prevent access to systems by unauthorized users.</li> <li>Maintains up-to-date documentation on all network configurations.</li> </ul>   <br/><br/> <strong>Network and Infrastructure Support - 40%</strong> <ul> <li>Resolves helpdesk work orders, prioritize and respond to help desk tickets as appropriate.</li> <li>Contact for escalating voice, network, and infrastructure issues; provide timely response to customer escalations.</li> <li>Adheres to policies, procedures, and technologies to ensure network security.</li> <li>Provides support of network infrastructure systems, configuration and management.</li> <li>Plans and implements upgrades and maintenance fixes.</li> <li>Ensures Infrastructure is fully operational and appropriately integrated for access with other systems.</li> <li>Recommends and executes modifications to network, or Virtualization environment in order to improve efficiency, reliability, and performance.</li> <li>Develops and maintains appropriate documentation.</li> <li>Keep current with technical changes.</li> <li>Other related support duties as assigned.</li> </ul>  </div> </div><br/>   <div> <div> Job Requirements</div><br/>  <div><strong>Minimum Qualifications</strong> <ul> <li>Diploma Computer Science or Management Information Systems or a related discipline preferred.</li> <li>Certificate in CCNA Voice, CCNP Voice.</li> <li>4 years of equivalent work experience.</li> <li>Experience with Voice Gateways (analog, digital and SIP) and dial plan design.</li> <li>Management and configuration of Cisco Unified communications.</li> <li>An equivalent combination of directly related education and experience may be considered.</li> </ul>   <br/><br/> <strong>Preferred</strong> <br/><br/> Hands-On experience Job_Description: <strong>About Bethany</strong> <br/><br/> For over half a century, Bethany has been improving the lives of Alberta seniors and adults with disabilities by providing housing, health and community services that honour their spirit and individuality. <br/><br/> At Bethany, we are on a journey of service excellence, with the launch of WAVE (We Action our Values Everyday), our service excellence program. We are committed to providing great service experiences for our residents, tenants, families and each other. Together, we are living our mission of Creating Caring Communities. <br/><br/> We offer competitive salaries, attractive benefits and pension programs, growth through learning and development, and numerous opportunities to give back to the community just a few of the things that led to Bethany being named one of Albertas Top Employers for 11 consecutive years in 2018. Its simple we invest in our people because they are the reason for our success. <br/><br/> We are delighted that you are considering joining our team! We are looking for people who are passionate about people, working to enhance everyones quality of life at every stage of the journey. <br/><br/> <strong>About the Role</strong> <br/><br/> A career as a Financial Analyst at Bethany is an opportunity to build strong relationships with individuals throughout the organization.This position is a direct expression of Bethanys values We Care, We Show Respect and We are Responsible and ensures these values are carried through in our daily interactions with others. <br/><br/> As a key member of Bethanys Finance team, you will be responsible for the daily, weekly, and monthly processing of financial data, verifying and reconciling financial information, performing relevant duties up to and including preparation and communication of financial statements, budgets, and reports to Finance and Operations management or representatives of third party organizations. Also responsible for directing, supervising and approving the related work of other Finance team staff. <br/><br/> <strong>What You Will Do:</strong> <br/><br/> Individual responsibilities will fall under the following main areas of focus: <ul> <li>Accountable for journal entries, bank and other balance sheet reconciliation and entries</li><li>Capture, record, process, and analyze monthly financial data required for financial statement preparation</li><li>Capture, record, process, and analyze budget entries required for operating and capital budget preparation</li><li>Yearend audit working paper preparation</li><li>Accountable for GST returns, calculations, preparation and filing</li><li>Prepare information required for standard and ad hoc reporting to external agencies</li><li>Accountable for assigned duties relating to the management of financial accounting, reporting and budgeting systems</li> </ul> <strong>What You Bring:</strong> <ul> <li>A recognized Bachelors degree</li><li>Registered at an Intermediate level in the CPA program</li><li>3 years of direct Accounting/Finance experience</li><li>Adaptable and able to manage multiple priorities</li><li>Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills</li><li>Excellent written and verbal communication skills</li><li>Advanced skills in Excel, MS Office, and Accounting Programs</li> </ul> <strong>How to Apply:</strong> <br/><br/> Like what you see and think you have what it takes to join our team? <br/><br/> Apply Online before 23:00 on May 6, 2018 at: http://bethanyseniors.com/careers/ <br/><br/> Please note this competition may close sooner if a suitable candidate is found. <br/><br/> <strong>All applicants are thanked for their interest.</strong> <br/><br/> Bethany Care Society is an equal opportunity employer. <br/><br/> Successful candidates will be required to obtain a Criminal Background Check. <br/><br/> Bethany Care Society complies with the Personal Information Protection and Electronic Documents Act (PIPEDA). By forwarding your resume to Bethany you are consenting to the collection and use of your personal information for this job competition. Your information will be kept strictly confidential.
Title: Finance Analyst

We offer many internal leadership and business skills courses along with tuition reimbursement programs for qualified employees. Every year, a significant number of our employees are able to take on new roles within the company thanks to our strong focus on hands-on learning and development.</DIV> <DIV> </DIV> <DIV>Husky is currently looking for a <B>HR Analyst, Payroll </B>for their Calgary, AB office. </DIV> <DIV> </DIV> <DIV>This position reports to the Manager, Payroll and will be responsible for the coordination of SAP development for Payroll & Time projects. This role will also be integral in our Time Management processes, and as a key member of the Payroll Team you will act as a point of contact for employees, managers and HR Business Partners with Time & Payroll related inquiries. </DIV> <DIV><B> </B></DIV> <DIV> </DIV> <DIV><B>Specific responsibilities will include</B>: </DIV> <UL> <LI> <DIV>Review, coordinate and manage all Payroll and Time SAP queries (follow-up, test, validate) for Payroll in conjunction with Payroll / Time Team and HR Business Partner</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Key member in payroll projects (enhancements, system upgrades, support, processes) to improve quality of payroll services</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Assist with analysis and issue resolution for domestic payroll and time processing to ensure data is administered correctly</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Assist in year-end administration and submissions as required</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Keep abreast of legislative environments as it pertains to Payroll and work proactively to ensure Payroll processes and systems are in place to address legislative changes as they occur</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Opportunity to work on projects – ie: Wage Types, Schedules, SuccessFactors</DIV></LI></UL> <DIV><B>Our ideal candidate will have the following qualifications:</B></DIV> <UL> <LI> <DIV>6 - 10 years' progressive experience working with an integrated financial and payroll system, specifically SAP</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>PCP Certification</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>US and Expat payroll experience is an asset</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>SAP implementation experience from a payroll perspective is an asset</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>SAP Hana experience would be an asset</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Experience processing semi-monthly Canadian payrolls, for 4000 employees, Expatriate Payroll knowledge, including SAP CATS processes</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Experience preparing payroll reconciliations, journal entries, and year-end audits</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Experience with SuccessFactors</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Intermediate to advanced knowledge of SAP Payroll, PA, CATS, and Reporting Functionalities</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Advanced Excel skills</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Analytical, detail oriented, flexible and able to work well under pressure of deadlines, multiple projects, changing priorities, and last-minute changes</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Maintain strict confidentiality</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Strong interpersonal and communication skills</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Works well in a collaborative team environment</DIV></LI></UL> <DIV> </DIV> <DIV><B> </B></DIV> <DIV><B>At Husky, we respect diversity and embrace an inclusive culture. We value uniqueness and different perspectives as they play a critical role in our success. To achieve this, individuals are selected based on qualifications, merit, and abilities and we encourage applications from everyone including visible minorities, Aboriginal people, women, and persons with disabilities.</B></DIV> <DIV> </DIV> <DIV>Husky Energy is an integrated Canadian energy company. It is headquartered in Calgary, Alberta, and is publicly traded on the Toronto Stock Exchange under the symbol HSE. The Company operates Upstream and Downstream business segments, with operations in Canada, the United States, China and Indonesia. </DIV> <DIV> </DIV> <DIV>Husky's balanced growth strategy focuses on consistent execution, disciplined financial management and safe and reliable operations.</DIV> <DIV> </DIV> <DIV>Interested candidates must apply online at: www.huskyenergy.com/careers. Only those candidates who apply via Husky's online application process can be considered. We thank all applicants for their interest in our organization; however, only short-listed applicants will be contacted.</DIV> <DIV> </DIV> <DIV>#LI-Post</DIV>

Job_Description: Manpower is currently seeking to hire a GIS Analyst to fill a long-term contract position for a major pipeline company in Calgary, AB. <br/><br/> Summary of Key Responsibilities include (job functions include but are not limited to): <br/><br/> Provides advanced level support and subject matter expertise in relation to the use of GIS to support business processes, conducting complex spatial analysis to produce GIS products that support business decision making and compliance reporting. <br/> Ensures that GIS data is created, maintained and updated in accordance to the GIS data model and other internal policies; creates documentation on GIS processes and programs. <br/> Proactively manages authored material, creating and updating procedures to ensure data quality control is met. <br/> Accountable for creating, maintaining and updating critical GIS datasets, among other duties assigned. <br/><br/> <strong>Qualifications and Requirements:</strong> <br/> 10+ years experience in a GIS role or position that leveraged GIS technology or combination of education and experience. <br/> Successfully graduated from an accredited post-secondary GIS program or equivalent combination of education and experience. <br/><br/> Please apply online and/or create and manage your profile at www.manpowerab.com. Alternatively, you can email us directly at Melissa.hughes@manpower.com or contact us at 403-269-6936 & ask for Melissa. Please note that only qualified candidates will be contacted. <br/><br/> You can also follow us on Facebook (@manpower.alberta), Instagram (Manpower.AB), Twitter (@ManpowerAB) & LinkedIn (Manpower Alberta) for more information on our current Companies and Job Postings.
