There are opportunities for you to help develop the GIS practice area within the office and company. <br/><br/> We offer a culture that promotes entrepreneurial spirit within the stability of a well-established company. Our growing Calgary office provides many professional development and advancement opportunities for those with an aptitude for consulting.</div>  <br/>  <div> <div>how you'll contribute to our company</div> <br/>Responsibilities will include the following:  <ul>  	<li>Generate new business opportunities and maintain client relationships</li> <li>Deliver figure generation</li> <li>Perform data cleaning and management</li> <li>Conduct database design</li> <li>Perform spatial and data analysis, including building hydraulic models</li> <li>Work alongside CAD staff on an array of activities</li> <li>Contribute to and lead multi-disciplinary and complex projects</li> <li>Work cross-functionally with a dynamic team of environmental scientists and engineers</li> </ul>  </div><br/>   <div> <div>what you will bring to the table</div> <br/>You should have the following qualifications:  <ul>  	<li>Graduate degree in relevant pure or applied science</li> <li>Minimum 2 years of post-graduation experience in consulting</li> <li>Progressive knowledge of ESRI and Manifold products; programming, preferably in SQL, Python, VB.NET, VB, and Statistics</li> <li>Excellent written and verbal communication skills</li> <li>Ability to work well under pressure and meet deadlines within a team environment</li> <li>Excellent organization skills and attention to detail</li> </ul>  </div><br/>   <div> <div>how you'll showcase your fit to the position</div> <br/>If you have the right background and would like to join a Platinum Club Member of Canada's Best Managed Companies Program, please forward your resume in confidence to: <br/><br/> Human Resources <br/> Associated Engineering <br/> 400-600 Crowfoot Crescent NW <br/> Calgary, Alberta T3G 0B4 <br/><br/> Fax: 250-545-3654 <br/> E-Mail: <u>hr-env@ae.ca</u> <br/><br/> Please include position title and location in the subject line if you are e-mailing your application. We thank all applicants, but will only contact those candidates selected for interviews.</div>  <br/>  <div> AE is an Equal Opportunity Employer and encourages women, Aboriginal people, persons with disabilities, members of visible minorities, and members of the LGBT community to apply. Job_Description: Sr Demand Analyst - 00127878-20180425 Description One of Huskys advantages is that we are an integrated oil and gas company. From exploration to development, production, refining and marketing, weve got it all! Combine this with a range of learning and development tools and an inclusive work environment, and you are well-positioned for a successful career at Husky. We have training, mentoring and career development programs and resources to help you develop both personally and professionally as an employee or a leader. We offer many internal leadership and business skills courses along with tuition reimbursement programs for qualified employees. Every year, a significant number of our employees are able to take on new roles within the company thanks to our strong focus on hands-on learning and development. Husky is currently looking for a Sr Demand Analyst at their Calgary, Alberta location. The Sr Demand Analyst works with Business and IS stakeholders to define, document, and validate analytics in support of business objectives and capabilities. This position takes ownership of business & IS demand analytics, key performing indicators; understanding intake, delivery and resourcing trends and assuring the prioritization of small demand in alignment with business needs. Working in direct collaboration with the IS Demand Analyst, the Sr Demand Analyst is accountable for assisting in the shaping opportunities into small, deliverable units of work in line with business priorities. This position plays a support role in release and maintenance efforts. This position is focused on identifying and understanding demand delivery related constrains in the domains of Upstream, Downstream, or Enterprise. Specific responsibilities will include : Communicate with the IS Demand Specialists, IS Management and IS Business Partners, regarding our overall status based on KPIs of our integrated delivery process Take ownership of demand analytics to identify delivery constraints and commitment risks and escalate accordingly Propose the reprioritization of ideas and features (enhancements/defects) based on dimensions identified during the shaping process while ensuring of alignment with business needs Forecast demand for existing technology resources and assesses the impact of prioritization of future initiatives Monitor and report on demand backlog along with other capability-specific enhancements/defects to keep workstreams full and delivery services fully utilized Review delivery of release progress regularly and escalate delivery commitment delays Play a support role in release and maintenance efforts to ensure coordinated deployment of solutions into production Continuously provide insight via visualizations of demand progress/status Assist demand specialists with the capturing of ideas, shaping of demand and submissions to engage procurement Take ownership of account review analytics Continuous improvement of demand analytics and management KPI dashboards Qualifications Our ideal candidate will have the following qualifications: Post-secondary degree in related discipline BRM certification ITIL Foundations Minimum 2-5 years' experience working with IS investment portfolios and analytics Experience building forecasting/financial models in tools such as Excel Experience in IS budgeting/cost analysis Background in financial portfolio management and understanding of how this could be applied to an IS environment would be an asset Minimum 3 years' experience with IS in an oil and gas domain Working knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite Portfolio Management Experience identifying issues and solutions in forecasting, acquiring, managing and deploying resources Stakeholder Management Interact with and present to a wide range of stakeholders Financial Management Able to create reports for front-line and executive level presentations Capable of performing strategic analysis and planning, ability to see the big picture and maintain, analyze and report on a large and diverse portfolio of demand Ability to develop forecasting and trending models Sound business judgment, negotiation, influencing and overall excellent people skills At Husky, we respect diversity and embrace an inclusive culture. We value uniqueness and different perspectives as they play a critical role in our success. To achieve this, individuals are selected based on qualifications, merit, and abilities and we encourage applications from everyone including visible minorities, Aboriginal people, women, and persons with disabilities. Husky Energy is an integrated Canadian energy company. It is headquartered in Calgary, Alberta, and is publicly traded on the Toronto Stock Exchange under the symbol HSE. The Company operates Upstream and Downstream business segments, with operations in Canada, the United States, China and Indonesia. Husky's balanced growth strategy focuses on consistent execution, disciplined financial management and safe and reliable operations. Interested candidates must apply online at: www.huskyenergy.com/careers . Only those candidates who apply via Husky's online application process can be considered. We thank all applicants for their interest in our organization; however, only short-listed applicants will be contacted. #LI-Post Job Business Analysis Primary Location CA-AB-Calgary
Title: Sr Demand Analyst

The Tax Analyst will assist the Manager Accounting at month-end, quarter-end and year-end to prepare reconciliations, accruals and audit related questions. <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities:</strong>  <ul> <li>Prepare monthly, Quarterly and annual tax returns</li>  <li>Assist with tax and CSOX Audits</li>  <li>New tax/rate implementation (registrations, system set up, filling)</li>  <li>Exemption certificates collection and system set up</li>  <li>Monthly Internal data audit</li>  <li>Ensure all necessary journal entries get posted to GL</li>   <li>Other specific analysis and/or initiatives, as required, to support the business unit.</li> </ul> <strong>Qualifications:</strong>  <ul> <li>Community College Diploma in accounting.</li>  <li>More than three (3), up to 5 years accounting, or accounts payable experience.</li>  <li>General knowledge of business and a good business sense.</li>  <li>Strong analytical and problem solving skills with attention to detail.</li>  <li>Well organized, with excellent time management skills.</li>  <li>Strong computer skills, especially in Microsoft Excel.</li>  <li>Ability to multitask and handle multiple deadlines and changing priorities.</li>   <li>Ability to gain the trust and confidence of managers.</li>  <li>Solid team player with exceptional oral and written communication skills.</li>  <li>Excellent interpersonal skills with a high level of honesty and integrity.</li> </ul> If you are interested in this challenging opportunity, please apply by <strong>May 18, 2018</strong> to: <br/><br/> Email : careers@superiorgasliquids.com</div> </div><div></div>
Title: Tax Analyst

Job_Description: <DIV><strong>What YOU Will Do:</strong></DIV> <br/>The TELUS Business Intelligence team is accountable for optimizing funnel and operational analysis through the design and implementation of innovation and business analytics for Customer Sales and Marketing programs. <br/><br/> As Performance Analysis Consultant, you will help lead the creation of a modern analytical framework built around data science, optimization and self-service analytics to enable key innovation strategies. <br/><br/> Our team is a fast-paced and entrepreneurial environment that is a great place to learn and grow. We have a culture of collaboration, recognition, and high-performance. Simply put, if you're curious, bright, and ambitious and looking for a challenge, this is the place to be.  <ul> <li>Support data-driven decision-making by enabling actionable insights from disparate data sources and implementing key innovation opportunities for stakeholders</li> <li>Design and implement Sales and EBITDA solutions to enable funnel management and coverage.</li> <li>Implement best-in-class end-to-end analytical processes to drive operational efficiencies and improved decision-making</li> <li>Work in conjunction with Sales and other teams for business readiness and implementing needed program requirements</li> <li>Mentor, assist with coaching and provide expert technical guidance to less experienced team members</LI> </ul>  <strong><DIV>Your ideal profile includes:</DIV>  <br/></strong>   <ul> <li>Strong understanding of Salesforce platform</li> <li>Fundamental understanding of statistical modeling utilizing regression and normalization</li> <li>Expert ability to break down and decompose complex datasets and ambiguous problems</li> <li>Understand telecom business models, measures, and metrics</li> <li>Deep expertise in various flavors of SQL and story tools such as Tableau/Wave</li> <li>Experience with a structured programming language such as C, C , Java, Python</li> <li>Strong background in utilizing various data modeling tools</li> <li>Ability to create and present to all levels of the organization including ELT; ability to take create meaningful business stories from complex datasets</li> <li>Able to effectively engage stakeholders to establish cross functional alignment for projects and initiatives</LI> </ul> <strong>Required Professional Designation/Certification & Experience:</strong>  <ul> <li>Post-secondary degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Economics or a related experience</li> <li>5 years’ of consulting or related predictive modeling/statistical experience is required</LI> </ul>  <DIV><strong>Who is TELUS?</strong></DIV> <br/> <strong></strong><br/>  <DIV>We're a high-performing team of individuals who collectively make TELUS one of the leading telecommunications companies in Canada. Our competitive consumer offerings include wireline, wireless, internet and Optik TV™. We also deliver a compelling range of products and services for small, medium and large businesses; and have carved out a leadership position in the health, energy, finance and public sector markets with innovative industry specific solutions.</DIV> <br/> <strong></strong><br/>  <DIV>Everyone belongs at TELUS. It doesn’t matter who you are, what you do or how you do it, at TELUS, your unique contribution and talents will be valued and respected. Because the more diverse perspectives we have the more likely we are to crack the code on what our customers want and our communities need.</DIV> <br/> <strong></strong><br/>  <DIV>Do you share our passion?</DIV> <br/> <strong></strong> <br/><br/> <strong></strong><br/>  <DIV>At TELUS, <strong>you</strong> create future friendly® possibilities.</DIV> <br/> <strong></strong><br/>  <DIV>At TELUS, we are committed to diversity and equitable access to employment opportunities based on ability.</DIV>
Title: Performance Analyst Consultant (Sales)

Job_Description: <div><div> <strong>Analyst, Risk Analytics</strong><br/><br/>AltaGas is an energy infrastructure business with a focus on natural gas, power, and regulated utilities. We have, and continue to build, a solid portfolio of assets to serve producers and to provide clean and affordable energy to our customers. We continuously strive to build dynamic teams to support our future growth. We provide opportunity, challenge and competitive compensation within a positive work environment that motivates people to build careers within our company. AltaGas’ success is driven by a skilled team of more than 1700 employees. <br/><br/> Rapid expansion of our business has created a wide range of career opportunities for qualified individuals. If you want to work for a company that offers work/life balance, financial assistance to support continuous learning and growth, and that has a solid track record of success with an achievement-oriented organizational culture, AltaGas may be the right company for you. <br/><br/> Reporting to the Manager Risk Analytics this position is responsible for developing enhanced measurement of market exposures, prices, and overall risk for AltaGas’ portfolio of commodity transactions, and enhancing the existing reporting to encompass our growing business.<br/><br/><strong>Responsibilities of the position include, but are not limited to the following:</strong>   <ul>  <li>Working collaboratively with Front, Middle, and Back office to ensure accurate valuation and reporting of transactions</li>    <li>Hands-on approach to Commodity Risk, taking a lead role in developing price models and price validation tools for commodity markets across North America</li>    <li>Analyzing internal and external market data and creating concise explanatory visuals and presentations</li>    <li>Collecting and analyzing data to support valuation models for prospective transactions</li>    <li>Developing tools to reconcile AltaGas’ commodity transaction exposure, position, and P&L</li>    <li>Ad hoc projects relating to AltaGas’ commodity transactions and prospective transactions</li>    <li>Utilizing analytical tools to assess future commodity risks</li>    <li>Creating and documenting commodity transaction valuation models</li>    <li>Explaining commodity market movements and drivers</li>    <li>Working within ETRM systems or other transactional data systems</li>    </ul>  <strong>Required Skills and Competencies:</strong>   <ul>  <li>Undergraduate degree in a quantitative discipline like Mathematics, Statistics, Finance, Economics, or Engineering.</li>    <li>Three to five years of experience in a Front or Middle Office role dealing in Natural Gas, Power, or NGL markets</li>    <li>Solid understanding of advanced market risk modelling techniques including option models, volatility measures, VaR, back-testing, stress scenarios, etc.</li>    <li>Ability to work independently and to collaborate as part of a team, while managing a volatile work load</li>    <li>Advanced skills in Excel and other business applications</li>    <li>Ability to effectively query SQL databases to extract required information</li>    <li>Experience with high-level programming languages (Java, C#, Python, etc.) is an asset</li>    <li>Experience with Allegro software is an asset</li>    </ul> Qualified applicants are invited to submit their resumes and accompanying cover letters in confidence to the Human Resources Department by visiting the link below. <br/><br/> We thank all applicants for their interest in our organization, but only those candidates selected for interviews will be contacted. No agency referrals or telephone inquiries at this time, please.</div> </div><div></div>
Title: Analyst, Risk Analytics

Job_Description: <P><STRONG><EM>Interested in being a part of a team that is leading the evolution of retail in Canada?<BR></EM></STRONG> <BR>Embracing and driving change is critical to our success. The complexity and rate at which the retail industry is transforming has increased exponentially in recent years and we are committed to being a leader in the industry. As such we are relentlessly focused on innovating at every level of our business, investing in new technologies and products, and doubling down on the best talent to drive the company forward. It is an especially exciting time to join the Canadian Tire Family of Companies.<BR> <BR><STRONG>What you'll do:</STRONG></P> <P>Reporting to the Manager, Financial Planning & Analysis, the Senior Analyst will be responsible to provide financial and analytical expertise within Mark's. The incumbent will play a key role in understanding system integration, corporate strategy and sales drivers and will provide insights into the financial performance of the company. </P> <P> </P> <P>During the monthly, quarterly and annual reporting cycle, the incumbent will be responsible to ensure that relevant analysis and reports are prepared to support various levels of reviews and presentations for senior stakeholders both internally and externally. This role will regularly collaborate with stakeholders across the organization to drive financial results. </P> <P>Key Objectives and Accountabilities:</P> <UL> <LI>Prepare and review monthly reporting packages which contain various reports and analysis </LI> <LI>Work with the Manager, Financial Planning & Analysis, to provide quantitative and qualitative decision support including proactive financial analysis</LI> <LI>Review key performance metrics (financial and business metrics) to improve existing reports and develop new reports </LI> <LI>Continuously seek to improve the quality and efficiency of these reports, including enhancing financial analysis models and streamlining analysis and processes</LI> <LI>Foster strong working relationships across the divisional businesses, and work proactively to identify opportunities for finance to act as a strategic business partner</LI> <LI>Provide support and/or lead ad hoc projects as necessary<BR>Support business partners with financial analysis focused on forward looking results</LI> <LI>Thorough analysis and investigation into the variances to plan and forecast</LI> <LI>Develop analysis that delivers qualitative and quantitative information, including internal performance</LI> <LI>Participate in planning meetings with business colleagues to support ongoing initiatives</LI> <LI>Partner and influence Management to ensure that the plan is realistic and executable</LI> <LI>Lead and participate in analytics projects with a focus on strategic imperatives; assess strategic alternatives and lead change and process design in the business.</LI></UL> <P><STRONG>Qualifications:</STRONG></P> <UL> <LI>Professional accounting designation (CPA, CFA).</LI> <LI>Minimum of four (4) years progressive experience in business or financial analytical role with at least two (2) years post designation</LI> <LI>Demonstrated experience with revenue planning or accounting in a large organization</LI> <LI>Strong technical and accounting knowledge as well as superior analytical skills</LI> <LI>Advanced MS Excel and PowerPoint skills</LI> <LI>Experience with financial systems (ERP) and Hyperion (Planning and HFM) preferred</LI> <LI>Demonstrated ability to independently plan, prioritize and coordinate activities to consistently meet deadlines</LI> <LI>Ability to clearly and confidently communicate recommendations, and trade-offs</LI> <LI>Ability to influence and persuade different points of view<BR>Strong time management and self-management skills</LI></UL>  Canadian Tire is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace for all. We recognize that our future success depends on the perspectives and contributions of all our employees -- their diverse backgrounds, abilities and experiences make our business stronger. If you are contacted for a job opportunity, please advise us of any accommodations needed to ensure fair and equitable access throughout the recruitment and selection process. All accommodation information provided will be treated as confidential and used only for the purpose of providing an accessible candidate experience.
Title: Senior Financial Analyst - Mark's

Job_Description: <strong>Financial Analyst I <br/> Calgary, AB <br/> 6+ Months</strong> <br/><br/> A Finance Analyst I is responsible for collecting & analyzing financial data and making recommendations to Finance or operating leaders. <br/><br/> <strong>Key responsibilities essential functions include:</strong>   <ul> <li>Reporting and month end close tasks</li> <li>Partner with leadership to drive performance & act as champion for strategic initiatives within the organization</li> <li>Contributes to developing estimates, operating plans forecasts reviews</li> <li>Drive profitable growth by providing analysis of results and identifying & tracking key metrics while advising the leadership team on risks and opportunities, as well as recommending actions - Contribute to improving efficiencies and performance as well as providing quality financial information.</li> <li>Actively participate with Operations Management to improve productivity.</li> <li>Develop and improve financial processes Finance reporting tools,</li> <li>Management reporting tools, budgeting and estimating processes, standard Production Cost set ups and analyses, Capital Investment.</li> <li>Assist with management reporting (regional and segment P&Ls) and communicate results to managers.</li> <li>Drive consistent usage of COFE, GLA (report net), and COGNOS Business Intelligence (B.I.) tools.</li> <li>Develop new reports for process improvements.</li> </ul>  <strong>Required Qualifications</strong>    <ul> <li>Bachelors degree in Accounting, Finance, or Business Administration or High School Diploma GED and minimum of three years financial work experience including developing forecasts & operating plans and leading business finance reviews</li> </ul>
Title: GECAN - Financial Analyst I

Job_Description: <div>Interested in being a part of a team that is leading the evolution of retail in Canada?</div><br/> <div>Embracing and driving change is critical to our success. The complexity and rate at which the retail industry is transforming has increased exponentially in recent years and we are committed to being a leader in the industry. As such we are relentlessly focused on innovating at every level of our business, investing in new technologies and products, and doubling down on the best talent to drive the company forward. It is an especially exciting time to join the Canadian Tire Family of Companies.</div><br/> <div>Our Technology team plays a critical role in our evolution, specifically as we transition to an omni-retailer where digital complements the physical. Our commitment to being a world-class digital organization is evident in how we are using cutting-edge technologies to bring our digital strategy to life in-store, online and on your mobile devices, ultimately improving customer experiences, driving traffic, and boosting loyalty.</div> <br/> <div>The Digital Operations team provides 24x7 production support for e-commerce banners including Sportchek, Marks, and Atmosphere. The team works core business hours and provides off-hours pager support on a rotating basis. The list of supported applications includes, but is not limited to: Web Content Management Systems, e-commerce Systems, Integration Endpoints and Connected Systems.</div><br/> <div><strong>What you’ll do:</strong></div><div>As a member of the Digital Operations team, the Systems Support Analyst plays a support role that provides production support and maintenance for e-commerce based applications.</div><br/>  <div><strong>Specific duties include:</strong></div><div>  <ul> <li>Preserving/Restoring service and resolving client-reported problems escalated from the 1st level support desk or monitoring alerts. Ensuring that business users are informed as to status and expected resolution times.</li><li>Providing 2nd level incident support, including rotating off-hours pager support.</li><li>Providing hands-on application support for daily operations for core applications, including service, data and process integrity, configuration, user administration, reporting and optimization.</li><li>Identifying root cause and resolution of any incidents reported by the monitoring systems and end users. Analyzing data inaccuracies and identifying risks of changes to the environment.</li><li>Developing the monitoring and alerting portfolio to meet service level requirements.</li><li>Ensuring software being transitioned to the team for support is stable and sustainable by guiding project teams during warranty periods.</li><li>Ensuring Change Management processes are adhered to.</li><li>Maintaining documentation, run-books, and providing training.</li><li>Providing SME (subject matter expertise) to projects and teams developing software enhancements.</li></ul></div> <br/> <div><strong>Who you are:</strong></div><br/>  <div><strong>We are looking for high performing individuals who are:</strong></div><div>  <ul> <li>Agile and innovative individuals, who are able to manage in an environment of change and ambiguity to help us take bold and strategic moves in this rapidly evolving retail environment.</li><li>Creative thinkers who take initiative and are capable of building, launching and managing projects/programs that drive results for our customers.</li><li>Problem solvers with the ability to analyze and prioritize to meet business objectives.</li><li>Collaborative team players with superior influencing skills, who build relationships easily across various stakeholder groups to move initiatives forward .</li></ul></div> <br/> <div>If you’re curious, ready to take on new challenges and open to doing things differently to help us evolve rapidly, then Canadian Tire is definitely the place to be.</div><br/> <div><strong>What you’ve done:</strong></div><div>  <ul> <li>3-5 years of experience in a retail environment and 5-7 years in an IT environment.</li><li>3-5 years of experience of SAP (Hybris) and Adobe (AEM) applications.</li><li>3-5 years of experience in Cloud Marketing tools including Google and Adobe.</li><li>Understanding of database environments (Oracle, MongoDB) with experience in reading, writing, and executing queries and scripts.</li><li>Solid experience in monitoring and managing production systems including Java-based applications and Linux-based environments.</li><li>Good understanding of retail business processes from an e-commerce and omni-channel perspective.</li><li>Excellent analytical skills with a keen attention to detail.</li><li>Strong technical and troubleshooting skills with the ability to correlate information.</li><li>Excellent facilitation and communication skills with the ability to bring multiple teams, knowledge-sets, and experience levels together to solve issues.</li><li>Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and able to meet strict timelines.</li><li>Ability to learn quickly, maintain documentation and deliver training to others.</li><li>Ability to compile ideas into a formal presentation and deliver to a group of individuals at various levels of the organization.</li><li>A strong focus on curiosity, drive, teamwork, and communication with a dedication to customer experience, brand, and revenue.</li></ul></div> <br/> <div><strong>Why us:</strong></div><div>Canadian Tire is one of Canada’s most iconic and diversified companies. Our culture and values uphold our pledge to sustainable practices, and commitment to our local communities through Jumpstart cannot be beat.</div> <br/> <div>To learn more about this team and the Canadian Tire Family of Companies follow us on LinkedIn.</div><br/> <div>AODA/D&I statement</div><br/>
Title: Systems Support Analyst - FGL Sports

Job_Description: <div><strong>Job ID:</strong> 150050 <br/> <strong>Store Name/Number:</strong> AB-The Core (0582) <br/> <strong>Address:</strong> 317 -7 Ave SW, Calgary, AB T2P 2Y9, Canada (CA) <br/> <strong>Full Time/Part Time:</strong> Part Time <br/> <strong>Position Type:</strong> Regular <br/><br/> The Operations Consultant works in partnership with the Operations Supervisor to maintain stockroom organization and merchandise updates. <br/><br/> <strong>ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES</strong> <br/> Client Service  <ul>  <li>Provide friendly, professional and knowledgeable service to clients as needed during store business hours.</li> <li>Assist in training other cashiers and consultants on Point-Of-Sale (POS) and MPOS.</li> </ul>  Store Presentation  <ul>  <li>Assist in maintaining standards of cleanliness and organization within the cashier zone.</li> <li>Be aware of and assist in maintaining SEPHORA’s merchandising concepts.</li> <li>Participate in programs to reduce shortage/loss.</li> </ul>  Merchandising and Operations  <ul>  <li>Perform shipment receipt and processing in a timely manner.</li> <li>Organize and maintain stockroom per company standards.</li> <li>Process transfers, damages and testers per company standards.</li> <li>Check in all visual elements and communicate missing/damaged pieces to Operations Supervisor.</li> <li>Ensure safety and tidiness standards are respected and maintained at all times.</li>  <li>Communicate inventory issues/concerns to Supervisor (s), Assistant Manager(s) or Store Manager.</li> <li>Ensure compliance with sampling policies and procedures.</li> <li>Participate in inventory control.</li> <li>Designated consultants will be cross-trained in cashier functions.</li> </ul>  <strong>EXPECTED SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS</strong>  <ul>  <li>1-2 years of retail/client service industry experience, preferably in a stockroom capacity.</li> <li>Possess good computer, arithmetic and organizational skills.</li> <li>Ability to multi-task, while being attentive to the needs of clients and the business.</li> <li>Effective time management, problem solving and communication skills.</li> <li>A High School graduate or equivalent.</li> <li>Flexible availability including evenings, weekends and holidays is required.</li> </ul>  <strong>ADDITIONAL INFORMATION</strong> <br/> <strong>Physical Requirements:</strong>  <ul>  <li>Work in a fragrance filled environment.</li> <li>Lift and carry up to 50 pounds. <li>Bend and stretch to stock shelves.</li> </ul>  <strong>COMPANY OVERVIEW</strong> <br/> Owned by LVMH Moet Hennessy Louis Vuitton, the world&apos;s leading luxury goods group, Sephora is highly regarded as a beauty trailblazer, thanks to its unparalleled assortment of prestige products, unbiased service from experts, interactive shopping environment, and innovation <br/> <strong>Sephora stores</strong> - Sephora operates approximately 1,900 stores in 29 countries worldwide, with an expanding base of over 360 stores across North America. Sephora opened its first U.S. store in New York in 1998, its first Canadian store in Toronto in 2004. Sephora&apos;s North American headquarters is located in San Francisco, with corporate offices in New York, Montreal and Toronto. <br/> <strong>Sephora.com</strong>  - Launched in the U.S. in 1999 and Canada in 2003, the foremost beauty site on the Internet is also Sephora&apos;s largest North American store in terms of sales and selection of products and brands.</div>

Title: Systems Support Analyst - FGL Sports

Job_Description: The Marketing Specialist role within the Purchasing department is to act as the liaison between Purchasing and Marketing, for the coordination and execution of our National Flyer Program, Marks.com, Magazine, TV, Billboard, Radio and other External Advertising such as ROP, digital ad’s & sponsorships. This person must work closely with purchasing and the compliance team to ensure all external advertising is compliant with the Competition Act. Feedback, proofing and guidance on the In-Store experience including Signage, Digital Media, & Merchandise Set up’s is also required. <br/><br/> Learning the products and understanding the vision of the purchasing is a key component to success. Knowing this information allows you to communicate the direction to the various departments. <br/><br/> This position ultimately reports to the VP of Purchasing. It is the touch point between many departments and Purchasing. You must be a problem solver; be detail orientated and have excellent communication skills. This is a fast paced environment where good time management is essential to success. <br/><br/> Responsibilities <br/><br/> Collaborate with Purchasing and Marketing to build and maintain advertising plans. <br/><br/> Learn the products, innovations and technologies and be able to communicate them. <br/><br/> Work with VP of Purchasing to give marketing direction of the world vision for the season and 5 year outlook. <br/><br/> Seasonally allocate flyer space to build advertising plan. <br/><br/> Build Flyer Paginations. All planned ad items laid out by page with allocated space. <br/><br/> Collect and communicate all product information needed to Marketing, including wardrobing, for creating ads. <br/><br/> Meet with Marketing & Ad agency to review paginations and give direction to build Flyer Page Plans. <br/><br/> Review Flyer Layouts with Purchasing team for accuracy and give feedback to marketing on creative direction for photography. <br/><br/> Review all Flyer Proofs with Purchasing for accuracy of copy detail, image selection and ensure sufficient inventory. <br/><br/> Give feedback to marketing and agency on Flyer Proofs through proof HQ and weekly meetings with Marketing Flyer Coordinator. <br/><br/> Get purchasing to complete a Flyer sign-off sheet for each flyer. Ensure all items and pricing are correct. <br/><br/> Review the Price Events in PMM for each flyer for accuracy. <br/><br/> Compile analysis of flyer campaign results. <br/><br/> Solid understanding of Competition Act. <br/><br/> Monitor with purchasing and compliance team all advertised items throughout the season ensuring compliancy. <br/><br/> Work with National Brand vendors for ad approvals. <br/><br/> Work with the Purchasing teams to ensure all pricing is set up for all promotional events. <br/><br/> Collaborate with the Digital Marketing team on digital ads. <br/><br/> Work with Web team to properly represent a good selection of our products on marks.com site. <br/><br/> Work with Signage team to ensure products and pricing are properly represented on signs in-store. <br/><br/> Work with vendors, purchasing & marketing on specialty campaigns including magazine, digital & sponsorships. <br/><br/> Incorporate flyer research and learning. <br/><br/> Required Skills and Experience <br/><br/> Excellent knowledge of the Canadian retail industry <br/><br/> 5 + years’ experience in retail, marketing or advertising <br/><br/> Degree or diploma in marketing an asset <br/><br/> Ability to handle multiple projects and prioritize with time sensitive tight deadlines <br/><br/> Excellent interpersonal skills to deal with colleagues of all levels, internally and externally <br/><br/> Strong problem-solving and organizational skills, and attention to detail <br/><br/> Strong analytic and quantitative skills <br/><br/> Superior verbal and written communication skills <br/><br/> Proficient with Excel, Microsoft Word, PowerPoint and Adobe <br/><br/> Basic skills in Outlook would be an asset
Title: Marketing Specialist - Industrial & Footwear

Job_Description: <b>Posting End Date:</b><p> </p><b>Number of Opening:</b>1<p> </p><b>Worker Type:</b>Permanent<p> </p><b>Position Overview:</b>Reporting to the Manager, Identity & Access Management, the Intermediate Identity & Access Management Analyst will be globally responsible for improving the security posture of all Finning regions with regards to: identity governance administration, conditional access management and privileged identity management.<br><br>The ideal candidate for this position is a proven thought leader, problem solver and integrator of people and processes, as well as an effective global internal consultant. The Intermediate Identity & Access Management Analyst must possess solid domain competencies in a number of Identity Management disciplines, including identity governance, authentication and authorization, privileged identity management, risk, privacy and compliance.<p> </p><b>Job Description:</b><p><u><b>Major Job Functions: </b></u></p><ul><li>Identity governance administration including configuring, maintaining, and monitoring SailPoint IdentityIQ functionality including certification campaigns, access policies and roles, and administering access requests and lifecycle events</li><li>Conditional access management including analysis of requests for multifactor authentication for applications employing Single Sign On (SSO), and configuration of conditional access management policies</li><li>Privileged identity management including administration of an enterprise credential store solution, privileged session management and endpoint privileged account management</li><li>Responsible for role management, entitlement analysis, role mining, developing roles for provisioning and maintaining roles</li><li>Responsible for certification configuration, certification decisions, certification completion and user support through certifications</li><li>Responsible for policy definition, detection and remediation of policy violations, and administration of segregation of duty policies, activity policies, risk score policies and other advanced policies</li><li>Responsible for identity and application risk scoring configuration, and monitoring risk.</li><li>Responsible for access request administration, lifecycle request configuration, monitoring access requests, and managing work items</li><li>Responsible for deployment strategies, entitlement catalog maintenance, application onboarding, and account correlation and aggregation strategies.</li><li>Responsible for identity maintenance, orphan account correlation, task scheduling and monitoring and troubleshooting</li><li>Responsible for configuration and maintenance of an enterprise credential store to manage passwords, SSH keys and privileged credentials</li><li>Responsible for configuration and maintenance of privileged session management tool to secure, monitor, and record privileged user sessions</li><li>Responsible for providing intelligence to detect, alert and respond to anomalous privileged activity in coordination with the Security Operations Center</li><li>Responsible for configuration and maintenance of tools to enforce least privilege, control applications and prevent credential theft on endpoints throughout the enterprise</li><li>Responsible for configuration and maintenance of conditional access policies and coordination with infrastructure team and service providers to ensure integration with Single Sign On services</li></ul><p> </p><p><u><b>Specific Skills & Knowledge:</b></u></p><ul><li>Proven ability to communicate with people at all levels — from analysts to executives</li><li>Excellent written and verbal communication skills — including the ability to effectively communicate security- and risk-related concepts to technical and nontechnical audiences — and strong interpersonal and collaborative skills</li><li>Strong skills as a negotiator, to facilitate commitment to, and sign-off on and document appropriate levels of residual risk</li><li>High level of personal integrity, with the ability to handle confidential and otherwise sensitive matters professionally and with the appropriate level of judgment and maturity</li><li>High degree of initiative, dependability and ability to work with little supervision</li><li>Ability to establish and maintain harmonious working relationships with co-workers, staff and external contacts in all locations, and to work effectively in a professional team environment.</li><li>Spanish is an asset, not mandatory</li><li>Basic knowledge of a broad range of standards and frameworks — for example, IT Infrastructure Library (ITIL), , Bill 198, Personal Information Protection and Electronics Documents Act (PIPEDA), EU General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR)</li><li>Understanding of strategic business risks</li><li>Ability to develop a comprehensive understanding of Finning’s business, market and industry and relate that knowledge to identified operations- and IT-related risks</li><li>Knowledge necessary to propose relevant IT responses to changing business risks and regulatory changes</li></ul><p></p><p><u><b>Education & Experience:</b></u></p><ul><li>Bachelor’s degree in Computer Sciences or equivalent experience</li><li>Obtained or working towards one of: Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP), Certified Information Security Manager (CISM), Certified Information Systems Auditor (CISA), Certified in Risk and Information Systems Control</li><li>Three to six years of experience in identity and access management or a related discipline (for example, IT security operations, risk, privacy, business continuity management or compliance).</li><li>Working experience with identity governance administration processes and tools, including access certifications and access request management</li><li>Working experience with privileged identity management processes and tools, including credential management, session management and endpoint privilege management</li><li>Working experience with conditional access management and/or multi-factor authentication solutions, and single sign on authentication protocols</li><li>Experience with assessing identity and access management requirements for new projects</li></ul><p></p><p> </p><p> </p><p>We are committed to diversity at Finning, to building and sustaining a diverse and inclusive workforce and as an equal opportunity employer we encourage applications from all qualified individuals. Finning does not discriminate against applicants based on genders, races, national and ethnic origins, religions, ages, sexual orientation, marital and family status, and/or mental or physical disabilities.</p>
Title: Identity & Access Management Analyst

Job_Description: Joint Venture Analyst – Calgary, AB<br/><br/>Reporting to the Manager, Facilities Engineering & Joint Venture Operations, you will create and maintain existing and new joint venture agreements. You will complete thorough area reviews of facilities and pipelines, agreements, production and third-party/carried partners to ensure all joint venture agreement revenue has been captured. You will help accounting resolve incorrect billings, equalization issues and JIB disputes. You will also be responsible for reviewing AFEs to ensure working interest is correct for facilities and pipeline projects. Developing and implementing electronic processes and systems for improved efficiency is another key aspect of this position. <br/><br/> To qualify for this position, you have a minimum of 10 years of upstream energy business experience. You have a strong understanding of upstream oil and gas including facilities, production, operations, drilling and completions. Exposure to other areas of the oil and gas business such as accounting, land (unit agreements) and marketing will be considered assets. <br/><br/> You have a solid understanding of industry standard agreements including PJVA templates and CAPL operating procedures. You are proficient using Microsoft Office; CS Explorer; SharePoint; geoSCOUT or AbaData; PETRINEX; PRISM/FeeMax; Qbyte FM; FileBound; and the Alberta Energy Electronic Transfer System (ETS). <br/><br/> You are effective at time management and following up on issues. Your strong problem solving, communication and organization skills enable you to prioritize tasks and produce results from yourself and the team. <br/><br/> NAL provides a fast-paced, team-orientated environment and excellent compensation. To apply for this position, please submit your resume to jobs@nal.ca, referencing the position title in the subject line. <br/><br/> We appreciate the interest of all applicants; however, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted. <br/><br/> View All Opportunities
Title: Joint Venture Analyst

Job_Description: <div> Analyst, Capital Planning & Analysis - Real Estate <br/>  Apply now »<br/>   <div> Apply now    <ul>  <br/>  <div> <div> <div> Start</div>  </div>  </div>  <br/><li>  <div> <strong>Please wait...</strong></div> </li>  </ul>   </div><br/>   <div> Apply now  <br/>  <div> <div> <strong> ×</strong> <br/>  Apply for Job</div><br/>   <div> <div> <div> ×</div><br/>   <div> ×</div><br/>   <div> ×</div><br/>   <div> Enter your email to apply</div> </div>  </div>  </div>  </div>  </div> <br/><strong>Date:</strong>  <br/>  09-May-2018 <br/><br/> <strong>Location:</strong> <br/>  Calgary, ON, CA <br/><br/> <strong>Company:</strong>  <br/>  Sobeys<br/> <div><strong>Requisition ID:</strong> 41314 <br/><br/> <strong>Career Group:</strong> Corporate Careers <br/><br/> <strong>Job Category:</strong> Finance <br/><br/> <strong>Travel Requirements:</strong> 0 - 10% <br/><br/> <strong>Country:</strong> Canada (CA) <br/><br/> <strong>Province:</strong> Alberta (CA-AB) <br/><br/> <strong>City:</strong> Calgary <br/><br/> <strong>Location:</strong> Sobeys West Calgary Office <br/><br/> <strong>Postal Code:</strong> <br/><br/> A proudly Canadian retail company, Sobeys began in 1907 as a small meat delivery business in Stellarton, Nova Scotia. Today, Sobeys Inc. serves the food shopping needs of Canadians with approximately 1,500 stores in all 10 provinces under retail banners that include Sobeys, Safeway, IGA, Foodland, FreshCo, Thrifty Foods, and Lawton’s Drug Stores as well as in-store pharmacies, liquor and more than 350 retail fuel locations. <br/><br/> Together with our 125,000 employees and franchise affiliates and a collective passion for delivering exceptional food and shopping experiences, Sobeys’ purpose is to improve the lives of Canadians by helping them Eat Better, Feel Better and Do Better. . <br/><br/> <strong>All career opportunities will be open a minimum of 5 business days from the date of posting.</strong><br/> <div>Overview <br/><br/> Provide financial support to the Real Estate Finance departments, focusing primarily on reviewing, uploading and monitoring minor and major CAR’s (capital appropriation request) into Sobeys ECAR system. <br/><br/> Job Description  <ul>  	<li>Perform review of all major and minor CAR’s to ensure completeness prior to uploading into ECAR (Electronic Capital Acquisition Request) system.</li> <li>Continuous monitoring of ECAR inboxes for all regions to ensure timely review of CAR’s and uploading into ECAR.</li> <li>Ensure CAR’s are reviewed and approved in accordance with Capital Plan Framework but also for special or unusual circumstances outlined by Manager Real Estate Finance.</li> <li>Monitor ECAR and Sharepoint sites to determine status of CAR’s, generate reporting that identifies age and stage of minor and major CAR’s.</li> <li>Assist in the maintenance of share point sites.</li> <li>Swift and diligent response times to urgent requests for E-CAR approval</li> <li>Perform Ad-hoc requests and administration including: investigation of CAR approval in REAC minutes or other, vacation coverage for team members, etc.</li> <li>Other duties as requested.</li> </ul> Job Requirements  <ul>  	<li>Attention to detail, accuracy and timeliness</li> <li>Proven ability to work independently and to adjust to a variety of tasks on a daily basis</li> <li>Good written and verbal communication skills</li> <li>Advanced level competence in MS Office tool suite</li> <li>Exceptional people skills</li> <li>Problem Solving Ability</li> <li>Aptitude for learning additional tools and new concepts in a speedy manner</li> <li>Understanding of real estate in a retail environment</li> <li>Advanced Excel skills</li> <li>3 years or more of progressively increasing levels of responsibility within a finance department in a medium to large organization.</li> <li>Accounting Designation ( CMA or CGA) preferred or final stages of obtaining the designation</li> </ul>  </div></div>
Title: Analyst, Capital Planning & Analysis - Real Estate

Job_Description: At MNP we pride ourselves on being different – it’s our entrepreneurial drive that sets us apart. It’s the same drive that’s helped us become Canada’s fastest growing national firm. We foster collaboration, value your ideas, promote based on talent, live balanced lifestyles and make time for FUN. We are one firm, one team, collaborating to support you wherever you want to take your career. <br/><br/> Join the momentum. We are seeking an Analyst for our growing Enterprise Risk Services team. Protecting businesses’ best interests, MNP is a leading national accounting, tax and business consulting firm in Canada. Our recognized Enterprise Risk team helps identify, evaluate and manage risk exposure to protect a company’s reputation and assets. Specifically, our Enterprise Risk Management team helps organizations reduce uncertainty and seize new opportunities to increase stakeholder value. <br/><br/> <strong>Performance Expectations</strong> <ul> <li><div>Work with project team to determine client needs, develop plans to meet the requirements, develop methodology to execute the project, and develop timelines for project execution.</div></li><li><div>Engage in continuous knowledge development regarding rules, regulations, best practices, tools, techniques and performance standards of various sectors.</div> </li><li><div>Execute transactions through the provision of client services including planning, budgeting, scheduling and coordinating engagements.</div></li><li><div>Facilitate collaboration with client engagement team prior to commencement of client work to discuss roles and responsibilities, risk areas, materiality and deadlines.</div></li><li><div>Identify ways to maximize the relationship with clients and deliver added value</div></li><li><div>Communicate (written and verbal) findings and recommendations to clients through the preparation of reports, presentations, and other deliverables.</div></li><li><div>Coordinate with Project Manager regarding the status of the work-in-progress and provide feedback where necessary.</div></li><li><div>Assist in the planning for and development of proposals, engagement letters, and other sales activities.</div></li><li><div>Monitor project timelines against targets, adjust where necessary; advise clients of project status.</div></li> <li> <div><strong>Assist in the execution of Business Resilience Services projects, including but not limited to:</strong></div></li>  <ul> <li><div>Assist in the preparation of documentation for Risk Assessments, Emergency Plans/Procedures, Business Impact Analysis, Business Continuity Plans, Crisis Communication Plans, Crisis Management Plans, Exercises and Audits.</div></li><li><div>Participate in client meetings to capture findings.</div></li> </ul>   <li> <div><strong>Assist in the execution of Enterprise Risk Management (ERM) projects, including but not limited to:</strong></div></li>  <ul> <li><div>Implementation of ERM programs for clients, including ERM Framework and tool design.</div></li><li><div>Risk Assessments, including facilitation of risk identification and assessment workshops, developing risk registers.</div></li><li>Developing risk appetite and risk tolerance statements and metrics.</li><li><div>ERM Maturity Assessments, including assessing clients’ ERM programs, benchmarking against leading practice, and developing implementation plans, reports and other deliverables.</div></li> </ul>  <li><div>Network and take a leadership role in the local professional, business, and community while raising awareness of MNP and looking for new business development opportunities.</div></li><li><div>Contribute to the development of new ideas and approaches to improve work processes.</div> </li><li><div>Promote regular attendance, balanced lifestyle and high standard of team wellness.</div></li><li><div>Attend internal MNP courses to further develop knowledge around performance improvement.</div> </li> </ul> <strong>Credentials</strong> <ul> <li><div>Some experience, including completion in course related to Enterprise Risk Management and / or Business Resilience program components including Emergency Response, Emergency Management, Business Continuity, Crisis Communication, and IT Disaster Recovery is an asset.</div></li><li><div>Must have excellent analytical, organizational, interpersonal, verbal, and written communication skills to effectively engage client and support the planning and execution of projects.</div></li><li><div>Highly motivated, committed, self-starter who can prioritize work, multi-task, and cope with changing priorities.</div></li><li><div>Strong customer service orientation and the ability to build positive business relationships.</div></li><li><div>Enthusiasm, capacity, and willingness to expand general business knowledge (finance, legal, HR, IT, etc.) and general industry knowledge (across various industries, including oil and gas, education, manufacturing, public sector, not-for-profit) through formal and informal means to ensure long term success in this role.</div></li><li><div>Must be able to work in a team and coordinate with colleagues to meet project objectives.</div></li><li><div>Flexibility and strong problem-solving skills, as required to meet client needs.</div></li><li><div>Strong analytical, organizational, and decision-making skills.</div></li><li><div>Strong verbal / written communications.</div></li><li><div>Possess a Certified Business Continuity Planner (CBCP) certification or equivalent certifications and/or experience is an asset.</div></li><li><div>Enterprise Risk Management Certification is an asset.</div></li><li><div>Experience in general management consulting is an asset.</div></li><li><div>Administrative skills, with effectiveness in managing time, developing tasks, and managing resources.</div></li><li><div>Proficiency in MS Office Suite (e.g. Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Visio).</div> </li><li><div>Strong formatting skills are an asset.</div></li><li><div>Some travel is required.</div></li> </ul> <strong>Core Competencies and Personal Characteristics</strong> <ul> <li><div><strong>Integrity –</strong> professional whose honesty, integrity, confidentiality and high ethical standards contributes to effective leadership and optimal business relationships</div></li><li><div><strong>Energy –</strong> displays enthusiasm, optimism, drive and passion while maintaining a high level of productivity and a balanced lifestyle</div></li><li><div><strong>Diversity –</strong> understands the importance of different backgrounds, perspectives and experiences and is respectful of individual differences</div></li><li><div><strong>Communication –</strong> effectively expresses ideas and conveys information in business writing, conversations and interactions with others</div></li><li><div><strong>Client Service Excellence –</strong> understands the importance of quality client service by being courteous, responding to client requests in a timely manner and monitoring satisfaction</div></li><li><div><strong>Teamwork & Relationship Development –</strong> works collaboratively with team members in order to achieve a common goal and develops, maintains and strengthens relationships with others, both inside and outside the Firm</div></li><li><div><strong>Accountability –</strong> takes responsibility for one’s own performance by setting clear goals and tracking progress against those goals; is highly organized and uses personal judgement and decision making</div></li><li><div><strong>Flexibility –</strong> effectively manages multiple assignments, adapts to changing priorities and is able to work independently or as part of a team</div></li> </ul> MNP encourages a balanced lifestyle and offers benefits that suit the way our team members work and play! In addition to a competitive salary, our total rewards package includes paid personal days, wellness program initiatives, health and dental benefits, a group pension plan with matching contribution, firm sponsored social events, and professional development assistance. <br/><br/> MNP proudly serves and responds to the needs of our clients in the public, private and not-for-profit sectors. Through partner-led engagements, we provide a collaborative, cost-effective approach to doing business, with innovative strategies to help organizations succeed across the country and around the world.
Title: Analyst, Enterprise Risk Services

Job_Description: <div><strong>Job ID:</strong> 150049 <br/> <strong>Store Name/Number:</strong> AB-The Core (0582) <br/> <strong>Address:</strong> 317 -7 Ave SW, Calgary, AB T2P 2Y9, Canada (CA) <br/> <strong>Full Time/Part Time:</strong> Part Time <br/> <strong>Position Type:</strong> Regular <br/><br/> The Skincare Consultant is a product expert, providing friendly, professional and knowledgeable service to all clients, while expressing and elevating his/her artistic abilities. They provide clients with make-up applications as required, suggest possible routines and build their basket with complementary products and tools. <br/><br/> <strong>ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES</strong> <br/> Client Service  <ul>  <li>Determine the client’s needs and suggest relevant products by listening to the client, and by leveraging product knowledge from brand trainings and in-store colour technologies.</li> <li>Encourage clients to try on the product by providing personalized make-up consultations and product application to the client while educating the client.</li> <li>Assist in training and educating fellow team members as needed.</li>  <li>Brand “specialists” are responsible for cross-training other consultants.</li> </ul>  Store Presentation  <ul>  <li>Determine the client’s needs and suggest relevant products by listening to the client, and by leveraging product knowledge from brand trainings and in-store colour technologies.</li> <li>Encourage clients to try on the product by providing personalized make-up consultations and product application to the client while educating the client.</li> <li>Assist in training and educating fellow team members as needed.</li> <li>Brand “specialists” are responsible for cross-training other consultants.</li> </ul>  Merchandising and Operations  <ul>  <li>Ensure safety and tidiness standards are respected and maintained at all times.</li>  <li>Communicate inventory issues/concerns to Supervisor(s), Assistant Manager(s) or Store Manager.</li> <li>Ensure compliance with sampling policies and procedures.</li> <li>Participate in inventory control.</li> <li>Designated consultants will be cross-trained in cashier functions.</li> </ul>  <strong>EXPECTED SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS</strong>  <ul>  <li>1-2 years of retail/client service industry experience, and excels as a team player.</li> <li>Education and experience in make-up artistry.</li> <li>Comfortable in engaging clients, and applying products to the client while providing consultations.</li> <li>Ability to multi-task, while providing professional and outstanding client service.</li> <li>Effective time management, problem solving and communication skills.</li> <li>A High School graduate or equivalent.</li> <li>Flexible availability including evenings, weekends and holidays is essential.</li> </ul>  <strong>ADDITIONAL INFORMATION</strong> <br/> <strong>Physical Requirements:</strong>  <ul>  <li>Work in a fragrance filled environment.</li> <li>Lift and carry up to 50 pounds.</li> <li>Bend and stretch to stock shelves.</li> </ul>  <strong>COMPANY OVERVIEW</strong> <br/> Owned by LVMH Moet Hennessy Louis Vuitton, the world&apos;s leading luxury goods group, Sephora is highly regarded as a beauty trailblazer, thanks to its unparalleled assortment of prestige products, unbiased service from experts, interactive shopping environment, and innovation. <br/><br/> <strong>Sephora stores</strong> - Sephora operates approximately 1,900 stores in 29 countries worldwide, with an expanding base of over 360 stores across North America. Sephora opened its first U.S. store in New York in 1998, its first Canadian store in Toronto in 2004. Sephora&apos;s North American headquarters is located in San Francisco, with corporate offices in New York, Montreal and Toronto. <br/> <strong>Sephora.com</strong>- Launched in the U.S. in 1999 and Canada in 2003, the foremost beauty site on the Internet is also Sephora&apos;s largest North American store in terms of sales and selection of products and brands.</div>
Title: Skincare Consultant

Job_Description: <div> Company Overview<br/><br/><strong>A global energy leader with an exciting future</strong>  <br/><br/> Nexen is an upstream oil and gas company responsibly developing energy resources in some of the world’s most significant basins, including the UK North Sea, offshore West Africa, the Gulf of Mexico and Western Canada. A wholly-owned subsidiary of CNOOC Limited, Nexen has three principal businesses: conventional oil and gas, oil sands, and shale gas. <br/><br/> As a wholly-owned subsidiary of CNOOC Limited, Nexen is better positioned than ever to realize our central purpose – creating value by responsibly supplying the energy that fuels people’s lives. While ownership has changed, our purpose, values and principle-based approach to doing business, remain unaltered. Our high standards of integrity and governance have earned us a global reputation for valuing the big picture: people, safety and the environment. Your contributions are rewarded with a highly competitive compensation package and a healthy work-life balance, and training that will open doors to your future.</div><br/>  <div> Location<br/><br/>Nexen’s head office in Calgary, Alberta, is home to almost all of our corporate support staff including human resources, finance, legal, supply chain management, information technology, as well as a number of asset teams. You’ll work alongside some of the best and most diverse talent in the energy industry.</div><br/>  <div> Position Overview<br/><br/>Geospatial Services is looking for a talented <strong>Geospatial Data Analyst</strong> to support the growing Geospatial data needs of the corporation. This is an exciting opportunity to work with a dedicated and professional Geospatial service oriented team in Calgary. The individual is responsible for full support of ESRI’s ArcSDE to the Geospatial Services team, and will participate in the continuing implementation and support of a corporate GIS strategy to deliver accurate and reliable geographic data, in support of Exploration & Production. The primary responsibilities of this position are to:  <ul> <li>Manage the company’s geospatial data in ArcSDE;</li> <li>Understand the needs of the Geospatial Services, Business Units and translate business requirements for GIS into recommendations for using spatial data to help the customer make sound business decisions, using visualization, analysis and other GIS tools;</li> <li>Liaise with the Geomatics, GIS and Remote Sensing teams to maintain the standards and build upon the content of the corporate GIS.</li> </ul>  </div><br/>  <div> Job Duties & Responsibilities<br/><br/>Responsible for strategic Geospatial Data Management for the corporation:  <ul> <li>Requirements collection: Identifying business units' geospatial data needs, to defining and prioritize these requirements, and recommending potential solutions.</li> <li>Designing enterprise geodatabase feature classes, modelling, loading, converting, integrating and updating geospatial data obtained from various internal and external data sources with compliance to a standardized geospatial data model.</li> <li>Developing and reviewing geospatial or tabular data, including data schemas attribute definitions, domains, file name conventions, etc.</li> <li>Developing and maintaining data in the enterprise distributed geodatabase environments as current and in sync by applying regularly scheduled automated data loading and updates from all data sources.</li> <li>Managing geospatial data across file systems and ArcSDE databases to deliver regional geospatial data and services in both desktop/web-based applications.</li> <li>Developing automated data management workflows, tasks, and geoprocessing scripts to improve efficiency and quality in acquiring, processing, performance, distributing, and accessibility of data for use in various GIS software applications.</li> <li>Providing expertise and guidance on geospatial data management and analytics, promoting and implementing data standards and resolving geospatial data migration and integration issues. (Complete life cycle for managing geospatial data across ArcSDE multi-user environment).</li> <li>Maintain data quality, including validation, non-duplication, completion, consistency, currency, timeliness, accuracy, and logical consistency.</li> <li>Overseeing Quality Control (QC) procedures for GIS data received from various data sources, as well as resolving business unit issues, for geospatial data anomalies.</li> <li>Following the geospatial data management best practices to maintain data integrity, security, and performance.</li> <li>Assisting and supporting teams in applying advanced geospatial data analytics, reporting and visualization techniques in support of business priorities.</li> <li>Partnering with business unit managers, developers, product managers, engineers, and analysts during development, implementations and deployment of GIS projects, and initiatives that integrate data from many different sources.</li> <li>Understanding vendor data licensing and usage limitation agreements.</li> <li>Collaborating with the GIS Analysts to continuously maximize data reuse, accessibility, and value.</li> <li>Communicate clearly and effectively cross-functional technical and non-technical audiences, both in verbal and written forms.</li> <li>Commitment in authoring technical documentation, Jive announcements, guidelines, and management of metadata collection and catalogue for all geospatial data using ISO 19139 standard.</li> <li>Basic spatial analysis techniques and, remote sensing knowledge.</li> <li>Facilitating training, Lunch & Learn, and demo sessions for business users.</li> <li>Collaborate with ArcSDE Systems Administrator for migrating geospatial data components into production database.</li> <li>Coordinate, create and administer Web Services through ArcGIS Online.</li> <li>Coordinate GIS workflows between Nexen offices (USA/UK/Calgary) for efficient information transfer</li> <li>Attend monthly Geospatial Services meetings.</li> <li>Providing technical leadership and support for the GIS user community, along with mentoring junior staff</li> <li>Participate in the evaluation of current industry technical data management software and data management practices and recommend appropriate upgrades and new purchases to meet the requirements of the business unit.</li> </ul>  </div><br/>  <div> Education & Experience   <ul> <li>3 - 7 years of related GIS experience, preferably within the oil and gas industry, with an understanding of the E&P lifecycle</li> <li>Degree or diploma in GIS, Geography, Geology, Geomatics Engineering, MIS, or a closely related discipline</li> <li>ESRI GIS certification preferred</li> <li>Experience with E&P industry data sources is considered an asset</li> <li>Working knowledge of map projections, datums, and transformations; must be able to verify data accuracy</li> <li>Strong analytical and problem solving skills with the ability to demonstrate excellent verbal, written and interpersonal relationship skills.</li> <li>Highly organized with strong time-management skills, priority setting and the capability of multi-tasking.</li> </ul> <strong>Operating Systems:</strong> Windows  <ul> <li><strong>Programming Languages & Libraries:</strong> Python, C#.Net, T-SQL, PL/SQL, ArcPy, FMEObjects, Microsoft Team Foundation (TFS), command batch processing</li>   <li><strong>GIS Software packages</strong>: Esri ArcGIS Enterprise (ArcMap, ArcCatalog, ArcSDE, ArcGIS for Server, Portal, ArcPro, ArcToolbox, Geoprocessing, ModelBuilder, Data Reviewer, ArcObjects)</li> <li><strong>Data Integration (ETL):</strong> Safe FME Desktop</li> <li><strong>Relational Databases:</strong> Oracle, MS SQL Server</li> <li><strong>Database Management Application:</strong> SQL Server Management Studio, Oracle SQL Developer, Citrix Composite</li>   <li><strong>Data Files:</strong> FileGDB, Shapefile</li>   <li><strong>Web Mapping & Services:</strong> REST, WMS, WFS, ArcGIS Web App Builder, ArcGIS Online</li>   <li><strong>Data Analytics:</strong> Tibco Spotfire</li>   <li><strong>Development Environment:</strong> PyScripter, MS .Net Visual Studio</li>   <li><strong>Industry Data Models:</strong> UPDM, APDM, PODS, PPDM</li> <li><strong>Exploration</strong><strong> & Production Vendor Data</strong>: IHS Markit Enerdeq, Drilling Info International (DII), Wood Mackenzie (WM), Cegal Blueback ISO tracker</li> <li><strong>Exploration</strong><strong> & Production Applications:</strong> IHS AccuMap, IHS EDIN, Petrel Studio, Quorum GIS (QGIS), Petrel Studio</li> <li><strong>Other:</strong> MS Office (Access, Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Visio, Outlook)</li> </ul>  </div><br/>  <div> Closing Statement<br/><br/>All positions require background checks which could include:  <ul> <li>Criminal police record check</li> <li>Education verification</li> <li>Credential verification</li> </ul> Click the “Apply for Job” button to start the application process. <br/><br/> No agency or telephone inquiries please.</div> <br/>
Title: CW - Geospatial Data Analyst

Title: Executive Sales Consultant

Job_Description: <strong>Position Title: People and Culture Analyst</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Team and Location: People and Culture– Calgary, AB</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Company Profile:</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Parkland is unique</strong>. We fuel communities by safely delivering high-quality petroleum products to motorists, businesses, consumers and wholesale customers across North America. Through unrivaled dependability and service, we connect communities to the products they need to heat their homes, fuel their industries and drive their economies. <br/><br/> <strong>Parkland is strong</strong>. We are one of North America’s fastest growing and largest independent distributors and marketers of fuels and lubricants. Our family includes Bluewave Energy, Columbia Fuels, Elbow River Marketing, Island Petroleum, Fas Gas Plus, Farstad Oil, Les Pétroles Parkland, Pioneer Energy, Sparlings, Superpumper Inc., Ultramar, and most recently Parkland Refining (B.C.) Ltd. <br/><br/> <strong>Parkland is growing</strong>. Our organization is powered by effective leadership, progressive strategies and industry-leading best practices— but more importantly, it is driven by talented, customer-focused people who value integrity, innovation and quality. We are looking for good-natured, hard-working candidates who want to build a rewarding career in a dynamic and collaborative work environment. We are a family and our family continues to grow. <br/><br/> <strong>Overview of Position:</strong> <br/><br/> The People and Culture Analyst will perform professional-level analytical and reporting work in a variety of assignments. This position will analyze data, report HR trends, provide predictive analytics and recommend solutions for people-related strategies. <br/><br/> <strong>Key Responsibilities:</strong> <br/><br/> Responsibilities for this position may include but are not limited to: <br/><br/> Research and Analytics <ul> <li>Use statistical analysis and data mining to develop, track, and analyze HR metrics and reports to empower operational decisions based on quantitative, qualitative, transactional, efficiency and human capital data;</li><li>Conduct analysis on data examining workforce demographics and diversity, recruitment, turnover, employee engagement, compensation and benefits, and learning and development Determine baseline trends in order to provide predictive analysis for future direction setting, and;</li><li>Proactively contribute to the creation of presentation materials relating to data modeling for stakeholder discussions;</li> </ul> Reporting and Workflow Design <ul> <li>Use Cognos Analytics (BI Reporting) to design, update and maintain reports as required from the business;</li><li>Design and implement workflows;</li> </ul> HCM System Functionality <ul> <li> Ensure continuous learning and improvement for current HCM to ensure system capabilities are maximized;</li><li>Research and continued education on the software features, updates;</li> </ul> Budget <ul> <li>Plan, review and provide direction for HR;</li><li>Business Unit annual budget and monthly reviews;</li> </ul> Continuous Improvement <ul> <li>Coach other members of HR to increase the analytical skills of the team;</li><li>Monitor changes in metrics and advise Senior Management of potential root causes, and;</li><li>Create information briefs for the Board of Directors and Senior Management.</li> </ul> <strong>Qualifications and Skills:</strong> <ul> <li>3-5 years’ experience of in depth data analysis and predictive forecasting with a proven track record of implemented solutions;</li><li>2-3 years’ exposure to the Human Resources field would be an asset;</li><li>Degree or equivalent relevant experience;</li><li>Formal statistics or actuarial training;</li><li>Familiar with Human Capital Management Systems (HCM) and Payroll platforms (preferably Ultimate Software, JDE);</li><li>Advanced expertise in Excel, Word and PowerPoint;</li><li>Proficient knowledge of general human resource practices, Employment Standards Acts, Human Rights Acts, privacy legislation, Employment Equity, and labour relations;</li><li>Understands the impacts that Human Resources data and trends have on the larger organization;</li><li>Attention to detail;</li><li>Ability to work in a fast pace environment with changing priorities;</li><li>Working Knowledge of enterprise Reporting and Visualization tools (Tableau, MS Power BI), and;</li><li>Experience with Programming languages such as R& Python would be an asset.</li> </ul> Our main priority at Parkland is our people. As an employee, you can expect a fair workplace, a professional work environment, competitive compensation, outstanding benefits, and a share in our success through the Employee Share Purchase Plan and our Annual Incentive Plan. <br/><br/> Our preferred method of application is online at www.parkland.ca <br/><br/> We thank all candidates in advance for their interest, however only those being considered will be contacted. <br/><br/> <strong>Parkland Fuel Corporation is committed to the principles of Employment Equity.</strong> <br/><br/> We strive to provide accessibility in employment to ensure equal access to employment opportunities for candidates, including persons with disabilities. Parkland Fuel Corporation will endeavour to provide accommodation to persons with disabilities in the recruitment process upon request. If you are selected for an interview and you require accommodation due to a disability, please notify us upon scheduling your interview.
Title: People and Culture Analyst

</ul>  <strong>ADDITIONAL INFORMATION</strong> <br/> <strong>Physical Requirements:</strong>  <ul>  <li>Work in a fragrance filled environment.</li> <li>Lift and carry up to 50 pounds.</li> <li>Bend and stretch to stock shelves.</li> </ul>  <strong>COMPANY OVERVIEW</strong> <br/> Owned by LVMH Moet Hennessy Louis Vuitton, the world&apos;s leading luxury goods group, Sephora is highly regarded as a beauty trailblazer, thanks to its unparalleled assortment of prestige products, unbiased service from experts, interactive shopping environment, and innovation. <br/><br/> <strong>Sephora stores</strong> - Sephora operates approximately 1,900 stores in 29 countries worldwide, with an expanding base of over 360 stores across North America. Sephora opened its first U.S. store in New York in 1998, its first Canadian store in Toronto in 2004. Sephora&apos;s North American headquarters is located in San Francisco, with corporate offices in New York, Montreal and Toronto. <br/> <strong>Sephora.com</strong>- Launched in the U.S. in 1999 and Canada in 2003, the foremost beauty site on the Internet is also Sephora&apos;s largest North American store in terms of sales and selection of products and brands.</div>
