Job_Description: <div><div><div><div><strong>Senior Commodity Tax Analyst</strong> <br/><br/> Reference Code: 50672</div> </div></div><div><strong>Location:</strong> Canada (CA) - Calgary, AB</div> <div><strong>Job Category:</strong> Accounting/Finance</div><div><strong>Employment Type:</strong> Employee Full-time</div><div><strong>Relocation Eligibility:</strong> This position is not eligible for our relocation program</div> <br/><strong>General Information</strong> <br/><br/> A Senior Commodity Tax Analyst position is currently available within the Taxation department, reporting to the Director of Indirect Tax. The team is responsible for preparing commodity tax returns for many Canadian pipeline and non-pipeline entities. The Senior Commodity Tax Analyst will work as part of a larger group to ensure compliance with Canadian commodity tax legislation. The successful candidate will have a strong knowledge of Canadian commodity tax legislation and possess the ability to analyze costs incurred and determine the appropriate tax treatment of these costs. <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities</strong> <br/><br/> • Preparing and reviewing tax returns for a large number of Canadian entities; <br/><br/> • Providing leadership and further develop best practices in compliance with commodity tax processes as they relate to TransCanada&apos;s Canadian entities; <br/><br/> • Interacting with internal Supply Chain, Accounts Payable, Corporate Accounting, Legal, Treasury and Finance departments to provide commodity tax guidance for all of TransCanada&apos;s Canadian business units; <br/><br/> • Researching tax issues; <br/><br/> • Corresponding with Federal and Provincial tax authorities as required; <br/><br/> • Providing support for Canadian external and internal audits; <br/><br/> • Participating in special projects, including implementation of a new tax provision software program; <br/><br/> • Other tasks as required. <br/><br/> <strong>Qualifications</strong> <br/><br/> • Demonstrated project management skills, with an ability to manage multiple and competing priorities; <br/><br/> • Team player having the ability to work effectively under tight deadlines; <br/><br/> • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills combined with the ability to interact effectively with senior management; <br/><br/> • Attention to detail and excellent organizational skills; <br/><br/> • Self-starter with a positive attitude and willingness to learn. <br/><br/> <strong>Education/Experience</strong> <ul> <li>Completion of a professional accounting designation (CA, CGA, CMA, CPA) with a minimum of four years of post-qualification experience;</li><li>Completion of the CICA in-depth GST course is preferred;</li><li>Strong knowledge of accounting and reporting standards;</li><li>Working knowledge of SAP background;</li><li>An equivalent combination of education and related work experience may be considered.</li> </ul> *Depending on the qualifications of the applicants, the successful candidate may be offered a position at a more appropriate level and/or ladder. <br/><br/> Applicants must have legal authorization to work in the country in which the position is based with no restrictions. <br/><br/> Applicants who require accommodation at any stage of the application process or if you would like additional information regarding TransCanada&apos;s accommodation policies please contact careers@transcanada.com. <br/><br/> All positions require background screening. Some include criminal and/or credit checks in order to comply with regulations. <br/><br/> <strong>Please apply to this posting by 05/15/2018.</strong> To apply, go to jobs.transcanada.com and enter reference code 50672. Only applications submitted through the TransCanada Careers website will be acknowledged. <br/><br/> TransCanada is an equal opportunity employer. <br/><br/> <strong>Make what you do matter.</strong> <br/><br/> At TransCanada we dream big, think big and do big things. For over 65 years, we&apos;ve had the vision and scale to deliver big things that matter to the world. From supplying reliable and efficient energy to millions of North Americans with our pipelines, gas storage and power generation facilities, we believe in making big things possible. <br/><br/> TransCanada is looking for people who are willing to think about the future...and think big. We&apos;re looking for people who are ready to take on the most significant challenges of their careers and define energy infrastructure in North America. <br/><br/> Thank you for choosing TransCanada in your career search.</div>

Job_Description: At MNP we pride ourselves on being different – it’s our entrepreneurial drive that sets us apart. It’s the same drive that’s helped us become Canada’s fastest growing national firm. We foster collaboration, value your ideas, promote based on talent, live balanced lifestyles and make time for FUN. We are one firm, one team, collaborating to support you wherever you want to take your career. <br/><br/> Join the momentum. We are seeking an Analyst for our growing Corporate Finance team. Positioning our clients for success, MNP Corporate Finance is a leader in providing transaction advisory services throughout Canada. Our team of recognized professionals help clients maximize their potential by providing innovative strategies for divestitures, financing, due diligence and acquisitions. With offices strategically located across Canada, we have the experience and expertise organizations need to take advantage of emerging opportunities in the national and global marketplace. <br/><br/> <strong>Performance Expectations</strong> <ul> <li><div>Assisting in executing corporate finance engagements</div> </li><li><div>Preparing financial models</div> </li><li><div>Researching industries, markets, and companies</div></li><li><div>Preparing marketing materials including proposals, newsletters, confidential information memorandums</div></li><li><div>Writing reports which synthesize ideas, research, interviews, and other information sources</div></li><li><div>Assisting with due diligence assignments</div></li><li><div>Communicating with investors and members of management teams</div> </li><li><div>Raise awareness of MNP at community events</div></li> </ul> <strong>Credentials</strong> <ul> <li><div>Completion of a Bachelor’s Degree in business with a specialization in Accounting or Finance</div></li><li><div>One (1) to two (2) years of experience at a professional services firm, ideally in financial analysis and modeling, and / or developing business plans.</div></li><li><div>Strong attention to detail</div> </li><li><div>Willingness to work long hours with short notice</div></li><li><div>Demonstrates a willingness to learn</div></li><li><div>Ability to meet tight deadlines</div> </li><li><div>Experience in preparing financial models and analyzing financial statements.</div></li><li><div>Strong working skills of Microsoft Word, Excel and PowerPoint</div></li><li><div>Familiarity with Salesforce and Capital IQ are an asset</div></li><li><div>Some travel may be required</div></li> </ul> <strong>Core Competencies and Personal Characteristics</strong> <ul> <li><div><strong>Integrity –</strong> professional whose honesty, integrity, confidentiality and high ethical standards contributes to effective leadership and optimal business relationships</div></li><li><div><strong>Energy –</strong> displays enthusiasm, optimism, drive and passion while maintaining a high level of productivity and a balanced lifestyle</div></li><li><div><strong>Diversity –</strong> understands the importance of different backgrounds, perspectives and experiences and is respectful of individual differences</div></li><li><div><strong>Communication –</strong> effectively expresses ideas and conveys information in business writing, conversations and interactions with others</div></li><li><div><strong>Client Service Excellence –</strong> understands the importance of quality client service by being courteous, responding to client requests in a timely manner and monitoring satisfaction</div></li><li><div><strong>Teamwork & Relationship Development –</strong> works collaboratively with team members in order to achieve a common goal and develops, maintains and strengthens relationships with others, both inside and outside the Firm</div></li><li><div><strong>Accountability –</strong> takes responsibility for one’s own performance by setting clear goals and tracking progress against those goals; is highly organized and uses personal judgement and decision making</div></li><li><div><strong>Flexibility –</strong> effectively manages multiple assignments, adapts to changing priorities and is able to work independently or as part of a team</div></li> </ul> MNP encourages a balanced lifestyle and offers benefits that suit the way our team members work and play! In addition to a competitive salary, our total rewards package includes paid personal days, wellness program initiatives, health and dental benefits, a group pension plan with matching contribution, firm sponsored social events, and professional development assistance. <br/><br/> MNP proudly serves and responds to the needs of our clients in the public, private and not-for-profit sectors. Through partner-led engagements, we provide a collaborative, cost-effective approach to doing business, with innovative strategies to help organizations succeed across the country and around the world.
Title: Analyst, Corporate Finance

Job_Description: <strong>Description:</strong> The position of Leasing Analyst is a newly created role and is tasked with conducting a variety of market analysis to assist the Residential Operations team in making strategic decisions that will enhance Northview’s core rental business. <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities:</strong>  <ul> <li>Collect, analyze and interpret data and statistics using quantitative and qualitative methodology to write comprehensive reports</li>   <li>Conduct rental analysis of market rents and recommend adjustments as needed</li> <li>Prepare monthly leasing status reports, following up with Resident Relations and Leasing Manager</li> <li>Collect and analyze resident survey data</li> <li>Review survey results and present data to Residential Operations Team</li> <li>Review Leasing calls and showing conversions</li> <li>Assist in budget and sales forecasting</li> <li>Develop and deliver effective presentations to inform of emerging or existing statistics and trends</li> <li>Reports to Resident Relations and Leasing Manager</li> <li>Other duties as assigned</li> </ul> <strong>Qualifications:</strong>  <ul> <li>An understanding of Property Management functions</li>   <li>Analytical skills</li> <li>Bachelor degree in finance, accounting or business</li> <li>Strong computer skills with proficiency in excel, word and PowerPoint</li> <li>Strong written and verbal communication skills</li> <li>Highly professional and team player</li> <li>Ability to multi-task and work under pressure</li> <li>Attention to detail</li> </ul>
Title: Leasing Analyst

Job_Description: <strong>Job no:</strong> COG-937566 <br/> <strong>Work type:</strong> Full time <br/> <strong>Location:</strong> Calgary <br/> <strong>Group:</strong> Corporate Operations Group <br/> <strong>Division:</strong> Technology <br/> <strong>Recruiter:</strong> Stewart Mitchell<br/> <div>In this role, you will provide technology support to Macquarie’s internal staff. You can expect your customer support efforts to be 70% on the phone, 20% via email and 10% via walk-up. <br/><br/> <strong>Functional Responsibilities</strong>  <ul> <li>Customer facing, technical support, focused on Workplace technologies listed below.</li> <li>Log incidents and requests for continued problem resolution and tracking.</li> <li>Maintain direct contact with users through the lifecycle of an incident or request.</li> <li>Call out to users and otherwise follow-up with them directly for more complex issues.</li> <li>Collaborate with domestic and international technology teams in order to drive issue resolution on behalf of customers.</li> <li>Contribute to Technology projects as required. tool such as Remedy or ServiceNow.</li> <li>Familiarity with MacOS.</li> </ul> <strong>Desired Business Capabilities</strong>  <ul> <li>Excellent written and verbal communication skills.</li> <li>Ability to tailor communication style to fit the audience and situation.</li> <li>Polished, mature, confident phone support skills.</li> <li>Commitment to delivering to the client within the boundaries of policies and procedures as they exist in a highly regulated industry such as Financial Services.</li> <li>Willingness to ‘own’ and be accountable for problems through resolution.</li> <li>Ability to perform effectively in a high pressure situations when faced with urgent issues or distressed customers.</li> <li>Ability to multi-task and prioritize with minimal supervision.</li> <li>Ability to balance high volume productivity and high quality demands in the form of first call resolutions.</li> <li>Possess a Continuous Improvement mindset by viewing current processes and procedures as opportunities for enhancement, tuning and improvement.</li> <li>Empathetic appreciation for different cultures and diverse points of view in the work place.</li> </ul> <strong>Desired Experience</strong>  <ul> <li>University degree in computer science or engineering, or equivalent work experience.</li> <li>Experience providing technology support to a global customer.</li> <li>Experience working as part of a global Technology support team.</li> <li>Experience providing formal phone support in a Help Desk, Service Desk or Call Center environment.</li> </ul> The Corporate Operations Group (COG) brings together specialist support services including workplace, human resources, market operations and technology. COG comprises the following divisions: Business Improvement and Strategy, Business Services, Human Resources, Market Operations, and Technology. <br/><br/> Find out more about Macquarie careers at www.macquarie.com/careers <br/><br/> Accommodation is available to all applicants to Macquarie, including during recruitment, selection and assessment processes. Title: Tech Assist Analyst

Job_Description: <div><div>  <div><strong>YOUR OPPORTUNITY:</strong></div><div>The Inventory Analyst is responsible for analyzing and managing master data, attributes, systems and processes for multiple operating areas within the company. Working alongside business units, buyers, warehouse personnel and systems support teams, the Analyst is responsible for creation, validation, analyzing and improving process, data and tools.</div><br/>  <div><strong>Calgary Based – Horizon/Albian Projects with potential travel or Temporary Assignment</strong></div><br/>  <div>To support the growth of Canadian Natural's Oil Sands operations, this position may be assigned to or require business travel to various contractor workplaces or to the Oil Sands site’s during project phases for extended periods.</div><br/>  <div><strong>**Please Note: This is a 12 month temporary position **</strong></div><br/>  <div><strong>HOW WILL YOU MAKE YOUR MARK?</strong></div>  <li>Understand, create, manage and analyze supply chain data, including item master, vendor master, inventory ledger and transactions, purchasing records, warehouse operations records, spend and assets information</li> <li>Identify business process gaps and requirements to develop and manage reporting</li> <li>Develop business intelligence for process accuracy, improvement and standardization opportunities</li> <li>Identify and implement opportunities for optimized supply/demand (increasing service, mitigating risk, reducing holding cost)</li> <li>Identify and implement opportunities to improve the procure to pay cycle, procurement functions and to leverage technology and tools for process efficiency</li> <li>Manage and deliver process improvement initiatives, including communication and change management of stakeholders</li> <li>Collaborate with leadership to incorporate policy and procedural changes into work practices</li>  <strong><div>QUALIFICATIONS:</div> <br/> </strong>  <li>Typically 5+ years of direct experience in master data management, business analysis, planning, consulting, supply management or inventory control</li>  <div><strong>• Solid experience with:</strong></div><div> o ERP systems (JD Edwards, Maximo, SAP)</div><br/>  <div> o Data management and analysis using queries in SQL, Java etc</div><br/>  <div> o Supply chain operations processes</div><br/>  <div> o Reporting and data visualization tools (Tableau, Spotfire, OBIEE, etc.)</div><br/>  <div> o Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint at an advanced level</div><br/>  <div>To see related Supply Management and Contracts roles at CNRL, visit: www.cnrl-careers.com/jobs/Supply-Management-and-Contracts</div><br/>  <div><strong>About Canadian Natural</strong> </div><br/>  <div>At Canadian Natural, we strive to live through our mission statement: "To develop people to work together to create value for the Company's shareholders by doing it right with fun and integrity." As a leading oil and gas producer, our diverse combination of assets include light oil, heavy oil, in situ oil sands production, oil sands mining and upgrading facilities, and natural gas. At Canadian Natural, safety is a core value. We conduct all of our operations in a way that identifies, minimizes and mitigates harm to the health and safety of employees, contractors, the public and the environment.</div><br/>  <div><strong>Canadian Natural Resources Limited - CNRL - is a publicly traded company on the TSX and NYSE as CNQ.</strong></div></div> </div><div></div>

Title: Fixed Asset Analyst

Job_Description: Are you passionate about making a difference in the world? Do you want to act as a catalyst helping to infuse a culture of goodness? Have you been a technical product manager, senior developer, software architect, engineering manager or just have some great experience working with business and technology? We may have just the right role for you! As Benevity’s Technical Product Analyst, you’ll be responsible for providing technical expertise to internal stakeholders and clients, while liaising with an outsourced team of passionate engineers and business analysts. <br/><br/> In this role, you’ll be expected to use your product and technical knowledge to provide input and guidance on the product roadmap, advocating for “back end” investment areas. You’ll be Benevity’s resident in-house expert and troubleshooter for the technical aspects of the product. You’ll support our implementation, services, and sales teams with your deep understanding of the system and the data it collects. <br/><br/> <strong>Who we are</strong> <br/><br/> Better Work and a Better World: at Benevity that’s what we’re all about. We’re a software company in the business of doing good, building better ways for companies to connect with their customers and employees around causes - we make “doing well by doing good” more than just a tagline. We’re growing fast and looking for more great people to join us. <br/><br/> We’re not Bono, just a passionate crew of workhorses out to change the world. We have that fun, flexible tech culture that people love (ok, some people – you know who you are!) – and we have a heart. We’re a registered B Corporation, which means we’re part of a new breed of companies committed to higher social and environmental standards. <br/><br/> You’ll join a dedicated, passionate team that creates innovative solutions for our raving fans (er, clients). And you’ll get to rub shoulders with some of the most iconic and notable companies and charities in the world to help them make a difference (in even better ways). Our entrepreneurial environment appeals to self-driven, flexible team players who learn quickly, aren’t afraid to tackle hard problems and don’t mind wearing jeans to work. Sound cool? Join us! <br/><br/> <strong>What You Will Do</strong> <br/><br/> · Leverage your knowledge of the product and expertise to derive an optimal solution. <br/> · Assess and analyze business strategy, market requirements, current state, and technology choices to evaluate and recommend solution alternatives. <br/> · Lead elicitation activities and author documentation of the system, architecture, and processes. Bring outsourced knowledge in-house. <br/> · Understand (and document) the system from a data security, compliance, and infrastructure operations perspective. <br/> · Oversee the relationship with our development outsource partner. <br/> · Liaise between outsource partner and Operations, ensuring smooth deployments and stable performance. <br/> · Conduct decision, business rules, and risk analysis. <br/> · Work closely with Product Management to ensure a balanced backlog of work that addresses technical debt, reduces operational friction, and designs for the future. <br/> · Identify opportunities to expand the application of the technology. <br/> · Assist in analysis / troubleshooting of issues. <br/> · Support Sales and Marketing during the RFP process. <br/><br/> <strong>What You Bring</strong> <br/><br/> · An analytical mindset; people have said you have a gift for seeing how seemingly disparate and unrelated events or processes are related <br/> · Strong written and verbal communication skills, able to communicate with both technical and business audiences <br/> · Demonstrable .NET experience including development, code analysis with debug / troubleshooting, and interpretation (to determine the underlying business logic and function of an existing piece of code). <br/> · Data and process modelling. Use case diagrams and entity relationship diagrams should be old hat. <br/> · Experience with end-to-end software development projects, preferably using a variety of different software development methodologies <br/> · Experience working with relational databases, BI/Reporting, ETL and integration projects <br/> · Experience managing (or at least working closely with) outsourced development teams <br/> · Background in computer science, engineering or related field <br/> · A passion for the Benevity mission <br/><br/> <strong>What You Can Expect</strong> <br/><br/> · Enjoy a fast-paced environment, with a history of proven success in a dynamic, rapidly growing company. <br/> · Demonstrate extraordinary time-management skills and organizational capabilities. <br/> · Be an innovative thinker, keen to be part of a growing company that is all about helping businesses do things differently to get better returns on their social good programs. <br/> · Build trust, value others, communicate effectively, drive execution, foster innovation. <br/> · Focus on the client, collaborate with others, solve problems creatively and demonstrate high integrity. <br/> · Professional internal and external relationships that meet company core values. <br/><br/> It is our hope and belief that you apply because you believe the same things we do – that global Goodness is an achievable goal! While we sincerely appreciate the time and effort you put into your application, unfortunately only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.
Title: Technical Product Analyst (.Net)

Job_Description: <strong>Operations Analyst</strong> <br/><br/> Vermilion has an excellent opportunity for an Operations Analyst. Based in Calgary, this position will report to the Supervisor, Canadian Operational Accounting. This position is a key member of the Canadian Planning & Analysis team which supports the Canadian Business Unit by delivering best in class information solutions that result in optimal business decisions. This role focuses on production/revenue reporting and operating expenses with key responsibilities that include monthly accruals, variance analysis, reporting, budgeting and forecasting. <br/><br/> <strong>Key Responsibilities</strong>  <ul>  	<li>Generate accruals related to monthly production, revenue, royalty expense, royalty income, transportation, and operating expense</li> <li>Work in conjunction with operations personnel to understand and analyze Vermilion’s performance</li> <li>Analyze and present operational results at monthly lease-op review meetings</li> <li>Prepare and distribute scheduled and ad hoc reports supporting multiple users at various levels</li> <li>Compiling quarterly operating expense results and forecast for management</li> <li>Contribute to the development of the annual operating expense budget</li> <li>Prepare and maintain operated payouts statements</li> <li>Provide back-up assistance for capital analysis</li> <li>Month-end close process including accruals, journal entries, account reconciliations</li> <li>Active support of internal control processes, including SOX</li> <li>Participate in special projects as required</li> <li>Any other assignments or projects as necessary</li> </ul> <strong>Essential Experience & Skills</strong>  <ul>  	<li>Minimum 5+ years of financial analysis experience in the oil and gas industry. The ideal candidate will have a strong familiarity with production, revenue and operating expense</li> <li>Strategic thinker with exemplary analytical and problem solving skills and capacity to identify information and resources needed to complete tasks</li> <li>Professional, team player with strong interpersonal skills and ability to develop and maintain partnerships</li> <li>Exceptional organizational and time management skills, ability to multi-task and manage priorities in a deadline driven environment</li> <li>Effective verbal and written communication skills with acute attention to detail</li> <li>Advanced Microsoft Excel</li> <li>Knowledge of Qbyte and AFE Navigator is an asset</li> </ul> <strong>Education</strong>  <ul>  	<li>Accounting designation (CPA)</li> </ul> <strong>Attributes & Characteristics</strong>  <ul>  	<li>Open and honest team player</li> <li>Positive and engaging personality</li> <li>Flexible, influential and assertive when required</li> </ul> <strong>Vermilion Attractions</strong>  <ul>  	<li>Alberta based, international company</li> <li>Diverse asset base in Europe, Australia, US and Canada</li> <li>20-year history of market outperformance</li> <li>Ranked among the Top 10 Best Workplaces in Canada, France and The Netherlands</li> <li>Challenging and inspiring environment that embraces teamwork and collaboration</li> <li>Strong community investment and committed to giving back to the communities where our people live and work</li> </ul> Vermilion is committed to ensuring we conduct our activities in a manner that will protect the health and safety of our employees, contractors and the public. Our HSE vision is to fully integrate Health, Safety and Environment into our business, where our culture is recognized as a model by industry and stakeholders, resulting in a healthy workplace free of incidents. All positions at Vermilion require a commitment to high levels of excellence in respect to HSE, reinforcing our corporate Core Values of Excellence, Trust, Respect, and Responsibility. <br/><br/> <strong>Posting Close Date: Open until a suitable candidate has been found</strong>
Title: Operations Analyst

Job_Description: To display this page you need a browser with JavaScript support.<br/> <div> <div> Addthis <br/> <strong> |</strong> <br/>  Email <br/>  Favorites <br/>  LinkedIn <br/>  Facebook <br/>  Twitter</div> </div><br/>  <div> Job Number: <br/>  J0518-0122</div><br/>   <div> Job Title: <br/>  Systems and Security Analyst</div><br/>  <div> Job Type: <br/>  Permanent Full Time</div><br/>  <div> Location: <br/>  Calgary</div><br/>  <div> City/Province: <br/>  Calgary, Alberta, Canada</div><br/>  <div> Number Of Positions: <br/>  1</div><br/>  <div> Date Posted: <br/>  May 4, 2018</div><br/>  <div> Closing Date: <br/>  May 20, 2018</div><br/>  <div> Start Date: <br/>  June 4, 2018</div><br/>  <div> Salary: <br/>  $88,936.00 - $104,500.00/Year</div><br/>  <div>As one of Canada’s fastest growing municipalities, Rocky View County offers significant opportunities for professional development. Our dedicated employees work with a variety of stakeholders to develop innovative and unique solutions for the complexities of rural and urban development. We seek individuals who thrive on challenges, who provide excellent customer service in a fast-paced environment, and whose positive energy enables the County to grow and prosper.</div><br/>  <div> Position Summary:<br/><br/>The Security/Systems Analyst is the primary resource for Rocky View County’s Information Security. The Security/Systems Analyst is a senior role where the incumbent develops security practices, processes, and will complete security analysis. It is estimated that 75% of this position will be devoted to Security related items. <br/><br/> The Security/Systems Analyst works under the direction of the Supervisor and Manager to provide security and systems support to all departments, and is focused particularly on the following key areas:</div><br/>  <div> Core Accountabilities:<br/><br/>The Security/Systems Analyst works under the direction of the Supervisor and Manager to provide security and systems support to all departments, and is focused particularly on the following key areas: <br/> Information and Network Security   <ul> <li>Oversee the implementation of various firewall configurations, audit firewall rule-sets, monitor firewall logs</li> <li>Design and Deploy Enterprise wide security policies – ensure that these are reflected in the everyday procedures throughout the Information Systems Section.</li> <li>Maintain and monitor Enterprise vulnerability management systems.</li> <li>Evaluate new and existing software systems – includes penetration testing, configuration review/audit, and code review.</li> <li>Ensure all security controls are in place and are being properly used – includes but not limited to the following items as well as those discussed above: Antivirus, Enterprise policies (both electronic and procedural), Access Controls, Auditing processes etc.</li> </ul>  System Design and Administration   <ul> <li>Design, implement and maintain various server environments which support various business services including: Database, Web, Mail and Document Management.</li> <li>Ensure software applications, services and hardware are running the most current service patches or updates.</li> </ul>  Custom Application Design and Maintenance   <ul> <li>Will have Business Analyst duties to work with all departments with the goal of designing and or recommending applications which integrated into Corporate processes.</li> <li>Liaise with departments to meet their business systems and reporting needs. Maintain applications to meet the changing and expanding requirements.</li> <li>Document both internal workings of application (client/server) and user interface.</li> </ul>  Hardware/Software Deployment <br/> Provide input and support to departments in the selection and implementation of computer hardware and software (commercial and/or custom) within the confines/demands of the RVC IT change management process. <br/> Planning and Organization <br/> The analyst is expected to work independently in many cases, managing all facets of the given project and to provide the timeliest services possible to end-users whilst staying within the confines/demands of the RVC IT change management process.</div><br/>  <div> Position Requirements:<br/><br/>•	BSc Computer Science from a recognized post-secondary institution.   <ul> <li>5 – 7 years progressive work experience.</li> <li>GIAC or equivalent Certificates, GSEC Security Essentials and GCIH Incident Handler (required); GCFA Forensic Analyst, GFNA Network Forensic Analyst (definite asset).</li> <li>Safe guarding of Rocky View County’s electronic information.</li> <li>Keep abreast with new technologies and evolving best practices.</li> <li>Strong technical problem solving and troubleshooting skills.</li> <li>Adherence to the need for the strict confidentiality of information.</li> <li>Strong communication skills (Technical/Lay Person) both internal and external customer service.</li> <li>Highly self-directed with the ability to take initiative, prioritize, and multi-task.</li> <li>Ability to work frequently beyond the scope of assigned duties.</li> <li>Willingness to mentor others – share knowledge and help develop skillsets with the IS team.</li> <li>Adhere to Health and Safety Legislation and Rocky View safe work policies and procedures at all times, ensuring the protection and safety of self, co-workers, the public and environment.</div></li> <br/><br/> </ul>  <div>We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only those selected for interviews will be contacted. <br/><br/> Please Note: All applicants must be legally entitled to live and work in Canada. <br/><br/> The County main office will be relocating to 262075 Rocky View Point, Balzac, AB T4A 0X2 late 2018 or early 2019.</div><br/>  <div> <strong>View Disclaimer</strong></div>  <br/>
Title: Systems and Security Analyst

Job_Description: <div><p><strong>Senior Market Analyst, Commercial </strong></p><p>Based in Calgary and reporting to the Manager, Commercial, you will play a key role in strategic commercial decision making related to TransAlta’s thermal and gas converted assets. By leveraging your expertise in market modeling, economic forecasting, and scenarios analysis, you will help with the evaluation of business opportunities and risks in a competitive power market with the intent of maximizing value of these assets within TransAlta’s portfolio.</p><p><strong>Accountabilities:</strong></p><ul><li>Develop and refine market model, economic dispatch and asset performance models to evaluate thermal and coal converted assets performance and profitability. </li><li>Model the impacts of policy and capacity market changes to support sound commercial business decision-making and inform external partner and stakeholder negotiations</li><li>Maintain comprehensive knowledge of commercially managed contracts, agreements and market and competitors’ changes governing the thermal and gas converted assets</li><li>Leverage your knowledge of agreements and commercial acumen to support other projects, areas of the business including:<ul><li>Act as liaison to Plant Engineering and Operations to ensure the most competitive operating decisions</li><li>Coordinate fuel cost management strategies based upon commodities pricing, plant operations and carbon exposure</li><li>Communicate and support analysis on coal to gas project. Present with impact to management team around commercial business recommendations.</li></ul></li><li>Review changes in regulations affecting generation assets<ul><li>Work with the regulatory group and provide analytical review of the effects of the regulations on asset contracts and make recommendations</li></ul></li><li>Execute commercial and external communications and negotiations within approved mandate</li><li>Support dispute resolution including strategy development, cost-benefits and business case development</li><li>Accountable to seek and deliver value-add growth opportunities for TransAlta</li></ul><p><strong>Qualifications:</strong></p><ul><li>Post-secondary in Economics, Econometrics, Business (ideally a Master’s degree)</li><li>10 to 15 years of energy market forecasting and modeling experience (ideally in electricity markets)</li><li>Experience with business case development, and contractual and financial management</li><li>Functional knowledge of electricity markets, gas markets and energy market fundamentals</li><li>Understand and adhere to regulatory compliance requirements within the Alberta power market</li></ul><p><strong>Technical Skills:</strong></p><ul><li>Demonstrated strong economic market modeling and financial business decision acumen is a must</li><li>Capacity to understand complex commercial arrangements and market rules in order to develop sound business cases and contractual solutions</li><li>Ability to represent the company, its position and values with internal stakeholders, and external partners</li><li>Team player with the ability to communicate effectively to stakeholders in the organization</li><li>Capacity to understand, manage and balance risk/reward tradeoffs in evaluating commercial business decisions and new market opportunities</li><li>Ability to apply market knowledge in enhancing the commercial value of the business</li></ul><p> <strong>Social Process Skills:</strong></p><ul><li>Leadership and Multi-Tasking skills<ul><li>Ability to manage cross-functional requests and projects without formal reports</li></ul></li><li>Communication<ul><li>Demonstrated capability to communicate to broad audiences including management and cross functional stakeholders</li></ul></li><li>Relationship management skills<ul><li>Establishing and maintaining cross functional collaborative relationships</li><li>Demonstrated ability to influence, negotiate and facilitate buy-in with a variety of stakeholders</li></ul></li><li>Presents with impact--includes skillfully participating in discussions and confidently expressing ideas and insights when appropriate with senior management</li><li>Ability to exchange ideas and information effectively using tact and diplomacy when dealing with others</li></ul><p> <strong>Other:</strong></p><ul><li>Travel may be required</li><li>After hours support may be required </li></ul><p>Our comprehensive and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, incentive and rewards programs form the foundation of TransAlta’s excellent employment proposition.<br><br>Come on board!</p></div>
Title: Senior Market Analyst, Commercial

Job_Description: <strong>→</strong> <br/> <strong>Sales Consultant</strong><br/><br/>Sales Consultant<br/><br/>Calgary, Alberta, Canada<br/><br/>Description <ul>  <li>Spence Diamonds is looking for GREAT sales professionals to join our team.</li> <li>Are you a person who can excel using a proven sales model?</li>  <li>Do you possess strong presentation and closing skills?</li>  <li>Are you an ambitious, top performer keen to lead like-minded people on a high performance team?</li> </ul> Spence Diamonds is looking for a professional Sales Consultant, with a proven track record of professional sales success throughout their career in inside or outside sales. We are a high performance organization, and take great pride in what we do. We are looking for a true sales superstar, who can create a high performance professional sales career. <br/><br/> <strong>The Company</strong> <br/><br/> Spence Diamonds is the leading diamond specialty concept in North America. The essence of the Spence experience is our deep commitment to our customer experience. We take great pride in the role we play in our customer’s “happily ever after”; thus, strongly believe that our first responsibility is to our customers. <br/><br/> Visit us at: https://www.spencediamonds.com <br/><br/> <strong>Principal Duties and Responsibilities</strong> <ul>  <li>Drive sales success through metrics analysis and targeted coaching</li> <li>Comfortable presenting valuable products and presenting products with confidence</li> <li>Ability to quickly gain positive rapport in a face to face environment</li> <li>To Ensure our customer receives the benefits of the full Spence experience</li> </ul>  <strong>Requirements</strong>  <ul>  <li>Proven track record as an effective sales consultant in an inside or outside sales roles (ie, automotive, cellular, real estate, investment services or office equipment industries</li> <li>Minimum of 2 years of professional sales experience with proven measurable results</li> <li>Detail oriented and embraces a structured process</li> <li>Disciplined, high energy and outgoing personality</li> <li>Natural born sales professional, who is driven for sales results by following a needs satisfaction activity based model</li> <li>Flexibility to work weekdays, weekends on a rotating schedule</li> </ul> Visit SpenceDiamonds.com for more information on our organization. <br/><br/> All inquiries will be kept strictly confidential. Only those short-listed will be contacted. We thank you for your<br/><br/>Benefits<br/><br/>We are proud to be a collection of the top talent in the industry, and were awarded the honourable distinctions as one of Canada’s 50 Best Managed Companies and one of Canada's 10 Most Admired Corporate Cultures. As a result, customers honour us with their business, allowing our people, our stakeholders and the communities in which we live and work to prosper. <br/><br/> <strong>What are we offering?</strong> <ul>  <li>Potential to earn $75K to $100K+</li> <li>Opportunity to partner with an industry leading brand, during the most exciting chapters of our story, to build an extraordinarily successful business</li> <li>Excellent extended benefits package</li> </ul>
Title: Sales Consultant

Job_Description: <strong>Marketing Specialist <br/> Retail Building Materials <br/> Calgary <br/> Digital and Traditional Marketing</strong>  <br/><br/> <em><strong>The role</strong> </em> <br/> Punching well above their weight, our client takes on some of the biggest players in the industry by way of competitive pricing, outstanding customer service and creative marketing. Using marketing techniques to drive traffic to their site, to engage with customers and to communicate promotions, the business is able to strategically take on the bigger organisations and differentiate themselves to building materials customers. <br/><br/> We currently seek an experienced marketing specialist to work within the companies' head office and be accountable for all marketing activity both online and offline. Digital marketing is the main focus of the role as budgets dictate that the big box retailers will have an advantage with traditional media but online the smaller organisation can often outperform their competitors by way of creatively and strategically planning marketing activity. <br/><br/> The role will be accountable for maintaining a cohesive design for the companys website and increasing the online marketing presence. Successful candidates will need a thorough knowledge of website design practices, new trends in marketing including social marketing strategies and SEO as well as experience driving sales through online campaigns. <br/><br/> The successful candidate will conceptualize and produce creative designs for print such as flyers, banners, signs, posters and marketing materials. They should have an excellent attention to detail, creativity and knowledge of information technology. <br/><br/> <strong><em>Job responsibilities</em> </strong>   <ul> <li>Managing website content, maintaining web design and streamlining navigation.</li>  <li>Design content for digital and social media streams, blogs and email campaigns.</li>  <li>Knowledge of search engines analytics.</li>  <li>Designing print Flyer layout, publishing content and maintaining continuity of themes.</li>  <li>Strong communication skills and up-to-date awareness of marketing techniques.</li>  <li>Work closely with store managers to understand their business objectives, the details of their core product groups and what their optimal customer demographic is.</li>  <li>Deliver on print Flyers and promotional print information brochures.</li>  <li>Liaise with various print suppliers.</li>  <li>Help in the planning of promotional events such as Trade Shows, In-store demos and events.</li>  <li>Collaborate with leadership to develop strategic marketing plans to support acquisition and retention of retail, contractor and home builder customers.</li> </ul>  <em><strong>The successful candidate</strong></em> <br/> This is a hands on role that requires the successful candidate to have up-to-date graphic design, marketing and web design skills. They should have experience of designing and managing a website and have knowledge and experience of online content management. They should have up-to-date social media knowledge and have experience designing and running campaigns through social channels. Much of the design work is done in-house so strong graphic design skills and experience are required. The candidate will also write blogs, write content for the website and write much of the promotional content that is used through all channels of communication so strong writing skills are essential. Knowledge of the following tools and packages are highly sought after;    <ul> <li>Google Analytics</li>  <li>Adobe Creative Suite</li>  <li>Photoshop</li>  <li>Illustrator</li>   <li>InDesign</li>  <li>HTML and basic word programming</li>  <li>Word, Excel and PowerPoint</li>  </ul>  This is an inclusive environment where employees share in the success of the organisation and very much treated as family. This is a unique opportunity for a technically minded marketer to be given the opportunity to control all marketing activities for an organisation and have a clear line of sight to the direct impact their marketing activity has on the performance of the business. <br/><br/> Please apply ASAP, this role is being hired with urgency.
Title: Marketing Specialist

Job_Description: Vintri is seeking a motivated and self-starting individual for the position of Junior Data Analyst at Vintri Technologies. Reporting to the Manager, Data Services, the Junior Data Analyst will help facilitate the successful delivery of Vintri projects as well as the development of scalability within the organization. <ul> <li>Highly proficient with the Microsoft Office suite with a particular focus on Excel.</li><li>Strong understanding of data best practices.</li><li>Intense attention to detail and engagement with data.</li><li>Knowledge of data management tools and platforms such as Python and Power Query.</li><li>Strong written and verbal communication skills.</li><li>Self-starting and highly motivated.</li><li>Data analytical skills are welcomed, but not required.</li><li>Proficiency in Microsoft Visio is also a plus, but not required.</li></ul>  <ul> <li>Support the Manager, Data Services in the successful delivery of Data Services’ projects. This includes project setup, planning, execution, and monitoring.</li><li>Manage the receipt and initial processing of data inputs throughout projects from key stakeholders.</li><li>Document and help create processes and procedures that will streamline Vintri’s service delivery and facilitate scalability within the organization.</li><li>Develop tools and solutions on platforms such as Python or Power Query to support the Vintri Data Services operations.</li><li>Manage internal tracking metrics and participate in the project tracking/invoicing process.</li><li>Interface with key stakeholders and customers, as needed.</li><li>Support the Manager, Data Services in the creation and delivery of project deliverables, such as audit reports and issue logs.</li><li>Support the Manager, Data Services in contributing to the product and service roadmap as the company continues to grow.</li>  </ul> <strong>About Vintri Technologies:</strong> <br/><br/> At Vintri Technologies, we are on the mission to save businesses from losing millions of dollars as it relates to their assets during the construction and manufacturing phases. With constant changes to regularly requirements, Vintri Technologies provides viable solutions for data capture, data integrity and data integration. <br/><br/> <strong>How to Apply:</strong> <br/><br/> To apply send all resumes to https://jobs-elevatedhr.icims.com/jobs/1490/junior-data-analyst/job <br/><br/> We thank all applicants for their submissions, but only those deemed qualified by the hiring manager will be contacted. <strong>No phone calls please.</strong>
Title: Junior Data Analyst

Job_Description: Robert Half Technology is currently seeking a QA Analyst for our Calgary Client. <br/> If you have the qualifications we are looking for, please submit your resume online to <br/> stephanie.sherlock@rht.com <br/><br/> <strong>RESPONSIBILITIES</strong> <br/><br/> ×	Responsible to analyze, action on, and verify requirements for testing purposes. <br/> ×	Gather all business requirements for the development stream and construct relevant QA documentation for testing purposes. <br/> ×	Write and execute test cases, track defects, fixes and retest in an Agile / SCRUM environment <br/> ×	Prioritize testing tasks based on criticality to the end user and ensure that all testing activities are completed as scheduled and co-ordinate testing to ensure release/sprint timelines and deliverables are met <br/> ×	Solid experience in developing test plans and strategies based on quality assurance best practices and experience <br/> ×	Analyze and understand complex User Stories, creation of test strategies and drive reviews with stakeholders <br/> ×	Collaborate with QA and development team to ensure all relevant and agreed upon aspects of the application are tested <br/> ×	Ability to recognize and test for scenarios that may affect other projects <br/> ×	Communicate effectively and positively with other members of the development team <br/> ×	Advocate for Quality in all aspects of design and development <br/> ×	Other duties as assigned
Title: Quality Assurance Analyst

Job_Description: <div><strong>Summary</strong> <br/><br/> Precision Drilling recently completed a large project to re-implement our 20+year old SAP system on the latest S/4 HANA platform. To support and continue to build on this investment we are looking for a candidate with strong experience in one or more of the following areas to join the team – Enterprise Asset Management, Sales & Distribution, Supply Chain Management, Health-Safety & Environment, Management of Change <br/><br/> Reporting to the Director of Business Systems Integration, the IT ERP Functional Analyst will design, implement, deploy, and sustain SAP functional solutions to achieve defined business goals <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities</strong>  <ul>  	<li>Act as subject matter expert for one or more of the SAP Logistics areas and business processes (SD, PM, MM, EH&S, MOC), and providing system and data support for the business process execution</li> <li>Maintain skills in SAP applications process design and configuration</li> <li>Maintain skills in SAP applications process design and configuration; SAP application design, development, integration, testing and deployment; and application technical architecture.</li> <li>Collect, analyze and document business process and functional requirements in both current and future-state</li> <li>Perform gap analysis between current and future state scenarios, implementation planning including development of implementation roadmaps</li> <li>Identify opportunities for and provide recommendations on business process improvements</li> <li>Lead test strategy development and facilitate sessions with technical staff and business team members to execute test cases</li> <li>Communicate effectively with business users and internal teams to deliver functional requirements, assist with documentation, create process maps, etc.</li> <li>Assist in the development of communications, training, and job aids to support change management activities for any projects or initiatives</li> <li>Develop and maintain strong relationships with business users and internal team members</li> <li>Motivate, communicate, and leverage skills and competencies of individuals within the business unit(s) supported</li> <li>Assist Project Manager(s) with project schedule development and maintenance</li> <li>Utilize expertise in project management, process improvement, metrics, requirements management, information technology, and understanding of the organization’s systems and capabilities to ensure the most efficient use of resources</li> </ul> <strong>Knowledge & Skills</strong> <br/><br/> Eagerness to contribute in a team-oriented environment <br/><br/> Self-starter who is able to work in a fast paced, results driven environment <br/><br/> Ability to work creatively and analytically in a problem-solving environment <br/><br/> Strong interpersonal skills, especially interviewing skills. <br/><br/> Excellent communication (written and verbal) <br/><br/> Superior organization skills and attention to detail <br/><br/> Self-confident to make suggestions for process improvement and issue resolution <br/><br/> Strong focus on delivery and quality; ability to ensure quality and accuracy of deliverables, with a focus on attention to detail <br/><br/> Large / complex implementation experience is a plus <br/><br/> Solid understanding of SAP is a must for the success of this role. Strong expertise in one or more of the following areas: SD, MM, PM, EHS, MOC <br/><br/> <strong>Education</strong> <br/><br/> University / college degree or equivalent experience plus 3 years SAP analyst experience <br/><br/> <strong>Experience</strong> <br/><br/> Experience working within the oil and gas industry an asset <br/><br/> Experience in process analysis, training material development and testing</div>  <br/>
Title: SAP Functional Analyst - Operations

Job_Description: <strong>THE OPPORTUNITY:</strong> <br/><br/> We are currently looking for a qualified Accounting Analyst, to complement our team in Calgary, AB. The successful candidate will report to the Accounting Manager. <br/><br/> <strong>This is a one year contract position.</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>RESPONSIBILITIES:</strong>  <ul> <li>Responsible for entering of cheques and EFTs;</li> <li>Performing the controls for Credit Applications;</li> <li>Completing bank reconciliations;</li> <li>Entering daily closes for branches in BC and Alberta;</li> <li>Support branch admin teams on daily closes, cash and receivables reconciliation;</li> <li>Perform other duties, as assigned.</li> </ul> <strong>QUALIFICATIONS:</strong>  <ul> <li>A university degree or advanced diploma in Accounting, Finance, or Business Administration is required;</li> <li>Transcript is a must;</li> <li>A working knowledge of accounting-related software is an asset;</li> <li>Attention to detail and a high degree of accuracy;</li> <li>Ability to efficiently and effectively identify and analyze transactional issues;</li> <li>Strong customer service skills;</li> <li>Excellent time management and prioritization skills;</li> <li>Ability to meet work requirements within established timelines;</li> <li>Communicate effectively verbally and in writing;</li> <li>Strong working knowledge of Word and Excel.</li> </ul> <strong>ABOUT US:</strong> <br/><br/> WesternOne provides aerial lifts and temporary heat services. We service large scale construction projects, home builders, commercial constructors, industrial customers, movie customers and other speciality niches. <br/><br/> We have 15 locations in Western Canada with plans to extend throughout the rest of the country. We deliver outstanding service to our customers, and are industry leaders in our areas. Our mission is to help our customers do their jobs safer, easier and faster by being the experts in what we do. <br/><br/> WesternOne is an equal opportunity employer. We thank all who respond; however, please note that only those applicants being considered will be contacted.
Title: Accounting Analyst

Job_Description: The ROT Senior Architect Analyst is responsible for ensuring that ROT funded projects deliver enterprise suitable solutions, optimizing potential savings and reducing risk. The ROT Senior Architect Analyst will assist with the creation of business cases by identifying and documenting the business needs of stakeholders and assisting with the complicated task of estimating the costs and savings early in the project development process. By ensuring that the proposed solutions will meet the enterprise needs and not just the needs of a single group, the ROT Senior Architect Analyst optimizes the return on investment of the ROT funds. <br/><br/> Starting with eliciting, analyzing, validating and documenting business, organizational and/or operational requirements, they develop the data needed to develop the optimum IT solution. The ROT Senior Architect Analyst will also contribute to the solution development, and the data that builds the business case – estimating both costs and savings. Lastly, the ROT Senior Architect Analyst will assist with the measurement of the actual savings achieved to ensure that the ROT program financial savings estimates are being met, and that the program has accurate data to support the reporting function. <br/><br/> Must be comfortable working with very large enterprise technology solutions across a wide variety of technical domains, and taking abstract, fluid solution ideas and turning them into concrete designs. <br/><br/> Must have outstanding interpersonal skills and deep technical fluency to allow them to complete complex tasks, to work independently with minimal coaching, and demonstrate leadership skills. <br/><br/> <strong>What you’ll do</strong> <br/><br/> The ROT Senior Architect Analyst will use their extensive experience coupled with formal architecture and analysis techniques and their own creativity to support the ROT program delivery. This role is primarily focused on collaborating with the 90 solution architects in the enterprise, and the senior leaders and other stakeholders to ensure that all decision making is supported with data and facts. The role has a secondary focus on supporting the program and project manager(s) as required, particularly in understanding risk and impact. <ul> <li>Elicit Requirements: Anticipates, quantifies and resolves problems and issues through requirements. Done by the identification of source requirements, risk management, and development of a priority matrix. Must be capable and confident to lead requirements gathering workshops and JAM sessions</li><li>Create Requirements<u>:</u> Document: Publishes, distributes, and ensures sign-off of the business requirements. Performs impact analysis on requested changes to requirements. Assists with risk management and can use specific tools such as priority matrices, and / or formal reviews with clients</li><li>Structured Analysis: Analyzes and determines problems, opportunities, and solution resolutions. Can identify and document "as-is" state vs. "to-be" state using a variety of tools and techniques based on the project and its complexity plus facilitation of interviews to help develop a consensus about the requirements</li><li>Business Case Development: Works with ROT stakeholders to develop the business case, including solution design, estimate costs, efforts and savings. Uses a variety of tools and techniques based on the need at hand, and is able to craft solutions that are suitable for enterprise use and account for the various different needs and demands of the various SBUs and functional units across the corporation.</li><li>Change Agency: Understands process and issues inherent in change management and plans and advises the program accordingly; instills confidence and trust in others; coordinates resources across departments/units; evaluates measures, works with delivery teams to develop specific change mgmt plans and deliverables for alignment and smooth implementation; acknowledges individual’s responses to change and helps them adjust</li><li>Monitoring: Monitors changing requirements and architectural responses to problems. Uses tools such as a user acceptance strategy to ensure that all business scenarios have been validated and business requirements and their integrity are maintained throughout the execution of the project.</li><li>Results Analysis and Internal Audit: Upon project conclusion, the Senior Architect Analyst with assist the PMO in performing the internal audit to ensure that the predicted benefits (financial) have been achieved.</li><li>Business / IT Fluency: Understands the societal impact of information and information technology in the business environment. Has a deep understanding of technology and solution architecture.</li><li>Business Process Analysis: Recommends improvements to business processes. Done by ensuring business goals are met by considering all tangible and intangible costs.</li><li>Build Business Relationships: Understand the business issues and challenges of the organization and industry. Done by working closely with Business and IT to ensure a strategic partnership between Business needs and Technology solutions.</li> </ul> <strong>What you’ve done</strong><ul> <li>10 years experience in a relevant industry vertical. (Retail, Wholesale Distribution, CPG, etc.)</li><li>5 years experience in Business Analysis practice</li><li>Proven proficiency / mastery of junior and intermediate Business Analyst competencies</li><li>Experience with package (COTS) customization and deployment</li><li>Experience with Product Lifecycle, Sales Order, Retail, Supply Chain, Finance, and/or Human Capital management systems is an asset</li><li>Experience in Solution Design and Architecture is an asset</li><li>Experience with ITIL Framework and IT Service Management (ITSM) is an asset</li><li>Knowledge of both traditional waterfall and Agile project methodologies is an asset.</li><li>Experience and knowledge of solution architecture is an asset.</li> </ul> <strong>Who you are</strong> <br/><br/> Communication: Ability to formulate concepts; communication of technical information to a non-technical audience; communication of business information to a technical audience. <br/><br/> Leadership: as a change agent, ability to develop and communicate change management strategies to technical and non-technical staff alike. <br/><br/> Business: Knowledge of business processes; ability to have a business-oriented vision; case development; business writing; modeling techniques. <br/><br/> Analytical: analytical and conceptual expertise; documentation, analysis and business requirements management techniques; object-oriented analysis; evaluation of profitability/risk; testing, verification and validation techniques. <ul> <li>Thinking (Analytical, Systemic, Creative): Identifies and integrates the critical elements of a situation, making correct inferences from data; breaks complex problems into component parts and organizes the parts in a systematic way; uses innovation to develop novel solutions; explains to others how to understand / approach complicated problems.</li><li>Professional Knowledge: Continually enhances knowledge and skills to keep abreast of industry changes, developments and emerging issues; understands what it takes to be successful in this business; has a thorough knowledge of organization’s mission, history, stakeholders and customers.</li><li>Builds Trust and Credibility by consistently adhering to the organization’s business principles and values. Is seen as direct, truthful, and trustworthy by co-workers, vendors, and customers.</li><li>Committed to results by taking personal responsibility for achieving mutually agreed upon individual/team objectives.</li><li>Demonstrates a desire to help and serve internal/external customers to meet their needs. Is proactive, responsive, and focused on discovering, anticipating, and exceeding the customer’s needs.</li><li>Works collaboratively and cooperatively with others to achieve shared goals and objectives. Considers the wider team, function, banner or the organization and takes action or makes decisions which support the success of those groups.</li><li>Recovers quickly after change, disruptions, or mistakes and can remain productive and focused. Is adaptable and can apply lessons learned in one situation to another situation.</li> </ul> Academic / Educational requirements <ul> <li>University degree or equivalent experience in Computer Science or related discipline.</li><li>Business Analysis Certification from an accredited source is an asset (CBAP® , CCBATM)</li> </ul>  Canadian Tire and FGL Sports are equal opportunity employers. We are committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace for all. We recognize that our future success depends on the perspectives and contributions of all our employees -- their diverse backgrounds, abilities and experiences make our business stronger. If you are contacted for a job opportunity, please advise us of any accommodations needed to ensure fair and equitable access throughout the recruitment and selection process. All accommodation information provided will be treated as confidential and used only for the purpose of providing an accessible candidate experience.
Title: Senior Analyst, Architecture - FGL Sports

reviewing infrastructure solutions. <br/><br/> <strong>What Does an <em>Infrastructure Consultant</em> do?</strong> <ul> <li>Install, configure, optimize, troubleshoot and support Microsoft Windows (2008/R2, 2012/R2), Exchange (2007, 2010,2013), Virtualization solutions (VMware, Hyper-V), Remote Desktop Services, and other core infrastructure components</li><li>Implement, and troubleshoot Office 365</li><li>Proven experience in delivery of technical projects on budget and on time</li><li>Effectively troubleshoot infrastructure issues like performance bottlenecks or configuration faults</li><li>Produce accurate and informative technical documentation</li><li>Prioritize and execute tasks in a high-energy environment</li><li>Understand the dynamic nature of a client's business and deliver the best-fit solution</li><li>Deal effectively with all levels of customers and team members</li><li>Work well under pressure and manage expectations effectively</li> </ul> <strong>What You’ll Need to be On IT:</strong> <ul> <li>Minimum of 5 years’ experience in a similar role</li><li>Substantial experience with, Windows Server 2008/2012, Active Directory, , VMWare, SAN Solutions, , Office 365 Subject Matter Expert level of understanding for at least one core infrastructure component</li><li>Strong organizational skills with excellent attention to detail</li><li>Experience working in a team-oriented, collaborative environment</li><li>Effective/proven communication skills</li><li>Experience installing, configurating, optimizing, troubleshooting and supporting Citrix XenApp/XenDesktop is an asset</li><li>Experience in implementation and management of Microsoft Azure is also an asset</li> </ul> <strong>Extra Reasons that show you’re ON IT:</strong> <ul> <li>You have the ability to quickly familiarize with client environment</li><li>You enjoy the changing demands of technology and embraces learning and expanding their knowledge</li><li>You possess strong time management skills with the ability to work effectively with a team or independently</li><li>You have strong attention to detail with the ability to organize and set priorities to manage multiple tasks and projects</li><li>You have the ability to understand and adhere to operating procedures and practices</li><li>You demonstrate professionalism through appearance and overall conduct</li><li>You are open and willing to communicate and respond to the needs of our clients, Graycon, our people and projects in a positive, professional, and supporting manner</li><li>You are strong in interpersonal and Having fun, working hard, enjoying cool events, building our careers and futures, making a positive impact in our communities and being proud of our team and company are all the things that make up who we are at Graycon I.T. <br/><br/> If you’re looking for a fun company environment that encourages learning with in-house training programs, shadowing experiences, mentor program, access to on-line training, and a technical library then we have what you are looking for! <br/><br/> Add to that comprehensive health benefits with employer paid premiums; RRSP matching; a fitness benefit, a karma volunteer day each year and an open, collaborative, and supportive employee oriented environment. <br/><br/> We’re ON IT across Canada, with offices in Calgary, Vancouver, Toronto, Edmonton, Saskatoon, Red Deer, Kamloops and Kelowna.
