Title: Senior Systems Analyst (Stratiform)

Job_Description: Inter Pipeline is a major petroleum transportation, storage and natural gas liquids processing business that ranks among the largest energy infrastructure companies in Canada. We are proud to be named one of Alberta’s Top 70 Employers, which recognizes Alberta businesses that lead their industries by being exceptional places to work.<br/><br/>Located out of our Calgary office, the Oil Movements Analyst role reports to the Supervisor of Volumetric Accounting and is a key member of Inter Pipeline’s Oil Movements department.<br/><br/>The Oil Movements Analyst is responsible for the volumetric accounting, analysis and reporting requirements for Inter Pipeline’s conventional and oil sands pipeline systems. In addition, this position provides ongoing management of Shipper Balances, producer statements and equalization statements. <br/><br/> <strong>Key Activities and Responsibilities:</strong> <ul> <li>Validate data to ensure accuracy and completeness of crude oil account information, while interacting frequently with pipeline schedulers</li><li>Calculate volumetric information from gauge reports, truck tickets, pipeline tickets, and other measurement reports that are gathered from the operators, business units and delivery systems</li><li>Enter ticket information for the Oil Sands pipelines, ensuring accuracy and completeness for month end reporting</li><li>Enter production splits, prepare equalization statements for customers on a monthly basis</li><li>Collaborate with administrators in field offices to ensure tickets, volume adjustments and other deadlines are completed</li><li>Compile and send Operator Production Summary reports, along with Petrinex reporting on a monthly basis</li><li>Monitor pipeline quality information as it comes in to ensure it meets the pipeline specifications and ensure testing methods meet the industry standards</li><li>Liaise with the Measurement department to ensure the accuracy of quality information used for Equalization</li><li>Liaise with the accounting department to ensure automatic, manual and miscellaneous invoicing is accurate</li><li>Liaise with the Business Development department ensuring required tariff changes and new implementations are completed accurately</li><li>Liaise with the Midstream Marketing department to ensure all reporting requirements are accurate on a monthly basis</li><li>Ensure customer queries are handled professionally and timely</li> </ul> <strong>Education, Skills and Experience:</strong> <ul> <li>Two to four years of related industry experience with University degree or diploma, Business related preferred</li> <li>Attention to detail is critical, demonstrates strong analytical and problem-solving skills</li><li>Advanced level for MS Office, in particular strong excel skills will be an asset</li><li>Demonstrates ability to interpret and communicate business analytics</li><li>Proven experience working in a fast paced, deadline driven environment</li><li>Well-developed interpersonal, team, customer service and communication skills, both written and verbal</li><li>Have an understanding of the Industry practices such as COLC calendar and the Equalization procedure guidelines</li><li>Experience working with Petrinex for government reporting.</li> </ul>
Title: Oil Movements Analyst

Job_Description: <div><div>Superior Gas Liquids is a leading mid-stream marketing company providing innovative and dependable energy solutions to gas & oil producers and whole sale propane end-users. Superior Gas Liquids’ growing operations have been built with its dynamic team of energy experts that strive to exceed both up and down stream customers' expectations. <br/><br/> Reporting to the Logistics Team Lead, the Transportation Analyst is responsible for the analysis and monitoring of Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) related to the transportation of propane. The Transportation Analyst also monitors budget and expenses as it relates to transportation, infrastructure, and compliance metrics related to the safe, efficient, and effective delivery of propane. Utilizing technical knowledge of Excel and Access the Transportation Analyst will be responsible for continuous improvement of various systems, processes, and documents. <br/><br/> <strong>Key Objectives:</strong>  <ul> <li>Prepare and distribute weekly, monthly, quarterly and annual summary reports to key stakeholders at Superior Gas Liquids, Superior Propane, and third party carriers detailing the achievement of key performance indicators. The Transportation Analyst will be responsible for managing various scorecards to track the KPIs, identifying trends, variances and gaps in the data.</li>  <li>Create weekly volume reports, compare to forecast, and identify trends. Report on supply and demand on a recurring basis to carriers, Superior Gas Liquids, and Superior Propane.</li>   <li>Manage and update yearly tool for Superior Propane’s Master Supply Agreement. Update and maintain on a daily basis.</li>  <li>Maintain and update various spreadsheets and tools for analysis including truck and rail freight, inventory, landed cost, demurrage and detention reports.</li>   <li>Monthly reconciliation of accessorial costs for SPI with a weekly update on performance</li>  <li>Support SGL’s accounting team to streamline payables. Coordinate with vendors and internally to reduce data entry process.</li>  <li>System administrator for various systems including SecureSheet, Geometrics, and Winfuel.</li>  <li>Update and analyze information for Superior Gas Liquids’ rail operations; backup to Rail Analyst</li>  <li>Manage Superior Gas Liquids’ Landed Cost program</li>  <li>Liase with service providers and consultants to obtain or collect requested information and coordinate the delivery and execution of transportation programs or services.</li>  <li>Create adhoc profitability reports on different truck and rail rates. This includes looking for opportunities to maximize profitability based on landed cost.</li>  <li>Work on solutions to decrease truck and rail accessorial fees.</li>  <li>Negotiate freight rates with truck and rail carriers</li>  <li>Back up to rail specialist and supply analyst.</li>  <li>Create weekly market updates for the six regions at Superior Propane.</li> </ul> <strong>Qualifications</strong>  <ul> <li>Relevant post-secondary education (Business, Logistics, Supply Chain, Finance, Information Technology, or equivalent degree)</li>  <li>1-3 years’ experience in a similar operations or analyst role.</li>  <li>Expert computer and technical skills, specifically with Microsoft Office are required (proven skills in Access or Excel using pivot tables, macros, lookups, etc.).</li>  <li>Previous exposure to VBA to automate and simplify business processes would be an asset</li>  <li>Ability to work well under pressure in a self-directed environment and deliver to deadlines.</li>  <li>Strong organizational and priority management skills, with the ability to adapt and respond to changing customer and business demands.</li>  <li>Good interpersonal skills, able to communicate effectively at all levels.</li>  <li>Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with an emphasis on accuracy and attention to detail.</li> </ul>  </div> </div><div></div>
Title: Transportation Analyst

Job_Description: <div> Job Description<br/><br/><strong>Ceridian. Makes Work Life Better™</strong> <br/><br/> This is our promise. Not only for our customers, but our employees as well. <br/><br/> Ceridian is a cloud company powered by people. Join us as we transform the world of work for millions of employees around the world. Our products help employees be paid on time, apply for promotions, grow their careers, and support their work/life fit. Our solutions and our people work together to help organizations control costs, save time, optimize their workforce, minimize risk and grow their businesses. <br/><br/> As a software company specializing in human capital management (HCM), Ceridian has not only invested heavily in cloud software development but in its people as well. We have a variety of career growth (Top Talent, Career Pathing, Tuition Reimbursement, & Job Rotation) and Diversity/Inclusion (YOUnity and Ceridian’s Women Network) programs to support your career journey at Ceridian. <br/><br/> We are looking for fun, intelligent, team oriented people who believe in our values: Customer Focus, Transparency, Diligence, Optimism, and Agility. <br/><br/> Find out why Ceridian employees declare Ceridian a Great Place to Work® in 2017, a Glassdoor Best Places to Work in 2017, and one of Canada’s Top 100 Employers for 2017!<br/> <div><div><div>The <strong>Solutions Consultant</strong> drives new client acquisition and growth in our existing client base by providing pre-sales technical support to the sales team throughout the sales cycle, including identifying client needs and the facilitation of customer product/application understanding through interactive presentations, demonstrations and benchmarks. This position will support the Mid Market Sales teams.</div> <div> <strong>Essential Functions</strong></div><div>  <ul> <li>Provides technical sales support</li><li>Analyzes an organization’s existing HCM environment; proposes, and demonstrates how Ceridian’s solutions can better address their requirements and solve business concerns</li><li>Offers insight and creative solutions to best meet client’s needs</li><li>Leads and facilitates demonstrations to provide customer engagement and understanding</li><li>Participates in all aspects of the sales cycle including strategizing, developing, and presenting compelling and relevant solutions</li> <li>Contributes to the RFP and demonstration knowledge base</li><li>Shares feedback and best practices to improve the sales team’s effectiveness</li><li>Exhibits Technical Proficiency</li><li>Maintains technical and professional skills to ensure proficiency in product offerings, in depth knowledge of competition and awareness of industry developments and trends in the marketplace</li><li>Leverages technical and professional skills to increase productivity and customer satisfaction</li><li>Maintains Accurate and Timely Customer, Pipeline, and Forecast Data</li><li>Captures all relevant information in SFDC/CRM system</li><li>Follows all defined processes and timelines (SOW requirements, deal review process, price setting, service level</li><li>requirements, demo scripts, expenses, etc.)</li><li>Keeps current on Ceridian processes and any relevant changes</li></ul></div> <br/> <div> <strong>Educational/Skills/Experience Requirements</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Minimum Qualifications</strong></div><div>  <ul> <li>University/College Degree/Diploma or equivalent related work experience</li><li>At least 1-2 years experience in a technology-related role in a business environment</li><li>Excellent communication (oral & written), problem solving and organization skills</li><li>Excellent interpersonal skills, builds trust and rapport with all levels of personnel</li><li>Excellent problem solving and organization skills</li><li>Demonstrated ability to function in a fast paced, deadline driven environment</li><li>Demonstrated business acumen, high energy and integrity, sense of urgency, work ethic and drive for results</li><li>Must have a valid drivers license</li></ul></div> <br/> <div> <strong>Preferred Qualifications</strong></div><div>  <ul> <li>University Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or relevant software/computer related fields</li><li>Moderate knowledge of Human Capital solutions (Payroll, HR, Workforce Management, Talent Management) and related systems</li><li>At least 1-2 years knowledge of the concepts and principles in at least one of Ceridian’s key HCM verticals</li><li>Previous client support experience</li><li>French or Spanish Bilingual</li><li>Familiarity with Microsoft Server Technology (Windows, SQL server, etc.)</li><li>Strong time management and organizational skills with ability to prioritize work from multiple sources</li> </ul></div> </div></div> <br/>Ceridian combines the excitement of a startup environment, with the growth opportunities of a large organization. We believe our employees should be happy and healthy, with peace of mind and a sense of fulfillment. We provide our employees with comprehensive benefits for various life circumstances and needs, great opportunities for career development, and a balanced lifestyle to achieve personal and professional success. <br/><br/> Ceridian is fueled by the diversity of our talented employees. We are an equal opportunity employer and embrace all individuals and what makes them unique. We consider all applicants, regardless of age, religion, race, color, ancestry, gender, gender identity, disability, national origin, race, sexual orientation, military or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, provincial or local laws. We enthusiastically encourage all individuals to apply for positions that fit their passions. Come join our inclusive team and start collaborating with us on award winning projects! <br/><br/> Connect with us on Twitter @CeridianCareers or Facebook CeridianCareers <br/><br/> We thank all applicants in advance for their interest in this position, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted. </div>
Title: Solutions Consultant (Western Canada)

Job_Description: <strong><div>   <ul>   <li>Share :</li> </ul> </div>  <br/></strong> <br/>  Senior Security Analyst<br/><br/><strong>Location:</strong>  Saskatoon, Regina, Calgary, Vancouver <br/><br/> WBM is looking for a talented individual to join our Managed Security Services team. This team works directly with the Enterprise-level clients to plan, assess, scope, design, implement and operate solutions and services that ensure our clients’ IT infrastructure and networks are secure and safe. We believe in providing the highest level of customer satisfaction by understanding our client’s needs and delivering security outcomes that are truly world-class.<br/><br/>Key Qualifications<br/><br/>A successful candidate will have a minimum of ten-year’s experience working in the Information Technology sector with strong focus on Information Security. They will possess strong communication skills, both written and verbal, and will be comfortable, friendly, and eloquent when presenting to both business and technical audiences. The Senior Security Analyst will be capable of understanding the complexities of Information Security topics and be able to represent these complexities in an ‘easy-to-understand’ manner for the purposes of delivering comprehensive and meaningful outcomes. <br/><br/> There is a strong team component to this job, therefore the candidate will possess a proven track-record working within a team environment and collaborating with others. The successful applicant will also be proficient at managing simultaneous projects, milestones, and tasks of varying scope and priority as they ensure customer satisfaction is maintained.<br/><br/>Experience<br/><br/>Ideal candidates will have hands on experience with the deployment of Information Security Infrastructure and the delivery of Infrastructure Security Services including:  <ul> <li>Traditional and Next Generation Firewalls</li> <li>Application Security systems</li> <li>Intrusion Prevention and Detection systems</li> <li>High Availability platforms such as load balancers</li> <li>Switching and Routing platforms</li> <li>Vulnerability and network testing platforms</li> <li>Security Policy definitions</li> <li>Ethical Hacking and Penetration Testing</li> <li>Forensics analysis related to Intrusion investigations</li> <li>Delivery of Security Awareness, Training and Education programs</li> </ul> Preferred candidates will also have experience with the deployment of technology based on the F5 Big-IP and SonicWALL security product offerings as follows:  <ul> <li>F5 Local Traffic Manager</li> <li>F5 Access Policy Manager</li> <li>F5 Application Security Manager</li> <li>F5 DNS (formerly Global Traffic Manager)</li> <li>F5 Advanced Firewall Manager</li> <li>SonicWALL SonicOS Next Generation Firewalls (e.g. TZ, NSA, Supermassive )</li> <li>SonicWALL E-mail protection platforms</li> </ul> Desirable candidates should have experience and in-depth understanding of Enterprise Infrastructure and concepts such as:  <ul> <li>Physical Data Centers</li> <li>Cloud based technologies</li> <li>Operating Systems (with preferred strong focus on Unix/Linux)</li> <li>Web Servers (both commercial and Open Source based)</li> <li>Virtualization technologies</li> <li>Identity, Federation and Access Management technologies</li> <li>Application development frameworks</li> <li>OSI networking model</li> <li>Modern Programming and Scripting languages</li> <li>Relational Databases and other structured data models</li> </ul> Although the successful candidate may be located in any one of the cities where WBM operates, travelling and being on-site at customer locations throughout Western Canada will be required. <br/><br/> The opportunity to succeed is exceptional and the opportunities to advance will be in multiple areas. Those in this position at WBM have flourished within it. Some have gone onto roles in IT and network administration, some have advanced to management positions within WBM, and some have accepted roles in IT Management within the customer organizations that they meet through their work at WBM.<br/><br/>Additional Details<br/><br/>WBM will offer you a competitive income and benefits package with clear paths for advancement. At WBM, we understand that the benefits we provide must go beyond caring for your health they must also provide for your financial well-being. That’s why in addition to medical, dental and disability coverage, we also provide you an attractive company pension plan, and a personal development program. <br/><br/> If you are a self-motivated individual with a desire to pursue this opportunity, email your resume to hr@wbm.ca or via the form below. <br/><br/> Only applicants selected for an interview will be contacted. We sincerely thank all applicants for their interest in WBM. <br/><br/> Connect with us on Facebook @wbmtech, on Twitter @wbmtech, and on LinkedIn @wbmtech. <br/><br/> <em><strong>Join our team, and write your own story.</strong></em><br/> <div> <div> <div> <div>Join our team and write your own story. <br/><br/> Apply Now</div>  </div>  </div>  </div> <br/>
Title: Senior Security Analyst

Job_Description: <DIV>Reporting to the Manager Information Technology, the Systems Analyst position requires a creative person who is a team player, with a strong technical and problem-solving background, the ability to relate to several different IT and client groups, and excellent verbal and written communication skills.</DIV> <UL> <LI> <DIV>Provide second level support for Field Service applications inquiries within Ensign</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Analyze and resolve both technical and process issues for business users</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Liaise with other personnel within IT to diagnose and resolve support issues</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Identifying, managing and escalating issues and risks in a timely manner</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Work with other functional teams within IT to investigate and resolve cross application process and integration issues</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Identify possible project opportunities to Management</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Report on current state of support </DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Keep abreast of Ensign’s global systems strategies</DIV></LI></UL> <UL> <LI> <DIV>Post-secondary education in Computer Science, Management Information Systems discipline or equivalent experience</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>2 - 5 years of experience in business application implementation and support</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Core technical skills should include SQL abilities and a good working knowledge of web application architecture</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Exposure to a wide range of technologies including a solid knowledge of databases, web applications, operating platforms, networking and systems integration</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Ability to work independently and as a part of a team and manage multiple tasks in an ever-changing environment</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Able to work with different client types to understand their needs, identify root causes of problems, and work to resolution</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Ability to develop rapport with various client groups and personalities and maintain strong working relationships</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Experience with ERP-level systems and processes</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Experience with SSRS reporting</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Some travel may be required, including to the United States</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Work is expected to be completed at the client’s office in downtown Calgary</DIV></LI></UL>
Title: Systems Analyst - 1 Year Limited Term Contract

Job_Description: <strong>Description:</strong> <br/> The primary responsibilities of this position are to develop security programs, provide subject matter expertise, top tier support to the operational security team, and participate in internal and external working groups. <br/> This senior position requires exceptional technical aptitude, leadership and customer interface skills. Daily activities include collaborating with the client, designing, implementing and supporting security solutions in line with the clients technology and business strategies <br/><br/> <strong>RESPONSIBILITIES:</strong>    <ul> <li>Utilizing Security Analysis tools and methodologies to effectively describe, inform and mitigate security threats for client customers</li> <li>Maintaining a strong understanding of current IT security Risk and vulnerabilities.</li> </ul>  The Senior Security Consultant supports project managers and change managers in the planning and design of security related services enhancements   <ul> <li>The Senior Security Consultant is the expert in security architecture and design principles and has a thorough understanding of security standards and methodologies</li> <li>The Senior Security Consultant is responsible for proper documentation and cross training needed to insure seamless introduction of new technologies and security changes within existing operational models</li> <li>Preparing drafts of changes for existing IT security procedures and policies or for new policies and procedures</li> <li>Work closely with other operational teams including network operations, abuse management, and external operational points of contact</li> </ul>  <strong>REQUIREMENTS:</strong>    <ul> <li>A minimum of 7 years of security professional work experience</li> <li>A thorough knowledge of IT Network, Data Centre, Internet Protocol, File Transfer, Spam.</li> <li>Expertise with security methodologies, standards, and best practices (i.e: ITIL, ISO 17799/BS7799, and other security-related practices are an asset)</li> <li>Expertise within a broad range of security sub-</li> <li>Experience with architecting, deploying and troubleshooting multi-vendor security environments including:</li> </ul>  o Firewalls (Cisco, Juniper, CheckPoint, Palo Alto); <br/> o IDS/P technologies (Tippingpoint, McAfee, Cisco, Juniper); <br/> o IPSec and SSL VPNs (Juniper, Cisco, Nortel); <br/> o SIEM tools (RSA Envision, ArcSight, Intellitactics); <br/> o Remote Authentication (TACACS+, RSA SecurID, CryptoCard); <br/> o Content Filtering (Websense, Crossbeam, Cisco IronPort).   <ul> <li>Troubleshooting of LAN/WAN multi-vendor environments including inter-networking technologies (including Cisco, Juniper and Nortel), IP applications and protocols (including HTTP/S, POP, SMTP, FTP, TELNET, SSH, NNTP, LDAP, SNMP), and telecommunications facilities (Frame Relay, Ethernet)</li> <li>Experience with Unix and Unix-like operating environments (including Solaris, HPUX, AIX, Linux, and *BSD)</li> </ul>  / Les principales responsabilités du titulaire de ce poste sont de développer des programmes de sécurité, de fournir de lexpertise et du soutien de haut niveau léquipe de sécurité opérationnelle et de participer des groupes de travail internes et externes. <br/> Le titulaire de ce poste de haut niveau a besoin de connaissances techniques exceptionnelles, de leadership et de compétences en matière dinterfaces client. Dans le cadre de ses activités quotidiennes, il collabore avec le client, conçoit et met en œuvre des solutions de sécurité harmonisées avec les stratégies de technologie et daffaires du client et offre du soutien légard de ces solutions. <br/><br/> <strong>RESPONSABILITÉS</strong>    <ul> <li>Utiliser des outils et des méthodologies danalyse de la sécurité pour décrire, documenter et atténuer efficacement les menaces de sécurité pour les clients de client.</li> <li>Actualiser ses connaissances de façon maintenir une compréhension poussée des vulnérabilités et des risques de sécurité des TI actuels.</li> <li>Soutenir les gestionnaires de projet et les gestionnaires du changement dans la planification et la conception daméliorations de service liées la sécurité.</li> <li>Agir titre dexpert pour ce qui est des principes darchitecture de sécurité et de conception et posséder une connaissance rigoureuse des normes et des méthodes en matière de sécurité.</li> <li>Être responsable de la documentation et de la formation croisée nécessaires pour assurer un lancement transparent des nouvelles technologies et des changements de sécurité dans les limites des modèles opérationnels actuels.</li> <li>Préparer des ébauches pour les changements apporter aux procédures et aux politiques de sécurité des TI en vigueur ou pour les nouvelles procédures et politiques.</li> <li>Travailler en étroite collaboration avec dautres équipes opérationnelles, y compris lexploitation de réseau, la gestion des abus et les points de contact opérationnels externes.</li> </ul>  <strong>EXIGENCES</strong>    <ul> <li>Minimum de sept ans dexpérience de travail en sécurité</li> <li>Connaissance approfondie des réseaux TI, des centres de données, des protocoles Internet, des transferts de fichiers et des pourriels.</li> <li>Expertise en méthodologies, normes et meilleures pratiques en sécurité (c.- -d., ITIL, ISO 17799/BS7799, et autres pratiques liées la sécurité, un atout)</li> <li>Expertise dans un large éventail de sous-disciplines du domaine de la sécurité</li> <li>Expérience en architecture, en déploiement et en dépannage denvironnements de sécurité multifournisseurs, notamment :</li> </ul>  o Pare-feux (Cisco, Juniper, CheckPoint, Palo Alto) <br/> o Technologies IDS/IDP (Tippingpoint, McAfee, Cisco, Juniper) <br/> o RPV IPSec et SSL (Juniper, Cisco, Nortel) <br/> o Outils de système de gestion de linformation et des événements de sécurité (SIEM) (RSA enVision, ArcSight, Intellitactics) <br/> o Authentification distance (TACACS+, RSA SecurID, CryptoCard) <br/> o Filtrage du contenu (Websense, Crossbeam, Cisco IronPort)   <ul> <li>Dépannage denvironnements de réseau local/étendu multifournisseurs, y compris les technologies dinterconnexion de réseaux (notamment Cisco, Juniper et Nortel), les applications et les protocoles IP (notamment HTTP/S, POP, SMTP, FTP, TELNET, SSH, NNTP, LDAP, SNMP) et les installations de télécommunications (relais de trames, Ethernet)</li> </ul>  Expérience des environnements dexploitation Unix ou de type Unix (notamment Solaris, HPUX, AIX, Linux et *BSD) <br/><br/> <strong>Top 3 must have skills:</strong>   <ul> <li>Cisco, Juniper, Palo Alto firewall design / deployment experience</li> <li>Cisco ISE design and Deployment experience</li> <li>Networking knowledge and understanding</li> </ul>  <strong>Top 3 nice to have skills:</strong>    <ul> <li>Good communication</li> <li>Other security technologies and automation platforms like Ansible</li> <li>Ability to manage multiple priorities at one time</li> </ul>
Title: IT Security Consultant 3 / Conseiller en sécurité des TI 3

Job_Description: <p>The ROT Senior Architect Analyst is responsible for ensuring that ROT funded projects deliver enterprise suitable solutions, optimizing potential savings and reducing risk. The ROT Senior Architect Analyst will assist with the creation of business cases by identifying and documenting the business needs of stakeholders and assisting with the complicated task of estimating the costs and savings early in the project development process. By ensuring that the proposed solutions will meet the enterprise needs and not just the needs of a single group, the ROT Senior Architect Analyst optimizes the return on investment of the ROT funds. </p><p><br></p><p>Starting with eliciting, analyzing, validating and documenting business, organizational and/or operational requirements, they develop the data needed to develop the optimum IT solution. The ROT Senior Architect Analyst will also contribute to the solution development, and the data that builds the business case – estimating both costs and savings. Lastly, the ROT Senior Architect Analyst will assist with the measurement of the actual savings achieved to ensure that the ROT program financial savings estimates are being met, and that the program has accurate data to support the reporting function.</p><p> </p><p>Must be comfortable working with very large enterprise technology solutions across a wide variety of technical domains, and taking abstract, fluid solution ideas and turning them into concrete designs.</p><p>Must have outstanding interpersonal skills and deep technical fluency to allow them to complete complex tasks, to work independently with minimal coaching, and demonstrate leadership skills. </p><p> </p><p><b>What you’ll do</b></p><p> </p><p>The ROT Senior Architect Analyst will use their extensive experience coupled with formal architecture and analysis techniques and their own creativity to support the ROT program delivery. This role is primarily focused on collaborating with the 90 solution architects in the enterprise, and the senior leaders and other stakeholders to ensure that all decision making is supported with data and facts. The role has a secondary focus on supporting the program and project manager(s) as required, particularly in understanding risk and impact.</p><p><br></p><p></p><ul><li>Elicit Requirements: Anticipates, quantifies and resolves problems and issues through requirements. Done by the identification of source requirements, risk management, and development of a priority matrix. Must be capable and confident to lead requirements gathering workshops and JAM sessions</li><li>Create Requirements<u>:</u> Document: Publishes, distributes, and ensures sign-off of the business requirements. Performs impact analysis on requested changes to requirements. Assists with risk management and can use specific tools such as priority matrices, and / or formal reviews with clients</li><li>Structured Analysis: Analyzes and determines problems, opportunities, and solution resolutions. Can identify and document "as-is" state vs. "to-be" state using a variety of tools and techniques based on the project and its complexity plus facilitation of interviews to help develop a consensus about the requirements</li><li>Business Case Development: Works with ROT stakeholders to develop the business case, including solution design, estimate costs, efforts and savings. Uses a variety of tools and techniques based on the need at hand, and is able to craft solutions that are suitable for enterprise use and account for the various different needs and demands of the various SBUs and functional units across the corporation.</li><li>Change Agency: Understands process and issues inherent in change management and plans and advises the program accordingly; instills confidence and trust in others; coordinates resources across departments/units; evaluates measures, works with delivery teams to develop specific change mgmt plans and deliverables for alignment and smooth implementation; acknowledges individual’s responses to change and helps them adjust</li><li>Monitoring: Monitors changing requirements and architectural responses to problems. Uses tools such as a user acceptance strategy to ensure that all business scenarios have been validated and business requirements and their integrity are maintained throughout the execution of the project.</li><li>Results Analysis and Internal Audit: Upon project conclusion, the Senior Architect Analyst with assist the PMO in performing the internal audit to ensure that the predicted benefits (financial) have been achieved.</li><li>Business / IT Fluency: Understands the societal impact of information and information technology in the business environment. Has a deep understanding of technology and solution architecture.</li><li>Business Process Analysis: Recommends improvements to business processes. Done by ensuring business goals are met by considering all tangible and intangible costs.</li><li>Build Business Relationships: Understand the business issues and challenges of the organization and industry. Done by working closely with Business and IT to ensure a strategic partnership between Business needs and Technology solutions.</li></ul><p></p><p><b>What you’ve done</b><b> </b></p><p></p><ul><li>10 years experience in a relevant industry vertical. (Retail, Wholesale Distribution, CPG, etc.)</li><li>5 years experience in Business Analysis practice</li><li>Proven proficiency / mastery of junior and intermediate Business Analyst competencies</li><li>Experience with package (COTS) customization and deployment</li><li>Experience with Product Lifecycle, Sales Order, Retail, Supply Chain, Finance, and/or Human Capital management systems is an asset</li><li>Experience in Solution Design and Architecture is an asset</li><li>Experience with ITIL Framework and IT Service Management (ITSM) is an asset</li><li>Knowledge of both traditional waterfall and Agile project methodologies is an asset.</li><li>Experience and knowledge of solution architecture is an asset.</li></ul><p></p><p><b>Who you are</b></p><p> </p><p>Communication: Ability to formulate concepts; communication of technical information to a non-technical audience; communication of business information to a technical audience.</p><p> </p><p>Leadership: as a change agent, ability to develop and communicate change management strategies to technical and non-technical staff alike.</p><p> </p><p>Business: Knowledge of business processes; ability to have a business-oriented vision; case development; business writing; modeling techniques.</p><p> </p><p>Analytical: analytical and conceptual expertise; documentation, analysis and business requirements management techniques; object-oriented analysis; evaluation of profitability/risk; testing, verification and validation techniques.</p><p></p><ul><li>Thinking (Analytical, Systemic, Creative): Identifies and integrates the critical elements of a situation, making correct inferences from data; breaks complex problems into component parts and organizes the parts in a systematic way; uses innovation to develop novel solutions; explains to others how to understand / approach complicated problems.</li><li>Professional Knowledge: Continually enhances knowledge and skills to keep abreast of industry changes, developments and emerging issues; understands what it takes to be successful in this business; has a thorough knowledge of organization’s mission, history, stakeholders and customers.</li><li>Builds Trust and Credibility by consistently adhering to the organization’s business principles and values. Is seen as direct, truthful, and trustworthy by co-workers, vendors, and customers.</li><li>Committed to results by taking personal responsibility for achieving mutually agreed upon individual/team objectives.</li><li>Demonstrates a desire to help and serve internal/external customers to meet their needs. Is proactive, responsive, and focused on discovering, anticipating, and exceeding the customer’s needs.</li><li>Works collaboratively and cooperatively with others to achieve shared goals and objectives. Considers the wider team, function, banner or the organization and takes action or makes decisions which support the success of those groups.</li><li>Recovers quickly after change, disruptions, or mistakes and can remain productive and focused. Is adaptable and can apply lessons learned in one situation to another situation.</li></ul><p></p><p> Academic / Educational requirements</p><p> </p><ul><li>University degree or equivalent experience in Computer Science or related discipline.</li><li>Business Analysis Certification from an accredited source is an asset (CBAP® , CCBATM)</li></ul>
Title: Senior Analyst, Architecture - FGL Sports

Job_Description: Reporting to the Logistics Manager, The Logistics Support Analyst– LPGs works closely with the entire LPG Logistics team to support the daily activities. The‘Analyst’ will also be responsible for updating internal systems with transactions and accruals and will ensure Revenue and Costs flow through to settlement. The successful candidate will be comfortable in a fast-paced, team-oriented environment and will possess the ability to prioritize and execute with minimal supervision. <br/><br/> <strong>Key Responsibilities:</strong> <ul> <li>Enter bill of ladings (BOL’s); system entry, distribution and record maintenance as required;</li><li>Validate and approve incoming invoices for all logistics costs, detention, demurrage and freight for transloading and storage;</li><li>May work with vendors to ensure accurate invoicing and ensure discrepancies are dealt with;</li><li>Enter recoverable costs, demurrage, detention, equipment repairs and maintenance into systems;</li><li>Work with and assist internal Logistics, Operations, Accounting and Credit groups</li><li>Assist Logistics Coordinators with problem invoices, investigations and accruals for all transactions</li><li>Assist in ad hoc reporting and analytical requests</li><li>Assist Logistics LPG Managers with Project requirements, including but not limited to retrieving data and analytical functions</li><li>Any other ad hoc duties</li> </ul> <strong>Qualifications& Skills:</strong> <br/><br/> • Post-secondary education or equivalent experience;1-2 years’ experience in business; <br/><br/> • High attention to detail with the ability to prioritize tasks in order to meet deadlines; <br/><br/> • Strong ability to take initiative and be proactive when resolving issues; <br/><br/> • Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to communicate within all levels of an organization; <br/><br/> • Flexibility to adjust to changing demands, responsibilities and issues; <br/><br/> • Strong computer skills required (with especially strong Excel skills); <br/><br/> • Allegro or Geometrics experience would be an asset; <br/><br/> • Willing to learn, comfortable in an ever-changing environment; <br/><br/> • Ability to analyze both successes and failures with a desire to constantly improve; <br/><br/> • Proactively work with multiple internal stakeholders <br/><br/> <em>This is an opportunity for a professional, ambitious and enthusiastic team player looking for a career with a fast-paced and growth oriented company. If you are up to the challenge and want to work with a dynamic and fun team, we want to hear from you!</em> <br/><br/> <em>We would like to thank all candidates in advance for their interest, however only those being considered will be contacted.</em> <br/><br/> <em>Our preferred method of application is online at</em><em>www.parkland.ca</em> <br/><br/> <em>Parkland Fuel Corporation is committed to the principles of Employment Equity.</em> <br/><br/> <em>We strive to provide accessibility in employment to ensure equal access to employment opportunities for candidates, including persons with disabilities. Parkland Fuel Corporation will endeavor to provide accommodation to persons with disabilities in the recruitment process upon request. If you are selected for an interview and you require accommodation due to a disability, please notify us upon scheduling your interview.</em>
Title: Logistics Support Analyst

Job_Description: Job Description<div><strong>Resource Energy Solutions</strong> has an exciting opportunity available for an enthusiastic team player with a proven track record of selling software in the oil and gas sector. <br/><br/> The successful candidate knows how to navigate the inner workings of clients and develop relationships with drilling and completions managers, IT managers/directors or BA’s, and finance people. The incumbent is an experienced and highly motivated individual who will be working in conjunction with the sales team and be able to execute sales strategy and tactics autonomously. <br/><br/> <strong>Primary Responsibilities:</strong> <ul> <li>Drive and achieve specific sales goals by managing the relationships with assigned and new accounts.</li><li>Network and develop new clients. Some travel will be required to key business centers throughout the country.</li><li>Ensure client satisfaction through effective expectation management during the sales process and a smooth sales-to-support transition for implementation.</li><li>Build a robust and qualified pipeline for short, mid and long term client capture.</li><li>Complete client needs analysis, identifying pressure points for all accounts, provide proposals, product demonstrations and presentations to close sales.</li><li>Must be able to successfully sell over the phone as well as in person and thrive in a rapidly growing environment with high expectations for sales growth.</li><li>Successful candidates will exhibit an ability to deliver sales results quickly.</li> </ul> <strong>Requirements:</strong> <ul> <li>3 years+ software applications and solutions sales experience.</li><li>Experience selling into the oil and gas sector, preferably drilling and completions.</li><li>A successful history of meeting sales goals and project goals.</li><li>Proficient in most computer applications, CRM knowledge an asset.</li><li>Strong team and collaborative skills and an ability to utilize inside support groups effectively.</li><li>Ability to effectively manage time and prioritize daily activities.</li><li>A natural ability and willingness to listen to the clients’ needs with a ‘can-do’ attitude.</li><li>Must be fluent in English (oral and written).</li><li>Travel will be required and at times with limited notice.</li><li>Understanding of the "Challenger Sales" approach would be considered an asset.</li> </ul> <strong>Rewards:</strong> <ul> <li>Base salary of $55,000 - $70,000 annually, plus a generous commission structure up to an extra $30,000 annually.</li><li>Full time employment.</li></ul></div> <br/> Company Description<div>Resource Energy Solutions is a global software company and service provider. Since 1995, RES has supplied world-class, leading-edge, project and cost management software solutions to the oil and gas and industry. <br/><br/> To this day, RES continues to lead in innovation and advanced client solutions within the oil and gas sector. Ongoing collaboration with industry associations and technology experts facilitates RES’ ability to bring new, exciting products to market in record time. In addition to its current product line, RES is focused on enhancing its complementary service offering and expanding its current client base.</div>
Title: Sales Consultant

Job_Description: The Senior Network Support Analyst is a key technical resource responsible for managing and supporting KPMG’s network infrastructure, reporting to the Manager of Network Infrastructure. This person will be responsible for implementing, managing and supporting our local and wide area networks along with the tools that provide proactive monitoring, analysis and reporting on KPMG’s networks. This person is a member of a nation-wide team of technical support staff focused on ongoing support and new deployments of KPMG’s IT infrastructure. There are no people management responsibilities. <br/><br/> <STRONG>Role and Responsibilities:</STRONG> <ul> <LI>Support and manage KPMG’s local and wide area network infrastructure, with a focus on proactive improvement of network health – solving issues before they become problems</LI><LI>Support, administration and configuration of corporate firewalls, including Palo Alto and Cisco platforms</LI><LI>Support, administration and configuration of corporate load balancers</LI><LI>Support, administration and configuration, of network monitoring and analysis tools including Cisco NAM/AVC, Cisco Prime Infrastructure, NetQOS Reporter Analyzer, NetVoyant, Bluecoat Reporter and others</LI><LI>Apply the suite of network management tools to new or evolving services, such as voice and video, Skype for Business and video conferencing to create reports for analysis, identifying trends and make recommendations.</LI><LI>Work closely with Operations, Support and Architecture team members to implement proactive approaches to monitoring and reporting on network services that maximize uptime, reliability and visibility</LI><LI>Document operational processes and troubleshooting guides for Network Support and Operations staff</LI><LI>Monitor and measure performance with regards to Service Level Agreements and KPI’s.</LI><LI>Monitor and resolve incident and problem tickets as they relate to network issues.</LI><LI>Manage multiple concurrent projects and ensure implementation of network services and monitoring solutions to meet ITS and business requirements.</LI><LI>Perform application updates, security patches and configuration changes on network hardware, services and management tools.</LI><LI>Work with Cisco and other vendors to resolve network issues in the environment.</LI><LI>Support and train Network Support and Operations resources.</LI><LI>Provide rotational on-call support outside of regular business hours</LI> </ul> At times, business needs arise and employees are required and agree to work beyond their normal work day or work week to fulfill the accountabilities required for their job. Likewise, people need extra time to devote to personal matters, and our approach to flexibility provides for this. <br/><br/> <STRONG>Skills and Qualifications:</STRONG> <ul> <LI>College Diploma or University Degree in the field of computer science and/or 5 years equivalent work experience</LI><LI>Minimum 3 years of experience supporting routing and switching in a complex Cisco based network environment that includes voice, video and data. Experience with Skype for Business is preferred</LI><LI>Minimum of 2 years of experience of Palo Alto Firewall administration</LI><LI>Minimum of 2 years of experience of Load Balancer administration, Netscaler SDX/MPX preferred</LI><LI>Cisco CCNA or CCNP would be an asset</LI><LI>Working knowledge of QoS concepts and configuration</LI><LI>Extensive experience in using network monitoring & management tools, including Cisco Prime Infrastructure, NAM and AVC, for troubleshooting and proactive analysis</LI><LI>Ability to review network flows and metrics proactively to determine potential trouble spots in the network before they lead to business impact</LI><LI>Working knowledge of TCP/IP and network routing protocols</LI><LI>Understanding of Netflow and SNMP protocols</LI><LI>Strong interpersonal and oral communication skills; comfortable working in an environment that deals with various levels of management</LI><LI>Highly self-motivated and directed and keen attention to detail</LI><LI>Proven analytical and problem-solving abilities.</LI><LI>Ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks in a high-pressure environment.</LI><LI>Strong customer service orientation.</LI> </ul> <STRONG>Why Choose KPMG?</STRONG> Making the right career choice is important, finding the right company is essential. Watch this video to see the type of people that thrive at KPMG. #LI-JY1
Title: Senior Network Analyst

5 years of experience in business application implementation and support</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Core technical skills should include SQL abilities and a good working knowledge of web application architecture</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Exposure to a wide range of technologies including a solid knowledge of databases, web applications, operating platforms, networking and systems integration</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Ability to work independently and as a part of a team and manage multiple tasks in an ever-changing environment</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Able to work with different client types to understand their needs, identify root causes of problems, and work to resolution</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Ability to develop rapport with various client groups and personalities and maintain strong working relationships</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Experience with ERP-level systems and processes</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Experience with SSRS reporting</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Some travel may be required, including to the United States</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Work is expected to be completed at the client’s office in downtown Calgary</DIV></LI></UL>
Title: Systems Analyst - 1 Year Limited Term Contract

Job_Description: <DIV>One of Husky’s advantages is that we are an integrated oil and gas company. From exploration to development, production, refining and marketing, we’ve got it all! Combine this with a range of learning and development tools and an inclusive work environment, and you are well-positioned for a successful career at Husky. </DIV> <DIV> </DIV> <DIV>We have training, mentoring and career development programs and resources to help you develop both personally and professionally – as an employee or a leader. We offer many internal leadership and business skills courses along with tuition reimbursement programs for qualified employees. Every year, a significant number of our employees are able to take on new roles within the company thanks to our strong focus on hands-on learning and development.</DIV> <DIV> </DIV> <DIV>We are looking for an experienced <B>HR Advisor, Workforce Planning</B> & <B>Analytics </B>to join our Human Resources team in our Calgary office. Reporting to the Manager, Workforce Planning & Analytics, you will be responsible supporting the ongoing development and implementation of the Workforce Planning and Analytics model across Husky. This will include the delivery of programs and processes that assists leaders to understand the talent implications of their business strategy, understand what roles are key to delivering that strategy and collecting data and analytics about the current supply of talent and future talent needs. </DIV> <DIV> </DIV> <DIV><B>Specific responsibilities will include:</B></DIV> <UL> <LI>Working with the Workforce Planning & Analytics COE to support the continued development, enhancement, implementation and delivery of the organization wide operational & strategic Workforce Planning and Analytics model and associated processes </LI> <LI>Working collaboratively with HR team members and other key stakeholders to identify and develop meaningful workforce metrics and analytics to support related decision making processes</LI> <LI>Providing advice and support for the workforce planning program cycles and associated processes</LI> <LI>Identifying and analyzing workforce data, analytics, and trends that are needed to determine the type, amount, and skill level of both the internal and external supply of talent and the competitive forces impacting the labour market</LI> <LI>Leveraging both quantitative and qualitative measures of the workforce for both current and future-state perspectives</LI> <LI>Providing support for scenario planning, forecasting, and future state modeling of workforce analytics</LI> <LI>Supporting regular and adhoc workforce reporting requirements</LI></UL> <DIV><B>Our ideal candidate will have the following qualifications:</B></DIV> <UL> <LI>7 years of concentrated experience in the areas of Workforce Planning, Reporting and HR Analytics </LI> <LI>An undergraduate degree in Human Resources, Business Administration or related area of study with emphasis in the business planning and/or data analytics field</LI> <LI>Advanced research and data analysis skills and a demonstrated ability to draw associated insights and make effective recommendations</LI> <LI>Experienced in the use of SAP HCM and SuccessFactors modules (or similar HRIS applications) and advanced working knowledge of Microsoft Office - especially Excel and PowerPoint. Working knowledge of other analytics tools / software would be an asset</LI> <LI>Experience working on and/or leading projects with strong consulting skills and the ability to influence from a non-authoritative position</LI> <LI> <DIV>Progressive and forward thinking with the demonstrated ability to develop clear and concise recommendations and to influence from a non-authoritative position</DIV></LI> <LI>Ability to successfully navigate a fast-paced, complex and changing work environment, while managing multiple and shifting priorities</LI> <LI>Proven communication, visualization and presentation skills</LI> <LI>Strong ability to collaborate with others in order to achieve the best results and deliver the most value</LI></UL> <DIV><B> </B></DIV> <DIV><B>At Husky, we respect diversity and embrace an inclusive culture. We value uniqueness and different perspectives as they play a critical role in our success. To achieve this, individuals are selected based on qualifications, merit, and abilities and we encourage applications from everyone including visible minorities, Aboriginal people, women, and persons with disabilities.</B></DIV> <DIV> </DIV> <DIV>Husky Energy is an integrated Canadian energy company. It is headquartered in Calgary, Alberta, and is publicly traded on the Toronto Stock Exchange under the symbol HSE. The Company operates Upstream and Downstream business segments, with operations in Canada, the United States, China and Indonesia. </DIV> <DIV> </DIV> <DIV>Husky's balanced growth strategy focuses on consistent execution, disciplined financial management and safe and reliable operations.</DIV> <DIV> </DIV> <DIV>#LIPost</DIV>
Title: HR Analyst, Workforce Planning & Analytics

Job_Description: <div>Capital Markets Analyst - Gibson Energy ULC <br/> <strong>Location:</strong> Calgary Head Office <br/> <strong>Job status:</strong> Permanent Full time <br/> <strong>Business Unit:</strong> Finance & Administration <br/><br/> <strong>PRIMARY PURPOSE OF JOB:</strong>  <ul>  	<li>Support a broad suite of functions within the Finance group, including Corporate Planning, Corporate Development, Treasury, and Investor Relations as part of a cross-functional analyst pool</li> <li>Perform detailed financial modelling and analysis, including economic evaluations and projections</li> <li>Prepare internal and external presentations and other supporting materials</li> <li>Research, track and analyze key capital markets, industry and business metrics, as well as industry competitors and business opportunities in both Canada and the U.S.</li> </ul> <strong>ACCOUNTABILITIES:</strong>  <ul>  	<li>Develop, maintain and improve the financial models and databases required to support various finance initiatives including forecasts for the existing business, evaluation of M&A&D opportunities and new projects, and analysis of financing needs and opportunities</li> <li>Assist in the development and review of the Business Unit and Corporate Strategic Plans as part of the planning and budgeting cycle;</li> <li>Prepare materials as part of the quarterly reporting cycle including various board materials, planning and forecasting updates, and development of investor relations materials</li> <li>Support larger scale initiatives, such as Investor Day and presentations to Rating Agencies</li> <li>Provide other analysis and support, as required</li> <li>Demonstrates a personal commitment and proactive approach to Environment, Health & Safety (EH&S) through participation in all applicable EH&S programs and ensures safe operation of the branch, team or unit and compliance with all Company EH&S policies and procedures</li> </ul> <strong>KEY SKILLS:</strong>  <ul>  	<li>Exceptional level of motivation and ability to work hard, with a focus on quality of work and attention to detail</li> <li>Superior verbal and written communication skills, including experience in a role with regular internal/external communication accountability</li> <li>Strong teamwork skills that are complimented with the ability to work autonomously on projects and initiatives</li> </ul> <strong>QUALIFICATIONS:</strong>  <ul>  	<li>Outstanding financial modelling and economic evaluation skills; experience with PowerPoint</li> <li>Minimum of 2 to 5 years of experience in financial analysis, corporate finance or planning roles</li> <li>Experience in Investment Banking, Sell-side Research, Buy-side or Corporate Planning exposure is considered a strong asset</li> <li>Previous midstream, infrastructure or oil & gas experience would be considered an asset</li> <li>CFA, CBV, and / or CA designation(s) would be preferred, but is not required</li> </ul> Please note: all employment offers are contingent upon completion of satisfactory background check, which, depending upon the position and function you are applying for, may include the following: criminal background check, employment references, employment verification, credit inquiry check and education/credential verification.</div> <br/>
Title: Capital Markets Analyst

Job_Description: Company Description<div><p>ShoreWise Consulting is a world class IT solution provider offering technology solutions and managed services in verticals such as Customer Contact, Healthcare and Finance (banking & trading).</p></div>Job Description<div><p><b>US Opportunity – for Canadian Citizens only</b></p><p>Our client based in the United States is looking for a Security Analyst. Responsibilities include. </p><p>Monitors network resources for security events, new or emerging threats and provides findings to Security Advisor</p><p>Maintains the integrity of the boundary between Region of Peel IT environment and the internet</p><p>Implements and maintains protection of network resources with malicious software prevention, detection and correction</p><p>Participates in developing IT-related security and privilege management policies</p><p>Reviews IT plans and designs for compliance with relevant privilege management policies and standards</p><p>Participates in the implementation of security, identity and privilege management business processes and tools</p><p>Participates in security assessments such as threat risk, vulnerability and business impact</p><p>Works in partnership with project teams to provide advice and guidance on security related matters</p><p>Researches and recommends enhancements to security awareness program and recommends improvements to existing security policies, processes and procedures based on changes to legislation, products, services, introductions, innovations etc.</p><p> Skills/attributes</p><p>Experience in administrating enterprise access privileges or in technology infrastructure, or an equivalent combination of education and experience</p><p>Proficient with security/authority systems (e.g. End Point Protection, Microsoft Active Directory, Microsoft Exchange, Blackberry, VPN, Two Factor Authentication, DNS, DMZ, IPS/IDS, Firewalls, email and web content filtering etc.)</p><p>Knowledge of operating system security for Windows, Linux and other operating systems</p><p>Knowledge of new and emerging security threats</p><p>Understanding of security principles and architectures, security risks assessment methods, and security monitoring methods and tools for assessing the effectiveness of security measures</p><p>Knowledge of technologies and technology-based solutions dealing with information security issues</p><p>Aware of best practices in Information Technology service delivery such as SDLC, PMBOK, COBIT and ITIL</p><p>Ability to understand customer needs and expectations to provide excellent service</p><p>Ability to effectively transmit, receive and accurately interpret ideas, information and needs</p><p>Strong problem solving and troubleshooting skills</p><p>Ability to work independently or as part of a team</p><p>Able to travel to various regional locations</p><p><br></p><p>Education and Experience</p><p>The applicant must have one of the below requirements to be considered for this role</p><p>Canadian/US University degree or Community College credentials with 2+ years of proven related experience, OR</p><p>Diploma Information Technology (approved Canadian Private Career College) or similar and 3+ years of proven related experience, OR</p><p>Bachelor’s degree in Information Technology or similar and 5+ years of proven related experience </p><p>Interested candidates who meet the above criteria and are willing to relocate to the United States, may send your resume along with an indication on best times to be reached.</p></div>Additional Information<div><p>The applicant must have one of the below requirements to be considered for this role<br><br>· Canadian/US University degree or Community College credentials with 2+ years of proven IT experience, OR<br>· Diploma Information Technology (approved Canadian Private Career College) or similar and 3+ years of proven IT experience, OR<br>· Bachelor’s degree in Information Technology or similar and 5+ years of proven IT experience<br><br>Interested candidates who meet the above criteria and are willing to relocate to the United States, are encouraged to apply.<br></p></div>I'm interested
Title: Security Analyst

Job_Description: <div>Senior Credit Analyst - Gibson Energy ULC <br/> <strong>Location:</strong> Calgary Head Office <br/> <strong>Job status:</strong> Permanent Full time <br/> <strong>Business Unit:</strong> Finance & Administration <br/><br/> <strong>PRIMARY PURPOSE OF JOB:</strong> <br/><br/> The Credit Analyst is responsible for reviewing and assessing counterparty credit, proposing credit limits for customers, monitoring credit exposures, providing accurate and timely credit reporting for internal business units and insurance providers and ensuring the Credit Policy is being followed. <br/><br/> <strong>ACCOUNTABILITIES:</strong>  <ul>  	<li>Maintain a portfolio of counterparties and monitor credit quality on an on-going basis</li> <li>Complete credit reviews for counterparties and recommend credit limits in line with the credit policy in a timely manner</li> <li>Monitor counterparty credit and take action on high risk customers in a timely manner</li> <li>Collect, research and analyze financial and market data from external credit agencies reports and articles from the financial press, internet and other relevant sources to identify high risk credit issues</li> <li>Coordinate the preparation of legal documentation including confidentiality agreements, parental guarantees and netting agreements with internal and external stakeholders (e.g. internal counsel, the business unit and the counterparty)</li> <li>Liaise with traders/business units and managers on credit matters</li> <li>Support the preparation of credit reporting deliverables for management on an ongoing basis, including Credit Committee presentations and audit committee materials</li> <li>Work with external lenders to prepare letters of credit requests and coordinate with external lenders and customers</li> <li>Make recommendations and coordinate credit inbound requests to Gibson from our customers (e.g. review request, provide information and coordinate providing financial assurance as required)</li> <li>Provide cash management support for the Treasury team as needed, including providing vacation back up coverage for primary analyst</li> <li>Proactively identify trends or patterns in information, draw conclusions and make recommendations based on implications of data</li> <li>Demonstrate a commitment to continual improvement including identifying opportunities to enhance processes and create efficiencies</li> <li>Provides advice and guidance to colleagues when required</li> <li>Support other activities across the treasury and capital markets finance functions on an ad hoc basis, as required (e.g. Treasury, Corporate Finance)</li> <li>Demonstrate a personal commitment and proactive approach to Health, Safety, Security & Environment (HSS&E) through participation in all applicable HSS&E programs and ensure safe operation of the branch, team or unit and compliance with all Company HSS&E policies and procedures</li> </ul> <strong>KEY SKILLS:</strong>  <ul>  	<li>Complete all required reporting accurately and timely</li> <li>Strong quantitative skills focused on financial analysis, accounting and financial theory</li> <li>Strong written and verbal communication skills</li> <li>Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously while maintaining a high standard of work</li> <li>Ability to excel under pressure amid demanding deadlines</li> <li>Ability to perform effectively in a team environment</li> <li>Demonstrated ability to quickly adapt to new situations</li> </ul> <strong>QUALIFICATIONS:</strong>  <ul>  	<li>Three to six years of relevant, full time work experience in credit, treasury and/or capital market</li> <li>Undergraduate degree in Business Administration or Commerce with a finance focus</li> <li>Treasury, credit or corporate finance experience is considered an asset</li> <li>Strong financial/analytical skills, excellent communication abilities</li> <li>Possess exceptional proficiency with MS Office, particularly Excel and PowerPoint</li> </ul> Please note: all employment offers are contingent upon completion of satisfactory background check, which, depending upon the position and function you are applying for, may include the following: criminal background check, employment references, employment verification, credit inquiry check and education/credential verification.</div> <br/>
Title: Senior Credit Analyst

Job_Description: <div><strong>Job Type:</strong> Permanent <br/> <strong>Primary Location:</strong> Calgary, Alberta, Canada <br/> <strong>All Available Locations:</strong> Calgary; Toronto <br/><br/> <u><strong>Position Overview:</strong></u> <br/><br/> Our internal Finance team is looking for a highly motivated, strategically minded and dynamic individual to support our Financial Advisory Practice. <br/><br/> Reporting to the Senior Finance Manager, FABS, this role will support the development of strategic insights, profitability analyses, and standardized view of business cases and consolidated financial reporting for our Financial Advisory practice in Western Canada. <br/><br/> <u><strong>Key responsibilities include but are not limited to:</strong></u> <ul> <li>Leverage a strong knowledge of the Firm’s financial model, systems and processes to act as a point of reference for leaders, practitioners and finance colleagues</li><li>Work closely with the leadership team, Talent Advisors, Resource Management and Learning groups to assist in developing long term and annual financial plans, forecasts and short-term financial outlooks using a range of predictive tools</li><li>Provide analyses to support weekly and periodic overviews of financial and operating performance</li><li>Assist Financial Advisory Leadership in managing investment levels by monitoring work-in-progress and accounts receivable, ensuring that each is appropriately valued and taking the necessary actions to ensure that aging WIP or AR are deal with.</li><li>Propose appropriate course of action based on areas of concern or opportunities for improvement</li><li>Measure and report on strategic initiatives aligned to our business and financial plans</li><li>Provide support to ensure the appropriate accounting entries are recorded at the end of each period and year end with respect to accruals, reserves and prepaid expenses</li><li>Manage a robust process that is able to proactively provide value add reports and profitability analyses that influence the decision making process of the Financial Advisory practice</li><li>Prepare and present insights based on analyses, key metrics trending and quantified risks and opportunities</li><li>Have sound understanding of the business model, across all Service Lines</li><li>Proactively assess and address needs of the Business Leaders</li><li>Participate as a Subject Matter Expert (SME) in firm wide Finance & Operations initiatives, fostering integration and collaboration across regions and services</li> </ul> <u><strong>Qualifications:</strong></u> <ul> <li>Exceptional ability to build strong working relationships and be viewed as a valued business advisor</li><li>Strong business and finance acumen and demonstrated ability to draw insights from information and convey complex information in a straightforward manner</li><li>Client-focused, proactive and results-oriented</li> <li>Degree in business /commerce or MBA including relevant professional designation (CPA or CMA) or current enrollment in a professional designation program</li><li>3-5 years of progressive experience in a finance role in a fast paced, demanding environment as a valued business advisor</li><li>Proficiency in Microsoft Suite of Office Products (i.e. Word, Excel, PowerPoint), SAP and Cognos reporting tools</li><li>Strong interpersonal skills, logical and efficient, with keen attention to detail</li><li>Proven ability to work independently and in a team environment</li><li>Strong organizational skills and a demonstrated ability to prioritize work in a demanding environment</li><li>Excellent oral and written communication skills</li> </ul> <strong>Why Deloitte?</strong> <br/><br/> Launch your career with Job_Description: <strong>Position Summary</strong><br/> <div> <div> <div> <div>As a member of the Calgary Homes team, the Interior Design Consultant is responsible to provide homeowners with an exceptional customer experience by assisting them with their Interior Selections from our Selections Centers. The Interior Design Consultant provides support for our Style Collection Palettes and continuous improvement of the overall homeowner experience. <br/><br/> The role will report to the Studio Manager and will ensure our homeowners expectations are met and reflected in clear concise documentation in a timely manner with an attention to detail and ultimately the customers satisfaction. <br/><br/> <strong>Areas of Responsibility</strong></div> </div> </div> </div>   <ul> <li>Develop strong knowledge base in current interior design trends and customer needs</li> <li>Provide collaborative suggestions to enhance and update product offering</li> <li>Maintain schedules and appointments for homeowner selections</li> <li>Support in planning and maintenance of product samples with Style Collections</li> <li>Represent the Brookfield Residential brand and culture in a positive manner at all times</li> <li>Liason with Estimating for accuracy and timing of pricing requests</li> <li>Attend product knowledge sessions with our Trade Partners</li> <li>Book all homeowner selection meetings in coordination with sales in a timely manner to maintain construction timelines</li> <li>Ensure all homeowner Interior Selections are documented clearly</li> <li>Ensure all upgraded product is documented on a change order with applicable cost</li> </ul> <strong>Qualifications</strong>  <ul> <li>Minimum 2 years experience in residential construction</li> <li>Post-secondary education; specifically an Interior Design Degree/Diploma will be considered an asset</li> <li>Product knowledge in latest design trends is an asset</li> <li>Strong Computer/Microsoft Office Skills</li> <li>Highly organized and detail oriented with great communication skills</li> <li>Ability to create and maintain strong relationship with team, trade partners, and customers</li> </ul> <strong>Career Package</strong> <br/><br/> We are proud to offer our employees what they value most: <br/><br/> • Competitive compensation   <ul> <li>Excellent extended health benefits</li> <li>Work-life balance</li> <li>Leadership development and mentorship programs</li> <li>Charitable donation matching</li> <li>A culture based on our values of Passion, Integrity and Community <br/><br/> <strong>The Company</strong> <br/><br/> Brookfield Residential is a leading North American land developer and homebuilder with one goal in mind - to create the best places to call home. From the development of award winning master-planned communities, to the design and construction of premier homes and commercial properties, we are committed to cultivating exceptional life experience for our customers and for our employees. <br/><br/> Building great communities and homes takes vision and dedication, but most importantly, it takes a strong team. Having been in business for more than 60 years, we know it is our people who make Brookfield Residential what it is today. We were humbled to be named by Aon as one of the Best Employers in Canada and U.S. in 2017.</li>  </ul>

Job_Description: <strong><br/><br/>US Payroll Analyst - Core Responsibilities:</strong> <br/><br/> Process weekly and bi-weekly US payrolls, including union and non-union; Manage payroll and HR data for employees from date of hire to termination; Investigate pay related questions in order to provide accurate and timely resolution; Maintain and develop written process documentation; Maintain professional knowledge of all payroll legislative changes; Participate in projects (research, testing) to improve quality of payroll services; Provide superior customer service; reconcile and balance all U.S. payroll tax accounts each quarter prior to filing; reconcile W-2s and validate and research W-2 corrections; - Decision Making: Operates more independently. Scope of recommendations span department operations. Duties: Is considered a fully qualified Payroll Analyst. Conducts own analysis to help the business function more effectively through findings. Develops and writes drafts of business process specifications and or can plan, analyze business practice providing expertise to leaders. Can be a project lead and is involved in matters that could have strategic importance to the function they are supporting. <br/><br/> Interested? Click on the “Apply” button!
