Job_Description: <strong>Who we are:</strong> <br/><br/> Challenger Geomatics Ltd. is a diverse geomatics company providing innovative surveying and mapping solutions to the public, government and industry across Western and Northern Canada and internationally since 1984. The company is wholly owned by its employees and has a staff of more than 160 dedicated employees based in Calgary, Grande Prairie, Edmonton, Fort McMurray, Yellowknife and Whitehorse. <br/><br/> <strong>Does Your Career Require a</strong> <strong>Challenge</strong><strong>?</strong> <br/><br/> Challenger offers challenging and rewarding employment along with on the job training and educational courses that allow our team members to rise to their full potential. We pride ourselves in offering opportunities for growth across all our offices. We offer competitive compensation and benefits packages to our employees. Challenger looks for "talent"- people who will be challenged and engaged in a growing company. We know that it is through our talent that we can continue to attain our goals and realize our vision. <br/><br/> <strong>Ready to join the</strong> <strong>Challenger</strong><strong> team?</strong> <br/><br/> We have been growing in all areas and continue to seek out passionate and innovative people who strive for excellence. Our growth is your opportunity! <br/><br/> We are currently seeking the talent of a Marketing Specialist. <br/><br/> <strong>Position Overview:</strong> <br/><br/> Reporting to the Business Development Manager, the Marketing Specialist is accountable to lead various marketing initiatives and provide support for corporate business development and communications. <br/><br/> This position is located out of either Calgary or Edmonton with occasional travel required. <br/><br/> <strong>General Responsibilities:</strong>  <ul> <li>Manages company social media presence and communications, and monitors and engages in relevant social discussions about our company and industry.</li>  <li>Creates content and campaigns appropriate for specific social networks to spread our brand and drive consistent, relevant traffic and lead generation.</li>  <li>Maintains and develops company website content, supports SEO/SEM campaigns, and updates company information on external web services and directories.</li>  <li>Develops and maintains sales and marketing tools, including brochures, trade show displays, and advertisements to support lead generation.</li>  <li>Develops and maintains corporate documents such as resumes, project profiles, etc. to support sales and marketing objectives.</li>  <li>Writes, develops and edits content and graphics for newsletters, press releases, proposals, marketing collateral, white papers, and other communications.</li>  <li>Coordinates distribution of company newsletter and other communications.</li>  <li>Leads the preparation of business proposals, marketing plans and presentations which are designed to address the key needs of potential clients.</li>  <li>Supports the planning, preparation and hosting of company events.</li>  <li>Assists in preparing for and attending tradeshows, conferences and other industry events.</li>  <li>Maintains the company database of client and prospect contacts.</li>  <li>Manages inventory of promotional goods to be readily available to support business development initiatives.</li>  <li>Participates in Business Development Team activities and initiatives.</li>  <li>Contributes to regularly scheduled meetings.</li>  </ul> <strong>Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:</strong>  <ul> <li>Excellent written and verbal communication and presentation skills.</li>  <li>Advanced level of proficiency in MS Office applications, including Word, Excel and PowerPoint.</li>  <li>High level of familiarity with social media networks, management platforms, and the execution of social media campaigns.</li>  <li>Working knowledge of Adobe Creative Suite, including Acrobat, Illustrator, Photoshop, etc.</li>  <li>Natural ability to build and maintain positive relationships with internal stakeholders.</li>  <li>Highly energetic and enthusiastic in engaging with client and prospects.</li>  <li>Brings a proactive, innovative and goal-oriented approach to all assignments.</li>  <li>An understanding of the services and clients associated with land survey, aerial photography, mapping, etc. is an asset.</li> </ul> <strong>Qualifications:</strong>  <ul> <li>Bachelor's degree (Marketing preferred).</li>  <li>3-5 years of relevant marketing experience.</li>  <li>Experience within the oil and gas, energy services, engineering and/or construction sectors is an asset.</li> </ul>
Title: Marketing Specialist (Calgary or Edmonton)

Job_Description: <div><div><strong>Analyst, Applications</strong> <br/><br/> AltaGas is an energy infrastructure business with a focus on natural gas, power, and regulated utilities. We have, and continue to build, a solid portfolio of assets to serve producers and to provide clean and affordable energy to our customers. We continuously strive to build dynamic teams to support our future growth. We provide opportunity, challenge and competitive compensation within a positive work environment that motivates people to build careers within our company. AltaGas’ success is driven by a skilled team of more than 1700 employees. <br/><br/> Rapid expansion of our business has created a wide range of career opportunities for qualified individuals. If you want to work for a company that offers work/life balance, financial assistance to support continuous learning and growth, and that has a solid track record of success with an achievement-oriented organizational culture, AltaGas may be the right company for you. <br/><br/> Reporting to the Team Lead, Corporate Applications Management Services, this position is responsible for providing application support and maintenance to ensure applications are compliant and meet business requirements. <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities of the position include, but are not limited to the following:</strong>  <ul>  <li>Provides application support and maintenance including daily checks, minor fixes or changes and minor application upgrades/patches (as well as documentation management)</li>    <li>Manages applications, including installation, maintenance and decommissioning</li>    <li>Manages and maintains the cybersecurity services and applications for Cybersecurity Operations</li>    <li>Manages the organization’s compliance to internal/external cybersecurity and cybersecurity accreditation regulations and policies</li>    <li>Ensures all services comply with quality assurance and control specifications</li>    <li>Supports the service transition team (including document reviews) during release management and new service introductions</li>    <li>Supports the Service/Help Desk in day-to-day end-user assistance and event management, including incident troubleshooting and resolution</li>    <li>Supports the acceptance, approval and fulfilment of provisioning request</li>    <li>Supports testing for upgrades, new release/service introduction</li>    <li>Uses best practices and tools to measure relevant data points providing high levels of management and team visibility to enable a rich, service level driven environment</li>   </ul>    <ul> <li>Provides on-call support as required</li> </ul> <strong>Qualifications:</strong>  <ul>  <li>Minimum five (5) years’ experience working in an application support role supporting JD Edwards or other ERP systems</li>    <li>Experience with a variety of enterprise level business applications and functions and supporting cybersecurity infrastructures</li>    <li>Strong data analysis capabilities and advanced Excel and Microsoft Office Suite proficiency required</li>    <li>Completion of a college diploma or university degree in business or information systems</li>    <li>Finance designations/certifications is heavily weighted</li>    <li>Experience with a variety of enterprise level business applications and functions</li>    <li>Knowledge of industry standard reporting and business intelligence tools</li>    <li>Experienced with applying fixes, patches, and upgrades from the product vendor</li>    <li>Strong interpersonal and communication skills</li>    <li>Aptitude for technology combined with solid business experience</li>    <li>Finance background with focus on Accounts Payable or Finance modules in JDE/ERP</li>    </ul> Qualified applicants are invited to submit their resumes in confidence to the Human Resources Department by visiting www.altagas.ca/careers. <br/><br/> We thank all applicants for their interest in our organization, but only those candidates selected for interviews will be contacted. No agency referrals or telephone inquiries at this time, please.</div> </div><div></div>
Title: Analyst, Applications

Job_Description: Our client, a well-established Relocation Management Company is looking to hire a Relocation Consultant to be based in their office in Alberta. <br/><br/> The Relocation Consultant will be responsible for managing and coordinating domestic and international relocations of assignees. <br/><br/> <strong>Key Responsibilities:</strong> <ul> <li>Working with corporate clients and their employees to counsel and manage all aspects of their assignment services including the logistics of their move, settling them in at their new destination and managing benefits throughout the life of the assignment</li><li>Manage domestic and international relocations</li><li>Acts as the main point of contact for administering the various phases of the relocation process for transferees</li><li>Ensuring that each expatriate employee’s assignment type is properly identified and allocated for tracking, reporting and cost projection purposes.</li><li>Monitors relocations in process and solves routine day to day problems</li><li>Working collaboratively with internal stakeholders to ensure the timely reporting and accuracy of client data</li><li>Manage relationships within vendor network</li><li>Works with the transferee and/or family to ensure all needs are understood and met, and adjusts services and counseling to changing needs and conditions throughout the move process</li> </ul> <strong>Qualifications and Experience:</strong>  <ul> <li>3 or more years of experience in Global Mobility/Relocation.</li><li>Strong knowledge of various assignment types including; short term, long term and permanent moves.</li><li>Knowledge and experience with domestic and international relocation</li><li>Certified Relocation Professional (CRP) certification preferred.</li><li>Strong oral and written communications skills.</li><li>Ability to multitask in a fast-paced environment.</li><li>Excellent customer service, a high energy level and ability to work to deadlines.</li><li>Strong computer skills (Excel, Word, Outlook) is necessary.</li> </ul>
Title: Relocation Consultant

Job_Description: <strong>About Us:</strong>  <br/> GE is the world's Digital Industrial Company, transforming industry with software-defined machines and solutions that are connected, responsive and predictive. Through our people, leadership development, services, technology and scale, GE delivers better outcomes for global customers by speaking the language of industry. <br/><br/> <strong>Role Summary:</strong>  <br/> The successful candidate will be responsible for the financial analysis, planning & closing processes and reporting of all Sales Transactions and CSAs in Canada for the North America region. This position reports into the TPS Regional Services Finance Manager and will work closely with the CM&S CFO and the Services HQ team in Florence, Italy. The role will also support the Canada Region CFO in helping understand the complete regional metrics and market dynamics. <br/><br/> <strong>Essential Responsibilities:</strong>  <br/> The candidate will have the following responsibilities:   <ul> <li>Provide overall financial leadership and support to the Transactional & CSA (Contractual Service Agreement) Operational teams for the Canada sub-region</li> <li>Support the Canada Area Leader and the Americas regional Leader with financial analysis and forecasting</li> <li>Drive operational OTR accountability through establishing and tracking regional Sales and Contribution Margin targets</li> <li>Support the annual margin-reviews on CSA contracts</li> <li>Pro-actively provide financial Risk and Opportunities input to QMI process</li> <li>Play a key role in the planning sessions (Blue Print). Ensure accurate estimates inputs for planning purposes by modeling various scenarios.</li> <li>Ensure compliance to Revenue Recognition policy. Liaise with controllership and advise local OTR team.</li> <li>Play a key role in the financial closing and ensure close cooperation and coordination with both the Product and Regional finance teams</li> <li>Responsible for monthly/quarterly assigned account reconciliations</li> <li>Ensure close coordination with GOF for countries where the accounting has been outsourced</li> <li>Ensure close cooperation and coordination with the CSA Excellence team in the US/Florence</li> <li>Comply with necessary regulations in the reporting process using knowledge of applicable Statutory and GAAP reporting requirements. Support internal/external audits.</li> <li>Responsible for creating and processing closing journal entries in general ledger like calculating and booking revenue and cost liquidation</li> <li>Participate in simplification projects focused on improving (financial) processes / performance and system usage</li> <li>Design, generate and enhance routine reports that meet client business needs by conducting thorough needs assessment with business stakeholders</li> <li>Flexibly and knowledgeably respond to client ad-hoc requests for customized data and reports</li> <li>Thoroughly consider the effects on relevant IT infrastructure & controllership, from both a functional & systems perspective, when evaluating and implementing OTR Finance process improvements</li> </ul>  <strong>Qualifications/Requirements:</strong>    <ul> <li>Bachelor or Master degree in Finance/Business Administration or equivalent</li> <li>At least 5 years of progressive finance experience in a complex environment</li> <li>Established analytical and project management ability</li> <li>Leadership skills with ability to work effectively in a matrix organization and builds operational trust quickly</li> <li>Strong interpersonal and communication skills</li> <li>Ability to anticipate, identify and resolve complex financial issues</li> <li>Strong controllership mindset</li> <li>Ambitious, pro-active, high-energy, positive attitude and team player</li> <li>Flexible, stress resilient and ability to meet deadlines while maintaining the highest standards of quality</li> <li>Fluent in English</li> <li>Knowledge of TPS processes and SAP/Oracle/HFM systems preferred</li> </ul>  <strong>Desired Characteristics:</strong>  <br/> Strong oral and written communication skills. Strong interpersonal and leadership skills. Ability to influence others and lead small teams. Lead initiatives of moderate scope and impact. Ability to coordinate several projects simultaneously. Effective problem identification and solution skills. Proven analytical and organizational ability. <br/><br/> <strong>Locations:</strong>  Canada; Alberta; Calgary
Title: Regional Financial Analyst Services Canada

Job_Description: <div><div><div><div><div><DIV>EY's people in more than 150 countries are committed to operating with integrity, quality and professionalism in the provision of audit, advisory, tax and transaction advisory services. We strive to help all of our people achieve their professional and personal goals through an inclusive environment that values everyone's contributions, appreciates diversity of thought, fosters growth, and provides continuous opportunities for development. Recognized as one of Canada's top employers, EY continually strives to be a great place to work. <BR><BR>Our SAP controls practice is expanding as companies continue to search for better, innovative ways to increase confidence in their reporting processes while lowering compliance costs. Which means, we need you. We need <B>Seniors</B> to help answer complex questions facing our clients and create critical solutions for the market place.</DIV>                   <div>  <DIV><B>Responsibilities:<BR></B></DIV> <DIV>Leveraging your knowledge of IT environments and industry trends, you will work across competencies, service lines and sectors to develop innovation solutions to build and sustain risk management and governance programs for our clients. You will support EY teams responsible for transforming risk functions and implementing leading practice technology solutions</DIV> <DIV> </DIV> <DIV><B>Requirements:</B><B> <BR></DIV></B> <UL> <LI> <DIV>Understand SAP security and business process concepts, and work directly with the client to identify technical issues and elevate appropriately</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Ability to conduct risk assessment and audits around SAP and support various SAP projects</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Deliver facts, analyses and recommendations in an accurate, clear and concise manner</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Handle multiple technically complex projects or engagements simultaneously</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Foster relationships with client personnel at appropriate levels</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Drive high-quality work products within expected timeframes and on budget</DIV></LI></UL> <DIV> </DIV> <DIV><B>To qualify for the role you must have</B></DIV> <UL> <LI> <DIV>A bachelor's degree and approximately 2 years of related work experience. </DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Application controls experience in SAP</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Experience testing controls, sensitive access and segregation of duties</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Demonstrate an understanding of SAP business processes (e.g., purchase-to-pay, record-to-report, order-to-cash)</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Experience with SAP GRC Access Control is desired</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Strong written and verbal communication skills </DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Basic project management and client service skills </DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Strong analytical and problem-solving skills </DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>A willingness to travel to meet client needs </DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Industry related certification (e.g., CPA, CISA)</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Strong understanding of IT industry trends</DIV></LI></UL> <DIV><BR><STRONG>EY is committed to inclusiveness, equity and accessibility. We encourage all qualified candidates to apply.</STRONG></DIV>  </div>            </div>  </div>  </div>     </div> 	</div>
Title: Senior Consultant – IT Risk Assurance (SAP)

Job_Description: <strong>Description:</strong> <br/> The primary responsibilities of this position are to develop security programs, provide subject matter expertise, top tier support to the operational security team, and participate in internal and external working groups. <br/> This senior position requires exceptional technical aptitude, leadership and customer interface skills. Daily activities include collaborating with the client, designing, implementing and supporting security solutions in line with the clients technology and business strategies <br/><br/> <strong>RESPONSIBILITIES:</strong>    <ul> <li>Utilizing Security Analysis tools and methodologies to effectively describe, inform and mitigate security threats for client customers</li> <li>Maintaining a strong understanding of current IT security Risk and vulnerabilities.</li> </ul>  The Senior Security Consultant supports project managers and change managers in the planning and design of security related services enhancements   <ul> <li>The Senior Security Consultant is the expert in security architecture and design principles and has a thorough understanding of security standards and methodologies</li> <li>The Senior Security Consultant is responsible for proper documentation and cross training needed to insure seamless introduction of new technologies and security changes within existing operational models</li> <li>Preparing drafts of changes for existing IT security procedures and policies or for new policies and procedures</li> <li>Work closely with other operational teams including network operations, abuse management, and external operational points of contact</li> </ul>  <strong>REQUIREMENTS:</strong>    <ul> <li>A minimum of 7 years of security professional work experience</li> <li>A thorough knowledge of IT Network, Data Centre, Internet Protocol, File Transfer, Spam.</li> <li>Expertise with security methodologies, standards, and best practices (i.e: ITIL, ISO 17799/BS7799, and other security-related practices are an asset)</li> <li>Expertise within a broad range of security sub-</li> <li>Experience with architecting, deploying and troubleshooting multi-vendor security environments including:</li> </ul>  o Firewalls (Cisco, Juniper, CheckPoint, Palo Alto); <br/> o IDS/P technologies (Tippingpoint, McAfee, Cisco, Juniper); <br/> o IPSec and SSL VPNs (Juniper, Cisco, Nortel); <br/> o SIEM tools (RSA Envision, ArcSight, Intellitactics); <br/> o Remote Authentication (TACACS+, RSA SecurID, CryptoCard); <br/> o Content Filtering (Websense, Crossbeam, Cisco IronPort).   <ul> <li>Troubleshooting of LAN/WAN multi-vendor environments including inter-networking technologies (including Cisco, Juniper and Nortel), IP applications and protocols (including HTTP/S, POP, SMTP, FTP, TELNET, SSH, NNTP, LDAP, SNMP), and telecommunications facilities (Frame Relay, Ethernet)</li> <li>Experience with Unix and Unix-like operating environments (including Solaris, HPUX, AIX, Linux, and *BSD)</li> </ul>  / Les principales responsabilités du titulaire de ce poste sont de développer des programmes de sécurité, de fournir de lexpertise et du soutien de haut niveau léquipe de sécurité opérationnelle et de participer des groupes de travail internes et externes. <br/> Le titulaire de ce poste de haut niveau a besoin de connaissances techniques exceptionnelles, de leadership et de compétences en matière dinterfaces client. Dans le cadre de ses activités quotidiennes, il collabore avec le client, conçoit et met en œuvre des solutions de sécurité harmonisées avec les stratégies de technologie et daffaires du client et offre du soutien légard de ces solutions. <br/><br/> <strong>RESPONSABILITÉS</strong>    <ul> <li>Utiliser des outils et des méthodologies danalyse de la sécurité pour décrire, documenter et atténuer efficacement les menaces de sécurité pour les clients de client.</li> <li>Actualiser ses connaissances de façon maintenir une compréhension poussée des vulnérabilités et des risques de sécurité des TI actuels.</li> <li>Soutenir les gestionnaires de projet et les gestionnaires du changement dans la planification et la conception daméliorations de service liées la sécurité.</li> <li>Agir titre dexpert pour ce qui est des principes darchitecture de sécurité et de conception et posséder une connaissance rigoureuse des normes et des méthodes en matière de sécurité.</li> <li>Être responsable de la documentation et de la formation croisée nécessaires pour assurer un lancement transparent des nouvelles technologies et des changements de sécurité dans les limites des modèles opérationnels actuels.</li> <li>Préparer des ébauches pour les changements apporter aux procédures et aux politiques de sécurité des TI en vigueur ou pour les nouvelles procédures et politiques.</li> <li>Travailler en étroite collaboration avec dautres équipes opérationnelles, y compris lexploitation de réseau, la gestion des abus et les points de contact opérationnels externes.</li> </ul>  <strong>EXIGENCES</strong>    <ul> <li>Minimum de sept ans dexpérience de travail en sécurité</li> <li>Connaissance approfondie des réseaux TI, des centres de données, des protocoles Internet, des transferts de fichiers et des pourriels.</li> <li>Expertise en méthodologies, normes et meilleures pratiques en sécurité (c.- -d., ITIL, ISO 17799/BS7799, et autres pratiques liées la sécurité, un atout)</li> <li>Expertise dans un large éventail de sous-disciplines du domaine de la sécurité</li> <li>Expérience en architecture, en déploiement et en dépannage denvironnements de sécurité multifournisseurs, notamment :</li> </ul>  o Pare-feux (Cisco, Juniper, CheckPoint, Palo Alto) <br/> o Technologies IDS/IDP (Tippingpoint, McAfee, Cisco, Juniper) <br/> o RPV IPSec et SSL (Juniper, Cisco, Nortel) <br/> o Outils de système de gestion de linformation et des événements de sécurité (SIEM) (RSA enVision, ArcSight, Intellitactics) <br/> o Authentification distance (TACACS+, RSA SecurID, CryptoCard) <br/> o Filtrage du contenu (Websense, Crossbeam, Cisco IronPort)   <ul> <li>Dépannage denvironnements de réseau local/étendu multifournisseurs, y compris les technologies dinterconnexion de réseaux (notamment Cisco, Juniper et Nortel), les applications et les protocoles IP (notamment HTTP/S, POP, SMTP, FTP, TELNET, SSH, NNTP, LDAP, SNMP) et les installations de télécommunications (relais de trames, Ethernet)</li> </ul>  Expérience des environnements dexploitation Unix ou de type Unix (notamment Solaris, HPUX, AIX, Linux et *BSD) <br/><br/> <strong>Top 3 must have skills:</strong>   <ul> <li>Cisco, Juniper, Palo Alto firewall design / deployment experience</li> <li>Cisco ISE design and Deployment experience</li> <li>Networking knowledge and understanding</li> </ul>  <strong>Top 3 nice to have skills:</strong>    <ul> <li>Good communication</li> <li>Other security technologies and automation platforms like Ansible</li> <li>Ability to manage multiple priorities at one time</li> </ul>
Title: IT Security Consultant 3 / Conseiller en sécurité des TI 3

Job_Description: <strong>Sr. Solution Analyst , IT, Enterprise Applications, Procurement, Calgary, AB and Saskatoon, SK</strong> <br/><br/> Why work at Nutrien? Great question! <br/><br/> Safety is a core value at Nutrien. Keeping every employee safe, healthy and secure is our top priority. Nothing is more important than seeing our people go home safe at the end of every single day. <br/><br/> While working here you will have the opportunity to grow your career while helping us feed the future. We pride ourselves in hiring from a variety of backgrounds and truly believe that it is our differences that make us stronger so we hope you will join us. <br/><br/> In addition to exciting and challenging opportunities, Nutrien offers competitive salaries, great benefits and performance based incentives. <br/><br/> Outside of the skills and necessary qualifications, you will be committed to sustaining our safe and positive work environment while welcoming working side by side others in a diverse culture. Culture at Nutrien is the core of everything we do and all employees are respectful of diverse opinions and views. <br/><br/> Reporting to the Sr. Manager, IT, Enterprise Applications, Procurement, the Sr. Solution Analyst is a strong techno-functional resource that will work directly with Nutrien’s Procurement Team to ensure business solutions are successfully enabled. The Sr. Solution Analyst will ensure existing systems are maintained, business opportunities are identified, ensure projects move forward on time and within budget, and ultimately facilitate achievement of business solutions. The Sr. Solution Analyst will need to collaborate with stakeholders at all levels of the organization, and will be responsible for coordinating work with IT team members, vendors, business stakeholders and other resources to establish and implement effective solutions to business problems. <br/><br/> <strong>Key Tasks:</strong> <br/><br/> Serves as Liaison between IT and Procurement Business Partners <ul> <li>Build Understanding of Procurement Business Process and the technology that supports it</li><li>Intake work requests from Procurement. Translates Business needs to Functional & Technical requirements, to drive overall procurement solutions.</li><li>Identify opportunities for improvement within both business process and technology solutions related to the procurement domain</li><li>Collaborates with Procurement to prioritize backlogs for solution design & resolution</li><li>Ownership of business incidents from identification through resolution</li> <li>Support Development of business cases for Procurement related projects that enable business capabilities or reduce technical debt</li> <li>Supports short and medium-term road mapping activities</li> </ul> Responsible for Quality Implementation and Support of Procurement Related Software <ul> <li>Monitors performance of Managed Services teams that support procurement applications</li><li>Collaboratively works with Managed Services team on solution design for complex business problems</li><li>Performs Proof of Concept work related to key business initiatives</li> </ul> Act as a key technical resource within IT Procurement Support Team <ul> <li>Understands, advocates and supports enterprise strategies</li><li>Responsible for work estimation within domain</li> <li>Collaboratively works with other teams to assess downstream impacts to procurement group</li><li>Serves as project technical lead to ensure business value is provided in a timely, cost-effective manner</li><li>Assists in resource planning</li> </ul> Champion Continuous improvement within IT Team <ul> <li>Understand emerging technologies and assess their potential use for meeting the business needs of Nutrien.</li> <li>Maintain technical knowledge of existing application roadmaps</li> <li>Champions technology improvements that drive business value</li><li>Mentors others on the team</li> </ul> Assists in Stakeholder Communication <ul> <li>Maintains monthly work list for Procurement team, and tracks progress throughout the month</li><li>Monitors work list progress on a weekly basis to identify risks to commitment of delivered activities</li><li>Assists in preparation of regular status reporting to be presented to IT and Procurement Management</li> </ul> <strong>Skills:</strong> <ul> <li>Deep understanding of enterprise scale procurement processes (Procure to Pay, Source to Contract, strategic sourcing, supplier risk management, etc)</li></ul>  <ul> <li>Strong Interpersonal skills – adept at building and maintaining strong working relationships and collaborating and communicating effectively in a business environment. Capability to deal with all levels within the organization, from Executive team to front line employee</li></ul>  <ul> <li>Exceptional communication, both written and verbal, and facilitation skills</li></ul>  <ul> <li>Demonstrated ability to work collaboratively with distributed teams. Experience working and leading off-shore teams is a strong preference.</li><li>Superior Time Management skills. Able to support multiple project initiatives simultaneously</li><li>Proficient in translating business problems into detailed requirements and technical specifications Adept at developing business cases, requirement documentation and test plans to support system activity</li><li>Flexible and able to work with varying levels of uncertainty.</li><li>Comfortable working independently with stakeholders, as well as alongside colleagues within a team environment</li><li>History of serving as Technical Lead and/or Project Manager on project initiatives</li><li>Demonstrates history of continuous training & learning in technology, leadership and communication</li><li>Experience applying the processes of the Software Development Life Cycle</li><li>Experience working with clients within both a corporate and industrial environment</li><li>Experience supervising others would be considered an asset</li><li><strong>Proven ability to develop consensus among diverse teams</strong></li> </ul> <strong>Qualifications:</strong> <ul> <li>Graduate of a recognized university with a degree in computer science, engineering, business or other relevant field. Educational and experience equivalents will also be considered</li><li>Minimum of 7 years of directly related and progressively responsible experience in supporting ERP applications solution design and development, including cross-domain experience with a strong preference for proficient understanding in <strong>SAP</strong> and/or <strong>SAP Ariba</strong></li><li>Minimum of 3 years of experience working with Procurement related modules.</li><li>Ability to travel</li> </ul> Nutrien is committed to creating an inclusive workplace. We encourage applications from all well qualified candidates who reflect the diversity of the regions where we operate. This includes recognizing the voluntary identification of status such as gender, sexual orientation, visible minority, Indigenous status, persons with disabilities, and veterans, where applicable. <br/><br/> If this sounds like a good match, apply now. <strong> In order to ensure consideration for this role, candidates are encouraged to apply by May 16, 2018. However, this job will remain posted until filled.</strong> You may be required to undergo a background check and substance test in accordance with Nutrien policies. <br/><br/> While we appreciate all applications we receive, we advise that only candidates under consideration will be contacted.
Title: Sr. Solution Analyst , IT, Enterprise Applications, Procurement

Job_Description: <div><div><div><div><div><DIV>EY's people in more than 150 countries are committed to operating with integrity, quality and professionalism in the provision of audit, advisory, tax and transaction advisory services. We strive to help all of our people achieve their professional and personal goals through an inclusive environment that values everyone's contributions, appreciates diversity of thought, fosters growth, and provides continuous opportunities for development. Recognized as one of Canada's top employers, EY continually strives to be a great place to work.<BR><BR>EY is seeking a <B>Senior</B>, to join our <B>Risk Assurance team in our Calgary office</B>. This professional will manage engagement teams, as well as directly assist clients in employing information systems, resources, and controls to maximize efficiencies and minimize risk. The successful candidate will also work with client personnel to analyze, evaluate, and enhance information systems facilitating the business internal control process, and will assist clients and other IT professionals in performing information technology (IT) control and security engagements. </DIV>                   <div>  <DIV><B>Responsibilities:<BR></DIV></B> <UL> <LI> <DIV>Provide high quality professional day-to-day management of internal/external audit engagements/projects and understand EY’s practices and service offerings and identify potential opportunities to improve such service offerings</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Lead and support the on-site coordination role for audit clients including planning, briefing team on the client's IT environment and industry IT trends, coaching and mentoring staff, communicating with the clients and completing audit engagements </DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Maintain relationships with client management to manage expectations of service, including work products, timing, and the value to be delivered.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Prepares IT external audit reports on the adequacy and effectiveness of control structure, along with practical recommendations to improve the effectiveness, efficiency of a control or process.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Able to discuss and resolve IT audit issues and recommendations with client management.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Demonstrate a thorough understanding of complex information systems and apply it to client situations.</DIV></LI></UL> <DIV><B>Requirements:</B> <B><BR></DIV></B> <UL> <LI> <DIV>A minimum of 2 years of experience in IT external and/or internal audit;</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Bachelor’s Degree (or higher) in Business Administration, Commerce, Computer Science, Management Information Systems, or other relevant program required. </DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Possessing relevant accounting / audit designation(s) or working towards one (e.g. CPA, CIA, and/or CISA) is required. </DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Demonstrated knowledge of COBIT, ITIL, or other IT frameworks would be as asset.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Experience with data and analytics tools such as ACL; providing IT support to non IT auditors.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Proficiency using SharePoint and MS Office Suite including Excel, Word, OneNote and PowerPoint</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Hands on experience with project management or IT operations based in large enterprise resource planning systems such as JD Edwards, Oracle and SAP or information security would be an asset.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Strong experience interacting with clients at all levels including Staff, Leadership and Partners: Strong written, communication, and presentation skills. </DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Ability to coach and mentor junior staff on engagements.</DIV><B> <DIV><BR>EY is committed to inclusiveness, equity and accessibility. We encourage all qualified candidates to apply.</DIV></B></LI></UL>  </div>            </div>  </div>  </div>     </div> 	</div>
Title: Senior Consultant – IT Risk Assurance

Job_Description: Position Summary <p></p> <p>VERSUS is focused on creating a community-minded downtown living experience. Surrounded by restaurants, cafes and local shops, VERSUS is pet-friendly and located in Calgary’s Beltline, just steps from 17th Avenue and the downtown core. Full of next-gen, eco-friendly urban amenities focused on bringing people together, VERSUS is committed to socially responsible living. To learn more, visit our website at VersusLiving.com.</p> <p>As an integral member of the team, the Leasing Consultant assists in developing and implementing diversified and innovative leasing strategies for the community. This role aims to maximize value by providing industry leading customer service to current and potential customers. The Leasing Consultant will strive to realize efficiencies and ensure first class facilities are provided to all customers. </p> <p>This position will work at both the Versus and London at Heritage locations in Calgary. Hours will be irregular to accommodate operating hours and will include weekends and holidays.</p> Key Responsibilities <ul>  <li>Greet and qualify customers on the phone or in person with the view that the end result will be a new resident.</li>  <li>Lease suites with specific leasing goals in mind.</li>  <li>Ensure that prospective resident applications are completed correctly and in full.</li>  <li>Oversee the signing of leases.</li>  <li>Complete move-in/move-out inspections with residents.</li>  <li>Maintain a database of contact information in YARDI.</li>  <li>Enhance customer satisfaction and retention.</li>  <li>Complete traffic reports, vacancy reports and related paperwork as required by the Leasing Manager.</li>  <li>Utilize follow-up programs (i.e. thank you cards, calls, etc.).</li>  <li>Participate in on-going sales training to improve sales techniques.</li>  <li>Report deficiencies in market ready suites and in the building to the Leasing Manager.</li>  <li>Visit competitive properties to stay informed on market conditions and complete monthly competitor comparisons.</li>  <li>Ensure local, provincial, & federal laws and regulations are being observed at the community.</li>  <li>Execute all work in a safe, professional manner in compliance with Occupational Health and Safety Legislation.</li>  <li>Ensure comprehension and compliance with all Westcorp Playbook policies.</li>  <li>Complete other duties as required and assigned by the Leasing Manager.</li> </ul> Required Skills & Abilities <ul>  <li>High School Graduate; Post-Secondary Education an asset</li>  <li>Extremely strong aptitude for sales and customer service</li>  <li>Proficient computer skills and knowledge of Microsoft Office (Word, Excel and Outlook)</li>  <li>Knowledge of YARDI and/or SharePoint is an asset</li>  <li>Strong interpersonal skills and organizational skills</li>  <li>Exceptional communication ability, written and verbal</li>  <li>High degree of professionalism and dedication to all stakeholders</li>  <li>Candidate must have excellent time management skills and ability to prioritize work</li>  <li>Must be flexible and adaptable to meet responsibilities as required</li>  <li>Appearance must be neat, clean and professional</li>  <li>Possess sensational customer service philosophy</li>  <li>Highly organized, results oriented and ability to work in a multi-functional team environment</li>  <li>Security clearance required upon offer of employment</li>  <li>In alignment with our <strong>Westcorp Values:</strong>  <ul>  <li><strong>Integrity, Vitality, Accountability, Results, Collaboration, Learning and Innovation</strong></li>  </ul></li> </ul>
Title: Sales Consultant

Job_Description: <STRONG>Senior Financial Analyst (Operations Reporting & Analysis)</STRONG> <br/><br/> <STRONG></STRONG> <br/><br/> <STRONG><EM>Interested in being a part of a team that is leading the evolution of retail in Canada?</EM></STRONG> <br/><br/> <STRONG></STRONG> <br/><br/> Embracing and driving change is critical to our success. The complexity and rate at which the retail industry is transforming has increased exponentially in recent years and we are committed to being a leader in the industry. As such we are relentlessly focused on innovating at every level of our business, investing in new technologies and products, and doubling down on the best talent to drive the company forward. It is an especially exciting time to join the Canadian Tire Family of Companies. <br/><br/> Our Operations Reporting & Analysis team plays a key role in helping us stay competitive in the ever-changing retail environment by providing accurate, timely, high-quality financial analysis and advice to our business. With over 600 employees across a variety of programs and projects, our Operations Reporting & Analysis team is helping to ensure that our leaders have right analytics to drive our business forward, especially in regards to the allocation of resources and asset investments. <br/><br/> <STRONG>What you’ll do</STRONG> <br/><br/> The incumbent is accountable to ensure that sales and margin are accurately planned, forecasted and analyzed as well as providing analytical support for strategic initiatives or operational efficiencies. <br/><br/> The suitable candidate will have strong background in performing business analytics with exposure to working and reconciling financial and business information systems. The incumbent will play a key role in understanding system integration, corporate strategy and sales drivers and will provide key insights into the financial performance of the company. During the monthly, quarterly and annual reporting cycle, the incumbent will be responsible to ensure that relevant analysis and reports are prepared to support various levels of reviews and presentations for senior stakeholders both internally and externally. This role will regularly collaborate with stakeholders across the organization to drive financial results. <br/><br/> Responsibilities  <ul> <li>Accountable for retail banner financial planning, analysis, forecasting and reporting; brick & mortar and eCommerce aspects</li> <li>Build and complete financial models with the purpose of analyzing bricks & mortar and eCommerce business unit performance</li> <li>Thorough analysis and investigation into the variances to plan and forecast</li> <li>Support business colleagues with financial analysis focused on forward looking financial results</li> <li>Participate in planning meetings with business colleagues to support ongoing business initiatives</li> <li>Partner and influence the Senior Management team to ensure that the plan is realistic and executable</li> <li>Lead and participate in analytics projects with a focus on strategic imperatives; assess strategic alternatives and lead change and process design in the business.</li> <li>Assess and identify areas of opportunities within the business for operational efficiencies with a requirement to analyse and implement change.</LI>  </ul> <STRONG>Who you are</STRONG> <br/><br/> We are looking for high performing individuals who are:  <ul> <li>Agile and innovative individuals, who are able to manage in an environment of change and ambiguity to help us take bold and strategic moves in this rapidly evolving retail environment</li> <li>Creative thinkers who take initiative and are capable of building, launching and managing projects/programs that drive results for our customers</li> <li>Problem solvers with the ability to analyze and prioritize to meet business objectives</li> <li>Collaborative team players with superior influencing skills, who build relationships easily across various stakeholder groups to move initiatives forward</LI>  </ul> If you’re curious, ready to take on new challenges and open to doing things differently to help us evolve rapidly, then Canadian Tire is definitely the place to be. <br/><br/> <STRONG>What you’ve done</STRONG>  <ul> <li>Professional accounting designation (CPA, CMA, CGA, CA).</li> <li>Minimum of six (6) years progressive experience in business or financial analytical role with at least two (2) years post designation</li> <li>Demonstrated experience with sales and revenue planning or accounting in a large organization</li> <li>Strong technical and accounting knowledge as well as superior analytical skills</li> <li>Advanced MS Excel and PowerPoint skills</li> <li>Experience with large financial systems (ERP or other) and Hyperion (Planning and HFM) preferred</li> <li>Demonstrated ability to independently plan, prioritize and coordinate activities to consistently meet deadlines</li> <li>Ability to clearly and confidently communicate written and verbal recommendations, as well as, articulate trade-offs</li> <li>Ability to influence and persuade different points of view <br/> Strong time management and self-management skills</LI> </ul> <STRONG>To learn more about this team and the Canadian Tire Family of Companies follow us on LinkedIn</STRONG>. <br/><br/> Canadian Tire is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace for all. We recognize that our future success depends on the perspectives and contributions of all our employees -- their diverse backgrounds, abilities and experiences make our business stronger. If you are contacted for a job opportunity, please advise us of any accommodations needed to ensure fair and equitable access throughout the recruitment and selection process. All accommodation information provided will be treated as confidential and used only for the purpose of providing an accessible candidate experience.
Title: Senior Financial Analyst

Title: Senior Financial Analyst

Job_Description: <div><div><div><div><div><DIV>EY's people in more than 150 countries are committed to operating with integrity, quality and professionalism in the provision of audit, tax, transaction and advisory services. We strive to help all of our people achieve their professional and personal goals through an inclusive environment that values everyone's contributions, appreciates diversity of thought, fosters growth, and provides continuous opportunities for development. Recognized as one of Canada's top employers, EY continually strives to be a great place to work.</DIV> <DIV> </DIV> <DIV>We currently have career opportunities for Manager / Senior Consultant in our IT Advisory Services team. The individuals will work directly with clients to transform their business challenges into technology solutions. The goal is to support our clients' efforts to make their business units more effective and efficient and, where required, provide services in connection with the development and implementation of technology solutions. Our experience is also important to the analysis of specific business requirements for alignment with technology architecture, technology infrastructure design, and vendor selection decisions that support the line of business IT organizations of our clients.</DIV> <DIV> </DIV> <DIV>This position falls within our IT Advisory team, which helps our clients enhance the effectiveness of Operations functions by assisting them as they shift their emphasis from transaction-level control, processing and reporting to more value driven, decision support and analytics. </DIV> <DIV> </DIV>                   <div>  <DIV><B>Responsibilities</B></DIV> <DIV> </DIV> <DIV>Participate in project teams through all phases of the technology enablement life cycle. Lend specific subject matter knowledge to the design and integration phase of each project, helping to give specificity to the appropriate architecture, data model, and system design and interfacing requirements.</DIV> <DIV> </DIV> <DIV>Advise clients on a variety of business process services that help identify, assess, manage and measure the organization's capabilities. Team with client technology professionals, and/or third-party strategic alliances to provide implementation of technology solutions. Participate in engagement management, engagement execution and reporting, and client relationship building and management.</DIV> <DIV> </DIV> <DIV>We are looking to expand our Practice area to include a team of people with experience in RPA (Robotic Process Automation). This team will work with our clients to help implement such RPA tools as Blue Prism, Automation Anywhere, Openspan and Workfusion. You must be able to develop and document RPA configuration best practices, configure new RPA processes and objects using core workflow principles that are efficient, well structured, maintainable and easy to understand. Have an understanding to support existing processes and implementing change requirements as part of a structured change control process as well as problem solving issues that arise in day to day running of RPA processes and providing timely responses and solutions as required.<BR><BR></DIV> <DIV><B>Qualifications</B></DIV> <DIV> </DIV> <DIV>Desired qualifications include:</DIV> <UL> <LI> <DIV>Demonstrated experience through all phases of the technology life cycle, including project planning, requirements definition, architecture design, build/configuration, testing and operational transition.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Strong track record implementing RPA Tools (e.g. Blue Prism, Automation Anywhere, Openspan and Workfusion.)</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Involved in IT strategy and transformation engagements (IT long range plan, roadmap, operating model, governance, enterprise architecture, etc.)</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>C# and/or Java, html, css</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Microsoft Technology (VB .NET, Windows, Internet Explorer, SQL Server, Web Services)</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Scripting languages (e.g., python, perl, powershell, bash, vbs, etc.)</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Approximately 2-5 years of related work experience; or a graduate degree </DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>A degree in computer science, engineering, accounting, finance or a related field; MBA or MS degree preferred.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Strong written and verbal communication, presentation, client service and technical writing skills, coupled with a strong interest in further developing and integrating operations with technology skills.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Comfortable researching client inquiries and emerging issues, including regulations, industry practices, and new technologies.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Advanced analytical and problem-solving skills.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>A high level of motivation, strong work ethic and self-starting attitude.</DIV></LI></UL> <DIV> </DIV> <DIV><B><U>Willingness and ability to travel approximately 50-80%.</U></B></DIV> <DIV> </DIV> <DIV><B>EY is committed to inclusiveness, equity and accessibility. We encourage all qualified candidates to apply.</B></DIV>  </div>            </div>  </div>  </div>     </div> 	</div>
Title: RPA – Senior Consultant

Job_Description: <div><strong>Job Type:</strong> Permanent <br/> <strong>Primary Location:</strong> Calgary, Alberta, Canada <br/> <strong>All Available Locations:</strong> Calgary<br/> <div> External Posting Description <br/><br/> Our transformation approach is based on a feedback driven co-creative working style where we partner with our clients to design, implement, train and coach their organization in a new way of working. Each of our professionals is a strategic thinker with a passion for helping organizations innovate on the way they work. Our measure of success is our ability to ask our clients the tough questions, challenge them towards making real sustainable change and help them achieve it by working on the ground with them. <br/><br/> As trusted advisors to many leading organizations, we are a market leader in the Lean/Agile IT Transformation space. Our key clients span across public sector, consumer business, insurance and banking industry segments. We are looking to add to our successful team and are seeking an experienced Senior Consultant to join our team. <br/><br/> Key Role & Responsibilities: <ul> <li> Focused on providing IT Transformation advisory, design and organizational change through a mix of SDLC design, team leadership and agile coaching</li><li> Extending the existing Deloitte LEAN framework and SDLC methods fitted to specific client context</li><li> Innovating on our current thinking and bringing in new approaches to changing how organizations and teams deliver software and systems</li><li> Guide and contribute to the development of LEAN project deliverables.</li><li> Lead day-to-day pilot SDLC implementations with clients and provide a diverse set of agile coaching services ranging from project management, requirements, design, development, testing and support</li><li> Leverage a wide range of consulting tools to varying client situations.</li><li> Conduct consultations with stakeholders including client IT managers, team leads and other delivery staff</li><li> Develop proposals and participate in sales/business development efforts within the Technology Consulting practice.</li><li> Contribute to knowledge management within our Technology Consulting practice.</li> </ul> External Posting Qualifications <ul> <li> Engineering or Computer Science background preferred with preference to those with an MBA or MSc (or equivalent)</li><li> Consulting experience from a globally recognized consulting firm</li><li> Experience as a technical lead within a large scale delivery project</li><li> Minimum 4 years of relevant work experience</li><li> Proficiency with applying different SDLC methods including Agile, Scrum, XP, RUP and Kanban</li><li> Strong understanding of solution architecture, design patterns and design modeling</li><li> Experience with project management methodologies</li><li> Advanced knowledge/experience with Microsoft Professional Suite (Word, Excel, & PowerPoint) and Microsoft Project required.</li><li> Experience with analysis of IT processes, re-engineering of processes to improve efficiency and quality</li><li> Proven knowledge transfer/training/leadership skills.</li><li> Excellent presentation and communication skills: both written and verbal are required.</li> </ul> Other Required Attributes: <ul> <li> Strong problem-solving skills - ability to take a process perspective and apply structured thinking in solving problems.</li><li> Solid understanding of IT organizations and specific challenges and issues.</li><li> Ability to commit to a potentially high level of travel</li><li> Subject matter expertise in any of Energy and Resources, Insurance, Banking, Consumer Business or Public Sector industries</li><li> Presence in the Agile community</li> </ul> </div> <br/><strong>Why Deloitte?</strong> <br/><br/> Launch your career with The One Firm where you can make a greater impact than you ever thought possible. With endless opportunities at every turn, and a culture built to support and drive our people to be the very best they can be, Deloitte is The One Firm for you to learn, grow, create, and lead. <br/><br/> At Deloitte, we understand that everyone, and their career goals, are different. As a firm, we help create the conditions and opportunities that will enable our people to thrive – both professionally and personally.
