Job_Description: <strong>Senior Systems Analyst, Calgary</strong> <br/><br/> Stratiform was founded in 2012 and has quickly grown to prominence with a hand-picked team and our commitment to Do Whats Right. Our expertise in Microsoft and Cloud has led to our rapid growth and market-leading reputation with customers. At Stratiform, we have become one of Microsofts go-to cloud partners in Canada. <br/><br/> In 2017, Stratiform was purchased by PCM Canada. Our Managed Services business continues to grow, and as it does, we need to bolster the team with more senior resources to oversee our customers, both within Stratiform and the greater PCM Canada. <br/><br/> <strong>Key Responsibilities (Senior Systems Analyst, Calgary):</strong> <br/><br/> Stratiforms Managed Services are delivered out of Calgary, consisting of tier 1, tier 2, and tier 3 technicians. As a Senior Systems Analyst (Tier 3), you will be responsible for providing technical leadership along with the other tier 3 resources, handling escalations from tier 2 and providing strategic value to Managed Services customers working with your team lead, and solution delivery manager. You will assist with customer onboarding, process development, and other high value technical tasks. <br/><br/> The organization is in the process of migrating from legacy ConnectWise and ZenDesk platforms to PCMs global, very mature, ServiceNow platform. There are Team Leads in Calgary and Edmonton that manage the day-to-day workloads, and two Solution Architects dedicated to Managed Services that assist the sales teams. <br/><br/> <strong>Key Responsibilities include:</strong>  <ul> <li>Manage tickets</li>   <ul> <li>Own incidents from inception to resolution, you are the point of contact for our customers</li>  <li>Sometimes scheduling tickets will be required</li>  <li>Be responsive and ensure SLAs are met with any tickets you handle</li> </ul>  <li>End-user support</li>   <ul> <li>End user support will be limited, but in cases where problems are escalated you will be engaged</li>  <li>Be responsive and respectful to end-users concerns, questions, and problems</li>  <li>Deal with issues related to</li>   <ul> <li>Workstations</li>  <li>Mobile Devices</li>  <li>General software troubleshooting</li></ul>   </ul>  <li>Server support</li>   <ul> <li>Correspond with and deal with contacts at customer organizations, whether they are IT Staff, or Managers</li>  <li>Deal with issues related to corporate infrastructure</li>   <ul> <li>Server Hardware</li>  <li>Switches</li>  <li>Routers</li>  <li>Firewalls</li>  <li>Access Points</li>  <li>Storage Arrays</li> </ul>  <li>Software</li>   <ul> <li>General software troubleshooting</li>  <li>Patching</li></ul>   </ul>  <li>Training</li>   <ul> <li>Responsible aiding in for mentorship and training of tier 1 and 2 resources</li>  <li>Tier 1 and 2 resources will engage you for guidance and leadership</li> </ul>  <li>You will be part of the tier 2 and 3 on-call rotation. This will potentially mean additional after-hours work, and additional compensation.</li>  <li>Own high value, highly technical tasks assigned by the SDM or team lead</li>   <ul> <li>As a highly skilled technical resource you may be engaged for process development, or technical guidance as required by the SDM or team lead</li>  <li>Assist team lead and SDM in technical discovery and assessment as our tools mature</li>  <li>Providing strategic technical advisory to managed services clients</li> </ul>  <li>You will be part of the team that deals with alerts from our monitoring systems, helping investigate and triage problems detected by our monitoring systems</li>  <li>Working flexibility is required, not everyone on the team starts and ends their day at the same time, we grant flexibility in the hours you work but expect there may be times you are required to work outside business hours too (this is a staple of IT)</li>  <li>Cross training and training as a team is a part of this role, if you possess skills other team members do not you may be expected to provide training, and if you require training other team members will provide you with training and mentorship as well</li>  <li>Respect and professionalism</li>   <ul> <li>Working hour flexibility is a benefit, but you will be expected to be communicative if you are unable to come in during your normal schedule</li>  <li>You are expected to work with your team, be respectful of your team mates, and conduct yourself with the utmost in professionalism</li>  <li>You will be respectful, and use appropriate language when dealing with customers and colleagues, were all adults and we expect you will understand what language is appropriate given your audience</li>  <li>Stratiform is a professional working environment, and we expect your attire, grooming, and hygiene reflect this, dress appropriately, and expect you may be expected to adhere to the dress standards of customers if you are required to go on site</li></ul>   </ul> <strong>Required Skills & Experience:</strong>  <ul> <li> Post-secondary training or education in an applicable technology related program, or equivalent work experience</li>  <li> 8-10 years work experience in IT</li>  <li> Experience working with, and understanding of Microsoft Operating Systems</li>  <li> Experience working with, and understanding of Microsoft Office Products</li>  <li> Experience with and understanding of virtualization technologies</li>  <li> Knowledge of ITIL disciplines</li>  <li> Excellent people skills</li>  <li> Excellent written and verbal communication skills</li>  <li> Willingness to support and mentor junior staff</li>  <li> Excellent customer facing/customer service skills</li>  <li> Able to demonstrate a high degree of flexibility including out of hours working</li>  <li> Able to manage sensitive and sometimes confidential information</li>  <li> Self-motivation and able to take responsibility</li>  <li> Able to manage and prioritize and tasks and time efficiently</li>  <li> Extensive Experience with troubleshooting and using computers and software</li>  <li> Passion for technology and learning</li>  <li> Easygoing, hardworking, team focused attitude</li></ul>   <ul> <li>Foundational knowledge of Microsoft technologies, networking, backup and other infrastructure platforms</li>  <li>Experience with Microsoft Azure services</li> </ul> This description reflects the core activities of the role but is not intended to be all-inclusive and other duties within the group/department may be required in addition to changes in the emphasis of duties as required from time to time. There is a requirement for the post holder to recognize this and adopt a flexible approach to work. Job descriptions will be reviewed regularly and where necessary revised in accordance with organizational needs. Any major changes will be discussed with the post holder. <br/><br/> <strong>Desired Skills & Experience:</strong>  <ul> <li>Experience with Microsoft Azure services is a highly differentiating asset</li>  <li>Programming and or scripting knowledge an asset (PowerShell and C# in particular)</li>  <li>Customer service experience</li>  <li>Prior work in an IT environment</li>  <li>Experience with other Microsoft Software</li>  <li>Experience with the Microsoft Cloud Solution Provider (CSP) program</li>  <li>Experience with ServiceNow and Kaseya is an asset</li>  <li>Consulting experience</li> </ul> Candidates must be able to work independently. Characteristics of importance include but are not limited to customer service, problem solving, communication skills, and the ability to read/interpret the needs/wants of customers. <br/><br/> <strong>Physical Requirements:</strong>  <ul> <li> Handling maximum of 21-50 lbs.</li>  <li> Lifting    <ul> <li>20- 50 lbs. (occasional) low level lifting</li>  <li>20- 50 lbs. (frequent) - waist level lifting</li>  <li>20-50 lbs. (rare) above shoulder lifting</li>  <li>20- 50 lbs. (occasional) front carry</li>  <li>5-20 lbs. (rare) side carry</li>  <li>Pushing/Pulling (hand carts and dollies)</li>  <li>60-100 lbs. (occasional)</li>  <li> Sitting/driving (constant)</li>  <li> Trunk rotation (rare)</li>  <li> Crouching/squatting/kneeling/crawling (occasional)</li>  <li> Walking and standing (frequent)</li>  <li> Climbing stairs (occasional)</li>  <li> Hand use (frequent).</li> </ul>  </li> </ul>
Title: Senior Systems Analyst (Stratiform)

Job_Description: Job Description<div><strong>Resource Energy Solutions</strong> has an exciting opportunity available for an enthusiastic team player with a proven track record of selling software in the oil and gas sector. <br/><br/> The successful candidate knows how to navigate the inner workings of clients and develop relationships with drilling and completions managers, IT managers/directors or BA’s, and finance people. The incumbent is an experienced and highly motivated individual who will be working in conjunction with the sales team and be able to execute sales strategy and tactics autonomously. <br/><br/> <strong>Primary Responsibilities:</strong> <ul> <li>Drive and achieve specific sales goals by managing the relationships with assigned and new accounts.</li><li>Network and develop new clients. Some travel will be required to key business centers throughout the country.</li><li>Ensure client satisfaction through effective expectation management during the sales process and a smooth sales-to-support transition for implementation.</li><li>Build a robust and qualified pipeline for short, mid and long term client capture.</li><li>Complete client needs analysis, identifying pressure points for all accounts, provide proposals, product demonstrations and presentations to close sales.</li><li>Must be able to successfully sell over the phone as well as in person and thrive in a rapidly growing environment with high expectations for sales growth.</li><li>Successful candidates will exhibit an ability to deliver sales results quickly.</li> </ul> <strong>Requirements:</strong> <ul> <li>3 years+ software applications and solutions sales experience.</li><li>Experience selling into the oil and gas sector, preferably drilling and completions.</li><li>A successful history of meeting sales goals and project goals.</li><li>Proficient in most computer applications, CRM knowledge an asset.</li><li>Strong team and collaborative skills and an ability to utilize inside support groups effectively.</li><li>Ability to effectively manage time and prioritize daily activities.</li><li>A natural ability and willingness to listen to the clients’ needs with a ‘can-do’ attitude.</li><li>Must be fluent in English (oral and written).</li><li>Travel will be required and at times with limited notice.</li><li>Understanding of the "Challenger Sales" approach would be considered an asset.</li> </ul> <strong>Rewards:</strong> <ul> <li>Base salary of $55,000 - $70,000 annually, plus a generous commission structure up to an extra $30,000 annually.</li><li>Full time employment.</li></ul></div> <br/> Company Description<div>Resource Energy Solutions is a global software company and service provider. Since 1995, RES has supplied world-class, leading-edge, project and cost management software solutions to the oil and gas and industry. <br/><br/> To this day, RES continues to lead in innovation and advanced client solutions within the oil and gas sector. Ongoing collaboration with industry associations and technology experts facilitates RES’ ability to bring new, exciting products to market in record time. In addition to its current product line, RES is focused on enhancing its complementary service offering and expanding its current client base.</div>
Title: Sales Consultant

Job_Description: Company Description<div>CGG (www.cgg.com) is a fully integrated Geoscience company providing leading geological, geophysical, and reservoir capabilities to its broad base of customers. Through its three complementary business divisions of Equipment, Acquisition and Geology, Geophysics & Reservoir (GGR), CGG brings value across all aspects of natural resource exploration by providing detailed information about the subsurface. CGG employs over 5,500 people around the world, all with a Passion for Geoscience and working together to deliver the best solutions to its customers.</div>Job Description<div>Start your career with a recognized leader in the geophysical industry. At CGG you will learn to create accurate 3D images of the subsurface using seismic data. You will be trained to utilize knowledge of seismic data acquisition, wavelet processing, noise attenuation, and velocity model building. You will learn to use state-of-the-art imaging software and select parameters to ensure a high quality, timely, and cost effective product.</div>Qualifications<div>This role requires that you work as part of a team of Seismic Imagers, dedicated to producing high resolution images of the earths subsurface for our internal and external clients. Emphasis will be on managing day-to-day operations of large projects, providing optimal quality control, problem identification and defining ideal solutions. You may work closely with our technical support staff to develop new techniques and tools and possibly collaborate with them to roll-out developing technologies. You will work to ensure that our clients receive a timely product that exceeds their expectations for image quality. <br/><br/> <strong>JOB REQUIREMENTS</strong> <ul>  <li>Graduate (MSc. or PhD) degree in Physics, Engineering, Mathamatics Geophysics or other related technical degree</li> <li>Must be a new graduate within the last 12 months</li> <li>Must have strong math and excellent problem-solving skills</li> <li>Team player that is a quick learner, with strong communication, organizational and presentation skills</li> <li>Experience with a UNIX environment preferred</li> <li>Must have the legal right to live and work in Canada</li>  </ul> Please note, the successful candidate will be required to relocate to Houston, Texas, USA for the first 6 months to participate in the New Hire Training program in our regional head office.</div>Additional Information<div><strong>Why choose CGG?</strong> <br/><br/> Joining a company with a culture of learning and a world-class structured career development pathway, our graduates can develop their technical, commercial and personal skills for the future via a suite of internal courses led by our own CGG University. <br/><br/> We encourage you to take ownership of your development by identifying opportunities to further progress your own skills and experience. <br/><br/> CGG focuses on the strengths and talents of our people and develop learning opportunities that encourage development at every step of your career.</div>
Title: Seismic Imaging Analyst

Job_Description: At MNP we pride ourselves on being different – it’s our entrepreneurial drive that sets us apart. It’s the same drive that’s helped us become Canada’s fastest growing national firm. We foster collaboration, value your ideas, promote based on talent, live balanced lifestyles and make time for FUN. We are one firm, one team, collaborating to support you wherever you want to take your career. <br/><br/> Join the momentum. We are seeking a Senior Consultant for our growing Computer Forensic Services team. Protecting businesses’ best interests, MNP is a leading national accounting, tax and business consulting firm in Canada. Our recognized Forensics team combines accounting and investigative expertise to resolve fraud emergencies. Our professionals conduct assessments that gauge an organization’s vulnerability to fraud and help implement anti-fraud controls to reduce exposure to criminal and civil wrongdoing. <br/><br/> <strong>Performance Expectations</strong> <ul> <li><div>Responsible for the management and execution of Computer Forensic client engagements</div></li><li><div>Acquire, preserve, recover, analyse and present digital evidence from computers and other digital media related to civil and criminal matters</div></li><li><div>Retrieve information from computers and other types of data storage devices including information that has been hidden, encrypted or damaged</div></li><li><div>Use forensic tools and investigative methods to find specific electronic data, including Internet use history, word processing documents, images and other files</div></li><li><div>Analyse mobile phone records to trace devices to a particular location</div> </li><li><div>Follow electronic data to establish links between individuals, groups and events</div> </li><li><div>Carefully document each stage of an investigation and write detailed reports of findings</div></li><li><div>Present technical findings to clients, legal counsel, law enforcement and courts, when required</div> </li><li><div>Actively participate with client engagement team prior to commencement of client work to discuss roles and responsibilities, risk areas, budgets and deadlines</div></li><li><div>Contribute to the development of new ideas and the integration of new technology and/or approaches in order to improve work processes</div> </li><li><div>Monitor project timelines against targets and adjust scope where necessary; advise clients of project status on a timely basis</div> </li><li><div>Promote MNP advisory services through the delivery of presentations, writing articles, facilitating workshops or participating in community activities</div></li><li><div>Raise awareness of MNP through discussions at community events including client and company sponsored functions</div></li> </ul> <strong>Credentials</strong> <ul> <li><div>Possess a Bachelor's Degree in a related field</div></li><li><div>Computer Forensic Specialist with a minimum of five (5) years experience is preferred</div></li><li><div>Possess a Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP) certification or similar digital forensics certification is an asset</div></li><li><div>Proven ability to manage an engagement from acquisition, analysis and reporting to a court standard</div></li><li><div>Experience and comfort using Computer Forensic programs such as, XWays, Axiom, Encase, FTK, Intella and Cellebrite is an asset</div></li><li><div>Proficient in the use of standard business software, such as Outlook, MS Word and Excel in the preparation of business materials and reporting</div></li><li><div>A creative approach to solving problems</div> </li><li><div>Proficiency in file management, detailed documentation and continuity of exhibits</div></li><li><div>Willing to travel to support clients</div></li><li><div>Ability and experience in providing expert witness testimony an asset</div></li><li><div>Fluent in English and other languages an asset, but not required</div></li> </ul> <strong>Core Competencies and Personal Characteristics</strong> <ul> <li><strong>Integrity –</strong> professional whose honesty, integrity, confidentiality and high ethical standards contributes to effective leadership and optimal business relationships</li><li><strong>Energy –</strong> displays enthusiasm, optimism and passion while maintaining a high level of productivity and a balanced lifestyle</li><li><strong>Diversity –</strong> understands the importance of different backgrounds, perspectives and experiences and is respectful of individual differences</li><li><strong>Communication –</strong> effectively expresses ideas and conveys information in business writing, conversations and interactions with others that make an impact and persuade their intended audience(s)</li><li><strong>Client Service Excellence –</strong> understands the importance of quality client service, proactively identifies client needs and creates strategies to proficiently serve clients</li><li><strong>Business Development –</strong> looks for and seizes profitable business opportunities while focusing on the ability to gain increased presence in the community</li> <li><strong>Forward Thinking –</strong> anticipates the implications of situations, takes appropriate action as needed and prepares for possible contingencies</li><li><strong>Agility with Change –</strong> initiates, sponsors and implements change by taking a facilitative catalyst role</li> <li><strong>People Management & Leadership –</strong> goal-driven leader who effectively manages self, others and teams to achieve goals</li><li><strong>Coaching –</strong> takes responsibility for one’s own and team members’ performance by setting clear goals and tracking progress against those goals, promptly addresses performance issues, is highly organized and uses personal judgement and decision making</li><li><strong>Flexibility –</strong> effectively manages multiple assignments, adapts to changing priorities and is able to work independently or as part of a team</li> </ul> MNP encourages a balanced lifestyle and offers benefits that suit the way our team members work and play! In addition to a competitive salary, our total rewards package includes paid personal days, wellness program initiatives, health and dental benefits, a group pension plan with matching contribution, firm sponsored social events, and professional development assistance. <br/><br/> MNP proudly serves and responds to the needs of our clients in the public, private and not-for-profit sectors. Through partner-led engagements, we provide a collaborative, cost-effective approach to doing business, with innovative strategies to help organizations succeed across the country and around the world. <br/><br/> #LI-KM2
Title: Senior Consultant, Computer Forensic Services

Job_Description: <div><p><strong>Job Type: </strong>Permanent <br><strong>Primary Location: </strong>Calgary, Alberta, Canada <br><strong>All Available Locations: </strong>Calgary </p><p><p><p>External Posting Description</p><p><p><strong>Deloitte’s Cyber Risk Services</strong> helps our clients to be Secure, Vigilant and Resilient in the face of an ever increasing array of cyber threats and vulnerabilities. Our Cyber Risk practice helps organizations with the management of information and technology risks by delivering end-to-end solutions, using proven methodologies and tools. Our services help organizations address timely and pervasive issues such as identity theft, data security breaches, data leakage, cybersecurity, and system outages across organizations of various sizes and industries, with the goal of enabling ongoing, secure, and reliable operations across the enterprise.<br><br>Our Calgary practice is growing and we are seeking a new Senior Consultant to join our talented team! As a Senior Consultant, you will:</p><ul><li>Work with a diverse team of talented Consultants (cyber intelligence and cybersecurity analysts/consultants)</li><li>Assist in cultivating relationships with clients</li><li>Demonstrate a solid understanding of business processes, risk management, IT controls and related standards</li><li>Assist with performing capability and cybersecurity assessments, developing best practice recommendations</li><li>Identify and evaluate complex business and technology risks, internal controls which mitigate risks</li><li>Employ a structured approach to project management</li><li>Conduct research to maintain and expand knowledge on the latest cybersecurity technologies and standards, as well as the threat and vulnerability landscape</li><li>Work with security vendors to understand their solution offerings and advise clients on appropriate technologies</li><li>Develop your expertise in a specialization and your reputation as a business advisor</li><li>Review cybersecurity-related events, assessing risk and validity, as well as reporting</li></ul></p></p><p><p>External Posting Qualifications</p><p><ul><li>Minimum 3 years of relevant work experience in incident response, vulnerability assessments, penetration testing, and/or ethical hacking</li><li>Previous consulting firm experience is an asset</li><li>Experience and knowledge of the deployment, maintenance, and use of the EnCase Enterprise, eDiscovery, and Cybersecurity forensic applications is an asset</li><li>Professional systems and command line tools</li><li>Expertise in cyber security solutions including ArcSight, QRadar, NetWitness, FireEye, Damballa, etc. is an asset</li><li>Expertise in security protection solutions including Firewall, Intrusion Detection/Protection Systems, Web Application Firewalls, Anti-Virus, and Application Whitelisting products</li><li>Expertise in SIEM configuration/customization/support</li><li>Knowledge of Operating System and Application Hardening</li><li>Experience with programming/scripting languages is an asset</li><li>Writing and speaking on both technical and business components will be a major part of the role</li><li>Strong time management skills</li><li>Self-directed, with the ability to thrive in a fast-paced and dynamic environment</li><li>Strong analytical and problem-solving skills</li><li>Ability to present ideas and results to technical and non-technical audiences</li></ul></p></p></p><p><strong>Why Job_Description: <strong>We are an experience design agency with a relentless focus on the customer.</strong> <br/><br/> The way a customer experiences a brand has a profound impact on perception, purchase behavior and loyalty. Thats why our work begins and ends with our clients customers. We listen to them. Validate with them. We even include them in our experience design process. We do this to create experiences that are simpler, more useful, entertaining, and convenient. Our mission is to in some way change their lives for the better. <br/><br/> <strong>Today were 950 people in 11 offices on 4 continents.</strong> <br/><br/> We are thinkers. Makers. Doers. We speak a dozen different languages and are inspired by a million different things. But no matter what our discipline is or where we are in the world, were united by a common excitement for digital thats absolute and contagious. <br/><br/> <strong>SEO Analyst</strong> <br/><br/> The SEO Analyst will be responsible for implementing SEO initiatives for client partners. They ensure that content can be found and viewed by potential and current customers. SEO Analysts play an important role in planning for marketing campaigns and provide insight into search engine optimization and user experience with digital content. <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities:</strong>  <ul> <li>Provide SEO analysis and recommendations in regards to digital presence and visibility</li> <li>Perform on-page optimization of keyword research, title and description tags, density and frequency</li> <li>Focus on data to improve site layout, functionality and conversions tied to business objectives</li> <li>Define key metrics and translate SEO results to business objects</li> <li>Research and administer social media tools in support of strategy</li> <li>Monitor and evaluate search results and performance across major search channels</li> <li>Communicate with SEO team and Management on project developments, timelines and results</li> </ul> <strong>Requirements:</strong>  <ul> <li>2-3+ Years of SEO experience with a strong technical focus</li> <li>Site audit experience</li> <li>Basic understanding of the dependencies and interconnectivity of media channels, and their effects on traffic demand and rankings</li> <li>Experience using Omniture, Google Analytics, and Coremetrics</li> <li>Strong analytical skills</li> <li>Systematic approach to identifying opportunities/issues, defining solutions and executing action plans</li> <li>Great attention to detail combined with the ability to prioritize and meet aggressive targets and deadlines</li> <li>Ability to work on multiple projects and clients</li> </ul>
Title: SEO Analyst

Job_Description: This is a chance to leverage your threat and vulnerability expertise with your flare for client engagement!<br/>  <div><strong>Join our team!</strong></div>  <br/>Prevent. Protect. Prevail. We live in a fast-paced cyber-world where protecting our information has become paramount. At TELUS Security, we strive to always be steps ahead, tackling the toughest security challenges head-on with top talent and cutting edge technology. Define your career today as a Managing Consultant with our Threat & Vulnerability Consulting team! <br/><br/> <strong>Here’s the impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together!</strong> <br/><br/> TELUS Security’s Threat & Vulnerability Consulting team has an opportunity for a dynamic individual to lead client security assessments which may include web vulnerability assessments, infrastructure vulnerability assessments, penetration testing, social engineering and WiFi Security reviews.<br/>  <div><strong>Here's how</strong></div> <br/>  <div>Each day you will take on exciting challenges…</div>  <ul>  <li>Participate in vulnerability assessments and penetration tests with TELUS clients</li> <li>Help improve TELUS overall testing capabilities through innovative ideas and approaches</li> <li>Work collaboratively with extended TELUS teams</li> <li>Develop and maintain key relationships with TELUS clients</li> <li>Continually improve your skills through formal and casual training opportunities</li> </ul> <strong>You’re the missing piece of the puzzle...</strong> <ul>  <li>Strong knowledge of vulnerability assessment practices and procedures</li> <li>Vulnerability assessment experience with any of the following: Qualys, Nexpose, Nessus, NMAP NSE, etc</li> <li>Knowledge of infrastructure vulnerability scanning including manual verification of findings</li> <li>Knowledge of information and IT security best practices</li> <li>Knowledge of social engineering and wireless testing</li> <li>Experience in penetration testing (ethical hacking) practices and procedures</li> <li>Knowledge of penetration testing methodologies (PWASP, PTES, OSSTMM)</li> <li>Goal based penetration testing, including privilege escalation, and lateral movement</li> <li>Penetration testing experience with any of the following: Kali, Metasploit, Powershell Empire, Medusa, Mimikatz, etc</li> <li>Web Application assessment with any of the following: Acunetix, Appscan, Burpsuite, SQLMap, OWASP Zap, etc</li> <li>Ability to lead projects/engagements, report writing and presentation skills; ability to clearly explain technical findings to a non-technical audience</li> <li>Ability to communicate technical threats to client</li> <li>Use of multiple security engagement tools, platforms and scripts in live client environments</li> <li>Minimum of 5 years industry experience</li> </ul>  <div><strong>Great-to-have’s...</strong></div>  <ul>  <li>Professional security certificates (i.e. OSCP, CISSP)</li> <li>Web application & Infrastructure security assessments from both an automated and manual perspective</li> <li>Penetration Testing experience</li> <li>PCI compliance knowledge and experience including the delivery of associated testing requirements</li> <li>Knowledge of PCI standard</li> <li>Knowledge of GRC standards</li> <li>Knowledge of security architecture standards</li> </ul>  <div>We are specifically looking for individuals in the Calgary, Edmonton or Vancouver areas.</div> <div></div> <div></div> <div><strong>Who is TELUS?</strong></div> <br/>  <div>We're a high-performing team of individuals who collectively make TELUS one of the leading telecommunications companies in Canada. Our competitive consumer offerings include wireline, wireless, internet and Optik TV™. We also deliver a compelling range of products and services for small, medium and large businesses; and have carved out a leadership position in the health, energy, finance and public sector markets with innovative industry specific solutions.</div> <br/>  <div>Everyone belongs at TELUS. It doesn’t matter who you are, what you do or how you do it, at TELUS, your unique contribution and talents will be valued and respected. Because the more diverse perspectives we have the more likely we are to crack the code on what our customers want and our communities need.</div> <br/>  <div>Do you share our passion?</div><br/>   <div>At TELUS, <strong>you</strong> create future friendly® possibilities.</div> <br/>  <div>At TELUS, we are committed to diversity and equitable access to employment opportunities based on ability.</div>
Title: Managing Consultant - Threat & Vulnerability Assessments

Job_Description: At MNP we pride ourselves on being different – it’s our entrepreneurial drive that sets us apart. It’s the same drive that’s helped us become Canada’s fastest growing national firm. We foster collaboration, value your ideas, promote based on talent, live balanced lifestyles and make time for FUN. We are one firm, one team, collaborating to support you wherever you want to take your career. <br/><br/> Join the momentum at MNP, as we are seeking a Consultant for our growing Cyber Security Services team. Protecting businesses’ best interests, MNP is a leading national accounting, tax and business consulting firm in Canada. Our Cyber Security team helps identify, evaluate and manage risk exposure to protect a company’s reputation and assets. Specifically, our cyber security services team identifies and addresses cyber security challenges, tests the resiliency against cyber-attacks, assists with IT governance and strategy, review and advise on defensive controls and offers advice on information security and privacy for all types of clients. <br/><br/> <strong>Performance Expectations</strong> <ul> <li><div>Deliver industry and technical expertise in information security through client interactions, reports, technical work, management presentations and the creation of high quality deliverables</div></li><li><div>Provision of client services including planning, budgeting, scheduling and coordinating engagements</div></li><li><div>Facilitate collaboration with client engagement team prior to commencement of client work to discuss roles and responsibilities, risk areas, materiality and deadlines</div></li><li><div>Identify ways to maximize the relationship with clients and deliver added value</div></li><li><div>Maintain high quality control by reviewing work done from other team members for accuracy and completeness; provide feedback to team members</div></li><li><div>Monitor project timelines against targets and adjust where necessary; advise clients of project status</div></li><li><div>Network and take a leadership role in the local professional and business community while raising awareness of MNP and looking for new business development opportunities</div></li><li><div>Contribute to the development of new ideas and approaches to improve work processes</div> </li><li><div>Assist in the development and training of team members towards professional and personal growth</div></li> </ul> <strong>Credentials</strong> <ul> <li><div>Possess a Bachelor’s Degree in computer science or a related field</div> </li><li><div>CISSP, CISA, CISM and/or other related certifications</div></li><li><div>Minimum one (1) to three (3 ) years’ of experience in security and privacy services</div> </li><li><div>Understanding and experience in the delivery of Cyber Security services (penetration testing, vulnerability assessments, TRA’s, PCI, cyber maturity assessments, cloud security, incident response/forensics, etc.)</div> </li><li><div>Understanding of Security and Privacy compliance (i.e. OSFI, Interac, PCI, PIPEDA, etc.)</div> </li><li><div>Understanding of IT security and governance frameworks (i.e.ISO 27001/2, COBIT, etc.)</div></li><li><div>Experience with architecting, configuration and delivering technology-based controls</div></li><li><div>Experience in business and practice development</div></li><li><div>Security Clearance considered an asset</div></li><li><div>Some travel required</div></li> </ul> <strong>Core Competencies and Personal Characteristics</strong> <ul> <li><div><strong>Integrity –</strong> professional whose honesty, integrity, confidentiality and high ethical standards contributes to effective leadership and optimal business relationships</div></li><li><div><strong>Energy –</strong> displays enthusiasm, optimism, drive and passion while maintaining a high level of productivity and a balanced lifestyle</div></li><li><div><strong>Diversity –</strong> understands the importance of different backgrounds, perspectives and experiences and is respectful of individual differences</div></li><li><div><strong>Communication –</strong> effectively expresses ideas and conveys information in business writing, conversations and interactions with others</div></li><li><div><strong>Client Service Excellence –</strong> understands the importance of quality client service by being courteous, responding to client requests in a timely manner and monitoring satisfaction</div></li><li><div><strong>Teamwork & Relationship Development –</strong> works collaboratively with team members in order to achieve a common goal and develops, maintains and strengthens relationships with others, both inside and outside the Firm</div></li><li><div><strong>Accountability –</strong> takes responsibility for one’s own performance by setting clear goals and tracking progress against those goals; is highly organized and uses personal judgement and decision making</div></li><li><div><strong>Flexibility –</strong> effectively manages multiple assignments, adapts to changing priorities and is able to work independently or as part of a team</div></li><li><div><strong>Work Ethic –</strong> consistently performs to high quality standards, is dependable and has a constant drive to improve</div></li><li><div><strong>Strategic Planning –</strong> analyzes the Firm’s competitive position by considering market and industry trends, existing and potential clients, and strengths and weaknesses of competitors</div></li><li><div><strong>Research & Analysis –</strong> questions inconsistencies in information and generates workable solutions by analyzing, gathering and organizing relevant information</div></li><li><div><strong>Stress Management –</strong> functions effectively when under pressure and maintains self-control in difficult situations</div></li><li><div><strong>Initiative –</strong> highly motivated self-starter who takes initiative with minimal supervision</div> </li> </ul> MNP encourages a balanced lifestyle and offers benefits that suit the way our team members work and play! In addition to a competitive salary, our total rewards package includes paid personal days, wellness program initiatives, health and dental benefits, a group pension plan with matching contribution, firm sponsored social events and professional development assistance. <br/><br/> MNP proudly serves and responds to the needs of our clients in the public, private and not-for-profit sectors. Through partner-led engagements, we provide a collaborative, cost-effective approach to doing business, with innovative strategies to help organizations succeed across the country and around the world. <br/><br/> #LI-KM2
Title: Consultant, Cyber Security Services

Job_Description: <strong>ROLE STATEMENT:</strong> <br/><br/> The Analyst, Quality Management will be a member of the Quality Management Department responsible for maintaining and improving corporate KPI reporting on operational and quality indicators and monitoring the overall integrity of the Quality Management System in regards capturing, managing and analyzing data for KPI reporting as well as document control. Reporting to the Senior Specialist, Quality Management, the Analyst, Quality Management will focus on working with both corporate and divisional groups in Canada, the USA and Latin America to capture operational and quality data, generate and distribute reports and models, maintain document and record integrity and assist with improving existing tools and systems. <br/><br/> <strong>SPECIFIC ACCOUNTABILITIES:</strong> <ul> <li>Capture and publish business procedures and supporting forms for field and corporate operations and functions</li><li>Manage capture, analysis and presentation of operational and quality data and generate and publish KPI reports</li><li>Assist with management of change processes to ensure operational changes are effectively captured, analyzed, processed and recorded</li><li>Maintain and improve the integrity of the corporate document and record control system</li><li>Assist with maintaining and improving the functionality and integrity of the corporate Quality Management reporting system</li><li>Work with IT and other departments to develop or improve solutions for data capture, analysis and recording</li><li>Assist operational staff in service quality modeling and reporting</li> </ul> <strong>HSE ACCOUNTABILITY:</strong> <ul> <li>Individual roles, responsibilities and accountabilities specific to Health, Safety and Environment at Calfrac Well Services can be located in the HSE Responsibilities and Performance Procedure (C-PR 14.0-0005). Employees are accountable to review and adhere to this procedure. The procedure is located on the Corporate HSE SharePoint library.</li> </ul> <strong>KEY ATTRIBUTES AND COMPETENCIES:</strong> <ul> <li>Well-developed analytical and problem solving skills</li><li>Background in data analysis and presentation</li><li>Strong attention to detail</li><li>Strong organization and multi-tasking skills</li><li>Ability to work within set deadlines and produce deliverables</li><li>Ability to set goals and pursue and achieve those goals independently</li> </ul> <strong>EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE:</strong> <ul> <li>Familiarity with data capture, analysis and presentation</li><li>Experience with creating and implementing statistical regressions</li><li>Understanding of KPI’s, benchmarking and balanced scorecard reporting techniques</li><li>Excellent computer skills including database applications</li><li>Post-secondary degree in business management, science or engineering</li> </ul> <strong><em>This position description represents an overview of the position and is not designed to cover all duties or requirements of the role.</em></strong>
Title: Analyst, Quality Management

Job_Description: <strong>Sr Financial Analyst, Phosphate, Calgary, AB</strong> <br/><br/> Why work at Nutrien? Great question! <br/><br/> Safety is a core value at Nutrien. Keeping every employee safe, healthy and secure is our top priority. Nothing is more important than seeing our people go home safe at the end of every single day. <br/><br/> While working here you will have the opportunity to grow your career while helping us feed the future. We pride ourselves in hiring from a variety of backgrounds and truly believe that it is our differences that make us stronger so we hope you will join us. <br/><br/> In addition to exciting and challenging opportunities, Nutrien offers competitive salaries, great benefits and performance based incentives. <br/><br/> Outside of the skills and necessary qualifications, you will be committed to sustaining our safe and positive work environment while welcoming working side by side others in a diverse culture. Culture at Nutrien is the core of everything we do and all employees are respectful of diverse opinions and views. <br/><br/> Reporting to the Director, Financial Planning & Analysis, Phosphate, you will work closely with key business partners to develop accurate business plans and short-term financial forecasts for the Phosphate and Sulfate business. <br/><br/> <strong>Key Tasks:</strong> <ul>  <li>Develop accurate short-term financial forecasts and the annual plan for the Phosphate business;</li> <li>Maintain and enhance the short-term forecasting models;</li> <li>Develop strong relationships with key business partners, including the marketing and plant finance teams;</li> <li>Support and facilitate business planning meetings with business partners;</li> <li>Ongoing financial analysis to support the business;</li> <li>Develop, maintain and complete key business partner reports; and,</li> <li>Complete ad hoc analysis, projects and initiatives as assigned.</li>  </ul> <strong>Skills:</strong> <ul>  <li>Demonstrated sense of urgency and a strong commitment to achieving deadlines;</li> <li>Excellent interpersonal, problem-solving and organizational skills;</li> <li>Strong verbal and written communication skills;</li> <li>Ability to work in a multi-tasking, deadline-oriented team environment, and interface with various levels of management and leadership;</li> <li>Ability to think strategically and an attention to detail;</li> <li>Curious, proactive and enjoy working in a collaborative, supportive team environment;</li> <li>Ability to adapt to changes in schedules and direction when necessary;</li> <li>Flexible to work extended hours to meet project timelines;</li> <li>Positive attitude and a team spirit.</li>  </ul> <strong>Qualifications:</strong> <ul>  <li>A university degree in accounting, finance, marketing or commerce;</li> <li>Professional designation (CPA, CBV or CFA) or MBA;</li> <li>6 – 8 years related and progressive work experience in a business or financial analysis role;</li> <li>Experience is designing and utilizing financial models;</li> <li>Strong critical thinking skills;</li> <li>Exceptional analytical acumen with capacity to identify, scope and solve complex problems;</li> <li>Background in business partnering with a strong desire to add value to the business, as well as a mindset for continuous improvement;</li> <li>Experience with Microsoft Word and PowerPoint, with strong skills in Microsoft Excel; and,</li> <li>Experience with SAP, Hyperion, Power Query and Power BI would be an asset.</li>  </ul> Nutrien is committed to creating an inclusive workplace. We encourage applications from all well qualified candidates who reflect the diversity of the regions where we operate. This includes recognizing the voluntary identification of status such as gender, sexual orientation, visible minority, Indigenous status, persons with disabilities, and veterans, where applicable. <br/><br/> If this sounds like a good match, apply now. This job will remain posted until filled. You may be required to undergo a background check and substance test in accordance with Nutrien policies. <br/><br/> While we appreciate all applications we receive, we advise that only candidates under consideration will be contacted.
Title: Sr Financial Analyst, Phosphate

Job_Description: Commodities and Global Markets provides clients with an integrated, end-to-end offering across global markets including equities, fixed income, foreign exchange and commodities. <br/><br/> The platform covers more than 25 markets and over 160 products, and has evolved over more than three decades to provide clients with access to markets, financing, financial hedging and physical execution. <br/><br/> Commodity Markets and Finance provides a full spectrum offering to clients with exposure to commodity markets. The division provides risk management, lending and financing, and physical execution and logistics services across the energy, metals and agricultural sectors globally. The division also offers commodity-based index products to institutional investors. <br/><br/> We are looking to hire a Senior Fundamentals Analyst to join our US Gas Trading team in Calgary. <br/><br/> Responsibilities  <ul> <li>Provide analytical support and expertise by conducting supply and demand analysis to generate trade strategies and identify market and pricing trends.</li>   <li>Primary regional focus will be Canada but an understanding of downstream influences in the Pacific Northwest, US Midwest and the US Northeast will be required. Coordination with fundamentals analysts in other Macquarie locations will be a key requirement of the job.</li>   <li>Understanding of and experience with producer influences/drivers across the Western Canadian Sedimentary basin is required.</li> <li>Design, develop and support short-term data and trading tools.</li> <li>Provide ad hoc analyses for the trading desk: Identify traders needs and provide timely and tradable analyses.</li> <li>Provide daily reports and participate in weekly meetings by providing a fundamental regional outlook.</li> <li>Utilize advance modelling techniques to determine the relationship between energy market variables.</li> <li>Provide updates on regulatory developments and analyses regarding the impact of changes.</li> <li>Investigate historical trends and analyze pricing volatility.</li> <li>Take initiative to continuously improve existing processes, tools and models with the aim of improving overall performance and reliability.</li> </ul> Requirements  <ul> <li>Bachelors degree in economics, business, finance, or other relevant degree with five or more years of natural gas market experience.</li> <li>Experience in fundamentals analysis in the natural gas sector. Expertise in Canadian markets as well as US Pacific Northwest, Northeast and Midwest markets.</li> <li>Knowledge of related commodity markets (such as electricity, oil, NGLs) would be helpful.</li> <li>Prior experience in optimization and trading activities in an energy trading environment (trading, asset optimization, risk management or portfolio analysis), preferred but not required.</li> <li>Strong Excel & VBA skills required; experience with SQL or Python a plus.</li>  </ul> Accommodation is available to all applicants to Macquarie, including during recruitment, selection and assessment processes. Please notify the recruiter listed on this posting if you require accommodation at any stage of the recruitment process. Access to Macquaries Accessibility policies is available at www.macquarie.ca
Title: Senior Fundamentals Analyst - Commodities and Global Markets

Job_Description: <strong>Position Summary:</strong> <br/><br/> Business name: Huron Advisors Canada Limited <br/> Title: Hyperion Planning Consultant (NOC 2171) <br/> Business address: Western Corporate Business Centre, Bow Valley Square 2, 205-5th Avenue SW T2P 2V7 <br/> Work location: Western Corporate Business Centre, Bow Valley Square 2, 205-5th Avenue SW T2P 2V7 <br/> Terms of employment: Permanent, Full time <br/> Hours of work: 40 hours per week <br/> Salary: $75,100.00 - $163,000 CAD a year <br/> Benefit: Eligible for bonuses and salary increases in accordance with company policy. Eligible to participate in the employee benefits program. <br/> Language of work: English <br/> Contact: cperlow@huronconsultinggroup.com <br/>  <br/> In this role, you will work with Huron and client team members throughout the entire implementation lifecycle, including planning, configuration, design, build, testing, training, and change management, go-live and post-production support. The Hyperion Planning Consultant will be responsible for all aspects of Hyperion system implementation including requirement gathering, application design, application configuration and implementation. <br/>  <br/> The Hyperion Planning Consultant will be responsible to:   <ul> <li>Develop and maintain project plans.</li> <li>Translate business needs into practical solutions.</li> <li>Build best practices within planning, forecasting and reporting processes and implementing new performance reporting, planning and forecasting processes within the Hyperion Planning toolset.</li> <li>Tune and optimize Planning and Essbase applications</li> <li>Design and build of reports using Hyperion Financial Reporting.</li> <li>Provide expertise in Hyperion Planning and/or Essbase related to outlines, calculations, load rules, Web Forms, Smart View, Partitions, Security, and application validation.</li> </ul>  <strong>Qualifications:</strong>   <ul> <li>Bachelor’s degree required; Master’s degree a plus, concentration in Finance or Accounting is preferred</li> <li>At least 6 years’ experience with Hyperion Planning and Essbase</li> <li>At least 6 years’ experience in analyzing requirements, writing functional specifications, conducting tests, troubleshooting issues and interfacing with business users</li> <li>Experience leading medium to large scale Hyperion Planning implementation projects</li> <li>Experience with Hyperion Planning and Hyperion Essbase in both development and administrative roles</li> <li>Experience with automation scripts (MaxL) and integration of the full Hyperion suite.</li> <li>Extensive knowledge of Excel, Essbase Spreadsheet Add-in and SmartView</li> <li>Excellent written and communication skills</li> <li>Extensive knowledge of financial process and functional processes</li> <li>Essbase aggregate storage experience is a plus(ASO)</li> <li>Prior team management experience, experience managing people (mentoring, delegating, reviewing work, and coaching staff)</li> <li>Willingness to travel</li> </ul>  Preferred Qualifications   <ul> <li>Familiarity with entire Hyperion EPM Suite</li> <li>Industry vertical experience</li> <li>Oracle certifications</li> </ul>  Huron Consulting Group offers a competitive compensation and benefits package including medical, dental, and vision coverage to employees and dependents; a Retirement Plan with a generous employer match; an employee stock purchase plan; a generous Paid Time Off policy; and paid maternity leave. Our Wellness Program supports employee total well-being by providing paramedical coverage through our Medical Plan, a Huron Wellness Reimbursement program and travel recognition benefit. All benefits and programs are subject to applicable eligibility requirements. <br/>  <br/> The Company is fully committed to providing equal employment opportunity in recruitment, employment, compensation, benefits, promotions, transfers, education, and all other terms of employment. Huron is an Equal Opportunity employer that encourages all qualified applicants, including women, Aboriginal peoples, persons with disabilities and members of visible minorities to apply. We endeavor to maintain a drug-free workplace. <br/><br/> <strong>About Huron:</strong> <br/><br/> At Huron, we’re redefining what a consulting organization can be. We go beyond advice to deliver results that last. We inherit our client’s challenges as if they were our own. We help them transform for the future. We advocate. We make a difference. And we intelligently, passionately, relentlessly do great work…together. <br/><br/> Are you the kind of person who stands ready to jump in, roll up your sleeves and transform ideas into action? Then come discover Huron. <br/><br/> Whether you have years of experience or come right out of college, we invite you to explore our many opportunities. Find out how you can use your talents and develop your skills to make an impact immediately. Learn about how our culture and values provide you with the kind of environment that invites new ideas and innovation. Come see how we collaborate with each other in a culture of learning, coaching, diversity and inclusion. And hear about our unwavering commitment to make a difference in partnership with our clients, shareholders, communities and colleagues. <br/><br/> We offer a competitive compensation/benefits package. Huron is an equal opportunity employer. We recruit, employ, compensate, transfer, promote and train without regard to race, color, creed, religion, national origin, sex, marital status, pregnancy, disability, sexual orientation, veteran status, age, FMLA status or any other basis protected by law. <br/><br/> <strong><div>LI:</div></strong>
Title: Hyperion Planning Consultant

The incumbent will liaison with Architecture, Information Security, Infrastructure and Database Administrators to understand the dependences and policies for data movement across the organization. <br/><br/> Essential Functions-BI Solutions Development and Testing-Perform installation, configuration and troubleshooting of off-the-shelf and custom software applications in JLL staging as well as customer test and production environments.Customize and enhance business software applications including GUI development/customization, report development, script development.Contribute to the complete software development life cycle- defining, designing, building, testing, and deploying.Assist with unit testing and quality assurance of the solution build at the various stages. Identify gaps and improvements in the proposed design and partner with Solution Consultants and Project Managers to reevaluate the design and project plan. <br/><br/> Customer Support-Analyze customer’s challenges and take a primary role in the design, development and implementation of comprehensive solutions that integrate smoothly into customer environments.Troubleshoot first and intermediate level support tickets.Identify gaps and improvements in the proposed design and partner with Solution Consultants and Project Managers to reevaluate the design and project plan. <br/><br/> Database and Report Development-Perform data management tasks and data structure modification, as well as development of data migration interfaces to integrate disparate applications/databases.Perform data mapping, data manipulation and data migration among various database systems and enterprise applications.Develop BI solutions using Tableau, Power BI, QLIK, or other platformsDevelop reports using SQL Server Reporting Services, Microsoft Access or other reporting tools. <br/><br/> Education, Certifications and Experience- RequiredUndergraduate degree or comparable work experience in relevant domain.2 – 7 years of relevant work experience.
