Title: Technical Consultant

Job_Description: <div><div>Reporting to the Business Lead, Shared Services, the Intermediate Application Analyst position is to participate in the planning, implementation and sustainment of business application solutions in support of business-critical applications including but not limited to MS Dynamics GP 2015, MS PowerBI, Azure Analysis Services, and Ceridian. They will assist business teams in the analysis, planning and implementation of efficient business, and operations solutions in support of core organizational functions and business processes. The Intermediate Application Analyst is the key contact for application incident management, root cause analysis, problem resolution and closure. On-call after business hours support may be required. <br/><br/> <strong><u>What you’ll do</u></strong> <br/><br/> As a team member, you will:  <ul> <li>Provide application technical support by investigating, troubleshooting and resolving operational application functionality related issues.</li>  <li>Manage application updates and ensure proper testing, documenting, and communications.</li>  <li>Document application problems and resolutions for future reference.</li>  <li>Document stakeholder requirements, and collaborate with all necessary stakeholders to determine scope items.</li>  <li>Configure software to meet documented requirements.</li>  <li>Test software based on Horizon North best practices and specifications.</li>  <li>Create and maintain system documentation</li>  <li>Acts as the liaison between various employees, technology and support teams</li>  <li>Develop and maintain an understanding of the business processes that rely on the supported applications.</li>  <li>Responsible for maintaining the integrity and availability of the business data while stored in IS Systems.</li>  <li>Responsible for supporting the achievement of Service Level Expectations (SLE) for supported applications.</li>  <li>Develop and maintain an effective work intake and management process.</li>  <li>Follow the development, and release of processes, procedures and systems required to accomplish goals.</li>  <li>Represent the team at various cross functional meetings and/or projects; promote existing and new programs and/or policies.</li>  <li>Participate on teams or projects which recommend, coordinate, and implement changes and/or improvements to products or systems.</li>  <li>Communicate with customers concerning issue escalation and established procedures.</li>  <li>Manage critical issues to resolution.</li>  <li>Perform other operational duties as required.</li>  <li>Comply with HNL safety policies and procedures</li>  <li>Support the company’s the vision and goals</li> </ul> <strong><u>Who you are</u></strong> <br/><br/> We are looking for high performing individuals who are:  <ul> <li>Agile and innovative individuals, who can manage in an environment of change and ambiguity to help us take bold and strategic moves in this rapidly evolving environment</li>  <li>Creative thinkers who take initiative and are capable of building, launching and managing projects/programs that drive results for our customers</li>  <li>Problem solvers with the ability to analyze and prioritize to meet business objectives</li>  <li>Collaborative team players with superior influencing skills, who build relationships easily across various stakeholder groups to move initiatives forward</li>  <li>Solid understanding of business process and supporting technologies;</li>  <li>Ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks in a high-pressure environment;</li> </ul> <strong><u>What you’ve done</u></strong>  <ul> <li>Bachelor’s degree or technical diploma from an accredited institution in Computer Science, Information Technology (IT) or related field;</li>  <li>5+ years of IT experience implementing, operating, enhancing, both packaged and custom applications</li>  <li>Experience with Financial Applications</li>  <li>Experience with implementing applications from requirements to delivery.</li>  <li>Experience with MS SQL and related reporting applications</li>  <li>Experience with MS PowerBI</li>  <li>Experience writing DAX</li>  <li>Experience supporting a medium to large Finance, HR and QHSE team.</li> </ul> <strong><u>Why us</u></strong> <br/><br/> We are industry leaders, always on the lookout for top talent. Embracing and driving change is critical to Horizon North’s success. The complexity and rate at which our portfolio is transforming has increased exponentially in recent years and we are committed to becoming a leader in the industry. As such we are relentlessly focused on innovating at every level of our business, and doubling down on the best talent to drive the company forward. It is an especially exciting time to join Horizon North. <br/><br/> Our industrial division supplies workforce accommodations, camp management services, access solutions, relocatable structures, and maintenance and utilities services. <br/><br/> Our modular construction division produces high quality building solutions for commercial and residential clients, including; offices, hotels, and retail buildings, as well as distinctive single detached homes and multi-family residential structures. <br/><br/> Because of our well diversified offering, Horizon North is uniquely positioned to meet the needs of our customers in numerous sectors, anywhere in Canada. <br/><br/> We are always looking for motivated and talented individuals who share our and are looking for people who want to build an organization they can be proud of, with growth opportunities befitting a brand that is entrepreneurial, innovative and highly competitive. <br/><br/> To learn more about this team and Horizon North, follow us on LinkedIn. <br/><br/> <em>The above statements describe the general nature and level of work being performed by individuals assigned to this classification. This is not intended to be an exhaustive list of all responsibilities and duties required of personnel so classified.</em></div> </div><div></div>
Title: Application Analyst - Intermediate

Job_Description: <div>The Alberta Electric System Operator is responsible for the safe, reliable, and economic planning and operation of the Alberta Interconnected Electric System. We provide open and non-discriminatory access to Alberta’s interconnected power grid and also facilitate Alberta’s competitive wholesale electricity market which, in 2017, had 291 participants and approximately $3 Billion in annual energy transactions. <br/><br/> The Transmission Forecast Analyst is tasked to provide dedicated forecasting and analytics support to assist transmission studies and planning decisions. This position works closely with Forecasting, Market simulation and Transmission Planning to enhence forecasting products, nodal market simulation model development, and facilitate congestion analysis application implementation. <br/><br/> The ideal candidate has a solid understanding of the Alberta electricity market, have extensive knowledge of power marekt simulation/optimzation model and will be able to quickly learn electric transmission systems and planning processes. <br/><br/> <strong>Accountabilities:</strong> <br/><br/> • Represent forecasting and analytics subject matter expertise on cross departmental connection/system study initiatives <br/><br/> • A service provider for forecasting assumptions and documents needed in transmission projects and provide sign off on key steps with regards to project filings <br/><br/> • Ongoing development of Nodal model to ensure credible nodal analytics, streamlined process and quality documentation <br/><br/> • Deliver short-term and long-term of key nodal analytics and perform nodal analysis in support of connection and system projects <br/><br/> • Support Forecasting change management initiatives <br/><br/> <strong>Education / Degree / Certification:</strong> <br/><br/> • Economics, Mathematics, Engineer, Business degree with courses in statistics, macroeconomics and energy economics preferred <br/><br/> <strong>Job Experience:</strong> <br/><br/> • 5-7 years experience in energy market research, forecasting and/or analysis, and Alberta electricity market fundamental modeling <br/><br/> • Superior computer and analytical skills, particularly with respect to running and maintaining Market Simulation models and SQL databases <br/><br/> • Strong critical thinking and problem solving skills <br/><br/> • The ability to stay current with relevant technology and innovations and market rule changes that impact job responsibilities <br/><br/> <em><strong>Applications accepted online via our careers site until May 15, 2018</strong></em> <br/><br/> The Alberta Electric System Operator, and its members, officers, employees and agents (collectively, the "AESO") is committed to protecting personal information provided to it. By submitting your personal information to the AESO for the purpose of pursuing employment with the AESO, you hereby consent to the collection, use and disclosure of your personal information by the AESO, in accordance with the provisions of the <em>Freedom of Information and Protection of Privacy Act of Alberta</em>, as amended from time to time.</div>
Title: Transmission Forecast Analyst

Job_Description: <DIV>Interested in being a part of a team that is leading the evolution of retail in Canada?</DIV> <br/> <DIV>Embracing and driving change is critical to our success. The complexity and rate at which the retail industry is transforming has increased exponentially in recent years and we are committed to being a leader in the industry. As such we are relentlessly focused on innovating at every level of our business, investing in new technologies and products, and doubling down on the best talent to drive the company forward. It is an especially exciting time to join the Canadian Tire Family of Companies.</DIV> <br/> <DIV>Sr. QA Analyst – Data Integration & Hadoop will report to the QA Manager</DIV> <br/> <DIV>The successful candidate will be accountable for working with the Data Technology & Integration project teams to help provide quality products for our business. They will also work with Project Managers, QA Analysts, Business Analysts, Developers, Architects, Vendors, and Business Stakeholders. The successful candidate in this role will ensure a high caliber of testing through execution of the testing plans and strategies. Finally, they will support the QA leaders in reporting the status of testing across all stakeholders within the CTC, FGL & Marks organizations. If this sounds like the role for you, you must have a passion for Quality Assurance & Software Testing, be excited by learning and exploration of applications, and be willing to have fun with an enthusiastic QA Team.</DIV> <br/> <strong><DIV>Responsibilities:</DIV>  <br/></strong>   <ul> <li>Define the testing strategy and approach for all integration and BigData projects in a complex & multisystem environments (including Hadoop platform)</li> <li>Manage & perform the testing activities for data integrations in alignment with the testing strategy and expectations for the quality of the project</li> <li>Create liaisons between different teams and contribute to the smooth communication between teams</li> <li>Design, implement and execute tests for ETL and Data Integration scenarios</LI>   <li>Perform Functional, Integration, Regression and End to End testing on all Data Technology projects</li> <li>Identify and assist in the resolution of testing issues, defects and Issues & risks in Jira Agile board</li> <li>Help coordinate project deliverables and resolve issues, identify dependencies and roadblocks</li> <li>Provide non-production and production environment support assistance when required</li> <li>Represent QA in different status meetings which may include project team members, business members, external vendors, leadership teams and stakeholders as required</li> <li>Provide coaching, mentoring and training to other team members on Data Technology QA framework</li> <li>Keep up to date of the latest emerging trends in the testing industry through personal research and by being an active member within the industry</li> <li>In collaboration with the QA Manager, help define ongoing quality improvement practices for CTC/FGL</LI>  </ul>  <strong><DIV>Required Skills and Experience:</DIV>  <br/></strong>   <ul> <li>Minimum 5 years of experience in a software development environment including 3 years in integration/ ETL testing (in Big Data platform)</li> <li>Demonstrated knowledge of integration testing methodologies and practices</li> <li>Experience testing in a Unix/Linux environment</li> <li>Experience working with integration tools like Tibco, Data stage, MQ, Change</li> <li>Experience working on Agile based team collaborative tools like JIRA, Bitbucket and Jenkins</li> <li>Experience developing tests in functional programming languages such as Python</li> <li>Experience testing of ETL and message queue workflows and workloads, including such tools as Apache Kafka, Nifi</li> <li>Experience testing distributed systems, including testing on the Hadoop platform and user-level Hadoop configuration and light administration skills</li> <li>Strong Hive – SQL knowledge including writing and executing queries to analyze data integrity</li> <li>Experience working in a highly integrated, multi-project environment</li> <li>Experience working with XML, jSON and EDI data formats</li> <li>Experience working with databases, including SQL Server, Oracle, Netezza and MariaDB</li> <li>Experience in planning, developing and executing Test Plans and Test Procedures and coordinating the collection of test results</li> <li>Detailed oriented personality complimented with strong analytical and problem solving skills</li> <li>Ability to communicate clearly in written and verbal communications</li> <li>Ability to work independently and as part of a team</li> <li>Excellent organizational and planning skills</li> <li>Ability to work well under pressure in a fast-paced team environment, working on multiple deliverables at the same time</li> <li>Knowledge of Retail, POS, Warehousing/Inventory, Supply Chain, or Finance industries an asset</LI> </ul>  <strong><DIV>About You:</DIV>  <br/></strong>   <ul> <li>Builds Trust and Credibility by consistently adhering to the organization’s business principles and values. Is seen as direct, truthful, and trustworthy by co-workers, vendors, and customers</li> <li>Committed to results by taking personal responsibility for achieving mutually agreed upon individual/team objectives</li> <li>Demonstrates a desire to help and serve internal/external customers to meet their needs. Is proactive, responsive, and focused on discovering, anticipating, and exceeding the customer’s needs</li> <li>Works collaboratively and cooperatively with others to achieve shared goals and objectives. Considers the wider team, function, banner or the organization and takes action or makes decisions which support the success of those groups</li> <li>Recovers quickly after change, disruptions, or mistakes and can remain productive and focused. Is adaptable and can apply lessons learned in one situation to another situation</LI> </ul>  <strong><DIV>Academic / Educational requirements:</DIV>  <br/></strong>   <ul> <li>BS in Computer Science, Engineering, Information Systems, or a Minimum of 5 years’ experience in the IT industry, specifically, as part of a team responsible for delivering software quality assurance and testing to IT projects</LI> </ul>  Canadian Tire is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace for all. We recognize that our future success depends on the perspectives and contributions of all our employees -- their diverse backgrounds, abilities and experiences make our business stronger. If you are contacted for a job opportunity, please advise us of any accommodations needed to ensure fair and equitable access throughout the recruitment and selection process. All accommodation information provided will be treated as confidential and used only for the purpose of providing an accessible candidate experience.
Title: Sr. QA Analyst – Data Integration & Hadoop - FGL Sports - Calgary, AB

Job_Description: Want to work with one of the most prestigious luxury auto brands in the world? Lexus of Royal Oak is seeking enthusiastic & inspiring leaders to join our growing team. With the growth in business we have the need for an experienced pre-owned sales professional to join our team <br/><br/> Our dealership is a brand new, state-of-the-art facility located in Calgary's Northwest Auto Mall. <br/><br/> We’re a family owned business and we place importance on our employees. <br/><br/> If you're service oriented and ready to kick start your career, we’re ready to invest in your future. <br/><br/> <strong>RESPONSIBILITIES:</strong>   <ul> <li>Approach, greet, and offer assistance or direction to any Guests who enters the dealership showroom or sales lot.</li> <li>Assist Guests in selecting a vehicle by asking questions and listening carefully to their responses.</li> <li>Explain product performance, application, and benefits to Guests</li> <li>Describe all optional equipment available for Guest purchase.</li> <li>Build strong rapport with Guest</li> <li>Perform high-quality, professional, and knowledgeable presentation and demonstration of new/used vehicles.</li> <li>Learn to overcome objections, close sales, and perform all other steps of the sales process in accordance with company standards.</li> <li>Report to the Sales Manager regarding objectives, planned activities, reviews, and analyses.</li> </ul>  <strong>REQUIREMENTS:</strong>   <ul> <li>Previous pre-owned sales experience is required .</li> <li>Comfortable with compensation based on commission sales</li> <li>Enthusiastic with high energy throughout the sales workday</li> <li>Outgoing with a friendly personality, especially while handling objections & negotiating pricing</li> <li>Guest Service oriented</li> <li>Possess strong communication skills</li> <li>Required to have a clean & valid driver’s licence</li> </ul>  Our dealership is family operated and oriented and we offer a progressive and respectable working environment. <br/><br/> We offer a competitive compensation program as well as salary plus commission program. We also offer long and short term disability, dental coverage and other benefits to be discussed at interview stage. <br/><br/> If you are goal oriented, positive, outgoing and aspire to grow with a great team, we would like to hear from you.
Title: Pre-Owned Sales Consultant

Job_Description: CAB Veterinary Tech Consultant-West <br/><br/> 14-May-2018 <br/><br/> 13-Jun-2018 <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities</strong> <br/> Delivering customer value and increasing overall business results. <br/><br/> Is the external and internal technical advocate of product brands, as well as the company brand. Promotes Elanco and its products in the veterinary field, i.e. key opinion leaders, veterinary schools, animal health technician colleges and veterinary clinics. The Veterinary Technical Consultant (“VTC”) provides technical input in case of questions; requests or complaints related to Elanco products or diseases areas. If appropriate, the VTC will conduct demonstration trials for customer and/or product registration use according to established protocols. The VTC will also be responsible for the interpretation and communication strategy of the results. <br/> With their in-depth understanding of customer needs, the VTC will support product innovation by anticipating change in market needs and preparing for the future. <br/> Support the marketing positioning of current products and claims through technical inputs, creative thinking, and experience trials and play a key role in training the sales teams through internal meetings, onboarding’s and field ride with’s . The TC will provide support for SAE’s (suspected Adverse Drug Events) investigations as required. <br/> The Technical Consultant is responsible for technical accuracy of promotional materials. <br/><br/> <strong>Day to day responsibilities:</strong>  <ul> <LI>Provide technical product and disease training, supporting the product positioning, to customers, channel partners and the sales team during onboarding and ongoing.</LI><LI>Handles technical inquiries on products requiring veterinary expertise such as off label indications, technical advice on products/clinical cases and provide scientific studies in response to specific requests.</LI><LI>Build and maintain relationships with key opinion leaders and key accounts through scheduled face-to-face interactions, and supporting the strategic planning and coordination of KOL speaking engagements.</LI><LI>Promotes company name and products at the veterinary schools, by calling on specialists and key influencers</LI><LI>Follow up on technical questions and complaints related to our product portfolio including potential adverse events.</LI><LI>Involve the Pharmacovigilance group when hearing about sAE’s according to internal SOP, and provide support for sAE investigation upon request by the Pharmacovigilance group.</LI> <LI>Support the sales team in targeted field ride-withs to provide technical coaching and veterinary clinic support</LI><LI>Responsible for the technical accuracy of promotional materials.</LI><LI>Assists in the production of technical tools and internal documents needed to support the sales force.</LI><LI>Reviews assigned trade journals and scientific symposium proceedings to make others aware of information that may impact Elanco products.</LI><LI>Develops and conducts technical presentations to a variety of audiences.</LI><LI>Assists and participates in addressing and solving issues related to competitive products and formulating responses to technical challenges that may arise.</LI><LI>Effectively communicate with management and R&D personnel on new product ideas or product improvements and provide technical advice to Sales and Marketing on ways to improve market share of Elanco products as necessary.</LI><LI>Effectively communicate with Regulatory Affairs and R&D on needed label changes on products to avoid misunderstanding or misuse of these products.</LI><LI>Work actively with the Marketing team, as needed, to help with advertising ideas, actual advertising copy and ad-editor.</LI><LI>Assist in the development and implementation of strategic brand activities.</LI><LI>Provide trade show technical support both nationally and internationally, as needed.</li> </ul>  <strong>Req ID</strong> <br/> <strong>41580BR</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Additional Skills/Preferences</strong>  <ul> <LI>Advanced degree in business or work experience as technical consultant are both positives attributes.</LI> </ul>  <strong>Additional Information</strong>  <ul> <LI>Veterinary Technical Consultant –</LI> <LI>Significant field time, 3 days per week, including overnights weekly</LI><LI>Expect travel to vary by region and time of year, overall 50-60% travel</LI> </ul>  <strong>Title</strong> <br/> Veterinary Technical Consultant – Companion Animal <br/><br/> <strong>Job Category</strong> <br/> Animal Health <br/><br/> <strong>Basic Qualifications</strong>  <ul> <LI>DVM degree required</LI><LI>Two year’s field experience (practice or commercial experience).</LI><LI>Team player with high degree of customer focus (Listening and questioning).</LI><LI>Good communication, presentation and interpersonal skills.</LI><LI>Organizational skills: ability to handle several tasks simultaneously.</LI><LI>Excellent English (both passive and active).</LI><LI>Computer literate on MS Office, Microsoft PowerPoint and Outlook (email).</LI><LI>Bilingualism (English/French) may be required depending on the geography.</LI><LI>Driving skills, and a valid provincial drivers’ license.</LI> </ul>  <strong>Company Overview</strong> <br/> Elanco Animal Health, a division of Eli Lilly Canada Inc, is engaged in the discovery, development, manufacturing and marketing of innovative animal health products. Elanco is a world leader in developing products and services that enhance animal health, wellness and performance. Elanco products contribute to the production of an affordable and abundant supply of food. Job_Description: CAB Veterinary Tech Consultant-West <br/><br/> 14-May-2018 <br/><br/> 13-Jun-2018 <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities</strong> <br/> Delivering customer value and increasing overall business results. <br/><br/> Is the external and internal technical advocate of product brands, as well as the company brand. Promotes Elanco and its products in the veterinary field, i.e. key opinion leaders, veterinary schools, animal health technician colleges and veterinary clinics. The Veterinary Technical Consultant (“VTC”) provides technical input in case of questions; requests or complaints related to Elanco products or diseases areas. If appropriate, the VTC will conduct demonstration trials for customer and/or product registration use according to established protocols. The VTC will also be responsible for the interpretation and communication strategy of the results. <br/> With their in-depth understanding of customer needs, the VTC will support product innovation by anticipating change in market needs and preparing for the future. <br/> Support the marketing positioning of current products and claims through technical inputs, creative thinking, and experience trials and play a key role in training the sales teams through internal meetings, onboarding’s and field ride with’s . The TC will provide support for SAE’s (suspected Adverse Drug Events) investigations as required. <br/> The Technical Consultant is responsible for technical accuracy of promotional materials. <br/><br/> <strong>Day to day responsibilities:</strong>  <ul> <LI>Provide technical product and disease training, supporting the product positioning, to customers, channel partners and the sales team during onboarding and ongoing.</LI><LI>Handles technical inquiries on products requiring veterinary expertise such as off label indications, technical advice on products/clinical cases and provide scientific studies in response to specific requests.</LI><LI>Build and maintain relationships with key opinion leaders and key accounts through scheduled face-to-face interactions, and supporting the strategic planning and coordination of KOL speaking engagements.</LI><LI>Promotes company name and products at the veterinary schools, by calling on specialists and key influencers</LI><LI>Follow up on technical questions and complaints related to our product portfolio including potential adverse events.</LI><LI>Involve the Pharmacovigilance group when hearing about sAE’s according to internal SOP, and provide support for sAE investigation upon request by the Pharmacovigilance group.</LI> <LI>Support the sales team in targeted field ride-withs to provide technical coaching and veterinary clinic support</LI><LI>Responsible for the technical accuracy of promotional materials.</LI><LI>Assists in the production of technical tools and internal documents needed to support the sales force.</LI><LI>Reviews assigned trade journals and scientific symposium proceedings to make others aware of information that may impact Elanco products.</LI><LI>Develops and conducts technical presentations to a variety of audiences.</LI><LI>Assists and participates in addressing and solving issues related to competitive products and formulating responses to technical challenges that may arise.</LI><LI>Effectively communicate with management and R&D personnel on new product ideas or product improvements and provide technical advice to Sales and Marketing on ways to improve market share of Elanco products as necessary.</LI><LI>Effectively communicate with Regulatory Affairs and R&D on needed label changes on products to avoid misunderstanding or misuse of these products.</LI><LI>Work actively with the Marketing team, as needed, to help with advertising ideas, actual advertising copy and ad-editor.</LI><LI>Assist in the development and implementation of strategic brand activities.</LI><LI>Provide trade show technical support both nationally and internationally, as needed.</li> </ul>  <strong>AutoReqId</strong> <br/> <strong>41580BR</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Additional Skills/Preferences</strong>  <ul> <LI>Advanced degree in business or work experience as technical consultant are both positives attributes.</LI> </ul>  <strong>
Title: CAB Veterinary Tech Consultant

Job_Description: Want to be on the leading edge? <br/> Desktop/Network Analyst   <ul> <li><em>Are you passionate about IT and helping humans get the most from their technology?</em></li> <li><em>Do you want to work in a highly collaborative company where you're learning like crazy with a team to back you up?</em></li> <li><em>Do you want to have fun working in a fast-paced setting, and know that you're making a difference?</em></li> </ul> CORE RESPONSIBILITIES:  <ul> <li>Priority #1: Help humans get their jobs done with technology;</li> <li>Configure, deploy, and support business-class equipment onsite and remotely using a variety of cutting-edge tools and technologies;</li> <li>Respond to customer-reported issues - identify problems, troubleshoot, and resolve with the support of your team;</li> <li>Recommend solutions and provide advice as required;</li> <li>Assist in design and delivery of IT projects;</li> <li>Document all activity in a clear and concise manner.</li> </ul> REQUIREMENTS <br/><br/> Bulletproof IT is growing steadily, and looking for reinforcements - people with experience supporting:  <ul> <li>Microsoft Windows-based desktops and servers</li> <li>Microsoft Exchange</li> <li>Remote Desktop Services</li> <li>Advanced firewalls</li> <li>Cloud services</li> <li>Mobile devices</li> </ul> <em>Excellent communication and people skills are as important to us as technical skills, and education and certifications are an advantage though the right experience and attitude may substitute.</em> <br/><br/> This position may be exactly what you're looking for, if:  <ul> <li>you want to be with a company that cares more about client satisfaction than "billable hours";</li> <li>you want to make a real difference instead of fighting bureaucracy and apathy all day;</li> <li>you are fed up with chaotic environments where everyone is expected to work in a vacuum, and REAL standards and best practices are few and far between;</li> <li>you want to be with a company that continually innovates and works to become something better every day.</li> </ul> With offices in Calgary and Red Deer, Bulletproof InfoTech is celebrating its 31st year as a high-end provider of Information Technology services to small and mid-sized businesses throughout Alberta.
Title: Desktop/Network Analyst

Job_Description: <strong>BDO. Because relationships matter.</strong> <br/><br/> There are many world-class accounting firms. Far fewer that offer a culture so rich in professional opportunity, personal fulfillment, and long-term growth. At BDO, we understand that exceptional service to our clients begins – and ends – with exceptional regard for our people. Because at its core, our business is not about numbers or spreadsheets, dollars or pence, but about people working with, for, and in service of others. In short, because relationships matter. <br/><br/> <strong>Position Summary</strong> <br/><br/> BDO Canada LLP is currently in the process of recruiting a Microsoft Dynamics NAV Consultant with interest in implementation consulting. This individual will be based at our Calgary office and work with our team of professionals to design, configure, train, support and implement components of Microsoft Dynamics NAV at various client sites throughout Alberta. Travel to other locations may also be required. BDO IT Solutions is a Microsoft Gold Certified partner and named Canadian Reseller for 3 consecutive years. <br/><br/> <strong>Key Accountabilities and Responsibilities:</strong> <ul> <li>Provide client support and consultation regarding issues with configurations and implementations via Help Desk function, remote support or on-site support with client</li><li>Provide support during Dynamics NAV software implementation at client sites</li><li>Provide application training for clients</li><li>Prepare client documentation and reports</li><li>On-going client support</li> </ul> <strong>Education and Professional Skills/Knowledge:</strong> <ul> <li>University Degree or College Diploma in accounting, business, or technology is desirable.</li><li>Working towards an Accounting Designation (CPA) is desired.</li><li>Experience with Dynamics NAV and Dynamics NAV certification is desired.</li><li>Experience with related reporting tools like Jet Reports is an asset.</li>  </ul> <strong>Applicants must have the following essential characteristics:</strong> <ul> <li>The ideal candidate must demonstrate by their previous work experience that they are interested in system implementation and have some background or expertise in finance, distribution, payroll, job costing and manufacturing.</li><li>Have excellent communication and interpretive skills. Communicating with clients and interpreting their needs will be a daily activity.</li><li>The successful candidate should also be an experienced Microsoft Office applications user.</li><li>Be a committed team player. The success on each project depends on the combined efforts of the implementation team.</li><li>Be well organized and able to work well under pressure both from clients and from team members.</li><li>Be flexible and adaptable to change. We implement change for diverse clients on a daily basis.</li><li>Be self-motivated. Learning new skills without prompting is expected.</li><li>Be willing to travel up to 25% out of province to the US and other countries.</li> </ul> In addition to competitive base salaries, BDO provides a comprehensive benefits plan, excellent mentorship support, opportunities for advancement and many other rewards. At BDO we are committed to the growth of our people. As part of our team, you can expect in-depth training and career development, diverse assignments and client exposure. <br/><br/> <strong>Our Vision</strong>: One Firm engaged to make a difference through valued relationships with our people, clients and communities. <br/><br/> #LI-MM1
Title: Microsoft Dynamics NAV Consultant

Over the past few years Shaw has partnered with industry giants such as Cisco-Meraki and Broadsoft to provide best in class, enterprise grade products for the SMB customer. <br/> At Shaw we believe a diverse workforce fosters diversity of thought and perspective, and more diversity means more solutions. Job_Description: <ul>  <li>Exergy Solutions is a different engineering design firm located in Calgary, Alberta. Exergy provides a unique blend of advice and skilled professionals to help customers improve their technical drawings and asset information.</li> <li>Exergy’s services include drafting as-builts, document management, field redlining, design and additive manufacturing.</li> <li>Our team is growing! We are a team of talented individuals focused on delivering consistent quality to our customers. We are looking for a document management professional that will be responsible for registering, tracking, classifying and distributing electronic and hard copy documents for our projects.</li> <li>Candidates that are flexible and willing to expand their knowledge and skills in other areas of the business operations, drafting and implementation of information management systems will be preferred.</li> </ul> <strong>Requirements</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Roles and Responsibilities</strong> <ul>  <li>Document management and control of multi-discipline drawings, with the creation of new lists and folder structures. Tracking all correspondences and transmissions.</li> <li>Learning client standards and familiarize with different transmittal and drawing tracking documents.</li> <li>Spearhead and develop electronic filing, archive system and project documentation turnover.</li> <li>Establish document control files and standards, work processes and training documentation.</li> <li>Respond to requests for retrieval of information and other general requests.</li> <li>Timely review document packages and requirements to ensure they are complete and compliant, integrated with specifications required on individual projects.</li> <li>Receive, track, file and monitor all documentation generated by drafting team, contractors and clients.</li> <li>Identify inconsistency and gaps in governing document workflow processes, requirements, or formats, and communicate findings to the team for improvement.</li> <li>Assist with project update and specific reporting. Create drawing transmittal packages for sending clients.</li> <li>Overall understanding of project delivery and management of change systems.</li> </ul> <strong>Skills and Experience</strong> <ul>  <li>6+ years document control experience.</li> <li>Accurate data entry and/or processing experience is beneficial.</li> <li>Advanced proficiency Microsoft Outlook, Word and Excel.</li> <li>Experience with Livelink, Bluecielo Meridian and other popular platforms.</li> <li>Efficiencies in responding to internal inquiries via email, phone or in person.</li> <li>Exceptional time management and prioritization skills.</li> <li>Ability to work within a team environment but also strongly self-motivated.</li> <li>Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail.</li> <li>Strong sense of responsibility and initiative is expected to drive results.</li> <li>Working knowledge of Business Intelligence reporting system would be an asset.</li> </ul> <strong>Benefits</strong> <br/><br/> Employer paid benefits program <br/><br/> <strong>**Online applications accepted only. Please do not contact us by phone.</strong>

Experienced financial planners are preferred however my client has a very comprehensive training program. My client is offering a generous initial 2 year program for higher grid payout and special bonusing for new assets transferred in. <br/><br/> The product shelf is extensive, including group and personal insurance, investments, mortgages, debt products, fee based account options. <br/><br/> My client provides Industry-leading investment tools and knowledgeable in house experts who will support you as you advise your clients. Whether it is the aspects of an investment portfolio or complex tax and estate planning matters, my client will provide a full suite of training, resources, and dedicated experts, and many other great financial, educational and professional incentives! <br/><br/> An ideal candidate for this position will have great interpersonal skills, is trust worthy, a quick learner and currently well regarded amongst their colleagues. <ul> <li>Proven track record of success in your field</li><li>Excellent communication skills</li><li>Desire to grow your own business</li><li>Ability to relentlessly pursue opportunities with tenacity</li><li>Experience in a customer service or a sales environment is an asset</li><li>Experience in marketing and prospecting a plus.</li> <li>Obtain and maintain all necessary licenses and registrations</li>  </ul>
Title: Financial Consultant

Job_Description: <p>The ROT Senior Architect Analyst is responsible for ensuring that ROT funded projects deliver enterprise suitable solutions, optimizing potential savings and reducing risk. The ROT Senior Architect Analyst will assist with the creation of business cases by identifying and documenting the business needs of stakeholders and assisting with the complicated task of estimating the costs and savings early in the project development process. By ensuring that the proposed solutions will meet the enterprise needs and not just the needs of a single group, the ROT Senior Architect Analyst optimizes the return on investment of the ROT funds. </p><p><br></p><p>Starting with eliciting, analyzing, validating and documenting business, organizational and/or operational requirements, they develop the data needed to develop the optimum IT solution. The ROT Senior Architect Analyst will also contribute to the solution development, and the data that builds the business case – estimating both costs and savings. Lastly, the ROT Senior Architect Analyst will assist with the measurement of the actual savings achieved to ensure that the ROT program financial savings estimates are being met, and that the program has accurate data to support the reporting function.</p><p> </p><p>Must be comfortable working with very large enterprise technology solutions across a wide variety of technical domains, and taking abstract, fluid solution ideas and turning them into concrete designs.</p><p>Must have outstanding interpersonal skills and deep technical fluency to allow them to complete complex tasks, to work independently with minimal coaching, and demonstrate leadership skills. </p><p> </p><p><b>What you’ll do</b></p><p> </p><p>The ROT Senior Architect Analyst will use their extensive experience coupled with formal architecture and analysis techniques and their own creativity to support the ROT program delivery. This role is primarily focused on collaborating with the 90 solution architects in the enterprise, and the senior leaders and other stakeholders to ensure that all decision making is supported with data and facts. The role has a secondary focus on supporting the program and project manager(s) as required, particularly in understanding risk and impact.</p><p><br></p><p></p><ul><li>Elicit Requirements: Anticipates, quantifies and resolves problems and issues through requirements. Done by the identification of source requirements, risk management, and development of a priority matrix. Must be capable and confident to lead requirements gathering workshops and JAM sessions</li><li>Create Requirements<u>:</u> Document: Publishes, distributes, and ensures sign-off of the business requirements. Performs impact analysis on requested changes to requirements. Assists with risk management and can use specific tools such as priority matrices, and / or formal reviews with clients</li><li>Structured Analysis: Analyzes and determines problems, opportunities, and solution resolutions. Can identify and document "as-is" state vs. "to-be" state using a variety of tools and techniques based on the project and its complexity plus facilitation of interviews to help develop a consensus about the requirements</li><li>Business Case Development: Works with ROT stakeholders to develop the business case, including solution design, estimate costs, efforts and savings. Uses a variety of tools and techniques based on the need at hand, and is able to craft solutions that are suitable for enterprise use and account for the various different needs and demands of the various SBUs and functional units across the corporation.</li><li>Change Agency: Understands process and issues inherent in change management and plans and advises the program accordingly; instills confidence and trust in others; coordinates resources across departments/units; evaluates measures, works with delivery teams to develop specific change mgmt plans and deliverables for alignment and smooth implementation; acknowledges individual’s responses to change and helps them adjust</li><li>Monitoring: Monitors changing requirements and architectural responses to problems. Uses tools such as a user acceptance strategy to ensure that all business scenarios have been validated and business requirements and their integrity are maintained throughout the execution of the project.</li><li>Results Analysis and Internal Audit: Upon project conclusion, the Senior Architect Analyst with assist the PMO in performing the internal audit to ensure that the predicted benefits (financial) have been achieved.</li><li>Business / IT Fluency: Understands the societal impact of information and information technology in the business environment. Has a deep understanding of technology and solution architecture.</li><li>Business Process Analysis: Recommends improvements to business processes. Done by ensuring business goals are met by considering all tangible and intangible costs.</li><li>Build Business Relationships: Understand the business issues and challenges of the organization and industry. Done by working closely with Business and IT to ensure a strategic partnership between Business needs and Technology solutions.</li></ul><p></p><p><b>What you’ve done</b><b> </b></p><p></p><ul><li>10 years experience in a relevant industry vertical. (Retail, Wholesale Distribution, CPG, etc.)</li><li>5 years experience in Business Analysis practice</li><li>Proven proficiency / mastery of junior and intermediate Business Analyst competencies</li><li>Experience with package (COTS) customization and deployment</li><li>Experience with Product Lifecycle, Sales Order, Retail, Supply Chain, Finance, and/or Human Capital management systems is an asset</li><li>Experience in Solution Design and Architecture is an asset</li><li>Experience with ITIL Framework and IT Service Management (ITSM) is an asset</li><li>Knowledge of both traditional waterfall and Agile project methodologies is an asset.</li><li>Experience and knowledge of solution architecture is an asset.</li></ul><p></p><p><b>Who you are</b></p><p> </p><p>Communication: Ability to formulate concepts; communication of technical information to a non-technical audience; communication of business information to a technical audience.</p><p> </p><p>Leadership: as a change agent, ability to develop and communicate change management strategies to technical and non-technical staff alike.</p><p> </p><p>Business: Knowledge of business processes; ability to have a business-oriented vision; case development; business writing; modeling techniques.</p><p> </p><p>Analytical: analytical and conceptual expertise; documentation, analysis and business requirements management techniques; object-oriented analysis; evaluation of profitability/risk; testing, verification and validation techniques.</p><p></p><ul><li>Thinking (Analytical, Systemic, Creative): Identifies and integrates the critical elements of a situation, making correct inferences from data; breaks complex problems into component parts and organizes the parts in a systematic way; uses innovation to develop novel solutions; explains to others how to understand / approach complicated problems.</li><li>Professional Knowledge: Continually enhances knowledge and skills to keep abreast of industry changes, developments and emerging issues; understands what it takes to be successful in this business; has a thorough knowledge of organization’s mission, history, stakeholders and customers.</li><li>Builds Trust and Credibility by consistently adhering to the organization’s business principles and values. Is seen as direct, truthful, and trustworthy by co-workers, vendors, and customers.</li><li>Committed to results by taking personal responsibility for achieving mutually agreed upon individual/team objectives.</li><li>Demonstrates a desire to help and serve internal/external customers to meet their needs. Is proactive, responsive, and focused on discovering, anticipating, and exceeding the customer’s needs.</li><li>Works collaboratively and cooperatively with others to achieve shared goals and objectives. Considers the wider team, function, banner or the organization and takes action or makes decisions which support the success of those groups.</li><li>Recovers quickly after change, disruptions, or mistakes and can remain productive and focused. Is adaptable and can apply lessons learned in one situation to another situation.</li></ul><p></p><p> Academic / Educational requirements</p><p> </p><ul><li>University degree or equivalent experience in Computer Science or related discipline.</li><li>Business Analysis Certification from an accredited source is an asset (CBAP® , CCBATM)</li></ul>  Canadian Tire and FGL Sports are equal opportunity employers. We are committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace for all. We recognize that our future success depends on the perspectives and contributions of all our employees -- their diverse backgrounds, abilities and experiences make our business stronger. If you are contacted for a job opportunity, please advise us of any accommodations needed to ensure fair and equitable access throughout the recruitment and selection process. All accommodation information provided will be treated as confidential and used only for the purpose of providing an accessible candidate experience.
Title: Senior Analyst, Architecture - FGL Sports

Job_Description: The ROT Senior Architect Analyst is responsible for ensuring that ROT funded projects deliver enterprise suitable solutions, optimizing potential savings and reducing risk. The ROT Senior Architect Analyst will assist with the creation of business cases by identifying and documenting the business needs of stakeholders and assisting with the complicated task of estimating the costs and savings early in the project development process. By ensuring that the proposed solutions will meet the enterprise needs and not just the needs of a single group, the ROT Senior Architect Analyst optimizes the return on investment of the ROT funds. <br/><br/> Starting with eliciting, analyzing, validating and documenting business, organizational and/or operational requirements, they develop the data needed to develop the optimum IT solution. The ROT Senior Architect Analyst will also contribute to the solution development, and the data that builds the business case – estimating both costs and savings. Lastly, the ROT Senior Architect Analyst will assist with the measurement of the actual savings achieved to ensure that the ROT program financial savings estimates are being met, and that the program has accurate data to support the reporting function. <br/><br/> Must be comfortable working with very large enterprise technology solutions across a wide variety of technical domains, and taking abstract, fluid solution ideas and turning them into concrete designs. <br/><br/> Must have outstanding interpersonal skills and deep technical fluency to allow them to complete complex tasks, to work independently with minimal coaching, and demonstrate leadership skills. <br/><br/> <strong>What you’ll do</strong> <br/><br/> The ROT Senior Architect Analyst will use their extensive experience coupled with formal architecture and analysis techniques and their own creativity to support the ROT program delivery. This role is primarily focused on collaborating with the 90 solution architects in the enterprise, and the senior leaders and other stakeholders to ensure that all decision making is supported with data and facts. The role has a secondary focus on supporting the program and project manager(s) as required, particularly in understanding risk and impact. <ul> <li>Elicit Requirements: Anticipates, quantifies and resolves problems and issues through requirements. Done by the identification of source requirements, risk management, and development of a priority matrix. Must be capable and confident to lead requirements gathering workshops and JAM sessions</li><li>Create Requirements<u>:</u> Document: Publishes, distributes, and ensures sign-off of the business requirements. Performs impact analysis on requested changes to requirements. Assists with risk management and can use specific tools such as priority matrices, and / or formal reviews with clients</li><li>Structured Analysis: Analyzes and determines problems, opportunities, and solution resolutions. Can identify and document "as-is" state vs. "to-be" state using a variety of tools and techniques based on the project and its complexity plus facilitation of interviews to help develop a consensus about the requirements</li><li>Business Case Development: Works with ROT stakeholders to develop the business case, including solution design, estimate costs, efforts and savings. Uses a variety of tools and techniques based on the need at hand, and is able to craft solutions that are suitable for enterprise use and account for the various different needs and demands of the various SBUs and functional units across the corporation.</li><li>Change Agency: Understands process and issues inherent in change management and plans and advises the program accordingly; instills confidence and trust in others; coordinates resources across departments/units; evaluates measures, works with delivery teams to develop specific change mgmt plans and deliverables for alignment and smooth implementation; acknowledges individual’s responses to change and helps them adjust</li><li>Monitoring: Monitors changing requirements and architectural responses to problems. Uses tools such as a user acceptance strategy to ensure that all business scenarios have been validated and business requirements and their integrity are maintained throughout the execution of the project.</li><li>Results Analysis and Internal Audit: Upon project conclusion, the Senior Architect Analyst with assist the PMO in performing the internal audit to ensure that the predicted benefits (financial) have been achieved.</li><li>Business / IT Fluency: Understands the societal impact of information and information technology in the business environment. Has a deep understanding of technology and solution architecture.</li><li>Business Process Analysis: Recommends improvements to business processes. Done by ensuring business goals are met by considering all tangible and intangible costs.</li><li>Build Business Relationships: Understand the business issues and challenges of the organization and industry. Done by working closely with Business and IT to ensure a strategic partnership between Business needs and Technology solutions.</li> </ul> <strong>What you’ve done</strong><ul> <li>10 years experience in a relevant industry vertical. (Retail, Wholesale Distribution, CPG, etc.)</li><li>5 years experience in Business Analysis practice</li><li>Proven proficiency / mastery of junior and intermediate Business Analyst competencies</li><li>Experience with package (COTS) customization and deployment</li><li>Experience with Product Lifecycle, Sales Order, Retail, Supply Chain, Finance, and/or Human Capital management systems is an asset</li><li>Experience in Solution Design and Architecture is an asset</li><li>Experience with ITIL Framework and IT Service Management (ITSM) is an asset</li><li>Knowledge of both traditional waterfall and Agile project methodologies is an asset.</li><li>Experience and knowledge of solution architecture is an asset.</li> </ul> <strong>Who you are</strong> <br/><br/> Communication: Ability to formulate concepts; communication of technical information to a non-technical audience; communication of business information to a technical audience. <br/><br/> Leadership: as a change agent, ability to develop and communicate change management strategies to technical and non-technical staff alike. <br/><br/> Business: Knowledge of business processes; ability to have a business-oriented vision; case development; business writing; modeling techniques. <br/><br/> Analytical: analytical and conceptual expertise; documentation, analysis and business requirements management techniques; object-oriented analysis; evaluation of profitability/risk; testing, verification and validation techniques. <ul> <li>Thinking (Analytical, Systemic, Creative): Identifies and integrates the critical elements of a situation, making correct inferences from data; breaks complex problems into component parts and organizes the parts in a systematic way; uses innovation to develop novel solutions; explains to others how to understand / approach complicated problems.</li><li>Professional Knowledge: Continually enhances knowledge and skills to keep abreast of industry changes, developments and emerging issues; understands what it takes to be successful in this business; has a thorough knowledge of organization’s mission, history, stakeholders and customers.</li><li>Builds Trust and Credibility by consistently adhering to the organization’s business principles and values. Is seen as direct, truthful, and trustworthy by co-workers, vendors, and customers.</li><li>Committed to results by taking personal responsibility for achieving mutually agreed upon individual/team objectives.</li><li>Demonstrates a desire to help and serve internal/external customers to meet their needs. Is proactive, responsive, and focused on discovering, anticipating, and exceeding the customer’s needs.</li><li>Works collaboratively and cooperatively with others to achieve shared goals and objectives. Considers the wider team, function, banner or the organization and takes action or makes decisions which support the success of those groups.</li><li>Recovers quickly after change, disruptions, or mistakes and can remain productive and focused. Is adaptable and can apply lessons learned in one situation to another situation.</li> </ul> Academic / Educational requirements <ul> <li>University degree or equivalent experience in Computer Science or related discipline.</li><li>Business Analysis Certification from an accredited source is an asset (CBAP® , CCBATM)</li> </ul>  Canadian Tire and FGL Sports are equal opportunity employers. We are committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace for all. We recognize that our future success depends on the perspectives and contributions of all our employees -- their diverse backgrounds, abilities and experiences make our business stronger. If you are contacted for a job opportunity, please advise us of any accommodations needed to ensure fair and equitable access throughout the recruitment and selection process. All accommodation information provided will be treated as confidential and used only for the purpose of providing an accessible candidate experience.
Title: Senior Analyst, Architecture - FGL Sports

Job_Description: <div>Take your career to the next step! <br/><br/> We are currently seeking an experienced SAP professional with a passion for customer service, outstanding analytical skills and a desire to be part of a winning team. This individual will be an innovator and outside the box thinker – willing to challenge norms and break through paradigms to maximize customer value.  <ul>  	<li>A dynamic problem solver with a track record for building innovative solutions</li> <li>A passion for working hand-in-hand with customers to drive lasting transformational change</li> <li>Desire to be part of a winning team in one of the fastest growing SAP practices in North America</li> </ul> We currently have a vacancy for an <strong>SAP MM Consultant</strong>: <br/><br/> <strong>Job Description:</strong>  <ul>  	<li>Analyze business requirements (e.g., functional and technical requirements, information need, business processes) by conducting information-gathering sessions with clients, analyzing the information and being able to document an accurate understanding of their business requirements and mapping of those to SAP business processes.</li> <li>Confidence and ability to make recommendations for selection of appropriate SAP business processes to meet client requirements effectively</li> <li>Functionality Testing: Knowledge of and ability to use testing methodologies, processes and tools for testing of functionality, including unit, integration, system, regression and dry run testing.</li> <li>Ability to design and develop test plans (e.g., test objectives, test cases, test data, test scripts) for executing unit, integration, system or acceptance testing in order to ensure the solution meets the business requirements.</li> <li>Develop process models based on business requirements in order to determine the completeness of the information and process components.</li> <li>Coordinate execution of project tasks in your functional area and be comfortable in working under the pressure of tight project deadlines.</li> <li>Provide support (e.g., break/fix, how to expertise, minor enhancements, monitoring, testing) for business applications or infrastructure to associates or third parties in order to maintain their productivity level (including international and fourth level break/fix support).</li> <li>Ability to deliver basic SAP training to client end-users</li> <li>Work very closely with business decision makers and end users.</li> <li>Strong oral, written and interpersonal skills</li> </ul> <strong>Required Skills and Experience</strong>  <ul>  	<li>Mid to Senior level MM experience – 5+ years</li> <li>Manufaturing Industry Experience</li> <li>Minimum 3 full life cycle implementations of SAP</li> <li>Pre-Sales support - Demos/prep and client presentations</li> <li>Ability to work in USA and Canada - We do not provide sponsorship</li> </ul> <strong>Education</strong>  <ul>  	<li>SAP Certification</li> <li>University Degree Preferred</li> </ul> Why join Illumiti? <br/><br/> At Illumiti, you will work hand-in-hand with some of the best and brightest SAP professionals in North America. You will be supported by the latest methodologies, tools and innovative thinking – all while enjoying the benefits of a close knit team and a great work environment. We take great pride in delivering unparalleled customer service and providing our customers with top value. <br/><br/> Our vision is to:  <ul>  	<li>Leverage innovative solutions to deliver business value to our customers across all stages of the Enterprise Software lifecycle;</li> <li>Develop long lasting, value based customer relationships by providing unparalleled customer service and solutions acumen; and</li> <li>Meet and exceed the expectations of our customers and our team.</li> </ul> If you are a senior SAP professional that thrives on finding solutions to complex business challenges – we want to hear from you. We offer a comprehensive benefits plan and very competitive compensation packages. <br/><br/> Take the next step in your career. Join Illumiti today! <br/><br/> <em>Illumiti is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age or veteran status. Illumiti is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.</em> <br/><br/> <em>Illumiti is committed to compliance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with disabilities Act (AODA) and Human Rights Code in the recruitment process. If you are an individual with a disability that requires a reasonable accommodation or are unable to use or access our recruitment tool as a result of your disability, you can request reasonable accommodations in the recruitment process by sending an email to accommodations@illumiti.com.</em></div> <br/>
Title: SAP MM Consultant

Job_Description: X  Travel Consultant  Calgary, AB, Canada  <div>  <div>  <b>Overview</b>  <p>We’re looking for talented and enthusiastic people to join our team of professional travel consultants.</p> <p>You must bring a progressive and innovative attitude and be up for the challenge of our rapidly growing and dynamic company.</p> <p>This is a store-front/retail opportunity, perfect to help grow your existing base of business.</p> <p>This role is a salary plus bonus position based downtown Calgary. Independent agent (commission only) opportunities also available.</p> <p>Available immediately.</p> <p>More details on request.</p>  </div>   <div>  <b>Requirements</b>  <ul> <li>Minimum of 1 year travel agency experience</li> <li>GDS experience</li> <li>Proven sales abilities</li> <li>Good decision maker</li> <li>Comfortable with ticketing through Sabre or Apollo</li> <li>Personal travel knowledge is an asset</li> <li>Excellent customer service skills</li> <li>Excellent communicator and team player</li> </ul>  <p></div></div>
Title: Travel Consultant

Job_Description: Are you a self-starter who is eager to learn? Do you enjoy building relationships with colleagues and customers? Are you enthusiastic and confident? If you answered yes to these questions, then PBS wants you!The PBS Products and Solutions Team is looking for an eager individual to join our team in the position of Junior Software Product Analyst. You will be responsible for working with a team of developers to bring our software to life, as well as be a liaison between our development department, call center and customers. You will be influential in the direction of our software. This is an entry-level position with the opportunity to grow and expand. Direct experience is not required. <br/>  <br/> Responsibilities Include; <br/><br/> Investigate, document and efficiently resolve problem and change tickets <br/> Gather and prioritize product and customer requirements, helping to define the product vision <br/> Maintain product backlog, write necessary requirements and user stories for new product features and enhancements <br/> Serve as a resource for internal teams on product questions, feature requests & other product related needs <br/> Manage multiple projects ensuring proper execution in a timely manner with exceptional quality <br/> Create, execute and validate manual test plans <br/> Work with our Product Marketing team to develop a seamless deployment process <br/> Confidently speak with customers to solve problems and uncover opportunities
Title: Junior Software Product Analyst

Job_Description: <strong>We are an experience design agency with a relentless focus on the customer.</strong> <br/><br/> The way a customer experiences a brand has a profound impact on perception, purchase behavior and loyalty. Thats why our work begins and ends with our clients customers. We listen to them. Validate with them. We even include them in our design process. By creating customer experiences that are simple, valuable, entertaining, and convenient, we deliver measurable results for some of the worlds most admired brands. <br/><br/> <strong>Today were 950 people in 11 offices on 4 continents.</strong> <br/><br/> We love diverse points of view, open minds, and people who are passionate, driven, and real. And we love all things digital, too. <br/><br/> <strong>Marketing Science Senior Analyst</strong> <br/><br/> The primary role of a senior analyst is to support the day-to-day work more independently. This requires solid contribution to at least two (2) of the five (5) sub-disciplines (tracking and measurement, data visualization, testing and evaluation, data integration and statistical modeling.) This position should have an understanding of how at least two of the other sub-disciplines fit into clients business and should continue to learn and develop in the other areas. The senior analyst will have more experience and provide guidance to less experienced analysts on daily work responsibilities and project delivery. This role will continue to learn the other sub-disciplines within Marketing Science. <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities:</strong>  <ul> <li>Solid understanding of what the data means and where it fits into the clients' business</li> <li>Well organized approach to a variety of project work</li> <li>Detail-oriented work style</li> <li>Strong time management skills to ensure accurate delivery</li> <li>Good communication skills with Marketing Science team members as well as across other disciplines</li> <li>Logical approach to analysis process that demonstrates how data lead to conclusions</li> <li>Consistent drive for collaboration with others to provide support, share skills, and learn more</li> <li>Confidently manage expectations with quick communications about project delivery and follow-up</li> </ul> <strong>Requirements:</strong>  <ul> <li>Strong attention to detail, organizational skills, and time management is key</li> <li>Top notch communication and collaboration skills are also key to success in the analyst role</li> <li>Expectations Management: a successful analyst will communicate quickly and accurately about delivery and delay, and follow up</li> <li>Intellectual Curiosity: analyst should ask the next question, and understand where our work fits in the big picture</li> <li>Logical Approach: cut a path that others can follow, and make sure your conclusions follow your evidence</li> <li>Skills Enhancement & Sharing: Keep learning, offer support, grow your comfort zone, and help the team grow and learn</li> </ul>
Title: Marketing Science Senior Analyst
