Title: Rental Consultant

Job_Description: <div> <div> <strong>Role and Responsibilities</strong> <br/> Creation of RICEF objects as per requirement. <br/> Extensive development of HR objects. <br/> Working with Functional team to understand the requirement and translating it into Technical specifications. <br/> Developing Data Conversion and Data migration programs to transform data from Peoplesoft to SAP HR. <br/> Performing Offshore-Onsite Coordination by gathering requirements from the Clients and conveying them to offshore Team. <br/> <strong>Please list 5 mandatory</strong> <strong>"</strong><strong>MUST HAVE</strong><strong>”</strong><strong> skills and experience for this requirement. Please include skills related to technical as well as domain and non-technical skills and experience as applicable to the position.</strong> <br/> Minimum 10 years of ABAP experience <br/> Minimum 5 years of experience in developing SAP HR Objects <br/> Implementation Experience in SAP HCM sub modules – Canada & US Payroll, Benefits, OM, PA and Time <br/> Willing to provide on call support on need basis.</div> </div>
Title: SAP ABAP Consultant

Job_Description: Since 1940, Dairy Queen® has been one of the world’s best known and loved brands. Based in Minneapolis, MN, International Dairy Queen Inc., (IDQ), is the parent company of American Dairy Queen Corporation. As a leading franchisor, there are more than 6,700 independently owned and operated restaurants in the U.S., Canada and 25 countries around the world. IDQ is a subsidiary of Berkshire Hathaway Inc. (Berkshire) which is led by Warren Buffett, the legendary investor and CEO of Berkshire. <br/><br/> Here at IDQ, we create extraordinary Fan experiences every day and we do this through our commitment to hiring and retaining only the best in class talent. We firmly believe that our employees are the catalyst to the success of the company where their initiative, strategic thinking, and entrepreneurial spirit are recognized and rewarded. We're looking for motivated, passionate and dedicated individuals with an inherent need and ambition to go after bigger challenges. <br/><br/> The Business Consultant provides leadership and coaching to franchisees and Operations team to achieve short and long-term company and operations objectives. This role will utilize knowledge of restaurant operations and staff resources to provide counsel and assistance to franchisee owners/operators to positively impact and improve sales, profits, operating standards and systems while maintaining or exceeding customer expectations. Protect <em>Dairy Queen®</em> trademarks while gaining and maintain support of DMA chair people and other key franchisee leadership in achieving objectives. <br/><br/> Accountabilities Include:  <ul> <li>Effectively implement and execute the Worldwide Operation’s Business Plan (Rolling 1, 2 and 3 year plan).</li>   <li>Develop and implement a district wide business plan (i.e., integrated marketing, operations, training, development and supply chain plan)</li>  <li>When and where appropriate, establish and implement effective business plans with franchise owners in the district. Provide necessary counsel and assistance to ensure the plans include specific objectives and strategies in support of DQCI’s Operations and Marketing Plan. Monitor progress and goal achievement status.</li>  <li>Provide leadership in developing and managing marketing performance through effective partnerships with appropriate departments, vendors and franchisees.</li>  <li>Responsible for positioning franchisees for consistent achievement of optimal shift management, food safety, quality, service, cleanliness, repair and maintenance, and atmosphere goals as established by Operation’s Business Plan and DQCI’s operating standards.</li>  <li>Where appropriate and available, determines financial status of select franchisees and monitors for progress. Provides impactful advice and counsel to position franchisees for optimal financial health.</li>  <li>Provide leadership in assisting with successful new restaurant / store openings. Provide training support from equipment install through opening and on-going consulting support to achieve our desired ROI.</li>  <li>Implement strategies to assist franchisee in executing human resource, training and professional development plans and programs, where appropriate.</li>  <li>Partners with appropriate DQCI’s staff to help position new and existing franchisees to establish and execute effective development, reinvestment, and renewal strategies.</li>  <li>Responsible for monitoring consistent execution and delivery of company strategies to ensure food safety, menu compliance, trademark protection and DQCI standards.</li> </ul>  <strong>Required Skills</strong>   <ul> <li>Excellent written and verbal communication skills, proficient in Microsoft Word, Excel and PowerPoint</li>  <li>Relationship building skills with the ability to create mutually beneficial relationships with both internal and external clients and ability to provide excellent customer service to both internal and external clients</li>  <li>Strong ability to multi-task and prioritize multiple projects and requests simultaneously, within an intense, deadline-driven environment</li>  <li>Ability to work on evenings and weekends, as necessary, to meet business needs</li>  <li>Frequent <em>(4+ hours per day)</em> communication via telephone and email</li>  <li>Ability to travel 2 - 4 weeks per month for franchisee and staff meetings/visits</li>  <li>Ability to drive an automobile for franchisee and staff meetings/visits which may require sitting in vehicle up to 8 hours per day and the ability to travel by air</li>  <li>Ability to stand on concrete or tiled floors for up to 8 hours per day</li>  <li>No food or beverage allergies that would prevent you from tasting products or working in and around a <em>Dairy Queen®</em> or <em>Orange Julius®</em> restaurant environment</li> </ul>  <strong>Required Experience</strong>   <ul> <li>Bachelor’s degree in business, restaurant management or a related field or equivalent restaurant operations experience</li>  <li>4 or more years of restaurant management (multi-unit/high volume preferred) and/or franchise operations management (or an equivalent combination of education and experience)</li>  <li>A clean driving record and ability to be insured to drive a car are required</li>  <li>Thorough knowledge and familiarity with the Restaurant Industry (QSR preferred) and restaurant operations</li> </ul> Comprehensive benefits package including Employer paid Medical, Dental, Vision and Basic Life Insurance, Retirement Savings Plan, paid vacation, sick and holiday time, tuition reimbursement and more! <br/><br/> Job Location <br/> Calgary, CA-AB <br/>
Title: Business Consultant

Job_Description: <div><div> <p><strong>Junior Sales Consultant</strong></p>  <p>LASIK MD is a national provider of laser vision correction and intraocular lens implant procedures. Since first opening our doors more than 17 years ago, it’s been our mission to encourage people to discover clear vision with our safe, affordable, and life-changing procedures. Today, we operate more than 30 clinics across the country, from St-John’s, Newfoundland, to Victoria, British Columbia. As a business, LASIK MD is stronger than ever, continually growing and evolving to meet an increase in demand. We’re made up of a team of dedicated employees, people who value the work they do because it means they can help others discover freedom from glasses and contacts. At LASIK MD, we work better together—and we want you to be a part of our team. <br>  </p>  <p><strong>Your mission</strong></p>  <p>Reporting directly to their clinic Center Director & Regional Supervisor, the Junior Sales Consultants’s main responsibility is to provide outstanding customer service while achieving their surgery booking-to-completion objective. The Junior Sales Advisor is relied upon to help manage the surgery schedule by ensuring both quality and consistent bookings while also executing strong retention techniques. </p>  <p> </p>  <p><strong>Responsibilities </strong></p>  <ul> <li>Maintain and exceed personal and clinic target “sales” objectives</li> <li>Uphold outstanding customer service</li> <li>Provide accurate information to patients regarding surgery pricing & available plans</li> <li>Manage and address patient questions in a timely manner</li> <li>Accurately complete all administrative tasks</li> <li>Update and ensure accuracy of appointment scheduler, phone system, as well as all necessary tracking reports</li> <li>Complete financing applications when required</li> <li>Participate and contribute to bi-weekly meetings</li> <li>Keep up to date on operational memos and policies</li> <li>Maintain functioning knowledge of at least 1 to 2 other clinical positions</li> <li>Any other tasks requested by Center Director or Regional Supervisor</li> </ul>  <p><strong>Required skills </strong></p>  <ul> <li>Excellent communicator; both written and verbal</li> <li>Strong customer service & sales background would be essential (minimum 2 years)</li> <li>Exceptional multi-tasking & organizational skills</li> <li>Results driven / goal oriented and ability to execute quickly</li> <li>Persuasive communication skills with strong problem solving abilities</li> <li>Proficiency with Microsoft Office (Excel, Outlook, Word)</li> <li>Ability to work as a team and autonomously</li> <li>Excellent use of judgment</li> <li>Interest in the health care or health services field</li> </ul>  <p> </p>  <p><strong>Position details </strong></p>  <p>This is a permanent, full-time position. We offer a competitive compensation, bonuses and benefits. Candidates must be willing to work 40 hours per week, on a flexible schedule (days, evenings and weekends). A full training is given to all new hires. LASIK MD will also give you the opportunity to learn new skills and make a difference in people's lives on a daily basis!</p>  <p> </p>  <p><em>We thank all candidates for their interest but we will only communicate with the candidates selected for an interview.</em></p>  <p> </p> </div></div><div><div> <br></div></div>
Title: Junior Sales Consultant

Job_Description: Why work for The Body Shop <br/><br/> As part of the LOreal Group, The Body shop is a major international beauty retail business. To bring our stores and products to life, we have a team of exceptional individuals working tirelessly behind the scenes. <br/><br/> If there is such a thing as the it factor in business, it is at The Body Shop, where you will discover how to work in a fast paced, energized work environment, helping to ensure our customers receive the best beauty products on the market. <br/><br/> As a Customer Consultant you will be responsible for meeting sales goals as set forth by the Shop Manager using corporate guidelines. Also, responsible for completing all sales support duties as assigned by the Shop Manager. The customer consultant will ensure that all actions maintain the customer as number one priority at all times. <br/><br/> <strong>Key Accountabilities:</strong> <br/> Consistently achieves sales goal as set forth by the Shop Manager. <br/> Maintains high standards of customer service. <br/> Aggressively achieves all event, promotion, and contest goals. <br/> Understands the product and communicates this understanding to the customer. <br/> Completes all assignments while maintaining the customer as the number one priority. <br/> Reads and comprehends all corporate communications and training materials. <br/> Demonstrates a positive and enthusiastic style aiding in an atmosphere of achieving results. <br/> Possesses a high standard of personal image and style in compliance with corporate guidelines. <br/> Maintains a high level of professionalism at all times. <br/> Helps management team to maintain merchandising presentation within corporate guidelines. <br/> Assists in maintaining excellent standards for housekeeping. <br/> Possesses a pride of ownership in the shop. <br/> Reports any security problems to Shop Manager. <br/> Adheres to all Loss Prevention policies and procedures. <br/> Adheres to all company policies and procedures as outlined in all shop manuals. <br/> Responsible for maintaining the ethical standards of The Body Shop including minimizing the environmental, health and safety risks in the workplace. Report potential risks, near misses and real accidents to relevant managers <br/><br/> Experience and Qualifications <br/> Prior customer service experience preferred <br/> Ability to serve customers in a courteous and professional manner <br/> Dependability <br/> The above information has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed within this career opportunity. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities and qualification required of a staff member. <br/><br/> The Body Shop International plc. is an equal opportunities employer and positively encourages applications from suitably qualified and eligible candidates regardless of sex, race, disability, age, sexual orientation, gender reassignment, religion or belief, marital status, or pregnancy and maternity. <br/><br/> About the Brand <br/><br/> The Body Shop International plc, the natural and ethical beauty brand, is uncompromising in its adherence to its Values. We strive for the perfect marriage of creative, innovative and effective products with strong integration of our Values. This continues to differentiate our Brand for 300 million customers worldwide, transgressing cultural and national points of difference everywhere. <br/><br/> We have over 2,700 stores in over 66 countries and territories worldwide. We continue to reach out to customers around the world through opening new stores, launching e-commerce sites, opening sub-franchise businesses and identifying selective wholesale in new markets plus adding new Global Travel Retail locations around the world. <br/><br/> Natural, sensorial and ethical: these are truly the Values that resonate with consumers in the 21st century and this is perfectly aligned with the Brand Values that have been in place at The Body Shop for more than 35 years. Our Values are against animal testing, support community fair trade, activate self-esteem, defend human rights and protect our planet. <br/><br/> We also have our own charity, The Body Shop Foundation. Launched in 1990 (registered charity no. 802757) we give financial support to pioneering, frontline organizations that otherwise have little hope of conventional funding. The Foundation's focus is to assist those working to achieve progress in the areas of human and civil rights, environmental and animal protection. <br/> Find out more about our parent company online at: http://www.loreal.com
Title: Customer Consultant

Job_Description: <div>The Senior Business Analyst, HR Operations is a valued partner providing expert level analysis supporting HRMS System projects and programs, defining and delivering solutions that meet business objectives and will serve as a facilitator between the HRMS Operations Team, IT, HR Programs and the business while influencing and balancing the needs of all parties with an end goal to ensure accurate employee records.</div> <br/> <div>The Ideal candidate has a natural passion for project management, data integrity, and collaborating with various stakeholders while acting as the departmental HRMS subject matter expert. The Sr. Analyst will inspire the team to grow their problem solving, root cause analysis, and consultative skills to the fullest potential, ensuring risks and issues are viewed as opportunities to learn and improve team efficiency and effectiveness.</div> <br/> <div>Working in partnership with project managers, HR program owners, Payroll, IT teams, and business stakeholders, the Senior Business Analyst will lead the execution of system implementation planning, mass changes, creation of test cases, and team analytical support.</div> <div></div><div><strong>Responsibilities</strong></div><div>  <ul> <li>Lead HR Operations Team Project Management and System Implementations including annual projects, activities, and initiatives as assigned.</li><li>Play a key role in the development of departmental scorecards with a view to learn and improve team efficiency and effectiveness.</li> <li>Lead requirements gathering, milestone planning and change management of key HRMS Projects.</li><li>Facilitate or participate in JAM sessions to refine scope into a project’s initial requirements and high-level project design, producing appropriate documentation.</li><li>Work with other Business Analysts and cross departmental project team members to prioritize project tasks and help to define acceptance criteria for testing efforts.</li> <li>Coordinate and oversee the work of other BAs as it relates to a specific project</li><li>Provide superior support to the HR Operations Manager, Senior Management and the HR Operations team on all matters related to HRMS data projects</li><li>Build all HR Operations business cases and initiative requirements</li> <li>Plan and execute all annual and adhoc mass data changes as per requirements</li> <li>Lead all business wide employee data reorganization initiatives</li><li>Lead senior leader employee data organization and reporting relationship initiatives</li><li>Act as bridge between HR and IT teams, ensuring common understanding and alignment on data project requirements, conveying requirements with clarity and precision</li> <li>Responsible for creating, refining and maintaining data project tests and tasks associated deliverables such as process flows and test cases</li> <li>Facilitate employee data problem-solving discussions and general communications between the HRMS Operations Team, IT, Payroll, and HR itself</li></ul></div> <br/> <div><strong>Who you are</strong></div><br/>  <div><strong>We are looking for high performing individuals who are:</strong></div><div>  <ul> <li>Agile and innovative and able to operate in an environment of change and ambiguity to help us take bold and strategic moves in this rapidly evolving environment</li><li>Creative thinkers who take initiative and are capable of building, launching and managing projects/programs that drive results</li> <li>Problem solvers with strong judgement, decision making, and influencing skills with the ability to analyze and prioritize to meet business objectives using their highly effective time management skills while working within tight timelines on multiple ongoing projects</li><li>Collaborative team players with superior influencing skills, who build relationships easily across various stakeholder groups to move initiatives forward</li> <li>Solid project managers with a strong understanding of a formal project management methodology in order to effectively work on cross-functional projects.</li> <li>Strong knowledge of business process design, mapping and optimization</li><li>Strong interpersonal and communication skills</li> <li>Strong planning and organizational skills, ability to prioritize, meet time commitments</li></ul></div> <br/> <div><strong>What you have done</strong></div><div>  <ul> <li>Strong experience with VIP HRMS Systems</li><li>Senior level experience with techniques and tools relevant to data analysis using MS Excel. Expertise required with macros, pivots, excel formulas, SQL, VBA.</li><li>Proven ability to make recommendations based on the interpretation of analysis.</li><li>Strong knowledge of Human Resources.</li> <li>Experience with PeopleSoft HR Systems is a plus.</li><li>University degree or equivalent</li><li>Minimum of 3 years of experience as a Business Administrator or Analyst in a project-based environment</li> <li>Understanding and experience with HR systems and processes</li><li>Strong knowledge of project software administration, methodologies/techniques</li> <li>Excellent verbal and communication skills.</li><li>Proficiency in written English and good documentation skills.</li><li>Good interpersonal skills.</li><li>A willingness to provide off-hours support as required</li></ul></div>  <br/>Canadian Tire is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace for all. We recognize that our future success depends on the perspectives and contributions of all our employees -- their diverse backgrounds, abilities and experiences make our business stronger. If you are contacted for a job opportunity, please advise us of any accommodations needed to ensure fair and equitable access throughout the recruitment and selection process. All accommodation information provided will be treated as confidential and used only for the purpose of providing an accessible candidate experience.
Title: Senior Analyst, HR Operations - Canadian Tire Corporation

Job_Description: The Senior Consultant will be responsible for evaluating and managing new initiatives and business opportunities. Oversees market analysis, monitors competitive activity, and identifies customer needs. Provides leadership in planning, designing, and implementing business plans with information technology strategies. This requires understanding of a customer’s business and requirements. Focus is on offering solutions as they relate to the future business environment and helping conceptualize the means to apply information technology as an asset. Creates process change by integrating new processes with existing processes. Recommends and facilitates business improvement programs. <br/> Provides support to customers on the integration of systems in a senior consultant capacity. Defines the scope of system integration by understanding the customer’s issues and conceiving deliverables. Participates and leads development in both business and technology strategies by utilizing knowledge of industry trends and key issues. Regularly interacts with executives. Provides primary leadership in the initiation and management of integrated business and technical solutions for the most complex business problems. Exercises judgment within broadly defined practices and policies in selecting methods, techniques and evaluation criteria for obtaining results. Requires 6-10 years of related work experience and Bachelor’s/Master’s degree, technical training, or equivalent combination of education and experience. Experience desired in business analysis, consulting, organizational design, process re-engineering, or technology. <br/> <strong>#LI-AK1</strong> <br/> <strong>Responsibilities</strong> <br/> You will work on the implementation that include the Company Unified Communications and Contact Center express platforms. This would include Company Unified Communications Manager, Company Spark, Company Unity Connection and other related applications and services. Experience integrating into legacy PBXs and other systems is required. <br/> You will work on the implementation that include the Company security and networking platforms. <br/> Company Certified (CCNP) Networking/Security or CCIE R/S or Security is highly desired. <br/> Senior Consultant must be use to working with Solution Architects and take a leadership role in the implementation and configuration of Company networking and security solutions. <br/> Ideal candidates will have experience deploy Company networking and security technologies such as Company ISE, Company Firepower, Company ASA, and Company Prime. In addition experience with Company ACI, iWAN, routing and switching will be preferred. <br/> Ideal candidate will have significant knowledge and experience implementing and deploying complex security and networking environments. <br/> Must be a self starter and be able to run and lead up projects in the Calgary area.
Title: Senior Consultant

Job_Description: <div> <div> Apply Now</div> </div><br/>  <div> <div> <strong>SAP B1 Implementation Consultant - Canada Central region <br/> Full Time / Permanent</strong> <br/> <strong>Location: Calgary, AB</strong> <br/><br/> Vision33 Inc. (www.vision33.com) is the number one global value added reseller (VAR) for SAP Business One. Vision33 helps growing enterprises challenge their business processes and find efficiencies that help them attain goals and achieve their vision for growth and success. As an SAP gold channel partner, Vision33 services over 700 customers across the globe; providing each with the right balance of software, world-class consulting and support services. As an SAP Business One Implementation Consultant, you will have the opportunity to work alongside some of the brightest minds in the ERP consulting industry. <br/><br/> <strong><em>You will be responsible for:</em> </strong>   <ul>  	<li>Providing implementation consultation, project management, and support services during SAP Business One installations, upgrades and customizations</li> <li>Recognizing and addressing gaps between SAP Business One solutions and the business practices of the clients</li> <li>Effectively communicating and building consensus with clients</li> <li>Supporting the preparation of the scope of work by providing task/time details</li> <li>Designing and conducting master data migration from legacy systems into SAP Business One</li> <li>Training, coaching, and mentoring Junior Implementation Consultants</li> <li>Developing and maintaining expert knowledge of SAP Business One</li> <li>Achievement of individual billable utilization targets</li> </ul>  <strong>Ideal candidates would possess the following qualifications:</strong>   <ul>  	<li>A Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Business (Accounting) and/or Information Systems from a recognized post-secondary institution</li> <li>Excellent communication skills, both written and oral</li> <li>Superior people skills; team-oriented, fast learner and very personable</li> <li>Self-motivated and driven to achieve success within a consulting environment</li> <li>Experience in an ERP implementation role with SAP Business One preferred, but not required. We are looking for motivated individuals to join our energetic team of professionals. If you want to get involved in an environment where you can really make a difference and where you can apply your knowledge to achieve results and work with an award-winning SAP Business Partner; please submit an online application today.</div> <br/> <div> <div> <div>Recruitment Team <br/> www.gzed.com</div></div> </div> </div>  <br/>

Job_Description: <div><strong>Recruitment Consultant – Temporary Administration & Accounting Business Development</strong></div><br/> <div>Have you ever considered Recruitment as a career? Your dream job may be helping someone else find theirs! Good recruiters do more than just match people with jobs; they are problem solvers, well positioned to make recommendations and consult with clients and candidates.</div><br/> <div>David Aplin Group is looking for the best and the brightest to join our highly experienced team of recruiters. We welcome both experienced recruiters who may be looking for a change as well as those from outside of our industry with the aptitude and attitude to succeed in what is a highly rewarding career. Headhunting as a career can appeal to professionals with a combination of people skills and a knack for persuasion and sales. Your job will be to build, develop and sustain relationships with clients as well as identifying talent and managing an in-depth recruitment process.</div><br/> <div><strong>What the role entails</strong></div><ul> <li>Identifying, developing, and securing clients who could benefit from Aplin’s services across both temporary and contract recruiting opportunities</li><li>Employing sales, business development, networking, and marketing techniques in order to attract business from potential clients</li><li>Visiting with clients to build and develop relationships, in order to gain a good understanding of companies, their industry, and their work culture</li> </ul>  <div><strong>What you can expect from David Aplin Group</strong></div><ul> <li>An office culture that is second to none. Our group has developed a truly supportive culture and strong business ethics where the success and happiness of all team members are at the forefront</li><li>Flexible salary structures that incentivize and reward high performance</li><li>Along with our compensation plan -- widely regarded as one of the best in the industry we are innovative in our approach to work/life balance. As an example, in addition to the standard 3 weeks’ vacation, we offer additional days based on performance up to a maximum of 12 per year</li><li>A strong benefits program including both life and health insurance</li><li>A structured and continuous training program to allow you to reach your potential and to give you the tools to succeed. This will be tailored based on experience and requirements</li> </ul>  <div><strong>What do you need to succeed?</strong></div><div></div> <br/> <div><strong>Along with a positive, go-getter attitude, you will have:</strong></div><ul> <li>Experience with temporary and contract recruitment</li><li>Strong negotiation skills</li><li>An ability to build and cultivate lasting relationships with clients</li> <li>Strong organizational skills alongside outstanding interpersonal, communication and time-management skills</li><li>A hardworking, self-motivated and ambitious approach</li><li>An ability and willingness to listen effectively</li> </ul>  <div>If the above sounds like it could be you then follow the link below to send us your resume. We look forward to hearing from you!</div><br/> <div>If you are interested in this position and meet the above criteria, please click the Apply button to send your resume in confidence directly to <strong>Peter LeGeyt</strong><strong>, Partner, Accounting & Finance.</strong> Visit our website at www.aplin.com to view our job opportunities, career tips, and tools. We thank all applicants; however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted. <br/><br/> <strong><em>WE APPRECIATE YOUR INTEREST IN DAVID APLIN GROUP.</em></strong> <br/><br/> <em>If this is your first introduction to us, we invite you to become one of our satisfied candidates. David Aplin Group has been Canadian owned since 1975. Our professional consultants are passionate about helping you find a fulfilling job or career and ensuring your complete satisfaction with our process. Our proven track record, nearly four decades long, is largely due to our team of highly skilled and successful specialists. Through superior service and a commitment to long-term relationships, we provide deep specialization in core areas for complete recruiting and HR solutions across Canada - all from one source. We look forward to exceeding your expectations!</em> <br/><br/> <em>Learn more about David Aplin Group and view all of our current job opportunities, career tips, and tools at www.aplin.com.</em></div>
Title: Recruitment Consultant

Job_Description: <div> SQL Report Writer / Dev Support Analyst<br/><br/><strong>Reports to</strong> <br/><br/> Manager of Information Technology <br/><br/> <strong>About International Fitness Holdings</strong> <br/><br/> International Fitness Holdings (IFH) is the parent company of World Health, Spa Lady and Bankers Hall Club. With 17 locations in Calgary and Edmonton, we have been inspiring Albertans to live a healthy and active lifestyle for the last 30 years. <br/><br/> <strong>Location</strong> <br/><br/> This position is based out the IFH head office located in North West Calgary (Edgemont). <br/><br/> <strong>Summary</strong> <br/><br/> The SQL Report Writer and Support (IT) position is a fantastic opportunity for a candidate that is beginning or in the early stages of their career. The successful candidate will perform a variety of data analysis and development tasks against our relational databases and produce detailed findings that will drive key business decisions. Analysis will be in the form of reports built using Microsoft Excel, SQL Server, and SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS). Additionally, the successful candidate will demonstrate an interest in applications development, programming and support. They will become an expert on our club management software as they will be required to configure and support the application on a regular basis, thereby ensuring that it is addressing the organization’s needs. <br/><br/> <strong>Key Accountabilities</strong>  <ul> <li>Acquiring and transforming raw data into meaningful and useful information for ad hoc and ongoing business needs.</li> <li>Working closely with the senior staff in gathering requirements for analysis and reporting.</li> <li>Responsible for requirement analysis, design, development, and deployment of business intelligence and analytical solutions.</li> <li>Communicating findings of analysis in non-technical language.</li> <li>Working with the operational group to understand current and historical business practices.Member Experience</li> <li>SQL database development and internal applications support.</li> <li>Maintaining and updating club management software.</li> <li>Serving as a Subject Matter Expert (SME) for club management software related inquiries.</li> <li>Other duties as assigned.</li> </ul> <strong>Required Experience</strong>  <ul> <li>A diploma or certificate in Computer Science or Business Intelligence and Analytics’ or Information Technologies or equivalent experience.</li> <li>Must be adept at queries and/or report writing – T-SQL, and SQL Server Reporting Services.</li> <li>Have exposure to modern programming languages such as Java, C#, etc</li> <li>Must love data analysis and finding out the ‘truth’ through rigorous and in-depth research and analytics.</li> <li>Experience writing reports using SQL Server Reporting Services and Microsoft Excel (macro development / VB scripting).</li> <li>Experience in Business Intelligence projects including Financial Data analysis would be an asset.</li> <li>Proficiency in summarizing analytics and conclusion according to the audience.</li> <li>Strong interpersonal and communication skills to interact with different levels and types of users.</li> <li>Understanding stakeholder’s business requirements and transforming these requirements into meaningful information and reporting.</li> <li>Strong multi-tasking and prioritization skills, with minimal supervision, for an ever-changing, fast paced environment.</li> </ul> <strong>Benefits</strong>  <ul> <li>Health, Dental, Paramedical (Massage, Chiropractor, etc.) for full-time employees.</li> <li>Complimentary gym membership for yourself and a friend or family member.</li> <li>Career advancement opportunities.</li> <li>Community involvement and philanthropy.</li> </ul> Due the volume of candidates, only those selected for an interview will be contacted. <br/><br/> Apply Now</div>
Title: SQL Report Writer / Dev Support Analyst

From delivering sales presentations and product demonstrations, to developing detailed installations or system integration plans, we ensure customers get the innovative, relevant, interoperable solutions they need. <br/><br/> <strong>Key Responsibilities:</strong> <ul> <li>Manages all activities of the pre-sales resources. In conjunction with sales and Services management develops strategies to direct resources toward the largest and most profitable</li> <li>As a business partner with sales management, manages the organizational effectiveness, efficiency, and alignment of all technical resources with clear divisional services bookings and product revenue goals.</li><li>Provides advice and counsel to sales management in the effective use and deployment of technical resources.</li><li>Must maintain close alignment with sales, Services Delivery management, and other management functions</li><li>Insures that sales and technical organizations are properly aligned to achieve objectives and TCE.</li><li>Management of the technical resource plan for the District Inspects configuration and documentation of software, hardware and service solutions to meet customer and sales objectives.</li><li>Ensures compliance of presales documentation. Internally qualifies sales opportunities in the terms of customer technical requirements, competition, decision making process and funding.</li><li>Orchestrates and leads District Sales and Services Leadership Meetings</li> </ul> <strong>Essential Requirements</strong> <ul> <li>10+ years of applicable industry experience with minimum 2 years in a management or leadership role</li><li>University degree in a technical discipline ideal</li><li>Detailed product knowledge</li><li>Previous hands-on experience in the data center environment, with expertise spanning storage, BRS, virtualization, convergence, Cloud and/or Big Data</li><li>Customer focused.</li><li>Communication skills.</li><li>Ability to work effectively with senior management.</li><li>Ability to manage in a matrix environment.</li><li>Ability to influence others to achieve results.</li> </ul> <strong>Benefits</strong> <br/> We offer highly competitive salaries, bonus programs, world-class benefits, and unparalleled growth and development opportunities all to create a compelling and rewarding work environment. <br/><br/> If you have the technical skills to take our sales to the next level, this is your opportunity to develop with Dell. <br/><br/> Dell is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. Dell will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics. Learn more about Diversity and Inclusion at Dell here.

Job_Description: <strong>SAP B1 Implementation Consultant - Canada Central region <br/> Full Time / Permanent</strong> <br/> <strong>Location: Calgary, AB</strong> <br/><br/> Vision33 Inc. (www.vision33.com) is the number one global value added reseller (VAR) for SAP Business One. Vision33 helps growing enterprises challenge their business processes and find efficiencies that help them attain goals and achieve their vision for growth and success. As an SAP gold channel partner, Vision33 services over 700 customers across the globe; providing each with the right balance of software, world-class consulting and support services. The companys broad global presence builds upon its local market insight from sales offices and US headquarters in Irvine, California; Canadian headquarters in Vancouver, British Columbia; and UK headquarters in London, England. <br/><br/> Vision33 offers enterprises access to the worlds largest and most experienced team of SAP Business One consultants and is consistently honored for its customer dedication, earning the prestigious 2016 SAP® Pinnacle Award in the customer choice category. <br/><br/> We have an immediate need for a talented <strong>SAP B1 Implementation Consultant</strong> to support our growing customer base. As an SAP Business One Implementation Consultant, you will have the opportunity to work alongside some of the brightest minds in the ERP consulting industry. <br/><br/> <strong><em>You will be responsible for:</em> </strong>   <ul> <li>Providing implementation consultation, project management, and support services during SAP Business One installations, upgrades and customizations</li>  <li>Recognizing and addressing gaps between SAP Business One solutions and the business practices of the clients</li>  <li>Effectively communicating and building consensus with clients</li>  <li>Supporting the preparation of the scope of work by providing task/time details</li>  <li>Designing and conducting master data migration from legacy systems into SAP Business One</li>  <li>Training, coaching, and mentoring Junior Implementation Consultants</li>  <li>Developing and maintaining expert knowledge of SAP Business One</li>  <li>Achievement of individual billable utilization targets</li> </ul>  <strong>Ideal candidates would possess the following qualifications:</strong>   <ul> <li>A Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Business (Accounting) and/or Information Systems from a recognized post-secondary institution</li>  <li>Excellent communication skills, both written and oral</li>  <li>Superior people skills; team-oriented, fast learner and very personable</li>  <li>Self-motivated and driven to achieve success within a consulting environment</li>  <li>Experience in an ERP implementation role with SAP Business One preferred, but not required. (Also beneficial would be implementation experience in SME space with other products such as Microsoft Dynamics, Sage, Epicor, and/or Netsuite)</li>  <li>Experience with software implementations, operational accounting, product distribution and fulfillment, warehouse management, manufacturing, or other applicable business processes.</li>  <li>Experience with MSSQL Server query development/tuning, HANA database engine, Crystal Reports development, data migration, or functional software integration design.</li>  <li>Experience managing software implementation projects including balancing budget, timeline, scope, and resource availability.</li> </ul>  We offer a competitive total rewards program including: salary, incentive plans, training and development, paid-vacations, retirement plans, health and wellness program and employee benefits; along with exciting opportunities for global and diverse project opportunities, internal mobility, travel, and so much more. We are looking for motivated individuals to join our energetic team of professionals. If you want to get involved in an environment where you can really make a difference and where you can apply your knowledge to achieve results and work with an award-winning SAP Business Partner; please submit an online application today. <br/>
Title: ERP Implementation Consultant

Job_Description: Our Risk Consulting services in our Advisory Practice help our clients to optimize their response and resilience to risks and to expected and unexpected changes and events, whether internally generated or externally imposed. Our Risk Consulting professionals provide a range of services to support our clients undergoing change so that growth, governance, and performance objectives are achieved. <br/><br/> Our Risk Consulting professionals collectively provide the following range of services: <ul> <LI>Internal Audit Risk and Compliance</LI><LI>Technology Risk Consulting</LI><LI>Forensic</LI><LI>Financial Risk Management</LI> </ul>  <STRONG>KPMG Professionals Are...</STRONG> <br/><br/> Individuals who take deep personal accountability for their work, have a passion for excellence, driven to achieve their full potential, and understand the value of building relationships with clients, future clients, their communities, the global firm and each other. A KPMG professional should have all of the following characteristics:  <ul> <LI>Strong work ethic</LI><LI>Thrive on challenges</LI><LI>Dedicated to providing outstanding client service.</LI> </ul>  <STRONG>Position Summary</STRONG> <br/><br/> KPMG’s Risk Consulting practice in Calgary is growing and we require an IT Audit Consultant to help manage and develop our Technology Risk Consulting Services. We are in search of an experienced professional whose knowledge and skill not only spans the technical realm, but who is effective in managing teams, relationship management and business development. The successful candidate will be responsible for managing and developing a team that is closely aligned with both our Advisory and Audit practices and contribute to the overall management and execution of our Technology Risk Consulting Services. <br/><br/> <STRONG>Role and Responsibilities</STRONG>  <ul> <LI>Manage / Perform operational audit activities in relation to SAP, specifically; process workflow, automated controls testing, access management and data extraction and analysis</LI><LI>Understand leading practices as it relates to SAP Security and provide recommendations to the business on security role design and implementation</LI><LI>Manage / Perform pre and post implementation reviews in relation to SAP</LI><LI>Delivering high quality and risk based internal audit reviews of business processes, business change, and the management of financial, operational and compliance risks within the IT space</LI><LI>Required to work as part of the end to end audit team in performing operational audits supported by SAP</LI><LI>Identify and report on all significant control weaknesses</LI><LI>Assist the Audit Partner and the Audit Team in supporting their work and working on self-contained tasks to ensure a fluent and well-structured Audit Process</LI><LI>Identify and communicate failures in control framework within SAP based processes and ability to identify opportunities for improvement in the areas of SAP GRC, SAP security and SAP controls</LI><LI>Business development and relationship management within the Calgary marketplace</LI><LI>Accountable and responsible for reviewing engagement files and ensuring compliance with quality standards</LI> </ul>  At times, business needs arise and employees are required and agree to work beyond their normal work day or work week to fulfill the accountabilities required for their job. Likewise, people need extra time to devote to personal matters, and our approach to flexibility provides for this. <br/><br/> <STRONG>Skills & Qualifications</STRONG> <br/><br/> The successful candidate will possess the following:  <ul> <LI>Bachelor’s degree (or higher) in Business Administration, Commerce, Computer Science, Management Information Systems, or other relevant program required</LI><LI>Preference will be given to candidates with CISA, CISSP, CISM or similar certification</LI><LI>2 or more years’ experience executing and managing IT Audit / Controls advisory services in a professional services or related organization</LI><LI>Knowledge of internal controls in ERP systems and supporting network, operating system and database layers</LI><LI>Detailed knowledge of best practice business controls expected within core processes supported by ERP systems and modules, with an emphasis on SAP</LI><LI>Knowledge of SAP security, including ECC authorization concept and role design for core processes</LI><LI>Experience with SAP GRC and / or other GRC tools</LI><LI>Strong understanding of Segregation of Duties frameworks</LI><LI>Highly motivated, committed, self-starter with good organization skills who can prioritize and cope with changing priorities</LI><LI>Must be able to clearly communicate issues and solutions to all levels of client and internal staff, on both a formal and informal basis</LI> </ul>  <strong><DIV>#LI-HH1</DIV></strong>
Title: Consultant - IT Audit

Job_Description: At MNP we pride ourselves on being different – it’s our entrepreneurial drive that sets us apart. It’s the same drive that’s helped us become Canada’s fastest growing national firm. We foster collaboration, value your ideas, promote based on talent, live balanced lifestyles and make time for FUN. We are one firm, one team, collaborating to support you wherever you want to take your career. <br/><br/> Join the momentum. We are seeking a Senior Consultant for our growing Enterprise Risk Services team. Protecting businesses’ best interests, MNP is a leading national accounting, tax and business consulting firm in Canada. Our recognized Enterprise Risk team helps identify, evaluate and manage risk exposure to protect a company’s reputation and assets. Specifically, our Enterprise Risk Management team helps organizations reduce uncertainty and seize new opportunities to increase stakeholder value. <br/><br/> <strong>Performance Expectations</strong> <ul> <li><div>Work with project team to determine client needs, develop plans to meet the requirements, develop methodology to execute the project, and develop timelines for project execution.</div></li><li><div>Engage in continuous knowledge development regarding rules, regulations, best practices, tools, techniques and performance standards of various sectors</div> </li><li><div>Execute transactions through the provision of client services including planning, budgeting, scheduling and coordinating engagements</div></li><li><div>Facilitate collaboration with client engagement team prior to commencement of client work to discuss roles and responsibilities, risk areas, materiality and deadlines</div></li><li><div>Identify ways to maximize the relationship with clients and deliver added value</div></li><li><div>Communicate (written and verbal) findings and recommendations to clients through the preparation of reports, presentations, and other deliverables.</div></li><li><div>Coordinate with Project Manager regarding the status of the work-in-progress and provide feedback where necessary.</div></li><li><div>Assist in the planning for and development of proposals, engagement letters, and other sales activities</div></li><li><div>Monitor project timelines against targets, adjust where necessary; advise clients of project status</div></li> <li> <div><strong>Assist in the planning and execution of Business Resilience Services projects, including but not limited to:</strong></div></li>  <ul> <li><div>Assist in the preparation of documentation for Risk Assessments, Emergency Plans/Procedures, Business Impact Analysis, Business Continuity Plans, Crisis Communication Plans, Crisis Management Plans, Exercises and Audits.</div></li><li><div>Participate in client meetings to capture findings.</div></li> </ul>   <li> <div><strong>Assist in the planning and execution of Enterprise Risk Management (ERM) projects, including but not limited to:</strong></div></li>  <ul> <li><div>Implementation of ERM programs for clients, including ERM Framework and tool design.</div></li><li><div>Risk Assessments, including facilitation of risk identification and assessment workshops, developing risk registers.</div></li><li><div>Developing risk appetite and risk tolerance statements and metrics.</div></li><li><div>ERM Maturity Assessments, including assessing clients’ ERM programs, benchmarking against leading practice, and developing implementation plans, reports and other deliverables.</div></li> </ul>  <li><div>Maintain high quality control by reviewing work done from other team members for accuracy and completeness; provide feedback to team members</div></li><li><div>Network and take a leadership role in the local professional, business, and community while raising awareness of MNP and looking for new business development opportunities</div></li><li><div>Contribute to the development of new ideas and approaches to improve work processes</div> </li><li><div>Promote regular attendance, balanced lifestyle and high standard of team wellness</div></li><li><div>Attend internal MNP courses to further develop knowledge around performance improvement</div> </li> </ul> <strong>Credentials</strong> <ul> <li><div>Three (3) to five (5) years of experience in Enterprise Risk Management and/or Business Resilience program components including Emergency Response, Emergency Management, Business Continuity, Crisis Communication and IT Disaster Recovery.</div> </li><li><div>Must have excellent analytical, organizational, interpersonal, verbal, and written communication skills to effectively engage client and support the planning and execution of projects.</div></li><li><div>Highly motivated, committed, self-starter who can prioritize work, multi-task, and cope with changing priorities.</div></li><li><div>Strong customer service orientation and the ability to build positive business relationships.</div></li><li><div>Enthusiasm, capacity, and willingness to expand general business knowledge (finance, legal, HR, IT, etc.) and general industry knowledge (across various industries, including oil and gas, education, manufacturing, public sector, not-for-profit) through formal and informal means to ensure long term success in this role.</div></li><li><div>Must be able to work in a team and coordinate with colleagues to meet project objectives.</div></li><li><div>Flexibility and strong problem-solving skills, as required to meet client needs.</div></li><li><div>Strong analytical, organizational, and decision-making skills.</div></li><li><div>Strong verbal/written communications.</div></li><li><div>Possess a Certified Business Continuity Planner (CBCP) certification or equivalent certifications and/or experience is an asset.</div></li><li><div>Enterprise Risk Management Certification is an asset.</div></li><li><div>Experience in general management consulting is an asset.</div></li><li><div>Administrative skills, with effectiveness in managing time, developing tasks and managing resources.</div></li><li><div>Proficiency in MS Office Suite (e.g. Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Visio)</div> </li><li><div>Strong formatting skills are an asset</div></li><li><div>Some travel is required</div> </li> </ul> <strong>Core Competencies and Personal Characteristics</strong> <ul> <li><div><strong>Integrity –</strong> professional whose honesty, integrity, confidentiality and high ethical standards contributes to effective leadership and optimal business relationships</div></li><li><div><strong>Energy –</strong> displays enthusiasm, optimism, drive and passion while maintaining a high level of productivity and a balanced lifestyle</div></li><li><div><strong>Diversity –</strong> understands the importance of different backgrounds, perspectives and experiences and is respectful of individual differences</div></li><li><div><strong>Communication –</strong> effectively expresses ideas and conveys information in business writing, conversations and interactions with others</div></li><li><div><strong>Client Service Excellence –</strong> understands the importance of quality client service by being courteous, responding to client requests in a timely manner and monitoring satisfaction</div></li><li><div><strong>Teamwork & Relationship Development –</strong> works collaboratively with team members in order to achieve a common goal and develops, maintains and strengthens relationships with others, both inside and outside the Firm</div></li><li><div><strong>Accountability –</strong> takes responsibility for one’s own performance by setting clear goals and tracking progress against those goals; is highly organized and uses personal judgement and decision making</div></li><li><div><strong>Flexibility –</strong> effectively manages multiple assignments, adapts to changing priorities and is able to work independently or as part of a team</div></li> </ul> MNP encourages a balanced lifestyle and offers benefits that suit the way our team members work and play! In addition to a competitive salary, our total rewards package includes paid personal days, wellness program initiatives, health and dental benefits, a group pension plan with matching contribution, firm sponsored social events, and professional development assistance. <br/><br/> MNP proudly serves and responds to the needs of our clients in the public, private and not-for-profit sectors. Through partner-led engagements, we provide a collaborative, cost-effective approach to doing business, with innovative strategies to help organizations succeed across the country and around the world.

Vendor experience with providers such as HP, NetApp, IBM, Cisco and EMC products considered an asset. <br>• Functional knowledge of core Networking technologies <br>• Familiarity with the following considered an asset:<br> o Additional Microsoft technologies, including<br>  - Windows 10 Deployment<br>  - SQL<br>  - Azure<br>  - Office 365 / Exchange Online<br> o VDI, Datacenter Automation, and Virtualization Management Solutions<br> o Solution delivery experience with Storage, Backup and Recovery, and Networking<br> o Experience in other virtualization platforms, including Citrix and Microsoft Hyper-V<br>• Strong oral/written communication, organization and interpersonal skills and a demonstrated effectiveness in a customer facing role<br>• Strong presentation technical skills and must be able to work cross-functionally with account teams and partner organizations<br>• Experience creating Statements of Work, proposal responses, and related documentation considered an asset.</p><p><br>Education and Accreditations:<br>• BSc in Computer Science or related discipline, or 2-3 year Technologist Diploma or equivalent<br>• Combination of certifications with the following technologies<br> o Microsoft (MCSE or equivalent experience)<br> o VMware (VCP or equivalent experience</p><p><br>To succeed in this role you should be energetic, motivated, and achievement-oriented. You are disciplined with an astute business sense, superior communication skills and with a strong orientation towards customer satisfaction. You are able to effectively present your ideas to senior management with a strong ability to think conceptually and strategically and to develop and/or leverage partnering relationships. </p><p><br>No unsolicited agency referrals please.<br><br></p></div>

Job_Description: <div><div><strong><u>What you’ll do</u></strong> <br/><br/> Small paragraph describing role. As a team member, you will:  <ul> <li>Coordinate financial close and consolidation process, including preparation and posting of required consolidation and elimination entries;</li>  <li>Conduct accounting treatment or disclosure research as needed to ensure all transactions are correctly recorded and external financial reporting is appropriate;</li>  <li>Prepare accounting policy and transaction treatment memos for CFO, Audit Committee and/or Auditor review;</li>  <li>Coordinate quarterly and annual Financial Statement and MD&A preparation;</li>  <li>Coordination and consolidation of budgets and forecasts, including consolidating entries and balance sheet components;</li>  <li>Participation in all public filing of financial documentation and press releases;</li>  <li>Contribute analysis and reporting as required for executive and board review;</li>  <li>Assist in special projects for reporting and compliance-related matters;</li>  <li>Develop and maintain effective working relationships with Operations, Operations Finance, Financial Shared Services and Legal personnel;</li> </ul> <strong><u>Who you are</u></strong> <br/><br/> We are looking for high performing individuals who are:  <ul> <li>Agile and innovative individuals, who can manage in an environment of change and ambiguity to help us take bold and strategic moves in this rapidly evolving environment</li>  <li>Creative thinkers who take initiative and are capable of building, launching and managing projects/programs that drive results for our customers</li>  <li>Problem solvers with the ability to analyze and prioritize to meet business objectives</li>  <li>Collaborative team players with superior influencing skills, who build relationships easily across various stakeholder groups to move initiatives forward</li> </ul> <strong><u>What you’ve done</u></strong>  <ul> <li>Completion of a recognized professional designation (CPA), preferably completed within an audit/public practice environment;</li>  <li>In addition, 5+ years of financial reporting and accounting experience, preferably in a public company environment;</li>  <li>Advanced skills in Excel required including modeling and design;</li>  <li>Experience with ERP systems, specific knowledge of GP Dynamics and Management Reporter beneficial;</li>  <li>Good working knowledge of IFRS standards;</li>  <li>Demonstrated success in a change environment.</li> </ul> <strong><u>Why us</u></strong> <br/><br/> We are industry leaders, always on the lookout for top talent. Embracing and driving change is critical to Horizon North’s success. The complexity and rate at which our portfolio is transforming has increased exponentially in recent years and we are committed to becoming a leader in the industry. As such we are relentlessly focused on innovating at every level of our business, and doubling down on the best talent to drive the company forward. It is an especially exciting time to join Horizon North. <br/><br/> Our industrial division supplies workforce accommodations, camp management services, access solutions, relocatable structures, and maintenance and utilities services. <br/><br/> Our modular construction division produces high quality building solutions for commercial and residential clients, including; offices, hotels, and retail buildings, as well as distinctive single detached homes and multi-family residential structures. <br/><br/> Because of our well diversified offering, Horizon North is uniquely positioned to meet the needs of our customers in numerous sectors, anywhere in Canada. <br/><br/> We are always looking for motivated and talented individuals who share our core values and are looking for people who want to build an organization they can be proud of, with growth opportunities befitting a brand that is entrepreneurial, innovative and highly competitive. <br/><br/> To learn more about this team and Horizon North, follow us on LinkedIn.</div> </div><div></div>

Job_Description: On!Track Sales Consultant-Calgary AB <br/>  <strong> <br/>  <div> Calgary, AB</div> </strong><br/>   <div>Reference No:  <br/>  5559</div>  <br/>  What's the role?<br/>   <div>The Software Field Specialist Canada will assist in growing and supporting a new software product and service with local, regional, and global partners at Hilti. This team member will coordinate with local sales personnel to leverage customer relationships and develop markets; thereby increasing sales and penetration of ON!Track.</div>  <br/>Who is Hilti?<br/>   <div>If you’re new to the industry, you might not have heard of us. We provide leading-edge tools, technologies, software and services for the global construction sector. We have a proud heritage, built over 75 years, and a worldwide reputation for pioneering products and exceptional service. With some 23,000 people in more than 120 countries, we’re a great place for you to show us your worth as you learn, grow and carve-out your career.</div>  <br/>What does the role involve?<br/>   <div>If you’re new to the industry, you might not have heard of us. We provide leading-edge tools, technologies, software and services for the global construction sector. We have a proud heritage, built over 75 years, and a worldwide reputation for pioneering products and exceptional service. With some 27,000 people in more than 120 countries, which we’re looking to expand, we’re a great place for you to show us your worth, step up to new challenges and grow your career.</div><br/>   <div> <div> You’ll work with some of the industry’s most trusted and innovative engineering products.</div> </div>  <br/>What do we offer?<br/>   <div>We’ll give you everything you need to excel in your role and one-to-one coaching. You’ll enjoy a rare combination of autonomy and camaraderie, as you’ll manage your own book of business while being part of a friendly team. <br/><br/> We’ll give you lots of responsibility, including your own portfolio of customers and these might be trades experts, project managers, or company leaders. From there, we’ll trust you to do whatever it takes to deliver outstanding results. Go the extra mile and we’ll reward you with unrivaled training, development, and career opportunities as soon as you’re ready for the next challenge. <br/><br/> Day to day you’ll report to , who will also be there to help you manage your career.</div>  <br/>Why should you apply?<br/>   <div>We have an excellent mix of people and some of our best account managers joined us with little or no construction experience. Success at Hilti is down to teamwork and ability, no matter what your background.</div>  <br/>What you need is:<br/>   <div>  <ul> <li>Bachelor’s degree preferred or equivalent work experience.</li>   <li>At least one year prior experience in customer service and/ or sales working directly with customers, preferred (either over phone or face-to-face)</li> <li> Ability to thrive both independently and in a team environment.</li>   <li>Demonstrated ability to develop engaged customer relationships and effectively implement strategic concepts.</li>   <li>Excellent time and territory management skills.</li>   <li>Must be persuasive, sales driven, customer focused, and a team player.</li>   <li>Proficient computer skills including MS Office Suite, and smartphones.</li>   <li>Must maintain a professional business appearance in accordance with HNA dress policy at all times.</li>   <li>Career advancement may require domestic and/or global mobility.</li>  <strong><li> Vehicle/ Driver’s License Requirements:</li>  </strong>  <li>Company vehicle provided for carrying tools/fasteners for product demonstration purposes.</li>   <li>Must have valid driver’s license and comply with HNA Fleet Safety Policy requirements.</li>   <li>Account Manager has responsibility for prudent care and protection of company assets.</li> </ul>  </div><br/>  <div>As part of your interview process, we’ll take you on a day-in-the-life ‘field ride’ to give you a feel for the job and the caliber of our people. We’ll also pay for your travel to the interview. <br/><br/> Tempted to apply or find out more? Go to hilti.ca/careers.</div><br/>  <div> On!Track Sales Consultant-Calgary AB</div>  <br/>

Job_Description: Sr. Citrix Systems Consultant BERMUDA! <br/><br/> $125-150K CAD equivalent, 6% Tax <br/><br/> Join the hundreds of Canadian expats that are enjoying the tax friendly, career enhancing and wonderful, sub-tropical living environment that is Bermuda. Located a short 2.5 hour flight from Toronto, Bermuda is a world away in terms of climate and lifestyle. None the less, the Island offers some of the most progressive and sophisticated career opportunities to be found anywhere in the world. <br/><br/> Our client is one of the premier I.T. Services organizations in the country. Closely partnered with global leaders in the industry such as IBM, HP, Microsoft, Cisco and Citrix, they provide the highest level of professional expertise to their international financial services customer base. <br/><br/> As a member of their rapidly expanding professional services team, the successful applicant will be involved in all aspects of projects, including pre-sales needs analysis, systems design, proposal preparation and presentation, project scheduling, systems implementation and support. <br/><br/> To be considered for this position you should have solid, recent experience and qualifications in the following areas: <br/><br/> A minimum of seven years experience in a senior consultant technical role <br/> Experience working with multiple clients simultaneously <br/> Advanced experience with Microsoft Active Directory <br/> Demonstrated experience in the design, architecture and implementation of large scale Citrix installations across multiple sectors <br/> Experience with package development and deployment <br/> Ability to effectively diagnose and resolve a wide variety of IT issues on the following technologies: Citrix, SCCM, Microsoft AD, Exchange, VMWare, and RSA <br/> Demonstrated experience in the development of architectural best practice guidelines and establishment of standards <br/> Exceptional and demonstrable consulting, customer service and relationship building skills, with the ability to interact well with a wide range of people <br/> Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to complete reports in a timely manner <br/> Successful candidates will hold current certifications in Citrix (CCE) and Microsoft (MCSE) or extensive, relevant experience in lieu of. <br/><br/> If you are highly portable and crave a big change in lifestyle that will also provide you an upward trajectory career wise, you may be the perfect candidate for this opportunity. With excellent remuneration, super low taxes, great benefits, relocation and start up rental support, this is a once in a lifetime offering for the right person! <br/><br/> If interested please contact right away: Frank Squires - frank@squiresresources.com <br/><br/> 1-705-725-7660 (Barrie, ON Canada) <br/> www.squiresresources.com
Title: Senior Citrix Systems Consultant - BERMUDA! 125-150k CAD equivalent, 6% tax

Job_Description: <strong>Peak Installations Inc.,</strong> one of the fastest growing exterior renovation companies in Canada, is looking for self-motivated individuals to complete our team. <br/><br/> <strong>Who we are:</strong> <br/><br/> We are a strategic partner to Home Depot. We sell and provide installation services for: windows, doors, roofing, siding, eavestrough, installation. The installations are performed by licensed and insured contractors. <br/><br/> We are a dynamic team of naturally driven people motivated to do our best work every single day. Our mission is to provide the best experience and greatest overall value to the customer of Home Depot seeking out professional installation services (DO IT FOR ME). We pride ourselves at continually enhancing the customer experience to be the best in the industry. We believe that the success of our company starts with taking care of the customer first. At Peak Installations we reward performance. With your success brings many incentives and an opportunity to be a part of our yearly awards trip. <br/><br/> Want to find out what makes this such a great place to work? Check out this video: <br/><br/> https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yiICuXIEfOY. <br/><br/> <strong>Who you are:</strong> <ul> <li>Experienced sales professional with track record of success</li><li>Knowledgeable home renovation industry</li><li>Love meeting people and influencing them</li><li>Passionate about our customers</li><li>Able to connect with all levels of Home Depot Associates</li><li>Communicate effectively with installers</li><li>Detail oriented, your quotes are always bang on</li><li>Open to learning and coaching, and sharing your knowledge with others</li><li>A loyal brand advocate, you believe in the value of great service and the costs associated with it</li><li>Embrace technology fully</li> </ul> <strong>What we offer:</strong> <ul> <li>Quality leads, and lots of them, no cold calling</li><li>Fast pay programs <strong>, competitive commissions - potential to earn $100K plus per year!</strong></li><li>A professional team to back you up with re-measurers, project coordinators, installers etc.</li><li>A dedicated coach to make sure you have everything you need to succeed</li><li>Millionaire's club* - A yearly trip for top sales consultants and their significant other. The last one was in beautiful Cancun*</li> </ul> <strong>Locations we are currently recruiting for:</strong> <ul> <li>Calgary, AB (1)</li> </ul> The Peak Group of Companies is an equal opportunity employer. We respect the dignity and worth of every individual in the workplace and value the importance of diversity, fairness, and trust. We offer a dynamic work environment and a competitive compensation package. Our goal is to attract, develop, and engage employees with exceptional ability and diverse backgrounds.
Title: In-Home Sales Consultant

Job_Description: Paladin Technologies has emerged as the largest complex systems integrator in Canada. As a leader in the design, deployment, optimization, management, and maintenance of communication and digital networks, Paladin can meet the needs of clients on a national scale, while providing local support. <br/><br/> We are 100% Canadian-owned, and operate nationally. The experts that make up Paladin's teams stay at the forefront of the changing technology landscape through continued training, complex client projects, and company support. As Paladin continues to grow, we continue to provide our employees with exciting challenges and a rewarding career. <br/><br/> We have a best-in-class delivery team supporting a diverse range of clients with various systems across most verticals. The System Analyst will be responsible for servicing electronic security systems from leading manufacturers such as Lenel, Genetec, Axis, Milestone and Avigilon. <br/><br/> <strong>RESPONSIBILITIES:</strong>  <ul>  	<li>Install, configure, and test servers, storage, workstations, and network infrastructure for physical security solutions</li>  <li>Install, configure, and test physical security management software packages, databases, operating systems, and virtualization platforms</li>  <li>Maintain, troubleshoot, and service issues related to the above infrastructure</li>  <li>Work directly with other Systems Analysts, Project Managers, Sales, and Engineering resources to help design IT infrastructure for physical security</li>  <li>Support sales efforts and activities in specifying IT components and integration methods</li>  <li>Be accountable for the installation and integration of systems, ensuring timelines are met and a quality solution is delivered</li>  <li>Work closely and collaborate with our Integrated Systems Technicians to ensure successful system delivery</li>  <li>Respond, support, and be available to Integrated Systems Technicians, while supporting and mentoring their learning and growth in IT infrastructure</li>  <li>Develop and maintain client relationships while building confidence and respect in the organization's abilities throughout the industry</li>  <li>Support the PMO in planning deployments</li>  <li>Prepare and maintain documentation in an efficient and professional manner</li>  <li>Research, prototype, and develop integrations between the components of physical and logical security systems</li>  <li>Be organized, enthusiastic, and take direction from the Project Management Office and the Director of Projects & Design</li>  <li>Be willing and available to participate in an afterhours OnCall rotation</li> </ul> <strong>QUALIFICATIONS:</strong>  <ul>  	<li>Minimum of 3 years' progressive experience in Information Technology, with proven experience in designing, deploying, and supporting complex systems</li>  <li>Postsecondary degree or diploma from a Technology Institute in computing, network support, or electronics</li>  <li>Ability to pass varying levels of security clearance</li>  <li>Clear and concise written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to present technical data and analysis to internal and external stakeholders</li>  <li>Sound organizational skills, with the capability to handle multiple tasks and projects in a fastpaced and priority-changing environment</li>  <li>Legally entitled to operate motor vehicle in Alberta with Valid Driver's License</li>  <li>Ability to work independently or in a team environment, with strong interpersonal skills</li>  <li>Willingness to mentor and build the technical abilities of the organization</li>  <li>Strong analytical and problemsolving skills</li> </ul> <strong><em>Experience with the following technologies is required:</em></strong>  <ul>  	<li>Windows Server 2003, 2008, 2012, and 2016, Windows 7/8/10, basic MS SQL administration tasks, IP networking, routers/switches, backup concepts and logical security</li>  <li>Accreditation or certification from a major network supplier such as Cisco</li>  <li>Certification in, or experience with, Microsoft Server and Client OS</li> </ul> <strong><em>Experience with the following technologies is an asset:</em></strong>  <ul>  	<li>Virtualization, clustering, fault tolerant systems, modern development and scripting languages, advanced MS SQL administration tasks including reporting, SAN/WAN architectures, HTML, JavaScript, XML, and Crystal Reports</li>  <li>Microsoft Certified Systems Expert (MCSE) and/or Microsoft Certified IT Professional (MCITP)</li>  <li>Understanding of experience with Physical Security system integration, including CCTV, Access Control, Intercom and Intrusion</li>  <li>Certification in, or extensive experience with, VMware</li> </ul>
Title: Systems Analyst
