Job_Description: <strong>Retail Sales Consultant</strong> <br/><br/> What we do matters at Moores Clothing for Men, a Canadian division of Tailored Brands, and we are hiring Retail Sales Consultants that have a passion for helping people love how they look. At Moores, we provide a personal, convenient, one of a kind retail shopping experience tailored personally to each customer's lifestyle. Our competitive compensation model allows our Wardrobe Sales Consultants to have a direct impact on growing their personal income potential on a weekly basis. Come experience our engaging workplace focused on teamwork, growth, and respect. <br/><br/> It is our vision to provide an engaging workplace focused on teamwork, growth, and respect. Come experience our extraordinary culture built upon these guiding principles: live the Golden Rule, practice teamwork, have respect for each other, be trustworthy, and keep an open mind and heart. What a great place to work! We are always looking for talented and unique individuals to join our team. Take the first step towards your new career opportunity today! <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities</strong>  <ul> <li>Learn and demonstrate our benchmark retail selling techniques on a consistent basis with customers</li> <li>Make appropriate recommendations for required alterations to customers and communicate effectively with tailors</li> <li>Work in a team selling environment by assisting teammates throughout the selling process</li> <li>Assist tuxedo rental customers as directed by management</li>  <li>Attend and participate in store meetings and attend all formal off site training courses as directed by management</li> </ul>  <strong>Requirements</strong>  <ul> <li>Desire to work in a commission driven sales position through commission based compensation</li>  <li>Ability to work a flexible schedule including nights, weekends and holidays</li> <li>Demonstrate a positive attitude and friendly demeanor</li>  <li>Maintain a professional, well-groomed appearance</li>  <li>Prior customer service experience preferred</li> </ul>
Title: Moores Clothing For Men Wardrobe Consultant

Job_Description: Our Health and Benefits business helps large and mid-size clients control health and welfare plan costs, improve health outcomes and promote employee engagement through broad-based, state-of-the-art interventions. We provide solutions encompassing creative plan design, vendor evaluation and management, pricing and funding strategies, data analytics, valuation support, compliance and governance strategies. We also provide Specialty consulting services including clinical/health management program design, pharmacy solutions, disability/absence management strategies, health analytics and claims audit services. Product based solutions such as our pharmacy purchasing coalition round out our broad-based suite of offerings. <br/><br/> In this role you will have ultimate accountability for the P&L of the Health and Benefits Large Market business for Calgary. As such, you will develop and drive the strategy for penetration of the local markets, serve as senior strategist and client relationship manager for select clients and projects, and lead a team of local consultants in the selling and delivery of work. You’ll also be asked to contribute your thought leadership to the overall development of the Health and Benefits business. This role requires strong collaboration with the Calgary H&B Mid Market Leader. <br/><br/> <strong>Performance Objectives:</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Member of H&B Regional Leadership Team:</strong>   <ul> <li>Manage, support and execute major H&B projects and business development initiatives to retain current clients, expand existing relationships and increase market share. Act as a change agent. Participate on H&B cross functional teams and promote collaboration and teamwork within the office team and division.</li>  </ul>  <strong>Member of Office Leadership Team:</strong>   <ul> <li>Work with Market Geography and Region H&B Leader to identify business development opportunities and develop strategic business plans for the LOB that support the practice strategic direction and the local market.</li><li>Initiate and drive new business development opportunities with clients and prospects.</li><li>Cross-Practice collaboration, including strong collaboration with the Calgary H&B Mid Market Leader.</li> </ul>  <strong>Operations management, P&L responsibilities:</strong>   <ul> <li>Contribute to the development of plans and budgets, delivering planned performance and ensuring office unit generates revenue, profit and market share growth in accordance with the office LOB profit plan.</li> </ul>  <strong>People management and development:</strong>   <ul> <li>Develop and execute on strategic staffing plans, including all people processes e.g., attracting and maintaining engagement and retention of key talent, providing appropriate training and career growth opportunities for all associates, performance management and salary and bonus planning.</li> </ul>  <strong>Client relationship management and delivery:</strong>   <ul> <li>Responsible for all aspects of local delivery of Willis Towers Watson products and services for the LOB. Collaborate with CRD Function and H&B Sales and Marketing and IC Leaders to develop local market client strategies to deepen, broaden and build profitable relationships, including the management and deployment of staff to effectively deliver client work.</li> </ul>  <strong>Work Quality/Manage risk:</strong>   <ul> <li>Focus on Professional Excellence work quality processes, measures and continuous improvement. Ensure LOB sanctioned tools are used for client assignments.</li> </ul>  <strong>Subject matter expertise, thought leadership:</strong>   <ul> <li>Contribute to the development of priority services and consulting processes and demonstrate deep consulting capability in one or more competence areas</li> </ul>  <strong>The Requirements:</strong>  <ul> <li>Proven track record of success in generating new revenue with new or existing Large Market clients or organizations of similar size as they relate to health and benefits consulting services</li><li>Deep knowledge and expertise in health and benefits design and management</li><li>Track record of success in managing and expanding large client relationships</li> <li>Strong experience in leading and developing teams of consultants</li><li>Proven ability to establish relationships and work collaboratively with team members in other practices and at all levels to effectively sell and deliver on client needs</li><li>An executive presence with polished and well developed written and oral communication skills</li><li>Interest and aptitude in keeping abreast of latest developments in health care and benefit trends and contributing to the development of new tools and approaches</li><li>Occasional air travel for client meetings or training or seminars may be required</li><li>An undergraduate degree is required; advanced degree preferred</li> </ul>  <strong>The Company</strong>  <br/> Willis Towers Watson is a leading global advisory, broking and solutions company that helps clients around the world turn risk into a path for growth. With roots dating to 1828, Willis Towers Watson has 40,000 employees serving more than 140 countries. We design and deliver solutions that manage risk, optimize benefits, cultivate talent, and expand the power of capital to protect and strengthen institutions and individuals. Our unique perspective allows us to see the critical intersections between talent, assets and ideas – the dynamic formula that drives business performance. Together, we unlock potential. Learn more at willistowerswatson.com.<br/>  <div><strong>Willis Towers Watson is an equal opportunity employer</strong></div><div>Willis Towers Watson believes that effectively managing a diverse workforce is vital to our business strategy. We have an obligation to our organization, ourselves and our clients to hire and develop the best people we can find. We will continually review our policies and practices to ensure that all areas of the employment process (including recruiting, hiring, work assignments, compensation, benefits, promotions, transfers, company-sponsored development programs and overall workplace experience) are free from discriminatory practices. We are committed to equal employment opportunities at Willis Towers Watson.</div> <br/> <strong>Unsolicited Contact:</strong> Any unsolicited resumes/candidate profiles submitted through our web site or to personal e-mail accounts of employees of Willis Towers Watson are considered property of Willis Towers Watson and are not subject to payment of agency fees. In order to be an authorized Recruitment Agency/Search Firm for Willis Towers Watson, any such agency must have an existing formal written agreement signed by an authorized Willis Towers Watson recruiter and an active working relationship with the organization. Resumes must be submitted according to our candidate submission process, which includes being actively engaged on the particular search. Likewise, for our authorized Recruitment Agencies/Search Firms, if the candidate submission process is not followed, no agency fees will be paid by Willis Towers Watson. Willis Towers Watson is an equal opportunity employer.
Title: H&B NA Consulting Market Leader

Job_Description: <div><div><div>Location: <br/><br/> Calgary, Alberta</div> <div>Department: <br/><br/> Sales</div> <div>Employment Type: <br/><br/> Full Time; Commission</div> <div>Reports to: <br/><br/> Community Sales Manager</div> <br/>Who We Are <br/><br/> Mattamy Homes is the largest privately owned homebuilder in North America, with a nearly 40-year history of operations across the United States and Canada. Every year, Mattamy helps 7,000 families realize their dream of home ownership. In the United States, the company is represented in 10 markets Charlotte, Raleigh-Durham, Phoenix, Tucson, Jacksonville, Orlando (where its US head office is located), Tampa, Sarasota, Naples and Southeast Florida and in Canada, those communities stretch across the Greater Toronto Area, as well as in Ottawa, Calgary and Edmonton. <br/><br/> What We Offer <br/><br/> In keeping with the Mattamy mission of providing The Best Homeowner Experience, the Sales Consultant provides excellent customer service while helping prospective purchasers to select their homes. <br/><br/> Responsibilities <ul> <li>Represent Mattamy as first point of contact for prospective purchasers</li><li>Ensure a successful sales process through discovering prospects' requirements, provide timely information on home features, upgrades and pricing and explaining Mattamy sales procedures and processes</li><li>Establish rapport with prospective purchasers and inform customers of the new homes available</li><li>Conduct show home tours, review site and floor plans, explain the available options and provide information on home features and pricing</li><li>Conduct appointments with homeowners at various stages of the sales process</li><li>Prospect and follow-up</li> <li>Respond accurately and quickly to homeowner inquiries</li><li>Assist in leading community sales admin including day to day tasks/duties and overall performance management</li><li>Prepare and maintain all purchaser files</li><li>Enter homeowner information for purchase and sale agreements into corporate database</li><li>Track customer interactions in corporate database</li> </ul> What You Bring <ul> <li>3+ years sales experience</li><li>New Homes sales experience is an asset</li><li>Excellent presentation skills and the ability to discover customer's requirements</li><li>Excellent verbal, listening and written communication skills</li><li>Ability to match customer's home requirements to units and products offered by Mattamy</li><li>Excellent customer service skills</li><li>Ability to read and understand construction, site and floor plans</li><li>Good organizational and time management skills</li><li>Computer literacy with experience in MS Office applications</li><li>Self-motivated with ability to work both independently and as part of a team</li><li>Exhibit the highest degree of honesty and professionalism</li><li>Ability to work in a demanding, fast paced, team oriented setting</li> </ul> Why Mattamy <br/><br/> When youre part of the Mattamy Homes family, your day to day work has an incredible impact on the lives of our customers. Everyone on our team contributes to the unique Mattamy way of helping customers achieve their home ownership dreams. What we do takes teamwork, and like family, everyone pulls together to give our very best. With a focus on continued growth and industry leadership, exciting career possibilities are waiting for you at Mattamy. <br/><br/> We offer a progressive environment with a competitive compensation and benefits package, continuous learning and opportunity for growth. <br/><br/> We have big plans for our business and our team. Be part of our ambitious future. <br/><br/> Mattamy Homes is committed to providing accommodation for people with disabilities. If you require accommodation through any aspects of the selection process, please notify us and we will work with you to meet your needs. <br/><br/> Qualified applicants will be contacted directly by the Talent Acquisition team.</div></div>
Title: New Homes Sales Consultant

Job_Description: Job Description<div><strong><em>ENTRY LEVEL POSITION - NO EXPERIENCE NECESSARY</em></strong> <br/><br/> We are currently looking for people who are in search of building their marketing collection from the ground up or are searching to work in a <strong><em>fresh</em></strong> and <strong><em>dynamic</em></strong> industry, then we have an answer to your search. As an Entry-Level marketing associate, we are looking for a candidate who will be responsible for looking after various marketing campaigns to draw in potential clients. <br/><br/> This position calls for those who have exceptional networking skills, a pleasant and enthusiastic demeanor, and genuine interpersonal skills. If you are ready for an exciting, but also challenging line of work, this may be the place for you. <br/><br/> <strong>Your responsibilities will include:</strong> <br/><br/> -Attend marketing workshops <br/><br/> -Seek out and engage with potential prospects <br/><br/> -Collaborate with Marketing team <br/><br/> -Develop and implement unique marketing strategies <br/><br/> -Provide education and support regarding <strong><em>client campaigns</em></strong> <br/><br/> -Act as a connection between the clients and potential customers <br/><br/> -Measure results and input client information via <strong><em>tablet technology</em> </strong> <br/><br/> -Maintain a consistent brand voice <br/><br/> -Develop a distinctive marketing skill-set <br/><br/> <strong>Other information about the opportunity:</strong> <br/><br/> -Supportive management team and mentoring <br/><br/> -Promotion structure based on excellence <br/><br/> -There are unlimited opportunities for advancement and career development <br/><br/> -There are also travel opportunities, *<em>if desired*</em> <br/><br/> <strong>Requirements:</strong> <br/><br/> -High School Diploma or equivalent, is the <em>minimum</em> <br/><br/> -Customer Service/Sales/ Marketing experience <strong>an asset</strong> <strong>but it is not required</strong> <br/><br/> -Candidate must be over 18 years old <br/><br/> -English and French <br/><br/> -Legal to work in Canada* <br/><br/> -Possession of strong interpersonal skills <br/><br/> -Each candidate must have a <strong><em>positive</em> </strong>attitude and <strong><em>professional</em></strong> demeanor <br/><br/> We do welcome all applicants to apply however please note that only select candidates will be contacted for an interview. Thank you for applying! <br/><br/> Please note that this is a full-time position (Monday-Friday)</div>
Title: Entry Level-Marketing Consultant

Job_Description: NovAtel is a leader in high precision OEM positioning technology. Our GNSS products and services are used in more than 60 countries around the globe to deliver precise positioning solutions in precision agriculture, defense, mapping, autonomous vehicles, survey and many other industries. <br/><br/> As NovAtel's Software Process Analyst you will provide end to end stewardship of our processes for Software/Firmware development and Verification & Validation. In addition to your deep understanding of best in class software development practices, you will leverage your excellent leadership and facilitation skills to refine existing processes and introduce new ones that help our development teams be maximally effective. This is a newly created role with high visibility within the Engineering team, exposure to senior level management and an opportunity to make a real impact. <ul> <li>Process creation, documentation, implementation and maintenance</li><li>Process compliance reporting, including conducting internal audits</li><li>Identifying and leading Continuous Improvement efforts to address deficiencies and improve efficiency</li><li>Process change management and training</li><li>Developing and refining metrics for tracking development and test compliance, quality, progress and productivity</li><li>Gap analysis with respect to established Quality Management Systems and development capability frameworks</li><li>Process tailoring as appropriate on a project by project basis</li> </ul> <strong>Must-Have:</strong> <ul> <li>B.Sc. in Computer Science, Engineering or equivalent</li><li>5+ years’ experience in a software development and test environment</li><li>Practical experience in process development and deployment</li><li>Well versed in Continuous Improvement methodologies, tools, and techniques</li><li>Familiarity with a variety of Software development models and quality frameworks (eg. SPICE, CMMI)</li><li>Experience with systematic approaches for identifying and assessing metrics and KPIs</li><li>Experience with issue tracking and collaboration tools</li><li>Must be able to achieve Controlled Goods and Reliability level security status</li> </ul> <strong>Key Success Factors:</strong> <ul> <li>Passionate about good process</li><li>Organized and detail oriented</li><li>Excellent facilitation and influencing skills</li><li>Confident, no ego, driven by integrity</li><li>Self-motivated, comfortable working autonomously and in a team environment</li><li>Excellent written and verbal English language communication skills</li> </ul> <strong>Nice-to-Have:</strong> <ul> <li>Experience with Jira, Confluence, Collaborator, Polarion RMT, Smartsheet</li><li>Embedded FW development experience</li><li>Knowledge of IATF 16949, ISO 26262</li><li>BA certification</li> </ul>
Title: Software Process Analyst

Job_Description: <strong>Job Description</strong><br/><br/><strong>Aon Is Looking For A Senior Consultant; Risk Control</strong> <br/><br/> As part of an industry-leading team, you will help empower results for our clients by delivering innovative and effective solutions as part of our Risk Control business group within Aon Risk Solutions in Calgary, AB. As a Senior Consultant, you will report directly to the Western Canadian Leader of Risk Solutions. <br/><br/> <strong>Your Impact As A Senior Consultant; Risk Control</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Job Responsibilities:</strong> <ul> <li>Facilitating enterprise risk assessments and cyber risk assessments</li><li>Supporting clients in improving and/or implementing enterprise risk management frameworks</li><li>Conducting reviews and developing business continuity, disaster recovery, crisis management and emergency response plans</li><li>Managing performance development, cross-training and succession planning initiatives in support of the attraction, retention and motivation of key talent;</li><li>Embodying and sponsoring Aon’s values and vision, business goals and objectives through a variety of effective communication techniques and structures;</li><li>Fostering and motivating a collaborative team culture across groups, units and teams within the Risk Control department;</li><li>Supporting the achievement of organizational business goals by creating positive and productive departmental working environments, coaching and developing talent and recognizing team and individual accomplishments may be required</li><li>Leading by example by demonstrating and sharing with all lines of business the importance of best practice; and</li><li>Other related duties and responsibilities as assigned.</li> </ul> <strong>You Bring Knowledge and Expertise</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Required Experience:</strong> <ul> <li>7 years of experience in implementing and consulting on ERM & BCM frameworks;</li><li>Strong analysis, problem solving and decision making capabilities;</li><li>Proven leadership skills, ability to motivate and engage a team of highly skilled professionals and work independently with minimum supervision;</li><li>Excellent interpersonal, communication and presentation skills, both verbally and written;</li><li>Client focused and proven relationship building skills;</li><li>Ability to work collaboratively as a key member of a team and independently with minimum supervision;</li><li>Meticulous attention to detail, refined organizational skills and the ability to multi-task;</li><li>Proven ability to prioritize competing requirements and deadlines under pressure;</li><li>Must have strong computer skills and be proficient with the Microsoft Office Package.</li> </ul> <strong>Education:</strong> <ul> <li>Currently hold a related degree and/or designation (Ie. Bachelor of Financing, Accounting Designation, MBA, CRM);</li><li>Commitment to ongoing learning and professional development.</li> </ul> **Posting End Date: May 31, 2018 <br/><br/> <strong>We Offer You:</strong> <br/><br/> A competitive total rewards package, continuing education & training, and tremendous potential with a growing worldwide organization. <br/><br/> <strong>Our Colleague Experience:</strong> <br/><br/> From helping clients gain access to capital after natural disasters, to creating access to health care and retirement for millions, Aon colleagues empower results for our clients, communities, and each other every day. They make a difference, work with the best, own their potential, and value one another. This is the Aon Colleague Experience, defining what it means to work at Aon and realizing our vision of empowering human and economic possibility. To learn more visit Aon Colleague Experience. <br/><br/> <strong>About Aon:</strong> <br/> Aon plc (NYSE:AON) is a leading global professional services firm providing a broad range of risk, retirement and health solutions. Our 50,000 colleagues in 120 countries empower results for clients by using proprietary data and analytics to deliver insights that reduce volatility and improve performance. <br/><br/> By applying for a position with Aon, you understand that, should you be made an offer, it will be contingent on your undergoing and successfully completing a background check consistent with Aon's employment policies. Background checks may include some or all of the following based on the nature of the position: SSN/SIN validation, education verification, employment verification, and criminal check, search against global sanctions and government watch lists, fingerprint verification, credit check, and/or drug test. You will be notified during the hiring process which checks are required by the position. <br/><br/> Aon is committed to a diverse workforce as an Employment Equity employer (Women, People with Disabilities, Aboriginal Peoples, and Visible Minorities). <br/><br/> DISCLAIMER: <br/> Nothing in this job description restricts management's right to assign or reassign duties and responsibilities to this job at any time.<br/><br/><strong>Job number:</strong> 2018-22594 <br/> <strong>Category:</strong> Risk Management / Risk Consulting <br/> <strong>Location:</strong> Canada, AB, Calgary <br/> <strong>4/24/2018 11:01:56</strong> <br/>
Title: Senior Consultant; Risk Control

Job_Description: Provides direction and specialist knowledge in applying the technology/application to client business. Facilitation of customer product/application understanding through presentations demonstrations and benchmarks; provision of support throughout the sell. <br/><br/> As a Principal Sales Consultant you will be responsible as the expert for formulating and leading presales technical / functional support activity to prospective clients and customers while ensuring customer satisfaction. Acts as a technical resource and mentor for less experienced Sales Consultants. Focuses on large or complex sales opportunities that need creative and complex solutions. Develops productivity tools and training for other Sales Consultants. Develops and delivers outstanding Oracle presentations and demonstrations. Leads any and all aspects of the technical sales process. Advises internal and external clients on overall architect solutions. <br/><br/> Leading contributor individually and as a team member, providing direction and mentoring to others. Work is non-routine and very complex, involving the application of advanced technical/business skills in area of specialization. 3 years vendor (sales and marketing) experience. 7 years business experience with relevant computer applications or database/tools. Ability to implement the most advanced product features. Thorough knowledge of system and application design. In depth knowledge of competitors. Demonstrated project management skills. Demonstrated excellent verbal and written communication skills: needs analysis, positioning, business justification, closing techniques. Ability to persuade others through presentations, demonstrations, and written communication. Ability to travel as needed. A/BS degree or equivalent, advanced degree highly desirable.
Title: HCM & ERP Principal Sales Consultant

Job_Description: <div>Take your career to the next step! <br/><br/> We are currently seeking an experienced SAP professional with a passion for customer service, outstanding analytical skills and a desire to be part of a winning team. This individual will be an innovator and outside the box thinker – willing to challenge norms and break through paradigms to maximize customer value.  <ul>  	<li>A dynamic problem solver with a track record for building innovative solutions</li> <li>A passion for working hand-in-hand with customers to drive lasting transformational change</li> <li>Desire to be part of a winning team in one of the fastest growing SAP practices in North America</li> </ul> <strong>We currently have a requirement for a Senior SAP PP/QM Consultant.</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Role Description:</strong>  <ul>  	<li>Prepare for and lead manufacturing-related Blueprint workshops with clients;</li> <li>Recommend Illumiti and SAP template business processes to effectively meet business requirements, solve existing pain points, and bring tangible business benefits to clients;</li> <li>Collaborate with consulting and client project teams to establish and document proposed solution design based on SAP and Illumiti Best Practice templates;</li> <li>Configure SAP Production Planning (PP) and Quality Managment (QM) modules based on business requirements;</li> <li>Prepare functional specs for FRICEW objects approved as part of proposed PP/QM solution</li> <li>Conduct knowledge transfer sessions with client teams;</li> <li>Execute unit testing and prepare and present sprint demo sessions to prove out and, if necessary, adjust the proposed solution;</li> <li>Identify and write required test scripts and support integration and user-acceptance testing cycles;</li> <li>Prepare training documentation, business process procedures, and execute training sessions;</li> <li>Solve ongoing support issues and help continuously improve system and business processes at existing clients;</li> <li>Contribute to pre-sales opportunities, including helping with pre-sales preparation activities and delivering pre-sales demos to prospective clients;</li> </ul> <strong>Required Skills and Experience</strong>  <ul>  	<li>Candidate must be able to legally work in the United States and Canada; we do not provide sponsorship;</li> <li>Willing to travel.</li> <li>Excels when working under the pressure of tight project deadlines;</li> <li>Able to map and clearly articulate how specific areas of SAP PP functionality can be used to meet business requirements and solve business problems;</li> <li>Strong oral and written communication skills absolutely required;</li> <li>Experience establishing credibility with business decision makers and end users;</li> <li>Candidate should possess 10+ years senior level PP experience, including experience with discrete PP, PP-PI, and REM manufacturing models.</li> <li>Delivered a minimum of 5 full life cycle SAP implementations;</li> <li>End-to-end PP experience from SOP -> Rough-cut capacity planning -> MRP -> Detailed scheduling -> Manufacturing execution -> Process reporting, etc.;</li> <li>Manufacturing industry experience: Chemical, process manufacturing, mining, mill products, automotive, high-tech, etc.;</li> <li>Required PP-related knowledge: Batch mgmt., batch determination, Product costing integration, PlanningATP integration;</li> <li>Knowledge and experience with PI-sheets is an asset;</li> <li>Strong QM experience in manufacturing environments is a benefit;</li> <li>Desired QM-related knowledge: Production receipt inspections, in-process inspections, purchasing receipt inspections, CoAs, Quality notifications, LIMs integration;</li> <li>Experience with SCM-APO a nice-to-have, including DP (and related BW), GATP, SNP, CIF, and/or PP/DS;</li> <li>Working knowledge of BAPIs, BADIs, and other enhancement methods is a requirement;</li> <li>General understanding of ABAP; debug a nice-to-have skill</li> </ul> <strong>Education</strong>  <ul>  	<li>University Degree preferred;</li> <li>SAP certifications in PP, QM, or other SAP areas are beneficial;</li> <li>Industry certifications, such as APICS CPIM, are considered an asset.</li> </ul> Why join Illumiti? <br/><br/> At Illumiti, you will work hand-in-hand with some of the best and brightest SAP professionals in North America. You will be supported by the latest methodologies, tools and innovative thinking – all while enjoying the benefits of a close knit team and a great work environment. We take great pride in delivering unparalleled customer service and providing our customers with top value. <br/><br/> Our vision is to:  <ul>  	<li>Leverage innovative solutions to deliver business value to our customers across all stages of the Enterprise Software lifecycle;</li> <li>Develop long lasting, value based customer relationships by providing unparalleled customer service and solutions acumen; and</li> <li>Meet and exceed the expectations of our customers and our team.</li> </ul> If you are a senior SAP professional that thrives on finding solutions to complex business challenges – we want to hear from you. We offer a comprehensive benefits plan and very competitive compensation packages. <br/><br/> Take the next step in your career. Join Illumiti today! <br/><br/> <em>Illumiti is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age or veteran status. Illumiti is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.</em> <br/><br/> <em>Illumiti is committed to compliance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with disabilities Act (AODA) and Human Rights Code in the recruitment process. If you are an individual with a disability that requires a reasonable accommodation or are unable to use or access our recruitment tool as a result of your disability, you can request reasonable accommodations in the recruitment process by sending an email to accommodations@illumiti.com.</em></div> <br/>
Title: SAP PP/QM Consultant

Job_Description: <ul> <li>Provide investment advice to a wide range of institutional clients (DB, DC, endowments, foundations, etc.) on the determination of investment objectives, establishment of investment policy, selection of investment managers and the monitoring of investments.</LI>   <li>Create and evaluate investment strategies and their impact.</LI>   <li>Provide advice with respect to plan governance</LI>   <li>Create project work plans and monitor timelines and budget</LI>   <li>Determine clients' requirements and brief the team as appropriate, providing the direction and guidance required to ensure deadlines and services standards are met.</LI>   <li>Ensure that specialist teams are involved in the provision of advice as and when appropriate.</LI>   <li>Peer review reports, adding client specific information and ensuring client suitability.</LI>   <li>Direct the work of employees in a project team and coach/mentor others.</li> <li>Market and expand the Investment consulting business as well as Mercer's broader services as appropriate.</LI> </ul>   <ul> <li>CFA designation considered an asset</LI>   <li>10 plus years of relevant experience in Defined Benefit or Defined Contribution</li> <li>Consulting experience an asset</LI> </ul> Mercer delivers advice and technology-driven solutions that help organizations meet the health, wealth and career needs of a changing workforce. Mercer’s more than 22,000 employees are based in 43 countries and the firm operates in over 130 countries. Mercer is a wholly owned subsidiary of Marsh & McLennan Companies (NYSE: MMC), the leading global professional services firm in the areas of risk, strategy and people. With more than 60,000 colleagues and annual revenue over $13 billion, Marsh & McLennan helps clients navigate an increasingly dynamic and complex environment. Marsh & McLennan Companies is also the parent company of Marsh,which advises individual and commercial clients of all sizes on insurance broking and innovative risk management solutions; Guy Carpenter, which develops advanced risk, reinsurance and capital strategies that help clients grow profitably and pursue emerging opportunities; and Oliver Wyman, which serves as a critical strategic, economic and brand advisor to private sector and governmental clients. For more information, visit www.mercer.com. Follow Mercer on Twitter @Mercer. <br/><br/> Marsh & McLennan Companies offers competitive salaries and comprehensive benefits and programs including: health and welfare, tuition assistance, pension, employee assistance program, domestic partnership benefits, career mobility, employee network groups, volunteer opportunities, and other programs. For more information about our company, please visit us at: http://www.mmc.com/. We embrace a culture that celebrates and promotes the many backgrounds, heritages and perspectives of our colleagues and clients. For more information, please visit us at: www.mmc.com/diversity.

Job_Description: <strong>Aon Is Looking For An Investment Consultant</strong> <br/><br/> As part of an industry-leading team, you will help empower results for our clients by delivering innovative and effective solutions as part of our Investment Consulting practice within Aon Hewitt in Vancouver, BC. As an Investment Consultant, you will report directly to the Associate Partner, Investment Consulting. <br/><br/> <strong>***Please note - this position is located in Vancouver, BC***</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Your Impact As An Investment Consultant</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Job Responsibilities:</strong>  <ul>   <li>Providing consulting services and technical support on a range of client accounts;</li> <li>Assisting with marketing and sales activities;</li> <li>Anticipating client issues, needs or concerns and proactively developing solutions to meet those needs;</li> <li>Identifying gaps between client needs and existing Aon services; proposing and developing service enhancements, adding to Aon's product/service portfolio and intellectual capital;</li> <li>Continually reviewing client accounts and relationships and recommending ways to enhance the value Aon brings to the client based on a deep understanding of the client's business and insight into industry trends;</li> <li>Making and/or assisting in effective oral presentations to clients or prospects, as part of a team or individually;</li> <li>Providing guidance, mentoring and support to Investment Consulting staff as they serve their clients, ensuring high standards of service;</li> <li>Acting as a role model for technical excellence, ensuring adherence to technical, professional and ethical standards.</li> <li>Leading by example by demonstrating and sharing with all lines of business the importance of best practice; and</li> <li>Other related duties and responsibilities as assigned.</li> </ul> <strong>You Bring Knowledge and Expertise</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Required Experience:</strong>  <ul>   <li>Minimum seven (7) years of progressive experience in the investment industry;</li> <li>Strong knowledge of investment managers, investment processes and of defined benefit and defined contribution pension plans;</li> <li>Excellent interpersonal, communication and presentation skills, both verbally and written;</li> <li>Client focused and proven relationship building skills;</li> <li>Ability to work collaboratively as a key member of a team and independently with minimum supervision;</li> <li>Meticulous attention to detail, refined organizational skills and the ability to multi-task;</li> <li>Proven ability to prioritize competing requirements and deadlines under pressure;</li> <li>Must have strong computer skills and be proficient with the Microsoft Office Package.</li> </ul> <strong>Preferred Experience:</strong>  <ul>   <li>Expertise in investment issues related to defined contribution pension plans would be an asset.</li> </ul> <strong>Education:</strong>  <ul>   <li>Post-Secondary degree or a combination of education and equivalent years of industry experience;</li> <li>Completed Chartered Financial Analyst (CFA) designation, or actively pursuing;</li> <li>Commitment to ongoing learning and professional development including courses and certifications.</li> </ul> <strong>We Offer You:</strong> <br/><br/> A competitive total rewards package, continuing education & training, and tremendous potential with a growing worldwide organization. <br/><br/> <strong>Our Colleague Experience:</strong> <br/><br/> From helping clients gain access to capital after natural disasters, to creating access to health care and retirement for millions, Aon colleagues empower results for our clients, communities, and each other every day. They make a difference, work with the best, own their potential, and value one another. This is the Aon Colleague Experience, defining what it means to work at Aon and realizing our vision of empowering human and economic possibility. To learn more visit Aon Colleague Experience. <br/><br/> <strong>About Aon:</strong> Aon plc (NYSE:AON) is a leading global professional services firm providing a broad range of risk, retirement and health solutions. Our 50,000 colleagues in 120 countries empower results for clients by using proprietary data and analytics to deliver insights that reduce volatility and improve performance. <br/><br/> By applying for a position with Aon, you understand that, should you be made an offer, it will be contingent on your undergoing and successfully completing a background check consistent with Aon's employment policies. Background checks may include some or all of the following based on the nature of the position: SSN/SIN validation, education verification, employment verification, and criminal check, search against global sanctions and government watch lists, fingerprint verification, credit check, and/or drug test. You will be notified during the hiring process which checks are required by the position. <br/><br/> Aon is committed to a diverse workforce as an Employment Equity employer (Women, People with Disabilities, Aboriginal Peoples, and Visible Minorities). <br/><br/> DISCLAIMER: Nothing in this job description restricts management's right to assign or reassign duties and responsibilities to this job at any time.

Job_Description: <div><div><div><div><div><div>EY’s <br/> people in more than 150 countries are committed to operating with integrity, <br/> quality and professionalism in the provision of audit, tax and transaction <br/> advisory services. We strive to help all of our people achieve their <br/> professional and personal goals through an inclusive environment that values <br/> everyone's contributions, appreciates diversity of thought, fosters growth, and <br/> provides continuous opportunities for development. Recognized as one of <br/> Canada's top employers, EY continually strives to be a great place to work.</div><br/>  <div>EY has a well-established Climate Change and Sustainability practice to respond <br/> to our client’s growing need of guidance in this area, including greenhouse gas <br/> emission verification, assurance over sustainability-related data, Environment, <br/> Health & Safety advisory, sustainability strategy, among other services. We <br/> are looking to expand our team of professionals focused on Environment, Health <br/> & Safety (EHS) advisory, providing high value, independent, trusted advice <br/> to our clients. Our clients include many of today's leading global companies, <br/> innovative growth companies and other Publicly Accountable Enterprises.</div><br/>  <div>We are currently seeking a qualified candidate able to demonstrate strong <br/> leadership qualities for an excellent career and leadership opportunity in the <br/> provision of EHS information technology (IT) advisory services, at the Senior <br/> Consultant level.</div><div>Our <br/> success depends on your success and we can help you realize your potential. Our <br/> work environment is designed to help high-performing people thrive. EY <br/> commitment to the quality and integrity of our services is exemplified by our <br/> methodologies and our rigorous quality controls applied to every client <br/> engagement. Together with our substantial investments in technology, knowledge, <br/> and learning resources for our professionals, we deliver high quality services <br/> to our clients and their stakeholders.</div><br/>  <div><strong>Responsibilities:</strong>  <ul>   <li>Participate in IT consulting engagements, such as software selection and <br/>  implementation, business process mapping, project management; in the EHS, Sustainability and Risk areas</li> <li>Strong analytical skills, ability to interpret business needs and <br/>  translate them into application and operational requirements</li> <li>Professional presence with the ability to quickly establish <br/>  personal credibility and demonstrate expertise</li> <li>Experience in facilitating meetings and drive discussions with <br/>  senior customer executives, business users, and IT professionals</li> <li>Work effectively as a team member, sharing responsibility, <br/>  providing support, maintaining communication and updating team leaders on <br/>  progress</li> <li>Support client relationships, business development and <br/>  account management efforts</li> <li>Build strong internal relationships with other services across the <br/>  organization</li> <li>Ability to travel for project work across Canada</li>  </ul> To qualify for this highly visible position with excellent potential for <br/> career advancement, candidates must have:  <ul>   <li>University degree in the Information Technology and/or Business <br/>  Administration fields</li> <li>1-3 years’ experience in technology <br/>  consulting services, preferably in the area of EHS and Sustainability <br/>  software (SAP, Enablon, Sphera, Process Map, Medgate, <br/>  etc.)</li> <li>Understanding of EHS processes such as <br/>  environmental compliance, incident management, risk assessment, <br/>  occupational health, industrial hygiene and others, is an asset</li> <li>Management consulting experience is an asset</li> <li>Previous experience with a public accounting firm or consulting practice in the <br/>  technology services area is an asset</li> <li>Energetic, passionate and entrepreneurial spirit</li> <li>A dedication to teamwork and leadership</li> <li>Advanced written and verbal communication skills</li> <li>Bilingualism (French - English) is an advantage</li> </ul> EY is committed to <br/> inclusiveness, equity and accessibility. We encourage all qualified candidates <br/> to apply. </div>  </div> </div>  </div>  </div> </div> <br/>
Title: Senior Consultant, Climate Change and Sustainability (EHS-IT)

Job_Description: Dell is a collective of customer-obsessed, industry-leading visionaries. At our core is a commitment to diversity, sustainability and our communities. We believe in working together to build a brighter future, celebrating the entrepreneurial spirit that lives inside us all, and marrying innovation with action. Dell is proud to offer unparalleled growth and development opportunities for our team members. We believe that technology is essential for driving human progress, and were committed to providing that technology to people and organizations everywhere, so they can transform the way they work and live. We currently have an opening on our Presales Commercial team. This role can be located anywhere within the Montreal region with the ability to work from home and travel within that region. Role Responsibilities Responsible for driving the technical sales strategy for DELL products and services in assigned customer accounts. As a member of a field account team, the candidate must demonstrate leadership abilities across a diverse set of matrix sales teams to accelerate the adoption of DELL EMC products and services. Works with Sales Team to develop & implement specific account penetration strategies, produce account specific product & service & sales plans Maintains knowledge of competitive solutions to effectively address & dispel customer objections to DELL solutions, & train the account team Anticipates technology and/or market trends & provides guidance on their application to external customers & feedback of business requirements back into DELL's engineering & marketing organizations Successfully builds relationships with the account team, partners & customers in support of sales team objectives & engages & leverages corporate resources, abilities, budgets & personnel as appropriate. Leads technical sales calls Configures & documents DELL software, hardware & service solutions to meet customer & sales objectives. Completes required presales documentation quickly & accurately Works with Sales Team to develop & implement specific account penetration strategies, produce account specific product & service & sales plans for Enterprise Products. Detailed product knowledge. Previous hands-on experience in the data center environment, with expertise spanning storage, BRS, virtualization, convergence, Cloud and/or Big Data Maintains knowledge of competitive solutions to effectively address & dispel customer objections to DELL solutions, & train the account team. Competitive Knowhow of HDS, IBM, NetApp Storage Solutions is essential Anticipates technology and/or market trends & provides guidance on their application to external customers & feedback of business requirements back into DELL's engineering & marketing organizations Requirements: Competitive understanding of the different storage vendors offerings from HDS, IBM, Oracle, NetApp, etc. Excellent presentation skills in front of all levels of the IT Organization Working knowledge of Storage Analysis and Monitoring Tools Detailed product knowledge. Previous hands-on experience in the data center environment, with expertise spanning storage, BRS, virtualization, convergence, Cloud and/or Big Data Customer focused. Communication skills. Ability to work effectively with senior management. Ability to manage in a matrix environment. Ability to influence others to achieve results. Company: With more than 100,000 team members globally, we promote an environment that is rooted in the entrepreneurial spirit in which the company was founded. Dells team members are committed to serving our communities, regularly volunteering for over 1,500 non-profit organizations. The company has also received many accolades from employer of choice to energy conservation. Our team members follow an open approach to technology innovation and believe that technology is essential for human success. Why work with us? Life at Dell means collaborating with dedicated professionals with a passion for technology. When we see something that could be improved, we get to work inventing the solution. Our people demonstrate our winning culture through positive and meaningful relationships. We invest in our people and offer a series of programs that enables them to pursue a career that fulfills their potential. Our team members health and wellness is our priority as well as rewarding them for their hard work. Dell is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at Dell are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion or belief, national, social or ethnic origin, sex (including pregnancy), age, physical, mental or sensory disability, HIV status, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, marital, civil union or domestic partnership status, past or present military service, family medical history or genetic information, family or parental status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. Dell will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics. Learn more about Diversity and Inclusion at Dell here .

Title: Senior Consultant (Modern Desktop)

Job_Description: Accelerate your career as you help reinvent the value and impact of information for business everywhere. At DELL EMC, we are leading customers on their journey to cloud computing by enabling them to store, manage, protect and analyze their information assets in a more agile, trusted and cost effective way. If you are passionate about technology and want to be part of the information management revolution, join more than 70,000+ DELL EMCers around the world who are leading the journey to the cloud. Pre-Sales The business is looking for a people-focused technical sales leader who provides technical direction and business guidance to the regional sales team. As a Sr. Sales Engineer, you will be accountable for regional revenue goals by driving innovative technical programs and overseeing day-to-day account-level activities. The successful candidate must be a highly technical professional possessing in-depth knowledge of the storage industry and virtualization who should be able to demonstrate technical leadership and subject matter expertise on storage products, distributed architectures, file systems, and competitive storage offerings in the SAN product space. GENERAL SUMMARY Provides technical leadership and direction to customers and internal staff in the development of fully integrated technology solutions in support of pre-sales activities in the assigned market. Assists in the analysis, design and development of fully integrated technology solutions. Acts as technical expert and consultant to develop and propose solutions that meet the technology and business requirements of assigned customers. Technical emphasis is on hardware capabilities, software requirements and systems integration. Makes technical and sales presentations to customer's technical staff and senior management. Understands DELL EMC and competitive technology and business applications within the assigned market. Conducts research, answers questions and removes objections that arise in a sales campaign. Serves as a trusted technology advisor to customers and serves as an internal resource on technical issues or specific business applications within an assigned market segment. Makes technical and sales presentations to technical staff and top management. Applicable markets: Enterprise, Commercial, Partner, Specialist/Practice PRINCIPAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES Works with Sales Team to develop and implement specific account penetration strategies, produce account specific product and service and sales plans. Maintains knowledge of competitive solutions to effectively address and dispel customer objections to DELL EMC solutions, and train the account team. Anticipates technology and/or market trends and provides guidance on their application to external customers and feedback of business requirements back into DELL EMC's engineering and marketing organizations. Successfully builds relationships with the account team, partners and customers in support of sales team objectives and engages and leverages corporate resources, abilities, budgets and personnel as appropriate. Leads technical sales calls Configures and documents DELL EMC software, hardware and service solutions to meet customer and sales objectives. Qualifies sales opportunities in the terms of customer technical requirements, competition, decision making process and funding. Presents and markets the design and value of proposed DELL EMC solution and business case to customers, prospects and DELL EMC management. Desired Skills & Experience: 3+ yrs of enterprise sales engineering management experience, be a self-motivated leader, highly energetic, with a strong hands-on, can do approach. Expertise in multiple areas as it relates to cloud architecture including virtualization and/or SAN, NAS, iSCSI, Flash, convergence/hyper-convergence, HPC, advanced server technology, devops, big data, etc. Knowledge of distributed computing, virtual memory subsystem and scale-out storage architecture is a plus. Demonstrated strong written, oral and presentation skills with the ability to discuss highly technical concepts to a variety of audiences, including executive level technical decision-makers. Demonstrated ability to develop and execute strategic initiatives. A high level of business acumen and experience working with Cx0 level personnel, bringing technology solutions to solve business challenges. Dell is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at Dell are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion or belief, national, social or ethnic origin, sex (including pregnancy), age, physical, mental or sensory disability, HIV status, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, marital, civil union or domestic partnership status, past or present military service, family medical history or genetic information, family or parental status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. Dell will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics. Learn more about Diversity and Inclusion at Dell here

Job_Description: KPMG's Management Consulting team is looking for an individual with a strong work ethic who is dedicated to providing outstanding client service to strengthen our Calgary team. We provide a wide range of advisory services to major client organizations in various industries; increase productivity and reduce operational costs through business process, organizational and technology enhancements; increase revenue potential and margins; implement practical solutions for continuous and sustainable improvements; align activities with operational strategy; and position the organization for future growth. <br/><br/> <STRONG>KPMG Professionals Are...</STRONG> <br/><br/> Individuals who take deep personal accountability for their work, have a passion for excellence, driven to achieve their full potential and understand the value of building relationships with clients, future clients, their communities, the global firm and each other. A KPMG professional should have all the following characteristics: <ul> <LI>Strong work ethic</LI><LI>Thrive on challenges</LI><LI>Dedicated to providing outstanding client service.</LI> </ul>  <STRONG>Position Summary</STRONG> <br/><br/> We are seeking a Consultant and/or Senior Consultant for our Financial Management Advisory practice who will be responsible for working with other team members to deliver engagements for clients to KPMG's high standards. The successful candidate will also ensure client satisfaction on assignments and work cooperatively with other Advisory practitioners in Canada. <br/><br/> <STRONG>Role and Responsibilities</STRONG> <br/><br/> Delivery of concurrent multiple finance improvement and finance transformation engagements including:  <ul> <LI>Finance Diagnostic and strategy</LI><LI>Finance Integration</LI><LI>Finance leading practices assessment</LI><LI>Finance Process Optimization</LI><LI>ERP Advisory – Finance</LI><LI>Business Intelligence services</LI><LI>Performance Measurement</LI><LI>Financial modeling</LI><LI>Project Management and Quality Assurance Services</LI> </ul>  <STRONG>Skills & Qualifications</STRONG>  <ul> <LI>University degree in Commerce or Administration or other relevant discipline is required.</LI><LI>Professional accounting designation (CA, CMA, CGA)</LI><LI>2+ years consulting or professional services firm background. Industry experience in finance roles would be an asset</LI><LI>Strong business analyst skills</LI><LI>Knowledge of ERP systems and reports applications would be an asset</LI><LI>Excellent oral communication ability including presentation and facilitation</LI><LI>Excellent report writing abilities</LI><LI>Strong client relationship skills</LI><LI>Ability to multi task and deliver several projects concurrently</LI><LI>Demonstrated ability to interact effectively with a diverse group of clients and colleagues</LI><LI>Ability to multi task and deliver several projects concurrently</LI><LI>Demonstrated ability to interact effectively with a diverse group of clients and colleagues</LI><LI>Ability to identify critical drivers to client service delivery</LI><LI>Knowledge of Energy industry including Power and Utility and Oil and Gas</LI>  </ul>  <strong><DIV>#LI-HH1</DIV></strong>
Title: Senior Consultant - Financial Management

Job_Description: <div><p><strong>Job Type: </strong>Permanent <br><strong>Primary Location: </strong>Calgary, Alberta, Canada <br><strong>All Available Locations: </strong>Calgary; Toronto; Vancouver </p><div><p><p>Posting Description</p><p><p>Deloitte helps businesses master technology and business challenges through the people and offerings of its Technology Strategy practice. We advise senior executives, particularly CEOs, CFOs and CIOs, on maximizing the creation of business value with the help of information technologies. Our end-to-end services cover the range of Information Technology challenges, from defining IT strategy and implementing the architecture to measuring and maximizing IT value as well as optimizing performance. We help our clients align their IT strategies with business strategies and transform the IT organization, processes, and technologies through financial discipline and a business-focused perspective.</p><p> </p><p>Mergers & Acquisitions | IT Transformation<br>Our IT merger and acquisition specialists help our clients to proactively plan and implement post-merger integration activities, as well as manage carve out projects. We offer a full suite of M&A IT capabilities-from IT capability development and diligence through IT integration or divestiture implementation-to help our clients businesses rapidly realize their deal drivers including planned synergies, significant cost savings, and establishing a strong basis for accelerated growth.</p><p> </p><p>Position Overview<br>Our practitioners work collaboratively within integrated, cross-functional teams to deliver M&A engagements across all phases of the M&A lifecycle including due-diligence, pre-close, and post-merger integration. Teamwork is crucial as teams are composed of a diverse group of specialists across multiple disciplines from both within our consulting practice and from our clients, helping drive towards a successful outcome. In this exciting and collaborative culture, our practitioners are empowered to own and deliver their respective deliverables while managing different clients and other stakeholders. Practitioners are also encouraged and enabled to get involved and contribute towards business and practice development, thought leadership and eminence building.</p></p></p><p><p>Posting Qualifications</p><p><p>Required:</p><p> </p><p>• Bachelor’s degree with 4+ years of relevant consulting or industry experience or<br>• Master’s degree with 2+ years of relevant consulting or industry experience<br>• Strong program management skills prioritizing strategic objectives and evaluating clients' opportunities against identified strategies.<br>• Experience with budget and resource allocation by utilizing MS Project and Excel.<br>• Establishing and overseeing the quality of deliverables by effectively participating in the presentation of proposals for business development activities.<br>• Experience providing service excellence by identifying key client business issues, determining client needs, evaluating and validating analyses, and developing recommendations for the client in the context of the overall engagement.<br>• Strong oral and written communication skills, including presentation skills (MS PowerPoint, MS Excel, MS Visio).<br>• Ability to work independently, manage multiple tasks and assignments while demonstrating strong problem solving and troubleshooting skills with the capacity to exercise mature judgment.<br>• Experience advising clients, managing tasks, executing projects and delivering results.</p><p> </p><p>Additional Qualifications and Experience Preferred:<br>• Comfortable with ambiguity with experience developing and facilitating large cross-functional workshops, planning and implementing IT integration and separation projects as the result of M&A activity.<br>• Demonstrate practical experience with communications, culture, and change management.<br>• Experience working in the Financial Services Industry or Energy and Resources Sector.<br>• Participated in one or more M&A projects focused on an IT work stream including IT Infrastructure separation, data center migration, application integration / separation / rationalization, IT synergies/cost reduction.<br>• Experience supporting cross-functional project management, contingency planning, and Day 1 cutover planning to help execute global technology deployment and integration for mergers, acquisitions, and divestitures.<br>• Experience guiding clients on key concepts and strategies for M&A engagements, including but not limited to stranded cost analyses, demanding timelines, and business continuity during transformation, synergy identification and capture, and system cutovers.<br>• Ability to articulate leading business issues and trends, including the associated technology implications within one or more industries.<br>• Experience participating in the development and presentation of proposals for business development activities.<br>• A willingness and ability to travel up to 80% of the time (Monday – Thursday).</p> </p></p></div><p><strong>Why Deloitte?</strong></p><p>Launch your career with The One Firm where you can make a greater impact than you ever thought possible. With endless opportunities at every turn, and a culture built to support and drive our people to be the very best they can be, Deloitte is The One Firm for you to learn, grow, create, and lead.</p><p>At Deloitte, we understand that everyone, and their career goals, are different. As a firm, we help create the conditions and opportunities that will enable our people to thrive – both professionally and personally. We do this by making three commitments to our people:</p><ul><li><em><strong>You will lead at every level:</strong></em> We grow the world’s best leaders so you can achieve the impact you seek, faster.</li><li><em><strong>You can work your way:</strong></em> We give you the means to work how you want, and we have innovative spaces and the mindset to help you be wildly successful.</li><li><em><strong>You will feel included and inspired:</strong></em> We create a deep sense of belonging where you can bring your whole self to work.</li></ul><p>Apply now and let us show you how to push your career to the next level at <em><strong>Deloitte. Preference will be given to those from the group insurance industry, a consulting firm or brokerage or in an HR department.</li> </ul> Education  <ul> <li>Post-secondary education</li>  <li>GBA (CEBS) designation, or working towards it.</li>  <li>Life Insurance license (this will be a requirement within 3 months of onboarding)</li> </ul> Skills  <ul> <li>Strong presentation skills and comfort speaking in front of large groups</li>  <li>Understanding of consultative selling and the ability to manage the sales cycle effectively and autonomously</li>  <li>Expert negotiation, technical and analytical skills</li>  <li>Can effectively communicate complex concepts in plain written and spoken language</li> </ul> Professional Traits  <ul> <li>Exceptional customer focus; some would say you’re the best</li>  <li>Extremely organized self-starter, flexible, highly independent</li>  <li>Ability to manage multiple deadlines simultaneously</li>  <li>Proven collaborative team member with the ability to motivate and inspire team members</li> </ul> <strong><u>Morneau Shepell</u> </strong> <br/><br/> Morneau Shepell is in the business of helping organizations help their people because we believe that engaged people are the driving force for society. Comprehensive policy review to take place annually</li><li>Respond to and follow-up on client requests and activities related to the new vehicle acquisition process</li><li>Manage day-to-day client activities and requests</li><li>Research client inquiries/issues related to vehicle replacement activities on a regular basis</li><li>Facilitate client inquires on a daily basis and determine best course of action for resolution</li><li>Assist with process improvement initiatives and business feedback when required</li><li>Other duties as assigned</li> </ul> <strong>Education/Experience:</strong> <ul> <li>College or University degree is preferred</li><li>Strong customer service experience</li> </ul> <strong>Requirements:</strong> <ul> <li>Able to influence without authority</li><li>Excellent communications skills (oral/written)</li><li>Self-motivated& takes initiative</li><li>Exceptional presentation skills</li><li>Organized& time management</li><li>Detailed oriented</li><li>Professional approach and appreciation for client's organization and sensitivities</li><li>Relationship-building skills (internal/external)</li><li>Results oriented</li><li>Resourceful and can ask probing questions to anticipate needs</li><li>Accountable - takes ownership</li><li>Proactive, anticipate client needs, consultative approach with ability to make recommendations</li><li>Proficient use of MS Office tools (PowerPoint, Excel and Word)</li><li>Sensitivity to client needs</li> </ul>

Job_Description: <div><p><strong>Job Type: </strong>Permanent <br><strong>Primary Location: </strong>Calgary, Alberta, Canada <br><strong>All Available Locations: </strong>Calgary; Vancouver </p><div><p><p>External Posting Description</p><p><p>Consulting in one word? Multifaceted. The different layers of challenging work, diverse workplaces and opportunities for growth means no two days are ever the same. As a leader of this collaborative team, you can develop your skills, challenge your entrepreneurial spirit and push your career to the next level.</p><p>Deloitte's Supply Chain & Manufacturing Operations Consulting practice is a leader in the Canadian market. We work hand-in-hand with our clients from across virtually every industry to improve business performance, drive shareholder value and create competitive advantage. Our clients include Canadian and international organizations of all sizes. If you’re eager to tackle complex programs, to learn from some of the biggest leaders in the industry, and to offer clarity in an ever-changing world, Consulting may be right for you. Get inspired by the talented people around you and let your story unfold at Deloitte. Broaden your skills. Broaden your reach. Broaden your career. It’s all possible at Deloitte.</p><p>We are growing and have new opportunities for talented professionals to join our successful and collaborative team. As a Manufacturing Strategy & Operations Consultant or Senior Consultant within the Supply Chain and Manufacturing Operations Practice, you will actively prioritize and manage the following key activities and responsibilities.</p><p> </p><p><strong><u>Responsibilities:</u></strong></p><ul><li>Participate in best-in-class Manufacturing assessments and transformations</li><li>Work with small, collaborative engagement teams through the development and the implementation of Manufacturing strategies and solutions</li><li>Develop innovative recommendations to address client issues based on an understanding of the client business and industry</li><li>Identify opportunities, author client deliverables and present findings at the senior client level</li><li>Work collaboratively with client personnel, leveraging their resources and knowledge to achieve project goals and complete deliverables on-time</li><li>Build strong relationships with client counterparts and key stakeholders</li><li>Provide clear and concise status updates and assist the leadership team with managing project risks</li><li>Mentor and support junior resources on engagements</li><li>Drive the development of proposals to assist clients in improving their supply chain performance</li><li>Continuously improve professional skills through a variety of Deloitte and external training courses</li><li>Participate in firm recruiting events to help the practice attract highly talented team members</li></ul></p></p><p><p>External Posting Qualifications</p><p><p>3-6+ years of Manufacturing related work experience; experience required will depend on entry level (Consultant or Senior Consultant)</p><ul><li>Project-based experience is an asset</li><li>Previous consulting experience, as an internal or external consultant, is preferred</li><li>Demonstrated expertise in key Manufacturing focus areas such as:<ul><li>Industrial Engineering</li><li>Operations excellence, continuous improvement</li><li>Process, Productivity, Quality or Service improvement</li><li>Lean / Six Sigma – Black belt, an asset</li><li>Maintenance Strategy, Maintenance Planning</li></ul></li><li>Experience with Manufacturing Execution applications, analytics and IoT technology is an asset</li><li>Strong analytical and problem-solving capabilities</li><li>Superior verbal and written communication skills</li><li>Excellent interpersonal skills and demonstrated ability to work effectively in teams</li><li>Someone who thrives in a fast-paced and fluid environment</li><li>Comfortable working in an ambiguous environment with pressing deadlines and constantly changing client needs and conditions</li><li>Proven ability to deliver project management accountabilities in a cross functional environment</li><li>Experienced with problem diagnosis, solution development, client communication, and facilitation of decision making, documentation, managing expectations, project profitability and team leadership</li><li>Ability to anticipate the long term, multifunctional impact of all decisions and take a broad approach to problem solving</li><li>MBA or P. Eng. designation is highly desirable</li><li>Strong commitment to professional and client service excellence</li><li>Extensive travel in Canada and USA may be required</li></ul></p></p></div><p><strong>Why Deloitte?</strong></p><p>Launch your career with The One Firm where you can make a greater impact than you ever thought possible. With endless opportunities at every turn, and a culture built to support and drive our people to be the very best they can be, Deloitte is The One Firm for you to learn, grow, create, and lead.</p><p>At Deloitte, we understand that everyone, and their career goals, are different. As a firm, we help create the conditions and opportunities that will enable our people to thrive – both professionally and personally. We do this by making three commitments to our people:</p><ul><li><em><strong>You will lead at every level:</strong></em> We grow the world’s best leaders so you can achieve the impact you seek, faster.</li><li><em><strong>You can work your way:</strong></em> We give you the means to work how you want, and we have innovative spaces and the mindset to help you be wildly successful.</li><li><em><strong>You will feel included and inspired:</strong></em> We create a deep sense of belonging where you can bring your whole self to work.</li></ul><p>Apply now and let us show you how to push your career to the next level at <em><strong>Deloitte. The One Firm. For You.</strong></em></p><p>Deloitte is an inclusive employer dedicated to building a diverse workforce. We encourage applications from all qualified candidates and will accommodate applicants’ needs under the respective provincial human rights codes throughout all stages of the recruitment and selection process. Please advise the Recruiter to ensure your accessibility needs are accommodated throughout this process. Information received relating to accommodation will be addressed confidentially.</p><p>We thank all applicants in advance for their interest; however, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted</p><p>31134</p><p> </p></div>

Job_Description: Since 2008, iSolutions Inc has been providing production data management services to the oil and gas and power domains. We have developed a reputation as the go-to provider of production data management services in the Calgary market. Due to continued growth we are in need of lead consultants to join our practice. In this role you will leverage your existing consulting and project management expertise to service iSolutions customers and institutionalize our operational knowledge. Some of the key near term deliverables of this role include: <br/><br/> · Construct and manage a project & resource matrix identifying all clients, technical and project management resources and their respective loading for the next 12 months along with near-term opportunities <br/><br/> · Codify existing project management, charter and related template documents <br/><br/> · Assist in development of our Operations Management System (OMS) KPI toolset <br/><br/> · Take ownership of a number of key customer relationships with complete ownership of <br/><br/> o Project Delivery <br/><br/> o Exploring follow-on opportunities <br/><br/> o Enhancing & sustaining customer relationships <br/><br/> · Within 90 days, develop deep understanding of production data management in the oil and gas & power spaces along with understanding of typical customer requirements including <br/><br/> o Regulatory frameworks <br/><br/> o Data requirements <br/><br/> o Reporting requirements <br/><br/> o Solution architectures <br/><br/> At iSolutions you will have complete ownership on assigned tasks with support from the team as needed. At iSolutions, <br/><br/> · We provide access to a large variation of projects at multiple lifecycle stages and customer sites <br/><br/> · We value transparency and assertiveness over heavyweight processes & task planning <br/><br/> · We provide an environment conducive to rapid learning & growth <br/><br/> To successfully compete for this role, you should possess some or all of the following: <br/><br/> · Proven track record of growing responsibilities and successful project outcomes <br/><br/> · Oil and Gas knowledge in the data management, measurement & material balances, downtime management and optimization <br/><br/> · Deep technical / systems knowledge including <br/><br/> o Field Data Capture Systems such as Energy Components, FieldView, Avocet, PVR <br/><br/> o Corporate Historian Tools such as OSISoft PI, Honeywell PHD/Uniformance, AspenTech IP.21 or related tools <br/><br/> o Reporting toolsets such as SSRS, Jasper, Business Objects <br/><br/> o Software development with modern tools such as ASP.NET, C# <br/><br/> · Previous experience working with an engineering consulting firm <br/><br/> · Experience working on-site at production facilities such as: <br/><br/> · Gas plants <br/><br/> · Heavy oil facilities <br/><br/> · Refineries <br/><br/> · Solid understanding of Project Management disciplines <br/><br/> o PMI & related constructs <br/><br/> o Project Reporting <br/><br/> o Risk Management <br/><br/> o Scheduling and Budgeting <br/><br/> This role will require occasional travel. iSolutions offers a competitive compensation package and equity participation opportunities for the right candidate. Please submit your resume in confidence for prompt consideration. Visit our website at Isolutions.com to learn more about our company.
