services, including Service Organisation Controls audits (SOC1 / CSAE3416 / SSAE16 / ISAE 3403; SOC2; and SOC3), IT internal audits, IT testing for external audits, and IT testing for CEO / CFO requirements, to a broad base of clients</div></li><li><div>Assist in IT audit planning, prepare IT test procedures, document, and test IT controls</div></li><li><div>Possess strong communication, interpersonal and analytical skills</div></li><li><div>Contribute to the development of new ideas and approaches to improve work processes</div></li><li><div>Attend internal MNP courses to further develop knowledge around performance improvement</div></li> </ul> <strong>Credentials</strong> <ul> <li><div>Hold a Bachelor's Degree in Business Administration or Commerce majoring in Accounting, Information Systems, Computer Science or other relevant degree</div></li><li><div>Possess, or in the process of obtaining professional certifications, such as CISA, CISM, CISSP, CIA, CPA or other relevant designations</div></li><li><div>Cyber security, IT audit and internal controls experience is a definite asset</div></li><li><div>Experience with SOC audits and assessments is highly desired</div></li><li><div>Possess a strong understanding of business and audit risks</div></li><li><div>Knowledge and understanding of control frameworks and standards, including CIS Critical Security Controls, COBIT, ITIL, and ISO 27001/2 are an asset</div></li><li><div>Strong computer literacy including effective working skills of Microsoft Word, Excel and PowerPoint</div></li><li><div>One (1) to three (3) years of IT audit experience or relevant external audit experience with a focus on IT processes and controls</div></li><li><div>Some travel may be required</div></li> </ul> <strong>Core Competencies and Personal Characteristics</strong> <ul> <li><div><strong>Integrity –</strong> professional whose honesty, integrity, confidentiality and high ethical standards contributes to effective leadership and optimal business relationships</div></li><li><div><strong>Energy –</strong> displays enthusiasm, optimism, drive and passion while maintaining a high level of productivity and a balanced lifestyle</div></li><li><div><strong>Diversity –</strong> understands the importance of different backgrounds, perspectives and experiences and is respectful of individual differences</div></li><li><div><strong>Communication –</strong> effectively expresses ideas and conveys information in business writing, conversations and interactions with others</div></li><li><div><strong>Client Service Excellence –</strong> understands the importance of quality client service by being courteous, responding to client requests in a timely manner and monitoring satisfaction</div></li><li><div><strong>Teamwork & Relationship Development –</strong> works collaboratively with team members in order to achieve a common goal and develops, maintains and strengthens relationships with others, both inside and outside the Firm</div></li><li><div><strong>Accountability –</strong> takes responsibility for one’s own performance by setting clear goals and tracking progress against those goals; is highly organized and uses personal judgement and decision making</div></li><li><div><strong>Flexibility –</strong> effectively manages multiple assignments, adapts to changing priorities and is able to work independently or as part of a team</div></li> </ul> MNP encourages a balanced lifestyle and offers benefits that suit the way our team members work and play! In addition to a competitive salary, our total rewards package includes paid personal days, wellness program initiatives, health and dental benefits, a group pension plan with matching contribution, firm sponsored social events, and professional development assistance. <br/><br/> MNP proudly serves and responds to the needs of our clients in the public, private and not-for-profit sectors. Through partner-led engagements, we provide a collaborative, cost-effective approach to doing business, with innovative strategies to help organizations succeed across the country and around the world.
Title: Consultant, Technology Risk Services

Job_Description: Summary <br/><br/> This position presents the opportunity to work on large, complex, and challenging projects for a leading environmental and civil consulting firm with an expanding presence in Canada. Barr Engineering Company has been recognized as one of the "Best Environmental Services Firms to Work For" by CE News and Environmental Business Journal. <br/><br/> The selected candidate will help expand our presence and establish our assessment and remediation capabilities in the Alberta and Western Canada markets. Typical business-development activities will include building and maintaining client relationships, tracking marketing leads and project opportunities, developing proposals and presentations, networking, and sharing Barr’s capabilities with existing and potential clients. Project work may include managing multidiscipline teams; preparing technical work plans and cost estimates for investigations of contaminated soil, sediment, groundwater, and vapor intrusion; interpreting data; conducting remediation technology evaluations and feasibility studies; preparing technical reports; and coordinating site remediation activities. Additionally, the selected candidate will be leading client and regulatory negotiations, mentoring junior staff and will be responsible for financial performance on projects. <br/><br/> This position is located in Barr’s Calgary office, but fulfillment of its responsibilities will require periodic travel within Canada and to the United States. <br/><br/> Minimum Qualifications  <ul> <li>Bachelor’s degree in engineering, environmental science, or geology</li> <li>Ten or more years of relevant work experience</li>   <li>Technical knowledge of the federal and provincial environmental regulations and programs related to environmental and waste regulations, site remediation and cleanup technologies</li> <li>Demonstrated client-relationship and business development skills</li> <li>Demonstrated effectiveness in building working relationships and leading multidiscipline teams</li> <li>Demonstrated project management and organization skills</li> <li>A flexible working style and willingness to modify personal schedule as required to meet project deadlines and/or client needs</li> <li>Willingness to travel for business development purposes</li> <li>Legal authorization to work in Canada and the United States without the need for sponsorship</li> <li>Acceptable driving record</li> </ul> Preferred Qualifications  <ul>  <li>Advanced degree in engineering, environmental science, or geology</li> <li>Fifteen or more years of relevant work experience</li> <li>If applicable to the degree, professionally certified in Alberta (e.g., P. Eng., P. Geol.)</li>   <li>Established network with area clients and the ability to develop or foster ongoing relationships and maintain a high level of client service</li> </ul> Barr Engineering and Environmental Science Canada, Ltd. reserves the right to consider other legitimate, non-discriminatory factors that are not specifically listed. <br/><br/> We require proof of eligibility to work in Canada. <br/><br/> Barr Engineering Company strives to make www.barr.com accessible to any and all users. If you would like to contact us regarding the accessibility of our website or need assistance with completing the application process, please call 952-832-2600, or toll free at 800-632-2277. <br/><br/> Barr is an equal opportunity employer.
Title: Environmental Consultant - Remediation Focus

Job_Description: <div><strong>Job Type:</strong> Permanent <br/> <strong>Primary Location:</strong> Calgary, Alberta, Canada <br/> <strong>All Available Locations:</strong> Calgary; Vancouver<br/> <div> External Posting Description <br/><br/> Consulting in one word? Multifaceted. The different layers of challenging work, diverse workplaces and opportunities for growth means no two days are ever the same. As a leader of this collaborative team, you can develop your skills, challenge your entrepreneurial spirit and push your career to the next level. <br/><br/> Deloitte's Supply Chain & Manufacturing Operations Consulting practice is a leader in the Canadian market. We work hand-in-hand with our clients from across virtually every industry to improve business performance, drive shareholder value and create competitive advantage. Our clients include Canadian and international organizations of all sizes. If you’re eager to tackle complex programs, to learn from some of the biggest leaders in the industry, and to offer clarity in an ever-changing world, Consulting may be right for you. Get inspired by the talented people around you and let your story unfold at Deloitte. Broaden your skills. Broaden your reach. Broaden your career. It’s all possible at Deloitte. <br/><br/> We are growing and have new opportunities for talented professionals to join our successful and collaborative team. As a Supply Chain Planning Consultant or Senior Consultant in the Supply Chain & Manufacturing Operations Practice, you will actively prioritize and manage the following key activities and responsibilities. <br/><br/> <strong><u>Responsibilities:</u></strong> <br/><br/> Responsibilities will vary by level (Consultant or Senior Consultant): <ul> <li>Participate in best-in-class Supply Chain Planning strategy projects, operations assessments, and transformations</li><li>Be part of, or lead collaborative engagement teams through the development and implementation of Supply Chain Planning strategies and solutions</li><li>Develop innovative recommendations to address client issues based on an understanding of the client business and industry</li><li>Identify opportunities, author client deliverables and present findings at the senior client level</li><li>Work collaboratively with client personnel, leveraging their resources and knowledge to achieve project goals and complete deliverables on-time</li><li>Build strong relationships with client counterparts and key stakeholders</li><li>Provide clear and concise status updates and assist the leadership team with managing project risks</li><li>Develop proposals to assist clients in improving their supply chain performance</li><li>Continuously improve professional skills through a variety of Deloitte and external training courses</li><li>Participate in firm recruiting events to help the practice attract highly talented team members</li> </ul> External Posting Qualifications <br/><br/> Minimum 3 years of Supply Chain Planning related work experience. Experience required will depend on entry level (Consultant or Senior Consultant). <ul> <li>Project-based experience is an asset</li><li>Previous consulting experience, as an internal or external consultant, is preferred</li><li>Demonstrated expertise in key Supply Chain Planning focus areas such as:  <ul> <li>Integrated Business Planning</li><li>Strategic Network Planning</li><li>Demand / Supply / Inventory Planning</li><li>Forecasting & Replenishment</li><li>Finite Scheduling</li></ul></li> <li>Experience with leading Supply Chain Planning applications and technology is an asset</li><li>Strong analytical and problem-solving capabilities</li><li>Superior verbal and written communication skills</li><li>Excellent interpersonal skills and demonstrated ability to work effectively in teams</li><li>Someone who thrives in a fast-paced and fluid environment</li><li>Comfortable working in an ambiguous environment with pressing deadlines and constantly changing client needs and conditions</li><li>Undergraduate studies in Business/Engineering/Mathematics/Computer Science advantageous</li><li>Graduate studies in Business or Supply Chain related specializations advantageous</li><li>Extensive travel within Canada and internationally may be required</li> </ul> </div> <br/><strong>Why Deloitte?</strong> <br/><br/> Launch your career with The One Firm where you can make a greater impact than you ever thought possible. With endless opportunities at every turn, and a culture built to support and drive our people to be the very best they can be, Deloitte is The One Firm for you to learn, grow, create, and lead. <br/><br/> At Deloitte, we understand that everyone, and their career goals, are different. As a firm, we help create the conditions and opportunities that will enable our people to thrive – both professionally and personally. We do this by making three commitments to our people: <ul> <li><em><strong>You will lead at every level:</strong></em> We grow the world’s best leaders so you can achieve the impact you seek, faster.</li><li><em><strong>You can work your way:</strong></em> We give you the means to work how you want, and we have innovative spaces and the mindset to help you be wildly successful.</li><li><em><strong>You will feel included and inspired:</strong></em> We create a deep sense of belonging where you can bring your whole self to work.</li> </ul> Apply now and let us show you how to push your career to the next level at <em><strong>Deloitte. The One Firm. For You.</strong></em> <br/><br/> Deloitte is an inclusive employer dedicated to building a diverse workforce. We encourage applications from all qualified candidates and will accommodate applicants’ needs under the respective provincial human rights codes throughout all stages of the recruitment and selection process. Please advise the Recruiter to ensure your accessibility needs are accommodated throughout this process. Information received relating to accommodation will be addressed confidentially. <br/><br/> We thank all applicants in advance for their interest; however, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted <br/><br/> 31135</div>
Title: Senior Consultant, Supply Chain Planning

Job_Description: <strong>Ready to create innovative solutions and best practices?</strong><br/>  <div><strong>Join our team!</strong></div>  <br/>As a member of our Corporate Data Infrastructure Operations team, the Technology Consultant plays a critical and important role in the day to day operational support of TELUS existing Backup and Storage infrastructure supporting the Business within a 24x7 environment. The Technology Consultant is responsible for the implementation of new infrastructure and maintaining the existing footprint. As a team member, you will provide expertise of Industry best practice as it plays an important role in driving the direction of new storage and data management technologies. <br/><br/> <strong>Here’s the impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together!</strong> <br/><br/> You’re a strategic and forward thinker who is willing to take on any technical challenges and believes in achieving excellence.<br/>  <div><strong>Here's how…</strong></div> <br/>  <div><strong>You will:</strong> </div>  <ul>  <li>Manage the Problem Management Queue to closure</li> <li>Plan and Implement Changes as required under the ITIL framework</li> <li>Provide recommendation for Backup and Storage Architecture</li> <li>Implement Backup, Storage and SAN Monitoring best practices and maintain capacity management methodologies</li> <li>Deliver day to day operational and administration support for Storage and Backup Infrastructure</li> <li>Manage relationship with internal clients and external vendors</li> <li>Perform mentoring to Onshore and Offshore Staff</li> </ul> <strong>You're the missing piece of the puzzle…</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>With a Customer First Focus, you have:</strong> <ul>  <li>A University degree in Computer Science or Information Systems or equivalent</li> <li>5 years of hands on experience with administration and Management of backup</li> <li>and Storage Infrastructure – i.e. Dell EMC, NetApp and Hitachi</li> <li>Experience troubleshooting OS, hardware, network, storage, SAN, and Backup application problems</li> <li>Working experience in large, complex multi-vendor environments</li>  <li>Proficiency in handling multiple tasks efficiently and work on a wide range of systems</li> <li>Worked with cross-functional and geographically diverse team members</li> </ul>  <strong><div>Great-to-haves:</div> <br/> </strong>  <ul>  <li>Certifications in one of the following areas will be an asset: NetApp, Brocade, EMC, Hitachi</li> <li>Knowledge of Oracle backup appliance (ZFS)</li> <li>Project Coordination skills</li>  </ul>  <div><strong>Who is TELUS?</strong></div> <div> <div>We're a high-performing team of individuals who collectively make TELUS one of the leading telecommunications companies in Canada. Our competitive consumer offerings include wireline, wireless, internet and Optik TV™. We also deliver a compelling range of products and services for small, medium and large businesses; and have carved out a leadership position in the health, energy, finance and public sector markets with innovative industry specific solutions.</div> <br/>  <div>Everyone belongs at TELUS. It doesn’t matter who you are, what you do or how you do it, at TELUS, your unique contribution and talents will be valued and respected. Because the more diverse perspectives we have the more likely we are to crack the code on what our customers want and our communities need.</div> <br/>  <div>Do you share our passion?</div><br/>   <div>At TELUS, <strong>you</strong> create future friendly® possibilities.</div> <br/>  <div>At TELUS, we are committed to diversity and equitable access to employment opportunities based on ability.</div></div>
Title: Technology Consultant - Storage and Backup Management

Job_Description: <strong>KPMG Professionals Are...</strong> <br/>  <br/> Individuals who take deep personal accountability for their work, have a passion for excellence, driven to achieve their full potential and understand the value of building relationships with clients, future clients, their communities, the global firm and each other. A KPMG professional should have all the following characteristics:  <ul> <li>Strong work ethic</li><li>Thrive on challenges</li><li>Dedicated to providing outstanding client service.</li> </ul>  <strong>Position Summary</strong> <br/>  <br/> KPMG's Management Consulting group is experiencing exceptional growth, especially within IT Advisory. The rapidly expanding IT Advisory team is seeking a Senior Consultant or Manager for its IT Advisory practice in Vancouver, Calgary, Toronto, or Montreal office. Specifically, the practice is looking to fill a Workday Data Conversion Lead position. <br/>  <br/> <strong>Role and Responsibilities</strong> <br/>  <br/> Our IT Advisory team advises clients on executive and management issues in IT, to increase the value that IT delivers within their organization. Working with the senior leadership we assist them to define strategy, identify and champion transformation opportunities and assist with key IT decisions. <br/>  <br/> <strong>As a Senior Consultant/Manager you will:</strong>   <ul> <li>Deliver engagements under the direction of Senior Leadership</li><li>Create relationships with clients and staff</li><li>Contribute to business development actives (i.e. proposal development)</li><li>Positively contribute to the IT Advisory and Workday practice</li> </ul>  <strong>A Workday Data Conversion Lead is expected to:</strong>   <ul> <li>Participate in Workday HCM projects involving strategy, implementation support, and Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) optimization related to Information Technology (IT) operations, business processes, security, and data integrity for the Workday applications in Workday projects involving strategy, implementation support, and Workday optimization related to information technology operations, business processes, security, and data integrity for the applications</li><li>Review and map Workday business processes</li><li>Execute the day-to-day activities of Workday advisory engagements for a variety of clients including process design, package implementation lifecycle support, and project reviews</li><li>Review business processes and advise clients on system services available within the Workday application</li><li>Identify and communicate findings to senior management and client personnel</li> </ul>  <strong>Skills & Qualifications</strong> <br/>  <br/> Successful candidates will possess the following skills and behaviors:  <ul> <li>A minimum of three years of enterprise resource planning (ERP), HCM or Financial implementation and data conversion experience</li><li>Completion of one full implementation with Workday Data Conversion and Workday certification in HCM or Integration (Please note that any candidate hired by KPMG into this position that doesn't currently have the aforementioned certification will be required to secure one within three months from the commencement of employment)</li><li>Bachelor's degree in an appropriate field from an accredited college/university</li><li>Strong verbal and analytical skills with the ability to write at a publication quality level</li><li>Detailed understanding of ERP System concepts and general module functionality</li><li>Applicants must be currently authorized to work in Canada without the need for visa sponsorship now or in the future</li><li>Canadian travel required, with occasional international travel a possibility.</li> </ul>  <strong>Why Choose KPMG?</strong>  Making the right career choice is important, finding the right company is essential. Watch this video to see the type of people that thrive at KPMG. <br/><br/> <strong>Location</strong> Calgary, AB <br/>  <br/> <strong>Job Title</strong> Workday Data Conversion Lead, Manager or Senior Consultant <br/>  <br/> <strong>Our Values, The KPMG Way</strong> <br/>  <br/> We lead by example | We work together | We respect the individual <br/> We seek the facts and provide insight | We are open and honest in our communication <br/> We are committed to our communities | Above all, we act with integrity <br/><br/> KPMG is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity in its workforce. KPMG encourages applications from all qualified individuals and will accommodate applicants’ disability-related needs, up to the point of undue hardship, throughout all stages of the recruitment and selection process. Any assessment and selection materials or processes used during the recruitment process will be available in an accessible format to applicants with disabilities, upon request. <strong>If you require a disability-related accommodation in order to participate in the recruitment process</strong>, please contact the HR Shared Service Centre by email at cafmcdnhrsthotline@kpmg.ca or by phone at 416-777-8002 or toll free 1-888-466-4778 (Option 1). KPMG will consult with all applicants with disabilities who request accommodation during the recruitment process to ensure that the accommodation provided takes into account the applicant’s individual accessibility needs. <br/><br/> <strong>Category</strong> Consulting <br/>  <br/> <strong>Job Function</strong> Advisory <br/>  <br/> <strong>Service Line</strong> IT Advisory (Management Consulting) <br/>  <br/> <strong>Industry</strong> Not Applicable

Job_Description: On!Track Sales Consultant-Calgary AB <br/>  <strong> <br/>  <div> Calgary, AB</div> </strong><br/>   <div>Reference No:  <br/>  5559</div>  <br/>  What's the role?<br/>   <div>The Software Field Specialist Canada will assist in growing and supporting a new software product and service with local, regional, and global partners at Hilti. This team member will coordinate with local sales personnel to leverage customer relationships and develop markets; thereby increasing sales and penetration of ON!Track.</div>  <br/>Who is Hilti?<br/>   <div>If you’re new to the industry, you might not have heard of us. We provide leading-edge tools, technologies, software and services for the global construction sector. We have a proud heritage, built over 75 years, and a worldwide reputation for pioneering products and exceptional service. With some 23,000 people in more than 120 countries, we’re a great place for you to show us your worth as you learn, grow and carve-out your career.</div>  <br/>What does the role involve?<br/>   <div>If you’re new to the industry, you might not have heard of us. We provide leading-edge tools, technologies, software and services for the global construction sector. We have a proud heritage, built over 75 years, and a worldwide reputation for pioneering products and exceptional service. With some 27,000 people in more than 120 countries, which we’re looking to expand, we’re a great place for you to show us your worth, step up to new challenges and grow your career.</div><br/>   <div> <div> You’ll work with some of the industry’s most trusted and innovative engineering products.</div> </div>  <br/>What do we offer?<br/>   <div>We’ll give you everything you need to excel in your role and one-to-one coaching. You’ll enjoy a rare combination of autonomy and camaraderie, as you’ll manage your own book of business while being part of a friendly team. <br/><br/> We’ll give you lots of responsibility, including your own portfolio of customers and these might be trades experts, project managers, or company leaders. From there, we’ll trust you to do whatever it takes to deliver outstanding results. Go the extra mile and we’ll reward you with unrivaled training, development, and career opportunities as soon as you’re ready for the next challenge. <br/><br/> Day to day you’ll report to , who will also be there to help you manage your career.</div>  <br/>Why should you apply?<br/>   <div>We have an excellent mix of people and some of our best account managers joined us with little or no construction experience. Success at Hilti is down to teamwork and ability, no matter what your background.</div>  <br/>What you need is:<br/>   <div>  <ul> <li>Bachelor’s degree preferred or equivalent work experience.</li>   <li>At least one year prior experience in customer service and/ or sales working directly with customers, preferred (either over phone or face-to-face)</li> <li> Ability to thrive both independently and in a team environment.</li>   <li>Demonstrated ability to develop engaged customer relationships and effectively implement strategic concepts.</li>   <li>Excellent time and territory management skills.</li>   <li>Must be persuasive, sales driven, customer focused, and a team player.</li>   <li>Proficient computer skills including MS Office Suite, and smartphones.</li>   <li>Must maintain a professional business appearance in accordance with HNA dress policy at all times.</li>   <li>Career advancement may require domestic and/or global mobility.</li>  <strong><li> Vehicle/ Driver’s License Requirements:</li>  </strong>  <li>Company vehicle provided for carrying tools/fasteners for product demonstration purposes.</li>   <li>Must have valid driver’s license and comply with HNA Fleet Safety Policy requirements.</li>   <li>Account Manager has responsibility for prudent care and protection of company assets.</li> </ul>  </div><br/>  <div>As part of your interview process, we’ll take you on a day-in-the-life ‘field ride’ to give you a feel for the job and the caliber of our people. We’ll also pay for your travel to the interview. <br/><br/> Tempted to apply or find out more? Go to hilti.ca/careers.</div><br/>  <div> On!Track Sales Consultant-Calgary AB</div>  <br/>
Title: On!Track Sales Consultant

Job_Description: Do you want to work with one of the fastest growing global consultancies in the property and infrastructure sectors? <br/><br/> Do you want to be a leader in one of Canada's largest construction markets? <br/><br/> Our Cost Management Team has an immediate need for a Senior Cost Consultant based out of our office in Calgary. Reporting to the team Lead, you will engage with major Developers, Designers, and Engineering companies in Calgary and Canada-wide. Our exciting portfolio of projects span across various sectors including, but not limited to, Commercial, Residential, Educational, Government, and Healthcare. As a Senior Cost Consultant, you will play an integral role in the continued growth of our Cost Management Team within the Calgary market and across Canada. <br/><br/> BTY is a leading professional consultancy firm specializing in supporting developers and owners plan, build and maintain real estate and infrastructure assets worldwide. We are consistently recognized as the #1 Technical Advisor in North America and #3 Globally. <br/><br/> <strong>Why BTY?</strong> <br/><br/> Like many other companies you can consider, we also cross all the t’s and dot all the i's for competitive compensation, bonuses, benefits that cover you and your family, vacation time and regular appraisals. <strong>But we offer a whole lot more for candidates who are the right fit for our team:</strong>  <ul> <li>You will spend one-on-one time learning from BTY’s Partners, Directors and Service Line Experts who will work with you to develop outstanding long-term relationships with clients and industry partners;</li>  <li>We bring you to the decision-making table from the start and listen to your point of view when we’re going after some of the most exciting projects worldwide;</li>  <li>We foster a collaborative culture that develops inspiring, well-rounded leaders with technical and business expertise from diverse backgrounds;</li>  <li>Your growth will never be limited to just your “backyard”. If you are excited by opportunities, learning new service lines or making your mark in a new market – you need to be part of the BTY team; and</li>  <li>We think it’s important to truly enjoy where you work and enjoy the people you work with. Our Culture brings the right balance of great work ethic, social time and respecting your time.</li> </ul> <strong>Responsibilities:</strong>  <ul> <li>Quantification of materials using BTY’s measurement software to prepare cost estimates in accordance with the CIQS Rules of Measurement and best practice</li>  <li>Understands unit rates, general conditions and pricing estimates</li>  <li>Prepare front-end cost reports to support cost estimates</li>  <li>Provide pro-active cost management advise and ensure the Clients understand the content of our reports</li>  <li>Networks occasionally promoting the business, cross-selling and building new contacts and enhancing client relationships</li>  <li>Attend periodic site inspections</li>  <li>Preparation of estimates in accordance with the CIQS elemental format and, where required, divisional trade format</li>  <li>Preparation of estimates at various stages of the design process, from conceptual design to pre-tender stage</li>  <li>Assessment and analysis of any cost variances between estimate stages</li>  <li>Preparation of change order review analysis and lifecycle cost estimates</li>  <li>Assessment of cost-to-complete and work-in-place for construction work during periodic site visits</li>  <li>Maintain and update cost estimating database for labour and material rates on a regular basis</li> </ul> <br/><br/> <strong>Skills and Expertise</strong>  <ul> <li>7+ years of relevant industry experience;</li>  <li>Professionally qualified: PQS, MRICS, LEED or working towards professional designation</li>  <li>University degree or equivalent;</li>  <li>Proven strategic thinker;</li>  <li>Understanding of the construction industry - development, contracting and consultant services;</li>   <li>Passion for business development and managing client relationships; and</li>  <li>A combination of experience and education will be considered</li> </ul> <strong>Ready to apply?</strong> Submit your résumé by clicking the button below. For more information, contact us at careers@bty.com <br/><br/> <strong>We value people before process.</strong> From building great relationships with clients and industry partners, to supporting the goals of team members in and out of the office; at BTY, you get to bring your whole self to help us achieve a shared vision for success. <br/><br/> Visit our website to learn more about our services, markets and the people behind our success. <br/><br/> Follow us on LinkedIn and Twitter to stay connected. <br/><br/> —— <br/><br/> Please note that only those applicants selected for an interview will be contacted. On this occasion, we request no outside solicitation from recruitment agencies. Thank you for your interest and please keep a close eye on our website for all future positions.
Title: Senior Cost Consultant

Job_Description: Our Risk Consulting services in our Advisory Services Practice help our clients to optimize their response and resilience to risks and to expected and unexpected changes and events, whether internally generated or externally imposed. Our Risk Consulting professionals provide a range of services to support our clients undergoing change so that growth, governance, and performance objectives are achieved. <br/><br/> Our Risk Consulting professionals collectively provide the following range of services: <br/> · Internal Audit Risk and Compliance <br/> · IT Advisory <br/> · Forensic <br/> · Financial Risk and Regulatory Management <br/><br/> <STRONG>KPMG Professionals Are...</STRONG> <br/><br/> Individuals who take deep personal accountability for their work, have a passion for excellence, driven to achieve their full potential, and understand the value of building relationships with clients, future clients, their communities, the global firm and each other. A KPMG professional should have all of the following characteristics: <br/><br/> · Strong work ethic <br/> · Thrive on challenges <br/> · Dedicated to providing outstanding client service. <br/><br/> <STRONG>Position Summary</STRONG> <br/><br/> KPMG’s Risk Consulting practice in Calgary is growing and we require an IT Advisory Senior <br/> Consultant to help manage and develop our IT Advisory Services. We are in search of an experienced professional whose knowledge and skill not only spans the technical realm, but who is effective in managing teams, relationship management and business development. The successful candidate will be responsible for managing and developing a team that is closely aligned with both our Advisory and Audit practices and contribute to the overall management and execution of our IT Advisory Services. <br/><br/> <STRONG>Role and Responsibilities</STRONG> <br/><br/> · Manage / Perform operational audit activities in relation to SAP, specifically; process workflow, automated controls testing, access management and data extraction and analysis <br/> · Understand leading practices as it relates to SAP Security and provide recommendations to the business on security role design and implementation <br/> · Manage / Perform pre and post implementation reviews in relation to SAP <br/> · Delivering high quality and risk based internal audit reviews of business processes, business change, and the management of financial, operational and compliance risks within the IT space <br/> · Required to work as part of the end to end audit team in performing operational audits supported by SAP <br/> · Identify and report on all significant control weaknesses <br/> · Assist the Audit Partner and the Audit Team in supporting their work and working on self-contained tasks to ensure a fluent and well-structured Audit Process <br/> · Identify and communicate failures in control framework within SAP based processes and ability to identify opportunities for improvement in the areas of SAP GRC, SAP security and SAP controls. <br/> · Business development and relationship management within the Calgary marketplace. <br/> · Accountable and responsible for reviewing engagement files and ensuring compliance with quality standards. <br/><br/> At times, business needs arise and employees are required and agree to work beyond their normal work day or work week to fulfill the accountabilities required for their job. Likewise, people need extra time to devote to personal matters, and our approach to flexibility provides for this. <br/><br/> <STRONG>Skills & Qualifications</STRONG> <br/><br/> The successful candidate will possess the following: <br/><br/> · 4 or more years experience executing and managing IT Audit / Controls advisory services in a professional services or related organization. <br/> · Knowledge of internal controls in ERP systems and supporting network, operating system and database layers. <br/> · Detailed knowledge of best practice business controls expected within core processes supported by ERP systems and modules, with an emphasis on SAP <br/> · Knowledge of SAP security, including ECC authorization concept and role design for core processes <br/> · Experience with SAP GRC and / or other GRC tools. <br/> · Strong understanding of Segregation of Duties frameworks <br/> · Preference will be given to candidates with CISA, CISSP, CISM or similar certification. <br/> · Highly motivated, committed, self-starter with good organization skills who can prioritize and cope with changing priorities. <br/> · Must be able to clearly communicate issues and solutions to all levels of client and internal staff, on both a formal and informal basis. <br/><br/> #LI-HH1
Title: Senior Consultant - IT Audit

Job_Description: <div><p><strong>Job Type: </strong>Permanent <br><strong>Primary Location: </strong>Calgary, Alberta, Canada <br><strong>All Available Locations: </strong>Calgary </p><div><p><p>External Posting Description</p><p><p>We are looking for a Consultant to join our Risk Advisory practice in Calgary. While you will be primarily involved in execution of General Information Technology Controls (GITCs) audits for various public and private clients as part of the IT Assurance service offering, you may also be involved in the following:</p><p>· IT Internal Audit - provide value-added and relevant analyses of an organization's internal control structure, performance, productivity, and efficiency;</p><p>· IT Advisory projects in the areas of Internal Controls Certification for Canadian and US listed companies;</p><p>· Projects in the general IT Security space; and</p><p>· Projects involving testing of automated and manual business process controls.</p><p> </p><p>As a Consultant, you will:</p><p>· Execute on GITC or other projects;</p><p>· Work in a collaborative team analyzing client issues and interviewing key personnel;</p><p>· Assist with the development of recommendations and presentations for client engagements; and</p><p>· Identify issues and define symptoms.</p></p></p><p><p>External Posting Qualifications</p><p><p>Qualifications:</p><p>· Between 1-3 years of relevant work experience</p><p>· University degree in a computer science, business or accounting discipline with outstanding grades</p><p>· Professional designation or willingness to obtain one is preferred (e.g. CISA, CPA or CIA)</p><p>· A strong IT background is preferred</p><p>· Experience with audits of US and Canadian listed companies, regulatory expectations and documentation requirements is an asset</p><p>· A Big 4 or other firm experience is an asset</p><p>· Excellent interpersonal relations and demonstrated ability to effectively work with others effectively in teams </p><p>· Ability to synthesize information and produce concise synopses/summaries</p><p>· Excellent listening, oral and written communication skills</p><p>· Ability to work to tight deadlines</p><p>· Multi-tasker and effective time management skills</p><p>· Strong commitment to professional client service excellence</p></p></p></div><p><strong>Why Deloitte?</strong></p><p>Launch your career with The One Firm where you can make a greater impact than you ever thought possible. With endless opportunities at every turn, and a culture built to support and drive our people to be the very best they can be, Deloitte is The One Firm for you to learn, grow, create, and lead.</p><p>At Deloitte, we understand that everyone, and their career goals, are different. We do this by making three commitments to our people:</p><ul><li><em><strong>You will lead at every level:</strong></em> We grow the world’s best leaders so you can achieve the impact you seek, faster.</li><li><em><strong>You can work your way:</strong></em> We give you the means to work how you want, and we have innovative spaces and the mindset to help you be wildly successful.</li><li><em><strong>You will feel included and inspired:</strong></em> We create a deep sense of belonging where you can bring your whole self to work.</li></ul><p>Apply now and let us show you how to push your career to the next level at <em><strong>Deloitte. The One Firm. For You.</strong></em></p><p>Deloitte is an inclusive employer dedicated to building a diverse workforce. We encourage applications from all qualified candidates and will accommodate applicants’ needs under the respective provincial human rights codes throughout all stages of the recruitment and selection process. Please advise the Recruiter to ensure your accessibility needs are accommodated throughout this process. Job_Description: As a Senior Solution Sitecore Developer/Architect Consultant, your focus will be on deep technical roles and leading teams in development and testing of mission critical enterprise solutions. You will be responsible for the design implementation of custom components and applications using the latest versions of the .NET Framework, ASP.NET, C#, VB.NET, Sitecore CMS platform, Office and other advanced components of Microsoft technology. <br/><br/> As you grow your career at Avanade you will build management, technical and planning skills. You will improve your abilities to think creatively, design solutions, and interact with customers. You will also hone your technical, management and consulting skills by participating in large projects and benefiting from the vast knowledge of your teammates. The Manager or Lead focuses on designing, deploying, and testing solution components of medium to large size and complexity. This position develops/tests mission critical enterprise solutions and contributes to Avanade's repository of intellectual property. In addition, the Manager or Lead Consultant assists with customer relationship, change requirements, proposal development, some marketing/PR initiatives and serves as a Career Manager. <br/><br/> Sitecore Architects will typically: Interact with teammates and customers to identify problems and solutions in working toward completion of project goal. <br/><br/> - Lead and mentor small to medium sized teams in the creation of customer components and applications   <ul> <li>Develop technical specifications based on functional requirements</li> <li>Develop components of the technical solution</li> <li>Perform tests according to a given test plan and documents results</li> <li>Perform basic support and debugging in test and production environment</li> <li>Identify and escalate problems</li> <li>Maintain and repair existing applications</li> <li>Lead teams and small projects <br/><br/> About you <br/><br/> You can supervise and lead small teams. You can learn new skills and specializations, and work independently to deliver results that impact the success of the whole team. <br/><br/> With three or so years of experience, your skillset allows you to manage your time and organize your workload on a daily and weekly basis. You also likely have a good understanding of project financials, profit and loss statements (P&Ls) and related metrics. <br/><br/> You can demonstrate key qualities including: <br/><br/> Excellence in communicating and presenting complex information to technical and non-technical stakeholders, both orally and in written form <br/><br/> Ability to work with global teams and interact with external clients in a professional growth market <br/><br/> Advanced skills in analyzing, designing, developing, implementing and maintaining application code in a variety of contexts <br/><br/> Development of client-based and web-based software solutions <br/><br/> Demonstrated experience in application development, complex code development, application-testing and component design. <br/><br/> You likely have a Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Management Information Systems or a related field. <br/><br/> About Avanade <br/><br/> Avanade leads in providing innovative digital services, business solutions and design-led experiences for its clients, delivered through the power of people and the Microsoft ecosystem. Our professionals combine technology, business and industry expertise to build and deploy solutions to realize results for clients and their customers. Avanade has 27,000 digitally connected people across 23 countries, bringing clients the best thinking through a collaborative culture that honors diversity and reflects the communities in which we operate. Majority owned by Accenture, Avanade was founded in 2000 by Accenture LLP and Microsoft Corporation. Learn more at www.avanade.com.<br/><br/>Qualifications <br/><br/> Key Qualifications:</li> </ul>  Focused Microsoft platform Skills   <ul> <li>Full lifecycle experience developing large scale applications</li> <li>Experience as a programmer in a large enterprise environment</li> </ul>  Demonstrated strong knowledge and proficiency in the following:   <ul> <li>.NET Framework ASP.NET, Windows Form, C# or VB.NET</li> <li>Sitecore</li> <li>Experienced in Sitecore customer management system a must</li> <li>Leading Migration Projects Plan with experience and expertise in leading a Sitecore Migration. <br/><br/> Avanade® Is An Equal Opportunity Employer. Avanade prohibits discrimination and harassment against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, age, religion, sex, national origin, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, disability, marital status or any other protected status. Avanade is also committed to providing accommodations for persons with disabilities in accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act. <br/><br/> <strong>Requisition ID - 52914</strong> <br/><br/> Avanade is the leading provider of innovative digital and cloud-enabling services, business solutions and design-led experiences, delivered through the power of people and the Microsoft ecosystem. Majority owned by Accenture, Avanade was founded in 2000 by Accenture LLP and Microsoft Corporation and has 30,000 professionals in 24 countries. Visit us at www.avanade.com.</li>  </ul>
Title: Senior Consultant, Solution Development-Sitecore

Job_Description: With over 300 employees, we are committed to professional development to build upon the strengths of the team. At Progress we encourage initiative and career growth, and offer a positive, dynamic and challenging working environment. With a competitive total compensation package and a track record of success, Progress seeks the brightest and most talented professionals in their area of expertise to join our team to meaningfully contribute to the ongoing success of our company. <br/><br/> <u><strong><strong>The Role</strong></strong></u><br/><br/>Progress Energy currently has a vacancy for an IT Analyst to join our team in Calgary. Reporting to the Manager, Information Technology, and the successful candidate will be responsible for maintaining the company's system infrastructure, ensuring systems are implemented and operated to support the business requirements with respect to availability, reliability, scalability, performance and system integrity. The incumbent must have experience in enterprise systems management, operations and be able to resolve issues, which impact systems, services and applications.<br/><br/><u><strong><strong>Key Responsibilities and Accountabilities</strong></strong></u> <ul> <li>Specialize in diagnosing and solving problems in complex computer systems using their knowledge of computer architecture and operations to find and resolve problems in computer networks, virtualization frameworks, storage platforms, and server / desktop computing environments</li><li>Responsible for the day-to-day administration and maintenance of many core computing systems and services on which the business application portfolio relies</li><li>Maintain operating system software, server and desktop infrastructure to ensure availability, reliability, capacity, software patch levels, and appropriate security</li><li>Troubleshoot system hardware, software, and networking issues, investigate and identify issue root cause, resolving problems and providing technical guidance to business users as required</li><li>Participate in Information Technology projects, both tactical and strategic, contributing to the development of project scope and objectives including; time lines, resources and budgets, coordinates project implementation activities to ensure enhancements and new technologies are effectively utilized</li><li>Liaise with business groups, vendors and service providers to facilitate both day-to-day operations and project execution</li><li>Provide technical expertise to internal stakeholders and contribute to the design and implementation of technology solutions to support department initiatives and activities</li><li>Aim to achieve stretch goals and puts plans in place to ensure successful completion</li> </ul> <u><strong><strong>Required Education, Experience and Skills</strong></strong></u> <ul> <li>Post-secondary education in a related field, with a degree or diploma in a technical concentration</li> <li>5 - 7 years’ experience working within the information technology field, in the Oil and Gas industry would be considered an asset</li><li>Strong understanding of Windows desktop and server operating systems</li><li>Previous experience working with enterprise storage, backup and patch management systems</li> <li>Knowledge of HP server and desktop hardware platforms would be considered and asset</li><li>Knowledge of VMWare, Citrix, Microsoft SCCM and Cisco infrastructure technologies would be considered an asset</li><li>Proven technical competency in troubleshooting infrastructure technology solutions</li><li>Superior communication and interpersonal skills for interacting with business and IT solutions staff</li> <li>Proven ability to work both independently, as well as collaboratively</li>  </ul>
Title: IT Operations Analyst

Job_Description: <div><strong>Full-Time Showroom Consultant</strong> <br/><br/> Bartle and Gibson Co. Ltd. has been in business since 1944. We are an independent industry leading distributor in plumbing, heating and electrical supplies across Western Canada and the North West Territories. We are committed to providing our valued customers excellent service and our team members an exciting and positive workplace. <br/><br/> As the <strong>Showroom Consultant</strong>, you are the face of Bartle & Gibson. You are welcoming and enthusiastic providing exceptional customer service to every customer you serve from Monday to Saturday. You greet all your clients and guide them through the process of finding the right products and purchasing. <br/><br/> You have a friendly, outgoing personality and are in search of a career opportunity to build upon your existing sales experience. You have the industry knowledge, ease of self-expression and communication skills of a great sales representative and know what it takes to keep your customers happy. You are adept at understanding customers' needs and are comfortable making product recommendations to meet those needs. <br/><br/> Reporting directly to the Plumbing Sales Manager, you will prove yourself to be an excellent representative for Bartle & Gibson Showroom focusing on growing our business by working with customers who visit our showroom to find their ideal and unique product packages and solutions. Your main job duties are but not limited to: <br/><br/> <strong>Job Duties/Responsibilities:</strong>  <ul> <li>Work with customers (homeowner, builders, designers) on the phone and in person to choose bath and kitchen products that fulfill their specific needs, demonstrating thorough product and pricing knowledge</li> <li>Maintaining the pristine of showroom products, show suites; displays are kept clean with an appealing presentation</li> <li>Schedule appointments appropriately to control customer traffic</li> <li>Handle special orders, requests, issues/concerns with enthusiasm and efficiency</li> <li>Source materials for customers</li> <li>Provide quotes for clients and quote follow ups</li> <li>Present and detail company products and services to existing and potential clients</li> <li>Prepare and activate paperwork to process sales</li> <li>Prepare reports on sales activity and effectiveness of product display</li> <li>Make sales calls and follow-up contact with previous visitors to the showroom</li> <li>Conduct after sales service with customers</li> <li>Research and stay up-to-date on product knowledge and industry trends</li> <li>Work closely with others (clients, suppliers, co-workers) in a professional, cooperative and positive manner to ensure project needs are met</li> <li>Professional grooming and presentation will be expected of salespeople who are representing Bartle & Gibson</li> <li>Other duties as required</li> </ul> You will prove yourself to be an asset to Bartle & Gibson by possessing the following skills necessary to succeed: <br/><br/> <strong>Skills/Qualifications:</strong>  <ul> <li>Outgoing and positive attitude</li> <li>Very organized with high attention to detail</li> <li>Quick responsiveness and problem solving skills</li> <li>Excellent communication skills (verbal and written); persuasive and influential</li> <li>Strong initiative and self-motivated</li> <li>Can work independently and in a team environment</li> <li>Ability to work in a fast-paced environment with high pressure for results</li> <li>Ability to meet strategic goals and objectives with little supervision</li> <li>Commitment to customer service</li> <li>Ability to develop and maintain mutually beneficial relationships with suppliers, customers and coworkers</li> </ul> <strong>Experience/Education:</strong>  <ul> <li>Minimum Grade 12 education required</li> <li><strong>Candidates should possess a minimum of two years’ sales experience</strong> (counter sales or inside sales)</li> <li>Knowledge of the plumbing and electrical industry or products would be considered an asset</li> <li>Strong computer skills with the ability to quickly learn new systems</li> </ul> If you want to join a company with a great culture that truly values and rewards you for a job well done, then we encourage you to submit your resume to careers@bartlegibson.com. Our compensation and benefits, including profit sharing and career growth potential are competitive and will be based on experience and abilities. <br/><br/> *No phone calls or drop ins. <strong>Apply by application submission only, stating applicable experience and salary expectations in your cover letter.</strong> All submissions are kept in the highest level of confidentiality. The position will remain open until a suitable candidate is selected. <br/><br/> We are an equal opportunity employer. We would like to thank all applicants for their interest in employment with Bartle & Gibson, however, only those who possess the desired qualifications, experience and <strong>local to the Calgary area</strong> will be contacted for further review. <br/><br/> Final candidates will be required to undergo an <strong>assessment and</strong> <strong>security screening</strong>, including a criminal record check. Employment is subject to screening completion that is satisfactory to Bartle & Gibson. <br/><br/> BG01 <br/><br/> Bartle & Gibson is an equal opportunity employer offering competitive wages and opportunity for advancement from within the organization.</div>  <br/>

Job_Description: <div>Requisition Id: 14854 <br/><br/> Department: Taxation Group <br/><br/> <strong>Summary of Responsibilities</strong> <br/><br/> Reporting to the Senior Manager the Tax Manager is responsible for the U.S., Canadian and International tax function pertaining to the business of the company as well as assistance in other tax related duties for Pembina Pipeline Corporation’s business entities. <br/><br/> The duties include, but are not limited to: <ul> <li>Reviews the federal and provincial/state income tax returns, including information returns and other filings;</li><li>Reviews income tax provision and provides support on complex accounting transactions;</li><li>Reviews and manages federal, provincial and state income tax audits;</li><li>Supports and assists with the implementation of corporate reorganization structures, acquisitions and divestitures;</li><li>Works with other groups in the organization to manage cash repatriation, intercompany transactions and special projects, including transfer pricing, shared service agreements, and cross border assignments;</li><li>Manages and supports other groups with current tax legislation and information from our joint venture entities; and</li><li>Liaison with external advisors and auditors.</li> </ul> <strong>Qualifications</strong> <ul> <li>10 + years of dedicated tax experience on working with corporations, partnerships, and/or international organizations;</li><li>Completion of a Canadian or U.S. accounting designation (CPA or CA);</li><li>Completed or enrolled in CPA In-Depth Tax Year II and willingness to complete the program;</li><li>Experience with income tax return and tax provision preparation for corporations and partnerships, some U.S. tax knowledge is required;</li><li>Proficient computer skills, specifically in excel and a working knowledge of SAP and BPC is an asset; and</li><li>Self-starter, with high attention to detail and the ability to work under pressure to meet reporting deadlines.</li> </ul> <strong>No agency calls please.</strong> <br/><br/> Pembina is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We are pleased to consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, protected veterans status or any other legally-protected factors. Accommodation for applicants with disabilities is available on request during the recruitment process. <br/><br/> Pembina Pipeline Corporation has been serving the transportation and midstream service needs of North America&apos;s energy industry for over 60 years. We process, terminal and transport our customers&apos; products safely - all while protecting the environment and delivering on our commitments to our shareholders and community stakeholders. When we build something, we do it right. <br/><br/> Powering Pembina&apos;s growth are our smart, creative and energetic people who allow us to remain a disciplined and responsible energy transportation and service provider and a trusted member in our communities. <br/><br/> Our expectations are high, and so are our rewards. We treat our people well – whether it’s through our total compensation package, our community engagement and volunteer opportunities, or our numerous fun social activities. <br/><br/> Pembina is a proud recipient of the 2018 Canada’s Top 100 Employers and Alberta&apos;s Top 70 Employers (2014-2017). We are also a strong supporter of Skills Canada. <br/><br/> ></div>

other appropriate certifications like TOGAF, Zachman, CISSP, OpenCA, ITIL, <br/>  Cobit, Prince</li> <li>Wide knowledge of IT market and trends</li> <li>Knowledge of full Oracle stack including Oracle Public Cloud <br/>  Services</li> <li>Knowledge of cloud competitors including <strong>AWS and/or Azure</strong></li> <li>Some specific knowledge of Oracle and competitor hardware solutions</li> <li>Some specific knowledge of Oracle database and middleware <br/>  technology</li> <li>Some specific knowledge of Oracle applications</li> <li>Some specific knowledge of Oracle industry solutions</li> <li>Detailed knowledge of architectural approaches including <br/>  consolidation, cloud computing, virtualization, disaster recovery, <br/>  information management, big data, Java applications, Oracle and non-Oracle <br/>  applications</li> <li>C-level presentation expertise</li> <li><strong>Open to travel as required</strong></li> </ul> <strong>Detailed Description <br/> and Job Requirements</strong> <br/><br/> Provides direction and <br/> specialist knowledge in applying the technology/application to client business. <br/> Facilitation of customer product/application understanding through <br/> presentations demonstrations and benchmarks; provision of support throughout <br/> the sell. <br/><br/> As a Principal Sales Consultant you will be <br/> responsible as the expert for formulating and leading presales technical / <br/> functional support activity to prospective clients and customers while ensuring <br/> customer satisfaction. Acts as a technical resource and mentor for less <br/> experienced Sales Consultants. Focuses on large or complex sales opportunities <br/> that need creative and complex solutions. Develops productivity tools and <br/> training for other Sales Consultants. Develops and delivers outstanding Oracle <br/> presentations and demonstrations. Leads any and all aspects of the technical <br/> sales process. Advises internal and external clients on overall architect <br/> solutions. <br/><br/> Leading contributor individually and as a team <br/> member, providing direction and mentoring to others. Work is non-routine and <br/> very complex, involving the application of advanced technical/business skills <br/> in area of specialization. 3 years vendor (sales and marketing) experience. 7 <br/> years business experience with relevant computer applications or <br/> database/tools. Ability to implement the most advanced product features. <br/> Thorough knowledge of system and application design. In depth knowledge of <br/> competitors. Demonstrated project management skills. Demonstrated excellent <br/> verbal and written communication skills: needs analysis, positioning, business <br/> justification, closing techniques. Ability to persuade others through <br/> presentations, demonstrations, and written communication. Ability to travel as <br/> needed. A/BS degree or equivalent, advanced degree highly desirable.
Title: Enterprise Cloud Architect / Principal Sales Consultant

Job_Description: <div> <div> <div> <div> <div><strong>About Scalar Decisions:</strong> <br/><br/> Scalar is Canada’s leading IT solutions integrator, focused on security, infrastructure, and cloud. Founded in 2004, Scalar is headquartered in Toronto, with offices in Montreal, Ottawa, London, Winnipeg, Calgary, Edmonton, and Vancouver. Scalar was recently named to the CRN Fast Growth Top 150 List and listed on the PROFIT 500 for the sixth year running. In addition, Scalar was deemed a major player in the IDC MarketScape for Canadian managed security service providers and ranked the #1 ICT security company on the 2014 - 2016 editions of the Branham 300. We focus on recruiting top talent, and we work hard to keep them. To learn more about Scalar, go to www.scalar.ca <br/><br/> <strong>Job Summary:</strong> <br/><br/> Are you an individual who is motivated by curiosity, driven for success and excellent customer service? Do you like working in a fun, fast-paced and rapidly growing work environment? Scalar Decisions is currently looking for a Cloud DevOps Consultant to join our Cloud Professional Services team. <br/><br/> As our ideal candidate, you will possess the Cloud technical expertise, particularly in AWS and Azure (GCP would be an asset, as well), to architect, engineer, and operationalize projects. Your previous experience at a service provider or large enterprise will enable us to implement industry best practices to meet our customers’ SLAs. Your appetite to learn will ensure we keep up with latest practices, ideas, and trends in the public cloud space. <br/><br/> <strong>Core Responsibilities:</strong>  <ul> <li>Participate in customer-facing and internal projects, assisting or leading the technical engineering and operationalization of cloud solutions</li> <li>Architect, engineer, and implement partial and /or complete cloud solutions using modern configuration management tools and practices (e.g., Ansible, Terraform, Jenkins)</li> <li>Troubleshoot performance, redundancy, configuration, and application incidents to resolution</li> <li>Maintain and continuously improve the existing fully managed cloud solutions</li> <li>Assist and/or implement a customer’s regular change requests</li> <li>Escalation to the vendor support, when required, to ensure SLAs are met</li> <li>Cross-train and document new solutions, tools, and practices to team members, to the operations team, and other groups</li> <li>Conduct new product/service evaluations for internal publication to management for possible adoption</li> <li>Investigate performance and process failures and work to improve them</li> <li>Stay apprised of new developments in both public cloud and operations, help in determining how and when those would affect and/or improve our architecture</li> <li>Follow the latest industry trends, practices, and ideas through training, certifications, conferences, and research</li> <li>Report current project status and discuss technical ideas to management</li> </ul> <strong>Requirements:</strong>  <ul> <li>10+ years of systems administration experience in a service provider or large enterprise</li> <li>4+ years of systems engineering experience in a service provider or large enterprise</li> <li>3+ years of public cloud experience with PRODUCTION workloads</li> <li>At least 1 certification from a major public cloud vendor</li> <li>Experience in at least 1 configuration management system (e.g., Puppet, Chef, Ansible, Terraform, etc.)</li> <li>Experience in at least 1 revision control system</li> <li>Solid understanding of DNS, VPN and networking</li> <li>Good understanding of the LAMP/LEMP or WIMP stack</li> <li>Experience with directory services (e.g., AD, LDAP)</li> <li>Some fluency of a programming or scripting language (e.g., Perl, Python, Bash, Powershell)</li> <li>Experience in a multi-tenant managed hosting or managed services department</li> <li>Demonstrated Root Cause Correct Action analysis, report generation, and presentation to customers</li> <li>Strong project timeline management skills and customer facing support experience</li> <li>Must have strong communication skills and the ability to articulate task management, priorities, and issues</li> </ul> If you are a passionate team player and you are interested in the above position or know someone who is, please apply through our careers website at https://scalar.bamboohr.com/jobs/. <br/><br/> We thank all candidates for their interest, however, only those selected for interviews will be contacted.</div>  </div>  </div><br/>  <div> <div> Apply for this Job</div>  </div>  </div><br/>  <div> <div> <div>
