Job_Description: <strong>JOB SUMMARY:</strong> <br/><br/> Reporting to the Regional Sales Manager, the Franchise Business Consultant is responsible for all activities and sales results in the district. Assigned stores may include a combination of corporate and franchised stores. Key areas of focus will be successful team growth while meeting financial and operational objectives. <br/><br/> <strong>KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:</strong> <ul> <li>Best practices Consultant through the review of store practices (i.e. brand standards and CTAs), sales and trends (merchandising, staffing, training, promotion of new products, etc.) is able to recommend customized "best practice" solutions to Franchisees with the goal of improving sales/profitability for the store.</li><li>Training, Monitoring & Enforcement of standards outlined in the Franchisee Agreement ensures that new franchisees are adequately oriented & trained; ensures all company policies and operating procedures are followed.</li><li>Corporate Office Liaison Acts as principle contact point between franchisee and head office departments to communicate or solicit information, collect data, resolve issues, etc.</li> </ul> <strong>EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE:</strong> <ul> <li>College level graduate (preferably from a Business, Retail or Marketing program) and/or extensive retail experience</li><li>Minimum of 2 to 3 years retail chain experience at a District or multi-store management level leading 10+ stores in a large retail chain; ideally gained in a progressive operations roles</li><li>Must have franchising experience</li><li>Demonstrate strong retail visual merchandising skills</li> </ul> <strong>ADDITIONAL SKILLS:</strong> <ul> <li>Able to work independently, organize their work and the work of others; able to multi-task and move from day to day-operational activities to planning level activities as required.</li><li>Results driven; willingness to strive for improvements and hold others accountable for their results</li><li>Strong problem solving skills</li><li>Strong customer service skills; communication skills and a sense of urgency</li><li>Able to operate a computer, (MS office products); cash register (including point of sale software)</li><li>Must hold a current driver's license and be able to drive. Overnight trips may be required</li><li>Must be able to work occasional evenings/weekends when required</li> </ul>  <strong>Job Posted by ApplicantPro</strong> <br/>
Title: Franchise Business Consultant (FBC)

Job_Description: <div><p><strong>Job Type: </strong>Permanent <br><strong>Primary Location: </strong>Calgary, Alberta, Canada <br><strong>All Available Locations: </strong>Calgary; Vancouver </p><div><p><p><b>Job description</b></p><p><p> </p><p><strong>Technology</strong></p><p>Our technologists help clients implement innovative technologies to drive their business’ forward. Our consultants link technology insights to clients’ organizational goals to fit within their full operating models, accounting for their people, intellectual capital, and processes.</p><p> </p><p><strong>SAP</strong></p><p>The full potential of SAP solutions isn't just about technology, it's also about driving sustainable business value. At Deloitte, our SAP specialists deliver the technology and services to help our clients meet business performance goals and improve processes. As an SAP Global Partner we provide a broad range of consulting services, from HR, CRM and supply chain to finance transformation.</p><p> </p><p><strong>SAP Supply Chain /Ariba– Senior Consultant </strong></p><p>Are you looking for a career trajectory that few other organizations can offer in SAP? What about access to a high-quality portfolio of businesses and clients with opportunities to work across capabilities, industries, and geographies – in roles and on projects aligned with your SAP Profitability Analysis skills? If this matches your interests and aspirations Deloitte may be right for you.</p><p> </p><p>As a Senior Consultant focused on SAP Supply Chain and Ariba, you are expected to: </p><ul><li>Deliver SAP Supply Chain projects successfully</li><li>Lead and support SAP Supply Chain pursuits and Practice Development initiatives</li><li>Supervise and coach junior colleagues and manage parts of client engagements</li><li>Develop external eminence for Deloitte</li><li>Promote and foster collaboration and knowledge sharing between practitioners within Deloitte</li></ul></p></p><p><p><b>Qualifications</b></p><p><ul><li>Completed undergraduate degree with outstanding academic credentials</li><li>Functional proficiency with at least 2+ full lifecycle SAP implementations and 4+ years of industry and/or consulting experience in the SAP space</li><li>At least 4 years of SAP experience implementing SAP Supply Chain and/or Ariba</li><li>Experience defining systems strategy, developing systems requirements, designing and prototyping, testing, training, defining support procedures and implementing practical business solutions under multiple deadlines</li><li>SAP certification is an asset</li><li>Adept at implementing technology-enabled business solutions for clients as part of a high-talent team and as a team lead or Project Manager on at least 1+ full cycle implementation</li><li>Experience in providing post implementation support</li><li>Thorough understanding of Supply Chain business processes</li><li>Strong commitment to professional client service excellence</li><li>Excellent interpersonal relations and demonstrated ability to work with others effectively in teams</li><li>Superior verbal and written communication skills</li><li>Ability to develop and present new ideas and conceptualize new approaches and solutions</li><li>Proven analytical skills and systematic problem solving</li></ul></p></p></div><p><strong>Why Deloitte?</strong></p><p>Launch your career with The One Firm where you can make a greater impact than you ever thought possible. With endless opportunities at every turn, and a culture built to support and drive our people to be the very best they can be, Deloitte is The One Firm for you to learn, grow, create, and lead.</p><p>At Deloitte, we understand that everyone, and their career goals, are different. As a firm, we help create the conditions and opportunities that will enable our people to thrive – both professionally and personally. We do this by making three commitments to our people:</p><ul><li><em><strong>You will lead at every level:</strong></em> We grow the world’s best leaders so you can achieve the impact you seek, faster.</li><li><em><strong>You can work your way:</strong></em> We give you the means to work how you want, and we have innovative spaces and the mindset to help you be wildly successful.</li><li><em><strong>You will feel included and inspired:</strong></em> We create a deep sense of belonging where you can bring your whole self to work.</li></ul><p>Apply now and let us show you how to push your career to the next level at <em><strong>Deloitte. The One Firm. For You.</strong></em></p><p>Deloitte is an inclusive employer dedicated to building a diverse workforce. We encourage applications from all qualified candidates and will accommodate applicants’ needs under the respective provincial human rights codes throughout all stages of the recruitment and selection process. Please advise the Recruiter to ensure your accessibility needs are accommodated throughout this process. Information received relating to accommodation will be addressed confidentially.</p><p>We thank all applicants in advance for their interest; however, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted</p><p>31750</p><p> </p></div>
Title: Senior Consultant, SAP Supply Chain/Ariba

Job_Description: <div>Requisition Id: 14854 <br/><br/> Department: Taxation Group <br/><br/> <strong>Summary of Responsibilities</strong> <br/><br/> Reporting to the Senior Manager the Tax Manager is responsible for the U.S., Canadian and International tax function pertaining to the business of the company as well as assistance in other tax related duties for Pembina Pipeline Corporation’s business entities. <br/><br/> The duties include, but are not limited to:  <ul>  	<li>Reviews the federal and provincial/state income tax returns, including information returns and other filings;</li> <li>Reviews income tax provision and provides support on complex accounting transactions;</li> <li>Reviews and manages federal, provincial and state income tax audits;</li> <li>Supports and assists with the implementation of corporate reorganization structures, acquisitions and divestitures;</li> <li>Works with other groups in the organization to manage cash repatriation, intercompany transactions and special projects, including transfer pricing, shared service agreements, and cross border assignments;</li> <li>Manages and supports other groups with current tax legislation and information from our joint venture entities; and</li> <li>Liaison with external advisors and auditors.</li> </ul> <strong>Qualifications</strong>  <ul>  	<li>10 + years of dedicated experience on working with corporate, partnership, and/or international tax compliance;</li> <li>Completion of a Canadian or U.S. accounting designation (CPA or CA);</li> <li>Completed or enrolled in CPA In-Depth Tax Year II and willingness to complete the program;</li> <li>Experience with income tax return and tax provision preparation for corporations and partnerships, some U.S. tax knowledge is required;</li> <li>Proficient computer skills, specifically in excel and a working knowledge of SAP and BPC is an asset; and</li> <li>Self-starter, with high attention to detail and the ability to work under pressure to meet reporting deadlines.</li> </ul> <strong>No agency calls please.</strong> <br/><br/> Pembina is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We are pleased to consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, protected veterans status or any other legally-protected factors. Accommodation for applicants with disabilities is available on request during the recruitment process. <br/><br/> Pembina Pipeline Corporation has been serving the transportation and midstream service needs of North America's energy industry for over 60 years. We process, terminal and transport our customers' products safely - all while protecting the environment and delivering on our commitments to our shareholders and community stakeholders. When we build something, we do it right. <br/><br/> Powering Pembina's growth are our smart, creative and energetic people who allow us to remain a disciplined and responsible energy transportation and service provider and a trusted member in our communities. <br/><br/> Our expectations are high, and so are our rewards. We treat our people well – whether it’s through our total compensation package, our community engagement and volunteer opportunities, or our numerous fun social activities. <br/><br/> Pembina is a proud recipient of the 2018 Canada’s Top 100 Employers and Alberta's Top 70 Employers (2014-2017). We are also a strong supporter of Skills Canada. <br/><br/> ></div>  <br/>
Title: Consultant, US Tax Manager

Job_Description: <strong>Job Description Senior Consultant (Modern Desktop)</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>STRATIFORM</strong> <br/><br/> Stratiform Inc. was founded in 2012 and has quickly grown to prominence with a hand-picked team consisting of Architect, Engineer and Developer Subject Matter Experts (SMEs). Stratiform SMEs are known throughout Canada as some of the best in the IT industry, and based on our reputation with customers in the market for delivering excellence across the Microsoft Platform. At Stratiform, we have become one of Microsofts go-to cloud partners in Canada. <br/><br/> <strong>Key Responsibilities (Senior Consultant):</strong> <br/><br/> You will be responsible for performing technical delivery and advisory services. The key focus will be execution of implementation, deployment, and upgrade projects, with a consultative approach aimed at promoting modern technologies in the customer workplace. You will be working with and supporting customers in small, medium, and large environments. The scope of work is extensive, and all candidates must have a broad range of Microsoft functional and technical capabilities and specifically, proficiency with the following technologies: Windows 10, System Center (specifically SCCM), and Application Packaging and Deployment  <ul> <li>Provide advice, oversight, and project delivery services</li>  <li>Execute requirements gathering and decision guidance workshops</li>   <li>Health checks & assessments</li></ul>   <ul> <li> Develop IP for all service offerings templates, best practices, operations runbooks, architecture and design documents, training/knowledge transfer packs</li>  <li> Provide pre-sales technical support and product demos/deep dives for customers</li>  <li> Provide mentorship and internal support to a peer group of consultants</li>  <li> Engage the enthusiast community by participating in technical events and blogging</li>  <li> Contribute to the Stratiform brand</li>  </ul> <strong>Required Skills & Experience:</strong>  <ul> <li>4+ years of Windows 10 administration or solid experience in systems development, network operations, software support or I.T. consulting</li>   <li>Effective learning skills, works well in a team environment</li>   <li>The ability to accurately and effectively communicate both the technical and non-technical aspects of modern desktop technologies and products to a variety of stakeholders within a wide array of presentation settings</li>   <li>4-6 years of experience in a technical consulting or Enterprise technical support environment with demonstrated knowledge supporting:</li>   <ul> <li>Windows 7, Windows 8, Windows 10 operating systems and Windows Server 2012 R2 and earlier Microsoft Windows Server Hyper-V</li>   <li>Microsoft System Center Configuration Manager (SCCM)</li>   <li>Active Directory, Infrastructure Services, Identity Management</li>   <li>Microsoft Security concepts DNS, DHCP, TCP/IP, routing, and network security</li>  </ul>  <li>Strong organization, time management, project management and negotiation skills desired</li>   <li>Ability to handle customer critical issues and work in difficult situations</li>  </ul> <strong>Desired Skills & Experience:</strong>  <ul> <li>Experience in Microsoft Management technologies, including Active Directory services, hybrid and modern SCCM strategies, WSUS, InTune, AutoPilot</li>  <li>Knowledge of the following would be advantageous: MDT (BDD), PowerShell, OS release branches, repackaging applications and virtualization of OS and applications.</li> </ul> Continuous learning mindset We are seeking people that think differently and are biased toward action to accomplish great things.  <ul> <li>Expert level of Microsoft enterprise software product offerings</li>   <li>Strong Communication Skills (including technical writing)</li>   <li>Excellent demonstrated customer service skills</li>  </ul> Candidates must be able to work independently. Characteristics of importance include but are not limited to customer service, problem solving, communication skills, and the ability to read/interpret the needs/wants of customer executives and leaders. <br/><br/> <strong>Physical Requirements:</strong> <br/><br/> Office environment with computer work. May have extensive periods of sitting, typing and phone use (may include headset). May need to lift up to 10 lbs. <br/><br/> As a condition of employment, this job is subject to the successful completion of the following Pre-employment conditions: Reference Checks, Criminal Background Checks and a Drivers Abstract if required for the role.
Title: Senior Consultant (Modern Desktop)

Job_Description: <p></p><p></p>Shine with Signet!  Peoples Jewellers is looking for dynamic, driven and creative individuals to join our team.  Are you ready to use your business and sales skills to begin a financially rewarding career? If you are the type of person that enjoys working with the best of the best and celebrating the successes of a strong team, then you should apply to Peoples Jewellers. Make the decision to build your career with a company that thrives on an outstanding customer experience, intense and continuous training and being able to make a difference in our customer's and employee's lives. If you have the drive and passion to succeed, apply with us today!  Management-level Opportunities  Join our team as a Store Manager and have a positive impact on many lives. Our Store Managers are responsible for maintaining daily focus on individual and team members' standards  achievement to attain sales and profit projections; contributing to an atmosphere of total customer satisfaction; developing skills and product knowledge of team members through training and evaluation; and recruiting and selection of team members. The Store Manager is also responsible for achieving profit margin goals by managing the P&L; following and enforcing all Company policies and procedures; and other operational and strategic duties.  Full-time and Part-time Sales Opportunities  Join our team as a Sales Associate and have a positive impact on many lives. Our Sales Associates are responsible for engaging customers in conversation to understand their needs and objections; presenting merchandise and detailed information on features and benefits; offering extended service plans and financing options; working with the entire sales team to provide a superior experience to all of our valued customers and meeting individual and team sales goals.  We value integrity, diversity, teamwork and opportunities for advancement maintaining our promotion from within philosophy. We provide training on sales techniques, product knowledge, and skills to take your career to the next level. In return, we ask that you bring your commitment to excellence, desire to grow and ability to provide a superior customer experience. Sales, retail and/or jewelry experience is preferred, but not required.  A Sampling of our Total Rewards:  * Base pay plus commission on sales * Base pay plus commission on sales * 401 (k) * Paid Vacation and  * Paid Holidays (Full Time Team Members) * Tuition Reimbursement, including DCA courses based on position * Training - Associate Training System, Management Training System, District Manager in Training, Career Development and more * Merchandise Discounts * Incentive Trips and Contests  If interested, please apply online at www.signetjewelers.com.  Signet Jewelers is an equal opportunity employer committed to promoting diversity of all levels of employees. Please know that while we appreciate every applicant's interest, we can only contact those selected for further consideration.
Title: Sales Associate / Jewelry Consultant - Peoples - Southcentre Mall

Job_Description: <div><p><strong>Job Type: </strong>Permanent <br><strong>Primary Location: </strong>Multiple Locations, Canada <br><strong>All Available Locations: </strong>Calgary; Toronto </p><div><p><p>External Posting Description</p><p><p>Deloitte is seeking consultants in the area of operations excellence with project management and leadership experience to help our industrial and utility clients develop and integrate their operations improvement programs with a focus on driving improved asset performance and productivity, increasing margin, reducing risk and improving safety and environmental outcomes. Deployed in a team environment, the successful candidate will both lead and provide consulting services to address client needs. They will achieve real results by partnering with the client’s operations, maintenance and engineering staff at multiple levels within their organization. Data analysis, facilitation and knowledge transfer is a significant component of the work and will be supported by a set of advanced tools and solutions.</p><p> </p><p>About Us:</p><p>Deloitte’s Operations Excellence team focuses on industries with an expensive and complex asset base, such as oil & gas, utilities, and manufacturing. Using a structured approach, we help organizations in these industries improve their profitability, safety, and environmental performance through proactive operations improvement programs, including in the areas of maintenance, reliability, process automation, productivity and cost reduction.</p><p> </p><p>Key Responsibilities:</p><p>· Lead and manage projects from kick-off to completion, ensuring the completion of all contract obligations and achieving desired value;</p><p>· Execute on project plans and commitments, as well as guide and manage team members to achieve project outcomes;</p><p>· Develop and convey business cases for operations improvement programs;</p><p>· Assess clients’ current state against desired future performance and create plans to close the gap;</p><p>· Work with various software and tools, including data capture, data analysis, interpretation and reporting;</p><p>· Facilitate working groups within client organizations, including helping to identify key members, training members in the principles and “how-to” of operations excellence, motivating high performance and ensuring the group achieves targets </p><p>· Ensure a cooperative and collaborative environment within the project team and with client stakeholders</p><p>· Write reports for clients summarizing achievements and recommending next steps;</p><p>· Communicate and share knowledge and lessons learned with rest of the Deloitte community;</p><p>· Directly contribute to development and enhancement of Deloitte’s practices and solutions;</p><p>· Contribute positively to Deloitte’s organizational culture, values and reputation;</p><p>· Pursue ongoing professional and personal self-development</p><p> </p></p></p><p><p>External Posting Qualifications</p><p><p>· Completed technical degree or diploma (Engineering, Skilled Trade, Computer Science/Technology, Robotics, etc.) with outstanding academic credentials</p><p>· Certifications such as CMRP, MMP, or experience working with API standards, ISO standards, etc is a strong asset</p><p>· Certifications in Six sigma, Reliability Centered Maintenance (RCM), Root Cause (Failure) Analysis – RCA/RCFA, lean manufacturing, are highly desirable</p><p>· Experience performing Organizational Impact Assessments (change, performance or design) and business process development and design</p><p>· Work experience in the oil & gas industry and / or in an industrial manufacturing environment</p><p>· Proven operations experience in the areas of maintenance, operations, reliability, engineering, process engineering or supply chain experience in parts, warehouse.</p><p>· Experience in organizational change/implementation/integration is a strong asset</p><p>· Experience with value chain analysis (optimization, cost reduction, throughput max)</p><p>· Knowledge in operations digitization (operations technology, SCADA, Industrial Internet of things, etc).</p><p>· Consulting experience and/or a strong consulting aptitude is desirable; the ability to think reflectively and develop a solution</p><p>· Results-oriented team player with proven theoretical and practical knowledge of equipment reliability and maintenance.</p><p>· Strong analytical skills along with the ability to troubleshoot issues and identify solutions.</p><p>· Strong verbal and written communication skills; comfortable presenting to an audience</p><p>· Ability to travel extensively throughout US and Canada and work on client-site is required</p></p></p></div><p><strong>Why Deloitte?</strong></p><p>Launch your career with The One Firm where you can make a greater impact than you ever thought possible. With endless opportunities at every turn, and a culture built to support and drive our people to be the very best they can be, Deloitte is The One Firm for you to learn, grow, create, and lead.</p><p>At Deloitte, we understand that everyone, and their career goals, are different. As a firm, we help create the conditions and opportunities that will enable our people to thrive – both professionally and personally. We do this by making three commitments to our people:</p><ul><li><em><strong>You will lead at every level:</strong></em> We grow the world’s best leaders so you can achieve the impact you seek, faster.</li><li><em><strong>You can work your way:</strong></em> We give you the means to work how you want, and we have innovative spaces and the mindset to help you be wildly successful.</li><li><em><strong>You will feel included and inspired:</strong></em> We create a deep sense of belonging where you can bring your whole self to work.</li></ul><p>Apply now and let us show you how to push your career to the next level at <em><strong>Deloitte. The One Firm. For You.</strong></em></p><p>Deloitte is an inclusive employer dedicated to building a diverse workforce. We encourage applications from all qualified candidates and will accommodate applicants’ needs under the respective provincial human rights codes throughout all stages of the recruitment and selection process. Please advise the Recruiter to ensure your accessibility needs are accommodated throughout this process. Information received relating to accommodation will be addressed confidentially.</p><p>We thank all applicants in advance for their interest; however, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted</p><p>34685</p><p> </p></div>
Title: Senior Consultant, Operational Excellence

Job_Description: <strong>Job Location : Calgary, Canada</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Both Full-Time and C2C Roles available</strong> <br/><br/> In this role, you will be responsible for the design and development of solutions leveraging SAP HANA as EDW and manage Visual BI customers and projects. <br/><br/> Specifically, you will <ul>  <li>With 8+ years in SAP Analytics (BW / HANA / Business Objects ) help manage Visual BI customers and Projects</li>  <li>Strong data modelling experience with SAP HANA by using BODS or SLT from SAP ECC and Non-SAP Data sources</li> <li>Strong understanding of SAP ERP Table structures (Financials, Inventory, Logistics, Supply Chain )</li>  <li>SAP HANA (SP8 and above) data modeling using Attribute, Analytic and Calculation Views</li> <li>Strong experience in HANA programming with SQL and database procedural languages such as PLSQL and T-SQL</li> <li>Work independently with minimal supervision</li> </ul> <strong>Requirements</strong> <ul>  <li>7+ years of hands-on experience in multiple EDW/BI developments</li> <li>2+ Years of hands-on experience in Enterprise HANA Modeling</li> <li>Experience with Business Objects Data Services (BODS)</li> <li>Experience with SAP BW</li>  <li>Experience with SLT / SDI</li>  <li>75% Travel or Relocation to Client Locations in Canada</li> <li>Business Objects Experience</li> <li>Non SAP Visualizations Tools Experience (Microsoft Power BI)</li> </ul> <strong>Benefits</strong> <ul>  <li>Excellent Rate or Pay</li>  </ul>

Job_Description: Description<br/><br/>Dealer Services is a division iA Financial Group and is one of Canada’s leading providers of automotive financial services and products. We're looking for assertive, dynamic individuals to complement our expanding team of sales/service professionals in Calgary. <br/><br/> If you excel in the following areas, we would like to hear from you:   <ul> <li>providing outstanding customer service and support</li> <li>promoting an extensive line of automotive/RV finance and insurance products, such as creditor insurance, extended service contracts and chemical appearance products</li> <li>teaching basic sales fundamentals (in relation to our product offering)</li> </ul>  Dealer Services offers a positive and fast paced work environment including:   <ul> <li>competitive compensation including base salary and commission</li> <li>car allowance</li> <li>generous paid vacation entitlement</li> <li>extensive benefits</li> <li>pension plan</li> <li>share purchase program</li> <li>an extensive on-boarding and training program to ensure a comfortable and productive transition into our team</li>  <strong><li>ongoing training development<br/><br/>Qualifications<br/><br/>Experience:</li>  </strong>  <li>2-5 years in automotive/RV sales management, or automotive/RV financial service management with a proven track record of success</li> </ul>  <strong>Skills:</strong>   <ul> <li>strong & professional work ethic</li> <li>team player but able to work independently</li> <li>adaptable, innovative and productive</li> <li>proficient in MS Office suite (Word, Excel, Outlook)</li> <li>strong communication skills</li> <li>strong prospecting and sales skills</li> <li>excellent analytical skills</li> <li>comprehensive understanding of the automotive/RV industry</li> <li>disciplined and a self-starter</li>  </ul>
Title: Automotive Sales Consultant, Dealer Services

Job_Description: Consultant <br/><br/> This individual will work as part of a team focused on providing strategic advice and developing solutions to complex business problems through the configuration, integration, testing and support of our business software applications. Consultants should have a strong desire for continuous learning and growth of technical and functional skills with the aspiration to leverage these skills to translate product vision into reality. Since the majority of the work is done under Client direction, the role involves extensive user interaction and requires excellent problem solving skills. <br/><br/> Responsibilities <ul> <li>Working with Clients on a daily basis to obtain business and technical specifications to help implement next generation software solutions</li><li>Working in small project teams on established activities or as a part of larger projects</li><li>Participating in the configuration, enhancement, and testing phases associated with software development and implementation</li><li>Ensuring successful completion of personal and team deliverables</li><li>Working closely with our software engineering teams to integrate release software into Client environments</li><li>Providing guidance and mentoring for less experienced consultants</li> </ul> Requirements <ul> <li>Bachelor degree in Engineering, Business or related disciplines that have an analytical component</li><li>Canadian Citizen or Permanent Resident with no need for current or future sponsorship</li><li>Must be willing to travel up to 100% during the week</li><li>Demonstrated leadership skills such as managing project schedules and fostering team collaboration</li> </ul> Preferred Skills <ul> <li>Demonstrated technical prowess including solving complex problems, programming skills (C++/C#, Java, VB, SQL and/or other computer programming languages), and familiarity/understanding of systems architecture</li><li>Aspiration or work experience in the oil and gas industry</li><li>Aspiration or work experience in developing and implementing solutions for Client needs</li><li>Entrepreneurial skills, including motivation to take on more responsibility</li><li>Interest to help grow and develop Client relationships through direct and meaningful interaction</li><li>Internship and/or other related work experience is strongly preferred</li>  </ul>
Title: Consultant

Job_Description: <strong><em>Are you passionate about helping people look their best?</em></strong> <br/><br/> <strong><em>Does helping people run a successful business excite you?</em></strong> <br/><br/> <strong><em>Do you want to work in a medical technology company with state of the art products?</em> </strong> <br/><br/> <strong><em>Do you have an Entrepreneurial spirit and a BIG appetite for learning?</em></strong> <br/><br/> <strong><em>Do you enjoy working hard and having fun?</em></strong> <br/><br/> If so, you will fit right in at Clarion with our Skin Health Team! <br/><br/> Clarion Medical Technologies has enjoyed year over year growth and is one of Canadas largest private medical companies offering high performance products since 1989. With the power of innovative technologies, the talent of our people and the expertise of our partners, we deliver the worlds best technology to make a difference in the lives of Canadians. <br/><br/> <strong>Our ideal Skin Health Sales Consultant is a self-starter with high energy, has persuasive communication style and loves the feedom that comes with being on the road</strong>. The successful candidate will be responsible for the Alberta/Saskatchewan/Manitoba territory and will need skin care industry experience, as well as 3-5 years of relevant sales experience with aproven sales track record in a large territory <br/><br/> <strong>What We Have To Offer:</strong>  <ul> <li>Life & Health Sciences Sector making peoples lives better!</li> <li>Competitive compensation with company paid benefits and pension match</li> <li>Strong focus on culture and employee engagement</li> <li>Flexible health care spending accounts for employee wellness</li> <li>Fun culture with high caliber team based across Canada</li> </ul>
Title: SK/MB/AB Skin Health Sales Consultant

Job_Description: <div><strong>Job Type:</strong> Permanent <br/> <strong>Primary Location:</strong> Calgary, Alberta, Canada <br/> <strong>All Available Locations:</strong> Calgary<br/> <div> Role Description <br/><br/> <strong>Remarkable people. Remarkable work.</strong> <strong>Remarkable career.</strong> <br/><br/> At Deloitte, we recognize that the days of one set path to career success are long over. We offer you the flexibility and choice to customize a work experience that fuels your passions, strengths and ambitions. We also try to ensure there are plenty of occasions to have fun, relax, play, exercise, and build relationships. At Deloitte, we are redefining what it means to be a professional services firm. We are all about ‘remarkable’: <strong>Remarkable people. Remarkable work. Remarkable career.</strong> (Even our workplace is remarkable!) <br/><br/> <strong>The team</strong> <br/><br/> Our HR Transformation (HRT) practice is leading the way when it comes to helping clients make sense of and draw insights from the rapid changes happening in the market. From being digital, to employee experience, to robotic process automation and the future of work: it is no longer enough to be strategic, HR needs to be the agent of change and innovation, win the war for talent and embrace the workforce disruption. Our ability to provide end-to-end services to our clients – from helping them envision where they want to go, to technology selection and solution design, straight through to implementation – makes us a standout in the market place (analysts consistently rate us as the leading firm in Canada and globally!). The roadmap to becoming a high-impact HR organization has never been more complex, and yet, it has never been more exciting to play in this space. <strong>Possibilities are limitless.</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>The role</strong> <br/><br/> As a Manager, you will play a key role in how we deliver our services to clients across a breadth of industries. You will have the opportunity to leverage leading research, analytics, technology and industry insights to impact the future of work and provide strategic and business-focused solutions to our clients. You will be part of a team that loves collaborating, taking on challenges and exceeding expectations. No two days are ever the same, but here is a sample of some of the work you might do in this role: build the infrastructure for new HR capabilities like predictive analytics, robotic process automation and employee experience; deliver engagements that advance strategic HR transformation for clients; develop and maintain client relationships and lead projects from planning through execution; consult with clients to increase effectiveness and reduce costs of HR service delivery through improved processes and technologies; participate in the selection, design and implementation of technology-enabled business and HR solutions for clients. <br/><br/> <strong>Who you are</strong> <br/><br/> Growing your career and future at Deloitte is within your hands and here is how you’ll succeed: <ul> <li><strong>You are genuinely passionate about HR,</strong> keeping up with trends, having your own point of view on what HR will look like in 10 to 15 years, and staying connected with what is happening in the market today, from an employee and an employer perspective.</li><li><strong>You demonstrate social perceptiveness,</strong> by being aware of others’ reactions and understanding why they react as they do by listening well and encouraging an open exchange of information and ideas using the appropriate communication tools.</li><li><strong>You have a design mindset,</strong> delivering a unique and customized customer service solution by using logic, imagination, intuition, and systemic reasoning to explore possibilities of what could be and by as a means of creating the desired outcomes that benefit the end user.</li><li><strong>You lead from the heart and with a purpose.</strong> You understand what drives those around you, you push them to do their best and you provide your teams with challenging and meaningful opportunities.</li><li><strong>You’re able to influence clients, teams and individuals positively</strong>, leading by example and truly understanding their needs<strong>.</strong> You project confidence, optimism, energy and credibility internally and externally.</li> </ul> <strong>The essentials</strong> <ul> <li>You have a bachelor’s degree in a related field. Master’s degree, CHRP and PMP designations are all attributes we are looking for, but if you have not acquired one yet, we are happy to help you to!</li><li>You have a successful career including progressively responsible roles in management and/or consulting.</li><li>You are experienced in leading teams of varying sizes that work with tight deadlines and with a high standard quality of work.</li><li>You have experience in playing a project manager role and being able to deliver the full cycle of project management accountabilities.</li><li>You are able to travel within Canada, US and, on occasion, internationally.</li> </ul> <strong>Join our team, share your strengths and dare to explore what a remarkable future could mean for you at Deloitte</strong><strong>!</strong> </div> <br/><strong>Why Deloitte?</strong> <br/><br/> Launch your career with The One Firm where you can make a greater impact than you ever thought possible. With endless opportunities at every turn, and a culture built to support and drive our people to be the very best they can be, Deloitte is The One Firm for you to learn, grow, create, and lead. <br/><br/> At Deloitte, we understand that everyone, and their career goals, are different. As a firm, we help create the conditions and opportunities that will enable our people to thrive – both professionally and personally. We do this by making three commitments to our people: <ul> <li><em><strong>You will lead at every level:</strong></em> We grow the world’s best leaders so you can achieve the impact you seek, faster.</li><li><em><strong>You can work your way:</strong></em> We give you the means to work how you want, and we have innovative spaces and the mindset to help you be wildly successful.</li><li><em><strong>You will feel included and inspired:</strong></em> We create a deep sense of belonging where you can bring your whole self to work.</li> </ul> Apply now and let us show you how to push your career to the next level at <em><strong>Deloitte. The One Firm. For You.</strong></em> <br/><br/> Deloitte is an inclusive employer dedicated to building a diverse workforce. We encourage applications from all qualified candidates and will accommodate applicants’ needs under the respective provincial human rights codes throughout all stages of the recruitment and selection process. Please advise the Recruiter to ensure your accessibility needs are accommodated throughout this process. Information received relating to accommodation will be addressed confidentially. <br/><br/> We thank all applicants in advance for their interest; however, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted <br/><br/> 34642</div>

Job_Description: The Sales Consultant role at Chartwell Royal Park Retirement Residence is an exceptional opportunity for an enterprising, self-directed Sales professional who brings demonstrated experience in sales, a sense of urgency and a drive for results, and who genuinely enjoys interacting with seniors. <br/><br/> The responsibilities of this position include but are not limited to:  <ul>   <li>Leverage Chartwell’s consultative sales process to help seniors and adult children make informed decisions when choosing a retirement residence;</li> <li>Drive occupancy levels and meet or exceed established sales targets:</li> <li>Manage telephone inquiries and convert to personal visit bookings;</li> <li>Conduct personal visits, follow up on leads, close sales through lease signings;</li> <li>Track sales activity in our CRM database and analyze reports to identify sales trends specific to the community and residence;</li> <li>Drive referrals and traffic:</li> <li>Create, retain and grow a portfolio of strategic networking partnerships with the local healthcare community and within the community at large:</li>   <li>Build a qualified lead database;</li> <li>Develop, promote, and implement marketing plans and events.</li> </ul> The ideal candidates will possess:  <ul>   <li>Proven experience in a consultative sales role;</li> <li>The ability to successfully follow an established sales process, including prospecting and closing sales transactions;</li> <li>Empathetic and caring interpersonal customer service skills;</li> <li>Ability to network, multi-task and promote services;</li> <li>Effective communication skills;</li> <li>Knowledge of the surrounding area and communities, valid provincial driver’s license and access to a vehicle;</li> <li>Computer literate with knowledge of related software programs;</li> <li>Flexible hours (evenings, weekends) may sometimes be required.</li> </ul> <em><strong>Candidates must be available to work days, evening, and weekends.</strong> </em>
Title: Sales Consultant

Job_Description: The Sr. Implementation Consultant will be the accounting lead role responsible for translating accounting business requirements into designs. Role would be responsible for configuration and testing of the accounting functions along with supporting users through training and testing. Would be responsible for leading up to 3 consultants. <br/><br/> Requirements: <ul>  <li>5 years in services delivery role with experience leading oil and gas software implementations</li> <li>Oil and Gas accounting experience, preferably in midstream and transportation</li> <li>Experience working in a flexible fast-paced high performance company</li> <li>Proven communication and organizational skills</li> <li>Strong people and relationship building skills</li> <li>Proven track record of operating with strong ethical standards</li> <li>Aptitude for problem solving and collaboration; excels at working in a team environment</li> <li>Track record of developing and delivering on goals and objectives</li> <li>Track record of mentoring and developing staff</li> <li>Drive consistency in delivery of software solutions</li> <li>Ability to manage a small team of resources, including managing and tracking to budgets and timelines</li> <li>Ensure that customers are satisfied and that the requirements are being met</li> <li>Build trust based relationships with customer project team and business personnel</li>  </ul> Technical / Functional Skills Preferred: <ul>  <li>Experience working with NGL marketing platforms (Allegro, RightAngle, Entero, etc.)</li> <li>Experience implementing or integrating with SAP Financial Accounting (FI)</li> <li>Experience with Full Absorption Product Costing: identifying variables and fixed costs, supporting invoice statement generation, automated journal entry creations, bookkeeping, chart of accounts management, and product inventory management</li> <li>Experience delivering projects leveraging multiple methodologies with an emphasis on execution of projects leveraging Agile techniques</li> <li>Experience working in Cloud/SaaS project delivery model</li> <li>Strong Microsoft SQL skills and experience working with a variety of reporting and business intelligence tools</li> <li>Relevant professional certificate (CPA, PMP, etc.)</li>  </ul>
Title: Sr. Implementation Consultant

Job_Description: <div> Job Description<br/>  <div><strong>This is an entry level position into a consulting business. In this role the person would work as part of a team and would provide support to more senior colleagues. The support would be in the areas of:</strong></div> <ul> <li>Logistics – working with the client and project team members to coordinate meetings and site visits to be as efficient as possible.</li>   <li>Project management – help to track project deliverables and resources to meet internal and external expectations. Development of project plan, scope of work.</li> <li>Client project management and communication. Client project updates, weekly reporting. Management of change. Internal and external communication of project progress.</li> <li>Document preparation – Develop meeting minutes and help to prepare compelling presentations for clients</li> <li>Client delivery – As the person progresses they would be expected to be part of a team delivery services to a client.</li>  </ul>  <div>Project field support. Planning and preparation, secondary consulting support.</div> <br/> Job Qualifications   <ul> <li>High School Diploma/GED required</li> <li>Technical degree in Project Management preferred</li> <li>5 to 7 years of experience</li> <li>Strong written and verbal communication skills.</li> <li>Strong project management capability</li> <li>Ability to interact with clients at multiple levels in their organization.</li>   <li>Able to work independently and maintain contact with colleagues who are spread across the continent.</li>  </ul>  About DowDuPont<br/><br/>DowDuPont (NYSE: DWDP) is a holding company comprised of The Dow Chemical Company and DuPont with the <br/>  intent to form strong, independent, publicly traded companies in agriculture, materials science and specialty <br/>  products sectors that will lead their respective industries through productive, science-based innovation to meet the <br/>  needs of customers and help solve global challenges. For more information, please visit us at www.dow-dupont.com. <br/><br/> The positions represented by this job posting are aligned to one of the three divisions, Agriculture, Materials <br/>  Science or Specialty Products, which are expected to separate from DowDuPont into stand-alone public companies. <br/>  Information on the division alignment will be provided during the recruitment process.</div> <br/>
Title: Business Associate Consultant

Job_Description: <div><strong>Job Type:</strong> Permanent <br/> <strong>Primary Location:</strong> Calgary, Alberta, Canada <br/> <strong>All Available Locations:</strong> Calgary<br/> <div> Role Description <br/><br/> <strong>Remarkable people. Remarkable work.</strong> <strong>Remarkable career.</strong> <br/><br/> At Deloitte, we recognize that the days of one set path to career success are long over. We offer you the flexibility and choice to customize a work experience that fuels your passions, strengths and ambitions. We also try to ensure there are plenty of occasions to have fun, relax, play, exercise, and build relationships. At Deloitte, we are redefining what it means to be a professional services firm. We are all about ‘remarkable’: <strong>Remarkable people. Remarkable work. Remarkable career.</strong> (Even our workplace is remarkable!) <br/><br/> <strong>The team</strong> <br/><br/> Our HR Transformation (HRT) practice is leading the way when it comes to helping clients make sense of and draw insights from the rapid changes happening in the market. From being digital, to employee experience, to robotic process automation and the future of work: it is no longer enough to be strategic, HR needs to be the agent of change and innovation, win the war for talent and embrace the workforce disruption. Our ability to provide end-to-end services to our clients – from helping them envision where they want to go, to technology selection and solution design, straight through to implementation – makes us a standout in the market place (analysts consistently rate us as the leading firm in Canada and globally!). The roadmap to becoming a high-impact HR organization has never been more complex, and yet, it has never been more exciting to play in this space. <strong>Possibilities are limitless.</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>The role</strong> <br/><br/> As a Manager, you will play a key role in how we deliver our services to clients across a breadth of industries. You will have the opportunity to leverage leading research, analytics, technology and industry insights to impact the future of work and provide strategic and business-focused solutions to our clients. You will be part of a team that loves collaborating, taking on challenges and exceeding expectations. No two days are ever the same, but here is a sample of some of the work you might do in this role: build the infrastructure for new HR capabilities like predictive analytics, robotic process automation and employee experience; deliver engagements that advance strategic HR transformation for clients; develop and maintain client relationships and lead projects from planning through execution; consult with clients to increase effectiveness and reduce costs of HR service delivery through improved processes and technologies; participate in the selection, design and implementation of technology-enabled business and HR solutions for clients. <br/><br/> <strong>Who you are</strong> <br/><br/> Growing your career and future at Deloitte is within your hands and here is how you’ll succeed: <ul> <li><strong>You are genuinely passionate about HR,</strong> keeping up with trends, having your own point of view on what HR will look like in 10 to 15 years, and staying connected with what is happening in the market today, from an employee and an employer perspective.</li><li><strong>You demonstrate social perceptiveness,</strong> by being aware of others’ reactions and understanding why they react as they do by listening well and encouraging an open exchange of information and ideas using the appropriate communication tools.</li><li><strong>You have a design mindset,</strong> delivering a unique and customized customer service solution by using logic, imagination, intuition, and systemic reasoning to explore possibilities of what could be and by as a means of creating the desired outcomes that benefit the end user.</li><li><strong>You lead from the heart and with a purpose.</strong> You understand what drives those around you, you push them to do their best and you provide your teams with challenging and meaningful opportunities.</li><li><strong>You’re able to influence clients, teams and individuals positively</strong>, leading by example and truly understanding their needs<strong>.</strong> You project confidence, optimism, energy and credibility internally and externally.</li> </ul> <strong>The essentials</strong> <ul> <li>You have a bachelor’s degree in a related field. Master’s degree, CHRP and PMP designations are all attributes we are looking for, but if you have not acquired one yet, we are happy to help you to!</li><li>You have a successful career including progressively responsible roles in management and/or consulting.</li><li>You are experienced in leading teams of varying sizes that work with tight deadlines and with a high standard quality of work.</li><li>You have experience in playing a project manager role and being able to deliver the full cycle of project management accountabilities.</li><li>You are able to travel within Canada, US and, on occasion, internationally.</li> </ul> <strong>Join our team, share your strengths and dare to explore what a remarkable future could mean for you at Deloitte</strong><strong>!</strong> </div> <br/><strong>Why Deloitte?</strong> <br/><br/> Launch your career with The One Firm where you can make a greater impact than you ever thought possible. With endless opportunities at every turn, and a culture built to support and drive our people to be the very best they can be, Deloitte is The One Firm for you to learn, grow, create, and lead. <br/><br/> At Deloitte, we understand that everyone, and their career goals, are different. As a firm, we help create the conditions and opportunities that will enable our people to thrive – both professionally and personally. We do this by making three commitments to our people: <ul> <li><em><strong>You will lead at every level:</strong></em> We grow the world’s best leaders so you can achieve the impact you seek, faster.</li><li><em><strong>You can work your way:</strong></em> We give you the means to work how you want, and we have innovative spaces and the mindset to help you be wildly successful.</li><li><em><strong>You will feel included and inspired:</strong></em> We create a deep sense of belonging where you can bring your whole self to work.</li> </ul> Apply now and let us show you how to push your career to the next level at <em><strong>Deloitte. The One Firm. For You.</strong></em> <br/><br/> Deloitte is an inclusive employer dedicated to building a diverse workforce. We encourage applications from all qualified candidates and will accommodate applicants’ needs under the respective provincial human rights codes throughout all stages of the recruitment and selection process. Please advise the Recruiter to ensure your accessibility needs are accommodated throughout this process. Information received relating to accommodation will be addressed confidentially. <br/><br/> We thank all applicants in advance for their interest; however, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted <br/><br/> 34642</div>
Title: Manager, Human Capital Consulting: HR Transformation & Advisory

Job_Description: <p></p><p></p>Shine with Signet!  Peoples Jewellers is looking for dynamic, driven and creative individuals to join our team.  Are you ready to use your business and sales skills to begin a financially rewarding career? If you are the type of person that enjoys working with the best of the best and celebrating the successes of a strong team, then you should apply to Peoples Jewellers. Make the decision to build your career with a company that thrives on an outstanding customer experience, intense and continuous training and being able to make a difference in our customer's and employee's lives. If you have the drive and passion to succeed, apply with us today!  Management-level Opportunities  Join our team as a Store Manager and have a positive impact on many lives. Our Store Managers are responsible for maintaining daily focus on individual and team members' standards  achievement to attain sales and profit projections; contributing to an atmosphere of total customer satisfaction; developing skills and product knowledge of team members through training and evaluation; and recruiting and selection of team members. The Store Manager is also responsible for achieving profit margin goals by managing the P&L; following and enforcing all Company policies and procedures; and other operational and strategic duties.  Full-time and Part-time Sales Opportunities  Join our team as a Sales Associate and have a positive impact on many lives. Our Sales Associates are responsible for engaging customers in conversation to understand their needs and objections; presenting merchandise and detailed information on features and benefits; offering extended service plans and financing options; working with the entire sales team to provide a superior experience to all of our valued customers and meeting individual and team sales goals.  We value integrity, diversity, teamwork and opportunities for advancement maintaining our promotion from within philosophy. We provide training on sales techniques, product knowledge, and skills to take your career to the next level. In return, we ask that you bring your commitment to excellence, desire to grow and ability to provide a superior customer experience. Sales, retail and/or jewelry experience is preferred, but not required.  A Sampling of our Total Rewards:  * Base pay plus commission on sales * Base pay plus commission on sales * 401 (k) * Paid Vacation and  * Paid Holidays (Full Time Team Members) * Tuition Reimbursement, including DCA courses based on position * Training - Associate Training System, Management Training System, District Manager in Training, Career Development and more * Merchandise Discounts * Incentive Trips and Contests  If interested, please apply online at www.signetjewelers.com.  Signet Jewelers is an equal opportunity employer committed to promoting diversity of all levels of employees. Please know that while we appreciate every applicant's interest, we can only contact those selected for further consideration.
Title: Sales Associate / Jewelry Consultant - Peoples - Northland Village

Job_Description: <strong>About the Company:</strong> <br/><br/> Timbercreek Asset Management Inc. (“TAMI”) is a privately-owned investment firm who actively owns and manages our multi-family residential buildings with experienced professionals. Our roots started in 1999 with our founding partners managing the day-to-day operations of the buildings themselves. Since then Timbercreek has expanded across Canada. Today we are a $6 billion multi-faceted investment management company focused on both domestic and international real estate investment. Over the past few years TAMI has been ranked multiple times by PROFIT Magazine as one of Canada’s fastest growing companies. <br/><br/> Timbercreek Communities (“TCOM”), a division of TAMI, currently manages a quality portfolio of over 200 multi-family residential buildings totaling over 20,000 residential suites well located in thirty cities and six provinces across Canada, including throughout Alberta, Manitoba, Ontario, Quebec, Nova Scotia and Saskatchewan. <br/><br/> <strong>Vision:</strong> <br/><br/> We are the leading owner and operator of multi-family residential communities across Canada. Timbercreek takes pride in ownership and an active hands-on approach to how we manage our communities. We are committed to working together collaboratively with our team and community members to create better living experiences. <br/><br/> <strong>About the Position:</strong> <br/><br/> The Sales& Marketing Specialist will support a diverse portfolio of activities including: the management of marketing material, content development, thought leadership, the Timbercreek digital& social media strategy, internal and external communications, award submissions and special projects. <br/><br/> <strong>Key Responsibilities:</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Marketing Material</strong> <ul> <li>Manage all sales materials in support of national and local initiatives, ensuring consistency and effectiveness</li><li>Manage Timbercreek Living blog calendar, posting and article editing</li><li>Oversee copywriting, graphic design and translation in execution of advertising and marketing collateral</li> </ul> <strong>Communications</strong> <ul> <li>Oversee all marketing communication to effectively represent our brand, products and services to our residents, markets or other external groups.</li></ul>  <ul> <li>Manage/execute external/internal communication strategies including website, email marketing and communications, social media, photography and video, engaging the organization’s various constituencies and reinforcing brand identity.</li><li>Work with Director, Sales& Marketing to execute Marketing communications</li> </ul> <strong>Website/Social Media</strong> <ul> <li>Responsible for the social media strategy for Timbercreek Communities</li><li>Provide oversight and day-to-day management of all digital and online assets, including the corporate website, micro-sites, blogs and all social media / networking sites, liaising with external developers and vendors as appropriate.</li></ul>  <ul> <li>Manage day-to-day updates and requests for Timbercreek Communities website, Kijiji and Lead Management</li><li>Develop and implement Kijiji Strategy including Top Ad Recommendation</li><li>Develop a search engine (SEO) strategy, metrics and create campaigns to increase on-line visibility</li><li>Assist with identifying local strategic sales and advertising programs for buildings</li> </ul> <strong>Analysis& Reporting</strong> <ul> <li>Analyze marketing metrics for identifying effect-cause relationships between financial outcomes and marketing actions to raise profitability.</li><li>Lead the measurement, collection, analysis and reporting of internet data for the purposes of understanding and optimizing web usage, in order to measure and assess the effectiveness of online campaigns.</li><li>Build marketing dashboards, which visualizes fundamental performance indicators.</li> </ul> <strong>Job Requirements:</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Education& Experience:</strong> <ul> <li>Bachelor of Commerce, Marketing, Communications, Business degree and 5-7 years of relevant work experience in marketing strategy and sales</li><li>Marketing experience with a B2C services company.</li><li>Minimum of 3 years’ experience in digital marketing</li></ul>  <ul> <li>Excellent writing, editing and research skills, with superior knowledge of grammar, spelling, punctuation and style</li><li>Strong attention to detail, taking pride in delivering on commitments.</li><li>Strong people, analytical, time and project management skills.</li><li>Proactive, innovative, creative, positive, articulate and professional.</li><li>Analytical and intellectually curious, seeking to understand root causes.</li><li>Effective communicator, able to synthesize data and information so it tells a compelling story that resonates with target audiences.</li></ul>  <ul> <li>Knowledge of the real estate industry and multi-residential, an asset</li><li>Bilingual (French) an asset</li> </ul> <strong>Qualifications:</strong> <ul> <li>Ability to think critically, strategically, and creatively to leverage best practices and enable solutions that lead to action</li><li>Team player, excellent consensus building skills with high degree of motivation and desire to collaborate with others</li><li>Results oriented with a solid track record of making an impact, developing and executing on strategies and delivering superior results</li><li>Ability to proactively resolve problems and manage conflict/negotiate positively</li><li>Strong verbal and written communication, time management and organization skills</li><li>Strong computer skills including Microsoft Office (Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Outlook) and Yardi</li> </ul>
Title: Regional Sales & Marketing Specialist

Job_Description: South Trail Chrysler is seeking a professional, enthusiastic Pre- Owned Vehicle Sales Consultant to join our team of specialists. The candidates must demonstrate passion for customer service and a process driven approach to sales.We offer great incentives for career advancement within South Trail Chrysler Regardless if you have a growing family or are starting a new one, we would like to offer you the opportunity to join ours! <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities:</strong>   <ul> <li>To promote and complete the sale of vehicles in an appropriate, professional and ethical manner with the highest regard to exemplary customer service</li> <li>To have up-to-date product knowledge of all vehicle makes and models including competitive brands</li> <li>To service all allocated sales inquiries in a prompt and effective fashion</li> <li>To have the ability to close sales</li> </ul>  <strong>Requirements:</strong>   <ul> <li>Valid Class 5 driver’s license with a clean driving record</li> <li>Previous retail sales experience, but not mandated</li> <li>Excellent written and verbal communication skills</li> <li>Willing to be trained by high ranked sales consultants within the company</li> <li>Ability to meet the needs of a diverse client base</li> <li>Demonstrated ability to multitask with excellent organizational skills with attention to detail</li> <li>Positive attitude</li> <li>Ability to work independently in a fast paced environment with prioritization skills</li> </ul>  Hours of work: Full-Time/ Shift work <br/><br/> <strong>Salary & Key Benefits:</strong>   <ul> <li>Paid training evaluation period</li> <li>Leading industry pay plan (competitive commission based )</li> <li>Comprehensive benefit package</li> </ul>
Title: Pre- Owned Vehicle Sales Consultant

Company: Eastside Dodge Chrysler Jeep Ram Fiat
Job_Description: Eastside Dodge is seeking a professional, enthusiastic New Vehicle Sales Consultant to join our team of specialists. Apply now to join a store that has been #1 in sales for 12 years running! With one of the largest New and Used vehicle inventories, make 2018 the year you find your new career, not just a job!WHAT WE OFFER:   <ul> <li>A guaranteed income for the first 3 months</li> <li>A great team environment</li> <li>Sales training to help you get started, previous experience not required</li> <li>A very large inventory to sell from both new and pre-owned</li> <li>Ongoing, aggressive marketing to generate customers</li> <li>Great income opportunity with a lucrative pay plan</li> <li>Very large customer base to draw from</li> <li>A dealership with a great reputation in Calgary</li> <li>Great staff functions: Bowling nights, Stampede parties, Entertainment nights, and rocking Christmas parties for staff and their families</li> <li>We also have the coolest boss in the car business!</li> </ul>  <strong>RESPONSIBILITIES:</strong>   <ul> <li>Greet customers in the indoor or the outdoor showroom</li> <li>Listen to understand the customer’s wants and needs</li> <li>Select the correct vehicle with the sales managers</li> <li>Present features and benefits</li> <li>Offer a test drive</li> <li>Finalize terms</li> </ul>  <strong>REQUIREMENTS:</strong>   <ul> <li>Previous automotive sales experience preferred</li> <li>Ability to negotiate and close</li> <li>Product knowledge is an asset</li> <li>Excellent customer service skills with the desire to exceed expectations</li> <li>Excellent organizational and prioritization skills, attention to detail</li> <li>Ability to meet the needs of a diverse client base</li> <li>Valid Class 5 Driver’s License with a clean driver’s record</li> <li>Provincial Sales License</li> <li>Computer skills: MS Office, Outlook</li> </ul>  A bit about the McManes Automotive Group….. <br/><br/> The McManes Automotive Group consists of dealerships spanning from Manitoba to British Columbia and we currently represent 13 brands of vehicles. Although our store locations are independently operated, we share the same overall culture by showing appreciation for every person that works with us. By taking care of our people, we inherently take care of our customers. Regardless if you have a growing family or are starting a new one, we would like to offer you the opportunity to join ours!

Job_Description: <STRONG><EM>Interested in being a part of a team that is leading the evolution of retail in Canada?</EM></STRONG> <br/><br/> Embracing and driving change is critical to our success. The complexity and rate at which the retail industry is transforming has increased exponentially in recent years and we are committed to being a leader in the industry. As such we are relentlessly focused on innovating at every level of our business, investing in new technologies and products, and doubling down on the best talent to drive the company forward. It is an especially exciting time to join the Canadian Tire Family of Companies. <br/><br/> <STRONG>What you'll do:</STRONG> <br/><br/> Reporting directly into Manager, Content Marketing, and working closely with the AVP of Content & VP of Marketing, the Consumer Marketing Specialist will play a key role in managing consumer marketing initiatives at Mark’s. You will develop and manage the execution of marketing plans including mass communications campaigns and Mark’s overall traditional and online marketing. A high level of integration across all marketing touch points is required to ensure a comprehensive and cohesive delivery of customer messaging. <br/><br/> <STRONG>You will also:</STRONG>  <ul> <li>Coordinate mass communications campaigns;</li> <li>Collaborate with the Planning team on research for Marketing tactics;</LI>   <li>Assist the marketing team through effective and efficient execution and tracking of all marketing strategies and tactics;</li> <li>Assist in coordination of product and advertising information between Purchasing and Marketing;</li> <li>Continuously improve processes to optimize advertising messages and channels;</li> <li>Responsible to be the gatekeeper for Brand and Category strategies across all content vehicles</LI>   <li>Coordinate promotional programs to ensure accuracy to and from all stakeholders;</li> <li>Manage national brand relationships, including developing media plans and execution and post reports;</li> <li>Manage work back schedule with internal and external partners to ensure programs stays on time/budget and all processes are followed and optimized;</li> <li>Liaise with external vendors to execute promotional events and campaigns;</li> <li>Maintain and strengthen relationships with Canadian Tire Corporation (CTC);</LI>   <li>Support Marketing team as required.</LI> </ul> <STRONG>What you bring:</STRONG>  <ul> <li>Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Marketing or a related field;</li> <li>3-5 years of experience in Consumer Marketing or Digital/Traditional Marketing in the retail industry;</li> <li>Ability to plan and manage at both the strategic and operational levels;</li> <li>Exposure to traditional media; print, OOH, flyer, TV, radio Etc… from a planning perspective;</li> <li>Excellent interpersonal skills to effectively interact with executive level customers and partners;</li> <li>Traditional media experience is an asset.</LI> </ul> As a condition of employment, this job is subject to the successful completion of the following Pre-employment conditions: Reference Checks and Criminal Background Checks.<br/><br/>Canadian Tire is an equal opportunity employer.
