Job_Description: <EM><STRONG>Interested in being a part of a team that is leading the evolution of retail in Canada?</STRONG></EM> <br/><br/> Embracing and driving change is critical to our success. The complexity and rate at which the retail industry is transforming has increased exponentially in recent years and we are committed to being a leader in the industry. As such we are relentlessly focused on innovating at every level of our business, investing in new technologies and products, and doubling down on the best talent to drive the company forward. It is an especially exciting time to join the Canadian Tire Family of Companies. <br/><br/> <STRONG>Job Summary</STRONG> <br/><br/> The Marketing Specialist role within the Purchasing department is to act as the liaison between Purchasing and Marketing, for the coordination and execution of our National Flyer Program, Marks.com, Magazine, TV, Billboard, Radio and other External Advertising such as ROP, digital ad’s & sponsorships. This person must work closely with purchasing and the compliance team to ensure all external advertising is compliant with the Competition Act. Feedback, proofing and guidance on the In-Store experience including Signage, Digital Media, & Merchandise Set up’s is also required. <br/><br/> Learning the products and understanding the vision of the purchasing is a key component to success. Knowing this information allows you to communicate the direction to the various departments. <br/><br/> This position ultimately reports to the VP of Purchasing. It is the touch point between many departments and Purchasing. You must be a problem solver; be detail orientated and have excellent communication skills. This is a fast paced environment where good time management is essential to success. <br/><br/> Responsibilities  <ul> <li>Collaborate with Purchasing and Marketing to build and maintain advertising plans.</LI>   <li>Learn the products, innovations and technologies and be able to communicate them.</LI>   <li>Work with VP of Purchasing to give marketing direction of the world vision for the season and 5 year outlook.</LI>   <li>Seasonally allocate flyer space to build advertising plan.</LI>   <li>Build Flyer Paginations. All planned ad items laid out by page with allocated space.</LI>   <li>Collect and communicate all product information needed to Marketing, including wardrobing, for creating ads.</li> <li>Meet with Marketing & Ad agency to review paginations and give direction to build Flyer Page Plans.</li> <li>Review Flyer Layouts with Purchasing team for accuracy and give feedback to marketing on creative direction for photography.</LI>   <li>Review all Flyer Proofs with Purchasing for accuracy of copy detail, image selection and ensure sufficient inventory.</LI>   <li>Give feedback to marketing and agency on Flyer Proofs through proof HQ and weekly meetings with Marketing Flyer Coordinator.</li> <li>Get purchasing to complete a Flyer sign-off sheet for each flyer. Ensure all items and pricing are correct.</LI>   <li>Review the Price Events in PMM for each flyer for accuracy.</li> <li>Compile analysis of flyer campaign results.</li> <li>Solid understanding of Competition Act.</LI>   <li>Monitor with purchasing and compliance team all advertised items throughout the season ensuring compliancy.</li> <li>Work with National Brand vendors for ad approvals.</li> <li>Work with the Purchasing teams to ensure all pricing is set up for all promotional events.</li> <li>Collaborate with the Digital Marketing team on digital ads.</li> <li>Work with Web team to properly represent a good selection of our products on marks.com site.</LI>   <li>Work with Signage team to ensure products and pricing are properly represented on signs in-store.</LI>   <li>Work with vendors, purchasing & marketing on specialty campaigns including magazine, digital & sponsorships.</li> <li>Incorporate flyer research and learning.</LI> </ul> <STRONG>Required Skills and Experience</STRONG>  <ul> <li>Excellent knowledge of the Canadian retail industry</li> <li>5 years’ experience in retail, marketing or advertising</LI>   <li>Degree or diploma in marketing an asset</li> <li>Ability to handle multiple projects and prioritize with time sensitive tight deadlines</li> <li>Excellent interpersonal skills to deal with colleagues of all levels, internally and externally</li> <li>Strong problem-solving and organizational skills, and attention to detail</li> <li>Strong analytic and quantitative skills</li> <li>Superior verbal and written communication skills</li> <li>Proficient with Excel, Microsoft Word, PowerPoint and Adobe</li> <li>Basic skills in Outlook would be an asset</LI> </ul>  Canadian Tire is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace for all. We recognize that our future success depends on the perspectives and contributions of all our employees -- their diverse backgrounds, abilities and experiences make our business stronger. If you are contacted for a job opportunity, please advise us of any accommodations needed to ensure fair and equitable access throughout the recruitment and selection process. All accommodation information provided will be treated as confidential and used only for the purpose of providing an accessible candidate experience.
Title: Marketing Specialist - Industrial & Footwear - Mark's

Job_Description: ArcSight Technology Consultant<br/><br/><strong>Job Description:</strong> <br/><br/> Ce poste est présentement en traduction. Disponible sous peu. <br/><br/> <strong>ArcSight Technology Consultant</strong> <br/><br/> Discover the new Micro Focus – now the world’s 7th largest pure-play software company. By combining HPE Software and Micro Focus offerings, we have built a brand new company with a stronger, bigger portfolio that delivers customer-centered innovation. We are now uniquely positioned to help enterprise customers solve their most pressing business problems and operate in the Hybrid environment—from mainframe to mobile to cloud. <br/><br/> Our portfolio spans the following areas: <br/><br/> <strong>DevOps | IT Operations| Cloud | Security | Info Governance | Big Data, Machine Learning, & Analytics</strong> <br/><br/> Take charge of your future and join our dynamic team as we go to market and support our customers with a best-in-class portfolio that will help shape the world’s software landscape. #discoverthenew <br/><br/> Micro Focus is a leading provider of security and compliance solutions for modern enterprises that want to mitigate risk in their hybrid environments and defend against advanced threats. Based on market leading products – ArcSight (security information and event management), Fortify (application security), Atalla (payments and data security) and Voltage (data-centric encryption and tokenization )– Micro Focus is singularly positioned to provide the most comprehensive Security Intelligence and Risk Management platform on the market, which uniquely delivers the advanced correlation, application protection, and network defense technology to protect today's applications and IT infrastructures from sophisticated cyber threats. <br/><br/> <strong>About the Role</strong> <br/><br/> The ArcSight Technology Consultant is responsible for implementing part or all of the technical solution to the client, in accordance with an agreed technical design. Occasionally responsible for providing a detailed technical design for enterprise solutions. The Technology Consultant understands a broad spectrum of Micro Focus technology in order to provide part or all of a detailed technical design which meets customer requirements. <br/><br/> <strong>The ArcSight Technology Consultant</strong> <ul> <li>Often leads small to medium technical projects. Works with and under the direction of the Project/Technical Manager and with customer nominated representatives. Liaises with Solutions Architect as appropriate.</li><li>Provides technical support and input on the application of technology to a defined business segment. Provides advice on solution and integration opportunities to defined segments.</li><li>Provides technical leadership on specific integration activities that are part of an engagement.</li><li>Provides planning and design support for the development of solution architectures that will be implemented in a multiple system environment.</li><li>Communicates across client community, and is viewed as adding value. Demonstrates execution of the Micro Focus strategy.</li><li>Contributes to knowledge tools and communities, and ensures project learning’s are documented and shared. Role models Focuses on single customer. Solves diverse and complex problems. May lead a project team.</li> </ul> <strong>Education and Experience Required:</strong> <ul> <li>At least 2-5 years of professional experience</li><li>1+ years ArcSight/SIEM experience</li><li>2-5 years Linux experience</li><li>1-2 years of data analysis</li><li>1-2 years of consulting experience – preferred</li><li>Bachelor of Arts/Science or equivalent degree in computer science or related area of study</li><li>Eligibility to obtain a Government clearance may be required.</li> </ul> <strong>Knowledge and Skills:</strong> <ul> <li>Has sufficient depth and breadth of technical knowledge to be individually responsible for the design and scope of deliverables.</li> <li>Has mastered at least one technical discipline with strong knowledge in at least three major technology areas. Possesses advanced level of business, technical, or functional knowledge.</li><li>Able to communicate with customers and present complex issues with assurance and confidence.</li><li>Ability to conduct/lead oral status/technical interchange meetings with clients on small to medium sized engagements.</li><li>Owns and produces customer documentation. Ability to translate technical details into concise and easy to understand written form. Ability to write relevant components of a proposal document (e.g. answer specific RFP questions). Ability to translate verbal requirements from face to face client meetings into requirements documents, statements of work, and proposals.</li><li>Able to discuss (within own area of expertise) requirements with a customer, and to challenge and clarify when appropriate. From the requirements, able to develop a high level design or plan, and then estimate the amount of effort required to deliver. Able to advise the engagement owner about the risks associated with this work package.</li><li>Ability to work with a team to provide written responses to technical proposals and /or reports/documentation for delivery.</li> </ul> If you want to be part of what's next and find out more about our available opportunities, visit Micro Focus Careers. <br/><br/> #LI-SD1 <br/><br/> <strong>Job:</strong><br/><br/>Services<br/><br/><strong>Job Level:</strong><br/><br/>Expert<br/><br/><strong>Micro Focus is EEO F/M/Protected Veteran/ Individual with Disabilities.</strong> <br/><br/> Micro Focus will comply with all applicable laws related to the use of arrest and conviction records, including the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance and similar laws and will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories.
Title: ArcSight Technology Consultant

Job_Description: <div><p><strong>Job Type: </strong>Permanent <br><strong>Primary Location: </strong>Calgary, Alberta, Canada <br><strong>All Available Locations: </strong>Calgary; Vancouver </p><div><p><p><b>Job description</b></p><p><p> </p><p><strong>Technology</strong></p><p>Our technologists help clients implement innovative technologies to drive their business’ forward. Our consultants link technology insights to clients’ organizational goals to fit within their full operating models, accounting for their people, intellectual capital, and processes.</p><p> </p><p><strong>SAP</strong></p><p>The full potential of SAP solutions isn't just about technology, it's also about driving sustainable business value. At Deloitte, our SAP specialists deliver the technology and services to help our clients meet business performance goals and improve processes. As an SAP Global Partner we provide a broad range of consulting services, from HR, CRM and supply chain to finance transformation.</p><p> </p><p><strong>Consultant, SAP Supply Chain Management/Ariba</strong></p><p>Are you looking for a career trajectory that few other organizations can offer in SAP? What about access to a high-quality portfolio of businesses and clients with opportunities to work across capabilities, industries, and geographies – in roles and on projects aligned with your SAP Profitability Analysis skills? If this matches your interests and aspirations Deloitte may be right for you.</p><p> </p><p>As a Consultant focused on SAP Supply Chain Management/Ariba you will:</p><ul><li>Support SAP SCM/Ariba pursuits and Practice Development initiatives</li><li>Deliver SAP SCM/Ariba projects successfully</li><li>Develop external eminence across SAP</li><li>Promote and foster collaboration and knowledge sharing between practitioners in SAP and across Deloitte.</li></ul></p></p><p><p><b>Qualifications</b></p><p><ul><li>Completed undergraduate degree with outstanding academic credentials</li><li>Functional proficiency with at least 1+ full lifecycle SAP implementations and 2+ years of industry and/or consulting experience in the SAP space</li><li>At least 2 years of SAP experience implementing SAP Supply Chain Management and/or Ariba</li><li>SAP certification is an asset</li><li>Experience in providing post implementation support</li><li>A thorough understanding of SAP Supply Chain Management and/or Ariba</li><li>Strong understanding of the integration points with complimentary modules</li><li>Strong commitment to professional client service excellence</li><li>Excellent interpersonal relations and demonstrated ability to work with others effectively in teams</li><li>Superior verbal and written communication skills</li><li>Ability to develop and present new ideas and conceptualize new approaches and solutions</li><li>Proven analytical skills and systematic problem solving</li><li>Canadian travel required, occasional international travel. Candidates must be able to enter the USA to work on client assignments</li></ul></p></p></div><p><strong>Why Deloitte?</strong></p><p>Launch your career with The One Firm where you can make a greater impact than you ever thought possible. With endless opportunities at every turn, and a culture built to support and drive our people to be the very best they can be, Deloitte is The One Firm for you to learn, grow, create, and lead.</p><p>At Deloitte, we understand that everyone, and their career goals, are different. Job_Description: South Trail Hyundai, a brand new dealership located in the newest South Trail Auto Mall , has a growing community and clientele. We need to expand our team of professionals and are looking for the right candidate or two to join our South Trail Hyundai family!Any interested candidates must be motivated to succeed, resourceful and possess the necessary capabilities to establish and maintain strong professional relationships with both existing and new clients. <br/><br/> If you are looking to work for a company that values integrity, good work ethic, and a strong sense of teamwork, then please apply today! <br/><br/> Why Work for us?   <ul> <li>Lucrative pay plan – commissioned based</li> <li>Sales Contest for an all-inclusive trip! (Past trips have included Phoenix and Mexico)</li> <li>Ask us about our “Sales team” Awards and Recognition !</li> <li>Promote Training & Development & Team building</li> <li>Forward thinking work environment</li> </ul>  <strong>Job requirements:</strong>   <ul> <li>Minimum 1 year automotive sales experience</li> <li>Positive attitude</li> <li>Excellent written and verbal communication skills</li> <li>Demonstrated ability to multitask and excellent organizational skills</li> <li>Ability to work independently in a fast paced environment and ensure quality and quantity of work meets expectations</li> <li>Valid Alberta Class 5 Driver’s license, AMVIC registered</li> </ul>  Job Duties   <ul> <li>Develop buyers by keeping good rapport with previous and new customers; also by suggesting trade-ins; respond to inquiries; recommend sales campaigns and promotions</li> <li>Qualify buyers by understanding their interests and requirements; matching requirements and interests to various models, etc.</li> <li>Effectively close sales by overcoming objection(s)</li> <li>Update own job knowledge by participating in educational opportunities and reading professional publications</li> <li>Figure out customer’s needs by listening and asking questions</li> <li>Perform walk-around with new and old customer and demonstrate features of suitable vehicles</li> <li>Ensure that customers understand the vehicle’s operating features, paperwork and warranty</li> <li>Establish and maintain follow-up system, which encourages repeat business referrals</li> <li>Report to the sales manager regarding reviews, analyses , objectives, and planned activities</li> </ul>  Located at: 6403 – 130 Ave SE, Calgary AB <br/><br/> Our Business Philosophy <br/><br/> “To give people the hope, vision, and competence through leadership and coaching to become successful in the automotive business”.
Title: Sales Consultant

It is the touch point between many departments and Purchasing. You must be a problem solver; be detail orientated and have excellent communication skills. This is a fast paced environment where good time management is essential to success. <br/><br/> Responsibilities  <ul> <li>Collaborate with Purchasing and Marketing to build and maintain advertising plans.</LI>   <li>Learn the products, innovations and technologies and be able to communicate them.</LI>   <li>Work with VP of Purchasing to give marketing direction of the world vision for the season and 5 year outlook.</LI>   <li>Seasonally allocate flyer space to build advertising plan.</LI>   <li>Build Flyer Paginations. All planned ad items laid out by page with allocated space.</LI>   <li>Collect and communicate all product information needed to Marketing, including wardrobing, for creating ads.</li> <li>Meet with Marketing & Ad agency to review paginations and give direction to build Flyer Page Plans.</li> <li>Review Flyer Layouts with Purchasing team for accuracy and give feedback to marketing on creative direction for photography.</LI>   <li>Review all Flyer Proofs with Purchasing for accuracy of copy detail, image selection and ensure sufficient inventory.</LI>   <li>Give feedback to marketing and agency on Flyer Proofs through proof HQ and weekly meetings with Marketing Flyer Coordinator.</li> <li>Get purchasing to complete a Flyer sign-off sheet for each flyer. Ensure all items and pricing are correct.</LI>   <li>Review the Price Events in PMM for each flyer for accuracy.</li> <li>Compile analysis of flyer campaign results.</li> <li>Solid understanding of Competition Act.</LI>   <li>Monitor with purchasing and compliance team all advertised items throughout the season ensuring compliancy.</li> <li>Work with National Brand vendors for ad approvals.</li> <li>Work with the Purchasing teams to ensure all pricing is set up for all promotional events.</li> <li>Collaborate with the Digital Marketing team on digital ads.</li> <li>Work with Web team to properly represent a good selection of our products on marks.com site.</LI>   <li>Work with Signage team to ensure products and pricing are properly represented on signs in-store.</LI>   <li>Work with vendors, purchasing & marketing on specialty campaigns including magazine, digital & sponsorships.</li> <li>Incorporate flyer research and learning.</LI> </ul> <STRONG>Required Skills and Experience</STRONG>  <ul> <li>Excellent knowledge of the Canadian retail industry</li> <li>5 years’ experience in retail, marketing or advertising</LI>   <li>Degree or diploma in marketing an asset</li> <li>Ability to handle multiple projects and prioritize with time sensitive tight deadlines</li> <li>Excellent interpersonal skills to deal with colleagues of all levels, internally and externally</li> <li>Strong problem-solving and organizational skills, and attention to detail</li> <li>Strong analytic and quantitative skills</li> <li>Superior verbal and written communication skills</li> <li>Proficient with Excel, Microsoft Word, PowerPoint and Adobe</li> <li>Basic skills in Outlook would be an asset</LI> </ul>  Canadian Tire is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace for all. We recognize that our future success depends on the perspectives and contributions of all our employees -- their diverse backgrounds, abilities and experiences make our business stronger. All accommodation information provided will be treated as confidential and used only for the purpose of providing an accessible candidate experience.
Title: Marketing Specialist - Industrial & Footwear - Mark's

Job_Description: <STRONG><EM>Interested in being a part of a team that is leading the evolution of retail in Canada?</EM></STRONG> <br/><br/> Embracing and driving change is critical to our success. The complexity and rate at which the retail industry is transforming has increased exponentially in recent years and we are committed to being a leader in the industry. As such we are relentlessly focused on innovating at every level of our business, investing in new technologies and products, and doubling down on the best talent to drive the company forward. It is an especially exciting time to join the Canadian Tire Family of Companies. <br/><br/> <STRONG>What you'll do:</STRONG> <br/><br/> Reporting directly into Manager, Content Marketing, and working closely with the AVP of Content & VP of Marketing, the Consumer Marketing Specialist will play a key role in managing consumer marketing initiatives at Mark’s. You will develop and manage the execution of marketing plans including mass communications campaigns and Mark’s overall traditional and online marketing. A high level of integration across all marketing touch points is required to ensure a comprehensive and cohesive delivery of customer messaging. <br/><br/> <STRONG>You will also:</STRONG>  <ul> <li>Coordinate mass communications campaigns;</li> <li>Collaborate with the Planning team on research for Marketing tactics;</LI>   <li>Assist the marketing team through effective and efficient execution and tracking of all marketing strategies and tactics;</li> <li>Assist in coordination of product and advertising information between Purchasing and Marketing;</li> <li>Continuously improve processes to optimize advertising messages and channels;</li> <li>Responsible to be the gatekeeper for Brand and Category strategies across all content vehicles</LI>   <li>Coordinate promotional programs to ensure accuracy to and from all stakeholders;</li> <li>Manage national brand relationships, including developing media plans and execution and post reports;</li> <li>Manage work back schedule with internal and external partners to ensure programs stays on time/budget and all processes are followed and optimized;</li> <li>Liaise with external vendors to execute promotional events and campaigns;</li> <li>Maintain and strengthen relationships with Canadian Tire Corporation (CTC);</LI>   <li>Support Marketing team as required.</LI> </ul> <STRONG>What you bring:</STRONG>  <ul> <li>Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Marketing or a related field;</li> <li>3-5 years of experience in Consumer Marketing or Digital/Traditional Marketing in the retail industry;</li> <li>Ability to plan and manage at both the strategic and operational levels;</li> <li>Exposure to traditional media; print, OOH, flyer, TV, radio Etc… from a planning perspective;</li> <li>Excellent interpersonal skills to effectively interact with executive level customers and partners;</li> <li>Traditional media experience is an asset.</LI> </ul> As a condition of employment, this job is subject to the successful completion of the following Pre-employment conditions: Reference Checks and Criminal Background Checks.<br/><br/>Canadian Tire is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace for all. We recognize that our future success depends on the perspectives and contributions of all our employees -- their diverse backgrounds, abilities and experiences make our business stronger. Job_Description: <div><strong>Job Type:</strong> Permanent <br/> <strong>Primary Location:</strong> Calgary, Alberta, Canada <br/> <strong>All Available Locations:</strong> Calgary; Edmonton; Vancouver <br/><br/> The Opportunity <br/><br/> As a member of the Human Capital Consulting team, you will work with a dedicated team of Consultants, Senior Consultants, Senior Managers, and Partners to solve our client's complex people issues. You will play a pivotal role with responsibilities that include developing project plans, managing project delivery, analyzing client issues, assembling leading practices developing actionable recommendations and preparing and delivering client presentations. You will deliver projects related but not limited to: <ul> <li>Organization design across all business units (e.g. IT, Finance, HR, Marketing, etc.)</li><li>Developing and executing strategies to address the key people issues associated with complex strategic change initiatives (e.g., corporate strategy implementations, new operating model implementations, managing the organizational and talent issues associated with mergers and integrations)</li><li>Developing strategies to manage the people considerations associated with large scale technology implementations (e.g., ERP, CRM, HRMS)</li><li>HR transformation including HR strategy, service delivery, process, technology, and outsourcing advisory.</li><li>Talent and workforce management strategies (e.g. process redesign, workforce planning, HR cloud technologies, including Workday and SuccessFactors)</li><li>High profile public sector clients and projects, primarily focused in Ontario, with opportunities to work on other Canadian and international engagements.</li> </ul> As a Senior Manager you will: <ul> <li>Support and lead a number of Human Capital engagements across Western Canada and Nationally, as required</li><li>Take a lead role in delivering and managing consulting services to high growth organizations with a diverse team of Consultants</li><li>Work in a fast growing and challenging environment with like-minded people who are eminent in their respective field</li> <li>Create long term relationships at a senior client level</li><li>Execute a client service plan on complex advisor</li><li>Actively mentor and coach team members to their highest potential</li><li>Create a learning environment through leadership</li> </ul> The experience needed: <br/><br/> Requirements: experience in Human Capital strategies, including a minimum of 5 years consulting background</li><li>Professional service experience is a must</li><li>Experience leading Human Capital strategies and programs for clients in the public sector (local, national, or international)</li><li>Strong commitment to professional and client service excellence</li><li>Superior verbal and written communication skills</li><li>Proven ability to deliver the full cycle of project management accountabilities</li> <li>Experienced with project problem diagnosis, solution development, client communications, facilitation of decision making, documentation, managing client expectations, project profitability and team leadership</li><li>Experienced in business development and building a practice</li><li>Ability to anticipate the long term impact of all decisions and take a broad approach to problem solving</li><li>Canadian travel required, occasional international travel. Candidates must be able to enter the USA to work on client assignments</li> </ul> <strong>Why Deloitte?</strong> <br/><br/> Launch your career with The One Firm where you can make a greater impact than you ever thought possible. With endless opportunities at every turn, and a culture built to support and drive our people to be the very best they can be, Deloitte is The One Firm for you to learn, grow, create, and lead. <br/><br/> At Deloitte, we understand that everyone, and their career goals, are different. As a firm, we help create the conditions and opportunities that will enable our people to thrive – both professionally and personally. We do this by making three commitments to our people: <ul> <li><em><strong>You will lead at every level:</strong></em> We grow the world’s best leaders so you can achieve the impact you seek, faster.</li><li><em><strong>You can work your way:</strong></em> We give you the means to work how you want, and we have innovative spaces and the mindset to help you be wildly successful.</li><li><em><strong>You will feel included and inspired:</strong></em> We create a deep sense of belonging where you can bring your whole self to work.</li> </ul> Apply now and let us show you how to push your career to the next level at <em><strong>Deloitte. Job_Description: Company Overview: The ADT Corporation (NYSE: ADT) is a leading provider of security and automation solutions for homes and businesses in the United States and Canada. ADT's broad and pioneering set of products and services, including ADT Pulse® interactive home and business solutions, and health services, meet a range of customer needs for todays active and increasingly mobile lifestyles. Headquartered in Boca Raton, Florida, ADT helps provide peace of mind to nearly seven million customers, and it employs approximately 17,500 people at 200 locations. More information is available at www.adt.com . Position Summary: The tenure of this position is responsible for the promotion of products to potential and existing customers. He is initiating and executing all steps of the sales cycle with commercial, industrial and institutional customers in order to meet targets and provide an exceptional customer experience. He provides support and assistance to the Commercial sales manager in the development of the target markets. Duties and Responsibilities: Meet with potential customers to determine their security needs Analyse needs and create a solution Create quotes covering all customers needs uncover during discovery Conduct effective presentations of proposals/solutions adapted to customers preoccupations. Use the companys sales process to: Create and foster relationships of trust with customers Reveal the need for a security system Translate the security system advantages into benefits for the customer Overcome objections Demonstrate the security system operation and capabilities Professionally close sales Request customers testimonials and referrals. Foster the existing customers loyalty by contacting them in a timely fashion Lead and coordinate the preparation of quotation to be submitted for tenders Set and meet self- development objectives Participate in the companys promotional events Develop and maintain business relations Develop new applications for specific industries. Complete the various sales forms as per the companys policies and procedures Process the sale documents through the proper channels within the agreed timeframe Quickly answer customers requests and direct them to the appropriate department Regularly communicate activities to the Sales Manager Maintain knowledge of security products and market current Perform any other tasks related to the position or assigned by the immediate supervisor
Title: Commercial Security Consultant

Job_Description: <strong>Shine with Signet!</strong><br/><br/>Peoples Jewellers is looking for dynamic, driven and creative individuals to join our team. <br/><br/> Are you ready to use your business and sales skills to begin a financially rewarding career? Apply to Peoples Jewellers if you enjoy working with the best of the best and celebrating the successes of a strong team. Build your career with a company that thrives on an outstanding customer experience, intense and continuous training and making a difference in our customers’ and employees’ lives. If you have the drive and passion to succeed, apply with us today!<br/><br/><strong>Management-Level Opportunities</strong><br/><br/>Interested in management? Our Store Managers maintain daily focus on individual and team members' standards achievement to attain sales and profit projections; contribute to an atmosphere of total customer satisfaction; develop team members’ skills and product knowledge through training and evaluation; and recruit and select team members. Store Managers are also responsible for achieving profit margin goals by managing the P&L; following and enforcing all Company policies and procedures; and other operational and strategic duties.<br/><br/><strong>Full-Time and Part-Time Sales Opportunities</strong><br/><br/>Join our team as a Sales Associate and provide a superior experience to our valued customers. Our Sales Associates are responsible for engaging customers in conversation to understand their needs and objections; presenting merchandise and detailed information on features and benefits; offering extended service plans and financing options; and meeting individual and team sales goals. <br/><br/> We value <strong>integrity</strong>, <strong>diversity</strong> and <strong>teamwork</strong> and offer <strong>opportunities for advancement</strong> as part of our promote from within philosophy. Job_Description: Fitness Consultant <p>A Fitness Consultant at World Health will enrol new members into the club, thus starting their journey towards a more healthy and active life.</p> <ul> <li>Prospect daily for new contacts to bring into the club.</li> <li>Participate in a variety of community events in order to develop leads for the club.</li> <li>Build relationships with your new members and existing members, which will lead to referral opportunities.</li> <li>Follow up with your new members to ensure they are using their membership.</li> <li>Assist your new members in becoming integrated into their membership.</li> <li>You will have the opportunity to earn an exceptional income.</li> </ul> <p>Fitness Consultants are able to participate in a number of contests throughout the year. Incentives can include steak dinners, weekend getaways, and trips to conferences or even Mexico.</p> <p>If you are a goal driven, passionate professional, who would love to dictate your own earning potential, this is the role for you.</p> <p><strong>What you also need to know:</strong></p> <ul> <li>Stay focused on your daily, weekly, and monthly goals.</li> <li>In the service industry, you work evenings and weekends and will work a 12-hour shift on closeout.</li> <li>Have thick skin. People will say “no” to you. Move past “no” to celebrate “yes”.</li> </ul> <p>Apply Now</p>
Title: Fitness Consultant

Job_Description: Candidates must possess the following skills and qualifications:   <ul> <li>5+ years of travel consultant experience</li> <li>Apollo or Sabre Experience is a must</li> <li>TICO OPC Certified</li> <li>Demonstrates thorough knowledge of domestic, transborder and international travel destinations</li> <li>Experience with corporate car and hotel bookings</li> <li>Full working knowledge of fares and rules</li> <li>Working knowledge of industry procedures for exchanges, Phase IVs and other ticket handling</li> <li>Knowledge of MSOffice</li> <li>Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written</li> <li>Shift work</li> <li>Must be able to work weekends</li> </ul>  <strong>Responsibilities will include:</strong>   <ul> <li>Build complete accurate and detailed client files using Sabre to include Domestic, Transborder and International bookings</li> <li>Accurately complete changes to client files using Sabre and assist others as needed</li> <li>Actively participates in training and product knowledge sessions</li> <li>Updates and/or build passenger as well as company profiles</li> <li>Establishes and maintains a rapport with clients in order to ensure customer satisfaction</li> <li>Resolve moderately complex client service issues</li> <li>Manages time and workload effectively</li> <li>Proactively and creatively researches and advises best options for clients and counsels appropriately</li> <li>Searches for best fares and shows a good understanding of consolidator and net fares</li> <li>Ability to work from a home office environment</li> </ul>  <strong>Home Office Requirements:</strong>   <ul> <li>Dedicated work space must be within own residence and that follows the ergonomic and safety guidelines for performing duties</li> <li>Employee is responsible for supplying their own furniture; desk with lockable drawer or separate lockable file cabinet, chair, document shredder, smoke detector in proximity of work area, and fire extinguisher</li> <li>Employee must complete The Home Office Safety and Ergonomics Assessment</li> <li>Employee must complete and meet the requirements of the Virtual Worker Checklist</li> <li>Employee must complete and meet the requirements of the Virtual Worker Policy and Schedule B “Additional Terms and Conditions for Home Based Workers</li> <li>High speed internet capability with at least 1Mbps download/upload speed (no wireless or satellite ISP’s are permitted). Separate internet line aside from your home internet for personal use.</li> </ul>  In addition to Health and Dental benefits and group RRSP, we offer a competitive base salary and the possibility of pay for performance increases, and agent incentives. We also have travel benefits such as FAM trips and agency discounts, and, we offer advancement opportunities. <br/><br/> At HRG, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve and creating an environment where every employee has the opportunity to reach his/her potential. <br/><br/> HRG is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity in its workforce. We encourage applications from all qualified individuals and will accommodate applicants’ disability-related needs, up to the point of undue hardship, throughout all stages of the recruitment and selection process. Any assessment and selection materials or processes used during the recruitment process will be available in an accessible format to applicants with disabilities, upon request. If you require a disability-related accommodation in order to participate in the recruitment process, please contact us. <br/><br/> In accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act, 2005 (AODA) HRG will consult with all applicants with disabilities who request accommodation during the recruitment process to ensure that the accommodation provided takes into account the applicant’s individual accessibility needs.
Title: Travel Consultant, Senior (After Hours)

Job_Description: Signing Bonus!Description: Automotive Sales Consultant <br/><br/> <strong>Position Summary:</strong> <br/><br/> At present we have an opening for a career minded and team oriented New Vehicle sales consultant. This is an excellent opportunity to earn an above average income. Full training is provided! <br/><br/> No previous automotive sales experience is required. <br/><br/> Many of our team have had previous experience in retail, cell phone, electronics and telephone sales. They have joined our team where they have excelled and increased their earning capacity. We offer excellent sales and product knowledge training. <br/><br/> Eastside Kia has an industry leading pay plan where consultants are rewarded for sales volume and gross profit. Sales Consultants are paid aggressively on business office spiffs. We invite you to come meet our management team and review our pay plan. <br/><br/> Position Requirements   <ul> <li>Prospecting</li> <li>Product Presentation</li> <li>Sales & Negotiating</li> <li>Vehicle Delivery</li> <li>Maintain CSI / Training Requirements</li> </ul>  Here is what we offer   <ul> <li>Aggressive spiff structure on Business Office products</li> <li>Team Building Events</li> <li>Health benefits package</li> <li>Education Assistance</li> <li>Full product and sales training</li> <li>Opportunities for career and management advancement</li> </ul>  Advancement <br/><br/> Eastside Kia values career development. Our sales managers and business managers are promoted from our sales floor. If you’re a top producer who is not being given a chance to advance, then consider a career change to the McManes Auto Group with Eastside Kia. <br/><br/> We are Southern Alberta’s #1 volume Kia dealer! We are one of few important dealers to have a separate pre-owned showroom. With our aggressive advertising, we experience high levels of sales traffic creating excellent sales opportunity. Currently, we have one position available to join out new vehicle sales team. <br/><br/> Kia <br/><br/> Don’t be fooled by the Kia Brand from 15 years ago. Kia is ranked top in quality recently winning the prestigious JD Power award for best “Initial In Class Quality” for the second year in a row. Kia beat all brands including luxury. <br/><br/> Advance your career with Calgary’s #1 dealer group: McManes Auto Group. <br/><br/> Why not enjoy driving to work in the morning. Eastside Kia provides a positive atmosphere, opportunity for advancement and team work. Contact us to find out why we are committed to our employee’s job satisfaction. Don’t think “short term employment” but rather see this as a “Career Opportunity”. <br/><br/> A bit about the McManes Automotive Group….. <br/><br/> The McManes Automotive Group consists of dealerships spanning from Manitoba to British Columbia and we currently represent 13 brands of vehicles. Although our store locations are independently operated, we share the same overall culture by showing appreciation for every person that works with us. By taking care of our people, we inherently take care of our customers. Regardless if you have a growing family or are starting a new one, we would like to offer you the opportunity to join ours!
Title: Sales Consultant

Job_Description: <strong>REV UP YOUR CAREER</strong> with Dilawri Group of Companies <br/><br/> Are you looking to develop and progress your career in Automotive Sales? The Dilawri Group is committed to hiring and training the best and brightest. If you are tenacious, likable, and are motivated to match each customer with their perfect vehicle, then we want to hear from you! <br/><br/> We have opportunities in many of our Calgary dealerships. Are you passionate about Honda, Hyundai, BMW, Infiniti, MINI or Volkswagen? Do you have experience selling ultra-luxury vehicles – then Distinctive Collection is the dealership for you? As the largest automotive group in Canada, we have the luxury to focus on each candidate’s unique skills and experience and ensure that we align the RIGHT dealership fit for your success. <br/><br/> <strong>ABOUT US</strong> <br/><br/> Dilawri Group of Companies is Canada’s Premier Automotive Group representing 67 dealerships and 30 brands across Canada including, 8…soon to be 9 dealerships and the Dilawri Collision Centre in Calgary! We have over 3,500 employees and are growing strong. <br/><br/> If you have no automotive experience but have an ability to sell and provide exceptional customer service….no problem! We have a solid training program and management support. <br/><br/> <strong>ABOUT THE ROLE</strong>  <ul> <li>As a Sales Representative, you will be responsible for the sale of new and pre-owned vehicles on the standards of gross profit, volume and customer satisfaction.</li> <li>You are actively involved in every stage of the sale process from the initial greeting through to delivery and future follow-up. Thus ensuring each customer is provided with the same exceptional sales experience. <strong><em>Success comes from consistently executing each step in the sales process…every time.</em></strong></li> <li>You maintain meticulous records in One-Eighty, our Sales Management tool, including customer information and status, follow-up phone call and appointment schedule, as well as confirmation of delivery dates and times. Detailed notes are kept at each stage of the sales process to ensure excellent customer service and compliance with CASL legislation.</li> <li>You are driven to stay current with product knowledge including our own brand and competitive models. In addition to the vehicle specifics, you are knowledgeable on aftermarket products and accessories. Your manager will conduct bi-weekly lot walks with the team to ensure you are aware and motivated by the sales potential of our always changing pre-owned inventory.</li> <li>You actively participate in daily and weekly meetings and all training courses.</li> <li>You are anxious to be provided with the opportunity to meet new clients and talk about our exciting vehicle line up by participating in trade shows or events such as the Dilawri Detour and the Calgary Auto Show.</li> </ul> <strong>ABOUT YOU</strong> <br/><br/> You are DRIVEN for success. <br/><br/> You are tenacious, likeable and are able to listen, learn and welcome direction and guidance from those who know what it takes for success. <br/><br/> You are customer service focused with the ability to listen and understand the customer’s needs so that you are able to assist, explain and support your customer in identifying the right vehicle for their needs. <br/><br/> You are self-motivated, hungry for personal success, and have an aptitude for sales. You must be comfortable asking for the sale and negotiate the deal! <br/><br/> You are proficient with computers and have the ability to use a variety of programs and learn other programs quickly. Experience with One-Eighty and Reynolds is an asset. <br/><br/> You are a licensed driver with a clean driver abstract. <br/><br/> You will be required to obtain your AMVIC license. <br/><br/> <strong><em>Give us the right attitude, we’ll give you a career</em></strong> <br/><br/> If you are driven for success and customer focused, apply today for a rewarding career tomorrow! We thank you for your interest in a career with the Dilawri Group. Qualified candidates will be contacted directly. All resumes will be accepted in confidence. <br/><br/> <strong><em>.</em></strong>
Title: Automotive Sales Consultant

Job_Description: <strong>Shine with Signet!</strong><br/><br/>Peoples Jewellers is looking for dynamic, driven and creative individuals to join our team. <br/><br/> Are you ready to use your business and sales skills to begin a financially rewarding career? Apply to Peoples Jewellers if you enjoy working with the best of the best and celebrating the successes of a strong team. Build your career with a company that thrives on an outstanding customer experience, intense and continuous training and making a difference in our customers’ and employees’ lives. If you have the drive and passion to succeed, apply with us today!<br/><br/><strong>Management-Level Opportunities</strong><br/><br/>Interested in management? Our Store Managers maintain daily focus on individual and team members' standards achievement to attain sales and profit projections; contribute to an atmosphere of total customer satisfaction; develop team members’ skills and product knowledge through training and evaluation; and recruit and select team members. Store Managers are also responsible for achieving profit margin goals by managing the P&L; following and enforcing all Company policies and procedures; and other operational and strategic duties.<br/><br/><strong>Full-Time and Part-Time Sales Opportunities</strong><br/><br/>Join our team as a Sales Associate and provide a superior experience to our valued customers. Our Sales Associates are responsible for engaging customers in conversation to understand their needs and objections; presenting merchandise and detailed information on features and benefits; offering extended service plans and financing options; and meeting individual and team sales goals. <br/><br/> We value <strong>integrity</strong>, <strong>diversity</strong> and <strong>teamwork</strong> and offer <strong>opportunities for advancement</strong> as part of our promote from within philosophy. We provide training on sales techniques, product knowledge and skills to take your career to the next level. In return, we ask that you bring your commitment to excellence, desire to grow and ability to deliver an exceptional customer experience.<br/><br/>Job Requirements:  <ul> <li>Sales, retail and/or jewelry experience is preferred, but not required.</li> </ul>  <strong>A Sampling of Our Total Rewards:</strong>  <ul> <li>Base pay plus commission on sales</li><li>Extended health benefits</li><li>Group RRSP</li><li>Paid vacation</li><li>Paid statutory holidays</li><li>Tuition reimbursement, including DCA courses based on position</li><li>Training — Associate Training System, Management Training System, District Manager in Training, career development and more</li><li>Merchandise discounts</li><li>Incentive trips and contests</li> </ul> Signet Jewelers is an equal opportunity employer committed to promoting diversity of all levels of employees. Please know that while we appreciate every applicant's interest, we can only contact those selected for further consideration.
Title: Sales Associate / Jewelry Consultant - Peoples - Sunridge Mall

Job_Description: <div><strong>Job Type:</strong> Permanent <br/> <strong>Primary Location:</strong> Calgary, Alberta, Canada <br/> <strong>All Available Locations:</strong> Calgary; Vancouver<br/> <div> External Posting Description <br/><br/> Consulting in one word? Multifaceted. The different layers of challenging work, diverse workplaces and opportunities for growth means no two days are ever the same. As a leader of this collaborative team, you can develop your skills, challenge your entrepreneurial spirit and push your career to the next level. <br/><br/> Deloitte's Supply Chain & Manufacturing Operations Consulting practice is a leader in the Canadian market. We work hand-in-hand with our clients from across virtually every industry to improve business performance, drive shareholder value and create competitive advantage. Our clients include Canadian and international organizations of all sizes. If you’re eager to tackle complex programs, to learn from some of the biggest leaders in the industry, and to offer clarity in an ever-changing world, Consulting may be right for you. Get inspired by the talented people around you and let your story unfold at Deloitte. Broaden your skills. Broaden your reach. Broaden your career. It’s all possible at Deloitte. <br/><br/> We are growing and have new opportunities for talented professionals to join our successful and collaborative team. As a Logistics & Distribution Consultant or Senior Consultant in the Supply Chain & Manufacturing Operations Practice, you will actively prioritize and manage the following key activities and responsibilities. <br/><br/> <strong><u>Responsibilities:</u></strong> <ul> <li>Participate in best-in-class Logistics & Distribution strategy projects, operations assessments, and transformations</li><li>Lead small, collaborative engagement teams through the development and the implementation of Logistics & Distribution strategies and solutions</li><li>Develop innovative recommendations to address client issues based on an understanding of the client business and industry</li><li>Identify opportunities, author client deliverables and present findings at the senior client level</li><li>Work collaboratively with client personnel, leveraging their resources and knowledge to achieve project goals and complete deliverables on-time</li><li>Build strong relationships with client counterparts and key stakeholders</li><li>Provide clear and concise status updates and assist the leadership team with managing project risks</li><li>Mentor and support junior resources on engagements</li><li>Drive the development of proposals to assist clients in improving their supply chain performance</li><li>Continuously improve professional skills through a variety of Deloitte and external training courses</li><li>Participate in firm recruiting events to help the practice attract highly talented team members</li> </ul> External Posting Qualifications <br/><br/> 3-6+ years of Logistics & Distribution related work experience; Experience required will depend on entry level (Consultant or Senior Consultant). <ul> <li>Project-based experience is an asset</li><li>Previous consulting experience, as an internal or external consultant, is preferred</li><li>Experienced in Supply Chain Assessments, Business Process Improvement, Transportation Sourcing, or Distribution Centre design, and familiarity to relevant supporting supply chain technologies e.g., WMS/TMS/Order Management and Inventory Planning tools</li> <li>Solid understanding of Transportation, Planning, Execution, Freight Settlement, Network Design, Supply Chain Strategy, Warehouse Operations & Optimization, Distribution Centre design, or experience with LTL, TL and Rail modes of transport</li><li>Someone who thrives in a fast-paced and fluid environment, comfortable working in an ambiguous environment with pressing deadlines and constantly changing client needs and conditions</li><li>Proven ability to deliver project management accountabilities in a cross functional environment</li><li>Experienced with problem diagnosis, solution development, client communication, and facilitation of decision making, documentation, managing expectations, project profitability and team leadership</li><li>Ability to anticipate the long term, multifunctional impact of all decisions and take a broad approach to problem solving</li><li>MBA or Engineering degrees are highly desirable</li><li>Strong analytical and problem-solving capabilities</li><li>Superior verbal and written communication skills</li><li>Excellent interpersonal skills and demonstrated ability to work effectively in teams</li><li>Extensive travel in Canada and USA may be required</li> </ul> </div> <br/><strong>Why Deloitte?</strong> <br/><br/> Launch your career with The One Firm where you can make a greater impact than you ever thought possible. With endless opportunities at every turn, and a culture built to support and drive our people to be the very best they can be, Deloitte is The One Firm for you to learn, grow, create, and lead. <br/><br/> At Deloitte, we understand that everyone, and their career goals, are different. As a firm, we help create the conditions and opportunities that will enable our people to thrive – both professionally and personally. We do this by making three commitments to our people: <ul> <li><em><strong>You will lead at every level:</strong></em> We grow the world’s best leaders so you can achieve the impact you seek, faster.</li><li><em><strong>You can work your way:</strong></em> We give you the means to work how you want, and we have innovative spaces and the mindset to help you be wildly successful.</li><li><em><strong>You will feel included and inspired:</strong></em> We create a deep sense of belonging where you can bring your whole self to work.</li> </ul> Apply now and let us show you how to push your career to the next level at <em><strong>Deloitte. The One Firm. For You.</strong></em> <br/><br/> Deloitte is an inclusive employer dedicated to building a diverse workforce. We encourage applications from all qualified candidates and will accommodate applicants’ needs under the respective provincial human rights codes throughout all stages of the recruitment and selection process. Please advise the Recruiter to ensure your accessibility needs are accommodated throughout this process. Information received relating to accommodation will be addressed confidentially. <br/><br/> We thank all applicants in advance for their interest; however, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted <br/><br/> 31133</div>
Title: Senior Consultant, Logistics & Distribution - Supply Chain & Manufacturing Operations

Job_Description: Provides direction and specialist knowledge in applying the technology/application to client business. Facilitation of customer product/application understanding through presentations demonstrations and benchmarks; provision of support throughout the sell. <br/> As a Principal Sales Consultant you will be responsible as the expert for formulating and leading presales technical / functional support activity to prospective clients and customers while ensuring customer satisfaction. Acts as a technical resource and mentor for less experienced Sales Consultants. Focuses on large or complex sales opportunities that need creative and complex solutions. Develops productivity tools and training for other Sales Consultants. Develops and delivers outstanding Company presentations and demonstrations. Leads any and all aspects of the technical sales process. Advises internal and external clients on overall architect solutions. <br/> Leading contributor individually and as a team member, providing direction and mentoring to others. Work is non-routine and very complex, involving the application of advanced technical/business skills in area of specialization. 3 years vendor (sales and marketing) experience. 7 years business experience with relevant computer applications or database/tools. Ability to implement the most advanced product features. Thorough knowledge of system and application design. In depth knowledge of competitors. Demonstrated project management skills. Demonstrated excellent verbal and written communication skills: needs analysis, positioning, business justification, closing techniques. Ability to persuade others through presentations, demonstrations, and written communication. Ability to travel as needed. A/BS degree or equivalent, advanced degree highly desirable.
Title: Supply Chain & Finance Principal Sales Consultant

Job_Description: SLR is a multi-disciplinary environmental consulting firm specializing in the Built Environment, Industry, Infrastructure, Mining & Minerals, Oil & Gas and Power sectors. SLR is one of a very small number of truly international specialist environmental consultancies. <br/><br/> As an employee controlled company, in which many of our staff have a share, SLR offers rewarding careers to all of its staff and values and rewards customer care and commitment as well as technical expertise. SLR provides a healthy and dynamic work environment, challenging career opportunities and competitive compensation and benefit packages. <br/><br/> For more information, please visit http://www.slrconsulting.com <br/><br/> <strong>Role:</strong> <ul> <li>Acoustic Consultant for SLR's Canadian Operations, based in Vancouver, Edmonton or Calgary working with colleagues in other SLR offices to support acoustics projects;</li><li>Contributing member of the existing 80-person global Acoustics & Vibration team</li> </ul> <strong>Responsibilities:</strong> <br/><br/> The role will include Acoustic Consulting project responsibilities, including measurements, modelling and reporting. Involvement in industrial, environmental and architectural acoustics and vibration projects. The work involved will be a mix of office based activities and field work. Occasional travel mostly within Canada but potentially internationally would be required <br/><br/> <strong>Technical Skills / Abilities / Experience:</strong> <ul> <li>4 to 8 years of environmental acoustics and vibration work experience</li><li>Familiarity with principles of underwater acoustics would be an asset</li><li>A relevant post-graduate degree may be considered in lieu of work experience</li><li>Experience with use of MS Office & relevant technical software design tools; e.g. Matlab</li> <li>Experience with sound and vibration measurement instrumentation</li><li>Experience with environmental noise modelling software; e.g. Cadna/A, SoundPLAN</li> </ul> <strong>Education / Qualifications / Memberships:</strong> <ul> <li>Minimum B.Sc. or B.Eng. in acoustics, physics, mechanical engineering, environmental science, or related field</li><li>Eligibility to work towards professional engineer status in BC or AB preferred</li><li>Strong technical writing ability</li> </ul> <strong>Personal Attributes:</strong> <ul> <li>Eligible to work in Canada</li><li>Excellent communication and interpersonal skills</li><li>Team player who demonstrates a co-operative spirit with colleagues and management</li><li>Optimistic and positive attitude</li><li>Ability to manage multiple priorities & deadlines</li> </ul>  <strong>Job Posted by ApplicantPro</strong> <br/>
Title: Intermediate Acoustic Consultant - Calgary, AB or Edmonton, AB or Vancouver, BC

Job_Description: Capital Chevrolet Buick GMC has an opening for a permanent full-time motivated, energetic and professional individual as an Automotive Sales Consultant.The Automotive Sales Consultant will be responsible for selling automobiles through the achievement of opportunity-based sales quotas. The goal is to do business with each and every customer more than once. The primary responsibility is to provide each customer with exceptional service. This is done through demonstrating thorough product and inventory knowledge with solid understanding of all automotive services available throughout the dealership. <br/><br/> If you have integrity, passion, and in-person presentational skills, then Capital Chevrolet Buick GMC is for you. You should bring a strong background in sales with a broad knowledge of automobiles, specifications and features. <br/><br/> <strong>Qualifications</strong>   <ul> <li>Demonstrated ability to convert prospects and close deals while maintaining established sales quotas.</li> <li>Professional demeanor, selling style, and appearance.</li> <li>Solid experience in opportunity qualification, planning, account development, and time management.</li> <li>Success in qualifying opportunities involving multiple key decision makers.</li> <li>Strong knowledge of sales principles, methods, practices, and techniques.</li> <li>Exceptional verbal communication and presentation skills.</li> <li>Self motivated, with high energy and an engaging level of enthusiasm.</li> <li>High level of integrity and work ethic.</li> </ul>  Capital Automotive Group is recognized nationally and provincially as the being the top performers in multiple categories. We offer a competitive compensation and benefits package as well as opportunities for career growth for all team members. <br/><br/> Come and join a winning team and apply today!
Title: Automotive Sales Consultant- Calgary, AB
